
000 
FXUS64 KMEG 010314
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
914 PM CST SAT DEC 31 2005

.UPDATE...

CIRRUS CLOUDS OUT AHEAD OF AN APPROACHING LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM ARE
MOVING THROUGH THE MIDSOUTH THIS EVENING. THE CIRRUS HAS NOT
PREVENTED TEMPERATURES FROM DROPPING QUICKLY THIS EVENING. CURRENT
TEMPERATURES ARE AT OR ALREADY BELOW FORECASTED LOWS. MODELS ARE
SHOWING LOW CLOUDS DEVELOPING TO THE SOUTH LATER TONIGHT...MOVING
INTO SOUTHERN PORTIONS OF THE AREA BY THE EARLY MORNING HOURS.
CURRENT SATELLITE IMAGES SHOW LOW CLOUDS DEVELOPING ALONG GULF
COAST SO EXPECT ANOTHER COUPLE OF HOURS BEFORE SPREADING NORTHWARD
INTO THE MIDSOUTH. WILL UPDATE TO LOWER FORECASTED LOWS INTO THE
LOW TO MID 30S AND TO UPDATE SKY CONDITIONS. UPDATE WILL BE OUT
SHORTLY.

&&

.PREV DISCUSSION... (ISSUED 350 PM CST SAT DEC 31 2005) 

DISCUSSION...
BOTH THE GFS AND ETA SEEM TO HANDLE A WEAK SHORT WAVE TROF IN A SIMILAR
MANNER AS IT MOVES THRU THE AREA TOMORROW NIGHT. ISENTROPIC LIFT
AHEAD OF THE TROF SHOULD PRODUCE QUITE A BIT OF CLOUDINESS ALONG WITH A
SLIGHT CHANCE OF LIGHT RAIN OVER THE AREA TOMORROW. AS THE TROF
MOVES THRU THERE WILL BE A POSSIBILITY OF A FEW THUNDERSTORMS. THE
MAIN THREAT OF STRONG STORMS SHOULD BE OVER THE EASTERN PART OF
THE FORECAST AREA HOWEVER.

GFS BRINGS ANOTHER SHORT WAVE THRU THE AREA ON WEDNESDAY PRODUCING
A FEW SHOWERS. OTHERWISE DRY CONDITIONS SHOULD PREVAIL WITH MILD
TEMPERATURES THRU THE MIDDLE OF THE WEEK. TEMPERATURES WILL TURN
COLDER TOWARDS THE END OF THE WEEK 


&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.
&&

$$

KRM


000 
FXUS64 KMEG 311618
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
1018 AM CST SAT DEC 31 2005

.UPDATE...
THE FORECAST APPEARS TO BE ON TRACK SO WILL NOT UPDATE AT THS TIME.


&&

.PREV DISCUSSION... (ISSUED 323 AM CST SAT DEC 31 2005) 

DISCUSSION...
EARLY THIS MORNING SKIES WERE MOSTLY CLEAR. SOME AREAS OF FOG ARE 
AFFECTING MAINLY NORTHEAST MISSISSIPPI WHERE HIGH SURFACE MOISTURE 
IS SLOW TO MOVE EAST. SOME MID/HIGH LEVEL CLOUDS WILL MOVE ACROSS 
THE MIDSOUTH OVER THE NEXT SEVERAL HOURS.

WEAK FLOW ALOFT TODAY WILL BRING UNEVENTFUL WEATHER TO THE FORECAST 
AREA. EXPECT A DRY...MILD DAY TODAY. A SHORTWAVE MOVING OVER THE 
DESERT SOUTHWEST TODAY WILL APPROACH THE MIDSOUTH OVERNIGHT.

THIS SHORTWAVE WILL BEGIN TO ADVECT IN LOW LEVEL MOISTURE BY LATE 
TONIGHT. EXPECT SOME LOW CLOUDS WITH MODEL SOUNDINGS INDICATING A 
SHALLOW LAYER OF SATURATION FROM THE SFC TO APPROXIMATELY 1KFT. 
LATEST MODEL SOUNDINGS INDICATE THAT THIS SHALLOW LAYER OF 
SATURATION WILL PERSIST THROUGH MUCH OF THE DAY SUNDAY. PERHAPS SOME 
LIGHT DRIZZLE/FOG WILL BE POSSIBLE. UNSEASONABLY WARM TEMPERATURES 
WILL ALSO BE EXPERIENCED SUNDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY.

APPEARS THAT THE MAIN RAIN CHANCES WILL OCCUR DURING SUNDAY EVENING 
WHEN THE AREA IS UNDER THE RIGHT ENTRANCE REGION OF A 80KT JET 
STREAK. WILL CONTINUE WITH CHANCE POPS OVER MOST OF THE AREA. WILL 
HANG ON TO RAIN CHANCES THROUGH MONDAY AS THE UPPER LOW MOVES JUST 
NORTH OF THE FORECAST AREA. PERHAPS SOME SHOWERS...ESPECIALLY OVER 
THE NORTHEASTERN CWA...WILL BE POSSIBLE WITH THE COLD CORE IN CLOSE 
PROXIMITY.

TEMPERATURES ARE EXPECTED TO RETURN TO NEAR NORMAL THURSDAY THROUGH 
THE REMAINDER OF THE WEEK. AFTER MONDAY...DRY CONDITIONS WILL 
PREVAIL.   


.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.
&&

$$


000 
FXUS64 KMEG 310332
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
932 PM CST FRI DEC 30 2005

.UPDATE...

SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS ASSOCIATED WITH THE COLD FRONT HAS
PUSHED OUT OF THE CWA THIS EVENING. UPDATED EARLIER TO REMOVE
POPS. SKIES ARE CLEARING BEHIND THE FRONT ALLOWING FOR
TEMPERATURES TO DROP FURTHER THAN EXPECTED. TEMPERATURES IN JBR
HAVE ALREADY DROPPED CLOSE TO FORECASTED LOW. WILL UPDATE ACROSS
THE CWA TO LOWER LOWS AT LEAST A CATEGORY. PATCHY DENSE FOG HAS
DEVELOPED IMMEDIATELY BEHIND THE FRONT WHERE THE WINDS ARE CALM
AND WHERE THE DRIER AIR HASN/T MOVED IN YET. HAVE ADDRESSED FOG
WITH A SPECIAL WEATHER STATEMENT AS FOG IS NOT EXPECTED TO LAST LONG
AS DRIER AIR HAS ALREADY MOVED INTO MUCH OF EASTERN ARKANSAS.
UPDATE WILL BE OUT SHORTLY.

&&

.PREV DISCUSSION... (ISSUED 255 PM CST FRI DEC 30 2005) 

SYNOPSIS...
SURFACE COLD FRONT MOVING THROUGH THE FORECAST AREA AT THIS TIME.  A 
RUMBLE OF THUNDER NEAR THE KY BORDER. OTHERWISE...LITTLE 
PRECIPITATION OCCURRING WITH THE COLD FRONT AS IT MOVES THROUGH THE 
MIDSOUTH.

SHORT TERM...TONIGHT THROUGH MONDAY...
A MILD ZONAL PATTERN THROUGH THIS PERIOD.  SHORTWAVES MOVE THROUGH 
IN RAPID SUCCESSION...HOWEVER MOISTURE ACROSS OUR REGION IS 
MARGINAL. GOOD DOWNWARD MOTION OCCURS THIS EVENING BEHIND THE COLD 
FRONT SO LOW CLOUDS SHOULD NOT BE A PROBLEM.  WILL MENTION A  
THUNDERSTORM POSSIBILITY FOR THE EASTERN HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA 
FOR THIS EVENING.  

NEXT SHORTWAVE IS EXPECTED TO MOVE THROUGH SUNDAY NIGHT AND EARLY 
MONDAY.  AGAIN MOISTURE IS RELATIVELY STARVED UNTIL SYSTEM MOVES TO 
OUR EAST.  WILL CONTINUE THE MODEST CHANCE FOR RAINFALL LATE SUNDAY 
AND EARLY MONDAY.   

LONGER TERM...TUESDAY THROUGH FRIDAY...
ON TUESDAY STRONG SOUTHWEST FLOW AHEAD OF SHORTWAVE WILL PUSH 
TEMPERATURES WELL ABOVE NORMAL.  RELATIVELY DRY SURFACE MOISTURE AND 
DEGREE OF SOUTHWEST FLOW SHOULD COMBINE TO PUSH TEMPS NEAR OR ABOVE 
70 ACROSS ALL BUT NORTHEAST PORTIONS OF WEST TENNESSEE.  A DRY 
FRONTAL PASSAGE IS LIKELY SINCE MOISTURE IS LIGHT AND BEST LIFT 
ASSOCIATED WITH THE SHORTWAVE IS WELL NORTH.  FOR NOW WILL KEEP 
FORECAST DRY.  

HIGH CONFIDENCE IN PATTERN CHANGE WITH THE SHORTWAVE THAT MOVES 
THROUGH ON WEDNESDAY.  BOTH THE ECMWF AND GFS SHOW A DEEPENING UPPER 
TROF THAT DEVELOPS ACROSS THE EASTERN HALF OF NORTH AMERICA.  ZONAL 
PATTERN TRANSITIONS TO NORTHWEST FLOW FOR DAYS 6 AND 7.  THIS WILL 
RESULT IN SIGNIFICANTLY COLDER TEMPERATURES. WILL TREND TOWARD 
SLIGHTLY BELOW NORMAL BOTH DAYS. POSSIBILITY OF FLURRIES OVER 
NORTHEAST SECTIONS OF FORECAST AREA...BUT FOR NOW WILL KEEP DRY.  


$$


&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.
&&

$$

KRM


000 
FXUS64 KMEG 300855
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
255 AM CST FRI DEC 30 2005

.DISCUSSION...
LOW CLOUDS STRETCHED ACROSS THE FAR NORTHEAST PARTS OF THE FORECAST 
AREA EARLY THIS MORNING. MEANWHILE...MID LEVEL CLOUDS WERE MOVING 
INTO THE NORTHWESTERN PARTS OF THE FA. A COLD FRONT STRETCHED FROM 
SIOUX FALLS TO KANSAS CITY TO OKLAHOMA CITY TO CHILDRESS. LOW LEVEL 
MOISTURE WAS ADVECTING NORTH ACROSS FAR EAST TEXAS AND CAN BE SEEN 
ON 11-3.9 MICRON SATELLITE IMAGERY...AS WELL AS SURFACE OBSERVATIONS.

THE UPPER LOW WILL TRANSLATE ACROSS IOWA TODAY. THIS WILL ALLOW THE 
LOW LEVEL MOISTURE OVER EAST TEXAS TO SHIFT EASTWARD BY THIS 
AFTERNOON. THE COLD FRONT SHOULD BE BISECTING CENTRAL ARKANSAS BY 
THIS AFTERNOON. THE FRONT WILL CONTINUE TO MOVE EASTWARD AND SOME 
SHOWERS SHOULD DEVELOP BY LATE AFTERNOON...ESPECIALLY OVER THE 
WESTERN HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA. THERE COULD BE SOME ISOLATED 
THUNDER GIVEN THE STEEP LAPSE RATES. THE BEST CHANCE FOR 
THUNDERSTORMS WILL BE ACROSS NORTHEAST MISSISSIPPI WHERE LOW LEVEL 
MOISTURE WILL BE MORE PLENTIFUL.

RAINFALL SHOULD END FROM WEST TO EAST BEGINNING EARLY THIS EVENING. 
THE EASTERN FORECAST AREA SHOULD SEE RAIN MOVE INTO MIDDLE TN BY 
SUNRISE. 

ONCE THE FRONT MOVES THROUGH THE AREA...THERE WILL BE A COUPLE DAYS 
OF LITTLE ACTIVITY. EXPECT TEMPERATURES TO REMAIN ABOVE SEASONAL 
AVERAGES THROUGH MID WEEK. ANOTHER CHANCE FOR RAIN WILL OCCUR ON 
SUNDAY NIGHT INTO MONDAY WITH THE NEXT SHORTWAVE TRANSLATING ACROSS 
THE SOUTH-CENTRAL U.S. ANOTHER FRONTAL SYSTEM WILL MOVE INTO THE 
MIDSOUTH WEDNESDAY. 

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.
&&

$$

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 300519
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
1119 PM CST THU DEC 29 2005

.UPDATE...
ANOTHER QUICK UPDATE TO LOWER TEMPERATURES A LITTLE MORE...INTO
THE MID AND UPPER 20S ACROSS PORTIONS OF WEST TENNESSEE AND
NORTHEAST CORNER OF MISSISSIPPI. CANT SEE TEMPS DROPPING MUCH
MORE...BUT ALREADY LOWER THAN ANTICIPATED.

&&

.PREV DISCUSSION... (ISSUED 853 PM CST THU DEC 29 2005) 

.UPDATE...
WEAK HIGH PRESSURE CENTERED NEAR BNA THIS EVENING. LOW PRESSURE
CENTERED NEAR FSD AND CDS...WITH FRONT BETWEEN THE TWO ACROSS THE
GREAT PLAINS. BACK EDGE OF CLOUDS HAS BEEN RATHER STUBBORN THIS
EVENING...AND HAS NOT MADE MUCH EASTWARD PROGRESS. CURRENTLY NEAR
A KENNETT TO SAVANNAH LINE. THESE CLOUDS SHOULD CLEAR THE AREA
THIS EVENING...IF ONE BELIEVES 925-850 MB RH PROGS. 

FORECAST PROBLEM OTHER THAN CLOUDS WILL BE LOW TEMPERATURES. A
FEW AREAS ALREADY BELOW FORECAST MINS...AND WILL NEED TO LOWER
THOSE ONE TO TWO CATEGORIES. WITH DEWPOINTS BETWEEN 30 AND
35...THAT LOOKS LIKE A PRETTY GOOD RANGE FOR LOWS FOR MOST OF THE
AREA. WOULD NOT BE SURPRISED IF TEMPERATURES LEVEL OFF OR RISE
TOWARD MORNING AS FLOW BECOMES A LITTLE MORE SOUTHERLY. 

LATEST NAM SOLUTION WOULD AGREE WITH TIMING OF MINIMAL THREAT OF
PRECIPITATION TOMORROW AFTERNOON AND EVENING. WILL ISSUE UPDATE A
LITTLE AFTER 03Z OBS COME IN...TO HAVE BEST TRENDS OF TEMPERATURES
AVAILABLE.
&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.
&&

AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
335 PM CST THU DEC 29 2005

.DISCUSSION...
THE GFS AND ETA SEEM TO BE IN PRETTY GOOD AGREEMENT. EXPECT SOME
SHOWERS ACROSS THE AREA FRIDAY AFTERNOON AND EVENING AS A COLD
FRONT MOVES ACROSS THE AREA ALTHOUGH NOT A WHOLE LOT OF MOISTURE
IS AVAILABLE. A BETTER CHANCE OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS SHOULD
MOVE THRU THE AREA SUNDAY NIGHT AND MONDAY AS ANOTHER COLD FRONT
MOVES THRU.



000 
FXUS64 KMEG 291626
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
1026 AM CST THU DEC 29 2005

.UPDATE...

FORECAST IS PRETTY MUCH ON TRACK...SO WILL NOT UPDATE AT THIS TIME.


&&

.PREV DISCUSSION... (ISSUED 443 AM CST THU DEC 29 2005) 

DISCUSSION...SURFACE AND UPPER AIR ANALYSIS PLACES LOW PRESSURE 
ACROSS THE APPALACIANS...RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE ACROSS THE PLAINS AND 
THE NEXT TROUGH OF LOW PRESSURE TO AFFECT THE AREA ALONG THE PACIFIC 
COAST OF THE UNITED STATES. MAIN FORECAST CONCERNS THIS PACKAGE IS 
CONVECTIVE POTENTIAL FRIDAY AFTERNOON AND FRIDAY NIGHT. 

TODAY AND TONIGHT...HIGH PRESSURE WILL CONTINUE TO BUILD INTO THE MID 
SOUTH. HOWEVER...SOME LOW LEVEL RESIDUAL MOISTURE TRAPPED UNDER 
SUBSIDENCE INVERSION WITH CYCLONIC FLOW ALOFT /PER SATELLITE IMAGERY 
AND 925-850 MB LAYER RH ANALYSIS/ SUGGESTS CLOUD COVER WILL BE SLOW 
TO CLEAR ACROSS PORTIONS OF THE FORECAST AREA PRIMARILY NORTH AND 
EAST OF MEMPHIS THROUGH LATE TONIGHT. AS A RESULT...NOT EXPECTING TO 
SEE MUCH RECOVERY IN HIGH TEMPERATURES THIS AFTERNOON WHERE CLOUD 
COVER WILL KEEP DAYTIME HEATING TO A MINIMUM. HIGHS WILL RANGE FROM 
THE LOWER 50S ACROSS SOUTHWEST SECTIONS TO LOWER TO MIDDLE 40S 
NORTHEAST. LOWS TONIGHT WILL RANGE FROM THE MID 30S TO NEAR 40. 

FRIDAY THROUGH SATURDAY...SOUTHERLY RETURN FLOW ON THE BACK SIDE OF HIGH 
PRESSURE RETURNS TO THE AREA AS THE NEXT MID LEVEL TROUGH AND 
ASSOCIATED SURFACE REFLECTION MOVES ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA FRIDAY 
NIGHT. BOTH NAM/GFS ANALYSIS INDICATES THAT EVEN WITH A DECENT WIND 
PROFILE ALOFT...MOISTURE AND INSTABILITY WILL BE LACKING JUST AS 
WITH THE SYSTEM THAT AFFECTED THE MID SOUTH THIS PAST WEDNESDAY 
MORNING. IN ADDITION...COLD AIR REMAINS TO THE NORTH WITH THIS 
SYSTEM AND CANNOT JUSTIFY A MENTION OF THUNDER AT THIS POINT. AS A 
RESULT...TRIMMED BACK POPS TO ALONG AND WEST OF THE MISSISSIPPI 
RIVER AND SCATTERED POPS FOR FRIDAY NIGHT AS BEST ISENTROPIC ASCENT 
ARRIVES BETWEEN 0-6Z SATURDAY. HIGH PRESSURE WILL RETURN ON SATURDAY 
AS UPPER LEVEL RIDGING BUILDS BACK IN ACROSS THE MID SOUTH.

LONG RANGE (SUNDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...ONLY MAJOR DIFFERENCES IN 
LONG RANGE MODELS IS HANDLING OF UPPER LEVEL TROUGH MOVING THROUGH 
THE MISSISSIPPI VALLEY ON MONDAY AS PROGRESSIVE WEATHER PATTERN 
CONTINUES ACROSS THE CONTINENTAL UNITED STATES WITH SYSTEMS 
AFFECTING THE LOWER MISSISSIPPI VALLEY EVERY FEW DAYS. GFS A BIT 
LESS PROGRESSIVE/POSITIVELY TILTED COMPARED TO THE NEGATIVELY TILTED 
00Z EUROPEAN SOLUTION AND DIGS FURTHER SOUTH ACROSS THE AREA. WILL 
MENTION A CHANCE OF THUNDER ON MONDAY AS 500 MB TEMPERATURES DROP 
SLIGHTLY BELOW -20C...LIS AROUND -4 AND SHOWALTER INDICIES AROUND 
-3. ANOTHER TROUGH WILL APPROACH THE MIDSOUTH AGAIN BY WEDNESDAY 
HOWEVER THIS SYSTEM APPEARS TO BE MOISTURE STARVED AND SOME MODEL 
TIMING DIFFERENCES WILL NOT INTRODUCE PRECIP AT THIS TIME. 
&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.
&&

$$








000 
FXUS64 KMEG 291043
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
443 AM CST THU DEC 29 2005

DISCUSSION...SURFACE AND UPPER AIR ANALYSIS PLACES LOW PRESSURE 
ACROSS THE APPALACIANS...RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE ACROSS THE PLAINS AND

AS UPPER LEVEL RIDGING BUILDS BACK IN ACROSS THE MID SOUTH.

LONG RANGE (SUNDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...ONLY MAJOR DIFFERENCES IN 
LONG RANGE MODELS IS HANDLING OF UPPER LEVEL TROUGH MOVING THROUGH 
THE MISSISSIPPI VALLEY ON MONDAY AS PROGRESSIVE WEATHER PATTERN 
CONTINUES ACROSS THE CONTINENTAL UNITED STATES WITH SYSTEMS 
AFFECTING THE LOWER MISSISSIPPI VALLEY EVERY FEW DAYS. GFS A BIT 
LESS PROGRESSIVE/POSITIVELY TILTED COMPARED TO THE NEGATIVELY TILTED 
00Z EUROPEAN SOLUTION AND DIGS FURTHER SOUTH ACROSS THE AREA. WILL 
MENTION A CHANCE OF THUNDER ON MONDAY AS 500 MB TEMPERATURES DROP 
SLIGHTLY BELOW -20C...LIS AROUND -4 AND SHOWALTER INDICIES AROUND 
-3. ANOTHER TROUGH WILL APPROACH THE MIDSOUTH AGAIN BY WEDNESDAY 
HOWEVER THIS SYSTEM APPEARS TO BE MOISTURE STARVED AND SOME MODEL 
TIMING DIFFERENCES WILL NOT INTRODUCE PRECIP AT THIS TIME. 
&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.
&&

$$

CJC





000 
FXUS64 KMEG 290342
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
942 PM CST WED DEC 28 2005

.UPDATE...
SURFACE AND UPPER LOWS OVER OHIO AT 03Z. STILL SEEING SOME LOW
CLOUDINESS OVER ABOUT THE NORTHEAST THIRD OF THE CWA...ROUGHLY
NORTH OF A JONESBORO TO SAVANNAH LINE. NEW NAM 925-850 MB RH PROG HAS
A PRETTY GOOD FIT WITH 90 PERCENT RH WHERE CLOUDS ARE. THIS CHART
SHOWS CLOUDS SHOULD MOVE OUT OF THAT AREA TOWARD SUNRISE. WILL
PROBABLY NEED TO FINE-TUNE CLOUD WORDING THERE LATER THIS EVENING.

TEMPERATURES ARE MAINLY IN THE 40S...A COUPLE OF DEGREES LOWER
THAN HOURLY GRIDS...BUT FORECAST LOWS STILL LOOK WITHIN REACH.
WINDS HAVE DECOUPLED TO SOME EXTENT...WHICH SHOULD ALLOW GOOD
RADIATING CONDITIONS. 

WILL LIKELY DO AN UPDATE AROUND 05Z TO GET RID OF EVENING WORDING.

&&

.PREV DISCUSSION... (ISSUED 300 PM CST WED DEC 28 2005) 

SYNOPSIS...
TIGHT CIRCULATION OVER THE OHIO VALLEY SLOWLY RETREATING NORTHEAST.  
TRAILING WEST EDGE OF LOW CLOUDS CREEPING TOWARD THE MISSISSIPPI 
RIVER AND THE MO BOOTHEEL.  FAIRLY DECENT TEMPERATURE GRADIENT WITH 
UPPER 40S ACROSS THE KY/MO BORDER AND MIDDLE 60S IN EAST CENTRAL MS.
 

SHORT TERM...TONIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY...
WHEN DO THE CLOUDS DISAPPEAR?  SATELLITE INDICATES CLOUDS RETREATING 
A BIT FASTER THAN MODELS INDICATE.  MOST AREAS SHOULD GO CLEAR EARLY 
THIS EVENING WITH LOCATIONS IN WEST TENNESSEE NEAREST THE TN RIVER 
CLEARING OUT AROUND MIDNIGHT.  ALTHOUGH THE SURFACE HIGH IS WEAK 
BELIEVE WE CAN DECOUPLE ENOUGH TO REACH NEAR FREEZING IN NORTHERN 
SECTIONS...SO HAVE DECIDED TO GO A BIT COOLER THAN GUIDANCE.  WITH 
SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE OVER THE REGION AND NO RETURN FLOW ON THURSDAY 
TEMPS SHOULD BE SLOW TO REBOUND.  HAVE KEPT TEMPS FAIRLY CLOSE TO 
CLIMATOLOGY IN THE NORTH AND A BIT WARMER THAN NORMAL IN THE SOUTH.
  

LONGER TERM...FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY...
ECMWF AND GFS IS GOOD AGREEMENT.  UPPER FLOW IS ZONAL AND FAIRLY 
FAST.  THIS DOESNT ALLOW MUCH TIME FOR GULF MOISTURE TO RETURN.  
FIRST SHORTWAVE AND SFC COLD FRONT MOVES THROUGH FRIDAY NIGHT.  LIKE 
LAST NIGHT...COLD FRONT MAY INDEED MOVE THROUGH DRY.  HAVE GONE A 
LOWER POP THAN PREVIOUS FORECAST.
  
ANOTHER SYSTEM IS EXPECTED LATE SUNDAY NIGHT AND MONDAY.  THE GFS IS 
SUGGESTING SUFFICIENT MOISTURE RETURN FOR WIDESPREAD PRECIPITATION 
LATE SUNDAY AND MONDAY MORNING.  

A SHORTWAVE AND STRONGER COLD FRONT COULD ARRIVE LATE WEDNESDAY.  OF 
COURSE TIMING IS AN ISSUE...WHICH COULD OCCUR AFTER THE FORECAST 
PERIOD.  FOR NOW HAVE KEPT THE FORECAST DRY.  THIS SHORTWAVE COULD 
BE THE START OF A MORE MERIDIANAL FLOW PATTERN AS WE MOVE INTO THE 
SECOND WEEK OF JANUARY. 

THROUGH THIS FORECAST PERIOD TEMPERATURES SHOULD AVERAGE ABOVE 
NORMAL.
      
&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.
&&

$$

WAGNER/BELLES

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 281651
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
1040 AM CST WED DEC 28 2005

.DISCUSSION...
STRONG COLD AIR ADVECTION OCCURRING ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA.  ALSO 
SATELLITE SHOWS LOW CLOUDS RACING INTO NORTHEAST ARKANSAS AND WEST 
TENNESSEE.  DONT SEE ANY TEMPERATURE RECOVERY AS DEEP UPPER LOW 
SPINS SLOWLY NORTHEAST INTO THE OHIO VALLEY.  WITH COLD AIR 
ADVECTION CONTINUING THROUGHOUT THE AFTERNOON HAVE UPDATED 
TEMPERATURES TO REFLECT A STEADY TREND FOR THE REST OF THE FIRST 
PERIOD. ...BELLES...

.PREV DISCUSSION ISSUED 450 AM CST WED DEC 28 2005..

09Z SURFACE ANALYSIS PLACES CENTER OF LOW PRESSURE JUST EAST OF 
SAINT LOUIS WITH A TRAILING COLD FRONT EXTENDING ALONG THE 
MISSISSIPPI RIVER. MAIN FORECAST CONCERNS THIS PACKAGE IS CONVECTIVE 
POTENTIAL TODAY AND FRIDAY.

TODAY AND TONIGHT...COLD FRONT WILL MOVE THROUGH THE MID SOUTH THIS 
MORNING. CONVECTIVE ACTIVITY FINALLY DEVELOPED A COUPLE OF HOURS AGO 
ACROSS AREAS TO THE NORTH OF JACKSON,TN. STEEP LAPSE RATES NEAR 
8C/KM...EXCELLENT WIND PROFILE WITH 45KT 850 MB JET AND 50KT 500MB 
JET...AND 300 MB UPPER LEVEL DIVERGENCE ARE PRESENT. HOWEVER...A 
LACK OF LOW LEVEL MOISTURE...AND MINIMAL INSTABILITY (ONLY 500-800 
J/KG AND MARGINAL LI/S PER LAPS ANALYSIS) AT BEST HAS KEPT 
CONVECTION TO A MINIMUM. AS A RESULT WENT WITH CHANCE POPS ACROSS 
THE EASTERN FOURTH OF THE FORECAST AREA WITH 20 POPS BACK TO THE 
RIVER THIS MORNING...AND SLIGHT CHANCE/CHANCE POPS FOR THE AFTERNOON 
AS WRAP AROUND MOISTURE ON THE BACKSIDE OF LOW PRESSURE MAY PRODUCE 
A SHOWER.

TONIGHT AND THURSDAY...HIGH PRESSURE WILL BEGIN TO BUILD BACK IN 
ACROSS THE MID SOUTH WITH UPPER LEVEL RIDGING RETURNING. ANY 
RESIDUAL RAIN ACROSS THE NORTHEAST SECTION OF THE FORECAST AREA 
SHOULD COME TO AN END BEFORE MIDNIGHT WITH CLOUD COVER DIMINISHING 
TOWARDS DAYBREAK THURSDAY. 

FRIDAY...NEXT MID LEVEL TROUGH APPROACHES THE MID SOUTH BRINGING 
ANOTHER CHANCE OF PRECIPITATION BACK TO THE AREA. 700-500 MB LAYER 
MID LEVEL LAPSE RATES AROUND 6.5 C/KM...DECENT MID LEVEL DYNAMICAL 
FORCING (700-500 MB Q-VECTOR CONVERGENCE) ON THE NORTHERN FRINGE OF 
THE AREA WILL BE PRESENT. HOWEVER...MOISTURE AND INSTABILITY STILL 
REMAIN THE BIG QUESTION MARKS FOR THIS NEXT SYSTEM WITH MODEL 
SOUNDINGS BARELY PRODUCING AN INCH AT BEST OF PRECIPITABLE WATER. AS 
A RESULT...CANNOT JUSTIFY GOING ABOVE CHANCE POPS AT THIS POINT.   

SATURDAY THROUGH TUESDAY...LATEST GFS/EUROPEAN SOLUTION A BIT SLOWER 
WITH PROGRESSION OF UPPER LEVEL TROUGHS ACROSS THE EASTERN UNTIED 
STATES THIS WEEKEND INTO THE MIDDLE OF NEXT WEEK. 00Z CANADIAN 
SOLUTION/NOGAPS TREND TOWARDS 00Z GFS SOLUTION. FAIRLY PROGRESSIVE 
PATTERN EXPECTED ACROSS THE MID SOUTH INTO NEXT WEEK WITH ANOTHER 
WAVE PRODUCING PRECIPITATION BY MONDAY.

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.
&&

$$

725 AM CST WED DEC 28 2005

.DISCUSSION...13Z SURFACE ANALYSIS PLACES SURFACE COLD FRONT THROUGH

MENTION OF PRECIP WITH THE EXCEPTION OF THE NORTHEAST THIRD WHICH 
MAY SEE AN ISOLATED SHOWER DEVELOP INTO THE AFTERNOON. 

UPDATED GRIDS ALREADY PUBLISHED.

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 280328
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
928 PM CST TUE DEC 27 2005

.UPDATE...
SURFACE LOW OVER CENTRAL MISSOURI AT 03Z. DRYLINE SOUTHWARD FROM
LOW IS MOVING THROUGH THE LITTLE ROCK AREA AT THIS TIME. CURRENTLY
NO PRECIPITATION DEVELOPING ON DRYLINE. DEWPOINTS IN THE MID 50S
AHEAD OF THE LINE DROP INTO THE 30S BEHIND IT. WINDS OF 15 TO 25
MPH AHEAD OF THE FRONT.

SURFACE CAPES MAINLY IN THE 200-400 RANGE AHEAD OF DRYLINE WITH
LIFTED INDICES AROUND 0. GOOD BIT OF INHIBITION AHEAD OF
FRONT...AND RUC/NAM SOUNDINGS INDICATE THAT BASES WOULD BE AROUND
825 MB...WITH A GOOD BIT OF CAPPING BELOW THAT. 

WEST EDGE OF CLOUDS LOOKS TO CLEAR THE MISSISSIPPI RIVER AROUND
06Z...WITH NO PRECIPITATION BEHIND IT. WILL NEED TO START
UPDATING FORECAST TO HANDLE EVENING WORDING...AND TO LOWER POPS
FROM WEST TO EAST. SINCE TEMPERATURE DROP WILL BE LATE IN THE
NIGHT...CANNOT SEE REASON FOR ADJUSTING LOW TEMPS FOR NOW...JUST
TEMPERATURE TRENDS.

&&

.PREV DISCUSSION... (ISSUED 155 PM CST TUE DEC 27 2005) 

DISCUSSION...

CURRENTLY...LOW CLOUDS ARE RAPIDLY MIXING OUT ACRS THE MID SOUTH 
THIS AFTN. STRONG SSW SURFACE FLOW HAS DEVELOPED ACRS MOST OF THE 
AREA WITH GUSTS OF 25 TO 30 MPH. TEMPS HAVE RISEN INTO THE UPPER 60S 
ACRS SOUTHERN AREAS WHILE NRN AREAS HAVE JUST ABOUT BROKEN 60. SENT 
A QUICK UPDATE TO REFLECT CURRENT TRENDS. 

TONIGHT...SFC LOW PRESSURE OVER EXTREME SE KS WILL TRACK ACRS MO AND 
INTO SRN IL BY 12Z. A COLD FRONT WL MOVE INTO WRN SXNS OF THE CWFA 
AROUND MIDNIGHT AND SWEEP EAST...MOVING OUT OF THE MID SOUTH SHORTLY 
AFTER SUNRISE. SCT SHOWERS/TSTMS SHOULD DEVELOP ALONG THE FRONT AS 
IT MOVES INTO THE MID SOUTH LATER TONIGHT. AVAILABLE MOISTURE IS A 
BIG QUESTION MARK WITH THIS SYSTEM. LOW LEVEL MOISTURE RETURN IS 
MARGINAL AT BEST WITH DEWPOINTS EXPECTED TO REACH THE MID 50S. 
MOISTURE IS ALSO NOT VERY DEEP WITH PRECIP H20 VALUES REMAINING BELOW 
1 INCH. DUE TO THE LACK OF DEEP MOISTURE HAVE OPTED TO CONTINUE WITH 
CHC POPS TONIGHT. SEVERE PARAMETERS LOOK MARGINAL AT BEST. WINDS 
ALOFT AND SHEAR ARE TYPICALLY STRONG BUT INSTABILITY SEEMS TO BE 
LACKING. MUCAPES FORECAST TO REMAIN LESS THAN 800 J/KG. UPDRAFTS WL 
HAVE A HARD TIME BEING SUSTAINED. NE MS WL BE THE MOST LIKELY AREA 
TO HAVE STRONG STORMS...BTWN 09Z-12Z...MAYBE SOME SMALL HAIL AND 
GUSTY WINDS. 

WEDNESDAY AND WEDNESDAY NIGHT...FRONT MOVES QUICKLY EAST INTO MIDDLE 
TN EARLY. MID SOUTH SHOULD BE SHROUDED BY LOW CLOUDS AND SOME LEFT 
OVER SHOWERS. TEMPS WL BE MUCH COOLER...THOUGH STILL A LITTLE WARMER 
THAN NORMAL. EXPECT LOW CLOUDS TO BE TENACIOUS...LIKE THIS LAST 
TIME...AND HANG ON ACRS MOST AREAS WED NIGHT. 

THURSDAY...SURFACE RIDGE BUILDS OVER THE AREA THOUGH LOW CLOUDS WL 
ONLY SLOWLY RETREAT. NOT MUCH TEMP ADVECTION EXPECTED SO TEMPS WL 
STILL REMAIN IN THE LOWER 50S. 

EXTENDED...LOOKS LIKE A SYSTEM EVERY COUPLE OF DAYS WITH RELATIVELY 
MILD TEMPS FOR THIS TIME OF YEAR. NEXT SYSTEM APPROACHES FRI 
RESULTING IN WARMER TEMPS FRI AFTN FOLLOWED BY SHOWERS AND 
TSTMS FOR FRI NIGHT INTO SAT. DRY SAT NIGHT INTO SUN AS 
HIGH PRESSURE CONTROLS WITH THE NEXT SYSTEM SUN NIGHT INTO MON.

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.
&&

$$

WAGNER/SJM

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
1017 AM CST TUE DEC 27 2005

.UPDATE...

LOW CLOUDS HAVE EXPLODED ACROSS THE REGION THIS MORNING. LOW LEVEL
RH FIELDS INDICATE THAT MUCH OF THE MID SOUTH WL STAY MOSTLY
CLOUDY FOR A GOOD PART OF THE DAY ESPECIALLY NW OF CLARKSDALE-
MEMPHIS-JACKSON LINE AND HAVE UPDATED SKY CONDITION. TEMPS STILL
CLIMBING NICELY UNDER STRONG WAA REGIME WITH AFTN HIGHS STILL
EXPECT TO REACH INTO THE 60S. HAVE TONED DOWN MAX TEMPS A COUPLE
OF DEGREES BECAUSE OF CLOUD COVER...BUT STILL A VERY WARM DAY FOR
THIS TIME OF YEAR. BREEZY CONDITIONS WL CONT AS WELL WITH GUSTS OF
25-30 MPH...ESPECIALLY ACRS THE DELTA.

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 271201
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
416 AM CST TUE DEC 27 2005

DISCUSSION...09Z SURFACE ANALYSIS PLACES NEXT AREA OF LOW PRESSURE 
TO AFFECT THE MID SOUTH ACROSS SOUTHWEST KANSAS AND WATER VAPOR 
IMAGERY PLACING ASSOCIATED MID LEVEL TROUGH BACK ACROSS THE ROCKIES. 
ACROSS THE MID SOUTH THIS MORNING SOUTHERLY RETURN FLOW ON THE 
BACKSIDE OF HIGH PRESSURE HAS ALREADY BEGUN WITH MANY SPOTS ALREADY 
IN THE 40S. 

TODAY...WARM DAY EXPECTED ACROSS THE MID SOUTH AS 13C 850 MB AIR 
UPSTREAM MOVES INTO THE FORECAST AREA THIS AFTERNOON...PRODUCING 
HIGHS IN THE MIDDLE 60S TO AROUND 70 ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA. WINDS 
MAY BECOME GUSTY BY AFTERNOON AS A PORTION OF 35-40KT BOUNDARY LAYER 
WINDS MIX DOWN TO THE SURFACE...BUT THINK THAT WINDS WILL STAY BELOW 
ADVISORY CRITERIA AT THIS TIME. DAY SHIFT WILL MONITOR TRENDS THIS 
MORNING AND ADJUST WIND FORECAST IF NECESSARY. MOST AREAS WILL START 
THE DAY OFF MOSTLY SUNNY BUT WILL BECOME PARTLY CLOUDY AS LOW LEVEL 
MOISTURE INCREASES ACROSS THE REGION. 

TONIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY...NGM/NAM/GFS IN DECENT AGREEMENT WITH 
PROGRESSION OF NEXT SYSTEM. 700-500 MB LAYER MID LEVEL LAPSE RATES 
WILL STEEPEN TO AROUND 7C/KM AS UPPER LEVEL LOW CLOSES OFF IN THE 
CENTRAL PLAINS AND ASSOCIATED SURFACE REFLECTION MOVES INTO THE 
MISSOURI VALLEY. 700 MB DEWPOINT DEPRESSIONS AROUND 10C...NEARLY 
UNIDIRECTIONAL WINDS (35KTS/850 MB...AND 50KTS/500MB)...BACKING 
SURFACE WINDS...0-1KM STORM RELATIVE HELICITIES AT OR ABOVE 150 
M2/S2...AND 1000-1200 J/KG MOST UNSTABLE CAPE ACROSS NORTHERN 
MISSISSIPPI SUGGEST A SEVERE THREAT MAY EXIST ACROSS PORTIONS OF THE 
FORECAST AREA ESPECIALLY AFTER MIDNIGHT. A FEW LIMITING FACTORS WITH 
THIS SYSTEM WILL BE MOISTURE AVAILABILITY...AND SURFACE BASED 
INSTABILITY. IF CONVECTION INITIATES /MAINLY ELEVATED/ IT SHOULD 
FORM INTO A LINE WITH SEVERE POTENTIAL REMAINING PRIMARILY ACROSS 
MISSISSIPPI. AT THIS TIME THE PRIMARY SEVERE WEATHER THREAT WOULD BE 
HAIL.

THE SURFACE COLD FRONT WILL MOVE THROUGH THE MID SOUTH DURING THE 
MORNING WITH ANY POST FRONTAL RAIN COMING TO AN END BY EARLY EVENING 
WITH LOWS DROPPING BACK INTO THE UPPER 30S TO LOWER 40S WEDNESDAY 
NIGHT. HIGH PRESSURE WILL RETURN ON THURSDAY AS UPPER LEVEL RIDGING 
BUILDS BACK IN ACROSS THE LOWER MISSISSIPPI VALLEY IN ADVANCE OF 
NEXT SYSTEM TO AFFECT THE AREA BY FRIDAY/SATURDAY. 

NO CHANGES MADE BEYOND THURSDAY AT THIS TIME.


&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.
&&


000 
FXUS64 KMEG 270316
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
916 PM CST MON DEC 26 2005

.UPDATE...
SKIES MOSTLY CLEAR AT 03Z WITH LIGHT SOUTHERLY WINDS AS SURFACE
HIGH MOVES OFF TO THE EAST. QUESTION OF THE NIGHT WILL BE
OVERNIGHT LOWS. OVER THE EAST PORTION OF THE CWA...TEMPERATURES
CRATERED PRETTY QUICKLY AFTER SUNSET. THERE HAS BEEN RECOVERY IN
SOME AREAS...AS MKL TEMP ROSE 4 DEGREES BETWEEN 02Z AND 03Z.
APPARENTLY A PROBLEM WITH UNION CITY AWOS...AS THEIR 56 DEGREE
READING AT 03Z WAY OUT OF LINE WITH EVERYONE ELSE. SEVERAL AREAS
ARE VERY CLOSE TO FORECAST LOWS. WILL TAKE A LOOK AT WEST
TENNESSEE AWOS OBS THIS HOUR...AND STRONGLY CONSIDERING LOWERING
OVERNIGHT LOWS IN THAT AREA AT LEAST ONE CATEGORY.

EARLY LOOK AT NGM/NAM 00Z SOLUTIONS ARE TENDING TO DE-EMPHASIZE
PRECIPITATION EVENT OVER OUR CWA FOR TUESDAY NIGHT AND
WEDNESDAY...DEVELOPING ANY PRECIP TO EAST OF OUR CWA. RATHER THAN
MAKING CHANGES TO FORECAST WITHOUT TAKING A DEEP LOOK INTO MODEL
SOLUTION...WILL CONTINUE TO ASSESS...AND PASS ON MY INPUT TO
MIDSHIFT FORECASTER.

&&

.PREV DISCUSSION... (ISSUED 1249 PM CST MON DEC 26 2005) 

DISCUSSION...

CURRENTLY...LOW CLOUDS SLOWLY CLEARING OUT OF WEST TN. CLOUDS STILL 
BLANKET AREAS EAST OF A UNION CITY TO SAVANNAH LINE BUT VISIBLE 
IMAGERY INDICATES THOSE AREAS WL CLEAR WITHIN THE NEXT COUPLE OF 
HOURS. SURFACE RIDGE MOVING EAST ACRS THE REGION WITH SOUTHERLY 
WINDS BEGINNING TO DEVELOP ACRS THE DELTA. TEMPS CLOSING IN ON THE 
50 DEGREE MARK AT MEM. MANY LOCATIONS WL SEE HIGHS IN THE LOWER 50S 
THIS AFTERNOON.

TONIGHT...A STRONG UPPER TROF WL MOVE OUT OF THE ROCKIES AND INTO 
SRN PLAINS BY 12Z TUE WITH A SURFACE LOW DEVELOPING OVER OK/KS. 
MEANWHILE HIGH PRESSURE WILL SLIP TO THE SOUTHEAST OF THE REGION. 
SKIES WL BE MOSTLY CLEAR OVERNIGHT. COOLEST TEMPS WL BE OVER 
EASTERN SECTIONS...CLOSEST TO THE SURFACE HIGH...WHERE THE WINDS WL 
BE LIGHTEST. SOUTHERLY SURFACE WINDS OF 5-10 MPH WL ONLY ALLOW 
TEMPS TO FALL TO INTO THE LOWER 40S ACRS THE DELTA.

TUESDAY...LOW PRESSURE STRENGTHENS AS THE 500 MB TROF CLOSES OFF 
OVER THE SRN PLAINS. 850 MB TEMPS OF 12-14C WL SURGE INTO THE AREA 
RESULTING IN A MUCH WARMER THAN NORMAL DAY. INCREASING HIGH 
CLOUDINESS WL KEEP TEMPS FROM GETTING OUT OF CONTROL TOUGH LOWER 
AND MID 60S SEEMS REASONABLE. SURFACE WINDS WL ALSO BE ON THE 
INCREASE AS THE PRESSURE GRADIENT TIGHTENS ACRS THE REGION. 

TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY NIGHT...SURFACE AND UPPER LOW MOVE ACRS 
SRN MO TUE NIGHT. THE ASSOCD COLD FRONT WL PUSH INTO THE REGION AND 
BE LOCATED NEAR THE MS RIVER BY 12Z WED AND MOVE INTO MIDDLE TN WED 
AFTN. EXPECT SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS WITH THE FRONT FOLLOWED BY 
WRAP AROUND SHOWERS AND LOW CLOUDS WED AFTN INTO WED NIGHT. THE BIG 
QUESTION IS THE SEVERE POTENTIAL ASSOCD WITH THIS SYSTEM. AS USUAL 
WITH THIS TIME OF YEAR THERE APPEARS TO BE ENOUGH SHEAR. INSTABILITY 
IS MORE QUESTIONABLE. SURFACE DEWPOINTS INCREASE INTO THE MID 50S 
AND PERHAPS UPPER 50S ACRS NRN MS IN ADVANCE OF THE FRONT. MODEL 
MUCAPES FORECASTS RANGE FROM ABOUT 500 TO 1000 J/KG. THE NAM IS MORE 
IMPRESSIVE WITH THIS SYSTEM AND THE ASSOCD SEVERE PARAMETERS WHILE 
THE GFS IS NOT AS AGGRESSIVE WITH THE BOUNDARY LAYER MOISTURE 
RETURN. ATTM...APPEARS TO BE A SMALL CHANCE FOR SEVERE WEATHER WITH 
BEST THREAT ACRS NRN MS LATE TUE NIGHT AND EARLY WED. 

EXTENDED...FAST MOVING ZONAL FLOW ACRS THE REGION WL LEAD TO A  
SERIES OF SYSTEMS MOVING QUICKLY ACRS THE AREA WITH NO TEMP EXTREMES 
THROUGH MON. LOW CLOUDS WL CLEAR OUT THU WITH HIGH PRESSURE BUILDING 
IN THROUGH THU NIGHT. ANOTHER SYSTEM APPROACHES FOR FRI NIGHT WITH A 
CHANCE OF RAIN BEFORE CLEARING OUT SAT. HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS IN FOR 
SAT NIGHT AND SUN. ANOTHER SYSTEM ARRIVES FOR SUN NIGHT AND MON.

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.
&&

$$

WAGNER

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
1249 PM CST MON DEC 26 2005

.DISCUSSION...

CURRENTLY...LOW CLOUDS SLOWLY CLEARING OUT OF WEST TN. CLOUDS STILL 
BLANKET AREAS EAST OF A UNION CITY TO SAVANNAH LINE BUT VISIBLE

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 261551
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
951 AM CST MON DEC 26 2005

.UPDATE...

CLOUDS HANGING TOUGH ACRS PARTS OF WEST TN THIS MORNING. THE
OVERCAST DECK BASICALLY LOCATED EAST OF A DYERSBURG-JACKSON-
CORINTH LINE. THIS DECK IS SLOWLY PROGRESSING TO THE EAST AND WL
CONTINUE TO RETREAT AS 850 MB RIDGE MOVES IN AND LOW LEVEL WAA
STRENGTHENS. SENT TO QUICK UPDATE TO DELAY CLEARING ACRS THE TN
RIVER VALLEY AND LOWER HIGH TEMPS THERE A COUPLE OF DEGREES OTRW
FORECAST ON TRACK.

&&

.PREV DISCUSSION... (ISSUED 405 AM CST MON DEC 26 2005) 

DISCUSSION...

THE H5 LOW THAT BROUGHT DAMP CONDITIONS TO THE MID-SOUTH OVER THE
CHRISTMAS WEEKEND IS MOVING AWAY AND LOCATED OVER THE MID-ATLANTIC
STATES THIS MORNING. SATELLITE SHOWS LOW CLOUDS CONTINUING TO MOVE
ACROSS THE MO BOOTHEEL INTO WEST TN AND A SMALL PART OF NORTH MS.
NAM 925 MB RELATIVE HUMIDITY FORECASTS INDICATE THESE CLOUDS WILL
GRADUALLY LIFT NORTHEASTWARD THIS MORNING LEAVING SUNNY SKIES
ACROSS THE AREA THIS AFTERNOON. AN UPPER LEVEL RIDGE WILL EXTEND
FROM THE PLAINS TO THE MID-SOUTH TODAY. MEANWHILE...SURFACE HIGH
PRESSURE WILL SLOWLY MOVE TO OUR EAST ALLOWING WINDS TO TURN TO
THE SOUTHWEST WITH WARMER TEMPERATURES.

THIS WARMING TREND WILL CONTINUE INTO TUESDAY. 850 MB PROGS
SHOW 12C TEMPERATURES SPREADING INTO THE MID-SOUTH. HIGHS WILL BE
MOSTLY IN THE 60S. HOWEVER...INCREASING SOUTHWEST WINDS WILL
CAUSE CLOUDS TO SPREAD INTO THE NORTHWEST HALF OF THE
REGION..ESPECIALLY NORTHEAST AR AND THE MO BOOTHEEL. THESE CLOUDS
WILL KEEP HIGH TEMPERATURES FROM REACHING THEIR FULL POTENTIAL.

THE NEXT STORM SYSTEM IS STILL ON TRACK BY THE MODELS TO AFFECT
THE MID-SOUTH TUESDAY NIGHT INTO WEDNESDAY. AN UPPER LEVEL TROUGH
AND ASSOCIATED COLD FRONT WILL MOVE INTO THE SOUTHER PLAINS
TUESDAY...THEN MOVE ACROSS THE MID-SOUTH TUESDAY NIGHT INTO
WEDNESDAY. THE SURFACE FRONT IS FORECAST TO MOVE INTO EASTERN AR
TOWARD SUNRISE WEDNESDAY. THINK THEIR IS ENOUGH OF A CHANCE OF
SEVERE THUNDERSTORMS WITH THIS SYSTEM TO MENTION IN THE HAZARDOUS
WEATHER OUTLOOK FOR THE ENTIRE AREA...ALTHOUGH JUST A CHANCE AT
THIS POINT. THE NAM / GFS TRACK THE SURFACE LOW PRESSURE JUST TO
OUR NORTH WITH THE NAM INDICATING THE UPPER TROUGH BECOMING MORE
NEGATIVELY TILTED WITH INCREASING UPPER LEVEL DIFFLUENCE.
SOUTHWEST WINDS AT 925 MB ARE FORECAST TO INCREASE TO 50 KNOTS
TUESDAY NIGHT. SURFACE DEWPOINTS ARE FORECAST TO CLIMB INTO THE
50S ACROSS MUCH OF THE AREA. CAPES ARE FORECAST BETWEEN 1000 AND
1500 J/KG FROM ABOUT THE TN / MS BORDER SOUTHWARD. MEANWHILE...0-3
KM HELICITY VALUES CLIMB TO BETWEEN 100 AND 150 M2/S2 ACROSS NORTH
MS. MUCH OF THIS WOULD PUT THE EMPHASIS FOR SEVERE WEATHER FROM
ABOUT THE TN / MS SOUTHWARD FROM EAST-CENTRAL AR INTO NORTH MS.
HOWEVER...CAN NOT RULE OUT THE THREAT OF SEVERE FURTHER NORTH
CLOSER TO THE UPPER LOW DUE TO COLD AIR ALOFT.

THERE ARE DIFFERENCES BETWEEN THE MODELS WEDNESDAY NIGHT WITH THE
GFS DIGGING THE UPPER LOW STRONGER ACROSS THE MID-SOUTH AND THE
NAM MOVING IT TO OUR EAST FASTER AND WEAKER. AT THIS POINT WILL
CONTINUE WITH A CHANCE OF SHOWERS WEDNESDAY NIGHT.

UPPER LEVEL RIDGING WILL SPREAD ACROSS THE AREA FROM THE WEST
THURSDAY WITH DRY WEATHER RETURNING. ANOTHER UPPER LEVEL TROUGH
AND ASSOCIATED COLD FRONT WILL MOVE THROUGH THE MID-SOUTH FRIDAY
NIGHT. THE LATEST GFS IS STRONGER WITH THIS SYSTEM THAN EARLIER
RUNS. WILL UP THE POPS A LITTLE. DRY WEATHER WILL RETURN BY
SATURDAY AFTERNOON AND CONTINUE INTO NEW YEARS DAY WITH NO REALLY
COLD AIR IN SIGHT THROUGH EARLY NEXT WEEK.

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.
&&

$$

SJM/JCL

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 260254
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
854 PM CST SUN DEC 25 2005

.DISCUSSION...

SATELLITE TRENDS SHOW LOW CLOUDS GRADUALLY PULLING AWAY FROM THE
REGION. THIS IS SUPPORTED REASONABLY WELL BY 00Z ETA. CURRENT
FORECAST SEEMS TO HAVE A GOOD HANDLE. ONCE THE LOW CLOUDS CLEAR
AND WINDS LIGHTEN...AREAS OF FOG ARE POSSIBLE AS RESIDUAL BOUNDARY
LAYER MOISTURE FROM RECENT RAINFALL CONDENSES. WILL UPDATE
FORECAST LATER IN THE EVENING MAINLY FOR TIME SENSITIVE
WORDING...GENERAL IDEA OF THE FORECAST IS STILL IN GOOD SHAPE.

&&

.PREV DISCUSSION... (ISSUED 208 PM CST SUN DEC 25 2005) 

DISCUSSION...

AN UPPER LEVEL LOW PRESSURE WILL CONTINUE PUSHING EAST TONIGHT. BACK 
EDGE OF CLOUDS ASSOCIATED WITH THE LOW IS CURRENTLY RUNNING FROM 
EXTREME EASTERN OKLAHOMA INTO SOUTHWEST ARKANSAS. DRIZZLE ALSO 
REMAINS AROUND THE AREA FROM THE UPPER LOW. EXPECT DRIZZLE THAT MAY 
BE MIXED WITH A FLURRY TO LINGER ACROSS NORTHEASTERN SECTIONS OF THE 
MIDSOUTH DURING THE EVENING HOURS ENDING BY MIDNIGHT. THE BACK EDGE 
OF THE CLOUDS WILL SLOWLY CREEP INTO THE CWA TONIGHT AND BY MORNING 
EXPECT THE ENTIRE MIDSOUTH TO BE MOSTLY CLEAR. TEMPERATURES WILL 
HOLD STEADY DURING THE EVENING HOURS UNTIL THE SKIES CLEAR THEN  
TEMPERATURES SHOULD PLUMMET INTO THE UPPER 20S TO LOWER 30S FOR 
LOWS. SOME FOG MAY ALSO DEVELOP AS THE SKIES CLEAR ESPECIALLY IN THE 
WESTERN SECTIONS OF THE MIDSOUTH.

HIGH PRESSURE WILL BUILD INTO THE MIDSOUTH FOR MONDAY. TEMPERATURES 
WILL REBOUND FROM TODAY AND WILL BE BACK INTO THE UPPER 40S TO MID 
50S FOR HIGHS. THE HIGH WILL SHIFT EAST BY MONDAY NIGHT AND WILL 
ALLOW FOR WELL ABOVE NORMAL TEMPERATURES TO OCCUR ON TUESDAY AS 
SOUTHWEST WINDS KICK INTO GEAR. TUESDAY WILL FEEL LIKE A HEAT WAVE 
WITH HIGHS IN THE 60S POSSIBLY REACHING CLOSE TO 70 DEGREES IN 
SOUTHERN AREAS OF THE CWA.

A DEVELOPING LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM WILL MOVE INTO THE REGION TUESDAY 
NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY NIGHT. EXPECT SOME SCATTERED SHOWERS WITH 
POSSIBLY A THUNDERSTORM TO DEVELOP TUESDAY EVENING ALONG A WARM 
FRONT THAT WILL BE LOCATED ALONG NORTHERN SECTIONS OF THE CWA. 
BETTER CHANCES FOR SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS WILL OCCUR WITH A SFC 
LOW AND ASSOCIATED COLD FRONT THAT WILL MOVE INTO THE CWA WEDNESDAY. 
SOME THUNDERSTORMS THAT OCCUR WEDNESDAY MAINLY ACROSS EAST CENTRAL 
ARKANSAS AND NORTH MISSISSIPPI COULD BE SEVERE BUT IT WILL END UP 
DEPENDING ON THE EXACT TRACK OF THE SFC LOW. STILL TOO EARLY TO 
REALLY TELL. WILL CONTINUE MENTION IN HWO WITH STRONG THUNDERSTORMS 
POSSIBLE ACROSS THIS AREA. AN UPPER LOW WILL MOVE IN BEHIND THE COLD 
FRONT WEDNESDAY NIGHT CONTINUING THE CHANCE FOR SHOWERS ACROSS THE 
AREA. CLOUDS FROM THE SYSTEM WILL CONTINUE INTO THURSDAY WITH COOLER 
TEMPERATURES BACK INTO THE UPPER 40S TO LOWER 50S FOR HIGHS.

HIGH PRESSURE WILL QUICKLY REBUILD INTO THE AREA BY THURSDAY NIGHT. 
THE HIGH PRESSURE WILL MOVE EAST BY FRIDAY BEFORE ANOTHER COLD FRONT 
MOVES THROUGH THE AREA FRIDAY NIGHT INTO SATURDAY. THE FRONT WILL 
NOT HAVE A LOT OF MOISTURE WITH IT SO THE FRONT MAY COME THROUGH 
DRY. WILL CONTINUE SMALL POPS FOR NOW.

HIGH PRESSURE WILL REBUILD INTO THE AREA FOR NEW YEARS GIVING THE 
MIDSOUTH DRY CONDITIONS WITH NEAR HIGHS IN THE 50S.

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.
&&

$$

KRM/VALLE

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
208 PM CST SUN DEC 25 2005

.DISCUSSION...

AN UPPER LEVEL LOW PRESSURE WILL CONTINUE PUSHING EAST TONIGHT. BACK 
EDGE OF CLOUDS ASSOCIATED WITH THE LOW IS CURRENTLY RUNNING FROM 
EXTREME EASTERN OKLAHOMA INTO SOUTHWEST ARKANSAS. DRIZZLE ALSO 
REMAINS AROUND THE AREA FROM THE UPPER LOW. EXPECT DRIZZLE THAT MAY 
BE MIXED WITH A FLURRY TO LINGER ACROSS NORTHEASTERN SECTIONS OF THE 
MIDSOUTH DURING THE EVENING HOURS ENDING BY MIDNIGHT. THE BACK EDGE 
OF THE CLOUDS WILL SLOWLY CREEP INTO THE CWA TONIGHT AND BY MORNING 
EXPECT THE ENTIRE MIDSOUTH TO BE MOSTLY CLEAR. TEMPERATURES WILL 
HOLD STEADY DURING THE EVENING HOURS UNTIL THE SKIES CLEAR THEN  
TEMPERATURES SHOULD PLUMMET INTO THE UPPER 20S TO LOWER 30S FOR 
LOWS. SOME FOG MAY ALSO DEVELOP AS THE SKIES CLEAR ESPECIALLY IN THE 
WESTERN SECTIONS OF THE MIDSOUTH.

HIGH PRESSURE WILL BUILD INTO THE MIDSOUTH FOR MONDAY. TEMPERATURES 
WILL REBOUND FROM TODAY AND WILL BE BACK INTO THE UPPER 40S TO MID 
50S FOR HIGHS. THE HIGH WILL SHIFT EAST BY MONDAY NIGHT AND WILL 
ALLOW FOR WELL ABOVE NORMAL TEMPERATURES TO OCCUR ON TUESDAY AS 
SOUTHWEST WINDS KICK INTO GEAR. TUESDAY WILL FEEL LIKE A HEAT WAVE 
WITH HIGHS IN THE 60S POSSIBLY REACHING CLOSE TO 70 DEGREES IN 
SOUTHERN AREAS OF THE CWA.

A DEVELOPING LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM WILL MOVE INTO THE REGION TUESDAY 
NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY NIGHT. EXPECT SOME SCATTERED SHOWERS WITH 
POSSIBLY A THUNDERSTORM TO DEVELOP TUESDAY EVENING ALONG A WARM 
FRONT THAT WILL BE LOCATED ALONG NORTHERN SECTIONS OF THE CWA. 
BETTER CHANCES FOR SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS WILL OCCUR WITH A SFC 
LOW AND ASSOCIATED COLD FRONT THAT WILL MOVE INTO THE CWA WEDNESDAY. 
SOME THUNDERSTORMS THAT OCCUR WEDNESDAY MAINLY ACROSS EAST CENTRAL 
ARKANSAS AND NORTH MISSISSIPPI COULD BE SEVERE BUT IT WILL END UP 
DEPENDING ON THE EXACT TRACK OF THE SFC LOW. STILL TOO EARLY TO 
REALLY TELL. WILL CONTINUE MENTION IN HWO WITH STRONG THUNDERSTORMS 
POSSIBLE ACROSS THIS AREA. AN UPPER LOW WILL MOVE IN BEHIND THE COLD 
FRONT WEDNESDAY NIGHT CONTINUING THE CHANCE FOR SHOWERS ACROSS THE 
AREA. CLOUDS FROM THE SYSTEM WILL CONTINUE INTO THURSDAY WITH COOLER 
TEMPERATURES BACK INTO THE UPPER 40S TO LOWER 50S FOR HIGHS.

HIGH PRESSURE WILL QUICKLY REBUILD INTO THE AREA BY THURSDAY NIGHT. 
THE HIGH PRESSURE WILL MOVE EAST BY FRIDAY BEFORE ANOTHER COLD FRONT 
MOVES THROUGH THE AREA FRIDAY NIGHT INTO SATURDAY. THE FRONT WILL 
NOT HAVE A LOT OF MOISTURE WITH IT SO THE FRONT MAY COME THROUGH 
DRY. WILL CONTINUE SMALL POPS FOR NOW.

HIGH PRESSURE WILL REBUILD INTO THE AREA FOR NEW YEARS GIVING THE 
MIDSOUTH DRY CONDITIONS WITH NEAR HIGHS IN THE 50S.

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 251614
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
1014 AM CST SUN DEC 25 2005

.UPDATE...

UPPER LOW CONTINUES TO PUSH EAST THIS MORNING. LIGHT RAIN OR
DRIZZLE CONTINUES TO FALL OVER PORTIONS OF THE MIDSOUTH. BLYTHEVILLE
EVEN REPORTED FLURRIES LAST HOUR. TEMPERATURES ARE COLD WITH
CURRENT READINGS IN THE UPPER 30S TO MID 40S. TEMPERATURES WILL HOVER
AROUND CURRENT TEMPS THE REST OF THE DAY. CURRENT FORECAST LOOKS GOOD
WILL ONLY ADD RAIN WITH POSSIBLE LIGHT SNOW ACROSS NORTHERN
SECTIONS OF THE MIDSOUTH SINCE TEMPERATURES ARE IN THE UPPER 30S
AND BLYTHEVILLE HAS REPORTED FLURRIES. UPDATE WILL BE OUT SHORTLY.

&&

.PREV DISCUSSION... (ISSUED 359 AM CST SUN DEC 25 2005) 

DISCUSSION...

A CLOSED H5 LOW OF 5410 METERS IS CENTERED OVER NORTHWEST TN THIS
MORNING. SATELLITE SHOWS LOW CLOUDS COVERING THE MID-SOUTH THIS
MORNING AND RADARS INDICATE RAIN WRAPPING AROUND THE H5 LOW ACROSS
PARTS OF THE AREA. BOUNDARY LAYER TEMPERATURES HAVE BEEN TOO WARM
FOR ANY SNOW IN OUR FORECAST AREA.

MODELS ARE IN AGREEMENT THAT THE H5 LOW WILL PUSH TOWARD THE OHIO
RIVER VALLEY TODAY. WILL CONTINUE WITH LIKELY POPS FOR MOST OF THE
AREA TODAY AS WRAP AROUND PRECIPITATION CONTINUES MAINLY THIS
MORNING. LATER FORECASTS WILL PROBABLY BE ABLE TO LOWER POPS FOR THIS
AFTERNOON ESPECIALLY ACROSS THE WESTERN HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA.
WILL MENTION CHANCE OF LIGHT SNOW IN ADDITION TO THE RAIN FOR
EXTREME NORTHEAST ARKANSAS...WITH THE BEST CHANCE ACROSS THE
HIGHER TERRAIN OF RANDOLPH AND LAWRENCE COUNTIES. NO ACCUMULATION
OF ANY SNOW IS EXPECTED IN THESE LOCATIONS AS TEMPERATURES REMAIN
ABOVE FREEZING. ELSEWHERE...LOOKING AT FORECAST CRITICAL LOW LEVEL
THICKNESS VALUES AND MODEL SOUNDINGS...BOUNDARY LAYER TEMPERATURES
APPEAR TOO WARM FOR BUT A REMOTE CHANCE OF SNOW AND WILL LEAVE OUT
OF THE FORECAST. COLDER AIR WILL GRADUALLY BE SPREADING INTO THE
MID-SOUTH TODAY BUT ABOUT THE TIME THE LOWER LEVELS GET COLD
ENOUGH FOR SNOW...THE CHANCE OF PRECIPITATION WILL HAVE ENDED OR THE
LEVELS AT MINUS 10C FOR ICE NUCLEATION WILL HAVE DRIED OUT LEAVING
BUT A CHANCE FOR DRIZZLE.

FORECAST RELATIVE HUMIDITY PROGS HAVE BEEN PERSISTENT IN SHOWING LOW
CLOUDS CLEARING FROM THE WEST TONIGHT. THINK WINDS WILL STAY UP
ENOUGH TO PREVENT WIDESPREAD DENSE FOG...BUT THIS WILL HAVE TO BE
WATCHED IN CASE WINDS DECREASE MORE THAN EXPECTED. THE H5 LOW WILL
LOSE INFLUENCE OVER MID-SOUTH WEATHER TONIGHT WITH H5 HEIGHTS
INCREASING ACROSS THE AREA.

MONDAY AND MONDAY NIGHT WILL BE WARMER AS UPPER LEVEL RIDGING
EXTENDS FROM THE PLAINS INTO THE MID-SOUTH. A SURFACE HIGH WILL
MOVE EAST OF OUR AREA ALLOWING WINDS TO TURN TO THE SOUTHWEST.
FORECAST 850 MB CHARTS SHOW GOOD WARM AIR ADVECTION.

ON TUESDAY...THE UPPER LEVEL RIDGE MOVES OVER THE MID-SOUTH AND
850 MB TEMPERATURES CLIMB TO BETWEEN 12C AND 14C. HOWEVER...THERE
IS A GOOD INFLUX OF MOISTURE AND ADVECTION OF HIGHER SURFACE
DEWPOINTS. THIS LEADS TO LOW CLOUDS SPREADING INTO THE AREA FROM
THE SOUTHWEST DURING THE AFTERNOON AS SHOWN BY THE NAM 925 MB
RELATIVE HUMIDITY FORECASTS. WILL FORECAST HIGHS IN THE UPPER 50S
AND LOWER 60S TUESDAY...BUT THEY COULD BE HIGHER IF THE CLOUDS
FAIL TO MATERIALIZE.

A POTENT UPPER LEVEL TROUGH AND ASSOCIATED SURFACE LOW WILL
APPROACH THE MID-SOUTH TUESDAY NIGHT AND MOVE ACROSS THE AREA
WEDNESDAY. FAVOR THE FASTER GFS / ECMWF FORECAST THAN THE SLOWER
NAM AS THE GFS DID BETTER WITH THE CURRENT SYSTEM. THERE COULD BE
SOME STRONG THUNDERSTORMS...ESPECIALLY ACROSS NORTH MS AS SHOWN BY
SPC IN THE EXTENDED OUTLOOK. THE GFS SHOWS LIFTED INDICES AROUND MINUS
TWO WITH GOOD UPPER LEVEL DIFFLUENCE ASSOCIATED WITH THE UPPER
LEVEL TROUGH WHICH WILL BE IN A DEEPENING STAGE. THIS IS REALLY TOO FAR
OUT AT THIS TIME TO PIN DOWN IF ANY THREAT OF SEVERE WILL EXTEND
AS FAR NORTH AS OUR FORECAST AREA.

A WEAKER TROUGH WILL BRING A CHANCE OF SHOWERS FRIDAY
NIGHT...CURRENT GRIDS LOOK FINE CONCERNING THIS.

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.
&&

$$

KRM

FXUS64 KMEG 250241
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
841 PM CST SAT DEC 24 2005

.DISCUSSION...

PATCHY TO AREAS OF DENSE FOG EXIST OVER MUCH OF WEST TN INTO
NORTHEAST MS. VISIBILITIES HAVE BEEN REPORTED AS LOW AS MINUS ONE
QUARTER OF A MILE IN SOME LOCATIONS. THIS FOG IS AHEAD OF THE
COLD FRONT WHICH CAN BE SEEN ON RADAR AS A LINE OF SHOWERS THAT AS
OF 0230Z EXTENDS FROM NEAR BLYTHEVILLE TO MEMPHIS TO NEAR OXFORD.
VISIBILITIES HAVE IMPROVED CONSIDERABLY ONCE THE FRONT HAS MOVED
THROUGH WITH DEW POINTS BEHIND THE FRONT LOWER THAN THOSE AHEAD OF
THE FRONT. EXPECT THIS LINE TO MOVE THROUGH ACROSS THE TN RIVER
AROUND 06Z WITH ALL DENSE FOG ENDING AREAWIDE BY THIS TIME. IN
REGARDS TO RAIN CHANCES...WILL LIKELY LEAVE CHANCES HIGH WITH
PERIODS WORDING SINCE REGIONAL RADAR STILL INDICATES PATCHES OF
LIGHTER RAIN OVER CENTRAL ARKANSAS AND WRAP AROUND RAINFALL OVER
WESTERN ARKANSAS THAT WILL MOVE TO NEAR THE MS RIVER BY MORNING.
LOWS LOOK REASONABLE...WILL MAKE A LATE EVENING UPDATE TO REMOVE
FOG WORDING ONCE THE FRONT HAS MOSTLY CLEARED THE REGION. WILL
ALLOW SPECIAL WEATHER STATEMENT TO EXPIRE AT 05Z.

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.
&&

$$

VALLE





000 
FXUS64 KMEG 250018
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
618 PM CST SAT DEC 24 2005

.DISCUSSION...

UPDATED FORECAST TO MENTION FOG. 00Z OBS FROM
BLYTHEVILLE...MILLINGTON AND TUPELO SHOW VISIBILITIES AT LESS THAN
HALF A MILE. HAVE RECEIVED REPORTS FROM THE SHELBY FOREST AREA OF
VISIBILITIES NEAR ZERO. OBSERVATIONS ACROSS THE AREA INDICATE THAT
THE FOG SEEMS TO BE PATCHY AND NOT WIDESPREAD...THEREFORE NO DENSE
FOG ADVISORY. WITH FRONT MOVING THROUGH AND WINDS EXPECTED TO PICK
BACK UP WOULD THINK THAT FOG WOULD REMAIN PATCHY. AM CONTEMPLATING
ISSUING SPECIAL WEATHER STATEMENT TO HIGHLIGHT FOG PROBLEM SINCE
THERE WILL BE A GOOD DEAL OF TRAVEL AROUND THE AREA TONIGHT. ALSO
UPED POPS SLIGHTLY SINCE REGIONAL RADAR TRENDS SHOWING WAVES OF
SHOWERS SPIRALING INTO THE REGION.

&&

.PREV DISCUSSION... (ISSUED 132 PM CST SAT DEC 24 2005) 

DISCUSSION...

A COLD FRONT IS CURRENTLY MAKING ITS WAY ACROSS WESTERN PORTIONS OF 
THE MIDSOUTH THIS AFTERNOON. THE FRONT WILL BE FOLLOWED BY AN UPPER 
LEVEL LOW. THE LOW IS EXPECTED TO TRACK ACROSS THE CWA TONIGHT INTO 
CHRISTMAS DAY. EXPECT SHOWERS WITH THE LOW TO MOVE THROUGH THE AREA 
TONIGHT. THE SHOWERS MAY MIX WITH SNOW AT TIMES ACROSS NORTHWESTERN 
PORTIONS OF THE CWA MAINLY AFTER MIDNIGHT AS THE COLD AIR FILTERS 
INTO THE REGION. CHRISTMAS DAY WILL BE COLD AS CLOUDY SKIES WILL 
PERSIST AROUND THE AREA WITH LINGERING SHOWERS FROM THE LOW PRESSURE 
SYSTEM. THE ENTIRE CWA MAY SEE AN OCCASIONAL SNOWFLAKE MIX WITH THE 
SHOWERS FROM TIME TO TIME. DO NOT EXPECT TEMPERATURES TO RISE MUCH 
DURING THE DAY AS THEY SHOULD HOVER AROUND FORECASTED LOWS THAT 
OCCUR TONIGHT.

CLOUDS WILL BEGIN TO MOVE OUT SUNDAY NIGHT AS HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS 
INTO THE REGION. TEMPERATURES WILL QUICKLY WARM AS THE HIGH SKIRTS 
EAST BY MONDAY NIGHT. TUESDAY WILL BE MUCH WARMER AS SOUTHWEST WINDS 
KICK UP ACROSS THE AREA. EXPECT HIGHS IN THE UPPER 50S TO MID 60S.

ANOTHER LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM WILL APPROACH THE MIDSOUTH TUESDAY NIGHT 
THROUGH WEDNESDAY NIGHT. EXPECT SHOWERS TO BREAK OUT OVER THE 
MIDSOUTH AHEAD OF A WARM FRONT TUESDAY NIGHT THAT WILL BE POSITIONED 
OVER THE CWA. A COLD FRONT WITH AN ASSOCIATED SFC LOW WILL MOVE 
THROUGH THE CWA WEDNESDAY INTO WEDNESDAY NIGHT. SHOWERS AND 
THUNDERSTORMS WILL DEVELOP ALONG THE FRONT. DEPENDING ON THE EXACT 
TRACK OF THE LOW...SOME THUNDERSTORMS COULD BE STRONG OVER PORTIONS 
OF NORTH MISSISSIPPI WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON AND EVENING. TEMPERATURES 
WILL COOL BEHIND THE FRONT.

HIGH PRESSURE WILL REBUILD INTO THE AREA DURING THE THURSDAY THROUGH 
FRIDAY TIME FRAME. EXPECT DRY CONDITIONS WITH TEMPERATURES NEAR 
NORMAL.

A COLD FRONT WILL MOVE THROUGH THE MIDSOUTH FRIDAY NIGHT AND 
SATURDAY WHICH WILL BRING ANOTHER CHANCE FOR RAIN TO THE AREA. 
TEMPERATURES WILL BE COOLER ON SATURDAY WITH HIGHS WILL BE IN THE UPPER 
40S TO LOWER 50S WITH LOWS IN THE 30S.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
MEM  41  43  34  53 /  80  60  10   0 
MKL  40  41  29  50 /  80  60  10   0 
JBR  39  43  30  52 /  80  60  10   0 
TUP  42  44  31  53 /  80  60  10   0

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 241648
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
1048 AM CST SAT DEC 24 2005

.UPDATE...

DRY SLOT AHEAD OF THE COLD FRONT IS BEGINNING TO MOVE INTO WESTERN
PORTIONS OF THE MIDSOUTH THIS MORNING. THE DRY SLOT WILL BRING
A BRIEF BREAK FROM THE CLOUDS BEFORE THE UPPER LEVEL LOW MOVES
OVER THE AREA TONIGHT. MEANWHILE...THE BACK EDGE OF THE MODERATE
TO HEAVY RAIN STRETCHES FROM SAVANNAH TO NEAR OXFORD. THE BACK
EDGE WILL CONTINUE TO MOVE EASTWARD AND WILL MOVE OUT OF THE CWA
DURING THE AFTERNOON HOURS. WILL UPDATE TO LOWER POPS THE REST OF THE
DAY. TEMPERATURES ARE CURRENTLY RUNNING AROUND THE MID 40S TO THE
NEAR 50 DEGREES FOR MOST LOCATIONS. EXPECT THE BREAK IN THE CLOUDS
SHOULD ALLOW TEMPERATURES TO WARM UP ENOUGH THIS AFTERNOON TO
REACH FORECASTED HIGHS IN THE LOW TO MID 50S.

&&

.PREV DISCUSSION... (ISSUED 410 AM CST SAT DEC 24 2005) 

DISCUSSION...

A WET CHRISTMAS HOLIDAY WEEKEND IS IN STORE FOR THE MID-SOUTH.
CLOUDS HAVE ALREADY SPREAD OVER THE AREA DURING THE NIGHT...AND
RAIN IS QUICKLY MOVING IN FROM THE WEST. AN UPPER LEVEL TROUGH HAS
ALREADY CLOSED OFF OVER THE CENTRAL PLAINS. A STRONG 300 MB JET OF
140 KNOTS ON THE WEST SIDE OF THIS TROUGH WILL CAUSE IT TO
CONTINUE TO DIG SOUTHWARD TODAY. BY 00Z THIS EVENING...THE CLOSED
LOW AT 500 MB IS FORECAST TO BE OVER NORTHERN AR / SOUTHERN MO
WITH THE GFS AND NAM SIMILAR AND THE GFS JUST SLIGHTLY STRONGER
WITH A CENTER HEIGHT OF 542 M. AN ASSOCIATED SURFACE COLD FRONT
WILL MOVE THROUGH THE MID-SOUTH FROM THE WEST TODAY AND THIS
EVENING. GOOD UPPER LEVEL DIFFLUENCE AHEAD OF THE UPPER TROUGH
ALONG WITH ISENTROPIC LIFT AHEAD OF THE SURFACE FRONT WILL LEAD TO
GOOD UPWARD MOTION...AND HIGH CHANCES OF SHOWERS TODAY. WILL ADD
ISOLATED THUNDER FROM EAST-CENTRAL AR...ACROSS NORTH MS...INTO
WEST TN FOR TODAY. STABILITY VALUES ARE MARGINAL AT BEST...BUT
LIGHTNING DETECTION HAS BEEN INDICATING SOME LIGHTNING STRIKES
ACROSS SOUTHERN AR EARLY THIS MORNING DUE TO ELEVATED INSTABILITY.

FOR TONIGHT AND CHRISTMAS...WILL CONTINUE WITH HIGH POPS. THE CLOSED 
UPPER LEVEL LOW WILL MOVE DIRECTLY OVER THE MID-SOUTH
TONIGHT...AND THEN GRADUALLY MOVE TO OUR EAST SUNDAY. LOOKING AT
CRITICAL 1000 TO 950 MB THICKNESS VALUES...1000 TO 850 MB
THICKNESS VALUES...AND MODEL SOUNDING DATA...THE CHANCE FOR SNOW 
APPEARS MARGINAL WITH THE BEST CHANCE PROBABLY ACROSS NORTHEAST AR
/ MO BOOTHEEL AND PARTICULARLY THE HIGHER TERRAIN OF RANDOLPH AND
LAWRENCE COUNTIES OF AR. BOUNDARY LAYER TEMPERATURES APPEAR
MARGINAL FOR SNOW BUT THE POSSIBILITY DOES EXIST FOR SOME SNOW.
WILL MENTION THE CHANCE OF SNOW (ALONG WITH RAIN) FOR NORTHEAST
AR / MO BOOTHEEL AFTER MIDNIGHT TONIGHT AS COLDER AIR PUSHES
IN...THEN ACROSS ALL OF THE MID-SOUTH CHRISTMAS. TEMPERATURES WILL
BE WELL ABOVE FREEZING...SO DO NOT EXPECT ANY ACCUMULATIONS OF SNOW.

AN UPPER LEVEL RIDGE WILL BUILD ACROSS THE MIDSOUTH MONDAY WITH A
RETURN TO MOSTLY SUNNY AND DRY WEATHER. ANOTHER LOW PRESSURE
SYSTEM WILL MOVE THROUGH THE MID-SOUTH WEDNESDAY CAUSING A CHANCE
OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS. INCREASED POPS SLIGHTLY FOR
WEDNESDAY...BUT THESE PROBABLY WILL NEED TO BE INCREASED FURTHER
IN LATER FORECASTS. DRY WEATHER WILL RETURN THURSDAY AS AN UPPER
LEVEL RIDGE BUILDS INTO THE AREA...CONTINUING THE QUICK WEST TO
EAST MOVEMENT OF WEATHER SYSTEMS ACROSS THE MID-SOUTH.

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.
&&

$$

KRM

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 240244
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
844 PM CST FRI DEC 23 2005

.DISCUSSION...

REGIONAL RADAR SHOWS LEADING EDGE OF RAIN BEGINNING TO MOVE OUT OF
OKLAHOMA. LATEST RUN OF THE NAM IS CONSISTENT WITH PREVIOUS RUN.
THIS BRINGS RAIN INTO AREAS ALONG AND WEST OF THE MISSISSIPPI
RIVER A COUPLE HOURS BEFORE MORNING. OBSERVATIONS ARE SHOWING THAT
TEMPS ARE BEGINNING TO LEVEL OFF. ONLY ADJUSTMENTS TO TONIGHTS
FORECAST ARE DUE TO WORDING. DID UPDATE FORECAST FOR EARLY TOMORROW
MORNING WITH LATEST MODEL RUN SHOWING THAT RAIN WILL LIKELY BE
LINGERING ACROSS EASTERN ARKANSAS FOR A FEW HOURS. 

&&

.PREV DISCUSSION... (ISSUED 221 PM CST FRI DEC 23 2005) 

DISCUSSION...

A DEVELOPING LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM WILL APPROACH THE MIDSOUTH LATE 
TONIGHT. MODELS HAVE COME INTO AGREEMENT WITH DEVELOPING A CUT OFF 
UPPER LOW OVER MISSOURI ALONG WITH AN APPROACHING COLD FRONT LATE 
TONIGHT. EXPECT INCREASING CLOUDS DURING THE EVENING HOURS WITH RAIN 
BEGINNING ACROSS WESTERN SECTIONS OF THE CWA AROUND MIDNIGHT. THE 
AREA OF RAIN WILL CONTINUE TO MOVE THROUGH THE MIDSOUTH ON SATURDAY 
AHEAD OF THE FRONT. EXPECT THE MAJORITY OF THE RAIN ASSOCIATED WITH 
THE FRONT TO EXIT THE MIDSOUTH BY SATURDAY EVENING. THE UPPER LOW 
WILL SKIRT ACROSS NORTHERN SECTIONS OF THE MIDSOUTH SATURDAY NIGHT 
INTO SUNDAY MORNING. EXPECT A BAND OF WRAP AROUND PRECIP BEHIND THE LOW. 
THE LOW LEVELS ARE STILL FAIRLY WARM SO EXPECT PRECIP TO REMAIN 
MAINLY RAIN AT THIS TIME BUT A CAN/T RULE OUT A CHANGEOVER TO SNOW 
OR RAIN MIXING WITH SNOW AT TIMES. WILL ADD MENTION OF RAIN OR SNOW IN 
FORECAST. EVEN WITH A MENTION OF SNOW THE MIDSOUTH SHOULD NOT EXPECT 
A WHITE CHRISTMAS. NO ACCUMULATION IS EXPECTED. CHRISTMAS WILL BE 
COLD WITH CLOUDY SKIES WITH POSSIBLE FLURRIES. EXPECT HIGHS IN THE 
LOWER TO MID 40S.

SKIES WILL BEGIN TO CLEAR CHRISTMAS NIGHT AS HIGH PRESSURE BEGINS TO 
BUILD INTO THE AREA. TEMPERATURES WILL QUICKLY WARM UP AS THE HIGH 
SHIFTS EAST BY MONDAY NIGHT. TEMPERATURES WILL RETURN TO THE UPPER 
50S BY TUESDAY FOR HIGHS FOR MOST LOCATIONS. 

ANOTHER LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM WILL DEVELOP TUESDAY NIGHT IN WHAT LOOKS 
TO BE AN EXACT REPEAT OF THIS WEEKEND/S SYSTEM. AN AREA OF RAIN WILL 
DEVELOP AHEAD OF A COLD FRONT AND WILL MOVE THROUGH THE AREA TUESDAY 
NIGHT AND WILL BE FOLLOWED BY AN UPPER LEVEL LOW WEDNESDAY INTO 
WEDNESDAY NIGHT. EXPECT WRAP AROUND RAIN ON WEDNESDAY/WEDNESDAY 
NIGHT. COOLER WEATHER WILL MOVE BACK INTO THE AREA WITH THE SYSTEM 
ON WEDNESDAY.

HIGH PRESSURE WILL MOVE BACK INTO THE CWA ON THURSDAY AND WILL 
DOMINATE THE WEATHER THROUGH THE END OF THE FORECAST PERIOD. 
TEMPERATURES WILL GRADUALLY WARM UP BY FRIDAY.

&&

KRM

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.


000 
FXUS64 KMEG 231618
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
1018 AM CST FRI DEC 23 2005

.UPDATE...
SOUTHWEST WINDS HAVE KICKED UP THIS MORNING WARMING TEMPERATURES
INTO THE 40S. WITH MOSTLY SUNNY SKIES...TEMPERATURES WILL CONTINUE TO
RISE INTO THE 50S AND SHOULD REACH EXPECTED HIGHS IN THE UPPER 50S.
CURRENT FORECAST LOOKS GOOD...NO UPDATES ARE EXPECTED.

&&

.PREV DISCUSSION... (ISSUED 354 AM CST FRI DEC 23 2005) 

DISCUSSION...

TODAY PROMISES TO BE A VERY NICE DAY WEATHERWISE FOR LAST MINUTE
CHRISTMAS SHOPPING. H5 HEIGHTS WILL BE WELL ABOVE NORMAL FOR THIS
TIME OF THE YEAR ACROSS THE MID-SOUTH WITH A WESTERLY FLOW.
SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE ALONG THE SOUTHEAST UNITED STATES COAST WILL
CAUSE A WARMING SOUTHWEST WIND FLOW ACROSS THE MID-SOUTH. THERE
MAY BE SOME CIRRUS...BUT THOSE PESKY LOW CLOUDS FROM YESTERDAY ARE
GONE. HIGHS TODAY WILL CLIMB INTO THE UPPER 50S.

AN UPPER LEVEL TROUGH WILL DIG INTO THE CENTRAL PLAINS
TONIGHT...AND EVENTUALLY A CLOSED LOW WILL FORM. AN ASSOCIATED
SURFACE COLD FRONT IS FORECAST TO APPROACH THE MID-SOUTH FROM THE
WEST TONIGHT. THE GFS AND NAM INDICATE FAIRLY GOOD UPPER LEVEL
DYNAMICS DEVELOPING ACROSS THE AREA BY LATE TONIGHT WITH GOOD
UPWARD MOTION. MOISTURE IS SOMEWHAT LIMITED AS 850 MB WINDS REMAIN
MOSTLY WESTERLY WITHOUT A GOOD INFLOW FROM THE GULF.
NEVERTHELESS...WILL EXPAND THE CHANCE OF SHOWERS ACROSS ALL OF THE
AREA AFTER MIDNIGHT...AND INCREASE THE POPS A LITTLE FOR TONIGHT.

ON CHRISTMAS EVE...THE COLD FRONT WILL MOVE THROUGH THE MID-SOUTH.
WILL INCREASE POPS FOR MOST OF THE AREA...WITH THE BEST CHANCE
FROM THE SOUTHEAST CORNER OF WEST TN INTO NORTHEAST MS WHERE THE
UPWARD MOTION BECOMES THE GREATEST DURING THE DAY. ATTM...STABILITY
VALUES APPEAR TOO LOW FOR ANY THUNDERSTORMS...BUT WILL MONITOR
LATER MODELS. THERE MAY BE SOME TEMPORARY DRY SLOTTING WITH PARTIAL
CLEARING BEHIND THE COLD FRONT...BEFORE CLOUDS AND COOLER AIR
MOVE IN. HOWEVER...AT THIS TIME...WILL CONTINUE MOSTLY CLOUDY
SKIES FOR THE AVERAGE SKY COVER SATURDAY. THE CLOSED UPPER LEVEL LOW
WILL MOVE TO THE NORTH OF THE AREA SATURDAY INTO EARLY SUNDAY. THE
GFS IS FURTHER SOUTH AND STRONGER WITH THE LOW THAN THE NAM. WILL
COMPROMISE BETWEEN THE MODELS AT THIS TIME. WILL CONTINUE WITH A
30 PERCENT CHANCE OF SHOWERS SATURDAY NIGHT. CAN NOT RULE OUT THE
RAIN MIXING WITH OR CHANGING TO SOME LIGHT SNOW...BUT LOOKING AT
THE MODEL SOUNDINGS THE BOUNDARY LAYER APPEARS MARGINAL FOR ANY
SNOW. WILL LEAVE OUT ANY MENTION OF SNOW FOR THE TIME BEING.

RELATIVE HUMIDITY PROGS SHOW LOW CLOUDS COVERING THE MID-SOUTH
CHRISTMAS DAY WITH A COLD NORTHWEST WIND. THE UPPER LEVEL LOW WILL
GRADUALLY MOVE TO OUR EAST.

MONDAY AND TUESDAY...A RATHER STRONG RIDGE BUILDS OVER THE
FORECAST AREA FROM THE WEST BRINGING DRY AND WARMER WEATHER. AN UPPER
LEVEL TROUGH AND ASSOCIATED COLD FRONT WILL MOVE THROUGH WEDNESDAY
BRINGING A CHANCE OF SHOWERS. NO REALLY COLD AIR IS SEEN IN THE
IMMEDIATE FUTURE THOUGH.

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.
&&

$$

KRM

945 PM CST THU DEC 22 2005

.DISCUSSION...

SOUTHERLY WINDS ARE GRADUALLY INCREASING OVER THE MIDSOUTH FROM
WESTERN COUNTIES. THIS MEANS THAT DESPITE MOSTLY CLEAR SKIES THAT
THE LOW TONIGHT MAY BE REACHED IN THE NEXT HOUR OR TWO. THEN WAA
SHOULD BE GREAT ENOUGH TO GRADUALLY INCREASE TEMPERATURE THROUGH
THE REST OF THE NIGHT.



000 
FXUS64 KMEG 221947
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
147 PM CST THU DEC 22 2005

.DISCUSSION...

HIGH PRESSURE WILL BE LOCATED OVER THE SOUTHEASTERN UNITED STATES 
TONIGHT. THIS WILL ALLOW FOR SOUTHWEST WINDS TO KICK UP OVER THE 
CWA. THE LINGERING LOW CLOUDS FROM TODAY SHOULD FINALLY DISSIPATE BY 
LATE THIS AFTERNOON ALLOWING FOR MOSTLY CLEAR SKIES. EXPECT 
TEMPERATURES TO DROP INTO THE UPPER 20S TO LOWER 30S FOR THE MOST 
PART.

THE SOUTHWEST WINDS WILL ALLOW FOR WARMER CONDITIONS ON FRIDAY. 
SKIES WILL BE MOSTLY SUNNY WITH HIGHS IN THE UPPER 50S. CLOUDS WILL 
BEGIN TO INCREASE FRIDAY NIGHT AHEAD OF AN APPROACHING COLD FRONT. 
MODELS DIFFER ON PLACEMENT OF THE SFC LOW AND THE DEVELOPMENT OF A 
CUT OFF UPPER LOW. THE GFS ALONG WITH UKMET AND ECMWF SHOWS A SFC 
LOW TRACKING ACROSS MISSOURI INTO KENTUCKY LATE FRIDAY NIGHT INTO 
SATURDAY NIGHT. THE MODELS ALSO SHOW A CUT OFF UPPER LOW DEVELOPING 
BEHIND THE SFC LOW. THE LATEST RUN OF THE NAM SHOWS NO CUT OFF UPPER 
LOW AND HAS THE SFC LOW MUCH FURTHER NORTH ALONG THE GREAT LAKES. IN 
FACT IT HAS WEAKENED THE ASSOCIATED SHORTWAVE FROM PREVIOUS RUN AND 
IS NOW NOT PRODUCING A LOT OF PRECIP WITH THE FRONTAL PASSAGE ON 
SATURDAY. WILL LEAN TOWARD THE GFS/UKMET/ECMWF SOLUTION. EXPECT 
FRONT TO BE THROUGH THE ENTIRE CWA BY LATE SATURDAY NIGHT. COLD AIR 
WILL FILTER INTO THE REGION BEHIND THE SYSTEM. CHRISTMAS DAY WILL BE 
A COLD DAY WITH CLOUDY SKIES WITH MAYBE A FLURRY OCCURRING ACROSS 
PORTIONS OF WEST TENNESSEE.

HIGH PRESSURE WILL BUILD INTO THE MIDSOUTH FOR MONDAY THROUGH 
TUESDAY NIGHT TIME FRAME. SKIES SHOULD BE MOSTLY CLEAR/PARTLY CLOUDY 
BY MONDAY BUT TEMPERATURES WILL STILL BE ON THE COOL SIDE. TUESDAY WILL 
BE A LITTLE WARMER AS THE HIGH SHIFTS EAST.

ANOTHER LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM WILL DEVELOP ON WEDNESDAY NEAR THE 
AR-LA-TEX REGION. EXPECT SYSTEM TO SPREAD RAIN INTO THE CWA THROUGH 
THE END OF THE FORECAST PERIOD AS THE SYSTEM MOVES EASTWARD.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
MEM  35  58  47  57 /   0   0  10  40 
MKL  29  57  44  52 /   0   0  10  40 
JBR  32  57  43  52 /   0   0  20  40 
TUP  28  58  42  58 /   0   0  10  40

FXUS64 KMEG 221605
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
1030 AM CST THU DEC 22 2005

.DISCUSSION... 

AREA OF LOW CLOUDS SEEMS TO BE EXPANDING ACROSS THE PORTIONS OF THE 
MIDSOUTH THIS MORNING. THE CLOUDS ARE MAINLY LOCATED FROM A PARIS TO 
WEST HELENA LINE. WILL UPDATE TO GO MOSTLY CLOUDY IN THIS CORRIDOR 
WITH PARTLY CLOUDY CONDITIONS ACROSS NORTHEAST ARKANSAS AND MOSTLY 
SUNNY SKIES ACROSS NORTHEAST MISSISSIPPI. WITH THE CLOUDS 
PRESENT...TEMPERATURES ARE NOT WARMING AS QUICKLY AS ANTICIPATED. 
WILL UPDATE TO LOWER HIGH TEMPERATURES A CATEGORY. UPDATE WILL BE 
OUT SHORTLY.



000 
FXUS64 KMEG 221328
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
728 AM CST THU DEC 22 2005

.UPDATE...

ISSUED A QUICK UPDATE TO ACCOUNT FOR PERSISTANT PATCHY LOW CLOUD
AND FOG DEVELOPMENT OVER PORTIONS OF THE AREA. EXTENDED LOW CLOUD AND
FOG WORDING TO INCLUDE ADDITIONAL ZONE GROUPINGS TO THE NORTH AND
EAST. UPDATED GRIDS AND ZONES JUST SENT.

&&

.PREV DISCUSSION... (ISSUED 406 AM CST THU DEC 22 2005) 

DISCUSSION...

HIGH PRESSURE HAS SETTLED OVER THE MID-SOUTH THIS MORNING. A PESKY
AREA OF LOW CLOUDS STILL LINGERS IN SPOTS NEAR THE MISSISSIPPI
RIVER EARLY THIS MORNING...WITH MOSTLY CLEAR SKIES ELSEWHERE.
EXPECT LOW CLOUDS TO DISSIPATE BEFORE SUNRISE...WITH MOSTLY CLEAR
CONDITIONS EXPECTED FOR THE MORNING RUSH HOUR. TEMPERATURES AT 09Z
RANGE FROM THE LOWER 20S IN EASTERN AREAS...WHERE CLEAR SKIES AND
GOOD RADIATIONAL COOLING CONDITIONS EXIST...TO THE LOWER AND MID
30S IN THE DELTA REGION...WHERE LOW CLOUDS ARE HANGING ON.
TEMPERATURES SHOULD SETTLE IN NEAR 20 DEGREES EAST TO NEAR 30
IN THE DELTA REGION BY SUNRISE.

VERY PLEASANT WEATHER IS EXPECTED OVER THE AREA TODAY AND FRIDAY AS
SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE SLIDES SLOWLY SOUTHEAST AND THE UPPER LEVEL
FLOW BECOMES PREDOMINANTLY ZONAL. WEAK LOW LEVEL WARM AIR ADVECTION
ALONG WITH FULL SUN THIS AFTERNOON SHOULD ALLOW TEMPERATURES TO
WARM 10 TO 12 DEGREES ABOVE YESTERDAYS HIGHS...WITH MAXES EXPECTED
IN THE 50S. EVEN STRONGER WARM AIR ADVECTION SHOULD CONTINUE INTO
FRIDAY...WITH HIGH TEMPERATURES WELL ABOVE NORMAL FOR THIS TIME OF
YEAR. 850 MB TEMPERATURES ARE FORECAST TO CLIMB TO +8C EAST TO
+11C WEST...AND TEMPERATURES ON FRIDAY SHOULD TOP OUT IN THE UPPER
50S NORTH TO LOWER 60S SOUTH...WITH A GOOD AMOUNT OF SUNSHINE.
THIS DRY AND WARM EARLY WINTER WEATHER WILL COME TO AN END OVER
THE HOLIDAY WEEKEND THOUGH AS THE NEXT STORM SYSTEM MOVES ACROSS
THE AREA.

BY FRIDAY NIGHT...A 500 MB SHORTWAVE TROUGH IS EXPECTED TO DROP
SOUTHEAST ACROSS THE PLAINS STATES AND AMPLIFY. THIS SHOULD HELP
SEND A COLD FRONT TOWARDS THE MID-SOUTH ON SATURDAY. CURRENTLY THE
MODELS ARE HANDLING THE DEGREE OF AMPLIFICATION OF THE TROUGH
DIFFERENTLY AS WELL AS THE AMOUNT OF MOISTURE RETURN AHEAD OF THE
SYSTEM. THE 00/06Z NAM RUNS ARE SHOWING LESS AMPLIFICATION WITH
THE TROUGH AND MUCH LESS MOISTURE RETURN. ON THE FLIP SIDE...THE
00Z RUNS OF THE GFS AND ECMWF ARE MUCH DEEPER WITH THIS UPPER
TROUGH AND IN FACT CUT OFF A 500 MB UPPER LOW OVER THE MIDDLE
MISSISSIPPI VALLEY...WHICH MOVES BY TO THE NORTH OF OUR AREA
THROUGH SUNDAY. IN ADDITION...THESE MODELS BRING IN A HIGHER
DEGREE OF MOISTURE WITH THIS SYSTEM. THEY INDICATE MORE SIGNIFICANT
MOISTURE IN ADVANCE OF THE FRONT AND THEN OCCLUDE THE FRONT AND
CONTINUE DEEPER MOISTURE WITH THE FRONTAL OCCLUSION AND UPPER LOW
ON SUNDAY. SINCE THERE IS STILL QUITE A BIT OF DISSAGREEMENT AMONG
THE VARIOUS COMPUTER MODELS AND ALSO SINCE THE NEW RUNS OF THE GFS
AND ECMWF ARE STRONGER AND FURTHER SOUTH WITH UPPER LEVEL SYSTEM
AS COMPARED TO YESTERDAYS RUNS...PREFER TO KEEP THE FORECAST
SIMILAR TO YESTERDAYS THINKING UNTIL BETTER MODEL CONTINUITY IS
ESTABLISHED. WITH THIS IN MIND...HAVE KEPT SLIGHT CHANCES FOR
SHOWERS IN THE FORECAST FOR AFTER MIDNIGHT FRIDAY NIGHT AND
CONTINUED WITH LOW END CHANCE POPS FOR SATURDAY AND SATURDAY
NIGHT. MOST PRECIPITATION SHOULD TAPER OFF BY SUNDAY MORNING...WITH
PLENTY OF LOW CLOUDS LINGERING THROUGH CHRISTMAS DAY. THESE CLOUDS
ALONG WITH LOW LEVEL COLD ADVECTION SHOULD KEEP TEMPERATURES MUCH
COOLER. HIGHS TEMPERATURES CHRISTMAS DAY SHOULD STRUGGLE TO GET
INTO THE 40S...AND MAY NEED TO BE LOWERED FURTHER IN UPCOMING
FORECASTS. CANNOT EVEN TOTALLY RULE OUT A FEW CHRISTMAS DAY
FLURRIES...BUT THINK THAT THE BULK OF THE MOISTURE FOR
PRECIPIATION GENERATION WILL HAVE MOVED EAST BY THEN. 

ONCE THIS SYSTEM PULLS TO OUR EAST LATE SUNDAY...DRY SURFACE HIGH
PRESSURE WILL BUILD BACK IN UNDER NORTHWEST FLOW ALOFT.
TEMPERATURES SHOULD BE A FEW DEGREES WARMER UNDER PARTLY CLOUDY
SKIES FOR THE BEGINNING OF NEXT WEEK. ANOTHER MORE SIGNIFICANT
SHORTWAVE WILL ATTEMPT TO APPROACH THE REGION BY THE MIDDLE OF
NEXT WEEK...BUT THERE REMAINS SOME TIMING DIFFERENCES AMONG THE
MEDIUM RANGE MODELS...SO HAVE DECIDED TO LEAVE THIS PART OF THE
FORECAST DRY FOR NOW WITH NEAR SEASONABLE TEMPERATURES.

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.
&&

$$

JLH






AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
406 AM CST THU DEC 22 2005

.DISCUSSION...

HIGH PRESSURE HAS SETTLED OVER THE MID-SOUTH THIS MORNING. A PESKY

MOISTURE IN ADVANCE OF THE FRONT AND THEN OCCLUDE THE FRONT AND
CONTINUE DEEPER MOISTURE WITH THE FRONTAL OCCLUSION AND UPPER LOW
ON SUNDAY. SINCE THERE IS STILL QUITE A BIT OF DISSAGREEMENT AMONG
THE VARIOUS COMPUTER MODELS AND ALSO SINCE THE NEW RUNS OF THE GFS
AND ECMWF ARE STRONGER AND FURTHER SOUTH WITH UPPER LEVEL SYSTEM
AS COMPARED TO YESTERDAYS RUNS...PREFER TO KEEP THE FORECAST
SIMILAR TO YESTERDAYS THINKING UNTIL BETTER MODEL CONTINUITY IS
ESTABLISHED. WITH THIS IN MIND...HAVE KEPT SLIGHT CHANCES FOR
SHOWERS IN THE FORECAST FOR AFTER MIDNIGHT FRIDAY NIGHT AND
CONTINUED WITH LOW END CHANCE POPS FOR SATURDAY AND SATURDAY
NIGHT. MOST PRECIPITATION SHOULD TAPER OFF BY SUNDAY MORNING...WITH
PLENTY OF LOW CLOUDS LINGERING THROUGH CHRISTMAS DAY. THESE CLOUDS
ALONG WITH LOW LEVEL COLD ADVECTION SHOULD KEEP TEMPERATURES MUCH
COOLER. HIGHS TEMPERATURES CHRISTMAS DAY SHOULD STRUGGLE TO GET
INTO THE 40S...AND MAY NEED TO BE LOWERED FURTHER IN UPCOMING
FORECASTS. CANNOT EVEN TOTALLY RULE OUT A FEW CHRISTMAS DAY
FLURRIES...BUT THINK THAT THE BULK OF THE MOISTURE FOR
PRECIPIATION GENERATION WILL HAVE MOVED EAST BY THEN. 

ONCE THIS SYSTEM PULLS TO OUR EAST LATE SUNDAY...DRY SURFACE HIGH
PRESSURE WILL BUILD BACK IN UNDER NORTHWEST FLOW ALOFT.
TEMPERATURES SHOULD BE A FEW DEGREES WARMER UNDER PARTLY CLOUDY
SKIES FOR THE BEGINNING OF NEXT WEEK. ANOTHER MORE SIGNIFICANT
SHORTWAVE WILL ATTEMPT TO APPROACH THE REGION BY THE MIDDLE OF
NEXT WEEK...BUT THERE REMAINS SOME TIMING DIFFERENCES AMONG THE
MEDIUM RANGE MODELS...SO HAVE DECIDED TO LEAVE THIS PART OF THE
FORECAST DRY FOR NOW WITH NEAR SEASONABLE TEMPERATURES.

&&

MIDSOUTH. FRONT AS WELL AS PRECIP SHOULD EXIT THE CWA BY CHRISTMAS
MORNING. ALTHOUGH CLOUDS WILL HANG AROUND THROUGH CHRISTMAS NIGHT.

HIGH PRESSURE WILL SETTLE IN FROM THE NORTH ON MONDAY AND WILL
KEEP TEMPERATURES SLIGHTLY BELOW NORMAL TO NEAR NORMAL THROUGH THE END
OF THE FORECAST PERIOD. EXPECT PARTLY CLOUDY SKIES WITH HIGHS IN
THE 40S AND 50S WITH LOWS IN THE 20S AND 30S DURING THIS TIME.

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 211000
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
400 AM CST WED DEC 21 2005

.DISCUSSION...

AN UPPER LEVEL SHORTWAVE TROUGH REMAINS STRETCHED OVER THE MID-
SOUTH THIS MORNING. LATEST INFRARED SATELLITE IMAGERY INDICATES AN
EXPANSIVE AREA OF LOW CLOUDS OVER THE REGION AND THIS IS IN
ASSOCIATION WITH INCREASED LOW LEVEL MOISTURE BETWEEN 3KFT AND 6KFT.
EXPECT THESE LOWER LEVEL CLOUDS TO REMAIN IN PLACE ACROSS MOST OF
THE AREA TODAY. THE ONLY EXCEPTIONS WILL BE ACROSS FAR NORTHEAST
AND SOUTHEAST SECTIONS...WHERE THE MOISTURE LAYER REMAINS MORE
SHALLOW AND MAY MIX OUT ENOUGH TO PRODUCE PARTLY CLOUDY SKIES.
ELSEWHERE...DEEPER MOISTURE LAYER SHOULD REMAIN TRAPPED AS AN 850 MB
THERMAL TROUGH AXIS LINGERS OVER THE AREA ALONG WITH WARM AIR
ADVECTION IN THE MID LEVELS OF THE ATMOSPHERE...ABOVE THE LOW
LEVEL THERMAL TROUGH. THIS SHOULD STRENGTHEN A LOW LEVEL INVERSION
AND THEREFORE KEEP THE MOISTURE TRAPPED BELOW. THESE CLOUDS SHOULD
IMPACT AFTERNOON HIGH TEMPERATURES...SO HAVE DECIDED TO GO SEVERAL
DEGREES COOLER THAN CURRENT MOS GUIDANCE.

THE 850 MB THERMAL TROUGH APPEARS TO LINGER ACROSS THE AREA INTO
TONIGHT...BEFORE LIFTING OUT TO THE EAST LATE TONIGHT. THEREFORE...
MOSTLY CLOUDY SKIES SHOULD CONTINUE AREAWIDE THROUGH AT LEAST
MIDNIGHT...WITH SOME SLOW CLEARING FROM THE NORTH AFTER MIDNIGHT.
STILL AREAS ALONG AND SOUTH OF INTERSTATE 40 SHOULD REMAIN IN THE
CLOUDS UNTIL THURSDAY MORNING. THIS WILL ALSO HAVE AN IMPACT ON
TONIGHTS OVERNIGHT LOWS. HAVE GONE NEAR MOS GUIDANCE ACROSS
NORTHERN AREAS...WHERE CLOUDS SHOULD CLEAR AFTER MIDNIGHT AND SOME
RADIATIONAL COOLING MAY OCCUR. ELSEWHERE...HAVE GONE ABOVE MOS
GUIDANCE TEMPERATURES...WHERE CLOUDS WILL INSOLATE AND KEEP
TEMPERATURES FROM BOTTOMING OUT.

FOR THE END OF THE WEEK...THE LOW LEVEL THERMAL TROUGH WILL LIFT
OUT TO THE EAST AND ALLOW FOR SHORTWAVE RIDGING ALOFT. IN
ADDITION...SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE WILL QUICKLY MOVE ACROSS AND THEN 
SOUTHEAST OF THE AREA...SETTING UP LOW LEVEL RETURN SOUTHERLY
FLOW. THIS COMBINED WITH APPRECIABLE WARM AIR ADVECTION ALOFT
SHOULD ALLOW TEMPERATURES TO REBOUND QUITE NICELY TO ABOVE AVERAGE
LEVELS ON THURSDAY AND FRIDAY...UNDER MOSTLY SUNNY TO PARTLY
CLOUDY SKIES.

ANOTHER 500 MB SHORTWAVE TROUGH AND COLD FRONT WILL APPROACH FOR
THE WEEKEND. AT THIS POINT...THE MODELS ARE INDICATING THE MID
LEVEL TROUGH HANGING BACK BEHIND THE COLD FRONT. IN ADDITION...MOISTURE
RETURN DOES NOT APPEAR TOO IMPRESSIVE AT THIS POINT. SO FOR NOW WILL
JUST KEEP SLIGHT CHANCE POPS AFTER MIDNIGHT FRIDAY NIGHT...AND LOW
END CHANCE POPS IN FOR SATURDAY WITH THE FRONT AND SATURDAY NIGHT
IN ASSOCIATION WITH THE LINGERING MID LEVEL TROUGH AXIS.
TEMPERATURES SHOULD BE NEAR NORMAL ON SATURDAY...BUT RETURN TO
BELOW AVERAGE FOR CHRISTMAS DAY...WITH DECENT COLD ADVECTION AND
LINGERING LOW CLOUD COVER. TEMPERATURES ACTUALLY MAY BE COOLER ON
SUNDAY THEN THE CURRENT FORECAST SHOWS...BUT WOULD LIKE TO SEE
CONTINUED MODEL TRENDS FOR THE NEXT FEW DAYS. BUT HAVE CONTINUED
TO TREND COOLER FOR CHRISTMAS DAY. THIS COLD SHOT APPEARS TO BE
SHORT-LIVED THOUGH WITH WARMER AND DRY WEATHER RETURNING FOR THE
BEGINNING OF NEXT WEEK.

BUY INTO THE FORECAST YET. WILL MAKE ADJUSTMENTS LATER IF NEEDED.

SFC HIGH WILL REMAIN OVER THE REGION UNTIL EARLY THURSDAY THEN MOVE

THE NEXT SYSTEM WILL BE A COLD FRONT WHICH WILL MOVE THROUGH

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 201000
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
400 AM CST TUE DEC 20 2005

.DISCUSSION...

COLD SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE CENTERED OVER THE MID-SOUTH THIS
MORNING HAS ALLOWED FOR CLEAR SKIES AND LIGHT WINDS. THIS HAS
PROVIDED FOR EXCELLENT RADIATIONAL COOLING CONDITIONS OVER THE
AREA AND AS A RESULT TEMPERATURES HAVE DROPPED INTO THE LOWER
TEENS IN NORTHEAST SECTIONS TO THE LOW 20S SOUTHWEST AREAS. THESE
VERY COLD TEMPERATURES SHOULD CONTINUE THROUGH SUNRISE THEN SLOWLY
BEGIN TO RISE.

A 500 MB SHORTWAVE TROUGH...CURRENTLY POSITIONED FROM THE MIDDLE
MISSISSIPPI VALLEY SOUTHWESTWARD ACROSS THE SOUTHERN PLAINS...WILL
CONTINUE TO MOVE SOUTHEAST TOWARDS THE AREA TODAY. LATEST EARLY
MORNING SATELLITE IMAGERY SHOWS A LARGE AREA OF LOW CLOUDS JUST TO
THE WEST OF THE FORECAST AREA AND IN ADVANCE OF THE UPPER LEVEL
SHORTWAVE TROUGH. EXPECT LOWER AND MID LEVEL CLOUDS TO SLOWLY
INCREASE ACROSS THE WESTERN PORTIONS OF THE AREA THROUGH THE DAY.
THIS WILL BE A SLOW PROCESS THOUGH...AS THE LOWER LEVELS OF THE
ATMOSPHERE REMAIN VERY DRY. WITH THIS IN MIND HAVE INCREASED
CLOUDS TO MOSTLY CLOUDY FOR THE WESTERN HALF OF THE REGION BY THIS
AFTERNOON...WITH PARTLY CLOUDY SKIES ELSEWHERE. NO PRECIPITATION
IS EXPECTED TODAY...AS THE LOW LEVELS OF THE ATMOSPHERE REMAIN TOO
DRY TO SUPPORT ANY. IN ADDITION...THE BEST LIFT AND MOISTURE
SHOULD REMAIN TO OUR SOUTHWEST TODAY. ISENTROPIC ANALYSIS ONLY
INDICATES VERY WEAK UPGLIDE AND RATHER HIGH CONDENSATION PRESSURE
DEFICITS OVER OUR AREA...WHICH IS NOT CONDUCIVE TO PRODUCING MUCH
PRECIPITATION. IN OTHER WORDS...NOT MUCH LIFT AND STILL A TOO
DRY. AS FOR TEMPERATURES...NOT EXPECTING MUCH OF A REBOUND OVER
YESTERDAYS HIGHS...AS 850 MB TEMPERATURES REMAIN IN THE -2C SOUTH
TO -6C NORTH...WITH MINIMAL TEMPERATURE ADVECTION. SO TEMPERATURES
FROM THE MID 30S NORTH TO LOW 40S SOUTH CAN BE EXPECTED.

THE APPROACHING SHORTWAVE TROUGH SHOULD SWING ACROSS THE AREA TONIGHT. 
THIS SHOULD BRING MOSTLY CLOUDY SKIES AREAWIDE. CANNOT COMPLETELY
RULE OUT A FEW FLURRIES TONIGHT ACROSS EXTREME SOUTHERN PORTIONS OF
THE FORECAST AREA. ALTHOUGH STILL RATHER DRY ATMOSPHERE SHOULD
LIMIT THIS TO VERY ISOLATED AREAS...IF AT ALL. NOT EXPECTING ANY
PROBLEMS...EVEN IF A FEW FLURRIES FALL. CHANCE OF THIS OCCURRING
STILL QUITE LOW...SO WILL LEAVE ALL MENTION OF FLURRIES OUT OF THE
FORECAST AT THIS POINT. BETTER CHANCES OF FLURRIES WILL REMAIN
SOUTH OF OUR FORECAST AREA TOWARDS CENTRAL AND SOUTHERN MISSISSIPPI.

THIS SHORTWAVE TROUGH SHOULD BEGIN TO LIFT OUT OF THE AREA ON
WEDNESDAY. ENOUGH MOISTURE MAY LINGER ACROSS THE AREA ALONG WITH A
LINGERING 850 MB THERMAL TROUGH AND POSSIBLY ENOUGH CAPPING ALOFT
TO LOCK LOW CLOUDS INTO THE AREA FOR A GOOD PART OF THE DAY
WEDNESDAY. THIS WILL HAVE AN IMPACT ON TEMPERATURES...EVEN AS WARM
ADVECTION ALOFT PICKS UP ON WEDNESDAY. EXPECT ANOTHER COOL
DAY...WITH TEMPERATURES IN THE 40S ACROSS THE AREA. CLOUDS SHOULD
BEGIN TO BREAK BY LATER WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON AS THE THERMAL TROUGH
PULLS EAST.

SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE WILL REMAIN OVER THE AREA THROUGH MID-WEEK
BEFORE MOVING SOUTHEAST OF THE AREA FOR THE END OF THE WEEK. UPPER
LEVEL RIDGING WILL ALSO BUILD IN FOR THE END OF THE WEEK. THIS
MEANS DRY WEATHER WITH A NOTICABLE WARMING TREND FOR THURSDAY AND
FRIDAY. TEMPERATURES SHOULD REBOUND TO ABOVE NORMAL LEVELS FOR
THIS TIME PERIOD. MEDIUM RANGE MODELS INDICATING ANOTHER SHORTWAVE
TROUGH AND ASSOCIATED COLD FRONT WILL APPROACH FRIDAY NIGHT...HELPING
TO BREAK DOWN THE UPPER RIDGE. THIS SYSTEM SHOULD MOVE ACROSS THE
AREA ON SATURDAY AND DEPART TO THE EAST SATURDAY NIGHT. HAVE KEPT
SLIGHT CHANCE TO CHANCE POPS FOR SHOWERS WITH THIS SYSTEM. THE
00Z/20 RUNS OF THE ECMWF AND GFS INCREASINGLY STRONGER AND DEEPER WITH
THIS UPPER SYSTEM AS COMPARED WITH PAST RUNS. SINCE THIS IS THE
FIRST INDICATIONS OF A STRONGER SYSTEM...PREFER TO ONLY TREND POPS
UP SLOWLY. HAVE ALSO LOWERED TEMPERATURES A BIT FOR CHRISTMAS DAY
BEHIND THE FRONT. MODELS SUGGEST COLDER CONDITIONS POSSIBLE FOR
CHRISTMAS DAY...BUT WILL NOT ADJUST TEMPS TOO SIGNIFICANTLY UNTIL
MODELS SHOW AN IMPROVED DAY TO DAY TREND. WILL HAVE A BETTER
HANDLE ON THIS SYSTEM AS WE GET CLOSER TO THE WEEKEND. DRY WEATHER
WILL ONCE AGAIN RETURN BEHIND THIS SYSTEM WITH NEAR OR SLIGHTLY
BELOW SEASONAL TEMPERATURES.

&&

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
236 PM CST MON DEC 19 2005

.DISCUSSION...
SURFACE HIGH CENTERED OVER MISSOURI THIS AFTERNOON. SOUNDINGS
PRETTY MUCH ISOTHERMAL UP TO ABOUT 800 MB...AND MOISTURE TRAPPED
BELOW THIS LEVEL. THIS HAS PRODUCED AN ALMOST SOLID CLOUD DECK TO
THE SOUTH AND WEST OF THE SURFACE HIGH AXIS. TEMPERATURE CLIMB HAS
STALLED BENEATH THESE CLOUDS. NAM 900-800 MB RH SEEMS TO HAVE A
DECENT DEPICTION OF CURRENT CLOUD DECK.
&&

.SHORT TERM (THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...
ALTHOUGH ONE SHORTWAVE MOVING THROUGH THE MIDWEST NOW...AND 2 MORE
TO FOLLOW OVER NEXT 48 HOURS...SIGNIFICANT PRECIPITATION NOT
EXPECTED THROUGH WEDNESDAY. MAIN FORECAST PROBLEMS WILL BE
TEMPERATURES AND CLOUDS. NAM FORECASTS ABOVE MENTIONED MOIST LAYER
TO CONTINUE TO THE WEST OF THE AREA THROUGH TOMORROW...THEN MOVE
ACROSS THE AREA WEDNESDAY. CLOUD COVER WILL BE DETERMINING FACTOR
ON BOTH LOWS TONIGHT AND HIGHS TOMORROW. NORTHEAST SECTIONS WILL
BE COOLEST IN AREA. ALMOST PERFECT RADIATING CONDITIONS...OUTSIDE
OF CLOUDY AREAS. WOULD NOT BE SURPRISED TO SEE NORTHEASTERN
PORTIONS OF CWA IN MIDDLE TEENS IF CLOUDS DO NOT ARRIVE. MAY FINE
TUNE OVERNIGHT LOWS IF CLOUD TRENDS CHANGE OVER THE NEXT HOUR OR
SO.

WILL TREND NEAR GFS GUIDANCE TOMORROW AND TOMORROW NIGHT...AS NOT
MUCH DIFFERENCE BETWEEN GFS/NAM THICKNESS AND BL TEMPERATURES
DURING THOSE PERIODS.

MODERATION IN TEMPERATURES BEGINS LATE WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON. HIGH
TEMPERATURES SHOULD BE NEAR NORMAL...AS THICKNESSES WOULD INDICATE
ABOUT 4 DEGREES OF WARMING.

&&
.LONGER TERM (THURSDAY AND BEYOND)...
GOOD WARMUP ADVERTISED ON ALL MODELS. ZONAL FLOW SHOULD RAISE
TEMPS ABOVE CLIMOTOLTOGY BY THURSDAY AND CONTINUE INTO EARLY
SATURDAY. QUESTION WILL BE EXACTLY HOW MUCH OF A WARMUP CAN WE
EXPECT ON THURSDAY. LOOKING AT THICKNESSES...COULD SEE A 15 DEGREE JUMP
FROM WHAT WE HAVE TODAY...850 TEMPS WOULD BEG FOR AT LEAST A 12
DEGREE JUMP. WILL STAY ON THE CONSERVATIVE SIDE FOR NOW...AND KEEP
TEMPS IN THE 50S. IF WE WERE TO MIX OUT TO 900 MB ON THURSDAY...WE
WOULD BE WELL INTO THE 60S.

FOR DAYS 5 THROUGH 7 THERE IS YET UNCERTAINTY CONCERNING A SERIES
OF SHORTWAVES THAT PUSH INTO THE EASTERN US. ALTHOUGH THE MODELS
ARE CONSISTENT WITH THIS PATTERN OCCURRING...HOWEVER THE AMOUNT OF
DIGGING AND DEGREE OF COLD AIR BEHIND EACH SYSTEMS IS STILL IN
DEBATE. FOR NOW WILL KEEP SLIGHT CHANCE FOR PCPN WITH THE COLD
FRONT ON SATURDAY AND TREND TOWARD CLIMATOLOGY FOR CHRISTMAS DAY.
&&

.UPDATE...

.PREV DISCUSSION... (ISSUED 356 AM CST MON DEC 19 2005) 

DISCUSSION...

COLD AIR SURGING INTO THE MID SOUTH THIS MORNING AS CANADIAN HIGH
PRESSURE MOVES INTO THE MID SOUTH. TEMPS HAVE FALLEN INTO THE 20S
AT MOST PLACES WITH A NORTHERLY BREEZE. SKIES WERE MOSTLY CLEAR
WITH SCT-BKN CLOUDS ALONG THE TN/KY AND AR/MO BORDERS. 

HIGH PRESSURE WILL MOVE INTO THE MS VALLEY BY LATER TODAY. LOW
LEVEL CAA WL CONT THROUGHOUT THE DAY WITH 850 MB TEMPS FALLING
INTO THE -4C TO -6C RANGE. EXPECT SOME CLOUDINESS ALONG THE NRN
TIER THIS MORNING OTRW PARTLY CLOUDY SKIES ACRS THE AREA...WITH
MORE SUN ACRS NRN MS. TEMPS WL STRUGGLE TODAY. TEMPS WL ONLY REACH
THE MID AND UPPER 30S ACRS NRN SXNS...ABOUT 40 IN MEM AND LOWER TO
MID 40S ACRS NRN MS.

HIGH PRESSURE WL SETTLE DIRECTLY OVER THE MID SOUTH TONIGHT
RESULTING IN LIGHT WINDS AND GOOD COOLING CONDITIONS. SOME HIGH
CLOUDINESS MAY ARRIVE LATE BUT THAT SHOULD NOT PREVENT SOME VERY
COLD TEMPS BY TUE MORNING. EASTERN SXNS WL FALL INTO THE UPPER
TEENS WHILE EVERYONE ELSE SHOULD SEE AT LEAST THE LOWER AND MID
20S. HIGH PRESSURE REMAINS OVER THE AREA ON TUE AND WITH LITTLE
IN THE WAY OF TEMP ADVECTION EXPECT ANOTHER COLD DAY WITH HIGHS IN
THE LOWER 40S...ABOUT 10 DEGREES BELOW NORMAL. MID AND HIGH CLOUDS
WL INCREASE THROUGHOUT THE DAY...ESPECIALLY ACRS SRN SXNS AS A
500 MB TROF SWINGS INTO THE AREA LATE TUE. THIS FEATURE WL MOVE
EAST OF THE REGION BY LATE TUE NIGHT AND SHOULD PRODUCE JUST
CLOUDINESS..MAINLY ACRS NRN MS.

HIGH PRESSURE REMAINS OVER THE AREA ON WED AS TEMPS SLOWLY START
TO MODERATE UNDER MOSTLY SUNNY SKIES. BY THU AND FRI THE HIGH
SLIPS TO THE EAST ALLOWING A WARMER SOUTHERLY FLOW TO DEVELOP.
TEMPS WL CLIMB TO NORMAL LEVELS OR SLIGHTY ABOVE BY THU AND BE
DOWNRIGHT WARM...MID AND UPPER 50S...BY FRI. 00Z GFS AND 00Z ECMWF
CONT TO INDICATE THAT A TROF WL MOVE THROUGH DURING THE FRI
NIGHT...SAT TIME FRAME. CURRENT 20 POPS LOOK FINE THEN CONDS WL BE
DRY SLIGHTLY WARMER THAN NORMAL FOR CHRISTMAS.

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.
&&

WAGNER/SJM
