000 
FXUS64 KMEG 200333
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
930 AM CST MON DEC 19 2005

.DISCUSSION...

CLEAR SKIES...LIGHT WINDS...AND LOW DEWPOINTS ARE DROPPING
TEMPERATURES QUICKLY THIS EVENING. HAVE ADJUSTED LOWS TO REFLECT
THIS. MID TEENS MAY BE REACHED AROUND PARIS TN. ITS MOSTLY CLEAR
TO CLEAR ACROSS THE AREA NOW...BUT EXPECT HIGH CLDS TO MOVE IN
LATER TNGT. MADE MINOR ADJUSTMENTS TO OTHER PARAMETERS. FCST
ALREADY ISSUED.

&&

...PREVIOUS DISCUSSION...

.SHORT TERM (THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...
ALTHOUGH ONE SHORTWAVE MOVING THROUGH THE MIDWEST NOW...AND 2
MORE TO FOLLOW OVER NEXT 48 HOURS...SIGNIFICANT PRECIPITATION NOT
EXPECTED THROUGH WEDNESDAY. MAIN FORECAST PROBLEMS WILL BE
TEMPERATURES AND CLOUDS. NAM FORECASTS ABOVE MENTIONED MOIST
LAYER TO CONTINUE TO THE WEST OF THE AREA THROUGH TOMORROW...THEN
MOVE ACROSS THE AREA WEDNESDAY. CLOUD COVER WILL BE DETERMINING
FACTOR ON BOTH LOWS TONIGHT AND HIGHS TOMORROW. NORTHEAST
SECTIONS WILL BE COOLEST IN AREA. ALMOST PERFECT RADIATING
CONDITIONS...OUTSIDE OF CLOUDY AREAS. WOULD NOT BE SURPRISED TO
SEE NORTHEASTERN PORTIONS OF CWA IN MIDDLE TEENS IF CLOUDS DO NOT
ARRIVE. MAY FINE TUNE OVERNIGHT LOWS IF CLOUD TRENDS CHANGE OVER
THE NEXT HOUR OR SO.

WILL TREND NEAR GFS GUIDANCE TOMORROW AND TOMORROW NIGHT...AS NOT
MUCH DIFFERENCE BETWEEN GFS/NAM THICKNESS AND BL TEMPERATURES
DURING THOSE PERIODS.

MODERATION IN TEMPERATURES BEGINS LATE WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON. HIGH
TEMPERATURES SHOULD BE NEAR NORMAL...AS THICKNESSES WOULD
INDICATE ABOUT 4 DEGREES OF WARMING.

&&
.LONGER TERM (THURSDAY AND BEYOND)...
GOOD WARMUP ADVERTISED ON ALL MODELS. ZONAL FLOW SHOULD RAISE
TEMPS ABOVE CLIMATOLOGY BY THURSDAY AND CONTINUE INTO EARLY
SATURDAY. QUESTION WILL BE EXACTLY HOW MUCH OF A WARMUP CAN WE
EXPECT ON THURSDAY. LOOKING AT THICKNESSES...COULD SEE A 15
DEGREE JUMP FROM WHAT WE HAVE TODAY...850 TEMPS WOULD BEG FOR AT
LEAST A 12 DEGREE JUMP. WILL STAY ON THE CONSERVATIVE SIDE FOR
NOW...AND KEEP TEMPS IN THE 50S. IF WE WERE TO MIX OUT TO 900 MB
ON THURSDAY...WE WOULD BE WELL INTO THE 60S.

FOR DAYS 5 THROUGH 7 THERE IS YET UNCERTAINTY CONCERNING A SERIES
OF SHORTWAVES THAT PUSH INTO THE EASTERN US. ALTHOUGH THE MODELS
ARE CONSISTENT WITH THIS PATTERN OCCURRING...HOWEVER THE AMOUNT
OF DIGGING AND DEGREE OF COLD AIR BEHIND EACH SYSTEMS IS STILL IN
DEBATE. FOR NOW WILL KEEP SLIGHT CHANCE FOR PCPN WITH THE COLD
FRONT ON SATURDAY AND TREND TOWARD CLIMATOLOGY FOR CHRISTMAS DAY.
&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.
&&

$$

RENCH/WAGNER

AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
356 AM CST MON DEC 19 2005

.DISCUSSION...

COLD AIR SURGING INTO THE MID SOUTH THIS MORNING AS CANADIAN HIGH
PRESSURE MOVES INTO THE MID SOUTH. TEMPS HAVE FALLEN INTO THE 20S
AT MOST PLACES WITH A NORTHERLY BREEZE. SKIES WERE MOSTLY CLEAR
WITH SCT-BKN CLOUDS ALONG THE TN/KY AND AR/MO BORDERS. 

HIGH PRESSURE WILL MOVE INTO THE MS VALLEY BY LATER TODAY. LOW
LEVEL CAA WL CONT THROUGHOUT THE DAY WITH 850 MB TEMPS FALLING
INTO THE -4C TO -6C RANGE. EXPECT SOME CLOUDINESS ALONG THE NRN
TIER THIS MORNING OTRW PARTLY CLOUDY SKIES ACRS THE AREA...WITH
MORE SUN ACRS NRN MS. TEMPS WL STRUGGLE TODAY. TEMPS WL ONLY REACH
THE MID AND UPPER 30S ACRS NRN SXNS...ABOUT 40 IN MEM AND LOWER TO
MID 40S ACRS NRN MS.

HIGH PRESSURE WL SETTLE DIRECTLY OVER THE MID SOUTH TONIGHT
RESULTING IN LIGHT WINDS AND GOOD COOLING CONDITIONS. SOME HIGH
CLOUDINESS MAY ARRIVE LATE BUT THAT SHOULD NOT PREVENT SOME VERY
COLD TEMPS BY TUE MORNING. EASTERN SXNS WL FALL INTO THE UPPER
TEENS WHILE EVERYONE ELSE SHOULD SEE AT LEAST THE LOWER AND MID
20S. HIGH PRESSURE REMAINS OVER THE AREA ON TUE AND WITH LITTLE
IN THE WAY OF TEMP ADVECTION EXPECT ANOTHER COLD DAY WITH HIGHS IN
THE LOWER 40S...ABOUT 10 DEGREES BELOW NORMAL. MID AND HIGH CLOUDS
WL INCREASE THROUGHOUT THE DAY...ESPECIALLY ACRS SRN SXNS AS A
500 MB TROF SWINGS INTO THE AREA LATE TUE. THIS FEATURE WL MOVE
EAST OF THE REGION BY LATE TUE NIGHT AND SHOULD PRODUCE JUST
CLOUDINESS..MAINLY ACRS NRN MS.

HIGH PRESSURE REMAINS OVER THE AREA ON WED AS TEMPS SLOWLY START
TO MODERATE UNDER MOSTLY SUNNY SKIES. BY THU AND FRI THE HIGH
SLIPS TO THE EAST ALLOWING A WARMER SOUTHERLY FLOW TO DEVELOP.
TEMPS WL CLIMB TO NORMAL LEVELS OR SLIGHTY ABOVE BY THU AND BE
DOWNRIGHT WARM...MID AND UPPER 50S...BY FRI. 00Z GFS AND 00Z ECMWF
CONT TO INDICATE THAT A TROF WL MOVE THROUGH DURING THE FRI
NIGHT...SAT TIME FRAME. CURRENT 20 POPS LOOK FINE THEN CONDS WL BE
DRY SLIGHTLY WARMER THAN NORMAL FOR CHRISTMAS.

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 190155
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
755 PM CST SUN DEC 18 2005

.DISCUSSION...00Z UPPER AIR ANALYSIS THIS EVENING PLACES AN 
ELONGATED TROUGH FROM QUEBEC TO THE NORTHERN PLAINS AND A COUPLE OF 
SHORTWAVES...ONE LOCATED ACROSS THE LOWER MISSISSIPPI VALLEY AND THE 
OTHER ONE IN THE SOUTHERN PLAINS. INFRARED/WATER VAPOR SATELLITE 
TRENDS OVER THE PAST FEW HOURS HAVE SHOWN DRIER AIR UPSTREAM WORKING 
IN ACROSS THE MID SOUTH WITH MID/UPPER LEVEL MOISTURE PLUME 
TRANSLATING EAST. CLOUD COVER ASSOCIATED WITH THE NEXT SHORTWAVE 
UPSTREAM IS EXPECTED TO AFFECT PORTIONS OF THE FORECAST AREA 
OVERNIGHT...ESPECIALLY ACROSS AREAS MAINLY NORTH OF I-40 WHERE 
1000-500 MB LAYER RH/S WILL BE AT OR ABOVE 60 PERCENT. TEMPERATURES 
ACROSS MUCH OF THE AREA HAVE FALLEN INTO THE 30S EXCEPT ACROSS 
PORTIONS OF NORTHEAST MISSISSIPPI WHERE CLOUD COVER HAS KEPT 
TEMPERATURES IN THE MIDDLE 40S. MADE SOME ADJUSTMENTS TO 
TEMPERATURE/SKY GRIDS TO REFLECT CURRENT TRENDS. 

UPDATED GRIDS ALREADY PUBLISHED.

CJC

.PREV DISCUSSION...ISSUED 210 PM CST SUN DEC 18 2005...

SATELLITE SHOWS A BATCH OF HIGH CLOUDS ASSOCIATED WITH UPPER LEVEL
SOUTHWEST FLOW THAT IS MOVING THROUGH THE REGION. THESE CLOUDS
HAVE BEEN OPAQUE ENOUGH FOR MOSTLY CLOUDY CONDITIONS OVER PORTIONS
OF THE REGION THIS AFTERNOON. EXPECT THE BACK EDGE OF THESE CLOUDS
TO BE NEAR OR JUST EAST OF THE MISSISSIPPI RIVER BY 00Z. MODELS
SHOW THE HIGH CLOUDS MOVING OUT OF THE REGION BY 06Z. LOWER LEVEL
CLOUDS ASSOCIATED WITH AN UPPER VORT AND NOTICEABLY COLDER AIR
WILL BE WORKING INTO NORTHEAST ARKANSAS INTO NORTHWEST TENNESSEE
AFTER MIDNIGHT. LIFT WITH THIS SYSTEM IS TOO WEAK FOR PRECIP
CHANCES. THESE CLOUDS SHOULD CONTINUE SOUTHWARD INTO SOUTHWEST TN
AND EAST CENTRAL ARKANSAS TOMORROW MORNING. MODELS SHOW MOISTURE
GRADUALLY DECREASING AS IT MOVES SOUTHWARD SO PROBABLY REMAIN
PARTLY CLOUDY OVER MOST OF NORTH MS. THE CLOUDS OVER THE NORTHERN
HALF OF THE AREA ARE EXPECTED TO MIX OUT BY AFTERNOON.
850MB TEMPS WILL FALL TO AROUND -6. WITH COLD AIR ADVECTION AND
CLOUD COVER...WOULDNT BE SURPRISED IF MANY LOCATIONS FAIL TO MAKE
IT OUT OF THE 30S. 

ANOTHER WEAK SYSTEM WILL MOVE JUST SOUTH OF THE REGION AROUND
MIDWEEK. MOISTURE LOOKS VERY LIMITED SO NO PRECIP CHANCES WITH
THIS SYSTEM EITHER. UPPER FLOW BECOMES MORE ZONAL TOWARDS THE END
OF THE WEEK. THIS SHOULD RESULT IN GOOD WARMING WITH TEMPERATURES
RISING TO SLIGHTLY ABOVE NORMAL. GFS AND EUROPEAN SHOW A COLD
FRONT MOVING INTO THE REGION FRIDAY NIGHT INTO SATURDAY. THE GFS
APPEARS TO BE TOO STRONG WITH UPPER VORT MOVING JUST NORTH OF THE
REGION AND THUS HIGHER QPF. HOWEVER...MOISTURE ALONG THE FRONT
WILL SUPPORT SLIGHT CHANCES OF RAIN SHOWERS. TOO WARM FOR
SNOW...SORRY.

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 180936
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
336 AM CST SUN DEC 18 2005

.DISCUSSION...

COOL HIGH PRESSURE CONTINUES OVER THE MID SOUTH THIS MORNING.
SKIES HAVE CLEARED OUT OVER MUCH THE MID SOUTH OVERNIGHT WITH MOST
OF THE CLOUD COVER NORTHWEST OF THE AREA ACROSS NW AR...OK AND MO.
WINDS WERE LIGHT NORTHERLY AND TEMPS HAVE FALLEN INTO THE LOWER
30S.

GIVEN RECENT SAT TRENDS EXPECT CLOUDS TO FILL IN ACRS THE NRN TIER
TODAY. EXPECT MORE SUNSHINE AS YOU HEAD SOUTH INTO NORTHERN MS.
SUNSHINE WL HELP TEMPS CLIMB A COUPLE DEGREES HIGHER THAN
SATURDAY...EXCEPT EXTREME NE AR WHERE CLOUDS MAY HINDER TEMPS
MORE. 

A 1040 MB CANADIAN HIGH SURGES SOUTH TONIGHT BRINGING A REINFORCING
SHOT OF COLD AIR. ALSO...EXPECT ADDITIONAL CLOUDINESS TO SPREAD
INTO THE AREA WITH THE FRONT. BY 12Z MON 850 TEMPS WL BE AROUND
-8C ALONG THE KY/TN BORDER. STRONG LOW LEVEL CAA WL CONTINUE THRU
THE DAY RESULTING IN HIGH TEMPS ONLY IN THE UPPER 30S NORTH TO
MID 40S ACRS SOUTHERN SECTIONS OF THE FORECAST AREA. THIS IS ABOUT
10 DEGREES BELOW NORMAL. HIGH PRESSURE WL BE CENTERED OVER THE MID
SOUTH BY TUE MORNING. SHOULD BE A VERY COLD NIGHT THOUGH THERE MAY
BE SOME HIGH CLOUDINESS MOVING IN LATE. EXPECT LOWS FROM THE UPPER
TEENS EAST TO MID 20S SOUTHWEST.

NEXT SYSTEM APPROACHES ON TUE AND MID AND HIGH CLOUDS WL PROBABLY
INCREASE THROUGH THE DAY...ESPECIALLY WEST OF THE RIVER. TEMPS WL
ONCE AGAIN BE WELL BELOW NORMAL. THE SYSTEM IS FORECAST TO WEAKEN
AS IT MOVES INTO THE AREA AND WL PROBABLY BE JUST AN AREA OF MID
CLOUDS WITH A FEW SPRINKLES/FLURRIES BY THE TIME IT GETS HERE.
TEMPS WL BE TRICKY TUE NIGHT SINCE IT WL DEPEND LARGELY ON AMOUNT
OF CLOUD COVER...MID 20S TO LOW 30S SEEMS FINE FOR NOW.

WED THROUGH FRI...HIGH PRESSURE CONTINUES...SLIDING SE OF THE AREA
BY THU AND FRI. AS SURFACE WINDS SHIFTS TO THE S/SW EXPECT A
WARMING TREND BY THE END OF THE WEEK WITH TEMPS SLIGHTLY ABOVE
NORMAL BY FRIDAY. GFS INDICATING THAT A TROF WL MOVE THROUGH ON
SAT WITH A CHANCE FOR PRECIP. 00Z ECMWF INDICATES MOISTURE NOT
VERY IMPRESSIVE SO WL LEAVE OUT MENTION OF PRECIP FOR NOW.

&&

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 180223
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
821 PM CST SAT DEC 17 2005

.DISCUSSION...00Z UPPER AIR ANALYSIS THIS EVENING SHOWS A BROAD 
UPPER LEVEL TROUGH STRETCHING ALONG THE NORTHERN PERIPHERY OF THE 
UNITED STATES WITH WEAK SHORTWAVES EMBEDDED IN SOUTHWEST FLOW ALOFT 
ACROSS THE CENTRAL/SOUTHERN PLAINS AND INTO THE MISSISSIPPI VALLEY. 
INFRARED/WATER VAPOR SATELLITE TRENDS CONTINUE TO SHOW EROSION OF 
CLOUD COVER ACROSS THE LOWER MISSISSIPPI VALLEY. 

SHORT TERM MODEL ANALYSIS SUGGESTS AREAS SOUTH OF I-40...ESPECIALLY 
ACROSS NORTHERN MISSISSIPPI WILL BE MOSTLY CLEAR OVERNIGHT WITH SOME 
RESIDUAL CLOUD COVER ACROSS AREAS TO THE NORTH. SURFACE TEMPERATURES 
ALREADY ARE IN THE MIDDLE TO UPPER 30S IN MANY SPOTS WITH DEWPOINTS 
IN THE MIDDLE 20S TO LOWER 30S. WILL MAKE AN ADDITIONAL ADJUSTMENT 
TO SKY COVER AND TEMPERATURES FOR OVERNIGHT.

UPDATED GRIDS WILL BE PUBLISHED SHORTLY.

CJC

.PREV DISCUSSION...ISSUED 230 PM CDT SAT DEC 17 2005...

SATELLITE SHOWS SOME BREAKS IN THE MID LEVEL CLOUD
DECK...ESPECIALLY AROUND THE ARKLATEX REGION. MEANWHILE...BOTH
GFS AND NAM INSIST THAT THE REGION WILL REMAIN MAINLY CLOUDY
TONIGHT. THINKING IS THAT THE BREAKS ARE BEING AIDED BY THE SUN
AND THAT AFTER SUNSET THE MOISTURE THAT CLOUDS WILL FILL BACK IN.
OTHERWISE...MAINLY A CLOUD FORECAST THROUGH THE SHORT TERM
PORTION. MODELS SHOW A GOOD PORTION OF THE MOISTURE MOVING OUT OF
THE REGION FOR MUCH OF THE DAY ON SUNDAY. HOWEVER THIS MOISTURE
RETURNS TOMORROW NIGHT AS A SHORTWAVE MOVES THROUGH THE REGION AND
BRINGS A COLD SHOT OF AIR WITH IT. ALTHOUGH A FEW SPRINKLES OR
FLURRIES ARE POSSIBLE...MUCH OF THE MOISTURE IS IN THE MID LEVELS
AND LIFT IS STRONG ENOUGH TO WARRANT PRECIP CHANCES. WILL CONTINUE
UNDERCUT TEMPS SLIGHTLY ON MONDAY DUE TO CLOUD COVER AND SHALLOW
COLD AIR MOVING THROUGH THE REGION. TEMPERATURES WILL LIKELY
STRUGGLE TO GET OUT OF THE 30S IN MANY LOCATIONS. 

DRY WEATHER SHOULD PERSIST UNTIL AT LEAST MIDWEEK. ON TUESDAY
NIGHT AND WEDNESDAY...GFS SHOWS AN UPPER VORT DROPPING DOWN THE
EASTERN SIDE OF THE WESTERN US RIDGE AND INTO THE SOUTHERN PLAINS.
THIS VORT WILL THEN MOVE THROUGH THE LOWER MISSISSIPPI RIVER
VALLEY WITH THE SURFACE LOW JUST OFF THE GULF COAST. 06Z AND 12Z
GFS SHOW SOME QPF MOVING INTO THE REGION...ALTHOUGH AMOUNTS LOOK
LIGHT AND LIFT APPEARS TO BE EXTREMELY WEAK. THIS SYSTEM HAS MANY
OF THE CHARACTERISTICS OF THIS WEEKENDS SYSTEM...THEREFORE HAVE
LEFT PRECIP CHANCES OUT OF THE FORECAST FOR THE TIME BEING. 

OTHERWISE...HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS BACK IN FOR THE CHRISTMAS WEEKEND
WITH 850 TEMPS WARMING TO AROUND +4. THIS SHOULD SUPPORT SURFACE
TEMPERATURES RISING A FEW DEGREES ABOVE NORMAL.

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.
&&

$$

.DISCUSSION...LATEST INFRARED/WATER VAPOR IMAGERY SHOW MID/HIGH

THE EAST. SKIES ARE MOSTLY CLEAR ACROSS THE MISSISSIPPI RIVER DELTA 
AND AREAS WEST OF THE RIVER. RUC/NAM MODEL SOUNDINGS SOME RESIDUAL 
700 MB MOISTURE WILL HANG AROUND THE MID SOUTH TONIGHT BUT THINK 
MOST AREAS WILL BE PARTLY CLOUDY INSTEAD OF MOSTLY CLOUDY. AS A 
RESULT...WILL MAKE SOME ADJUSTMENTS TO SKY COVER...TEMPERATURES 
BASED ON CURRENT TRENDS.

DECK...ESPECIALLY AROUND THE ARKLATEX REGION. MEANWHILE...BOTH

OF THE CHARACTERISTICS OF THIS WEEKENDS SYSTEM...THEREFORE HAVE

THIS VORT WILL THEN MOVE THROUGH THE LOWER MISSISSIPPI RIVER
VALLEY WITH THE SURFACE LOW JUST OFF THE GULF COAST. 06Z AND 12Z
GFS SHOW SOME QPF MOVING INTO THE REGION...ALTHOUGH AMOUNTS LOOK
LIGHT AND LIFT APPEARS TO BE EXTREMELY WEAK. THIS SYSTEM HAS MANY
OF THE CHARACTERISTICS OF THIS WEEKENDS SYSTEM...THEREFORE HAVE
LEFT PRECIP CHANCES OUT OF THE FORECAST FOR THE TIME BEING. 

OTHERWISE...HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS BACK IN FOR THE CHRISTMAS WEEKEND
WITH 850 TEMPS WARMING TO AROUND +4. THIS SHOULD SUPPORT SURFACE
TEMPERATURES RISING A FEW DEGREES ABOVE NORMAL.

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.
&&

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...CORRECTED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
420 AM CST SAT DEC 17 2005

.DISCUSSION...

CURRENTLY...SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE OVER THE REGION THIS MORNING WITH
MID AND HIGH CLOUDS STREAMING THROUGH ON FAST SW FLOW ALOFT.
TEMPS RANGE FROM THE UPPER 20S TO UPPER 30S WITH LIGHT AND
VARIABLE SURFACE WINDS.

HIGH PRESSURE WILL CONTINUE OVER THE REGION TODAY AND TONIGHT WITH
LIGHT EASTERLY SURFACE FLOW. SYSTEM AND MOST OF THE ASSOCD
MOISTURE OVER THE NORTHERN GULF SHOULD REMAIN SUPPRESSED WELL TO
THE SOUTH. HIGH TEMPS TODAY WL BE AROUND 50...JUST ABOUT NORMAL.
EXPECT A GOOD DEAL OF MID AND HIGH CLOUDS TO CONT IN SW FLOW
ALOFT. THERE WILL BE JUST A SLIGHT CHANCE OF RAIN ACRS NE MS THIS
EVENING BEFORE GULF SYSTEM QUICKLY DEPARTS.

ON SUNDAY 1040 MB HIGH PRESSURE MOVES INTO THE CENTRAL PLAINS AND
THEN OVER THE MID SOUTH BY LATE MON...REINFORCING COOL AIRMASS. A
FLURRY IS NOT OUT OF THE QUESTION ACRS NRN AREAS LATE SUN
NIGHT/EARLY MON AHEAD OF 500 MB SHORTWAVE. HIGH TEMPS ON MONDAY WL
STRUGGLE INTO THE UPPER 30S NORTH AS 850 MB TEMPS DIP TO -6C. TUE
MORNING SHOULD BE VERY COLD WITH HIGH DIRECTLY OVER THE AREA. ONLY
QUESTION WL BE CLOUD COVER STREAMING IN LATE AHEAD OF NEXT
SHORTWAVE. SURFACE HIGH REMAINS OVER THE AREA TUE AND WITH NO 
ADVECTION TEMPS WL REMAIN ABOUT 5 DEGREES BELOW NORMAL.

TUE NIGHT A WEAKENING SHORTWAVE MOVES FROM THE RED RIVER VALLEY
AT 00Z WED TO THE MID SOUTH BY 12Z WED. THIS FEATURE IS TRACKED
WELL BY BOTH 00Z GFS AND 00Z ECMWF. MOISTURE AND LIFT FIELDS LOOK
LESS IMPRESSIVE AS THE SYSTEM MOVES INTO THE MID SOUTH THOUGH THE GFS
IS KICKING OUT SOME LIGHT PRECIP ACRS NRN MS LATE TUE NIGHT. 
SOUNDINGS INDICATE PRECIP COULD BE RAIN OR SNOW. THERE IS A SMALL 
POSSIBILITY OF SOME LIGHT RAIN/SNOW ACRS E CNTRL AR/NRN MS LATE TUE 
NIGHT. WL SEE HOW THIS SYSTEM EVOLVES ON SUCCEEDING RUNS BEFORE 
ADDING TO THE FORECAST.

WED THROUGH FRI...DRY HIGH PRESSURE CONTINUES OVER THE REGION
WITH A WARMING TREND BY FRIDAY AND TEMPS SLIGHTLY ABOVE NORMAL.

&&

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
810 PM CST FRI DEC 16 2005

.DISCUSSION...

WATER VAPOR IMAGERY AND 00Z UPPER AIR ANALYSIS PLACES A BROAD UPPER 
LEVEL LOW ACROSS LAKE SUPERIOR AND AN UPPER LEVEL JET TRANSPORTING 
PACIFIC/GULF MID/HIGH LEVEL MOISTURE INTO THE LOWER MISSISSIPPI 
VALLEY THIS EVENING. TEMPERATURES HAVE SLOWLY BEEN DROPPING INTO THE 
LOWER 40S/UPPER 30S AND WILL ONLY MAKE MINOR CHANGES TO SKY COVER 
AND TEMPERATURES BASED ON CURRENT TRENDS.

UPDATED GRIDS WILL BE PUBLISHED SHORTLY.

CJC

.PREV DISCUSSION...ISSUED 146 PM CST FRI DEC 16 2005

SATELLITE SHOWS A GOOD DEAL OF TRANSPARENT CIRRUS MOVING THROUGH
THE REGION WITH MUCH DENSER MID TO HIGH CLOUDS OVER TEXAS. LATEST MODELS
CONTINUE TO SUGGEST THAT THE REGION WILL BECOME MOSTLY CLOUDY
UNDER THIS DECK OF MID TO HIGH LEVEL CLOUDS. NO MAJOR CHANGES MADE
TO THE FORECAST. SOUTHERN STREAM SYSTEM IS EXPECTED TO TRACK ALONG
THE GULF COAST WITH THE BULK OF THE MOISTURE REMAINING SOUTH OF
THE FORECAST AREA. RAIN SHIELD MIGHT GET AS FAR NORTH AS AROUND
TUPELO SATURDAY NIGHT. NORTHERN STREAM SYSTEM STAYS WELL NORTH OF
THE AREA SATURDAY AND SUNDAY WITH ANY PRECIPITATION FALLING ACROSS
CENTRAL MISSOURI. ALTHOUGH THERE COULD BE SOME PERIODS OF SUN ON
SATURDAY...FEEL THAT MOST OF THE TIME WILL REMAIN MAINLY CLOUDY.
NAM SHOWS STRATUS HANGING AROUND THE AREA ON SUNDAY AS THE
SOUTHERN STREAM SYSTEM MOVES AWAY FROM THE AREA. THIS MAY HINDER
HIGH TEMPS ON SUNDAY. A CLIPPER SYSTEM IS EXPECTED TO MOVE THROUGH
MONDAY. MODELS HAVE BACKED OFF CONSIDERABLY IN TERMS OF QPF...IN
FACT THEY ARE NOW DRY. WILL CONTINUE DRY FORECAST THROUGH NEXT
WEEK ALTHOUGH MODELS CONTINUE TO SHOW A BIG COOL DOWN FOR MONDAY.
SO MUCH THAT TEMPS MAY STRUGGLE TO GET OUT OF THE 30S ON MONDAY.
GFS SHOWS AN UPPER LOW DEVELOPING IN THE SOUTHERN PLAINS AROUND
MIDWEEK...BUT TRACKING WELL SOUTH OF THE REGION AND SHOULD NOT
IMPACT THE MID SOUTH AS IT MOVES ALONG THE GULF COAST TOWARDS END
WEEK. CHRISTMAS EVE FORECAST IS DRY WITH BIG BLUE H IN CONTROL.
850 TEMPS WARMING TO AROUND +6 SHOULD TRANSLATE INTO TEMPERATURES
CLIMBING A FEW DEGREES ABOVE NORMAL.

20S AND LOWER 30S AS WINDS SLOWLY DIMINISH. SKIES WERE CLEAR
ACROSS THE REGION.

DRIFT EAST ON SATURDAY. EXPECT HIGH TEMPS IN THE MID AND UPPER
40S THIS AFTERNOON...A COUPLE DEGREES BELOW NORMAL...AND ONLY
SLIGHTLY WARMER ON SATURDAY AFTERNOON. MID AND HIGH CLOUDS WILL BE ON THE
INCREASE BY THIS AFTERNOON INTO SATURDAY AHEAD OF THE NEXT SYSTEM.

ON SATURDAY AND SATURDAY NIGHT EXPECT SURFACE LOW TO MOVE ALONG
THE GULF COAST. THIS TIME SYSTEM AND ASSOCIATED MOISTURE WILL REMAIN
SUPPRESSED TO THE SOUTH WITH JUST A SLIGHT CHANCE OF RAIN ACROSS
EXTREME SOUTH PART OF THE FORECAST AREA. ANOTHER WEAK SYSTEM WILL
PASS TO THE NORTH OF THE REGION.

REINFORCING SHOT OF COLD AIR MOVES INTO THE MID SOUTH SUNDAY AND
ESPECIALLY SUNDAY NIGHT AS A STRONG 1040 MB HIGH PRESSURE SYSTEM
BUILDS INTO THE REGION. MONDAY WILL BE VERY COLD WITH HIGH TEMPS
IN THE 30S AND LOWER 40S...ABOUT 8-12 DEGREES BELOW NORMAL. TEMPS
WL DROP INTO THE TEENS IN MANY LOCATION TUE MORNING AS HIGH
PRESSURE MOVES DIRECTLY OVER THE AREA.

EXTENDED...COOL WEATHER CONTS THROUGH THU AS COOL HIGH PRESSURE
REMAINS OVER THE REGION. PERHAPS BY FRI WL COULD SEE A WARMING
TREND AS MEAN TROF SHIFTS EAST AND SOUTHERLY FLOW MAY RETURN.

SATELLITE SHOWS COLD AIR CU OVER MISSOURI TRYING TO WORK SOUTHWARD

OF MID LEVEL MOISTURE MOVING INTO THE REGION FROM THE SOUTHWEST
DURING THE DAY TOMORROW. EXPECT CLOUDS TO INCREASE THROUGHOUT THE
DAY. CLOUD COVER WILL STICK AROUND THROUGHOUT MUCH OF THE WEEKEND
AS A LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM MOVES ALONG THE GULF COAST. MODELS
CONTINUE TO INDICATE THAT THE BULK OF THE MOISTURE WILL REMAIN
SOUTH OF THE REGION. THERE IS A SECONDARY BATCH OF PRECIPITATION
ASSOCIATED WITH NORTHERN STREAM ENERGY BUT THAT SHOULD MOVE ACROSS
MISSOURI.

THIS MORNINGS RUN OF THE GFS SHOWS AN UPPER VORT TRAVERSING ACROSS
SOUTHERN MISSOURI ON MONDAY WHICH COULD LIGHT RAIN OR LIGHT SNOW
ACROSS NORTHERN HALF OF THE REGION. PREVIOUS RUNS DID NOT SUPPORT
THIS. ALTHOUGH LATEST RUN OF THE EUROPEAN DOES SUGGEST IT. HAVE
LEFT CHANCES OUT FOR NOW UNTIL THERE IS SOME RUN TO RUN
CONSISTENCY. MODELS SHOW A QUICK HITTING SHOT OF COLD AIR BEHIND
THIS SYSTEM. BUT TEMPERATURES SHOULD RECOVER RELATIVELY QUICKLY AS
THE UPPER TROUGH LIFTS AWAY FROM THE REGION.

SHOULD ALLOW TEMPERATURES TO DIP TO FORECAST LOWS.

FXUS64 KMEG 142039
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
239 PM CST WED DEC 14 2005

.DISCUSSION...

RAIN WILL SPREAD BACK ACROSS MUCH OF THE MID-SOUTH THE REMAINDER
OF THIS AFTERNOON AND TONIGHT...OTHERWISE THE FORECAST IS MOSTLY A
DRY ONE FOR THE NEXT WEEK.

AN UPPER LEVEL SHORT WAVE WILL MOVE EASTWARD FROM TX TONIGHT. AN
ASSOCIATED SURFACE LOW WILL MOVE FROM EASTERN TX TO AL BY 12Z
THURSDAY AND DEEPEN. THE RESULT WILL BE RAIN SPREADING ACROSS
MAINLY THE SOUTHEAST TWO-THIRDS OF THE MID-SOUTH. THERE WILL BE A
TIGHT GRADIENT OF POPS TONIGHT RANGING FROM 100 PERCENT AT TUP TO
30 PERCENT AT JBR. RADARS ALREADY INDICATE WIDESPREAD RAIN
STRETCHING FROM NORTH MS TO EAST TX. A COLD FRONT WILL PUSH
THROUGH THE MID-SOUTH OVERNIGHT AND EARLY THURSDAY FROM THE WEST.
CLOUDS WILL GRADUALLY DECREASE FROM THE WEST AFTER MIDNIGHT.

THERE MAY BE SOME LINGERING RAIN EARLY THURSDAY FROM THE SOUTHEAST
CORNER OF WEST TN INTO NORTHEAST MS. OTHERWISE COOLER AND DRY HIGH
PRESSURE WILL BUILD INTO THE AREA FROM THE WEST THROUGH
FRIDAY...THEN MOVE EASTWARD SATURDAY. THE NAM...GFS...AND ECMWF
INDICATE A WEAK SURFACE LOW TRACKING WELL TO OUR SOUTH SATURDAY
NIGHT THROUGH THE NORTHERN GULF. WILL LEAVE IN A SLIGHT CHANCE OF
LIGHT RAIN FOR PART OF NORTH MS FOR THIS TIME.

STRONG HIGH PRESSURE WILL STRETCH FROM THE NORTHERN PLAINS TO THE
MID-SOUTH EARLY NEXT WEEK. AND UPPER LEVEL TROUGH WILL APPROACH
THE AREA FROM THE NORTH MONDAY NIGHT AND TUESDAY CAUSING SOME
CLOUDS...BUT ATTM THE LOWER LEVELS APPEAR TOO LOW FOR ANY PRECIPITATION.

&&

FXUS64 KMEG 141554
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
954 AM CST WED DEC 14 2005

.DISCUSSION...

RADAR SHOWS PATCHES OF RAIN EXTENDING FROM THE SOUTHEAST CORNER
OF WEST TN INTO NORTHEAST MS. AN UPPER LEVEL SHORT WAVE HELPING TO
CAUSE THE RAIN IS QUICKLY MOVING EAST TAKING THIS RAIN WITH IT.
HOWEVER...THE THREAT OF RAIN IS NOT OVER FOR THIS AFTERNOON. A
COLD FRONT TO OUR WEST WILL NEAR EAST ARKANSAS BY LATE THIS
AFTERNOON WITH A WARM FRONT LOCATED TO OUR SOUTHWEST. ANOTHER UPPER
LEVEL SHORT WAVE OVER TX WILL MOVE EAST WITH AN ASSOCIATED SURFACE
LOW OVER THE NORTHWEST GULF MOVING INTO LA BY LATE THIS AFTERNOON.
THIS WILL CAUSE RAIN TO SPREAD BACK INTO NORTH MS. WILL ADJUST
POPS FOR THIS AFTERNOON RANGING FROM LIKELY TO PART OF NORTH MS TO
ABOUT 30 PERCENT ELSEWHERE. REMAINDER OF THIS AFTERNOONS FORECAST
LOOKS GOOD.

&&

.PREV DISCUSSION... (ISSUED 251 AM CST WED DEC 14 2005) 

DISCUSSION...

COLD FRONTAL EXTENDS FROM EASTERN SOUTH DAKOTA THROUGH CENTRAL KANSAS
INTO NORTHWEST TEXAS AND CONTINUES TO MOVE SLOWLY EAST. EXTENSIVE
AREA OF LIGHT RAIN SHOWERS CAN BE FOUND ACROSS MAINLY THE WESTERN
HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA. THIS AREA OF RAIN SHOULD GRADUALLY MOVE
EAST DURING THE NEXT FEW HOURS. BEST CHANCE OF RAIN TODAY SHOULD BE
EAST OF THE MISSISSIPPI RIVER SO HAVE LIKELY TO CATEGORICAL POPS
THERE WITH CHANCE TO LIKELY POPS WEST OF THE RIVER. BY 00Z TONIGHT
THE COLD FRONT BE MOVING ACROSS THE MISSISSIPPI RIVER SO WHILE MOST
OF THE RAIN WILL BE AHEAD OF THE FRONT...THERE MAY STILL BE A FEW
SHOWERS BEHIND THE FRONT SO HAVE KEPT LOW POPS ACROSS EAST ARKANSAS.
COLD FRONT SHOULD BE JUST EAST OF THE FORECAST AREA BY THURSDAY
MORNING SO SOME RAIN LINGERING IN OUR EXTREME SOUTHEAST COUNTIES NOT
OUT OF THE QUESTION SO HAVE SLIGHT CHANCE POPS IN. AIR BEHIND THIS
COLD FRONT IS DRIER BUT NOT THAT MUCH COLDER SO WILL SEE LITTLE
CHANGE IN HIGHS FOR THURSDAY AND FRIDAY BUT OVERNIGHT LOWS WILL BE
A LITTLE COLDER. THE NEXT WEATHER SYSTEM WILL APPROACHING THE REGION
ON SATURDAY. 00Z MODEL RUNS ARE SLOWER WITH THIS SYSTEM SO HAVE
REMOVED POPS FOR SATURDAY. MODELS ALSO KEEPING MOST OF THE MOISTURE
TO OUR SOUTH SO HAVE REDUCED POPS TO SLIGHT CHANCE CATEGORY FOR
SATURDAY NIGHT AND SUNDAY. ANOTHER STORM SYSTEM MAY APPROACH THE
REGION TUESDAY BUT LITTLE AGREEMENT ABOUT THIS SYSTEM SO WILL KEEP
FORECAST DRY FOR NOW.

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.
&&

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
251 AM CST WED DEC 14 2005

.DISCUSSION...

COLD FRONTAL EXTENDS FROM EASTERN SOUTH DAKOTA THROUGH CENTRAL KANSAS
INTO NORTHWEST TEXAS AND CONTINUES TO MOVE SLOWLY EAST. EXTENSIVE
AREA OF LIGHT RAIN SHOWERS CAN BE FOUND ACROSS MAINLY THE WESTERN
HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA. THIS AREA OF RAIN SHOULD GRADUALLY MOVE
EAST DURING THE NEXT FEW HOURS. BEST CHANCE OF RAIN TODAY SHOULD BE
EAST OF THE MISSISSIPPI RIVER SO HAVE LIKELY TO CATEGORICAL POPS
THERE WITH CHANCE TO LIKELY POPS WEST OF THE RIVER. BY 00Z TONIGHT
THE COLD FRONT BE MOVING ACROSS THE MISSISSIPPI RIVER SO WHILE MOST
OF THE RAIN WILL BE AHEAD OF THE FRONT...THERE MAY STILL BE A FEW
SHOWERS BEHIND THE FRONT SO HAVE KEPT LOW POPS ACROSS EAST ARKANSAS.
COLD FRONT SHOULD BE JUST EAST OF THE FORECAST AREA BY THURSDAY
MORNING SO SOME RAIN LINGERING IN OUR EXTREME SOUTHEAST COUNTIES NOT
OUT OF THE QUESTION SO HAVE SLIGHT CHANCE POPS IN. AIR BEHIND THIS
COLD FRONT IS DRIER BUT NOT THAT MUCH COLDER SO WILL SEE LITTLE
CHANGE IN HIGHS FOR THURSDAY AND FRIDAY BUT OVERNIGHT LOWS WILL BE
A LITTLE COLDER. THE NEXT WEATHER SYSTEM WILL APPROACHING THE REGION
ON SATURDAY. 00Z MODEL RUNS ARE SLOWER WITH THIS SYSTEM SO HAVE
REMOVED POPS FOR SATURDAY. MODELS ALSO KEEPING MOST OF THE MOISTURE
TO OUR SOUTH SO HAVE REDUCED POPS TO SLIGHT CHANCE CATEGORY FOR
SATURDAY NIGHT AND SUNDAY. ANOTHER STORM SYSTEM MAY APPROACH THE
REGION TUESDAY BUT LITTLE AGREEMENT ABOUT THIS SYSTEM SO WILL KEEP
FORECAST DRY FOR NOW.

AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
945 PM CST TUE DEC 13 2005

.UPDATE...

REGIONAL RADAR SHOWS THAT RAIN HAS DEVELOPED AS FORECAST ACROSS 
EASTERN OKLAHOMA AND WESTERN ARKANSAS. THE SHIELD OF RAIN WILL
CONTINUE TO PROGRESS TOWARD THE MIDSOUTH...FOLLOWING THE BEST
ISENTROPIC LIFT. RAIN SHOULD BE SPREADING ACROSS THE MS RIVER
AROUND 09-12Z. THE CURRENT FORECAST HANDLES THIS WELL. DID MAKE
SOME CHANGES TO THE POP CONFIGURATION FOR TOMORROW. MODELS IN GOOD
AGREEMENT THAT PRECIP WILL BE GONE WEST OF THE RIVER BY 18Z.
REDUCED POPS IN THESE AREAS TO CHANCE CATEGORY FOR THE AFTERNOON
HOURS AND THE MIDNIGHT SHIFT WILL LIKELY BE ABLE TO TRIM THIS BACK
FURTHER.

TEMPERATURES IN NE SECTIONS OF THE CWA HAVE DIPPED BEYOND THE
FORECAST LOWS. ADJUSTED GRIDS TO SHOW THIS DEVELOPMENT BUT FEEL
THERE WILL NOT BE MUCH MORE OF A DROP DUE TO CLOUDY SKIES AND
INCREASING WARM AIR ADVECTION. 

REST OF THE FORECAST PARAMETERS ON TRACK. UPDATED ZONES WILL BE OUT
SHORTLY.


JFB

&&

.PREV DISCUSSION... (ISSUED 230 PM CST TUE DEC 13 2005) 

DISCUSSION...

THE IMPORTANT WEATHER NEWS FOR THE MIDSOUTH AT THIS TIME IS THAT
ITS FIXIN TO RAIN. REGIONAL WEATHER ANALYSIS NOW HAS A FRONT IN
SE CO AND SW KS THAT IS GOING TO MOVE THROUGH HERE WEDNESDAY
NIGHT. INCREASING CLOUDINESS AND WINDS ARE EXPECTED AS THE FRONT
DRAWS NEAR FROM THE WEST. RAIN WILL BE THE MAIN COURSE ON THE
WEATHER MENU...AND IT COULD START BEFORE MIDNIGHT WEST OF THE
MISSISSIPPI RIVER. RAIN WILL OVERSPREAD THE REST OF OUR AREA
BEFORE DAYBREAK WEDNESDAY. RAIN IS EXPECTED OFF AND ON THROUGH
THE DAY TOMORROW. THEN...THE FRONT WILL BE IN AL/MIDDLE TN BY
THURSDAY MORNING...AND RAIN WILL TAPER OFF FROM THE WEST
WEDNESDAY NIGHT.

THE NEXT WEATHER EVENT FOR US WILL BE THIS COMING WEEKEND WHEN A
LOW FORMS IN THE GULF. WE WILL BE ON THE NORTHERN EXTREME OF
MOISTURE THAT RIDES UP OVER THE HIGH THAT WILL BE POSITIONED IN
THIS AREA. BECAUSE PCPN COMES SATURDAY AND STAYS MAINLY IN THE
SOUTHERN HALF OF THE MIDSOUTH...LIGHT RAIN IS THE MOST LIKELY
FORM.

&&

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
345 PM CST MON DEC 13 2005

.DISCUSSION...

WEATHER MAPS THIS AFTERNOON HAVE A DEEP TROUGH OVER THE
NORTHEASTERN STATES AND A SURFACE HIGH OVER THE MIDSOUTH. THE
HIGH WILL MOVE ON EAST TONIGHT AND TUESDAY WHILE ANOTHER FRONT
GETS ORGANIZED IN THE PLAINS. AS THE PLAINS FRONT GETS CLOSER
TUESDAY NIGHT...OVERRUNNING WILL DEVELOP AHEAD OF THE FRONT AND
BRING MOST ALL LOCATIONS A COLD RAIN TUESDAY NIGHT INTO THURSDAY
MORNING. THE FRONT AND ASSOCIATED RAIN WILL MOVE OUT OF THIS AREA
BY THURSDAY MORNING.

DRY WEATHER IS EXPECTED THURSDAY THROUGH FRIDAY NIGHT.
SATURDAY...A LOW WILL DEVELOP IN THE GULF AND BRING RAIN TO
SOUTHERN MIDSOUTH COUNTIES SATURDAY INTO SATURDAY EVENING. TIMING
OF THE EVENT INDICATES ALL PRECIPITATION SHOULD BE LIQUID.

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 130905
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
305 AM CST TUE DEC 13 2005

.DISCUSSION...

QUIET WEATHER CURRENTLY OVER THE FORECAST AREA WITH CLEAR SKIES AND
LIGHT WINDS TEMPERATURES HAVE FALLEN INTO THE MID 20S TO MID 30S.
HIGH PRESSURE WILL WEAKEN AS IT MOVES EAST WHICH WILL KEEP WINDS IN
MORE OF AN EASTERLY DIRECTION THIS AFTERNOON. IN ADDITION...CLOUDS
WILL BEGIN TO INCREASE OVER THE REGION LATER THIS MORNING INTO THIS
AFTERNOON. AS A RESULT...TEMPERATURES SHOULD NOT BE NEARLY AS WARM AS
THEY WERE MONDAY. STORM SYSTEM WILL MOVE RAPIDLY OUT OF THE ROCKIES
THIS AFTERNOON AND INTO NORTHWEST MISSOURI BY WEDNESDAY MORNING.
THIS SYSTEM WILL BEGIN TO SPREAD RAIN INTO THE FORECAST AREA TONIGHT
MAINLY AFTER MIDNIGHT SO HAVE ADJUSTED POPS SOME FOR TONIGHT. BEST
CHANCE OF RAIN WILL BE ON WEDNESDAY AS FRONTAL BOUNDARY WILL MOVE
THROUGH THE FORECAST AREA. AIR BEHIND THIS SYSTEM APPEARS TO BE MORE
PACIFIC IN ORIGIN THAN ARCTIC SO IT SHOULDNT BE MUCH COOLER FOR
THURSDAY AND FRIDAY. FORECAST GETS MORE COMPLICATED AS THE WEEKEND
APPROACHES. MODELS TRY TO BRING SOME SHORTWAVE ENERGY SATURDAY INTO
SUNDAY. IT APPEARS THAT WE WILL SEE SOME PRECIPITATION STARTING
SOMETIME SATURDAY AND CONTINUING INTO SATURDAY NIGHT AND SUNDAY.
TIMING IS KEY AS THERE MAY BE SOME SNOW OVER THE NORTHERN HALF OF
THE FORECAST AREA SATURDAY NIGHT DEPENDING ON HOW LOW TEMPERATURES
DROP DURING THE EVENING HOURS.

&&

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 120925
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
325 AM CST MON DEC 12 2005

.DISCUSSION...
INTERESTING SURFACE MAP THIS MORNING WITH WEAK BOUNDARY JUST TO
OUR NORTH. TEMPERATURES MAINLY IN THE 40S...ABOUT 5 DEGREES ABOVE
GUIDANCE. NOT MUCH IN THE WAY OF CLOUDS RIGHT NOW. SOME STRATUS UP
BETWEEN STL AND PAH COULD MOVE INTO NORTHEAST PORTIONS OF AREA.
&&

.SHORT TERM (THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...
OTHER THAN SOME STRATUS POSSIBLE ACROSS NORTHEAST CORNER...MAINLY
A TEMPERATURE FORECAST TODAY. WHILE THERE WILL BE SOME COLD
ADVECTION GOING ON...IT DOESNT LOOK PARTICULARLY STRONG. 09Z OBS
RUNNING ABOUT 5 DEGREES ABOVE ALL MOS GUIDANCE AT ALL SITES. WE
ARE CURRENTLY WITHIN 3-5 DEGREES OF TODAYS MAX TEMPS. WITH
SUNSHINE EXPECTED...HAVE BUMPED UP TEMPS 3-5 DEGREES. HIGH
PRESSURE DRIFTS OVER AREA TONIGHT. WITH LIGHTER WINDS...EXPECT
LOWS TUESDAY MORNING TO BE NEAR FREEZING.

HIGH MOVES QUICKLY TO THE EAST ON TUESDAY. AS WE WILL BE STARTING
FROM A LOWER BASE ON TUESDAY...HIGH TEMPERATURES EXPECTED TO BE
A LITTLE LOWER THAN TODAY. AS SYSTEM MOVES OUT OF ROCKIES TUESDAY
NIGHT...WE START TO SEE SOME ISENTROPIC LIFT...SHOWS UP PRETTY
WELL ON 285K SURFACE. GFS A LITTLE MORE AGGRESSIVE ON BRINGING
PRECIPITATION IN QUICKER. FIRST QUESTION OF THE DAY IS WHETHER
MEASURABLE PRECIPITATION REACHES THE GROUND IN OUR CWA BEFORE 12Z
WEDNESDAY. CURRENT FORECAST SEEMS TO SHADOW THE GFS IN THIS
RESPECT. SINCE THERE IS ONLY ABOUT 3-6 HOURS DIFFERENCE IN TIMING
BETWEEN GFS AND NAM...WILL HOLD ONTO CURRENT FORECAST POPS FOR
NOW.

WEDNESDAY TO BE A RAINY DAY ANY WAY YOU CUT IT. HAVE RAISED POPS
TO CATEGORICAL DURING THE DAY ON WEDNESDAY. SEE NO REASON TO FIGHT
MAV TEMP GUIDANCE FOR WEDNESDAY. BOTH GFS AND NAM LINGER
PRECIPITATION INTO AT LEAST WEDNESDAY EVENING ACROSS THE
AREA...AND HAVE BUMPED UP POPS THERE AS WELL.
&&

.LONG TERM (AFTER WEDNESDAY)...
PRECIPITATION SHOULD CLEAR THE AREA BY THURSDAY MORNING. COLDER
AIR MOVES IN BEHIND THIS SYSTEM FOR 24-36 HOURS...MAINLY AFFECTING
AREAS TO THE NORTH OF THE CWA. WE WILL STILL BE BELOW NORMAL ON
TEMPS HOWEVER.

BOTH ECMWF AND GFS HAVE UPPER TROF FROM GREAT LAKES TO TEXAS OVER
THE WEEKEND...BASICALLY SOUTHWEST FLOW FOR US. OF COURSE MODELS
DIFFER ON WHICH IMPULSES COULD PROVIDE PRECIPITATION. THESE
SYSTEMS WILL NEED TO BE WATCHED BECAUSE 1000-500 MB THICKNESS
PROGS INDICATE CRITICAL THICKNESSES WOULD BE IN...OR CLOSE TO THE
CWA BY SUNDAY. FOR NOW...WILL GO THE COURSE WITH CURRENT FORECAST.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
936 PM CST SUN DEC 11 2005

.UPDATE...

A CLIPPER TYPE SYSTEM CURRENTLY MOVING ACROSS THE MID MISSISSIPPI
VALLEY IN NORTHWESTERLY FLOW ALOFT THIS EVENING WILL CONTINUE TO
SWEEP SOUTHEAST INTO THE TENNESSEE VALLEY LATER TONIGHT. THE WEAK
LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM WILL MOVE BY TO OUR NORTHEAST BUT WILL HELP
DRAG A COLD FRONT ACROSS THE MID-SOUTH LATE TONIGHT. AHEAD OF THE
FRONT...LOW LEVEL SOUTHWESTERLY FLOW HAS KEPT TEMPERATURES FROM
FALLING MUCH ACROSS THE AREA. THINK THAT TEMPERATURES WILL STAY
WARMER DUE TO WEAK LOW LEVEL WARM ADVECTION AHEAD OF THE FRONT FOR
MOST OF THE NIGHT ALONG WITH CLOUD COVER ACROSS NORTHEAST SECTIONS.
THEREFORE HAVE RAISED TEMPERATURES A FEW DEGREES MOST AREAS. ALSO...STILL
EXPECTING MOSTLY CLOUDY SKIES OVER NORTHEAST SECTIONS THROUGH THE
NIGHT...WITH PARTLY CLOUDY TO MOSTLY CLEAR CONDITIONS FURTHER
SOUTH. SO OTHER THAN UPDATES FOR TEMPERATURES...THE REMAINDER OF
THE FORECAST LOOKS GOOD.

UPDATED GRIDS AND ZONES OUT SHORTLY...HAVE A GOOD EVENING.

FXUS64 KMEG 112141
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
340 PM CST SUN DEC 11 2005

.DISCUSSION...

A WEAK COLD FRONT TO OUR NW WILL MOVE THROUGH THE FORECAST AREA LATE 
TONIGHT. THIS WILL PROVIDE SOME MID LEVEL CLOUDS TONIGHT AND A 
SLIGHT DROP IN TEMPERATURES FOR MONDAY. A SFC HIGH WILL MOVE ACROSS 
THE REGION MONDAY NIGHT AND TO THE EAST TUESDAY. DRY AND SEASONABLE 
CONDITIONS ARE EXPECTED THROUGH TUESDAY.

A RETURN WARM/MOIST ADVECTION FLOW BECOMES ESTABLISHED TUESDAY NIGHT 
AS 850-700MB WARM ADVECTION INCREASES UP TO 10C/12HR. WINDS AT THAT 
LEVEL WILL BE PERPENDICULAR WITH THE ISENTROPES...SO THIS LOOKS LIKE 
A CLASSIC OVERRUNNING SCENARIO BEGINNING LATE TUESDAY NIGHT AND 
CONTINUING INTO WEDNESDAY. DRYING WILL OCCUR WHEN A COLD FRONT MOVES 
IN FROM THE WEST BY WEDNESDAY EVENING.

HIGH PRESSURE WILL CONTROL THE WEATHER AGAIN THURSDAY AND FRIDAY 
PROVIDING DRY AND SEASONABLE CONDITIONS. THE NEXT CHANCE OF RAIN MAY 
BE SATURDAY NIGHT OR SUNDAY. MODEL SOLUTIONS ARE INCONSISTENT FOR 
THE WEEKEND WHETHER IT WILL BE DRY OR A LOW OUT OF THE GULF WILL 
PROVIDE A CHANCE OF RAIN.

FXUS64 KMEG 111155 AAA
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
555 AM CST SUN DEC 11 2005

.UPDATE...
SIGNIFICANT BREAK IN CLOUD COVER HAS DEVELOPED OVER THE AREA. WE
SHOULD SEE MORE SIGNIFICANT TEMPERATURE RECOVERY OVER NORTHEAST
AREAS...ESPECIALLY DURING THE MORNING HOURS. 

ALSO MADE AN ADJUSTMENT TO CARRY PRECIPITATION DURING THE ENTIRE
DAY ON WEDNESDAY INSTEAD OF JUST DURING THE MORNING. 06Z MODELS
SUPPORT THE TIMING IDEA...AND IT FITS WITH NEIGHBORS. UPDATE OUT
IN A FEW MINUTES.

&&

.PREV DISCUSSION... (ISSUED 305 AM CST SUN DEC 11 2005) 

DISCUSSION...
ANOTHER IN A SEEMINGLY UNENDING STREAM OF VORTICES WILL MOVE
THROUGH THE NORTHERN PORTION OF THE CWA THIS MORNING. INCREASED
MOISTURE AROUND 900 MB HAS AIDED IN THE DEVELOPMENT OF A CLOUD
DECK AROUND 3000 FEET THAT HAS MOVED INTO THE NORTHERN COUNTIES.
WIND SHIFT LINE HAS MOVED INTO NORTHWEST PORTIONS OF THE AREA AS
WELL. NO SIGNIFICANT TEMPERATURE OR DEWPOINT DIFFERENCE NOTED
ACROSS THIS BOUNDARY. MOST TEMPERATURES BETWEEN 35 AND 40 AT
08Z...WITH DEWPOINTS BETWEEN 25 AND 30.

SHORT TERM (THROUGH TUESDAY)...
MODELS CONSISTENT IN SWEEPING CURRENT SHORTWAVE OUT OF THE AREA
DURING THE MORNING. PREVIOUSLY MENTIONED CLOUDS SHOULD DEPART AS
WELL...ALTHOUGH WOULD NOT BE SHOCKED IF FAR NE IS MOSTLY CLOUDY
ALL DAY. LOW LEVEL TEMPERATURES FROM BOTH MODELS INDICATE THAT
TODAY SHOULD BE SEVERAL DEGREES WARMER THAN SATURDAY...BUT CLOUDS
LIKELY TO RETARD THIS SOMEWHAT. WILL GO ABOVE PREVIOUS
FORECAST...BUT NOT QUITE AS HIGH AS NAM WOULD INDICATE.

NEXT SHORTWAVE MOVES THROUGH OVERNIGHT TONIGHT...WITH NO REAL
NOTICEABLE CHANGE. MAY SEE A COUPLE MORE DEGREES OF WARMING ON
MONDAY IN A FEW AREAS. WE GET INTO SHORTWAVE RIDGING AFTER THAT
SHORTWAVE MOVES THROUGH...AND EXPECT RIDGING TO HOLD UNTIL TUESDAY
NIGHT.

LONG TERM (AFTER TUESDAY)...
AS HAS BEEN THE CASE FOR SEVERAL WEEKS...NOT A LOT OF CONSISTENCY
BETWEEN MEDIUM RANGE MODELS...OR SOMETIMES WITHIN THE SAME MODEL
BETWEEN RUNS. THERE IS SOME CONSENSUS THAT A SHORTWAVE WILL MOVE
THROUGH THE AREA ON WEDNESDAY...BRINGING A CHANCE OF RAIN DURING
THE DAY. EXPECT TEMPERATURES WARM ENOUGH WHERE PRECIPITATION TYPE
IS NOT AN ISSUE. PRECIP SHOULD BE OUT OF THE AREA BY MIDDAY ON
THURSDAY...AND EXPECT FRIDAY AND SATURDAY TO BE DRY. 

AFTER THURSDAY...ECMWF AGAIN WANTS TO BRING IN COLDER AIR...WITH A
HIGHER AMPLITUDE PATTERN THAN GFS. BY 00Z SATURDAY...GFS AND ECMWF
HAVE AS MUCH AS 300 METER DIFFERENCE IN HEIGHTS OVER CALIFORNIA.
EARLY LOOK AT HPCS PREEPD MESSAGE INDICATES THEY ARE TRENDING
TOWARD ECMWF SOLUTION.

HAVE TRENDED MOST FORECAST TEMPERATURES UP A LITTLE...BUT NOT AS
HIGH AS GUIDANCE. THESE ADJUSTMENTS SEEM TO FIT A LITTLE BETTER
WITH SURROUNDING OFFICES.

NEEDLESS TO SAY...CONFIDENCE IN DETAILS OF FORECAST PAST WEDNESDAY
IS RATHER LOW...DUE TO POOR CONTINUITY IN MODEL SOLUTIONS.
&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.
&&

$$

NEXT SHORTWAVE MOVES THROUGH OVERNIGHT TONIGHT...WITH NO REAL
NOTICEABLE CHANGE. MAY SEE A COUPLE MORE DEGREES OF WARMING ON
MONDAY IN A FEW AREAS. WE GET INTO SHORTWAVE RIDGING AFTER THAT
SHORTWAVE MOVES THROUGH...AND EXPECT RIDGING TO HOLD UNTIL TUESDAY
NIGHT.
&&

.LONG TERM (AFTER TUESDAY)...
AS HAS BEEN THE CASE FOR SEVERAL WEEKS...NOT A LOT OF CONSISTENCY
BETWEEN MEDIUM RANGE MODELS...OR SOMETIMES WITHIN THE SAME MODEL
BETWEEN RUNS. THERE IS SOME CONSENSUS THAT A SHORTWAVE WILL MOVE
THROUGH THE AREA ON WEDNESDAY...BRINGING A CHANCE OF RAIN DURING
THE DAY. EXPECT TEMPERATURES WARM ENOUGH WHERE PRECIPITATION TYPE
IS NOT AN ISSUE. PRECIP SHOULD BE OUT OF THE AREA BY MIDDAY ON
THURSDAY...AND EXPECT FRIDAY AND SATURDAY TO BE DRY. 

AFTER THURSDAY...ECMWF AGAIN WANTS TO BRING IN COLDER AIR...WITH A
HIGHER AMPLITUDE PATTERN THAN GFS. BY 00Z SATURDAY...GFS AND ECMWF
HAVE AS MUCH AS 300 METER DIFFERENCE IN HEIGHTS OVER CALIFORNIA.
EARLY LOOK AT HPCS PREEPD MESSAGE INDICATES THEY ARE TRENDING
TOWARD ECMWF SOLUTION.

HAVE TRENDED MOST FORECAST TEMPERATURES UP A LITTLE...BUT NOT AS
HIGH AS GUIDANCE. THESE ADJUSTMENTS SEEM TO FIT A LITTLE BETTER
WITH SURROUNDING OFFICES.

NEEDLESS TO SAY...CONFIDENCE IN DETAILS OF FORECAST PAST WEDNESDAY
IS RATHER LOW...DUE TO POOR CONTINUITY IN MODEL SOLUTIONS.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
MEM  50  34  50  32 /  10  10  10  10 
MKL  44  30  46  29 /  10  10  10  10 
JBR  48  32  47  29 /  10  10  10  10 
TUP  50  31  51  33 /  10  10  10  10

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
952 PM CST SAT DEC 10 2005

.UPDATE...

A SHORTWAVE TROUGH CONTINUES TO DIVE SOUTHEAST ACROSS THE CENTRAL
MISSISSIPPI VALLEY THIS EVENING. LOW CLOUDS IN ADVANCE OF THIS
FEATURE HAVE BEGUN TO SPREAD INTO NORTHERN PORTIONS OF THE MID-
SOUTH AND HAVE UPDATED CLOUD GRIDS TO MOSTLY CLOUDY IN THE
NORTHERN ONE-THIRD OF THE AREA. SURFACE WINDS HAVE ALSO TURNED
SOUTHWESTERLY IN ADVANCE OF THIS FEATURE AT 5-10 MPH NORTH HALF
AND LESS THAN 5 MPH SOUTH. HAVE ADJUSTED TEMPERATURES UP A FEW
DEGREES ESPECIALLY NORTH WHERE CLOUDS AND MIXING SHOULD KEEP
TEMPERATURES FROM BOTTOMING OUT LIKE THE PAST FEW NIGHTS. SO A
WARMER NIGHT IS IN STORE. OTHERWISE REMAINDER OF THE FORECAST
LOOKS GOOD.

UPDATED GRIDS AND ZONES OUT SHORTLY.

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 102018
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
220 PM CST SAT DEC 10 2005

.SYNOPSIS...
SOUTHWEST SURFACE FLOW AHEAD OF A PACIFIC FRONT MOVING THROUGH THE 
MIDWEST.  SYSTEM IS DRY FOR THE MIDSOUTH...EXCEPT FOR SNOW SHOWERS 
ACROSS IOWA AND ILLINOIS.  STILL SEE SOME SNOW COVER ON SATELLITE 
ACROSS FAR NORTHEAST ARKANSAS AND THE MISSOURI BOOTHEEL.  TEMPS 
BELOW AVERAGE...DESPITE SOUTHWEST FLOW AND FULL SUN.

&&

.SHORT TERM (THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...
FAST...NORTHWEST FLOW...WITH A SERIES OF SHORTWAVES ROTATING THROUGH 
FOR THE NEXT 36 HOURS.  FIRST SHORTWAVE MOVES THROUGH TONIGHT 
FOLLOWED BY ANOTHER ON SUNDAY.  NEITHER SHOULD PRODUCE ANY 
PRECIPITATION WITH THE BEST FORCING WELL EAST OF THE FORECAST AREA. 
MAIN INFLUENCE WILL BE IN KEEPING TEMPS ON THE COOL SIDE OF 
CLIMATOLOGY.

MORE SIGNIFICANT SHORTWAVE EXPECTED TO MOVE THOUGH TUESDAY NIGHT AND 
WEDNESDAY MORNING.  MODELS MAY HAVE SLOWED DOWN A LITTLE BIT WITH 
THIS FEATURE, BUT IN GENERAL ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT. AT THIS TIME 
THERE IS NO INDICATION OF ANY FROZEN PRECIPITATION.      

&&

.LONG RANGE (AFTER WEDNESDAY)...
BIG DIFFERENCES BETWEEN THE GFS AND ECMWF.  LOW CONFIDENCE IN THIS 
FORECAST WITH MODEL FLIPS ON EACH RUN....ALTHOUGH THE ECMWF IS MOST 
CONSISTENT.  MAIN DIFFERENCE IS STRONG SHORTWAVE WHICH DIVES 
SOUTH ALONG THE CANADIAN ROCKYS ON DAY 4.  GFS EVENTUALLY SPLITS THE 
ENERGY.  ONE SHORTWAVE HEADS TOWARD THE GREAT LAKES...WHILE THE 
OTHER RETROGRESSES ALONG THE PACIFIC COAST.  THE GFS SOLUTION PUMPS 
A FLAT RIDGE ACROSS THE CENTRAL US. MUCH MILDER FOR THE MIDSOUTH.
MEANWHILE THE ECMWF TAKES THE SHORTWAVE AND REINFORCES THE TROF 
ACROSS THE CENTRAL US...WHICH IS A MUCH COLDER SOLUTION FOR THE 
MIDSOUTH.

INCLINED TO FAVOR THE ECMWF SOLUTION SINCE THE MEAN TROF HAS BEEN 
ACROSS THE CENTRAL US AND THE ECMWF HAS BEEN MOST CONSISTENT. THUS 
HAVE DECIDED TO STICK MAINLY NEAR CLIMATOLOGY OR SLIGHTLY BELOW. 
ALSO...WITH EITHER MODEL SOLUTION...NO INDICATION OF MEASURABLE 
PRECIPITATION THROUGH THE PERIOD. 

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.

&&

$$

 BELLES

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 100921
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
321 AM CST SAT DEC 10 2005

.DISCUSSION...
SURFACE HIGH CURRENTLY OVER SOUTHEASTERN STATES AND MOVING SLOWLY
EAST. WATER VAPOR LOOP CLEARLY SHOWS SHORTWAVE MOVING QUICKLY
EAST...ENTERING NW ARKANSAS AT 0830Z. MOISTURE BEING LIFTED
NORTHEAST AHEAD OF THE SHORTWAVE. THIS IS REFLECTED BY 2500-4000
FT CLOUDS MOVING NE ACROSS ARKANSAS. EXPECT THESE CLOUDS IN
MEMPHIS METRO AREA BY ABOUT 13Z. TEMPERATURES CURRENTLY IN THE
TEENS IN MOST AREAS...BUT SHOULD RISE INTO THE 20S AS CLOUDS ARRIVE.
&&

.SHORT TERM (THROUGH MONDAY)...
MODELS SHOW 3 SEPARATE SHORTWAVES MOVING ACROSS THE CWA BY 15Z ON
SUNDAY. WE WILL SEE AN INCREASE IN CLOUD COVER WITH THE SHORTWAVE
THIS MORNING AND THE ONE SUNDAY MORNING...WONT REALLY NOTICE MUCH
FROM THE ONE THIS EVENING. EXPECT CLOUDY CONDITIONS FOR SEVERAL
HOURS THIS MORNING...BUT AS SHORTWAVE MOVES EAST...CLOUDS SHOULD
EXIT AS WELL. THIS PERIOD OF CLOUDS WILL PREVENT TEMPERATURES FROM
REACHING THEIR MAX POTENTIAL. EVEN SO...WITH SIGNIFICANT
SUNSHINE...TEMPS SHOULD BE 10-15 DEGREES WARMER THAN FRIDAY. WHILE
WE CANT RULE OUT A FLURRY OR SPRINKLE WITH THESE SHORTWAVES...DO
NOT EXPECT MEASURABLE PRECIPITATION.

SURFACE FRONT TO MOVE THROUGH THIS EVENING. TEMPERATURES BEHIND
THE FRONT ARE ACTUALLY ABOUT 10 DEGREES WARMER THAN AHEAD OF IT.
CURRENT AIRMASS IS OF ARCTIC ORIGIN...AIRMASS BEHIND FRONT IS OF
PACIFIC ORIGIN. DEWPOINTS BEHIND FRONT IN MID-UPPER 20S...SO LOWS
TONIGHT MUCH WARMER THAN THIS MORNING.

AFTER LAST SHORTWAVE EXITS TOMORROW MORNING...H500 HEIGHTS BEGIN
RISING A LITTLE AS SYSTEM UNDERCUTS WEST COAST RIDGE. THIS ALLOWS
SHORTWAVE RIDGING TO MOVE INTO THE AREA. WE SHOULD SEE A LOT OF
SUN ON SUNDAY AND MONDAY...WITH TEMPERATURES MUCH CLOSER TO NORMAL
FOR MID-DECEMBER.
&&

.LONG RANGE (AFTER MONDAY)...
THIS MORNING...THERE IS AT LEAST A LITTLE BIT OF MODEL CONTINUITY
BETWEEN THE 00Z OPERATIONAL GFS AND THE 00Z ECMWF UNTIL ABOUT 00Z
THURSDAY BEFORE GOING THEIR SEPARATE WAYS. SYSTEM COMING UNDER
WEST COAST RIDGE TO PHASE SOMEWHAT WITH A NORTHERN STREAM SYSTEM
TUESDAY NIGHT AND WEDNESDAY...BRINGING A CHANCE OF RAIN BACK TO
THE AREA. THIS WAS ALREADY COVERED IN PREVIOUS FORECAST AND WILL
ALLOW THIS TO RIDE. THICKNESSES IN BOTH MODELS INDICATE ALL
PRECIPITATION WITH THIS EVENT SHOULD BE LIQUID IN OUR CWA.

DIFFERENCES BEGIN TO APPEAR ON THURSDAY...AS GFS IS A LITTLE
QUICKER TO LIFT PHASED SYSTEM OUT OF THE AREA. GFS PATTERN MUCH
LESS AMPLIFIED AFTER THURSDAY THAN ECMWF IS...AND CONSIDERABLY
WARMER. FOR EXAMPLE...500 HEIGHT AT MEM ON GFS IS 100 METERS
HIGHER THAN ECMWF AT 00Z/17. FOR NOW...WILL KEEP DRY FORECAST
AFTER WEDNESDAY...AND TREND FORECAST TEMPS UP A LITTLE...BUT NOT
QUITE TO MEX DATA. 
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

JBR  45  28  46  32 /  10  10  10  10

FXUS64 KMEG 100341
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
941 PM CST FRI DEC 9 2005

.DISCUSSION...

SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE REMAINS SITUATED OVER THE MID-SOUTH THIS
EVENING. THIS HAS ALLOWED FOR CLEAR SKIES AND CALM WINDS OVER THE
EASTERN 2/3RDS OF THE FORECAST AREA AND ALSO ALLOWED FOR THE
ATMOSPHERE TO DECOUPLE IN MOST AREAS. THEREFORE...TEMPERATURES
HAVE QUICKLY DROPPED INTO THE TEENS AND LOWER 20S AS OF 03Z.
REGIONAL SATELLITE IMAGERY IS INDICATING SCATTERED HIGH CLOUDS
MOVING INTO NORTHWEST PORTIONS OF THE AREA AHEAD OF AN UPPER LEVEL
SHORTWAVE CURRENTLY MOVING ACROSS OKLAHOMA. THESE HIGH CLOUDS MAY
HELP TO SLOW TEMPERATURE FALLS ACROSS ESPECIALLY NORTHWEST
SECTIONS. BUT STILL EXPECT TEMPS IN THESE AREAS TO BOTTOM OUT IN
THE LOW AND MID TEENS. ELSEWHERE...CLOUD COVER SHOULD REMAIN
ISOLATED AT BEST AND MOSTLY CLEAR SKIES SHOULD CONTINUE. OVERALL
THE CURRENT FORECAST IS CLOSE TO ON TRACK. ONLY TEMPERATURE
CONCERN IS AT MEMPHIS INTERNATIONAL...WHERE UPPER TEENS SHOULD BE
AS LOW AS IT SHOULD GO. BUT RURAL AREAS AWAY FROM MEMPHIS MAY
STILL SEE MID TEENS...SO WILL LEAVE FORECAST ALONE.

OVERALL...FORECAST IS IN GOOD SHAPE AND WILL MAKE NO CHANGES AT
THIS TIME.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 092016
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
216 PM CST FRI DEC 9 2005

.DISCUSSION...

A COLD DOME OF HIGH PRESSURE IS CENTERED OVER NORTHEAST ARKANSAS.
TEMPERATURES HAVE REALLY STRUGGLED TODAY WITH MANY AREAS NOT EVEN
REACHING THE FREEZING POINT. GUIDANCE HAS NOT HANDLED TEMPERATURES
TODAY WELL AT ALL. AN UPPER VORT IS OVER COLORADO AND HIGH CLOUDS
HAVE DEVELOPED IN RESPONSE TO THIS VORT OVER KANSAS AND OKLAHOMA. 

PROBLEM TONIGHT IS MIN TEMPS. DEW POINTS ARE IN THE TEENS. SKIES
SHOULD BE CLEAR TO START BUT HIGH CLOUDS ASSOCIATED WITH THE UPPER
VORT MAY MOVE OVER THE REGION AFTER MIDNIGHT. THE POSITION OF THE
HIGH PRESSURE APPEARS TO BE THE KEY. WITH IT CENTERED OVER THE
REGION...WINDS SHOULD GO LIGHT EARLY THIS EVENING. WITH CLEAR
SKIES AND LOW DEW POINTS...TEMPERATURES WILL LIKELY PLUMMET DURING
THE EVENING HOURS PERHAPS LEVELING OFF SOME ONCE THE HIGH CLOUDS
MOVE OVERHEAD. GUIDANCE APPEARS TO BE EXTREMELY UNRELIABLE. HAVE
DRASTICALLY UNDERCUT MIN TEMPERATURES TO NEAR DEW POINT READINGS.
WOULD NOT BE SURPRISED IF SINGLE DIGITS ARE REPORTED ACROSS THE
REGION. THIS MAY BE ESPECIALLY TRUE OVER NORTHEAST ARKANSAS AND
INTO THE BOOTHEEL WHERE THE SNOW PACK IN PLACE. 

THE HIGH WILL SHIFT EAST OF THE REGION TOMORROW WITH SOUTHERLY
WINDS RETURNING AT THE SURFACE. MODELS SHOW COLDER AIR AT 850MB
MOVING BACK IN BEHIND THE VORT. AM REAL UNCERTAIN AS TO WHETHER OR
NOT THE GUIDANCE HIGH TEMPS FOR TOMORROW WILL EVEN BE REALIZED
ESPECIALLY SINCE TEMPERATURES WILL BE STARTING FROM A MUCH LOWER
BASE THAN MODELS SUGGEST. ALSO THE NAM SHOWS SOME STRATUS AT 850MB
MOVING UP FROM THE SOUTH PERHAPS MOVING AS FAR NORTH AS THE TN/MS
LINE. GFS DOES NOT SHOW THESE CLOUDS MOVING THIS FAR NORTH. ONLY
HESITATION IN NOT LOWERING TEMPS FOR TOMORROW IS UNCERTAINTY IN
THE IMPACT OF THE SOUTHERLY WINDS. 

A CLIPPER SYSTEM WILL MOVE THROUGH THE AREA TOMORROW NIGHT. THIS
WILL BRING A REINFORCING DOSE OF COLD AIR TO THE REGION. NAM SHOWS
A GOOD DEAL OF LOW CLOUDS BEHIND THE SYSTEM. CLOUDS PLUS WINDS
REMAINING UP SHOULD PREVENT TEMPS WARMER. LOW LEVELS WAY TOO DRY
TO MENTION ANY PRECIP.

BELOW NORMAL TEMPERATURES AND DRY WEATHER WILL STICK AROUND UNTIL
EARLY NEXT WEEK. GFS SHOWS THE UPPER TROUGH THAT IS OVER THE
REGION BEING REPLACED BY A SHORTWAVE RIDGE. THIS WOULD TRANSLATE
INTO WARMER TEMPERATURES. GFS SHOWS A SHORTWAVE SCOOTING THROUGH
THE REGION ON TUESDAY. THIS COULD PRODUCE A CHANCE FOR RAIN. TOO
WARM FOR SNOW. FROM MIDWEEK ONWARD...ALL BETS ARE OFF. MODELS
CONTINUE TO JUMP AROUND WITH THE UPPER PATTERN FROM DAY TO DAY.
WILL KEEP FORECAST DRY UNTIL MORE CONSISTENCY IS REALIZED.

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
1028 AM CST FRI DEC 9 2005

.DISCUSSION...

HIGH PRESSURE IS CENTERED OVER NORTH CENTRAL ARKANSAS THIS
MORNING. SOME CIRRUS IS DRIFTING THROUGH NORTH MISSISSIPPI...THIS
IS ASSOCIATED WITH MOISTURE ASSOCIATED WITH THE SUBTROPICAL JET.
TEMPERATURES OVER THE NORTHERN TWO THIRDS OF THE FORECAST AREA ARE
NOT RESPONDING WELL OR AT LEAST AS WELL AS GUIDANCE WOULD HAVE
THEM. MODELS PROBABLY NOT PICKING UP ON THE STRENGTH OF THE
SHALLOW COLD AIR IN PLACE OVER THE REGION. HAVE LOWERED AFTERNOON
HIGH TEMPS WITH SOME AREAS NOT LIKELY TO GET ABOVE FREEZING.

SET IN 1917.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
151 AM CST FRI DEC 9 2005

.DISCUSSION...
SURFACE HIGH CURRENTLY CENTERED OVER EASTERN OKLAHOMA. FRIGID
AIRMASS IN PLACE WITH TEMPERATURES UPPER TEENS TO MIDDLE 20S
ACROSS THE CWA. AREAS TO OUR NORTH AND WEST EVEN COLDER...WITH

SOUTHEAST HALF OF CWA SHOULD GRADUALLY SHIFT EAST BY MIDDAY.
&&

.SHORT TERM (THROUGH SUNDAY)...
UPPER FLOW WILL REMAIN MAINLY NORTHWESTERLY THROUGH THE WEEKEND.
SHORTWAVES TO MOVE THROUGH THE FLOW JUST NORTH OF OUR AREA ON BOTH
SATURDAY AND SUNDAY. VERY LITTLE MOISTURE FOR THESE SHORTWAVES TO
WORK ON. WHILE A SPRINKLE OR TWO WOULD BE POSSIBLE WITH THE
SUNDAY SHORTWAVE...CHANCE OF MEASURABLE PRECIPITATION IS TOO LOW
FOR MENTION IN ZONES AT THIS TIME.

CURRENT TEMPERATURE FORECAST APPEARS TO BE IN GOOD SHAPE WITH
LITTLE OR NO ADJUSTMENT NEEDED...OUTSIDE OF FITTING CURRENT
TEMPERATURE TRENDS. DIFFICULT TO TELL EXACTLY WHERE ANY SNOW COVER
MIGHT BE LOCATED THIS EVENING...AND LOOKING AT OBSERVATIONS
DOESNT APPEAR TO GIVE AN OBVIOUS CLUE EITHER.
&&

.LONG TERM (AFTER SUNDAY)...
UPPER LOW ALONG PACIFIC COAST WILL EVENTUALLY UNDERCUT THE RIDGE
AND MOVE INTO CONVERGENT FLOW ACROSS THE SOUTHERN PLAINS MONDAY
AND TUESDAY. STRONGER NORTHERN STREAM SHORTWAVE TO AFFECT THE AREA
AROUND WEDNESDAY. WITH NO REAL STRONG SOUTHERLY FLOW...SYSTEMS TO
BE MOISTURE STARVED AGAIN. DO NOT SEE ANY REASON TO MAKE
SIGNIFICANT CHANGES TO EXTENDED FORECAST AT THIS TIME.
&&

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 090315
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
915 PM CST THU DEC 8 2005

.UPDATE...

LOW CLOUDS HAVE EXITED MOST OF THE CWA THIS EVENING THANKS TO WNW
TO NW WINDS ON THE BACKSIDE OF THE EXITING 500 MB SHORTWAVE. LOW
LEVEL COLD AIR ADVECTION WILL CONTINUE ALL NIGHT...USHERING IN
COLDER TEMPERATURES AND EVEN LOWER DEWPOINTS. HAVE MADE A FEW
ADJUSTMENTS TO TEMPERATURES TONIGHT. A 1 TO 2 INCH SNOW IS ON THE
GROUND IN EXTREME NE ARKANSAS AND THE MISSOURI BOOTHEEL.
TEMPERATURES IN THESE LOCATIONS ARE ALREADY NEAR 20. GIVEN THE
SNOW COVER...CLEAR SKIES...LOWER DEWPOINTS...AND CONTINUED
CAA...HAVE DECIDED TO DROP TEMPS THERE ABOUT A CATEGORY. 

SATELLITE IMAGERY SHOWS BANDS OF CIRRUS CLOUDS MOVING ACROSS NE
MISSISSIPPI. GFS PICKS THIS UP WELL IN ITS 250 MB RH FIELD AND
DOES NOT SHOW IT EXITING THE AREA UNTIL AFTER 12Z. THIS LOOKS
CONSISTENT WITH THE LATEST SATELLITE. THEREFORE...HAVE BUMPED
TEMPS UP A CATEGORY FROM TUPELO SOUTHWARD AS THE THICKER CIRRUS
WILL NOT ALLOW TEMPS TO FALL AS MUCH AS THEY OTHERWISE WOULD.
TEMPS AND OTHER FORECAST PARAMETERS LOOK GOOD FOR THE REST OF THE 
AREA.

WE SPOKE WITH SEVERAL OF THE SHERIFFS OFFICES FROM NE AR...THE
MISSOURI BOOTHEEL...AND NW TN. ALL REPORTS ARE THAT ROAD
CONDITIONS ARE IN GOOD SHAPE WITH JUST SLICK SPOTS ON A FEW RURAL
BRIDGES. THANKS TO EVERYBODY TODAY FOR THEIR WINTER WEATHER
REPORTS. WE WILL SEND OUT A PUBLIC INFORMATION STATEMENT SHORTLY
TO DOCUMENT THE ACCUMULATIONS FROM ACROSS THE AREA.

JFB

&&

.PREV DISCUSSION... (ISSUED 238 PM CST THU DEC 8 2005) 

DISCUSSION...

RADAR SHOWS THE BACK EDGE OF VERY LIGHT PRECIPITATION ADVANCING
THROUGH WEST TENNESSEE. WILL CANCEL ALL REMAINING ADVISORIES.
SATELLITE SHOWS DRY PUNCH WORKING ACROSS ARKANSAS. MODELS SHOW
THIS TREND CONTINUING THIS EVENING RESULTING IN CLEAR SKIES
OVERNIGHT. TONIGHT AND TOMORROW NIGHT WILL BE COLDEST NIGHTS WITH
GUIDANCE SHOWING MANY AREAS DROPPING INTO THE TEENS ON BOTH
NIGHTS. TEMPERATURES SHOULD WARM NOTICEABLY ON SATURDAY AS THE
AREA OF HIGH PRESSURE SHIFTS EAST OF THE REGION AND WINDS TURN
SOUTHERLY AGAIN. DRY NORTHWEST FLOW SHOULD PREVAIL TILL MIDWEEK
WHEN ANOTHER DISTURBANCE WILL KICK OUT OF THE WEST AND PROVIDE A
CHANCE FOR RAIN.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
929 AM CST THU DEC 8 2005

.DISCUSSION...

UPDATED FORECAST FOR TEMPERATURE TRENDS THIS MORNING. NO CHANGES
MADE TO PRECIP FORECAST. RADAR CONTINUES TO SHOW AN AREA OF PRECIP
ACROSS THE ENTIRE REGION. HAVE RECEIVED REPORTS OF 1-2 INCHES OF
SNOW NORTH OF JONESBORO...A MIX FROM FORREST CITY TO BLYTHEVILLE
INTO NORTHWEST TENNESSEE. NO MAJOR ICE ACCUMULATIONS AND NONE ARE
EXPECTED. HOWEVER ROADS COULD BECOME JUST SLICK ENOUGH FOR SOME
PROBLEMS. FURTHER SOUTH...ALONG THE I-40 CORRIDOR...TEMPS ARE
HOVERING JUST ABOVE FREEZING. WITH PRECIP IN THE AREA AND WINDS
OUT OF THE NORTH FEEL UNCOMFORTABLE TO REMOVE ADVISORY IN THIS
AREA AT THIS TIME. PRECIPITATION SHOULD COME TO AN END EAST OF THE
RIVER AROUND NOON...ACROSS EXTREME WEST TENNESSEE AND NORTHWEST MS
BY 2PM OR SO...LATE THIS AFTERNOON FOR REMAINING AREAS. LOCAL
STORM REPORTS ARE AVAILABLE ON THE WEB SITE...WWW.SRH.NOAA.GOV/MEG.

.PREV DISCUSSION... (ISSUED 226 AM CST THU DEC 8 2005) 

DISCUSSION...

DEVELOPING LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM ALONG GULF COAST ALONG WITH AN
UPPER LEVEL LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM THAT WILL TRACK ALONG SOUTHERN
NEBRASKA INTO NORTHERN MISSOURI WILL HELP SPREAD A VARIETY OF
PRECIPITATION TYPES INTO THE MIDSOUTH TODAY. LATEST RADAR IMAGES
SHOW RADAR ECHOES MOVING IN FROM THE SOUTHWEST ALTHOUGH NOTHING IS
HITTING THE GROUND YET SINCE THE LOWER LAYERS OF THE ATMOSPHERE
ARE STILL PRETTY DRY. EXPECT THE LAYERS TO MOISTEN BY THIS MORNING
ALLOWING FOR PRECIP TO BEGIN REACHING THE SFC. WITH REGARDS TO
PRECIP TYPE CURRENTLY EXPECT ALL SNOW ACROSS EXTREME NORTHEAST
ARKANSAS WITH TOTAL ACCUMULATIONS OF 1 TO 3 INCHES ENDING AROUND
NOON. FOR AREAS NEAR JONESBORO STRETCHING INTO THE MISSOURI
BOOTHEEL INTO DYERSBURG AND UNION CITY...EXPECT A MIXTURE OF
FREEZING RAIN...SLEET...AND SNOW WITH TOTAL ACCUMULATIONS AROUND
AN INCH. PRECIP WILL END AROUND NOON WEST OF THE RIVER...AND
AROUND 300 PM EAST OF THE RIVER. FOR EAST CENTRAL ARKANSAS INTO
THE MEMPHIS METRO AREA...STRETCHING NORTHEASTWARD INTO JACKSON AND
PARIS TN...EXPECT A MIXTURE OF RAIN...FREEZING RAIN AND SLEET WITH
ICE ACCUMULATIONS LESS THAN A TENTH OF AN INCH AND ANY SLEET
ACCUMULATION LESS THAN AN INCH. EXPECT PRECIP TO END ACROSS EAST
CENTRAL ARKANSAS AROUND NOON...FOR MEMPHIS METRO DURING EARLY
AFTERNOON HOURS...FOR JACKSON AND PARIS AROUND 400 PM. EXTREME
NORTHWEST MISSISSIPPI AND PHILLIPS COUNTY ARKANSAS MAY SEE PRECIP
BEGIN AS FREEZING RAIN BEFORE QUICKLY SWITCHING TO RAIN. DO NOT
EXPECT LITTLE IF ANY ACCUMULATION HERE. ALL OTHER AREAS WILL
RECEIVE ONLY RAIN. WILL UPDATE ADVISORIES TO REFLECT MORE DETAIL
TIMING OF EVENT AND PRECIP TYPE.

HIGH PRESSURE WILL QUICKLY BUILD IN BEHIND THE LOW PRESSURE SYSTEMS. 
EXPECT DRY CONDITIONS WITH TEMPERATURES SLOWLY WARMING INTO THE 30S 
AND 40S FOR HIGHS FRIDAY AND SATURDAY WITH LOWS IN THE TEENS AND 20S.

A DRY COLD FRONT WILL MOVE THROUGH THE CWA SATURDAY NIGHT. FRONT 
WILL NOT HAVE A LOT OF COLD AIR BEHIND IT SO DON/T EXPECT MAJOR 
TEMPERATURES CHANGES BEHIND IT. PORTIONS OF NORTHWEST TENNESSEE MAY 
SEE A FEW FLURRIES BEHIND THE FRONT ON SUNDAY.

HIGH PRESSURE WILL REBUILD INTO THE AREA FOR THE BEGINNING OF THE 
WEEK. EXPECT HIGHS IN THE 40S AND 50S WITH LOWS IN THE 20S AND 30S.

ANOTHER LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM WILL TRACK ALONG THE GULF COAST STATES 
AND WILL SPREAD RAIN INTO THE MIDSOUTH TUESDAY NIGHT INTO WEDNESDAY.

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...SNOW ADVISORY UNTIL NOON CST TODAY FOR CLAY-GREENE-LAWRENCE-
     RANDOLPH.

     WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY UNTIL NOON CST TODAY FOR CRITTENDEN-
     CROSS-ST. FRANCIS.

     WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY UNTIL NOON CST TODAY FOR CRAIGHEAD-
     MISSISSIPPI-POINSETT.

MO...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY UNTIL NOON CST TODAY FOR DUNKLIN-
     PEMISCOT.

MS...NONE.
TN...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY UNTIL 3 PM CST THIS AFTERNOON FOR DYER-
     LAKE-LAUDERDALE-OBION.

     WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY UNTIL 6 PM CST THIS AFTERNOON FOR 
     CARROLL-CROCKETT-GIBSON-HAYWOOD-HENRY-MADISON-WEAKLEY.

     WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY UNTIL 3 PM CST THIS AFTERNOON FOR 
     FAYETTE-SHELBY-TIPTON.

226 AM CST THU DEC 8 2005

.DISCUSSION...

DEVELOPING LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM ALONG GULF COAST ALONG WITH AN
UPPER LEVEL LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM THAT WILL TRACK ALONG SOUTHERN
NEBRASKA INTO NORTHERN MISSOURI WILL HELP SPREAD A VARIETY OF
PRECIPITATION TYPES INTO THE MIDSOUTH TODAY. LATEST RADAR IMAGES
SHOW RADAR ECHOES MOVING IN FROM THE SOUTHWEST ALTHOUGH NOTHING IS
HITTING THE GROUND YET SINCE THE LOWER LAYERS OF THE ATMOSPHERE

AND 40S FOR HIGHS FRIDAY AND SATURDAY WITH LOWS IN THE TEENS AND 20S.

FXUS64 KMEG 080334 CCA
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...CORRECTION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
925 PM CST WED DEC 7 2005

ADDED FAYETTE COUNTY TO WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY

.DISCUSSION...
WINTER WEATHER EVENT TRYING TO GET STARTED OVER ARKANSAS THIS 
EVENING. SOME REPORTS OVER CENTRAL ARKANSAS CONFIRMED SOME LIGHT 
SNOW AROUND CONWAY...AND REGIONAL RADAR ANIMATION INDICATES SOME 
SMALL AREAS OF SLEET OR HEAVIER SNOW SHOWERS. FARTHER WEST...OVER 
NORTHEAST OKLAHOMA...SNOW HAS BEEN FALLING AROUND THE TULSA AREA FOR 
THE LAST SEVERAL HOURS. THE ARCTIC FRONT HAS MOVED THROUGH THIS 
REGION AND CURRENTLY WAS LOCATED FROM FORT SMITH TO LONGVIEW TO 
VICTORIA. THE INVERTED TROUGH WAS LOCATED ACROSS WESTERN ARKANSAS.

TEMPERATURES OVER THE MIDSOUTH HAVE BEEN AROUND 30 OVER THE NORTHERN 
THIRD...UPPER 30S OVER THE CENTRAL THIRD AND LOWER TO MID 40S ACROSS 
THE SOUTHERN THIRD. LOW LEVEL MOISTURE ADVECTION WAS SEEN ALONG THE 
TROUGH AXIS...MAINLY ALONG THE TEXAS/LOUISIANA STATE LINE. THIRTY 
DEGREE DEWPOINTS HAVE BEEN SLOWLY BUILDING NORTHWARD INTO NORTHWEST 
MS. 

SATELLITE IMAGERY WAS INDICATING SOME CLOUD ENHANCEMENTS ALONG THE 
MAIN JET AXIS. THIS...COMBINED WITH ISENTROPIC UPGLIDE WILL BE WHERE 
THE BEST DYNAMICS WILL BE LOCATED. THIS AXIS WILL SHIFT EASTWARD 
OVERNIGHT.

THE DEWPOINTS ACROSS THE MIDSOUTH RANGED FROM THE UPPER TEENS ACROSS 
THE NORTH...LOWER AND MID 20S ELSEWHERE. THE LATEST MODEL SOUNDINGS 
INDICATE A DRY LAYER BELOW 4 KFT. STILL SOME UNCERTAINTY ON AMOUNT 
OF PRECIP...HOWEVER THE DRY LAYERS DO SUGGEST LIGHTER AMOUNTS THAN 
PREVIOUS RUNS. THE SURFACE TEMPERATURES WILL BE CRITICAL AS THE 
FREEZING LINE IS ILL DEFINED. BEST PLACEMENT WILL PROBABLY PUT IT 
ALONG OR JUST NORTH OF I-40. THE TIMING OF THE ONSET OF THE PRECIP 
WILL BE CLOSE TO 7AM OVER THE MEMPHIS METRO AREA...AND SLIGHTLY 
SOONER OVER NORTHEAST ARKANSAS.

A BAND OF FREEZING RAIN...PERHAPS MIXED WITH SLEET WILL PROBABLY 
OCCUR BETWEEN AREAS ROUGHLY ALONG I-40 AND NORTH TO WYNNE AR TO 
PARIS TN. WE BELIEVE THAT SNOW WILL BE LIKELY ABOVE THE WYNNE TO 
PARIS LINE. ALL AMOUNTS WILL REMAIN LIGHT. WE WILL BE ISSUING A 
WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY FOR AREAS ALONG I-40 AND NORTHWARD.

THE TIMING OF THE FROZEN PRECIPITATION WILL BE AROUND RUSH-HOUR 
TRAFFIC. BELIEVE THAT THE GREATEST CHANCES FOR FROZEN PRECIP TO 
AFFECT THE MEMPHIS AREA WILL BE FROM 5 AM TO 9 AM. AFTER 9 AM 
TEMPERATURES WILL BEGIN TO RISE ABOVE FREEZING IN THE MEMPHIS AREA. 

AREAS THAT SEE SNOW...SHOULD SEE IT ENDING BY THE AFTERNOON.

GENERALLY AREAS SOUTH OF I-40 WILL REMAIN ALL RAIN...SUCH AS NORTH 
MISSISSIPPI.

MANY GRIDS WILL NEED TO BE REWORKED...SO ZONES MAY BE SLIGHTLY 
DELAYED. WE WILL WORK HARD TO GET THESE OUT AS QUICKLY AS 
POSSIBLE.   

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY FROM 3 AM TO NOON THURSDAY
     ARZ008-009-017-018-026>028-035-036-048. 
MO...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY FROM 3 AM TO NOON THURSDAY
     MOZ113-115.
MS...NONE.
TN...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY FROM 3 AM TO NOON THURSDAY      
TNZ001>004-019>021-048>052-088-089.

&&

$$

AC

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
925 PM CST WED DEC 7 2005

.DISCUSSION...
WINTER WEATHER EVENT TRYING TO GET STARTED OVER ARKANSAS THIS 
EVENING. SOME REPORTS OVER CENTRAL ARKANSAS CONFIRMED SOME LIGHT 
SNOW AROUND CONWAY...AND REGIONAL RADAR ANIMATION INDICATES SOME

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 072054
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
254 PM CST WED DEC 7 2005

.DISCUSSION...

CURRENTLY...MID AND HIGH CLOUDS RACING INTO THE REGION WITH A BRISK
NE SURFACE WIND AT 10 TO 15 MPH. TEMPS HAVE ONLY WARMED INTO THE
MID 30S NORTH TO MID 40S SOUTH WITH DEWPOINTS IN THE LOWER 20S. 

TONIGHT AND THURSDAY...CONFIDENCE IN THE FORECAST CONTINUES TO BE
LOW AND THE 12Z MODEL RUN HAS DONE LITTLE TO CLARIFY THE
SITUATION. POTENTIAL STILL EXISTS FOR WINTER WEATHER EVENT OVER
PARTS OF THE AREA LATE TONIGHT INTO THURSDAY.

A STRONG 500 MB LOW WL MOVE SOUTHEAST INTO CNTRL PLAINS BY 12Z
THU. MEANWHILE A SURFACE LOW WILL DEVELOP OVER THE NORTHERN GULF
WITH AN INVERTED TROF OVER THE EASTERN SECTIONS OF THE MID SOUTH
BY 12Z THU. COLD AIR WL REMAIN IN PLACE ON THE WEST/NORTHWEST SIDE
OF THE INVERTED TROF SETTING THE STAGE FOR A WINTRY MIX. BY 00Z FRI 
A SURFACE LOW WL DEVELOP OVER THE OH VALLEY AND RACE NORTHEAST
ALONG WITH THE UPPER LOW THU NIGHT.

THE 12Z ETA AND GFS ARE IN VERY GOOD AGREEMENT WITH THESE SYNOPTIC
SCALE FEATURES. THE BIG DIFFERENCES LIE IN THE LIFT AND MOISTURE AS
THE SYSTEM MOVES THROUGH THE AREA. THE ETA IS THE BULLISH MODEL...
ORGANIZING THE SYSTEM MORE QUICKLY. ETA QPFS RANGE FROM AROUND 0.20
INCHES ACRS NE AR TO 0.75 INCHES OVER NE MS. THE GFS IS MUCH DRIER
AND LESS ORGANIZED WITH ONLY A TRACE ACRS NE AR TO ABOUT 0.5
INCHES OVER NE MS. THE GFS IS INDICATING THAT A DRY SLOT WILL WORK
INTO THE AREA AND CUT OFF PRECIP QUICKLY...ESPECIALLY ACRS EASTERN
AR. THE ECMWF...CANADIAN AND NGM MODELS ALSO HINT AT THIS.

GIVEN THE UNCERTAINITY OF QPF AMOUNT WL HOLD OFF ON ANY ADVISORIES
ATTM. HAVE BASICALLY GONE WITH A BLEND OF THE ETA AND GFS QPF
AMOUNTS FOR THIS FORECAST. USING ETA MODEL SOUNDINGS EXPECT ALL
SNOW ACRS EXTREME NORTHEAST ARKANSAS WITH 1-2 INCHES AS A
POTENTIAL ACCUMULATION. JUST TO THE SOUTH ACROSS THE PARIS-
DYERSBURG-JONESBORO REGION EXPECT A MIX OF SNOW...SLEET AND SOME
FREEZING RAIN WITH PERHAPS AN INCH TOTAL. THE JACKSON-MEMPHIS-
MARIANNA (I-40 CORRIDOR) WILL SEE A MIX OF RAIN...FREEZING RAIN
AND SLEET CHANGING TO MOSTLY RAIN DURING THE MORNING. LIGHT ICING
COULD OCCUR IN THIS AREA. AREAS JUST TO THE SOUTH...FROM SELMER-
HOLLY SPRINGS-CLARKSDALE...COULD SEE A BRIEF PERIOD OF FREEZING
RAIN IN THE MORNING WITH NO SIGNIFICANT ICING. 

THERE WL BE A CHANCE OF PRECIP AFTER MIDNIGHT...WITH PERHAPS A
FEW SPRINKLES OR FLURRIES THIS EVENING. VERY DRY AIRMASS ACROSS
THE REGION SHOULD PREVENT PRECIP FROM STARTING TOO EARLY. WL CONT
LIKELY POPS FOR THU THOUGH AGAIN IT IS THE QPF AMOUNT THAT IS THE
BIG QUESTION. ANY PRECIP WL TAPER OFF RAPIDLY DURING THE
AFTERNOON/EARLY EVENING AS THE SYSTEM MOVES QUICKLY TO THE
NORTHEAST.

THIS EVENT CONTINUES TO BE MONITORED AND AN WINTER WEATHER
ADVISORY MAY NEED TO BE ISSUED BY UPCOMING SHIFTS. WL ISSUE AN SPS
WITH THE FORECAST PACKAGE TO HIGHLIGHT THE POSSIBILITY OF WINTER
WEATHER FOR LATE TONIGHT AND THU.

EXTENDED...MEAN TROF OVER THE EASTERN U.S. MEANS CONTINUED COLD NW
FLOW ACROSS THE MID SOUTH AND MAINLY BELOW NORMAL TEMPS. 

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
MEM  32  37  24  41 /  30  60  10  10 
MKL  30  38  19  40 /  20  70  20  10 
JBR  28  35  19  38 /  40  60  10  10 
TUP  35  44  23  45 /  20  70  20  10 

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.

&&

SJM

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 071623
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
1023 AM CST WED DEC 7 2005

.UPDATE...

MID AND HIGH CLOUDS STARTING TO STREAM INTO THE REGION AHEAD OF
THE APPROACHING SYSTEM. COLD AIR IN PLACE WITH BRISK NORTHEAST
WINDS THIS MORNING. CURRENT FORECAST ON TRACK.

CONCERNING POTENTIAL WINTER WEATHER EVENT...12Z MODELS HAVE
CLEARED UP ABSOLUTELY NOTHING. GFS CONTINUES TO FORECAST A VERY
LIGHT EVENT WHILE THE ETA IS MORE BULLISH. MORE ON THIS THIS
AFTERNOON.

&&

.PREV DISCUSSION... (ISSUED 245 AM CST WED DEC 7 2005) 

DISCUSSION...  

HIGH PRESSURE HAS SHIFTED EAST THIS MORNING. LATEST SATELLITE IMAGES 
SHOW HIGH CLOUDS DRIFTING ACROSS THE SOUTHERN SECTIONS OF THE 
COUNTRY WHILE LOW TO MID CLOUDS ARE LOCATED NORTHWEST OF THE AREA 
ACROSS MISSOURI AND KANSAS. THE HIGH CLOUDS ARE ASSOCIATED WITH A 
DEVELOPING LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM ALONG THE GULF COAST WHILE THE LOW 
AND MID CLOUDS ARE ASSOCIATED WITH AN UPPER LEVEL LOW. EXPECT THE 
MIDSOUTH TO STAY BETWEEN THE TWO AREAS OF CLOUDS TODAY. THIS SHOULD 
ALLOW FOR MOSTLY SUNNY TO PARTLY CLOUDY SKIES ACROSS THE CWA.

BY TONIGHT...CLOUDS FROM THESE TWO SYSTEMS WILL BEGIN TO FILTER INTO 
THE AREA. THE POTENTIAL FOR WINTER WEATHER FROM THESE TWO SYSTEMS IS 
BECOMING LESS CERTAIN WITH EACH MODEL RUN. THE LATEST RUN IS MUCH 
WARMER THAN THE PREVIOUS NIGHT. THE MODELS ARE PRETTY CONSISTENT 
WITH POSITION OF THE UPPER LOW TO TRACK ACROSS SOUTHERN 
NEBRASKA/NORTHERN KANSAS INTO NORTHERN MISSOURI WHILE THE SFC LOW 
STAYS SOUTH OF THE GULF COAST. THE LOCATIONS OF THE TWO SYSTEMS IS 
NOT IDEAL FOR ANY MAJOR WINTER WEATHER ACCUMULATION THUS ANY THAT 
OCCURS SHOULD ONLY WARRANT AN ADVISORY IF THAT. NO ADVISORY WILL BE 
ISSUED AT THIS TIME AS IT IS STILL TOO EARLY TO KNOW WHAT WILL 
HAPPEN. WITH THAT IN MIND CURRENT THINKING IS TO EXPECT EXTREME 
NORTHEAST ARKANSAS(POCAHONTAS...WALNUT RIDGE AREA) TO RECEIVE MAINLY 
JUST SNOW. AMOUNTS MAY RANGE FROM 1 TO 3 INCHES. SOUTH OF THIS AREA 
FROM JONESBORO TO UNION CITY TO SEE A MIX OF FREEZING 
RAIN...SLEET...AND SNOW. AMOUNTS WILL BE AROUND AN INCH. FURTHER 
SOUTH...FROM EAST CENTRAL ARKANSAS TO PARIS TN INCLUDING THE MEMPHIS 
METRO AREA...EXPECT A MIX OF RAIN...FREEZING RAIN AND SLEET WITH 
AMOUNTS LESS THAN AN INCH. FURTHER SOUTH ACROSS THE REST OF NORTH 
MISSISSIPPI TO NEAR SAVANNAH TN...EXPECT ALL RAIN. CAN NOT STRESS 
ENOUGH THAT THERE IS STILL A LOT OF UNCERTAINTY WITH THE FORECAST 
AND IF MODEL RUNS CONTINUE TO SHOW WARMER CONDITIONS...MEMPHIS METRO 
COULD EASILY SEE ONLY RAIN. PLEASE STAY TUNED. EXPECT MOST OF THE 
PRECIP TO START OUT THURSDAY MORNING AND WILL END BY THURSDAY 
AFTERNOON INTO EARLY THURSDAY EVENING.

HIGH PRESSURE WILL BUILD INTO THE MIDSOUTH BEHIND THE SYSTEMS FOR 
FRIDAY AND SATURDAY. TEMPERATURES WILL MAINLY BE IN THE 40S AND 50S FOR 
HIGHS AND 20S FOR LOWS.

A DRY COLD FRONT WILL SWING THROUGH THE AREA SATURDAY NIGHT FOLLOWED 
BY AN UPPER TROUGH ON SUNDAY. A FEW LOCATIONS ACROSS NORTHWEST 
TENNESSEE MAY SEE A FEW FLURRIES WITH THE TROUGH.

HIGH PRESSURE WILL REBUILD BEHIND THE FRONT FOR SUNDAY NIGHT INTO 
MONDAY. TEMPERATURES SHOULD REBOUND INTO THE 50S FOR HIGHS BY MONDAY 
WITH LOWS IN THE 20S AND 30S.

ANOTHER LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM MAY DEVELOP ALONG THE GULF COAST TOWARD 
THE END OF THE FORECAST PERIOD BUT MODELS ARE NOT PUTTING OUT A LOT 
OF PRECIP WITH THE SYSTEM. 

$$

&&

MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.

&&

$$

SJM/KRM

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
245 AM CST WED DEC 7 2005

.DISCUSSION...  

HIGH PRESSURE HAS SHIFTED EAST THIS MORNING. LATEST SATELLITE IMAGES 
SHOW HIGH CLOUDS DRIFTING ACROSS THE SOUTHERN SECTIONS OF THE 
COUNTRY WHILE LOW TO MID CLOUDS ARE LOCATED NORTHWEST OF THE AREA 
ACROSS MISSOURI AND KANSAS. THE HIGH CLOUDS ARE ASSOCIATED WITH A 
DEVELOPING LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM ALONG THE GULF COAST WHILE THE LOW 
AND MID CLOUDS ARE ASSOCIATED WITH AN UPPER LEVEL LOW. EXPECT THE 
MIDSOUTH TO STAY BETWEEN THE TWO AREAS OF CLOUDS TODAY. THIS SHOULD 
ALLOW FOR MOSTLY SUNNY TO PARTLY CLOUDY SKIES ACROSS THE CWA.

BY TONIGHT...CLOUDS FROM THESE TWO SYSTEMS WILL BEGIN TO FILTER INTO 
THE AREA. THE POTENTIAL FOR WINTER WEATHER FROM THESE TWO SYSTEMS IS 
BECOMING LESS CERTAIN WITH EACH MODEL RUN. THE LATEST RUN IS MUCH 
WARMER THAN THE PREVIOUS NIGHT. THE MODELS ARE PRETTY CONSISTENT 
WITH POSITION OF THE UPPER LOW TO TRACK ACROSS SOUTHERN 
NEBRASKA/NORTHERN KANSAS INTO NORTHERN MISSOURI WHILE THE SFC LOW 
STAYS SOUTH OF THE GULF COAST. THE LOCATIONS OF THE TWO SYSTEMS IS 
NOT IDEAL FOR ANY MAJOR WINTER WEATHER ACCUMULATION THUS ANY THAT 
OCCURS SHOULD ONLY WARRANT AN ADVISORY IF THAT. NO ADVISORY WILL BE 
ISSUED AT THIS TIME AS IT IS STILL TOO EARLY TO KNOW WHAT WILL 
HAPPEN. WITH THAT IN MIND CURRENT THINKING IS TO EXPECT EXTREME 
NORTHEAST ARKANSAS(POCAHONTAS...WALNUT RIDGE AREA) TO RECEIVE MAINLY 
JUST SNOW. AMOUNTS MAY RANGE FROM 1 TO 3 INCHES. SOUTH OF THIS AREA 
FROM JONESBORO TO UNION CITY TO SEE A MIX OF FREEZING 
RAIN...SLEET...AND SNOW. AMOUNTS WILL BE AROUND AN INCH. FURTHER 
SOUTH...FROM EAST CENTRAL ARKANSAS TO PARIS TN INCLUDING THE MEMPHIS 
METRO AREA...EXPECT A MIX OF RAIN...FREEZING RAIN AND SLEET WITH 
AMOUNTS LESS THAN AN INCH. FURTHER SOUTH ACROSS THE REST OF NORTH 
MISSISSIPPI TO NEAR SAVANNAH TN...EXPECT ALL RAIN. CAN NOT STRESS 
ENOUGH THAT THERE IS STILL A LOT OF UNCERTAINTY WITH THE FORECAST 
AND IF MODEL RUNS CONTINUE TO SHOW WARMER CONDITIONS...MEMPHIS METRO 
COULD EASILY SEE ONLY RAIN. PLEASE STAY TUNED. EXPECT MOST OF THE 
PRECIP TO START OUT THURSDAY MORNING AND WILL END BY THURSDAY 
AFTERNOON INTO EARLY THURSDAY EVENING.

HIGH PRESSURE WILL BUILD INTO THE MIDSOUTH BEHIND THE SYSTEMS FOR 
FRIDAY AND SATURDAY. TEMPERATURES WILL MAINLY BE IN THE 40S AND 50S FOR 
HIGHS AND 20S FOR LOWS.

A DRY COLD FRONT WILL SWING THROUGH THE AREA SATURDAY NIGHT FOLLOWED 
BY AN UPPER TROUGH ON SUNDAY. A FEW LOCATIONS ACROSS NORTHWEST 
TENNESSEE MAY SEE A FEW FLURRIES WITH THE TROUGH.

HIGH PRESSURE WILL REBUILD BEHIND THE FRONT FOR SUNDAY NIGHT INTO 
MONDAY. TEMPERATURES SHOULD REBOUND INTO THE 50S FOR HIGHS BY MONDAY 
WITH LOWS IN THE 20S AND 30S.

ANOTHER LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM MAY DEVELOP ALONG THE GULF COAST TOWARD 
THE END OF THE FORECAST PERIOD BUT MODELS ARE NOT PUTTING OUT A LOT 
OF PRECIP WITH THE SYSTEM. 

$$


&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.

&&

$$


KRM

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 070208
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
808 PM CST TUE DEC 6 2005

.UPDATE...

SATELLITE SHOWS SOME CIRRUS ACROSS THE MIDSOUTH...OTHERWISE SKIES
ARE MOSTLY CLEAR. 00Z KLZK SOUNDING IS VERY DRY WITH A PRECIPITABLE
WATER OF ONLY 0.19 INCH. COLD SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE CONTINUES TO
BUILD INTO THE AREA FROM THE NORTH. CURRENT FORECAST IS FINE AND
NO UPDATES ARE NEEDED ATTM.

&&

.PREV DISCUSSION... (ISSUED 255 PM CST TUE DEC 6 2005) 

SYNOPSIS...  
COLD FRONT IS MOVING THROUGH THE NORTHERN PORTION OF THE MIDSOUTH 
THIS AFTERNOON BEHIND A WEAK UPPER LEVEL CIRCULATION IN IL.  NO 
CLOUDS ACCOMPANY THE FRONT AS IT MOVES INTO OUR AREA.  TEMPS RATHER 
COOL...SOME 10 DEGREES BELOW AVERAGE UNDER FULL SUN.

SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)
INTERESTING FORECAST.  POLAR AIRMASS REMAINS THROUGH THE SHORT TERM. 
CHALLENGE WILL BE PRECIPITATION TYPE AND AMOUNT WITH DEVELOPING 
STORM SYSTEM AND STRONG SHORTWAVE MOVING OUT OF THE CENTRAL 
ROCKYS.  FOCUSING ON TWO ASPECTS OF THE SYSTEM.  THE 500 MB 
CIRCULATION WHICH REMAINS NORTH OF THE REGION AND THE ISENTROPIC 
CONTRIBUTION WHICH IS MOST LIKELY TO CONTRIBUTE TO MIXED 
PRECIPITATION LATE WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND THURSDAY.

MODELS IN GOOD AGREEMENT ON TRACK OF 500 MB CIRCULATION WHICH 
SUGGESTS THAT ANY SIGNIFICANT SNOWFALL SHOULD BE WELL NORTH OF THE 
MIDSOUTH...HOWEVER DUE TO GOOD LOW LEVEL COLD AIR COMING OUT OF 1040 
MB HIGH CENTERED OVER THE HIGH PLAINS DECENT ISENTROPIC LIFT WILL 
CAUSE MIXED PRECIPITATION TO OCCUR ACROSS AT LEAST THE NORTH THIRD 
OF THE FORECAST AREA...MAINLY ON THURSDAY.  

DEEPEST COLD AIR FROM WALNUT RIDGE TO PARIS WHICH IS WHERE LIGHT 
ACCUMULATIONS OF SNOW AND ICE MAY OCCUR...OTHERWISE MIX 
PRECIPITATION...MAINLY RAIN...FREEZING DRIZZLE/RAIN AND SLEET MAY 
GENERALLY OCCUR NORTH OF A FORREST CITY TO MEMPHIS TO SAVANNAH LINE. 
TO THE SOUTH ALL RAIN.  LATE THURSDAY AFTERNOON AND THURSDAY EVENING 
MODEL SOUNDINGS SUGGEST SOME CHANGEOVER TO FLURRIES OR SNOW SHOWERS 
AT ALL AREAS...ALTHOUGH MAINLY EASTERN FORECAST AREA WITH NO 
ACCUMULATION.    
   

LONG TERM...(FRIDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)
DIFFERENCES WITH ECMWF AND GFS ARE GETTING MORE RESOLVED.  ECMWF WAS 
FASTER AND DEEPER WITH DEVELOPING TROF ACROSS THE CENTRAL US BY DAY 
5.  GFS HAS FLOW SPLIT THRU MUCH OF THE FORECAST PERIOD BEFORE 
PHASING A TROF OVER THE CENTRAL US BY DAY 6/7.  LATEST 12Z ECMWF RUN 
IS CLOSER TO THE GFS RUN.  HAVE USED A BLEND OF THE GFS/ECMWF. 
OVERALL TEMPS ARE EXPECTED TO BE BELOW AVERAGE.  ANY SIGNIFICANT 
PRECIPITATION EVENTS ARE NOT EXPECTED AT THIS TIME.

$$


&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.

&&

$$

JCL/BELLES


000 
FXUS64 KMEG 060919
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
320 AM CST TUE DEC 6 2005

.DISCUSSION...  

...POSSIBLE WINTER WEATHER TO AFFECT THE MIDSOUTH LATE WEDNESDAY NIGHT 
   INTO EARLY THURSDAY EVENING...

HIGH PRESSURE WILL CONTINUE TO DOMINATE THE WEATHER ACROSS THE 
MIDSOUTH IN THE SHORT TERM. EXPECT MOSTLY SUNNY SKIES TODAY WITH 
TEMPERATURES REMAINING ON THE COOL SIDE WITH HIGHS IN THE 40S. 
TEMPERATURES WILL REMAIN COLD TONIGHT WITH LOWS IN THE UPPER TEENS 
INTO THE 20S WITH MOSTLY CLEAR SKIES. 

THE HIGH WILL SHIFT EAST TONIGHT ALLOWING FOR A SFC LOW PRESSURE 
SYSTEM TO DEVELOP ALONG THE GULF COAST ON WEDNESDAY.  IN 
ADDITION...AN UPPER LEVEL LOW WILL MOVE OUT OF THE ROCKIES INTO THE 
CENTRAL PLAINS.  CLOUDS FROM THESE TWO SYSTEMS WILL BEGIN TO MOVE 
INTO THE MIDSOUTH ON WEDNESDAY. THIS WILL HELP KEEP TEMPERATURES IN 
THE UPPER 30S INTO THE MID 40S FOR HIGHS ON WEDNESDAY. MODELS ARE IN 
PRETTY GOOD AGREEMENT THAT PRECIP WILL HOLD OFF UNTIL AROUND 
MIDNIGHT WEDNESDAY NIGHT. WITH COLD TEMPERATURES IN PLACE...MAJORITY 
OF PRECIP THAT FALLS WILL BE WINTER WEATHER TYPE. THE FORECASTING 
PROBLEMS COME WITH THE STRENGTH OF THE SFC LOW ALONG THE GULF COAST. 
THIS LEAVES MAJOR UNCERTAINTY WITH PRECIP AMOUNTS. THE NAM IS MUCH 
STRONGER WITH THE LOW THUS IS PRODUCING HIGHER PRECIP AMOUNTS THAN 
THE GFS. WILL LEAN TOWARD THE GFS SINCE POSITION OF SFC LOW IS 
PRETTY FAR SOUTH AND UPPER LOW WILL REMAIN NORTH OF THE AREA. THIS 
WILL LEAVE THE AREA WITH PRECIPITATION AMOUNTS ON THE LIGHT SIDE. 
EXPECT RAIN/SNOW LINE TO BE SOUTH OF MEMPHIS...ROUGHLY AROUND WEST 
HELENA...OXFORD...TO SAVANNAH LINE. AROUND THIS LINE WILL SEE A 
MIXTURE OF PRECIP BEFORE CHANGING TO ALL SNOW. FOR THE MEMPHIS 
METRO...EXPECT PRECIP TO MAYBE TO INITIALLY START OUT AS SLEET 
QUICKLY SWITCHING TO SNOW. FURTHER NORTH WILL SEE ALL SNOW. TUPELO 
AREA WILL SEE ALL RAIN. FOR AMOUNTS EXPECT(STILL A LOT OF 
UNCERTAINTY)...MEMPHIS METRO NORTHWARD TO SEE A TOTAL OF 1-3 INCHES 
WHEN ITS ALL SAID AND DONE. FOR LOCATIONS NEAR THE RAIN/SNOW LINE 
WILL SEE AN INCH OR LESS ON THE GROUND. EXPECT PRECIP TO COME TO AN 
END BY 00Z THURSDAY EVENING FOR WESTERN SECTIONS OF THE MIDSOUTH AND 
AROUND 06Z FOR EASTERN SECTIONS.

HIGH PRESSURE WILL REBUILD INTO THE MIDSOUTH BEHIND THE LOW PRESSURE 
SYSTEM FOR THE WEEKEND. A GRADUAL WARMING TREND WILL OCCUR BY THE 
LATTER PART OF THE WEEKEND. EXPECT HIGHS BACK INTO THE 50S BY 
SUNDAY. 

ANOTHER LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM ALONG THE GULF COAST WILL APPROACH THE 
MIDSOUTH ON MONDAY. EXPECT AN INCREASE IN CLOUD COVER BUT RAIN WILL 
HOLD OFF UNTIL AFTER THE END OF THE FORECAST PERIOD.

$$


&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 060222
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
822 PM CST MON DEC 5 2005

.UPDATE...

SATELLITE SHOWS CLEAR SKIES ACROSS THE MID-SOUTH THIS EVENING.
BASED ON MODEL RELATIVE HUMIDITY FORECASTS...THINK SKIES WILL
REMAIN CLEAR TONIGHT. UPPER LEVEL TROUGH WILL SWING TO OUR
NORTH WITH THE ASSOCIATED CLOUDS REMAINING TO OUR NORTH.
SURFACE WINDS WILL GRADUALLY TURN TO THE SOUTH LATER TONIGHT AS A
SURFACE LOW MOVES INTO MO. HOWEVER...THE WINDS WILL NOT TURN TO
THE SOUTH QUICK ENOUGH TO KEEP LOW TEMPERATURES FROM DROPPING
A LITTLE LOWER THAN FORECAST. AS A RESULT...WILL UPDATE TO LOWER
FORECAST MINIMUMS A FEW DEGREES.

&&

.PREV DISCUSSION... (ISSUED 338 PM CST MON DEC 5 2005) 

DISCUSSION...
..POSSIBLE WINTER STORM TO AFFECT THE MIDSOUTH LATE WEDNESDAY NIGHT 
   INTO THURSDAY...

THE MAJOR PROBLEMS FOR THE MIDSOUTH AND THIS FORECAST PERIOD WILL BE 
THE WINTER STORM THAT WILL LIKELY IMPACT THE REGION WEDNESDAY NIGHT 
AND THURSDAY.

THIS STORM SYSTEM WILL BEGIN AS A SHORTWAVE TROUGH DIGGING INTO THE 
NORTHERN ROCKIES TUESDAY MORNING. THE WEATHER OVER THE MIDSOUTH WILL 
REMAIN COOLER THAN NORMAL AND CHANCES FOR PRECIPITATION WILL REMAIN 
LOW UNTIL WEDNESDAY NIGHT.

THE SHORTWAVE TROUGH DEEPENS INTO SOUTHEASTERN COLORADO BY WEDNESDAY 
AFTERNOON. THE COLD AIR THAT MOVED INTO THE MIDSOUTH SUNDAY...WILL 
BE REINFORCED TOMORROW. THIS MAKES THINGS INTERESTING WHEN THE STORM 
SYSTEM MOVES CLOSER TO THE MIDSOUTH. FORECAST SOUNDINGS FROM BOTH 
THE GFS AND NAM SUPPORT SNOW FOR AT LEAST THE NORTHERN THIRD OF THE 
FORECAST AREA BEGINNING LATE WEDNESDAY NIGHT. A MIXTURE OF SLEET...
FREEZING RAIN...SNOW AND RAIN WILL BE POSSIBLE ACROSS PARTS OF WEST 
TENNESSEE AND PARTS OF NORTHERN MISSISSIPPI. 

VERY STRONG ISENTROPIC LIFT WILL OCCUR OVER MOST OF THE AREA...AHEAD 
OF THE UPPER LOW. PW VALUES INCREASE TO THREE QUARTERS OF INCH FOR 
SEVERAL AREAS ACROSS THE MIDSOUTH. 

IT APPEARS THAT BY THURSDAY MORNING...A WINTRY MIX WILL CONTINUE TO 
POSE POSSIBLE PROBLEMS FOR AREAS ALONG AND SOUTH OF A LINE FROM WEST 
HELENA TO SOMERVILLE TO SAVANNAH. A CHANGE OVER TO ALL RAIN SHOULD 
OCCUR IN THE EARLY MORNING HOURS IN THE TUPELO AND SOUTH AREAS. BY 
THURSDAY AFTERNOON THE ISENTROPIC LIFT DECREASES RAPIDLY AND WOULD 
EXPECT PRECIP TO BE ON THE DECREASE.

THE FORECAST FOR THIS TIME FRAME WILL BECOME MORE DEFINITE TOMORROW 
AND OF COURSE...WEDNESDAY. LATEST THINKING COULD BRING UP TO 6 
INCHES OF SNOW ACROSS NE AR...MO BOOTHEEL AND EXTREME NORTHWEST TN. 
THE WORST CASE SCENARIO FOR THE MEMPHIS METRO AREA WILL BE 3 
INCHES...HOWEVER SOME SNOW MAY CHANGE OVER TO FREEZING RAIN/SLEET 
BEFORE IT ALL ENDS THURSDAY AFTERNOON. 

AFTER THIS SYSTEM PASSES AND THE PRECIP ENDS...TEMPERATURES WILL 
GRADUALLY WARM INTO THE UPPER 40S BY SATURDAY. OVERNIGHT LOWS WILL 
BE TRICKY DEPENDING ON POSSIBLE SNOW COVER/DEPTH.

$$


&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.
&&

$$

JCL/AC
