000 
FXUS64 KMEG 051056
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
415 A CST MON DEC 5 2005

.DISCUSSION...

RAIN HAS FINALLY MOVED OUT OF THE MIDSOUTH WITH RESPECT TO THE
LAST FRONT. CLOUDS SHOULD GRADUALLY CLEAR OUT FROM THE WEST
DURING THE DAY. WINDS WILL BE NORTHERLY AND GUSTY TDA DUE TO A
HIGH IN KS.

CONTINUED DRY COLD WEATHER IS SCHEDULED TONIGHT THROUGH WED AS
ARCTIC AIR KEEPS ON COMING DOWN INTO THE AREA.

AFTER THAT...MODELS INDICATE AN UPPER CUT OFF LOW WILL BE IN THE
CENTRAL PLAINS THAT WILL MOVE EAST TO OHIO BY THURSDAY EVENING.
THIS TROUGH WILL GENERATE KIND OF AN INVERTED TROUGH AT THE
SURFACE. NET RESULT IS THAT WINTER COULD ARRIVE IN EARNEST.
FROZEN PCPN IS LIKELY. THE NORTHERN COUNTIES COULD GET SNOW WHILE
THE SOUTHERN THIRD OF THE MIDSOUTH GETS A MIX OF RAIN/FREEZING
RAIN/SLEET/SNOW.

FRIDAY THROUGH SUNDAY AFTERNOON...NORTHWESTERLY UPPER FLOW SHOULD
DOMINATE. THIS WILL PRODUCE DRY WEATHER WITH COLD DAYS AND COLD
NIGHTS.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
845 PM CST SUN DEC 4 2005

.DISCUSSION...

AREA OF LIGHT RAIN HAS THINNED OUT CONSIDERABLY SINCE THIS AFTERNOON
AMD IS NOW CONFINED TO SOUTHEAST SECTION OF THE FORECAST AREA. HAVE
TRIMMED BACKED POPS FOR TONIGHT. TEMPERATURES OVER THE AREA WHERE
THE RAIN IS FALLING REMAIN ABOVE FREEZING AND SHOULD STAY THAT WAY
OVERNIGHT SO HAVE REMOVED ANY MENTION OF A MIX. IN ADDITION...ONCE
THIS RAIN MOVES OUT OF THE REGION OVERNIGHT...THERE SHOULD BE NO
ADDITIONAL PRECIPITATION SO HAVE REMOVED ANY MENTION OF
PRECIPITATION FOR MONDAY MORNING.



000 
FXUS64 KMEG 042141
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
341 PM CST SUN DEC 4 2005

.DISCUSSION...

A MUCH COLDER AIRMASS HAS FILTERED INTO THE MID-SOUTH TODAY BEHIND
A COLD FRONT THAT MOVED ACROSS THE AREA LAST NIGHT AND IS NOW
POSITIONED ACROSS SOUTH-CENTRAL MISSISSIPPI. THE MID AND UPPER
LEVEL FLOW HAS REMAINED SOUTHWESTERLY AND THIS HAS CAUSED THE
FRONTAL BOUNDARY TO STALL AND ALSO ALLOWED LOW LEVEL MOISTURE
ORIGINATING ALONG THE GULF COAST TO BE ISENTROPICALLY LIFTED UP
AND OVER THE BOUNDARY ACROSS SOUTHERN PORTIONS OF OUR AREA. THIS
HAS ALLOWED CONTINUED AND PERSISTANT DEVELOPMENT OF SHOWERS AND
THUNDERSTORMS THROUGH THE AFTERNOON ACROSS MAINLY NORTH
MISSISSIPPI. THUNDERSTORMS THAT HAVE DEVELOPED HAVE REMAINED
ELEVATED AND WITH COLD MID LEVEL TEMPERATURES COMBINED WITH DECENT
ELEVATED INSTABILITY...SEVERAL OF THESE STORMS HAVE PRODUCED SMALL
HAIL. THIS SHOULD CONTINUE INTO THE EVENING HOURS.

A SHORTWAVE TROUGH DIGGING SOUTHEAST ACROSS THE PLAINS STATES THIS
AFTERNOON WILL HELP TO INDUCE A WEAK SURFACE LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM
ALONG THE FRONT ACROSS SOUTHEAST MISSISSIPPI LATE THIS
AFTERNOON...WHICH WILL MOVE NORTHEAST OVERNIGHT. THIS IN
COMBINATION WITH CONTINUED ISENTROPIC LIFT OVER THE FRONT AND WEAK
LARGE SCALE LIFT ASSOCIATED WITH THE RIGHT ENTRANCE REGION OF A STRONG
140+ KT UPPER LEVEL JET STREAK...SHOULD KEEP PRECIPITATION GOING
ACROSS SOUTHERN PORTIONS OF THE AREA TONIGHT. AT THE SAME
TIME...COLD AIR WILL CONTINUE TO FILTER SOUTHWARD TOWARDS THE
DEVELOPING LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM. AS THIS OCCURS...ENOUGH COLD AIR
MAY FILTER INTO PORTIONS OF WEST TENNESSEE (MAINLY FROM JACKSON
TENNESSEE AND POINTS SOUTH AND EAST) AND FAR NORTHEAST MISSISSIPPI
(NORTH AND EAST OF TUPELO MISSISSIPPI) BEFORE THE PRECIPITATION
ENDS TO ALLOW FOR A PERIOD OF RAIN MIXED WITH SNOW OR ALL SNOW.
THIS HAS BEEN SUPPORTED BY 12Z/18Z NAM FORECAST SOUNDINGS ACROSS
THESE AREAS. THE GOOD NEWS IS THAT THE PRECIPITATION SHOULD BE
LIGHT AND ONLY EXPECTING A BRIEF PERIOD OF FROZEN PRECIPITATION AT
BEST. IN ADDITION...TEMPERATURES SHOULD BE HOVERING AT OR JUST
ABOVE FREEZING AND WITH WARM GROUND TEMPERATURES...NOT EXPECTING
MUCH IN THE WAY OF ACCUMULATION AT THIS TIME. BUT STILL A TASTE OF
WINTER IS POSSIBLE AFTER MIDNIGHT TONIGHT FOR PORTIONS OF THE MID-SOUTH.

THE STORM SYSTEM SHOULD LIFT NORTHEAST OUT OF THE AREA ON MONDAY
MORNING...BRINGING AN END TO ANY LEFT OVER PRECIPITATION. THEN
HIGH PRESSURE WILL BUILD IN WITH DRY AND UNSEASONABLY COLD
TEMPERATURES. DRY AND BELOW NORMAL TEMPERATURES WILL CONTINUE
THROUGH TUESDAY...WITH SOME SLIGHT MODERATION IN TEMPERATURES...YET
STILL BELOW NORMAL AS SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE SLIDES EAST. IN THE
UPPER LEVELS...A LARGE LONGWAVE TROUGH WILL COVER THE EASTERN
UNITED STATES. BY TUESDAY NIGHT...ANOTHER SHORTWAVE DISTURBANCE IS
FORECAST TO DIVE SOUTHEAST INTO THE BASE OF THE LONGWAVE TROUGH
AND HELP PUSH AN ARCTIC COLD FRONT ACROSS THE AREA. FOLLOWING THIS
FRONT...MUCH COLDER AIR...WELL BELOW NORMAL...SHOULD FILTER INTO
THE REGION. THE UPPER DISTURBANCE SHOULD HANG BACK BEHIND THE
FRONT ON WEDNESDAY BEFORE APPROACHING THE AREA WEDNESDAY NIGHT.
THERE MAY BE A CHANCE FOR A FEW FLURRIES ON WEDNESDAY AS THE UPPER
DISTURBANCE ATTEMPTS TO SQUEEZE OUT ANY AVAILABLE MOISTURE. 

THEN THE FORECAST BECOMES TRICKY AS THE FORECAST MODELS CONTINUE
TO DIVERGE CONCERNING THE HANDLING OF THE UPPER SHORTWAVE TROUGH.
THE LATEST 12/18Z RUNS OF THE NAM AND THE 04/12Z RUN OF THE ECMWF
AMPLIFY THE WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON SHORTWAVE TROUGH MORE SHARPLY...ALLOWING
FOR AN INVERTED SURFACE TROUGH AND OVERRUNNING MOISTURE TO BE
PULLED BACK OVER THE COLD AIRMASS AND INTRODUCING THE POSSIBILITY
FOR A WINTER WEATHER SITUATION WEDNESDAY NIGHT INTO THURSDAY OVER
OUR AREA. THE 12Z GFS IS LESS AMPLIFIED WITH THE SHORTWAVE AND
MORE PROGRESSIVE...ALLOWING THE SHORTWAVE TO BE QUICKLY SHUNTED
EAST AND CLOSING THE GULF...THEREFORE LEAVING THE AREA COLD AND
DRY. SO WITH SO MUCH UNCERTAINTY AND CONTINUITY WITH THE FORECAST
MODELS AT THIS RANGE...FELT IT BEST TO KEEP A DRY FORECAST GOING
UNTIL THE MODELS COME INTO BETTER AGREEMENT. ALSO WANT TO AVOID
FLIP FLOPPING THE FORECAST. NEEDLESS TO SAY INTERESTING THINGS TO
WATCH FOR THE END OF THE WEEK. AFTER THIS SYSTEM DEPARTS...EXPECT
DRY AND SLIGHTLY WARMER WEATHER FOR THE FIRST PART OF NEXT WEEKEND.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

JBR  27  38  24  44 /  10  10  10  10

WILL HAVE A TOUGH TIME RISING MUCH TODAY AS LOW LEVEL COLD AIR
ADVECTION CONTINUES OVER THE AREA. ALSO...LOOKING AT WET
CONDITIONS CONTINUING OVER PRIMARILY NORTH MISSISSIPPI TODAY AS
MOISTURE CONTINUES TO BE ADVECTED AND LIFTED UP AND OVER THE
SLOWING FRONTAL BOUNDARY TO OUR SOUTH. DECENT ISENTROPIC UPGLIDE
WAS NOTED ON THE 295K THETA SURFACE WITH LOW CONDENSATION PRESSURE
DEFICITS. THIS IS ALSO REFLECTED IN THE LATEST RADAR REFLECTIVITY
SHOWING GOOD COVERAGE OF SHOWERS AND ISOLATED THUNDERSTORMS
STRETCHED ACROSS THE SOUTHERN HALF OF OUR AREA. GOOD ISENTROPIC
LIFT WILL CONTINUE OVER THESE AREAS...IN ADDITION TO SOME LARGE
SCALE ASCENT IN ASSOCIATION WITH THE RIGHT ENTRANCE REGION OF A
STRENTHENING MID AND UPPER LEVEL JET STREAK CUTTING ACROSS THE
TENNESSEE VALLEY (125/115 KT AT 200/250 MB NOTED FROM THE SGF/LZK
12Z SOUNDINGS). SO WITH ALL THIS IN MIND HAVE BUMPED UP POPS
ACROSS SOUTHERN AREAS WITH EXPECTED CONTINUED HIGH CHANCES FOR
SHOWERS AND ISOLATED THUNDERSTORMS CONTINUING. FURTHER
NORTH...EXPECT CONTINUED DRY CONDITIONS BUT COLD TEMPERATURES
TODAY.

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 032156
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
356 PM CST SAT DEC 3 2005

.DISCUSSION...

A RATHER COMPLEX FORECAST FOR TONIGHT AS A LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM
CENTERED OVER NORTHWEST ARKANSAS CONINUES TO MOVE NORTHEAST. A
WARM FRONT THAT EXTENDS EAST FROM THIS LOW PRESSURE CENTER
STRETCHES FROM JUST NORTH OF MEMPHIS TO JUST NORTH OF TUPELO AS OF
21Z. TO THE SOUTH OF THIS FRONT...UNSEASONABLY WARM AND HUMID
WEATHER EXISTS...WITH TEMPERATURES CLIMBING INTO THE 70S AND
DEWPOINTS SURGING INTO THE LOW 60S. SKIES ALSO CONTINUE TO CLEAR
BEHIND THE WARM FRONT. FURTHER TO THE NORTH OF THE WARM
FRONT...LOW CLOUDS ARE HANGING ON AND TEMPERATURES REMAIN IN THE
50S WITH EVEN LOWER DEWPOINTS. THE WARM FRONT SHOULD CONTINUE TO
ADVANCE NORTHWARD BEFORE BEGINNING TO STALL ACROSS NORTHERN
PORTIONS OF THE FORECAST AREA. THIS WILL PLACE THE SOUTHERN TWO-
THIRDS OF THE MID-SOUTH INTO THE WARM SECTOR. 

ALTHOUGH THE ATMOSPHERE IS BECOMING INCREASINGLY UNSTABLE IN THE
LOWER LEVELS ACROSS THE WARM SECTOR THIS AFTERNOON...IT ALSO REMAINS
CAPPED THIS AFTERNOON WITH NO UPPER LEVEL FORCING TO LIFT THE
UNSTABLE ATMOSPHERE THROUGH THE CAP AT THIS TIME. THIS WILL CREATE
SOME PROBLEMS WITH DEVELOPING SURFACE BASED INSTABILITY ACROSS THE
WARM SECTOR. ATMOSPHERIC PARAMETERS ACROSS THE WARM SECTOR WILL
CONTINUE TO BECOME INCREASINGLY FAVORABLE FOR SEVERE WEATHER LATER
THIS EVENING...WITH MLCAPES AND SUFFICIENT DEEP LAYER SHEAR TO
SUPPORT SUPERCELL STRUCTURES. THE PROBLEM WILL BE THAT THE MID-
LEVEL FORCING HANGS BACK BEHIND THE FRONTAL BOUNDARY AND WILL NOT
BECOME FAVORABLE FOR LIFT UNTIL LATER TONIGHT TO THE NORTH OF THE FRONT.
AS THE LOW PRESSURE LIFTS NORTHEAST IT SHOULD DRAG THE COLD FRONT
ACROSS THE MID-SOUTH LATER THIS EVENING. AS THE FRONT MOVES ACROSS
THE AREA AND THE FAVORABLE ENTRANCE REGION OF A 70+ KNOT MID LEVEL
JET TRAILS JUST BEHIND THE FRONT...THUNDERSTORMS WILL BEGIN TO
DEVELOP. AT THIS POINT IT APPEARS THAT DEVELOPMENT AHEAD OF THE
FRONT MAY REMAIN LIMITED...WITH THUNDERSTORMS DEVELOPING JUST BEHIND
THE FRONT AND REMAINING ELEVATED. SHEAR AND INSTABILITY ABOVE THE
INCREASINGLY STABLE BOUNDARY LAYER WILL STILL SUPPORT ROTATING
SUPERCELL THUNDERSTORMS WITH A PRIMARILY LARGE HAIL THREAT. THERE IS
STILL SOME SMALL POTENTIAL FOR THUNDERSTORMS TO DEVELOP
IMMEDIATELY ALONG THE FRONT LATER TONIGHT ACROSS PORTIONS OF
NORTHEAST MISSISSIPPI. IF THIS WERE TO OCCUR...THEN ANY SURFACED
BASED STORMS WILL HAVE THE POTENTIAL TO PRODUCE LARGE
HAIL...DAMAGING WINDS...AND AN ISOLATED TORNADO. ALTHOUGH AGAIN
THE THREAT FOR SURFACE BASED CONVECTION LOOKS LESS LIKELY AT THIS
POINT.

ONCE THE INITIAL LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM MOVES EAST OF THE AREA...THE
TRAILING COLD FRONT SHOULD DROP SOUTH INTO NORTH CENTRAL
MISSISSIPPI AND STALL AS A MORE POTENT SHORTWAVE DROPS SOUTHEAST
ACROSS THE PLAINS STATES AND INDUCES THE DEVELOPMENT OF ANOTHER
LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM ALONG THE FRONT TO OUR SOUTH. THIS SECONDARY
LOW PRESSURE DEVELOPMENT WILL HELP TO REDEVELOP PRECIPITATION
ACROSS NORTHERN MISSISSIPPI...WITH DECREASING CHANCES FURTHER
NORTHWARD INTO SOUTHERN TENNESSEE SUNDAY AND SUNDAY NIGHT. FURTHER
NORTH ACROSS NORTHERN AREAS...ONLY CLOUD COVER IS EXPECTED.
TEMPERATURES WILL GET CLOSE TO CRITICAL LEVELS FOR FROZEN
PRECIPITATION NEAR THE TENNESSEE/MISSISSIPPI BORDER. BUT THINK
PRECIP SHOULD SHUT OFF BEFORE TEMPERATURES GET COLD ENOUGH TO
SUPPORT SNOW. BUT THIS WILL NEED TO BE WATCHED.

THIS SECONDARY LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM WILL MOVE EAST AND HIGH
PRESSURE WILL BUILD IN. EXPECT DRY AND COOL WEATHER THROUGH
TUESDAY. BY WEDNESDAY...MEDIUM RANGE MODELS ARE INDICATING ANOTHER
FRONTAL PASSAGE WITH ARCTIC HIGH PRESSURE BUILDING IN. MUCH COLDER
AIR WILL FILTER SOUTH FOR THE END OF THE WEEK...WITH TEMPERATURES
MUCH BELOW NORMAL. THE MODELS CONTINUING TO FLIP FLOP BETWEEN DRY
AND POSSIBLE WINTER WEATHER CONDITIONS. AT THIS POINT...WILL LEAVE
EXTENDED DRY UNTIL MODELS COME INTO SOME KIND OF AGREEMENT ON THE
EXTENDED WEATHER SITUATION.

LOOKS LIKE AN ACTIVE WEATHER EVENING ON TAP FOR THE MID-SOUTH.

AN AREA OF LOW PRESSURE LOCATED THIS MORNING OVER EASTERN
OKLAHOMA WILL CONTINUE TO MOVE EAST THROUGH THE DAY. A WARM FRONT
EXTENDING EAST FROM THE LOW...CURRENTLY STRETCHED ACROSS CENTRAL
ARKANSAS INTO NORTH-CENTRAL MISSISSIPPI WILL CONTINUE TO ADVANCE
NORTHEAST ACROSS THE MID-SOUTH. AREAS SOUTH OF THE FRONT HAVE SEEN
A DRAMATIC INCREASE IN DEWPOINTS...WITH LOW 60S DEWPOINTS AS FAR
NORTH NOW AS GREENVILLE MISSISSIPPI. THESE HIGH DEWPOINTS AND
BREAKS IN THE CLOUD COVER ARE EXPECTED TO REACH INTO FAR SOUTHERN
TENNESSEE BY LATE THIS AFTERNOON. THIS SHOULD ALLOW THE ATMOSPHERE
TO BECOME INCREASINGLY UNSTABLE ACROSS THE SOUTHERN HALF OF THE
AREA AND SET THE STAGE FOR THUNDERSTORM DEVELOPMENT AFTER 00Z AS
SURFACE LOW MOVES ACROSS THE AREA. EXPECT DEVELOPMENT IN VICINITY
OF THE LOW AND ALONG SLOWING WARM FRONT FIRST THEN DEVELOPING
LATER ALONG THE COLD FRONT AS IT MOVES THROUGH NORTH MISSISSIPPI.
SEVERE POTENTIAL WILL INCREASE AFTER 00Z AS WELL...WITH STRONG
WIND FIELDS...HIGH HELICITY VALUES...AND STEEPENING LAPSE RATES.
POTENTIAL FOR DAMAGING WINDS...LARGE HAIL...AND A FEW
TORNADOES...ESPECIALLY ACROSS NORTHEAST MISSISSIPPI AFTER DARK
WITH ANY SURFACE BASED CONVECTION THAT CAN DEVELOP. JUST NORTH OF
THE WARM FRONT ELEVATED SEVERE WITH A LARGE HAIL POTENTIAL WILL BE
POSSIBLE OVER WEST TENNESSEE WITH ROTATING STORMS ROOTED ABOVE
STABLE LAYER.

BACK TO TODAY...FARTHER EAST ACROSS EASTERN AND NORTHEASTERN SECTIONS OF
THE MID-SOUTH...BEST ISENTROPIC FORCING OF MOISTURE STARTING TO
SHIFT EAST INTO MIDDLE TENNESSEE AND ALABAMA. THINK THAT LESS
CHANCES FOR SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS DURING THE DAYLIGHT HOURS
FROM WEST TO EAST...AS ELEVATED MIXED LAYER NOTED ON MORNING
SOUNDINGS TO OUR SOUTHWEST OVERSPREADS THE AREA AND CAPS THE
ATMOSPHERE UNTIL AFTER 00Z WITH AFORMENTIONED SYSTEM. 

SO HAVE MADE CHANGES MAINLY WITH REDUCING POPS FROM WEST TO EAST
FOR TODAY. UPDATED GRIDS AND ZONES OUT MOMENTARILY.

.DISCUSSION...

A LOW NOW OVER OK WILL MOVE TO THE MIDSOUTH BY THIS EVENING.

WARM FRONT POSITIONED FROM OKC TO MOB. EVENTUALLY...COUNTIES TO

HAPPENS...SHEAR WILL BECOME STRONG ALONG WITH MORE MOISTURE AND

AND POSSIBLY A TORNADO. NORTH OF I 40...HAIL STORMS COULD DEVELOP
LATER TODAY.

THE LOW SHOULD BE IN WV BY SUN MORNING WHILE THE TRAILING COLD
FRONT SLOWS IN CENTRAL MS. THE SOUTH HALF OF THE CWA WILL
CONTINUE TO GET SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS BUT THE NORTH HALF
SHOULD BE DRY SUNDAY.

THE FRONT WILL MOVE ON TO THE COAST BY SUN EVENING...BUT WAVES
MOVING ALONG THE FRONT WILL PROVIDE A CONTINUED CHANCE FOR
TRW/SHW IN THE S HALF OF OUR AREA.

MONDAY...RAIN WILL BE CONFINED TO THE SOUTHEASTERN THIRD OF THE
CWA MONDAY MORNING. RAIN SHOULD BE OUT OF THE MIDSOUTH BY NOON
MONDAY.

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 030239
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
414 PM CST FRI DEC 2 2005

.DISCUSSION...
SOME CLOUDS BEGINNING TO MOVE INTO CENTRAL AND WESTERN ARKANSAS AND
EVENTUALLY INTO THE FORECAST AREA. NO RAIN IN SIGHT AT THIS POINT
AND IT SHOULD BE WELL AFTER MIDNIGHT BEFORE WE SEE ANY RAIN.
TEMPERATURES ARE GETTING CLOSE TO THE FORECAST LOWS BUT WITH CLOUDS
COMING IN THEY SHOULD NOT DROP TO MUCH LOWER. CURRENT FORECAST LOOKS
FINE FOR NOW SO NO CHANGES ARE PLANNED AT THIS TIME.

.PREVIOUS DISCUSSION...
SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE IS SITUATED OVER THE MID-SOUTH THIS
AFTERNOON AND THIS HAS PROVIDED FOR A MOSTLY SUNNY AFTERNOON WITH
COOL TEMPERATURES. THIS HIGH PRESSURE WILL CONTINUE MOVING EAST
AND WILL ALLOW FOR A CHANGE IN THE WEATHER PATTERN FOR THE
WEEKEND.

A LOW AMPLITUDE SHORTWAVE TROUGH MOVING OUT OF THE INTERMOUNTAIN
WEST THIS AFTERNOON WILL CONTINUE TO MOVE EAST IN THE INCREASINGLY
FASTER ZONAL FLOW ALOFT. THIS HAS INDUCED THE DEVELOPMENT OF A
WEAK SURFACE LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM IN THE LEE OF THE ROCKIES...CENTERED
OVER WESTERN KANSAS. LOW LEVEL SOUTHERLY FLOW HAS DEVELOPED THIS
AFTERNOON IN ADVANCE OF THIS SYSTEM ACROSS THE SOUTHERN PLAINS AND
THIS ALSO IS REFLECTED BY THE INCREASE IN LOW LEVEL CLOUDS ACROSS
EASTERN TEXAS. ADVECTION OF THIS MOISTER AIRMASS SHOULD CONTINUE
OVERNIGHT AND BEGIN TO SPREAD NORTH AND EAST TOWARDS THE MID-
SOUTH ON SATURDAY BEHIND A DEVELOPING WARM FRONT THAT WILL EXTEND
EAST ACROSS THE LOWER MISSISSIPPI VALLEY LATER TONIGHT. EXPECT
RAIN TO DEVELOP AFTER MIDNIGHT AHEAD OF THE DEVELOPING WARM
FRONT...AS INCREASING MOISTURE IS ISENTROPICALLY LIFTED OVER THE
DEVELOPING BOUNDARY. CHANCES FOR RAIN AND ISOLATED THUNDERSTORMS
WILL CONTINUE THROUGH SATURDAY MORNING.

THE SURFACE WARM FRONT SHOULD PROGRESS ACROSS NORTH MISSISSIPPI BY
SATURDAY AFTERNOON BEFORE STALLING IN THE VICINITY OF INTERSTATE
40. LATER SATURDAY EVENING...THE LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM WILL MOVE
ALONG THE STALLED BOUNDARY. TO THE SOUTH OF THE WARM FRONT (MAINLY
ACROSS NORTH MISSISSIPPI)...THE AIRMASS SHOULD BECOME INCREASINGLY
UNSTABLE...WITH SURFACE DEWPOINTS APPROACHING OR EXCEEDING 60
DEGREES. IN ADDITION...850-500 MB MID LEVEL LAPSE RATES BECOME
STEEP BETWEEN 6.5 AND 7.0 C/KM IN ADVANCE OF THE SURFACE
LOW...OVER THE WARM SECTOR AND JUST ALONG AND TO THE NORTH OF THE
BAROCLINIC BOUNDARY. ALSO...WIND SPEEDS THROUGHOUT THE ATMOSPHERE
WILL CONTINUE TO STRENGTHEN...WITH A LOW LEVEL JET PROGGED TO
INCREASE BETWEEN 50-60 KTS AND MID LEVEL WINDS BETWEEN 60-70 KTS.
IN ADDITION...0-1 KM HELICITIES WILL BE IN EXCESS OF 250 M2/S2
OVER THE WARM SECTOR. THE PRIMARY QUESTION WITH RESPECT TO
TOMORROW WILL BE HOW MUCH OF THE WARM SECTOR GETS INTO OUR AREA.
THERE IS STILL SOME UNCERTAINTY IN HOW FAR NORTH THE WARM FRONT
REACHES...BUT AT THIS TIME IT APPEARS THAT AT LEAST SOUTHERN
PORTIONS OF THE FORECAST AREA WILL GET INTO THE WARM SECTOR.
ANOTHER LIMITING FACTOR MAY BE THAT THE SYSTEM HAS SLOWED A BIT
AND THE BEST FORCING WILL BE AFTER 00Z...SO WE WILL LOOSE DAYTIME
HEATING. YET...MID LEVEL LAPSE RATES ARE SUCH...IN ASSOCIATION
WITH THE 500 MB COLD CORE (500 MB TEMPS BETWEEN -14 AND -16
DEGREES)...SHOULD HELP KEEP DECENT MLCAPES EVEN AFTER DARK. SO
THERE SHOULD BE THE THREAT OF SOME SURFACE BASED CONVECTION...SOME
OF WHICH COULD BECOME SEVERE WITH LARGE HAIL...DAMAGING
WINDS...AND AN ISOLATED TORNADO...ACROSS THE WARM SECTOR. FURTHER
NORTH...ACROSS EAST ARKANSAS AND WEST TENNESSEE...THE CONVECTION
SHOULD REMAIN ELEVATED. BUT WITH SUCH STEEP LAPSE RATES...CANNOT
RULE OUT LARGE HAIL POSSIBILITIES WITH ROTATING STORMS ROOTED
ABOVE THE BOUNDARY LAYER. SPC HAS PLACED THE SOUTHERN HALF OF THE
AREA IN SLIGHT RISK FOR SEVERE SATURDAY AFTERNOON AND NIGHT.

THIS LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM SHOULD LIFT NORTHEAST AND DRAG THE FRONT
SLOWLY SOUTH INTO NORTH MISSISSIPPI ON SUNDAY. ANOTHER MORE
AMPLIFIED SHORTWAVE WILL APPROACH THE MID-SOUTH AND ALLOW FOR THE
DEVELOPMENT OF A SECONDARY MORE POTENT LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM TO
DEVELOP LATER SUNDAY ALONG THE BAROCLINIC ZONE TO OUR SOUTH. THIS
LOW WILL MOVE EAST AND SHOULD ALLOW FOR RAIN TO REDEVELOP OVER THE
AREA TO THE NORTH OF THIS SYSTEM. ELEVATED ISOLATED THUNDERSTORMS
WILL BE POSSIBLE OVER PORTIONS OF NORTH MISSISSIPPI LATER SUNDAY
AND SUNDAY NIGHT. AS THIS SYSTEM IS DEVELOPING...COLDER AIR WILL
CONTINUE FILTERING SOUTH ACROSS THE AREA SUNDAY AND SUNDAY NIGHT.
MUCH COLDER TEMPERATURES CAN BE EXPECTED AREAWIDE DURING THIS TIME
PERIOD. ENOUGH COLD AIR MAY FILTER INTO NORTHERN SECTIONS SUNDAY
NIGHT TO ALLOW FOR THE POSSIBILITY OF THE PRECIPITATION MIXING
WITH OR CHANGING TO SNOW. ALTHOUGH AT THIS TIME IT APPEARS THAT BY
THE TIME ENOUGH COLD AIR FILTERS IN...PRECIPITATION WILL BE LIGHT.
SO NO MAJOR PROBLEMS EXPECTED AT THIS TIME...BUT WILL NEED TO KEEP
AN EYE ON THE SITUATION OVER THE NEXT COUPLE OF DAYS.

ONCE THIS SECONDARY SHORTWAVE SWINGS THROUGH...PRECIPITATION
SHOULD COME TO AN END MONDAY MORNING. COLD CANADIAN HIGH PRESSURE
WILL SETTLE OVER THE MID-SOUTH...WITH BELOW NORMAL TEMPERATURES
AND DRY WEATHER EXPECTED THROUGH WEDNESDAY MORNING. 12Z MEDIUM
RANGE MODELS ARE STILL HINTING AT AN ARCTIC AIRMASS FILTERING
SOUTH INTO THE AREA BY WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND THURSDAY...AS A POTENT
UPPER LEVEL SHORTWAVE DIVES SOUTH ACROSS THE PLAINS STATES. 12Z
RUNS OF BOTH THE GFS AND ECMWF ARE INDICATING A SURFACE LOW
DEVELOPING OVER THE GULF AND MOVING NORTHEAST...POSSIBLY SPREADING
PRECIPITATION OVER THE COLD AIRMASS. BECAUSE OF THIS HAVE
INTRODUCED A CHANCE OF RAIN OR SNOW OVER THE AREA FOR THURSDAY AND
THURSDAY NIGHT. THERE HAS BEEN SOME MODEL INCONSISTANCY BETWEEN
THE 00Z AND 12Z RUNS...SO PLENTY OF TIME TO WATCH THIS SYSTEM.

MKL  33  54  43  46 /  30  50  50  50

FXUS64 KMEG 020951
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
345 AM CST THU DEC 2 2005

CLEAR SKIES AND LIGHT WINDS ARE ALLOWING TEMPERATURES TO GET VERY
COLD OVERNIGHT. LOWS COULD REACH 20 AT PARIS TN AND 30 AT
ABERDEEN MS. THE AIR MASS BRINGING THIS COLD WEATHER WILL SLIP ON
EAST TDA. AS A RESULT WINDS WILL VEER TO THE SOUTHEAST BY THIS
AFTERNOON. THE NET RESULT OF ALL THIS IS THAT THERE WILL BE LOTS
OF SUNSHINE TDA WHILE TEMPS RISE TO THE MID 40S TO LOWER 50S.

THE HIGH WILL BE OVER THE EASTERN STATES BY SATURDAY MORNING AND
A LOW WILL HAVE MOVED INTO OK. A WARM FRONT WILL HAVE DEVELOPED
SOUTHWEST OF OUR AREA THRU THE NIGHT. MOISTURE WILL LIKELY COME
UP OVER THE MIDSOUTH AND BRING SOME LIGHT RAIN BY DAYBREAK.

SATURDAY THE LOW GETS OVER MEMPHIS. MOST OF THE AREA WILL GET
RAIN...BUT COUNTIES SOUTH OF I 40 COULD HAVE HAIL AND WIND STORMS
ACCORDING TO THE GFS. CONDITIONS WILL BE BEST FOR SEVERE WEATHER
IN NORTHERN MISSISSIPPI WHERE INSTABILITY WILL BE GREATEST.

SATURDAYS LOW WILL MOVE ON EAST AND LET A FRONT SWEEP SOUTH
THROUGH THE AREA OVERNIGHT. THIS WILL DIMINISH PCPN CHANCES FROM
THE NORTH AND SEVERE WEATHER WILL COME TO A HALT SATURDAY
EVENING.

OVERRUNNING RAIN WILL REDEVELOP SUNDAY AS AN UPPER TROUGH DIGS
INTO THE PLAINS. THUNDERSTORMS COULD OCCUR IN SOUTHEASTERN
COUNTIES DURING THE DAY. OVERRUNNING WILL CONTINUE SUNDAY NIGHT
AS THE UPPER TROUGH SHARPENS AND MOVES TOWARD THE MIDSOUTH. THINK
PCPN WILL BE LIQUID SUN NIGHT.

MONDAY WILL BE MAINLY DRY AND COOLER AS THE UPPER TROUGH AXIS
MOVES ON EAST OF US. DRY WEATHER SHOULD BE THE RULE THEN ON
THROUGH WEDNESDAY NIGHT. AFTER THAT...ANOTHER UPPER TROUGH COULD
GO THROUGH THE MIDWEST AND BRING ANOTHER ROUND OF RAIN.

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.
&&

$$

WER





000 
FXUS64 KMEG 020243
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
843 PM CST THU DEC 1 2005

.UPDATE...

HIGH PRESSURE LOCATED ACROSS THE MISSISSIPPI RIVER VALLEY
TONIGHT. UNDER CLEAR SKIES AND DIMINISHING WINDS TEMPS WILL FALL
INTO THE 20S AT MOST PLACES. A FEW HIGH CLOUDS WILL SKIRT THE
NORTHERN TIER AFTER MIDNIGHT. CURRENT FORECAST ON TRACK. WL UPDATE
ZONES TO REMOVED TIME SENSITIVE WORDING WITH REGARD TO WINDS. 

&&

.PREV DISCUSSION... (ISSUED 402 PM CST THU DEC 1 2005) 

DISCUSSION...

THE SHORT TERM FORECAST REMAINS STRAIGHT-FORWARD THIS AFTERNOON
BUT THE MIDDLE AND LATTER PORTION OF THE FORECAST IS RATHER COMPLEX. 
IN THE SHORT TERM...SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE HAS SETTLED OVER THE
MID-SOUTH WITH NORTHWESTERLY FLOW ALOFT. EXPECT THIS HIGH PRESSURE
SYSTEM TO SLIDE EAST THROUGH FRIDAY...PROVIDING FOR DRY WEATHER
AND BELOW NORMAL TEMPERATURES. 

THE FORECAST BECOMES MORE COMPLEX AS WE GET INTO THE WEEKEND AND
INTO NEXT WEEK. SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE SHOULD BE LOCATED TO THE
EAST OF THE AREA BY FRIDAY NIGHT...WITH THE UPPER LEVEL FLOW
BECOMING ZONAL. A SHORTWAVE IMPULSE NOW PUSHING ONSHORE ACROSS THE
WEST COAST WILL TRANSLATE EASTWARD IN THE ZONAL FLOW AND HELP TO
DEVELOP A WEAK SURFACE LOW OVER THE SOUTHERN PLAINS STATES ON
FRIDAY. THIS WEAK LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM WILL MOVE EAST TOWARDS THE MID-
SOUTH FRIDAY NIGHT AND ACROSS THE AREA ON SATURDAY. AS THIS LOW
PRESSURE APPROACHES FRIDAY NIGHT...THE LOW LEVEL FLOW SHOULD TURN
INCREASINGLY SOUTHERLY...WITH LOW LEVEL MOISTURE BEGINNING TO
RETURN NORTHWARD. CURRENTLY FAVORING THE NAM SOLUTION OVER THE GFS
WITH RESPECT TO THE OVERALL TRACK OF THE LOW. PREFER AT THIS TIME
THE LESS AMPLIFIED SOLUTION PROVIDED BY THE NAM. ALSO...AM A BIT
CONCERNED ABOUT THE QUICKNESS OF BOTH THE MODELS IN RETURNING 60
DEGREE DEWPOINTS SO FAR NORTH ON SATURDAY...WITH NO DEEP
AMPLIFICATION OF THE UPPER FLOW AND THE DEEP ENTRUSION OF DRY AND
COLD AIRMASS INTO THE SOUTH TODAY. SO WILL NEED TO KEEP AN EYE ON
HOW FAR NORTH MODIFIED GULF AIRMASS RETURNS ON SATURDAY AND WHERE
THE BAROCLINIC ZONE SETS UP. THIS WILL BE WHERE THE SURFACE LOW
TRACKS AS IT MOVES EASTWARD ALONG THE STALLED FRONT ON SATURDAY
INTO SATURDAY NIGHT. AT THIS TIME...IT APPEARS THAT THE BOUNDARY
WILL MAKE IT INTO NORTH MISSISSIPPI BY SATURDAY AFTERNOON.
PRECEDING THIS BOUNDARY FRIDAY NIGHT...LOW LEVEL MOISTURE SHOULD
RETURN NORTH...ISENTROPICALLY LIFTED OVER THE ADVANCING WARM
FRONT. THIS IS BEST REFLECTED ON THE 295K PRESSURE SURFACE WITH
DEEPER LOW LEVEL MOISTURE BEING LIFTED OVER THE FRONT. THIS SHOULD
MEAN THAT RAIN AND ISOLATED THUNDERSTORMS SHOULD DEVELOP LATER
FRIDAY NIGHT AND SPREAD FROM SOUTH TO NORTH. 

BY SATURDAY...THE WARM FRONT SHOULD STALL ACROSS PORTIONS OF NORTH
MISSISSIPPI WITH THE WEAK LOW MOVING EAST ALONG THE BOUNDARY. AREAS
SOUTH OF THE BOUNDARY SHOULD GET INTO THE WARM SECTOR...MAINLY
ACROSS NORTHEAST MISSISSIPPI. MODELS (INCLUDING THE PREFERED NAM) ARE
INDICATING THE ATMOSPHERE BECOMING UNSTABLE OVER THESE AREAS. WITH
STRONG DEEP LAYER FLOW CUTTING ACROSS THE WARM SECTOR...THE
PRESENCE OF THE SURFACE BOUNDARY...AND SOME LARGE SCALE FORCING
ASSOCIATED WITH THE RIGHT ENTRANCE REGION OF A 110+ KNOT UPPER
JET...THERE MAY BE SOME SURFACE BASED CONVECTION AND THE
POSSIBILITY OF SEVERE WEATHER IN THESE AREAS. AGAIN THE GREATEST
THREAT WILL BE ACROSS PORTIONS OF NORTHEAST MISSISSIPPI...MAINLY
SOUTHEAST OF THE TUPELO AREA. AREAS FURTHER NORTH...ALONG AND JUST
NORTH OF THE FRONT WILL HAVE THE POSSIBILITY FOR ELEVATED
CONVECTION...WITH POSSIBLY SOME HAIL REPORTS. THE EXTENT OF THE
SEVERE THREAT WILL REMAIN HINGED UPON THE EVENTUAL LOW
TRACK AND AMOUNT OF INSTABILITY/OVERALL SIZE OF WARM SECTOR. THERE
MAY BE LOW CLOUDS OVER THE DEVELOPING WARM SECTOR WHICH WOULD CUT
DOWN ON SEVERE THREAT. BUT THERE IS CURRENTLY SOME SEVERE THREAT
FOR SATURDAY AFTERNOON AND EVENING AND WILL NEED TO BE CLOSELY
WATCHED OVER THE NEXT COUPLE OF DAYS. CONFIDENCE IS STILL RATHER
LOW WITH THE EXPECTED SURFACE LOW TRACK AS MODELS REMAIN SOMEWHAT DIVERGENT.

AFTER THE FIRST LOW PRESSURE PASSES BY SATURDAY NIGHT...THE FRONT
SHOULD SLOWLY SAG SOUTH WITH COOLER AIR FILTERING INTO THE REGION.
A SECONDARY SHORTWAVE IMPULSE WILL DIVE SOUTHEAST ACROSS THE
PLAINS STATES SATURDAY NIGHT AND TOWARDS THE AREA SUNDAY. THIS
WILL HELP INDUCE THE DEVELOPMENT OF ANOTHER LOW THAT WILL TRACK
FURTHER SOUTH. THIS WILL STILL SPREAD MOISTURE AND RAIN CHANCES
ACROSS THE AREA SATURDAY NIGHT INTO SUNDAY NIGHT. COLDER AIR WILL
CONTINUE FILTERING SOUTH INTO NORTHERN PORTIONS OF THE AREA SUNDAY
INTO SUNDAY NIGHT. THERE IS SOME POSSIBILITY THAT ENOUGH COLD AIR
WILL FILTER SOUTH INTO NORTHERN TIER AREAS TO CHANGE THE LIGHT
RAIN TO LIGHT SNOW. ANY FROZEN PRECIP SHOULD BE LIGHT AND CHANCES
LOW...SO DOES NOT APPEAR TO BE A BIG DEAL AT THIS POINT.

STRONG CANADIAN HIGH PRESSURE WILL BUILD IN BY MONDAY AND THE
FRONT SHOULD SWEEP SOUTHEAST...BRINGING AN END TO ANY PRECIP BY
MONDAY MORNING. THEN COLDER AND DRY AIR WILL FILTER IN FOR TUESDAY
THROUGH THURSDAY...WITH STRONG SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE OVERHEAD.
THERE WILL BE ANOTHER STRONG SHORTWAVE THAT WILL DIVE SOUTHEAST
TOWARDS THE AREA BEYOND THIS EXTENDED PERIOD THAT WILL NEED TO BE
CLOSELY WATCHED. MORE PRECIP WILL BE POSSIBLE BY THE END OF THE
WEEK...AND WITH RETREATING MODIFIED ARCTIC AIRMASS STILL IN
PLACE...SOME FROZEN PRECIP IS NOT OUT OF THE QUESTION. BUT STILL
WELL INTO THE EXTENDED WITH PLENTY OF TIME FOR CHANGES IN THE
PATTERN. SO NOT LIKELY...BUT WILL CONTINUE TO MONITOR WITH PLENTY
OF TIME TO WATCH.

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.
&&

$$

SJM/JLH









000 
FXUS64 KMEG 011705
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
1105 AM CST THU DEC 1 2005

.UPDATE...

THE COLD FRONT THAT MOVED ACROSS THE MID-SOUTH THIS MORNING IS NOW
TO THE SOUTH AND EAST OF THE AREA. SKIES HAVE CLEARED NICELY
ACROSS MOST OF THE REGION AND SHOULD REMAIN SO ACROSS MOST AREAS
THROUGH THE AFTERNOON. THE ONLY EXCEPTION WILL BE ACROSS NORTHEAST
SECTIONS (PORTIONS OF NORTHWEST TENNESSEE) WHERE CO-LOCATION TO THE
COLDEST TEMPERATURES ALOFT WILL ALLOW FOR SOME REDEVELOPMENT OF A
CU FIELD. THESE CLOUDS SHOULD TEND TO DIMINISH LATER THIS
AFTERNOON. SO THEREFORE...UPDATED THE CLOUD GRIDS TO REFLECT THESE CHANGES.

DECENT LOW LEVEL COLD AIR ADVECTION WILL CONTINUE ACROSS THE AREA
THIS AFTERNOON BEHIND THE COLD FRONT. TEMPERATURES WILL STRUGGLE
TO WARM MUCH FROM CURRENT READINGS...SO HAVE DROPPED TEMPERATURE
FORECAST A FEW DEGREES...ESPECIALLY ACROSS THE NORTHERN TIER OF
THE FORECAST AREA...WHERE COLD ADVECTION IS STRONGEST. TEMPERATURE
GRIDS ALSO REFLECT THESE CHANGES.

OTHERWISE...THE REMAINDER OF THE FORECAST LOOKS IN GOOD SHAPE. SO
EXPECT CONTINUED COOL TEMPERATURES UNDER GUSTY NORTHWEST WINDS AND
DRY WEATHER FOR THE REMAINDER OF THE DAY. 

UPDATED GRIDS AND ZONE FORECAST ALREADY SENT.

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.
&&

$$

JLH






000 
FXUS64 KMEG 011259
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
659 AM CST THU DEC 1 2005

.DISCUSSION...

AREA OF LIGHT RAIN IS BEGINNING TO MOVE OUT OF THE REGION. ALSO
CLEARING BEGINNING TO MOVE INTO THE AREA FROM THE NORTHWEST.
UPDATED FORECAST ACCORDINGLY.

&&

.PREV DISCUSSION... (ISSUED 315 AM CST THU DEC 1 2005) 

DISCUSSION...

AN UPPER SHORTWAVE WITH AN ASSOCIATED SURFACE COLD FRONT IS MOVING
ACROSS ARKANSAS THIS MORNING. KNQA AND KLZK ARE BOTH SHOWING A FEW
RETURNS. MUCH OF THESE RETURNS ARE EMANATING FROM MID CLOUD WITH
ONLY A FEW SPRINKLES IS REACHING THE GROUND. THERE IS A BATCH OF
STRONGER RETURNS MOVING FROM LITTLE ROCK TOWARDS CLARKSDALE WHERE
THE RAIN MAY BE MORE MEASURABLE. OBSERVATIONS FROM LITTLE ROCK
HAVE CONFIRMED THIS. HAVE INCLUDED ISOLATED TO SCATTERED SHOWERS
FROM CLARKSDALE TO TUPELO THIS MORNING BECAUSE OF THIS.
OTHERWISE...FORECAST MAINLY ON TRACK. CLOUD COVER IS A LITTLE MORE
EXTENSIVE THAN PLANNED BUT CLOUDS ARE EXPECTED TO MOVE OUT OF THE
REGION BY AFTERNOON. WILL LEAN TOWARDS GUIDANCE ON HIGH TEMPS
TODAY DESPITE YESTERDAYS PERFORMANCE. BELIEVE THE PROBLEM
YESTERDAY MAY BE DUE TO THE TEMPERATURES STARTING OUT COLDER THAN
MODELS EXPECTED. THIS IS NOT THE CASE THIS MORNING.

HIGH PRESSURE SHOULD PROVIDE MAINLY CLEAR SKIES TONIGHT AND FOR
MUCH OF THE DAY ON FRIDAY. EXCELLENT RADIATING CONDITIONS
TONIGHT...WOULDNT BE SURPRISED TO SEE A FEW TEEN READINGS OUT OF
SOME OF THE COLDER SPOTS OF WESTERN TENNESSEE AND EXTREME NORTH
MISSISSIPPI. HAVE UNDERCUT GUIDANCE HIGHS FOR FRIDAY. EXPECT THAT
A SIMILAR SITUATION TO YESTERDAY WHERE TEMPS IN THE MORNING START
OUT A LITTLE LOWER THAN THE MODELS EXPECT AND SO AFTERNOON HIGHS
ARENT AS WARM. CLOUDS ARE EXPECTED TO STREAM NORTHWARD LATE
TOMORROW AFTERNOON AND TOMORROW EVENING IN ADVANCE OF A WARM FRONT
MOVING OUT OF THE SOUTH. MODELS CONTINUE TO SHOW OVERRUNNING LIGHT
RAIN BREAKING OUT ACROSS THE REGION TOMORROW NIGHT AS
BAROCLINICITY INCREASES. 

THERE IS NOT MUCH DIFFERENCE BETWEEN THE NAM AND GFS BUT JUST
ENOUGH TO CREATE SERIOUS FORECAST ISSUES. THE NAM IS FURTHER SOUTH
THAN THE GFS WITH THE TRACK OF A SURFACE LOW THAT IS EXPECTED TO
DEVELOP OVER THE SOUTHERN PLAINS. BOTH MODELS STALL THE WARM FRONT
ROUGHLY ALONG I 40. THE GFS HAS BEEN CONSISTENT IN THAT THE LOW
RUNS RIGHT UP THE FRONT WHEREAS THE NAM IS FURTHER SOUTH BECAUSE
ITS SOLUTION IS FASTER WITH THE 850MB FLOW AND FEELS THE EFFECTS
OF IT. WILL CONTINUE TO SIDE WITH THE GFS SOLUTION BASED UPON
EXCELLENT CONSISTENCY ON ITS 00Z RUNS OVER THE PAST FEW NIGHTS
WHEREAS THIS IS REALLY JUST THE FIRST RUN OF THE NAM. AS A
RESULT...THERE SHOULD BE A NOTICEABLE TEMPERATURE DIFFERENCE
BETWEEN JONESBORO (IN THE COLD SECTOR) AND TUPELO (IN THE WARM
SECTOR). ALONG THE FRONT...FOR MEMPHIS AND JACKSON THE TEMPERATURE
FORECAST COULD EASILY BUST BY 5 TO 10 DEGREES DEPENDING UPON JUST
WHERE THE FRONT SETS UP. GFS CONTINUES TO ADVERTISE AN UNSTABLE
SITUATION DEVELOPING IN THE WARM SECTOR LATE SATURDAY AND SATURDAY
EVENING AS THE LOW MOVES THROUGH THE REGION AND DRAGS A COLD FRONT
THROUGH NORTH MISSISSIPPI. GFS INSTABILITY IS AROUND -2 WITH CAPES
OF ABOUT 500-800J/KG AND MID LEVEL LAPSE RATES AROUND 7 C/KM. THE
GFS SHOWS A GOOD DEAL OF CLOUD COVER WHICH MAY LIMIT THE
INSTABILITY. ALTHOUGH IF CONVECTION WERE TO DEVELOP THERE WOULD BE
A SEVERE THREAT WITH HAIL AND DAMAGING WINDS AS THE PRIMARY
THREAT. AN ISOLATED TORNADO IS POSSIBLE AS WELL. 

THE FRONT WILL LINGER JUST SOUTH OF THE REGION ON SUNDAY BEFORE AN
UPPER SHORTWAVE MOVES THROUGH THE REGION KICKING THE SYSTEM AWAY
FROM THE AREA. CLOUD COVER AND CHANCES OF RAIN WILL CONTINUE INTO
SUNDAY EVENING UNTIL THE UPPER SHORTWAVE MOVES THROUGH. THERE IS
A SLIM CHANCE OF A WET SNOWFLAKE SUNDAY EVENING WITH GFS SHOWING
THE THERMAL PROFILE BELOW FREEZING JUST AS THE MOISTURE IS
LEAVING. 

GFS IS MUCH COLDER THAN YESTERDAYS RUN FOR NEXT WEEK WITH 850
TEMPS FALLING AS LOW AS -10 OVER JONESBORO. THE EUROPEAN DOES
SUPPORT THIS COLDER TREND BUT NOT QUITE AS COLD...ABOUT 3 DEGREES
WARMER AT 850. BOTTOM LINE IS THAT TEMPS NEXT WEEK SHOULD BE WELL
BELOW NORMAL AS AN UPPER TROUGH DIGS INTO THE CENTRAL U.S. 

MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.

$$

VALLE





000 
FXUS64 KMEG 010915

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
315 AM CST THU DEC 1 2005

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 010117
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
717 PM CST WED NOV 30 2005

.UPDATE...

TEMPS FALLING QUICKLY IN ADVANCE OF HIGH CLOUDS MOVING RAPIDLY ACRS
ARKANSAS. EASTERN LOCATIONS OF THE FORECAST AREA WL CONT TO HAVE
GOOD RADIATIONAL COOLING CONDS FOR NEXT COUPLE OF HOURS. WL DO A
QUICK UPDATE TO LOWER TEMPS A COUPLE OF DEGREES ACRS THE TN RIVER
VALLEY. ELSEWHERE TEMPS LOOK GOOD...CLOUDS MOVING IN WILL SLOW
THE FALL.

&&

.PREV DISCUSSION... (ISSUED 303 PM CST WED NOV 30 2005) 

DISCUSSION...
HIGH PRESSURE CENTERED OVER CWA...WITH CLEAR SKIES AND
TEMPERATURES MAINLY IN THE 40S. DEWPOINTS IN THE 20S AND LIGHT
WINDS. 

SHORT TERM (THROUGH FRIDAY NIGHT)...
SHORT TERM PORTION IS THE EASY PORTION OF THE FORECAST. SURFACE
HIGH BEGINS TO MOVE OFF TO THE EAST TONIGHT...WITH RETURN FLOW
SETTING UP. SINCE DEWPOINTS ARE BELOW FREEZING THE WHOLE WAY TO
THE GULF COAST...GOING TO BE QUITE A WHILE BEFORE WE MOISTEN UP.
SHORTWAVE PASSES BY US TO THE NORTH TONIGHT...AND DONT EXPECT
MUCH MORE THAN SOME HIGH CLOUDS...IF THAT MUCH.

THURSDAY AND FRIDAY WILL BE DRY AS NEXT SURFACE HIGH TRANSLATES
EASTWARD ACROSS US. TEMPERATURES TONIGHT PROBABLY A COUPLE DEGREES
WARMER THAN YESTERDAY IN MOST AREAS...AND A FEW DEGREES HIGHER
THAN THAT ON FRIDAY MORNING. HIGHS NEAR OR SLIGHTLY ABOVE THOSE
SEEN TODAY IN MOST AREAS. NEXT IMPULSE KICKS OUT OF ROCKIES
FRIDAY NIGHT. MODELS INDICATE ISENTROPIC LIFT IS AVAILABLE...BUT
IT WILL TAKE A WHILE FOR THE LOWER LAYERS TO MOISTEN UP. MAY NOT
HAVE MEASURABLE PRECIPITATION REACH THE SURFACE BY 12Z
SATURDAY...AND WILL KEEP CHANCE POPS. 

LONG TERM (SATURDAY AND BEYOND)...
REAL FORECAST FUN IS IN THE LONG TERM. AS HAS BEEN THE CASE THE LAST
WEEK OR SO...THERE HAS BEEN VERY POOR CONTINUITY IN SOLUTIONS
BETWEEN THE MODELS...AND POOR RUN TO RUN CONSISTENCY WITHIN THE
GFS. NEEDLESS TO SAY...CONFIDENCE IN EXTENDED FORECAST PERIOD IS
BELOW NORMAL.

BOUNDARY FROM FRIDAYS SYSTEM HANGS NEAR OR JUST SOUTH OF THE CWA
SATURDAY MORNING. AS SOUTHERLY FLOW RETURNS AGAIN FRIDAY NIGHT...WARM
SECTOR WILL LIFT INTO OR VERY CLOSE TO THE CWA SATURDAY AFTERNOON
AND EVENING. MODELS SHOW ENOUGH INSTABILITY IN WARM SECTOR FOR
POTENTIAL THUNDERSTORMS. PARAMETERS FOR SEVERE WEATHER NOT PARTICULARLY
STRONG ON THIS RUN. WILL USE INTERSTATE 40 FOR A DIVIDING LINE FOR
CONVECTION/NO CONVECTION SATURDAY AFTERNOON. WITH UNCERTAINTY ON
FRONTAL POSITION AND MOISTURE AVAILABILITY...POPS WILL REMAIN IN
CHANCE RANGE FOR NOW. SATURDAY TEMPERATURES WILL BE WARMEST OF THE
WEEK. BOTH GFS AND NAM SHOW 850 TEMPS AROUND +10 ON SATURDAY.
SO...DEPENDING ON LOCATION OF WARM FRONT...AND CLOUD COVER...WE
COULD BE ANYWHERE FROM LOWER 60S TO LOWER 70S ON HIGHS. WILL GO
MIDDLE OF THE COURSE FOR NOW.

MODELS FORECAST FRONT TO MOVE THROUGH ON SUNDAY...AND HANG UP TO
THE SOUTH OF THE AREA BY MONDAY MORNING. POPS WILL TAPER OFF
SUNDAY AND SUNDAY NIGHT.

DETAILS EXTREMELY MURKY AFTER MONDAY MORNING. GFS 12Z RUN A LARGE
DEPARTURE FROM PREVIOUS RUNS...PHASING 3 STREAMS AND BRINGING THE
CORE OF THE POLAR AIR INTO THE MISSISSIPPI RIVER VALLEY TUESDAY
AND WEDNESDAY. GFS TAKES 85O TEMPS FROM +10 ON SUNDAY MORNING...TO
-20 () BY TUESDAY EVENING. WHILE 06Z DGEX AND 12Z ECMWF DO SHOW
COLDER WEATHER...NO INDICATIONS OF ALL STREAMS PHASING ON EITHER
MODEL. CONSIDERING POOR MODEL CONTINUITY MENTIONED ABOVE...WILL
COOL FORECAST FOR MONDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY A FEW DEGREES BELOW
CURRENT FORECAST. FORECAST WILL REMAIN DRY FOR THOSE PERIODS.

IF GFS WERE TO DEVELOP CONTINUITY FROM RUN TO RUN WITH THIS
SOLUTION...LATER FORECASTS WOULD NEED TO BE COOLED
SIGNIFICANTLY...SO STAY TUNED. 12Z GFS SOLUTION WOULD DICTATE
TEMPERATURES BELOW FREEZING ALL DAY TUESDAY.

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.
&&

$$

SJM/WAGNER






UPDATING TO LOWER MAX TEMPS ACROSS NORTHERN PORTION OF CWA.



000 
FXUS64 KMEG 301542
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
942 AM CST WED NOV 30 2005

.UPDATE...
HIGH PRESSURE CENTERED OVER THE MIDSOUTH THIS MORNING. SKIES ARE
CLEAR WITH TEMPERATURES IN THE 30S AREAWIDE THIS MORNING. WITH
LIGHT WINDS...TEMPERATURES SHOULD RESPOND AS CURRENTLY FORECAST.
WILL UPDATE IN THE NEXT HOUR OR SO TO REMOVE TIME SENSITIVE
WORDING FROM FIRST PERIOD.

&&

.PREV DISCUSSION... (ISSUED 242 AM CST WED NOV 30 2005) 

DISCUSSION...

HIGH PRESSURE IS FIRMLY ENTRENCHED OVER THE REGION THIS MORNING.
CLEAR SKIES WITH LIGHT WINDS AND LOW DEW POINTS HAVE RESULTED IN
MANY LOCATIONS REPORTING TEMPS IN THE 20S. HIGH PRESSURE SHOULD
CONTINUE TO PROVIDE MAINLY SUNNY CONDITIONS TODAY AND GUIDANCE
SEEMS UNIFORM AND REASONABLE ON HIGHS FOR TODAY. TONIGHT A WEAK
SHORTWAVE AND ASSOCIATED COLD FRONT WILL MOVE INTO THE REGION.
GFS/NAM CONTINUE TO SHOW DRY LOW LEVELS IN PLACE WITH LITTLE
MOISTURE RETURN AHEAD OF THE FRONT. THUS NO RAIN IS EXPECTED. HAVE
EVEN BACKED OFF OF CLOUD COVER WITH GFS/NAM SHOWING SIGNIFICANT
850MB MOISTURE MAKING IT ONLY AS FAR NORTH AS PERHAPS CLARKSDALE
TO COLUMBUS. A REINFORCING SHOT OF COOL DRY AIR WILL MOVE INTO THE
REGION FOR THE REMAINDER OF THE WEEK. 

FRIDAY NIGHT...GFS/NAM SHOW A LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM DEVELOPING OVER
THE SOUTHERN PLAINS. A WARM FRONT WILL MOVE NORTHWARD INTO THE
MIDSOUTH DURING THE NIGHT. THERE SHOULD BE ENOUGH MOISTURE RETURN
WITH THE FRONT FOR AREAS OF OVERRUNNING RAINFALL ACROSS THE REGION
FRIDAY NIGHT INTO SATURDAY. HIGHS WILL BE NOTICEABLY WARMER ON
SATURDAY AS THE MODES SHOW MOST OF THE REGION UNDER THE INFLUENCE
OF THE WARM SECTOR OF THE SYSTEM WITH 850MB TEMPS ABOVE +10. THE
AREA OF LOW PRESSURE SHOULD MOVE THROUGH THE REGION LATE IN THE
DAY ON SATURDAY OR DURING THE EVENING. THIS WILL DRAG A STRONG
COLD FRONT THROUGH THE REGION ON THE BACK SIDE OF THE LOW. GFS
SHOWS ENOUGH SURFACE BASED INSTABILITY WITH LIS AROUND -2 TO
WARRANT THUNDER. MID LEVEL LAPSE RATES LOOK IMPRESSIVE AS WELL
(7 C/KM). SEVERE POTENTIAL AS IS OFTEN THE CASE THIS TIME OF YEAR
WILL BE DEPENDENT UPON HOW MUCH INSTABILITY IS IN PLACE. AND THAT
IS REALLY NOT KNOWN FOR SURE AT THIS TIME. THE FRONT SHOULD CLEAR
THE REGION BY SUNDAY AFTERNOON WITH COLD AIR ONCE AGAIN FILTERING
INTO THE REGION. 850 TEMPS FALL TO AROUND -4 BY MONDAY. GFS SHOWS
A CLIPPER SYSTEM MOVING INTO THE REGION MONDAY NIGHT WHICH COULD
SUPPORT A FEW FLURRIES. HOWEVER MODEL SOLUTIONS TEND TO CHANGE
QUITE DRAMATICALLY THAT FAR OUT AND NOT WILLING TO MENTION IN
FORECAST AT THIS TIME. 
&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.
&&

$$

WAGNER/VALLE

VALLE





000 
FXUS64 KMEG 300317
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
917 PM CST TUE NOV 29 2005

.UPDATE...

SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE CENTERED OVER EAST TEXAS THIS EVENING WILL
MOVE EAST OVERNIGHT TO THE LOWER MISSISSIPPI VALLEY. SURFACE WINDS
CONT TO DIMINISH AND TEMPS HAVE ALREADY FALLEN INTO THE UPPER 20S
AND LOWER 30S. WL TRIM LOW TEMPS A DEGREE OR TWO. WL ALSO UPDATE
TO REFLECT THE CLEAR SKIES ACROSS THE REGION. WL UPDATE ZONES
SHORTLY.

&&

.PREV DISCUSSION... (ISSUED 146 PM CST TUE NOV 29 2005) 

DISCUSSION...
LITTLE CHANGE IN SURFACE PATTERN DURING THE DAYLIGHT
HOURS...ALTHOUGH THERE MAY BE A SLIGHT REINFORCING PUSH OF COLD
AIR...ALONG A ORD-STL-FSM LINE. MAY BE AS MUCH A WIND SHIFT LINE
AS ANYTHING...WINDS SHIFT ABOUT 30 DEGREES AND GET A LITTLE
GUSTIER. COLD AIR STRATOCUMULUS CLOUDS ARE ALONG THE MISSISSIPPI
RIVER...AND THESE SHOULD DISSIPATE AROUND SUNSET. TEMPS MAINLY IN
THE LOW TO MID 40S AND DEWPOINTS IN THE 20S.

SHORT TERM (THROUGH FRIDAY)...
UPPER FLOW REMAINS SLIGHTLY NORTHWESTERLY...AND RATHER QUICK. NEXT
SYSTEM TO APPROACH THE AREA WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND THURSDAY MORNING.
THIS SYSTEM IS MOISTURE STARVED AND WHILE A FEW SPRINKLES COULD
CONCEIVABLY OCCUR...DO NOT EXPECT ANY MEASURABLE PRECIPITATION.
THIS WOULD BE THE ONLY EVENT TO SPEAK OF THROUGH FRIDAY. MOST OF
THE TIME...CLOUD COVER TO BE RATHER LIMITED. EXCEPTION WOULD BE
WEDNESDAY NIGHT INTO THURSDAY.

NOT A LARGE SPREAD IN TEMPERATURE GUIDANCE...WITH MET NUMBERS
GENERALLY A LITTLE COLDER THAN MAV NUMBERS. DID NOT FIND IT
NECESSARY TO MAKE LARGE CHANGES IN GOING FORECAST.

LONG TERM (AFTER FRIDAY)...
STILL SIGNIFICANT DISAGREEMENTS BETWEEN MEDIUM RANGE MODELS ON
EVOLUTION OF PATTERN DAYS 4-7...BEFORE EVENTUALLY COMING BACK TO A
FLOW PATTERN THAT IS MAINLY OUT OF THE NORTHWEST. THERE HAVE EVEN
BEEN VERY STRONG RUN TO RUN DIFFERENCES WITHIN THE SAME MODEL.
NEEDLESS TO SAY...CONFIDENCE IN DETAILS OF ANY ONE MODEL SOLUTION
VERY LOW.

ON THE 12Z RUN...THE DIFFERENCE SEEMS TO BE AN IMPULSE THAT ECMWF
DIGS MORE STRONGLY INTO THE WESTERN U.S...TURNING THE FLOW
SOUTHWEST FOR A WHILE...WHILE GFS KEEPS FLOW NORTHWEST...NOT
DIGGING THE TROF. BOTH MODELS ARE TRENDING TOWARD WEAKER SOLUTIONS
AT THE SURFACE OVER THE WEEKEND AND EARLY NEXT WEEK.

BOTH MODELS BRING A WEAK IMPULSE OUT OF THE ROCKIES BY FRIDAY NIGHT...SETTING
UP ISENTROPIC LIFT OVER OUR AREA. THE POTENTIAL FOR PRECIPITATION
EXISTS AS EARLY AS FRIDAY NIGHT...AND SEE NO REASON TO ELIMINATE
LOW POPS WE ARE CURRENTLY CARRYING. SURFACE BOUNDARY REMAINS IN
AREA UNTIL SUNDAY OR MONDAY. THERE WILL BE IMPULSES TRAVELING
ALONG THIS BOUNDARY THROUGH THE WEEKEND. AS QUICK AS THE UPPER
FLOW IS...TIMING OF THESE IMPULSES 5 DAYS IN ADVANCE IS
PROBLEMATIC AT BEST. GFS APPEARS TO OVEREMPHASIZING IMPULSE SUNDAY
NIGHT INTO MONDAY...PRODUCING A SIGNIFICANT PRECIP SHIELD TO OUR
SOUTH ON MONDAY. LOOKING AT GFS FORECAST SOUNDINGS...ANY/ALL
PRECIPITATION IN OUR CWA OVER THE WEEKEND WILL BE LIQUID. ALL POPS
FOR WEEKEND PERIOD WILL REMAIN IN THE CHANCE RANGE FOR NOW.

CONSIDERING THE CONTINUITY ISSUES...MAKING RADICAL CHANGES TO GOING
FORECAST WOULD NOT BE PRUDENT AT THIS TIME. HAVE MADE SOME EDITS
TO GRIDS THAT ALLOW FOR A BETTER FIT TO SURROUNDING OFFICES.

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.
&&

$$

SJM/WAGNER

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
MEM  31  52  41  52 /   0   0  10  10 
MKL  25  50  32  52 /   0   0  10  10 
JBR  27  50  35  52 /   0   0  10  10



000 
FXUS64 KMEG 291603
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
1003 AM CST TUE NOV 29 2005

.UPDATE...
COLD FRONT WELL OUT OF AREA WITH SURFACE AND UPPER LOWS TO THE
NORTH. SOUTHERN EDGE OF COLD AIR STRATOCUMULUS CLOUDS HAS BEEN
BREAKING UP THIS MORNING...BUT AS SUN ANGLE GETS A LITTLE
HIGHER...THESE BREAKS MAY FILL IN AGAIN. TRENDS SHOULD BECOME
APPARENT IN THE NEXT HOUR OR TWO. TEMPS MID 30S NORTH TO MID 40S
SOUTH...AND COULD SEE ANOTHER 10 DEGREES OR SO OF WARMING.
FORECAST HIGHS APPEAR TO BE ON TRACK AT PRESENT...SO SEE NO NEED
FOR AN UPDATE IN THE IMMEDIATE FUTURE.

&&

.PREV DISCUSSION... (ISSUED 232 AM CST TUE NOV 29 2005) 

DISCUSSION...

COLD AIR CONTINUES TO POUR INTO THE REGION. 850 TEMPS AT 12Z SHOWN
TO BE AROUND -2 AT TUPELO TO -10 AT JONESBORO. SATELLITE SHOWS
COLD AIR CLOUDS ACROSS MISSOURI EXTENDING INTO WESTERN ARKANSAS.
BOTH GFS/NAM PICKING UP ON THIS MOISTURE AT THE 850MB LEVEL. THEY
SHOW THIS MOISTURE TRYING TO WORK EASTWARD BUT HAVING A TOUGH TIME
WORKING INTO THE REGION DUE TO THE DRY AIR IN PLACE. SATELLITE
TRENDS OVERNIGHT HAVE SUPPORTED THIS. BOTH MODELS SHOW THE
MOISTURE THICKENING OVER NORTHEAST ARKANSAS AND INTO NORTHWEST
TENNESSEE AS THE DIURNAL COMPONENT TAKES HOLD AND THE STRATOCU
BECOMES MORE OVERCAST. THEN THE CLOUDS SHOULD DISSIPATE BY EVENING
WITH THE LOSS OF THE SUN. GIVEN THE CLOUD COVER AND COLD AIR IN
PLACE FAVOR THE MET GUIDANCE FOR TODAY EXCEPT SOUTH OF A LINE FROM
CLARKSDALE TO TUPELO. FAVOR THE MAV GUIDANCE WITH THE MAV
HANDLING THE OVERNIGHT TEMP CURVE MUCH BETTER. 

NO SIGNIFICANT WEATHER EXPECTED UNTIL WEDNESDAY NIGHT. THEN A WEAK
SHORTWAVE AND ASSOCIATED FRONT WILL APPROACH THE REGION FROM THE
WEST. GFS SHOWS SOME RAIN WITH THIS SYSTEM WHILE THE ETA IS DRY.
BOTH MODELS SHOW AN INCREASE IN LOW LEVEL CLOUDINESS. FEEL THAT
UPPER DYNAMICS ARE TOO WEAK AND THAT NOT ENOUGH LOW LEVEL MOISTURE
WILL RETURN FOR MUCH MORE THAN A FEW SPRINKLES. 

UPPER PATTERN BECOMES MORE ZONAL ACROSS THE EASTERN TWO THIRDS OF
THE COUNTRY. AS A RESULT...THERE IS A GREAT DEAL OF DISAGREEMENT
UPON MODELS AND A LOT OF INCONSISTENCY WITH SYSTEMS OVER THE
WEEKEND. 00Z GFS SHOWS A WEAK LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM DEVELOPING OVER
THE SOUTHERN PLAINS ON FRIDAY. THIS WILL FORCE A WARM FRONT
NORTHWARD FRIDAY NIGHT RESULTING IN A CHANCE OF LIGHT RAIN FRIDAY
NIGHT. THE LOW PRESSURE AREA WOULD MOVE OVER THE REGION ON
SATURDAY WITH CONTINUED CHANCES FOR RAIN. A MORE SIGNIFICANT
SYSTEM DEVELOPS OVER THE SOUTHERN PLAINS RACES THROUGH THE
AREA SUNDAY INTO SUNDAY NIGHT. THIS SYSTEM IS ASSOCIATED WITH A
STRONGER SHORTWAVE AND HAS A REINFORCING SHOT OF COLD AIR BEHIND
IT. INSTABILITY LIKELY TOO LOW FOR SEVERE WEATHER. EUROPEAN DOESNT
REALLY SHOW THESE SYSTEMS. LOW CHANCES DUE TO UNCERTAINTY.

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.
&&

$$

WAGNER/VALLE

FXUS64 KMEG 290832
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
232 AM CST TUE NOV 29 2005

.DISCUSSION...

COLD AIR CONTINUES TO POUR INTO THE REGION. 850 TEMPS AT 12Z SHOWN
TO BE AROUND -2 AT TUPELO TO -10 AT JONESBORO. SATELLITE SHOWS
COLD AIR CLOUDS ACROSS MISSOURI EXTENDING INTO WESTERN ARKANSAS.
BOTH GFS/NAM PICKING UP ON THIS MOISTURE AT THE 850MB LEVEL. THEY
SHOW THIS MOISTURE TRYING TO WORK EASTWARD BUT HAVING A TOUGH TIME
WORKING INTO THE REGION DUE TO THE DRY AIR IN PLACE. SATELLITE
TRENDS OVERNIGHT HAVE SUPPORTED THIS. BOTH MODELS SHOW THE
MOISTURE THICKENING OVER NORTHEAST ARKANSAS AND INTO NORTHWEST
TENNESSEE AS THE DIURNAL COMPONENT TAKES HOLD AND THE STRATOCU
BECOMES MORE OVERCAST. THEN THE CLOUDS SHOULD DISSIPATE BY EVENING
WITH THE LOSS OF THE SUN. GIVEN THE CLOUD COVER AND COLD AIR IN
PLACE FAVOR THE MET GUIDANCE FOR TODAY EXCEPT SOUTH OF A LINE FROM
CLARKSDALE TO TUPELO. FAVOR THE MAV GUIDANCE WITH THE MAV
HANDLING THE OVERNIGHT TEMP CURVE MUCH BETTER. 

NO SIGNIFICANT WEATHER EXPECTED UNTIL WEDNESDAY NIGHT. THEN A WEAK
SHORTWAVE AND ASSOCIATED FRONT WILL APPROACH THE REGION FROM THE
WEST. GFS SHOWS SOME RAIN WITH THIS SYSTEM WHILE THE ETA IS DRY.
BOTH MODELS SHOW AN INCREASE IN LOW LEVEL CLOUDINESS. FEEL THAT
UPPER DYNAMICS ARE TOO WEAK AND THAT NOT ENOUGH LOW LEVEL MOISTURE
WILL RETURN FOR MUCH MORE THAN A FEW SPRINKLES. 

UPPER PATTERN BECOMES MORE ZONAL ACROSS THE EASTERN TWO THIRDS OF
THE COUNTRY. AS A RESULT...THERE IS A GREAT DEAL OF DISAGREEMENT
UPON MODELS AND A LOT OF INCONSISTENCY WITH SYSTEMS OVER THE
WEEKEND. 00Z GFS SHOWS A WEAK LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM DEVELOPING OVER
THE SOUTHERN PLAINS ON FRIDAY. THIS WILL FORCE A WARM FRONT
NORTHWARD FRIDAY NIGHT RESULTING IN A CHANCE OF LIGHT RAIN FRIDAY
NIGHT. THE LOW PRESSURE AREA WOULD MOVE OVER THE REGION ON
SATURDAY WITH CONTINUED CHANCES FOR RAIN. A MORE SIGNIFICANT
SYSTEM DEVELOPS OVER THE SOUTHERN PLAINS RACES THROUGH THE
AREA SUNDAY INTO SUNDAY NIGHT. THIS SYSTEM IS ASSOCIATED WITH A
STRONGER SHORTWAVE AND HAS A REINFORCING SHOT OF COLD AIR BEHIND
IT. INSTABILITY LIKELY TOO LOW FOR SEVERE WEATHER. EUROPEAN DOESNT
REALLY SHOW THESE SYSTEMS. LOW CHANCES DUE TO UNCERTAINTY.

FXUS64 KMEG 290352
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
952 PM CST MON NOV 28 2005

.UPDATE...

COOLER AND DRIER AIR CONTINUES TO FILTER INTO THE REGION ON GUSTY
WSW WINDS THIS EVENING. TEMPS ALREADY IN THE UPPER 30S ACRS N
CNTRL AR AND THIS AIR WILL BE ADVECTING INTO THE MID SOUTH
OVERNIGHT. TEMPS SHOULD BE IN THE 30S ACRS MOST PLACES BY MORNING.
LOW CLOUDS CONT TO PULL NE OUT OF THE REGION SO WL UPDATE SKY
CONDS. WL CONT PARTLY CLOUDY SKIES NRN HALF AND MOSTLY CLEAR SKIES
ACRS SRN HALF WHERE SKIES HAVE CLEARED OUT. OTRW FORECAST ON
TRACK.

&&

.PREV DISCUSSION... (ISSUED 336 PM CST MON NOV 28 2005) 

DISCUSSION...

THE COLD FRONT HAS MOVED EAST OF THE CWA EARLY THIS AFTERNOON. 
CLEARING HAS OCCURRED BEHIND THE FRONT WITH A STRONG SOUTHWEST WIND. 
A COLD POOL ALOFT ASSOCIATED WITH A STRONG UPPER LOW IS PROVIDING 
LOW CLOUDS ACROSS NW AR AND AREAS TO THE NORTH. THE SE EDGE OF THESE 
CLOUDS HAS MOVED INTO A PORTION OF NE AR DURING THE AFTERNOON.

EXPECT THE LOW CLOUDS TO EXTEND A LITTLE FARTHER TO THE SE THIS 
EVENING BEFORE BREAKING UP OVERNIGHT. WINDS WILL BE A LIGHTER BUT 
STILL OVER 10 MPH. A TURN TO THE WEST IN WIND DIRECTION THIS EVENING 
WILL ALLOW FOR MORE COLD AND DRY ADVECTION. 

HIGH PRESSURE WILL BUILD INTO THE REGION TUESDAY...MOVING ACROSS THE 
LWR MS VLY TUESDAY NIGHT AND TO THE EAST WEDNESDAY. COOL AND DRY 
WEATHER WILL PERSIST THROUGH MOST OF THE WEEK. A WEAK COLD FRONT 
WILL MOVE THROUGH THE REGION THURSDAY AND REINFORCE THE COOL AND DRY 
AIRMASS IN PLACE.

A WEAK LOW IS EXPECTED TO TRACK ACROSS THE CWA SUNDAY AND PROVIDE A 
SMALL CHANCE OF RAIN. MODELS HAVE BEEN INCONSISTENT WITH THIS 
SCENARIO SO CONFIDENCE IS LOW. A COLDER AIRMASS WILL PUSH INTO THE 
REGION EARLY NEXT WEEK.

MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.

A COLD FRONT CONTINUES TO PROGRESS EASTWARD ACROSS WRN TN AND NRN

SHIFTED FROM SOUTH TO SOUTHWEST BEHIND THE FRONT WITH A DROP IN THE 
TEMPERATURE AND DEWPOINT. A WEDGE OF CLEARING HAS OCCURRED BEHIND 
THE BOUNDARY BUT LOW CLOUDS WERE TO THE NORTHWEST.

EXPECT THE FRONT TO CLEAR THE EASTERN EDGE OF THE CWA AROUND MIDDAY 
PUSHING THE SHOWERS INTO MIDDLE TN AND ALABAMA. THE CLEAR WEDGE WILL 
GRADUALLY MOVE EASTWARD ACROSS WRN TN AND NRN MS WHILE LOW CLOUDS 
TRY TO INVADE NE AR. TEMPERATURES WILL BE TRICKY AS COLD ADVECTION 
BATTLES THE AREAS WITH SUN BEHIND THE FRONT.

THE REST OF THE WEEK WILL BE SEASONABLY COOL AND DRY. ANOTHER COLD 
FRONT WILL MOVE THROUGH THURSDAY. NEXT WEEKEND MAY HAVE A CHANCE OF 
RAIN FROM THE NEXT LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
307 AM CST MON NOV 28 2005

.DISCUSSION...
A LINE OF SHOWERS WAS MOVING ACROSS THE WESTERN HALF OF THE FORECAST 
AREA THIS MORNING. THERE WERE NO CLOUD TO GROUND LIGHTNING STRIKES 
IN THE FORECAST AREA SINCE 2 AM. THE LINE OF STORMS OVER THE FA 
HAVE NOT BEEN SEVERE DUE TO THE LACK OF INSTABILITY...HOWEVER THE 
WIND PROFILES REMAIN FAVORABLE FOR SEVERE THUNDERSTORMS. 

THE LINE OF STORMS WILL CONTINUE MOVING EASTWARD AT ABOUT 20 MPH AND 
BEGIN MOVING INTO NORTHEAST MISSISSIPPI AND WEST TENNESSEE NEAR THE 
TN RIVER BY 6 AM. THE LINE WILL MOVE OUT OF NORTHEAST MISSISSIPPI BY 
LATE MORNING WITH SOME SHOWERS FILLING IN BEHIND THE LINE. BY 
TONIGHT THE RAIN WILL HAVE CLEARED MOST AREAS.

TEMPERATURES WILL BE TRICKY TODAY AS MAX TEMPERATURES WILL OCCUR 
AROUND 9 AM AND THEN REMAIN STEADY OR SLOWLY FALL THROUGH THE DAY IN 
THE WAKE OF THE COLD FRONT. OVERNIGHT LOWS WILL FALL INTO THE 30S.

MUCH COOLER DAY IN STORE FOR THE REMAINDER OF THE WEEK WITH MAX 
TEMPERATURES HOVERING AROUND 50 AND OVERNIGHT LOWS MAINLY IN THE 
30S. LONG RANGE WEATHER PATTERN SUPPORTS A DRY FORECAST THROUGH THE 
NEXT SEVEN DAYS.

FXUS64 KMEG 280216
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
816 PM CST SUN NOV 27 2005

.UPDATE...
CURRENT FORECAST APPEARS TO BE ON TRACK. NO SIGNIFICANT REASONS
FOR UPDATES AT THIS TIME. TORNADO WATCH 879 UNTIL 08Z FOR AREAS
WEST OF THE MISSISSIPPI RIVER.

SURFACE LOW IN KS AT 01Z WITH A DRYLINE INTO WESTERN PORTIONS OF
AR. UPPER AIR CHARTS SHOWED A 250 MB JET OF 183 KTS AT FORT WORTH AT
00Z. THIS JET LIKELY HELPING TO DRIVE DRYLINE EASTWARD...ALTHOUGH
MAIN PUNCH IS TO NORTHEAST INTO WESTERN MISSOURI.

AHEAD OF DRYLINE...DEWPOINTS IN THE LOWER 60S ACROSS EASTERN HALF
OF AR. WEST OF DRYLINE...A NARROW RIBBON OF DEWPOINTS IN THE TEENS
ACROSS EASTERN OK. SURFACE INSTABILITY STILL REMAINS AN ISSUE...BETWEEN
0 AND -2 FOR LIFTED INDICES. STILL PLENTY OF HELICITY
AVAILABLE...IN THE 300 TO 500 RANGE. SPC CONTINUES WITH MODERATE
RISK UP TO OUR WESTERN BORDER...AND SLIGHT OVER JUST ABOUT ALL OF
OUR CWA. SEE NO REASON TO DISAGREE WITH THAT ASSESSMENT. AS LINE
OF CONVECTION MOVES EASTWARD INTO MORE STABLE AIRMASS...HOPEFULLY
THE STORMS WILL WEAKEN AFTER MIDNIGHT.

SOUTHERN END OF LINE IN LA AND TX MAY NOT BE QUITE AS POTENT AS A
FEW HOURS AGO...BUT CONVECTION OVER AR STILL NEEDS TO BE WATCHED
CLOSELY. EARLIER TIMING OF LINE REACHING THE MISSISSIPPI RIVER
AROUND MIDNIGHT...AND OUT OF THE CWA DURING THE MORNING HOURS
STILL LOOKS VALID.

&&

.PREV DISCUSSION... (ISSUED 234 PM CST SUN NOV 27 2005) 

DISCUSSION...
SKIES ARE BEGINNING TO CLEAR UP A LITTLE ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA.
THIS MAY HELP FURTHER DESTABILIZE THINGS AHEAD OF THE STORM SYSTEM
MOVING INTO KANSAS. THUNDERSTORMS HAVE BEGUN TO DEVELOP OVER EXTREME
WESTERN ARKANSAS THIS AFTERNOON AND THESE STORMS HAVE ALREADY BECOME
SEVERE. COLD FRONT STILL LAGGING BEHIND SOMEWHAT ACROSS NORTHWEST
OKLAHOMA INTO THE TEXAS PANHANDLE WITH A DRY-LINE EXTENDING FROM
EASTERN OKLAHOMA INTO NORTHEAST TEXAS. MAIN SQUALL LINE HAS YET TO
DEVELOP YET BUT SHOULD START TO WITHIN THE NEXT COUPLE OF HOURS.
EXPECT THUNDERSTORMS TO START MOVING INTO OUR FORECAST AREA LATER
THIS EVENING. MAIN THREAT WOULD BE DAMAGING STRAIGHT LINE WINDS
ALONG THE SQUALL LINE WITH A RISK OF SUPERCELLS WITH THUNDERSTORMS
THAT DEVELOP AHEAD OF THE LINE. MODELS CONTINUE TO SLOW DOWN THE
MOVEMENT OF THE FRONT WHICH SHOULD REACH THE MISSISSIPPI BY AROUND
12Z AND CLEAR THE FORECAST AREA BY 00Z. THIS MEANS MORE OF THE
FORECAST AREA WILL BE AHEAD OF THE FRONT MONDAY MORNING AND THEREFORE
WILL STILL SEE A RISK FOR SEVERE WEATHER. ONCE THE FRONT CLEARS...
COOLER AND DRIER AIR WILL BEGIN TO FILTER INTO THE REGION. UPPER
LEVEL PATTERN WILL EVOLVE INTO MORE OF A ZONAL FLOW SO THIS WEEKS
WEATHER WILL BE MORE SEASONABLE AND MAINLY DRY. THE NEXT CHANCE OF
RAIN APPEARS TO BE TOWARD THE END OF NEXT WEEKEND WHEN ANOTHER
STORM SYSTEM APPROACHES THE REGION.

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 270933
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
332 AM CST SUN NOV 27 2005

.DISCUSSION...
AREAS OF RAINFALL COVERED MUCH OF THE MIDSOUTH THIS MORNING. 
RAINFALL WAS SHOWING SIGNS OF DIMINISHING ACROSS THE SOUTHWESTERN 
AND WESTERN EDGES OF THE FORECAST AREA. THE LATEST ISENTROPIC 
SURFACE ANALYSIS AND FORECASTS OF THE LOWER LAYERS SUGGEST THAT 
PARCELS WILL HAVE TO BE LIFTED OVER 75 MB BEFORE SATURATING. 
THEREFORE...THIS BATCH OF RAIN SHOULD CONTINUE TO MOVE OUT OF THE 
FORECAST AREA THIS MORNING AND PARTLY CLOUDY SKIES SHOULD OCCUR 
ACROSS THE WESTERN THIRD OF THE FORECAST AREA TODAY. DAYTIME 
TEMPERATURES SHOULD BE WELL ABOVE MACHINE NUMBERS...ESPECIALLY OVER 
MEMPHIS AND JONESBORO.

WITH THE SECOND...MORE POWERFUL SHORTWAVE APPROACHING THE MIDSOUTH 
THIS AFTERNOON ADDITIONAL LOW LEVEL MOISTURE WILL REALLY SURGE 
NORTHWARD. THE THETA E RIDGE AXIS WILL BE OVER NORTHEAST ARKANSAS 
THIS AFTERNOON WHICH IS RIGHT ON THE EDGE OF THE MODERATE RISK AREA 
OUTLINED BY SPC. SURFACE DEWPOINTS WILL RISE INTO THE LOWER 60S THIS 
AFTERNOON...ESPECIALLY FOR THE WESTERN HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA. 
UPPER DYNAMICS LOOKS BEST AFTER 9 PM AND WILL COINCIDE WITH WHEN THE 
SEVERE THUNDERSTORMS WILL ENTER THE AREA. THESE STORMS WILL BE 
FUELED BY A 130+ KNOT JET STREAK...STRONG SOUTHEAST BOUNDARY LAYER 
WINDS OF UP TO 30 KNOTS...LOW 60 DEWPOINTS AND A VEERING WIND 
PROFILE. PERHAPS BY LATE THIS AFTERNOON A FEW SHOWERS AND 
THUNDERSTORMS COULD DEVELOP OVER NORTHEAST ARKANSAS AHEAD OF THE 
FRONT.

A SQUALL LINE IS EXPECTED TO MOVE THROUGH THE REGION OVERNIGHT. 
DAMAGING WINDS IN EXCESS OF 60 MPH WILL BE LIKELY AS WILL ISOLATED 
TORNADOES...GIVEN THE HIGH HELICITY VALUES. BELIEVE THAT THE LINE OF 
STORMS WILL MOVE FAST ENOUGH THAT WIDESPREAD FLOODING WILL NOT BE A 
PROBLEM...HOWEVER A FEW AREAS MAY SEE VERY HEAVY RAINFALL IN A SHORT 
AMOUNT OF TIME. 

BY 6 AM MONDAY...THE LINE WILL STILL BE MOVING THROUGH NORTHEAST 
MISSISSIPPI AND PARTS OF WEST TENNESSEE. THE STORMS OVER NORTHEAST 
MISSISSIPPI WILL CONTINUE TO HAVE THE POTENTIAL TO PRODUCE DAMAGING  
WINDS. SPC HAS OUTLOOKED THIS AREA IN SWODY2.

BY MONDAY AFTERNOON...THE MAJORITY OF THE RAINFALL WILL HAVE MOVED 
WELL EAST OF THE FORECAST AREA. BEING ON THE BACKSIDE OF THE UPPER 
LOW WILL LEAVE OUR REGION IN PARTLY TO MOSTLY CLOUDY SKIES AND 
COOLER TEMPERATURES THROUGH THE REMAINDER OF THE WEEK. LONG RANGE 
MODELS ADVERTISING DRY CONDITIONS TO PERSIST FOR THE NEXT SEVEN 
DAYS.

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 262047
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
247 PM CST SAT NOV 26 2005

.DISCUSSION...
CLOUDS ARE BUILDING INTO THE REGION FROM THE SOUTH AHEAD OF THE
UPPER LEVEL SHORTWAVE WHICH MOVING INTO NORTHWEST LOUISIANA. SOME
SHOWERS MOVING INTO NORTHEAST MISSISSIPPI AT THE PRESENT TIME.
BIGGEST CHANGE IN THE WEATHER OVER THE PAST FEW HOURS HAS BEEN IN
MOISTURE AS DEWPOINTS HAVE INCREASED TO THE 40S AND LOW 50S WITH 60
DEGREE DEWPOINTS JUST SOUTH OF JACKSON MISSISSIPPI. EVERYTHING
REMAINS ON TRACK FOR A WET NIGHT LATER TONIGHT AS UPPER LEVEL
SHORTWAVE MOVES THROUGH NORTHEAST ARKANSAS. PLENTY OF MOISTURE IN
THE AREA TO PRODUCE WIDESPREAD RAIN WITH SOME ISOLATED THUNDERSTORMS.
THIS BATCH OF RAIN WILL HANG OVER INTO OUR EASTERN AREAS THROUGH
SUNDAY MORNING SO HAVE KEPT LIKELY POPS GOING THERE FOR SUNDAY.

BIG UPPER LEVEL STORM SYSTEM WILL MOVE OUT INTO THE TEXAS PANHANDLE
ON SUNDAY AND TRACK NORTHEAST THROUGH MONDAY. THE COLD FRONT
ASSOCIATED WITH THIS SYSTEM WILL APPROACH THE FORECAST AREA SUNDAY
NIGHT. WITH SOUTHERLY WINDS BRINGING MORE MOISTURE INTO THE REGION
AHEAD OF THE FRONT WOULD NOT BE SURPRISED TO SEE SOME SHOWERS AND
THUNDERSTORMS DEVELOP DURING THE AFTERNOON HOURS SO HAVE KEPT SOME
POPS IN ALL THE ZONES FOR SUNDAY. BY SUNDAY NIGHT...WE WILL SEE A
BETTER CHANCE OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS SO HAVE LIKELY POPS. AS
THE FRONT GETS CLOSER TO THE REGION THERE WILL BE A BETTER CHANCE OF
SEVERE WEATHER AS WELL. MAIN THREAT REMAINS DAMAGING STRAIGHT LINE
WINDS BUT TORNADOES CANT BE RULED OUT. THE FRONT WILL NOT
COMPLETELY PUSH OUT OF THE FORECAST AREA UNTIL LATE MONDAY AFTERNOON
SO SOME REDEVELOPMENT OF STORMS AHEAD OF THE FRONT ON MONDAY IS A
POSSIBILITY AND AGAIN THERE MAY BE SOME SEVERE STORMS. BEHIND THE
FRONT...TEMPERATURES WILL BEGIN TO FALL DURING THE AFTERNOON AND
EVENING HOURS. THE AIR BEHIND THIS NEXT SYSTEM WONT BE NEARLY AS
COLD AS THIS LAST ONE SO MOST LOCATIONS WILL REMAIN ABOVE FREEZING
MONDAY NIGHT INTO TUESDAY MORNING.

THE UPPER AIR PATTERN WILL BECOME MORE ZONAL AND THAT SHOULD KEEP
TEMPERATURES MORE SEASONABLE FOR WEDNESDAY THROUGH SATURDAY. ANOTHER
COLD FRONT WILL MOVE THROUGH THE REGION ON THURSDAY BUT NOT EXPECTING
TO SEE MUCH MOISTURE AHEAD OF THE FRONT SO DRY WEATHER SHOULD PERSIST
INTO THE BEGINNING OF NEXT WEEKEND.

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...

THE WEST TO EAST. HIGH CLOUDS WILL MOVE ACROSS THE AREA LATER
TODAY...OVERALL A MOSTLY CLOUDY DAY. TEMPERATURES WILL WARM INTO THE
LOWER AND MID 60S IN ADVANCE OF A SHORTWAVE TROUGH.

THE SHORTWAVE WAS LOCATED OVER SOUTH TEXAS THIS MORNING WHERE
SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS WERE DEVELOPING. LATER TODAY...THIS SYSTEM
WILL TRACK INTO THE MIDSOUTH WITH RAIN CHANCES INCREASING THIS
AFTERNOON AND ESPECIALLY TONIGHT. MOST LOCATIONS WILL GET RAIN BY
SUNDAY MORNING WITH A FEW ISOLATED THUNDERSTORMS. THE REMNANTS OF
THIS SYSTEM WILL HANG IN THE FORECAST AREA THROUGH SUNDAY
MORNING...MAINLY THE EASTERN AREAS.

A POWERFUL STORM SYSTEM WILL MOVE OUT OF THE ROCKIES ON SUNDAY. IN
ADVANCE OF THE UPPER LEVEL LOW...THE 50+ KNOT LOW LEVEL JET WILL
PUMP IN MUCH HIGHER DEWPOINTS THROUGH SUNDAY. DEPENDING ON THE
EVOLUTION AND SPEED OF THIS SYSTEM...WILL AFFECT THE TIME OF DAY THE
STORMS OCCUR. THE SLOWER NAM IS PREFERRED GIVEN THE STRONG JET ON
THE WEST SIDE OF THE TROUGH WHICH WOULD SEEM TO WANT TO DIG THE
UPPER LOW FARTHER SOUTH. THUS SLOWING THE SYSTEM BY ABOUT 6 HOURS OR
SO.

BY SUNDAY AFTERNOON...CAPES AROUND 1000 J/KG AND A GOOD VEERING
PROFILE COULD PRODUCE A FEW THUNDERSTORMS APPROACHING SEVERE LIMITS.
HOWEVER...THE BULK OF THE LIFT AND UPPER DYNAMICS WILL STILL BE OFF
TO THE WEST. APPEARS THAT THE BEST CHANCE FOR SEVERE THUNDERSTORMS
WILL BE AFTER 9 PM SUNDAY NIGHT. COULD SEE A LINE OF THUNDERSTORMS
ALONG THE COLD FRONT MOVE ACROSS THE MISSISSIPPI RIVER BY 5 AM.
WINDS IN EXCESS OF 60 MPH ARE LIKELY WITH THIS LINE OF THUNDERSTORMS
AS LOW AND MID LEVEL WINDS ARE IN EXCESS OF 50 KNOTS.

THE COLD FRONT WILL CONTINUE TO PROGRESS EASTWARD WITH MOST OF THE
SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS ENDING IN THE AFTERNOON...CLEARING FROM
WEST TO EAST. COLD ADVECTION THROUGH THE DAY WILL ALLOW TEMPERATURES
TO WARM ONLY A FEW DEGREES DURING THE LATE MORNING HOURS.

THE UPPER AIR PATTERN WILL FLATTEN OUT AND BECOME MORE ZONAL. THE
SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE IN CONTROL OF THE WEATHER THROUGH WEDNESDAY
WILL MOVE TO THE EAST. A SHORTWAVE MOVING ACROSS THE GREAT LAKES
REGION ON WEDNESDAY NIGHT WILL SEND ANOTHER COLD FRONT INTO THE
MIDSOUTH ON THURSDAY. WILL HAVE TO WATCH IF ANY MOISTURE RETURN ON
THE WEST SIDE OF THE SURFACE HIGH OCCURS AND CAN GET CAUGHT AHEAD OF
THE FRONT. IF SO...PERHAPS ANOTHER SHOT OF RAIN COMES THURSDAY NIGHT.

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.

LOW CLOUDS WERE FILTERING INTO THE FORECAST AREA THIS MORNING FROM

TODAY...OVERALL A MOSTLY CLOUDY DAY. TEMPERATURES WILL WARM INTO THE

715 PM CST FRI NOV 25 2005

.DISCUSSION...

CLEAR SKIES THIS EVENING HAS ALLOWED TEMPERATURES TO DROP NEAR 
EXPECTED LOW TEMPERATURES. WINDS ARE EXPECTED TO TURN AROUND TO THE 
SOUTH LATER TONIGHT. IN ADDITION...CLOUDS WILL MOVE INTO THE AREA 
OVERNIGHT AHEAD OF A WARM FRONT. THE COMBINATION OF THESE TWO ITEMS 
WILL KEEP LOWS STABILIZED THROUGH THE REMAINDER OF THE NIGHT. WILL 
UPDATE TO LOWER LOWS A CATEGORY TO ACCOUNT FOR THE CURRENT 
CONDITIONS.

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 252050
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
250 PM CST FRI NOV 25 2005

.DISCUSSION...

SKIES HAVE BEEN MOSTLY CLEAR FOR MUCH OF THE DAY TODAY ACROSS THE
FORECAST AREA BUT DESPITE THE LACK OF CLOUDS TEMPERATURES HAVE ONLY
MANAGED TO WARM INTO THE 40S OVER MOST OF THE FORECAST AREA. SURFACE
HIGH IS NOW EAST OF THE REGION AND AS IT CONTINUES TO MOVE TOWARD
THE ATLANTIC COAST WINDS WILL SHIFT SOUTHEAST LATER TONIGHT WHICH
SHOULD HELP KEEP TEMPERATURES FROM DROPPING VERY MUCH. WARM FRONT
WILL SURGE NORTH ON SATURDAY ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA WHICH WILL
HELP BRING A RAPID RETURN TO MOISTURE OVER THE REGION. THERE MAY BE A
FEW SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS IN ASSOCIATION WITH THE WARM FRONT
SATURDAY AFTERNOON SO HAVE KEPT CHANCE POPS IN. UPPER LEVEL
SHORTWAVE WILL MOVE THROUGH THE REGION SATURDAY NIGHT AND SUNDAY
MORNING BRINGING WIDESPREAD RAIN INTO THE FORECAST AREA. MOST OF
SUNDAY SHOULD BE DRY BUT WARM AS TEMPERATURES WILL APPROACH 70
DEGREES DURING THE AFTERNOON. THIS WILL HELP SET THE STAGE FOR A
POTENTIALLY STORMY SUNDAY NIGHT AND MONDAY MORNING AS STORM SYSTEM
WILL MOVE OUT OF THE ROCKIES SUNDAY AND TRACK ACROSS SOUTHERN
KANSAS INTO SOUTHERN WISCONSIN BY MONDAY MORNING. COLD FRONT
ASSOCIATED WITH THIS LOW WILL MOVE INTO THE FORECAST AREA LATE
SUNDAY NIGHT. EXPECT SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS SUNDAY NIGHT AND
MONDAY AHEAD OF THE FRONT. CURRENT DAY 3 OUTLOOK HAS A SLIGHT RISK
FOR SEVERE WEATHER OVER MUCH OF NORTHERN ARKANSAS AND SOUTHERN
MISSOURI. WHILE THE MAIN THREAT WOULD BE STRAIGHT LINE WINDS...WOULD
NOT BE SURPRISED TO SEE SOME TORNADIC ACTIVITY AS WELL. THE COLD
FRONT SHOULD CLEAR THE REGION BY MONDAY AFTERNOON BUT THERE MAY STILL
BE SOME LINGERING RAIN AROUND MONDAY NIGHT SO HAVE KEPT SLIGHT CHANCE
POPS IN. BY TUESDAY HIGH PRESSURE WILL BEGIN TO BUILD IN AND SHOULD
HELP BRING ANOTHER PERIOD OF DRY AND COOL WEATHER FOR THE MIDDLE OF
NEXT WEEK.

&&

TEMPERATURES ARE IN THE MID 20S IN THE NORTH TO UPPER 30S IN THE

MORNING SO HAVE UPDATED FORECAST TO LOWER MAX TEMPERATURES.
REMAINDER OF FORECAST LOOKS GOOD SO NO OTHER CHANGES WERE MADE.

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 250938
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
338 AM CST FRI NOV 25 2005

.DISCUSSION...
SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE WAS ANCHORED OVER SOUTHERN ILLINOIS AND UPPER 
FLOW WAS NORTHWEST. THE SURFACE HIGH WILL BUILD EASTWARD AND SURFACE 
WINDS WILL BECOME SOUTHEAST BY EARLY EVENING. MEANWHILE THE UPPER 
TROUGH NEAR THE BIG BEND OF TEXAS WILL APPROACH THE AREA.

LOW LEVEL MOISTURE ADVECTION WILL COMMENCE TONIGHT IN ADVANCE OF THE 
DEVELOPING STORM SYSTEM. RAIN CHANCES WILL INCREASE SATURDAY 
AFTERNOON AND INTO SATURDAY NIGHT. A FEW THUNDERSTORMS WILL BE 
POSSIBLE MAINLY SATURDAY NIGHT. LOW LEVEL JET OF GREATER THAN 50 
KNOTS WILL FEED PLENTY OF MOISTURE INTO ANY STORMS THAT DEVELOP.

A MUCH STRONGER STORM SYSTEM WILL MOVE INTO THE PACIFIC NORTHWEST 
SATURDAY. THIS SYSTEM IS PROGGED TO DIG INTO THE SOUTHERN 
ROCKIES...PERHAPS AS FAR SOUTH AS THE SOUTH PLAINS OF TEXAS BEFORE 
EJECTING NORTHEAST. THIS POWERFUL STORM SYSTEM WILL HAVE THE 
CAPABILITY OF PRODUCING SEVERE WEATHER OVER MOST OF THE MIDSOUTH 
SUNDAY INTO SUNDAY NIGHT. SURFACE DEWPOINTS WILL RISE INTO THE LOWER 
60S AND INSTABILITY WILL BE PLENTIFUL. UPPER DYNAMICS ARE IMPRESSIVE 
AS WELL AS HELICITY. THE BULK OF BEST LIFT WILL OCCUR AFTER MIDNIGHT 
SUNDAY NIGHT. 

A COLD FRONT WILL MOVE THROUGH THE MIDSOUTH MONDAY MORNING AS THE 
UPPER LEVEL LOW TRACKS INTO THE GREAT LAKES REGION BY TUESDAY 
AFTERNOON. DRY AIR WILL FILTER INTO THE REGION DIMINISHING RAIN 
CHANCES FOR TUESDAY. BY WEDNESDAY...SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE WILL BE IN 
CONTROL THROUGH THE REMAINING OF THE FORECAST PERIOD SQUASHING ANY 
CHANCES FOR MEASURABLE PRECIP. 

&&

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 250245
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
845 PM CST THU NOV 24 2005

.UPDATE...
SURFACE DEWPOINTS ARE DROPPING RAPIDLY OVER THE FORECAST AREA.
HOWEVER CLOUD COVER OVER THE AREA SHOULD KEEP TEMPERATURES FROM
GETTING AS LOW AS FORECAST IN THE CURRENT FORECAST PACKAGE. SO
WILL MAKE AN ADJUSTMENT IN MINIMUM TEMPERATURES AND CLOUD COVER.

&&

.PREV DISCUSSION... (ISSUED 251 PM CST THU NOV 24 2005) 

DISCUSSION...

WHILE COLD FRONT IS NOW WELL SOUTH OF THE FORECAST AREA THIS
AFTERNOON COOLER AIR HAS YET TO MOVE INTO THE REGION AS TEMPERATURES
REMAIN IN THE MID 50S TO MID 60S. IN ADDITION...HIGH CLOUDS ARE
STARTING TO STREAM INTO THE REGION FROM THE SOUTHWEST. ALL THIS ADDS
UP TO MOST AREAS NOT GETTING QUITE AS COLD OVERNIGHT AS PREVIOUSLY
THOUGHT SO HAVE BUMPED UP LOWS A FEW DEGREES. SURFACE HIGH WILL
SETTLE INTO THE FORECAST AREA BY FRIDAY MORNING WHICH WILL MEAN
TEMPERATURES SHOULD BE SOME 10-15 DEGREES COOLER THAN TODAY. THE
HIGH SHOULD MOVE OFF TO THE EAST QUICKLY AND BY FRIDAY NIGHT WINDS
WILL SHIFT TO THE SOUTH AND HELP MODIFY TEMPERATURES. WARM FRONTAL
PASSAGE SHOULD OCCUR ON SATURDAY AND COMBINED WITH A UPPER LEVEL
SHORT WAVE WILL MEAN A CHANCE OF RAIN BY SATURDAY AFTERNOON WITH A
BETTER CHANCE OF RAIN SATURDAY NIGHT. VIGOROUS STORM SYSTEM WILL MOVE
OUT OF THE ROCKIES ON SUNDAY AND TRACK NORTHEAST INTO IOWA. THIS
SYSTEM SHOULD SPREAD SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS INTO THE FORECAST
AREA SUNDAY NIGHT AND MONDAY. WHILE DYNAMICS APPEAR TO BE A LITTLE
TOO FAR NORTH...CANT RULE OUT SEVERE WEATHER SO WILL LEAVE HWO
WORDING ALONE FOR NOW. THIS SYSTEM WILL BE SOMEWHAT SLOW TO MOVE OUT
OF THE REGION WITH THREAT OF RAIN CONTINUING INTO TUESDAY EVENING.
HIGH PRESSURE WILL EVENTUALLY SETTLE IN THE NORTHERN ROCKIES BY
WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND KEEP THINGS DRY AND COOL FOR THE MIDDLE PART OF
NEXT WEEK.

&&

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
927 AM CST THU NOV 24 2005

.DISCUSSION...

COLD FRONT HAS MOVED THROUGH THE FORECAST AREA THIS MORNING.
TEMPERATURES HAVE PRETTY MUCH REACHED THEIR PEAK FOR THE DAY AND
SHOULD BEGIN TO SLOWLY FALL DURING THE AFTERNOON. CURRENT FORECAST
APPEARS TO HAVE A GOOD HANDLE ON THIS SITUATION SO WILL NOT MAKE ANY
CHANGES AT THIS TIME.



000 
FXUS64 KMEG 241036
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
435 AM CST THU NOV 24 2005

.DISCUSSION...SURFACE ANALYSIS THIS MORNING PLACES COLD FRONT ACROSS 
THE NORTHERN PLAINS INTO THE OHIO RIVER VALLEY. MAIN FORECAST 
CONCERNS THIS PACKAGE IS LOW TEMPERATURES TONIGHT AND CONVECTIVE 
POTENTIAL LATE THIS WEEKEND INTO EARLY NEXT WEEK.

TODAY...COLD FRONT CURRENTLY UPSTREAM WILL MOVE THROUGH THE MID 
SOUTH THIS MORNING. 850 MB TEMPERATURES RANGING FROM -1C ACROSS THE 
NORTH TO 6C ACROSS SOUTHERN SECTIONS OF THE FORECAST AREA SUPPORT 
HIGHS IN THE 50S NORTH TO LOWER 60S SOUTH. 850-700 MB LAYER RH/S 
AROUND 60 PERCENT MAY PRODUCE SOME MID LEVEL CLOUDS WITH THE FRONTAL 
PASSAGE...BUT NOT ANTICIPATING A LOT OF CLOUD COVER OVERALL. 

TONIGHT...SURFACE COLD FRONT WILL BE ALONG THE GULF COAST BY EARLY 
EVENING AS COLD ARCTIC AIR SPILLS DOWN FROM CANADA AND MODIFIES TO 
BETWEEN -5C TO +2C AS IT REACHES THE LOWER MISSISSIPPI VALLEY AND 
1000-500 MB LAYER RH/S AT OR BELOW 35 PERCENT. MODEL SOUNDINGS 
SUGGEST THAT LOWS COULD POSSIBLY DIP BACK INTO THE TEENS ACROSS 
NORTHERN SECTIONS OF THE FORECAST AREA. CURRENT FORECASTED LOWS 
OVERALL ON TRACK AND WILL ONLY MAKE MINOR AJUSTMENTS TO LOWS.

FRIDAY...COLD AIR WILL SLOWLY BEGIN TO RETREAT BACK NORTH AS HIGH 
PRESSURE MOVES EAST AND SOUTHERLY FLOW RETURNS TO THE MID SOUTH. 
EXPECTING PARTLY CLOUDY SKIES WITH A GRADUAL RETURN OF LOW/MID LEVEL 
MOISTURE. 

SATURDAY AND SUNDAY...A MID LEVEL SHORTWAVE AND ASSOCIATED WARM FRONT WILL 
MOVE ACROSS THE LOWER MISSISSIPPI VALLEY SATURDAY AND SATURDAY 
NIGHT...REACHING THE MID SOUTH SATURDAY NIGHT. BOTH NAM/GFS 
SOLUTIONS SIMILAR AND HAVE BEEN CONSISTENT WITH POPS FOR SATURDAY 
NIGHT...EVEN WITH POOR MODEL RUN TO RUN CONSISTENCY ISSUES IN THE 
MEDIUM AND LONG RANGE. AS A RESULT...MADE ADJUSTMENTS TO POPS WITH 
PRIMARILY CHANCE POPS SATURDAY AFTERNOON AND LIKELY POPS SATURDAY 
NIGHT.  

A TRAILING COLD FRONT IS STILL ANTICIPATED TO COME THROUGH DURING THE 
DAY ON MONDAY. MADE VERY LITTLE IF ANY CHANGES TO MONDAY AND BEYOND 
DUE TO POOR MODEL RUN TO RUN CONSISTENCY...WITH THE GFS/EUROPEAN/AND 
DGEX. CONSEQUENTLY...WILL ONLY MENTION STRONG THUNDERSTORMS IN THE 
HWO UNTIL LATER MODEL RUNS SUPPORT A TREND TOWARDS SEVERE 
CONVECTION.   

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.



000 
FXUS64 KMEG 240325
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
925 PM CST WED NOV 23 2005

.UPDATE...
WIND SHIFT APPEARS TO BE NEAR INTERSTATE 40 AT 03Z. CLOUDS HAVE
DIMINISHED CONSIDERABLY. MAIN COLD FRONT APPEARS TO BE JUST
ENTERING NORTHERN MISSOURI. FORECAST PROBLEM IS WHETHER
TEMPERATURES WILL FALL TO FORECAST MINS TONIGHT. THERE ARE SOME
TEMPERATURES IN THE 40S AND LOWER 50S IN MISSOURI...SO WE MAY
REACH THOSE MINS LATE IN THE NIGHT. CHANGES TO FORECAST FOR
TONIGHT ARE MINOR...AND BASICALLY TO TAKE INTO ACCOUNT CURRENT
TRENDS IN TEMPERATURES...CLOUDS AND WINDS.

&&

.PREV DISCUSSION... (ISSUED 344 PM CST WED NOV 23 2005) 

DISCUSSION...

A LARGE UPPER LEVEL TROUGH OF LOW PRESSURE CONTINUES OVER THE
EASTERN HALF OF THE UNITED STATES THIS AFTERNOON AND THIS WILL
CONTINUE THROUGH THANKSGIVING DAY BEFORE SLOWLY LIFTING OUT TO THE
NORTHEAST BY THE BEGINNING OF THE WEEKEND. THIS WILL KEEP UPPER
LEVEL NORTHWESTERLY FLOW ALOFT OVER THE AREA THROUGH THE END OF
THE WEEK. A SHORTWAVE DISTURBANCE EMBEDDED WITHIN THE NORTHWEST
FLOW WILL DROP SOUTHEAST ACROSS THE GREAT LAKES AND INTO THE MID
ATLANTIC STATES TOMORROW. THIS WILL HELP TO PUSH A SURFACE (MAINLY
A WIND SHIFT) TROUGH ACROSS THE MID-SOUTH TONIGHT...AND A
STRONGER COLD FRONT ACROSS THE AREA BY THURSDAY AFTERNOON. THERE
WILL BE LIMITED MOISTURE IN ADVANCE OF THESE FEATURES...SO NOT
EXPECTING ANY PRECIPITATION TONIGHT OR THURSDAY. A QUICK SHOT OF
MUCH COLDER AIR WILL START TO FILTER SOUTH INTO THE REGION BY LATE
TOMORROW AFTERNOON ON GUSTY NORTHWEST WINDS. WINDS WILL BEGIN TO
DIMINISH LATER TOMORROW NIGHT AS CANADIAN HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS
OVERHEAD. THIS WILL ALLOW FOR MOSTLY CLEAR SKIES THURSDAY NIGHT
AND WITH LIGHT WINDS LATE AND CONTINUED COLD ADVECTION...EXPECT
TEMPERATURES TO BOTTOM OUT INTO THE UPPER 10S AND 20S. AN
UNSEASONABLY COOL DAY CAN BE EXPECTED ON FRIDAY BEFORE HIGH
PRESSURE QUICKLY SLIDES EAST ON SATURDAY AND ALLOWS FOR THE RETURN
OF WARM ADVECTION AND WARMER TEMPERATURES.

THE OVERALL PATTERN WILL BEGIN TO CHANGE BY THE WEEKEND AS A
CUTOFF UPPER LEVEL LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM CURRENTLY OFF OF THE COAST
OF SOUTHERN CALIFORNIA MOVES EAST OUT OF THE SOUTHWEST U.S. AND
ACROSS THE MID-SOUTH BY SATURDAY NIGHT. AT THE SAME TIME...A
POTENT UPPER LEVEL SHORTWAVE CURRENTLY OVER THE NORTHERN PACIFIC
WILL CRASH INTO THE PACIFIC NORTHWEST AND INTO THE SOUTHERN PLAINS
OVER THE WEEKEND. AS THIS OCCURS...A SURFACE LOW WILL DEVELOP IN
THE LEE OF THE ROCKIES WITH A WARM FRONT DEVELOPING AND PUSHING
NORTH TOWARDS THE AREA SATURDAY NIGHT. AS THIS WARM FRONT COMBINED
WITH THE LEAD SOUTHERN STREAM SHORTWAVE LIFTS NORTH ACROSS THE
MID-SOUTH SATURDAY NIGHT...EXPECT SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS TO
DEVELOP OVER THE AREA. THE WARM FRONT WILL MOVE NORTH OF THE AREA
BY SUNDAY AFTERNOON...LEAVING THE MID-SOUTH ENTRENCHED IN THE WARM
SECTOR WITH QUICKLY RISING DEWPOINTS AND MUCH WARMER TEMPERATURES.
ALSO BY LATER SUNDAY AFTERNOON...THE SECOND AND MUCH STRONGER
SHORTWAVE WILL CONTINUE DIGGING ACROSS THE SOUTHERN PLAINS...BECOMING
NEGATIVELY TILTED. AS THIS OCCURS...THE SURFACE LOW PRESSURE OVER
THE SOUTHERN PLAINS SHOULD LIFT NORTHEAST INTO THE MID MISSISSIPPI
VALLEY WHILE DEEPENING. STRONG UPPER LEVEL HEIGHT FALLS ALONG WITH
STRENTHING WIND FIELDS AND SHEAR SHOULD BEGIN TO OVERSPREAD THE
WARM SECTOR OVER THE AREA. THIS SHOULD SET THE STAGE FOR
THUNDERSTORM DEVELOPMENT OVER THE AREA LATER SUNDAY
AFTERNOON...CONTINUING THROUGH SUNDAY NIGHT AND INTO MONDAY. AT
THIS TIME...THERE APPEARS TO BE SOME POTENTIAL FOR SEVERE
WEATHER. SINCE THIS SYSTEM IS STILL SEVERAL DAYS AWAY...THERE WILL
BE PLENTY OF TIME TO MONITOR THE EVENTUAL EVOLUTION OF THIS SYSTEM
AND ITS EFFECTS. BUT NEEDLESS TO SAY...SOMETHING TO DEFINITELY
WATCH FOR SEVERE POTENTIAL.

BY LATER MONDAY...THE LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM SHOULD LIFT WELL TO THE
NORTH ALONG WITH THE STRONG UPPER SUPPORT. AT THIS TIME...THE
MODELS ARE HINTING THAT THE TRAILING COLD FRONT MAY STALL
SOMEWHERE ACROSS THE AREA THROUGH THE BEGINNING OF NEXT WEEK...AS
THE SYSTEM NEVER REALLY CLEARS THROUGH THE AREA AND THE UPPER FLOW
REMAINS SOUTHWESTERLY. CONFIDENCE ON THIS PART OF THE FORECAST IS
RATHER LOW...SO FELT IT PRUDENT AT THIS POINT TO KEEP SLIGHT
CHANCE POPS IN THE FORECAST THROUGH TUESDAY WITH ABOVE NORMAL
TEMPERATURES. ANOTHER SYSTEM WILL MOVE THROUGH THE AREA BY MID-
WEEK BRINGING THE NEXT CHANCES FOR SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS AND
KEEPING A RATHER ACTIVE WEATHER PATTERN IN PLACE FOR NEXT WEEK.

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.

WAGNER/JLH






000 
FXUS64 KMEG 232144
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
344 PM CST WED NOV 23 2005

.DISCUSSION...

A LARGE UPPER LEVEL TROUGH OF LOW PRESSURE CONTINUES OVER THE
EASTERN HALF OF THE UNITED STATES THIS AFTERNOON AND THIS WILL
CONTINUE THROUGH THANKSGIVING DAY BEFORE SLOWLY LIFTING OUT TO THE
NORTHEAST BY THE BEGINNING OF THE WEEKEND. THIS WILL KEEP UPPER
LEVEL NORTHWESTERLY FLOW ALOFT OVER THE AREA THROUGH THE END OF
THE WEEK. A SHORTWAVE DISTURBANCE EMBEDDED WITHIN THE NORTHWEST
FLOW WILL DROP SOUTHEAST ACROSS THE GREAT LAKES AND INTO THE MID
ATLANTIC STATES TOMORROW. THIS WILL HELP TO PUSH A SURFACE (MAINLY
A WIND SHIFT) TROUGH ACROSS THE MID-SOUTH TONIGHT...AND A
STRONGER COLD FRONT ACROSS THE AREA BY THURSDAY AFTERNOON. THERE
WILL BE LIMITED MOISTURE IN ADVANCE OF THESE FEATURES...SO NOT
EXPECTING ANY PRECIPITATION TONIGHT OR THURSDAY. A QUICK SHOT OF
MUCH COLDER AIR WILL START TO FILTER SOUTH INTO THE REGION BY LATE
TOMORROW AFTERNOON ON GUSTY NORTHWEST WINDS. WINDS WILL BEGIN TO
DIMINISH LATER TOMORROW NIGHT AS CANADIAN HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS
OVERHEAD. THIS WILL ALLOW FOR MOSTLY CLEAR SKIES THURSDAY NIGHT
AND WITH LIGHT WINDS LATE AND CONTINUED COLD ADVECTION...EXPECT
TEMPERATURES TO BOTTOM OUT INTO THE UPPER 10S AND 20S. AN
UNSEASONABLY COOL DAY CAN BE EXPECTED ON FRIDAY BEFORE HIGH
PRESSURE QUICKLY SLIDES EAST ON SATURDAY AND ALLOWS FOR THE RETURN
OF WARM ADVECTION AND WARMER TEMPERATURES.

THE OVERALL PATTERN WILL BEGIN TO CHANGE BY THE WEEKEND AS A
CUTOFF UPPER LEVEL LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM CURRENTLY OFF OF THE COAST
OF SOUTHERN CALIFORNIA MOVES EAST OUT OF THE SOUTHWEST U.S. AND
ACROSS THE MID-SOUTH BY SATURDAY NIGHT. AT THE SAME TIME...A
POTENT UPPER LEVEL SHORTWAVE CURRENTLY OVER THE NORTHERN PACIFIC
WILL CRASH INTO THE PACIFIC NORTHWEST AND INTO THE SOUTHERN PLAINS
OVER THE WEEKEND. AS THIS OCCURS...A SURFACE LOW WILL DEVELOP IN
THE LEE OF THE ROCKIES WITH A WARM FRONT DEVELOPING AND PUSHING
NORTH TOWARDS THE AREA SATURDAY NIGHT. AS THIS WARM FRONT COMBINED
WITH THE LEAD SOUTHERN STREAM SHORTWAVE LIFTS NORTH ACROSS THE
MID-SOUTH SATURDAY NIGHT...EXPECT SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS TO
DEVELOP OVER THE AREA. THE WARM FRONT WILL MOVE NORTH OF THE AREA
BY SUNDAY AFTERNOON...LEAVING THE MID-SOUTH ENTRENCHED IN THE WARM
SECTOR WITH QUICKLY RISING DEWPOINTS AND MUCH WARMER TEMPERATURES.
ALSO BY LATER SUNDAY AFTERNOON...THE SECOND AND MUCH STRONGER
SHORTWAVE WILL CONTINUE DIGGING ACROSS THE SOUTHERN PLAINS...BECOMING
NEGATIVELY TILTED. AS THIS OCCURS...THE SURFACE LOW PRESSURE OVER
THE SOUTHERN PLAINS SHOULD LIFT NORTHEAST INTO THE MID MISSISSIPPI
VALLEY WHILE DEEPENING. STRONG UPPER LEVEL HEIGHT FALLS ALONG WITH
STRENTHING WIND FIELDS AND SHEAR SHOULD BEGIN TO OVERSPREAD THE
WARM SECTOR OVER THE AREA. THIS SHOULD SET THE STAGE FOR
THUNDERSTORM DEVELOPMENT OVER THE AREA LATER SUNDAY
AFTERNOON...CONTINUING THROUGH SUNDAY NIGHT AND INTO MONDAY. AT
THIS TIME...THERE APPEARS TO BE SOME POTENTIAL FOR SEVERE
WEATHER. SINCE THIS SYSTEM IS STILL SEVERAL DAYS AWAY...THERE WILL
BE PLENTY OF TIME TO MONITOR THE EVENTUAL EVOLUTION OF THIS SYSTEM
AND ITS EFFECTS. BUT NEEDLESS TO SAY...SOMETHING TO DEFINITELY
WATCH FOR SEVERE POTENTIAL.

BY LATER MONDAY...THE LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM SHOULD LIFT WELL TO THE
NORTH ALONG WITH THE STRONG UPPER SUPPORT. AT THIS TIME...THE
MODELS ARE HINTING THAT THE TRAILING COLD FRONT MAY STALL
SOMEWHERE ACROSS THE AREA THROUGH THE BEGINNING OF NEXT WEEK...AS
THE SYSTEM NEVER REALLY CLEARS THROUGH THE AREA AND THE UPPER FLOW
REMAINS SOUTHWESTERLY. CONFIDENCE ON THIS PART OF THE FORECAST IS
RATHER LOW...SO FELT IT PRUDENT AT THIS POINT TO KEEP SLIGHT
CHANCE POPS IN THE FORECAST THROUGH TUESDAY WITH ABOVE NORMAL
TEMPERATURES. ANOTHER SYSTEM WILL MOVE THROUGH THE AREA BY MID-
WEEK BRINGING THE NEXT CHANCES FOR SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS AND
KEEPING A RATHER ACTIVE WEATHER PATTERN IN PLACE FOR NEXT WEEK.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
MEM  47  58  28  47 /  10  10  10   0 
MKL  42  54  18  44 /  10  10  10   0 
JBR  44  55  24  44 /  10  10  10   0 
TUP  45  61  27  47 /  10  10  10   0 

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
