AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
1045 AM CST WED NOV 23 2005

.UPDATE...

WEAK SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE OVER THE AREA THIS MORNING WILL KEEP
DRY WEATHER IN PLACE THROUGH THE DAY. A DEEP UPPER TROUGH OVER THE
EASTERN U.S. WILL KEEP THE FLOW ALOFT N0RTHWESTERLY WITH SOME MID
AND HIGH LEVEL MOISTURE STREAMING SOUTHEAST AND PRODUCING SOME CLOUDINESS
TODAY. THESE MID AND HIGH CLOUDS WILL REMAIN SCATTERED TO
OCCASIONALLY BROKEN AT TIMES...SO DECIDED TO KEEP THE PARTLY
CLOUDY WORDING AREAWIDE GOING IN THE FORECAST. SOUTHWEST WINDS
WILL ALSO BE RATHER STRONG AND GUSTY TODAY...AS A LOW PRESSURE
SYSTEM DEEPENS OVER THE GREAT LAKES REGION HELPING TO INCREASE THE
LOW LEVEL PRESSURE GRADIENT. WITH THIS IN MIND...HAVE BUMPED WIND
SPEEDS UP SOME...WITH GUSTS UP TO 30 MPH THIS AFTERNOON. OTHERWISE...THE
FORECAST LOOKS GOOD WITH CONTINUED DRY AND WARMER WEATHER THIS
AFTERNOON...WITH HIGHS TEMPS NEAR 60 NORTHEAST SECTIONS TO THE MID
60S SOUTHWEST SECTIONS.

UPDATED GRIDS AND ZONE FORECAST OUT SHORTLY.

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 231021
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
419 AM CST WED NOV 23 2005

.DISCUSSION...00Z UPPER AIR ANALYSIS PLACES UPPER LEVEL LOW ACROSS 
NEW ENGLAND WITH LONG WAVE TROUGH EXTENDING ALONG THE EAST COAST OF 
THE UNITED STATES. UPPER LEVEL RIDGING REMAINS IN PLACE ACROSS THE 
WESTERN UNITED STATES WITH THE MISSISSIPPI VALLEY IN CYCLONIC FLOW 
WITH NUMEROUS SHORTWAVES EMBEDDED WITHIN THE SYNOPTIC FLOW. AT THE 
SURFACE A SURFACE TROUGH EXTENDS ACROSS THE CENTRAL/SOUTHERN PLAINS. 
MAIN FORECAST CONCERNS THIS FORECAST PACKAGE IS LOW TEMPERATURES 
FRIDAY AFTER FRONTAL PASSAGE AND NEXT CHANCE OF PRECIPITATION BY THE 
LATER HALF OF THE WEEKEND INTO NEXT WEEK. 

TODAY...QUIET WEATHER EXPECTED ACROSS THE MID SOUTH TODAY WITH WEAK 
RIDGING IN PLACE THIS MORNING. INFRARED SATELLITE THIS MORNING SHOWS 
SOME MID LEVEL CLOUDS ASSOCIATED WITH A WEAK MID LEVEL SHORTWAVE 
ACROSS THE EXTREME NORTHEAST SECTION OF THE FORECAST AREA THIS 
MORNING AND EXTENDING FURTHER NORTH ACROSS THE EASTERN HALF OF 
MISSOURI. WENT WITH MOSTLY CLOUDY SKIES ACROSS PORTIONS OF WESTERN 
TENNESSEE THIS MORNING WITH PARTLY CLOUDY SKIES ELSEWHERE. HIGH 
TEMPERATURES TODAY WILL BE IN THE 60S. A FEW AREAS MAY SEE SOME 
GUSTY WINDS THIS AFTERNOON WITH 950 MB WINDS AROUND 30 KTS. 

TONIGHT AND THANKSGIVING DAY...COLD FRONT CURRENTLY LOCATED ACROSS 
CENTRAL MANITOBA WILL DIVE DOWN ACROSS THE MISSISSIPPI VALLEY 
TONIGHT AND THANKSGIVING DAY. BOTH THE NAM/GFS SUGGEST FRONTAL 
PASSAGE OCCURRING DURING THE MORNING HOURS. MID LEVEL DYNAMICAL 
FORCING WITH THIS SYSTEM IS LESS THAN IDEAL AND LACKING 
MOISTURE...RESULTING IN DRY FRONTAL PASSAGE ACROSS THE LOWER 
MISSISSIPPI VALLEY. 

THURSDAY NIGHT AND FRIDAY...COLD NIGHT EXPECTED ACROSS PORTIONS OF 
THE FORECAST AREA AS 0C TO -5C 850 MB AIR DRAINS INTO PORTIONS OF 
THE LOWER MISSISSIPPI VALLEY. 1000-500 MB LAYER RH/S WILL DROP TO 
AROUND 35 PERCENT AND MODEL SOUNDINGS SUGGEST TEMPERATURES COULD 
EASILY DROP INTO THE LOWER 20S BY FRIDAY MORNING...ESPECIALLY ACROSS 
THE NORTHERN HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA. 

LONG RANGE (SATURDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...A LONGWAVE TROUGH WILL ENTER 
THE PACIFIC COAST ON FRIDAY WITH A CUTOFF LOW DEVELOPING ACROSS THE 
SOUTHWEST UNITED STATES. MODEL RUN TO RUN CONSISTENCY ISSUES PERSIST 
WITH THIS SECTION OF THE FORECAST AS A PATTERN SHIFT IS ABOUT TO 
TAKE PLACE NEXT WEEK WITH THE MID SOUTH TRANSITIONING FROM NORTHWEST 
FLOW TO SOUTHWEST FLOW ALOFT. THE GFS/EUROPEAN...ESPECIALLY BEYOND 
144 HRS AS THE LATEST RUN OF THE GFS PLACES THE UPPER LEVEL LOW 
ACROSS OKLAHOMA AND THE EUROPEAN SOLUTION PREFERRING THE LOW ACROSS 
MINNESOTA. INTERESTINGLY ENOUGH BOTH THE 00Z GFS AND 06Z DGEX SHOW 
THE UPPER LEVEL LOW BECOMING NEGATIVELY TILTED BY 12Z TUESDAY ACROSS 
MISSOURI...BUT NOT READY JUST YET TO BUY INTO THAT SOLUTION WITH 
MODEL CONSISTENCY ISSUES.  OTHER SOLUTIONS FROM THE NOGAPS...DGEX AND 
CANADIAN SUPPORT THE GFS AND WILL TREND TOWARDS GFS SOLUTION. AS A 
RESULT...ADJUSTED POPS TO CHANCE SATURDAY NIGHT AS COLD FRONTAL 
BOUNDARY MOVES BACK NORTH AS A WARM FRONT ACROSS THE AREA INTO 
SUNDAY. LITTLE IF ANY CHANGES WERE MADE BEYOND MONDAY.  
&&

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
944 PM CST TUE NOV 22 2005

.UPDATE...
MINOR ADJUSTMENTS TO WINDS AND CLOUDS FOR CURRENT TRENDS...MAINLY
TO LOWER MIN TEMPS ACROSS NORTHEAST HALF OF CWA 3 TO 5 DEGREES.
UPDATE OUT SHORTLY.

&&

.PREV DISCUSSION... (ISSUED 245 PM CST TUE NOV 22 2005) 

DISCUSSION...

TONIGHT...HUGE TROUGH OVER THE EASTERN STATES IS PUSHING MORE OF
THE CURRENT SURFACE HIGH TOWARD THE GULF COAST. MID LEVEL MOISTURE
COMING DOWN THE WEST SIDE OF THE TROUGH SHOULD STAY TO THE EAST OF
OUR AREA TONIGHT. AS A RESULT...COOL/DRY WEATHER WILL PERSIST
TONIGHT.

WEDNESDAY...A STRONG SURFACE LOW WILL COME DOWN THE WEST SIDE OF
THE TROUGH NEAR LAKE SUPERIOR AND ROTATE DOWN TOWARD MICHIGAN
WHILE OUR CURRENT HIGH CENTERS IN THE WESTERN GULF. THE LOW OVER
MICHIGAN WILL BRING IN ANOTHER COLD OUTBREAK WITH THE LEADING
EDGE OF THE FRONT BEING NEAR MINNEAPOLIS BY WEDNESDAY EVENING.

WEDNESDAY NIGHT...THE LOW WILL CENTER OVER WESTERN ONTARIO AND
THE COLD FRONT WILL MOVE QUICKLY DOWN THROUGH THE MIDWEST TO NEAR
MEMPHIS OVERNIGHT. NO PRECIPITATION IS EXPECTED WITH THE FRONT.

THURSDAY...COLD AIR WILL BLOW IN FROM THE NORTH ALL DAY LONG AS
THE FRONT GOES ON DOWN TO THE GULF COAST. IT WILL BE 5 TO 10
DEGREES COOLER THURSDAY COMPARED TO WEDNESDAY.

THURSDAY NIGHT...VERY COLD CONDITIONS ARE EXPECTED THURSDAY
NIGHT. BY DAYBREAK...LOOK FOR LOWER 20S AROUND PARIS TO THE MID
3S0 AROUND CLARKSDALE.

FRIDAY...THE COLD AIRMASS WILL MOVE ON TO EAST TENNESSEE. THE
MAJOR UPPER TROUGH IN THE EAST WILL LIFT OUT SOME AS A CUT OFF
LOW OVER THE SOUTHWEST GETS TO NORTHERN MEXICO. PCPN WILL DEVELOP
NORTHEAST OF THE CUTOFF IN SE TX AND S LA BY FRI EVENING.

FRIDAY NIGHT...THE UPPER CUTOFF LOW REMAINS PRETTY MUCH IN N
MEXICO AND FUNNELS MOISTURE UP THROUGH EASTERN TEX AND SW AR.

SATURDAY THROUGH NEXT TUESDAY...THE CUTOFF WILL MOVE NORTHEAST
AND WEAKEN. CHANCE ARE DECENT FOR THIS SYSTEM TO BRING THE
MIDSOUTH SIGNIFICANTS AMTS OF RAIN BY MONDAY MORNING. MONDAY AND
TUESDAY A STRONGER CUTOFF WILL MOVE IN FROM THE SOUTHWEST AND
BRING ANOTHER BATCH OF SHOWERS AND POSSIBLY THUNDERSTORMS.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
1100 AM CST TUE NOV 22 2005

.DISCUSSION...
RIDGING TO BUILD MORE TDA BOTH AT SURFACE AND ALOFT. THIS WILL
KEEP WINDS NORTHERLY AND GUSTY AT TIMES. HIGHS WILL BE LIMITED TO
THE UPPER 40S TO MID 50S. SKIES SHOULD AVERAGE OUT TO BE PARTLY
CLDY THE REST OF THE DAY.

HAVE ALREADY ADJUSTED TDAS FCST FOR TRENDS ALREADY DEVELOPING.

.PREVIOUS DISCUSSION...
DISCUSSION...00Z UPPER AIR ANALYSIS PLACES UPPER LEVEL LOW ACROSS
NORTHERN GEORGIA WITH TROUGH AXIS ACROSS MICHIGAN AND THE OHIO
VALLEY...AND A RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE ACROSS THE PACIFIC COAST.
MEANWHILE...A 850 MB SHORTWAVE EVIDENT ON WATER VAPOR
IMAGERY/PROFILER DATA WAS MOVING ACROSS THE LOWER MISSISSIPPI
VALLEY THIS MORNING. TEMPERATURES THIS MORNING ACROSS THE
FORECAST AREA ARE PRIMARILY IN THE 40S.

850 MB SHORTWAVE WILL MOVE ACROSS THE MID SOUTH TODAY PRODUCING
NOT MUCH MORE THAN PARTLY CLOUDY SKIES WITH 1000-500 MB LAYER
RH/S AROUND 60 PERCENT...DECREASING TO 40 PERCENT BY LATER IN THE
AFTERNOON. HIGH TEMPERATURES WILL BE IN THE LOWER TO MIDDLE 50S
ACROSS THE MID SOUTH WITH LOWS TONIGHT IN THE 30S.

THE FORECAST AREA WILL CONTINUE TO REMAIN IN CYCLONIC FLOW ALOFT
AS NEXT FRONT FROM CANADA DIVES ACROSS THE MISSISSIPPI VALLEY ON
THANKSGIVING DAY WITH 850 MB TEMPERATURES DROPPING BETWEEN 0C TO
-5C BY THURSDAY NIGHT BEHIND THE COLD FRONT. A DRY FRONTAL
PASSAGE IS ANTICIPATED ACROSS THE MID SOUTH WITH HIGHER RELATIVE
HUMIDITIES AND ISENTROPIC ASCENT PASSING TO THE NORTH AND EAST OF
THE FORECAST AREA.

LONG RANGE...(FRIDAY AND BEYOND)...UPPER LEVEL LOW ACROSS HUDSON
BAY WILL MOVE NORTHEAST INTO THE CANADIAN MARITIMES WHILE UPPER
LEVEL RIDGING FROM THE ROCKIES MOVES EAST INTO THE MISSISSIPPI
VALLEY. THIS RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE WON/T LAST LONG AS NEXT
TROUGH ENTERS THE PACIFIC COAST BY SATURDAY AND A CLOSED LOW
DEVELOPS ACROSS THE SOUTHWEST UNITED STATES...EVENTUALLY
AFFECTING THE MID SOUTH BY EARLY NEXT WEEK. GFS/DGEX SEEMS TO
HAVE BEST HANDLE ON THE LONG RANGE FORECAST WITH 00Z EUROPEAN RUN
AS AN OUTLIER TAKING THE UPPER LEVEL LOW MUCH FURTHER ACROSS
KANSAS/MISSOURI. AS A RESULT...RAISED POPS TO CHANCE ACROSS AREAS
MAINLY IN NORTHERN MISSISSIPPI TO REFLECT THIS TREND.

FXUS64 KMEG 220318
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
918 PM CST MON NOV 21 2005

.UPDATE...
GOING FORECAST APPEARS TO BE IN PRETTY GOOD SHAPE. HIGH CLOUDS
MOVING SOUTHEAST THROUGH MISSOURI...AND WILL BE IN OUR AREA IN THE
NEXT FEW HOURS. GOING FORECAST OF PARTLY CLOUDY IS REASONABLE.
TEMPERATURES MAY EVENTUALLY BE A CONCERN...AS HIGH CLOUDS COULD
CUT OFF COOLING. MINOR UPDATE TO BE ISSUED HANDLING CURRENT
TRENDS...INCLUDING LOWERING TEMPS NEAR PHT...ALREADY AT FORECAST LOW.

&&

.PREV DISCUSSION... (ISSUED 255 PM CST MON NOV 21 2005) 

DISCUSSION...

CURRENTLY...UPPER LOW MOVING QUICKLY EAST OF THE REGION THIS
AFTERNOON. PARTLY CLOUDY SKIES PREVAIL ACRS THE REGION WITH TEMPS
IN THE MID 50S AND A NORTHWESTERLY BREEZE.

TONIGHT AND TUESDAY...CLOUDS WILL CONT TO DIMINISH DURING THE
EVENING HOURS THEN A 500MB SHORTWAVE WILL DIVE SOUTH INTO THE
REGION BRINGING A REINFORCING SHOT OF COOL AIR. SURFACE WINDS WILL
STAY UP SO LOW TEMPS IN THE 30S SEEM REASONABLE. MODELS INDICATING
SOME MID LEVELS CLOUDINESS ASSOCD WITH THE SHORTWAVE SWEEPING
ACROSS THE MID SOUTH TONIGHT FOLLOWED BY SOME LOWER LEVEL MOISTURE
WORKING INTO PARTS OF W TN DURING THE MORNING HOURS. TUE WL BE
BREEZY AND COOL WITH TEMPS ONLY AROUND 50.

TUE NIGHT THROUGH WED NIGHT...SURFACE RIDGE QUICKLY MOVES ACROSS THE
AREA TUE NIGHT. LOW TEMPS WL BE TRICKY DEPENDING ON HOW QUICKLY
THE RETURN FLOW RESTARTS AFTER THE RIDGE AXIS MOVES THROUGH. SURFACE
WINDS TURN SOUTHWESTERLY AND INCREASE AS A BROAD SURFACE TROF
MOVES THROUGH THE AREA ON WED. STRONG LOW LEVEL WAA WL LEAD TO
TEMPS IN THE 60S WED AFTN. WED NIGHT WL BE RELATIVELY MILD WITH
LOWS IN THE 40S. 

THURSDAY THROUGH FRIDAY...STRONG SHORTWAVE MOVES INTO THE OH
VALLEY THURSDAY WITH COLD FRONT PUSHING THROUGH DURING THE DAY.
MUCH COOLER AIR WL BE FILTERING IN BUT NOT BEFORE A HALFWAY DECENT
THANKSGIVING. SURFACE WINDS WILL INCREASE DURING THE AFTERNOON
WITH HIGHS IN THE UPPER 50S NORTH TO LOWER 60S SOUTH. COLD HIGH
PRESSURE SETTLES ACRS THE AREA THU NIGHT AND SUB FREEZING TEMPS
SHOULD BE COMMON BY 12Z FRI. FRIDAY WL BE A COOL DAY WITH TEMPS IN
THE 50S. 

EXTENDED...HIGH PRESSURE SLIPS EAST FRIDAY NIGHT AND SATURDAY.
UPPER TROF MOVES OUT OF TEXAS AND CREATES A POTENTIAL OVERRUNNING
EVENT SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY. 12Z MODELS SUPPRESSING SYSTEM
SOUTHWARD BY MONDAY. 

&&

SOME MID LEVELS CLOUDINESS ASSOCD WITH THE SHORTWAVE SWEEPING
ACROSS THE MID SOUTH TONIGHT FOLLOWED BY SOME LOWER LEVEL MOISTURE
WORKING INTO PARTS OF W TN DURING THE MORNING HOURS. TUE WL BE
BREEZY AND COOL WITH TEMPS ONLY AROUND 50.

TUE NIGHT THROUGH WED NIGHT...SURFACE RIDGE QUICKLY MOVES ACROSS THE
AREA TUE NIGHT. LOW TEMPS WL BE TRICKY DEPENDING ON HOW QUICKLY
THE RETURN FLOW RESTARTS AFTER THE RIDGE AXIS MOVES THROUGH. SURFACE
WINDS TURN SOUTHWESTERLY AND INCREASE AS A BROAD SURFACE TROF
MOVES THROUGH THE AREA ON WED. STRONG LOW LEVEL WAA WL LEAD TO
TEMPS IN THE 60S WED AFTN. WED NIGHT WL BE RELATIVELY MILD WITH
LOWS IN THE 40S. 

THURSDAY THROUGH FRIDAY...STRONG SHORTWAVE MOVES INTO THE OH
VALLEY THURSDAY WITH COLD FRONT PUSHING THROUGH DURING THE DAY.
MUCH COOLER AIR WL BE FILTERING IN BUT NOT BEFORE A HALFWAY DECENT
THANKSGIVING. SURFACE WINDS WILL INCREASE DURING THE AFTERNOON
WITH HIGHS IN THE UPPER 50S NORTH TO LOWER 60S SOUTH. COLD HIGH
PRESSURE SETTLES ACRS THE AREA THU NIGHT AND SUB FREEZING TEMPS
SHOULD BE COMMON BY 12Z FRI. FRIDAY WL BE A COOL DAY WITH TEMPS IN
THE 50S. 

EXTENDED...HIGH PRESSURE SLIPS EAST FRIDAY NIGHT AND SATURDAY.
UPPER TROF MOVES OUT OF TEXAS AND CREATES A POTENTIAL OVERRUNNING
EVENT SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY. 12Z MODELS SUPPRESSING SYSTEM
SOUTHWARD BY MONDAY. 

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
MEM  39  52  36  64 /  10  10  10  10 
MKL  36  48  29  59 /  10  10  10  10 
JBR  36  50  34  63 /  10  10  10  10 
TUP  39  51  32  62 /  10  10  10  10 

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.
&&

SJM

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 211547
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
947 AM CST MON NOV 21 2005

.UPDATE...

THE UPPER LOW WAS MOVING ACROSS S CNTRL MS THIS MORNING. ASSOCD
LIGHT PRECIP STRETCHES ACROSS PARTS OF NE MS WITH CLOUD COVER
EAST OF A PARIS TN TO OXFORD MS LINE. DURING THE AFTERNOON THE
UPPER LOW WILL RACE EASTWARD THROUGH AL AND INTO WRN GA. PRECIP
ACRS NE MS WL DIMINISH WITH CLOUD COVER DECREASING FROM THE WEST
AS THE AFTERNOON WEARS ON. HAVE UPDATED CLOUD AND PRECIP TRENDS.

&&

.PREV DISCUSSION... (ISSUED 327 AM CST MON NOV 21 2005) 

DISCUSSION...

A CLOSED UPPER LEVEL LOW IS LOCATED OVER NORTHERN LA THIS MORNING
WITH A DEVELOPING SURFACE LOW LOCATED OFF THE FL PANHANDLE.
SATELLITE SHOWS THE ENHANCED COLDER CLOUD TOP TEMPERATURES FROM
NORTHEAST MS SOUTHWARD...GRADUALLY MOVING TO THE NORTHEAST. THIS
IS IN AN AREA OF GOOD UPPER LEVEL DIFFLUENCE AHEAD OF THE UPPER LOW.
RADARS SHOW RAIN SPREADING ACROSS NORTHEAST MS INTO THE SOUTHEAST
CORNER OF WEST TN. HOWEVER...THE LOWER LEVELS HAVE BEEN QUITE DRY
AND THE RAIN HAS BEEN SLOW TO REACH THE GROUND. THE LOWER
ATMOSPHERE IS GRADUALLY MOISTENING WITH SURFACE OBSERVATIONS
INCLUDING TUPELO REPORTING SOME LIGHT RAIN.

FOR TODAY...THE UPPER LEVEL LOW WILL MOVE EAST OF THE MID-SOUTH AND
DEEPEN WHILE THE ASSOCIATED SURFACE LOW MOVES TOWARD SOUTH
CAROLINA. WILL HAVE POPS RANGING FROM LIKELY ACROSS PARTS OF
NORTHEAST MS TO LESS THAN 20 PERCENT FROM EXTREME NORTHEAST AR
ACROSS THE MO BOOTHEEL. CLOUDS WILL HELP TO HOLD TEMPERATURES DOWN
WITH THE BEST CHANCE FOR SUNSHINE ACROSS NORTHEAST AR AND THE MO
BOOTHEEL TODAY.

FOR TONIGHT AND TUESDAY...NORTHERLY WINDS WILL FEED COOLER AIR
INTO THE MID-SOUTH WITH HIGH PRESSURE TO OUR WEST AND LOW PRESSURE
MOVING UP THE EAST COAST. SKIES WILL BE PARTLY CLOUDY AS A 500 MB
VORT MAX LOCATED IN NORTHWEST FLOW MOVES JUST TO OUR EAST.

ON WEDNESDAY...WINDS WILL TURN TO THE SOUTHWEST ALLOWING FOR
WARMER TEMPERATURES. CONDITIONS WILL REMAIN DRY. WINDS WILL TURN
BACK TO THE NORTH ON THANKSGIVING AND WILL ALLOW COOLER AIR TO SPILL
BACK INTO THE MID-SOUTH. THE LATEST GFS PUSHES THE MAIN BRUNT OF
THE COLDER AIR TO OUR EAST. RAISED MAX TEMPERATURES SOME IN THE
EXTENDED TO BE BETTER IN LINE WITH SURROUNDING OFFICES.

SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE WILL PUSH INTO THE AREA FROM THE NORTHEAST
OVER THE WEEKEND. THE GFS INDICATES SOUTHWEST FLOW ALOFT COULD
RESULT IN SOME OVERRUNNING SUNDAY. WILL MENTION 20 PERCENT CHANCE
OF SHOWERS SUNDAY...BUT AM NOT TOO IMPRESSED WITH THIS ATTM BASED
ON THE LATEST GFS MODEL RUN.

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.
&&

$$

SJM/JCL

FXUS64 KMEG 210252
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
852 PM CST SUN NOV 20 2005

.DISCUSSION...

AN ELONGATED UPPER LOW EXTENDS FROM SOUTHWEST MISSOURI INTO THE
ARKLATEX REGION. A PLUME OF MOISTURE IS MOVING NORTHWARD AHEAD OF
THE LOW. THIS MOISTURE IS CLIPPING NORTHEAST MISSISSIPPI RESULTING
IN A FEW LIGHT RAIN SHOWERS. NO MAJOR CHANGES ANTICIPATED FOR
TONIGHTS FORECAST. UPPER LOW AND ASSOCIATED MOISTURE PLUME WILL
CONTINUE RAIN CHANCES. BETTER RAIN CHANCES WILL BE SOUTH AND EAST
OF THE MID SOUTH WHERE UPPER LEVEL WINDS ARE MORE SUPPORTIVE OF
STRONGER LIFT.

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 201924
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
130 PM CST SUN NOV 20 2005

.DISCUSSION...

CLOUDS WILL CONTINUE TO MOVE INTO THE MIDSOUTH TONIGHT AS AN UPPER 
LEVEL LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM DRIFTS SOUTHEASTWARD FROM SOUTHWEST 
MISSOURI. IN ADDITION...A SFC LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM WILL DEVELOP OVER 
THE FLORIDA PANHANDLE AND WILL SPREAD CLOUDS NORTHWESTWARD ALONG 
WITH A CHANCE FOR RAIN. EXPECT BULK OF RAINFALL TO REMAIN OVER 
SOUTHEASTERN PORTIONS OF THE MIDSOUTH. ALTHOUGH OTHER PARTS OF THE 
CWA STILL COULD SEE A FEW SPRINKLES AS THE UPPER LOW MOVES THROUGH 
THE AREA. THESE TWO SYSTEMS WILL SLOWLY MOVE EASTWARD BUT WILL 
CONTINUE TO AFFECT THE WEATHER ACROSS THE MIDSOUTH THROUGH LATE 
MONDAY. EXPECT MOSTLY CLOUDY TO CLOUDY CONDITIONS DURING THIS TIME 
WITH COOLER TEMPERATURES.

HIGH PRESSURE WILL BUILD INTO THE MIDSOUTH FOR THE MIDDLE PART OF 
THE WEEK. EXPECT TEMPERATURES TO SLOWLY MODERATE WITH DRY CONDITIONS 
CONTINUING ACROSS THE AREA.

A REINFORCING COLD FRONT WILL MOVE THOUGH THE MIDSOUTH WEDNESDAY 
NIGHT. THE FRONT WILL COME THROUGH THE AREA DRY BUT WILL BRING 
COOLER TEMPERATURES TO THE AREA FOR THE THANKSGIVING WEEKEND. EXPECT 
HIGH TEMPERATURES IN THE UPPER 40S TO MID 50S WITH LOWS IN THE 20S 
AND 30S DURING MUCH OF THE HOLIDAY WEEKEND WITH DRY CONDITIONS.

A LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM WILL DEVELOP EARLY SUNDAY ACROSS TEXAS AND 
WILL MOVE TOWARD THE MIDSOUTH. EXPECT THE SYSTEM TO BRING THE BEST 
CHANCE OF RAIN DURING THE FORECAST PERIOD TO THE AREA.

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.

&&

FXUS64 KMEG 201529
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
930 AM CST SUN NOV 20 2005

.DISCUSSION...

A DECK OF ALTOCUMULUS CLOUDS ARE CURRENTLY SPREADING NORTHEASTWARD 
ACROSS THE MIDSOUTH. SOME LIGHT RAIN OR EVEN SPRINKLES MAY FALL 
ACROSS NORTHEAST ARKANSAS MUCH LIKE YESTERDAY AS CLOUDS AHEAD OF THE 
UPPER LOW MOVE INTO THE AREA. EXPECT CONDITIONS TO BECOME MOSTLY 
CLOUDY ACROSS THE ENTIRE AREA BY THIS AFTERNOON. TEMPERATURES ARE 
CURRENTLY IN THE 40S AND ARE EXPECTED TO REACH HIGHS IN THE MID 50S 
TO THE LOWER 60S. CURRENT FORECAST LOOKS GOOD...WILL UPDATE LATER 
THIS MORNING TO REMOVE MENTION OF MORNING WORDING THE SKY CONDITION 
GROUP.



000 
FXUS64 KMEG 200957
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
357 AM CST SUN NOV 20 2005

.DISCUSSION...

AN UPPER LEVEL TROUGH EXTENDS THROUGH THE CENTRAL AND SOUTHERN
PLAINS THIS MORNING WITH A CLOSED LOW OVER KS. MID-LEVEL CLOUDS
ARE STREAMING ACROSS THE MID-SOUTH IN ADVANCE OF THIS SYSTEM
HELPING TO HOLD TEMPERATURES UP ACROSS MUCH OF THE AREA. THINK
CLOUDS WILL INCREASE ACROSS THE MID-SOUTH TODAY AS THE UPPER
TROUGH EDGES CLOSER. IN ADDITION...WILL ADD A SLIGHT CHANCE OF
LIGHT RAIN TO PART OF NORTHEAST AR FOR TODAY AS SATELLITE SHOWS
SOME ENHANCEMENT OF THE CLOUD TOPS ACROSS WESTERN AR MOVING EAST. 

GENERALLY WILL FOLLOW THE GFS IN THIS MORNINGS FORECAST...WHICH
AGREES CLOSELY WITH WHAT WE HAVE GOING. THE CLOSED UPPER LEVEL LOW
WILL DIG TO OUR SOUTH AND THEN MOVE TO OUR EAST BY MONDAY
AFTERNOON. MEANWHILE...A SURFACE LOW IS FORECAST TO DEVELOP ALONG
THE FL/GA BORDER TONIGHT...THEN MOVE NORTHEASTWARD ALONG THE EAST
COAST. WILL CONTINUE WITH OUR CURRENT POP FORECAST RANGING FROM SMALL
POPS TONIGHT AND MONDAY FROM EXTREME NORTHEAST AR INTO EXTREME
NORTHWEST TN TO LIKELY POPS ACROSS NORTHEAST MS. THE GREATEST
THREAT OF RAIN WILL BE OVER NORTHEAST MS WHERE THE MOISTURE WILL
BE GREATER AND ALSO CLOSER TO THE DEVELOPING SURFACE LOW. RAIN
AMOUNTS WILL BE MOSTLY LIGHT AS WE NEVER GET A GOOD SOUTHERLY
INFLUX OF MOISTURE AT THE LOWER LEVELS.

THE UPPER LOW WILL MOVE TO OUR EAST MONDAY NIGHT TAKING THE RAIN
WITH IT. COLDER AIR WILL SPILL INTO THE MID-SOUTH ON NORTHERLY WINDS MONDAY
NIGHT AND TUESDAY AS A TIGHT GRADIENT EXIST BETWEEN SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE
TO OUR WEST AND THE LOW PRESSURE ALONG THE EAST COAST. RELATIVE
HUMIDITY PROGS INDICATE COLD AIR STRATOCUMULUS SPREADING INTO MUCH
OF THE MID-SOUTH LATE MONDAY NIGHT AND TUESDAY MORNING. A 500 MB VORT
MAX IS FORECAST TO AFFECT EASTERN AREAS OF THE MID-SOUTH LATE
MONDAY NIGHT...COULD SQUEEZE OUT SOME SNOW FLURRIES BUT WILL NOT
MENTION ATTM.

A BRIEF WARMUP WILL OCCUR WEDNESDAY AS WINDS TURN TO THE
SOUTHWEST. A COLD FRONT WILL MOVE THROUGH THE MID-SOUTH FROM THE
NORTH WEDNESDAY NIGHT BRINGING ANOTHER SHOT OF COLD AIR FROM THANKSGIVING
INTO FRIDAY. THE LATEST GFS INDICATES SOME MOISTURE BEHIND THE
FRONT...BUT FOR NOW WILL KEEP THE FORECAST DRY INDICATING ONLY CLOUDS.

&&

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
916 PM CST SAT NOV 19 2005

.DISCUSSION...

SURFACE MAP PLACES A SLOW MOVING COLD FRONT FROM WESTERN MISSOURI
INTO EASTERN OKLAHOMA. THE MID SOUTH IS IN LIGHT SOUTHERLY FLOW
AHEAD OF THE FRONT. THE FRONT IS NOT EXPECTED TO ARRIVE TILL
TOMORROW. AN UPPER LOW IS ALSO NOTED OVER EASTERN KANSAS INTO
WESTERN MISSOURI AND WILL RESULT IN RAIN CHANCES OVER THE NEXT DAY
OR SO. MEANWHILE...PARTLY CLOUDY CONDITIONS ARE HAVING A BIG
IMPACT ON TEMPS TONIGHT. WHEN CLOUDS MOVE OVER AN AREA TEMPS RISE
INTO THE 40S...WHEN THEY CLEAR OUT TEMPS DROP INTO THE 30S. MODELS
SHOW A GENERAL THICKENING OF CLOUDS WEST OF THE MISSOURI RIVER
OVERNIGHT AS THE FRONT APPROACHES. HAVE RISEN TEMPS SOME IN THOSE
AREAS. ELSEWHERE ONLY SIGNIFICANT ADJUSTMENT TO TEMPS WAS OVER
NORTHEAST MISSISSIPPI WHERE CLOUDS HAVE NOT BEEN AS NOTICEABLE
THIS EVENING.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
200 PM CST SAT NOV 19 2005

.DISCUSSION...

MIDSOUTH WILL BE LOCATED BETWEEN WEATHER SYSTEMS TONIGHT. SHORTWAVE 
MOVING THROUGH THE AREA CURRENTLY WILL MOVE OUT OF THE MIDSOUTH BY 
EVENING ALLOWING SKY CONDITIONS TO RETURN TO AT LEAST PARTLY CLOUDY  
DEPENDING ON HOW MUCH CIRRUS IS AROUND.  LOWS WILL BE A LITTLE 
WARMER TONIGHT AND WILL RANGE FROM THE LOWER 30S TO THE UPPER 30S 
ACROSS THE AREA.

AN UPPER LEVEL LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM WILL APPROACH THE AREA FOR THE 
LATTER PART OF THE WEEKEND INTO EARLY NEXT WEEK. MODELS STILL DIFFER 
ON TIMING AND LOCATION OF THE LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM...WITH THE GFS 
BEING A LITTLE FASTER THAN THE NAM AND THE NAM A LITTLE FURTHER 
SOUTH. NONETHELESS...THE UPPER LOW WILL SPREAD SHOWERS INTO THE CWA 
BEGINNING SUNDAY NIGHT ENDING SOMETIME MONDAY NIGHT. MONDAY WILL BE 
THE BEST CHANCE FOR RAINFALL ACROSS THE AREA. ALTHOUGH RAINFALL 
TOTALS WILL REMAIN ON THE LIGHT SIDE. COOLER TEMPERATURES ARE 
EXPECTED WITH THE UPPER LEVEL LOW. HIGHS MAY STRUGGLE TO REACH 50 
DEGREES ON MONDAY.

HIGH PRESSURE WILL BUILD INTO THE MIDSOUTH FOR THE TUESDAY THROUGH 
WEDNESDAY TIME PERIOD. EXPECT PARTLY CLOUDY AND DRY CONDITIONS. 
EXPECT HIGHS IN THE 50S AND THE LOWS IN THE 30S DURING THIS TIME.

A REINFORCING COLD FRONT WILL MOVE THROUGH THE CWA WEDNESDAY NIGHT 
AND WILL BRING COLDER TEMPERATURES JUST IN TIME FOR THANKSGIVING. 
FRONT IS EXPECTED TO COME THROUGH AREA DRY. THANKSGIVING WILL ALSO 
BE DRY AS HIGH PRESSURE REBUILDS INTO THE AREA THROUGH THE END OF 
THE FORECAST PERIOD. EXPECT HIGHS IN THE UPPER 40S TO LOWER 50S WITH 
LOWS IN THE 20S AND 30S DURING THIS TIME.

AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
340 AM CST SAT NOV 19 2005

.DISCUSSION...

SATELLITE SHOWS WIDESPREAD MID-LEVEL CLOUDS STREAMING TOWARD THE
MID-SOUTH FROM THE SOUTHWEST THIS MORNING. THESE CLOUDS ARE AHEAD
OF AN UPPER LEVEL SHORTWAVE LOCATED IN THE SOUTHERN PLAINS...WHICH
IS FORECAST TO MOVE NORTHEASTWARD ACROSS THE MID-SOUTH TODAY AND
BECOME SHEARED. THINK THESE CLOUDS WILL OVERSPREAD THE AREA THIS
MORNING. CAN NOT RULE OUT A SPRINKLE OR TWO...BUT THE LOWER LEVELS
ARE RATHER DRY SO WILL NOT MENTION IN THE FORECAST. ATTM...NO
PRECIPITATION IS BEING REPORTED AT THE SURFACE IN ASSOCIATION WITH
THESE CLOUDS. WILL GO CLOSE TO THE COOLER MAV GUIDANCE SINCE THINK
THESE CLOUDS WILL HELP TO PUT A DAMPER ON HIGH TEMPERATURES TODAY.

FOR TONIGHT...THE SHORTWAVE WILL MOVE OUT OF THE MID-SOUTH LEAVING
THE AREA IN A LULL WEATHERWISE. AN UPPER LEVEL LOW WILL DEEPEN TO
THE WEST OF THE MID-SOUTH IN THE SOUTHERN / CENTRAL PLAINS (NAM AND
GFS DIFFER ON EXACT PLACEMENT). THIS UPPER LEVEL LOW WILL BE THE
MAIN INFLUENCE OVER OUR WEATHER SUNDAY INTO MONDAY. THIS LOW IS
FORECAST TO TRACK ACROSS THE MID-SOUTH WHILE A STRONG SURFACE LOW
DEVELOPS ALONG THE EAST COAST. THE GFS AND ECMWF MODELS ARE
CONSIDERABLY FASTER IN SPEED WITH THIS SYSTEM THAN THE NAM...WILL
LEAN TOWARD THE GFS / ECMWF BUT NOT TOTALLY DISCOUNT THE NAM ATTM.
THINK WE WILL SEE AN INCREASE IN CLOUDS SUNDAY...THEN A CHANCE OF
RAIN SUNDAY NIGHT AND MONDAY. RAIN CHANCES MAY NEED TO BE
INCREASED IN LATER FORECASTS. HOWEVER...WITH THE LOWER LEVELS
STARTING RATHER DRY AND NOT A GOOD SOUTHERLY FLOW AT THE LOWER
LEVELS...THINK MOST RAIN AMOUNTS WILL BE ON THE LIGHT SIDE. THE
GFS INDICATES THE LOW EAST OF OUR FORECAST AREA BY MONDAY NIGHT.

WILL CONTINUE WITH A DRY FORECAST FOR TUESDAY THROUGH FRIDAY. COLD
AIR WILL PUSH INTO THE AREA TUESDAY WITH A TIGHT SURFACE GRADIENT
BETWEEN HIGH PRESSURE TO OUR WEST AND THE SURFACE LOW ALONG THE
EAST COAST. A DRY COLD FRONT WILL PUSH THROUGH THE AREA WEDNESDAY
NIGHT WITH ANOTHER REINFORCING SHOT OF COLD AIR MOVING IN FOR
THANKSGIVING.

SUNDAY NIGHT INTO MONDAY NIGHT. WILL ADD SOME SMALL POPS TO THE 
FORECAST. HIGHS WILL RETURN TO THE 50S BEHIND THE SYSTEMS WITH LOWS 
IN THE 20S AND 30S.

WEEK. EXPECT PARTLY CLOUDY CONDITIONS TO RETURN TO THE AREA.

FRONT WILL COME THROUGH DRY BUT WOULDN/T BE SURPRISED IF A FEW 
FLURRIES FALL OVER EASTERN AREAS OF THE CWA BEHIND THE FRONT 
THANKSGIVING NIGHT AS A STRONG VORT MAX MOVES THROUGH THE REGION. 
COLDER TEMPERATURES ARE EXPECTED BEHIND THE FRONT.

HIGH PRESSURE WILL RETURN TO THE AREA FOR FRIDAY. EXPECT PARTLY

FXUS64 KMEG 180912
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
312 AM CST FRI NOV 18 2005

.DISCUSSION...

IT IS A COLD MORNING ACROSS THE MID-SOUTH WITH TEMPERATURES WELL
INTO THE 20S IN MOST LOCATIONS. SATELLITE SHOWS CLEAR SKIES ACROSS
THE AREA. THE UPPER LEVEL FLOW REMAINS OUT OF THE NORTHWEST WHILE
SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE EXTENDS ACROSS THE MID-SOUTH.

SUNNY SKIES CAN BE EXPECTED TODAY AS A STABLE AND VERY DRY AIR
MASS REMAINS OVER THE AREA. THE SURFACE HIGH WILL SLIDE TO THE
EAST BY LATE IN THE DAY WITH WINDS GRADUALLY TURNING TO THE SOUTH
ACROSS THE WESTERN HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA. TEMPERATURES WILL BE
A LITTLE WARMER THAN YESTERDAY.

THE WARMING TREND AND DRY WEATHER WILL CONTINUE INTO SATURDAY AS
WINDS INCREASE FROM THE SOUTHWEST. A COLD FRONT WILL PUSH THROUGH
SATURDAY NIGHT AND SUNDAY. MEANWHILE...AN UPPER LEVEL TROUGH IS
FORECAST TO MOVE THROUGH THE MID-SOUTH SUNDAY INTO MONDAY. THE GFS
IS AN OUTLIER TO OTHER MODELS INCLUDING THE NAM AND EUROPEAN IN
SHOWING A STRONGER CLOSED UPPER LEVEL LOW. ATTM...WILL LEAN TOWARD
THE WEAKER SOLUTION OF THE NAM...BUT WILL MONITOR LATER RUNS OF
THE GFS. MOISTURE ASSOCIATED WITH THE SURFACE COLD FRONT AND THE
UPPER LEVEL TROUGH APPEAR TO BE TOO LIMITED FOR ANY
PRECIPITATION...THUS WILL CONTINUE WITH A DRY FORECAST. LOW CLOUDS
ASSOCIATED WITH A COLD POOL AT 850 MB ARE FORECAST TO PUSH INTO
NORTHEAST ARKANSAS LATE SATURDAY NIGHT AND ACROSS THE MISSISSIPPI
RIVER SUNDAY. THESE CLOUDS WILL CLEAR MONDAY.

HIGH PRESSURE WILL BUILD INTO THE MID-SOUTH MONDAY. ANOTHER DRY
COLD FRONT IS FORECAST TO MOVE THROUGH MONDAY NIGHT AND TUESDAY
BRINGING ANOTHER GOOD SHOT OF COLD AIR. THEN ON THANKSGIVING DAY...YET
ANOTHER DRY COLD FRONT IS FORECAST TO PUSH THROUGH THE MID-SOUTH
KEEPING TEMPERATURES BELOW NORMAL.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
845 PM CST THU NOV 17 2005

.DISCUSSION...

CLEAR SKIES AND LIGHT WINDS HAVE ALLOWED TEMPERATURES TO DROP TO
THEIR LOWEST LEVELS SO FAR THIS SEASON. CURRENT FORECAST HAS A GOOD
HANDLE ON THE SITUATION SO NO CHANGES ARE PLANNED AT THIS TIME.

.PREVIOUS DISCUSSION...

COLD TEMPERATURES WILL CONTINUE THROUGH THE FORECAST PERIOD AS
SEVERAL REINFORCING COLD FRONTS EXPECTED OVER THE NEXT SEVERAL DAYS.

TONIGHT...COLD HIGH PRESSURE WILL REMAIN OVER THE MIDSOUTH. EXPECT
MOSTLY CLEAR SKIES WITH LIGHT WINDS. THESE CONDITIONS WILL HELP LOW
TEMPERATURES FALL EVEN FURTHER THAN LAST NIGHT. EXPECT LOWS RANGING
FROM THE UPPER TEENS TO THE MID 20S ACROSS THE CWA.

FRIDAY WILL BE ANOTHER COLD DAY BUT A LITTLE WARMER THAN TODAY.
EXPECT HIGHS IN THE UPPER 40S TO THE MID 50S.

HIGH PRESSURE WILL SHIFT EASTWARD BY FRIDAY NIGHT AND SATURDAY
ALLOWING FOR THE FIRST COLD FRONT TO APPROACH THE AREA. FRONT WILL
MOVE THROUGH THE AREA SATURDAY NIGHT INTO SUNDAY. EXPECT THE FRONT
TO MOVE THROUGH DRY AS NOT A LOT OF MOISTURE ASSOCIATED WITH THE
FRONT.

SHORT-LIVED HIGH PRESSURE WILL MOVE INTO THE AREA FOR SUNDAY NIGHT
AND MONDAY BEFORE ANOTHER DRY COLD FRONT MOVES THROUGH THE CWA
MONDAY NIGHT INTO TUESDAY.

HIGH PRESSURE WILL MOVE INTO THE MIDSOUTH ON TUESDAY AND WILL
CONTINUE THROUGH WEDNESDAY NIGHT BEFORE ANOTHER DRY FRONT MOVES INTO
THE AREA ON THANKSGIVING DAY. EXPECT HIGHS IN THE 50S WITH LOWS IN
THE 30 AND 40S DURING THE ENTIRE FORECAST PERIOD FOR THE MOST PART.

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 170936
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
336 AM CST THU NOV 17 2005

.DISCUSSION...

ANOTHER QUIET WEATHER MORNING ACROSS THE MID-SOUTH WITH CANADIAN
SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE CONTINUING TO SETTLE IN. TEMPERATURES HAVE
FALLEN OFF INTO THE 20S TO LOWER 30S ACROSS THE AREA...SO THE
ENTIRE AREA WILL REMAIN BELOW FREEZING THROUGH SUNRISE. SOME
LOCATIONS ACROSS EASTERN SECTIONS OF THE AREA HAVE FALLEN INTO THE
LOW AND MID 20S WITH A HARD FREEZE. WILL CONTINUE THE FREEZE
WARNING THROUGH 9 AM. WILL LET DAY SHIFT EVALUATE THE SITUATION
CONCERNING POSSIBLE FREEZE WARNING FOR TONIGHT...BUT THINK MOST
AREAS...EXCEPT MAYBE OUR SOUTHERN TIER COUNTIES AND URBAN
AREAS...WILL HAVE ENDED THIS YEARS GROWING SEASON. THIS WILL NEED
TO BE EVALUATED LATER ONCE TEMPERATURES BOTTOM OUT TO THIS
MORNINGS LOWS. SKIES ALSO REMAIN CLEAR WITH NORTH WINDS BETWEEN
5-10 MPH.

SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE WILL REMAIN OVER THE AREA THROUGH THE END OF
THE WEEK...WITH A COOL AND DRY NORTHWESTERLY FLOW IN THE MID AND
UPPER LEVELS OF THE ATMOSPHERE. THIS MEANS ANOTHER SUNNY DAY TODAY
WITH TEMPERATURES ONLY REACHING THE MID 40S NORTH TO THE LOW 50S
FAR SOUTHERN AREAS. THE SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE WILL SLIDE EAST
TONIGHT AND BE CENTERED OVER THE MID-SOUTH. THIS WILL SET THE
STAGE FOR EXCELLENT RADIATIONAL COOLING CONDITIONS...WITH CLEAR
SKIES AND LIGHT WINDS. EXPECT TEMPERATURES TONIGHT TO BE A COUPLE
OF DEGREES COLDER THAN THIS MORNING...FALLING INTO THE UPPER
TEENS IN NORTHEAST SECTIONS TO THE MID 20S SOUTH AND IN URBAN
AREAS. ON FRIDAY...AFTER A VERY COLD START EXPECT TEMPERATURES TO
WARM A FEW DEGREES ABOVE THURSDAYS HIGHS...BUT STILL BELOW NORMAL.
A WEAK UPPER LEVEL SHORTWAVE WILL MOVE THROUGH FRIDAY NIGHT...BUT
WITH VERY DRY ATMOSPHERIC CONDITIONS EXPECT JUST A FEW MID AND
HIGH CLOUDS WITH THIS FEATURE. BY SATURDAY...SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE
WILL SLIDE EVEN FURTHER EAST AND WINDS WILL TURN TO MORE OF A
SOUTHERLY DIRECTION...ALLOWING HIGH TEMPERATURES TO WARM FURTHER
TO NEAR SEASONAL AVERAGES WITH CONTINUED DRY WEATHER.

UPPER LEVEL NORTHWESTERLY FLOW WILL CONTINUE THROUGH THE EXTENDED
PERIOD...WITH FAST MOVING SHORTWAVE DISTURBANCES MOVING THROUGH
THE UPPER FLOW. ANOTHER IN A SERIES OF THESE UPPER DISTURBANCES
WILL MOVE ACROSS THE AREA SATURDAY NIGHT INTO SUNDAY...WITH
ANOTHER SHORTWAVE PASSING THROUGH THE AREA MONDAY NIGHT INTO
TUESDAY. LOW LEVEL MOISTURE IN ADVANCE OF THESE SYSTEMS WILL BE
LIMITED...SO NOT EXPECTING ANY PRECIPITATION THROUGH THE EXTENDED
PERIOD. THESE WEATHER FEATURES WILL SIMPLY HELP TO REINFORCE THE
BELOW NORMAL TEMPERATURES ACROSS THE AREA THROUGH THE EXTENDED PERIOD.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
MEM  49  28  53  35 /   0   0  10  10 
MKL  45  19  49  28 /   0   0  10  10 
JBR  47  24  52  31 /   0   0  10  10 
TUP  50  24  53  30 /   0   0  10  10 

&&

     CRITTENDEN-CROSS-GREENE-LAWRENCE-LEE(AR)-MISSISSIPPI-

.DISCUSSION...

COLDEST NIGHT OF THE SEASON IS NOW DEVELOPING. STATIONS NEAR TN
RIVER ALREADY BELOW FREEZING. CERTAINLY LUKS LIKE FCST LOWS WILL

MAYBE EVEN A TAD COOLER DUE TO THE COLDER START TOMORROW MORNING.

COOL WEATHER PATTERN WILL CONTINUE THROUGH THE FORECAST PERIOD.
EXPECT A COUPLE OF REINFORCING COLD FRONTS TO MOVE THROUGH THE
CWA DURING THIS TIME. THE FIRST WILL MOVE THROUGH THE AREA
SATURDAY NIGHT INTO SUNDAY. THE SECOND WILL OCCUR MONDAY NIGHT
INTO TUESDAY. NOT A LOT OF MOISTURE ASSOCIATED WITH THEM SO
EXPECT THEM TO PASS THROUGH THE AREA DRY. HOWEVER CAN/T RULE OUT
A FEW SPRINKLES MAYBE EVEN A FEW FLURRIES ACROSS PORTIONS OF
NORTHWEST TENNESSEE WITH THE SECOND FRONT MONDAY NIGHT INTO
TUESDAY MORNING. WILL CONTINUE WITH DRY FORECAST FOR NOW. EXPECT
TEMPERATURES IN THE 40S AND 50S FOR HIGHS WITH LOWS IN THE 30 AND
40S FOR THE MOST PART DURING THIS TIME.

&&

FOR      CLAY-CRAIGHEAD-CRITTENDEN-CROSS-GREENE-LAWRENCE-LEE(AR)-

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
200 PM CST WED NOV 16 2005

.DISCUSSION...
HIGH PRESSURE WILL SETTLE OVER THE MIDSOUTH TONIGHT. EXPECT CLEAR 
SKIES ACROSS THE CWA. THIS WILL BRING THE COLDEST NIGHT OF THE YEAR 
TO THE AREA. EXPECT LOWS IN THE 20S. WILL CONTINUE WITH THE FREEZE 
WARNING FOR TONIGHT.

HIGH PRESSURE WILL CONTINUE OVER THE AREA ON THURSDAY. EXPECT 
ANOTHER COLD DAY ACROSS THE AREA WITH HIGHS MUCH LIKE TODAY AND 
MAYBE EVEN A TAD COOLER DUE TO THE COLDER START TOMORROW MORNING.

COOL WEATHER PATTERN WILL CONTINUE THROUGH THE FORECAST PERIOD. EXPECT A 
COUPLE OF REINFORCING COLD FRONTS TO MOVE THROUGH THE CWA DURING 
THIS TIME. THE FIRST WILL MOVE THROUGH THE AREA SATURDAY NIGHT INTO 
SUNDAY. THE SECOND WILL OCCUR MONDAY NIGHT INTO TUESDAY. NOT A LOT 
OF MOISTURE ASSOCIATED WITH THEM SO EXPECT THEM TO PASS THROUGH THE 
AREA DRY. HOWEVER CAN/T RULE OUT A FEW SPRINKLES MAYBE EVEN A FEW 
FLURRIES ACROSS PORTIONS OF NORTHWEST TENNESSEE WITH THE SECOND 
FRONT MONDAY NIGHT INTO TUESDAY MORNING. WILL CONTINUE WITH DRY 
FORECAST FOR NOW. EXPECT TEMPERATURES IN THE 40S AND 50S FOR HIGHS 
WITH LOWS IN THE 30 AND 40S FOR THE MOST PART DURING THIS TIME.

TEMPERATURES ARE IN THE UPPER 30S TO LOWER 40S. FORECASTED HIGHS MAY 
BE A TAD COOL SO WILL BUMP UP A CATEGORY. UPDATE WILL BE OUT SHORTLY.



000 
FXUS64 KMEG 160954
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
354 AM CST WED NOV 16 2005

.DISCUSSION...

A MUCH CALMER MORNING AS COMPARED TO 24 HOURS AGO. THE COLD FRONT
THAT BROUGHT YESTERDAYS SEVERE WEATHER HAS SWEPT WELL TO THE
EAST. THIS MORNING WE ARE LEFT WITH MUCH COLDER TEMPERATURES AS A
CANADIAN AIRMASS HAS FILTERED IN BEHIND THE FRONT. THERE ARE CLOUDS
LINGERING ACROSS THE AREA...WITH A LOW OVERCAST ACROSS PORTIONS OF
NORTHEASTERN SECTIONS OF THE FORECAST AREA AND A MID LEVEL DECK
ACROSS SOUTHEAST SECTIONS. EXPECT PARTLY CLOUDY SKIES ACROSS
MOST AREAS...WITH THE EXCEPTION BEING ACROSS NORTHEAST AREAS WHERE
MOSTLY CLOUDY SKIES WILL CONTINUE THIS MORNING. SKIES SHOULD
QUICKLY CLEAR OUT BY THIS AFTERNOON...LEAVING MOSTLY SUNNY SKIES
AREAWIDE AS CANADIAN HIGH PRESSURE CONTINUES TO BUILD IN. TEMPERATURES
WILL STRUGGLE ALL DAY AS STRONG COLD AIR ADVECTION CONTINUES WITH
850 MB TEMPS PLUNGING TO -2 C SOUTH TO -8 C NORTH. THIS WILL BE
OUR FIRST TASTE OF WINTER...WITH HIGHS ONLY REACHING INTO THE 40S
TO AROUND 50.

AS HIGH PRESSURE SLIDES FURTHER EAST AND CLOSER TO THE MID-SOUTH
TONIGHT...WE SHOULD SEE WINDS LIGHTEN ACROSS THE AREA...AND WITH
CLEAR SKIES...WILL SEE THE COLDEST NIGHT SO FAR THIS YEAR.
TEMPERATURES WILL PLUNGE DEEP INTO THE 20S FOR MOST
AREAS...BRINGING A HARD FREEZE AND AN END TO THE GROWING SEASON
FOR MOST LOCATIONS. THEREFORE...HAVE ISSUED A FREEZE WARNING FOR
THE ENTIRE CWA. UNSEASONABLY COOL CONDITIONS UNDER MOSTLY CLEAR
SKIES WILL CONTINUE INTO THURSDAY AND THURSDAY NIGHT AS HIGH
PRESSURE REMAINS OVER THE AREA. ACTUALLY...THURSDAY NIGHT MAY BE
EVEN A FEW DEGREES COLDER...AS EXCELLENT RADIAIONAL COOLING
CONDITIONS SHOULD DEVELOP.

HIGH PRESSURE WILL SLIDE EAST ON FRIDAY...ALLOWING FOR CONTINUED
DRY CONDITIONS AND A SLOW MODERATION IN TEMPERATURES...BUT STILL
BELOW NORMAL INTO THE WEEKEND. THE UPPER LEVEL FLOW WILL REMAIN
NORTHWESTERLY THROUGH THE EXTENDED PERIOD...WITH UPPER LEVEL
SHORTWAVE DISTURBANCES MOVING THROUGH THE FLOW EVERY COUPLE OF
DAYS. THE FIRST SHORTWAVE AND ASSOCIATED CLIPPER TYPE SYSTEM WILL
MOVE ACROSS THE AREA SATURDAY NIGHT...WITH AN EVEN MORE POTENT
TYPE CLIPPER SYSTEM PROGGED TO MOVE THROUGH NEXT MONDAY NIGHT AND
TUESDAY. MOISTURE WILL BE LIMITED AHEAD OF THESE SYSTEMS...SO NOT
EXPECTING ANY PRECIPITATION...ONLY MID-LEVEL CLOUDS. THE ONLY
EXCEPTION WILL BE WITH THE SYSTEM EARLY NEXT WEEK. THERE MAY
EVENTUALLY END UP BEING SUFFICIENT MOISTURE FOR PRECIP...BUT
PREFER TO HOLD OFF FOR NOW SINCE THIS IS WELL INTO THE EXTENDED
PERIOD AND WOULD LIKE TO SEE FURTHER MODEL CONSISTENCY WITH THIS FEATURE.
IN ADDITION...TEMPERATURES WILL REMAIN BELOW NORMAL THROUGH THE
EXTENDED PERIOD...WITH EACH OF THESE SHORTWAVE/CLIPPER FEATURES
SERVING TO REINFORCE COOLER AIR ACROSS THE AREA.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
MEM  48  29  49  28 /  10   0   0  10 
MKL  46  22  46  20 /  10   0   0  10 
JBR  46  25  47  24 /  10   0   0  10 
TUP  50  26  51  25 /  10   0   0  10 

&&

     CLAY-CRAIGHEAD-CRITTENDEN-CROSS-GREENE-LAWRENCE-LEE(AR)-
     MISSISSIPPI-PHILLIPS-POINSETT-RANDOLPH-ST. FRANCIS.

     ALCORN-BENTON(MS)-CALHOUN-CHICKASAW-COAHOMA-DESOTO-ITAWAMBA-

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
1025 PM CST TUE NOV 15 2005

.DISCUSSION...

MUCH COLDER AIR IS POURING INTO THE MIDSOUTH FOLLOWING A FRONT
THAT WENT THROUGH THIS AFTERNOON AND EVENING. COUNTIES IN
NORTHEAST ARKANSAS COULD GET DOWN TO FREEZING TONIGHT WHILE LOWS
DROP TO THE LOWER 40S SOUTHEAST OF TUPELO. CLOUDINESS WILL
PERSIST MUCH OF THE NIGHT WHILE STIFF WINDS OUR OF THE NORTHWEST
BRINGS COLD WIND CHILLS TONIGHT.

FREEZE WARNING WILL HAVE TO BE ISSUED FOR THURSDAY MORNING. SOME
PLACES WILL SEE TEMPS DROP TO NEAR 20 DEGREES.

RENCH





000 
FXUS64 KMEG 151954
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
154 PM CST TUE NOV 15 2005

.DISCUSSION...
OUT OF NECESSITY...SEVERE WEATHER...DISCUSSION WILL BE FAIRLY
SHORT...FOR ME. IF SIGNIFICANT CHANGES ARE NEEDED TO WHAT IS
CURRENTLY OUT THERE...WILL UPDATE THIS DISCUSSION.

TWO LINES OF THUNDERSTORMS AHEAD OF STRONG COLD FRONT...WITH
SECOND LINE JUST ENTERING NORTHWEST CORNER OF CWA. TEMPS AHEAD OF
FRONT IN 70S WITH DEWPOINTS IN 60S. TEMPS BEHIND FRONT IN 40S AND
50S. 
&&

.SHORT TERM (THROUGH FRIDAY)...
FIRST PERIOD POPS WILL BE BASED ON RADAR TRENDS AROUND 2130Z.
SURE THAT SPC WILL ISSUE ANOTHER WATCH FOR PORTIONS OF CWA NEAR
PRESS TIME...AS CURRENT WATCH EXPIRES AT 23Z. WILL LIKELY CLEAR
COUNTIES BEHIND SECOND LINE BY PRESS TIME. WILL PROBABLY LET WIND
ADVISORY EXPIRE AT 00Z...WILL KEEP AN EYE ON OBS BEHIND FRONT TILL
PRESS TIME.

MUCH COLDER BEHIND FRONT. VISIBLE SATELLITE SHOWS COLD AIR STRATUS
BEHIND FRONT ACROSS ABOUT NORTHERN HALF OF AR. QUESTION BECOMES
WHETHER THIS CLOUD COVER WILL LIFT OUT OF AREA BY MORNING. CURRENT
FORECASTS ARE THAT CLOUDS SHOULD CLEAR MOST OR ALL OF AREA BY MID-
MORNING TOMORROW. TEMPS BEHIND IN SUNSHINE WELL BEHIND FRONT ARE
AROUND 50...SO THIS LOOKS REASONABLE FOR HIGHS TOMORROW.

WINDS DECOUPLE WEDNESDAY NIGHT...SKIES CLEAR...DEWPOINTS IN THE
TEENS. ALL ELEMENTS IN PLACE FOR A WIDESPREAD FREEZE WEDNESDAY
NIGHT. WITH SIGNIFICANT CONVECTIVE WEATHER IN AREA THIS
AFTERNOON...WILL NOT CONFUSE ISSUE WITH ANOTHER HEADLINE. FREEZE
WARNING WILL LIKELY GO OUT ON MIDNIGHT SHIFT FOR WEDNESDAY NIGHT.

THURSDAY AND FRIDAY...MOSTLY SUNNY WITH BELOW NORMAL TEMPERATURES.
FREEZE LIKELY AGAIN FRIDAY MORNING WITH MINOR MODERATION IN TEMPS.
&&

.LONG TERM (AFTER FRIDAY)...
NORTHWEST FLOW THROUGH PERIOD...AS PATTERN HAS CHANGED WITH RIDGE
OVER WESTERN U.S. SYSTEM MOVES THROUGH SATURDAY NIGHT...AND
ANOTHER ONE ABOUT TUESDAY. NO SIGNIFICANT MOISTURE WITH EITHER
SYSTEM SO NO PRECIP MENTIONED.

SOME WARMING AHEAD OF FRONT ON SATURDAY...BUT MEX NUMBERS FOR
SATURDAY LOOK OVERDONE. TEMPERATURES GENERALLY NEAR OR BELOW
NORMAL FOR EXTENDED PERIOD.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
MEM  39  50  28  51 / 100  10  10  10 
MKL  38  48  22  48 / 100  10  10  10 
JBR  33  48  25  49 /  40  10  10  10 
TUP  41  51  26  52 / 100  10  10  10



000 
FXUS64 KMEG 151523
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
923 AM CST TUE NOV 15 2005

.UPDATE...
NOT EXPECTING SIGNIFICANT UPDATES THIS MORNING. HEADLINES ARE IN
EFFECT...AND DONT SEE ANYTHING THAT WILL CHANGE THOSE SOON. IF
THERE ARE ANY UPDATES BEFORE NOON...THEY ARE LIKELY TO BE
TEMPERATURE RELATED...AS SOME AREAS CLOSE TO FORECAST HIGHS. 

SEEING SOME CONVECTIVE DEVELOPMENT ALONG COLD FRONT IN NW
ARKANSAS...BUT THIS IS STILL SEVERAL HOURS FROM APPROACHING OUR
AREA. 

&&

.PREV DISCUSSION... (ISSUED 739 AM CST TUE NOV 15 2005) 

UPDATE TO GO HIGH RISK FOR ENTIRE MID-SOUTH AND ADD PDS TORNADO
WATCH 865...

..SIGNIFICANT SEVERE WEATHER OUTBREAK LIKELY ACROSS THE MID-SOUTH
   THIS AFTERNOON AND EVENING...

..HIGH RISK OF SEVERE THUNDERSTORMS FOR THE ENTIRE MID-SOUTH...
..PARTICULARLY DANGEROUS SITUATION TORNADO WATCH 865 UNTIL 5 PM CST
   FOR THE ENTIRE MID-SOUTH...
..WIND ADVISORY UNTIL 6 PM CST FOR THE ENTIRE MID-SOUTH...

A CLASSIC SEVERE WEATHER SETUP WILL LEAD TO NUMEROUS SEVERE
THUNDERSTORMS ACROSS THE AREA THIS AFTERNOON AND EVENING. A
VIGOROUS MID/UPPER LEVEL SHORTWAVE DISTURBANCE WILL CONTINUE TO
DIVE SOUTHEAST ACROSS THE SOUTHERN PLAINS STATES TODAY...INITIATED
BY A STRONG 120 KT UPPER TROPOSPHERIC JET STREAK NOW DROPPING INTO
THE BASE OF THE UPPER TROUGH DIGGING OVER THE PLAINS. AS THIS JET
STREAK ROUNDS THE BEND AND EJECTS OUT OF THE BASE OF THE TROUGH AND
STRENGTHENS...THE REGION WILL BECOME LOCATED IN THE FAVORABLE
RIGHT ENTRANCE QUADRANT WHICH SHOULD LEAD TO STRONG LARGE SCALE
ASCENT ACROSS THE ENTIRE AREA LATER TODAY. AS THIS DISTURBANCE
SWINGS THROUGH IT WILL HELP TO STRENGTHEN A SURFACE LOW CURRENTLY
ANALYZED OVER NORTH OKLAHOMA EARLY THIS MORNING. THIS
STRENGTHENING SURFACE LOW WILL MOVE NORTHEAST ACROSS SOUTHERN
MISSOURI THIS AFTERNOON AND THIS FEATURE WILL SERVE TO FURTHER
STRENGTHEN THE LOW LEVEL FLOW...AND FURTHER BACK SURFACE WINDS
OVER THE AREA. IN ADDITION...AS THE STRONG UPPER LEVEL SHORTWAVE
APPROACHES IT WILL HELP TO FURTHER STRENGTHEN THE LOW LEVEL JET
OVER THE AREA...WHICH AS OF 09Z WAS ANALYZED AT 40 KTS PER THE OKO
WIND PROFILER. THIS LOW LEVEL JET IS FORECAST BY THE MODELS TO
STRENGTHEN TO OVER 60 KTS BY THIS AFTERNOON. ENOUGH MIXING TO
HEIGHTS WHERE THESE STRONG WINDS EXIST WILL ALLOW FOR STRONG AND
GUSTY SURFACE WINDS ACROSS THE AREA. THEREFORE...HAVE ISSUED A
WIND ADVISORY AREAWIDE TODAY. IN ADDITION...EXPECT SHEAR PROFILES TO
BE VERY STRONG THIS AFTERNOON. IMPRESSIVE 0-1 KM HELICITY VALUES WILL
RANGE BETWEEN 150-300 M2/S2 AFTER 18Z. SO OVERALL VERY STRONG
SHEAR AND HELICITY VALUES...WILL ALLOW FOR AN ENHANCED TORNADO
THREAT...ESPECIALLY WITH DISCRETE SUPERCELL THUNDERSTORMS THAT
MAY FORM AHEAD OF AN EXPECTED SEVERE SQUALL LINE.

THE ENTIRE AREA IS CURRENTLY WELL ENTRENCHED IN THE WARM SECTOR
THIS MORNING...AS THE WARM FRONT THAT PASSED THROUGH THE AREA
YESTERDAY IS NOW SITUATED JUST NORTH OF OUR FORECAST AREA. THIS
WARM FRONT WILL CONTINUE TO SURGE FURTHER NORTHWARD IN RESPONSE TO
THE STRENGTHENING LOW LEVEL JET. TEMPERATURES AREAWIDE AT 09Z WERE
AROUND 70 WITH DEWPOINTS IN THE LOW TO MID 60S. THIS WARM AND
HUMID AIRMASS WILL SUPPORT MUCAPE VALUES BETWEEN 1000-2000 J/KG
AREAWIDE LATER TODAY. IN ADDITION...AS HEIGHT FALLS SPREAD OVER
THE WARM SECTOR BY AFTERNOON...EXPECT THE POSSIBILITY OF THE MORE
DISCRETE THUNDERSTORMS TO DEVELOP ACROSS PORTIONS OF THE WARM
SECTOR. THESE THUNDERSTORMS WILL HAVE PLENTY OF SHEAR AND
INSTABILITY TO ALLOW THEM TO GAIN SUPERCELL CHARACTERISTICS...WITH
AN ENHANCED TORNADO THREAT AND EVEN THE POSSIBILITY OF A STRONG
TORNADO. AS THE SURFACE LOW PULLS FURTHER NORTH AND EAST IT WILL HELP
TO DRAG A STRONG COLD FRONT THROUGH THE AREA LATE THIS AFTERNOON INTO
THIS EVENING. WIND FIELDS THROUGH THE ATMOSPHERE WILL THEN BECOME
INCREASINGLY UNIDIRECTIONAL...BUT STILL VERY STRONG. THIS SHOULD
SUPPORT AN INTENSE SQUALL LINE TO DEVELOP...WITH A THREAT OF
DAMAGING STRAIGHT-LINE WINDS AND ISOLATED TORNADOES. THERE WILL BE A
THREAT FOR SIGNIFICANT WIND EVENTS IN ANY PRONOUNCED BOW ECHOES
THAT CAN DEVELOP.

THE SEVERE WEATHER THREAT WILL END ABRUPTLY AFTER PASSAGE OF THE
COLD FRONT...AND SHOULD END BY EARLY THIS EVENING WEST OF THE
MISSISSIPPI RIVER AND AFTER MIDNIGHT ACROSS OUR EASTERN ZONES.
MUCH COLDER AIR WILL FILTER INTO THE AREA BEHIND THE FRONT.

THE EXTENDED FORECAST WILL BE DOMINATED BY DRY NORTHWESTERLY FLOW
ALOFT WITH EMBEDDED NORTHERN STREAM DISTURBANCES MOVING THROUGH
THE FLOW EVERY COUPLE OF DAYS. NOT EXPECTING ANY RETURN FLOW OF
LOW LEVEL MOISTURE AHEAD OF THESE FEATURES...SO THESE FRONTS WILL
SIMPLY SERVE TO REINFORCE COLDER TEMPERATURES ACROSS THE AREA.
TEMPERATURES WILL REMAIN BELOW NORMAL THROUGH THE EXTENDED PERIOD
WITH THE LIKELIHOOD OF SOME KILLING FREEZES...ESPECIALLY WEDNESDAY
AND THURSDAY NIGHTS.

AGAIN...SEVERE WEATHER IS LIKELY THIS AFTERNOON SO PLAN NOW FOR
WHAT YOU WILL DO IF A WARNING IS ISSUED FOR YOUR AREA.
&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...WIND ADVISORY UNTIL 6 PM CST THIS AFTERNOON FOR CLAY-CRAIGHEAD-
     CRITTENDEN-CROSS-GREENE-LAWRENCE-LEE(AR)-MISSISSIPPI-
     PHILLIPS-POINSETT-RANDOLPH-ST. FRANCIS.

MO...WIND ADVISORY UNTIL 6 PM CST THIS AFTERNOON FOR DUNKLIN-PEMISCOT.

MS...WIND ADVISORY UNTIL 6 PM CST THIS AFTERNOON FOR ALCORN-
     BENTON(MS)-CALHOUN-CHICKASAW-COAHOMA-DESOTO-ITAWAMBA-
     LAFAYETTE-LEE(MS)-MARSHALL-MONROE-PANOLA-PONTOTOC-PRENTISS-
     QUITMAN-TALLAHATCHIE-TATE-TIPPAH-TISHOMINGO-TUNICA-UNION-
     YALOBUSHA.

TN...WIND ADVISORY UNTIL 6 PM CST THIS AFTERNOON FOR CARROLL-CHESTER-
     CROCKETT-DECATUR-DYER-FAYETTE-GIBSON-HARDEMAN-HARDIN-
     HAYWOOD-HENDERSON-HENRY-LAKE-LAUDERDALE-MADISON-MCNAIRY-
     OBION-SHELBY-TIPTON-WEAKLEY.

OVER THE AREA. IN ADDITION...AS THE STRONG UPPER LEVEL SHORTWAVE
APPROACHES IT WILL HELP TO FURTHER STRENGTHEN THE LOW LEVEL JET
OVER THE AREA...WHICH AS OF 09Z WAS ANALYZED AT 40 KTS PER THE OKO
WIND PROFILER. THIS LOW LEVEL JET IS FORECAST BY THE MODELS TO
STRENGTHEN TO OVER 60 KTS BY THIS AFTERNOON. ENOUGH MIXING TO
HEIGHTS WHERE THESE STRONG WINDS EXIST WILL ALLOW FOR STRONG AND
GUSTY SURFACE WINDS ACROSS THE AREA. THEREFORE...HAVE ISSUED A
WIND ADVISORY AREAWIDE TODAY. IN ADDITION...EXPECT SHEAR PROFILES TO
BE VERY STRONG THIS AFTERNOON. IMPRESSIVE 0-1 KM HELICITY VALUES WILL
RANGE BETWEEN 150-300 M2/S2 AFTER 18Z. SO OVERALL VERY STRONG
SHEAR AND HELICITY VALUES...WILL ALLOW FOR AN ENHANCED TORNADO
THREAT...ESPECIALLY WITH DISCRETE SUPERCELL THUNDERSTORMS THAT
MAY FORM AHEAD OF AN EXPECTED SEVERE SQUALL LINE.

THE ENTIRE AREA IS CURRENTLY WELL ENTRENCHED IN THE WARM SECTOR
THIS MORNING...AS THE WARM FRONT THAT PASSED THROUGH THE AREA
YESTERDAY IS NOW SITUATED JUST NORTH OF OUR FORECAST AREA. THIS
WARM FRONT WILL CONTINUE TO SURGE FURTHER NORTHWARD IN RESPONSE TO
THE STRENGTHENING LOW LEVEL JET. TEMPERATURES AREAWIDE AT 09Z WERE
AROUND 70 WITH DEWPOINTS IN THE LOW TO MID 60S. THIS WARM AND
HUMID AIRMASS WILL SUPPORT MUCAPE VALUES BETWEEN 1000-2000 J/KG
AREAWIDE LATER TODAY. IN ADDITION...AS HEIGHT FALLS SPREAD OVER
THE WARM SECTOR BY AFTERNOON...EXPECT THE POSSIBILITY OF THE MORE
DISCRETE THUNDERSTORMS TO DEVELOP ACROSS PORTIONS OF THE WARM
SECTOR. THESE THUNDERSTORMS WILL HAVE PLENTY OF SHEAR AND
INSTABILITY TO ALLOW THEM TO GAIN SUPERCELL CHARACTERISTICS...WITH
AN ENHANCED TORNADO THREAT AND EVEN THE POSSIBILITY OF A STRONG
TORNADO. AS THE SURFACE LOW PULLS FURTHER NORTH AND EAST IT WILL HELP
TO DRAG A STRONG COLD FRONT THROUGH THE AREA LATE THIS AFTERNOON INTO
THIS EVENING. WIND FIELDS THROUGH THE ATMOSPHERE WILL THEN BECOME
INCREASINGLY UNIDIRECTIONAL...BUT STILL VERY STRONG. THIS SHOULD
SUPPORT AN INTENSE SQUALL LINE TO DEVELOP...WITH A THREAT OF
DAMAGING STRAIGHT-LINE WINDS AND ISOLATED TORNADOES. THERE WILL BE A
THREAT FOR SIGNIFICANT WIND EVENTS IN ANY PRONOUNCED BOW ECHOES
THAT CAN DEVELOP.

THE SEVERE WEATHER THREAT WILL END ABRUPTLY AFTER PASSAGE OF THE
COLD FRONT...AND SHOULD END BY EARLY THIS EVENING WEST OF THE
MISSISSIPPI RIVER AND AFTER MIDNIGHT ACROSS OUR EASTERN ZONES.
MUCH COLDER AIR WILL FILTER INTO THE AREA BEHIND THE FRONT.

THE EXTENDED FORECAST WILL BE DOMINATED BY DRY NORTHWESTERLY FLOW
ALOFT WITH EMBEDDED NORTHERN STREAM DISTURBANCES MOVING THROUGH
THE FLOW EVERY COUPLE OF DAYS. NOT EXPECTING ANY RETURN FLOW OF
LOW LEVEL MOISTURE AHEAD OF THESE FEATURES...SO THESE FRONTS WILL
SIMPLY SERVE TO REINFORCE COLDER TEMPERATURES ACROSS THE AREA.
TEMPERATURES WILL REMAIN BELOW NORMAL THROUGH THE EXTENDED PERIOD
WITH THE LIKELIHOOD OF SOME KILLING FREEZES...ESPECIALLY WEDNESDAY
AND THURSDAY NIGHTS.

AGAIN...SEVERE WEATHER IS LIKELY THIS AFTERNOON SO PLAN NOW FOR
WHAT YOU WILL DO IF A WARNING IS ISSUED FOR YOUR AREA.

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...WIND ADVISORY UNTIL 6 PM CST THIS AFTERNOON FOR CLAY-CRAIGHEAD-
     CRITTENDEN-CROSS-GREENE-LAWRENCE-LEE(AR)-MISSISSIPPI-
     PHILLIPS-POINSETT-RANDOLPH-ST. FRANCIS.

MO...WIND ADVISORY UNTIL 6 PM CST THIS AFTERNOON FOR DUNKLIN-
PEMISCOT.

MS...WIND ADVISORY UNTIL 6 PM CST THIS AFTERNOON FOR ALCORN-
     BENTON(MS)-CALHOUN-CHICKASAW-COAHOMA-DESOTO-ITAWAMBA-
     LAFAYETTE-LEE(MS)-MARSHALL-MONROE-PANOLA-PONTOTOC-PRENTISS-
     QUITMAN-TALLAHATCHIE-TATE-TIPPAH-TISHOMINGO-TUNICA-UNION-
     YALOBUSHA.

TN...WIND ADVISORY UNTIL 6 PM CST THIS AFTERNOON FOR CARROLL-CHESTER-
     CROCKETT-DECATUR-DYER-FAYETTE-GIBSON-HARDEMAN-HARDIN-
     HAYWOOD-HENDERSON-HENRY-LAKE-LAUDERDALE-MADISON-MCNAIRY-
     OBION-SHELBY-TIPTON-WEAKLEY.

&&



FXUS64 KMEG 151337
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
737 AM CST TUE NOV 15 2005

.UPDATE TO GO HIGH RISK FOR ENTIRE MID-SOUTH AND ADD PDS TORNADO
WATCH 865...

...SIGNIFICANT SEVERE WEATHER OUTBREAK LIKELY ACROSS THE MID-SOUTH
   THIS AFTERNOON AND EVENING...

...HIGH RISK OF SEVERE THUNDERSTORMS FOR THE ENTIRE MID-SOUTH...
...PARTICULARLY DANGEROUS SITUATION TORNADO WATCH 865 UNTIL 5 PM CST
   FOR THE ENTIRE MID-SOUTH...
...MODERATE RISK OF SEVERE THUNDERSTORMS ACROSS THE REMAINDER OF
   NORTH MISSISSIPPI...TO THE SOUTH OF THE HIGH RISK AREA...
...WIND ADVISORY UNTIL 6 PM CST FOR THE ENTIRE MID-SOUTH...


A CLASSIC SEVERE WEATHER SETUP WILL LEAD TO NUMEROUS SEVERE
THUNDERSTORMS ACROSS THE AREA THIS AFTERNOON AND EVENING. A
VIGOROUS MID/UPPER LEVEL SHORTWAVE DISTURBANCE WILL CONTINUE TO
DIVE SOUTHEAST ACROSS THE SOUTHERN PLAINS STATES TODAY...INITIATED
BY A STRONG 120 KT UPPER TROPOSPHERIC JET STREAK NOW DROPPING INTO
THE BASE OF THE UPPER TROUGH DIGGING OVER THE PLAINS. AS THIS JET
STREAK ROUNDS THE BEND AND EJECTS OUT OF THE BASE OF THE TROUGH AND
STRENGTHENS...THE REGION WILL BECOME LOCATED IN THE FAVORABLE
RIGHT ENTRANCE QUADRANT WHICH SHOULD LEAD TO STRONG LARGE SCALE
ASCENT ACROSS THE ENTIRE AREA LATER TODAY. AS THIS DISTURBANCE
SWINGS THROUGH IT WILL HELP TO STRENGTHEN A SURFACE LOW CURRENTLY
ANALYZED OVER NORTH OKLAHOMA EARLY THIS MORNING. THIS
STRENGTHENING SURFACE LOW WILL MOVE NORTHEAST ACROSS SOUTHERN
MISSOURI THIS AFTERNOON AND THIS FEATURE WILL SERVE TO FURTHER
STRENGTHEN THE LOW LEVEL FLOW...AND FURTHER BACK SURFACE WINDS
OVER THE AREA. IN ADDITION...AS THE STRONG UPPER LEVEL SHORTWAVE
APPROACHES IT WILL HELP TO FURTHER STRENGTHEN THE LOW LEVEL JET
OVER THE AREA...WHICH AS OF 09Z WAS ANALYZED AT 40 KTS PER THE OKO
WIND PROFILER. THIS LOW LEVEL JET IS FORECAST BY THE MODELS TO
STRENGTHEN TO OVER 60 KTS BY THIS AFTERNOON. ENOUGH MIXING TO
HEIGHTS WHERE THESE STRONG WINDS EXIST WILL ALLOW FOR STRONG AND
GUSTY SURFACE WINDS ACROSS THE AREA. THEREFORE...HAVE ISSUED A
WIND ADVISORY AREAWIDE TODAY. IN ADDITION...EXPECT SHEAR PROFILES TO
BE VERY STRONG THIS AFTERNOON. IMPRESSIVE 0-1 KM HELICITY VALUES WILL
RANGE BETWEEN 150-300 M2/S2 AFTER 18Z. SO OVERALL VERY STRONG
SHEAR AND HELICITY VALUES...WILL ALLOW FOR AN ENHANCED TORNADO
THREAT...ESPECIALLY WITH DISCRETE SUPERCELL THUNDERSTORMS THAT
MAY FORM AHEAD OF AN EXPECTED SEVERE SQUALL LINE.

THE ENTIRE AREA IS CURRENTLY WELL ENTRENCHED IN THE WARM SECTOR
THIS MORNING...AS THE WARM FRONT THAT PASSED THROUGH THE AREA
YESTERDAY IS NOW SITUATED JUST NORTH OF OUR FORECAST AREA. THIS
WARM FRONT WILL CONTINUE TO SURGE FURTHER NORTHWARD IN RESPONSE TO
THE STRENGTHENING LOW LEVEL JET. TEMPERATURES AREAWIDE AT 09Z WERE
AROUND 70 WITH DEWPOINTS IN THE LOW TO MID 60S. THIS WARM AND
HUMID AIRMASS WILL SUPPORT MUCAPE VALUES BETWEEN 1000-2000 J/KG
AREAWIDE LATER TODAY. IN ADDITION...AS HEIGHT FALLS SPREAD OVER
THE WARM SECTOR BY AFTERNOON...EXPECT THE POSSIBILITY OF THE MORE
DISCRETE THUNDERSTORMS TO DEVELOP ACROSS PORTIONS OF THE WARM
SECTOR. THESE THUNDERSTORMS WILL HAVE PLENTY OF SHEAR AND
INSTABILITY TO ALLOW THEM TO GAIN SUPERCELL CHARACTERISTICS...WITH
AN ENHANCED TORNADO THREAT AND EVEN THE POSSIBILITY OF A STRONG
TORNADO. AS THE SURFACE LOW PULLS FURTHER NORTH AND EAST IT WILL HELP
TO DRAG A STRONG COLD FRONT THROUGH THE AREA LATE THIS AFTERNOON INTO
THIS EVENING. WIND FIELDS THROUGH THE ATMOSPHERE WILL THEN BECOME
INCREASINGLY UNIDIRECTIONAL...BUT STILL VERY STRONG. THIS SHOULD
SUPPORT AN INTENSE SQUALL LINE TO DEVELOP...WITH A THREAT OF
DAMAGING STRAIGHT-LINE WINDS AND ISOLATED TORNADOES. THERE WILL BE A
THREAT FOR SIGNIFICANT WIND EVENTS IN ANY PRONOUNCED BOW ECHOES
THAT CAN DEVELOP.

THE SEVERE WEATHER THREAT WILL END ABRUPTLY AFTER PASSAGE OF THE
COLD FRONT...AND SHOULD END BY EARLY THIS EVENING WEST OF THE
MISSISSIPPI RIVER AND AFTER MIDNIGHT ACROSS OUR EASTERN ZONES.
MUCH COLDER AIR WILL FILTER INTO THE AREA BEHIND THE FRONT.

THE EXTENDED FORECAST WILL BE DOMINATED BY DRY NORTHWESTERLY FLOW
ALOFT WITH EMBEDDED NORTHERN STREAM DISTURBANCES MOVING THROUGH
THE FLOW EVERY COUPLE OF DAYS. NOT EXPECTING ANY RETURN FLOW OF
LOW LEVEL MOISTURE AHEAD OF THESE FEATURES...SO THESE FRONTS WILL
SIMPLY SERVE TO REINFORCE COLDER TEMPERATURES ACROSS THE AREA.
TEMPERATURES WILL REMAIN BELOW NORMAL THROUGH THE EXTENDED PERIOD
WITH THE LIKELIHOOD OF SOME KILLING FREEZES...ESPECIALLY WEDNESDAY
AND THURSDAY NIGHTS.

AGAIN...SEVERE WEATHER IS LIKELY THIS AFTERNOON SO PLAN NOW FOR
WHAT YOU WILL DO IF A WARNING IS ISSUED FOR YOUR AREA.

&&

516 AM CST TUE NOV 15 2005

.UPDATE...

RESENT UPDATED ZONES TO REMOVE TORNADO WATCH 863 WORDING. THE
WATCH HAS EXPIRED AND CURRENTLY THERE ARE NO WATCHES IN EFFECT FOR
THE FORECAST AREA.

ADDITIONAL TORNADO WATCHES WILL LIKELY BE ISSUED THROUGH THE DAY...SO
PLEASE REMAIN ALERT TO THE EXPECTED QUICKLY CHANGING WEATHER
SITUATION AS WE PROGRESS THROUGH THE DAY AND THE THREAT FOR
SEVERE WEATHER...INCLUDING TORNADOES...DAMAGING WIND...AND LARGE
HAIL INCREASES.

&&

.PREV DISCUSSION... (ISSUED 428 AM CST TUE NOV 15 2005) 

..SIGNIFICANT SEVERE WEATHER OUTBREAK LIKELY ACROSS THE MID-SOUTH
THIS AFTERNOON AND EVENING...

..HIGH RISK OF SEVERE THUNDERSTORMS FOR EAST AND NORTHEAST
ARKANSAS...THE MISSOURI BOOTHEEL...WEST TENNESSEE...AND EXTREME
NORTH MISSISSIPPI...

..MODERATE RISK OF SEVERE THUNDERSTORMS ACROSS THE REMAINDER OF
NORTH MISSISSIPPI...TO THE SOUTH OF THE HIGH RISK AREA...

..WIND ADVISORY UNTIL 6 PM CST FOR THE ENTIRE MID-SOUTH...
 

A CLASSIC SEVERE WEATHER SETUP WILL LEAD TO NUMEROUS SEVERE
THUNDERSTORMS ACROSS THE AREA THIS AFTERNOON AND EVENING. A
VIGOROUS MID/UPPER LEVEL SHORTWAVE DISTURBANCE WILL CONTINUE TO
DIVE SOUTHEAST ACROSS THE SOUTHERN PLAINS STATES TODAY...INITIATED 
BY A STRONG 120 KT UPPER TROPOSPHERIC JET STREAK NOW DROPPING INTO
THE BASE OF THE UPPER TROUGH DIGGING OVER THE PLAINS. AS THIS JET STREAK
ROUNDS THE BEND AND EJECTS OUT OF THE BASE OF THE TROUGH AND
STRENGTHENS...THE REGION WILL BECOME LOCATED IN THE FAVORABLE

ASCENT ACROSS THE ENTIRE AREA LATER TODAY. AS THIS DISTURBANCE

ANALYZED OVER NORTH OKLAHOMA EARLY THIS MORNING. THIS
STRENGTHENING SURFACE LOW WILL MOVE NORTHEAST ACROSS SOUTHERN
MISSOURI THIS AFTERNOON AND THIS FEATURE WILL SERVE TO FURTHER
STRENGTHEN THE LOW LEVEL FLOW...AND FURTHER BACK SURFACE WINDS
OVER THE AREA. IN ADDITION...AS THE STRONG UPPER LEVEL SHORTWAVE
APPROACHES IT WILL HELP TO FURTHER STRENGTHEN THE LOW LEVEL JET
OVER THE AREA...WHICH AS OF 09Z WAS ANALYZED AT 40 KTS PER THE OKO
WIND PROFILER. THIS LOW LEVEL JET IS FORECAST BY THE MODELS TO
STRENGTHEN TO OVER 60 KTS BY THIS AFTERNOON. ENOUGH MIXING TO
HEIGHTS WHERE THESE STRONG WINDS EXIST WILL ALLOW FOR STRONG AND
GUSTY SURFACE WINDS ACROSS THE AREA. THEREFORE...HAVE ISSUED A
WIND ADVISORY AREAWIDE TODAY. IN ADDITION...EXPECT SHEAR PROFILES TO BE VERY
STRONG THIS AFTERNOON. IMPRESSIVE 0-1 KM HELICITY VALUES WILL
RANGE BETWEEN 150-300 M2/S2 AFTER 18Z. SO OVERALL VERY STRONG
SHEAR AND HELICITY VALUES...WILL ALLOW FOR AN ENHANCED TORNADO
THREAT...ESPECIALLY WITH DISCRETE SUPERCELL THUNDERSTORMS THAT
MAY FORM AHEAD OF AN EXPECTED SEVERE SQUALL LINE.

YESTERDAY IS NOW SITUATED JUST NORTH OF OUR FORECAST AREA. THIS

AROUND 70 WITH DEWPOINTS IN THE LOW TO MID 60S. THIS WARM AND
HUMID AIRMASS WILL SUPPORT MUCAPE VALUES BETWEEN 1000-2000 J/KG
AREAWIDE LATER TODAY. IN ADDITION...AS HEIGHT FALLS SPREAD OVER
THE WARM SECTOR BY AFTERNOON...EXPECT THE POSSIBILITY OF THE MORE
DISCRETE THUNDERSTORMS TO DEVELOP ACROSS PORTIONS OF THE WARM
SECTOR. THESE THUNDERSTORMS WILL HAVE PLENTY OF SHEAR AND
INSTABILITY TO ALLOW THEM TO GAIN SUPERCELL CHARACTERISTICS...WITH
AN ENHANCED TORNADO THREAT AND EVEN THE POSSIBILITY OF A STRONG TORNADO.
AS THE SURFACE LOW PULLS FURTHER NORTH AND EAST IT WILL HELP TO
DRAG A STRONG COLD FRONT THROUGH THE AREA LATE THIS AFTERNOON INTO
THIS EVENING. WIND FIELDS THROUGH THE ATMOSPHERE WILL THEN BECOME
INCREASINGLY UNIDIRECTIONAL...BUT STILL VERY STRONG. THIS SHOULD
SUPPORT AN INTENSE SQUALL LINE TO DEVELOP...WITH A THREAT OF

AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
745 PM CST MON NOV 14 2005

.DISCUSSION...

MAPS INDICATE A WARM FRONT NOW FROM EVANSVILLE TO JONESBORO AND
ON TO SOUTH OF FORT SMITH. THUNDERSTORMS ARE NOW NORTH OF THE
FRONT WHILE SHOWERS ARE DEVELOPING OFF AND ON IN WEST TENNESSEE
AND SOUTHEAST OF TUPELO. MOISTURE CONTINUES TO INCREASE OVER THE
AREA AND SPC INDICATED STORMS COULD EVEN DEVELOP SOUTH OF THE
FRONT THIS EVENING. BUT...THE FRONT IS EXPECTED TO MOVE FARTHER
NORTH TONIGHT AND TAKE MOST OF THE WEATHER WITH IT.

A SIGNIFICANT SEVERE WEATHER EVENT IS STILL EXPECTED TUESDAY...
MAINLY IN THE AFTERNOON AND EVENING.

...PREVIOUS DISCUSSION...
WARM FRONT MOVING NORTHWARD THROUGH CWA...PROBABLY NEAR A JBR-
DYR-HZD LINE AT 20Z. TEMPERATURES MAINLY IN THE 70S TO SOUTH OF
FRONT WITH DEWPOINTS IN MID 60S...TEMPS IN THE 50S ONCE YOU GET
ABOUT 50 MILES NORTH OF WARM FRONT. CLOUDS HAVE SCATTERED OUT
SOME TO THE SOUTH OF THE WARM FRONT. ALONG AND NORTH OF THE
FRONT...SCATTERED CONVECTION HAS BROKEN OUT. WITH STRONG WIND
FIELDS...SPC HAS ISSUED TORNADO WATCH 861 FOR ABOUT WEST HALF OF
CWA UNTIL 03Z. &&

.SHORT TERM (THROUGH THURSDAY)...
ALL OF THE SIGNIFICANT WEATHER WILL BE IN THE SHORT TERM PORTION
OF FORECAST. VORT MOVING OUT OF THE ROCKIES THIS EVENING WILL
TAKE A DEEPENING LOW FROM THE TEXAS PANHANDLE TO LAKE MICHIGAN BY
TOMORROW EVENING. WIND FIELDS WILL BE RATHER STRONG WITH H850
WINDS INCREASING TO AROUND 70 KTS BY TOMORROW AFTERNOON.

AS WARM FRONT LIFTS NORTH OF THE AREA TONIGHT...AND WE LOSE
SURFACE HEATING...MAIN SEVERE WEATHER THREAT FOR THE OVERNIGHT
HOURS WILL DIMINISH. ALL SIGNS POINT TO SIGNIFICANT SEVERE
WEATHER EVENT ON TUESDAY. LIFTED INDICES AROUND -3 TO -4...MU
CAPES OF 1000-2000...0-3KM HELICITIES NEAR 500 AND 0-1KM
HELICITIES OF 200-300. EXPECT SQUALL LINE TO BE OVER CENTRAL
ARKANSAS AROUND 18Z ON TUESDAY...ALONG THE MISSISSIPPI RIVER
AROUND 22Z...AND OUT OF THE CWA AROUND 03Z. MAIN THREAT TO BE
DAMAGING WINDS...BUT ANY SUPERCELLS THAT DEVELOP IN ADVANCE OF
THE LINE WILL HAVE THE POTENTIAL TO PRODUCE TORNADOES.
GENERALLY...SURFACE WINDS TOMORROW SHOULD STAY JUST SHORT OF WIND
ADVISORY CRITERIA...AND DONT PLAN ON HEADLINING FOR THAT RIGHT
NOW. WILL BE CARRYING 40 TO 60 POPS TONIGHT...AND CATEGORICAL
AREA WIDE TOMORROW. WILL PLACE MENTION OF SEVERE IN ALL AREAS
TOMORROW. PRECIP SHOULD MOVE OUT OF MOST OF CWA DURING THE
EVENING TOMORROW...AND EVERYWHERE BY WEDNESDAY MORNING.

MUCH COLDER AIR TO MOVE INTO THE AREA WITH THE PASSAGE OF THIS
FRONT. H850 TEMPS WILL FALL FROM ABOUT +14 AT 00Z WEDNESDAY TO
ABOUT -4 BY 18Z WEDNESDAY AT MEMPHIS. THIS WILL PRODUCE MUCH
COLDER TEMPERATURES FOR WEDNESDAY. FORECAST HIGHS WILL BE IN THE
LOWER 50S IN MOST AREAS...AND IF CLOUDS ARE SLOW TO CLEAR...THIS
COULD BE HIGHLY OPTIMISTIC. SURFACE WINDS WILL DECOUPLE WEDNESDAY
NIGHT...AND WITH CLEAR SKIES...EXPECT TEMPERATURES TO PLUNGE.
EXPECTING A WIDESPREAD FREEZE FOR THURSDAY MORNING. FORECAST WILL
LIKELY NEED TO BE HEADLINED FOR THIS LATER...BUT WILL JUST WORRY
ABOUT CONVECTIVE ISSUES IN THIS PACKAGE. DO NOT SEE HIGHS ON
THURSDAY BEING ANY WARMER THAN THOSE ON WEDNESDAY.
&&

.LONG TERM (AFTER THURSDAY)...
AS UPPER RIDGE BUILDS OVER WEST COAST...THERE WILL BE SEVERAL
IMPULSES MOVING TOWARD THE EAST COAST THROUGH NORTHWEST FLOW.
TIMING OF INDIVIDUAL IMPULSES VARIES WITH THE DIFFERENT MODELS.
GFS INDICATES MOISTURE TOO LIMITED FOR PRECIPITATION FOR MOST OF
THE EXTENDED FORECAST PERIOD. LOW LEVEL FLOW WILL NOT GAIN A
SOUTHERLY COMPONENT MUCH BEFORE SUNDAY...SO EXPECTING BELOW
NORMAL TEMPERATURES...HIGHS MAINLY IN THE 50S...LOWS NEAR
FREEZING FOR MOST OF THE CWA.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
MEM  63  70  40  51 /  60  90  40  10
MKL  61  70  38  50 /  60  90  50  10
JBR  59  68  35  53 /  70  90  10  10
TUP  63  74  43  51 /  50  90  60  10

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.
&&

$$

RENCH/WAGNER





000 
FXUS64 KMEG 142100
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
300 PM CST MON NOV 14 2005

.DISCUSSION...
WARM FRONT MOVING NORTHWARD THROUGH CWA...PROBABLY NEAR A JBR-DYR-
HZD LINE AT 20Z. TEMPERATURES MAINLY IN THE 70S TO SOUTH OF FRONT
WITH DEWPOINTS IN MID 60S...TEMPS IN THE 50S ONCE YOU GET ABOUT 50
MILES NORTH OF WARM FRONT. CLOUDS HAVE SCATTERED OUT SOME TO THE
SOUTH OF THE WARM FRONT. ALONG AND NORTH OF THE FRONT...SCATTERED
CONVECTION HAS BROKEN OUT. WITH STRONG WIND FIELDS...SPC HAS
ISSUED TORNADO WATCH 861 FOR ABOUT WEST HALF OF CWA UNTIL 03Z.
&&

.SHORT TERM (THROUGH THURSDAY)...
ALL OF THE SIGNIFICANT WEATHER WILL BE IN THE SHORT TERM PORTION
OF FORECAST. VORT MOVING OUT OF THE ROCKIES THIS EVENING WILL TAKE
A DEEPENING LOW FROM THE TEXAS PANHANDLE TO LAKE MICHIGAN BY
TOMORROW EVENING. WIND FIELDS WILL BE RATHER STRONG WITH H850
WINDS INCREASING TO AROUND 70 KTS BY TOMORROW AFTERNOON. 

AS WARM FRONT LIFTS NORTH OF THE AREA TONIGHT...AND WE LOSE
SURFACE HEATING...MAIN SEVERE WEATHER THREAT FOR THE OVERNIGHT
HOURS WILL DIMINISH. ALL SIGNS POINT TO SIGNIFICANT SEVERE WEATHER
EVENT ON TUESDAY. LIFTED INDICES AROUND -3 TO -4...MU CAPES OF
1000-2000...0-3KM HELICITIES NEAR 500 AND 0-1KM HELICITIES OF 200-
300. EXPECT SQUALL LINE TO BE OVER CENTRAL ARKANSAS AROUND 18Z ON
TUESDAY...ALONG THE MISSISSIPPI RIVER AROUND 22Z...AND OUT OF THE
CWA AROUND 03Z. MAIN THREAT TO BE DAMAGING WINDS...BUT ANY
SUPERCELLS THAT DEVELOP IN ADVANCE OF THE LINE WILL HAVE THE
POTENTIAL TO PRODUCE TORNADOES. GENERALLY...SURFACE WINDS TOMORROW
SHOULD STAY JUST SHORT OF WIND ADVISORY CRITERIA...AND DONT PLAN
ON HEADLINING FOR THAT RIGHT NOW. WILL BE CARRYING 40 TO 60 POPS
TONIGHT...AND CATEGORICAL AREA WIDE TOMORROW. WILL PLACE MENTION
OF SEVERE IN ALL AREAS TOMORROW. PRECIP SHOULD MOVE OUT OF MOST OF
CWA DURING THE EVENING TOMORROW...AND EVERYWHERE BY WEDNESDAY
MORNING.

MUCH COLDER AIR TO MOVE INTO THE AREA WITH THE PASSAGE OF THIS
FRONT. H850 TEMPS WILL FALL FROM ABOUT +14 AT 00Z WEDNESDAY TO
ABOUT -4 BY 18Z WEDNESDAY AT MEMPHIS. THIS WILL PRODUCE MUCH
COLDER TEMPERATURES FOR WEDNESDAY. FORECAST HIGHS WILL BE IN THE
LOWER 50S IN MOST AREAS...AND IF CLOUDS ARE SLOW TO CLEAR...THIS
COULD BE HIGHLY OPTIMISTIC. SURFACE WINDS WILL DECOUPLE WEDNESDAY
NIGHT...AND WITH CLEAR SKIES...EXPECT TEMPERATURES TO PLUNGE.
EXPECTING A WIDESPREAD FREEZE FOR THURSDAY MORNING. FORECAST WILL
LIKELY NEED TO BE HEADLINED FOR THIS LATER...BUT WILL JUST WORRY
ABOUT CONVECTIVE ISSUES IN THIS PACKAGE. DO NOT SEE HIGHS ON
THURSDAY BEING ANY WARMER THAN THOSE ON WEDNESDAY.
&&

.LONG TERM (AFTER THURSDAY)...
AS UPPER RIDGE BUILDS OVER WEST COAST...THERE WILL BE SEVERAL
IMPULSES MOVING TOWARD THE EAST COAST THROUGH NORTHWEST FLOW.

GFS INDICATES MOISTURE TOO LIMITED FOR PRECIPITATION FOR MOST OF

SOUTHERLY COMPONENT MUCH BEFORE SUNDAY...SO EXPECTING BELOW NORMAL
TEMPERATURES...HIGHS MAINLY IN THE 50S...LOWS NEAR FREEZING FOR
MOST OF THE CWA.

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 141628 AAA
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
1028 AM CST MON NOV 14 2005

.UPDATED DISCUSSION...
WARM FRONT HAS PROGRESSED NORTHWARD TO NEAR THE TN-MS STATE LINE. ALL
MODELS CONSISTENT IN MOVING FRONT TO THE NORTH OF THE CWA BY
EVENING. AREAL COVERAGE OF CONVECTION HAS DECREASED TO THE SOUTH OF
THE FRONT...AND HAVE LOWERED POPS TO THE CHANCE RANGE THERE. NO
REAL CLEARING YET...WHICH WILL HELP IN TAMING THE THREAT OF SEVERE
WEATHER IN THE SHORT TERM...THROUGH ABOUT 20Z.

DEWPOINTS ALREADY IN THE UPPER 60S TO NEAR 70 AS CLOSE AS GWO...SO
AIRMASS WILL DEFINITELY BE JUICY. HAVENT MADE ANY SIGNIFICANT
CHANGES TO FORECAST OTHER THAN POPS BASED ON RADAR TRENDS.

THINGS STILL LOOK ON TRACK FOR SIGNIFICANT SEVERE WEATHER EVENT
DURING THE DAYTIME HOURS ON TUESDAY. OFFICE IS PLANNING ON PHONE
CONFERENCE WITH MEDIA AND EMA AROUND 19Z THIS AFTERNOON. WILL GET
INTO MORE DETAIL WITH PARAMETERS...ETC...WITH AFTERNOON PACKAGE.

&&

.PREVIOUS DISCUSSION ISSUED AT 410 AM CST...

CURRENTLY...STATIONARY FRONT WAS LOCATED FROM NRN AL THROUGH
N CNTRL MS INTO NRN LA THIS MORNING. A LARGE SURFACE DEWPOINT
GRADIENT WAS ASSOCIATED WITH THIS FRONT. DEWPOINTS WERE IN THE
MID 30S ACROSS NRN SECTIONS OF THE MID SOUTH AND THE MID 60S
ACROSS CNTRL MS. THE FRONT HAS BECOME INCREASINGLY ACTIVE OVERNIGHT
WITH NUMEROUS SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS DEVELOPING OVER N CNTRL
MS.

TODAY AND TONIGHT...THE WARM FRONT WILL SURGE NORTH TODAY MOVING
TO THE MS/TN BORDER BY 18Z AND TO THE TN/KY BORDER BY 00Z.
MEANWHILE A SIGNIFICANT 500 MB SHORTWAVE WILL EXIT THE ROCKIES
AND MOVE INTO THE MID MISSISSIPPI VALLEY LATER TODAY PLACING THE
MID SOUTH IN THE RIGHT ENTRANCE REGION OF THE ASSOCIATED JET
STREAK. THE 30-35 KT SWLY LOW LEVEL JET WILL TRANSPORT MOISTURE
NORTHWARD ACROSS THE WARM FRONT. THE INGREDIENTS FOR LIFT AND
SUSTAINED MOISTURE TRANSPORT ARE IN PLACE SO EXPECT PLENTY OF
SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS TODAY. WILL GO WITH CATEGORICAL POPS
FOR MOST PLACES WITH LIKELY POPS ACROSS NORTHERN SECTIONS. TEMPS
WILL BE WARMEST ACROSS NORTHERN MS WHERE THE WARM FRONT WILL MOVE
THROUGH THIS MORNING. READINGS IN LOWER 70S SHOULD BE NO PROBLEM
THERE...MAYBE HIGHER DEPENDING ON CLOUDS AND PRECIP. COOLEST TEMPS
ARE EXPECTED ACROSS THE NORTHERN TIER WHERE LOWER 60S WILL BE THE
TARGET.

THERE IS A SLIGHT RISK FOR SEVERE WEATHER LATER TODAY AND THIS
EVENING FOR THE ENTIRE MID SOUTH. VERTICAL WIND PROFILES WILL SUPPORT
SUPERCELL DEVELOPMENT...ESPECIALLY IN THE VICINITY OF THE WARM
FRONT...IF ENOUGH INSTABILITY IS PRESENT. SURFACE DEWPOINTS WILL
RISE INTO THE MID 60S SOUTH OF THE WARM FRONT WITH MLCAPES OF 500-
1500 J/KG POSSIBLE BY THIS EVENING. IF SUPERCELLS ARE ABLE TO
DEVELOP THEN DAMAGING WINDS...HAIL AND A FEW TORNADOES ARE
POSSIBLE.

THE WARM FRONT WILL MOVE INTO SRN MO/WRN KY BY MIDNIGHT AND THE
SEVERE THREAT SHOULD DIMINISH FOR THE TIME BEING. WL GO WITH
THE HIGHEST POPS ACROSS NORTHERN SECTIONS TONIGHT WITH LESSER POPS
ACRS NORTHERN MISSISSIPPI. IT WILL BE A MILD NIGHT WITH TEMPS IN
THE LOWER 60S MOST PLACES.

TUESDAY...THIS SYSTEM IS LOOKING MORE IMPRESSIVE ALL THE TIME. ETA
AND GFS HAVE GOOD AGREEMENT AND CONTINUITY WITH THIS SYSTEM. 00Z
AND 06Z RUNS ARE 6-12 HOURS SLOWER THAN PREVIOUS RUNS AND THE
FORECAST WILL TAKE THAT INTO ACCOUNT. A STRONG UPPER TROF WILL
DIVE INTO THE CENTRAL PLAINS MONDAY NIGHT WITH A SURFACE LOW
DEVELOPING OVER EASTERN OK BY EARLY TUESDAY. BY EARLY TUESDAY THE
MID SOUTH IS DEEPLY ENTRENCHED IN THE WARM SECTOR WITH SURFACE
DEWPOINTS IN THE LOWER AND MID 60S AND A SOUTHERLY LOW LEVEL JET AT
35-40 KTS AND INCREASING TO 50 KTS. MLCAPES FORECAST BETWEEN 1000-
1500 J/KG TUESDAY MORNING. DURING THE MORNING HOURS THE MAIN 500
MB SHORTWAVE WILL MOVE INTO KANSAS PLACING THE MID SOUTH IN THE
ENTRANCE REGION OF A STRENGTHENING 130 KT JET. VERY FAVORABLE
VERTICAL WIND PROFILES FOR SEVERE WEATHER WILL BE IN PLACE WITH
0-3 KM HELICITY VALES GREATER THAN 250 M2/S2. EXPECT A LINE OF
THUNDERSTORMS TO DEVELOP ALONG THE COLD FRONT THAT WILL MOVE INTO
WESTERN SECTION OF THE FORECAST AREA AROUND 18Z AND SWEEP ACROSS
THE MID SOUTH TUESDAY AFTERNOON AND EARLY EVENING. ALSO...WITH
STRONG FORCING SPREADING ACROSS THE WARM SECTOR IT IS POSSIBLE
THAT DISCRETE SUPERCELLS COULD DEVELOP IN ADVANCE OF THE MAIN
SQUALL LINE.

AS A RESULT OF THIS SCENARIO THERE IS A MODERATE RISK FOR SEVERE
WEATHER TUESDAY INTO EARLY TUESDAY EVENING. THE MAIN THREAT WITH
THE LINE OF THUNDERSTORMS THAT SWEEPS ACROSS THE AREA WILL BE
DAMAGING WINDS. HAIL IS A LESSER THREAT. A FEW TORNADOES CANNOT BE
RULED OUT. IF DISCRETE SUPERCELLS DEVELOP AHEAD OF THE LINE OF
THUNDERSTORMS THEN THE MAIN THREAT FROM THOSE STORMS WILL BE
TORNADOES...WITH HAIL AND DAMAGING WINDS SECONDARY.

TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH THE EXTENDED FORECAST...VERY COOL AIRMASS
MOVES IN BEHIND THE FRONT. TEMPS WILL PLUMMET INTO THE 30S AND LOWER
40S TUESDAY NIGHT WITH A BRISK NORTHWEST WIND. WEDNESDAY WILL BE
CHILLY WITH TEMPS ONLY IN THE LOW AND MID 50S. HIGH PRESSURE WILL
BUILD OVER THE AREA WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND A WIDESPREAD FREEZE IS
POSSIBLE. SIMILAR CONDITIONS CONTINUE FOR THURSDAY NIGHT SO ANOTHER
FREEZE MAY BE ON TAP.

A COUPLE OF UPPER TROFS PASS THROUGH DURING THE FRIDAY TO SUNDAY
TIME FRAME. ATTM EXPECT SOME CLOUDS FROM THESE SYSTEMS ALONG WITH
A CONTINUATION OF THE COOL WEATHER.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
MEM  69  63  70  40 /  80  60  80  40
MKL  66  61  70  38 /  80  60  80  50
JBR  63  59  68  35 /  70  70  80  10
TUP  72  62  74  43 /  90  50  70  60

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.
&&

$$

WAGNER/SJM





000 
FXUS64 KMEG 141012 CCA
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...CORRECTED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
410 AM CST MON NOV 14 2005

.DISCUSSION...

CURRENTLY...STATIONARY FRONT WAS LOCATED FROM NRN AL THROUGH
N CNTRL MS INTO NRN LA THIS MORNING. A LARGE SURFACE DEWPOINT
GRADIENT WAS ASSOCIATED WITH THIS FRONT. DEWPOINTS WERE IN THE
MID 30S ACROSS NRN SECTIONS OF THE MID SOUTH AND THE MID 60S
ACROSS CNTRL MS. THE FRONT HAS BECOME INCREASINGLY ACTIVE OVERNIGHT
WITH NUMEROUS SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS DEVELOPING OVER N CNTRL
MS.

TODAY AND TONIGHT...THE WARM FRONT WILL SURGE NORTH TODAY MOVING
TO THE MS/TN BORDER BY 18Z AND TO THE TN/KY BORDER BY 00Z.
MEANWHILE A SIGNIFICANT 500 MB SHORTWAVE WILL EXIT THE ROCKIES
AND MOVE INTO THE MID MISSISSIPPI VALLEY LATER TODAY PLACING THE
MID SOUTH IN THE RIGHT ENTRANCE REGION OF THE ASSOCIATED JET
STREAK. THE 30-35 KT SWLY LOW LEVEL JET WILL TRANSPORT MOISTURE
NORTHWARD ACROSS THE WARM FRONT. THE INGREDIENTS FOR LIFT AND
SUSTAINED MOISTURE TRANSPORT ARE IN PLACE SO EXPECT PLENTY OF
SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS TODAY. WILL GO WITH CATEGORICAL POPS
FOR MOST PLACES WITH LIKELY POPS ACROSS NORTHERN SECTIONS. TEMPS
WILL BE WARMEST ACROSS NORTHERN MS WHERE THE WARM FRONT WILL MOVE
THROUGH THIS MORNING. READINGS IN LOWER 70S SHOULD BE NO PROBLEM
THERE...MAYBE HIGHER DEPENDING ON CLOUDS AND PRECIP. COOLEST TEMPS
ARE EXPECTED ACROSS THE NORTHERN TIER WHERE LOWER 60S WILL BE THE
TARGET.

THERE IS A SLIGHT RISK FOR SEVERE WEATHER LATER TODAY AND THIS
EVENING FOR THE ENTIRE MID SOUTH. VERTICAL WIND PROFILES WILL SUPPORT
SUPERCELL DEVELOPMENT...ESPECIALLY IN THE VICINITY OF THE WARM
FRONT...IF ENOUGH INSTABILITY IS PRESENT. SURFACE DEWPOINTS WILL
RISE INTO THE MID 60S SOUTH OF THE WARM FRONT WITH MLCAPES OF 500-
1500 J/KG POSSIBLE BY THIS EVENING. IF SUPERCELLS ARE ABLE TO
DEVELOP THEN DAMAGING WINDS...HAIL AND A FEW TORNADOES ARE
POSSIBLE.

THE WARM FRONT WILL MOVE INTO SRN MO/WRN KY BY MIDNIGHT AND THE
SEVERE THREAT SHOULD DIMINISH FOR THE TIME BEING. WL GO WITH
THE HIGHEST POPS ACROSS NORTHERN SECTIONS TONIGHT WITH LESSER POPS
ACRS NORTHERN MISSISSIPPI. IT WILL BE A MILD NIGHT WITH TEMPS IN
THE LOWER 60S MOST PLACES.

TUESDAY...THIS SYSTEM IS LOOKING MORE IMPRESSIVE ALL THE TIME. ETA
AND GFS HAVE GOOD AGREEMENT AND CONTINUITY WITH THIS SYSTEM. 00Z
AND 06Z RUNS ARE 6-12 HOURS SLOWER THAN PREVIOUS RUNS AND THE
FORECAST WILL TAKE THAT INTO ACCOUNT. A STRONG UPPER TROF WILL
DIVE INTO THE CENTRAL PLAINS MONDAY NIGHT WITH A SURFACE LOW
DEVELOPING OVER EASTERN OK BY EARLY TUESDAY. BY EARLY TUESDAY THE
MID SOUTH IS DEEPLY ENTRENCHED IN THE WARM SECTOR WITH SURFACE
DEWPOINTS IN THE LOWER AND MID 60S AND A SOUTHERLY LOW LEVEL JET AT
35-40 KTS AND INCREASING TO 50 KTS. MLCAPES FORECAST BETWEEN 1000-
1500 J/KG TUESDAY MORNING. DURING THE MORNING HOURS THE MAIN 500
MB SHORTWAVE WILL MOVE INTO KANSAS PLACING THE MID SOUTH IN THE
ENTRANCE REGION OF A STRENGTHENING 130 KT JET. VERY FAVORABLE
VERTICAL WIND PROFILES FOR SEVERE WEATHER WILL BE IN PLACE WITH
0-3 KM HELICITY VALES GREATER THAN 250 M2/S2. EXPECT A LINE OF
THUNDERSTORMS TO DEVELOP ALONG THE COLD FRONT THAT WILL MOVE INTO
WESTERN SECTION OF THE FORECAST AREA AROUND 18Z AND SWEEP ACROSS
THE MID SOUTH TUESDAY AFTERNOON AND EARLY EVENING. ALSO...WITH
STRONG FORCING SPREADING ACROSS THE WARM SECTOR IT IS POSSIBLE
THAT DISCRETE SUPERCELLS COULD DEVELOP IN ADVANCE OF THE MAIN
SQUALL LINE.

AS A RESULT OF THIS SCENARIO THERE IS A MODERATE RISK FOR SEVERE
WEATHER TUESDAY INTO EARLY TUESDAY EVENING. THE MAIN THREAT WITH
THE LINE OF THUNDERSTORMS THAT SWEEPS ACROSS THE AREA WILL BE
DAMAGING WINDS. HAIL IS A LESSER THREAT. A FEW TORNADOES CANNOT BE
RULED OUT. IF DISCRETE SUPERCELLS DEVELOP AHEAD OF THE LINE OF
THUNDERSTORMS THEN THE MAIN THREAT FROM THOSE STORMS WILL BE
TORNADOES...WITH HAIL AND DAMAGING WINDS SECONDARY.

TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH THE EXTENDED FORECAST...VERY COOL AIRMASS
MOVES IN BEHIND THE FRONT. TEMPS WILL PLUMMET INTO THE 30S AND LOWER 
40S TUESDAY NIGHT WITH A BRISK NORTHWEST WIND. WEDNESDAY WILL BE  
CHILLY WITH TEMPS ONLY IN THE LOW AND MID 50S. HIGH PRESSURE WILL 
BUILD OVER THE AREA WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND A WIDESPREAD FREEZE IS 
POSSIBLE. SIMILAR CONDITIONS CONTINUE FOR THURSDAY NIGHT SO ANOTHER 
FREEZE MAY BE ON TAP.

A COUPLE OF UPPER TROFS PASS THROUGH DURING THE FRIDAY TO SUNDAY
TIME FRAME. ATTM EXPECT SOME CLOUDS FROM THESE SYSTEMS ALONG WITH
A CONTINUATION OF THE COOL WEATHER.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
359 AM CST MON NOV 14 2005

THE WARM FRONT WILL MOVE INTO SRN MO/WRN KY BY MIDNIGHT AND THE

35-40 KTS AND INCREASING TO 50 KTS. MLCAPES FORECAST BETWEEN 1000-
1500 J/KG TUESDAY MORNING. DURING THE MORNING HOURS THE MAIN 500
MB SHORTWAVE WILL MOVE INTO KANSAS PLACING THE MID SOUTH IN THE
ENTRANCE REGION OF A STRENGTHENING 130 KT JET. VERY FAVORABLE
VERTICAL WIND PROFILES FOR SEVERE WEATHER WILL BE IN PLACE WITH
0-3 KM HELICITY VALES GREATER THAN 250 M2/S2. EXPECT A LINE OF
THUNDERSTORMS TO DEVELOP ALONG THE COLD FRONT THAT WILL MOVE INTO
WESTERN SECTION OF THE FORECAST AREA AROUND 18Z AND SWEEP ACROSS
THE MID SOUTH TUESDAY AFTERNOON AND EARLY EVENING. ALSO...WITH
STRONG FORCING SPREADING ACROSS THE WARM SECTOR IT IS POSSIBLE
THAT DISCRETE SUPERCELLS COULD DEVELOP IN ADVANCE OF THE MAIN
SQUALL LINE.

AS A RESULT OF THIS SCENARIO THERE IS A MODERATE RISK FOR SEVERE
WEATHER TUESDAY INTO EARLY TUESDAY EVENING. THE MAIN THREAT WITH
THE LINE OF THUNDERSTORMS THAT SWEEPS ACROSS THE AREA WILL BE
DAMAGING WINDS. HAIL IS A LESSER THREAT. A FEW TORNADOES CANNOT BE
RULED OUT. IF DISCRETE SUPERCELLS DEVELOP AHEAD OF THE LINE OF
THUNDERSTORMS THEN THE MAIN THREAT FROM THOSE STORMS WILL BE
TORNADOES...WITH HAIL AND DAMAGING WINDS SECONDARY.

TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH THE EXTENDED FORECAST...VERY COOL AIRMASS
MOVES IN BEHIND THE FRONT. TEMPS WILL PLUMMET INTO THE 30S AND
LOWER 40S TUESDAY WITH A BRISK NORTHWEST WIND. WEDNESDAY WILL BE A
CHILLY WITH TEMPS ONLY IN THE LOW AND MID 50S. HIGH PRESSURE WILL
BUILD OVER THE AREA WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND A WIDESPREAD FREEZE IS
POSSIBLE. SIMILAR CONDITIONS CONTINUE FOR THURSDAY NIGHT SO
ANOTHER FREEZE MAY BE ON TAP.

A COUPLE OF UPPER TROFS PASS THROUGH DURING THE FRIDAY TO SUNDAY
TIME FRAME. ATTM EXPECT SOME CLOUDS FROM THESE SYSTEMS ALONG WITH
A CONTINUATION OF THE COOL WEATHER.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
MEM  69  63  70  40 /  80  60  80  40 
MKL  66  61  70  38 /  80  60  80  50 
JBR  63  59  68  35 /  70  70  80  10 
TUP  72  62  74  43 /  90  50  70  60 

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.
&&

$$

SJM
