000 
FXUS64 KMEG 140214
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
813 PM CST SUN NOV 13 2005

.DISCUSSION...QUASI STATIONARY SURFACE BOUNDARY STRETCHES FROM 
WESTERN TENNESSEE TO NORTHERN/CENTRAL MISSISSIPPI AND THEN INTO 
NORTHERN LOUISIANA. THIS BOUNDARY WILL SLOWLY BEGIN TO MOVE BACK 
NORTH AS A WARM FRONT MONDAY. ADDITIONAL CONVECTION OVER THE PAST 
COUPLE OF HOURS HAS DEVELOPED ACROSS SOUTHERN ARKANSAS...SLOWLY 
DRIFTING EAST NORTHEAST. ACROSS THE MID SOUTH...CONVECTION SLOWLY 
BEGINNING TO INCREASE ONCE AGAIN ALONG AND SOUTH OF THE BOUNDARY. 
MODEL SOUNDINGS AND STABILITY PARAMETERS SUGGEST THAT THUNDER WILL 
BE MINIMAL AND ELEVATED IF ANY DEVELOPS ACROSS THE MID SOUTH. NORTH 
OF THE STALLED OUT BOUNDARY A FEW SPOTS ALREADY REPORTING 1-2 SM 
VISIBILITIES. WILL ISSUE AN UPDATE TO ADJUST FORECAST FOR 
PRECIPITATION/TEMPERATURE TRENDS AND TO ADD PATCHY FOG TO AREAS 
ALONG AND NORTH OF THE BOUNDARY. 

UPDATED GRIDS WILL BE PUBLISHED SHORTLY.

CJC 

.PREV DISCUSSION...ISSUED 310 PM CST SUN NOV 13 2005...

SURFACE MAP SHOWS THE COLD FRONT HAS PASSED THROUGH JONESBORO AND
EXTENDS SOUTHWEST THROUGH CENTRAL ARKANSAS. BOTH GFS/NAM SHOW THE
FRONT MOVING TO NEAR I 40 BY 00Z AND BECOMING ORIENTED WEST TO
EAST ACROSS EXTREME SOUTHERN ARKANSAS AND NORTHERN HALF OF
MISSISSIPPI OVERNIGHT. RAIN CHANCES EXIST OVERNIGHT WITH BOTH
MODELS SHOWING SCATTERED CONVECTION DEVELOPING ALONG THE FRONT
THROUGHOUT THE NIGHT. THUNDER WILL LIKELY BE LIMITED DUE TO LACK
OF INSTABILITY ALTHOUGH THERE IS ENOUGH INSTABILITY FOR A RUMBLE
OF THUNDER. GFS/NAM SHOWING A GOOD DEAL OF 850MB MOISTURE HANGING
AROUND MUCH OF THE AREA. EXPECT CLEARING TO BE LIMITED TO EXTREME
NORTHEAST ARKANSAS INTO THE BOOTHEEL.

TOMORROW...FRONT WILL BEGIN TO SLOWLY MEANDER ITS WAY NORTHWARD AS A
WARM FRONT. THERE IS A FAIR AMOUNT OF INSTABILITY SOUTH OF THE
FRONT AND THERE IS A GOOD DEAL OF SHEAR NORTH OF THE FRONT. BOTH
MODELS SHOWING A PIECE OF ENERGY MOVING UP THROUGH NORTHEAST
MISSISSIPPI RESULTING IN HIGHER RAIN CHANCES THERE.
ELSEWHERE...SCATTERED SHOWERS AND A FEW THUNDERSTORMS POSSIBLE
WITH THE WARM FRONT. SEVERE POTENTIAL IS VERY QUESTIONABLE FOR
TOMORROW SINCE NORTH OF THE FRONT WHERE THE BETTER SHEAR IS
LOCATED THE INSTABILITY IS VERY MUCH HINDERED DUE TO A SHARP
TEMPERATURE INVERSION AT 925MB. IF A THUNDERSTORM COULD MANAGE TO
DEVELOP RIGHT ALONG THE FRONT...THERE JUST MIGHT BE ENOUGH OF THE
INSTABILITY AND SHEAR FOR ISOLATED TORNADO THREAT. 

TOMORROW NIGHT THE WARM FRONT CONTINUES MOVING NORTH OF THE AREA.
RAIN CHANCES CONTINUE WITH THE WARM FRONT AROUND. A STRONG COLD
FRONT WILL APPROACH THE REGION LATE TOMORROW NIGHT. ALTHOUGH THE
FRONT IS NOT EXPECTED TO ARRIVE NOW UNTIL AFTER 12Z...BETTER RAIN
CHANCES EXIST OVER NORTHEAST ARKANSAS DUE TO UNCERTAINTY IN THE
TIMING OF THE FRONT.

TUESDAY...STRONG COLD FRONT PLOWS INTO THE REGION. THIS WOULD
LIKELY BE A CLEAR CUT SIGNIFICANT SEVERE WEATHER OUTBREAK IF THE
INSTABILITY WAS BETTER. THE PROBLEM WITH A POTENTIAL OUTBREAK IS
TOO MUCH LOW LEVEL MOISTURE TRANSLATING INTO CLOUD COVER
TRANSLATING INTO LOW INSTABILITY. STILL...GIVEN THE STRENGTH OF THE
FRONT (+12 850MB TEMPS AHEAD OF FRONT VS -2 BEHIND) AND +100 KT
JET MOVING ACROSS MISSOURI...THERE IS A SLIGHT RISK THAT THE
DYNAMICS MAY OVERCOME THE INSTABILITY. THERE IS CERTAINLY A
STRAIGHT LINE WIND THREAT DUE TO THE PROXIMITY OF THE UPPER LEVER
LEVEL WINDS. HELICITY VALUES ARE OVER 150 M2/S2 SO THERE IS ALSO A
TORNADO THREAT. ONCE AGAIN...INSTABILITY THE KEY HERE.

RAIN CHANCES CONTINUE INTO TUESDAY NIGHT DUE TO FRONT TIMING. COLD
DOME OF HIGH PRESSURE THEN BUILDS OVER THE AREA WITH 850 TEMPS
AROUND -2 OVER THE REGION. A WIDESPREAD FREEZE IS POSSIBLE AROUND
MID WEEK AS THE HIGH BECOMES CENTERED OVER THE AREA. GFS IS NOT
CONSISTENT TOWARDS THE END OF THE WEEK WITH TODAYS SOLUTION
ADVERTISING A PAIR OF CLIPPER SYSTEMS MOVING THROUGH THE REGION
WHEREAS YESTERDAYS RUN SHOWED HIGH PRESSURE FIRMLY IN CONTROL.
WILL CONTINUE WITH CURRENT FORECAST OF COOL DRY WEATHER UNTIL THE
MODELS SHOW A BIT MORE CONSISTENCY IN THE EXTENDED.


&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.
&&

$$

VALLE

FXUS64 KMEG 131632
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
1032 AM CST SUN NOV 13 2005

.DISCUSSION...

SURFACE COLD FRONT IS ENTERING THE BOOTHEEL AND NORTHEAST ARKANSAS
AND EXTENDS SOUTHWEST THROUGH THE ARKANSAS. SATELLITE SHOWS MAINLY
CLOUDY CONDITIONS THROUGHOUT THE REGION WITH CLEARING OCCURRING
BEHIND THE FRONT. REGIONAL RADAR SHOWS TWO MAIN AREAS OF RAIN.
BOTH ARE MOVING FROM SOUTHWEST TO NORTHEAST. ONE AREA IS JUST
SOUTH OF TUPELO AND EXTENDS THROUGH GREENWOOD. THIS AREA IS PRETTY
SOLID WITH LITTLE BREAKS. THE SECOND AREA RUNS NEAR TO I 40 BUT IT
IS MUCH MORE SCATTERED IN NATURE. THERE ARE JUST A COUPLE OF
LIGHTNING STRIKES IN EACH BAND. TODAYS FORECAST HAS BEEN ADJUSTED
FOR TEMPS DUE TO CLOUDS/RAIN ALSO HAVE ADJUSTED RAIN CHANCES AND
THUNDERSTORM CHANCES DUE TO CURRENT TRENDS. FRONT IS EXPECTED TO
BE NEAR I 40 BY 00Z WITH SOME CLEARING OCCURRING BEHIND THE FRONT.

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 131311 CCA
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...CORRECTED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
710 AM CST SUN NOV 13 2005

.DISCUSSION...

A BROAD LINE OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS WAS MOVING ACROSS THE MID 
SOUTH EARLY THIS MORNING. AIRMASS FAIRLY STABLE ACRS THE AREA THOUGH 
LOW LEVEL WINDS ARE QUITE STRONG...40-50 KTS AT 3KFT ON THE KNQA 88D 
WIND PROFILE...RESULTING IN SOME GUSTY SFC WINDS WITH SOME OF THESE 
TSTMS. KNQA REPORTED A GUST TO 37 MPH RECENTLY.

TODAY AND TONIGHT...SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS WILL BE MOST NUMEROUS
ACROSS SE HALF OF THE AREA AS A COLD FRONT SLOWLY MOVES THROUGH
THE AREA. SOME DRIER AIR WILL TRY TO WORK INTO NRN SXNS LATER
TODAY AND THE SUN MAY BREAK OUT IN THOSE AREAS. THE FRONT WL STALL 
ACRS NRN MS LATER TODAY AND TONIGHT. BEST CHANCES FOR PRECIP TONIGHT 
WL BE ACRS NRN MS WITH LESSER CHANCES TO THE NORTH.

MONDAY...THE STALLED FRONT WILL MOVE NORTHWARD ON MON AS A WARM 
FRONT. BY MON AFTN THE FRONT SHOULD BE LOCATED FROM NRN AR EASTWARD
TO W TN. SFC DEWPOINTS WL CLIMB TO THE LOWER 60S SOUTH OF THE FRONT 
WITH DECENT INSTABILITY FOR THIS TIME OF YEAR. SBCAPES SHOULD BE 
GREATER THAN 1000 J/KG AND SFC LIFTED INDICES AROUND -2C. IN THIS 
SCENARIO STRONG VEERING WOULD BE PRESENT ALONG THE WARM FRONT WITH 
HELICITIES IN THE 200-400 M2/S2 RANGE. GFS AND ETA BOTH IN GOOD 
AGREEMENT WITH THIS WARM FRONT...THOUGH THE ETA IS A LITTLE FURTHER 
NORTH AT 00Z TUE. MODELS DEPICT A SHORTWAVE ACRS KS/MO THAT MAY 
PROVIDE THE LIFT NEEDED TO TRIGGER TSTMS AND POSSIBLY SUPERCELL 
STORMS. IF STORMS ARE ABLE TO DEVELOP THEN DAMAGING WIND...HAIL AND 
TORNADOES ARE POSSIBLE...MAINLY ACRS NORTHERN SECTIONS OF THE MID 
SOUTH MON AFTN INTO MON EVENING.

MONDAY NIGHT AND TUESDAY...WARM FRONT WL SHIFT NORTH OF THE AREA
MON NIGHT AS A STRONG UPPER TROF DIVES INTO THE CNTRL PLAINS.
SURFACE LOW PRESSURE WL DEVELOP ACRS THE SRN PLAINS AND MOVE TO
SE MO BY 12Z TUE. A LINE OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS WILL DEVELOP
ALONG AND IN ADVANCE OF THE ASSOCD COLD FRONT LOCATED FROM THE
SFC LOW SOUTHWESTWARD INTO THE ARKLATEX BY 12Z TUE. THIS LINE OF
THUNDERSTORMS WILL SWEEP ACRS THE MID SOUTH ON TUE. 00Z AND 06Z
ETA/GFS MODEL RUNS ARE IN VERY GOOD AGREEMENT WITH RESPECT TO THIS 
SYSTEM. THEY ARE ALSO A LITTLE SLOWER WITH MOVING THIS SYSTEM THROUGH
THAN PREVIOUS RUNS. SEVERE WEATHER ALSO APPEARS POSSIBLE AS THIS 
FRONT MOVES THROUGH. AIRMASS DESTABILIZES IN ADVANCE OF THE FRONT ON 
TUE. SBCAPES OF 500-1000 J/KG...SFC DEWPOINTS 60-65F AND VERY STRONG 
UNIDIRECTIONAL WIND FIELDS POINT TO A SQUALL LINE WITH DAMAGING 
WINDS AS THE GREATEST THREAT FOLLOWED BY HAIL.

TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY NIGHT...WL LEAVE SOME LINGERING
SHOWERS ACRS NE MS THROUGH MIDNIGHT OTHERWISE HIGH PRESSURE
BUILDING ACRS THE REGION WITH MUCH COOLER AIR RUSHING IN AND TEMPS
DROPPING INTO THE 30S MOST PLACES. WEDNESDAY WL BE QUITE FALL LIKE
WITH BRISK NORTHWEST WINDS AND HIGH TEMPS IN THE LOWER AND MID
50S. HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS DIRECTLY OVER THE MID SOUTH WEDNESDAY
NIGHT AND THIS WL RESULT IN A WIDESPREAD FREEZE.

EXTENDED...DRY CONDITIONS WITH BELOW NORMAL TEMPS WL CONT DURING
THE THU TO SAT TIME FRAME.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
MEM  68  54  68  62 /  60  20  40  50 
MKL  66  51  66  60 /  60  20  50  50 
JBR  67  49  65  56 /  30  10  40  60 
TUP  70  57  70  61 /  80  50  60  40 

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...

THAN PREVIOUS RUNS. SEVERE WEATHER ALSO APPEARS POSSIBLE AS THIS
FRONT MOVES THOUGH. AIRMASS DESTABILIZES IN ADVANCE OF THE FRONT
ON TUE. SBCAPES OF 500-1000 J/KG...SFC DEWPOINTS 60-65F AND VERY
STRONG UNIDIRECTIONAL WIND FIELDS POINT TO A SQUALL LINE WITH

FXUS64 KMEG 130249
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
846 PM CST SAT NOV 12 2005

.DISCUSSION...2Z SURFACE ANALYSIS THIS EVENING PLACES CENTER OF LOW 
PRESSURE ACROSS DES MOINES IOWA WITH A SURFACE COLD FRONT EXTENDING 
SOUTH INTO EASTERN KANSAS/WESTERN MISSOURI. A DRYLINE EXTENDS FURTHER 
SOUTHWARD ACROSS EASTERN OKLAHOMA AND TEXAS. SO FAR LOW LEVEL 
MOISTURE HAS BEEN CONFINED MAINLY TO WESTERN MISSOURI AND THE 
WESTERN HALF OF ARKANSAS THUS FAR WITH DEWPOINTS ACROSS THE MID 
SOUTH STILL IN THE 30S AND 40S. MAIN FORECAST CONCERN OVERNIGHT IS 
CONVECTIVE POTENTIAL. 

NEARLY UNIDIRECTIONAL 35 KT 850 MB WINDS AND 50 KT 500 MB WINDS 
ALONG WITH 10C 700 MB DEWPOINT DEPRESSIONS SUPPORT LINEAR 
ORGANIZATION WITH CONVECTION TONIGHT...AS REGIONAL WSR-88D RADAR 
TRENDS ALREADY SUGGEST. SHORT TERM LAPS ANALYSIS SHOW ATMOSPHERE 
ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA SLOWLY BEGINNING TO DESTABILIZE AS MODERATE 
/6.5 C/KM 700-500 MB LAYER LAPSE RATES SLOWLY WORK EAST ACROSS 
ARKANSAS. IN ADDITION...LATEST INFRARED SATELLITE TRENDS OVER THE 
PAST HOUR SHOW CONVECTIVE CLOUD TOPS WARMING ACROSS WESTERN 
ARKANSAS...A SIGN OF WEAKENING CONVECTION. NOT ANTICIPATING ANY 
SEVERE WEATHER OVERNIGHT ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA AS UPSTREAM 
CONVECTION ARRIVES. FORECAST GRIDS ON TRACK OVERALL...BUT WILL ISSUE 
AN UPDATE TO MAKE SOME MINOR ADJUSTMENTS BASED ON CURRENT TRENDS.  

UPDATED GRIDS WILL BE PUBLISHED SHORTLY.

CJC

.PREV DISCUSSION...ISSUED 247 PM CST SAT NOV 12 2005...

SATELLITE SHOWS CLOUDS OVER ARKANSAS SLOWLY MOVING EASTWARD. THESE
CLOUDS SHOULD GRADUALLY OVERTAKE MUCH OF THE REGION THIS EVENING.
RADAR HAS DETECTED A FEW ECHOS OVER EASTERN ARKANSAS. AT MOST THIS
IS SPRINKLES IF IT IS REACHING THE SURFACE AT ALL GIVEN THE DRY
LOW LEVELS. NO SIGNIFICANT CHANGES IN THE MODELS. EXPECT
PRECIPITATION TO BREAK OUT OVER CENTRAL ARKANSAS LATE THIS EVENING
AS THE 850MB FRONT MOVES INTO THE REGION. THE SURFACE FRONT WILL
BE LAGGING BEHIND. SEVERE POTENTIAL CONTINUE TO LOOK LOW BECAUSE
THE UPPER DYNAMICS ARE NOT IN PHASE WITH THE SURFACE FEATURE AND
INSTABILITY IS LOW. GIVEN THE STRENGTH OF THE WIND AHEAD OF THE
FRONT...A FEW STRONGER WIND GUSTS UP TO AROUND 35 OR 40 MPH ARE
POSSIBLE ACROSS EASTERN ARKANSAS TONIGHT AS THE CONVECTION
APPROACHES. CHANCES FOR RAIN WILL LINGER INTO SUNDAY AS THE FRONT
MOVES THROUGH THE REGION WITH THE SURFACE FRONT STALLING ACROSS
CENTRAL MISSISSIPPI. RAIN CHANCES WILL PERSIST ACROSS MUCH OF NORTHERN
MISSISSIPPI DUE TO UNCERTAINTY WITH THE STALLING OF THE FRONT AND
WAVES MOVING ALONG THE FRONT. ALTHOUGH SOME CLEARING IS POSSIBLE
SUNDAY AFTERNOON AND SUNDAY EVENING...BOTH GFS/ETA SHOW MOISTURE
AT 850MB SURGING BACK NORTHWARD SUNDAY NIGHT AS THE FRONT BEGINS
TO MOVE NORTH. 

THE FRONT WILL MOVE THROUGH AND WELL NORTH OF THE REGION ON
MONDAY. HAVE RAISED RAIN CHANCES ON MONDAY SINCE THE FRONT MAY
FIRE A SHOWER OR THUNDERSTORM OFF AS IT MOVES THROUGH THE REGION.
BOTH NAM AND GFS KEY ON AN UPPER LEVEL FEATURE MOVING OUT OF
LOUISIANA MONDAY MORNING AND MOVING THROUGH NORTHERN MISSISSIPPI
DURING THE DAY ON MONDAY. THUS...HIGHER RAIN CHANCES ACROSS THIS
AREA. WITH BOTH MODELS SHOWING AN ABUNDANT AMOUNT OF MOISTURE
AROUND AT 850MB...AGREE WITH GUIDANCE THAT IT MAY BE MAINLY
CLOUDY. 

GOOD CHANCES FOR RAIN MONDAY NIGHT AND TUESDAY AS A STRONG COLD
FRONT DROPS SOUTHEASTWARD INTO THE REGION. SEVERE POTENTIAL
REMAINS MARGINAL AT THIS POINT WITH THE BIG QUESTION INVOLVING
INSTABILITY. A 120KT JET WILL BE RACING ACROSS MISSOURI AND INTO
THE OHIO VALLEY AT THIS TIME WHICH MAY PROVIDE ADDITIONAL LIFT.
NAM AND GFS 0-3KM HELICITY VALUES ARE ABOVE 150 M2/S2. TOO EARLY
TO GET TOO CONCERNED ABOUT THE SITUATION BUT CERTAINLY SOMETHING TO
KEEP AN EYE ON. THE FRONT SHOULD MOVE THROUGH THE AREA BY 00Z
WEDNESDAY. 850MB TEMPS BY 12Z WEDNESDAY COULD BE AS LOW AS -4
ACROSS PORTIONS OF THE REGION. TO FURTHER HIGHLIGHT THE STRENGTH
OF THE FRONT...850 TEMPS 12Z TUESDAY ARE PROJECTED TO BE +12.

BELOW NORMAL CONDITIONS AND DRY WEATHER ARE FORECASTED FOR THE
REMAINDER OF THE WEEK AS CANADIAN HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS OVER THE
AREA. FREEZING TEMPERATURES ARE POSSIBLE ONCE AGAIN AROUND MID WEEK.

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.
&&

$$

VALLE

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 122047
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
247 PM CST SAT NOV 12 2005

.DISCUSSION...

SATELLITE SHOWS CLOUDS OVER ARKANSAS SLOWLY MOVING EASTWARD. THESE
CLOUDS SHOULD GRADUALLY OVERTAKE MUCH OF THE REGION THIS EVENING.
RADAR HAS DETECTED A FEW ECHOS OVER EASTERN ARKANSAS. AT MOST THIS
IS SPRINKLES IF IT IS REACHING THE SURFACE AT ALL GIVEN THE DRY
LOW LEVELS. NO SIGNIFICANT CHANGES IN THE MODELS. EXPECT
PRECIPITATION TO BREAK OUT OVER CENTRAL ARKANSAS LATE THIS EVENING
AS THE 850MB FRONT MOVES INTO THE REGION. THE SURFACE FRONT WILL
BE LAGGING BEHIND. SEVERE POTENTIAL CONTINUE TO LOOK LOW BECAUSE
THE UPPER DYNAMICS ARE NOT IN PHASE WITH THE SURFACE FEATURE AND
INSTABILITY IS LOW. GIVEN THE STRENGTH OF THE WIND AHEAD OF THE
FRONT...A FEW STRONGER WIND GUSTS UP TO AROUND 35 OR 40 MPH ARE
POSSIBLE ACROSS EASTERN ARKANSAS TONIGHT AS THE CONVECTION
APPROACHES. CHANCES FOR RAIN WILL LINGER INTO SUNDAY AS THE FRONT
MOVES THROUGH THE REGION WITH THE SURFACE FRONT STALLING ACROSS
CENTRAL MISSISSIPPI. RAIN CHANCES WILL PERSIST ACROSS MUCH OF NORTHERN
MISSISSIPPI DUE TO UNCERTAINTY WITH THE STALLING OF THE FRONT AND
WAVES MOVING ALONG THE FRONT. ALTHOUGH SOME CLEARING IS POSSIBLE
SUNDAY AFTERNOON AND SUNDAY EVENING...BOTH GFS/ETA SHOW MOISTURE
AT 850MB SURGING BACK NORTHWARD SUNDAY NIGHT AS THE FRONT BEGINS
TO MOVE NORTH. 

THE FRONT WILL MOVE THROUGH AND WELL NORTH OF THE REGION ON
MONDAY. HAVE RAISED RAIN CHANCES ON MONDAY SINCE THE FRONT MAY
FIRE A SHOWER OR THUNDERSTORM OFF AS IT MOVES THROUGH THE REGION.
BOTH NAM AND GFS KEY ON AN UPPER LEVEL FEATURE MOVING OUT OF
LOUISIANA MONDAY MORNING AND MOVING THROUGH NORTHERN MISSISSIPPI
DURING THE DAY ON MONDAY. THUS...HIGHER RAIN CHANCES ACROSS THIS
AREA. WITH BOTH MODELS SHOWING AN ABUNDANT AMOUNT OF MOISTURE
AROUND AT 850MB...AGREE WITH GUIDANCE THAT IT MAY BE MAINLY
CLOUDY. 

GOOD CHANCES FOR RAIN MONDAY NIGHT AND TUESDAY AS A STRONG COLD
FRONT DROPS SOUTHEASTWARD INTO THE REGION. SEVERE POTENTIAL
REMAINS MARGINAL AT THIS POINT WITH THE BIG QUESTION INVOLVING
INSTABILITY. A 120KT JET WILL BE RACING ACROSS MISSOURI AND INTO
THE OHIO VALLEY AT THIS TIME WHICH MAY PROVIDE ADDITIONAL LIFT.
NAM AND GFS 0-3KM HELICITY VALUES ARE ABOVE 150 M2/S2. TOO EARLY
TO GET TOO CONCERNED ABOUT THE SITUATION BUT CERTAINLY SOMETHING TO
KEEP AN EYE ON. THE FRONT SHOULD MOVE THROUGH THE AREA BY 00Z
WEDNESDAY. 850MB TEMPS BY 12Z WEDNESDAY COULD BE AS LOW AS -4
ACROSS PORTIONS OF THE REGION. TO FURTHER HIGHLIGHT THE STRENGTH
OF THE FRONT...850 TEMPS 12Z TUESDAY ARE PROJECTED TO BE +12.

BELOW NORMAL CONDITIONS AND DRY WEATHER ARE FORECASTED FOR THE
REMAINDER OF THE WEEK AS CANADIAN HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS OVER THE
AREA. FREEZING TEMPERATURES ARE POSSIBLE ONCE AGAIN AROUND MID WEEK.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
1017 AM CST SAT NOV 12 2005

.DISCUSSION...

REGIONAL RADAR SHOWS A THIN LINE OF SHOWERS ORIENTED NORTH TO
SOUTH ACROSS CENTRAL ARKANSAS MOVING SLOWLY EASTWARD. DEW POINTS
ARE EXTREMELY LOW ACROSS THE MID SOUTH. AS A RESULT...EXPECT THAT
VERY LITTLE IF ANY RAIN WOULD OCCUR. STILL...SLIGHT CHANCE OF
SHOWERS CANT BE ENTIRELY RULED OUT FROM ROUGHLY THE MISSISSIPPI
RIVER WESTWARD THIS AFTERNOON. OTHERWISE...FORECAST IS PRETTY MUCH
ON TRACK. SHOULD SEE AN INCREASE IN CLOUD COVER ACROSS EASTERN
ARKANSAS INTO EXTREME WEST TN AND NORTHWEST MS THIS AFTERNOON.
HIGH TEMPS LOOK REASONABLE. SEVERE POTENTIAL FOR THIS AFTERNOON
AND TONIGHT LOOKS RATHER MARGINAL. INSTABILITY IS REAL LOW. WINDS
ARE FAIRLY STRONG OFF THE SURFACE WHICH IS REALLY THE ONLY
POSSIBLE THREAT. POSSIBLY MIXING DOWN SOME STRONGER WIND GUSTS
TONIGHT...BUT ONCE AGAIN LIKELY VERY ISOLATED IF AT ALL.

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 120929
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
329 AM CST SAT NOV 12 2005

.DISCUSSION...

CLEAR SKIES ACROSS THE MID SOUTH THIS MORNING AS HIGH PRESSURE WAS
LOCATED ACROSS THE SOUTHEAST U.S. LARGE TEMPERATURES RANGES ACROSS
THE MID SOUTH THIS MORNING. SOME EASTERN SECTIONS DECOUPLED AND
WENT CALM AND TEMPS HAVE FALLEN INTO THE 30S. MEANWHILE LIGHT
SOUTHERLY WINDS WERE KEEPING MEMPHIS TEMPS AROUND 50. 

TODAY THROUGH SUNDAY...HIGH PRESSURE WL CONT TO SLIP EAST TODAY BUT 
NOT BEFORE ANOTHER NICE DAY ACROSS THE REGION. EXPECT TEMPS IN THE
LOWER 70S WITH INCREASING CLOUDS ACROSS WESTERN SECTIONS.
DEWPOINTS WL START TO RISE ACRS THE AREA...ESPECIALLY ERN AR/MO
BOOTHEEL THIS AFTN. A 500 MB SHORTWAVE MOVES FROM THE ROCKIES
INTO THE MS VALLEY BY LATE THIS AFTN AND TONIGHT PROVIDING SOME
LIFT ACRS THE SRN PLAINS. EXPECT A LINE OF SHOWERS AND
THUNDERSTORMS TO DEVELOP ALONG THE INSTABILITY AXIS IN ADVANCE OF
THE SFC DRYLINE/COLD FRONT ACRS ERN OK LATER TODAY INTO THIS
EVENING AND MOVE ACROSS ARKANSAS TONIGHT. THIS LINE WL BE
WEAKENING AS IT MOVES EAST SINCE UPPER SUPPORT WL BE RACING
NORTHEAST AND INSTABILITY WL BE DECREASING. A FEW STORMS ACRS ERN
AR MAY BE STRONG TONIGHT WITH SOME SMALL HAIL AND GUSTY WINDS.
EXPECT MILD TEMPS ACRS THE REGION TONIGHT WITH READINGS MAINLY IN
THE 50S. SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS WL MOVE ACRS THE REGION TONIGHT
AND SUNDAY WITH THE FRONT STALLING OUT JUST SOUTH OF THE FORECAST
AREA SUNDAY NIGHT. A LITTLE COOLER ON SUNDAY WITH CLOUDS AND
PRECIP.

SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY...FRONT STALLED JUST TO OUR SOUTH ON
SUNDAY NIGHT WITH SMALL CHANCES FOR PRECIP ACRS PARTS OF NORTH MS.
COOLER AIR BRUSHES NORTHERN SECTIONS SUNDAY NIGHT. THIS FRONT
SURGES BACK NORTH ON MONDAY AS A WARM FRONT WITH SMALL CHANCE OF
PRECIP AREAWIDE AND DEWPOINTS CLIMBING ABOVE 60F. 

MONDAY NIGHT AND TUESDAY...STRONG SHORTWAVE DIVES INTO THE MID MS
VALLEY MONDAY NIGHT WITH ASSOCD COLD FRONT PLOWING THROUGH THE
MID SOUTH MON NIGHT AND TUE. MOIST AND SOMEWHAT UNSTABLE AIRMASS
IN ADVANCE OF THE FRONT SO THERE ARE SOME SEVERE WEATHER CONCERNS.
MUCH COOLER AIRMASS WL BE USHERED IN BEHIND THE FRONT.

TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY...COOL HIGH PRESSURE WL BUILD ACRS
THE SOUTHERN PLAINS TUE NIGHT AND MOVE DIRECTLY OVER THE AREA BY
12Z THU. THERE IS A CHANCE OF A WIDESPREAD FREEZE THU MORNING. A
DRY COLD FRONT WL PUSH THROUGH THU NIGHT WITH A REINFORCING SHOT OF
COOL AIR FOR FRI.

&&

JBR  70  56  65  46 /  10  80  40  10

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 120259
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
859 PM CST FRI NOV 11 2005

.DISCUSSION...02Z SURFACE ANALYSIS THIS EVENING CENTERS HIGH 
PRESSURE ACROSS WEST VIRGINIA EXTENDING THROUGH NEW ENGLAND AND THE 
SOUTHEAST UNITED STATES. MEANWHILE...THE NEXT COLD FRONT TO AFFECT 
THE MID SOUTH SATURDAY NIGHT AND SUNDAY IS LOCATED ACROSS THE 
NORTHERN/CENTRAL PLAINS. TEMPERATURES THIS EVENING ACROSS THE MID 
SOUTH ARE IN THE MIDDLE 40S TO 50S. VERY LITTLE CLOUD COVER EVIDENT 
ON INFRARED SATELLITE WITH THE EXCEPTION OF A FEW CIRRUS AS 00Z UPPER 
ANALYSIS PLACES UPPER LEVEL RIDGING ACROSS THE LOWER MISSISSIPPI 
VALLEY. WILL UPDATE GRIDS TO MAKE MINOR TEMPERATURE ADJUSTMENTS 
BASED ON CURRENT TRENDS. 

UPDATED GRIDS WILL BE PUBLISHED SHORTLY.

CJC

.PREV DISCUSSION...ISSUED 239 PM CST FRI NOV 11 2005...

AN AREA OF HIGH PRESSURE EXTENDS FROM EASTERN KENTUCKY THROUGH
NORTHWEST MISSISSIPPI. THE HIGH WILL MOVE EASTWARD TONIGHT AS THE
UPPER LEVEL RIDGE SHIFTS EASTWARD AND A SHORTWAVE TROUGH ADVANCES
INTO THE PLAINS OVERNIGHT. LOOKING AT MAINLY CLEAR SKIES WITH ONLY
A FEW CIRRUS DRIFTING THROUGH THE REGION ONCE AGAIN TONIGHT. DEW
POINTS ARE EVEN LOWER THIS AFTERNOON WITH SEVERAL STATIONS OVER
WEST TN AND NORTHEAST MS REPORTED DEW POINTS IN THE TEENS.
HOWEVER...THE GRADIENT SHOULD INCREASE DURING THE EVENING WHICH
SHOULD ALLOW WINDS TO REMAIN UP A LITTLE OVERNIGHT. AS A
RESULT...DO NOT EXPECT TEMPERATURES TO APPROACH FREEZING POINT
TONIGHT. 

EXPECT PERIODS OF CLOUDS TOMORROW ASSOCIATED WITH A DEW POINT
SURGE AHEAD OF THE NEXT SHORTWAVE AND ASSOCIATED COLD FRONT. DEW
POINTS OVER THE MID SOUTH WILL START IN THE 30S IN THE MORNING BUT
WILL CLIMB INTO THE 40S WITH 50 DEW POINTS OVER MUCH OF ARKANSAS
BY SUNSET. RAIN WILL LIKELY HOLD OFF UNTIL THE LATER IN THE
EVENING AND OVERNIGHT TOMORROW NIGHT. ETA IS A FEW HOURS SLOWER THAN
THE GFS IN BRINGING RAIN INTO THE REGION. THE GFS DEVELOPS THE
PRECIPITATION AHEAD OF THE FRONT IN THE VICINITY OF THE UPPER
LEVEL SHORTWAVE MOVING THROUGH THE REGION WHEREAS THE ETA HOLDS
PRECIP BACK CLOSER TO THE FRONT YET STILL JUST AHEAD OF THE FRONT.
EITHER CASE...EXPECT MOST AREAS TO SEE MEASURABLE RAIN EITHER
TOMORROW NIGHT OR SUNDAY MORNING. THERE MAY BE ENOUGH INSTABILITY
AROUND FOR A FEW CLAPS OF THUNDER BUT AM NOT EXPECTING SEVERE
WEATHER BECAUSE THE UPPER LEVEL FEATURES ARE OUTRUNNING THE
SURFACE FRONT. RAINFALL AMOUNTS ARE UNCERTAIN AND WILL LARGELY
DEPEND UPON JUST HOW STRONG THE LIFT WITH THE UPPER JET IS AND HOW
MUCH MOISTURE ADVECTS INTO THE AREA. BROAD ESTIMATE WOULD BE A
QUARTER TO THREE QUARTERS OF AN INCH. THE SYSTEM SHOULD BE EXITING
THE REGION AROUND 00Z ON SUNDAY WITH THE FRONT EVENTUALLY STALLING
OUT JUST SOUTH OF THE AREA. WILL LINGER POPS ACROSS THE REGION
SUNDAY NIGHT DUE TO TIMING UNCERTAINTIES. THE FRONT IS EXPECTED TO
SURGE BACK NORTHWARD AS A WARM FRONT ON MONDAY AS ANOTHER LOW
PRESSURE SYSTEM ENTERS THE PLAINS. LOW CHANCES FOR RAIN ON MONDAY
DUE TO LOW MOISTURE AND WEAK UPPER DYNAMICS. 

THE GFS SHOWS THE NEXT FRONT MOVING INTO THE AREA LATE MONDAY
NIGHT AND THROUGH THE AREA TUESDAY AFTERNOON WITH PRECIPITATION
DEVELOPING OVER THE REGION AND ALONG THE FRONT AS A 120KT UPPER
JET STREAK RACES ACROSS MISSOURI AND INTO THE OHIO VALLEY. SEVERE
POTENTIAL STILL UNCERTAIN BUT HAVE CONCERNS ABOUT THE QUICK TURN
AROUND BETWEEN SYSTEM WITH REGARDS TO MOISTURE RETURN AND
INSTABILITY. THE GFS AND EUROPEAN SHOW ANOTHER COLD SHOT ABOUT 6
HOURS BEHIND THE SURFACE FRONT MOVING INTO THE REGION. 850 TEMPS
BY 12Z WEDNESDAY OVER MEMPHIS ARE AROUND -2. WOULDNT BE SURPRISED
IF HIGH TEMPS OCCUR IN THE MORNING ON TUESDAY WITH STRONG COLD AIR
ADVECTION TAKING PLACE DURING THE DAY. TEMPERATURES FOR WEDNESDAY
AND THURSDAY HAVE ADJUSTED DOWN A COUPLE DEGREES BUT IF CURRENT
FORECASTS HOLDS...HIGHS MAY NEED TO BE LOWERED AN ADDITIONAL FIVE
DEGREES OR SO. DRY WEATHER AND BELOW NORMAL TEMPERATURES ARE
ANTICIPATED FOR THE REMAINDER OF NEXT WEEK AS CANADIAN HIGH
PRESSURE SETS UP OVER THE REGION.

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.
&&

$$

VALLE

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
800 AM CST FRI NOV 11 2005

.DISCUSSION...

HAVE UPDATED FORECAST TO REMOVE FREEZE WARNING.

.PREV DISCUSSION... (ISSUED 316 AM CST FRI NOV 11 2005) 

DISCUSSION...

HIGH PRESSURE OVER THE REGION TONIGHT WITH CLEAR SKIES AND LIGHT
WINDS. TEMPS HAVE FALLEN INTO THE LOWER 30S ACROSS THE EASTERN
PORTIONS OF THE FORECAST AREA WITH 29 DEGREES REPORTED AT 08Z AT 
SAVANNAH. FREEZE WARNING CONTS ACROSS MOST OF W TN AND NE MS
THROUGH 14Z.

TODAY AND TONIGHT...HIGH PRESSURE SLIPS EAST AS SURFACE WINDS TURN
SOUTHERLY BY THIS AFTERNOON. MEANWHILE 500MB UPPER RIDGE MOVES TO
THE MS RIVER VALLEY BY LATE TODAY. GOOD LOW LEVEL WAA PUSHES 850
MB TEMPS TO ABOUT 12C. VERY DRY AIRMASS IN PLACE SO EXPECT PLENTY
OF SUNSHINE WITH TEMPS NEAR 70. EXPECT MOSTLY CLEAR SKIES TONIGHT
WITH WARMER LOW TEMPS THANKS TO LIGHT SOUTHERLY WINDS.

WEEKEND...UPPER RIDGE MOVES EAST AS NEXT SYSTEM APPROACHES ON SAT.
EXPECT SAT WL BE DRY WITH FADING SUNSHINE. STRONG SHORTWAVE MOVES
OUT OF THE ROCKIES AND INTO THE PLAINS WITH BEST DYNAMICS REMAINING
TO THE NORTH OF THE REGION. MEANWHILE A COLD FRONT WL PUSH ACRS THE
REGION SAT NIGHT AND SUNDAY. INSTABILITY LOOKS QUESTIONABLE ATTM
AND WITH BEST DYNAMICS WELL TO THE NORTH SEVERE WX CHCS ARE LOW.
WL INCREASE POPS ACRS THE AREA SINCE MODELS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT
WITH FRONTAL POSITION AND QPF FIELDS. FRONT WL STALL JUST TO THE
SOUTH SUN NIGHT.

EXTENDED...FRONT WL LIFT BACK TO THE NORTH ON MONDAY AS A WARM
FRONT AND COULD PRODUCE SOME SHOWERS. ECMWF AND GFS IN GOOD
AGREEMENT WITH NEXT SYSTEM. EXPECT A STRONG COLD FRONT TO PUSH
THOUGH MON NIGHT AND TUE BRINGING A CHILLY AIRMASS ACROSS THE MID
SOUTH FOR THE MIDDLE PART OF THE WEEK. HAVE TRIMMED SEVERAL
DEGREES OFF PREVIOUS FORECAST BUT THIS MAY NOT BE COOL ENOUGH.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
257 PM CST THU NOV 10 2005

.DISCUSSION...

THE CENTER OF HIGH PRESSURE HAS SETTLED INTO NORTHEAST ARKANSAS
THIS AFTERNOON. DEW POINTS ARE EXTREMELY DRY (MID 20S) OVER MUCH
OF THE AREA. THIS IS NOTICEABLY DRIER THAN GUIDANCE. SATELLITE
SHOWS MAINLY CLEAR SKIES OVER THE REGION. THERE IS NOTED A THIN
VEIL OF CIRRUS MOVING SOUTHEASTWARD ACROSS WESTERN MISSOURI AND
INTO CENTRAL ARKANSAS. EXCELLENT RADIATIONAL CONDITIONS ARE IN
PLACE FOR TONIGHT WITH THE ONLY FLAW BEING THE CIRRUS. THE GFS
SEEMS TO HAVE A GOOD HANDLE DEPICTING MOISTURE AT THE 200MB LEVEL.
THIS MOISTURE DOES MOVE INTO EASTERN ARKANSAS AND JUST INTO WEST
TENNESSEE OVERNIGHT. THIS MAY KEEP TEMPERATURES UP JUST ABOVE THE
FREEZING POINT OVER EASTERN ARKANSAS INTO NORTHWEST MISSISSIPPI.
RAINFALL AMOUNTS YESTERDAY WERE RELATIVELY UNIMPRESSIVE. GIVEN
THIS AFTERNOONS CONDITIONS THE SOIL IS PROBABLY DRY ALREADY. WILL ISSUE
A FREEZE WARNING EAST OF THESE AREA. AM REASONABLY CONFIDENT THAT
FREEZING TEMPERATURES WILL BE REACHED IN THE WARNING AREA. HEAT
ISLAND EFFECT WILL LIKELY BE EXTREMELY NOTICEABLY TONIGHT. DURING
THE MOST RECENT OUTBREAK THERE WAS ABOUT A 5-7 DEGREE SPREAD FROM
THE AIRPORT TO THE NWS...IN EXTREME EASTERN AND NORTHERN SHELBY
COUNTY THE SPREAD WAS AS MUCH AS 12 DEGREES. WITH THE DRY AIR IN
PLACE...EXPECT TEMPERATURES TO PLUMMET DURING THE EVENING.

SURFACE WINDS SHOULD TURN AROUND TO THE SOUTH TOMORROW WITH
EXCELLENT WARM AIR ADVECTION NOTED AT 850MB. 850 TEMPS WILL
APPROACH +12. WILL LIKELY NOT MIX UP TO 850 BECAUSE OF THE COLD
START BUT MODEL SOUNDINGS STILL SUPPORT UPPER 60S TO AROUND 70.
ENOUGH OF A GRADIENT EXISTS TOMORROW NIGHT THAT TEMPERATURES
SHOULD REMAIN WELL ABOVE FREEZING.

THE NEXT CHANCE OF RAIN IS SATURDAY NIGHT AND SUNDAY.
EUROPEAN/GFS/ETA ALL SHOW THE FRONT MOVING THROUGH THE REGION
ALTHOUGH THE ETA IS SLOWER IN PASSAGE THAN THE EUROPEAN/GFS. ALL
MODELS SUPPORTIVE OF GOOD RAIN CHANCES WITH THE FRONT SINCE
MOISTURE SHOULD RISE NORTHWARD FROM THE GULF WITH HIGH PRESSURE
POSITIONED OVER THE CAROLINAS. LOOKS LIKE THERE WILL BE ABOUT A
24-48 HOUR BREAK IN BETWEEN SYSTEMS. THE GFS BRING A SECONDARY
FRONT IN FROM THE NORTHWEST. THE GFS HAS NOT BEEN CONSISTENT ON
THE TIMING OF THE FRONT BUT BEST GUESS IS THAT PASSAGE WILL BE
AROUND TUESDAY. GLANCING AT MID LEVEL LAPSE RATES AND SFC BASED
CAPES THERE APPEARS TO BE JUST ENOUGH INSTABILITY TO SUPPORT
THUNDER WITH BOTH SYSTEMS. NO SEVERE POTENTIAL WITH THE FIRST
SYSTEM AND TOO EARLY TO REALLY TELL WITH THE SECOND SYSTEM.

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...FREEZE WARNING FROM MIDNIGHT TONIGHT TO 8 AM CST FRIDAY FOR 
     ALCORN-BENTON(MS)-CALHOUN-CHICKASAW-ITAWAMBA-LAFAYETTE-
     LEE(MS)-MARSHALL-MONROE-PONTOTOC-PRENTISS-TIPPAH-TISHOMINGO-
     UNION-YALOBUSHA.

TN...FREEZE WARNING FROM MIDNIGHT TONIGHT TO 8 AM CST FRIDAY FOR 
     CARROLL-CHESTER-CROCKETT-DECATUR-DYER-FAYETTE-GIBSON-
     HARDEMAN-HARDIN-HAYWOOD-HENDERSON-HENRY-LAKE-LAUDERDALE-
     MADISON-MCNAIRY-OBION-TIPTON-WEAKLEY.

&&

$$

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
1018 AM CST THU NOV 10 2005

.DISCUSSION...

HIGH PRESSURE CENTERED OVER CENTRAL MISSOURI WILL CONTINUE TO
BUILD SOUTHEASTWARD INTO THE MID SOUTH THIS AFTERNOON. SATELLITE
SHOWS JUST A FEW CIRRUS DRIFTING THROUGH THE REGION. TEMPERATURES
ARE RUNNING CLOSE TO THE MET GUIDANCE. TOGETHER WITH MORNING
TRENDS...RAISED TEMPS ACROSS SOUTHWEST TN...EAST CENTRAL AR AND
NORTH MS. LOWER 60S STILL LOOK REASONABLE ACROSS NORTHWEST TN INTO
NORTHEAST AR. THE CENTER OF HIGH PRESSURE WILL BE OVER THE
MIDSOUTH TONIGHT. DEW POINTS ARE CURRENTLY RUNNING IN THE MID TO
UPPER 20S...WINDS ARE EXPECTED TO GO LIGHT AND SKIES CLEAR. TEMPS
TONIGHT SHOULD DROP INTO THE MID 30S AT LEAST POSSIBLY INTO THE
20S ACROSS MUCH OF WEST TN AND EXTREME NORTH MS. 850MB TEMPS ARE
STILL WARM (AROUND +8) WHICH WOULDNT NORMALLY SUPPORT SUCH COLD
TEMPS. AS A RESULT AM CONCERNED ABOUT UNDERCUTTING GUIDANCE TOO
MUCH. WILL CONTINUE TO MONITOR TRENDS THIS AFTERNOON...BUT FREEZE
WARNING LOOKS VERY LIKELY TONIGHT ACROSS MUCH OF WEST TN AND MOST
LOCATIONS AREAWIDE WILL SEE AT LEAST A FROST.

FXUS64 KMEG 100843
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
243 AM CST THU NOV 10 2005

.DISCUSSION...

COLD FRONT WELL SOUTH OF THE FORECAST AREA EARLY THIS MORNING. SKIES
HAVE BECOME MOSTLY CLEAR WITH ONLY SOME CIRRUS MOVING THROUGH THE
REGION. HIGH PRESSURE CENTERED OVER SOUTHERN KANSAS THIS MORNING.
SKIES SHOULD REMAIN MOSTLY CLEAR THROUGH SATURDAY AS HIGH MOVES
SLOWLY EAST. WITH CLEAR SKIES AND LIGHT WINDS TONIGHT...TEMPERATURES
WILL APPROACH FREEZING MARK OVER NORTHEAST SECTIONS OF FORECAST AREA.
AS HIGH BEGINS TO MOVE EAST OF FORECAST AREA FRIDAY...WINDS WILL
BEGIN TO SHIFT TO THE SOUTH AND HELP WARM THINGS UP A LITTLE. NEXT
COLD FRONT WILL APPROACH THE REGION SATURDAY NIGHT AND SUNDAY
BRINGING SCATTERED THUNDERSTORMS AHEAD OF IT. AS WITH THE LAST FRONT
THE MAIN DYNAMICS SHOULD REMAIN WELL TO THE NORTH SO NOT EXPECTING
MUCH IN THE WAY OF SEVERE WEATHER. THIS FRONT IS EXPECTED TO STALL
JUST TO OUR SOUTH SO EXPECT A CHANCE OF THUNDERSTORMS OVER SOUTHERN
SECTIONS OF THE FORECAST AREA SUNDAY NIGHT AND MONDAY. ANOTHER FRONT
MOVES THROUGH THE REGION TUESDAY BUT WITH LIMITED MOISTURE TO WORK
WITH DO NOT EXPECT TO SEE MUCH IN THE WAY OF RAIN. HIGH PRESSURE
REUTRNS TO THE REGION WEDNESDAY BRINGING A RETURN OF DRY WEATHER.

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 092114
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
315 PM CST WED NOV 9 2005

.SYNOPSIS...
COLD FRONT MOVING INTO NORTHEAST ARKANSAS AND THE MISSOURI 
BOOTHEEL.  ISOLATED SHOWERS HAVE DEVELOPED ALONG THE FRONT. SO FAR 
TUPELO HAS SET A RECORD HIGH AND THE RECORD AT JACKSON WAS TIED.  
CLOUD COVER IS HELPING TO KEEP READINGS A TAD LOWER THAN EXPECTED.  

&&

.SHORT TERM...TONIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY...
THE TREND OF ISOLATED SHOWERS ALONG THE FRONT IS EXPECTED THROUGH 
MIDNIGHT AS THE COLD FRONT PICKS UP STEAM AND HEADS INTO CENTRAL 
MISSISSIPPI.  SHORTWAVE WELL NORTH OF THE REGION SO INSTABILITY IN 
OUR AREA WEAK.  THIS SHOULD LIMIT ANY SEVERE WEATHER AND KEEP 
THUNDER TO A MINIMUM.

AFTER TONIGHT EXPECT HIGH PRESSURE TO DOMINATE THROUGH SATURDAY 
MORNING.  HAVE ADJUSTED NIGHT TIME LOW TEMPERATURES TO ACCOMADATE 
THE USUAL HEAT ISLANDS AND COLD POCKETS.  CONDITIONS SHOULD GET 
FROSTY FRIDAY NIGHT FOR MUCH OF WEST TENNESSEE AND NORTHEAST 
MISSISSIPPI. NO ADVISORIES PLANNED FOR THAT AREA AS TEMPERATURES 
HAVE REACHED THE LOWER 30S AND UPPER 20S ALREADY THIS SEASON.  

.LONGER TERM...SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY...
STRONG SHORT WAVE OVER CA COAST WILL EJECT INTO THE PLAINS. THIS 
WILL HELP BRING RETURN FLOW AND SFC MOISTURE BACK INTO THE 
REGION. MEANWHILE ANOTHER STRONG SHORTWAVE IN THE NORTHERN STREAM 
WILL PUSH A COLD FRONT INTO OUR REGION SATURDAY NIGHT.  AS THE TWO 
SYSTEMS INTERACT RAINFALL IS QUITE POSSIBLE SATURDAY NIGHT AND 
SUNDAY.  HAVE LEFT OUT THUNDER FOR NOW AS IT APPEARS INSTABILITY A 
LITTLE WEAK.

ECMWF AND GFS NOW AGREE THAT FLOW WILL BECOME MORE NORTHWEST THROUGH 
DAY 7.  THIS WILL ALLOW FOR MORE NORMAL TEMPERATURES AND PERIODIC 
FRONTAL PASSAGES.  THE NEXT FRONT IS EXPECTED TUESDAY NIGHT.  

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.
&&

$$

 BELLES

FXUS64 KMEG 090847
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
247 AM CST WED NOV 9 2005

.DISCUSSION...

COLD FRONT LOCATED FROM CENTRAL WISCONSIN THROUGH NORTHERN MISSOURI
INTO NORTHERN OKLAHOMA THIS MORNING. VERY LITTLE RAIN ASSOCIATED
WITH THE FRONT RIGHT NOW. IF ANY THUNDERSTORMS DO DEVELOP AHEAD OF
THE FRONT...THEY WOULD NOT MAKE OUR FORECAST AREA UNTIL AFTERNOON AT
THE EARLIEST SO KEPT MORNING HOURS DRY AND WENT WITH SLIGHT CHANCE
POPS FOR THIS AFTERNOON AND TONIGHT.

TEMPERATURES HAVE NOT FALLEN A LOT OVERNIGHT AND REMAIN IN THE MID
60S TO NEAR 70. NOT OUT OF THE QUESTION TO SEE TEMPERATURES WARM UP
TO THE UPPER 70S TO NEAR 80 BY THIS AFTERNOON WHICH PUTS HIGHS
WITHIN A DEGREE OR TWO OF RECORDS AT ALL OF OUR SITES SO WILL
MENTION NEAR RECORD HIGHS FOR TODAY.

COOLER AIR WILL FILTER IN BEHIND THE FRONT ON THURSDAY WITH HIGHS
SOME 10-20 DEGREES COOLER THAN TODAY. BY FRIDAY MORNING...CLEAR
SKIES AND LIGHT WINDS WILL HELP TEMPERATURES DROP QUITE A BIT. SOME
SECTIONS OF NORTHWEST TENNESSEE MAY SEE READINGS AT OR SLIGHTLY
BELOW FREEZING.

NEXT COLD FRONT APPROACHES REGION BY SATURDAY NIGHT BRINGING ANOTHER
CHANCE OF RAIN FOR THE LATTER PART OF THE WEEKEND. THIS FRONT MAY
HANG AROUND UNTIL MONDAY SO HAVE KEPT RAIN CHANCE IN FOR MONDAY AS
WELL.

.DISCUSSION...

HAVE DECIDED TO MAKE ANOTHER QUICK FORECAST UPDATE TO RAISE
TEMPERATURES A FEW MORE DEGREES ACROSS CENTRAL AND WESTERN AREAS.
CURRENT TEMPERATURE FORECAST FOR EASTERN PORTIONS OF THE FORECAST
AREA LOOKS FINE FOR NOW...SO LEFT THESE AREAS ALONE. WARM ADVECTION
AND MOISTURE ADVECTION FROM THE SOUTHWEST APPEARS TO BE A BIT
STRONGER THAN PREVIOUSLY FORECAST...SO THIS WILL PREVENT
TEMPERATURES FROM DROPPING TOO MUCH TONIGHT. ALSO WILL GO PARTLY
CLOUDY EVERYWHERE...AS MID AND HIGH CLOUDS MOVE ACROSS THE AREA.
MAY ALSO BE SOME PATCHY LOWER CLOUDS DEVELOP OVER AREAS WEST OF
THE MISSISSIPPI RIVER AS MID 60S DEWPOINTS ADVECT INTO THE AREA.
CLOUDS WILL ALSO HELP KEEP TEMPS HIGHER.

UPDATED ZONES AND GRIDS WILL BE OUT SHORTLY TO REFLECT THESE
CHANGES.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
1002 PM CST TUE NOV 8 2005

.DISCUSSION...

SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE STILL IN CONTROL OF THE WEATHER OVER THE
MID-SOUTH TONIGHT. THIS HIGH IS NOW SITUATED TO OUR EAST AND HAS
ALLOWED RETURN SOUTHERLY FLOW TO CONTINUE ACROSS THE AREA. SOME
WARM ADVECTION ALONG WITH MOISTURE ADVECTION FROM THE SOUTHWEST
LATE TONIGHT WILL ADVECT LOW TO MID 60 DEWPOINTS INTO OUR AREA
INTO THE DAY WEDNESDAY. THIS INCREASED LOW LEVEL HUMIDITY AND HIGH
CLOUD COVER STREAMING IN FROM THE WEST WILL KEEP LOW TEMPERATURES
HIGHER...ESPECIALLY FOR THE WESTERN HALF OF THE REGION.
THEREFORE...HAVE BUMPED TEMPS UP JUST A FEW DEGREES OVER THESE
AREAS FOR TONIGHT. BUT OVERALL...TEMPS REMAIN WELL ABOVE SEASONAL
LEVELS AREAWIDE FOR THIS TIME OF YEAR. OTHERWISE...THE REMAINDER
OF THE FORECAST IS ON TRACK...AND EXPECTING JUST ANOTHER QUIET
AND MILD WEATHER NIGHT.

UPDATED GRIDS AND ZONES HAVE ALREADY BEEN SENT. HAVE A GOOD NIGHT

&&

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
245 PM CST TUE NOV 8 2005

.DISCUSSION...

RECORD HIGH TEMPERATURES WERE REACHED IN THE MIDSOUTH THIS
AFTERNOON AT MANY LOCATIONS DUE TO SOUTHERLY WINDS AND LOTS OF
SUNSHINE. HOWEVER...A FRONT NOW IN THE MIDWEST WILL CHANGE THINGS
WHEN IT GETS TO SOUTHERN MO BY WED MORN. CLOUDINESS WILL INCREASE
AND LIMIT HIGHS TO MOSTLY THE 70S. THERE COULD ALSO BE A FEW
SHOWERS AND ISOLATED THUNDERSTORMS WEDNESDAY.

THE FRONT WILL MOVE THROUGH THE AREA STARTING EARLY WED MORN AND
BE OUT OF SOUTHERN COUNTIES SOMETIME DURING THE EVENING TOMORROW
NIGHT. NIGHTLY LOWS WILL THEN DROP TO THE 40S AND 50S WEDNESDAY
NIGHT AND THE 30S AND 40S THURSDAY NIGHT. THERE COULD EVEN BE
SOME FROST AGAIN EARLY FRIDAY MORNING.

MORE SHOWERS WILL MOVE IN FROM THE WEST SATURDAY NIGHT DUE TO
ANOTHER FRONT. THIS FRONT WILL KEEP CHANCES OF SHOWERS ALIVE THE
REST OF THE WEEKEND INTO EARLY NEXT WEEK.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
1000 AM CST TUE NOV 8 2005

.DISCUSSION...

STEERING WINDS ARE BECOMING NORTHWESTERLY ACROSS THE MIDSOUTH
ATTM. MEANWHILE...WINDS ARE SOUTHERLY AT THE SURFACE AND
DEWPOINTS HAVE RISEN INTO THE 60S. WARMING THIS MORNING IS NOT AS
FAST AS IT WAS YDA...BUT RECORD HIGHS ARE STILL EXPECTED THIS
AFTERNOON UNDER PARTLY CLOUDY SKIES.

TONIGHT...WEST NORTHWESTERLY FLOW ALOFT WILL PUSH A WEAK FRONT TO
SOUTHERLY MO AND CLOUDINESS WILL INCREASE A LITTLE.

WEDNESDAY...THE FRONT DROPS THROUGH MOST OF THE AREA BRINGING A
FEW SHOWERS TO THE AREA. ANY THUNDERSTORMS THAT DEVELOP SHOULD
NOT BE SEVERE. PASSAGE OF THE FRONT WILL BE NOTICED BY THE
ARRIVAL OF COOLER AIR FROM THE NORTHWEST.

THURSDAY AND FRIDAY...NORTHWEST WINDS ALOFT WILL THEN COOL IT OFF
WITH HIGHS 20 DEGREES COOLER THAN TODAYS HIGHS THURSDAY. LOW TO
MID 30S ARE COMING TO NORTHERN COUNTIES FRIDAY MORNING AND
EXPOSED LOW LYING SPOTS COULD SEE FROST EARLY.

TODAY. TONIGHT SHOULD REMAIN QUIET AS WELL WITH ONLY A FEW CLOUDS
AROUND. COLD FRONT WILL BE APPROACHING THE REGION ON WEDNESDAY.
SHOULD EXPECT TO SEE AT LEAST A FEW THUNDERSTORMS ACROSS THE REGION.
DYNAMICS APPEAR TO BE TOO FAR NORTH TO PRODUCE MUCH IN THE WAY OF
SEVERE WEATHER. MORE CLOUDS AHEAD OF THE FRONT WILL HELP KEEP
TEMPERATURES FROM GETTING NEARLY AS WARM ON WEDNESDAY BUT STILL WILL
BE WELL ABOVE NORMAL. FRONT SHOULD BE THROUGH MUCH OF THE REGION BY
THURSDAY MORNING BUT SOME LOCATIONS IN NORTH MISSISSIPPI COULD STILL
SEE A THUNDERSTORMS THURSDAY MORNING. TEMPERATURES SHOULD BE QUITE A
BIT COOLER ON THURSDAY WITH HIGHS SOME 15 DEGREES COOLER THAN
WEDNESDAY BUT THAT PUTS TEMPERATURES NEAR NORMAL. TEMPERATURES SHOULD
WARM UP A LITTLE OVER THE WEEKEND BEFORE ANOTHER FRONT MOVES THROUGH

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
310 PM CST MON NOV 7 2005

.DISCUSSION...

VERY DRY AIR...SOUTHERLY WINDS...AND LOTS OF SUNSHINE COUPLED
TOGETHER TODAY TO PRODUCE RECORD HIGH TEMPERATURES. IT NOT SEEMS
POSSIBLE TO SET MORE RECORD HIGHS TUE AND WED.

OTHERWISE...A HIGH IN THE SOUTHEASTERN STATES WILL MAKE FOR MORE
SOUTHERLY WINDS TONIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY NIGHT. THEN A FRONT WITH
SHOWERS WILL COME THROUGH WEDNESDAY FOLLOWED BY A PACIFIC HIGH.
MAINLY LIGHT RAINFALL IS EXPECTED.

UPPER LEVEL RIDGING THEN TAKES PLACE AND KEEPS THE HIGH
ENTRENCHED OVER US WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY. IT WILL WARM
UP DURING THE WEEKEND AND AN UPPER CUTOFF WILL APPROACH THE
MIDSOUTH FROM THE WEST. THIS CUTOFFS PATH IS SUITABLE TO BRING
SHOWERS EARLY NEXT WEEK.

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 071713
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
1100 AM CST MON NOV 7 2005

.DISCUSSION...

HIGH PRESSURE NOW EXITING EAST WHILE A WARM FRONT NOW IN THE
STARKVILLE TO CLARKSDALE AREA MOVING NORTH OVER THE MIDSOUTH.
THERES BEEN LOTS OF SUN TODAY AND WINDS HAVE HAVE BEEN LIGHT TO
MODERATE. TEMPERATURES REBOUNDED RAPIDLY THIS MORNING. THIS MIX OF
WEATHER FACTORS INDICATE RECORD HIGH TEMPERATURES COULD OCCUR TODAY
AT MANY LOCATIONS...ESPECIALLY IN NORTH MISSISSIPPI. HAVE RAISED
TODAYS HIGHS TO REFLECT THIS THINKING. MADE TREND ADJUSTMENTS TO
OTHER PARAMETERS LIKE DEWPOINTS WHICH WERE TOO HIGH NORTHERN
COUNTIES.


PREVIOUS DISCUSSION...
FRONTAL SYSTEM HAS HUNG UP OVER CENTRAL MISSISSIPPI THIS MORNING.
DRIER AIR HAS FILTERED INTO ABOUT THE NORTHERN HALF OF CWA...WITH
DEWPOINTS NEAR 40. CIRRUS MOVING IN FROM WEST...AND SOME HINTS OF
CLOUDS AROUND 5000 FEET.
&&

.SHORT TERM (THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...
HIGH PRESSURE TO MOVE OFF TO THE EAST TODAY...WITH SOUTHERLY FLOW
RETURNING. MOISTURE AT 850 MB WITH CLOUDS TO OUR WEST IS PROBABLY
FIRST INDICATION OF FLOW RETURNING. SOUNDINGS FROM BOTH GFS AND
NAM INDICATE THERE SHOULD BE AT LEAST SOME CLOUDS TODAY...ALTHOUGH
A FAIR AMOUNT OF SUNSHINE. TEMPERATURES TO SHOW SOME RECOVERY FROM
YESTERDAY. FULL SUN WOULD LIKELY ALLOW RECORD TEMPS TO BE SET FOR
THE DAY TODAY.

WARMING CONTINUES TOMORROW...AND WINDS PICK UP A LITTLE. RATHER
LEERY OF MAV GUIDANCE FOR TOMORROW. AT MEM...MKL...AND TUP...MAV
VALUES FOR TOMORROW...IF VERIFIED...WOULD SET OR TIE ALL TIME
RECORD HIGHS FOR MONTH OF NOVEMBER. EVEN LOWEST OF MOS FORECASTS
INDICATE RECORDS FOR THE DATE AT ALL 4 VERIFYING STATIONS.

NEXT SYSTEM APPROACHES FROM THE NORTHWEST ON WEDNESDAY. ALL MODELS
NOW COMING INTO AGREEMENT ON PASSAGE OF COLD FRONT DURING THE
AFTERNOON AND EVENING HOURS ON WEDNESDAY. MOISTURE RATHER
LIMITED...AND NOT A GREAT DEAL OF LOW LEVEL CONVERGENCE WITH
FRONT...AS MAIN ENERGY TO THE NORTH. WILL KEEP POPS IN THE 20 TO
30 RANGE. MOST PRECIP WILL BE WITH AND/OR BEHIND FRONT...ASSUMING
WE GET ANY AT ALL. CLOUDS WITH FRONT TO HOLD DOWN TEMPS A LITTLE
ON WEDNESDAY.
&&

.LONG TERM (AFTER WEDNESDAY)...
WITH MODELS COMING INTO AGREEMENT ON FRONTAL PASSAGE
WEDNESDAY...WILL BE ENDING PRECIP THURSDAY MORNING...AND LOWERING
TEMPERATURES FROM PREVIOUS FORECAST. TEMPS TO BE CONSIDERABLY
COOLER THAN TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY...BUT STILL NEAR OR ABOVE CLIMO.
FORECAST WILL THEN BE DRY UNTIL ABOUT SUNDAY. SHORTWAVE MOVING OUT
OF SOUTHWEST OVER UPPER RIDGE WILL BE WEAKENING...BUT STILL SEE A
CHANCE OF PRECIPITATION FOR SUNDAY.

IN THE LONGER TERM...DONT SEE ANY INDICATIONS OF MAJOR LONG TERM
PATTERN CHANGE THROUGH NEXT TWO WEEKS. LOOKS LIKE IT IS GOING TO
BE A RATHER WARM NOVEMBER ON THE WHOLE.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
MEM  82  60  84  64 /  10  10  10  10
MKL  78  58  82  62 /  10  10  10  10
JBR  77  59  82  63 /  10  10  10  10
TUP  84  60  83  63 /  10  10  10  10

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 070828
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
228 AM CST MON NOV 7 2005

.DISCUSSION...
FRONTAL SYSTEM HAS HUNG UP OVER CENTRAL MISSISSIPPI THIS MORNING.
DRIER AIR HAS FILTERED INTO ABOUT THE NORTHERN HALF OF CWA...WITH
DEWPOINTS NEAR 40. CIRRUS MOVING IN FROM WEST...AND SOME HINTS OF
CLOUDS AROUND 5000 FEET.
&&

.SHORT TERM (THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...
HIGH PRESSURE TO MOVE OFF TO THE EAST TODAY...WITH SOUTHERLY FLOW
RETURNING. MOISTURE AT 850 MB WITH CLOUDS TO OUR WEST IS PROBABLY
FIRST INDICATION OF FLOW RETURNING. SOUNDINGS FROM BOTH GFS AND
NAM INDICATE THERE SHOULD BE AT LEAST SOME CLOUDS TODAY...ALTHOUGH
A FAIR AMOUNT OF SUNSHINE. TEMPERATURES TO SHOW SOME RECOVERY FROM
YESTERDAY. FULL SUN WOULD LIKELY ALLOW RECORD TEMPS TO BE SET FOR
THE DAY TODAY. 

WARMING CONTINUES TOMORROW...AND WINDS PICK UP A LITTLE. RATHER
LEERY OF MAV GUIDANCE FOR TOMORROW. AT MEM...MKL...AND TUP...MAV
VALUES FOR TOMORROW...IF VERIFIED...WOULD SET OR TIE ALL TIME
RECORD HIGHS FOR MONTH OF NOVEMBER. EVEN LOWEST OF MOS FORECASTS
INDICATE RECORDS FOR THE DATE AT ALL 4 VERIFYING STATIONS.

NEXT SYSTEM APPROACHES FROM THE NORTHWEST ON WEDNESDAY. ALL MODELS
NOW COMING INTO AGREEMENT ON PASSAGE OF COLD FRONT DURING THE
AFTERNOON AND EVENING HOURS ON WEDNESDAY. MOISTURE RATHER
LIMITED...AND NOT A GREAT DEAL OF LOW LEVEL CONVERGENCE WITH
FRONT...AS MAIN ENERGY TO THE NORTH. WILL KEEP POPS IN THE 20 TO
30 RANGE. MOST PRECIP WILL BE WITH AND/OR BEHIND FRONT...ASSUMING
WE GET ANY AT ALL. CLOUDS WITH FRONT TO HOLD DOWN TEMPS A LITTLE
ON WEDNESDAY.
&&

.LONG TERM (AFTER WEDNESDAY)...
WITH MODELS COMING INTO AGREEMENT ON FRONTAL PASSAGE
WEDNESDAY...WILL BE ENDING PRECIP THURSDAY MORNING...AND LOWERING
TEMPERATURES FROM PREVIOUS FORECAST. TEMPS TO BE CONSIDERABLY
COOLER THAN TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY...BUT STILL NEAR OR ABOVE CLIMO.
FORECAST WILL THEN BE DRY UNTIL ABOUT SUNDAY. SHORTWAVE MOVING OUT
OF SOUTHWEST OVER UPPER RIDGE WILL BE WEAKENING...BUT STILL SEE A
CHANCE OF PRECIPITATION FOR SUNDAY.

IN THE LONGER TERM...DONT SEE ANY INDICATIONS OF MAJOR LONG TERM
PATTERN CHANGE THROUGH NEXT TWO WEEKS. LOOKS LIKE IT IS GOING TO
BE A RATHER WARM NOVEMBER ON THE WHOLE.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
MEM  80  60  84  64 /  10  10  10  10 
MKL  76  58  82  62 /  10  10  10  10 
JBR  77  59  82  63 /  10  10  10  10 
TUP  81  60  83  63 /  10  10  10  10

FXUS64 KMEG 070331
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
931 PM CST SUN NOV 6 2005

.UPDATE...

SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE HAS SETTLED OVER THE MID-SOUTH THIS EVENING
AND WILL CONTINUE TO BE THE DOMINANT WEATHER FEATURE TONIGHT. THE
COLD FRONT THAT MOVED ACROSS THE AREA LAST NIGHT HAS STALLED
ACROSS CENTRAL MISSISSIPPI. MUCH LOWER DEWPOINTS HAVE FILTERED
INTO THE NORTHERN TWO-THIRDS OF THE AREA. OVER THE SOUTHERN ONE-
THIRD OF THE FORECAST AREA...HIGHER DEWPOINTS EXIST AND THIS
COMBINED WITH LIGHT WINDS AND MOIST CONDITIONS FROM LAST NIGHTS
STORMS...EXPECT PATCHY FOG TO DEVELOP. ELSEWHERE LIGHT
WINDS...MOSTLY CLEAR SKIES...AND LOW DEWPOINTS WILL PROVIDE FOR A
GOOD RADIATIONAL COOLING SITUATION. OVER THESE AREAS...HAVE
LOWERED TEMPERATURES A FEW DEGREES TO ACCOUNT FOR RADIATIONAL
COOLING AND TO REFLECT CURRENT TEMPERATURE TRENDS. HIGH CLOUDS MAY
MOVE INTO THE AREA FROM THE NORTHWEST LATE TONIGHT AND THIS MAY
HELP TO KEEP TEMPERATURES FROM BOTTOMING OUT EVEN FURTHER. ALL IN
ALL IT LOOKS LIKE A RATHER QUIET WEATHER NIGHT. OTHER THAN
TEMPERATURES...THE REMAINDER OF THE FORECAST LOOKS ON TRACK.

UPDATED GRIDS AND ZONES WILL BE OUT SHORTLY. 

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.
&&

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 061645
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
1044 AM CST SUN NOV 6 2005

.DISCUSSION...16Z SURFACE ANALYSIS PLACES COLD FRONT ACROSS 
MISSISSIPPI BETWEEN GREENWOOD AND JUST SOUTH OF TUPELO. THIS FRONT 
SHOULD CONTINUE TO MOVE THROUGH THE REMAINDER OF THE FORECAST AREA 
THIS AFTERNOON THEN BECOME QUASI-STATIONARY ACROSS CENTRAL 
MISSISSIPPI. WILL ISSUE AN UPDATE TO REMOVE MORNING POPS FROM 
FORECAST AND ADJUST SKY COVER/TEMPERATURES BASED ON CURRENT TRENDS.

UPDATED GRIDS WILL BE PUBLISHED SHORTLY.

CJC

.PREV DISCUSSION...ISSUED 332 AM CST SUN NOV 6 2005

A VERY BUSY MORNING CONTINUES ACROSS THE MEMPHIS FORECAST AREA.
A BROKEN LINE OF STRONG TO SEVERE THUNDERSTORMS CONTINUE TO MOVE
ACROSS PORTIONS OF WEST TENNESSEE AND NORTH MISSISSIPPI AHEAD OF
AN ADVANCING COLD FRONT THAT IS BEING FORCED SOUTHEAST BY A
VIGOROUS SHORTWAVE TROUGH MOVING ACROSS THE AREA. WIND FIELDS AND
ATMOSPHERIC SHEAR REMAIN STRONG AHEAD OF THE FRONT AND LOW LEVEL
HELICITIES CONTINUE TO INCREASE...CONTINUING THE THREAT OF SEVERE
WEATHER...INCLUDING THE LIKELIHOOD OF A FEW MORE DAMAGING WIND
EVENTS BEFORE SUNRISE EAST OF THE MISSISSIPPI RIVER. CANNOT RULE OUT
AN ISOLATED TORNADO AS WELL. THIS WEATHER SYSTEM SHOULD SWEEP EAST
OF THE REGION ON SUNDAY. HAVE KEPT SOME LINGERING SLIGHT CHANCE
POPS ACROSS SOUTHEAST AREAS...AS THESE AREAS MAY HAVE TO WAIT
UNTIL AFTER 12Z FOR FRONTAL PASSAGE. ONCE THE FRONT SWEEPS THROUGH
SKIES WILL BEGIN TO CLEAR. DEWPOINTS WILL BE LOWER BEHIND THE
FRONT...BUT EXPECT ONLY SLIGHTLY COOLER TEMPERATURES...BUT STILL
ABOVE NORMAL FOR THIS TIME OF YEAR.

SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE WILL BUILD INTO THE AREA FOR THE END OF THE
WEEKEND AND LINGER THROUGH THE FIRST PART OF THE WEEK. THE UPPER
FLOW WILL BECOME ZONAL THROUGH MONDAY AND THEN EXPECT BROAD UPPER
LEVEL RIDGING THROUGH MID WEEK. THIS MEANS MORE DRY WEATHER AND
TEMPERATURES MORE CHARACTERISTIC OF EARLY FALL RATHER THAN
NOVEMBER. THE RIDGE WILL BEGIN TO BREAK DOWN TOWARDS THE LATER
PART OF THE WEEK AS THE NEXT SHORTWAVE TROUGH AND ASSOCIATED COLD
FRONT SKIRT CLOSER TO THE AREA. MODELS HAVE NOT BEEN CONSISTENT WITH
THIS NEXT FEATURE...SO CONFIDENCE IN FRONTAL LOCATION IS BELOW
AVERAGE. HAVE DECIDED TO TREND TEMPERATURES UP A BIT FOR THE
EXTENDED AS THE NEXT COLD FRONT WILL BE OF PACIFIC ORIGIN AND
THERE ARE STILL SOME QUESTIONS AS TO WHETHER IT COMPLETELY MOVES
ACROSS THE AREA. HAVE KEPT LOW CHANCE POPS FOR THE POSSIBILITY
THAT THE FRONT MAY BE IN THE AREA...BUT AGAIN CONFIDENCE QUITE
LOW. AT THIS POINT...IT APPEARS THAT TEMPERATURES WILL REMAIN
ABOVE AVERAGE FOR THE FORESEEABLE FUTURE...WITH BELOW AVERAGE RAIN
CHANCES CONTINUING THROUGH THE FORECAST PERIOD.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
MEM  72  55  79  60 /  10  10  10  10 
MKL  71  46  76  58 /  10  10  10  10 
JBR  71  48  77  59 /  10  10  10  10 
TUP  76  52  80  59 /  20  10  10  10 

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.
&&

FXUS64 KMEG 060849
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
249 AM CST SUN NOV 6 2005

.UPDATE...

ANOTHER UPDATE TO THE GRIDS AND ZONES TO REFLECT CHANGES TO THE
WATCHES. HAVE CANCELLED COUNTIES WEST OF THE MISSISSIPPI RIVER
FROM SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WATCH 843. ALSO HAVE CANCELLED
LAKE...OBION...AND DYER COUNTIES FROM SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WATCH
844. ALL REMAINING COUNTIES ACROSS WEST TENNESSEE THAT WERE IN
SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WATCH 844 ARE NOW IN TORNADO WATCH 845. IT
APPEARS THAT CONDITIONS ARE BECOMING A BIT MORE FAVORABLE FOR THE
POSSIBILITY OF ISOLATED TORNADOES IN EMBEDDED SUPERCELL
THUNDERSTORMS WITHIN THE CURRENT CONVECTIVE LINE MOVING ACROSS
WEST TENNESSEE...THEREFORE SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WATCH 844 HAS BEEN
UPGRADED TO A TORNADO WATCH. 

UPDATED GRIDS AND ZONES HAVE ALREADY BEEN SENT. PLEASE CONTACT THE
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE OFFICE IN MEMPHIS TO REPORT STORM DAMAGE.

&&

AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
131 AM CST SUN NOV 6 2005

.UPDATE...

QUICK UPDATE TO ADD NEW SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WATCH FOR ALL OF WEST
TENNESSEE AND CRITTENDEN COUNTY ARKANSAS. BROKEN LINE OF STRONG TO
SEVERE STORMS CONTINUES TO MOVE ACROSS THE MID-SOUTH AND
CONDITIONS APPEAR FAVORABLE FOR SEVERE THUNDERSTORMS MAINLY ALONG
AND EAST OF THE MISSISSIPPI RIVER FOR THE REMAINDER OF THE NIGHT.
DAMAGING WINDS WILL BE THE GREATEST THREAT WITH THESE STORMS...BUT
CANNOT RULE OUT AN ISOLATED TORNADO OR LARGE HAIL REPORT. 

ALL STORM SPOTTERS...TELEVISION/RADIO STATIONS...HAM RADIO
OPERATORS...AND EMERGENCY MANAGEMENT OFFICIALS ARE ENCOURAGED TO
FORWARD REPORTS TO US HERE AT THE MEMPHIS NATIONAL WEATHER
SERVICE.

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 060424
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
1024 PM CST SAT NOV 5 2005

.UPDATE...

...SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WATCH IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 AM CST FOR PORTIONS
OF NORTHEAST ARKANSAS AND THE MISSOURI BOOTHEEL...

LATE UPDATE TONIGHT DUE TO SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WATCH COORDINATION.
A LINE OF STRONG TO SEVERE THUNDERSTORMS PUSHING TOWARDS NORTHEAST 
ARKANSAS CURRENTLY. THIS LINE OF STORMS HAS DEVELOPED AHEAD OF AN
EASTWARD MOVING COLD FRONT AND SIGNIFICANT NEGATIVELY TILTED
SHORTWAVE DISTURBANCE MOVING NORTHEAST ACROSS THE SOUTHERN PLAINS STATES.
THE ATMOSPHERE WILL CONTINUE TO DESTABILIZE OVER MAINLY NORTHERN
PORTIONS OF THE MID-SOUTH IN ASSOCIATION WITH THE SHORTWAVE.
ALSO...ATMOSPHERIC SHEAR IS SUFFICIENTLY STRONG TO SUPPORT SOME
SEVERE WIND GUSTS IN THE STRONGEST STORMS. ALSO...LOW LEVEL WIND
FIELD IS BACKED ENOUGH AHEAD OF THE FRONT TO POSE AN ISOLATED
THREAT OF A TORNADO IN ANY SUPERCELLS THAT ARE EMBEDDED WITHIN THE
LINE. ALTHOUGH...THIS THREAT SHOULD BE LIMITED WITH DAMAGING
STRAIGHT-LINE WINDS BEING THE PRIMARY THREAT WITH ALSO A LOWER
THREAT OF ISOLATED LARGE HAIL. A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WATCH IS IN
EFFECT UNTIL 4 AM FOR PORTIONS OF NORTHEAST ARKANSAS AND THE
MISSOURI BOOTHEEL TO ACCOUNT FOR THIS POTENTIAL. SEVERE POTENTIAL
MAY SPREAD FURTHER EAST INTO NORTHWEST TENNESSEE AFTER
MIDNIGHT...BUT WILL NEED TO SEE HOW THIS EVOLVES AS THERE WILL BE
SOME QUESTION TO THE OVERALL AMOUNT OF INSTABILITY OVER THESE
AREAS AS PRIMARY FOCUS OF LIFT ASSOCIATED WITH THE SHORTWAVE LIFTS
TO THE NORTHEAST OF THE AREA. WILL KEEP AN EYE ON THIS AREA THOUGH
FOR THE REMAINDER OF THE NIGHT.

UPDATED GRIDS AND ZONES ALREADY SENT. STAY ABREAST OF ANY
ADDITIONAL WATCHES OR SEVERE WEATHER WARNINGS ISSUED THROUGH THE
REMAINDER OF THE NIGHT. 

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE. 
MO...NONE. 
MS...NONE. 
TN...NONE.

&&

$$

JLH

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 052131
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
330 PM CST SAT NOV 5 2005

.DISCUSSION...SURFACE ANALYSIS THIS AFTERNOON PLACES LOW PRESSURE 
ACROSS SOUTHWEST MISSOURI WITH A WARM FRONT EXTENDING NORTHEAST ACROSS 
THE NORTHWEST HALF OF MISSOURI AND A DRYLINE SOUTH OF THE LOW. A 
STRONG CAPPING INVERSION ACROSS THE REGION HAS KEPT THE MID SOUTH 
DRY THUS FAR WITH TEMPERATURES IN THE MIDDLE 70S TO AROUND 80. WINDS 
HAVE BEEN GUSTY ACROSS A PORTION OF NORTHEAST ARKANSAS AS SOME 
OF THE 40 KT 850 MB WINDS HAVE MIXED DOWN TO THE SURFACE. MAIN 
FORECAST CONCERN THIS PACKAGE IS SEVERE WEATHER POTENTIAL TONIGHT. 

TONIGHT...SURFACE LOW CONTINUE TO DEEPEN AND MOVE NORTHEAST ACROSS 
MISSOURI TONIGHT. MEANWHILE...UPPER LEVEL TROUGH WILL BECOME 
NEGATIVELY TILTED AS IT MOVES ACROSS THE MISSISSIPPI VALLEY AND 
PLACES THE MID SOUTH IN THE RIGHT ENTRANCE REGION OF UPPER LEVEL 
JET. 

40 KT+ 850MB WINDS ALONG WITH 50 KT 500 MB WINDS...CAPES AROUND 1500 
J/KG AND A TONGUE OF 20 C+ 700 MB AIR SUPPORT THE FORMATION OF A 
SQUALL LINE WEST OF THE RIVER LATER THIS EVENING AS STRONG CAPPING 
INVERSION EVENTUALLY WEAKENS AND THE CONVECTION MOVES ACROSS THE 
FORECAST AREA PRIMARILY AFTER MIDNIGHT. IN ADDITION...0-1KM STORM 
RELATIVE HELICITY VALUES AROUND 350 M2/S2...0-6 KM BULK SHEAR VALUES 
AROUND 50 KTS...AND LCL/S DECREASING BELOW 4000 FT ALSO SUGGEST A 
POSSIBILITY OF SUPERCELLS EMBEDDED WITHIN THE SQUALL LINE. 
HOWEVER...MAIN LIMITING FACTOR WITH THIS CONVECTION MAY BE LOSS OF 
INSTABILITY WITH THE CONVECTION NOT DUE TO ARRIVE UNTIL LATER 
TONIGHT. WILL GO WITH SCATTERED POPS TO THE SOUTH AND LIKELY POPS 
ACROSS THE NORTHERN TIER OF COUNTIES ALONG AND EAST OF THE MISSOURI 
BOOTHEEL AFTER MIDNIGHT. EVENING SHIFT WILL CONTINUE TO MONITOR 
PRE-CONVECTIVE TRENDS AND ADJUST FORECAST IF NECESSARY. WILL ALSO 
KEEP A MENTION OF GUSTY WINDS IN THE FORECAST THROUGH EARLY EVENING.

SUNDAY AND BEYOND...HIGH PRESSURE WILL BUILD IN ACROSS THE MID SOUTH 
AS THE COLD FRONT MOVES SOUTH OF THE FORECAST AREA. TEMPERATURES 
BEHIND THE FRONT WILL NOT BE MUCH DIFFERENT THAN THE PAST FEW DAYS 
AS UPPER LEVEL PATTERN GRADUALLY RETURNS TO SOUTHWEST FLOW BY 
TUESDAY NIGHT.

WEDNESDAY THROUGH SATURDAY...LONG RANGE MODELS IN DECENT AGREEMENT 
WITH UPPER LEVEL PATTERN ACROSS THE REGION. ONLY DIFFERENCES IS A 
SLIGHTLY SLOWER PROGRESSION OF UPPER LEVEL TROUGH. BOTH GFS/EUROPEAN 
STILL ADVERTISE A COLD FRONT MOVING THROUGH THE MID SOUTH WEDNESDAY 
NIGHT AND HIGH PRESSURE BUILDING BACK IN ON THURSDAY. KEPT 
TEMPERATURES A FEW DEGREES ABOVE GUIDANCE AS LONG RANGE GFS CAME IN 
MUCH COOLER THAN PREVIOUS RUNS.  

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.
&&

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 051718
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
1115 AM CST SAT NOV 5 2005

DISCUSSION...SURFACE ANALYSIS THIS MORNING PLACES LOW PRESSURE 
ACROSS CENTRAL OKLAHOMA WITH A QUASI STATIONARY BOUNDARY EXTENDING 
NORTHEAST ACROSS THE NORTHWEST HALF OF MISSOURI AND A DRYLINE SOUTH 
OF THE LOW. MAIN FORECAST CONCERNS THIS AFTERNOON IS WIND AND 
CONVECTIVE POTENTIAL.  

12Z SOUNDING AT KLZK THIS MORNING DEPICTED A 40 KT 850 MB LOW LEVEL 
JET ALONG WITH A STRONG CAPPING INVERSION AT 775 MB. A COUPLE OF 
SPOTS ACROSS THE RED RIVER VALLEY HAVE REPORTED SUSTAINED SURFACE 
WINDS AROUND 22KTS. 700-500 MB LAPSE RATES WILL INCREASE TO 6.5-7.0 
C/KM THIS AFTERNOON ACROSS AREAS WEST OF THE MISSISSIPPI RIVER WITH 
SURFACE BASED CAPES AROUND 800 J/KG AND LI/S AROUND -4. MODEL 
SOUNDINGS INDICATE THE FORECAST AREA WILL REMAIN MOSTLY CAPPED OFF 
AT LEAST THROUGH MID AFTERNOON. THINK BEST CHANCE FOR SEEING ANY 
ISOLATED CONVECTION DEVELOPING WOULD BE ACROSS THE FAR SOUTHEAST 
SECTIONS OF THE FORECAST AREA AND AREAS PRIMARILY WEST OF THE 
MISSISSIPPI RIVER. IN ADDITION WITH HIGHS IN THE MIDDLE 70S TO 
AROUND 80...WOULDN/T BE SURPRISED TO SEE A FEW GUSTS APPROACHING 30 
KTS THIS AFTERNOON AS SOME OF THE 850 MB WINDS MIX DOWN TO THE SURFACE. 
WILL ISSUE AN UPDATE TO ADJUST FOR CURRENT TRENDS AND MONITOR WIND 
TRENDS THIS AFTERNOON FOR WIND ADVISORY POTENTIAL ACROSS THE DELTA 
AND POINTS WEST.

UPDATED GRIDS WILL BE PUBLISHED SHORTLY. 

CJC

.PREV DISCUSSION...ISSUED 213 AM CST SAT NOV 5 2005

.SHORT TERM (THROUGH MONDAY)...
UPPER ENERGY CURRENTLY OVER IDAHO WILL SLIDE SOUTH AND EAST INTO
KANSAS AND MISSOURI BY THIS EVENING...STRENGTHENING A SURFACE LOW
ALONG THE COLD FRONT AS IT MOVES NORTHEASTWARD INTO THE GREAT
LAKES BY SUNDAY AFTERNOON. THIS WILL DRAG THE FRONT THROUGH US
OVERNIGHT TONIGHT. WHILE WIND FIELDS ARE CONDUCIVE TO SEVERE
WEATHER...AVAILABLE MOISTURE IS NOT PARTICULARLY DEEP. EXPECT
SCATTERED CONVECTION TO DEVELOP ALONG THE FRONT THIS AFTERNOON AND
MOVE ACROSS THE AREA OVERNIGHT.

NAM SHOWING AN L.I. OF -4 AND CAPES OF 1500 TO 2500 JUST AHEAD OF
THE FRONT. WIND FIELDS ARE CONDUCIVE FOR STRAIGHT LINE WINDS. WIND
DIRECTION IN THE FORECAST SOUNDING FOR MEMPHIS DOESNT CHANGE VERY
MUCH DURING THE EVENT. ASSUMING THERE ARE NO MICROSCALE EFFECTS TO
GENERATE TURNING...WILL ONLY MENTION DAMAGING WINDS IN THE HWO.
MAIN THREAT REMAINS DAMAGING WINDS NORTH OF INTERSTATE 40. HIGH
TEMPS TODAY WILL BE SIMILAR TO FRIDAY.

SYSTEM WILL CLEAR OUT OF THE MEMPHIS CWA SUNDAY MORNING. REST OF
SUNDAY AND ALL OF MONDAY EXPECTED TO BE DRY WITH TEMPERATURES
ABOVE NORMAL.
&&

.LONG TERM (AFTER MONDAY)...
EXPECT A REPLAY OF TONIGHTS SCENARIO AROUND WEDNESDAY EVENING.
MODEL SOLUTIONS FOR THIS EVENT STILL ALL OVER THE MAP. NOT GOING
TO MAKE SIGNIFICANT CHANGES IN THE EXTENDED FORECAST. ALSO...GFS
SEEMS TO PUMP MORE COLD AIR DOWN BEHIND WEDNESDAYS FRONT FOR THE
END OF NEXT WEEK. THIS SOLUTION SEEMS TO BE SOMEWHAT OF AN
OUTLIER...AS ECMWF HAS AN UPPER RIDGE OVER US NEXT FRIDAY AND
SATURDAY. BELIEVE MEX GUIDANCE FROM 00Z RUN IS TOO COOL FOR
THURSDAY THROUGH SATURDAY OF NEXT WEEK. NOT GOING TO MAKE MAJOR
CHANGES WITH EXTENDED FORECAST ON THIS CYCLE. WILL CONTINUE CHANCE
POPS WHERE THEY ARE AT IN THE FORECAST.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
MEM  78  60  75  54 /  20  30  20  10 
MKL  76  59  73  51 /  20  40  20  10 
JBR  76  57  73  51 /  20  40  10  10 
TUP  78  61  77  54 /  20  30  20  10 

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
213 AM CST SAT NOV 5 2005

.DISCUSSION...
FRONTAL SYSTEM AND ASSOCIATED LOW RUNNING FROM CHICAGO...TO KANSAS
CITY AND AMARILLO EARLY THIS MORNING. SOUTHERLY WINDS OVER ENTIRE
CWA WITH TEMPS IN LOW TO MID 60S AND DEWPOINTS MID 50S TO LOWER
60S. SOME STRATO-CU CLOUDS...MOST CLOUD COVER IS AT HIGH LEVELS
THOUGH. WOULD NOT BE SHOCKED...HOWEVER...TO SEE LOWER CLOUDS TAKE
OVER TOWARD SUNRISE.
&&

KANSAS AND MISSOURI BY THIS EVENING...STRENGTHENING A SURFACE LOW

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 050343
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
943 PM CST FRI NOV 4 2005

.UPDATE...

SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE OVER THE SOUTHEAST STATES CONTINUES TO
SLIDE EAST AS A COLD FRONT NOW STRETCHED ACROSS THE PLAINS 
STATES SLOWLY MOVES SOUTHEAST. THE SURFACE PRESSURE GRADIENT
REMAINS TIGHT THIS EVENING...SO EXPECT SOUTHERLY WINDS TO STAY
UP TONIGHT...ALTHOUGH HAVE REMOVED GUSTS FROM THE FORECAST FOR
THE REMAINDER OF THE NIGHT. A WEAK UPPER LEVEL SHORTWAVE TROUGH 
CONTINUES TO MOVE ACROSS THE AREA THIS EVENING IN THE STRENGTHING
UPPER LEVEL SOUTHWESTERLY FLOW ALOFT. THIS FEATURE HAS SPREAD A
MID AND UPPER LEVEL DECK OF SCATTERED TO BROKEN CLOUDS OVER MAINLY
THE SOUTHEAST HALF OF THE AREA...WITH MOSTLY CLEAR SKIES OVER
AREAS FURTHER NORTHWEST. LOW LEVEL MOISTURE WILL CONTINUE TO
INCREASE OVERNIGHT UNDER SOUTHERLY LOW LEVEL FLOW AND FORECAST
SOUNDINGS INDICATE SCATTERED LOW CLOUDS POSSIBLY DEVELOPING
TOWARDS DAWN. HAVE UPDATED SKY GRIDS SLIGHTLY TO REFLECT CURRENT
AND FORECAST CLOUD SITUATION. OTHERWISE...ALL OTHER FORECAST
PARAMETERS LOOK GOOD.

UPDATED GRIDS AND ZONES HAVE BEEN SENT TO REFLECT CLOUD COVER
CHANGES AND TO REMOVE EVENING WIND GUST WORDING FROM THE FORECAST.


&&

.PREV DISCUSSION... (ISSUED 307 PM CST FRI NOV 4 2005) 

DISCUSSION...VISIBLE SATELLITE ACROSS THE MID SOUTH OVER THE PAST 
FEW HOURS SHOWING SKIES BECOMING PARTLY CLOUDY AS MOISTURE AHEAD OF 
850 MB TROUGH TRANSLATES EAST. TEMPERATURES THIS AFTERNOON HAVE 
WARMED INTO THE LOWER TO MIDDLE 70S. SOME AREAS PRIMARILY ALONG AND 
WEST OF THE MISSISSIPPI RIVER DELTA REPORTING WINDS BELOW ADVISORY 
CRITERIA. MAIN FORECAST CONCERNS THIS PACKAGE IS CONVECTIVE 
POTENTIAL SATURDAY/SUNDAY AND AGAIN ON WEDNESDAY.

TONIGHT...PRECIPITATION FREE WEATHER EXPECTED ACROSS THE MID SOUTH 
WITH THE FORECAST AREA BETWEEN HIGH PRESSURE OFF TO THE EAST AND A 
COLD FRONT LOCATED ACROSS THE MISSOURI VALLEY AND CENTRAL PLAINS. 
DEWPOINTS HAVE NOT DROPPED MUCH TODAY WITH MID/HIGH LEVEL CLOUDS 
PRESENT AND A STRONG GRADIENT TRANSPORTING GULF MOISTURE UP TO THE 
MID SOUTH. LOW TEMPERATURES TONIGHT WILL BE IN THE UPPER 50S TO 
LOWER 60S.

SATURDAY...COLD FRONT UPSTREAM ACROSS MISSOURI AND ARKANSAS WILL 
MAKE VERY LITTLE PROGRESS DURING THE DAY ACROSS THE MID/LOWER 
MISSISSIPPI VALLEY. 700-500 MB LAYER MID LEVEL LAPSE RATES WILL 
INCREASE TO 6.5-7.0 C/KM...WITH LI/S AROUND -5 AND SURFACE BASED 
CAPES BETWEEN 1500-2000 J/KG. ADJUSTED POPS TO LATE 
MORNING/AFTERNOON AS ANY CONVECTION WHICH DEVELOPS WILL 
PRIMARILY BE DIURNALLY DRIVEN.

SATURDAY NIGHT AND SUNDAY...COLD FRONT WILL MOVE THROUGH THE MID SOUTH 
AFTER MIDNIGHT. ANY ONGOING CONVECTION UPSTREAM SHOULD WEAKEN AS 
DIURNAL INSTABILITY DIMINISHES AND WILL BE MOSTLY ELEVATED AND 
REMAIN BELOW SEVERE LIMITS. RAISED POPS ACROSS NOTHERN SECTIONS OF 
THE FORECAST AREA WITH BETTER FORCING PRESENT. COLD FRONT WILL 
LINGER AROUND NORTHERN MISSISSIPPI SUNDAY MORNING BEFORE PUSHING 
THROUGH THE ENTIRE FORECAST AREA BY SUNDAY AFTERNOON. NOT EXPECTING 
MUCH OF A CHANGE IN TEMPERATURES WITH PASSAGE OF THE FRONT AS AREA 
BEGINS TO TRANSITION TO SOUTHWEST FLOW ALOFT BY MONDAY/TUESDAY.

MONDAY THROUGH FRIDAY...LOWER MISSSISSIPI VALLEY WILL TRANSITION 
BRIEFLY TO SOUTHWEST FLOW ALOFT THEN BACK TO ZONAL FLOW BY THE END 
OF THE PERIOD. LONG RANGE MODEL RUN TO RUN CONSISTENCY THIS FORECAST 
PACKAGE IN GOOD AGREEMENT. 

A COLD FRONT WILL SLOWLY MOVE THROUGH THE FORECAST AREA WEDNESDAY 
NIGHT AND THURSDAY AS THE SURFACE COLD FRONT WILL BE PARALLEL TO 
UPPER LEVEL FLOW. AT THIS TIME THINK BEST CHANCE FOR PRECIPITATION 
WILL BE WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND WENT WITH LOW END POPS FOR NOW AS BETTER 
FORCING SHOULD REMAIN NORTH OF THE FORECAST AREA. 

MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.

&&

$$

CJC/JLH

AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
1045 AM CST FRI NOV 4 2005

.DISCUSSION...SURFACE ANALYSIS THIS MORNING SHOWS A COLD FRONT 
STRETCHING FROM NORTHERN LAKE MICHIGAN BACK THROUGH CENTRAL MISSOURI 
AND SOUTHEAST KANSAS. VISIBLE AND WATER VAPOR IMAGERY SHOW MOSTLY 
MID/HIGH LEVEL MOISTURE MOVING ACROSS THE MID SOUTH THIS MORNING. 
THINK TEMPERATURES WILL HAVE A HARD TIME REACHING FORECAST HIGHS 
WITH EXTENSIVE CLOUD COVER ACROSS THE AREA. WILL ISSUE AN UPDATE TO 
ADJUST FORECAST FOR CLOUD COVER TRENDS AND TO LOWER TEMPERATURES A 
FEW DEGREES. 

UPDATED GRIDS WILL BE PUBLISHED SHORTLY. 


.PREV DISCUSSION...ISSUED 310 AM CST FRI NOV 4 2005...

HIGH PRESSURE CENTERED OFF THE CAROLINA COAST THIS MORNING. LOW
PRESSURE CENTERED OVER WISCONSIN...WITH COLD FRONT TO NEAR WICHITA
KANSAS. SOUTH WINDS ARE ALLOWING MOISTURE TO RETURN TO THE AREA.
JUST SOUTH OF OUR AREA...DEWPOINTS RUNNING ABOUT 15 DEGREES HIGHER
THAN THEY WERE JUST 12 HOURS AGO. TEMPERATURES RANGE FROM LOWER
50S NEAR TUPELO...TO LOWER 60S ALONG AND WEST OF MISSISSIPPI
RIVER. CIRRUS MOVING INTO THE MIDSOUTH FROM THE WEST...BUT NO SIGN
OF LOW CLOUDS ANY TIME SOON.

&&

.SHORT TERM (THROUGH SUNDAY)...
SOUTHWEST FLOW THROUGH THE SHORT TERM FORECAST. COLD FRONT MAKES
VERY LITTLE PROGRESS OVER THE NEXT 36 HOURS. THROUGH THE DAYTIME
HOURS ON SATURDAY...DONT EXPECT MUCH MORE THAN CIRRUS TO AFFECT
THE WEATHER. WHILE BOUNDARY AND 85O TEMPS WOULD INDICATE ABOUT 5
DEGREES OF WARMING TODAY...ADDITIONAL CLOUDS SHOULD HOLD THAT
INCREASE DOWN A LITTLE...WHICH SHOULD KEEP HIGHS BELOW RECORD
TERRITORY. WITH SOUTHERLY FLOW BRINGING IN MOISTURE...AFTERNOON
RELATIVE HUMIDITIES SHOULD STAY ABOVE RED FLAG LEVELS TODAY.

NOT MUCH CHANGE IN HIGHS ON SATURDAY. ENERGY MOVING THROUGH THE
GREAT LAKES SATURDAY AND SATURDAY NIGHT WILL FINALLY BEGIN MOVING
COLD FRONT EAST. FRONT TO MOVE THROUGH THE AREA SATURDAY NIGHT AND
SUNDAY MORNING. SOUNDINGS INDICATE AIRMASS SHOULD BE CAPPED FOR
MOST OF THE DAY SATURDAY. BEST FORCING WILL BE NORTH OF OUR AREA.
CANNOT RULE OUT THUNDERSTORMS OVERNIGHT SATURDAY NIGHT AND WILL
KEEP CHANCE MENTION IN FORECAST AS IT STANDS. WILL MENTION IN HWO
THAT A FEW STORMS COULD BE STRONG...BUT WILL STOP SHORT OF SEVERE
MENTION FOR NOW...EVEN THOUGH SWODY2 HAS AREA NORTH OF INTERSTATE
40 OUTLOOKED FOR SLIGHT RISK.

DRIER...BUT NOT SIGNIFICANTLY COOLER AIR MOVES INTO THE AREA ON SUNDAY.

&&

.LONG TERM (AFTER SUNDAY)...
SCENARIO FOR NEXT 48 HOURS WILL REPEAT TUESDAY THROUGH
THURSDAY...WITH ANOTHER CHANCE OF THUNDERSTORMS. BEST TIMING OF
FRONTAL PASSAGE AND PRECIPITATION WOULD BE ABOUT WEDNESDAY NIGHT.
EVEN WITH PASSAGE OF THAT FRONT ON WEDNESDAY NIGHT...SURFACE HIGH
BEHIND IT IS OF PACIFIC ORIGIN. THIS BASICALLY MEANS THAT INDIAN
SUMMER...AND MUCH ABOVE NORMAL TEMPERATURES WILL CONTINUE THROUGH
THE END OF NEXT WEEK.

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.
&&

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
859 PM CST THU NOV 3 2005

.UPDATE...

REMOVED RED FLAG WARNING FROM WATCH/WARNING/ADVISORY SECTION
BELOW.

&&

.PREV DISCUSSION... (ISSUED 748 PM CST THU NOV 3 2005) 

UPDATE...

WILL LET THE RED FLAG WARNING ISSUED EARLIER FOR FORESTRY
INTERESTS IN NORTHEAST AR...THE MO BOOTHEEL...AND WEST TN EXPIRE
AT 9 PM. HUMIDITIES ARE GRADUALLY INCREASING WITH SUNSET AND WINDS
ARE NOT AS STRONG. UPDATED ZONES TO REMOVE WIND GUSTS FOR THIS
EVENING. HOWEVER...A TIGHT SURFACE GRADIENT WILL KEEP SOUTH WINDS
BETWEEN 10 AND 15 MPH ACROSS MUCH OF THE AREA OVERNIGHT. THIS WILL
HELP TO HOLD TEMPERATURES UP. SATELLITE INDICATES SOME THIN CIRRUS
MOVING ACROSS THE MID-SOUTH...BUT MOSTLY CLEAR SHOULD SUFFICE FOR
OVERNIGHT.

PREV DISCUSSION... (ISSUED 237 PM CST THU NOV 3 2005) 

FIRE WEATHER THE MAIN STORY ON THIS OTHERWISE QUIET DAY. RED FLAG
WARNING FOR ALL AREAS EXCEPT NORTH MS UNTIL 9 PM. CONDITIONS AT
20Z VERY CLOSE TO THE WARNING CRITERIA.

SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY NIGHT)...
THE PRESSURE GRADIENT BETWEEN LOW PRESSURE OVER THE CENTRAL PLAINS
AND HIGH PRESSURE OVER THE SE WILL REMAIN STRONG OVERNIGHT. WINDS
WILL STAY UP AND PREVENT TEMPERATURES FROM FREE FALLING. DID
UNDERCUT GUIDANCE A LITTLE BIT AS IT HAS TRENDED TOO WARM FOR
SEVERAL DAYS NOW.

ANOTHER QUIET DAY IN STORE FOR TOMORROW WITH BROAD SW FLOW ALOFT
KEEPING FRONTAL BOUNDARY WELL TO OUR NORTH. NO FIRE WEATHER
HEADLINES ARE EXPECTED FOR FRIDAY. CONTINUED SOUTHERLY FLOW WILL
ALLOW DEWPOINTS TO SLOWLY RISE...KEEPING RH VALUES ABOVE THE
CRITICAL 25 PERCENT THRESHOLD. FEEL THAT MODELS ARE WAY TOO
AGGRESSIVE IN THE MOISTURE RETURN. IT WILL BE VERY HARD TO GET 60
DEWPOINTS IN HERE SINCE THE CLOSEST 60 DEWPOINTS ON THE SFC CHARTS
ARE DOWN IN THE GULF OF MEXICO. SUBSTANTIAL MIXING WILL OCCUR
TOMORROW TO KEEP DEWPOINTS SOMEWHAT IN CHECK AND WINDS ON THE
BREEZY SIDE. TEMPS LOOK TO BE SIMILAR TO TODAY.

CONDITIONS BEGIN TO CHANGE BY SATURDAY. A SHORTWAVE WILL PROGRESS
THROUGH THE RELATIVELY FAST 500 MB FLOW...PUSHING A COLD FRONT
INTO THE MIDSOUTH. GFS/NAM MUCH LESS AMPLIFIED WITH THE SHORTWAVE
THAN THE ECMWF/UKMET/CANADIAN. BEST CHANCES OF PRECIP LOOK TO BE
IN NORTHERN HALF OF CWA. MOISTURE RETURN AHEAD OF THE FRONT STILL
A QUESTION MARK. MODELS LIKELY OVERDOING THE 60 DEWPOINTS AND THAT
WILL HAVE AN AFFECT ON ANY POTENTIAL INSTABILITY. WILL KEEP
MENTION OF THUNDER GIVEN THE DEGREE OF FRONTAL FORCING AND THE
REGION BEING IN THE FAVORABLE RIGHT ENTRANCE REGION OF A 100 KT JET.

LONG TERM (SUNDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...
NOT MUCH OF AN AIRMASS CHANGE BEHIND THE FRONT WITH THE AIRMASS
BEING OF PACIFIC ORIGIN. WINDS QUICKLY TURN BACK OUT OF THE SOUTH
BY MONDAY. 12Z GFS HAS COME IN LINE WITH THE 00Z EURO ON BRINGING
A FRONT THROUGH WEDNESDAY NIGHT/THURSDAY. THEREFORE...INTRODUCED
SLIGHT CHANCE POPS. GIVEN THE FAST FLOW OF THE DOMINANT PACIFIC
JET...MODELS WILL CONTINUE TO STRUGGLE WITH HOW TO DEAL WITH THE
ENERGY (AS HAS BEEN SEEN FOR THIS WEEKENDS SYSTEM.) WILL LET THE
MODELS THINK ABOUT THINGS SOME MORE BEFORE GOING WITH HIGHER POPS
FOR THIS EVENT. 

ANOTHER RESULT OF THE PACIFIC JET IS THE CONTINUATION OF MILD
TEMPERATURES THROUGHOUT THE PERIOD. HOWEVER...DID NOT GO AS WARM
AS THE NEAR RECORD BREAKING 12Z MEX GUIDANCE. THERE ARE NO HINTS
OF ANY CANADIAN COLD AIR FOR AT THE LEAST THE NEXT 7 DAYS.

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.

&&

$$

JCL

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 031825
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
1225 PM CST THU NOV 3 2005

.UPDATE...

AFTER COORDINATION WITH THE TN DIVISION OF FORESTRY...HAVE ISSUED
A RED FLAG WARNING FOR WEST TENNESSEE. 18Z OBS SHOWING RH VALUES
BEGINNING TO DIP BELOW 30 PERCENT ALONG WITH WINDS SUSTAINED AT
15 MPH OR MORE. NOT ALL AREAS MAY REACH THE CRITERIA...BUT IT IS
CLOSE ENOUGH TO WARRANT THE ISSUANCE...ESPECIALLY WITH THE VERY
DRY GROUND CONDITIONS PRESENT. ALL PRODUCTS HAVE BEEN UPDATED AND
SENT. 

THINK WINDS WILL STAY DOWN JUST ENOUGH IN NORTH MISSISSIPPI TO
PRECLUDE A RED FLAG THERE. WILL CONTINUE TO MONITOR AND COORDINATE
OUR EFFORTS WITH THE MISSISSIPPI OFFICIALS.

ONCE AGAIN...THANKS TO ALL THE FORESTRY SERVICES FOR THEIR
COORDINATION.

&&

.PREV DISCUSSION... (ISSUED 918 AM CST THU NOV 3 2005) 

UPDATE...

HAVE MADE UPDATES TO THE FORECAST PRIMARILY FOR FIRE WEATHER
PURPOSES. A LOOK AT THE 12Z NAM SOUNDINGS INDICATE THAT AREAS
OVER NE ARKANSAS AND THE MISSOURI BOOTHEEL WILL MIX UP TO AROUND
900 MB WHERE WINDS OF 40KTS ARE INDICATED. THIS WILL RESULT IN
WINDS OF 15 TO 20 MPH WITH HIGHER GUSTS AT THE SURFACE. 
ADDITIONALLY...WITH THE ENTIRE ATMOSPHERIC COLUMN EXTREMELY DRY
(PRECIP WATERS LESS THAN 0.50) FEEL THAT DEWPOINTS WILL ALSO LOWER
SOME WITH AMPLE MIXING. TAKING ALL OF THIS INTO ACCOUNT ALONG WITH
COORDINATION WITH THE ARKANSAS AND MISSOURI FORESTRY
SERVICES...HAVE ISSUED A RED FLAG WARNING THROUGH THIS EVENING.

REST OF THE FORECAST LOOKS TO BE IN GOOD SHAPE. WILL SEND A ZONE
UPDATE TO ACCOUNT FOR THE HIGHER WINDS EXPECTED TODAY.

MANY THANKS GO OUT TO THE FORESTRY SERVICES IN AR AND MO FOR THEIR
COORDINATION THIS MORNING.

PREV DISCUSSION... (ISSUED 215 AM CST WED NOV 2 2005) 

DISCUSSION...

HIGH PRESSURE HAS SHIFTED EAST THIS MORNING ALLOWING FOR SOUTHERLY 
WINDS TO KICK UP ALREADY ACROSS WESTERN PORTIONS OF THE MIDSOUTH. 
EXPECT WINDS TO RANGE FROM 10 TO 20 MPH BY THIS AFTERNOON. THIS WILL 
CREATE A WILDFIRE CONCERN MAINLY ACROSS WESTERN SECTIONS OF THE 
MIDSOUTH AS ONE OF THE DRIEST OCTOBERS ON RECORD HAS ALLOWED FOREST 
FUELS TO BECOME DRY. WARM TEMPERATURES THIS AFTERNOON...COMBINED 
WITH LOW AFTERNOON RELATIVE HUMIDITY...AND THE STRONG AND GUSTY 
WINDS WILL HELP CREATE THE WILDFIRE DANGER. EXPECT HIGHS TO REACH 
INTO THE UPPER 70S THIS AFTERNOON.

HIGH PRESSURE WILL REMAIN TO THE EAST OF THE MIDSOUTH THROUGH FRIDAY 
NIGHT. THIS WILL KEEP THE GUSTY SOUTHERLY WINDS AND WARM 
TEMPERATURES AROUND THE CWA. EXPECT HIGHS TO REACH NEAR 80S DEGREES 
WITH LOWS THE UPPER 50S TO LOW 60S. SKIES WILL REMAIN MOSTLY CLEAR 
TO PARTLY CLOUDY DURING THIS TIME.

A SHORTWAVE WITH AN ASSOCIATED WEAK COLD FRONT WILL MOVE INTO 
PORTIONS OF THE MIDSOUTH BEGINNING SATURDAY. THE WILL SPREAD SMALL 
CHANCES FOR SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS INTO THE CWA THROUGH SUNDAY. 
TEMPERATURES ARE NOT EXPECTED TO COOL DOWN MUCH BEHIND THE 
FRONT...SHOULD REMAIN ABOVE NORMAL.

HIGH PRESSURE REBUILDS INTO THE AREA FOR THE EARLY PART OF NEXT 
WEEK. EXPECT DRY CONDITIONS DURING THIS TIME. HIGH WILL QUICKLY 
SHIFT EASTWARD ALLOWING TEMPERATURES TO REBOUND BACK TO NEAR 80 
DEGREES FOR HIGHS BY TUESDAY AS SOUTHERLY WINDS INCREASE OVER THE 
AREA.

ANOTHER COLD FRONT WILL APPROACH NORTHWESTERN PORTIONS OF THE 
MIDSOUTH BY LATE WEDNESDAY. EXPECT PRECIP TO HOLD OFF UNTIL AFTER 
THE END OF THE FORECAST PERIOD.

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...RED FLAG WARNING UNTIL 9 PM CST THIS EVENING FOR CLAY-CRAIGHEAD-
     CRITTENDEN-CROSS-GREENE-LAWRENCE-LEE(AR)-MISSISSIPPI-
     PHILLIPS-POINSETT-RANDOLPH-ST. FRANCIS.

MO...RED FLAG WARNING UNTIL 9 PM CST THIS EVENING FOR DUNKLIN-
     PEMISCOT.

MS...NONE.
TN...RED FLAG WARNING UNTIL 9 PM CST THIS EVENING FOR BENTON(TN)-
     CARROLL-CHESTER-CROCKETT-DECATUR-DYER-FAYETTE-GIBSON-
     HARDEMAN-HAYWOOD-HENDERSON-HENRY-LAKE-LAUDERDALE-MADISON-
     MCNAIRY-OBION-SHELBY-TIPTON-WEAKLEY.

&&

$$

JFB/KRM

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 030210 AAA
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
810 PM CST WED NOV 2 2005

.UPDATE...

SATELLITE SHOWS CLEAR SKIES COVERING THE MID-SOUTH THIS EVENING.
SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE IS MOVING TO THE EAST ALLOWING LIGHT SOUTH
WINDS ACROSS MUCH OF OUR AREA. THIS WILL HELP TO HOLD UP OVERNIGHT
LOWS. THE COLDEST LOCATIONS WILL EXTEND FROM NORTHEAST MS INTO THE
SOUTHEAST CORNER OF WEST TN WHERE WINDS WILL BE MORE CALM. THE
CURRENT FORECAST AND GRIDS HAVE ALL OF THIS COVERED WELL...NO
UPDATES ATTM.

&&

.PREV DISCUSSION... (ISSUED 307 PM CST WED NOV 2 2005) 

SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE EXTENDS FROM THE LOWER MISSISSIPPI VALLEY
NORTHEAST TO THE MID ATLANTIC STATES. TEMPS HAVE WARMED INTO THE
70S THOUGHT DEWPOINTS REMAIN QUITE LOW...MAINLY IN THE 30S.
SURFACE WINDS HAVE SHIFTED AROUND TO THE SOUTH ACROSS WESTERN
SECTIONS OF THE MID SOUTH AS THE SFC HIGH CONT TO MOVE TO THE
EAST.

TONIGHT...SFC HIGH PRESSURE WL CONT TO INFLUENCE EASTERN SECTIONS
OF THE FORECAST AREA. EXPECT SURFACE WINDS TO REMAIN VERY LIGHT
ACROSS EASTERN SECTIONS OF THE AREA. CLEAR SKIES AND LOW DEWPOINTS
WILL RESULT IN TEMPS IN THE UPPER 30S...COLDER IN SOME LOCATIONS.
HAVE UNDERCUT GUIDANCE 4-5 DEGREES IN THESE AREAS. A LIGHT SOUTHERLY
BREEZE SHOULD CONT OVERNIGHT ACRS THE DELTA PREVENTING TEMPS FROM
NOSE DIVING.

THURSDAY...HIGH PRESSURE WL SLIP A LITTLE FURTHER EAST WHILE LOW
PRESSURE DEVELOPS IN THE CNTRL PLAINS. THE RESULTANT PRESSURE
GRADIENT WL RESULT IN MORE WIND THU...ESPECIALLY ACRS ERN AR AND
THE MO BOOTHEEL. EXPECT THE WARMING TREND TO CONT AS WELL WITH
850 MB TEMPS 14-16C. DUE TO WINDS...RH VALUES BELOW 30 PERCENT AND
ONGOING DRY WEATHER THERE IS AN INCREASING FIRE WEATHER CONCERN
ACRS ERN AR/MO BOOTHEEL FOR THU AFTN. WL CONT TO MONITOR.
OTRW...EXPECT PLENTY OF SUNSHINE AND TEMPS IN THE UPPER 70S.

THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY NIGHT...LOW PRESSURE OVER THE CNTRL
PLAINS WILL RACE NORTHEAST TO THE GREAT LAKES WITH A WEAK COLD
FRONT STRETCHED ACRS THE OH VALLEY SOUTHWEST INTO THE SRN PLAINS.
AREA WL REMAIN DRY AND MILD WITH TEMPS ON FRI AFTN NEARING 80
DEGREES. LOW TEMPS WL CONT TO MODERATE WITH READINGS NOT FALLING
MUCH BELOW 60 BY SAT MORNING. 

SATURDAY THROUGH MONDAY...BIG DIFFERENCES IN MEDIUM RANGE MODELS
FOR THIS TIME PERIOD. GFS INDICATES WSW FLOW ACRS THE REGION WITH
COLD FRONT STALLING OUT NORTH OF THE REGION AND THE MID SOUTH
REMAINING MILD AND FOR THE MOST PART DRY. THE ECMWF HAS A MUCH
MORE AMPLIFIED PATTERN WITH A STRONG UPPER TROF MOVING ACRS THE MID
MS VALLEY WITH A COLD FRONT PUSHING THROUGH THE REGION ON SUNDAY.
WL DECREASE POPS A LITTLE IN THE SAT-SUN NIGHT.

MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH WED...ECMWF HAS A MAJOR TROF ACRS THE ERN
U.S. WHILE THE GFS HAS BASICALLY MILD ZONAL FLOW. THE BIG
DIFFERENCE WL BE TEMPS AND DEWPOINTS. THE ECMWF WOULD BE COOLER
WITH LOWER DEWPOINTS AS COOL HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS OVER THE REGION
BEHIND THE FRONT WHILE THE GFS WOULD RESULT IN MILDER AND MORE
HUMID CONDITIONS WITH HIGH PRESSURE OFF THE EAST COAST AND
PREVAILING SOUTHERLY LOW LEVEL FLOW.

&&


.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.

&&


$$

JCL/SJM

70S THOUGHT DEWPOINTS REMAIN QUITE LOW...MAINLY IN THE 30S.
SURFACE WINDS HAVE SHIFTED AROUND TO THE SOUTH ACROSS WESTERN
SECTIONS OF THE MID SOUTH AS THE SFC HIGH CONT TO MOVE TO THE
EAST.

TONIGHT...SFC HIGH PRESSURE WL CONT TO INFLUENCE EASTERN SECTIONS
OF THE FORECAST AREA. EXPECT SURFACE WINDS TO REMAIN VERY LIGHT
ACROSS EASTERN SECTIONS OF THE AREA. CLEAR SKIES AND LOW DEWPOINTS
WILL RESULT IN TEMPS IN THE UPPER 30S...COLDER IN SOME LOCATIONS.
HAVE UNDERCUT GUIDANCE 4-5 DEGREES IN THESE AREAS. A LIGHT SOUTHERLY
BREEZE SHOULD CONT OVERNIGHT ACRS THE DELTA PREVENTING TEMPS FROM
NOSE DIVING.

THURSDAY...HIGH PRESSURE WL SLIP A LITTLE FURTHER EAST WHILE LOW
PRESSURE DEVELOPS IN THE CNTRL PLAINS. THE RESULTANT PRESSURE
GRADIENT WL RESULT IN MORE WIND THU...ESPECIALLY ACRS ERN AR AND
THE MO BOOTHEEL. EXPECT THE WARMING TREND TO CONT AS WELL WITH
850 MB TEMPS 14-16C. DUE TO WINDS...RH VALUES BELOW 30 PERCENT AND
ONGOING DRY WEATHER THERE IS AN INCREASING FIRE WEATHER CONCERN
ACRS ERN AR/MO BOOTHEEL FOR THU AFTN. WL CONT TO MONITOR.
OTRW...EXPECT PLENTY OF SUNSHINE AND TEMPS IN THE UPPER 70S.

THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY NIGHT...LOW PRESSURE OVER THE CNTRL
PLAINS WILL RACE NORTHEAST TO THE GREAT LAKES WITH A WEAK COLD
FRONT STRETCHED ACRS THE OH VALLEY SOUTHWEST INTO THE SRN PLAINS.
AREA WL REMAIN DRY AND MILD WITH TEMPS ON FRI AFTN NEARING 80
DEGREES. LOW TEMPS WL CONT TO MODERATE WITH READINGS NOT FALLING
MUCH BELOW 60 BY SAT MORNING. 

SATURDAY THROUGH MONDAY...BIG DIFFERENCES IN MEDIUM RANGE MODELS
FOR THIS TIME PERIOD. GFS INDICATES WSW FLOW ACRS THE REGION WITH
COLD FRONT STALLING OUT NORTH OF THE REGION AND THE MID SOUTH
REMAINING MILD AND FOR THE MOST PART DRY. THE ECMWF HAS A MUCH
MORE AMPLIFIED PATTERN WITH A STRONG UPPER TROF MOVING ACRS THE MID
MS VALLEY WITH A COLD FRONT PUSHING THROUGH THE REGION ON SUNDAY.
WL DECREASE POPS A LITTLE IN THE SAT-SUN NIGHT.

MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH WED...ECMWF HAS A MAJOR TROF ACRS THE ERN
U.S. WHILE THE GFS HAS BASICALLY MILD ZONAL FLOW. THE BIG
DIFFERENCE WL BE TEMPS AND DEWPOINTS. THE ECMWF WOULD BE COOLER
WITH LOWER DEWPOINTS AS COOL HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS OVER THE REGION
BEHIND THE FRONT WHILE THE GFS WOULD RESULT IN MILDER AND MORE
HUMID CONDITIONS WITH HIGH PRESSURE OFF THE EAST COAST AND
PREVAILING SOUTHERLY LOW LEVEL FLOW.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
MEM  49  78  57  80 /   0   0   0  10 
MKL  40  77  53  79 /   0   0   0  10 
JBR  46  78  54  78 /   0   0   0  10 
TUP  39  78  52  78 /   0   0   0  10 

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.
&&

SJM
