
000 
FXUS64 KMEG 021611
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
1011 AM CST WED NOV 2 2005

.UPDATE...

HIGH PRESSURE STRETCHES FROM THE LOWER MISSISSIPPI VALLEY NORTHEAST
INTO THE OHIO VALLEY THIS MORNING. TEMPS ARE QUICKLY REBOUNDING
AND FORECAST HIGHS IN THE LOWER AND MID 70S EXPECTED THIS AFTN.
EXPECT PLENTY OF SUNSHINE WITH VERY DRY AIRMASS IN PLACE. WINDS
WILL BEGIN TO SHIFT AROUND TO THE SOUTH ACRS NE AR/MO BOOTHEEL
LATER TODAY AS HIGH SHIFTS EAST. CURRENT FORECAST ON TRACK AND WL
UPDATE FOR TIME SENSITIVE WORDING CONCERNING THE SURFACE WINDS.

&&

.PREV DISCUSSION... (ISSUED 115 AM CST WED NOV 2 2005) 

DISCUSSION...

PLEASANT WEATHER EXPECTED ACROSS THE MIDSOUTH FOR THE END OF THE 
WORK WEEK. HIGH PRESSURE WILL CONTINUE TO DOMINATE THE WEATHER 
OVER THE MIDSOUTH THROUGH FRIDAY. EXPECT CLEAR TO MOSTLY CLEAR 
CONDITIONS DURING THIS TIME. EXPECT HIGHS TODAY IN THE LOWER TO MID 
70S. THE HIGH WILL SHIFT EAST BY TONIGHT ALLOWING FOR SOUTHERLY 
WINDS TO BRING A GRADUAL WARMING TREND TO THE MIDSOUTH. EXPECT HIGH 
TEMPERATURES IN THE UPPER 70S WITH LOWS IN THE 50S FOR THURSDAY AND 
FRIDAY.

A SHORTWAVE WILL SWING INTO NORTHERN PORTIONS OF THE MIDSOUTH BY 
FRIDAY NIGHT WITH AN ASSOCIATED COLD FRONT MOVING INTO THE AREA BY 
SATURDAY NIGHT. MODELS NOW SHOWING THE FRONT WASHING OUT OVER THE 
AREA BY SUNDAY NIGHT. STILL A LOT OF UNCERTAINTY WITH THE 
FRONT...WILL CONTINUE WITH 20 TO 30 POPS DURING THIS TIME FOR NOW. 

THE WASHED OUT FRONT MAY BECOME THE FOCUS OF ISOLATED SHRA/TSRA 
DEVELOPMENT DURING THE EARLY PART OF NEXT WEEK. SINCE MODELS DO NOT 
HAVE A GOOD HANDLE ON THE FRONT...WILL LEAVE THIS PART OF FORECAST 
DRY FOR NOW. EXPECT TEMPERATURES TO REMAIN ABOVE NORMAL DURING THIS 
TIME.

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.
&&

$$

SJM/KRM








000 
FXUS64 KMEG 030818
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
215 AM CST WED NOV 2 2005

.DISCUSSION...

HIGH PRESSURE HAS SHIFTED EAST THIS MORNING ALLOWING FOR SOUTHERLY 
WINDS TO KICK UP ALREADY ACROSS WESTERN PORTIONS OF THE MIDSOUTH. 
EXPECT WINDS TO RANGE FROM 10 TO 20 MPH BY THIS AFTERNOON. THIS WILL 
CREATE A WILDFIRE CONCERN MAINLY ACROSS WESTERN SECTIONS OF THE 
MIDSOUTH AS ONE OF THE DRIEST OCTOBERS ON RECORD HAS ALLOWED FOREST 
FUELS TO BECOME DRY. WARM TEMPERATURES THIS AFTERNOON...COMBINED 
WITH LOW AFTERNOON RELATIVE HUMIDITY...AND THE STRONG AND GUSTY 
WINDS WILL HELP CREATE THE WILDFIRE DANGER. EXPECT HIGHS TO REACH 
INTO THE UPPER 70S THIS AFTERNOON.

HIGH PRESSURE WILL REMAIN TO THE EAST OF THE MIDSOUTH THROUGH FRIDAY 
NIGHT. THIS WILL KEEP THE GUSTY SOUTHERLY WINDS AND WARM 
TEMPERATURES AROUND THE CWA. EXPECT HIGHS TO REACH NEAR 80S DEGREES 
WITH LOWS THE UPPER 50S TO LOW 60S. SKIES WILL REMAIN MOSTLY CLEAR 
TO PARTLY CLOUDY DURING THIS TIME.

A SHORTWAVE WITH AN ASSOCIATED WEAK COLD FRONT WILL MOVE INTO 
PORTIONS OF THE MIDSOUTH BEGINNING SATURDAY. THE WILL SPREAD SMALL 
CHANCES FOR SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS INTO THE CWA THROUGH SUNDAY. 
TEMPERATURES ARE NOT EXPECTED TO COOL DOWN MUCH BEHIND THE 
FRONT...SHOULD REMAIN ABOVE NORMAL.

HIGH PRESSURE REBUILDS INTO THE AREA FOR THE EARLY PART OF NEXT 
WEEK. EXPECT DRY CONDITIONS DURING THIS TIME. HIGH WILL QUICKLY 
SHIFT EASTWARD ALLOWING TEMPERATURES TO REBOUND BACK TO NEAR 80 
DEGREES FOR HIGHS BY TUESDAY AS SOUTHERLY WINDS INCREASE OVER THE 
AREA.

ANOTHER COLD FRONT WILL APPROACH NORTHWESTERN PORTIONS OF THE 
MIDSOUTH BY LATE WEDNESDAY. EXPECT PRECIP TO HOLD OFF UNTIL AFTER 
THE END OF THE FORECAST PERIOD.

&&

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 020118 AAA
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
718 PM CST TUE NOV 1 2005

.DISCUSSION...

SKIES HAVE CLEARED ACROSS THE MID-SOUTH AS HIGH PRESSURE SURFACE
AND ALOFT BUILDS INTO THE AREA FROM THE WEST. 00Z LZK SOUNDING IS 
VERY DRY WITH A PRECIPITABLE WATER OF 0.41 INCH. WITH SURFACE 
DEWPOINTS FALLING INTO MOSTLY THE 30S...DECOUPLING WINDS...AND A 
VERY DRY AIR MASS...EXPECT A GOOD NIGHT FOR RADIATIONAL COOLING. 
WITH LOWER FORECAST MINIMUM TEMPERATURES INTO THE 30S FOR JUST ABOUT 
EVERY LOCATION TONIGHT...THIS AGREES WITH UPSTREAM MINIMUMS THIS 
MORNING.

&&

.PREV DISCUSSION... (ISSUED 223 PM CST TUE NOV 1 2005) 

DISCUSSION...
THE CLEARING LINE HAS BEEN GRADUALLY SHIFTING EASTWARD THIS 
AFTERNOON AS PLANNED. BY EARLY EVENING THE CLOUDS SHOULD HAVE 
ADVANCED OUT OF THE AREA LEAVING CLEAR SKIES. GOOD RADIATIONAL 
COOLING AND LIGHT WINDS OVERNIGHT WILL ALLOW TEMPERATURES TO DIP 
BELOW CURRENT GUIDANCE NUMBERS.

THE MIDSOUTH WILL RECOVER FROM THE COOLER TEMPERATURES ON WEDNESDAY 
AS WARMER AIR BEGINS TO MOVE IN. EXPECT DAYTIME MAX TEMPS FROM THE 
LOW TO MID 70S REGION WIDE. PERSISTENCE WILL BE A GOOD BET WEDNESDAY 
NIGHT AND INTO THURSDAY. EXPECT EVEN WARMER TEMPERATURES THURSDAY 
AND ON INTO FRIDAY AS THE MIDSOUTH IS UNDER THE INFLUENCE OF THE 
UPPER LEVEL RIDGE.

THE NEXT CHANCES FOR RAIN WILL BE FRIDAY NIGHT IN ADVANCE OF A 
SHORTWAVE TRANSLATING ACROSS MISSOURI. THIS SHORTWAVE WILL BE ONE IN 
A SERIES OF DISTURBANCES THAT WILL CARVE OUT THE TROUGH OVER THE 
CENTRAL U.S. THIS WEEKEND. EXPECT THE MAIN COLD FRONT TO MOVE 
THROUGH SUNDAY NIGHT INTO MONDAY. SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS WILL 
FORM ALONG AND AHEAD OF THIS FRONT SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY 
NIGHT. DEPENDING ON THE SPEED OF THE FRONT...RAIN MAY LINGER INTO 
MONDAY MORNING...BUT WE ARE UNDER THE IMPRESSION THAT THE FRONT WILL 
MOVE SWIFTLY SOUTH OF THE FORECAST AREA BY SUNRISE MONDAY.  

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.

&&

$$

AC/JCL

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
1008 AM CST TUE NOV 1 2005

.DISCUSSION...
UPPER LOW WAS SINKING INTO SOUTHERN MS. THE LIGHT RAIN HAS BEEN 
DIMINISHING RAPIDLY OVER THE PAST HOUR. WILL REMOVE THE MENTION OF 
RAIN IN THE FORECAST. 

CLOUDS EXTEND FROM UNION CITY TO HELENA AND EAST....WHILE IT WAS 
SUNNY TO THE WEST. WEAK COLD ADVECTION WILL TAKE PLACE ACROSS THE 
FORECAST AREA TODAY. THE CLOUDS WILL BE SLOWEST TO CLEAR OUT OVER 
NORTHEAST MS...SO TEMPERATURES WILL NOT WARM UP AS MUCH AS EARLIER 
THOUGHT. HAVE TRENDED TEMPS DOWNWARD DUE TO THE CLOUD COVER/COLD 
ADVECTION FOR NORTHEAST MS.

FXUS64 KMEG 010736
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
140 AM CST TUE NOV 1 2005

.DISCUSSION...

COLD FRONT BEGINNING TO MOVE THROUGH WESTERN PORTIONS OF THE MIDSOUTH 
ATTM. AN AREA OF LIGHT RAIN IS ACCOMPANYING THE FRONT. EXPECT MOST 
OF THE RAIN TO BE EAST OF THE MISSISSIPPI RIVER BY ZONE ISSUANCE. 
WILL GO WITH HIGHER POPS EAST(LIKELYS) TO SLIGHT CHANCE POPS ACROSS 
EXTREME NORTHEAST ARKANSAS. BY LATE AFTERNOON...EXPECT PRECIP TO 
ONLY LINGER ACROSS EXTREME SOUTHEASTERN ZONES SO WILL LEAVE A SLIGHT 
CHANCE POP HERE. CLOUDS WILL DECREASE AS THE DAY PROGRESSES AND 
EXPECT CLEAR SKIES BY THIS EVENING ACROSS THE ENTIRE MIDSOUTH. CLEAR 
SKIES WILL ALLOW LOWS TO DROP BACK INTO THE 40S TONIGHT.

HIGH PRESSURE WILL CONTINUE TO BUILD INTO THE CWA ON WEDNESDAY. THE 
HIGH WILL DOMINATE THE WEATHER THROUGH FRIDAY. EXPECT CLEAR TO 
MOSTLY CLEAR CONDITIONS DURING THIS TIME. TEMPERATURES WILL BE NEAR 
NORMAL WITH A WARMING TREND FOR THURSDAY AND FRIDAY AS THE HIGH 
SHIFTS EAST.

ANOTHER COLD FRONT WILL MOVE INTO THE AREA FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH 
SATURDAY NIGHT. EXPECT ONLY LIGHT RAIN MUCH LIKE TODAYS FRONT. WILL 
GO WITH CHANCE POPS.

HIGH PRESSURE WILL REBUILD INTO THE CWA FOR THE END OF THE WEEKEND 
INTO EARLY NEXT WEEK. EXPECT MOSTLY CLEAR CONDITIONS WITH NEAR 
NORMAL TEMPERATURES.


000 
FXUS64 KMEG 010210 AAB
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
810 PM CST MON OCT 31 2005

.UPDATE...
CURRENT FORECAST AND GRIDS ARE FINE...SO NO UPDATES AT THIS TIME.
POSITIVELY TILTED UPPER LEVEL TROUGH AND ASSOCIATED COLD FRONT ARE
MOVING INTO THE MID-SOUTH THIS EVENING FROM THE WEST. MUCH OF THE
DYNAMICS WITH THE UPPER LEVEL TROUGH HAVE SHIFTED TO THE NORTH AND
SOUTH OF THE MID-SOUTH. IN ADDITION...THE LOWER LEVELS OF THE
ATMOSPHERE ARE DRY IN ADVANCE OF THE RAIN...THUS IT IS TAKING
SOME TIME FOR THE RAIN TO REACH THE GROUND. WHILE AMOUNTS WILL BE
MOSTLY LIGHT...THINK HIGH POPS ARE STILL IN ORDER...AS A BAND OF
LIGHT TO MODERATE SHOWERS MOVE ACROSS THE MID-SOUTH OVERNIGHT.
EVAPORATED COOLING IS LOWERING TEMPERATURES INTO THE 50S AS THE
RAIN BEGINS. SATELLITE SHOWS CLOUDY SKIES OVER-SPREADING THE MID-
SOUTH.

&&

.PREV DISCUSSION... (ISSUED 608 PM CST MON OCT 31 2005) 

UPDATE...

WILL UPDATE THE FORECAST TO REMOVE THUNDERSTORMS FOR TONIGHT. LAPS
DATA INDICATES THE ATMOSPHERE IS STABLE ACROSS THE MID-SOUTH WITH
LIFTED INDICES BETWEEN PLUS 8 AND 13. THE LATEST RUC INDICATES THE
UNSTABLE AIR WILL REMAIN TO OUR SOUTH OVERNIGHT. ALSO LATEST
SATELLITE AND LIGHTNING DATA INDICATES THUNDERSTORMS EARLIER TO THE WEST
HAVE SHRUNK WELL TO OUR SOUTH. WILL PROBABLY NEED TO TWEAK THE
FORECAST SOME MORE IN A LATER UPDATE.

PREV DISCUSSION... (ISSUED 302 PM CST MON OCT 31 2005) 

REGIONAL RADARS INDICATE A LONG LINE OF THUNDERSTORMS FROM LITTLE
ROCK TO FAR EAST TEXAS. NUMEROUS SHOWERS WERE IN THE WAKE OF THE
LEADING LINE OF STORMS. THE LINE OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS HAS
BEEN SLOW TO MOVE EASTWARD TODAY SINCE THE LOWER AND MID LEVEL
FLOW HAS BEEN ORIENTED PARALLEL TO THE LINE OF STORMS.

EASTWARD PROGRESSION OF THESE SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS WILL OCCUR 
BRINGING RAIN TO MOST AREAS OF THE MIDSOUTH. CURRENT THINKING WILL 
BRING THE RAIN FIRST INTO NORTHEAST ARKANSAS BY 7 PM. BELIEVE THAT 
THE MEMPHIS METRO AREA WILL SEE RAIN BEGIN AROUND 11 PM. BY LATE 
TONIGHT THE SHOWERS SHOULD MAKE THEIR WAY INTO THE TUPELO/COLUMBUS 
MS AREA. SOME LINGERING SHOWERS WILL BE POSSIBLE TUESDAY MORNING 
ESPECIALLY OVER THE SOUTHEAST FORECAST AREA.

THIS SYSTEM WILL MOVE SOUTH AND EAST OF THE MIDSOUTH CAUSING DRIER 
AND SLIGHTLY COOLER AIR INTO THE REGION. THIS WILL BE SHORT LIVED AS 
TEMPERATURES BEGIN TO WARM INTO THE LOWER 70S AGAIN BY WEDNESDAY. 
THE WARM TEMPERATURES WILL BE IN RESPONSE TO A SHORTWAVE TRANSLATING 
ACROSS THE NORTHERN PLAINS...CAUSING THE LOW LEVEL FLOW TO RETURN TO 
THE SOUTH.

TEMPERATURES THROUGH THE WEEK WILL BE ON THE RISE WITH MAX 
TEMPERATURES FRIDAY AND SATURDAY IN THE UPPER 70S LONG RANGE MODELS 
SUGGEST A SHORTWAVE AND ASSOCIATED COLD FRONT WILL SWING ACROSS THE 
CENTRAL U.S. SATURDAY AND PRODUCE A CHANCE OF SHOWERS AND 
THUNDERSTORMS SATURDAY NIGHT. A COOL DOWN WILL BE IN STORE AFTER 
SATURDAY WITH DAYTIME TEMPERATURES RETURNING TO THE UPPER 60S.

$$

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.

&&

$$

AC/JCL

.DISCUSSION...
REGIONAL RADARS INDICATE A LONG LINE OF THUNDERSTORMS FROM LITTLE 
ROCK TO FAR EAST TEXAS. NUMEROUS SHOWERS WERE IN THE WAKE OF THE 
LEADING LINE OF STORMS. THE LINE OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS HAS 
BEEN SLOW TO MOVE EASTWARD TODAY SINCE THE LOWER AND MID LEVEL FLOW 
HAS BEEN ORIENTED PARALLEL TO THE LINE OF STORMS.

EASTWARD PROGRESSION OF THESE SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS WILL OCCUR 
BRINGING RAIN TO MOST AREAS OF THE MIDSOUTH. CURRENT THINKING WILL 
BRING THE RAIN FIRST INTO NORTHEAST ARKANSAS BY 7 PM. BELIEVE THAT 
THE MEMPHIS METRO AREA WILL SEE RAIN BEGIN AROUND 11 PM. BY LATE 
TONIGHT THE SHOWERS SHOULD MAKE THEIR WAY INTO THE TUPELO/COLUMBUS 
MS AREA. SOME LINGERING SHOWERS WILL BE POSSIBLE TUESDAY MORNING 
ESPECIALLY OVER THE SOUTHEAST FORECAST AREA.

THIS SYSTEM WILL MOVE SOUTH AND EAST OF THE MIDSOUTH CAUSING DRIER 
AND SLIGHTLY COOLER AIR INTO THE REGION. THIS WILL BE SHORT LIVED AS 
TEMPERATURES BEGIN TO WARM INTO THE LOWER 70S AGAIN BY WEDNESDAY. 
THE WARM TEMPERATURES WILL BE IN RESPONSE TO A SHORTWAVE TRANSLATING 
ACROSS THE NORTHERN PLAINS...CAUSING THE LOW LEVEL FLOW TO RETURN TO 
THE SOUTH.

TEMPERATURES THROUGH THE WEEK WILL BE ON THE RISE WITH MAX 
TEMPERATURES FRIDAY AND SATURDAY IN THE UPPER 70S LONG RANGE MODELS 
SUGGEST A SHORTWAVE AND ASSOCIATED COLD FRONT WILL SWING ACROSS THE 
CENTRAL U.S. SATURDAY AND PRODUCE A CHANCE OF SHOWERS AND 
THUNDERSTORMS SATURDAY NIGHT. A COOL DOWN WILL BE IN STORE AFTER 
SATURDAY WITH DAYTIME TEMPERATURES RETURNING TO THE UPPER 60S.

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.

&&

$$

NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
907 AM CST MON OCT 31 2005

.DISCUSSION...
NUMEROUS SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS HAVE FORMED OVER EASTERN 
OKLAHOMA...NORTHWESTERN ARKANSAS AND SOUTHWESTERN MISSOURI THIS 
MORNING. THIS IS IN ASSOCIATION WITH A STRONG SHORTWAVE DROPPING 
INTO THE OKLAHOMA PANHANDLE. THE DEEPENING TROUGH WILL SLOW THE 
EASTWARD PROGRESSION OF THE STORMS TO THE WEST OF THE FORECAST AREA 
SINCE THE FLOW IS MORE PARALLEL TO THE CONVECTION. HAVE TRENDED 
RAINFALL TO BEGIN MAINLY THIS AFTERNOON OVER NORTHEAST ARKANSAS AND 
LATE THIS AFTERNOON JUST EAST OF THE MS RIVER. STILL LOOKS LIKE BEST 
CHANCES WILL BE OVERNIGHT FOR MOST AREAS.

TEMPERATURES FOR THE REMAINDER OF THE DAY LOOK GOOD. TWEAKED CLOUD 
COVER AND MORNING WORDING. UPDATED ZONES OUT SHORTLY.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
310 AM CST MON OCT 31 2005

.DISCUSSION...

SHARPENING UPPER TROUGH AND ITS SURFACE FRONT IS NOW OVER THE
PLAINS STATES. LIGHT SHOWERS HAVE DEVELOPED OVER NORTHWESTERN
PARTS OF THE MIDSOUTH AS A RESULT. THIS TROUGH WILL MOVE EAST
TODAY AND INCREASE SHOWER COVERAGE IN NORTHWESTERN COUNTIES OF
OUR AREA. THEN...AN UPPER LEVEL CUTOFF LOW WILL DEVELOP IN
ARKANSAS BY MIDNIGHT AND MOVE SOUTHEAST. A SURFACE LOW WILL MOVE
INTO MISSISSIPPI BY TUESDAY MORNING. AS THE LOW MOVES THROUGH
THIS EVENING...RAIN CHANCES WILL INCREASE ALONG WITH RAIN AMTS.
AS THE UPPER LOW AND MOVES SOUTHEAST TUESDAY...PCP WILL SLIDE TO
THE SOUTHEAST WITH IT. TEMPS WILL BE A LITTLE COOLER TUE AND TUE
NIGHT.

FXUS64 KMEG 302023
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
222 PM CST SUN OCT 30 2005

.DISCUSSION...
A SHORTWAVE TROUGH WAS MOVING ACROSS NORTH-CENTRAL ARKANSAS THIS 
AFTERNOON AND HAS PRODUCED SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS OVER NORTHERN 
ARKANSAS AND SOUTHERN MISSOURI. MAINLY HIGH LEVEL CLOUDINESS HAS 
MOVED INTO THE FORECAST AREA IN ASSOCIATION WITH THIS SHORTWAVE. 

LATEST MODEL SOLUTIONS DIVERGE WITH UPCOMING RAIN EVENT FOR MONDAY 
INTO TUESDAY. THE NAM/UKMET ARE SIMILAR IN DRIVING THE APPROACHING 
SHORTWAVE WHICH IS CURRENTLY OVER COLORADO...SOUTH OF THE FORECAST 
AREA. NOT ONLY SOUTH OF THE AREA BUT MUCH SLOWER MOVING THAN THE 
GFS. SHOULD THE NAM/UKMET VERIFY...THEN RAIN WILL LIKELY MOVE SOUTH 
OF THE FORECAST AREA LATE MONDAY NIGHT...LEAVING TUESDAY DRY. 
HOWEVER...THE TRACK OF THE GFS SHORTWAVE WILL KEEP MOST OF TUESDAY 
WET...ESPECIALLY OVER NORTHEAST MISSISSIPPI.

WITH SUCH VARIABILITY IN THE SOLUTIONS...HAVE A TOUGH TIME ARGUING 
WITH GUIDANCE NUMBERS THIS FORECAST CYCLE. CAN SAY WITH SOME 
CERTAINTY THAT IT WILL RAIN OVER NORTHEAST ARKANSAS MONDAY 
NIGHT...AND POSSIBLY OVER MOST LOCATIONS. HOWEVER...CURRENT FORECAST 
WILL KEEP THE RAIN THROUGH TUESDAY...WHICH IS AN OPTIMISTIC 
FORECAST. 

WE WILL HAVE TO KEEP EYES ON A HOPEFUL MODEL CONVERGENCE OVER THE 
NEXT SEVERAL HOURS.

THE REMAINDER OF THE FORECAST WILL BE DRY AND FAIRLY MILD AS NEARLY 
ZONAL FLOW OVERTAKES THE CENTRAL U.S. TEMPERATURES WILL BE ABOVE 
SEASONAL NORMALS WEDNESDAY THROUGH AT LEAST...NEXT SUNDAY.

FXUS64 KMEG 300806
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
200 AM CST SUN OCT 30 2005

.DISCUSSION...

EXCELLENT FALL WEATHER WILL CONTINUE OVER THE MIDSOUTH TODAY AS
LOTS OF SUNSHINE WARMS IT RAPIDLY BACK UP AND WINDS GET BACK TO
THE SOUTH. THIS WEATHER IS DUE TO NEARLY ZONAL FLOW ALOFT AND A
SURFACE HIGH OVER THE SOUTHEASTERN ATLANTIC COAST.

AN UPPER TROUGH WILL DEVELOP OVER THE PLAINS BY MONDAY MORNING
AND CREATE A LOW OVER THE STATE OF OKLAHOMA. THIS LOW AND ITS
FRONT WILL CARRY MOISTURE AND LIFT WITH IT. SHOWERS AND
THUNDERSTORMS COULD DEVELOP WEST OF THE MISSISSIPPI RIVER BY NOON
MONDAY AND TWO COUNTIES FARTHER EAST BY EVENING MONDAY. SHOWERS
WILL CONTINUE OVERNIGHT MONDAY.

THE LOW WILL MOVE INTO MISSISSIPPI BY TUESDAY MORNING AND
CONTINUE THE CHANCE FOR SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS DURING THE DAY
TUESDAY.

AFTER THAT...THE SURFACE LOW GOES DOWN TOWARD BILOXI MS AND RAIN
WILL DIMINISH IN OUR AREA FROM THE NORTH TUESDAY EVENING.

WEDNESDAY THROUGH SATURDAY...IT SHOULD BE DRY. TEMPERATURES WILL
RANGE FROM THE 70S FOR HIGHS TO THE 40S AND 50S FOR LOWS.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
925 PM CDT SAT OCT 29 2005

.DISCUSSION...SURFACE ANALYSIS PLACES CENTER OF HIGH PRESSURE ACROSS 
EASTERN TENNESSEE/KENTUCKY. INFRARED SATELLITE IMAGERY SHOWS CLEAR 
SKIES ACROSS THE MID SOUTH THIS EVENING WITH TEMPERATURES IN THE 
UPPER 40S TO LOWER 50S. 00Z RAOB FROM KLZK SHOWED A SUBSTANTIAL 
AMOUNT OF DRY AIR PRESENT ACROSS THE LOWER MISSISSIPPI VALLEY AND 
EXPECTING CLEAR SKIES OVERNIGHT WITH DECOUPLED WINDS. WILL BE MAKING 
ADJUSTMENTS TO LOWS OVERNIGHT WITH CURRENT DEWPOINTS IN LOWER TO 
MIDDLE 30S. WILL ALSO MENTION SOME FROST FOR AREAS AT OR BELOW 36 
DEGREES OVERNIGHT.

UPDATED GRIDS WILL BE PUBLISHED SHORTLY.

CJC


.PREV DISCUSSION...ISSUED 248 PM CDT SAT OCT 29 2005

SKIES REMAIN CLEAR OVER THE REGION THIS AFTERNOON WHICH HAS ALLOWED
TEMPERATURES TO WARM UP INTO THE 60S. SURFACE HIGH IS MOVING OFF TO
EAST AND THAT SHOULD ALLOW LIGHT SOUTH WINDS TO BLOW OVERNIGHT WHICH
SHOULD HELP KEEP TEMPERATURES UP A LITTLE COMPARED TO THE LAST COUPLE
OF NIGHTS SO NO FROST ADVISORY FOR TONIGHT. COULD STILL SEE SOME
PATCHY FROST TONIGHT SO WILL MENTION IN ZONES. COLD FRONT CURRENTLY
ACROSS NORTHWEST KANSAS AND CENTRAL NEBRASKA WILL MOVE SLOWLY EAST
OVER THE NEXT COUPLE OF DAYS. FRONT WILL BE TOO FAR AWAY ON SUNDAY
SO SUNNY SKIES SHOULD BE FOUND ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA. SOUTH WINDS
SHOULD HELP BRING WARMER AIR INTO THE REGION SO MOST LOCATIONS SHOULD
SEE TEMPERATURES ABOVE 70. CLOUDS SHOULD BEGIN TO MOVE INTO THE
FORECAST AREA BY SUNDAY NIGHT AND WILL GRADUALLY INCREASE MONDAY.
WITH FRONT APPROACHING MONDAY EXPECT SOME SCATTERED SHOWERS TO MOVE
INTO THE FORECAST AREA. BY MONDAY NIGHT...SCATTERED THUNDERSTORMS
WILL BE FOUND ACROSS MUCH OF THE FORECAST AREA. COLD FRONT SHOULD BE
MOVING OUT OF THE REGION TUESDAY BUT SCATTERED SHOWERS WILL STILL BE
POSSIBLE. HIGH WILL BUILD IN BY LATE TUESDAY NIGHT AND THAT WILL
PROVIDE ANOTHER DRY PERIOD FOR MUCH OF NEXT WEEK.

&&

AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
341 PM CDT FRI OCT 28 2005

.DISCUSSION...LATEST SURFACE ANALYSIS PLACES HIGH PRESSURE ACROSS 
THE MISSISSIPPI VALLEY. TEMPERATURES THIS AFTERNOON HAVE WARMED 
INTO THE LOWER TO MIDDLE 60S ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA. 

TONIGHT...GOOD POTENTIAL FOR FROST TONIGHT WITH VISIBLE SATELLITE 
SHOWS SUNNY SKIES ACROSS THE MID SOUTH THIS AFTERNOON. WINDS WILL 
DECOUPLE AGAIN WITH LOWS DROPPING INTO THE LOWER TO MIDDLE 30S 
OVERNIGHT. AS A RESULT...WILL BE ISSUING A FROST ADVISORY FOR THE 
ENTIRE AREA THROUGH 12Z.

SATURDAY AND SUNDAY...PRECIPITATION FREE WEATHER WILL CONTINUE 
ACROSS THE AREA WITH SURFACE AND UPPER LEVEL RIDGING IN PLACE. 850 
MB TEMPERATURES AROUND 9-10C WILL PRODUCE HIGHS IN THE UPPER 60S TO 
LOWER 70S. 

MONDAY...NAM/GFS BOTH ADVERTISING A COLD FRONT AFFECTING THE LOWER 
MISSISSIPPI VALLEY MONDAY NIGHT INTO TUESDAY. MODEL SOUNDINGS 
SUGGEST ANY CONVECTION THAT DEVELOPS WILL FALL INTO THE DRY LOW 
LEVELS OF THE ATMOSPHERE. IN ADDITION...BETTER FORCING WILL BE 
LOCATED UPSTREAM ACROSS THE MIDDLE MISSISSIPPI VALLEY. MADE SOME 
MODIFICATIONS TO POPS FOR THIS EVENT AS BEST CHANCES /30 POPS/WILL 
REMAIN MAINLY WEST OF THE MISSISSIPPI RIVER...AND SLIGHT CHANCES 
EAST.

LONG RANGE/TUESDAY THROUGH FRIDAY/...00Z GFS/EUROPEAN/CANADIAN RUNS 
SHOW COLD FRONT ALONG THE EAST COAST OF THE UNITED STATES BY MID DAY 
TUESDAY. HIGH PRESSURE WILL BUILD IN ACROSS THE REGION THROUGH 
THURSDAY. LONG RANGE MODELS INDICATE ANOTHER COLD FRONT COMING 
THROUGH THE LOWER MISSISSIPPI VALLEY BY SATURDAY. HOWEVER...WILL NOT 
MENTION MENTION PRECIPITATION WITH LOW PROBABILITIES AT THIS TIME.
&&

.PREV DISCUSSION... (ISSUED 902 PM CDT THU OCT 27 2005) 

UPDATE...

HIGH PRESSURE STRETCHES FROM THE GREAT LAKES SOUTH INTO THE DELTA
REGION THIS EVENING. CLOUDS CONT TO DISSIPATE ACRS THE REGION
LEAVING BEHIND CLEAR SKIES. WINDS ARE DIMINISHING AND TEMPS ONCE
AGAIN ARE FALLING QUITE RAPIDLY. HAVE CUT 1-3 DEGREES FROM
FORECAST LOWS AND ADJUSTED SFC WINDS. PATCHY FROST WL MAINLY BE
ACRS PARTS OF W TN AND EXTREME NE MS THOUGH OTHER ISOLD SPOTS
COULD SEE SOME FROST.

PREV DISCUSSION... (ISSUED 239 PM CDT THU OCT 27 2005) 

DISCUSSION...
SKIES ARE MOSTLY CLOUDY THIS AFTERNOON ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA AS
AFTERNOON CUMULUS CLOUDS FORMED AFTER CLOUD COVER FROM THIS MORNING
WENT AWAY. THESE CLOUDS SHOULD ALSO GRADUALLY DIE OUT THIS EVENING
LEAVING MOSTLY CLEAR SKIES OVERNIGHT. TEMPERATURES EARLY FRIDAY AND
SATURDAY MORNING SHOULD BE FAIRLY CLOSE TO WHAT THEY WERE THIS
MORNING IF NOT A DEGREE OR TWO WARMER. THIS SHOULD MEAN FEWER AREAS
WILL SEE ANY FROST SO HAVE REDUCED THE AREA THAT SHOULD ENCOUNTER
PATCHY FROST. HIGH PRESSURE WILL REMAIN IN CONTROL FOR ANOTHER FEW
MORE DAYS SO DRY WEATHER WILL CONTINUE THROUGH MONDAY. THE HIGH WILL
MOVE FAR ENOUGH EAST BY SATURDAY THAT WE SHOULD SEE A RETURN TO SOUTH
WINDS AND A SLOW WARMUP OVER THE WEEKEND. COLD FRONT WILL APPROACH
THE REGION BY MONDAY NIGHT SO HAVE KEPT MENTION OF RAIN IN THE
FORECAST FOR MONDAY...MONDAY NIGHT AND TUESDAY. AS THE FRONT
APPROACHES...THERE SHOULD A BETTER CHANCE FOR THUNDERSTORMS SO HAVE
CHANGED WORDING FROM SHOWERS TO THUNDERSTORMS FOR MONDAY NIGHT AND
TUESDAY. HIGH PRESSURE RETURNS TO THE REGION BY TUESDAY NIGHT AND DRY
WEATHER RETURNS FOR WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY.

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.
&&

$$

SJM









FXUS64 KMEG 280202
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
902 PM CDT THU OCT 27 2005

.UPDATE...

HIGH PRESSURE STRETCHES FROM THE GREAT LAKES SOUTH INTO THE DELTA
REGION THIS EVENING. CLOUDS CONT TO DISSIPATE ACRS THE REGION
LEAVING BEHIND CLEAR SKIES. WINDS ARE DIMINISHING AND TEMPS ONCE
AGAIN ARE FALLING QUITE RAPIDLY. HAVE CUT 1-3 DEGREES FROM
FORECAST LOWS AND ADJUSTED SFC WINDS. PATCHY FROST WL MAINLY BE
ACRS PARTS OF W TN AND EXTREME NE MS THOUGH OTHER ISOLD SPOTS
COULD SEE SOME FROST.

&&

.PREV DISCUSSION... (ISSUED 239 PM CDT THU OCT 27 2005) 

DISCUSSION...
SKIES ARE MOSTLY CLOUDY THIS AFTERNOON ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA AS
AFTERNOON CUMULUS CLOUDS FORMED AFTER CLOUD COVER FROM THIS MORNING
WENT AWAY. THESE CLOUDS SHOULD ALSO GRADUALLY DIE OUT THIS EVENING
LEAVING MOSTLY CLEAR SKIES OVERNIGHT. TEMPERATURES EARLY FRIDAY AND
SATURDAY MORNING SHOULD BE FAIRLY CLOSE TO WHAT THEY WERE THIS
MORNING IF NOT A DEGREE OR TWO WARMER. THIS SHOULD MEAN FEWER AREAS
WILL SEE ANY FROST SO HAVE REDUCED THE AREA THAT SHOULD ENCOUNTER
PATCHY FROST. HIGH PRESSURE WILL REMAIN IN CONTROL FOR ANOTHER FEW
MORE DAYS SO DRY WEATHER WILL CONTINUE THROUGH MONDAY. THE HIGH WILL
MOVE FAR ENOUGH EAST BY SATURDAY THAT WE SHOULD SEE A RETURN TO SOUTH
WINDS AND A SLOW WARMUP OVER THE WEEKEND. COLD FRONT WILL APPROACH
THE REGION BY MONDAY NIGHT SO HAVE KEPT MENTION OF RAIN IN THE
FORECAST FOR MONDAY...MONDAY NIGHT AND TUESDAY. AS THE FRONT
APPROACHES...THERE SHOULD A BETTER CHANCE FOR THUNDERSTORMS SO HAVE
CHANGED WORDING FROM SHOWERS TO THUNDERSTORMS FOR MONDAY NIGHT AND
TUESDAY. HIGH PRESSURE RETURNS TO THE REGION BY TUESDAY NIGHT AND DRY
WEATHER RETURNS FOR WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY.

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 270938
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
438 AM CDT THU OCT 27 2005

.UPDATE...

SATELLITE SHOWS AREA OF STRATUS OVER WEST TN AND EAST AR HAVE
INCREASED DRAMATICALLY. AS A RESULT OF THE CLOUD
COVER...TEMPERATURES HAVE RISEN INTO THE LOW 40S IN MANY AREAS.
WHAT FROST HAD DEVELOPED IS NOW LIKELY MELTING OR HAS MELTED.
THEREFORE HAVE UPDATED TO CANCEL FROST ADVISORY FOR WEST
TN...NORTHEAST AR...BOOTHEEL AND EXTREME NORTHERN MS.

&&

.PREV DISCUSSION... (ISSUED 301 AM CDT THU OCT 27 2005) 

DISCUSSION...

SATELLITE SHOWS A DECK OF BROKEN TO OVERCAST CLOUDS AT AROUND
6000FT ADVANCING INTO WEST TN AND EAST AR AHEAD OF A SHORTWAVE
TROUGH FROM THE NORTH. BEHIND THE LEADING EDGE OF THE TROUGH MORE
CLOUDS ARE GATHERING OVER EAST CENTRAL MISSOURI. NAM AND GFS BOTH
SHOW DEW POINT DEPRESSIONS <2C AT 850-825MB ASSOCIATED WITH THESE
CLOUDS. 06Z NAM MODEL SOUNDINGS SEEM TO HAVE A GOOD HANDLE ON
CLOUD COVER TODAY. THIS SHOWS THE CLOUD DECK HOLDING STRONG AT
JACKSON AND MEMPHIS. THE SOUNDING SHOWS CLOUDS AT 12Z AT
JONESBORO...BREAKING UP FOR A TIME THIS MORNING BEFORE CLOUDING
BACK OVER LATE IN THE MORNING AS THE MOISTURE ACROSS EAST CENTRAL
MISSOURI COMBINED WITH DIURNAL HEATING AID CLOUD DEVELOPMENT. THE
MODELS SHOW THE PRIME MOISTURE AXIS ACROSS MOST OF THE REGION WITH
THE SOUTHERN EDGE AROUND THE TUPELO TO CLARKSDALE AREA. BEST GUESS
IS FOR A MOSTLY CLOUDY FORECAST FOR ALL AREAS NORTH OF TUPELO AND
CLARKSDALE...PARTLY CLOUDY SOUTH OF THOSE AREAS. MOST AREAS HAVE
SEEN TEMPS DROP DOWN INTO THE MID 30S BEFORE THE CLOUDS ROLLED IN.
SO FROST LIKELY HAS FORMED IN THESE AREAS. TEMPS HAVE WARMED BACK
UP A COUPLE DEGREES UNDER THE CLOUD COVER SO NOT SURE IF FROST
STILL EXISTS THERE OR NOT. WILL CONTINUE THE FROST ADVISORY FOR
NOW. COOLED TEMPS A FEW DEGREES BELOW GUIDANCE OVER WEST TN INTO
NORTHEAST AR DUE TO CLOUD COVER FOR TODAY. 

MODELS SHOWING CLOUD COVER QUICKLY DISSIPATING THIS EVENING WITH
THE LOSS OF THE DIURNAL INSTABILITY AND THE SHORTWAVE MOVING SOUTH
OF THE AREA. SOUNDINGS SUPPORT SKIES CLEARING. WILL MENTION PATCHY
FROST AFTER MIDNIGHT SINCE DEW POINTS ARE EXPECTED TO REMAIN IN
THE LOW TO MID 30S DURING THE OVERNIGHT HOURS. 850MB TEMPS WILL
CONTINUE TO WARM AND 1000MB GEOSTROPHIC WINDS OF AROUND 10-15KTS
INDICATE THAT THERE MAY BE JUST ENOUGH WIND TO KEEP THE SURFACE
LAYER STIRRED. 

UPPER RIDGE CURRENTLY OVER THE PLAINS BUILDS OVER THE AREA ON
FRIDAY AND INTO THE WEEKEND. THIS SHOULD ALLOW FOR MAINLY CLEAR
SKIES AND A GRADUAL WARMING TREND WITH HIGHS POSSIBLY REACHING 70
ON SATURDAY. THE THREAT FOR FROST WILL PERSIST UNTIL SATURDAY
MORNING DUE TO LOW DEW POINTS AND LIGHT WINDS AT NIGHT. THIS WILL
BE ESPECIALLY TRUE FOR THE COLD SPOTS ACROSS WEST TN AND NORTHEAST
MS. 

THE NEXT THREAT FOR RAIN COMES EARLY NEXT WEEK AS GFS CONTINUE TO
SHOW THE UPPER RIDGE SLIDING OFF TO THE EAST AND ALLOWING A
SHORTWAVE TROUGH TO MOVE INTO THE REGION ON MONDAY AND THROUGH THE
REGION MONDAY NIGHT OR EARLY TUESDAY. INSTABILITY DOES NOT LOOK
STRONG ENOUGH TO MENTION THUNDER AT THIS TIME. 

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...FROST ADVISORY UNTIL 9 AM CDT THIS MORNING FOR LEE(AR)-PHILLIPS.

MO...NONE.
MS...FROST ADVISORY UNTIL 9 AM CDT THIS MORNING FOR CALHOUN-CHICKASAW-
     COAHOMA-ITAWAMBA-LAFAYETTE-LEE(MS)-MONROE-PANOLA-PONTOTOC-
     QUITMAN-TALLAHATCHIE-TUNICA-UNION-YALOBUSHA.

TN...NONE.
&&

FXUS64 KMEG 270219
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
919 PM CDT WED OCT 26 2005

.UPDATE...

CLEAR SKIES AND LIGHT WINDS PREVAIL ACROSS THE MID SOUTH THIS
EVENING. SFC TEMPS FALLING RAPIDLY ONCE AGAIN. 02Z TEMPS AND
DEWPOINTS RUNNING A LITTLE WARMER THAN LAST NIGHT AND LOW TEMP
FORECAST LOOKS GOOD. FROST ADVISORY CONTINUES FROM MIDNIGHT
THROUGH 9 AM THU. WATCHING AN AREA OF MID CLOUDS MOVING SOUTH
ACROSS MISSOURI ASSOCD WITH A PRETTY DECENT 500 MB SHORTWAVE.
EXTRAPOLATION BRINGS SOME OF THESE CLOUDS INTO NORTHERNMOST AREAS
LATE TONIGHT. FORECAST ON TRACK WITH NO CHANGES ATTM.

&&

.PREV DISCUSSION... (ISSUED 204 PM CDT WED OCT 26 2005) 

DISCUSSION...
SURFACE HIGH PRETTY MUCH CENTERED ON MISSISSIPPI RIVER THIS
AFTERNOON. CUMULUS FIELD MUCH LESS EXTENSIVE THAN LAST FEW DAYS.
TEMPS AT 18Z MIDDLE 50S TO LOWER 60S...AND EXPECT A COUPLE DEGREES
TO GO YET FOR HIGHS.

SHORT TERM (THROUGH SATURDAY)...
SURFACE HIGH TO REMAIN OVER EASTERN U.S. THROUGH SATURDAY. SHORTWAVE
MOVING SOUTH FROM GREAT LAKES TONIGHT...BUT MOST MID-LEVEL
CLOUDINESS SHOULD REMAIN NORTH OF THE CWA. AFTER THAT...NOT A
GREAT DEAL OF TROUBLE WITH CLOUDS AND WEATHER THROUGH SATURDAY.

TEMPERATURE FORECAST FOR TONIGHT A BIT OF A PROBLEM. ALL MOS
GUIDANCE DEWPOINTS RUNNING ABOUT 5 DEGREES WARMER THAN REALITY.
CURRENT DEWPOINTS IN A SIMILAR RANGE TO THOSE YESTERDAY...AND SEE
NO LOW LEVEL MOISTURE ADVECTION OCCURRING. AS LONG AS CLOUD
FORECAST COOPERATES...EXPECT MINS WITHIN A DEGREE OR TWO OF THIS
MORNING. THIS IS AT LEAST 2 CATEGORIES COOLER THAN GUIDANCE IN
MOST AREAS.

OF COURSE...THAT MEANS MORE FROST TOMORROW MORNING. WHILE ISOLATED
AREAS WILL FALL BELOW FREEZING AGAIN FOR SEVERAL HOURS...CONFIDENCE
IN WIDESPREAD SUB-FREEZING TEMPERATURES NOT HIGH ENOUGH FOR A
FREEZE WARNING...SO WILL GO FROST ADVISORY ENTIRE CWA. END OF
GROWING SEASON LOCALLY DEFINED AS MINS OF 28 OR COLDER...AND THERE
WERE ONLY ISOLATED REPORTS THAT LOW THIS MORNING...SO NEED
SOMETHING OUT THERE.

TEMPERATURES THURSDAY AND FRIDAY A LITTLE WARMER THAN TODAY BY A
DEGREE OR TWO. SLIGHT MODERATION IN MINS FOR FRIDAY MORNING AS
WELL. AS RETURN FLOW GETS GOING...TEMPS SATURDAY WARM TO A LITTLE
ABOVE NORMAL.

LONG TERM (SUNDAY AND BEYOND)...
RIDGE BEGINS TO MOVE EAST ON SUNDAY...AND CURRENT FORECAST LOOKS
REASONABLE. BEYOND THAT...LITTLE TRUST GIVEN IN 12Z RUN OF GFS
SOLUTION. THAT MODEL TRIES TO CLOSE OFF AN UPPER LOW OVER SOUTHERN
MS/AL ON TUESDAY. THIS SOLUTION WOULD BRING A VERY WET PERIOD
MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY. ECMWF/CANADIAN/NOGAPS MUCH MORE
PROGRESSIVE WITH SYSTEM...WHICH WOULD MEAN DRIER WEATHER. GFS
SOLUTION DISCOUNTED FOR THIS RUN BEYOND SUNDAY...AT LEAST UNTIL
SOME MORE RUN TO RUN CONTINUITY OCCURS. WILL KEEP LOW POPS IN
FORECAST FOR MONDAY AND TUESDAY...DRY WEDNESDAY...WHICH IS IN STEP
WITH SURROUNDING OFFICES. TEMPS IN EXTENDED SHOULD BE SLIGHTLY
ABOVE NORMAL.

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...FROST ADVISORY UNTIL 9 AM CDT THURSDAY FOR CLAY-CRAIGHEAD-
     CRITTENDEN-CROSS-GREENE-LAWRENCE-LEE(AR)-MISSISSIPPI-
     PHILLIPS-POINSETT-RANDOLPH-ST. FRANCIS.

MO...FROST ADVISORY UNTIL 9 AM CDT THURSDAY FOR DUNKLIN-PEMISCOT.

MS...FROST ADVISORY UNTIL 9 AM CDT THURSDAY FOR ALCORN-BENTON(MS)-
     CALHOUN-CHICKASAW-COAHOMA-DESOTO-ITAWAMBA-LAFAYETTE-LEE(MS)-
     MARSHALL-MONROE-PANOLA-PONTOTOC-PRENTISS-QUITMAN-
     TALLAHATCHIE-TATE-TIPPAH-TISHOMINGO-TUNICA-UNION-YALOBUSHA.

TN...FROST ADVISORY UNTIL 9 AM CDT THURSDAY FOR CARROLL-CHESTER-
     CROCKETT-DECATUR-DYER-FAYETTE-GIBSON-HARDEMAN-HARDIN-
     HAYWOOD-HENDERSON-HENRY-LAKE-LAUDERDALE-MADISON-MCNAIRY-
     OBION-SHELBY-TIPTON-WEAKLEY.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
900 AM CDT WED OCT 26 2005

.UPDATE...
QUICK UPDATE FOR END OF FREEZE WARNING. GRIDS ADJUSTED TO FIT
EARLY MORNING TRENDS. NO SIGNIFICANT CHANGES TO FORECAST.

&&

.PREV DISCUSSION... (ISSUED 305 AM CDT WED OCT 26 2005) 

DISCUSSION...

COLDEST MORNING OF THE SEASON SO FAR WITH HIGH PRESSURE PROVIDING
CALM WINDS ACROSS THE REGION. CLEAR SKIES ALLOWING FOR EXCELLENT
RADIATIONAL COOLING. DEW POINTS ARE IN THE LOWER 30S ALLOWING
TEMPS TO REACH THE FREEZING POINT IN SEVERAL LOCATIONS OUTSIDE OF
THE SHELBY COUNTY 240 LOOP. FREEZE WARNING WILL BE ALLOWED TO
CONTINUE TILL 9 AM THIS MORNING.

NAM CONTINUES TO SHOW 850 DEW POINT DEPRESSIONS LESS THAN 2C WITH
RH GREATER THAN 85 PERCENT OVER WEST TN AND NORTHEAST MS THIS
AFTERNOON. NAM SOUNDINGS SHOW THIS TO BE A VERY THIN MOIST LAYER
AND GFS/NAM CU RULE POINT TO SCATTERED TO BROKEN CONDITIONS THERE
THIS AFTERNOON. WILL GO WITH PARTLY CLOUDY THIS AFTERNOON ALTHOUGH
THERE MAY BE NEED FOR AN EARLY AFTERNOON UPDATE IF THE COVERAGE
BECOMES MORE EXTENSIVE THAN CURRENT THINKING. THE UPPER TROUGH
OVER THE EASTERN U.S. IS BEGINNING TO GIVE WAY TO AN UPPER RIDGE
OVER THE WESTERN U.S. AS A RESULT TEMPERATURES WILL GRADUALLY WARM
UP OVER THE NEXT FEW DAYS. 

HIGH PRESSURE WILL REMAIN IN CONTROL ONCE AGAIN TONIGHT. SO WINDS
ARE EXPECTED TO GO LIGHT OR CALM. THE UPPER LEVEL SHORTWAVE WILL
BE OVER THE AREA SO AM A LITTLE CONCERNED ABOUT CLOUDS. ADDITIONAL
SOME WARMING WILL BE OCCURRING AT 850MB. NO SIGNIFICANT DEW POINT
RISE IS ANTICIPATED TODAY AND RADIATIONAL CONDITIONS SHOULD BE
SUFFICIENT FOR AT LEAST PATCHY AREAS OF FROST. WOULD NOT BE
SHOCKED IF A SECOND FROST OR EVEN FREEZE ADVISORY OR WARNING WOULD
BE NEEDED FOR TONIGHT. BUT DUE TO THE UNCERTAINTY OF THE UPPER
SHORTWAVE FEEL THAT IT IS BEST FOR DAY SHIFT TO REEVALUATE. 

UPPER RIDGE WILL PROVIDE DRY WEATHER AND MAINLY SUNNY CONDITIONS
INTO THE WEEKEND. GFS/EUROPEAN CONTINUE TO SHOW THE UPPER RIDGE
MOVING EAST OF THE REGION AND GIVING WAY TO AN UPPER SHORTWAVE
TROUGH WHICH WILL PROVIDE THE NEXT CHANCE FOR RAIN. THERE IS QUITE
A BIT OF UNCERTAINTY IN TIMING WITH GFS DELAYING THE ARRIVAL NOW
TILL TUESDAY. FORECAST WILL BROAD BRUSH EARLY NEXT WEEK WITH
SLIGHT CHANCES UNTIL MODELS COME INTO BETTER AGREEMENT.

MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.

MO...NONE.

MS...NONE.

TN...NONE.

$$


&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.
&&

WAGNER/VALLE

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...CORRECTED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
900 AM CDT WED OCT 26 2005

.UPDATE...
QUICK UPDATE FOR END OF FREEZE WARNING. GRIDS ADJUSTED TO FIT
EARLY MORNING TRENDS. NO SIGNIFICANT CHANGES TO FORECAST.

&&

.PREV DISCUSSION... (ISSUED 305 AM CDT WED OCT 26 2005) 

DISCUSSION...

COLDEST MORNING OF THE SEASON SO FAR WITH HIGH PRESSURE PROVIDING
CALM WINDS ACROSS THE REGION. CLEAR SKIES ALLOWING FOR EXCELLENT
RADIATIONAL COOLING. DEW POINTS ARE IN THE LOWER 30S ALLOWING
TEMPS TO REACH THE FREEZING POINT IN SEVERAL LOCATIONS OUTSIDE OF
THE SHELBY COUNTY 240 LOOP. FREEZE WARNING WILL BE ALLOWED TO
CONTINUE TILL 9 AM THIS MORNING.

NAM CONTINUES TO SHOW 850 DEW POINT DEPRESSIONS LESS THAN 2C WITH
RH GREATER THAN 85 PERCENT OVER WEST TN AND NORTHEAST MS THIS
AFTERNOON. NAM SOUNDINGS SHOW THIS TO BE A VERY THIN MOIST LAYER



000 
FXUS64 KMEG 260440
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
1140 PM CDT TUE OCT 25 2005

.UPDATE...

TEMPS FALLING RAPIDLY UNDER CLEAR SKIES AND CALM WINDS. SAVANNAH
AND MIDDLETON (HARDEMAN COUNTY) ALREADY AT 33 DEGREES WITH PLENTY
OF STATIONS IN THE MID 30S. WL GO AHEAD AND UPGRADE TO A FREEZE
WARNING FOR THE ENTIRE AREA THROUGH 9 AM.

&&

.PREV DISCUSSION... (ISSUED 933 PM CDT TUE OCT 25 2005) 

UPDATE...

CLOUDS CONT TO DISSIPATE WHILE SFC WINDS HAVE GONE CALM ACROSS MUCH
OF THE REGION THIS EVENING. AT 02Z TEMPS MAINLY IN THE LOWER 40S
WITH ISOLATED SPOTS ALREADY IN THE UPPER 30S. DEWPOINTS GENERALLY
WERE IN THE MID 30S SETTING THE STAGE FOR EXTENSIVE FROST
DEVELOPMENT LATER TONIGHT. MADE SOME MINOR TEMPS ADJUSTMENTS TO
BRING MIN TEMPS DOWN TO 33 DEGREES EVERYWHERE EXCEPT THE MEMPHIS
URBAN HEAT ISLAND. ALSO WENT WITH WIDESPREAD FROST WORDING.
SOME ISOLATED...WELL PROTECTED AREAS WL PROBABLY REACH THE
FREEZING MARK BY MORNING.

PREV DISCUSSION... (ISSUED 244 PM CDT TUE OCT 25 2005) 

DISCUSSION...
CUMULUS FIELD IS NOT QUITE AS EXTENSIVE AS YESTERDAY...BUT STILL
ENOUGH TO KEEP TEMPERATURES DOWN A LITTLE BIT. HIGH PRESSURE
CENTERED NEAR KANSAS CITY...AND WILL MOVE EAST AS NEW ENGLAND
SYSTEM EVENTUALLY MOVES OUT LATER IN THE WEEK. AFTERNOON TEMPERATURES
GENERALLY IN THE MID 50S WITH DEWPOINTS 30 TO 35. NORTH WINDS
STILL AT 10 TO 15 MPH. 

SHORT TERM (THROUGH FRIDAY)... 
AS HAS BEEN THE CASE THE LAST COUPLE OF NIGHTS...COLD AIR CLOUDS
SHOULD DISSIPATE BETWEEN 6 PM AND 9 PM.

DEWPOINTS RUNNING A COUPLE OF DEGREES LOWER THAN YESTERDAY AFTERNOON.
WITH CLEARING SKIES...AND WINDS DECOUPLING...RADIATIONAL COOLING
IS A GIVEN. EXPECT OVERNIGHT LOWS TO RUN A COUPLE OF DEGREES
COLDER TOMORROW MORNING THAN THIS MORNING. WHILE ISOLATED SPOTS
WILL LIKELY FALL BELOW FREEZING...MOST AREAS SHOULD STAY JUST
ABOVE FREEZING. WIDESPREAD FROST IS EXPECTED...SO WILL CONTINUE
THE ADVISORY AREAWIDE. 

AIRMASS DRIES OUT SOME MORE TOMORROW...AND LOW LEVEL TEMPERATURES
INCREASE ABOUT 3C. WITH LESS CLOUD COVER...EXPECT HIGHS 5-8
DEGREES WARMER THAN TODAY. ABOUT A CATEGORY WARMER ON LOWS
TOMORROW NIGHT AND THURSDAY. THURSDAY NIGHT AND FRIDAY NOT MUCH
DIFFERENT FROM THURSDAY.

LONG TERM (AFTER FRIDAY)...
UPPER LEVEL LOW FINALLY LOSES ITS GRIP ON NEW ENGLAND OVER THE
WEEKEND...ALLOWING AN UPPER RIDGE TO MOVE ACROSS THE MIDSOUTH. A
SURFACE HIGH WILL MOVE INTO THE APPALACHIANS SATURDAY...KEEPING
THE WEATHER DRY INTO MONDAY. SATURDAY AND SUNDAY WILL SEE
TEMPERATURES NEAR OR SLIGHTLY ABOVE NORMAL. 

AS ENERGY DROPS INTO THE MISSISSIPPI VALLEY EARLY NEXT WEEK...A
COLD FRONT WILL MOVE THROUGH THE AREA ABOUT MONDAY. AT
PRESENT...MOISTURE IS FORECAST TO BE RATHER SPARSE WITH THIS
FRONT. WILL CONTINUE THE SLIGHT POPS FOR MONDAY AND MONDAY
EVENING. CONDITIONS SHOULD DRY OUT ON TUESDAY. TEMPERATURES MONDAY
AND TUESDAY WILL FALL BACK TO SLIGHTLY BELOW NORMAL LEVELS.

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...FREEZE WARNING UNTIL 9 AM CDT WEDNESDAY FOR CLAY-CRAIGHEAD-
     CRITTENDEN-CROSS-GREENE-LAWRENCE-LEE(AR)-MISSISSIPPI-
     PHILLIPS-POINSETT-RANDOLPH-ST. FRANCIS.

MO...FREEZE WARNING UNTIL 9 AM CDT WEDNESDAY FOR DUNKLIN-PEMISCOT.

MS...FREEZE WARNING UNTIL 9 AM CDT WEDNESDAY FOR ALCORN-BENTON(MS)-
     CALHOUN-CHICKASAW-COAHOMA-DESOTO-ITAWAMBA-LAFAYETTE-LEE(MS)-
     MARSHALL-MONROE-PANOLA-PONTOTOC-PRENTISS-QUITMAN-
     TALLAHATCHIE-TATE-TIPPAH-TISHOMINGO-TUNICA-UNION-YALOBUSHA.

WAGNER








000 
FXUS64 KMEG 251600
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
1100 AM CDT TUE OCT 25 2005

.UPDATE...
COLD AIR STRATOCU HAS BEEN SLOW TO DEVELOP THIS MORNING. BY THIS
TIME YESTERDAY...MOST OF THE AREA WAS MOSTLY CLOUDY. MOISTURE
LEVELS HAVE BEEN A LITTLE LOWER THAN YESTERDAY...AND COLD AIR
ADVECTION NOT AS STRONG. WILL UPDATE AFTER 16Z OBS ARRIVE TO BE A
LITTLE MORE OPTIMISTIC ON CLOUD COVER. MOST AREAS ARE RUNNING A
COUPLE OF DEGREES COOLER THAN MONDAY. ADDITIONAL SUNSHINE TODAY
SHOULD BALANCE OUT HIGH TEMPERATURES CLOSE TO WHAT WE ACHIEVED
YESTERDAY...OR A TOUCH WARMER.

&&

.PREV DISCUSSION... (ISSUED 242 AM CDT TUE OCT 25 2005) 

DISCUSSION...

SURFACE MAP SHOWS AN AREA OF HIGH PRESSURE ORIENTED NORTH-SOUTH
THROUGH THE PLAINS. THERE HAS BEEN ENOUGH OF A GRADIENT OVERNIGHT
FOR THE WINDS TO KEEP UP. THIS COMBINED WITH CLOUD COVER DURING
THE FIRST HALF OF THE NIGHT WAS SUFFICIENT TO KEEP TEMPS FROM
FALLING TO THE DEW POINTS WHICH ARE IN THE LOW TO MID 30S. MODELS
CONTINUE TO SHOW A GREAT DEAL OF LOW LEVEL MOISTURE AROUND.
SATELLITE TREND LOOKS VERY SIMILAR TO YESTERDAY WHERE CLOUDS
DIMINISHED DURING THE NOCTURNAL HOURS. BASED UPON THE TREND EXPECT
STRATOCU TO REDEVELOP AFTER MID MORNING WITH MODELS SHOWING THAT
THE CLOUD COVER MAY BE MOST PREVALENT EAST OF A LINE FROM
JONESBORO TO CLARKSDALE MS. 850 TEMPS ARE A COUPLE DEGREES WARMER
AND HAVE FORECASTED HIGHS TO BE A COUPLE DEGREES WARMER AS A
RESULT. TEMPS SHOULD BE COOLER ACROSS WEST TN AND NORTHEAST MS DUE
TO ANTICIPATED CLOUD COVER. THE STRATOCU FIELD SHOULD DIMINISH
DURING THE EVENING AS HAS BEEN THE TREND. HIGH PRESSURE WILL BUILD
OVER THE AREA RESULTING IN LIGHT WINDS. COMBINED WITH LOW DEW
POINTS EXPECT MOST AREAS TO SEE TEMPS IN THE MID TO UPPER 30S AT
LEAST. WOULDNT BE SURPRISED IF A FEW OF THE COLDER SPOTS ACROSS
WEST TN AND NORTHEAST MS SAW TEMPS AS LOW AS 30. MANY LOCATIONS
WILL LIKELY SEE FROST IN THIS SCENARIO THUS PROMPTING A FROST
ADVISORY FOR THE REGION. A FEW LOCATIONS MAY NEED TO BE UPGRADED
TO A FREEZE WARNING BASED UPON TRENDS DURING THE DAY. MIN TEMP
INSIDE THE 240 LOOP IN SHELBY COUNTY MAY BE A FEW DEGREES WARMER
DUE TO HEAT ISLAND EFFECTS AND FROST MAY NOT EVEN OCCUR THERE.

HIGH PRESSURE WILL DOMINATE THE WEATHER FOR THE NEXT SEVERAL DAYS
AS THE UPPER PATTERN GRADUALLY SHIFTS EASTWARD FROM THE CURRENT
STATE OF A TROUGH IN THE EAST WITH A RIDGE OVER THE WEST. THE
UPPER RIDGE BUILDING OVER THE REGION WILL RESULT IN A GRADUAL
WARMING TREND ALONG WITH CONTINUED DRY WEATHER. ANOTHER
FROST/FREEZE IS POSSIBLE AGAIN TOMORROW NIGHT AS WINDS WILL LIKELY
REMAIN LIGHT BUT NOT CERTAIN JUST HOW MUCH WARMING WILL OCCUR
BETWEEN NOW AND THEN. 

THE NEXT CHANCE OF RAIN IS NOT UNTIL LATE IN THE WEEKEND OR EARLY
NEXT WEEK AS THE UPPER RIDGE MOVES EASTWARD AND A SHORTWAVE
TROUGH SLOWLY MOVES INTO THE AREA.

&&


000 
FXUS64 KMEG 250742
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
242 AM CDT TUE OCT 25 2005

.DISCUSSION...

SURFACE MAP SHOWS AN AREA OF HIGH PRESSURE ORIENTED NORTH-SOUTH
THROUGH THE PLAINS. THERE HAS BEEN ENOUGH OF A GRADIENT OVERNIGHT
FOR THE WINDS TO KEEP UP. THIS COMBINED WITH CLOUD COVER DURING
THE FIRST HALF OF THE NIGHT WAS SUFFICIENT TO KEEP TEMPS FROM
FALLING TO THE DEW POINTS WHICH ARE IN THE LOW TO MID 30S. MODELS
CONTINUE TO SHOW A GREAT DEAL OF LOW LEVEL MOISTURE AROUND.
SATELLITE TREND LOOKS VERY SIMILAR TO YESTERDAY WHERE CLOUDS
DIMINISHED DURING THE NOCTURNAL HOURS. BASED UPON THE TREND EXPECT
STRATOCU TO REDEVELOP AFTER MID MORNING WITH MODELS SHOWING THAT
THE CLOUD COVER MAY BE MOST PREVALENT EAST OF A LINE FROM
JONESBORO TO CLARKSDALE MS. 850 TEMPS ARE A COUPLE DEGREES WARMER
AND HAVE FORECASTED HIGHS TO BE A COUPLE DEGREES WARMER AS A
RESULT. TEMPS SHOULD BE COOLER ACROSS WEST TN AND NORTHEAST MS DUE
TO ANTICIPATED CLOUD COVER. THE STRATOCU FIELD SHOULD DIMINISH
DURING THE EVENING AS HAS BEEN THE TREND. HIGH PRESSURE WILL BUILD
OVER THE AREA RESULTING IN LIGHT WINDS. COMBINED WITH LOW DEW
POINTS EXPECT MOST AREAS TO SEE TEMPS IN THE MID TO UPPER 30S AT
LEAST. WOULDNT BE SURPRISED IF A FEW OF THE COLDER SPOTS ACROSS
WEST TN AND NORTHEAST MS SAW TEMPS AS LOW AS 30. MANY LOCATIONS
WILL LIKELY SEE FROST IN THIS SCENARIO THUS PROMPTING A FROST
ADVISORY FOR THE REGION. A FEW LOCATIONS MAY NEED TO BE UPGRADED
TO A FREEZE WARNING BASED UPON TRENDS DURING THE DAY. MIN TEMP
INSIDE THE 240 LOOP IN SHELBY COUNTY MAY BE A FEW DEGREES WARMER
DUE TO HEAT ISLAND EFFECTS AND FROST MAY NOT EVEN OCCUR THERE.

HIGH PRESSURE WILL DOMINATE THE WEATHER FOR THE NEXT SEVERAL DAYS
AS THE UPPER PATTERN GRADUALLY SHIFTS EASTWARD FROM THE CURRENT
STATE OF A TROUGH IN THE EAST WITH A RIDGE OVER THE WEST. THE
UPPER RIDGE BUILDING OVER THE REGION WILL RESULT IN A GRADUAL
WARMING TREND ALONG WITH CONTINUED DRY WEATHER. ANOTHER
FROST/FREEZE IS POSSIBLE AGAIN TOMORROW NIGHT AS WINDS WILL LIKELY
REMAIN LIGHT BUT NOT CERTAIN JUST HOW MUCH WARMING WILL OCCUR
BETWEEN NOW AND THEN. 

THE NEXT CHANCE OF RAIN IS NOT UNTIL LATE IN THE WEEKEND OR EARLY
NEXT WEEK AS THE UPPER RIDGE MOVES EASTWARD AND A SHORTWAVE
TROUGH SLOWLY MOVES INTO THE AREA.

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...FROST ADVISORY FROM MIDNIGHT TONIGHT TO 9 AM CDT WEDNESDAY FOR 
     CLAY-CRAIGHEAD-CRITTENDEN-CROSS-GREENE-LAWRENCE-LEE(AR)-
     MISSISSIPPI-PHILLIPS-POINSETT-RANDOLPH-ST. FRANCIS.

MO...FROST ADVISORY FROM MIDNIGHT TONIGHT TO 9 AM CDT WEDNESDAY FOR 
     DUNKLIN-PEMISCOT.

MS...FROST ADVISORY FROM MIDNIGHT TONIGHT TO 9 AM CDT WEDNESDAY FOR 
     ALCORN-BENTON(MS)-CALHOUN-CHICKASAW-COAHOMA-DESOTO-ITAWAMBA-

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 250207
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
907 PM CDT MON OCT 24 2005

.EVENING UPDATE...

PERSISTENT CLOUD DECK STARTING TO BREAK UP WEST OF THE MS RIVER
AND ACRS NW MS. THIS TREND SHOULD CONT AND MOVE SLOWLY EAST AS THE
UPPER TROF MOVES AWAY FROM THE REGION. UPDATED THE FORECAST TO
SLOW THE CLEARING TREND. ALSO DECREASED SURFACE WINDS A LITTLE
CONSIDERING OBSERVATIONS AND GUIDANCE. KEPT AREAS FROM MKL TO THE
NE CLOUDY FOR REMAINDER OF THE NIGHT AND RAISED LOW TEMPS A COUPLE
OF DEGREES TO 40. TEMPS ELSW LOOK OK FOR NOW BUT REACHING THE
UPPER 30S IN SOME LOCATIONS WL DEPEND ON EXACTLY WHEN THE CLOUDS
MOVE OUT.

&&

.PREV DISCUSSION... (ISSUED 602 PM CDT MON OCT 24 2005) 

UPDATE...

CLOUD DECK AT 5-7 KFT HANGING TOUGH ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA.
HAVE UPDATED THE ENTIRE AREA FOR MOSTLY CLOUDY SKIES FOR AT LEAST
THIS EVENING. 

PREV DISCUSSION... (ISSUED 325 PM CDT MON OCT 24 2005) 

DISCUSSION...

AN UPPER LOW WAS CENTERED OVER THE OH VLY THIS AFTERNOON AND 
PROVIDED A BROKEN DECK OF STRATOCU TO THE REGION. PLENTY OF CLOUDS 
AND A MODERATE NORTH WIND PROVIDED FOR A RATHER COOL LATE OCTOBER 
DAY. EXPECT THE UPPER LOW TO GRADUALLY MOVE EASTWARD TONIGHT WHILE 
THE LOW CLOUDS TO BREAKUP. PRESSURE GRADIENT WILL BE STRONG ENOUGH 
TO SUPPORT WINDS JUST HIGH ENOUGH TO INHIBIT A LOT OF FROST.

A LONGWAVE UPPER TROUGH WILL REMAIN OVER THE ERN HALF OF THE U.S. 
THROUGH THE ENTIRE WEEK...SO EXPECT COOL WEATHER TO CONTINUE THROUGH 
THE PERIOD. A POLAR HIGH WELL TO THE NW WILL GRADUALLY BUILD INTO 
OUR REGION TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY. WINDS WILL DECREASE AND BECOME 
NEARLY CALM BY TUESDAY NIGHT...SO FROST WILL AT LEAST BE PATCHY IN 
ALL PARTS OF THE FORECAST AREA WHILE PORTIONS OF WEST TENNESSEE 
EXPERIENCE SCATTERED TO WIDESPREAD FROST. A FROST ADVISORY MAY BE 
NEEDED TUESDAY NIGHT FOR A PORTION OF THE FORECAST AREA WHERE LOWS 
DROP INTO THE MID 30S...BUT WILL WAIT UNTIL WE GET CLOSER TO THAT 
TIME PERIOD. PATCHY FROST WILL AGAIN BE POSSIBLE WEDNESDAY 
NIGHT...MAINLY IN PORTIONS OF WEST TENNESSEE AND NORTH MISSISSIPPI 
AS THE HIGH SLOWLY RETREATS TO THE EAST.

ANOTHER SHORTWAVE UPPER TROUGH WILL MOVE THROUGH THE REGION 
FRIDAY...SO THE COOL AIR WILL BE REINFORCED AGAIN WITH SOME MORE 
CLOUDS. CANNOT RULE OUT A SPRINKLE FRI ESPECIALLY TO OUR NORTH.

ANOTHER HIGH DOMINATES THE REGION NEXT WEEKEND WITH SEASONABLY COOL 
AND DRY CONDITIONS INTO HALLOWEEN.

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 240802
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
303 AM CDT MON OCT 24 2005

.DISCUSSION...
OVERNIGHT...CLOUDS HAVE BEEN VERY SLOW TO MOVE INTO THE FORECAST 
AREA. THIS HAS ALLOWED TEMPERATURES TO DIP INTO THE LOWER 30S FOR A 
FEW LOCATIONS OVER WEST TENNESSEE. 

LATEST ISENTROPIC SURFACE ANALYSIS INDICATES INCREASING CONDENSATION 
PRESSURE DEFICITS FROM SOUTHERN MISSOURI INTO MISSISSIPPI AND 
DOWNSLOPE WINDS/DEEP COLD ADVECTION. THIS HELPS EXPLAIN WHY THE LOW 
CLOUD DECK VIRTUALLY HAS CEASED FURTHER DEVELOPMENT SOUTHWARD. SOME 
PATCHY FOG IS LIKELY ACROSS NORTHERN MISSISSIPPI AND SOUTHWEST 
TENNESSEE AS TEMPERATURES WILL FALL CLOSE TO DEWPOINT VALUES.

MOSTLY SUNNY TO PARTLY CLOUDY SKIES TODAY WITH BREEZY NORTHWESTERLY 
WINDS. COLD AIR ADVECTION AT 850MB SUGGESTS THAT MAX TEMPERATURES 
WILL GENERALLY RANGE FROM THE MID 50S TO LOWER 60S.

THE DEEP UPPER TROUGH OVER THE EASTERN U.S. WILL CONTINUE TO PROVIDE 
MUCH COOLER TEMPERATURES TO THE MIDSOUTH FOR MOST OF THE WEEK. 
ANOTHER SHORTWAVE OUT OF CANADA WILL GET PULLED INTO THE STRONG 
NORTHERLY FLOW TODAY. THIS WILL PROVIDE ANOTHER COOL SHOT OF AIR TO 
INFILTRATE THE MIDSOUTH TUESDAY. DAYTIME TEMPERATURES TOMORROW WILL 
ONLY BE A COUPLE OF DEGREES WARMER THAN TODAY/S VALUES. HOWEVER...BY 
TUESDAY MORNING...LACK OF CLOUD COVER AND ADDITIONAL COLD AIR MOVING 
INTO THE REGION MAY ALLOW FOR THE NORTHERN HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA 
TO EXPERIENCE SOME FREEZING TEMPERATURES. MODEL GUIDANCE IS 
SUGGESTING THAT LOW TEMPERATURES WEDNESDAY MORNING WILL BE WELL 
ABOVE FREEZING...BUT WE ARE TRENDING TOWARD THE COOLER VALUES.

ANOTHER SYSTEM TO WATCH THE NEXT COUPLE OF DAYS WILL BE THE NEXT 
SHORTWAVE PROGGED TO STRENGTHEN AND DROP OUT OF THE GREAT LAKES 
REGION. THIS WOULD AFFECT OUR FORECAST AREA FRIDAY WITH COOLER 
TEMPERATURES AND POSSIBLY A SHOT OF LIGHT RAIN. AFTER THIS SYSTEM 
DRIFTS EAST...SHORTWAVE RIDGING WILL ALLOW TEMPERATURES TO RETURN TO 
NEAR NORMAL VALUES BY LATE NEXT WEEKEND.   

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
254 AM CDT SUN OCT 23 2005

.DISCUSSION...
A COLD FRONT WAS LOCATED FROM PADUCAH TO FORT SMITH AND IT WAS 
MOVING VERY SLOWLY SOUTHWARD. SOME LIGHT RAIN WAS OCCURRING ALONG 
AND JUST NORTH OF THE FRONT MAINLY OVER SOUTHERN ILLINOIS. THE RAIN 
IS ASSOCIATED WITH A 110+ KNOT JET STREAK BISECTING THIS AREA.

THE SLOW MOVEMENT OF THE FRONT WILL PERSIST UNTIL THE SHORTWAVE 
DIVING OUT THE NORTHERN PLAINS GETS CLOSER TO THE REGION. EXPECT THE 
FRONT TO BEGIN SURGING SOUTHWARD BY 8 AM THIS MORNING. IT SHOULD 
MOVE THROUGH THE WHOLE FORECAST AREA BY 3 PM...EXITING NORTHEAST 
MISSISSIPPI LAST. AS MENTIONED BEFORE...SOME LIGHT RAIN MAY OCCUR 
MAINLY OVER NORTHWEST TENNESSEE AND THE MISSOURI BOOTHEEL. ANY 
RAINFALL AMOUNTS WILL BE LIGHT I.E. LESS THAN ONE TENTH INCH...AND  
RAIN CHANCES HAVE BEEN TRIMMED BACK FROM EARLIER FORECASTS. 

THE MAIN STORY WILL BE THE AFTERMATH OF THE FRONTAL PASSAGE. THIS 
WILL LEAVE THE MIDSOUTH IN A PATTERN WHICH WILL MAKE TEMPERATURES 
WELL BELOW SEASONAL NORMS FOR SUNDAY AND MONDAY. THESE DAYS WILL BE  
THE COLDEST TEMPERATURES ALL WEEK. 

THE UPPER TROUGH OVER THE SOUTHEAST U.S. WILL WEAKEN ITS GRIP ON THE 
MIDSOUTH WEDNESDAY. THIS MEANS THAT TEMPERATURES WILL GRADUALLY WARM 
CLOSER TO THE SEASONAL NORMALS BY NEXT WEEKEND. RAIN CHANCES WILL 
ALSO REMAIN LOW THROUGH MOST OF THE WEEK.

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 220815
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
315 AM CDT SAT OCT 22 2005

.DISCUSSION...
LOW CLOUDS HAVE DIMINISHED FROM PARTS OF NORTHEAST ARKANSAS AND THE 
MISSOURI BOOTHEEL. THE CLEARING LINE IS SLOWLY MOVING SOUTHWARD AND 
EXPECT BY MID MORNING THAT MOST OF THE CLOUDS WILL HAVE MOVED OUT OF 
THE AREA. THE ONLY EXCEPTION WILL LIKELY BE NORTHEAST MISSISSIPPI.

WEAK COLD AIR ADVECTION TODAY WILL KEEP DAYTIME TEMPERATURES IN THE 
UPPER 60S ACROSS THE MIDSOUTH. 

A STRONG UPPER LOW WILL DROP OUT OF THE NORTHERN PLAINS TODAY. THIS 
UPPER LOW WILL BEGIN TO INFLUENCE THE WEATHER ACROSS THE FORECAST 
AREA LATE TONIGHT AND INTO SUNDAY. THERE WILL BE A LOT OF UPPER 
LEVEL ENERGY THAT COULD GENERATE A FEW SPRINKLES SUNDAY. HOWEVER THE 
MOST SIGNIFICANT PART OF THIS SYSTEM WILL BE THE COLD AIR ASSOCIATED 
WITH IT. DAYTIME HIGHS ON SUNDAY WILL BE IN THE LOWER 60S AND THAT 
MAY BE TOO OPTIMISTIC. A VERY COLD NIGHT IN STORE SUNDAY WITH MONDAY 
MORNING LOWS IN THE UPPER 30S AND LOWER 40S. 

THIS UPPER LOW REINFORCES THE TROUGH OVER THE EASTERN U.S. THIS WILL 
CAUSE BELOW NORMAL TEMPERATURES THROUGH THE FIRST HALF OF THE 
UPCOMING WEEK.

PRECIP CHANCES WILL REMAIN SLIM FOR THE NEXT 7 DAYS. HOWEVER...THERE 
MAY BE SOME LIGHT RAIN ASSOCIATED WITH THE STRONG SYSTEM THAT WILL 
AFFECT THE REGION LATE TONIGHT AND SUNDAY.

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.
&&

$$

AC

FXUS64 KMEG 220303
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
1015 PM CDT FRI OCT 21 2005

.DISCUSSION...
LOW CLOUDS REMAIN OVER THE MIDSOUTH THIS EVENING. EXPECT THE CLOUDS 
TO STICK AROUND THROUGH MUCH OF THE MORNING. AREA SHOULD THEN SEE 
SOME CLEARING BY AFTERNOON...ESPECIALLY NORTHWESTERN PORTIONS OF THE 
CWA. CURRENT TEMPERATURES ARE IN THE MID 50S TO MID 60S AND LOOK ON 
TRACK TO REACH LOWS IN THE UPPER 40S TO LOWER 50S. CURRENT FORECAST 
LOOKS GOOD...NO UPDATES ARE EXPECTED.

&&

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 211947
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
247 PM CDT FRI OCT 21 2005

.DISCUSSION...
LOW CLOUDS HAVE MOVED INTO MOST OF THE FORECAST AREA THIS AFTERNOON.
THIS HAS KEPT TEMPERATURES IN THE 60S THROUGHOUT THE DAY AND ACROSS
PARTS OF NORTH MISSISSIPPI WHERE THE CLOUDS HAVE YET TO REACH
TEMPERATURES HAVE WARMED INTO THE LOW TO MID 70S. CLOUDS SHOULD
CONTINUE TO COVER MUCH OF THE FORECAST AREA TONIGHT WHICH WILL HELP
KEEP FROM COOLING OFF AS MUCH AS THEY COULD. THE CLOUDS WILL BEGIN
TO MOVE OUT AND THIN ON SATURDAY ALLOWING FOR SOME PEAKS OF SUNSHINE.
TEMPERATURES WILL BE A FEW DEGREES WARMER THAN TODAY IN MOST
LOCATIONS. UPPER LEVEL LOW BEGINNING TO DIVE OUT OF SOUTHERN
MANITOBA PROVINCE AND SHOULD REACH NORTHERN MISSOURI BY SUNDAY. THIS
WILL BRING A REINFORCING SHOT OF COLDER AIR INTO THE REGION ON
SUNDAY WITH TEMPERATURES A FEW DEGREES COOLER THAN SATURDAY. SUNDAY
NIGHT WILL BE CHILLY WITH READINGS MONDAY MORNING DROPPING BELOW 40
DEGREES OVER PARTS OF NORTHWEST TENNESSEE. HIGH PRESSURE SHOULD
BECOME ANCHORED OVER THE CENTRAL U.S. BY MONDAY AND ONLY MOVE SLOWLY
EAST FOR MUCH OF NEXT WEEK LEAVING WITH DRY AND UNSEASONABLY COOL
TEMPERATURES.


&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.
&&

FXUS64 KMEG 211443
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
943 AM CDT FRI OCT 21 2005

.DISCUSSION...
COLD FRONT JUST EAST OF FORECAST AREA THIS MORNING. LOW CLOUDS ARE
SLOWLY STREAMING IN BEHIND THE FRONT. THESE CLOUDS WILL HELP KEEP
TEMPERATURES FROM RISING VERY MUCH THIS AFTERNOON. HAVE ADJUSTED
HIGHS LOWER TODAY TO ACCOUNT FOR THE CLOUDS. REMAINDER OF FORECAST
LOOKS FINE.

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 210833
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
333 AM CDT FRI OCT 21 2005

.DISCUSSION...
A WEAKENING SHORTWAVE WAS TRANSLATING ACROSS SOUTHERN ILLINOIS THIS 
MORNING. AT THE SURFACE...A COLD FRONT IS LOCATED FROM PADUCAH TO 
MEMPHIS TO GREENWOOD. SOME ISOLATED SHOWERS WERE MOVING ACROSS PARTS 
OF WEST TENNESSEE AND NORTHEAST MISSISSIPPI THIS MORNING. THESE 
SHOWERS WILL EXIT THE AREA BY 8 AM.

THE MODELS ARE DIFFERING SLIGHTLY AS FAR AS THE STRENGTH OF THE 
DEEPENING TROUGH THIS WEEKEND. THE NAM IS MUCH STRONGER THAN THE GFS 
AND MORE AGGRESSIVE WITH THE COLD AIR ADVECTION LATER IN THE WEEKEND.
THERE IS NO DOUBT THAT THIS TROUGH WILL BE SIGNIFICANT AND USHER IN 
MUCH COOLER AIR SUNDAY INTO MONDAY.

CURRENTLY THE UPPER LEVEL SHORTWAVE LOCATED OVER SOUTHERN 
SASKATCHEWAN WILL DIG INTO NORTHERN MINNESOTA LATER TONIGHT. A 
STRONG JET STREAK ON THE BACKSIDE OF THE UPPER LOW WILL DEEPEN THE 
TROUGH OVER THE EASTERN HALF OF THE U.S. THROUGH SUNDAY. DAYTIME 
TEMPERATURES SUNDAY WILL BE AROUND 60 DEGREES WITH GUSTY NORTHERLY 
WINDS. PERHAPS SOME LIGHT PRECIP WILL ACCOMPANY THE STRONG SHORTWAVE 
LATE SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY...BUT AM NOT CONVINCED THAT IT 
WILL BE MEASURABLE. THUS HAVE REMOVED SLIGHT CHANCES FOR THIS TIME 
FRAME.

THERE ARE SOME DISCREPANCIES WITH THE LATEST LONG RANGE FORECASTS. 
HAVE OPTED TO ALLOW ANOTHER RUN OF THE MODELS BEFORE JUMPING TO 
CONCLUSIONS TOO EARLY FOR LATE IN THE FORECAST PERIOD. HAVE NOT MADE 
ANY MODIFICATIONS TO DAY 5 AND ON. 

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.
&&

$$

AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
1030 PM CDT THU OCT 20 2005

.DISCUSSION...
COLD FRONT MOVING BEGINNING TO MOVE THROUGH THE MIDSOUTH ATTM. A FEW 
SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS HAVE DEVELOPED ALONG AND OUT AHEAD OF THE 
FRONT. WILL KEEP 20 POPS GOING. SKIES REMAIN PARTLY CLOUDY ACROSS 
THE CWA AS ONLY SCATTERED LOW TO MID CLOUDS EXIST OVER THE AREA. 
EXPECT AN AREA OF LOW CLOUDS CURRENTLY OVER MISSOURI...EASTERN 
KANSAS...AND NORTHEASTERN OKLAHOMA TO MOVE INTO THE CWA DURING THE 
MORNING HOURS MAINLY AFTER 12Z. WILL LEAVE PARTLY CLOUDY GOING FOR 
THE OVERNIGHT HOURS. REST OF FORECAST LOOKS GOOD...UPDATE WILL BE 
OUT SHORTLY.

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 201950
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
250 PM CDT THU OCT 20 2005

.DISCUSSION...
SURFACE LOW NOW OVER SOUTH CENTRAL MISSOURI WITH COLD FRONT EXTENDING
SOUTHWEST THROUGH WESTERN ARKANSAS INTO NORTHEAST TEXAS. A SMALL
AREA OF THUNDERSTORMS WAS MOVING NORTHEAST ACROSS NORTHEAST ARKANSAS
INTO SOUTHEAST MISSOURI. WOULD NOT BE SURPRISED IF THERE IS NOT ANY
ADDITIONAL THUNDERSTORM DEVELOPMENT BUT AM NOT CONFIDENT ENOUGH TO
COMPLETELY REMOVE POPS FROM TONIGHTS FORECAST SO WILL KEEP SLIGHT
CHANCE IN FOR NOW. THE COLD FRONT SHOULD MAKE ITS WAY THROUGH FRIDAY
AND FRIDAY NIGHT. NOT TOO MUCH MOISTURE TO WORK WITH BUT WILL KEEP
SLIGHT CHANCE POPS IN FOR BOTH FRIDAY AND FRIDAY NIGHT. COOLER AIR
WILL BEGIN TO MOVE IN BEHIND THE FRONT WITH TEMPERATURES SOME 10-15
DEGREES COOLER THAN TODAY. MAJOR CHANCE TO UPPER LEVEL PATTERN
BEGINS SATURDAY AS CLOSED LOW WILL DROP SOUTH FROM THE NORTHERN
PLAINS INTO OHIO VALLEY BY SUNDAY. THIS SYSTEM MAY KICK OFF A FEW
SHOWERS OVER EASTERN ARKANSAS EARLY SUNDAY MORNING AND ACROSS THE
ENTIRE FORECAST AREA DURING THE DAY SUNDAY. MOISTURE WILL STILL BE
LIMITED SO ONLY HAVE SLIGHT CHANCE POPS. DEEP UPPER LEVEL TROUGH WILL
HOLD IN PLACE OVER THE EASTERN HALF OF THE U.S. FOR MONDAY THROUGH
THURSDAY KEEPING COOL WEATHER OVER THE FORECAST AREA WITH A SLOW
WARMING TREND THROUGH THE PERIOD.

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
930 AM CDT THU OCT 20 2005

.DISCUSSION...
SURFACE LOW LOCATED OVER SOUTHWEST MISSOURI THIS MORNING WITH COLD
FRONT EXTENDING SOUTH NEAR ARKANSAS/OKLAHOMA BORDER INTO NORTH TEXAS.
A FEW SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS CAN BE FOUND OVER NORTHEAST ARKANSAS
MOVING NORTHEAST INTO SOUTHEAST MISSOURI. COULD SEE SOME ADDITIONAL
THUNDERSTORMS DEVELOP LATER THIS MORNING. NOT MUCH IN THE WAY ON
INSTABILITY OVER THE FORECAST AREA BUT STILL CANT COMPLETELY RULE
OUT A SEVERE STORM OR TWO. CURRENT FORECAST LOOKS GOOD FOR NOW SO NO
CHANGES ARE PLANNED AT THIS TIME.

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 200916
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
415 AM CDT THU OCT 20 2005

.DISCUSSION...LATEST SURFACE ANALYSIS THIS MORNING CENTERS LOW 
PRESSURE NEAR WICHITA WITH A TRAILING COLD FRONT STRETCHING BACK 
THROUGH WESTERN OKLAHOMA. MEANWHILE...A STATIONARY BOUNDARY EXTENDS 
FROM SOUTHERN ILLINOIS BACK TOWARDS SPRINGFIELD MISSOURI. ACROSS THE 
MID SOUTH IN THE WARM SECTOR TEMPERATURES THIS MORNING ARE IN THE 
MID 60S TO LOWER 70S. MAIN CONCERNS THIS FORECAST PACKAGE IS SEVERE 
WEATHER POTENTIAL TODAY AND PRECIPITATION CHANCES THIS WEEKEND WITH 
APPROACH OF SECONDARY COLD FRONT. 

TODAY AND TONIGHT...AREA OF LOW PRESSURE WILL CONTINUE TO MOVE TOWARD THE 
MID SOUTH TODAY. 700-500 MB LAYER MID LEVEL LAPSE RATES WILL 
INCREASE TO 6.5 C/KM IN RESPONSE TO APPROACHING COLD FRONT.  MODEL 
SOUNDINGS ACROSS NORTHERN SECTIONS OF THE FORECAST AREA PRODUCE 
SURFACE BASED CAPES OF 1200 J/KG...LI/S AROUND -4...AND NEARLY 
UNIDIRECTIONAL WINDS AT 850 MB/20KT/ AND AND 50KT WINDS AT 500 MB. 
ALSO 700 MB DEWPOINT DEPRESSIONS AROUND 14C SUGGEST A DAMAGING WIND 
THREAT MAY EXIST WITH ANY THUNDERSTORMS THAT BECOME SEVERE.  HOWEVER 
A LIMITING FACTOR WITH THIS CONVECTION MAY BE AVAILABLE LOW LEVEL 
MOISTURE. AS A RESULT...THINK THAT BEST CHANCE OF SEEING ANY 
CONVECTIVE ACTIVITY WILL BE ACROSS THE FAR NORTHWEST CORNER OF THE 
FORECAST AREA AND WILL LEAVE THE REST OF NORTHEAST ARKANSAS AS 20 
POPS. THE REMAINDER OF THE FORECAST AREA SHOULD REMAIN DRY THIS 
AFTERNOON. 850 MB TEMPERATURES AROUND 17C WILL PRODUCE HIGHS VERY 
SIMILAR TO YESTERDAY IN THE UPPER 80S WITH THE EXCEPTION OF THE 
MISSOURI BOOTHEEL AND EXTREME NORTHEAST ARKANSAS WHERE ONGOING 
CONVECTION OR CONVECTIVE DEBRIS WILL HOLD TEMPERATURES DOWN IN THE 
LOWER 80S. 

THE COLD FRONT WILL MOVE THROUGH THE MID SOUTH TONIGHT. STRONGER 
MID LEVEL DYNAMICAL FORCING /700-500 Q-VECTOR CONVERGENCE/ WILL 
REMAIN NORTH OF THE TENNESSEE/MISSISSIPPI BORDER. ANY POTENTIAL 
SEVERE WEATHER THREAT SHOULD DIMINISH BEFORE MIDNIGHT AS THE 
BOUNDARY LAYER STABILIZES. 

FRIDAY/FRIDAY NIGHT...WRAP AROUND MOISTURE ON THE BACKSIDE OF LOW 
PRESSURE WILL PRODUCE A CHANCE OF SHOWERS ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA 
WITH 700-500 MB LAYER LAPSE RATES AROUND 6 C/KM...AND LI/S AROUND 
-4. ANY REMAINING RAIN SHOWERS SHOULD COME TO AN END BY FRIDAY 
NIGHT. HIGHS FRIDAY WILL BE IN THE UPPER 60S TO 70S WITH MOST AREAS 
REACHING HIGHS IN THE MORNING WITH THE EXCEPTION OF PORTIONS OF 
NORTHERN MISSISSIPPI. LOWS WILL DROP BACK INTO THE UPPER 40S TO 
LOWER 50S. 

SATURDAY...THE LOWER MISSISSIPPI VALLEY WILL BE IN BETWEEN 
SYSTEMS...THE COLD FRONT WHICH WILL PASS THROUGH AND ANOTHER 
CANADIAN FRONT WHICH WILL MOVE THROUGH SUNDAY. 850 MB TEMPERATURES 
AROUND 6-7C WILL PRODUCE HIGHS IN THE UPPER 60S TO LOWER 70S AT 
BEST. 

SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY...A SECONDARY COLD FRONT WILL MOVE 
THROUGH THE MID SOUTH ON SUNDAY AS A LARGE UPPER LEVEL LOW SPINS 
ACROSS THE GREAT LAKES REGION/OHIO VALLEY. ADDED A SLIGHT CHANCE OF 
RAIN SHOWERS TO SATURDAY NIGHT WEST OF THE MISSISSIPPI RIVER AND TO 
THE REMAINDER OF THE FORECAST AREA ON SUNDAY. HIGH PRESSURE WILL 
RETURN THROUGH THE END OF THE PERIOD.     

NO SIGNIFICANT CHANGES MADE BEYOND SUNDAY.
&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.
&&

$$

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
1000 PM CDT WED OCT 19 2005

.DISCUSSION...
MOSTLY CLEAR SKIES REMAIN OVER THE MIDSOUTH THIS EVENING. EXPECT 
THIS TREND TO CONTINUE INTO THE EARLY PART OF THURSDAY. A COLD FRONT 
CURRENTLY LOCATED ACROSS MISSOURI STRETCHING INTO OKLAHOMA WILL 
BEGIN TO MOVE INTO THE MIDSOUTH ON THURSDAY. THE FRONT WILL BRING 
CHANCES FOR SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS TO THE CWA THROUGH FRIDAY 
NIGHT. COOLER WEATHER WILL MOVE INTO THE AREA BEHIND THE FRONT. FOR 
NOW TEMPERATURES ARE CURRENTLY IN THE UPPER 60S TO LOWER 70S AND 
LOOK ON TRACK TO REACH LOW TEMPERATURES IN THE UPPER 50S TO LOWER 
60S. CURRENT FORECAST LOOKS GOOD...NO UPDATES ARE EXPECTED.

COLD FRONT EXTENDS FROM NEAR DETROIT SOUTHWEST TO JUST SOUTH OF


000 
FXUS64 KMEG 190930
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
428 AM CDT WED OCT 19 2005

.DISCUSSION...LATEST SURFACE ANALYSIS THIS MORNING PLACES COLD FRONT 
FROM NORTHERN LAKE MICHIGAN/HURON BACK THROUGH NORTHERN ILLINOIS AND 
SOUTHERN IOWA/NORTHERN MISSOURI. TEMPERATURES THIS MORNING ACROSS 
THE MID SOUTH ARE IN THE 60S WITH MEMPHIS NEAR 70. MAIN CONCERNS 
THIS FORECAST PACKAGE IS RECORD HIGH TEMPERATURES EXPECTED ACROSS 
THE MID SOUTH THIS AFTERNOON AND CONVECTIVE CHANCES 
THURSDAY/THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH THE END OF THE WEEKEND.  

TODAY...ANOTHER UNSEASONABLY WARM DAY EXPECTED ACROSS THE MID SOUTH 
AS 850 MB TEMPERATURES AROUND 17C UNDER AN UPPER LEVEL RIDGE PRODUCE 
HIGHS IN THE UPPER 80S TO AROUND 90. WOULD NOT BE SURPRISED TO SEE 
QUITE A FEW NEW HIGH TEMPERATURE RECORDS SET ACROSS THE FORECAST 
THIS AFTERNOON. LISTED BELOW ARE THE HIGH TEMPERATURE RECORDS FOR 
THIS DATE... 

OCTOBER 19 RECORD HIGH TEMPS
MEMPHIS 88
JACKSON 88
JONESBORO89
TUPELO88

TONIGHT...COLD FRONT UPSTREAM WILL BECOME QUASI-STATIONARY ALONG 
SOUTHERN MISSOURI/OHIO VALLEY. NOT ANTICIPATING ANY CONVECTION 
ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA WITH MODEL SOUNDINGS INDICATING QUITE A BIT 
OF DRY AIR PRESENT THROUGH THE COLUMN. LOW TEMPERATURES WILL BE 
SIMILAR TO TEMPERATURES THIS MORNING. 

THURSDAY...QUASI-STATIONARY BOUNDARY WILL MAKE LITTLE IF ANY 
MOVEMENT DURING THE DAY AS AN AREA OF LOW PRESSURE AND A TRAILING 
COLD FRONT FROM THE CENTRAL/SOUTHERN PLAINS MOVES ALONG THE STALLED 
OUT BOUNDARY ACROSS SOUTHERN MISSOURI/NORTHERN ARKANSAS. ADDED A 
SLIGHT CHANCE OF POPS ACROSS THE MISSOURI BOOTHEEL AND NORTHEAST 
ARKANSAS WITH 700-500 MB LAYER LAPSE RATES INCREASING TO 6-6.5 C/KM 
AND INSTABILITY INCREASES ESPECIALLY DURING THE AFTERNOON. 
TEMPERATURES WILL BE WARM AGAIN WITH HIGHS IN THE 80S AND MADE MINOR 
ADJUSTMENTS TO TEMPERATURES AS CLOUD COVER/CONVECTION MAY HOLD DOWN 
TEMPERATURES SLIGHTLY ACROSS THE FAR NORTHWEST SECTION ACROSS THE 
BOOTHEEL AND A PORTION OF NORTHEAST ARKANSAS. 

THURSDAY NIGHT AND FRIDAY...AREA OF LOW PRESSURE AND TRAILING COLD 
FRONT WILL MOVE THROUGH THE MID SOUTH. STRONG MID LEVEL DYNAMICAL 
FORCING /700-500 MB LAYER Q-VECTOR CONVERGENCE/ AND MODERATE 700-500 
MB LAYER LAPSE RATES AROUND 6.5 C/KM WILL BE PRESENT TO PRODUCE SOME 
CONVECTION. HOWEVER...LACK OF MOISTURE AND LIMITED INSTABILITY 
SHOULD KEEP MOST IF NOT ALL CONVECTION BELOW SEVERE LIMITS AND 
CONSEQUENTLY KEPT POPS AS LOW END CHANCE. WRAP AROUND MOISTURE ON 
THE BACK SIDE OF THE LOW WILL PRODUCE A CHANCE OF RAIN SHOWERS 
FRIDAY INTO FRIDAY EVENING. 

LONG RANGE /SATURDAY THROUGH TUESDAY/...LARGE CLOSED LOW WILL AFFECT 
MUCH OF THE EASTERN UNITED STATES THROUGH THE END OF THE FORECAST 
PERIOD. LATEST 00Z GFS/EUROPEAN SOLUTION ARE IN PRETTY DECENT 
AGREEMENT WITH THE CANADIAN SOLUTION BY FAR THE OUTLIER AS IT PLACES 
THE UPPER LEVEL LOW ACROSS THE EAST COAST COMPARED TO THE GFS/EURO 
LOW PINWHEELING AROUND THE GREAT LAKES REGION. AS A RESULT...WILL 
STICK TOWARDS GFS/EURO SOLUTION. 

A REINFORCING SHOT OF COLD AIR WILL COME WITH THE PASSAGE OF ANOTHER 
COLD FRONT ON SUNDAY. AT THIS TIME IT APPEARS THAT THE BOUNDARY 
LAYER WILL BE TOO DRY FOR RAIN SHOWERS...BUT POSSIBLY A SPRINKLE OR 
TWO ACROSS THE NORTHERN THIRD OF THE FORECAST AREA SUNDAY EVENING. 
HIGH PRESSURE WILL BUILD BACK IN ACROSS THE MID SOUTH THROUGH THE 
END OF THE PERIOD AS UPPER LEVEL RIDGING TRANSLATES EAST FROM THE 
ROCKIES INTO THE MISSISSIPPI VALLEY. WILL FOLLOW MEX NUMBERS WITH 
DECENT AGREEMENT BETWEEN EURO/GFS. 

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.
&&

$$

CJC

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
920 PM CDT TUE OCT 18 2005

.DISCUSSION...
AGAIN ANOTHER QUIET NIGHT ACROSS THE MIDSOUTH. DEWPOINTS RUNNING
HIGHER TONIGHT THAN THEY HAVE BEEN FOR SEVERAL DAYS. A LITTLE MORE
DUST IN THE AIR MAY HELP LOWER VISIBILITIES A LITTLE BIT IN FAVORED
PLACES LIKE MKL...BUT NOT ENOUGH TO CAUSE ISSUES.

CURRENT TEMPERATURE TRENDS LOOK OK...MAY EVENTUALLY NEED TO RAISE
LOWS IN EXTREME EAST...BUT DEWPOINTS HAVE HAD A HABIT OF DROPPING
AFTER MIDNIGHT...SO WONT TOUCH FOR NOW. NO UPDATES IMMINENT.
&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.
&&

$$

WAGNER





000 
FXUS64 KMEG 181932
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
232 PM CDT TUE OCT 18 2005

.DISCUSSION...

SUNNY SKIES AND WARM TEMPS WERE THE STORY ACROSS THE MID SOUTH
THIS AFTERNOON. TEMPS HAVE CLIMBED ABOVE THE 80 DEGREE MARK WITH
LIGHT SOUTHWEST WINDS. THE WARM WEATHER WILL COME TO AN ABRUPT
A MAJOR PATTERN SHIFT WL OCCUR THIS WEEKEND.

TONIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY....WARM PATTERN WILL CONTINUE.
SHORTWAVE RIDGE WL BUILD ACROSS THE MID SOUTH TONIGHT WITH WEAK
SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE CONTINUING ACROSS THE SOUTHEAST STATES.
LIGHT SOUTHWEST WINDS WILL CONT TO BRING HIGHER DEWPOINTS INTO THE
REGION. EXPECT MILD LOWS TONIGHT WITH READINGS IN THE UPPER 50S TO
MID 60S IN MEMPHIS. UPPER RIDGE CENTERED OVER THE MID SOUTH ON
WED. 850 MB TEMPS OF 16-18C INDICATE THE POTENTIAL FOR A VERY WARM
AFTERNOON. WE SHOULD SEE SOME MAX TEMP RECORDS FALL ACROSS THE
AREA.

OCTOBER 19 RECORD HIGH TEMPS
MEMPHIS 	88
JACKSON 	88
JONESBORO	89
TUPELO		88

WEDNESDAY NIGHT TROUGH FRIDAY...A STRONG UPPER LOW WL EJECT OUT OF
THE SOUTHERN ROCKIES AND INTO THE CENTRAL PLAINS ON WEDNESDAY
NIGHT. WESTERN AREAS MAY SEE AN INCREASE IN CLOUDS OTRW EXPECT
ANOTHER MILD NIGHT WITH TEMPS MAINLY ABOVE 60. UPPER LOW WL MOVE
INTO MO BY LATE THU WITH THE ASSOCD SFC LOW SOUTH OF STL. THU WL
BE THE LAST REALLY WARM DAY FOR A WHILE WITH TEMPS WELL INTO THE
80S. THE ASSOCD COLD FRONT WL BEGIN PUSHING INTO NE AR AROUND 00Z
FRI SO WL ADD A SLIGHT CHC POP IN THOSE AREAS TO ACCOUNT FOR THIS. 
12Z MODELS ARE IN MUCH BETTER AGREEMENT WITH REGARD TO THIS
SYSTEM. BOTH MODELS INDICATE A LACK OF MOISTURE RETURN IN ADVANCE
OF THE COLD FRONT. AS A RESULT WL KEEP POPS FAIRLY LOW WITH THIS
FRONTAL PASSAGE...MAINLY SLIGHT CHC ACRS SRN SXNS WITH CHC POPS
ACRS NRN HALF.

THE SFC AND UPPER LOW WL TRACK INTO THE OH VALLEY BY 12Z THU WITH
THE COLD FRONT MOVING TO EASTERN SECTIONS OF THE CWFA BY THAT
TIME. SEVERE WEATHER THREAT THU NIGHT APPEARS LIMITED BY THE LACK
OF MOISTURE AND INSTABILITY. COLD FRONT MOVES EAST OF THE REGION
ON FRI AS THE UPPER LOW PHASES WITH A NRN STREAM TROF TO CREATE A
LARGE TROF ACRS THE GREAT LAKES AND OH VALLEY BY SAT MORNING.
COLDER AIR WL MOVE INTO THE MID SOUTH FRI AFTN AND SAT WITH PLENTY
OF LOW CLOUDS...BREEZY CONDS AND POSSIBLY SOME LEFTOVER RAIN
SHOWERS...ESPECIALLY ACRS NE SXNS OF THE FORECAST AREA. HIGH TEMPS
WL PROBABLY OCCUR DURING THE MORNING ON FRIDAY AND RANGE FROM 65-
70 ON SAT.

ON SAT ANOTHER PIECE OF ENERGY COMING OUT OF CANADA WL DROP INTO
THE UPPER TROF OVER THE GREAT LAKES AND CARVE OUT A LARGE UPPER
LOW ACROSS THAT SAME REGION LATE SAT INTO SUN. THIS WL SEND DOWN A
REINFORCING SHOT OF COLD AIR INTO THE MID SOUTH FOR SUN AND MON.
TEMPS ON SUN AND MON WL BE AT LEAST 10-15 DEGREES BELOW NORMAL
WITH A GOOD BREEZE AND SOME STRATOCU ACRS NRN SXNS. TEMPS WL BEGIN
TO MODERATE ON TUE AS THE LARGE UPPER LOW BEGINS TO LIFT TO THE
NE.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
MEM  66  90  67  87 /   0  10  10  10 
MKL  57  88  61  86 /   0  10  10  10 
JBR  60  89  61  86 /   0  10  10  10 
TUP  57  88  60  87 /   0  10  10  10 

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.
&&

$$

SJM

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 181532
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
1032 AM CDT TUE OCT 18 2005

.UPDATE...
MOSTLY SUNNY SKIES AND QUICKLY WARMING TEMPS ACROSS THE REGION THIS
MORNING. KLZK 850 MB TEMPS WERE 18C AT 12Z INDICATING POTENTIAL
FOR A VERY WARM AFTERNOON. READINGS WL BE WITHIN A COUPLE OF
DEGREES OF RECORDS ACROSS THE CWFA. CURRENT FORECAST LOOKS GOOD
WITH NO CHANGES PLANNED.

RECORDS FOR TODAY
MEMPHIS 89
JACKSON 89
JONESBORO 90
TUPELO 90

&&

.PREV DISCUSSION... (ISSUED 430 AM CDT TUE OCT 18 2005) 

DISCUSSION...00Z UPPER AIR ANALYSIS PLACES HIGH PRESSURE ACROSS THE 
WESTERN GULF OF MEXICO...A SHORT WAVE PASSING THROUGH THE GREAT 
LAKES REGION...AND A CUTOFF AREA OF LOW PRESSURE OFF THE COAST OF 
SOUTHERN CALIFORNIA. TEMPERATURES ACROSS THE MID SOUTH THIS MORNING 
RANGE FROM THE UPPER 50S TO LOWER 60S. MAIN CONCERNS THIS FORECAST 
PACKAGE IS HIGH TEMPERATURES WEDNESDAY AND FRONTAL PASSAGE THURSDAY 
NIGHT/FRIDAY MORNING.  

TODAY AND TONIGHT...ANOTHER PLEASANT DAY EXPECTED ACROSS THE MID SOUTH 
TODAY WITH HIGH PRESSURE ACROSS THE LOWER MISSISSIPPI VALLEY. 850 MB 
TEMPERATURES AROUND 17C WILL PRODUCE HIGHS IN THE MIDDLE TO UPPER 
80S WITH 10 KT WINDS MIXING DOWN TO THE SURFACE BY AFTERNOON.  WINDS 
WILL DECOUPLE AGAIN TONIGHT WITH UPPER LEVEL RIDGE IN PLACE ACROSS 
THE MID SOUTH. 

WEDNESDAY...CUT OFF LOW LOCATED OFF THE COAST OF SOUTHWEST 
CALIFORNIA WILL MOVE TOWARDS THE FOUR CORNERS AS UPPER LEVEL RIDGING 
BEGINS TO GRADUALLY SHIFT EAST. 850 MB TEMPERATURES AROUND 18C WILL 
PRODUCE NEAR RECORD/RECORD HIGHS ACROSS PORTIONS OF THE AREA. 

THURSDAY AND BEYOND...MID LEVEL TROUGH AND ASSOCIATED SURFACE COLD 
FRONT WILL MOVE THROUGH THE MID SOUTH THURSDAY NIGHT INTO FRIDAY. 
GFS/NAM SOMEWHAT SIMILAR WITH TRACK OF LOW PRESSURE ACROSS THE 
MISSOURI VALLEY BUT GFS SOLUTION A BIT STRONGER WITH MID LEVEL 
TROUGH BECOMING NEGATIVELY TILTED. ADJUSTED POPS UP TO LOW END 
CHANCE THURSDAY NIGHT ACROSS MUCH OF THE FORECAST AREA AS THE COLD 
FRONT APPROACHES.  

SOME MODEL DIFFERENCES BEGIN TO SHOW UP FOR FRIDAY AND THE WEEKEND. 
00Z GFS RUN SIGNIFICANTLY COOLER THAN EUROPEAN SOLUTION /-1C 850 MB 
AIR REACHING AS FAR SOUTH AS THE NORTHERN THIRD OF THE FORECAST 
AREA/ AS THE CUTOFF LOW PHASES WITH AN UPPER TROUGH ACROSS THE UPPER 
MIDWEST...THEN SPINS ACROSS THE UPPER MIDWEST/GREAT LAKES REGION 
INTO NEXT WEEK. WILL KEEP FORECAST DRY AT THIS TIME FOR SATURDAY 
AFTERNOON AND BEYOND WITH LOW CONFIDENCE IN MODEL RUN TO RUN 
CONSISTENCY IN EXTENDED. THINK A BLEND BETWEEN THE EUROPEAN/GFS 
SOLUTION IS THE MOST PLAUSIBLE AT THIS TIME AND ADJUSTED 
TEMPERATURES A BIT ABOVE THE MUCH COOLER 00Z/18 MEX GUIDANCE.

OCTOBER 19 RECORD HIGH TEMPS
MEMPHIS 	88
JACKSON 	88
JONESBORO	89
TUPELO		88

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.
&&

$$

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 180220
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
920 PM CDT MON OCT 17 2005

.EVENING DISCUSSION...
NOT MUCH TO SAY WITH CLEAR SKIES AND LIGHT SOUTH WINDS. CURRENT 
FORECAST LOWS APPEAR REASONABLE WITH COOLEST TEMPERATURES EAST.
NO UPDATE PLANNED AT THIS TIME.
&&

.PREVIOUS DISCUSSION ISSUED AT 231 PM CDT...
SUNNY SKIES ACROSS THE MID SOUTH THIS AFTERNOON WITH TEMPS IN THE
MID 70S TO NEAR 80. AIRMASS STILL VERY DRY WITH DEWPOINTS IN THE
UPPER 30S TO AROUND 40 THOUGH MOISTURE STARTING TO WORK INTO
WESTERN AREAS WHERE SOUTHERLY WINDS HAVE DEVELOPED. DEWPOINTS WERE
NEARING 50 OVER PARTS OF EASTERN AR.

TONIGHT...SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE CONTINUES TO SLIP TO THE SE
OVERNIGHT. MIN TEMPS WL GENERALLY BE DICTATED BY THE SFC WINDS
AND DEWPOINTS. LOWEST DEWPOINTS AND LIGHTEST WINDS WL BE ACROSS
SE PARTS OF W TN AND NE MS. HAVE CUT ABOUT 5 DEGREES FROM GUIDANCE
IN THOSE AREAS. EXPECT TEMPS WL DIP INTO THE UPPER 40S
THERE...PERHAPS LOWER. WARMEST TEMPS WL BE ACRS THE DELTA WHERE
LIGHT SSW WINDS WL CONT ALONG WITH INCREASING DEWPOINTS.

TUESDAY THROUGH THURSDAY...UPPER LOW MOVES OUT OF THE SW U.S. AND
INTO THE CNTRL PLAINS BY LATE THU. LARGE DIFFERENCES BETWEEN NAM
AND GFS. NAM WEAKER...FASTER AND FURTHER SOUTH WITH THE SFC LOW.
ATTM STILL PREFER GFS WHICH HAS BEEN CONSISTENT WITH THIS SYSTEM.
WEAK UPPER LEVEL RIDGING WL DEVELOP IN ADVANCE OF THIS SYSTEM AND 
SPREAD ACROSS THE REGION TUE AND WED. 850 MB TEMPS WL REACH 14-16C
ON TUE AND 16C+ ON WED. THIS WL RESULT IN SURFACE TEMPS IN THE MID
AND UPPER 80S ON TUE AND NEAR 90 BY WED AFTN. RECORDS WL BE IN
JEOPARDY WED AFTN WITH THE 4 MAJOR CLIMATE SITES WITHIN REACH.

OCTOBER 19 RECORD HIGH TEMPS
MEMPHIS 	88
JACKSON 	88
JONESBORO	89
TUPELO		88

ANOTHER WARM DAY EXPECTED THU THOUGH PERHAPS WITH MORE CLOUDINESS
IT WL BE A COUPLE DEGREES COOLER...MORE LIKE 86-87 DEGREES.

THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY...UPPER LOW OVER THE CNTRL PLAINS
MOVES TO THE NE AND PHASES WITH THE MAJOR NRN STREAM TROF MOVING
OUT OF SRN CANADA RESULTING IN A LARGE UPPER LOW ACRS THE NRN
GREAT LAKES BY LATE SAT. THE ASSOCIATED COLD FRONT WL PUSH THROUGH
THE MID SOUTH LATE THU NIGHT...FRIDAY AND EARLY FRI NIGHT. 

STRONG UPPER SUPPORT AND DECENT LOW LEVEL MOISTURE RETURN COULD
RESULT IN SOME STRONG THUNDERSTORMS ON FRIDAY BUT THAT ALL
DEPENDS ON HOW THE SYSTEM EVENTUALLY EVOLVES. EXPECT CHANCES FOR
PRECIP THU NIGHT...FRIDAY AND FRIDAY EVENING FOLLOWED BY
EXTENSIVE LOW CLOUDINESS LATE FRIDAY NIGHT AND SATURDAY MORNING
AND MUCH COOLER TEMPS. EXPECT HIGHS ONLY AROUND 70 ON SAT ACRS W
TN WHERE THE CLOUDS HANG ON.

SUNDAY AND MONDAY...EXPECT LARGE UPPER LOW SOMEWHERE NEAR THE SRN
AND ERN GREAT LAKES. THIS SOLUTION IS VERY DIFFERENT THAN PREVIOUS
GFS RUNS BUT IT IS SIMILAR TO THE 00Z ECMWF SO CONFIDENCE IS
INCREASING.ATTM WL GO WITH PARTLY CLOUDY SKIES AND TEMPS SLIGHTLY
BELOW NORMAL THOUGH DEPENDING ON THE EXACT LOCATION IT COULD
EASILY BE CLOUDY AND MUCH COOLER.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
MEM  60  87  66  89 /   0   0   0  10 
MKL  51  86  57  88 /   0   0   0  10 
JBR  56  88  59  89 /   0   0   0  10 
TUP  51  87  57  88 /   0   0   0  10 

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.
&&

$$

WAGNER/SJM

OVERNIGHT. MIN TEMPS WL GENERALLY BE DICTATED BY THE SFC WINDS
AND DEWPOINTS. LOWEST DEWPOINTS AND LIGHTEST WINDS WL BE ACROSS
SE PARTS OF W TN AND NE MS. HAVE CUT ABOUT 5 DEGREES FROM GUIDANCE
IN THOSE AREAS. EXPECT TEMPS WL DIP INTO THE UPPER 40S
THERE...PERHAPS LOWER. WARMEST TEMPS WL BE ACRS THE DELTA WHERE

INTO THE CNTRL PLAINS BY LATE THU. LARGE DIFFERENCES BETWEEN NAM
AND GFS. NAM WEAKER...FASTER AND FURTHER SOUTH WITH THE SFC LOW.

MEMPHIS 88
JACKSON 88
JONESBORO89

THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY...UPPER LOW OVER THE CNTRL PLAINS
MOVES TO THE NE AND PHASES WITH THE MAJOR NRN STREAM TROF MOVING
OUT OF SRN CANADA RESULTING IN A LARGE UPPER LOW ACRS THE NRN
GREAT LAKES BY LATE SAT. THE ASSOCIATED COLD FRONT WL PUSH THROUGH
THE MID SOUTH LATE THU NIGHT...FRIDAY AND EARLY FRI NIGHT. 

STRONG UPPER SUPPORT AND DECENT LOW LEVEL MOISTURE RETURN COULD
RESULT IN SOME STRONG THUNDERSTORMS ON FRIDAY BUT THAT ALL
DEPENDS ON HOW THE SYSTEM EVENTUALLY EVOLVES. EXPECT CHANCES FOR
PRECIP THU NIGHT...FRIDAY AND FRIDAY EVENING FOLLOWED BY
EXTENSIVE LOW CLOUDINESS LATE FRIDAY NIGHT AND SATURDAY MORNING
AND MUCH COOLER TEMPS. EXPECT HIGHS ONLY AROUND 70 ON SAT ACRS W
TN WHERE THE CLOUDS HANG ON.

SUNDAY AND MONDAY...EXPECT LARGE UPPER LOW SOMEWHERE NEAR THE SRN
AND ERN GREAT LAKES. THIS SOLUTION IS VERY DIFFERENT THAN PREVIOUS
GFS RUNS BUT IT IS SIMILAR TO THE 00Z ECMWF SO CONFIDENCE IS
INCREASING.ATTM WL GO WITH PARTLY CLOUDY SKIES AND TEMPS SLIGHTLY
BELOW NORMAL THOUGH DEPENDING ON THE EXACT LOCATION IT COULD
EASILY BE CLOUDY AND MUCH COOLER.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
MEM  60  87  66  89 /   0   0   0  10 
MKL  51  86  57  88 /   0   0   0  10 
JBR  56  88  59  89 /   0   0   0  10

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
231 PM CDT MON OCT 17 2005

.DISCUSSION...
SUNNY SKIES ACROSS THE MID SOUTH THIS AFTERNOON WITH TEMPS IN THE
MID 70S TO NEAR 80. AIRMASS STILL VERY DRY WITH DEWPOINTS IN THE
UPPER 30S TO AROUND 40 THOUGH MOISTURE STARTING TO WORK INTO
WESTERN AREAS WHERE SOUTHERLY WINDS HAVE DEVELOPED. DEWPOINTS WERE
NEARING 50 OVER PARTS OF EASTERN AR.

TONIGHT...SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE CONTINUES TO SLIP TO THE SE
OVERNIGHT. MIN TEMPS WL GENERALLY BE DICTATED BY THE SFC WINDS
AND DEWPOINTS. LOWEST DEWPOINTS AND LIGHTEST WINDS WL BE ACROSS
SE PARTS OF W TN AND NE MS. HAVE CUT ABOUT 5 DEGREES FROM GUIDANCE
IN THOSE AREAS. EXPECT TEMPS WL DIP INTO THE UPPER 40S
THERE...PERHAPS LOWER. WARMEST TEMPS WL BE ACRS THE DELTA WHERE
LIGHT SSW WINDS WL CONT ALONG WITH INCREASING DEWPOINTS.

TUESDAY THROUGH THURSDAY...UPPER LOW MOVES OUT OF THE SW U.S. AND
INTO THE CNTRL PLAINS BY LATE THU. LARGE DIFFERENCES BETWEEN NAM
AND GFS. NAM WEAKER...FASTER AND FURTHER SOUTH WITH THE SFC LOW.
ATTM STILL PREFER GFS WHICH HAS BEEN CONSISTENT WITH THIS SYSTEM.
WEAK UPPER LEVEL RIDGING WL DEVELOP IN ADVANCE OF THIS SYSTEM AND 
SPREAD ACROSS THE REGION TUE AND WED. 850 MB TEMPS WL REACH 14-16C
ON TUE AND 16C+ ON WED. THIS WL RESULT IN SURFACE TEMPS IN THE MID
AND UPPER 80S ON TUE AND NEAR 90 BY WED AFTN. RECORDS WL BE IN
JEOPARDY WED AFTN WITH THE 4 MAJOR CLIMATE SITES WITHIN REACH.

OCTOBER 19 RECORD HIGH TEMPS
MEMPHIS 88
JACKSON 88
JONESBORO89
TUPELO88

ANOTHER WARM DAY EXPECTED THU THOUGH PERHAPS WITH MORE CLOUDINESS
IT WL BE A COUPLE DEGREES COOLER...MORE LIKE 86-87 DEGREES.

MOVES TO THE NE AND PHASES WITH THE MAJOR NRN STREAM TROF MOVING
OUT OF SRN CANADA RESULTING IN A LARGE UPPER LOW ACRS THE NRN
GREAT LAKES BY LATE SAT. THE ASSOCIATED COLD FRONT WL PUSH THROUGH
