000 
FXUS64 KMEG 171537
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
1037 AM CDT MON OCT 17 2005

.UPDATE...
AN AREA OF MIDDLE CLOUDS ASSOCIATED WITH SHORTWAVE MOVING THROUGH
THE GREAT LAKES WERE MOVING ACROSS SE MO THIS MORNING. MODELS
INDICATE THIS AREA OF MID LEVEL MOISTURE WL WORK ACRS NRN SECTIONS OF
THE MID SOUTH THIS AFTERNOON. WL ADD PARTLY CLOUDY SKIES NORTH OF
DYR. OTHERWISE FORECAST ON TRACK.

&&

.PREV DISCUSSION... (ISSUED 419 AM CDT MON OCT 17 2005) 

DISCUSSION...

SATELLITE SHOWS CLEAR SKIES COVERING THE MID-SOUTH EARLY THIS
MORNING. TEMPERATURES ARE CHILLY WITH UPPER 30S ALONG THE TN RIVER
AND MAINLY 40S ELSEWHERE. 

CURRENT MODELS INDICATE A WEATHER SCENARIO ABOUT AS WE ALREADY
HAVE FORECAST FOR THIS WEEK. SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE WILL MOVE TO
THE EAST OF THE MID-SOUTH THROUGH MID-WEEK ALLOWING WINDS TO TURN
TO THE SOUTHWEST. MEANWHILE...HIGH PRESSURE ALOFT WILL SPREAD OVER
THE AREA. THE NAM INDICATES 850 MB TEMPERATURES OF 18 DEGREES CELSIUS
SPREADING INTO THE MID-SOUTH WEDNESDAY. MEAN ATMOSPHERIC MOISTURE
WILL REMAIN LOW THROUGH MID-WEEK. AS A RESULT...RAIN-FREE WEATHER
WILL CONTINUE THE FIRST HALF OF THIS WEEK WITH TEMPERATURES
CLIMBING WELL ABOVE NORMAL. IN FACT...AFTERNOON HIGHS WEDNESDAY
ARE FORECAST JUST SHY OF THE 90 DEGREE MARK. THE LATEST DAY OF THE
YEAR THAT IT HAS REACHED 90 DEGREES AT THE MEMPHIS INTERNATIONAL
AIRPORT IS OCTOBER 14TH.

THE NEXT CHANCE OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS CONTINUES TO BE
THURSDAY NIGHT INTO FRIDAY NIGHT. WEAKENING LOW PRESSURE SURFACE
AND ALOFT WILL MOVE INTO THE UPPER MIDWEST THURSDAY NIGHT FROM THE
SOUTHWEST. MEANWHILE...A TRAILING COLD FRONT IS FORECAST TO MOVE
INTO EAST AR LATE THURSDAY NIGHT...AND ACROSS THE MID-SOUTH FRIDAY.
THE LATEST GFS IS INDICATING A RATHER VIGOROUS SHORTWAVE MOVING
INTO THE MID-SOUTH FROM THE WEST FRIDAY WITH LIFTED INDICES
FALLING TO BETWEEN MINUS 2 AND MINUS 4. THIS WOULD INDICATE HIGHER
POPS THAN THE 30 PERCENT WE PRESENTLY HAVE GOING. THE ECMWF IS
NOT INDICATING THIS STRONG SHORTWAVE. AS A RESULT...PREFER TO
EXAMINE LATER MODEL RUNS BEFORE RAISING POPS THAT FAR OUT.

COOLER AND DRIER AIR IS STILL FORECAST TO SPREAD INTO THE MID-
SOUTH NEXT WEEKEND AS THE COLD FRONT MOVES TO OUR EAST.

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.
&&

$$

JCL/SJM

FXUS64 KMEG 161815
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
200 PM CDT SUN OCT 16 2005

.DISCUSSION...

HIGH PRESSURE WILL CONTINUE TO BE THE BIG STORY THIS WEEK. THE HIGH 
WILL CONTINUE TO DOMINATE THE WEATHER THROUGH THE END OF THE WEEK. 
THIS WILL KEEP DRY CONDITIONS AROUND THE CWA. CLEAR TO PARTLY CLOUDY 
CONDITIONS WILL CONTINUE TO PREVAIL DURING THIS TIME. A GRADUAL 
WARMING TREND IS EXPECTED AS THE HIGH SHIFTS EASTWARD BY MIDWEEK. 
EXPECT TONIGHTS LOWS TO BE SIMILAR TO LAST NIGHTS WITH LOWS IN THE 
LOWER 40S TO THE LOWER 50S. THE LOWS WILL GRADUALLY WARM TO THE UPPER 
50S TO LOWER 60S BY THE END OF THE WEEK. HIGHS ON MONDAY WILL BE A 
TAD WARMER THAN TODAY WITH READINGS IN THE LOWER 80S. THE HIGHS WILL 
GRADUALLY WARM INTO THE MID AND UPPER 80S BY THE END OF THE WEEK.

MODELS ARE STILL SHOWING A COLD FRONT MOVING THROUGH THE CWA DURING 
THE THURSDAY NIGHT TO FRIDAY NIGHT TIME FRAME. ALTHOUGH THE LATEST 
RUN IS NOT SHOWING AS MUCH RAINFALL THAN PREVIOUS RUNS...WILL KEEP 
20 TO 30 POPS GOING FOR NOW. 

COOLER WEATHER WILL MOVE INTO THE REGION BEHIND THE FRONT FOR THE 
WEEKEND AS HIGH PRESSURE REBUILDS INTO THE CWA. EXPECT HIGHS IN THE 
70S AND LOWS IN THE 40S AND 50S.

FXUS64 KMEG 160903
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
403 AM CDT SUN OCT 16 2005

.DISCUSSION...

IT IS ANOTHER QUIET NIGHT WEATHER-WISE ACROSS THE MID-SOUTH.
COOLER AND DRIER AIR IS SPREADING INTO THE MID-SOUTH FROM THE
NORTH. SURFACE DEWPOINTS HAVE FALLEN INTO THE UPPER 30S ACROSS
PARTS OF NORTHEAST AR AND NORTHWEST TN. 

MODELS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT CONCERNING MID-SOUTH WEATHER FOR THIS
WEEK. THE NEXT CHANCE OF RAIN IS NOT EXPECTED UNTIL THURSDAY NIGHT
AT THE EARLIEST.

TODAY WILL BE ABOUT 5 TO 7 DEGREES COOLER THAN YESTERDAY AS
SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE EXTENDS FROM THE GREAT LAKES TO THE LOWER
MISSISSIPPI RIVER VALLEY. UPPER LEVEL RIDGING WILL ALSO EXTEND
ACROSS THE MID-SOUTH WITH THE MEAN ATMOSPHERIC MOISTURE REMAINING
VERY LOW. A FEW CIRRUS CLOUDS MAY SPILL INTO THE AREA FROM THE
WEST...BUT OTHERWISE CLEAR SKIES WILL PERSIST.

TONIGHT WILL BE A GOOD RADIATIONAL COOLING NIGHT WITH LOW SURFACE
DEWPOINTS...CLEAR SKIES...AND LIGHT WIND.

FOR MONDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY...SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE WILL MOVE TO
OUR SOUTHEAST ALLOWING SURFACE WINDS TO TURN TO THE SOUTHWEST. 
TEMPERATURES WILL BE ON THE INCREASE WITH UPPER 80S POSSIBLE
ACROSS PARTS OF THE AREA BY MID-WEEK AS 850 MB TEMPERATURES CLIMB
ABOVE PLUS 16 DEGREES CELSIUS.  

THE LATEST RUNS OF THE GFS AND ECMWF ARE IN AGREEMENT WITH A COLD
FRONTAL PASSAGE THROUGH THE MID-SOUTH THURSDAY NIGHT AND FRIDAY.
MOST OF THE UPPER LEVEL DYNAMICS WITH THIS SYSTEM ARE FORECAST TO
PUSH WELL TO OUR NORTH WITH INSTABLITY LACKING ACROSS OUR AREA.
POPS OF 20 TO 30 PERCENT FROM THURSDAY NIGHT INTO FRIDAY NIGHT
STILL LOOK GOOD.


000 
FXUS64 KMEG 150901
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
401 AM CDT SAT OCT 15 2005

.DISCUSSION...

IT IS A TYPICAL MID-OCTOBER NIGHT WEATHER-WISE ACROSS THE MID-SOUTH.
SATELLITE SHOWS CLEAR SKIES COVERING MUCH OF THE CONTINENTAL
UNITED STATES INCLUDING THE MID-SOUTH. A LARGE SCALE UPPER LEVEL
RIDGE EXTENDS FROM THE SOUTHERN PLAINS TO THE NORTHERN ROCKIES
WITH THE MID-SOUTH IN NORTHWEST FLOW ALOFT. WATER VAPOR SATELLITE
IMAGERY INDICATES DRY AIR COVERING THE MID-SOUTH AT THE MID AND
UPPER LEVELS. IN FACT...BASED ON SURFACE OBSERVATIONS...THE DRY
AIR EXTENDS CLOSE TO THE GROUND WITH VISIBILITIES HOLDING CLOSE TO
10 MILES THROUGHOUT THE REGION DESPITE LIGHT WINDS...EVEN AT THE
NORMALLY FOGGY LOCATIONS.

MODELS ARE IN AGREEMENT THAT A TRANQUIL WEATHER PATTERN WILL
CONTINUE THROUGH AT LEAST THE MIDDLE OF NEXT WEEK.

CLEAR SKIES WILL PERSIST THROUGH THE WEEKEND WITH A STABLE AND DRY
ATMOSPHERE REMAINING IN PLACE. TEMPERATURES WILL BE A FEW DEGREES
WARMER THAN YESTERDAY...BUT SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE WILL SINK INTO
THE AREA FROM THE NORTH TONIGHT AND SUNDAY COOLING TEMPERATURES
BACK DOWN A FEW DEGREES. THE SURFACE HIGH WILL SLIDE EAST OF THE
MID-SOUTH MONDAY WITH WINDS GRADUALLY TURNING TO THE SOUTHWEST.
THIS WILL ALLOW FOR WARMER TEMPERATURES TOWARD THE MIDDLE OF NEXT
WEEK. A VERY WEAK WEST TO EAST COLD FRONT IS FORECAST TO APPROACH
THE NORTHERN BORDER OF THE MID-SOUTH MONDAY NIGHT AND BECOME
STATIONARY. MOISTURE WILL REMAIN TOO LIMITED AND THE ATMOSPHERE
TOO STABLE FOR ANY RAIN FROM THIS FRONT ACROSS THE MID-SOUTH. 

THE NEXT CHANCE OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS WILL BE ABOUT THURSDAY
NIGHT. LOW PRESSURE SURFACE AND ALOFT IS FORECAST TO MOVE INTO THE
UPPER MIDWEST THURSDAY. A TRAILING COLD FRONT IS FORECAST BY THE
GFS TO MOVE INTO THE MID-SOUTH THURSDAY NIGHT...WITH THE ECMWF A
LITTLE FASTER. MOST OF THE UPPER LEVEL DYNAMICS PUSH TO OUR NORTH.
CURRENT FORECAST OF 20 TO 30 PERCENT POPS FOR THURSDAY NIGHT AND
FRIDAY LOOKS ALRIGHT FOR NOW. HOPEFULLY...LATER MODELS WILL BECOME
IN BETTER AGREEMENT ON TIMING OF THE FRONT.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
404 AM CDT FRI OCT 14 2005

.DISCUSSION...

MIDDLE AND HIGH LEVEL CLOUDS ARE MOVING ACROSS THE MID-SOUTH EARLY 
THIS MORNING. THESE CLOUDS ARE AHEAD OF AN UPPER LEVEL SHORTWAVE
WHICH WILL MOVE QUICKLY THROUGH THE MID-SOUTH FROM THE NORTHWEST
TODAY. THINK BY SUNRISE...MOST OF THE CLOUDS WILL BE FROM WEST TN
INTO NORTH MS WITH CLEARING SKIES ACROSS EAST AR AND THE MO
BOOTHEEL. CLEARING SKIES WILL SPREAD OVER ALL THE MID-SOUTH LATER
THIS MORNING AS THE SHORTWAVE MOVES EAST OF THE AREA BY EARLY
AFTERNOON. THE ATMOSPHERE IS TOO STABLE AND MOISTURE IS TOO
LIMITED FOR ANY RAIN TO OCCUR WITH THIS SHORTWAVE. THE CLOUDS HAVE
PREVENTED MUCH FOG FROM FORMING OVERNIGHT...THUS WILL NOT MENTION
IN THE GRIDS THIS MORNING. HIGH TEMPERATURES WILL BE ABOUT LIKE
YESTERDAY...CONTINUING A LITTLE ABOVE NORMAL FOR THIS TIME OF THE
YEAR.

ONLY MINOR CHANGES ARE EXPECTED IN OUR WEATHER THROUGH THE MIDDLE OF
NEXT WEEK...MAINLY SMALL VARIATIONS IN TEMPERATURES WITH DRY
WEATHER CONTINUING.

SKIES WILL BE MOSTLY CLEAR TONIGHT AND THROUGH THE WEEKEND AS THE
ATMOSPHERE REMAINS STABLE AND DRY. HIGHS WILL BE A DEGREE OR SO
WARMER SATURDAY AS UPPER LEVEL RIDGING INCREASES TO OUR WEST.
NORTHWEST FLOW ALOFT ACROSS THE MID-SOUTH WILL ALLOW COOLER HIGH
PRESSURE TO PUSH INTO THE AREA SATURDAY NIGHT INTO SUNDAY
...PROVIDING SOME VERY NICE FALL WEATHER SUNDAY AND MONDAY. BY
TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY...THE SURFACE FLOW WILL BECOME SOUTHWESTERLY
WITH UPPER LEVEL RIDGING INCREASING ACROSS THE MID-SOUTH. THIS
WILL CAUSE HIGH TEMPERATURES TO WARM INTO THE MIDDLE 80S ACROSS PARTS
OF THE AREA.

THE GFS INDICATES LOW PRESSURE SURFACE AND ALOFT MOVING INTO MO
TOWARD THE SECOND HALF OF NEXT WEEK WITH A TRAILING COLD FRONT
MOVING INTO THE MID-SOUTH THURSDAY NIGHT. MOST OF THE UPPER LEVEL
DYNAMICS PUSH TO OUR NORTH. FOR NOW WILL CONTINUE WITH THE
PRESENT FORECAST OF 20 PERCENT CHANCE OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS
FOR THURSDAY.

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 130904
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
404 AM CDT THU OCT 13 2005

.DISCUSSION...

WEAK SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE ALONG WITH AN UPPER RIDGE OF HIGH
PRESSURE REMAIN IN PLACE OVER THE MID-SOUTH THIS MORNING. THIS HAS
ALLOWED FOR MOSTLY CLEAR SKIES AND PATCHY FOG...SOME DENSE OVER
EASTERN SECTIONS. PESKY LOW CLOUDS THAT HAVE PLAGUED THE REGION FOR
THE PAST COUPLE OF MORNINGS SHOULD NOT BE A PROBLEM THIS MORNING...
WITH NAM REGIONAL FORECAST SOUNDINGS DRIER THAN PREVIOUS MORNINGS
IN THE LOW LEVELS WITH ONLY INDICATIONS OF FOG. ONCE THE PATCHY FOG
BURNS OFF BY MID MORNING...EXPECT A PLEASANT FALL DAY WITH MOSTLY
SUNNY SKIES AND TEMPERATURES RUNNING ABOUT 3 TO 5 DEGREES ABOVE
AVERAGE. EXPECT SOME HIGH CIRRUS CLOUDS TO DEVELOP OVER THE AREA BY
THIS AFTERNOON AHEAD OF AN APPROACHING SHORTWAVE TROUGH CURRENTLY
MOVING INTO THE PLAINS STATES THIS MORNING. THESE HIGH CLOUDS SHOULD
REMAIN THIN ENOUGH THOUGH TO WARRANT MOSTLY SUNNY SKIES THROUGH THE
DAY.

THIS SHORTWAVE TROUGH WILL CONTINUE TO MOVE SOUTHEAST AND ACROSS
THE MID-SOUTH TONIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY. MOISTURE RETURN AHEAD OF THIS
FEATURE APPEARS TO BE NON-EXISTENT...WITH WATER VAPOR IMAGERY
INDICATING PLENTY OF MID AND UPPER LEVEL DRY AIR AHEAD OF THIS
SYSTEM...AND LIGHT NORTHERLY SURFACE FLOW KEEPING ANY LOW LEVEL GULF
OF MEXICO MOISTURE LOCKED INTO THE NORTHERN GULF. THEREFORE...WILL
KEEP A DRY FORECAST GOING...WITH THE SHORTWAVE PASSAGE DRY. THIS
UPPER SHORTWAVE WILL ALSO PUSH A VERY WEAK COLD FRONT/SURFACE
TROUGH ACROSS THE AREA TONIGHT...WITH LOWER DEWPOINTS NOTED BEHIND
THE FRONT. ANOTHER DRY FRONT WILL MOVE ACROSS THE AREA ON SATURDAY
UNDER DRY NORTHWESTERLY FLOW ALOFT. EXPECT TEMPERATURES TO BE A
DEGREE OR TWO COOLER ON FRIDAY...AS THE THERMAL TROUGH ALOFT PUSHES
THROUGH...THEN REMAIN STEADY AROUND 80 DEGREES THROUGH THE WEEKEND.
THESE TEMPERATURES ARE STILL ABOVE SEASONAL AVERAGES FOR THIS TIME
OF YEAR. WITH THE DRY AIRMASS OVERNIGHT...LOWS WILL STILL COOL BACK
INTO THE 50S THIS WEEKEND. DRY WEATHER IS ALSO EXPECTED...SO A VERY
PLEASANT FALL WEEKEND IS IN STORE.

FOR NEXT WEEK...MODEL GUIDANCE STILL INDICATING THAT UPPER LEVEL
ENERGY CURRENTLY MOVING ACROSS THE NORTHERN PACIFIC OCEAN WILL CARVE
OUT A DEEP TROUGH OVER THE WESTERN STATES BY THE END OF THE
WEEKEND...WITH A STRONG UPPER LOW CUTTING OFF OVER THE SOUTHWESTERN
U.S. BY EARLY NEXT WEEK. WITH THESE STRONG HEIGHT FALLS INDICATED
OVER THE SOUTHWESTERN STATES...SHOULD SEE IN RESPONSE SOME UPPER
LEVEL RIDGING DEVELOP FURTHER EAST OVER OUR AREA FOR THE FIRST HALF
OF NEXT WEEK. THIS WILL PROVIDE CONTINUED DRY AND POSSIBLY SLIGHTLY
WARMER WEATHER FOR THE FIRST HALF OF NEXT WEEK. THE CUT OFF LOW IS
THEN FORECAST BY MOST OF THE GLOBAL MODELS TO EJECT OUT TO THE
NORTHEAST BY THE MIDDLE TO END OF NEXT WEEK. THIS SYSTEM MAY BRING
OUR NEXT CHANCES FOR PRECIPITATION...BUT IT IS STILL WAY TOO FAR OUT
BEYOND THE EXTENDED FORECAST PERIOD TO PIN ANYTHING DOWN. SO EXTENDED
PERIOD FOR THIS FORECAST SHOULD REMAIN DRY WITH ABOVE SEASONAL
TEMPERATURES.

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 120857
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
357 AM CDT WED OCT 12 2005

.DISCUSSION...

SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE TO THE NORTHEAST IS ONCE AGAIN KEEPING A
LIGHT NORTHEASTERLY BOUNDARY LAYER FLOW OVER THE MID-SOUTH. LOW
CLOUDS CONFINED MAINLY TO NORTHEAST SECTIONS OF THE FORECAST AREA
EARLY THIS MORNING...WITH MID LEVEL CLOUDS STREAMING NORTHEAST
OVER THE AREA IN ADVANCE OF THE UPPER LEVEL LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM
LIFTING NORTHEAST ACROSS THE PLAINS STATES. NAM FORECAST SOUNDINGS
A BIT DRIER IN THE LOW LEVELS ACROSS THE SOUTHWEST HALF OF THE
FORECAST AREA...AND WITH MID-LEVEL CLOUDS OVERHEAD MAY REDUCE THE
AMOUNT OF LOW CLOUDS OVER JONESBORO TO MEMPHIS TO OXFORD AND
POINTS SOUTHWEST AS COMPARED TO YESTERDAY. ALSO...SURFACE
TEMPERATURE-DEWPOINT SPREAD A BIT GREATER AS COMPARED TO
YESTERDAY MORNING OVER THE SOUTHWEST HALF. STILL LOOKS AS IF
NORTHEAST SECTIONS OF THE FORECAST AREA...INCLUDING JACKSON AND
POINTS NORTHEAST WILL HANG ONTO LOW CLOUDS AGAIN FOR MUCH OF THE
DAY. SKIES SHOULD BECOME PARTLY CLOUDY ACROSS MOST AREAS BY THIS
AFTERNOON...EXCEPT OVER THE ABOVE MENTIONED NORTHEAST PORTIONS OF
THE AREA. HAVE THEREFORE...WENT NEAR GUIDANCE TEMPERATURES OVER
SOUTHWEST HALF OF AREA...WHERE LOW CLOUDS SHOULD BE LESS OF A
PROBLEM BUT STILL SOME MID LEVEL CLOUDS...AND HAVE GONE BELOW
GUIDANCE IN THE NORTHEAST...WHERE LOW CLOUDS SHOULD BE MOST
PERSISTANT.

THE UPPER LEVEL LOW OVER THE NORTH-CENTRAL PLAINS STATES TODAY
SHOULD CONTINUE TO LIFT OUT TO THE NORTHEAST AS A SHORTWAVE
DISTURBANCE MOVING THROUGH THE PACIFIC NORTHWEST CONTINUES TO DROP
SOUTHEASTWARD...RECARVING THE UPPER TROUGH OVER THE PLAINS STATES
AND OVER THE MID-SOUTH FOR THURSDAY NIGHT AND FRIDAY. UNTIL
THEN...EXPECT A FLATTENING UPPER RIDGE AND SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE
TO KEEP DRY WEATHER TONIGHT AND TOMORROW...WITH A BIT WARMER
TEMPERATURES ON THURSDAY. AS THE UPPER LEVEL SHORTWAVE TROUGH AND
VERY WEAK SURFACE COLD FRONT PUSH ACROSS THE AREA THURSDAY NIGHT
INTO FRIDAY...SHOULD BE JUST ENOUGH UPPER LEVEL SUPPORT TO
POSSIBLY SQUEEZE OUT A FEW SHOWERS AND MAYBE AN ELEVATED
THUNDERSTORM. AT THIS POINT...LOW LEVEL MOISTURE RETURN LOOKS
LIMITED AT BEST...WITH NORTHEAST LOW LEVEL FLOW CONTINUING...SO
ANY RAIN ACTIVITY SHOULD BE SPOTTY AND LIGHT...WITH MANY AREAS
REMAINING DRY. BUT STILL FELT THAT A 20 POP WAS WARRENTED AT THIS
POINT...ESPECIALLY OVER NORTHERN AREAS WITH DECENT SHORTWAVE
ENERGY PUSHING THROUGH.

ONCE THE END OF THE WEEK SHORTWAVE MOVES EAST...EXPECT SURFACE
HIGH PRESSURE TO MOVE IN FROM THE NORTHWEST WITH DRY NORTHWESTERLY
FLOW ALOFT EXPECTED. NOT MUCH OF A THERMAL PATTERN CHANGE...SO
EXPECT THE WEEKEND TO BE DRY...WITH NEAR SEASONABLE TEMPERATURES.
THE LATEST RUN OF THE GFS HAS FALLEN INTO LINE WITH THE OTHER
GLOBAL MODELS INCLUDING THE ECMWF AND UKMET WITH THE UPPER LEVEL
ENERGY THAT DROPS INTO THE SOUTHWEST U.S. AND CUTS OFF ANOTHER
DEEP UPPER LOW FOR THE BEGINNING TO MIDDLE OF NEXT WEEK. THIS
MODEL TREND SEEMS MUCH MORE REALISTIC AS COMPARED TO YESTERDAYS
00Z GFS RUN WHICH HAD THE UPPER LOW MUCH FURTHER EAST. THIS WILL KEEP
THE MID-SOUTH UNDER A BUILDING UPPER RIDGE THROUGH MID-WEEK WITH
DRY WEATHER AND NEAR OR SLIGHTLY ABOVE SEASONAL TEMPERATURES
CONTINUING.

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 111912
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
212 PM CDT TUE OCT 11 2005

.DISCUSSION...
SURFACE HIGH OVER THE GREAT LAKES CONTINUES THE NORTHEAST LOW
LEVEL FLOW OVER THE AREA. CLOUDS HAVE AGAIN BEEN VERY STUBBORN TO
BURN OFF TODAY...UNDER INVERSION AROUND 900 MB. THIS HAS HELD
TEMPERATURES DOWN CONSIDERABLY IN AREAS THAT HAVE CLOUDS. SOME AREAS
WILL NOT GET OUT OF THE 60S TODAY.
&&

.SHORT TERM (THROUGH FRIDAY)...
WE HAVE HAD PATCHY DENSE FOG EAST OF THE MISSISSIPPI RIVER THE LAST
2 NIGHTS. AIRMASS HAS NOT CHANGED...SO EXPECT SIMILAR SITUATION
TONIGHT.

NAM HAS HAD A MUCH BETTER HANDLE ON CLOUDS TRAPPED BELOW INVERSION
THAN GFS HAS. NAM MODEL SOUNDINGS FOR MEMPHIS INDICATE THAT CLOUDS
MAY BREAK UP A LITTLE EARLIER TOMORROW THAN TODAY...AND SHOULD NOT
BE A MAJOR ISSUE ON THURSDAY.

UPPER SYSTEM PASSES TO THE NORTH OF THE MIDSOUTH THURSDAY NIGHT INTO
FRIDAY...DRAGGING A COLD FRONT THROUGH THE AREA. THIS FRONT WILL
HAVE LITTLE MOISTURE WITH IT. WHILE THERE COULD BE SOME
PRECIPITATION WITH THIS FRONT...CANNOT SEE GOING ANY HIGHER THAN THE
20 POPS ALREADY IN THE FORECAST.

TEMPERATURES...MODELS HAVE NOT HAD A CONSISTENT HANDLE ON TEMPS FOR
THE LAST SEVERAL DAYS. TRENDING TOWARD NAM SOLUTION...SINCE THAT
MODEL SEEMS TO BE HANDLING THE CLOUD COVER PROBLEMS BETTER. THAT
MEANS UNDERCUTTING THE MAV ACROSS THE BOARD ON HIGHS UNTIL WE LOSE
THE CLOUDS. THURSDAY AND FRIDAY HIGHS A LITTLE CLOSER TO MAV/MEX
GUIDANCE.

&&

.LONG TERM (AFTER FRIDAY)...
12Z GFS HAS FINALLY COME AROUND TO A SOLUTION A LITTLE CLOSER TO
ECMWF AND OTHER MODELS...WITH AN UPPER LOW OVER THE SW US BY
TUESDAY...INSTEAD OF THE BOWLING BALL UPPER LOW IT WAS DEPICTING
OVER MISSOURI AT THIS TIME YESTERDAY.

BASICALLY...EXPECTING DRY EXTENDED FORECAST PERIOD. EXPECTING TEMPS
ABOVE CLIMO...BUT NOT AS HIGH AS MEX.
&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.

WAGNER





000 
FXUS64 KMEG 111456
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
956 AM CDT TUE OCT 11 2005

.MID-MORNING DISCUSSION...
AS FEARED YESTERDAY...NAM HAS A MUCH BETTER HANDLE ON CLOUDS TRAPPED
BELOW INVERSION THAN GFS HAD. NEW NAM MODEL SOUNDINGS FOR MEMPHIS
INDICATE THAT IF WE WERE TO LOSE THE CLOUDS...IT WOULD BE LATE IN
THE AFTERNOON. DISCERNING JUST WHO WILL BREAK OUT OF THE CLOUDS IS
DIFFICULT AT THIS TIME. JBR NEAR THE EDGE OF THE CLOUDS...AND
CLOUDS SEEM TO BE FAIRLY THIN AT MKL. WE ARE STILL AN HOUR OR SO
FROM WHEN WE STARTED SEEING BURNOFF YESTERDAY. AREAS THAT LOSE THE
CLOUDS FAIRLY QUICKLY CAN STILL REACH THEIR FORECAST MAX TEMPS...
BUT THOSE THAT DONT LOSE IT UNTIL LATE AFTERNOON WILL BE 2-3
CATEGORIES BELOW FORECAST MAXES.

PLAN TO DO AN UPDATE AROUND 16Z...WITH HIGH TEMPERATURES BASED ON
CURRENT CLOUD TRENDS.
&&

.EARLIER DISCUSSION ISSUED AT 353 AM CDT...

WEAK SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE CONTINUES TO KEEP LIGHT NORTHEASTERLY
BOUNDARY LAYER FLOW OVER THE MID-SOUTH THIS MORNING. ALSO PLENTY
OF BOUNDARY LAYER MOISTURE STILL HANGING AROUND...SO LOW STRATUS
DECK HAS ONCE AGAIN FORMED OVER MAINLY NORTHERN AND EASTERN
SECTIONS THIS MORNING. THE MAIN FORECAST QUESTION FOR TODAY WILL
BE TO WHAT EXTENT DO THE LOW CLOUDS DEVELOP OVER THE AREA AND HOW
LONG DO THEY LINGER. IT APPEARS THAT THIS LOW LEVEL MOISTURE MAY
REMAIN TRAPPED UNDER A SUBSIDENCE INVERSION OVER THE AREA THROUGH
MOST OF THE MORNING...AS SHORTWAVE UPPER RIDGING PERSISTS OVER THE
MID-SOUTH TODAY. CURRENT THINKING IS THAT LOW CLOUD DECK WILL BE
MOST PREVALENT OVER THE NORTHEAST HALF OF THE AREA THIS MORNING.
LOW CLOUD COVER SHOULD BEGIN TO MIX OUT BY LATE MORNING ACROSS
MANY AREAS...BUT MAY BE STUBBORN TO CLEAR OUT OF FAR NORTHEAST
AREAS EVEN INTO THIS AFTERNOON. THEREFORE...HAVE DECIDED TO GO
MOSTLY CLOUDY THIS MORNING OVER NORTHEAST HALF OF CWA AND EVEN
KEEP MOSTLY CLOUDY ALL DAY FOR FAR NORTHEAST ZONES. FURTHER
SOUTHWEST...ENOUGH DRY AIR SHOULD KEEP SKIES PARTLY CLOUDY...BUT
WILL NEED TO KEEP AN EYE OUT EVEN OVER THESE AREAS THIS
MORNING...AS ENOUGH LOW LEVEL MOISTURE MAY BE PRESENT AND WITH
STEEPING LOW LEVEL LAPSE RATES BELOW THE INVERSION AFTER SUNRISE
MAY INITIATE SOME LOW CLOUD DEVELOPMENT EVEN OVER THESE AREAS. BUT
CONFIDENCE ON THIS LOW ENOUGH TO GO PARTLY CLOUDY FOR THESE AREAS.
WITH LOW CLOUDS LINGERING IN THE NORTHEAST...HAVE UNDERCUT
GUIDANCE TEMPERATURES BY A FEW DEGREES HERE. ELSEWHERE...HAVE
GONE CLOSE TO GUIDANCE TEMPS.

ONCE LOW CLOUDS BURN OFF IN MOST AREAS...SHOULD BE A DECENT
AFTERNOON WITH DRY CONDITIONS AS THE UPPER LEVEL SHORTWAVE RIDGING
PERSISTS OVER THE REGION...ALONG WITH WEAK HIGH PRESSURE AT THE
SURFACE. THROUGH MID WEEK...A DEEP CUTOFF UPPER LEVEL LOW PRESSURE
SYSTEM NOW OVER THE ROCKY MOUNTAIN STATES WILL BEGIN TO LIFT OUT TO
THE NORTHEAST AS A SHORTWAVE TROUGH DIGS INTO THE PACIFIC NORTHWEST.
THIS SHORTWAVE ENERGY SHOULD THEN DROP INTO THE BASE OF THE PLAINS
STATES UPPER TROUGH AND MOVE ACROSS THE AREA THURSDAY NIGHT AND
FRIDAY. UNTIL THEN...EXPECT DRY CONDITIONS WITH PARTLY CLOUDY
SKIES AND SEASONABLE TEMPERATURES TONIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY. AS THE
UPPER SHORTWAVE AND ASSOCIATED WEAK SURFACE FRONT MOVES ACROSS THE
AREA THURSDAY NIGHT AND FRIDAY MORNING...THERE WILL BE A SLIGHT
CHANCE FOR SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS. STILL LOOKS LIKE DEEP
MOISTURE IN ADVANCE OF THIS SYSTEM WILL BE LIMITED...SO IT LOOKS
LIKE 20 POPS AT BEST. WILL LEAVE THIS IN THE FORECAST FOR NOW
UNTIL WE GET CLOSER TO THE EVENT AND RESOLVE MOISTURE QUESTIONS.

HIGH PRESSURE WILL THEN ONCE AGAIN BUILD INTO THE AREA FOR THE
WEEKEND...WITH DRY WEATHER AND SEASONABLE TEMPERATURES. FOR THE
FAR EXTENDED PERIOD...INTO THE BEGINNING OF NEXT WEEK...STILL MANY
MODEL DIFFERENCES WITH RESPECT TO THE MEDIUM RANGE MODEL
GUIDANCE...WITH 00Z GFS DEVELOPING A DEEP CUTOFF UPPER LOW OVER
THE CENTRAL PLAINS STATES WITH A STRONG COLD FRONT PUSHING ACROSS
THE MID-SOUTH BY MONDAY NIGHT. THE ECMWF MUCH LESS AGGRESSIVE WITH
ITS HANDLING OF THE UPPER LEVEL ENERGY AND ALSO DROPS THE UPPER
ENERGY MUCH FURTHER SOUTHWEST. WITH SO MUCH UNCERTAINTY IN THE
EXTENDED MODEL GUIDANCE AND IT BEING THE FAR EXTENDED
PERIOD...HAVE DECIDED TO LEAVE CONDITIONS DRY THROUGH NEXT MONDAY.
TEMPERATURES THROUGH THE EXTENDED SHOULD REMAIN SEASONABLE.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
MEM  75  57  80  58 /  10  10  10  10
MKL  72  53  78  54 /  10  10  10  10
JBR  73  54  78  55 /  10  10  10  10
TUP  75  56  81  57 /  10  10  10  10

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.
&&

$$

WAGNER/JLH

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
353 AM CDT TUE OCT 11 2005

.DISCUSSION...

WEAK SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE CONTINUES TO KEEP LIGHT NORTHEASTERLY
BOUNDARY LAYER FLOW OVER THE MID-SOUTH THIS MORNING. ALSO PLENTY
OF BOUNDARY LAYER MOISTURE STILL HANGING AROUND...SO LOW STRATUS
DECK HAS ONCE AGAIN FORMED OVER MAINLY NORTHERN AND EASTERN
SECTIONS THIS MORNING. THE MAIN FORECAST QUESTION FOR TODAY WILL
BE TO WHAT EXTENT DO THE LOW CLOUDS DEVELOP OVER THE AREA AND HOW
LONG DO THEY LINGER. IT APPEARS THAT THIS LOW LEVEL MOISTURE MAY
REMAIN TRAPPED UNDER A SUBSIDENCE INVERSION OVER THE AREA THROUGH
MOST OF THE MORNING...AS SHORTWAVE UPPER RIDGING PERSISTS OVER THE
MID-SOUTH TODAY. CURRENT THINKING IS THAT LOW CLOUD DECK WILL BE
MOST PREVALENT OVER THE NORTHEAST HALF OF THE AREA THIS MORNING.
LOW CLOUD COVER SHOULD BEGIN TO MIX OUT BY LATE MORNING ACROSS
MANY AREAS...BUT MAY BE STUBBORN TO CLEAR OUT OF FAR NORTHEAST
AREAS EVEN INTO THIS AFTERNOON. THEREFORE...HAVE DECIDED TO GO
MOSTLY CLOUDY THIS MORNING OVER NORTHEAST HALF OF CWA AND EVEN
KEEP MOSTLY CLOUDY ALL DAY FOR FAR NORTHEAST ZONES. FURTHER
SOUTHWEST...ENOUGH DRY AIR SHOULD KEEP SKIES PARTLY CLOUDY...BUT
WILL NEED TO KEEP AN EYE OUT EVEN OVER THESE AREAS THIS
MORNING...AS ENOUGH LOW LEVEL MOISTURE MAY BE PRESENT AND WITH
STEEPING LOW LEVEL LAPSE RATES BELOW THE INVERSION AFTER SUNRISE
MAY INITIATE SOME LOW CLOUD DEVELOPMENT EVEN OVER THESE AREAS. BUT
CONFIDENCE ON THIS LOW ENOUGH TO GO PARTLY CLOUDY FOR THESE AREAS.
WITH LOW CLOUDS LINGERING IN THE NORTHEAST...HAVE UNDERCUT
GUIDANCE TEMPERATURES BY A FEW DEGREES HERE. ELSEWHERE...HAVE
GONE CLOSE TO GUIDANCE TEMPS.

ONCE LOW CLOUDS BURN OFF IN MOST AREAS...SHOULD BE A DECENT
AFTERNOON WITH DRY CONDITIONS AS THE UPPER LEVEL SHORTWAVE RIDGING
PERSISTS OVER THE REGION...ALONG WITH WEAK HIGH PRESSURE AT THE SURFACE.

NORTHEAST AS A SHORTWAVE TROUGH DIGS INTO THE PACIFIC NORTHWEST.

LIKE 20 POPS AT BEST. WILL LEAVE THIS IN THE FORECAST FOR NOW
UNTIL WE GET CLOSER TO THE EVENT AND RESOLVE MOISTURE QUESTIONS.

HIGH PRESSURE WILL THEN ONCE AGAIN BUILD INTO THE AREA FOR THE
WEEKEND...WITH DRY WEATHER AND SEASONABLE TEMPERATURES. FOR THE
FAR EXTENDED PERIOD...INTO THE BEGINNING OF NEXT WEEK...STILL MANY

GUIDANCE...WITH 00Z GFS DEVELOPING A DEEP CUTOFF UPPER LOW OVER

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
845 PM CDT MON OCT 10 2005

.DISCUSSION

INVERSION OVER THE NORTHEASTERN MIDSOUTH IS MAINTAINING A LOW
LEVEL CLD DECK AT THE PRESENT TIME. A SWATH OF HIGH CLDS RUN
ALONG THE MS RIVER IS AT THE FRONT EDGE OF DRIER AIR MOVING INTO
THE AREA. THINK INVERSION WILL MAINTAIN CLDS OVER MUCH OF
NORTHERN AREA AND EVEN MAKE FOR STRATUS OVER THE REST OF THE AREA
LATER TNGT.

EXPECTING CLDS TO BREAK UP AGAIN TUE MORN LIKE THEY DID TDA.

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 101839
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
139 PM CDT MON OCT 10 2005

.SYNOPSIS...
SURFACE PRESSURE PATTERN RATHER WEAK ACROSS THE MIDSOUTH AT MIDDAY.
UPPER LOW LIFTING AWAY TO THE NORTHEAST FROM KENTUCKY...WITH
STRONG UPPER SYSTEM CENTERED OVER THE SOUTHERN ROCKIES.

INVERSION BETWEEN 850 AND 900 MB HAS MOISTURE TRAPPED BELOW IT...
LEAVING CONSIDERABLE STRATUS ACROSS THE AREA. THIS HAS HELD
TEMPERATURES BELOW FORECAST LEVELS BY AS MUCH AS 10 DEGREES. SEEING
SOME BREAKS IN THE CLOUDS...BUT IT IS ALREADY 18Z...SO SOME AREAS
WILL NOT CLEAR COMPLETELY...NOR REACH THEIR FORECAST HIGHS.
&&

.SHORT TERM (THROUGH THURSDAY)...
NAM MODEL SOUNDINGS HAVE BEEN HANDLING INVERSION AND ASSOCIATED
STRATUS BETTER THAN GFS THIS MORNING. THE NAM FORECAST SOUNDINGS
WOULD INDICATE THAT TUESDAY WILL BE A REPLAY OF WHAT IS GOING ON
TODAY. STRATUS LATE TONIGHT...AND TAKING MOST OF TUESDAY TO BREAK
UP AGAIN. THIS WOULD HOLD TEMPERATURES BELOW MAV GUIDANCE. WONT GO
QUITE AS LOW AS THE MET GUIDANCE YET...BUT TREND IT THAT WAY.

UPPER LOW CURRENTLY OVER SOUTHERN ROCKIES LIFTS INTO THE DAKOTAS BY
WEDNESDAY MORNING...KEEPING PRECIPITATION WELL TO OUR WEST. SOUNDINGS
ON WEDNESDAY NOT QUITE AS BULLISH ON LOW LEVEL MOISTURE BEING TRAPPED
UNDER THE INVERSION. A LITTLE BETTER CHANCE OF SUNSHINE THAN TODAY OR
TOMORROW. CURRENT FORECAST TEMPS FOR WEDNESDAY ABOUT A CATEGORY BELOW
MAV GUIDANCE...AND WILL HOLD IT THERE. NAM WOULD ARGUE FOR LOWERING
EVEN FURTHER.

UPPER TROF TO MOVE THROUGH THE AREA LATE THURSDAY. MINOR TIMING
DIFFERENCES BETWEEN MODELS. NAM A LITTLE SLOWER. WE CURRENTLY HAVE
MENTION OF PRECIPITATION IN FOR THURSDAY NIGHT AND FRIDAY...AND NOT
ENOUGH EVIDENCE TO MOVE AWAY FROM THIS FORECAST. THURSDAY PROBABLY
THE WARM DAY OF THE WEEK.
&&

.LONG TERM (AFTER THURSDAY)...
CURRENT GFS RUN SUPP0RTS GOING FORECAST THROUGH ABOUT SATURDAY...WITH
UPPER RIDGE OVER THE CENTER OF THE COUNTRY. AFTER THAT...GFS SEEMS
TO GET LOST...EVENTUALLY DEVELOPING A STRONG UPPER LOW OVER MISSOURI
BY NEXT MONDAY EVENING. THIS SOLUTION IS NOT SUPPORTED BY THE 00Z
RUN OF THE ECMWF...THE 06Z DGEX...THE CANADIAN MODEL...OR BY PREVIOUS
RUNS OF THE GFS. AFTER SATURDAY...12Z RUN OF GFS DISCOUNTED FOR THIS
FORECAST PERIOD. MOST MEDIUM RANGE MODELS INDICATE THAT IF THERE IS
GOING TO BE A CLOSED LOW OVER THE MIDDLE OF THE U.S...PROBABLY
WONT BE BEFORE THE END OF NEXT WEEK.

UPPER RIDGE REMAINS OVER THE EAST HALF OF THE U.S. THROUGH NEXT
MONDAY. AFTER THE CHANCE OF PRECIPITATION EARLY IN THE EXTENDED
PERIOD...THURSDAY NIGHT AND FRIDAY...NO PRECIPITATION EXPECTED.
HAVE TRENDED WEEKEND MAXES UP A LITTLE BIT...BUT NOT TO POINT OF MEX
DATA OR HPC.
&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.
&&

$$

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 101427
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
927 AM CDT MON OCT 10 2005

.MID MORNING UPDATE...
UPPER LOW LIFTING AWAY TO THE NORTHEAST THIS MORNING.
UNFORTUNATELY...MOISTURE STILL TRAPPED BELOW INVERSION AROUND 850
MB...GIVING A RATHER EXTENSIVE STRATUS DECK. COLUMN APPEARS TO BE
DRYING...AND EXPECT MUCH OR ALL OF STRATUS DECK TO MIX OUT DURING
THE MORNING. SOUNDINGS...HOWEVER...INDICATE THAT WE WILL LIKELY NOT
TOTALLY GET RID OF INVERSION. THIS LEAVES SOME POTENTIAL FOR AREAS
TO REMAIN CLOUDY. WILL KEEP CLOSE EYE ON THIS.

MAX TEMP FORECAST IS REASONABLE...BUT IF CLOUDS ARE SLOW TO CLEAR...
WOULD NEED TO LOWER SOME HIGH TEMP FORECASTS CONSIDERABLY. WILL
CONTINUE TO MONITOR THROUGH THE MORNING.
&&

.EARLY MORNING UPDATE ISSUED AT 555 AM...

LOW CLOUDS SURGING WESTWARD INTO MUCH OF THE MID SOUTH EARLY THIS
MORNING. WILL GO AHEAD AND UPDATE FORECAST TO REFLECT MOSTLY
CLOUDY CONDITIONS FOR ALL AREAS THIS MORNING. CLOUDS WL SCT OUT
LATER THIS MORNING AND AFTN.

&&

.PREV DISCUSSION... (ISSUED 215 AM CDT MON OCT 10 2005)

DISCUSSION...

CURRENT...AN UPPER LOW WAS SITUATED OVER THE NE SECTION OF WEST TN
THIS MORNING. LOW CLOUDS WERE SPREAD ACRS NEARLY ALL OF WEST TN...
PARTS OF EASTERN AR AND EXTREME NORTHERN MS. THIS MORNING TEMPS
RANGED FROM THE LOWER AND MID 50S WITH LIGHT AND VARIABLE WINDS.

TODAY AND TONIGHT...EXPECT LOW CLOUDS TO HANG TOUGH ACRS WEST TN
THROUGH THE MORNING HOURS. CLOUDS SHOULD MIX OUT AS THE DAY
PROGRESSES AND AS THE SHORTWAVE RIDGE BUILDS ACRS THE REGION.
THESE CLOUDS WL KEEP AFTN HIGH TEMPS DOWN A BIT...ESPECIALLY ACRS
WEST TN. HAVE CUT A FEW DEGREES FROM THE PREVIOUS FORECAST. UPPER
RIDGE WL BE CENTERED OVER THE AREA TONIGHT. TEMP GUIDANCE SEEMS
FINE WITH READINGS IN THE LOWER 50S. HOWEVER IF IT COMPLETELY
CLEARS OUT UPPER 40S MAY BE MORE WIDESPREAD.

TUESDAY THROUGH THURSDAY...MAJOR UPPER LOW WL MOVE FROM THE
ROCKIES INTO THE NRN GREAT LAKES DURING THIS TIME FRAME. MID SOUTH
PLACED IN AN AREA OF WSW FLOW ALOFT WITH NO SURFACE FRONTS OR
SIGNIFICANT UPPER LEVEL DYNAMICS TO CONTEND WITH. SHOULD BE DRY
AND MILDER WITH HIGHS IN THE UPPER 70S...MAYBE 80.

THURSDAY NIGHT AND FRIDAY...UPPER TROF SWINGS THROUGH WITH A WEAK
COLD FRONT. SYSTEM CONTINUES TO LOOK MOISTURE STARVED SO 20 POPS
ARE ALL THAT WARRANTED ATTM.

FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY...HIGH PRESSURE SLIDES EAST ACROSS
THE REGION DURING THE PERIOD WITH DRY AND MILD CONDITIONS
EXPECTED.

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.
&&

$$

WAGNER/SJM

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 092345
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
645 PM CDT SUN OCT 9 2005

.DISCUSSION...LATEST INFRARED SATELLITE IMAGES/LOCAL PROFILERS SHOW 
MID LEVEL CIRCULATION BEGINNING TO EJECT INTO KENTUCKY/OHIO VALLEY. 
TRAILING EDGE OF LIGHT RAIN ACROSS THE EASTERN THIRD OF THE FORECAST 
AREA AS UPPER LEVEL RIDGING SLOWLY BUILDING INTO THE MID SOUTH. WILL 
BE ISSUING AN UPDATE TO REMOVE RAIN FROM THE FORECAST GRIDS AND TO 
ADJUST CLOUD COVER. TEMPERATURES TONIGHT LOOK GOOD AND WILL ONLY 
MAKE MINOR CHANGES BASED ON CURRENT TRENDS.

UPDATED GRIDS WILL BE PUBLISHED SHORTLY.

CJC

.PREV DISCUSSION...ISSUED 254 PM CDT SUN OCT 9 2005...

AN UPPER VORT IS LOCATED OVER NORTHWEST MISSISSIPPI. THIS VORT IS
EXPECTED TO CONTINUE TO MOVE TOWARDS THE NORTHEAST TONIGHT.
SCATTERED SHOWERS AND THUNDERSHOWERS HAVE MOVED THROUGH THE MID
SOUTH TODAY. SATELLITE SHOWS AN AREA OF MAINLY STRATOCU ACROSS
WEST TN AND INTO PARTS OF NORTH MS AND EAST AR. MUCH OF THESE
CLOUDS HAVE A DIURNAL CONVECTIVE ELEMENT SO EXPECT A GENERAL
CLEARING TREND AFTER SUNSET. PRECIPITATION SHOULD QUICKLY DIMINISH
AS WELL. 

A SHORTWAVE RIDGE WILL BUILD OVER THE REGION TOMORROW. THE NAM
CONTINUES TO SHOW A GREAT DEAL OF LOW LEVEL MOISTURE AT THE 925MB.
THIS CONTINUES TO AFFECT THE GUIDANCE NUMBERS MOST NOTABLY ON
TUESDAY BY PRODUCING CLOUD COVER ON THE MET. WILL CONTINUE TO SIDE
WITH THE GFS SOLUTION AND MAV NUMBERS GIVEN THE POOR PERFORMANCE
OF THE NAM RECENTLY IN HANDLING THE LOW LEVEL MOISTURE. AN UPPER
SHORTWAVE WILL MOVE THROUGH ON WEDNESDAY BUT GFS CONTINUES TO
SHOW THAT THE LIFT ASSOCIATED WITH THIS SYSTEM IS WEAK AND THE
AMOUNT OF MOISTURE IS INSIGNIFICANT. GFS SHOWS A COLD FRONT MOVING
THROUGH LATER IN THE WEEK WHICH MAY HAVE ENOUGH LIFT TO PRODUCE
SOME SHOWERS AND THUNDERSHOWERS.


&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.
&&

$$

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 091145
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
645 AM CDT SUN OCT 9 2005

.UPDATE...

UPPER LOW HAS MOVED INTO SOUTHEAST ARKANSAS AND CONVECTION
CONTINUES TO INCREASE ACROSS NRN MS. ISOLATED LIGHTNING STRIKES
HAVE ALSO BEEN RECORDED. GIVEN RECENT TRENDS AND FORECAST TRACK OF
THE UPPER LOW WL INCREASE POPS TO 30 PERCENT AND ADD MENTION OF
THUNDER ACRS THE ENTIRE CWFA.

&&

.PREV DISCUSSION... (ISSUED 217 AM CDT SUN OCT 9 2005) 

DISCUSSION...
UPPER LOW CENTERED OVER THE ARKLATEX THIS MORNING. SAT IMAGERY
INDICATES A GOOD DEAL OF MIDDLE AND HIGH CLOUDS ACRS THE REGION
WHILE THE KNQA 88D DEPICTS A BAND OF LIGHT SHOWERS FROM ARG-MEM-
TUP. TEMPS WERE GENERALLY IN THE LOWER 50S WITH LIGHT NORTHERLY
SURFACE WINDS.

TODAY...THE CENTER UPPER LOW WL TRACK ACRS NRN MS THIS AFTN. A GOOD
DEAL OF MID LEVEL MOISTURE WL RESULT IN A MOSTLY CLOUDY AND COOL
DAY WITH TEMPS IN THE MID AND UPPER 60S. THE BIG QUESTION WL BE PRECIP
CHANCES. THERE IS A GOOD DEAL OF DRY AIR BELOW 800 MB BUT PRECIP
ALREADY REACHING THE GROUND HERE IN MEMPHIS. MORE SHOWER ACTIVITY
WAS ALREADY DEVELOPING ACRS SRN AR IN ADVANCE OF THE UPPER LOW
AND THIS PRECIP MAY TRACK ACRS THE AREA DURING THE DAY. WL NEED
TO GO AHEAD AND ADD A 20 POP ACRS THE ENTIRE AREA.

TONIGHT...UPPER LOW WL TRACK INTO MID TN TONIGHT. SKIES WL CLEAR
FROM THE WEST WITH CLOUDS LINGERING LONGEST ALONG THE TN RIVER
VALLEY. GUIDANCE TEMPS LOOK FINE WITH UPPER 40S AND LOWER 50S
EXPECTED.

MON AND TUE...SHORTWAVE UPPER RIDGE BUILDS ACRS THE REGION WITH
LOW 1000-500 MB MEAN RH VALUES. SHOULD BE PLENTY OF SUNSHINE AND
GRADUAL WARMING TEMPS. LOW-MID 70S FOR MON AND MID-UPPER 70S ON
TUE.

WED AND THU...ECMWF AND GFS MOVE LARGE UPPER LOW OUT OF THE
PLAINS AND INTO THE GREAT LAKES REGION PLACING THE MID SOUTH IN A
DRY SW FLOW ALOFT WITH LIGHT NORTHERLY FLOW AT THE SFC. EXPECT DRY
AND MILD CONDS.

FRI AND SAT...TROF AXIS SWINGS THROUGH THE AREA WITH A WEAK SFC
FRONT. THERE IS A SLIM CHANCE OF PRECIP DURING THIS TIME FRAME BUT
MOISTURE AND LIFT ARE VERY MARGINAL. SO NO NEED TO ADD POPS TO
THE FORECAST ATTM. UPPER RIDGING BUILDS ACRS THE REGION ON SAT
WITH DRY AIRMASS AND CONTINUED MILD TEMPS.

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.
&&

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 090122
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
815 PM CDT SAT OCT 8 2005

.DISCUSSION...00Z UPPER AIR ANALYSIS PLACES UPPER LEVEL LOW NEAR THE 
RED RIVER VALLEY. SOME UPPER LEVEL DIVERGENCE PRESENT ALSO NOTED 
ACROSS THE LOWER MISSISSIPPI VALLEY THIS EVENING. MAIN QUESTION THIS 
EVENING IS STILL RAINFALL POTENTIAL.

WSR-88D RADAR TRENDS OVER THE PAST FEW HOURS HAVE SHOWN A DECREASE 
IN RETURNS WITH SPRINKLES AT BEST ACROSS PORTIONS OF NORTHERN 
MISSISSIPPI WITH LOW LEVEL DRY AIR IN PLACE ACROSS MUCH OF THE 
FORECAST AREA. SEE NO REASON AT THIS TIME TO REMOVE SPRINKLES FROM 
FORECAST WITH SOME MID LEVEL MOISTURE PRESENT...700-500 MB LAYER 
LAPSE RATES AROUND 6 C/KM...AND SOME UPPER LEVEL DIVERGENCE ACROSS 
THE MID SOUTH. WILL ISSUE AN UPDATE TO ADJUST CLOUD COVER FOR 
CURRENT TRENDS WITH MOST AREAS ALREADY BECOMING CLOUDY/MOSTLY 
CLOUDY. TEMPERATURES LOOK OKAY AND WILL MAKE ONLY MINOR TWEAKS. 

UPDATED GRIDS WILL BE OUT SHORTLY.

.PREV DISCUSSION...ISSUED 308 PM CDT SAT OCT 8 2005...

AN UPPER VORT MAX IS OVER EASTERN TEXAS. MID LEVEL MOISTURE IS
ADVANCING INTO THE MID SOUTH AHEAD OF THIS SYSTEM. RADAR HAS
DETECTED A FEW ECHOS BUT THE SOUNDINGS SHOW THAT THE LOW LEVELS
ARE EXTREMELY DRY SO DO NOT EXPECT MUCH MORE THAN SPRINKLES FROM
THESE RETURNS. THE RETURNS ARE DUE TO AN AREA OF LIFT CAUSED BY
UPPER LEVEL DIVERGENCE AHEAD OF THE VORT.

THE UPPER VORT WILL SWING THROUGH THE REGION ON SUNDAY. LOW LEVELS
STILL LOOK RATHER DRY SO DO NOT EXPECT MUCH MORE THAN A FEW
SPRINKLES AROUND DURING THE DAY. BOTH GFS/NAM SHOW ENOUGH MID
LEVEL MOISTURE TO SUPPORT MOSTLY CLOUDY FORECAST OVER MUCH OF THE
REGION. CLOUD COVER WILL LIKELY KEEP TEMPS IN THE MID TO UPPER
60S. 

CLEARING SKIES ARE EXPECTED TOMORROW NIGHT AS THE VORT MOVES AWAY
FROM THE REGION AND A SHORTWAVE RIDGE BUILDS OVER THE AREA. THE
MET GUIDANCE IS NOTABLY COOLER AND NOTABLY CLOUDIER. THE NAM HAS A
GREAT AMOUNT OF LOW LEVEL MOISTURE LINGERING OVER THE AREA AND
LOOKS EXTREMELY DUBIOUS. FAVOR MAV GUIDANCE WHICH APPEARS TO
HANDLE THE LOW LEVEL MOISTURE FIELDS MUCH BETTER. 

ON WEDNESDAY...A WEAK COLD FRONT WILL MOVE THROUGH THE REGION.
MOISTURE RETURN IS A PROBLEM AND RAIN CHANCES APPEAR TO BE TOO LOW
TO YET MENTION IN THE FORECAST. HIGH PRESSURE WILL PROVIDE DRY
WEATHER AND NEAR NORMAL TEMPS FOR LATE WEEK.

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.
&&

$$

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 080757
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
257 AM CDT SAT OCT 8 2005

.DISCUSSION...
MOSTLY CLEAR SKIES ACRS THE REGION THIS MORNING WITH A FEW MID AND
HIGH CLOUDS PASSING THROUGH. NORTHERLY BREEZE CONTINUES TO BRING
COOL AIR INTO THE MID SOUTH WITH TEMPS DROPPING INTO THE UPPER 40S
ACRS NRN SXNS. MID SOUTH WEDGED BETWEEN LOW PRESSURE ACRS THE 
SOUTHEAST STATES AND SFC HIGH PRESSURE ACRS THE MS VALLEY. UPPER
TROF WAS IN THE PROCESS OF CUTTING OFF ACRS THE SRN PLAINS. 

TODAY...UPPER LOW WL MOVE EAST INTO THE ARKLATEX BY LATE THIS
AFTERNOON. THIS FEATURE SHOULD BRING SOME CLOUDS BACK INTO THE
AREA BUT LITTLE ELSE. WITH COOL NORTHERLY SFC FLOW CONTINUING
EXPECT ANOTHER DAY WITH HIGHS MAINLY IN THE UPPER 60S...WHICH IS
ABOUT 8-10 DEGREES COOLER THAN NORMAL.

TONIGHT AND SUNDAY...UPPER LOW MOVES INTO THE DELTA AND ACROSS THE
AREA ON SUNDAY. EXPECT SOME CLOUDINESS BUT LIFT AND MOISTURE
INSUFFICIENT FOR ANY PRECIP. MOS NUMBERS LOOK FINE WITH READINGS
IN THE 46-51 DEGREE RANGE TONIGHT. WITH LOWER HEIGHTS AND SOME
CLOUDS HIGH TEMPS ON SUNDAY WL CONT TO BE BELOW NORMAL.

MONDAY AND TUESDAY...UPPER LOW PULLS TO THE NORTHEAST WHILE A WEAK UPPER
RIDGE BUILDS ACRS THE REGION. VERY DRY AIRMASS BUILDS INTO THE
REGION RESULTING IN PLENTY OF SUNSHINE AND WARMER TEMPS. HIGH TEMPS WL
NUDGE CLOSER TO NORMAL...MID TO UPPER 70S THANKS TO HIGHER HEIGHTS
AND SUNSHINE.

WEDNESDAY THROUGH FRIDAY...NEXT UPPER LOW MOVES INTO THE UPPER MS
VALLEY ON WED. A VERY WEAK FRONT MAY MOVE THROUGH THE REGION WED
NIGHT OR THU BUT THIS SYSTEM WL BE MOISTURE STARVED WITH NO LOW
LEVEL RETURN FROM THE GULF AND DRY SW FLOW ALOFT. EXPECT MILD AND
DRY CONDS.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
MEM  68  51  69  52 /   0   0  10  10 
MKL  68  46  69  49 /   0   0  10  10 
JBR  67  46  69  49 /   0   0  10  10 
TUP  69  49  72  52 /   0   0  10  10

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 080130
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
828 PM CDT FRI OCT 7 2005

.DISCUSSION...00Z UPPER AIR ANALYSIS PLACES LONGWAVE TROUGH FROM 
ONTARIO/QUEBEC TO THE WESTERN TEXAS. A SECONDARY MID LEVEL TROUGH 
EXTENDS FROM THE TENNESSEE VALLEY TO THE PANHANDLE OF FLORIDA. 
INFRARED SATELLITE IMAGERY SHOWS MID/HIGH LEVEL CLOUDS DISSIPATING 
AS STRONG SUBSIDENCE CONTINUES TO SPILL INTO THE MID SOUTH. WILL 
MAKE SOME MINOR ADJUSTMENTS TO CLOUD COVER/TEMPERATURES/WINDS BASED 
UPON CURRENT TRENDS. 

UPDATED GRIDS WILL BE PUBLISHED SHORTLY.

CJC
 
.PREV DISCUSSION...ISSUED 243 PM CDT FRI OCT 7 2005...

SATELLITE SHOWS AN ARES OF LOW STRATUS EXTENDING FROM NEAR
SAVANNAH TO AROUND TUPELO AND THROUGH GREENWOOD. THESE CLOUDS
HAVE BEEN PROGRESSIVELY MOVING TOWARDS THE SOUTHEAST AHEAD OF AN
APPROACHING SHORTWAVE. THERE IS AN AREA OF SCATTERED TO BROKEN MID
LEVEL CLOUDS ACROSS ARKANSAS THAT IS ASSOCIATED WITH THE SHORTWAVE
TROUGH. 

LOW STRATUS WILL LIKELY HANG ON SOUTHEAST OF TUPELO INTO THE
EVENING. THE EASTWARD PROGRESSION OF THE SHORTWAVE SHOULD PUSH
THESE CLOUDS OUT OF MISSISSIPPI SOMETIME AFTER MIDNIGHT. THIS IS
THE SOLUTION OFFERED BY THE GFS AND IS SUPPORTED BY SATELLITE
TRENDS AS OPPOSED TO THE NAM SOLUTION WHICH HANGS ON TO THE LOW
LEVEL MOISTURE OVER MUCH OF WEST TN AND NORTH MS. WILL CONTINUE
PARTLY CLOUDY WORDING ELSEWHERE WITH SATELLITE SHOWING SOME MID
LEVEL CLOUDS IN THE SOUTHWEST FLOW OVER ARKANSAS WHICH COULD DRIFT
THROUGH THE REGION TONIGHT. GOOD AGREEMENT BETWEEN THE MAV/MET
GUIDANCE. WITH WINDS REMAINING UP TONIGHT SEE NO AREAS FOR
SIGNIFICANT IMPROVEMENT OVER THE GUIDANCE. 

HIGH PRESSURE WILL CONTINUE TO BUILD OVER THE REGION TOMORROW.
FAVOR MAV GUIDANCE...THE MET GUIDANCE LOOKS A LITTLE OVERDONE WITH
RESPECT TO CLOUD COVER AS THE MOISTURE AXIS THAT IS CURRENTLY OVER
ARKANSAS MOVES OVER THE MIDSOUTH. FEEL THAT THESE CLOUDS WILL BE
MORE SCATTERED THAN ANYTHING AS DRY AIR CONTINUES TO WORK INTO THE
REGION. 

AN UPPER VORT THAT IS OVER THE SOUTHERN PLAINS TODAY WILL BEGIN TO
ARRIVE ON SUNDAY. A FEW CLOUDS ARE LIKELY AHEAD AND WITH THE VORT
SATURDAY NIGHT AND SUNDAY. DEPTH OF THE ATMOSPHERE LOOKS TOO DRY
TO SUPPORT RAIN CHANCES. MET GUIDANCE IS NOTABLY COOLER ON SUNDAY
THAN THE MAV OR FWC. NOT THAT THE NAM BRINGS QUITE A BIT OF LOW
LEVEL MOISTURE AT 925MB INTO THE REGION FROM THE NORTH AND EAST
WHEREAS THE GFS DOES NOT REALLY SHOW THAT MUCH MOISTURE BEING
PUMPED IN WITH THE VORT. AT THIS TIME NOT WILLING TO LOWER
FORECAST TEMPS ON POSSIBLE LOW STRATUS 48 HOURS OUT.

DRY WEATHER AND GRADUAL WARMING TREND SHOULD CONTINUE INTO MID
WEEK AS A SHORTWAVE RIDGE MOVES OVER THE REGION. A WEAK COLD FRONT
ASSOCIATED WITH A SHORTWAVE MOVING OUT FROM A DEEP TROUGH OVER THE
WESTERN PLAINS WILL MOVE THROUGH ON WEDNESDAY. VERTICAL MOTION
WITH THE FRONT AND MOISTURE DOES NOT SUPPORT SIGNIFICANT RAIN
CHANCES. DRY WEATHER SHOULD CONTINUE THROUGH THE REST OF THE WEEK
AS HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS IN BEHIND THE FRONT.

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.
&&

$$

VALLE

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
1033 AM CDT FRI OCT 7 2005

.DISCUSSION...

SATELLITE SHOWS LOW STRATUS LINGERING SOUTHEAST OF A LINE FROM
PARIS TO JACKSON TO MEMPHIS AND CLARKSDALE. THE BACK EDGE OF THESE
CLOUDS ARE GRADUALLY MOVING TOWARDS THE SOUTHEAST AHEAD OF AN
APPROACHING SHORTWAVE TROUGH. THIS GRADUAL CLEARING TREND SHOULD
CONTINUE THIS AFTERNOON ALTHOUGH THE 12Z ETA SHOWS THE LOW LEVEL
MOISTURE HANGING ON EAST OF A LINE FROM IUKA TO TUPELO TO BRUCE.
THIS AREA MAY END UP MIXING OUT THE LOW STRATUS BEFORE THE
AFTERNOON IS OUT. HOWEVER MODEL SOUNDINGS DO NOT REALLY SUPPORT
THIS. NO OBVIOUSLY ADJUSTMENTS NEEDED TO THE TEMP FORECAST FOR TODAY.

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 070810
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
310 AM CDT FRI OCT 7 2005

.DISCUSSION...

MID SOUTH WAS CAUGHT BETWEEN STACKED LOW PRESSURE ACROSS THE
SOUTHEAST U.S. AND AN UPPER TROF THE PLAINS THIS MORNING. CLOUDS COVER
MOST OF THE ERN HALF OF THE CWA WITH PARTLY CLOUDY CONDS ALONG THE
RIVER AND TO THE WEST. BRISK NORTHERLY WINDS WERE USHERING IN
COOL...DRY AIR WITH TEMPS IN THE 50S THIS MORNING.

TODAY...LOW PRESSURE REMAINS OVER THE SOUTHEAST U.S. TODAY WHILE THE
UPPER TROF MOVES ACRS THE CNTRL STATES. THE NORTHERN PART OF THIS
TROF WL MOVE INTO THE OH VALLEY WHILE THE SOUTHERN PART...LOCATED
OVER THE SOUTHERN PLAINS BY 00Z...IS IMPEDED BY THE SYSTEM OVER
THE SOUTHEAST. AS A RESULT A CLOSED LOW FORMS OVER THE SOUTHERN
PLAINS TONIGHT. 1000-500MB MOISTURE FIELDS INDICATE A GOOD DEAL OF
CLOUDINESS ACRS ERN SXNS TODAY WITH PARTLY CLOUDY SKIES FROM THE
RIVER TO THE WEST. TEMPS WL REMAIN QUITE COOL UNDER BRISK
NORTHERLY WINDS...READINGS WL BE IN THE MID 60S.

TONIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY NIGHT...AN UPPER LOW WL MOVE SLOWLY ACRS
THE REGION DURING THE TIME FRAME AS A STRONG UPPER LOW PUSHES
INTO THE WESTERN PLAINS. EXPECT COOLER THAN NORMAL TEMPS AND
PERIODS OF CLOUDS AND SUN. NOT ENUF LIFT AND MOISTURE FOR PRECIP
WITH THIS SYSTEM. DECENT SFC GRADIENT ACRS THE AREA TONIGHT WL
KEEP TEMPS FROM FREE FALLING.

MONDAY AND TUESDAY...WEAK UPPER RIDGE BUILDS OVER THE REGION AFTER
THE UPPER LOW EXITS AND IN ADVANCE OF THE NEXT SYSTEM MOVING INTO
THE PLAINS. VERY DRY AIRMASS BUILDS IN WITH LITTLE IN THE WAY OF
CLOUD COVER. A WARMING TREND WL RESULT IN HIGH TEMPS IN THE MID
AND UPPER 70S BOTH DAYS.

WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY...UPPER RIDGE MOVES EAST AS NEXT TROF MOVES
INTO THE MS RIVER VALLEY. GFS INDICATES A LACK OF MOISTURE AND
DYNAMICS WITH THIS SYSTEM AND A WEAK FRONTAL PASSAGE. AT THIS TIME
WL CONT DRY AND MILD FORECAST.

&&


000 
FXUS64 KMEG 070127
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
825 PM CDT THU OCT 6 2005

.DISCUSSION...
THE EASTERN PART OF THE FORECAST AREA IS SANDWICHED BETWEEN THE 
INFLUENCE OF THE COLD FRONT AND THE INFLUENCE FROM THE SOUTHEAST 
U.S. TROPICAL SYSTEM. THIS HAS CAUSED SINKING AIR ESPECIALLY ACROSS 
PARTS OF NORTH MISSISSIPPI. MOST OF THE VERY LIGHT/WEAK ECHOS THAT 
WERE OCCURRING OVER ALABAMA HAS DISSIPATED. THIS WILL SQUASH ANY 
CHANCES THE EASTERN PARTS OF THE FORECAST AREA HAD FOR 
MEASURABLE PRECIPITATION OVERNIGHT. THUS THE FORECAST WILL BE 
UPDATED TO ACCOUNT FOR A SLIGHT CHANGE IN CLOUD COVER AND THE 
REMOVAL OF RAIN CHANCES. MOSTLY CLOUDY CONDITIONS WILL EXIST FOR THE 
MAJORITY OF THE MIDSOUTH TONIGHT. NO OTHER CHANGES NEEDED. 

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 061952
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
251 PM CDT THU OCT 6 2005

.DISCUSSION...

SURFACE COLD FRONT HAS BECOME NEARLY INDISTINGUISHABLE ACROSS THE 
REGION. IT MAY LIE BETWEEN THE NORTHEASTERLY WINDS OVER NORTHEAST MS 
ASSOCIATED WITH THE REMNANTS OF TROPICAL DEPRESSION TAMMY AND THE 
NORTHWESTERLY WINDS OVER THE REST OF THE REGION. THE CENTER OF WHAT 
REMAINS OF TAMMY IS NOW OVER THE FLORIDA PANHANDLE. SATELLITE HAS 
SHOWN A LOW STRATUS DECK PROGRESSIVELY MOVING SOUTHEASTWARD ACROSS 
THE REGION. THIS DECK HAS BEGUN TO BREAK UP IN THE AFTERNOON 
HEATING. MEANWHILE CLOUDS ARE SLOWLY WORKING INTO NORTHEAST MS FROM 
THE EAST...THIS ASSOCIATED WITH THE TROPICAL SYSTEM. THE GFS/NAM 
APPEAR TO BE TOO AGGRESSIVE WITH THE AMOUNT OF RAIN MOVING ACROSS 
NORTH ALABAMA AND INTO NORTHEAST MS THIS AFTERNOON. THE RUC HAS HAD 
THE BEST HANDLE ON THIS SITUATION. FEEL THAT THE BEST CHANCES FOR 
RAIN TONIGHT ACROSS THE MIDSOUTH WILL BE JUST WEST OF THE TENNESSEE 
RIVER. EVEN AT THAT RAIN AMOUNTS SHOULD BE UNIMPRESSIVE MAYBE A FEW 
HUNDREDTHS AT BEST. DUE TO THE MIXING OF THE LOW STRATUS THAT HAS 
OCCURRED THIS AFTERNOON AND CONTINUED ADVECTION OF DRIER AIR FROM 
THE NORTHWEST...FEEL THAT THE ONLY AREAS THAT MAY BE CLOUDY ARE 
AREAS NEAR AND EAST OF JACKSON TO OXFORD. THIS CLOUD COVER WILL BE 
ASSOCIATED WITH THE TROPICAL SYSTEM. NO MAJOR CHANGES MADE TO 
FORECAST LOWS.

UPPER TROUGH ASSOCIATED WITH THE COLD FRONT SHOULD PROGRESS ACROSS 
THE AREA TOMORROW. THIS SHOULD LIFT ANY LINGERING CLOUD COVER FROM 
TAMMY AWAY FROM THE REGION BY AFTERNOON. MAV IS ABOUT 5 DEGREES 
WARMER THAN MET/FWC GUIDANCE ACROSS THE REGION BEGINNING TOMORROW 
NIGHT. ALTHOUGH THE MODELS ARE SIMILAR IN THEIR HANDLING OF 850 
TEMPS THEY ARE QUITE DIFFERENT IN TERMS OF 1000MB TEMPS. THIS 
INDICATES A DISAGREEMENT IN THE STRENGTH OF THE SHALLOW COLD POOL. 
GIVEN THE TIME OF YEAR YET...FEEL THAT THE NAM MAY BE TOO AGGRESSIVE 
IN THE SOUTHWARD PROGRESSION OF THE COLD AIR. 

MODELS INDICATE A STRONG VORT MOVING THROUGH THE REGION FROM THE 
SOUTHWEST ON SUNDAY. THIS VORT IS EXPECTED TO FORM IN THE SOUTHERN 
PLAINS TOMORROW. IT IS ASSOCIATED WITH THE SHORTWAVE TROUGH THAT 
WILL MOVE THROUGH OUR REGION TOMORROW AFTERNOON. THIS VORT WILL 
BECOME CUT OFF FROM THE MAIN FLOW AND WILL BE EJECTED OUT AS A 
STRONG UPPER TROUGH DIGS INTO THE WESTERN US. 850-500MB MOISTURE IS 
EXTREMELY DRY SO DO NOT EXPECT ANY RAINFALL FROM THIS VORT. 

A GRADUAL WARMING IS EXPECTED THROUGH EARLY NEXT WEEK AS THE UPPER 
FLOW BECOMES SOUTHWESTERLY IN RESPONSE TO THE WESTERN U.S. TROUGH. 
GFS IS ADVERTISING A WEAK COLD FRONT MOVING THROUGH AROUND MID WEEK 
BUT WITH LITTLE MOISTURE TO WORK WITH.

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
1055 AM CDT THU OCT 6 2005

.DISCUSSION...

SURFACE COLD FRONT HAS BECOME NEARLY INDISTINGUISHABLE ACROSS THE 
REGION. THE CENTER OF TROPICAL DEPRESSION TAMMY HAS MOVED INTO 
SOUTHEASTERN ALABAMA. AS A RESULT WINDS AHEAD OF THE FRONT ARE OUT 
OF THE NORTH AS WELL. SATELLITE HAS SHOWN A LOW STRATUS DECK 
PROGRESSIVELY MOVING SOUTHEASTWARD ACROSS THE REGION. THIS DECK IS 
ASSOCIATED WITH SIGNIFICANT COLD AIR ADVECTING INTO THE REGION. 
TEMPS ACROSS EASTERN ARKANSAS AND EXTREME WESTERN TENNESSEE HAVE 
LIKELY ALREADY SEEN THEIR HIGHS FOR THE DAY AND TEMPS WILL HOLD IN 
THE 65 TO 70 DEGREE RANGE. TO FURTHER COMPLICATE MATTERS...MODELS 
SHOW MOISTURE FROM THE REMNANTS OF MOVING ACROSS THE TENNESSEE RIVER 
THIS AFTERNOON. BASED UPON SATELLITE TRENDS...EXPECT THIS MOISTURE 
TO HOLD OFF TILL LATE THIS AFTERNOON. IN THE AREAS IN THE 
MIDDLE...NAMELY FROM OXFORD TO AROUND BOLIVAR. EXPECT CLOUDS TO 
GRADUALLY WORK IN FROM ONE OF THE TWO DIRECTIONS SOMETIME LATER IN 
THE AFTERNOON. PROBABLY LATE ENOUGH IN THESE AREAS TO JUSTIFY PARTLY 
CLOUDY WORDING. AHEAD OF THE LOW STRATUS...SUN WILL LIKELY WARM 
TEMPS INTO THE LOW TO MID 80S. FEEL THAT SIGNIFICANT RAIN ALONG THE 
TENNESSEE RIVER THIS AFTERNOON IS STILL JUST A SLIGHT CHANCE. RADAR 
TRENDS REALLY DO NOT SUPPORT RAISING POPS MUCH IN THESE AREAS.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
240 AM CDT THU OCT 6 2005

.DISCUSSION...

COLD FRONT BEGINNING TO MOVE THE FORECAST AREA EARLY THIS MORNING.
NO RAIN ASSOCIATED WITH THE FRONT AND NONE IS EXPECTED AS THE FRONT
CONTINUE TO MOVE THROUGH THE REGION. TROPICAL STORM TAMMY CONTINUES
TO PUSH NORTHWEST THROUGH SOUTHERN GEORGIA. RAIN ASSOCIATED WITH
TAMMY AS FAR WEST AS SOUTHERN ALABAMA. THE QUESTION IS WHEN TAMMY
WILL BEGIN TO MAKE A TURN TO THE NORTH. CURRENT FORECAST HAS TAMMY
CONTINUING TO MOVE NORTHWEST THROUGH TONIGHT. THAT MEANS THAT THERE
IS A POSSIBILITY OF SOME THE RAIN FROM TAMMY REACHING THE EASTERN
PART OF THE FORECAST AREA. WILL PUT SLIGHT CHANCE POPS OVER PART OF
NORTHEAST MISSISSIPPI FOR THIS AFTERNOON. FOR TONIGHT WILL PUT IN
CHANCE POPS OVER NORTHEAST MISSISSIPPI AND SLIGHT CHANCE POPS IN
EASTERN SECTIONS OF WEST TENNESSEE. COOLER AIR WILL MOVE IN BEHIND
THE FRONT LATE TODAY BEHIND SOME BRISK NORTH WINDS. HOWEVER WITH THE
COOLER AIR TAKING A LITTLE LONGER TO GET HERE THAN EARLIER
FORECASTED...TEMPERATURES TODAY MAY BE A FEW DEGREES WARMER THAN
EARLIER FORECASTED WITH HIGHS IN THE MID 70S TO LOWER 80S ACROSS THE
REGION. COOL WEATHER SHOULD HOLD ON FOR THE NEXT COUPLE OF DAYS AND
BY THE END OF THE WEEKEND...UPPER LEVEL RIDGE BEGINS TO BUILD OVER
THE EASTERN HALF OF THE COUNTRY AND TEMPERATURES WILL START WARMING
UP SOME THROUGH MUCH OF NEXT WEEK.

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 051948
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
248 PM CDT WED OCT 5 2005

.DISCUSSION...
A PATTERN CHANGE WILL SOON COMMENCE ACROSS THE MIDSOUTH. THIS WILL
BRING A RETURN TO FALL LIKE WEATHER. THE MAIN FORECASTS CONCERNS
FOR THIS PACKAGE ARE PRECIP CHANCES WITH THE FRONTAL PASSAGE AND
THE TIMING OF THE ARRIVAL OF THE COLDER AIR.

&&

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...
AS OF 19Z...A STRONG COLD FRONT EXTENDS FROM WESTERN WISCONSIN
SOUTH TO NORTH CENTRAL TEXAS. THE FRONT WILL CONTINUE TO PUSH
TOWARD THE MIDSOUTH OVERNIGHT. THE ACTUAL PRESSURE TROUGH WILL
LIKELY CLEAR THE REGION BY 12Z...HOWEVER THE TEMPERATURE/DEWPOINT
GRADIENT WILL LACK A FEW HOURS BEHIND. HAVE DECIDED TO TAKE OUT
ALL MENTION OF PRECIP. ALL THE DYNAMICS ASSOCIATED WITH THE
NORTHERN STREAM SHORTWAVE WILL REMAIN WELL TO THE NORTH. IN
ADDITION...700 MB RH LEVELS WILL REMAIN LESS THAN 40 PERCENT.
THESE FACTORS COMBINED WITH LITTLE SURFACE CONVERGENCE ALONG THE
FRONT...MID LEVEL LAPSE RATES OF LESS THAN 6 C/KM...AND LITTLE TO
NO INSTABILITY PAINT A VERY DRY PICTURE FOR THE MIDSOUTH. AS FAR
AS TEMPS ARE CONCERNED...WENT ABOVE MAV GUIDANCE FOR OVERNIGHT
LOWS. WITH THE TEMP GRADIENT AND SIGNIFICANT COLD AIR ADVECTION
NOT ARRIVING TILL AFTER 12Z...DO NOT SEE HOW WE COOL DOWN TOO
MUCH.

TEMPERATURES DURING THE DAY THURSDAY WILL BE TRICKY AND WILL
DEPEND GREATLY ON THE AMOUNT OF CLOUD COVER. GFS 925-850MB RH
FIELDS SUGGEST A SIGNIFICANT POST FRONTAL STRATUS FIELD SHOULD
ENTER THE MIDSOUTH. THIS WOULD TEND TO KEEP HIGHS BELOW MAV
GUIDANCE VALUES. THE FORECAST WILL REFLECT THIS THINKING...WITH
AREAS DOWN AROUND TUPELO SEEING THE BEST OPPORTUNITY FOR HEATING
BEFORE THE CAA ARRIVES. ONE THING THAT WILL BE MORE CERTAIN IS
THAT A STRONG NORTHERLY WIND WILL BE FELT ACROSS THE AREA
TOMORROW. WINDS OF 15-20MPH WITH HIGHER GUSTS WILL BE COMMON. THIS
IS DUE TO A LARGE PRESSURE GRADIENT BETWEEN CANADIAN HIGH PRESSURE
BUILDING SOUTH AND THE COMBINATION OF THE REMNANTS OF T.S. TAMMY
AND DEVELOPING LOW PRESSURE OVER THE NE GULF. 

ONE THING TO NOTE ABOUT THE LOW OVER THE NE GULF. MODELS ARE ALL
OVER THE PLACE IN REGARDS TO THE TRACK OF T.S. TAMMY AND THE LOW
THAT DEVELOPS OVER THE NE GULF. THE NAM SOLUTION HAS BEEN
COMPLETELY DISCOUNTED AS IT IS NOT A RELIABLE TROPICAL MODEL. THE
GFS IS PREFERRED HERE AS IT HAS BEEN THE MORE CONSISTENT SOLUTION.
IT KEEPS ALL TROPICAL ACTIVITY WELL TO OUR EAST. THE ECMWF IS A
LITTLE FURTHER WEST WITH THE LOW AND WOULD RESULT IN POSSIBLE RAIN
CHANCES OVER NE MISSISSIPPI LATE THURSDAY INTO FRIDAY...HOWEVER
ITS INITIALIZATION OF THE SFC FEATURES ARE SUSPECT. WILL KEEP THE
FORECAST DRY FOR NOW AND CONTINUE TO MONITOR DEVELOPMENTS IN THE
EASTERN GULF.

THE HEART OF THE COLDER AIR WILL ENTRENCH ITSELF INTO THE CWA
THURSDAY NIGHT. TEMPS WILL BE BELOW NORMAL THURS NIGHT AND FRIDAY.

&&

.LONG TERM (FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...
TRANQUIL WEATHER FOR THE REST OF THE FORECAST. TEMPERATURES WILL
REMAIN BELOW NORMAL FOR THE FIRST HALF OF THE WEEKEND AND WILL
SLOWLY WARM TO NEAR CLIMO LEVELS BY WEDNESDAY. DID UNDERCUT
GUIDANCE ON TEMPS. APPEARS AS IF THE GFS IS MODIFYING THE AIRMASS
TOO QUICKLY GIVEN THE LACK OF A RETURN FLOW (WINDS WILL STAY NORTHEAST
TO EAST THROUGH THE PERIOD.) HIGH PRESSURE WILL DOMINATE WITH NO
RAIN IN SIGHT.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

MKL  65  78  49  65 /  10  10  10  10 
JBR  63  70  47  64 /  10  10  10  10

FXUS64 KMEG 051524
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
1024 AM CDT WED OCT 5 2005

.UPDATE...
THE UPPER LEVEL RIDGE THAT HAS DOMINATED THE MIDSOUTH WEATHER IS
BEGINNING TO WEAKEN...AS SEEN IN THE HEIGHT FALLS IN AREA RAOB
SOUNDINGS. THIS IS IN RESPONSE TO A STRONG NORTHERN STREAM
SHORTWAVE LOCATED OVER THE HIGH PLAINS THAT CONTINUES TO PROGRESS
EASTWARD. ITS ASSOCIATED STRONG COLD FRONT CURRENTLY EXTENDS FROM
MINNESOTA SOUTH TO THE TX PANHANDLE. THE FRONT WILL NOT ARRIVE IN
THE MIDSOUTH UNTIL LATER TONIGHT.

CURRENT FORECAST IS IN GOOD SHAPE FOR OUR AREA AND ONLY A MINOR
TWEAK TO AFTERNOON HIGHS WERE MADE. TEMPS ARE RUNNING VERY SIMILAR
TO YESTERDAY AT THIS TIME...AND SO ARE 850 MB TEMPS OF AROUND 16C.
THIS WILL PROMOTE HIGHS IN THE UPPER 80S AREA WIDE...THUS HAVE
TAKEN OUT MENTION OF LOWER 90S ACROSS SW ZONES. CU FIELD SHOULD
DEVELOP BY EARLY AFTERNOON WITH CONVECTIVE TEMPS IN THE MID 80S
AND DEWPOINTS A FEW DEGREES HIGHER THAN YESTERDAY.

UPDATE WILL BE OUT SHORTLY.

JFB

&&

.PREV DISCUSSION... (ISSUED 248 AM CDT WED OCT 5 2005) 

NOT MUCH CHANGE IN THE WEATHER PATTERN IN THE LAST 24 HOURS WITH
SURFACE HIGH OVER THE NORTHEAST U.S. AND COLD FRONT ONLY MAKING
SMALL PROGRESS EAST NOW INTO CENTRAL KANSAS. VERY LITTLE RAIN CAN BE
FOUND AHEAD OF THE FRONT THIS MORNING. THE FRONT SHOULD BEGIN TO
MOVE FASTER TODAY AND TONIGHT BUT SHOULD REMAIN WELL NORTH OF THE
FORECAST AREA BEFORE 00Z SO WILL CONTINUE WITH A DRY FORECAST FOR
TODAY. COLD FRONT SHOULD MOVE THROUGH THE REGION BEGINNING AROUND
MIDNIGHT AND CONTINUING THROUGH EARLY THURSDAY MORNING. WOULD NOT BE
SURPRISED AT THIS POINT TO SEE NO RAIN WITH THE FRONT BUT NOT
COMFORTABLE GOING COMPLETELY DRY SO WILL LEAVE SLIGHT CHANCE POPS
ALONE FOR TONIGHT AND FOR THE EXTREME SOUTHEAST ON THURSDAY MORNING.

COOLER AIR WILL MOVE IN BEHIND THE FRONT ON THURSDAY AS CANADIAN
HIGH SETTLES INTO THE NORTHERN PLAINS. IT APPEARS THAT THURSDAY
WONT BE QUITE AS COOL AS PREVIOUS THOUGHT AS HIGH WILL NOT MOVED
CLOSE ENOUGH TO OUR REGION YET BUT TEMPERATURES WILL STILL BE SOME
10-15 DEGREES COOLER THAN TODAY.

NAM MODEL HAS DIFFICULTY DEALING WITH THE TROPICAL DISTURBANCE WHICH
IS FORECAST TO MOVE ACROSS FLORIDA TODAY AND TONIGHT. MOST OF THE
OTHER MODELS BRING THE DISTURBANCE NORTH INTO THE FLORIDA PANHANDLE
AND THEN NORTHEAST INTO THE MID ATLANTIC STATES. THE NAM TRIES TO
KEEP THIS DISTURBANCE OVER THE GULF AREA AND SPREAD CLOUDS AND RAIN
OVER THE REGION FOR THURSDAY NIGHT AND FRIDAY. SINCE NAM SEEMS TO BE
THE ONLY MODEL FOLLOWING THIS SCENARIO IT WAS IGNORED FOR THAT PART
OF THE FORECAST.

FRIDAY SHOULD BE THE COOLEST DAY AS SURFACE HIGH ALMOST DUE NORTH OF
THE FORECAST AREA. BY SATURDAY WINDS WILL BEGIN TO SHIFT BACK TOWARD
THE SOUTH AND A SLOW GRADUAL WARMUP WILL BEGIN AND CONTINUE THROUGH
THE BEGINNING OF NEXT WEEK.

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...

FXUS64 KMEG 041947
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
247 PM CDT TUE OCT 4 2005

.DISCUSSION...
UPPER LEVEL RIDGE PERSISTS OVER THE MIDSOUTH THIS AFTERNOON
PROVIDING DRY WEATHER AND WARM TEMPS. AS OF 19Z...TEMPS ARE IN THE
MID TO UPPER 80S ACROSS THE REGION WITH DEWPOINTS A LITTLE LOWER
THAN THEY WERE YESTERDAY. MAIN FORECAST CONCERN FOR THIS PACKAGE
ARE PRECIP CHANCES WEDNESDAY NIGHT INTO THURSDAY WITH A FRONTAL
PASSAGE.

&&

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)...
LITTLE TO TALK ABOUT IN THE NEAR TERM. HIGH PRESSURE HOLDS ON FOR
ONE MORE NIGHT WITH ABOVE NORMAL TEMPS EXPECTED FOR LOWS. WITH
DEWPOINTS RUNNING A LITTLE LOWER THAN LAST NIGHT...DECIDED TO
LEAVE OUT THE MENTION OF PATCHY FOG. HOWEVER...WOULD NOT BE
SURPRISED IF THE USUAL SUSPECTS DID SEE A LITTLE FOG OVERNIGHT.

ON WEDNESDAY...UPPER HIGH BREAKS DOWN IN RESPONSE TO A STRONG
NORTHERN STREAM SHORTWAVE. THIS FEATURE WILL PUSH A STRONG COLD
FRONT THROUGH THE MIDSOUTH WEDNESDAY NIGHT. DEEP LAYER MOISTURE
LOOKS VERY INEFFICIENT FOR MUCH PRECIP. THE STRONG SHORTWAVE AND
ASSOCIATED JET MAX WILL REMAIN WELL TO THE NORTH. IN
ADDITION...CONVERGENCE ALONG THE FRONT LOOKS POOR WITH MODELS
SHOWING A NORTHEAST WIND AHEAD OF THE FRONT. ALL THIS BOILS DOWN
TO A REDUCTION IN POPS TO SLIGHT CHANCE ON WEDNESDAY NIGHT. ALSO
REMOVED MENTION OF THUNDER DUE TO LITTLE IF ANY INSTABILITY AND
MEAGER MID LEVEL LAPSE RATES.

MODELS IN AGREEMENT THAT THE FRONT SHOULD BE EAST OF THE AREA BY
THURSDAY MORNING...WITH A STRONG NORTH WIND DEVELOPING IN
ASSOCIATION WITH A 1035 MB HIGH DROPPING SOUTH OUT OF CANADA. DID
RAISE TEMPS A COUPLE OF CATEGORIES ON THURSDAY AS THE HEART OF THE
COLD AIR WILL BE DELAYED IN ARRIVING UNTIL THURSDAY NIGHT. THE
OTHER FLY IN THE OINTMENT IS THE DEVELOPMENT OF A LOW PRESSURE
SYSTEM OVER THE EASTERN GULF. MODELS VARY IN STRENGTH AND LOCATION
OF THIS SYSTEM. IF THE LOW DEVELOPS FAR ENOUGH TO THE NORTH...IT
COULD BRING SOME MOISTURE UP AND OVER THE FRONTAL SURFACE INTO NE
MS. THEREFORE...LEFT A SLIGHT CHANCE POP IN FOR THOSE AREAS. TOO
MUCH UNCERTAINTY EXISTS WITH THIS FEATURE WITH A LARGE SPREAD IN
THE GLOBAL MODELS. THEREFORE...WILL TAKE A WAIT AND SEE APPROACH.

&&

.LONG TERM (THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...
CANADIAN HIGH PRESSURE WILL BRING BELOW NORMAL TEMPS TO THE
MIDSOUTH THROUGH THE WEEKEND...WITH A SLOW MODERATION IN TEMPS BY
TUESDAY. NO RETURN FLOW IS EXPECTED...WITH NORTHEAST TO EAST WINDS
PREVAILING. COULD BE QUITE BREEZY ON FRIDAY WITH THE DEVELOPING
LOW OVER THE EAST GULF AND HIGH PRESSURE OVER THE PLAINS CAUSING A
TIGHT PRESSURE GRADIENT. DID BUMP WINDS UP IN THE GRIDS...BUT MAY
NEED TO BE BUMPED UP MORE IN LATER FORECASTS. OTHER THAN THAT...NO
RAIN IN SIGHT THROUGH THE MIDDLE OF NEXT WEEK.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
MEM  69  88  64  76 /  10  10  20  10 
MKL  64  87  61  76 /  10  10  20  10 
JBR  64  89  59  72 /  10  10  20  10 
TUP  65  87  65  81 /  10  10  20  20

.UPDATE...
UPPER LEVEL RIDGE CONTINUES TO BE THE DOMINANT WEATHER FEATURE OVER

12Z LZK SOUNDING SHOWS A RELATIVELY DRY AIRMASS WITH PRECIPITABLE

16C TO 17C WILL SUPPORT HIGHS IN UPPER 80S TO NEAR 90. NO AFTERNOON

ASSOCIATED WITH THE RIDGE. CURRENT FORECAST HAS A GOOD HANDLE ON THE

JFB

.PREVIOUS DISCUSSION ISSUED AT 239 AM TUE OCT 4 2005...
HIGH PRESSURE REMAINS ENTRENCHED OVER THE NORTHEAST U.S. WITH
SURFACE COLD FRONT OVER CENTRAL NEBRASKA INTO SOUTHERN MINNESOTA.
TEMPERATURES REMAIN MILD OVER THE REGION THIS MORNING WITH READINGS
IN THE MID 60S TO MID 70S WITH JUST A FEW CLOUDS AROUND.

ANOTHER DRY AND WARM DAY IN STORE FOR TODAY WITH UPPER LEVEL RIDGE
HOLDING IN PLACE. UPPER LEVEL TROUGH OVER THE PACIFIC NORTHWEST THIS
MORNING WILL MOVE EAST OVER THE NEXT COUPLE OF DAYS. THIS WILL HELP
PUSH COLD FRONT TOWARD THE REGION. IT APPEARS THAT THE FRONT WONT
REACH THE UNTIL WEDNESDAY NIGHT SO HAVE REMOVED POPS FROM WEDNESDAY

FRONT WEDNESDAY NIGHT INTO THURSDAY MORNING BUT KEPT POPS IN CHANCE
CATEGORY FOR WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND SLIGHT CHANCE FOR THURSDAY.

MUCH COOLER AIR WILL MOVE IN BEHIND THE FRONT WITH TEMPERATURES SOME
15 TO 25 DEGREES COOLER ON THURSDAY. TEMPERATURES WILL MODERATE OVER
THE WEEKEND AS UPPER LEVEL RIDGE RETURNS TO THE REGION. EXTENDED
MODELS SHOW VERY AMPLIFIED PATTERN BY THE BEGINNING OF NEXT WEEK
WITH DEEP TROUGH OVER THE ROCKIES AND LARGE RIDGE OVER THE EASTERN
HALF OF THE COUNTRY BY MONDAY.

FXUS64 KMEG 040739

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
239 AM CDT TUE OCT 4 2005

.DISCUSSION...

HIGH PRESSURE REMAINS ENTRENCHED OVER THE NORTHEAST U.S. WITH
SURFACE COLD FRONT OVER CENTRAL NEBRASKA INTO SOUTHERN MINNESOTA.
TEMPERATURES REMAIN MILD OVER THE REGION THIS MORNING WITH READINGS
IN THE MID 60S TO MID 70S WITH JUST A FEW CLOUDS AROUND.

ANOTHER DRY AND WARM DAY IN STORE FOR TODAY WITH UPPER LEVEL RIDGE
HOLDING IN PLACE. UPPER LEVEL TROUGH OVER THE PACIFIC NORTHWEST THIS
MORNING WILL MOVE EAST OVER THE NEXT COUPLE OF DAYS. THIS WILL HELP
PUSH COLD FRONT TOWARD THE REGION. IT APPEARS THAT THE FRONT WONT
REACH THE UNTIL WEDNESDAY NIGHT SO HAVE REMOVED POPS FROM WEDNESDAY
FORECAST. STILL EXPECT TO BE SOME RAIN ALONG AND EVEN BEHIND THE
FRONT WEDNESDAY NIGHT INTO THURSDAY MORNING BUT KEPT POPS IN CHANCE
CATEGORY FOR WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND SLIGHT CHANCE FOR THURSDAY.

MUCH COOLER AIR WILL MOVE IN BEHIND THE FRONT WITH TEMPERATURES SOME
15 TO 25 DEGREES COOLER ON THURSDAY. TEMPERATURES WILL MODERATE OVER
THE WEEKEND AS UPPER LEVEL RIDGE RETURNS TO THE REGION. EXTENDED
MODELS SHOW VERY AMPLIFIED PATTERN BY THE BEGINNING OF NEXT WEEK
WITH DEEP TROUGH OVER THE ROCKIES AND LARGE RIDGE OVER THE EASTERN
HALF OF THE COUNTRY BY MONDAY.

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...

320 AM CDT MON OCT 3 2005

.DISCUSSION...

A DEVELOPING RIDGE BOTH SFC AND ALOFT WILL EXTEND FROM MID ATL 
STATES INTO TX FROM TODAY THROUGH MUCH OF WEDNESDAY. THIS WILL 
PROVIDE A WARM LATE SUMMER PATTERN ACROSS THE FCST AREA THROUGH THE 
FIRST HALF OF THE WEEK. THE RIDGE WILL BE STRONG ENOUGH TO SUPPRESS 
DIURNAL CONVECTION.

A COLD FRONT OVER THE NORTH CENTRAL PART OF THE US WILL MOVE THROUGH 
THE FCST AREA WEDNESDAY NIGHT. THIS WILL PROVIDE A CHANCE OF SHOWERS 
AND THUNDERSTORMS FROM LATE WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON INTO A PART OF 
THURSDAY. MUCH COOLER WEATHER WILL FOLLOW THE FRONT UNDER GUSTY 
NORTHERLY WINDS.

A POLAR HIGH WELL TO THE NORTH WILL DOMINATE THE FCST AREA FRIDAY 
THROUGH SUNDAY PROVIDING CONTINUED COOL AND DRY CONDITIONS.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
943 PM CDT SUN OCT 2 2005

.DISCUSSION...

HIGH PRESSURE REMAINS OVER THE MID-SOUTH TONIGHT. THIS HAS PROVIDED
CLEAR SKIES...LIGHT SOUTHEAST WINDS...ALONG WITH WARM AND HUMID
CONDITIONS. TEMPERATURES RUNNING A FEW DEGREES WARMER TONIGHT AS
COMPARED TO LAST NIGHT...AND WITH DEWPOINTS RUNNING AROUND 70
DEGREES...HAVE DECIDED TO BUMP TEMPS UP A FEW DEGREES ACROSS THE
AREA...EXCEPT FOR FAR EASTERN ZONES. ALSO SKIES REMAIN CLEAR
AREAWIDE...WITH ONLY A FEW HIGH THIN CIRRUS MOVING INTO WESTERN
ARKANSAS. THESE HIGH CLOUDS MAY MOVE INTO WESTERN PORTIONS OF THE
AREA TOWARDS DAWN...BUT SHOULD NOT BE ENOUGH TO OBSCURE MUCH OF THE
SKY. SO HAVE UPDATED SKY COVER FROM PARTLY CLOUDY TO MOSTLY CLEAR TO
ACCOUNT FOR THIS. OTHERWISE...THE REMAINDER OF THE FORECAST LOOKS ON
TRACK FOR TONIGHT.

UPDATED GRIDS AND ZONES OUT SHORTLY TO REFLECT TEMPERATURE AND SKY
COVER CHANGES.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
340 PM CDT SUN OCT 2 2005

.DISCUSSION...SURFACE ANALYSIS THIS AFTERNOON PLACES WARM FRONT 
ACROSS NORTHERN MISSOURI. SOUTH OF THE FRONT TEMPERATURES ARE IN THE 
MIDDLE TO UPPER 80S WITH UPPER 60 TO LOWER 70 SURFACE DEWPOINTS.

TONIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY...REGIONAL WIND PROFILER DATA INDICATES MID 
LEVEL TROUGH IS EXITING THE FORECAST AREA. 88D RADAR TRENDS ACROSS 
THE MID SOUTH NOT SHOWING ANY RETURNS THUS FAR AND WILL KEEP A 
PRECIPITATION FREE FORECAST FOR THIS EVENING. NO PRECIPITATION IS 
ANTICIPATED AT THIS TIME THROUGH TUESDAY WITH WEAK MID/UPPER LEVEL 
RIDGING OVERHEAD. TEMPERATURES WERE ADJUSTED UPWARD INTO WEDNESDAY 
AS COLD FRONTAL PASSAGE WILL BE DELAYED UNTIL LATE WEDNESDAY/EARLY 
THURSDAY.

WEDNESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY...COLD FRONT WILL ENTER THE MID SOUTH 
WEDNESDAY NIGHT. MODELS HAVE TRENDED FRONTAL PASSAGE SLOWER THAN 
PAST COUPLE OF RUNS...WITH FRONTAL PASSAGE BETWEEN MID/LATE 
WEDNESDAY EVENING/EARLY THURSDAY MORNING. WILL LEAVE 30 POPS IN FOR 
NOW DUE TO THE UNCERTAINTY IN TIMING AND LINGER PRECIP INTO 
THURSDAY. HIGH PRESSURE WILL BUILD IN BEHIND THE FRONT 
RESULTING IN DRY WEATHER THROUGH THE END OF THE PERIOD.

AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
1105 AM CDT SUN OCT 2 2005

.DISCUSSION...15 UTC SURFACE ANALYSIS THIS MORNING PLACES WARM FRONT 
ACROSS MISSOURI/ILLINOIS. SOUTH OF THE BOUNDARY SURFACE DEWPOINTS 
ARE IN THE UPPER 60 TO LOWER 70S. MAIN CONCERN FOR THIS AFTERNOON IS 
CONVECTIVE POTENTIAL. 

12Z 850 MB UPPER AIR ANALYSIS INDICATED LOW LEVEL MOISTURE PLUME 
EXTENDING JUST WEST OF THE FORECAST AREA UP INTO WESTERN ONTARIO. 
500 MB SHORTWAVE WILL CONTINUE TO MOVE THROUGH THE MID SOUTH THIS 
AFTERNOON. LAPS DATA SHOWS A WEAK INVERTED SURFACE TROUGH LOCATED 
NEAR THE TENNESSEE/MISSISSIPPI BORDER WITH THE ATMOSPHERE ALREADY 
BECOMING UNSTABLE AS NOTED BY VISIBLE SATELLITE. RUC MODEL SOUNDINGS 
APPEAR TO HAVE THE BEST HANDLE ON CONVECTIVE POTENTIAL THIS 
AFTERNOON. SURFACE BASED CAPES AROUND 2000 J/KG...LI/S AROUND 
-6...AND 700-500 MB LAYER LAPSE RATES AROUND 6 C/KM SUGGEST ANY 
THUNDERSTORMS THAT DO DEVELOP WOULD EXHIBIT PULSE TYPE CONVECTION 
TENDENCIES. THINK THAT BEST CHANCE OF SHRA/TSRA WILL BE PRIMARILY 
ALONG AND WEST OF THE MISSISSIPPI RIVER DELTA. WILL KEEP CONVECTION 
AS ISOLATED THIS AFTERNOON BUT WILL CONTINUE TO MONITOR CONVECTIVE 
TRENDS. WILL ISSUE AN UPDATE TO ADJUST TEMPERATURES/CLOUD 
COVER BASED ON CURRENT TRENDS.

UPDATED GRIDS WILL BE PUBLISHED SHORTLY.

CJC

.PREV DISCUSSION...ISSUED 305 AM CDT SUN OCT 2 2005...

A WARM FRONT OVER THE NORTHERN PART OF THE CWA WILL CONTINUE 
DRIFTING TO THE NORTH TODAY. A WARM AND HUMID AIRMASS IN PLACE WILL 
BE JUST UNSTABLE ENOUGH TO WARRANT A SLIGHT CHANCE OF THUNDERSTORMS 
THIS AFTERNOON THROUGH EARLY EVENING.

AN UPPER LEVEL HIGH WILL DEVELOP OVER ARKANSAS TONIGHT AND MONDAY 
AND PERSISTS OVER THE REGION THROUGH EARLY WEDNESDAY. THIS WILL 
CONTINUE THE WARM WEATHER THROUGH THE FIRST HALF OF THE WEEK. SOME 
DIURNAL INSTABILITY WILL EXIST MON-TUE BUT NOT ENOUGH TO JUSTIFY 20 
POPS AS THE HIGH WILL BE TOO STRONG.

A COLD FRONT WILL MOVE THROUGH THE FCST AREA FROM THE NORTHWEST 
WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON AND EVENING. SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS ARE 
POSSIBLE ALONG AND AHEAD THE FRONT. MUCH COOLER AND DRIER AIR WILL 
FOLLOW THE FRONT WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH THE END OF THE FORECAST 
PERIOD AS A STRONG SFC HIGH TO THE NORTH INFLUENCES OUR WEATHER.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
844 PM CDT SAT OCT 1 2005

.DISCUSSION...

AN UPPER LEVEL INVERTED TROUGH AXIS REMAINS STRETCHED ACROSS THE MID-
SOUTH THIS EVENING. THIS FEATURE HELPED TRIGGER THE SHOWERS AND
THUNDERSTORMS THAT DEVELOPED OVER THE AREA. EXPECT CONTINUED
ISOLATED SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS FOR THE REMAINDER OF THE NIGHT
WITH THIS FEATURE ALONG WITH A HUMID UNSTABLE AIRMASS REMAINING
IN PLACE. WITH DEWPOINTS CURRENTLY RUNNING IN THE LOWER 70S ALONG
WITH SOUTHEASTERLY WINDS...ONLY EXPECT TEMPERATURES TO FALL OFF A
COUPLE MORE DEGREES. WITH THIS IN MIND...HAVE RAISED TEMPERATURES UP
A FEW DEGREES. OTHERWISE...ALL OTHER PARAMETERS LOOK GOOD.

UPDATED GRIDS AND ZONES OUT SHORTLY.

FXUS64 KMEG 020010
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
710 PM CDT SAT OCT 1 2005

.UPDATE...

LINE OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS PUSHING NORTH ACROSS MOST OF WEST
TENNESSEE...HAVE GONE AHEAD AND WENT WITH SCATTERED POPS ACROSS ALL
OF WEST TENNESSEE TO REFLECT CURRENT RADAR TRENDS. MOST STORMS WILL
REMAIN BELOW SEVERE LIMITS FOR THE REMAINDER OF THIS EVENING...AND
BEGIN TO DIMINISH IN COVERAGE LATER TONIGHT.


.DISCUSSION FROM 302 PM CDT...

A WEAK INVERTED SURFACE TROUGH EXTENDS ACROSS THE MID SOUTH THIS
AFTERNOON ON THE BACK EDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE CENTERED NEAR THE
VIRGINIA/CAROLINA COAST. MEANWHILE AN UPPER LEVEL LOW LOCATED IN THE
SOUTHERN PLAINS WILL WEAKEN AND MOVE INTO THE UPPER/MIDDLE
MISSISSIPPI VALLEY THROUGH SUNDAY. MAIN FORECAST CONCERNS THIS
PACKAGE IS CONVECTIVE POTENTIAL TONIGHT AND SUNDAY...AND AGAIN ON
WEDNESDAY WITH PASSAGE OF NEXT COLD FRONT.

TONIGHT...INVERTED SURFACE TROUGH WILL MOVE NORTH OF THE FORECAST
AREA. MODEL CONVECTIVE FIELDS PRODUCE 1000 J/KG CAPE...LI/S AROUND
-3 AND WEAK LOW/MID LEVEL LAPSE RATES.  SURFACE DEWPOINTS THIS
AFTERNOON HAVE QUICKLY RECOVERED INTO THE 60S TO LOWER 70S WITH THE
RETURN OF SOUTHWEST FLOW. WEAK ISOLATED DAYTIME CONVECTION
WHICH DEVELOPED MAINLY ACROSS PORTIONS OF NORTHERN MISSISSIPPI AS
NOTED BY KNQA/KGWX 88D RADARS SHOULD CONTINUE AT LEAST UNTIL SUNSET
AND DIMINISH WITH THE LOSS OF DAYTIME INSTABILITY. WILL CARRY
ISOLATED POPS ACROSS NORTHERN MISSISSIPPI AND A PORTION OF WESTERN
TENNESSEE THROUGH EARLY EVENING.

SUNDAY...ANOTHER WEAK INVERTED SURFACE TROUGH WILL AFFECT THE MID
SOUTH. MODEL SOUNDINGS PRODUCE 1500 J/KG SURFACE BASED CAPE...LI/S
AROUND -5...BUT CANNOT JUSTIFY RAISING POPS ANY HIGHER THAN
SLIGHT CHANCE AT THIS TIME WITH LOW/MID LEVEL LAPSE RATES REMAINING
PRETTY WEAK AROUND 5 C/KM AND BETTER FORCING NORTH ACROSS THE
MIDDLE/UPPER MISSISSIPPI VALLEY ASSOCIATED WITH A MID LEVEL TROUGH.
850 MB TEMPERATURES AROUND 16C WILL PRODUCE HIGHS IN THE MIDDLE TO
UPPER 80S ACROSS THE MID SOUTH.

MONDAY AND TUESDAY...LOWER MISSISSIPPI VALLEY WILL REMAIN IN
SOUTHWEST FLOW ALOFT. DAYTIME INSTABILITY WILL BE PRESENT WITH CAPES
AROUND 1500 J/KG...AND LI/S AROUND -3. PROBABILITIES ARE TOO LOW AT
THIS TIME TO JUSTIFY A MENTION OF CONVECTION IN FORECAST.

WEDNESDAY THROUGH SATURDAY...MODELS HAVE BEEN TRENDING A BIT FASTER
WITH PROGRESSION OF LONGWAVE TROUGH ACROSS THE MISSISSIPPI VALLEY ON
WEDNESDAY. EUROPEAN SOLUTION HAS BEEN TRENDING LESS AMPLIFIED WITH
THE TROUGH WHEN COMPARED TO THE GFS. CURRENT MODEL TRENDS SUGGEST
FRONTAL PASSAGE WILL BE DURING THE DAYTIME ON WEDNESDAY. HIGH
PRESSURE WILL BUILD IN BEHIND THE FRONT THROUGH THE END OF THE
PERIOD.

COORDINATION WITH PAH...OHX...HUN...JAN...THANKS.

&&
.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
1032 AM CDT SAT OCT 1 2005

.DISCUSSION...SURFACE ANALYSIS THIS MORNING CENTERS HIGH PRESSURE 
ALONG THE CAROLINA/VIRGINIA COAST. A WEAK INVERTED SURFACE TROUGH 
EXTENDS ACROSS THE MID SOUTH AND A MID LEVEL LOW PRODUCING SHOWERS 
AND THUNDERSTORMS ACROSS THE SOUTHERN PLAINS. MAIN FORECAST CONCERN 
FOR THIS AFTERNOON IS CONVECTIVE POTENTIAL. 

MODEL SOUNDINGS PRODUCE 1500 J/KG SURFACE BASED CAPE AND LI/S AROUND 
-4 PRIMARILY ALONG AND SOUTH OF THE TENNESSEE/MISSISSIPPI BORDER. 
HOWEVER WILL NOT ADD POPS TO FORECAST THIS AFTERNOON AS POOR 850-700 
MB/700-500 MB LAYER LAPSE RATES REMAIN AT OR BELOW 5 C/KM INTO THE 
AFTERNOON. WILL UPDATE FORECAST TO ADJUST CLOUD COVER FOR THIS 
AFTERNOON AS VISIBLE SATELLITE ALREADY SHOWING A SCATTERED/BROKEN 
ALTOCUMULUS DECK ACROSS THE MID SOUTH. WILL ALSO MAKE MINOR TWEAKS 
TO TEMPERATURES/WINDS BASED UPON CURRENT TRENDS.  

UPDATED GRIDS WILL BE PUBLISHED SHORTLY.

CJC

.PREV DISCUSSION...ISSUED  140 AM CDT SAT OCT 1 2005...

HIGH PRESSURE AT SURFACE AND ALOFT...CENTERED OVER VIRGINIA EARLY
THIS MORNING...WITH RIDGE EXTENDING WESTWARD OVER OUR AREA. COLD
FRONT STILL IN NORTHERN PLAINS...AND DOES NOT APPEAR TO BE A PLAYER
IN THE NEXT FEW DAYS. CONVECTIVE COMPLEX OVER OKLAHOMA AND TEXAS...
ASSOCIATED WITH AN UPPER LOW NOT MAKING A MOVE ON US EITHER.
TEMPERATURES A LITTLE COOLER THAN FORECAST...ALREADY AT OR BELOW
FORECAST MINS IN SOME AREAS AT 06Z.
&&

.SHORT TERM (THROUGH MONDAY)...
UPPER RIDGE NOT MAKING MUCH OF A MOVE ANY TIME SOON. FLOW DOES
BECOME A LITTLE MORE SOUTHERLY OVER OUR AREA...WHICH WILL
ALLOW MOISTURE TO RETURN. ALREADY HAVE MID 60S DEWPOINTS ALONG
AND SOUTH OF INTERSTATE 20...SO WHEN WINDS GO SOUTHERLY...
MOISTURE WILL INCREASE QUICKLY. UPPER LOW WILL PASS NORTH AND WEST
OF THE MEMPHIS CWA ON SUNDAY. CAPES OFF THE NAM MODEL FOR SUNDAY
AFTERNOON SHOW 1000-2000 ACROSS MOST OF THE AREA. BEST LIFT WILL BE
TO THE NORTH...AND NO REAL CONVERGENCE IN LOW LEVELS TO TRIGGER
PRECIPITATION. FOR NOW...FOR CONTINUITY...WILL HOLD IN CURRENT 20
POPS...BUT HAVING SOME DOUBTS WHETHER THERE WILL BE ANY PRECIPITATION
AT ALL IN OUR AREA ON SUNDAY. EVEN LESS POTENTIAL FOR PRECIPITATION
MONDAY.

TEMPERATURES...TODAY...MOST AREAS SHOULD BE 2 TO 3 CATEGORIES (6 TO
10 DEGREES) WARMER THAN ON FRIDAY. HIGHER DEWPOINTS OVERNIGHT TONIGHT
WILL LEAD TO MINS ON SUNDAY MORNING BEING ABOUT 10 DEGREES WARMER
THAN THIS MORNING...AND THAT MAY BE CONSERVATIVE. LITTLE CHANGE IN
TEMPERATURES FOR SUNDAY AND MONDAY.
&&

.LONG TERM (AFTER MONDAY)...
RIDGE BEGINS TO GET FORCED EASTWARD AROUND MIDWEEK...AS A RATHER
HEALTHY UPPER SYSTEM MOVES EAST ACROSS THE NORTHERN U.S. THIS WILL
PUSH A COLD FRONT THROUGH THE AREA WEDNESDAY. AGAIN...SIMILAR TO
SUNDAY...BEST FORCING WILL REMAIN TO THE NORTH. GFS APPEARS TO BE A
LITTLE HEAVY HANDED ON MOISTURE AND PRECIPITATION ON WEDNESDAY. WILL
CONTINUE THE LOW POPS...BUT IF 00Z RUN OF GFS IS CLOSE ON MOISTURE...
POPS MAY NEED TO BE RAISED IN LATER FORECASTS.

AFTER THE FRONT MOVES THROUGH ON WEDNESDAY NIGHT...THE REST OF THE
FORECAST PERIOD REMAINS DRY.

TEMPERATURES...TUESDAY TEMPS SIMILAR TO MONDAY. WEDNESDAY MAX TEMPS
WILL BE HIGHLY DEPENDENT ON TIMING OF COLD FRONT PASSAGE ACROSS THE
AREA. IF GFS TIMING IS CORRECT...FORECAST HIGH TEMPS FOR WEDNESDAY
WILL BE TOO WARM. IN FACT...AFTER FRONTAL PASSAGE...IF GFS
VERIFIES...CURRENT FORECAST AND GUIDANCE WILL BE TOO WARM FROM
THURSDAY THROUGH THE END OF THE FORECAST PERIOD. CONSIDERING 925 MB
TEMPERATURES FOR THURSDAY AND FRIDAY...MUCH OF CWA WILL HAVE TROUBLE
GETTING OUT OF THE 60S. WHEN WINDS DECOUPLE THURSDAY EVENING...
POTENTIAL FOR SOME AREAS TO FALL INTO THE 30S...BASED ON BOUNDARY
LAYER DEWPOINTS. MODERATION IN TEMPERATURES BEGINS LATE ON FRIDAY FOR
NEXT WEEKEND.

WAGNER

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.

$$

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
140 AM CDT SAT OCT 1 2005

.DISCUSSION...
HIGH PRESSURE AT SURFACE AND ALOFT...CENTERED OVER VIRGINIA EARLY
THIS MORNING...WITH RIDGE EXTENDING WESTWARD OVER OUR AREA. COLD
FRONT STILL IN NORTHERN PLAINS...AND DOES NOT APPEAR TO BE A PLAYER
IN THE NEXT FEW DAYS. CONVECTIVE COMPLEX OVER OKLAHOMA AND TEXAS...
ASSOCIATED WITH AN UPPER LOW NOT MAKING A MOVE ON US EITHER.
TEMPERATURES A LITTLE COOLER THAN FORECAST...ALREADY AT OR BELOW
FORECAST MINS IN SOME AREAS AT 06Z.

HIGH PRESSURE REMAINS IN PLACE OVER THE MID-SOUTH THIS

HIGHER TONIGHT AS COMPARED TO LAST NIGHT AS SURFACE DEWPOINTS
ARE CURRENTLY RUNNING ABOUT 10 DEGREES HIGHER TONIGHT AND THIS
SHOULD PREVENT TEMPS FROM DROPPING LOWER THAN THE 50S IN MOST
LOCATIONS. CURRENT FORECAST LOOKS IN GOOD SHAPE...AND NO

FXUS64 KMEG 301923
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
220 PM CDT FRI SEP 30 2005

.DISCUSSION...SURFACE ANALYSIS PLACES 1024 MB HIGH PRESSURE ACROSS 
VIRGINIA WITH SOUTHERLY RETURN FLOW BEGINNING TO SET UP ACROSS 
ARKANSAS. TEMPERATURES ACROSS THE MID SOUTH THUS FAR HAVE WARMED 
INTO THE 70S. MAIN FORECAST CONCERNS THIS PACKAGE WILL BE CONVECTIVE 
CHANCES SUNDAY AND AGAIN ON WEDNESDAY. 

TONIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY NIGHT...PLEASANT WEATHER EXPECTED ACROSS 
THE MID SOUTH THROUGH SATURDAY NIGHT. TEMPERATURES WILL BE A BIT 
WARMER THAN LAST NIGHT AS SOUTHERLY RETURN FLOW ON THE BACKSIDE OF 
HIGH PRESSURE SETS UP ACROSS THE MID SOUTH. HIGHS ON SATURDAY WILL 
BE BACK IN THE 80S WITH MOSTLY SUNNY/MOSTLY CLEAR SKIES AS 1000-500 
MB LAYER RH/S WILL BE AT OR AROUND 40 PERCENT. 

SUNDAY...UPPER LEVEL LOW LOCATED ACROSS THE PANHANDLE OF TEXAS WILL 
MOVE THROUGH THE MIDDLE MISSISSIPPI VALLEY ON SUNDAY. 320K SURFACE 
SHOWS WEAK ISENTROPIC ASCENT ACROSS THE MID SOUTH DURING THE DAY. IN 
ADDITION...MODEL SOUNDINGS PRODUCE AT LEAST 1200 J/KG SURFACE BASED 
CAPE...AND LI/S AROUND -4. WILL KEEP POPS FOR NOW AS SLIGHT CHANCE 
WHILE FORCING WITH THIS FEATURE WILL BE NOT AS IDEAL AS THE NEXT 
SYSTEM EXPECTED TO AFFECT THE AREA BY MID WEEK.

TUESDAY THROUGH FRIDAY...SOME MODEL DISAGREEMENT WITH THE TIMING OF 
THE NEXT SIGNIFICANT COLD FRONT ACROSS THE MID SOUTH. LATEST 
EUROPEAN RUN SLOWER THAN PREVIOUS RUN AND GFS/CANADIAN TRENDING 
FASTER. WILL LEAN TOWARDS GFS/CANADIAN SOLUTION FOR NOW AND RAISE 
POPS UP TO CHANCE CATEGORY FOR WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON/EVENING. EXPECT 
SIMILAR TEMPERATURES OR A FEW DEGREES COOLER BEHIND THE FRONT AS 
CANADIAN HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS IN ACROSS THE MISSISSIPPI VALLEY.

AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
1036 AM CDT FRI SEP 30 2005

.DISCUSSION...SURFACE ANALYSIS THIS MORNING CENTERS HIGH PRESSURE 
ACROSS THE OHIO VALLEY. TEMPERATURES ACROSS THE MID SOUTH THIS 
MORNING ARE PRIMARILY IN THE 60S WITH VISIBLE SATELLITE DEPICTING 
SUNNY SKIES. CURRENT FORECAST HANDLED WELL IN FORECAST GRIDS AND 
WILL NOT ISSUE AN UPDATE AT THIS TIME.

CJC

.PREV DISCUSSION...ISSUED 245 AM CDT FRI SEP 30 2005...

HIGH PRESSURE HAS SETTLED INTO THE REGION EARLY THIS MORNING. CLEAR
SKIES AND LIGHT WINDS HAVE ALLOWED TEMPERATURES TO DROP INTO THE MID
40S TO MID 50S ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA. SKIES WILL BE SUNNY TODAY
WHICH ALLOW TEMPERATURES TO WARM INTO THE MID TO UPPER 70S. TONIGHT
SHOULD BE CLEAR AGAIN BUT NOT NEARLY AS COOL. THE SURFACE HIGH WILL
MOVE TO THE EAST BY SATURDAY BRINGING A RETURN TO SOUTHERLY WINDS
WHICH WILL HELP WARM THINGS UP SOME MORE WITH HIGHS ON SATURDAY IN
THE LOW TO MID 80S. UPPER LEVEL LOW WILL TRACK ACROSS MISSOURI ON
SUNDAY SO HAVE KEPT 20 POPS IN THE FORECAST. NEXT CHANCE AT A COLD
FRONT MOVING THROUGH THE REGION WILL BE WEDNESDAY. EXTENDED MODELS
ARE NOT IN AGREEMENT AS TO THE TIMING OF THE FRONT SO DECIDED TO
LEAVE THAT PART OF THE FORECAST ALONE FOR NOW. ONCE THE FRONT MOVES
THROUGH HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS IN AGAIN AND NEXT WEEKEND IS LOOKING TO
BE PRETTY NICE.
