FXUS64 KMEG 300127
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
826 PM CDT THU SEP 29 2005

.UPDATE...
SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE STRETCHES FROM MO TO OH THIS EVENING.
NORTHEAST WINDS CIRCULATING AROUND THIS HIGH ARE PUSHING COOLER
AIR INTO THE MIDSOUTH. SURFACE DEWPOINTS ARE IN THE 40S ACROSS THE
MIDSOUTH. SATELLITE SHOWS CLEAR SKIES ACROSS THE AREA. FORECAST
OVERNIGHT LOWS AND REMAINDER OF THE FORECAST LOOKS FINE. OUR FIRST
REAL TASTE OF FALL WEATHER HAS ARRIVED. NO UPDATES ATTM.

.PREV DISCUSSION...
ISSUED 240 PM CDT THU SEP 29 2005

SURFACE COLD FRONT EXTENDS FROM CENTRAL ALABAMA INTO SOUTHERN
MISSISSIPPI. VISIBLE SATELLITE THIS AFTERNOON SHOWS SOME POST FRONTAL
STRATOCUMULUS ACROSS THE SOUTHERN TIER OF COUNTIES IN FORECAST AREA
GRADUALLY DEPARTING. TEMPERATURES HAVE ONLY WARMED INTO THE UPPER 60S
TO LOWER 70S WITH COLD AIR ADVECTION IN PLACE ACROSS THE MID SOUTH.
MAIN FORECAST CONCERNS THIS PACKAGE IS CONVECTIVE CHANCES ON SUNDAY
AND AGAIN ON WEDNESDAY.

TONIGHT...COOL NIGHT EXPECTED ACROSS THE MID SOUTH. HIGH PRESSURE
WILL CONTINUE TO BUILD IN TONIGHT. TEMPERATURES WILL DROP BACK INTO
THE 40S WITH UPPER 30S TO LOWER 40 SURFACE DEWPOINTS ALREADY IN
PLACE ACROSS THE AREA. CLEAR SKIES ARE EXPECTED WITH 1000-500 MB
LAYER RH/S AROUND 20-30 PERCENT.

FRIDAY AND SATURDAY...HIGH PRESSURE WILL BRING ANOTHER PLEASANT
COUPLE OF DAYS TO THE FORECAST AREA. SUNNY SKIES ARE EXPECTED ON
FRIDAY WITH 1000-500 MB LAYER RH/S REMAINING AT OR AROUND 30
PERCENT. ALSO MODEL SOUNDINGS SUPPORT HIGHS IN THE 70S AT BEST. HIGH
PRESSURE WILL GRADUALLY BEGIN TO MOVE EAST OF THE REGION BY FRIDAY
NIGHT...ALLOWING SOUTHERLY FLOW TO RETURN ON THE BACKSIDE OF HIGH
PRESSURE. LOW TEMPERATURES WILL BE A BIT WARMER THAN TONIGHT AND
HIGHS WARMING BACK INTO THE LOWER TO MIDDLE 80S ON SATURDAY.

SUNDAY THROUGH THURSDAY...UPPER LEVEL LOW CURRENTLY LOCATED ACROSS
NORTHEAST ARIZONA WILL MOVE EAST INTO THE MIDDLE MISSISSIPPI VALLEY
BY SUNDAY. BETTER FORCING WITH THIS FEATURE WILL REMAIN TO THE NORTH
OF THE MID SOUTH. HOWEVER...WILL NEED TO MENTION A SLIGHT CHANCE OF
SHOWERS/THUNDERSTORMS WITH 320K SURFACE SHOWING SOME WEAK ISENTROPIC
ASCENT. ANOTHER UPPER LEVEL LOW IS EXPECTED TO MOVE ACROSS THE
NORTHERN UNITED STATES BY MIDWEEK BRINGING A SLIGHT CHANCE OF
SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS TO THE MID SOUTH BY WEDNESDAY/WEDNESDAY
NIGHT. UPPER LEVEL FORCING WITH THIS SYSTEM LOOKS MUCH BETTER AND
LATER SHIFTS MAY NEED TO ADJUST POPS UPWARD ACCORDINGLY. HIGH
PRESSURE WILL BUILD BACK INTO THE MID SOUTH ON THURSDAY.

&&

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 291601
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
1100 AM CDT THU SEP 29 2005

.DISCUSSION...14 UTC SURFACE ANALYSIS PLACES COLD FRONT ACROSS 
CENTRAL ALABAMA AND SOUTHERN MISSISSIPPI. MEANWHILE...1026 MB HIGH 
PRESSURE CENTERED ACROSS CENTRAL MISSOURI. TEMPERATURES ACROSS THE 
MID SOUTH ARE IN THE 50S WITH VISIBLE SATELLITE IMAGES SHOWING BACK 
EDGE OF POST FRONTAL STRATUS ALONG THE TENNESSEE/MISSISSIPPI STATE 
BORDER. SOME DIURNAL BASED STRATO CUMULUS DEVELOPED ACROSS PORTIONS 
OF WESTERN TENNESSEE...HOWEVER UPPER LEVEL SUBSIDENCE IS ALREADY 
STARTING TO SUPPRESS THE CLOUD COVER. FORECAST OVERALL ON TRACK AND 
WILL NOT ISSUE AN UPDATE AT THIS TIME.

CJC

.PREV DISCUSSION...ISSUED 200 AM CDT THU SEP 29 2005...

COLD FRONT MOVING THROUGH THE CWA THIS MORNING. A LINE OF SHOWERS 
AND THUNDERSTORMS IS ACCOMPANYING THE FRONT THROUGH THE AREA. STRONG 
NORTH-NORTHWEST WINDS ARE ALREADY USHERING IN COOLER AND DRIER AIR 
INTO THE REGION. EXPECT FRONT TO STILL BE MOVING THROUGH 
SOUTHEASTERN PORTIONS OF THE CWA SO WILL LEAVE A SMALL POP GOING 
THROUGH MIDDAY...MAY NEED TO EXPAND FURTHER NORTH DEPENDING ON 
LATEST RADAR IMAGES AT ZONE ISSUANCE. OTHERWISE HIGH PRESSURE WILL 
QUICKLY BUILD INTO THE REST OF THE CWA TODAY. EXPECT SKIES TO 
QUICKLY CLEAR OUT DURING THE MORNING HOURS AS THE DRIER AIR MOVES 
INTO THE REGION. WILL GO WITH A MOSTLY CLOUDY BECOMING MOSTLY SUNNY 
WORDING FOR TODAY. TODAY WILL DEFINITELY FEEL LIKE AUTUMN WITH 
HIGHS REACHING NEAR 70 DEGREES.

HIGH PRESSURE WILL CONTINUE TO BUILD OVER THE AREA AND WILL DOMINATE 
THE WEATHER THROUGH THE EARLY PART OF THE WEEKEND. CLEAR SKIES AND 
LIGHT WINDS WILL ALLOW TEMPERATURES TO DROP INTO THE 40S TONIGHT. ON 
FRIDAY...TEMPERATURES WILL REMAIN COOL WITH HIGHS IN THE 70S. 

UPPER TROUGH WILL SKIRT THE AREA FOR THE LATTER PART OF THE WEEKEND. 
WILL KEEP SMALL POPS IN FORECAST.

HIGH PRESSURE WILL BUILD OVER THE AREA FOR THE BEGINNING PART OF THE WEEK. 
THIS WILL WARM TEMPERATURES BACK TO THE MID 80S FOR HIGHS WITH LOWS 
IN THE 60S. 

THE NEXT COLD FRONT WILL APPROACH THE AREA ON WEDNESDAY. SOME PRECIP 
MAY GET INTO NORTHWESTERN ZONES DURING AFTERNOON HOURS BUT WILL HOLD 
OFF ON PUTTING IN FORECAST FOR NOW.

KRM

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.

AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
927 PM CDT WED SEP 28 2005

.UPDATE...

HAVE CANCELLED SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WATCH 823...AS SEVERE WEATHER
THREAT HAS MOVED OUT OF THE WATCH AREA. FURTHER SOUTHEAST...THERE
CONTINUES TO BE AN ISOLATED SEVERE THREAT...BUT COVERAGE SHOULD BE
ISOLATED AND ANOTHER SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WATCH IS NOT ANTICIPATED
AT THIS TIME.

.DISCUSSION FROM 857 PM...

JUST ANOTHER QUICK UPDATE TO EXTEND POSSIBILITY OF SEVERE FURTHER
SOUTHEAST TO INCLUDE PORTIONS OF SOUTHWEST TENNESSEE AND NORTHWEST
MISSISSIPPI. ACROSS THESE AREAS...EXPECT THUNDERSTORMS TO MOVE IN
BETWEEN 930 PM AND 1130 PM...WITH AN ISOLATED DAMAGING WIND THREAT
POSSIBLE ACROSS PORTIONS OF THESE AREAS.

&&

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 290157
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
857 PM CDT WED SEP 28 2005

.UPDATE...

JUST ANOTHER QUICK UPDATE TO EXTEND POSSIBILITY OF SEVERE FURTHER
SOUTHEAST TO INCLUDE PORTIONS OF SOUTHWEST TENNESSEE AND NORTHWEST
MISSISSIPPI. ACROSS THESE AREAS...EXPECT THUNDERSTORMS TO MOVE IN
BETWEEN 930 PM AND 1130 PM...WITH AN ISOLATED DAMAGING WIND THREAT
POSSIBLE ACROSS PORTIONS OF THESE AREAS.


.DISCUSSION FROM 809 PM...

A LINE OF SEVERE THUNDERSTORMS CONTINUES TO MOVE EAST ACROSS
NORTHEAST ARKANSAS AND THE MISSOURI BOOTHEEL. THE PRIMARY THREAT
WITH THESE STORMS WILL CONTINUE TO BE DAMAGING WINDS AND
MARGINALLY SEVERE HAIL. THIS SEVERE WEATHER THREAT SHOULD
CONTINUE SPREADING EAST INTO PORTIONS OF NORTHWEST TENNESSEE OVER THE
NEXT HOUR OR TWO. DUE TO THIS...HAVE INCLUDED ALL OF NORTHEAST
ARKANSAS...THE MISSOURI BOOTHEEL...AND PORTIONS OF WEST TENNESSEE
INTO A SLIGHT RISK AREA. THEN AS THE ENTIRE LINE SWEEPS FURTHER
SOUTH AND EAST THE SEVERE WEATHER THREAT WILL BEGIN TO SLOWLY
DIMINISH AS THE ATMOSPHERE BECOMES INCREASINGLY STABLE. ALTHOUGH...
CANNOT TOTALLY RULE OUT AN ISOLATED SEVERE WIND GUST OR SMALL HAIL
EVEN FURTHER SOUTHEAST OF THE SLIGHT RISK AREA.

HAVE UPDATED THE GRIDS AND ZONES TO REFLECT ONGOING SITUATION.
UPDATES OUT SHORTLY.

&&


.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WATCH IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 PM FOR ARZ008-009-
017-018-026-027.
MO...SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WATCH IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 PM FOR MOZ113.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 281850
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
150 PM CDT WED SEP 28 2005

.DISCUSSION...
MOSTLY SUNNY SKIES ACROSS THE REGION WITH WARM TEMPS THIS
AFTERNOON. WHAT A DIFFERENCE THE NEXT 24 HOURS WILL MAKE. THE BIG
WEATHER STORY IS A STRONG SHORTWAVE MOVING INTO THE CENTRAL PLAINS
WITH THE ASSOCD COLD FRONT PUSHING INTO THE MID MS VALLEY THIS
AFTN. DECENT RETURN FLOW WAS OCCURRING IN ADVANCE OF THE FRONT AS
SFC DEWPOINTS HAVE CLIMBED INTO THE MID AND UPPER 60S. THE FRONT
WL MOVE QUICKLY INTO NE AR EARLY THIS EVENING. STRONG LIFTING IN
ADVANCE OF THE VIGOROUS SHORTWAVE AND ALONG THE SURFACE FRONT WL
TRIGGER SCT SHOWERS AND TSTMS. SINCE THE AIRMASS WL CONT TO
DESTABILIZE LATE THIS AFTN AS DEWPOINTS RISE TO NEAR 70 AND CAPES
APPROACH 1500 J/KG A FEW OF THESE STORMS MAY BE SEVERE WITH
DAMAGING WIND AND HAIL. LOOKS LIKE BEST COMBINATION OF TIMING AND
INGREDIENTS WL OCCUR ACRS NE AR EARLY THIS EVENING WHERE
INSTABILITY WL BE MODERATE AS THE FRONT PUSHES THROUGH. ACRS THE
REMAINDER OF THE AREA THE LOSS OF HEATING AS THE SUN SETS SHOULD
PRECLUDE ANY SEVERE WEATHER THOUGH A FEW STORMS MAY BE STRONG.

THE FRONT WL WORK QUICKLY ACRS THE MID SOUTH TONIGHT AND WL BE
SOUTH OF THE AREA BY 12Z THU. SCT SHOWERS AND TSTMS WL END ACRS
NE AR AFTER MIDNIGHT WITH SKIES CLEARING OUT AND MUCH COOLER AIR
FILTERING IN BEHIND THE FRONT. TEMPS WL FALL INTO THE LOWER AND
MIDDLE 50S ACRS NRN SXNS BY THU MORNING. ON THURSDAY EXPECT STRONG
LOW LEVEL CAA THROUGHOUT THE DAY WITH PLENTY OF SUNSHINE DUE TO A
VERY DRY AIRMASS. TEMPS WL BE ALMOST 20 DEGREES COLDER WITH
READINGS STRUGGLING TO REACH 70 IN SOME AREAS. A BRISK NORTHERLY
WIND WL HAVE A FALL FEEL TO IT.

THE COLDEST NIGHT OF THIS NEW FALL SEASON WL BE UPON US THURSDAY.
HIGH PRESSURE WL SETTLED ACRS THE REGION WITH CLEAR SKIES AND
DIMINISHING WINDS. EXPECT TEMPS DEEP INTO THE 40S...EXCEPT
MEM...WITH SOME ISOLD UPPER 30S POSSIBLE ACRS COLDER SXNS OF W
TN.

ANOTHER PLEASANT DAY IN STORE FOR FRIDAY WITH HIGH PRESSURE IN
CONTROL. TEMPS WL START TO WARM A LITTLE WITH READINGS MAINLY IN
THE MID 70S. BY FRI NIGHT SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE MOVES OFF TO THE
EAST AS AN UPPER LOW STARTS TO MOVE INTO THE SRN PLAINS. EASTERLY
FLOW DEVELOPS ALONG THE GULF COAST STATES ADVECTING SOME HIGHER
DEWPOINT AIR INTO MID SOUTH. AS A RESULT MIN TEMPS A LITTLE WARMER
THAN THE PREVIOUS NIGHT.

THE UPPER LOW MOVES TO THE NW OF THE AREA SAT NIGHT THROUGH SUN DRAWING
UP SOME MOISTURE INTO THE AREA. WL CONT WITH SMALL POPS FOR THIS
TIME PERIOD. AFTER THIS FEATURE MOVES THROUGH HIGH PRESSURE WL BE
IN CONTROL FOR THE FIRST HALF OF THE WEEK WITH MILD TEMPS. NEXT
FRONT MAY MOVE THROUGH THE AREA WED NIGHT/THU TIME FRAME. 

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
MEM  59  70  50  76 /  50  10  10  10 
MKL  56  68  40  74 /  50  10  10  10 
JBR  54  70  45  75 /  50  10  10  10 
TUP  61  71  46  78 /  50  20  10  10 

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.

MS...NONE.

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 281614
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
1114 AM CDT WED SEP 28 2005

.UPDATE...
SKIES WERE MOSTLY SUNNY THIS MORNING WITH LIGHT SOUTHERLY WINDS 
ACROSS THE REGION IN ADVANCE OF COLD FRONT APPROACHING THE MID MS 
VALLEY. TEMPS WERE WARMING NICELY WITH MID AND UPPER 80S ON TAP FOR 
THIS AFTERNOON. COLD FRONT WL MOVE INTO NE AR/MO BOOTHEEL BY 00Z. 
WL PUSH BACK MENTION OF PRECIP TO LATE THIS AFTERNOON FOR NE AR/MO 
BOOTHEEL JUDGING BY CURRENT RADAR/SAT TRENDS. OTRW ONGOING FORECAST 
LOOKS GOOD.  

.PREV DISCUSSION ISSUED AT 130 AM CDT...
COOL AND QUIET WEATHER EXISTS ACROSS THE MIDSOUTH THIS MORNING. 
QUIET WEATHER WILL COME TO AN END BY THIS AFTERNOON ACROSS 
NORTHWESTERN PORTIONS OF THE CWA AS A COLD FRONT WILL BEGIN TO MOVE 
INTO THE AREA. EXPECT SCATTERED SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS TO 
ACCOMPANY THE FRONT. WILL KEEP SLIGHT CHANCE POPS IN NORTHWESTERN 
ZONES FOR THIS AFTERNOON AND KEEP 50 POPS GOING FOR TONIGHT AS THE 
FRONT MAKES ITS WAY THROUGH THE CWA. SOME PRECIP MAY LINGER IN 
SOUTHEASTERN ZONES FOR THURSDAY MORNING SO WILL KEEP A SMALL POP IN 
THESE ZONES THROUGH MIDDAY. OTHERWISE...COOLER AND MORE AUTUMN-LIKE 
TEMPERATURES WILL FILTER IN BEHIND THE FRONT ON THURSDAY AS HIGH 
PRESSURE REBUILDS INTO THE CWA. EXPECT HIGHS NEAR 70 FOR THURSDAY. 

CLEAR SKIES AND LIGHT WINDS WILL ALLOW TEMPERATURES TO DROP INTO THE 
40S TO NEAR 50 DEGREES FOR MOST LOCATIONS THURSDAY NIGHT. SOME 
GUIDANCE IS EVEN SHOWING THE UPPER 30S FOR MKL FOR THIS TIME PERIOD. 
HIGH PRESSURE AND THE COOL WEATHER WILL CONTINUE THROUGH SATURDAY. 

AN UPPER TROUGH WILL SKIRT MAINLY NORTHERN PORTIONS OF THE MIDSOUTH 
SATURDAY NIGHT INTO SUNDAY NIGHT. THE TROUGH MAY PRODUCE A FEW 
ISOLATED SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS. 

AN UPPER RIDGE WILL BUILD INTO THE AREA BY MONDAY ALLOWING FOR DRY 
WEATHER AND WARMER TEMPERATURES TO RETURN TO THE MIDSOUTH THROUGH 
THE END OF THE FORECAST PERIOD. TEMPERATURES WILL BE SLIGHTLY ABOVE 
NORMAL FOR THIS TIME OF YEAR WITH HIGHS IN THE MID 80S AND LOWS IN 
THE MID TO UPPER 60S.
&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 271931
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
231 PM CDT TUE SEP 27 2005

.DISCUSSION...
SKIES WERE PARTLY CLOUDY OVER THE MIDSOUTH TODAY WITH MORE CLOUD 
COVER FARTHER WEST. A BROAD AREA OF HIGH PRESSURE WAS IN CONTROL OF 
MOST OF THE NATION.

A STRONG SHORTWAVE TROUGH WILL DIG INTO WESTERN MONTANA THIS 
EVENING. THE ASSOCIATED COLD FRONT WAS LOCATED FROM NORTHWESTERN 
MINNESOTA TO EASTERN COLORADO. ABUNDANT LOW LEVEL MOISTURE WILL BE 
ADVECTED ALONG AND AHEAD OF THE FRONT...AS SEEN IN THE 850MB 
TRAJECTORIES. AS THE SHORTWAVE DIGS INTO CENTRAL ILLINOIS BY LATE 
WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON...THE COLD FRONT WILL BEGIN TO MOVE INTO THE 
NORTHWESTERN FORECAST AREA. SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS WILL LIKELY 
ACCOMPANY THE FRONTAL PASSAGE. THE BULK OF THE RAIN WILL OCCUR 
ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA WEDNESDAY NIGHT.

THIS FRONT WILL BE MUCH COOLER AND FALL LIKE THAN THE RECORD 
BREAKING TEMPERATURES OF THE RECENT PAST. CURRENT THINKING IS THAT 
THE FRONT WILL MOVE THROUGH THE SOUTHEASTERN PARTS OF THE FORECAST 
AREA BY NOON THURSDAY...SO UNTIL THEN...A CHANCE FOR RAIN WILL 
EXIST. OTHERWISE...NORTHERLY WINDS AND COLD ADVECTION THROUGHOUT THE 
DAY THURSDAY WILL TAKE PLACE. MAX TEMPERATURES WILL ONLY WARM INTO 
THE 70S.  

THE MODELS DEPICT THE CURRENT LOW OVER THE NORTHERN GREAT BASIN TO 
GET CUT OFF FROM THE MAIN FLOW. THIS LOW WILL LINGER OVER THE DESERT 
SOUTHWEST BEFORE KICKING OUT INTO THE PLAINS ON FRIDAY. THERE IS 
SOME SPECULATION ON THE HANDLING OF THIS FEATURE. BY SUNDAY 
AFTERNOON...THE GFS PRODUCES AN UPPER HIGH OVER THE MIDSOUTH. AS 
TIME PROGRESSES...A WEAK EASTERLY TYPE WAVE IS GENERATED AND THE 
STEERING FLOW BRINGS THIS WAVE ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA ON TUESDAY. 
THE LATEST MEX DATA INDICATES A SLIGHT CHANCE FOR RAIN WITH THIS 
FEATURE. WILL NOT BITE ON THIS SOLUTION YET.

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.

$$

AC

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 270619
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
130 AM CDT TUE SEP 27 2005

.DISCUSSION...
HIGH PRESSURE WILL BUILD INTO THE MIDSOUTH TODAY BEHIND THE COLD 
FRONT THAT MOVED THROUGH THE CWA THIS EVENING. TEMPERATURES WILL BE 
SLIGHTLY COOLER WITH HIGHS IN THE MID 80S. SKIES WILL BECOME MOSTLY 
SUNNY BY THIS AFTERNOON AS THE STRATUS CURRENTLY AROUND THE AREA IS 
EXPECTED TO BURN OFF.

TONIGHT...HIGH PRESSURE WILL CONTINUE OVER THE AREA. EXPECT CLEAR 
SKIES AND LIGHT WINDS ALLOWING FOR LOW TEMPERATURES TO DROP INTO THE 
MID 50S TO MID 60S.

A COLD FRONT WILL BEGIN TO APPROACH THE AREA ON WEDNESDAY. EXPECT 
PARTLY CLOUDY CONDITIONS FOR MOST OF THE DAY. BY 
AFTERNOON...NORTHEAST ARKANSAS AND THE MISSOURI BOOTHEEL WILL BEGIN 
TO SEE CHANCES FOR SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS AS THE FRONT MOVES INTO 
THE CWA. WILL ADD POPS TO THE FORECAST FOR THE NORTHWESTERN ZONES.

FRONT WILL CONTINUE TO MOVE THROUGH THE MIDSOUTH WEDNESDAY NIGHT. 
WILL BUMP POPS FROM SLIGHT CHANCE TO 40/50 POPS ACROSS THE ENTIRE 
MIDSOUTH. PRECIPITATION CHANCES WILL LINGER INTO THURSDAY ACROSS 
SOUTHEASTERN SECTIONS OF THE CWA.

HIGH PRESSURE WILL BUILD IN BEHIND THE FRONT BY THURSDAY NIGHT 
BRINGING EVEN COOLER AND MORE AUTUMN LIKE WEATHER TO THE MIDSOUTH. 
THE HIGH WILL DOMINATE THE WEATHER THROUGH THE BEGINNING PART OF THE 
WEEKEND. EXPECT HIGHS IN THE 70S AND LOWS IN THE 40S AND 50S.

AN UPPER LEVEL LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM MAY BRING CHANCES FOR SHOWERS AND 
THUNDERSTORMS TO THE AREA FOR THE END OF THE WEEKEND UNTIL THE END 
OF THE FORECAST PERIOD. STILL EARLY TO KNOW EXACT MOVEMENT AND 
POSITION OF THE LOW...WILL KEEP SMALL POPS IN FORECAST.
&&

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 270133
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
833 PM CDT MON SEP 26 2005

.UPDATE...
RADAR INDICATES ISOLATED SHOWERS THAT MOVED INTO EAST-CENTRAL
AR AND SOUTHWEST TN ARE DISSIPATING WITH LOSS OF DAYTIME HEATING.
PLAN TO UPDATE AND REMOVE RAIN CHANCES FROM THE FORECAST FOR THE
REMAINDER OF THE NIGHT. OUTFLOW BOUNDARY ASSOCIATED WITH THESE
SHOWERS WILL MOVE INTO NORTH MS AND COULD STILL SET OFF ONE OR TWO
SHOWERS...BUT THE PROBABILITY IS VERY SLIM AND NOT HIGH ENOUGH TO
MENTION IN THE FORECAST. LATEST SURFACE ANALYSIS INDICATES LOWER
DEWPOINTS...IN THE 60S...SPREADING INTO NORTHERN AREAS OF THE
MIDSOUTH ALONG WITH A LITTLE INCREASE IN THE WIND SPEED FROM THE
NORTH AS HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS INTO THE AREA. THE HIGH WILL CONTINUE
TO BUILD INTO THE MIDSOUTH OVERNIGHT FROM THE NORTH. FORECAST LOWS
LOOK OK.

.PREV DISCUSSION...

UPDATE ISSUED 452 PM CDT MON SEP 26 2005...

UPDATED FORECAST TO INCLUDE ISOLATED SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS
ACROSS NORTHEAST AR...THE MO BOOTHEEL...AND WEST TN NORTH OF MEMPHIS
THROUGH EARLY EVENING. AN UPPER LEVEL SHORT WAVE WITH THE MAIN
VORT MAX JUST NORTH OF THE MIDSOUTH HAS KICKED OFF A FEW SHOWERS
ACROSS NORTHEAST AR INTO THE MO BOOTHEEL. ADDITIONAL DEVELOPMENT IS
POSSIBLE ACROSS NORTHWEST TN. THESE SHOWERS...AND POSSIBLE
THUNDERSTORMS AS LAPS SHOWS CAPES AROUND 800 J/KG...WILL MOVE
SOUTHEASTWARD. THINK THEY WILL DIMINISH WILL LOSS OF DAYTIME HEATING.
HOWEVER...WILL CONTINUE TO MONITOR IN CASE NEED TO ADD THE SLIGHT
CHANCE OF SHOWERS / THUNDERSTORMS TO ZONES FURTHER SOUTHWARD.

DISCUSSION ISSUED 300 PM CDT MON SEP 26 2005...

A COLD FRONT HAS PUSHED THROUGH THE MID SOUTH THIS AFTERNOON. A FEW
SHOWERS ENTERED NORTHERN ARKANSAS EARLY THIS AFTERNOON BUT HAVE
DIMINISHED AS THEY PUSH FURTHER AWAY FROM THE UPPER JET AND DEEPER
MOISTURE NORTH OF THE REGION. AM CONCERNED ABOUT LOW STRATUS AND/OR
FOG DEVELOPMENT LATE TONIGHT CONSIDERING THE COLD AIR ADVECTING IN
TONIGHT WITH THE MOIST AIR THAT IS ALREADY IN PLACE. THE MAV/MET
GUIDANCE IS HINTING AT THIS SCENARIO DEVELOPING...AND BOTH INDICATE
THAT THE STRATUS MAY BE MORE NOTICEABLE NEAR AND WEST OF THE
MISSISSIPPI RIVER.

HIGH PRESSURE WILL BUILD INTO THE AREA OVER THE NEXT COUPLE OF
DAYS. 850 TEMPS ARE AROUND +17 WHICH SHOULD TRANSLATE INTO HIGHS IN
THE 80S. A STRONGER COLD FRONT WILL ARRIVE WEDNESDAY/WEDNESDAY
NIGHT. THERE ARE QUESTIONS ABOUT THE AMOUNT OF FORCING ALONG THE
FRONT OVER THE MIDSOUTH. A VORT MAX WILL BE OVER WESTERN ARKANSAS
WHICH WILL AID SUPPORT THERE WHILE THE JET STREAM WILL BE MOVING
NORTHEAST OF THE REGION. WILL CONTINUE LOW CHANCES FOR NOW BUT MAY
HAVE TO UP THEM IF LATER MODEL RUNS SHOW BETTER SUPPORT OVER THE
REGION.

GFS HAS HAD GOOD CONSISTENCY WITH THE COOLER AIR COMING INTO THE
REGION. NAM AND EUROPEAN RUNS ALSO SUPPORT THE COOLER AIR COMING
DOWN. 850 TEMPS FALL TO AROUND +12 ON THURSDAY WHICH DOES SUPPORT
HIGHS IN THE 70S. LOWS IN THE 50S ARE VERY LIKELY AS WELL AND SOME
OF THE COLD SPOTS MAY SEE LOWS IN THE 40S.

THE NEXT CHANCE OF RAIN IS SATURDAY NIGHT AND ONWARDS AS THE GFS
ADVERTISES A CLOSED LOW APPROACHING THE REGION FROM THE WEST.

&&


.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.

THE 80S. A STRONGER COLD FRONT WILL ARRIVE WEDNESDAY/WEDNESDAY
NIGHT. THERE ARE QUESTIONS ABOUT THE AMOUNT OF FORCING ALONG THE
FRONT OVER THE MIDSOUTH. A VORT MAX WILL BE OVER WESTERN ARKANSAS
WHICH WILL AID SUPPORT THERE WHILE THE JET STREAM WILL BE MOVING
NORTHEAST OF THE REGION. WILL CONTINUE LOW CHANCES FOR NOW BUT MAY
HAVE TO UP THEM IF LATER MODEL RUNS SHOW BETTER SUPPORT OVER THE
REGION. 

GFS HAS HAD GOOD CONSISTENCY WITH THE COOLER AIR COMING INTO THE
REGION. NAM AND EUROPEAN RUNS ALSO SUPPORT THE COOLER AIR COMING
DOWN. 850 TEMPS FALL TO AROUND +12 ON THURSDAY WHICH DOES SUPPORT
HIGHS IN THE 70S. LOWS IN THE 50S ARE VERY LIKELY AS WELL AND SOME
OF THE COLD SPOTS MAY SEE LOWS IN THE 40S. 

THE NEXT CHANCE OF RAIN IS SATURDAY NIGHT AND ONWARDS AS THE GFS
ADVERTISES A CLOSED LOW APPROACHING THE REGION FROM THE WEST.

&&


.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.

$$

VALLE





000 
FXUS64 KMEG 261445
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
945 AM CDT MON SEP 26 2005

.DISCUSSION...

SATELLITE SHOWS AN AREA OF LOW CLOUDS ACROSS WEST TENNESSEE
EXTENDING INTO NORTHEAST MISSISSIPPI. THESE ARE CLOUDS ASSOCIATED
WITH THE REMNANTS FROM HURRICANE RITA. RITA IS NOW AN ELONGATED
TROUGH THAT EXTENDS FROM OHIO THROUGH MIDDLE TENNESSEE AND INTO
WESTERN ALABAMA. THERE IS A COLD FRONT THAT EXTENDS FROM THE OHIO
RIVER VALLEY THROUGH THE MISSOURI BOOTHEEL AND CENTRAL ARKANSAS
AND DOWN INTO NORTHEAST TEXAS. THIS FRONT IS PROGRESSIVELY MOVING
INTO THE REGION AND SHOULD KICK THE REMNANTS OF RITA AWAY FROM THE
AREA. THE LOW CLOUDS WILL LIKELY MIX OUT THIS AFTERNOON RESULTING
IN PARTLY CLOUDY SKIES. THE COLD FRONT WILL CONTINUE TO DROP
SOUTHWARD THIS AFTERNOON AND TONIGHT. RAIN CHANCES ARE LOW BECAUSE
FORCING ALONG THE FRONT IS WEAK THUS UPWARD VERTICAL MOTION IS
LIMITED. NO UPDATE PLANNED TO CURRENT FORECAST.

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.

FXUS64 KMEG 260733
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
215 AM CDT MON SEP 26 2005

.DISCUSSION...

REMNANTS OF RITA ARE HASTENING NORTHEAST INTO THE OHIO VALLEY
AHEAD OF A COLD FRONT FROM CHICAGO TO OKLAHOMA CITY. WESTERN EDGE
OF RITAS CLD SHIELD IS NOW ROUGHLY ON THE WESTERN COUNTIES OF
THE MIDSOUTH CWA. EXPECT CU TO DEVELOP TODAY AHEAD OF THE FRONT
WHICH INDICATES THERE WILL BE ENOUGH SUNSHINE TO WARM INTO THE
MID TO UPPER 80S TODAY. WINDS WILL BECOME NORTHERLY ONCE THE
FRONT PASSES.

THE CENTER OF THE HIGH PUSHING THE FRONT THROUGH THE MIDSOUTH
WILL ACTUALLY MOVE EAST INTO THE MID ATLANTIC STATES BY TUESDAY
EVENING WHILE ANOTHER FRONT SLIPS SOUTHEASTWARD OUT OF CANADA TO
THE MIDWEST. A FEW SHOWERS MAY ACCOMPANY THE FRONT WEDNESDAY.

BOTH OF THE FRONTS WILL BRING COOLER WEATHER. SOME NORTHERN
MIDSOUTH COUNTIES COULD COOL DOWN INTO THE UPPER 40S BY WEDNESDAY
MORNING.

A SHORT WAVE TROUGH WORKING EAST THROUGH THE NORTHERN FLOW WILL
BRING MORE RAIN THIS WEEKEND.

FXUS64 KMEG 252106 CCA
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...CORRECTED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
406 PM CDT SUN SEP 25 2005

.DISCUSSION...
RITA CONTINUES ITS NORTHEASTWARD MOVEMENT AT ABOUT 20 MPH. RITA WAS
CENTERED JUST WEST OF JONESBORO THIS AFTERNOON. ASSOCIATED RAIN
BANDS WERE MOVING ACROSS WEST TENNESSEE AND NORTH MISSISSIPPI. THESE
BANDS WILL MOVE EASTWARD OVER THE NEXT SEVERAL HOURS. THUS...THE
FLOOD WATCH WILL EXPIRE AT 4 PM. THE WIND ADVISORY WILL ALSO EXPIRE
AT 4 PM. MAY CANCEL TORNADO WATCH AT 4 PM AS WELL...WILL REFER TO
RADAR BEFORE ISSUANCE OF NEW FORECAST.

WITH RITA ON ITS WAY OUT OF THE REGION...THE RAINFALL WILL LIKELY
END BY MIDNIGHT. RITA IS BEING EJECTED BY A SHORTWAVE TROUGH
TRANSLATING ACROSS THE GREAT LAKES REGION THIS AFTERNOON. THE
STRONGER TROUGH LINGERING BACK IN THE NORTHERN ROCKIES WILL FOLLOW
IN THE WAKE OF THE INITIAL WAVE. THIS WAVE WILL BRING IN COOLER AIR
INTO THE MIDSOUTH BY MONDAY NIGHT. THIS WILL PUT THE REGION IN A
NICE...FALL PATTERN.

APPEARS THAT DRY WEATHER WILL PERSIST FOR THE FORECAST AREA THROUGH
MUCH OF THE WEEK. ANOTHER COLD FRONT...THE STRONGEST THIS FALL WILL
MOVE OUT OF THE PLAINS ON WEDNESDAY NIGHT. THIS WILL CAUSE DAYTIME
TEMPERATURES THURSDAY AND FRIDAY TO BE IN THE MID 70S OVER MUCH OF
THE MIDSOUTH.

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.

$$

FXUS64 KMEG 251503
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
1002 AM CDT SUN SEP 25 2005

.DISCUSSION...
THE CENTER OF RITA WAS LOCATED EAST OF LITTLE ROCK MOVING NORTHEAST 
AT 20 MPH. THERE WAS ONE SIGNIFICANT RAIN BAND STRETCHING FROM THE 
MISSOURI BOOTHEEL THROUGH FAYETTE COUNTY AND INTO EASTERN YALOBUSHA 
COUNTY IN NORTHERN MISSISSIPPI. WIND GUSTS FROM 40 TO 60 MPH HAVE 
OCCURRED WITH THE STRONGER SHOWERS. ADDITIONAL TORNADO THREAT WILL 
STILL EXIST FOR THE MIDSOUTH FOR MOST OF THE DAY TODAY. AN UPDATED 
TORNADO WATCH IS EXPECTED WITHIN THE NEXT COUPLE OF HOURS. WILL 
AWAIT THE NEW WATCH BEFORE TRANSMITTING THE UPDATED ZONES.

WE HAVE LOWERED MAX TEMPS A COUPLE OF DEGREES WITH ANTICIPATED CLOUD 
COVER AND RAIN. WILL BE EXAMINING THE FLOOD THREAT FOR LATER PERIODS 
FOR THE 4 PM ISSUANCE. THE WIND ADVISORY WILL CONTINUE THROUGH 
TODAY. 

&&

FXUS64 KMEG 250849
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
315 AM CDT SUN SEP 25 2005

.DISCUSSION...

TROPICAL DEPRESSION RITA IS NOW THREATENING THE MIDSOUTH WITH
SEVERE WEATHER...HIGH WINDS AND FLOODING. TORNADOES AND FLASH
FLOODING SEEM TO THE MOST SERIOUS THREAT TODAY.

THE EYE AT 3 AM WAS AROUND HOPE AR. THE EYA SHOULD MOVE NORTHEAST
TO JUST NORTHEAST OF LITTLE ROCK BY 7 PM AND ON NORTHEAST TO THE
BOOTHEEL BY 7 AM MONDAY. MAIN FEEDER BAND NOW GOES UP THE
MISSISSIPPI RIVER TO NEAR GREENVILLE MS AND THEN NORTH INTO EAST
CENTRAL AR BEFORE CURVING INTO NORTH CENTRAL AR. THE BAND IS
MOVING SLOWLY EAST. TORNADOES HAVE OCCURRED WITH THIS BAND ALONG
WITH FLASH FLOODING UNDER THE TRAINING HEAVY CELLS.

ANOTHER TORNADO WATCH HAS BEEN ISSUED AND WILL LAST UNTIL 1 PM
DUE TO SLOW MOVEMENT OF THE STORM AND DAYTIME HEATING THAT MIGHT
OCCUR FROM BREAKS IN CLOUD COVER.

STRONG WINDS WITH GUSTS TO 40 MPH WILL BE COMMON OVER THE
MIDSOUTH TODAY. EVEN STRONGER GUSTS COULD OCCUR NEAR HEAVIER
STORMS.

STORMS SHOULD TAPER OFF MONDAY AS THE TROPICAL SYSTEM MOVES TO
THE NORTHEAST AND HIGH PRESSURE FILLS INTO THE AREA.

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES

CDT MONDAY.
WIND ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM SUNDAY.

CDT MONDAY.
WIND ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM SUNDAY.

918 PM CDT SAT SEP 24 2005

.DISCUSSION...

TROPICAL STORM RITA NOW SHOWING A BIT OF A TURN TOWARD THE NORTHEAST
AS IT MOVES INTO SOUTHWEST ARKANSAS. TORNADIC THREAT REMAIN OVER THE
WESTERN HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA AND NEW TORNADO WATCH IN EFFECT
UNTIL 4 AM. IN ADDITION...WINDS HAVE BEGUN TO INCREASE OVER WESTERN
SECTIONS OF THE FORECAST AREA WITH WINDS GUSTS APPROACHING 30 MPH.
HAVE ISSUED A WIND ADVISORY FOR THE ENTIRE FORECAST AREA UNTIL 4 PM
SUNDAY. REMAINDER OF FORECAST LOOKS FINE SO NO OTHER CHANGES WERE
MADE.

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 242227 CCB
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...CORRECTION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
527 PM CDT SAT SEP 24 2005

.DISCUSSION...

HAVE DECIDED TO ISSUE A FLOOD WATCH THAT WILL BE IN EFFECT FROM 6 AM
CDT SUNDAY MORNING THROUGH 6 AM CDT MONDAY MORNING. THIS IS IN
ANTICIPATION OF HEAVY RAINFALL SUNDAY AND SUNDAY NIGHT. AT THIS
POINT...IT APPEARS LIKELY THAT RAINFALL TOTALS BETWEEN 3 AND 6
INCHES...WITH ISOLATED HIGHER AMOUNTS...WILL OCCUR. SOME COMPUTER
MODELS INDICATE THE STORM MAY SLOW...AND IF THIS OCCURS RAINFALL
TOTALS MAY BE MUCH HIGHER THAN CURRENTLY INDICATED. STAY TUNED.

TORNADO WATCHES 815 AND 816 CONTINUE FOR PORTIONS OF THE AREA
THROUGH 9 PM CDT TONIGHT.


.PREVIOUS DISCUSSION ISSUED AT 337 PM...

WEATHER CONDITIONS WILL BEGIN TO DETERIORATE ACROSS SOUTHERN
PORTIONS OF THE MID-SOUTH OVER THE NEXT COUPLE OF HOURS. SEVERE
THREAT CONTINUING TO INCREASE OVER EAST-CENTRAL ARKANSAS AND NORTH
MISSISSIPPI...WITH FAVORABLE SHEAR PROFILES THAT WILL BE CONDUCIVE
TO TORNADO DEVELOPMENT...ESPECIALLY ACROSS EAST ARKANSAS AND
NORTHWEST MISSISSIPPI. OUTER CONVECTIVE SPIRAL BANDS JUST SOUTHWEST
OF THE FORECAST AREA CONTAIN SEVERAL MINI-SUPERCELL THUNDERSTORMS
WITH RADAR INDICATED ROTATION. THESE SPIRAL BANDS AND INCREASINGLY
FAVORABLE SEVERE ENVIRONMENT WILL CONTINUE TO MOVE NORTHWARD
THROUGH THE EVENING. THE BEST SEVERE WEATHER AND TORNADO THREAT WILL
REMAIN PRIMARILY SOUTH OF THE INTERSTATE 40 CORRIDOR THIS EVENING
AND TONIGHT. ALTHOUGH...SEVERE WEATHER CANNOT BE COMPLETELY RULED
OUT FARTHER NORTH AS THE CONVECTIVE BANDS ROTATE NORTHWESTWARD. LOSS
OF DAYTIME HEATING LATER TONIGHT MAY LESSON THE OVERALL SEVERE
THREAT...BUT WITH CONTINUED INCREASING LOW LEVEL SHEAR VALUES AND
WINDS...THERE WILL STILL BE SOME LEVEL OF SEVERE THREAT THROUGH THE
NIGHT.

RITA WILL CONTINUE TO THE NORTH AND THEN MORE NORTHEASTERLY ON
SUNDAY...AS WELL AS SLOW ITS FORWARD SPEED AS THE STEERING FLOW
WEAKENS SOMEWHAT. LOW LEVEL SHEAR PROFILES ACROSS THE ENTIRE MID-
SOUTH WILL BE STRONG ON SUNDAY...AND THERE WILL ONCE AGAIN BE A
SEVERE WEATHER AND TORNADO THREAT OVERSPREADING THE AREA. BY SUNDAY
NIGHT...RITA SHOULD HAVE WEAKENED SUFFICIENTLY ENOUGH TO PREVENT A
SEVERE WEATHER THREAT CONTINUING BEYOND SUNDAY NIGHT...BUT THEN AS
SOME OF THE GLOBAL AND TROPICAL MODELS INDICATE A SLOWING OF THE
SYSTEM AS IT MOVES CLOSER TO OUR AREA. AS THIS OCCURS...THE THREAT
FOR FLOODING WILL INCREASE. AT THIS POINT THERE IS THE POTENTIAL
FOR HEAVY RAIN AND POSSIBLE FLOODING...BUT CONFIDENCE IS NOT HIGH
ENOUGH REGARDING THE SPEED AND TIMING OF THE REMNANT LOW TO ISSUE A
FLOOD WATCH AT THIS TIME. AT SOME POINT...A FLOOD WATCH MAY BECOME
NECESSARY AND WILL BRIEF NEXT SHIFT ON THIS POSSIBILITY. ALSO PLAN
TO HIGHLIGHT THE FLOOD THREAT AS WELL AS THE SEVERE WEATHER THREAT
IN THE HAZARDOUS WEATHER OUTLOOK.

RITA SHOULD FINALLY CLEAR EAST OF THE AREA BY MID-WEEK BRINGING AN
END TO THE LIKELY RAIN CHANCES. THERE MAY STILL BE SMALL CHANCES OF
SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND THURSDAY...AS A
STRONGER NORTHERN STREAM TROUGH PUSHES A COLD FRONT THROUGH THE
AREA. FOLLOWING THIS FRONT...EXPECT A TASTE OF FALL FOR THE END OF
NEXT WEEK WITH COOLER TEMPERATURES AND LESS HUMID CONDITIONS.

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES
AR...TORNADO WATCH IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM CDT FOR ARZ058-027-028-035-
036-048-049. FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM 6 AM CDT SUNDAY THROUGH 6 AM
CDT MONDAY FOR ALL ARKANSAS COUNTIES.

MO...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM 6 AM CDT SUNDAY THROUGH 6 AM
CDT MONDAY FOR ALL MISSOURI COUNTIES..

MS...TORNADO WATCH IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM FOR MSZ010>013-015>017-
020>024-001-007-008. FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM 6 AM CDT SUNDAY
THROUGH 6 AM CDT MONDAY FOR ALL MISSISSIPPI COUNTIES.

TN...TORNADO WATCH IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM FOR TNZ049-088. FLOOD WATCH
IN EFFECT FROM 6 AM CDT SUNDAY THROUGH 6 AM CDT MONDAY FOR ALL
TENNESSEE COUNTIES.

$$

REMAIN PRIMARILY SOUTH OF THE INTERSTATE 40 CORRIDOR THIS EVENING
AND TONIGHT. ALTHOUGH...SEVERE WEATHER CANNOT BE COMPLETELY RULED
OUT FARTHER NORTH AS THE CONVECTIVE BANDS ROTATE NORTHWESTWARD. LOSS
OF DAYTIME HEATING LATER TONIGHT MAY LESSON THE OVERALL SEVERE
THREAT...BUT WITH CONTINUED INCREASING LOW LEVEL SHEAR VALUES AND
WINDS...THERE WILL STILL BE SOME LEVEL OF SEVERE THREAT THROUGH THE
NIGHT.

RITA WILL CONTINUE TO THE NORTH AND THEN MORE NORTHEASTERLY ON
SUNDAY...AS WELL AS SLOW ITS FORWARD SPEED AS THE STEERING FLOW
WEAKENS SOMEWHAT. LOW LEVEL SHEAR PROFILES ACROSS THE ENTIRE MID-
SOUTH WILL BE STRONG ON SUNDAY...AND THERE WILL ONCE AGAIN BE A
SEVERE WEATHER AND TORNADO THREAT OVERSPREADING THE AREA. BY SUNDAY
NIGHT...RITA SHOULD HAVE WEAKENED SUFFICIENTLY ENOUGH TO PREVENT A
SEVERE WEATHER THREAT CONTINUING BEYOND SUNDAY NIGHT...BUT THEN AS
SOME OF THE GLOBAL AND TROPICAL MODELS INDICATE A SLOWING OF THE
SYSTEM AS IT MOVES CLOSER TO OUR AREA. AS THIS OCCURS...THE THREAT
FOR FLOODING WILL INCREASE. AT THIS POINT THERE IS THE POTENTIAL
FOR HEAVY RAIN AND POSSIBLE FLOODING...BUT CONFIDENCE IS NOT HIGH
ENOUGH REGARDING THE SPEED AND TIMING OF THE REMNANT LOW TO ISSUE A
FLOOD WATCH AT THIS TIME. AT SOME POINT...A FLOOD WATCH MAY BECOME
NECESSARY AND WILL BRIEF NEXT SHIFT ON THIS POSSIBILITY. ALSO PLAN
TO HIGHLIGHT THE FLOOD THREAT AS WELL AS THE SEVERE WEATHER THREAT
IN THE HAZARDOUS WEATHER OUTLOOK.

RITA SHOULD FINALLY CLEAR EAST OF THE AREA BY MID-WEEK BRINGING AN
END TO THE LIKELY RAIN CHANCES. THERE MAY STILL BE SMALL CHANCES OF
SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND THURSDAY...AS A
STRONGER NORTHERN STREAM TROUGH PUSHES A COLD FRONT THROUGH THE
AREA. FOLLOWING THIS FRONT...EXPECT A TASTE OF FALL FOR THE END OF
NEXT WEEK WITH COOLER TEMPERATURES AND LESS HUMID CONDITIONS.

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES
AR...TORNADO WATCH IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM FOR ARZ058-027-028-035-036-
048-049.
MO...NONE.
MS...TORNADO WATCH IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM FOR MSZ010>013-015>017-
020>024-001-007-008.
TN...TORNADO WATCH IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM FOR TNZ049-088.

$$

JLH

FXUS64 KMEG 242121 AAA
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATE
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
421 PM CDT SAT SEP 24 2005

.DISCUSSION...

HAVE ADDED NEW TORNADO WATCH TO THE ZONE FORECAST FOR PORTIONS OF
EAST ARKANSAS...NORTHWEST MISSISSIPPI...AND SOUTHWEST TENNESSEE WHICH
WILL BE IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM. THIS WILL BE TORNADO WATCH 815.


.PREVIOUS DISCUSSION ISSUED AT 337 PM...

WEATHER CONDITIONS WILL BEGIN TO DETERIORATE ACROSS SOUTHERN
PORTIONS OF THE MID-SOUTH OVER THE NEXT COUPLE OF HOURS. SEVERE
THREAT CONTINUING TO INCREASE OVER EAST-CENTRAL ARKANSAS AND NORTH
MISSISSIPPI...WITH FAVORABLE SHEAR PROFILES THAT WILL BE CONDUCIVE
TO TORNADO DEVELOPMENT...ESPECIALLY ACROSS EAST ARKANSAS AND
NORTHWEST MISSISSIPPI. OUTER CONVECTIVE SPIRAL BANDS JUST SOUTHWEST
OF THE FORECAST AREA CONTAIN SEVERAL MINI-SUPERCELL THUNDERSTORMS
WITH RADAR INDICATED ROTATION. THESE SPIRAL BANDS AND INCREASINGLY
FAVORABLE SEVERE ENVIRONMENT WILL CONTINUE TO MOVE NORTHWARD
THROUGH THE EVENING. THE BEST SEVERE WEATHER AND TORNADO THREAT WILL
REMAIN PRIMARILY SOUTH OF THE INTERSTATE 40 CORRIDOR THIS EVENING
AND TONIGHT. ALTHOUGH...SEVERE WEATHER CANNOT BE COMPLETELY RULED
OUT FARTHER NORTH AS THE CONVECTIVE BANDS ROTATE NORTHWESTWARD. LOSS
OF DAYTIME HEATING LATER TONIGHT MAY LESSON THE OVERALL SEVERE
THREAT...BUT WITH CONTINUED INCREASING LOW LEVEL SHEAR VALUES AND
WINDS...THERE WILL STILL BE SOME LEVEL OF SEVERE THREAT THROUGH THE
NIGHT.

RITA WILL CONTINUE TO THE NORTH AND THEN MORE NORTHEASTERLY ON
SUNDAY...AS WELL AS SLOW ITS FORWARD SPEED AS THE STEERING FLOW
WEAKENS SOMEWHAT. LOW LEVEL SHEAR PROFILES ACROSS THE ENTIRE MID-
SOUTH WILL BE STRONG ON SUNDAY...AND THERE WILL ONCE AGAIN BE A
SEVERE WEATHER AND TORNADO THREAT OVERSPREADING THE AREA. BY SUNDAY
NIGHT...RITA SHOULD HAVE WEAKENED SUFFICIENTLY ENOUGH TO PREVENT A
SEVERE WEATHER THREAT CONTINUING BEYOND SUNDAY NIGHT...BUT THEN AS
SOME OF THE GLOBAL AND TROPICAL MODELS INDICATE A SLOWING OF THE
SYSTEM AS IT MOVES CLOSER TO OUR AREA. AS THIS OCCURS...THE THREAT
FOR FLOODING WILL INCREASE. AT THIS POINT THERE IS THE POTENTIAL
FOR HEAVY RAIN AND POSSIBLE FLOODING...BUT CONFIDENCE IS NOT HIGH
ENOUGH REGARDING THE SPEED AND TIMING OF THE REMNANT LOW TO ISSUE A
FLOOD WATCH AT THIS TIME. AT SOME POINT...A FLOOD WATCH MAY BECOME
NECESSARY AND WILL BRIEF NEXT SHIFT ON THIS POSSIBILITY. ALSO PLAN
TO HIGHLIGHT THE FLOOD THREAT AS WELL AS THE SEVERE WEATHER THREAT
IN THE HAZARDOUS WEATHER OUTLOOK.

RITA SHOULD FINALLY CLEAR EAST OF THE AREA BY MID-WEEK BRINGING AN
END TO THE LIKELY RAIN CHANCES. THERE MAY STILL BE SMALL CHANCES OF
SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND THURSDAY...AS A
STRONGER NORTHERN STREAM TROUGH PUSHES A COLD FRONT THROUGH THE
AREA. FOLLOWING THIS FRONT...EXPECT A TASTE OF FALL FOR THE END OF
NEXT WEEK WITH COOLER TEMPERATURES AND LESS HUMID CONDITIONS.

&&

FXUS64 KMEG 241617
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
1117 AM CDT SAT SEP 24 2005

.DISCUSSION...

THE BIG STORY THIS MORNING WILL BE IMPACTS FROM THE REMNANTS OF
HURRICANE RITA...CURRENTLY MOVING NORTH ACROSS EXTREME EAST TEXAS
THIS MORNING. LATEST NHC TRACK GUIDANCE NOW HAS SHIFTED THE
EVENTUAL TRACK OF RITA FURTHER NORTH AND EAST...WHICH IF OCCURS
WOULD MEAN POSSIBLE SIGNIFICANT WEATHER IMPACTS ACROSS PORTIONS OF
THE MID-SOUTH. THE FIRST THINGS TO DEAL WITH IN THE FIRST PERIOD
IS RAIN AND THUNDERSTORM POTENTIAL AND SEVERE WEATHER THREATS. AT
THIS POINT...IT APPEARS THAT THE TIMING OF THE ARRIVAL OF THE FIRST
OUTER BANDS HAS SLOWED A BIT. CLOSEST OUTER BANDS AND THUNDERSTORMS
IN ASSOCIATION WITH RITA ARE NOW APPROACHING INTERSTATE 20 IN SOUTH-
CENTRAL MISSISSIPPI. THEREFORE...HAVE DECIDED TO TRIM POPS BACK A
BIT ACROSS THE NORTHERN HALF OF THE AREA.

THE ENVIRONMENT TO OUR SOUTH IS BECOMING FAVORABLE FOR SEVERE
WEATHER AND TORNADOES. THE SOUNDINGS TO OUR SOUTH ARE INDICATING A
STRONGLY SHEARED AND INCREASINGLY UNSTABLE ENVIRONMENT. THE LOW LEVEL
WIND PROFILE NOTED FROM THE 12Z JAN SOUNDING SHOWS INCREASING LOW
LEVEL VEERING AND STRONG LOW LEVEL WIND FIELDS...40-60 KTS BETWEEN
3000 FT. AND 5000 FT. THIS ENVIRONMENT APPEARS FAVORABLE FOR TORNADO
DEVELOPMENT AND WITH RITA CONTINUING TO MOVE NORTH...IT APPEARS THAT
THIS ENVIRONMENT WILL EVENTUALLY ADVECT NORTH AS RITA CONTINUES
NORTHWARD. WITH THIS IN MIND...CURRENTLY ANTICIPATING THE SEVERE
WEATHER AND TORNADO THREAT TO MOVE NORTH INTO PORTIONS OF NORTH
MISSISSIPPI AND EAST-CENTRAL ARKANSAS LATER THIS EVENING. HAVE
UPDATED THE HAZARDOUS WEATHER OUTLOOK TO INCLUDE A SLIGHT RISK FOR
SEVERE WEATHER ACROSS THE SOUTHERN HALF OF THE AREA...AND WILL
CONTINUE TO MONITOR THIS THREAT THROUGH THE DAY. THE SEVERE THREAT
MAY MOVE A BIT FURTHER NORTHWARD TONIGHT AND SUNDAY...BUT WILL HAVE
MUCH MORE DETAILS LATER TODAY. ALSO...CURRENT FORECAST TRACK MAY
BRING A HEAVY RAIN AND FLOODING THREAT OVER THE COMING DAYS...AND
WILL UPDATE AFTERNOON FORECAST PACKAGE LATER TODAY TO REFLECT THESE
POSSIBILITIES.

UPDATED ZONES AND FORECAST OUT SHORTLY. STAYED TUNED FOR UPDATES ON
POTENTIAL HAZARDS THROUGH THE DAY AND OVER THE NEXT COUPLE OF DAYS.

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.

$$

JLH

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
355 AM CDT SAT SEP 24 2005

.DISCUSSION...

HURRICANE RITA IS NOW PLAYING A BIG ROLE IN MIDSOUTH WEATHER.
SKIES HAVE BECOME MOSTLY CLOUDY AND WINDS ARE NOW MOSTLY EAST
SOUTHEAST.

RAINBANDS FROM THE STORM WILL MOVE INTO THE AREA TDA WHILE WINDS
INCREASE SIGNIFICANTLY. RITA IS PEGGED TO LINGER IN THE ARKLATX
REGION INTO WED. ALSO...A FRONT IS TO COME SOUTHEAST THROUGH THE
REGION MONDAY. NET RESULT OF THIS ACTIVITY IS A WET FCST TDA
THROUGH MONDAY.

THE FIRST COOL DOWN OF THE SEASON WILL FOLLOW FRONTAL PASSAGE.
LOWS IN THE LOWER 50S WILL BE NOTED BY FRIDAY MORNING.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
839 PM CDT FRI SEP 23 2005

.DISCUSSION...

CENTER OF HURRICANE RITA IS APPROACHING THE WESTERN EDGE OF THE
LOUISIANA COAST THIS EVENING. RAIN BANDS EXTEND NORTHWARD FROM THE
HURRICANE OVER MUCH OF NORTHERN LOUISIANA WITH SOME ISOLATED RAIN
OVER PORTIONS OF CENTRAL MISSISSIPPI. NONE OF THE RAIN ASSOCIATED
WITH THE HURRICANE WILL REACH THE FORECAST AREA BEFORE SUNRISE.
CURRENT FORECAST LOOKS FINE SO NO CHANGES ARE PLANNED.



000 
FXUS64 KMEG 232005
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
305 PM CDT FRI SEP 23 2005

.DISCUSSION...

A RATHER DIFFICULT FORECAST TODAY WITH PREDICTING THE EVENTUAL
IMPACTS FROM HURRICANE RITA ACROSS OUR FORECAST AREA. THE PRIMARY
CONCERNS WILL BE THE OVERALL SYNOPTIC PATTERN THAT WILL EVENTUALLY
DETERMINE THE FUTURE PATH OF RITA AND HER POTENTIAL IMPACTS ON THE
MID-SOUTH.

IN THE SHORT-TERM...WEAK SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE ALONG WITH A
WEAKENING UPPER LEVEL RIDGE WILL PERSIST OVER THE REGION FOR THE
REMAINDER OF THIS AFTERNOON AS THE UPPER RIDGE CONTINUES TO BREAK
DOWN AND MOVE EAST. THIS WEAKENING OF THE UPPER RIDGE HAS ALLOWED
HURRICANE RITA TO MOVE IN A MORE NORTHWARD DIRECTION TODAY AND RITA
SHOULD CONTINUE TO APPROACH THE GULF COAST WITH A LANDFALL IN THE
VICINITY OF THE TEXAS/LOUISIANA STATE LINE. OF COURSE AS IS NORMAL
WITH ANY TROPICAL SYSTEM...A WOBBLE TO THE EAST OR WEST BEFORE
LANDFALL COULD ALTER THE ULTIMATE LANDFALL POINT. AS FOR WHICH
DIRECTION RITA MOVES AFTER LANDFALL IS THE BIG QUESTION THAT WILL
IMPACT WEATHER CONDITIONS ACROSS THE MID-SOUTH THIS WEEKEND.

AT THIS POINT AND WITH SOMEWHAT LOWER CONFIDENCE THAN USUAL...IT
APPEARS THAT THE EVENTUAL TRACK OF RITA WILL DEPEND ON THE OVERALL
EVOLUTION OF THE SYNOPTIC PATTERN OVER THE UNITED STATES. IN
PARTICULAR...THE BIG QUESTION WILL BE THE EVOLUTION OF THE WESTERN
TROUGH CURRENTLY OVER THE PACIFIC NORTHWEST AND ITS EFFECTS ON THE
UPPER RIDGE CURRENTLY BREAKING DOWN OVER THE SOUTHEAST U.S. AFTER
MUCH ANALYSIS OF THE 12Z UPPER LEVEL RAOB DATA...IT APPEARS THAT THE
12Z GFS RUN HAS A DECENT HANDLE ON THE OVERALL UPPER PATTERN AND ALSO
THE SURFACE TRACK OF THE HURRICANE...AT LEAST IN THE SHORT-TERM...
LOOKS GOOD. THE 12Z GFS MODEL RUN SHOWS THE UPPER TROUGH MOVING EAST
AND FILLING AS A STRONG UPPER JET STREAK EJECTS OUT OF THE BASE OF
THE TROUGH ACROSS THE CENTRAL ROCKIES. THIS WOULD LEAD TO A LESS
AMPLIFIED TROUGH OVER THE WEST...AND A MUCH FLATTER UPPER RIDGE.
THIS WOULD LEAVE WEAK SOUTHWESTERLY FLOW ALOFT OVER MUCH OF THE
SOUTHERN U.S. AND WOULD TEND TO ALLOW THE REMNANTS OF RITA TO MOVE
NORTHWARD ALONG THE WESTERN LOUISIANA/EASTERN TEXAS AREA THAN
SLOWLY DRIFT NORTHEAST IN THE WEAK SOUTHWESTERLY FLOW ALOFT.

IF THIS OCCURS...PORTIONS OF THE MID-SOUTH...ESPECIALLY SOUTHWESTERN
AREAS WILL HAVE A FLOOD POTENTIAL AS WELL AS A SEVERE WEATHER
(TORNADO) POTENTIAL. OTHER MODELS HANDLE THE SYNOPTIC PATTERN A BIT
DIFFERENTLY AND STALL THE REMNANT LOW FURTHER TO OUR WEST...WHICH
WOULD LESSON THE FLOODING RAIN/SEVERE WEATHER POTENTIAL. AT THIS
POINT HAVE FAVORED THE GFS MODEL... BUT DUE TO LOWER THAN AVERAGE
CONFIDENCE...PREFER TO JUST KEEP CHANCE POPS GOING STARTING SATURDAY
AREAWIDE...WITH BEST CHANCES SOUTH AND LESSER CHANCES NORTH. THEN FOR
SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY NIGHT...KEEP LIKELY TO CATEGORICAL POPS
AREAWIDE AND MENTION IN THE HWO THE SEVERE/FLASH FLOOD
POSSIBILITIES AND REFLECT THAT THINGS COULD CHANGE BASED UPON THE
EVENTUAL TRACK.

AS FOR THE EXTENDED FORECAST...MADE FEW CHANGES WITH THE BIG STORY
IN THE EXTENDED BEING THE PASSAGE OF A STRONG COLD FRONT WEDNESDAY
NIGHT. EXPECT COOLER AND LESS HUMID CONDITIONS BEHIND THIS FRONT.

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.

$$

JLH





000 
FXUS64 KMEG 231507
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
1007 AM CDT FRI SEP 23 2005

.DISCUSSION...

A BROAD WEAKENING UPPER RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE ALONG WITH WEAK
SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE REMAIN IN PLACE OVER THE MID-SOUTH THIS
MORNING. A FRONTAL BOUNDARY HAS STALLED TO OUR NORTH ACROSS
SOUTHERN ILLINOIS...SOUTHERN MISSOURI...AND INTO OKLAHOMA. THE
BOUNDARY SHOULD NOT MOVE MUCH THROUGH THE DAY AS THE UPPER LEVEL
SOUTHWESTERLY FLOW ALOFT IS ALIGNED ALONG THE FRONT. IN ADDITION...
WEAK SHORTWAVES ARE MOVING THROUGH THE FLOW AND HAVE HELPED TRIGGER
SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS ALONG THE BOUNDARY. WITH THE UPPER FLOW
IN PLACE...CURRENTLY THINK THAT MOST OF THE THUNDERSTORM ACTIVITY
WILL REMAIN NORTH OF OUR FORECAST AREA...BUT WILL KEEP AN EYE ON
THIS THROUGH THE DAY. EXPECT CLOUD COVER TO MOVE MORE SLOWLY INTO
THE AREA FROM THE SOUTH THAN EARLIER EXPECTED IN ASSOCIATION WITH
HURRICANE RITA. STILL LOOKING AT THIN HIGH CIRRUS CLOUDS
OVERSPREADING THE AREA...BUT SHOULD BE THIN ENOUGH TO ALLOW DECENT
DAYTIME HEATING TO CONTINUE. HAVE MADE THE APPROPRIATE UPDATES TO
THE CLOUD GRIDS. ALSO WILL ADJUST TEMPERATURES UP A FEW DEGREES TO
OVER SOUTHERN AREAS TO REFLECT INCREASED DAYTIME HEATING. SO EXPECT
PRIMARILY ANOTHER UNSEASONABLY WARM AND DRY DAY.

HURRICANE RITA STILL ON TRACK TO MAKE LANDFALL ALONG THE UPPER TEXAS
TO SOUTHWEST LOUISIANA COASTLINE. THE HURRICANE IS STILL GOING
THROUGH INTERNAL PROCESSES...OR EYEWALL REPLACEMENT CYCLES...SO
THERE MAY BE CONTINUED FLUCTUATIONS IN INTENSITY. IT APPEARS AT
THIS POINT THAT OUTER BANDS ON THE EASTERN SIDE OF THE STORM WILL
BEGIN IMPACTING THE AREA DURING THE DAY SATURDAY AS THE SYSTEM
MOVES SLOWLY NORTH...BUT WILL HAVE MUCH MORE INFORMATION ON THIS
SYSTEM LATER TODAY. STAY TUNED.

UPDATED GRIDS AND ZONES OUT SHORTLY.

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.

$$

JLH

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 230832
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
330 AM CDT FRI SEP 23 2005

CLOUDS FROM RITA HAVE SPREAD OVER MOST OF THE SOUTHERN HALF OF
THE MIDSOUTH ALREADY. THEY WILL SPREAD FARTHER NORTH THROUGH THE
DAY. CLOUDS WILL LIMIT HEATING TODAY ESPECIALLY IN SOUTHERN
COUNTIES. BUT...TEMPERATURES WILL STILL GET UP INTO THE UPPER 80S
TO MID 90S.

A RAIN BAND FROM RITA COULD IMPACT THE SOUTHERN MIDSOUTH TONIGHT.
RITA SHOULD MAKE LANDFALL EARLY SATURDAY MORNING AND MOVE NORTH
BEFORE STALLING IN THE ARKLATEX AREA SUNDAY. THIS WILL PUT THE
MIDSOUTH IN A FAVORED RAINFALL AREA THROUGH THE WEEKEND. MORE
SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS COULD BE STIRRED UP BY A FRONT COMING
DOWN INTO THE AREA MONDAY.

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.

$$

WER





000 
FXUS64 KMEG 230148
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
847 PM CDT THU SEP 22 2005

.UPDATE...
A FEW HIGH CLOUDS FROM RITAS OUTFLOW ALREADY SKIMMING THE SE CORNER 
OF THE FORECAST AREA THIS EVENING WITH THE NORTHERNMOST RAINBAND 
DISSIPATING ACRS S CNTRL MS/AL. THE FIRST NIGHT OF THE OFFICIAL FALL 
SEASON WILL BE QUITE WARM WITH LOWS FROM THE UPPER 60S TO LOWER 
70S...ABOUT 10 DEGREES ABOVE NORMAL FOR THIS TIME OF YEAR. ONGOING 
FORECAST LOOKS FINE WITH NO UPDATE PLANNED. 

SJM

.PREV DISCUSSION ISSUED AT 321 PM...
UNSEASONABLY WARM TEMPERATURES CONTINUE ACROSS THE MID-SOUTH THIS 
AFTERNOON...AS SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE CONTINUES TO RIDGE DOWN OVER 
THE REGION AND A WEAKENING UPPER RIDGE EXTENDS OVER THE AREA. EXPECT 
PLEASANT BUT WARM AND UNSEASONABLY HUMID WEATHER TO CONTINUE THROUGH 
TONIGHT...WITH MOSTLY CLEAR SKIES.

THE UPPER RIDGE OVERHEAD TODAY SHOULD CONTINUE TO WEAKEN AND MOVE
EAST AS AN UPPER TROUGH CONTINUES TO DIG ACROSS THE WESTERN STATES.
AN UPPER LEVEL SHORTWAVE RIDING OVER THE TOP OF THE RIDGE ON
FRIDAY WILL INTERACT WITH A SURFACE COLD FRONT THAT WILL BE MOVING
SLOWLY SOUTH ACROSS SOUTHERN ILLINOIS...SOUTH-CENTRAL MISSOURI...AND
NORTHERN OKLAHOMA...TO PRODUCE SCATTERED THUNDERSTORMS TO OUR NORTH.
HAVE DECIDED TO ADD SLIGHT CHANCE POPS TO OUR NORTHERN BORDER TO
ACCOUNT FOR ANY CONVECTIVELY PRODUCED OUTFLOW BOUNDARY THAT MAY MOVE
INTO THESE AREAS FROM CONVECTION GENERATED TO THE NORTH. ACROSS THE
REMAINDER OF THE AREA...EXPECT HIGH PRESSURE TO HOLD ON AND PROVIDE
MORE UNSEASONABLY HOT...HUMID...AND DRY WEATHER.

THE NEXT BIG WEATHER STORY FOR THE WEEKEND AND FIRST PART OF NEXT
WEEK WILL BE THE EVENTUAL TRACK OF HURRICANE RITA. THE FORECAST
GUIDANCE...INCLUDING THE GFS AND MOST OF THE TROPICAL MODEL SUITE
HAS SHIFTED THE FORECAST TRACK A BIT MORE TO THE EAST AS COMPARED TO
YESTERDAYS RUNS. THE CURRENT NHC FORECAST TRACK LANDFALLS THE
HURRICANE ON SATURDAY MORNING AS A CATEGORY 4 HURRICANE ALONG THE
EXTREME NORTHEAST TEXAS COAST. WITH THE UPPER RIDGE GRADUALLY
BREAKING DOWN THIS TRACK APPEARS REASONABLE. THE REMNANT SYSTEM
WEAKENS AND SLOWLY MOVES NORTH...BEFORE POSSIBLY STALLING IN THE
VICINITY OF THE ARKLATEX REGION THROUGH THE END OF THE WEEKEND AND
EARLY NEXT WEEK. SINCE WE ARE STILL AT LEAST A DAY AND A HALF FROM
LANDFALL THERE STILL MAY BE SOME CHANGES IN THE TRACK. ANY CHANGES IN
PROJECTED TRACK WILL HAVE AN IMPACT ON THE TYPE OF WEATHER THAT WE
SEE ACROSS OUR FORECAST AREA.

AT THIS POINT...IT APPEARS THAT THE MID-SOUTH WILL REMAIN TO THE EAST
OF THE TRACK OF RITA. WITH THIS TYPE OF TRACK...THE MID-SOUTH CAN
ANTICIPATE THAT OUTER RAINBANDS ON THE EASTERN SIDE OF RITA WILL
ROTATE NORTHWARD ACROSS THE AREA BEGINNING LATE FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH
AT LEAST SUNDAY. THERE MAY ALSO BE SOME SEVERE WEATHER (TORNADO)
THREAT ASSOCIATED WITH THE OUTER RAINBANDS...BUT THIS WILL NOT BE
RESOLVED UNTIL WE GET CLOSER TO THE EVENT. ANY CHANGES IN THE TRACK
AND STRENGTH WILL CHANGE THE WEATHER IMPACTS EXPECTED ACROSS OUR
AREA. STAY TUNED.

BY MID-WEEK...RITA WILL HAVE DISSIPATED TO A REMNANT LOW SOMEWHERE
OVER THE SOUTHERN MISSISSIPPI VALLEY AND THE UPPER FLOW WILL BECOME
MORE PROGRESSIVE AND AMPLIFIED. BEFORE THAN...PLENTY OF LOW LEVEL
MOISTURE AND INSTABILITY SHOULD HANG AROUND TO PRODUCE SCATTERED TO
ISOLATED CHANCES FOR SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS FOR THE BEGINNING OF
NEXT WEEK. AN UPPER TROUGH WILL HELP SEND A COLD FRONT TOWARDS THE
AREA WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND THURSDAY...WITH ADDITIONAL CHANCES FOR
SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS. COOLER AND DRYER WEATHER SHOULD FOLLOW THE
FRONT FOR THE END OF NEXT WEEK.

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.

$$

JLH







000

FXUS64 KMEG 221552 AAA
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
1052 AM CDT THU SEP 22 2005

.DISCUSSION...

SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE CENTERED OVER THE MID-ATLANTIC STATES THIS
MORNING CONTINUES TO RIDGE SOUTHWESTWARD INTO THE MID-SOUTH. IN
ADDITION...AN UPPER LEVEL RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE IS CURRENTLY
CENTERED OVER THE SOUTHERN PLAINS STATES AND SHOULD BEGIN TO BUILD
EASTWARD OVER THE MID-SOUTH THIS AFTERNOON. LOOKING AT REGIONAL
VISIBLE SATELLITE IMAGERY AT 15Z...SHOWED CLEAR SKIES OVER MOST OF
THE FORECAST AREA...EXCEPT FOR A WEAK CU FIELD NOTED OVER AREAS OF
ELEVATION OVER NORTHEAST ARKANSAS. ALSO AN OLD CONVECTIVE BOUNDARY
WITH AN ENHANCED CU LINE WAS NOTED OVER SOUTH-CENTRAL ARKANSAS.
EXPECT THIS BOUNDARY TO REMAIN WEST OF OUR AREA TODAY.

AREA 12Z SOUNDINGS SHOWING A DECENT CAPPING INVERSION AROUND 750 MB.
MESOETA FORECAST SOUNDINGS INDICATE THAT AFTERNOON CONVECTIVE
TEMPERATURES WILL BE IN THE UPPER 90S. EXPECT THAT WITH SOME UPPER
HEIGHT RISES AND A GOOD AMOUNT OF SUN...THAT SURFACE TEMPERATURES
WILL REACH NEAR RECORD HIGHS ONCE AGAIN WITH MID TO UPPER 90S. DUE TO
TEMPERATURES RISING TO NEAR THE CONVECTIVE TEMPERATURES THIS
AFTERNOON ALONG WITH AN SOMEWHAT UNSTABLE LOWER ATMOSPHERE...THINK
THAT A CU FIELD WILL AGAIN DEVELOP. CONVECTIVE CHANCES LOOK VERY LOW
TODAY...WITH NO IDENTIFIABLE FORCING MECHANISMS...RATHER DRY
SOUNDING PROFILES...AND UPPER RIDGING. PLAN TO LEAVE THUNDERSTORM
CHANCES OUT OF THE FORECAST FOR TODAY. EVEN WITH THE EXPECTED CU
FIELD...STILL THINK THAT MOSTLY SUNNY SKIES LOOKS FINE. CURRENT
FORECAST IS ON TRACK...AND WILL ONLY UPDATE TO REMOVE MORNING FOG
WORDING.

AS FOR HURRICANE RITA...STILL AN EXTREMELY DANGEROUS CATEGORY 5
STORM OVER THE CENTRAL GULF OF MEXICO. QUICK LOOK AT THE MODELS...
BOTH GLOBAL AND TROPICAL...SHOWING A SLIGHT SHIFT TO THE EAST AS
COMPARED TO YESTERDAY. ALSO IT APPEARS THAT RITA IS GOING THROUGH AN
EYEWALL REPLACEMENT CYCLE AND CLOUD TOPS ARE ONCE AGAIN COOLING
WITH CONCENTRIC EYEWALLS. WILL BE LOOKING AT RITA IN MORE DETAIL
THIS AFTERNOON AND POSSIBLE EFFECTS FROM THE REMNANT SYSTEM TO THE
FORECAST AREA.

UPDATED ZONE FORECAST AND GRIDS OUT SHORTLY.

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.

$$

JLH

FXUS64 KMEG 221509 AAA

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
1009 AM CDT THU SEP 22 2005

.DISCUSSION...

SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE CENTERED OVER THE MID-ATLANTIC STATES THIS
MORNING CONTINUES TO RIDGE SOUTHWESTWARD INTO THE MID-SOUTH. IN
ADDITION...AN UPPER LEVEL RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE IS CURRENTLY
CENTERED OVER THE SOUTHERN PLAINS STATES AND SHOULD BEGIN TO BUILD
EASTWARD OVER THE MID-SOUTH THIS AFTERNOON. LOOKING AT REGIONAL
VISIBLE SATELLITE IMAGERY AT 15Z...SHOWED CLEAR SKIES OVER MOST OF
THE FORECAST AREA...EXCEPT FOR A WEAK CU FIELD NOTED OVER AREAS OF
ELEVATION OVER NORTHEAST ARKANSAS. ALSO AN OLD CONVECTIVE BOUNDARY
WITH AN ENHANCED CU LINE WAS NOTED OVER SOUTH-CENTRAL ARKANSAS.
EXPECT THIS BOUNDARY TO REMAIN WEST OF OUR AREA TODAY.

AREA 12Z SOUNDINGS SHOWING A DECENT CAPPING INVERSION AROUND 750 MB.
MESOETA FORECAST SOUNDINGS INDICATE THAT AFTERNOON CONVECTIVE
TEMPERATURES WILL BE IN THE UPPER 90S. EXPECT THAT WITH SOME UPPER
HEIGHT RISES AND A GOOD AMOUNT OF SUN...THAT SURFACE TEMPERATURES
WILL REACH NEAR RECORD HIGHS ONCE AGAIN WITH MID TO UPPER 90S. DUE TO

CHANCES OUT OF THE FORECAST FOR TODAY. EVEN WITH THE EXPECTED CU

WORDING.

AS FOR HURRICANE RITA...STILL AN EXTREMELY DANGEROUS CATEGORY 5
STORM OVER THE CENTRAL GULF OF MEXICO. QUICK LOOK AT THE MODELS...

COMPARED TO YESTERDAY. ALSO IT APPEARS THAT RITA HAS COMPLETED AN
EYEWALL REPLACEMENT CYCLE AND CLOUD TOPS ARE ONCE AGAIN COOLING
AROUND THE WELL DEFINED EYE. WILL BE LOOKING AT RITA IN MORE DETAIL
THIS AFTERNOON AND POSSIBLE EFFECTS FROM THE REMNANT SYSTEM TO THE
FORECAST AREA.

UPDATED ZONE FORECAST AND GRIDS OUT SHORTLY.



000 
FXUS64 KMEG 221046
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
546 AM CDT THU SEP 22 2005

.UPDATE...
SURFACE OBS INDICATING A FEW AREAS OF FOG WITH VISIBILITIES OF 3/4SM 
OR LESS ACROSS WEST TN AND EXTREME NORTH MS. UPDATED TO MENTION 
PATCHY DENSE FOG ACCORDINGLY. FOG NOT WIDESPREAD ENOUGH TO WARRANT 
ADVISORY.

.DISCUSSION...

HOT WEATHER WILL CONTINUE THROUGHOUT THE REGION TODAY. AN ELONGATED  
RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE THAT EXTENDS FROM TEXAS THROUGH THE MIDSOUTH 
AND INTO THE SOUTHEAST U.S. IS THE ONLY WEATHER FEATURE AFFECTING 
THE MIDSOUTH REGION. THERE IS A COLD FRONT ACROSS THE PLAINS REGION 
THAT IS NOT EXPECTED TO MAKE IT INTO THE REGION DUE TO THE STRENGTH 
OF THE RIDGE OVER THE AREA. RECORD HIGHS VERY POSSIBLE OVER MEMPHIS 
AND JACKSON TODAY AS 850 TEMP ARE AROUND THE +20 MARK. BELOW ARE 
RECORDS FOR TODAY AND TOMORROW. FAVOR THE WARMER FWC NUMBERS EXCEPT 
AT TUPELO WHICH LOOKS A TAD TOO COOL. THE FWC HAD DONE WELL IN THIS 
AIR MASS EXCEPT FOR YESTERDAY WHERE SCATTERED THUNDERSTORMS KEPT 
TEMPS DOWN A BIT. OTHERWISE...SHOULD START OFF VERY SUNNY WITH SOME 
DIURNAL CU POSSIBLE. THERE SHOULD NOT BE ANY STORMS AROUND TODAY. 
THE SHORTWAVE THAT FIRED STORMS YESTERDAY HAS WEAKENED AND MOVED 
AWAY FROM THE REGION. 

THE BIG QUESTION FOR THE MID SOUTH IS WHAT IMPACT WILL HURRICANE 
RITA HAVE ON THE REGIONS WEATHER. THE 00Z GFS CAME IN WITH A 
LANDFALL MORE EASTERLY THAN IN PREVIOUS RUNS (NORTH OF GALVESTON 
BAY). MEANWHILE THE 00Z NAM HAS LANDFALL CLOSER TO WHERE THE GFS WAS 
YESTERDAY MORNING...SOUTH OF GALVESTON BAY. THE DRASTIC TURN IN THE 
GFS IS LIKELY DUE TO THE WEAKNESS DEVELOPING FASTER IN THE RIDGE 
THAN PREVIOUS RUNS HAD SUGGESTED. RECENT SATELLITE IMAGERY SHOWS A 
TURN TOWARDS THE NORTHWEST WHICH WOULD SUPPORT MORE THE 00Z GFS. IN 
THE GFS SOLUTION...THE MIDSOUTH WOULD RECEIVE MORE RAINFALL AND THE 
RAIN WOULD BE MOVING UP FROM THE SOUTH SOONER THAN CURRENT FORECAST 
(BY SATURDAY 12Z). MEANWHILE...IF THE NAM VERIFIES THEN THE ONGOING 
FORECAST IS NOT BAD AT ALL. THERE WILL LIKELY BE RAIN AROUND MUCH OF 
THE AREA THROUGH THE WEEKEND AND FEEL THAT MOST PLACES WILL AT LEAST 
SEE SOME RAIN. NOT READY TO FORECAST LIKELY CHANCES IN ANY ONE TIME 
PERIOD YET...WOULD PREFER TO SEE SOME MORE CONTINUITY IN THE MODEL 
RUNS. UPPER LEVEL CIRRUS MAY BEGIN TO AFFECT THE REGION AS EARLY AS 
TOMORROW WHICH IS WHY TEMPS ARE FORECASTED TO BE COOLER.

THE TRENDS IN THE MODELS IS NOT A GOOD ONE FOR EAST TEXAS. THIS 
TREND IS THAT THE HURRICANE WILL NOT BE PICKED UP BY THE SHORTWAVE 
TROUGH AND CARRIED AWAY IN THE WESTERLIES. INSTEAD...THE MODELS HAVE 
THE RIDGE OVER OKLAHOMA HOLDING STRONG AND THE HURRICANE MORE OR 
LESS BECOMING STALLED OVER THE REGION. THIS WOULD MEAN A LOT OF RAIN 
TO SAY THE LEAST FOR THAT AREA. SINCE THE UPPER FLOW WILL BE OUT OF 
THE SOUTHWEST...EXPECT THAT THE MIDSOUTH WILL SEE PERIODS OF RAIN 
FROM THAT SYSTEM THROUGHOUT THE WEEKEND AND INTO EARLY NEXT WEEK AT 
LEAST. THE GFS BRINGS DOWN A COOL FRONT MONDAY AND MONDAY NIGHT 
WHICH MAY DRY OUT OUR REGION FOR A DAY. IF THIS DOES NOT PAN 
OUT...COULD BE LOOKING AT A RAINY STRETCH OF DAYS. HAZARD POTENTIAL 
FOR THE MIDSOUTH IS STILL NOT TOTALLY KNOWN DUE TO UNCERTAINTY IN 
WHERE LANDFALL WILL OCCUR AND WHAT WILL EXACTLY HAPPEN WITH THE 
SYSTEM ONCE IT MOVES INLAND. SIGNIFICANT WINDS ARE LOOKING MORE 
UNLIKELY BECAUSE THE SYSTEM WILL LIKELY NEVER GET CLOSE ENOUGH TO 
THE REGION FOR THAT TO BE A FACTOR. AM SLIGHTLY CONCERNED ABOUT 
ISOLATED TORNADOS WITH THESE RAIN BANDS BUT THE REGION MAY BE TOO 
FAR AWAY FROM THE BETTER SHEAR FOR THIS TO BE A PROBLEM. AM REAL 
UNCERTAIN ABOUT THE FLOOD THREAT. IT HAS BEEN RATHER DRY AND THE 
GROUND COULD SUPPORT A LOT OF RAIN OVER A LONG PERIOD OF TIME. ONCE 
AGAIN...THE REGION MAY BE TOO FAR AWAY FROM THE HEAVIER RAIN FOR 
FLASH FLOODING TO OCCUR. ALL OF THIS IS SUBJECT TO CHANGE...AND 
EVERYONE SHOULD STILL STAY ALERT TO THE LATEST FORECASTS.


SITE            22ND         23RD
MEMPHIS   (MEM) 94(1970)     95(1931)
JACKSON   (MKL) 95(1955)     94(1988)
JONESBORO (JBR) 99(1921)     97(1897)
TUPELO    (TUP) 99(1935)     99(1935)

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.

$$

VALLE






THE GFS SOLUTION...THE MIDSOUTH WOULD RECEIVE MORE RAINFALL AND THE 
RAIN WOULD BE MOVING UP FROM THE SOUTH SOONER THAN CURRENT FORECAST 
(BY SATURDAY 12Z). MEANWHILE...IF THE NAM VERIFIES THEN THE ONGOING 
FORECAST IS NOT BAD AT ALL. THERE WILL LIKELY BE RAIN AROUND MUCH OF 
THE AREA THROUGH THE WEEKEND AND FEEL THAT MOST PLACES WILL AT LEAST 
SEE SOME RAIN. NOT READY TO FORECAST LIKELY CHANCES IN ANY ONE TIME 
PERIOD YET...WOULD PREFER TO SEE SOME MORE CONTINUITY IN THE MODEL 
RUNS. UPPER LEVEL CIRRUS MAY BEGIN TO AFFECT THE REGION AS EARLY AS 
TOMORROW WHICH IS WHY TEMPS ARE FORECASTED TO BE COOLER.

THE TRENDS IN THE MODELS IS NOT A GOOD ONE FOR EAST TEXAS. THIS 
TREND IS THAT THE HURRICANE WILL NOT BE PICKED UP BY THE SHORTWAVE 
TROUGH AND CARRIED AWAY IN THE WESTERLIES. INSTEAD...THE MODELS HAVE 
THE RIDGE OVER OKLAHOMA HOLDING STRONG AND THE HURRICANE MORE OR 
LESS BECOMING STALLED OVER THE REGION. THIS WOULD MEAN A LOT OF RAIN 
TO SAY THE LEAST FOR THAT AREA. SINCE THE UPPER FLOW WILL BE OUT OF 
THE SOUTHWEST...EXPECT THAT THE MIDSOUTH WILL SEE PERIODS OF RAIN 
FROM THAT SYSTEM THROUGHOUT THE WEEKEND AND INTO EARLY NEXT WEEK AT 
LEAST. THE GFS BRINGS DOWN A COOL FRONT MONDAY AND MONDAY NIGHT 
WHICH MAY DRY OUT OUR REGION FOR A DAY. IF THIS DOES NOT PAN 
OUT...COULD BE LOOKING AT A RAINY STRETCH OF DAYS. HAZARD POTENTIAL 
FOR THE MIDSOUTH IS STILL NOT TOTALLY KNOWN DUE TO UNCERTAINTY IN 
WHERE LANDFALL WILL OCCUR AND WHAT WILL EXACTLY HAPPEN WITH THE 
SYSTEM ONCE IT MOVES INLAND. SIGNIFICANT WINDS ARE LOOKING MORE 
UNLIKELY BECAUSE THE SYSTEM WILL LIKELY NEVER GET CLOSE ENOUGH TO 
THE REGION FOR THAT TO BE A FACTOR. AM SLIGHTLY CONCERNED ABOUT 
ISOLATED TORNADOS WITH THESE RAIN BANDS BUT THE REGION MAY BE TOO 
FAR AWAY FROM THE BETTER SHEAR FOR THIS TO BE A PROBLEM. AM REAL 
UNCERTAIN ABOUT THE FLOOD THREAT. IT HAS BEEN RATHER DRY AND THE 
GROUND COULD SUPPORT A LOT OF RAIN OVER A LONG PERIOD OF TIME. ONCE 
AGAIN...THE REGION MAY BE TOO FAR AWAY FROM THE HEAVIER RAIN FOR 
FLASH FLOODING TO OCCUR. ALL OF THIS IS SUBJECT TO CHANGE...AND 
EVERYONE SHOULD STILL STAY ALERT TO THE LATEST FORECASTS.


SITE            22ND         23RD
MEMPHIS   (MEM) 94(1970)     95(1931)
JACKSON   (MKL) 95(1955)     94(1988)
JONESBORO (JBR) 99(1921)     97(1897)
TUPELO    (TUP) 99(1935)     99(1935)

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES
AR...NONE.

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 211943
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
245 PM CDT WED SEP 21 2005

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT)
VERY WEAK SHORTWAVE HAS TRIGGERED ISOLATED THUNDERSTORMS FOR MUCH OF 
THE DAY. IT APPEARS THAT THERE ARE A COUPLE OF WEAK BOUNDARIES OVER 
OUR CWA. ONE RUNS FROM KENNETT MISSOURI TO NEAR SAVANNAH...WITH A 
CUMULUS FIELD TO THE NORTHEAST OF IT. ANOTHER ACROSS NORTH 
MISSISSIPPI.

AIRMASS CAN STILL SUPPORT ISOLATED CONVECTION...BUT FEEL IF IT IS 
GOING TO DEVELOP...IT WILL BE IN THE NEXT 60 TO 90 MINUTES. 
CURRENTLY THINKING ISOLATED CONVECTION ACROSS MAINLY NORTH 
MISSISSIPPI...AND NORTHEAST OF BOUNDARY ACROSS WEST TENNESSEE.

WILL RAISE TEMPS A COUPLE OF DEGREES TONIGHT...BASED ON READINGS 
THIS MORNING.

WAGNER
&&

.LONG TERM...(THURSDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)
PRETTY GOOD BAROCLINICITY ACROSS THE US/CANADIAN BOARDER.  AT SOME 
POINT THAT ENERGY HAS GOT TO BUCKLE...BUT MODELS (ECMWF/GFS/UKMET) 
INDICATING THAT THE TROF WILL DROP ACROSS THE WESTERN US THROUGH THE 
FORECAST PERIOD. STRONG H5 RIDGE ACROSS THE CENTRAL US WILL SLOWLY 
MOVE INTO THE SOUTHEAST US AS HURRICANE RITA MOVES INLAND.

FORECAST CHALLENGE IS WHETHER OR NOT THE REMNANTS OF RITA MOVE INTO 
OUR SERVICE AREA. DIFFICULT TO SAY SINCE DECENT SFC HIGH MOVES INTO 
GREAT LAKES REGION AND UPPER TROF DEVELOPS ACROSS THE ROCKYS.  
MODELS INDICATE THAT A BULK OF THE TROPICAL MOISTURE MAY INDEED 
REMAIN TO OUR WEST BEFORE FINALLY BEING SCOPED UP BY A TROF ON DAY 
7. FOR NOW HAVE NOT CHANGED MUCH OF THE FORECAST. LEFT SOME 
CONSERVATIVE POPS IN THE FORECAST AS WE REMAIN IN EAST TO SOUTHEAST 
SFC FLOW THROUGH MUCH OF THE PERIOD.

UNDER THE STRONG H5 RIDGE WE SHOULD CONTINUE TO SEE NEAR RECORD HIGH 
TEMPS THROUGH FRIDAY BEFORE HIGH CLOUDS...POSSIBLE CONVECTION...AND 
LOWER HEIGHTS ALOFT HELP DROP HIGH TEMPS BACK INTO THE 80S. 
..BELLES..

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.

$$

 BELLES/WAGNER








000 
FXUS64 KMEG 210830
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
330 AM CDT WED SEP 21 2005

.DISCUSSION...

A WEAK SURFACE TROUGH EXTENDS EAST/WEST ACROSS THE REGION. 
POSITIONING THE FRONT IS DIFFICULT DUE TO LACK OF OBSERVATIONS DUE 
TO AN UPGRADE AT THE FAA. AT 04Z IT WAS NEAR THE TN/MS BORDER. 
ISOLATED THUNDERSTORMS PERSIST AS OF 08Z. FUELING THESE STORMS IS 
INSTABILITY OF AROUND 1000 J/KG AND AN UPPER VORT MAX THAT IS OVER 
THE REGION.

BOTH GFS/NAM HAVE A GOOD HANDLE ON THE UPPER VORT. THIS VORT IS NOT 
EXPECTED TO MOVE MUCH AND WILL REMAIN OVER THE REGION MUCH OF TODAY. 
THE MODELS DO NOT SHOW MUCH IN THE WAY OF RAIN CHANCES. THIS IS 
LIKELY DUE TO THE LACK OF DEEP MOISTURE. WITH THE UPPER VORT IN THE 
VICINITY ALONG WITH THE WEAK SURFACE BOUNDARY AND VERY GOOD 
INSTABILITY EXPECTED (CAPE > 3000 J/KG AND LI -5) FEEL THAT ISOLATED 
THUNDERSTORMS WILL ONCE AGAIN BE AROUND ALTHOUGH THE AREAL COVERAGE 
WILL BE LOW DUE TO THE LACK OF DEEP LEVEL MOISTURE. UNUSUALLY HOT 
WEATHER WILL PERSIST INTO THE WEEKEND AS THE UPPER RIDGE CENTERED 
OVER TEXAS WILL DICTATE THE WEATHER. RECORD HEAT WILL ONCE AGAIN BE 
POSSIBLE. SEE TABLE BELOW FOR RECORDS OVER THE NEXT THREE DAYS.

THE NAM BRINGS A COLD FRONT DOWN INTO THE REGION LATE FRIDAY. IT 
ALSO MAINTAINS THE POSITION OF THE UPPER RIDGE OVER TEXAS AND STEERS 
HURRICANE RITA INTO THE SOUTHERN TIP OF TEXAS. SINCE THE NAM IS 
TRADITIONALLY NOT VERY GOOD IN HANDLING HURRICANE TRACKS OUT PAST 
THREE DAYS...WILL SIDE WITH THE GFS WHICH IS CONSISTENT WITH MOST 
OTHER SOLUTIONS. THIS BRINGS RITA INTO THE NORTHWEST GULF COAST AND 
SLIDES THE CENTER OF THE UPPER RIDGE OVER THE MIDSOUTH AND INTO THE 
SOUTHEASTERN US. WITH THIS SOLUTION...THIS SHOULD KEEP THE FRONT 
NORTH OF THE REGION. THE FORECAST WILL CONTINUE TO BE HOT AND DRY 
FOR THURSDAY AND FRIDAY. ON SATURDAY THE GFS BEGINS TO BRING THE 
FIRST ROUND OF PRECIPITATION FROM RITA INTO THE REGION. NOT SURE HOW 
LIKELY THIS IS SINCE THE GFS IS BREAKING OFF A DESCENT SIZE VORT MAX 
FROM THE STORM AND BRINGING IT UP. THIS IS DIFFERENT FROM YESTERDAYS 
RUN. IN EITHER CASE...SHOULD DEFINITELY BE GETTING A GOOD DEAL OF 
MID AND HIGH CLOUDS WHICH SHOULD LOWER TEMPS. 

THE EXTENDED FORECAST HAS MANY QUESTIONS STILL. THE MODELS ARE 
INCONSISTENT IN THEIR HANDLING OF THE HURRICANE ONCE IT MAKES 
LANDFALL. THE LATEST GFS STALLS IT OUT OVER SOUTHEAST TEXAS WHILE 
OTHER MODELS LIFT IT NORTHWARD TO BE CAUGHT IN THE WESTERLIES. STILL 
SHOULD RESULT IN RAIN CHANCES IN EITHER CASE. THE QUESTION BECOMES 
WHEN TO REMOVE RAIN CHANCES AND JUST HOW MUCH RAIN THE MIDSOUTH WILL 
SEE. 

SITE            21ST         22ND         23RD
MEMPHIS   (MEM) 95(1955)     94(1970)     95(1931)
JACKSON   (MKL) 98(1955)     95(1955)     94(1988)
JONESBORO (JBR) 97(1955)     99(1921)     97(1897)
TUPELO    (TUP) 99(1935)     99(1935)     99(1935)

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 210439
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
1138 PM CDT TUE SEP 20 2005

.LATE EVENING UPDATE...
ISOLATED SHOWERS AND TSTMS CONT TO DEVELOP AND MOVE SE ALONG 
INSTABILITY AXIS INVOF WEAK STATIONARY FRONT. SFC DEWPOINTS WERE IN 
THE LOWER 70S ALONG WITH SBCAPES OF 1200-2000 J/KG. THIS WAS 
PROVIDING ENUF FUEL TO SUSTAIN DEVELOPMENT AS OUTFLOW BOUNDARIES 
CONT TO PUSH INTO THE UNSTABLE AIR. AS AIRMASS CONTINUES TO 
STABILIZE OVERNIGHT EXPECT THIS CONVECTION TO EVENTUALLY DIE. WL GO 
AHEAD AND LEAVE IN ISOLD POPS FOR THE REMAINDER OF THE NIGHT. 

SJM

.PREV EVENING UPDATE...
ISSUED 950 PM CDT TUE SEP 20 2005

VERY WEAK STATIONARY FRONT JUST NORTH OF MEM STRETCHED EAST-WEST 
ACRS THE MID SOUTH THIS EVENING. WARM LATE SUMMER NIGHT ACRS THE 
REGION WITH DEWPOINTS OF 70-75F POOLING INVOF FRONT. WL BUMP MIN 
TEMPS FOR TONIGHT UP A LITTLE AS A RESULT. ISOLD SHOWERS AND 
THUNDERSTORMS HAVE DEVELOPED INVOF OF FRONT AND WL NEED TO CONT 
THESE THROUGH MIDNIGHT. CONVECTION SHOULD DIE OFF AROUND THEN. 

.PREV UPDATE...
ISSUED 305 PM CDT TUE SEP 20 2005

HAVE DECIDED TO ADD ISOLATED THUNDERSTORMS THROUGH EARLY EVENING
ACROSS THE MIDSOUTH AS THE ATMOSPHERE BECOMES INCREASINGLY
UNSTABLE. ALSO...CAN NOT RULE OUT AN ISOLATED SEVERE THUNDERSTORM
WITH LARGE HAIL AND DAMAGING WIND.

.PREV DISCUSSION...
ISSUED 251 PM CDT TUE SEP 20 2005

A LATE SUMMER HEAT WAVE HAS SET IN ACROSS THE MIDSOUTH. THE HIGH
TEMPERATURE THUS FAR TODAY AT THE MEMPHIS INTERNATIONAL AIRPORT HAS
BEEN 97 DEGREES...THE RECORD HIGH IS 98 DEGREES. MID-AFTERNOON
TEMPERATURES ARE MOSTLY IN THE MIDDLE 90S ACROSS THE MIDSOUTH.
ATTM...PLAN TO GO WITH A RAIN-FREE FORECAST FOR TONIGHT. HOWEVER...
AM A LITTLE UNEASY WITH THIS...AND A CHANGE MAY NEED TO BE MADE AT
THE LAST MINUTE BASED ON WHAT RADARS INDICATE. PRESENTLY...88D KNQA
IS ECHO FREE. HOWEVER...THE ATMOSPHERE HAS BECOME UNSTABLE ACROSS
THE MIDSOUTH WITH CAPES EXCEEDING 2000 J/KG ACROSS MUCH OF THE
AREA. A LIMITING FACTOR IS THE MOISTURE...WATER VAPOR IMAGERY SHOWS
DRY AIR AT THE MID AND UPPER LEVELS HAS SPREAD INTO THE MIDSOUTH FROM
THE NORTHWEST. NEVERTHELESS...WOULD NOT BE TOTALLY SURPRISED IF A
THUNDERSTORM OR TWO DEVELOPED BEFORE SUNSET.

A WEAK COLD FRONT LIES FROM ABOUT SOUTH-CENTRAL MO INTO SOUTHERN IL.
THINK THIS FRONT WILL WASH OUT AS IT PERHAPS MOVES A LITTLE FURTHER
SOUTH. DO NOT THINK THIS FRONT WILL HAVE MUCH IF ANY INFLUENCE OVER
MIDSOUTH WEATHER. HIGH PRESSURE ALOFT WILL DOMINATE MIDSOUTH WEATHER
WELL INTO SATURDAY WITH THE MEAN ATMOSPHERIC MOISTURE REMAINING
LOW. TEMPERATURES WILL REMAIN WELL ABOVE NORMAL AS OUR HEAT WAVE
CONTINUES.

CHANGES WILL COME SUNDAY INTO EARLY NEXT WEEK...WITH THE FORECAST
DEPENDING ON THE EVENTUAL PATH OF HURRICANE RITA.  LATEST
INDICATIONS ARE THAT RITA WILL MAKE LANDFALL SOMEWHERE ALONG THE
TX OR SOUTHWESTERN LA COAST ABOUT SATURDAY. THE REMNANTS ARE FORECAST
TO EVENTUAL RECURVE TOWARD THE NORTHEAST AND MOVE THROUGH MO.
MODELS DIFFER ON HOW CLOSE THE REMNANT LOW WILL TRACK TO THE
MIDSOUTH. ATTM...WILL KEEP POPS IN THE CHANCE CATEGORY FROM SUNDAY
INTO TUESDAY WITH LOWER TEMPERATURES AND INCREASED CLOUD COVER.
OBVIOUSLY...THIS WILL BE FINED TUNED IN LATER FORECASTS.

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 201444
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
943 AM CDT TUE SEP 20 2005


.DISCUSSION...

CURRENT FORECAST IS ON TRACK AND DO NOT SEE ANY REASON FOR AN UPDATE
ATTM. UPPER SHORT WAVE EXTENDS FROM OH THROUGH KY...AND IS MOVING
SOUTHEASTWARD. STRONG UPPER LEVEL HIGH IS CENTERED OVER TX WITH THE
MIDSOUTH IN NORTHWESTERLY FLOW ALOFT. WATER VAPOR IMAGERY
INDICATES DRY AIR AT THE MID AND UPPER LEVELS SPREADING INTO THE
MIDSOUTH. A VERY WEAK COLD FRONT EXTENDS FROM CENTRAL IL THROUGH
SOUTH-CENTRAL MO WITH AN OUTFLOW BOUNDARY ACROSS SOUTHERN MO. THIS
FRONT WILL MOVE SLOWLY SOUTHEASTWARD...BUT IT WILL BECOME VERY
DIFFUSED. 12Z LZK SOUNDING INDICATES AFTERNOON CAPES AT OR ABOVE
3000 J/KG FOR THE MIDSOUTH. THUS THERE WILL BE ENOUGH INSTABILITY
FOR ISOLATED THUNDERSTORMS THIS AFTERNOON AHEAD OF THE COLD FRONT.
AFTERNOON HIGHS WILL CONTINUE TO BE WELL ABOVE NORMAL...IN THE MID
90S. CURRENT FORECAST HAS ALL OF THIS COVERED WELL.

.PREV DISCUSSION...
ISSUED 301 AM CDT TUE SEP 20 2005

07Z SURFACE MAP SHOWS THE COLD FRONT EXTENDS FROM ROUGHLY CHICAGO
THROUGH ST.LOUIS AND INTO OKLAHOMA. A THUNDERSTORM COMPLEX DEVELOPED
AHEAD OF THE FRONT DURING THE OVERNIGHT HOURS. THIS COMPLEX IS
ASSOCIATED WITH THE ENTRANCE REGION OF THE UPPER JET AND A SHORTWAVE
THROUGH THAT AREA. AN UPPER RIDGE IS CENTERED OVER TEXAS.

OVERNIGHT TRENDS CONTINUE TO SHOW A SCATTERED LINE OF SHOWERS AND
THUNDERSTORMS DROPPING SOUTHWARDS. EXPECT THAT THE SOUTHERN
PROGRESSION OF THIS LINE WILL GRADUALLY FIZZLE AS IT MOVES FURTHER
AWAY FROM THE FRONT AND FURTHER AWAY FROM THE BETTER UPPER DYNAMICS
THAT ARE ACROSS MISSOURI AND KENTUCKY. A STRAY STORM OR TWO MAY MAKE
IT INTO NORTHERN ARKANSAS AND INTO NORTHWEST TENNESSEE. ALTHOUGH THE
FRONT WILL BE MOVING INTO THE MID SOUTH LATER TODAY...MODELS SHOW
NOT MUCH PUNCH WITH THIS FRONT. ALSO...THE DEPTH OF THE LOW LEVEL
MOISTURE IS FAIRLY LOW AND THE BETTER UPPER LEVEL DYNAMICS WILL MOVE
NORTHEAST OF THE REGION TODAY. STILL...INSTABILITY IS RATHER
IMPRESSIVE WITH CAPES GREATER THAN 3000 J/KG AND LI BELOW -5.
WOULDNT BE SURPRISED IF AN ISOLATED STORM OR TWO POPS UP TODAY BUT
EXPECT THAT THE AREAL COVERAGE WILL BE RATHER LOW. 850 TEMPS AROUND
+20 AND A FAIR AMOUNT OF SUNSHINE SHOULD TRANSLATE INTO HIGHS IN THE
MID 90S ONCE AGAIN.

GFS/NAM SOLUTIONS SHOW A MOISTURE AXIS ASSOCIATED WITH THE REMNANTS
OF THE FRONT OVER NORTH MISSISSIPPI TOMORROW. WOULDNT BE SURPRISED
IF A COUPLE STORMS FIRED UP IN THE AFTERNOON HEATING IN THIS AREA.
AREAL COVERAGE AND CONFIDENCE FACTOR RATHER LOW AND CANT SEE
CHANGING THE ONGOING FORECAST FOR WEDNESDAY OF DRY WEATHER AT THIS
POINT.

NAM/GFS/EUROPEAN ALL NOW SHOWING THE POSITION OF THE UPPER RIDGE
EASTWARD SLIDING OUT OF TEXAS ON THURSDAY. AS IT SLIDES TOWARDS THE
MIDSOUTH...THIS SHOULD RESULT IN CONTINUED HOT AND DRY CONDITIONS
INTO THE FIRST HALF OF THE WEEKEND. THE FORECAST FOR THE SECOND HALF
OF THE WEEKEND AND THE FIRST PART OF NEXT WEEK BECOMES RATHER TRICKY
DUE TO UNCERTAINTY IN THE FORECAST TRACK OF RITA. EUROPEAN/GFS IN
GOOD AGREEMENT THAT THE STORM WILL MAKE LANDFALL ALONG THE TEXAS
COAST ON SATURDAY. THE STORM IS THEN EXPECTED TO MOVE NORTHWARD
ALONG THE PERIPHERY OF THE UPPER RIDGE THROUGH EAST TEXAS SATURDAY
NIGHT AND INTO SUNDAY. THE MIDSOUTH MAY BEGIN TO SEE RAIN BANDS WITH
THIS STORM ON SUNDAY AND COULD PERSIST INTO TUESDAY. THE 00Z GFS
SHOWS THE STORM MOVING THROUGH THE MIDSOUTH ON MONDAY. IT SHOULD BE
STRESSED THAT THERE IS A GREAT DEAL OF UNCERTAINTY IN THIS FORECAST.
THE LANDFALL COULD BE MUCH FURTHER SOUTH...PERHAPS INTO MEXICO. IF
THIS OCCURS THEN THE MIDSOUTH MAY NOT SEE ANY RAIN WHATSOEVER FROM
THIS STORM.

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 200801
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
301 AM CDT TUE SEP 20 2005

.DISCUSSION...

07Z SURFACE MAP SHOWS THE COLD FRONT EXTENDS FROM ROUGHLY CHICAGO 
THROUGH ST.LOUIS AND INTO OKLAHOMA. A THUNDERSTORM COMPLEX DEVELOPED 
AHEAD OF THE FRONT DURING THE OVERNIGHT HOURS. THIS COMPLEX IS 
ASSOCIATED WITH THE ENTRANCE REGION OF THE UPPER JET AND A SHORTWAVE 
THROUGH THAT AREA. AN UPPER RIDGE IS CENTERED OVER TEXAS.

OVERNIGHT TRENDS CONTINUE TO SHOW A SCATTERED LINE OF SHOWERS AND 
THUNDERSTORMS DROPPING SOUTHWARDS. EXPECT THAT THE SOUTHERN 
PROGRESSION OF THIS LINE WILL GRADUALLY FIZZLE AS IT MOVES FURTHER 
AWAY FROM THE FRONT AND FURTHER AWAY FROM THE BETTER UPPER DYNAMICS 
THAT ARE ACROSS MISSOURI AND KENTUCKY. A STRAY STORM OR TWO MAY MAKE 
IT INTO NORTHERN ARKANSAS AND INTO NORTHWEST TENNESSEE. ALTHOUGH THE 
FRONT WILL BE MOVING INTO THE MID SOUTH LATER TODAY...MODELS SHOW 
NOT MUCH PUNCH WITH THIS FRONT. ALSO...THE DEPTH OF THE LOW LEVEL 
MOISTURE IS FAIRLY LOW AND THE BETTER UPPER LEVEL DYNAMICS WILL MOVE 
NORTHEAST OF THE REGION TODAY. STILL...INSTABILITY IS RATHER 
IMPRESSIVE WITH CAPES GREATER THAN 3000 J/KG AND LI BELOW -5. 
WOULDNT BE SURPRISED IF AN ISOLATED STORM OR TWO POPS UP TODAY BUT 
EXPECT THAT THE AREAL COVERAGE WILL BE RATHER LOW. 850 TEMPS AROUND 
+20 AND A FAIR AMOUNT OF SUNSHINE SHOULD TRANSLATE INTO HIGHS IN THE 
MID 90S ONCE AGAIN. 

GFS/NAM SOLUTIONS SHOW A MOISTURE AXIS ASSOCIATED WITH THE REMNANTS 
OF THE FRONT OVER NORTH MISSISSIPPI TOMORROW. WOULDNT BE SURPRISED 
IF A COUPLE STORMS FIRED UP IN THE AFTERNOON HEATING IN THIS AREA. 
AREAL COVERAGE AND CONFIDENCE FACTOR RATHER LOW AND CANT SEE 
CHANGING THE ONGOING FORECAST FOR WEDNESDAY OF DRY WEATHER AT THIS 
POINT.

EASTWARD SLIDING OUT OF TEXAS ON THURSDAY. AS IT SLIDES TOWARDS THE 
MIDSOUTH...THIS SHOULD RESULT IN CONTINUED HOT AND DRY CONDITIONS 
INTO THE FIRST HALF OF THE WEEKEND. THE FORECAST FOR THE SECOND HALF 
OF THE WEEKEND AND THE FIRST PART OF NEXT WEEK BECOMES RATHER TRICKY 
DUE TO UNCERTAINTY IN THE FORECAST TRACK OF RITA. EUROPEAN/GFS IN 
GOOD AGREEMENT THAT THE STORM WILL MAKE LANDFALL ALONG THE TEXAS 
COAST ON SATURDAY. THE STORM IS THEN EXPECTED TO MOVE NORTHWARD 
ALONG THE PERIPHERY OF THE UPPER RIDGE THROUGH EAST TEXAS SATURDAY 
NIGHT AND INTO SUNDAY. THE MIDSOUTH MAY BEGIN TO SEE RAIN BANDS WITH

FXUS64 KMEG 200230
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
930 PM CDT MON SEP 19 2005

.UPDATE...
CURRENTLY CLEAR ACRS THE REGION THIS EVENING. TEMPS HAVE FALLEN 
TO AROUND 70 ACRS EASTERN SXNS WHERE THE WINDS HAVE GONE CALM. ACRS 
THE DELTA LIGHT S/SE SFC WINDS PREVAIL KEEPING TEMPS IN THE LOW/MID 
80S. A COLD FRONT MOVING THROUGH THE MID MS VALLEY THIS EVENING WL 
MOVE SOUTH TO NEAR THE KY/TN BORDER BY 12Z. TSTMS HAVE BEEN 
DEVELOPING ALONG THIS FRONT ACRS MO AND IL AND SOME STORMS MAY MOVE 
INTO NRN SXNS OF THE FORECAST AREA...ESPECIALLY NW TN...LATER 
TONIGHT. WL KEEP 20 POPS ACRS NRN SXNS. ONLY UPDATE WL BE TO REMOVE 
MIDNIGHT WORDING. 

SJM

.PREV DISCUSSION ISSUED AT 342 PM...SURFACE ANALYSIS PLACES COLD 
FRONT FROM SOUTHEAST IOWA TO EAST KANSAS WITH LATEST SATELLITE/88D 
IMAGERY TRENDS SHOWING CONVECTION ALONG THE BOUNDARY. ACROSS THE MID 
SOUTH...SOUTHERLY RETURN FLOW ON THE BACK SIDE OF HIGH PRESSURE 
BRINGING TEMPERATURES INTO THE LOWER TO MIDDLE 90S ACROSS THE MID 
SOUTH. MAIN CONCERNS THIS FORECAST PACKAGE IS CONVECTIVE POTENTIAL 
WITH COLD FRONT TONIGHT AND TUESDAY...THEN THE POSSIBLE FUTURE 
REMNANTS OF SOON TO BE HURRICANE RITA. 

TONIGHT AND TUESDAY...COLD FRONT WILL BEGIN TO APPROACH THE MID 
SOUTH TONIGHT AND MOVE THROUGH THE MID SOUTH ON TUESDAY. HELD 
PRECIPITATION CHANCES OFF UNTIL AFTER MIDNIGHT ACROSS THE NORTHERN 
THIRD OF THE AREA. BY TUESDAY...700-500 MB LAYER LAPSE RATES AROUND 
6.5 C/KM...SURFACE BASED CAPES AROUND 2000-2500 J/KG...AND WEAK MID 
LEVEL DYNAMICAL FORCING /700-500 MB Q-VECTOR CONVERGENCE/ JUSTIFIES 
A MENTION OF AT LEAST 20 POPS ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA DURING THE 
DAY. HIGH PRESSURE WILL GRADUALLY BUILD IN ACROSS THE REGION TUESDAY 
NIGHT AND WEDNESDAY BRINGING DRY WEATHER UNTIL THE WEEKEND.

FRIDAY THROUGH MONDAY...SURFACE AND UPPER LEVEL RIDGE WILL GRADUALLY 
MOVE EAST WITH SOUTHWEST FLOW DEVELOPING ON THE BACKSIDE OF HIGH 
PRESSURE. UNCERTAINTY STILL EXISTS WITH THE EVENTUAL TRACK OF SOON 
TO BE HURRICANE RITA. 00Z RUNS OF EUROPEAN/GFS WERE BRINGING THE 
TROPICAL SYSTEM ONSHORE FROM MEXICO TO CORPUS CHRISTI. 12Z RUNS HAVE 
TRENDED A BIT NORTH...PRIMARILY TOWARDS HOUSTON AT THIS TIME WITH 
THE REMNANTS EVENTUALLY MOVING INTO THE MID SOUTH BY THE END OF THE 
WEEKEND AT THE EARLIEST. CURRENTLY HAVE 20 POPS FOR THE END OF THE 
LONG RANGE FORECAST. HOWEVER...IF THE LATEST MODEL TREND CONTINUES 
LATER SHIFTS WILL ADJUST POPS ACCORDINGLY. STAY TUNED... 

&&

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 191601
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
1101 AM CDT MON SEP 19 2005

.DISCUSSION...LATEST SURFACE ANALYSIS THIS MORNING CENTERS 1024 MB 
HIGH PRESSURE ACROSS NORTHERN ALABAMA. SOUNDINGS THIS MORNING FROM 
KJAN/KLZK SHOW CAPPING INVERSION PRESENT AROUND 725 MB. 850MB 
TEMPERATURES AROUND 20C THIS MORNING SUGGEST TEMPERATURES IN THE 
MIDDLE 90S IN A FEW PLACES ACROSS THE MID SOUTH THIS AFTERNOON. 
CURRENT FORECAST OVERALL ON TRACK AND WILL NOT ISSUE AN UPDATE AT 
THIS TIME.

.PREV DISCUSSION...ISSUED 243 AM CDT MON SEP 19 2005...

THE MIDSOUTH IS UNDER THE INFLUENCE OF NEAR ZONAL FLOW...ON THE 
NORTHERN EDGE OF THE UPPER HIGH OVER LOUISIANA. IT WAS MOSTLY 
CLEAR OVER THE FORECAST AREA THIS MORNING. FARTHER NORTH A COMPLEX 
OF THUNDERSTORMS WAS MOVING ACROSS CENTRAL AND NORTHERN ILLINOIS. A 
COLD FRONT WAS LOCATED FROM SOUTHERN MINNESOTA TO NORTHERN 
NEBRASKA.

A HOT DAY IS ON TAP ACROSS THE MIDSOUTH TODAY AND TUESDAY AS 850MB 
TEMPERATURES WARM OUT WEST AND ADVECT INTO THE AREA. WE WILL BE 
FLIRTING WITH THE RECORD HIGH TEMPERATURE OF 97 HERE IN MEMPHIS.  
THE SURFACE TROUGH OVER THE CENTRAL PLAINS WILL ALSO AID IN BRINGING 
WARM...MOIST AIR TO THE REGION. THE LATEST MODELS AGREE THAT THE 
MOVEMENT OF THE COLD FRONT WILL BE SLIGHTLY SLOWER THAN PREVIOUSLY 
THOUGHT. THIS REALLY MEANS THAT THE CHANCE FOR SEVERE WEATHER HAS 
SHIFTED NORTH OF THE FORECAST AREA FOR TODAY AND TONIGHT. 

THE COLD FRONT WILL MOVE THROUGH THE FA AFTER MIDNIGHT TONIGHT. 
MODEL SOUNDING SHOW THAT SUFFICIENT MOISTURE...CONVERGENCE AND LIFT 
WILL EXIST TO PRODUCE SCATTERED THUNDERSTORMS AFTER MIDNIGHT. THE 
BEST CHANCES FOR RAIN WILL BE MAINLY ACROSS THE EASTERN THIRD OF THE 
MIDSOUTH. AS THE FRONT SAGS AND SLOWS ITS SOUTHWARD MOVEMENT... 
RESIDUAL RAIN WILL BE POSSIBLE OVER PARTS OF NORTHEAST MISSISSIPPI 
WEDNESDAY. THE REMAINDER OF THE AREA WILL BE DRY...AND ONLY SLIGHTLY 
COOLER WITH TEMPERATURES ABOVE THE NORMALS OF 85 AND 63.

FOR NEXT WEEKEND...WE WILL HAVE TO MONITOR TROPICAL STORM RITA FOR 
THE NEXT CHANCES FOR RAINFALL. CURRENT TRACKS TAKE IT TOWARDS THE 
TEXAS GULF COAST. UPPER LEVEL STEERING WINDS TAKE IT ACROSS EASTERN 
TEXAS...ARKANSAS AND THEN MISSOURI BY NEXT TUESDAY.

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.

.DISCUSSION...
WHAT IS LEFT OF THE MCS FROM EARLIER TODAY CONTINUES TO MOVE ACROSS
SOUTHEAST MISSOURI AND JUST BRUSHING THE EXTREME NORTHERN COUNTIES
IN THE FORECAST AREA. THIS ACTIVITY SHOULD DIE OUT IN THE NEXT HOUR
OR TWO. LOW PRESSURE WAS OVER CENTRAL KANSAS THIS AFTERNOON WITH A
COLD FRONT EXTENDING INTO SOUTHWEST KANSAS. AS THE LOW TRACKS
NORTHEAST THE FRONT WILL EVENTUALLY APPROACH THE REGION BY MONDAY
NIGHT. THERE MAY BE SOME ISOLATED THUNDERSTORMS DEVELOP AHEAD OF THE
FRONT ON MONDAY NIGHT ACROSS MAINLY THE NORTHERN HALF OF THE
FORECAST AREA. SPC HAS THAT AREA IN A SLIGHT RISK FOR SEVERE
THUNDERSTORMS SO WILL KEEP MENTION OF IT IN THE HWO. WHAT IS LEFT OF
THE FRONT SHOULD WEAKEN BY TUESDAY SO WILL GO WITH A DRY FORECAST FOR
TUESDAY. BOTH MODELS TRY TO SHIFT UPPER LEVEL RIDGE BACK WEST BY THE
MIDDLE OF THE WEEK. THE ETA IS MORE AGGRESSIVE WITH THIS SHIFT AND IN
TURN TRIES TO BRING TD 18 ALONG A MORE NORTHERLY TRACK THAN DOES THE
GFS. AT THIS POINT...NEITHER SCENARIO SHOULD MEAN MUCH IN THE WAY OF
RAIN SO DRY FORECAST WILL CONTINUE THROUGH THE REMAINDER OF THIS
UPCOMING WEEK.
