000 
FXUS64 KMEG 180724
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
224 AM CDT SUN SEP 18 2005

.DISCUSSION...
A QUIET MORNING FOR THE MIDSOUTH WITH ONLY A FEW CLOUDS DRIFTING 
ACROSS ARKANSAS. SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE IS ANCHORED OVER THE OHIO AND 
MISSISSIPPI VALLEYS. FARTHER WEST...A COMPLEX OF SEVERE 
THUNDERSTORMS HAS DEVELOPED OVER EASTERN KANSAS. CLOUD DEBRIS FROM 
THUNDERSTORMS THAT FORMED EARLIER OVER WEST TEXAS WAS DRIFTING INTO 
OKLAHOMA. THOSE CLOUDS WERE SHOWING SIGNS OF WARMING.

THE SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE OVER THE OHIO/MISSISSIPPI VALLEYS WILL 
BEGIN TO SHIFT EASTWARD TODAY. THIS WILL PUT THE MIDSOUTH ON THE 
WESTERN EDGE OF THE HIGH WHICH WILL ALLOW LOW LEVEL MOISTURE TO FEED 
BACK INTO THE AREA...AS WELL AS WARMER TEMPERATURES. THE STEERING 
FLOW FROM THE UPPER HIGH LOCATED OVER FAR EAST TX AND WRN LA WAS 
MOSTLY ZONAL OVER THE FORECAST AREA. WITH THIS FLOW...THE STORMS 
FARTHER WEST MAY CLIP THE NORTHWESTERN EDGE OF THE FA TONIGHT. 
CONFIDENCE IS RATHER LOW AT THIS POINT SO WILL NOT MENTION IN 
UPCOMING FORECAST. 

OF CONCERN WILL BE THE RETURN OF MOISTURE...ESPECIALLY FOR TUESDAY 
AHEAD A COLD FRONT. THE LATEST SWODY2 COVERS THE DETAILS. NOTICED 
THAN THE NAM WAS ABOUT 12 TO 18 HOURS FASTER WITH THE FRONTAL 
MOVEMENT THAN THE GFS. HOWEVER...BOTH MODELS SUGGEST THAT CAPE 
VALUES NEAR 3000 J/KG...CONVERGENCE AHEAD OF THE FRONT AND 
SUFFICIENT LIFT WILL SUPPORT ANY STORMS THAT DO FORM. THIS FRONT 
WILL BE PUSHED SOUTHWARD FROM A STRONG SHORTWAVE TRANSLATING ACROSS 
THE NRN U.S. INTO THE GREAT LAKES REGION.

THE FRONT LOOKS MUCH STRONGER TODAY WHEN COMPARED TO PAST SEVERAL 
MODEL RUNS. THE FRONT SHOULD MOVE THROUGH THE FORECAST AREA TUESDAY. 
THE SPEED OF THE FRONT WILL REALLY DETERMINE TEMPERATURES FOR 
TUESDAY...BUT HAVE GONE SLIGHTLY WARMER TRENDING TOWARD THE SLOWER 
SOLUTION OF THE GFS.

THE REMAINDER OF THE WEEK LOOKS DRY. PERHAPS BY THE BEGINNING OF 
NEXT WEEK THE AREA MAY BE AFFECTED BY TROPICAL REMNANTS OF WHAT IS 
NOW TROPICAL DEPRESSION 18.

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES
AR...NONE.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
1015 PM CDT SAT SEP 17 2005

.DISCUSSION...
SKIES HAVE REMAINED CLEAR FOR MUCH OF THE EVENING. A BATCH OF CIRRUS 
HAS BEEN MOVING INTO THE WEST OVER THE LAST HOUR OR TWO. CIRRUS IS 
IN ASSOCIATION WITH A COMPLEX OF STORMS THAT HAS DEVELOPED OVER 
OKLAHOMA/TEXAS. EXPECT THE MAIN AREA OF CIRRUS SHOULD STAY WEST OF 
THE CWA DURING THE OVERNIGHT HOURS LEAVING THE MIDSOUTH WITH MOSTLY 
CLEAR SKIES. WITH THE CLEAR SKIES...TEMPERATURES HAVE REALLY DROPPED 
WITH NORTHERN LOCATIONS ALREADY IN THE LOWER TO MID 60S. SOUTHERN 
AREAS REMAIN IN THE LOWER 70S FOR THE MOST PART AND LOOK GOOD TO 
REACH FORECASTED LOWS IN THE LOWER TO MID 60S. LOW TEMPERATURES IN 
NORTHERN LOCATIONS WILL NEED TO BE LOWERED A CATEGORY AS THE THIN 
PATCHES OF CIRRUS WILL NOT BE ENOUGH TO KEEP TEMPERATURES FROM 
DROPPING FURTHER.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
208 AM CDT SAT SEP 17 2005

.DISCUSSION...
PLEASANT TEMPERATURES RESIDE ACROSS THE MIDSOUTH THIS MORNING. SOME  
LOW CLOUDS HAVE DEVELOPED OVER PARTS OF WEST TENNESSEE AND NORTH 
MISSISSIPPI. EXPECT THESE CLOUDS TO SLOWLY GIVE WAY TO PLENTY OF 
SUNSHINE LATER TODAY. THEY WILL BE SLOWEST TO CLEAR OUT OF NORTHEAST 
MISSISSIPPI. 

THE RIDGE OVER EAST TEXAS WILL REMAIN NEARLY STATIONARY FOR THE  
REMAINDER OF THE WEEK. THIS RIDGE POSITION WILL CAUSE THE MIDSOUTH 
TO WARM BACK UP TO ABOVE SEASONAL NORMALS BEGINNING SUNDAY. EXPECT 
DAYTIME HIGHS AROUND 90 AND LOWS IN THE LOWER 70S FOR MOST 
LOCATIONS. AT THIS POINT...RAIN CHANCES LOOK VERY SLIM FOR THE NEXT 
SEVEN DAYS.

BOUNDARY TRIES TO APPROACH THE REGION BY LATE MONDAY NIGHT AND
TUESDAY BUT WITH LIMITED MOISTURE AVAILABLE...DO NOT EXPECT TO SEE

.DISCUSSION...

THAT STRETCHED FROM SOUTHEASTERN MISSOURI TO SOUTHWESTERN ARKANSAS. 

THE SHORTWAVE SPINNING OVER CENTRAL ILLINOIS/INDIANA WILL AID IN 
PUSHING THE COLD FRONT FARTHER EAST AND SOUTH LATER TODAY. A 70KT 
JET ON THE BACK SIDE OF THE TROUGH AXIS WILL PROVIDE THE DYNAMICS TO 
PRODUCE THE BETTER CHANCES FOR RAIN ACROSS THE SOUTHEAST PORTION OF 
THE FORECAST AREA TODAY. IT APPEARS THAT THESE BETTER CHANCES FOR 
RAIN WILL ROUGHLY BE ALONG AND SOUTH OF A LEXINGTON TN TO CLARKSDALE 
MS. MOISTURE WILL POOL AHEAD OF THE FRONT THUS UNSTABLE CONDITIONS 
WILL RESIDE HERE. THE COLD FRONT WILL MOVE THROUGH THIS PORTION OF 
THE AREA BY THIS EVENING CLEARING OUT THIS MOISTURE AND PROVIDING 
DRIER AND COOLER AIR IN ITS WAKE.

BY SATURDAY THE SUBTROPICAL HIGH OVER SOUTHEASTERN TEXAS MAKES ITS 
PRESENCE KNOWN AS IT BUILDS A LITTLE FARTHER NORTH AND EAST. THIS 
WILL PROVIDE THE MID SOUTH WITH DRY CONDITIONS DURING THE WEEKEND 
FOR THE MOST PART. ONE MINOR CONCERN IS THE NORTHERN PORTIONS OF THE 
FORECAST AREA. THEY WILL BE ON THE NORTHERN PERIMETER OF THE HIGH 
WHICH RAISES CONCERNS FOR ANY CONVECTION THAT FORMS IN THE CENTRAL 
PLAINS. THIS CONVECTION COULD MOVE INTO THE NORTHERN TIER OF THE 
FORECAST AREA SUNDAY/SUNDAY NIGHT. 

ANOTHER WEAK FRONT APPROACHES THE AREA TUESDAY. AT THIS POINT IT 
APPEARS THAT IT WILL BE DRY AHEAD OF IT AND STILL ABOVE NORMAL 
TEMPERATURES EXPECTED. THIS WILL BE SOMETHING TO WATCH THE NEXT 
COUPLE OF DAYS.

FXUS64 KMEG 141527
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
1027 AM CDT WED SEP 14 2005

DISCUSSION...

A COLD FRONT REMAINS STRETCHED FROM MICHIGAN SOUTHWESTWARD ACROSS
SOUTHEAST MISSOURI...AND INTO OKLAHOMA. A WEAK SHORTWAVE TROUGH NOW
MOVING ACROSS ARKANSAS HAS TRIGGERED SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS
ACROSS CENTRAL AND EASTERN ARKANSAS THIS MORNING. THIS ACTIVITY AND
ASSOCIATED CLOUD COVER WILL CONTINUE TO SPREAD EAST INTO WESTERN
TENNESSEE AND NORTHWEST MISSISSIPPI THIS AFTERNOON. ADDITIONAL SHOWER
AND THUNDERSTORM DEVELOPMENT WILL BE POSSIBLE LATER THIS AFTERNOON
IN ADVANCE OF THE SOUTHWARD MOVING COLD FRONT OVER NORTHERN
SECTIONS OF THE MIDSOUTH AND ALONG AN OLD CONVECTIVE OUTFLOW
BOUNDARY STRETCHED ACROSS NORTH MISSISSIPPI. WITH THIS IN MIND...HAVE
INCREASED POPS ACROSS MAINLY THE SOUTHERN 2/3RDS OF THE FORECAST AREA
TO ACCOUNT FOR ONGOING TRENDS AND ANTICIPATED CONVECTIVE DEVELOPMENT
THIS AFTERNOON AND LEFT HIGH CHANCE POPS ACROSS THE NORTHERN 1/3RD
AS IS. ALSO HAVE LOWERED HIGH TEMPERATURES FOR AREAS WEST OF THE
MISSISSIPPI RIVER DUE TO ABUNDANT CLOUD COVER AND ONGOING
PRECIPITATION. ONLY OTHER CHANGES HAVE BEEN TO ADJUST WINDS FOR
ONGOING WIND PATTERN. OTHER GRID PARAMETERS LOOK GOOD.

UPDATED GRIDS AND ZONES HAVE BEEN SENT. WILL CONTINUE TO MONITOR
CONVECTIVE EVOLUTION THROUGH THIS AFTERNOON.


.DISCUSSION FROM 431 AM CDT THIS MORNING...

00Z UPPER AIR ANALYSIS THIS MORNING PLACES LONG WAVE TROUGH FROM
WESTERN ONTARIO BACK INTO THE SOUTHERN PLAINS. AHEAD OF THIS FEATURE
ANOTHER WEAK SHORTWAVE WAS MOVING THROUGH THE MID SOUTH WITH 850 MB
MOISTURE POOLING ACROSS CENTRAL ARKANSAS. AT THE SURFACE A COLD FRONT
EXTENDS FROM CENTRAL LAKE SUPERIOR BACK INTO CENTRAL OKLAHOMA. MAIN
CONCERNS THIS FORECAST PACKAGE IS CONVECTIVE POTENTIAL ASSOCIATED
WITH FRONTAL PASSAGE BETWEEN TODAY AND FRIDAY.

TODAY...SURFACE COLD FRONT WILL CONTINUE TO MOVE TOWARDS THE
MID SOUTH AND STALL OUT ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA BY THIS AFTERNOON.
SOUTH OF THE FRONT...LI/S AROUND -6...SURFACE BASED CAPES BETWEEN
1500-2000 J/KG...AND MARGINAL TO MODERATE 700-500 MB LAYER LAPSE
RATES AROUND 6-6.5 C/KM SUGGESTS ANY CONVECTION THAT DEVELOPS IN THE
UNSTABLE ENVIRONMENT WILL BE OF MULTICELL TYPE WITH MARGINAL WIND
PROFILES ALOFT AND POTENTIAL FOR MAINLY ISOLATED HAIL/WIND THREATS.
IN ADDITION...PRECIPITABLE WATER VALUES WILL INCREASE TO AROUND 2
INCHES SUGGESTING A POTENTIAL FOR HEAVY RAINFALL WITH ANY
THUNDERSTORMS. LATEST 88D TRENDS OVER THE PAST FEW HOURS SHOW A LINE
OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS WEAKENING A BIT AS IT APPROACHES THE
FORECAST AREA. BASED ON CONVECTIVE TRENDS THIS MORNING I/LL GO WITH
NUMEROUS SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS ACROSS THE NORTHWEST
SECTION...SCATTERED POPS ELSEWHERE TAPERING OFF TO ISOLATED CHANCES
ACROSS PORTIONS OF NORTHERN MISSISSIPPI AND PRIMARILY CHANCE POPS
THIS AFTERNOON AS ATMOSPHERE MAY ENCOUNTER SOME DIFFICULTY
DESTABILIZING AGAIN FROM THIS MORNING/S CONVECTION.

TONIGHT...BOTH THE NAM AND GFS MODEL RUN SHOW AN EMBEDDED MID LEVEL
SHORTWAVE IN SOUTHWEST FLOW MOVING THROUGH THE LOWER MISSISSIPPI
VALLEY TONIGHT. AN MESOSCALE CONVECTIVE SYSTEM IS EXPECTED TO
DEVELOP ACROSS OKLAHOMA AND MOVE ACROSS ARKANSAS OVERNIGHT PRODUCING
ADDITIONAL SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS. INSTABILITY WILL CONTINUE TO
WEAKEN AS THE NIGHT PROGRESSES ACROSS THE MID SOUTH AND THINK SEVERE
WEATHER THREAT WILL BE MINIMAL IF ANY.

THURSDAY AND THURSDAY NIGHT...COLD FRONT WILL FINALLY BEGIN TO PUSH
SOUTH AND EAST OF THE FORECAST AREA BY LATE THURSDAY NIGHT. UPPER
LEVEL DYNAMICS WILL IMPROVE AS THE RIGHT REAR QUADRANT OF THE UPPER
LEVEL JET AND 35 KT 850 MB LOW LEVEL JET MOVE ACROSS THE LOWER
MISSISSIPPI VALLEY BY LATE AFTERNOON. SEVERAL INGREDIENTS SUCH AS
35KT OR GREATER UNIDIRECTIONAL WINDS AT 700/500 MB...POOLING OF 70F
SURFACE DEWPOINTS ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA...QUASI-STATIONARY SURFACE
FRONT PARALLEL TO UPPER LEVEL FLOW...AND A TONGUE OF 700 MB DEW POINT
DEPRESSIONS AROUND 17C SUGGEST A PROGRESSIVE WARM SEASON BOW ECHO
MAY FORM ALONG THE SURFACE BOUNDARY AND PUSH SOUTH THROUGH THE AREA
THURSDAY NIGHT. MAIN POTENTIAL SEVERE WEATHER THREAT WITH THIS
SCENARIO WOULD BE DAMAGING STRAIGHT LINE WINDS. WILL HIGHLIGHT
SEVERE WEATHER POTENTIAL IN THE HWO.

FRIDAY AND BEYOND...HIGH PRESSURE WILL BUILD IN BEHIND THE FRONT
BRINGING MAINLY PRECIPITATION FREE WEATHER TO THE MID SOUTH AS AN
UPPER LEVEL RIDGE TRIES TO RE-ESTABLISH ITSELF ACROSS THE EASTERN
UNITED STATES.

&&

FXUS64 KMEG 132044
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
345 PM CDT TUE SEP 13 2005

.DISCUSSION...
HIGH PRESSURE SLOWLY LOSING ITS GRIP ACRS THE AREA THIS AFTN. THE 
VERY DRY AIRMASS THAT HAD BEEN ACRS THE REGION FOR SEVERAL DAYS IS 
RETREATING TO THE EAST AS INDICATES BY THE WATER VAPOR IMAGERY. 
INCREASED MOISTURE COMBINED WITH AFTN HEATING AND A WEAK SHORTWAVE 
MOVING INTO ERN AR HAS RESULTED IN ISOLD SHOWERS ACRS THE DELTA THIS 
AFTN. THIS ACTIVITY SHOULD BE SHORT LIVED THIS AFTN BUT WL NEED TO 
MENTION ISOLD POPS IN THE FORECAST UNTIL ABOUT 01Z...OR AROUND 
SUNSET.

OVER THE NEXT COUPLE OF DAYS WE WILL BE SEEING A PATTERN SHIFT AS 
THE STAGNANT UPPER RIDGE ACRS THE REGION WEAKENS AND THE MEAN TROF 
OVER THE WRN STATES MOVES EAST THROUGH THE MID SOUTH PUSHING A 
SURFACE FRONT THROUGH THE REGION WITH GOOD CHANCES FOR RAIN. ANOTHER 
UPPER RIDGE BUILDS ACRS THE REGION THE WEEKEND AND EARLY NEXT WEEK 
RESULTING IN ANOTHER STRETCH OF DRY WEATHER. 

TONIGHT...AFTER EVENING CONVECTION DISSIPATES EXPECT DRY WEATHER FOR 
MOST OF THE NIGHT. THE ASSOCD CDFNT WL MOVE SOUTHEAST INTO THE MID 
MS VALLEY LATE TONIGHT. CONVECTION THAT DEVELOPS ALONG AND AHEAD OF 
THIS FRONT COULD IMPACT NE AR BY LATE TONIGHT. ELSW...EXPECT A 
LITTLE LESS FOG DUE TO LIGHT SOUTHERLY WINDS. 

WEDNESDAY...THE COLD FRONT WL SAG SOUTH INTO THE EXTREME NORTHERN 
PARTS OF THE MID SOUTH. DYNAMICS NOT TO IMPRESSIVE ON WED WITH MAIN 
SHORTWAVE STILL WELL TO THE WEST. WL HAVE TO RELY ON WEAK SFC 
CONVERGENCE ALONG THE FRONT...OUTFLOW BOUNDARIES THAT MOVE SOUTH 
INTO THE AREA FROM OVERNIGHT CONVECTION ACRS MO/AR AND SFC 
HEATING TO DEVELOP SHOWERS OR TSTMS. WL GO WITH HIGHEST POPS INVOF 
OF SFC FRONT ACRS NRN SXNS WITH LESSER POPS TO THE SOUTH. 

WEDNESDAY NIGHT...NEARLY STATIONARY FRONT WL BE LOCATED ACRS THE 
REGION. SEVERAL FACTORS POINTING TOWARD POTENTIAL MCS DEVELOPMENT 
ACRS WRN AR WED NIGHT. A DECENT 500 MB SHORTWAVE MOVES INTO THE SRN 
PLAINS. MEANWHILE A STRONG JET STRETCHES NORTH OF THE OH VALLEY WITH 
THE SRN PLAINS LOCATED IN THE DIFFULENT REGION OF THE REAR ENTRANCE 
JET. STRONG MOISTURE TRANSPORT AT 850 MB IS ALSO FORECAST ACRS AR. 
THIS FACTORS SHOULD RESULT IN MCS GENERATION OVER WRN AR WED EVE. 
THE MCS WL PROBABLY REACH THE MS RIVER BY 12Z. THERE IS A SMALL 
RISK OF SEVERE WEATHER WITH THIS SYSTEM. GIVEN THE TIME OF DAY AND 
LACK OF STRONG INSTABILITY THE MAIN THREAT WL PROBABLY BE DAMAGING 
WINDS. IT CONTINUES TO LOOK LIKE ANY THREAT WL BE ROUGHLY NORTH 
OF I-40 LATE WED NIGHT INTO THU MORNING.

THURSDAY...ONGOING MCS WL HAVE A BIG EFFECT ON WEATHER FOR THURSDAY. 
EXPECT SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS ACRS MUCH OF THE NORTHERN HALF OF 
THE MID SOUTH IN THE MORNING. VERY POSSIBLE MCS WL LAY DOWN A STABLE 
AIRMASS ACRS NORTHERN SECTION OF THE MID SOUTH WITH OUTFLOW 
BOUNDARIES PUSHING INTO NRN MS. ANY AFTN REDEVELOPMENT WL DEPEND ON 
EVOLUTION OF BOUNDARIES...HEATING AND THE TIMING OF SHORTWAVE MOVING 
ACRS THE AREA. CONTD WITH HIGHEST POPS ACRS NRN SXNS DUE TO MCS WITH 
CHC POPS ACRS N MS. 

THURSDAY NIGHT INTO FRIDAY...18Z ETA AND 12Z GFS IN DECENT AGREEMENT 
WITH MOVING FRONT SOUTH OF THE REGION THURSDAY NIGHT AND FRIDAY. WL 
TAPER BACK POPS ON FRI.

SATURDAY THROUGH TUESDAY...UPPER RIDGING BUILDS BACK OVER THE AREA 
WITH DRY WEATHER AND SLIGHTLY ABOVE NORMAL TEMPS. 

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES

SJM

.PREV DISCUSSION ISSUED AT 407 AM...LATEST SURFACE ANALYSIS PLACES 
HIGH PRESSURE ACROSS THE MID SOUTH. UPPER AIR ANALYSIS SHOWS A RIDGE 
OF HIGH PRESSURE ACROSS THE EASTERN UNITED STATES...A TROUGH 
EXTENDING THROUGH THE ROCKIES AND HURRICANE OPHELIA ALONG THE 
CAROLINA COAST. MAIN FORECAST CONCERNS THIS PACKAGE IS CONVECTIVE 
POTENTIAL ASSOCIATED WITH FRONTAL PASSAGE WEDNESDAY THROUGH FRIDAY. 

TODAY...WEAK SOUTHERLY FLOW AT THE SURFACE AND ALOFT WILL CONTINUE 
ACROSS THE MID SOUTH ON THE BACK SIDE OF HIGH PRESSURE AS IT MOVES 
EAST TODAY. DECOUPLED WINDS...CLEAR SKIES...AND HIGH RELATIVE 
HUMIDITIES HAVE PRODUCED SOME PATCHY FOG ACROSS FAR SOUTHEASTERN 
SECTIONS OF THE FORECAST AREA OVERNIGHT AND CARRIED PATCHY FOG AT 
LEAST THROUGH SUNRISE. MODEL SOUNDINGS INDICATE SOME INSTABILITY 
PRESENT ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA THIS AFTERNOON WITH LI/S AROUND 
-3...1500-2000 J/KG SURFACE BASED CAPE...AND WEAK WINDS ALOFT. 
HOWEVER...A CAPPING INVERSION PRESENT AROUND 625 MB SHOULD PREVENT 
ANY CONVECTION FROM DEVELOPING. NONETHELESS...EXPECT TO SEE SOME 
CLOUDS IN THE AFTERNOON AND HIGHS IN THE LOWER 90S WITH 850 MB 
DEWPOINTS AROUND 18-19C.

TONIGHT...A WEAK MID LEVEL SHORTWAVE IN SOUTHWEST FLOW ALOFT WILL 
MOVE ACROSS THE MIDDLE MISSISSIPPI VALLEY. CAPPING INVERSION 
MENTIONED ABOVE WILL KEEP MOST OF THE FORECAST AREA DRY BUT SHOULD 
WEAKEN ENOUGH ACROSS THE FAR NORTHWEST SECTION OF THE FORECAST AREA 
TO JUSTIFY A MENTION OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS. 

WEDNESDAY...SURFACE COLD FRONT WILL BEGIN TO SLIDE SOUTH ACROSS THE 
MID SOUTH DURING THE DAY AND EVENTUALLY BECOME QUASI-STATIONARY. NOT 
TOO IMPRESSED WITH THE DYNAMICS OF THE BOUNDARY AT THE ONSET WITH 
SURFACE LEVEL FLOW PARALLEL TO UPPER LEVEL FLOW AND WEAK UPPER LEVEL 
DYNAMICAL FORCING DURING THE DAYTIME. MADE LITTLE IF ANY AJUSTMENTS 
TO POPS WITH BEST CHANCES REMAINING ACROSS NORTHERN SECTIONS OF THE 
FORECAST AREA.  

WEDNESDAY NIGHT...FRONT WILL REMAIN QUASI-STATIONARY ACROSS THE MID 
SOUTH AS ANOTHER AREA OF LOW PRESSURE DEVELOPS ACROSS OKLAHOMA AND 
MOVES ALONG THE FRONT. IN ADDITION...AN MCS IS ANTICIPATED TO 
DEVELOP ACROSS OKLAHOMA AND MOVE ACROSS ARKANSAS INTO AN UNSTABLE 
AIRMASS. HAIL AND DAMAGING WINDS ARE POSSIBLE THREATS WITH THE 
COMPLEX IF IT HOLDS TOGETHER DURING THE OVERNIGHT HOURS ACROSS THE 
FORECAST AREA.

THURSDAY AND FRIDAY...UPPER LEVEL RIDGING ACROSS THE EASTERN UNITED 
STATES WILL CONTINUE TO BREAK DOWN...ALLOWING THE UPPER LEVEL TROUGH 
TO PUSH THE COLD FRONT THROUGH THE FORECAST AREA ON FRIDAY WITH DRY 
WEATHER EXPECTED THIS WEEKEND. 

NO CHANGES MADE BEYOND FRIDAY.
&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.

FXUS64 KMEG 131513
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
1013 AM CDT TUE SEP 13 2005

.UPDATE...
HIGH PRESSURE STARTING TO SLOWLY LOSE ITS GRIP ACRS THE MID SOUTH. 
WATER VAPOR IMAGERY SHOWING INCREASED MOISTURE WEST OF THE RIVER 
WITH VERY DRY AIRMASS RETREATING TOWARD THE EAST. SCT MID CLOUDS 
WERE MOVING INTO ERN AR AND THE MO BOOTHEEL THIS MORNING WHILE CLEAR 
SKIES WERE THE RULE ACRS W TN AND N MS. UPDATED SKY CONDITION TO 
REFLECT THIS. WL REMOVE PATCHY FOG AND TEMPS LOOK ON TRACK. 

SJM

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 122038
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
338 PM CDT MON SEP 12 2005

.DISCUSSION...
A LARGE AREA OF HIGH PRESSURE COVERS THE OHIO...TN AND LOWER MS 
VALLEYS THIS AFTERNOON. WATER VAPOR INDICATES A VERY DRY AIRMASS 
ACRS THE REGION. A FEW CU HAVE POPPED UP ACRS THE MID SOUTH AS TEMPS 
HAVE CLIMBED TO AROUND 90 DEGREES. SFC DEWPOINTS HAVE MIXED DOWN TO 
THE UPPER 50S AGAIN THIS AFTN. 

TONIGHT AND TUE...HIGH PRESSURE HANGS ON WITH MOSTLY CLEAR SKIES 
TONIGHT. EXPECT PATCHY FOG ACRS MAINLY ERN SXNS...LIKE MKL. TUE WL 
BE MOSTLY SUNNY AND PERHAPS A LITTLE WARMER UNDER SOUTHWEST FLOW. 

TUE NIGHT THROUGH FRI...OVER THE NEXT FEW DAYS THE RIDGE OVER THE 
REGION WL SLOWLY BREAK DOWN AS A TROF MOVES INTO THE CNTRL PLAINS. 
12Z GFS AND 18Z ETA IN GOOD AGREEMENT THE MOVEMENT OF THE ASSOCD 
COLD FRONT. THIS COLD FRONT WL SLOWLY SAG SOUTHEAST INTO THE NRN 
SXNS OF THE MID SOUTH BY WED AND WORK THROUGH THE AREA THU AND FRI. 
WL START WITH HIGHER POPS ACRS NRN SXNS WED AND THU AS FRONT REMAINS 
STATIONARY THROUGH THAT AREA DUE TO NEARLY ZONAL FLOW ALOFT. THERE 
WL PROBABLY BE SOME MCS DEVELOPMENT ALONG THE FRONT AS SEVERAL WEAK 
SHORTWAVES MOVE ACRS THE AREA. THERE IS A SMALL POSSIBILITY OF 
STRONG TO SEVERE STORMS DURING THE PERIOD DEPENDING ON 
INSTABILITY...WHICH ATTM DOES NOT APPEAR TO BE GREAT. 

FRI NIGHT THROUGH MON...BY FRI NIGHT AND SAT THE UPPER FLOW BECOMES 
MORE NORTHWESTERLY AND THE VERY WEAK...NEARLY WASHED OUT...SFC FRONT 
MOVES SOUTH OF THE REGION. UPPER LEVEL RIDGING STRENGTHENS TOWARD 
THE END OF THE WEEKEND INTO THE BEGINNING OF NEXT WEEK RESULTING IN 
DRY WEATHER AND PLEASANT TEMPS. 

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 121539
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
1039 AM CDT MON SEP 12 2005

.UPDATE...
HIGH PRESSURE CONTINUES TO BE IN CONTROL TODAY WITH VERY DRY AIRMASS 
ACROSS THE MID SOUTH. EXPECT SUNNY SKIES TODAY WITH MAYBE A FEW CU 
ACRS EASTERN SECTIONS OF THE FORECAST AREA...MAINLY ALONG THE TN 
RIVER VALLEY. TEMPS WARMING QUICKLY AND HIGHS OF 90-92 DEGREES LOOK 
GOOD. NO UPDATES PLANNED FOR NOW. 

.PREV DISCUSSION ISSUED AT 348 AM...
A LARGE AREA OF HIGH PRESSURE EXTENDED FROM THE OHIO RIVER VALLEY TO
THE LOWER MISSISSIPPI RIVER VALLEY EARLY THIS MORNING. SKIES WERE
MOSTLY CLEAR ACROSS THE MIDSOUTH. WATER VAPOR SATELLITE IMAGERY
CONTINUED TO INDICATE A VERY DRY AIR MASS ACROSS THE MIDSOUTH. SOME
PATCHY FOG WAS BEING REPORTED...BUT NOT AS PREVALENT AS THE LAST FEW
NIGHTS AS LOWER SURFACE DEWPOINTS HAVE MOVED INTO THE AREA. TODAYS
WEATHER WILL BE ABOUT LIKE YESTERDAY...SUNNY AND WARM.

UPPER LEVEL HEIGHTS WILL BEGIN TO LOWER ACROSS THE MIDSOUTH TUESDAY
AS A TROUGH MOVES INTO THE PLAINS. INCREASING SOUTHWEST WINDS WILL
ALLOW HIGH TEMPERATURES TO BE A DEGREE OR TWO WARMER. THE AIR MASS
WILL REMAIN DRY WITH MOSTLY SUNNY SKIES.

MODELS AGREE THAT THE RIDGE WILL BREAK DOWN ACROSS THE MIDSOUTH BY
WEDNESDAY WITH THE UPPER LEVEL FLOW BECOMING WESTERLY. A COLD
FRONT IS FORECAST TO SLOWLY PUSH INTO THE MIDSOUTH FROM THE NORTH
WEDNESDAY...BECOMING NEARLY STATIONARY EAST TO WEST ACROSS THE AREA
INTO THURSDAY. THE ATMOSPHERE WILL BECOME MORE UNSTABLE ACROSS THE
MIDSOUTH WEDNESDAY. IN ADDITION...UPPER LEVEL DISTURBANCES RIDING
ALONG THE FRONT WILL HELP TO CAUSE A CHANCE OF THUNDERSTORMS. WILL
INCREASE THE POPS DURING THIS TIME...BUT THEY MAY HAVE TO BE
INCREASED EVEN MORE IN LATER FORECASTS. COULD POSSIBLY SEE A
MESOSCALE CONVECTIVE COMPLEX MOVE ACROSS THE AREA FROM THE WEST
DURING THIS TIME. INCREASED CLOUD COVER AND THE PRECIPITATION WILL
HELP TO HOLD HIGH TEMPERATURES DOWN SOME.

THE FRONT IS FORECAST TO PUSH SOUTH OF THE MIDSOUTH BY FRIDAY NIGHT
AS THE UPPER LEVEL FLOW BECOMES MORE NORTHWESTERLY. MEANWHILE...HIGH
PRESSURE ALOFT WILL BEGIN TO SPREAD INTO THE AREA FROM THE WEST OVER
THE WEEKEND. THUS WILL CONTINUE WILL A DRY FORECAST FOR THE WEEKEND.

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.

FXUS64 KMEG 111924
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
230 PM CDT SUN SEP 11 2005

.DISCUSSION...
HIGH PRESSURE ALOFT WILL CONTINUE TO DOMINATE THE WEATHER THROUGH 
MIDWEEK. MOSTLY CLEAR TO PARTLY CLOUDY CONDITIONS WILL PREVAIL WITH 
HIGH TEMPERATURES NEAR 90 WITH LOWS IN IN THE 60S TO LOWER 70S.

BY WEDNESDAY...A COLD FRONT WILL MOVE INTO THE CWA FROM THE 
NORTHWEST AND WILL BRING CHANCES FOR RAIN BACK TO THE FORECAST. THE 
FRONT WILL LINGER OVER THE CWA THROUGH FRIDAY AND WILL BRING 
CONTINUED CHANCES FOR SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS TO THE AREA. WILL 
PUT 20 TO 30 POPS DURING THIS TIME. TEMPERATURES WILL BE COOLER WITH 
THE CLOUD COVER AND PRECIPITATION AROUND THE AREA. EXPECT HIGHS IN 
THE 80S AND LOWS IN THE 60S.

BY SATURDAY...HIGH PRESSURE WILL REBUILD BACK INTO THE AREA ALLOWING 
FOR DRY AND PLEASANT CONDITIONS TO RETURN TO THE MIDSOUTH FOR THE 
WEEKEND. EXPECT HIGHS IN THE MID TO UPPER 80S AND LOWS IN THE 60S 
DURING THIS TIME.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
1015 AM CDT SUN SEP 11 2005

.DISCUSSION...
QUIET WEATHER PATTERN CONTINUES ACROSS THE MIDSOUTH THIS MORNING. CU 
WILL DEVELOP BY MIDDAY GIVING THE AREA MOSTLY SUNNY SKIES. 
TEMPERATURES ARE CURRENTLY AROUND 80 DEGREES AND LOOK ON TRACK TO 
REACH HIGHS AROUND 90 OR LOWER 90S. HAZE IS NOT AS BAD AS YESTERDAY 
WITH MOST VISIBILITIES ABOVE 6 MILES ALREADY THIS MORNING SO WILL 
REMOVE MENTION OF EARLY MORNING FOG AND HAZY CONDITIONS. UPDATE WILL 
BE OUT SHORTLY.

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 110900
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
400 AM CDT SUN SEP 11 2005

.DISCUSSION...
A STAGNANT WEATHER PATTERN WILL CONTINUE ACROSS THE MIDSOUTH THE
NEXT COUPLE OF DAYS. A LARGE AREA OF HIGH PRESSURE ALOFT EXTENDING
FROM THE UPPER MIDWEST TO THE LOWER MISSISSIPPI RIVER VALLEY WILL
PERSIST THROUGH MONDAY. AREAS OF FOG HAVE ONCE AGAIN DEVELOPED
ACROSS THE MIDSOUTH THIS MORNING WITH MOSTLY CLEAR SKIES AND CALM
WIND. THE FOG WILL GRADUALLY BURN OFF EARLY THIS MORNING...BUT
CONDITIONS WILL REMAIN HAZY FOR MOST OF THE MIDSOUTH THROUGHOUT
MUCH OF THE DAY. HIGH TEMPERATURES TODAY WILL BE ABOUT LIKE
YESTERDAY. WINDS WILL BECOME MORE SOUTHWESTERLY MONDAY WHICH WILL
BOOST HIGHS A COUPLE OF DEGREES.

THE FORECAST BECOMES A LITTLE MORE COMPLICATED TOWARD MID-WEEK AND
ESPECIALLY TOWARD THE END OF THE WEEK. HEIGHTS ARE FORECAST TO
LOWER ACROSS THE MIDSOUTH TUESDAY AS THE RIDGE WEAKENS. THIS WILL
ALLOW AN EAST TO WEST COLD FRONT TO MOVE TO A LINE EXTENDING FROM
SOUTHERN IL TO SOUTHERN MO TO NORTHEAST OK WEDNESDAY. ATTM...THINK
PRECIPITATION ASSOCIATED WITH THIS FRONT WILL REMAIN NORTH OF THE
MIDSOUTH THROUGH WEDNESDAY.

THE GFS BRINGS THE FRONT INTO AND THROUGH THE MIDSOUTH DURING THE
TIMEFRAME FROM THURSDAY INTO FRIDAY. THE TIMING ON THIS WAY BE TOO
FAST...ESPECIALLY WITH SOME UNCERTAINTY REGARDING HOW FAST
HURRICANE OPHELIA MOVES ALONG THE NORTH CAROLINA COAST. IN
ADDITION...AM NOT CONVINCED THE FRONT WILL MAKE IT THROUGH THE
MIDSOUTH WITH THE UPPER LEVEL FLOW REMAINING WEST TO SOUTHWEST.
PREFER TO SEE LATER MODEL RUNS. THUS FOR NOW WILL GO WITH A SLOWER
MOVEMENT OF THE FRONT AND EXPECT IT TO STALL ACROSS THE MIDSOUTH.
WILL ADD A SLIGHT CHANCE OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS TO THE
NORTHERN HALF OF THE MIDSOUTH THURSDAY NIGHT...AND INCLUDE FOR THE
ENTIRE MIDSOUTH FRIDAY INTO SATURDAY. THESE POPS MAY HAVE TO BE
INCREASED IN LATER FORECASTS.

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.

$$





SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE AND UPPER LEVEL RIDGE CONTINUE TO BE THE

LOWER EAST OF THE DELTA JUSTIFYING FOG MENTIONING.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
200 PM CDT SAT SEP 10 2005

.DISCUSSION...
HIGH PRESSURE ALOFT WILL REMAIN IN PLACE OVER THE MIDSOUTH THROUGH 
THE END OF THE WEEKEND. THIS WILL CONTINUE TO BRING MOSTLY CLEAR 
CONDITIONS TO THE AREA WITH HIGHS AROUND 90 AND LOWS IN THE 60S TO

HIGH WILL SHIFT EASTWARD FOR THE BEGINNING OF NEXT WEEK. EXPECT A 
LITTLE MORE CLOUD COVER WITH HIGHS A TAD WARMER...IN THE LOWER 90S 
AND LOWS IN THE UPPER 60S TO MID 70S. 

BY WEDNESDAY THROUGH FRIDAY...A COLD FRONT WILL APPROACH FROM THE 
NORTHWEST BUT WILL BECOME STATIONARY ACROSS SOUTHERN MISSOURI AS THE 
UPPER RIDGE WILL CONTINUE TO HOLD STRONG OVER THE MIDSOUTH. CAN/T 
RULE OUT A FEW ISOLATED SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS SKIRTING NORTHERN 
PORTIONS OF THE CWA BUT MOST AREAS WILL REMAIN DRY. WILL KEEP DRY 
FORECAST FOR ENTIRE CWA FOR NOW.

ON SATURDAY...RIDGE WILL BREAK DOWN ALLOWING THE FLOW TO BECOME MORE 
ZONAL. EXPECT SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS TO DEVELOP OUT AHEAD OF THE 
FRONTAL BOUNDARY. WILL ADD A CHANCE FOR POPS. HIGHS WILL BE IN THE 
UPPER 80S WITH LOWS IN THE 60S BY THIS TIME.

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 100756
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
256 AM CDT SAT SEP 10 2005

.DISCUSSION...
A LARGE AREA OF HIGH PRESSURE ALOFT COVERS THE MIDDLE AND LOWER
MISSISSIPPI RIVER VALLEY THIS MORNING. SATELLITE SHOWS CLEAR SKIES
ACROSS THE MIDSOUTH. SURFACE OBSERVATIONS INDICATE THAT A CALM
WIND HAS ALLOWED AREAS OF FOG TO FORM ONCE AGAIN ACROSS MUCH OF THE
AREA. LOWEST VISIBILITIES ARE MOSTLY BETWEEN 1 AND 2 MILES ACROSS
WEST TN AND NORTH MS...WILL MENTION THE FOG IN THE GRIDS / ZONES
THROUGH EARLY MORNING FOR THESE AREAS.

THE WEATHER PATTERN AFFECTING THE MIDSOUTH WILL REMAIN STAGNANT FOR
THE NEXT FEW DAYS. HIGH TEMPERATURES WILL WARM A COUPLE OF DEGREES
TODAY...THEN REMAIN ABOUT THE SAME THE NEXT FEW DAYS. OVERNIGHT
LOWS WILL REMAIN ABOUT THE SAME AS THIS MORNING. HIGH PRESSURE ALOFT
WILL MOVE TO THE EAST OF THE MIDSOUTH SUNDAY...THEN HEIGHTS WILL
GRADUALLY LOWER SOME EARLY NEXT WEEK. A COLD FRONT IS FORECAST TO
SETTLE EAST TO WEST FROM SOUTHERN IL / IN THROUGH SOUTH CENTRAL MO TO
SOUTHERN KS BY WEDNESDAY. SOUTHWEST FLOW ALOFT IS EXPECTED TO KEEP
THIS FRONT WELL NORTH OF THE MIDSOUTH...THUS CONTINUED DRY WEATHER
FOR THE MIDSOUTH. HOWEVER...THIS WILL NEED TO BE WATCHED IN CASE
THE FRONT SETTLES FURTHER SOUTH THAN EXPECTED. THE GFS INDICATES A
COLD FRONT PUSHING INTO THE MIDSOUTH FROM THE NORTHWEST NEXT FRIDAY
OR SATURDAY WITH A CHANCE OF RAIN. HOWEVER...THIS IS GETTING NEAR THE
END OR BEYOND THE CURRENT FORECAST. WILL LET LATER SHIFTS SEE IF THIS
TREND CONTINUES BEFORE INTRODUCING ANY RAIN THAT FAR OUT. LATEST
TRACK FROM THE NATIONAL HURRICANE CENTER TAKES OPHELIA INTO THE
CAROLINAS NEXT WEEK...WELL AWAY FROM THE MIDSOUTH.

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
306 AM CDT FRI SEP 9 2005

.DISCUSSION...

HIGH PRESSURE ALOFT COVERS THE SOUTHERN AND CENTRAL PLAINS THIS
MORNING WITH A NORTHWEST WIND FLOW ALOFT ACROSS THE MIDSOUTH.
SATELLITE SHOWS SKIES ARE CLEAR ACROSS THE MIDSOUTH WITH WATER
VAPOR IMAGERY INDICATING DRY CONDITIONS AT THE MID AND UPPER LEVELS
OF THE ATMOSPHERE. CALM WINDS HAVE ALLOWED PATCHY FOG TO DEVELOP
ACROSS PARTS OF WEST TN INTO NORTHEAST MS WITH A FEW LOCATIONS
REPORTING VISIBILITIES 1/2 TO 1 MILE. WILL INDICATE THIS PATCHY FOG
IN THE GRIDS / ZONES THROUGH EARLY THIS MORNING.

HIGH PRESSURE ALOFT WILL BUILD OVER THE MIDSOUTH FROM THE WEST
TODAY...BE OVER THE MIDSOUTH SATURDAY...THEN SETTLE TO THE EAST OF
THE MIDSOUTH SUNDAY. ALL IN ALL...RAIN FREE WEATHER IS FORECAST TO
CONTINUE ACROSS THE MIDSOUTH INTO NEXT WEEK. TEMPERATURES WILL WARM
A LITTLE THE NEXT COUPLE OF DAYS AS THE HIGH BUILDS OVER THE
AREA...AND SOILS DRY SOME. VERY WARM AFTERNOONS AND MILD NIGHTS CAN
BE EXPECTED INTO NEXT WEEK. HURRICANE OPHELIA IS FORECAST TO REMAIN
OFF THE COAST OF THE SOUTHEAST UNITES STATES THROUGH EARLY NEXT
WEEK. WILL CONTINUE TO MONITOR...AT THIS TIME IS NOT EXPECTED
TO AFFECT OUR WEATHER...PERHAPS AT THE MOST BRINGING SOME CLOUDS TO
PARTS OF THE AREA.

820 PM CDT THU SEP 8 2005

.DISCUSSION...

A RIDGE OVER THE MIDDLE PART OF THE COUNTRY WILL CONTINUE TO KEEP
THE MIDSOUTH DRY TONIGHT WHILE THERE IS A RING OF STORMY WEATHER
AROUND THE RIDGE. STORMS ARE IN AZ UP TO THE CENTRAL ROCKIES.
OTHERS ARE OVER IL/IN/OH. TO THE SOUTH...AN AREA OF DISTURBED
WEATHER IS IN THE WESTERN GULF. HURRICANE OPHELIA IS
STRENGTHENING OFF THE EAST COAST OF FL.

THE WEATHER DRIVER SHOULD BE THE DEEPENING TROUGH ON THE WEST
COAST. THIS WILL MOVE THE UPPER RIDGE SQUARELY OVER US. MOSTLY
SUNNY DAYS AND CLEAR NIGHTS SHOULD PERSIST. DAYS WILL BE WARM AND
NIGHTS MILD. NOT BAD FOR THIS TIME OF YEAR.



000 
FXUS64 KMEG 081921
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
221 PM CDT THU SEP 8 2005

.DISCUSSION...
THERE ARE NO FORESEEABLE CHANGES TO THE WEATHER OVER THE MIDSOUTH 
FOR THE NEXT SEVEN DAYS. AN UPPER LEVEL RIDGE WILL CONTINUE TO BUILD 
OVER THE REGION DUE TO A TROUGH PHASE AND AMPLIFICATION OVER THE 
WESTERN UNITED STATES. 

ONLY MINOR CONCERN FOR TONIGHT IS THE POSSIBILITY OF FOG. SOME 
STATIONS OVER EASTERN PORTIONS OF THE AREA DROPPED DOWN TO 1/2 MILE 
AT TIMES LAST NIGHT. WITH CLEAR SKIES...LIGHT WINDS...AND DEWPOINTS 
SLIGHTLY HIGHER...BELIEVE THE THREAT FOR PATCHY FOG IS THERE AND 
WILL MENTION IN ZONES FOR EASTERN AREAS. OTHER THAN THAT...ANOTHER 
NICE NIGHT IS ON TAP WITH LOWS IN THE 60S.

NOT MUCH TO SPEAK OF FOR THE REST OF THE FORECAST. HIGH TEMPS WILL 
WARM INTO THE UPPER 80S AND LOWER 90S OVER THE NEXT SEVERAL DAYS. 
DESPITE A 595DM RIDGE DEVELOPING OVER US BY SUNDAY...850 TEMPS WILL 
RANGE AROUND 18C. THIS SHOWS THAT THE RIDGE IS MORE OF DOWNSTREAM 
RESPONSE TO THE AMPLIFICATION OF THE TROUGH OUT WEST AND WE WILL NOT 
SEE THE TYPE OF HEAT THAT CAN BE EXPERIENCED WITH THIS TYPE OF UPPER
LEVEL PATTERN. DEEP LAYER MOISTURE WILL REMAIN VERY LIMITED AS 
WELL...KEEPING SKIES MOSTLY CLEAR WITH ONLY A FEW DIURNAL CU 
POSSIBLE. 

ECMWF AND GFS AGREE THAT THE RIDGE AXIS WILL SHIFT EAST BY MIDWEEK 
WITH HEIGHTS LOWERING ACROSS THE REGION...HELPING TEMPS TO COOL BACK 
DOWN A FEW DEGREES. TROPICAL STORM OPHELIA WILL PLAY HAVOC WITH 
FORECASTS ALONG THE SOUTHEAST COAST AS IT WILL REMAIN IN A WEAK 
STEERING FLOW ALOFT...ALLOWING IT TO MEANDER OFF THE COAST. WITH 
THIS TYPE OF PATTERN AND STORM MOTION...OPHELIA SHOULD NOT BE A 
FACTOR IN OUR WEATHER THROUGH AT LEAST NEXT THURSDAY...IF EVER.

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.

$$

JFB 








000 
FXUS64 KMEG 081455
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
955 AM CDT THU SEP 8 2005

.DISCUSSION...
SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE CONTINUES TO RIDGE OVER THE MIDSOUTH IN 
RESPONSE TO AN UPPER LEVEL HIGH THAT IS AMPLIFYING OVER THE HIGH 
PLAINS. ANOTHER DRY DAY IS ON TAP. 12Z LZK SOUNDING AND FORECAST 
SOUNDINGS FOR TODAY INDICATE VERY LITTLE DEEP LAYER MOISTURE...SO 
WHILE A FEW CU CANNOT BE RULED OUT...SKIES SHOULD BE MOSTLY SUNNY. 
850 TEMPS OF 15-16C WILL YIELD TEMPS IN THE UPPER 80S TO NEAR 90. 
CURRENT FORECAST HANDLES THIS ALL VERY WELL AND NO UPDATES WILL BE 
NEEDED.

JFB

.PREVIOUS DISCUSSION ISSUED AT 342 AM THU SEP 8 2005...

SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE REMAINS CENTERED OVER THE NORTHEAST U.S. THIS
MORNING AND THIS SYSTEM CONTINUES TO RIDGE SOUTHWEST OVER OUR AREA.
THIS HAS PROVIDED ANOTHER MOSTLY CLEAR AND SEASONABLY COOL MORNING...
WITH AREAS OF PATCHY FOG AND TEMPERATURES MAINLY IN THE 60S. THESE
CONDITIONS WILL AGAIN PERSIST THROUGH SUNRISE.

SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE WILL CONTINUE TO EXTEND OVER THE MID-SOUTH FOR
THE NEXT SEVERAL DAYS. IN THE UPPER LEVELS...THE AREA REMAINS ON
THE EASTERN EDGE OF A BUILDING UPPER LEVEL RIDGE NOW CENTERED OVER
THE HIGH PLAINS. A WEAK UPPER SHORTWAVE TROUGH SKIRTING ACROSS THE
GREAT LAKES REGION WILL SLIDE INTO THE NORTHEAST U.S. THROUGH THE
WEEKEND. AS THIS SHORTWAVE MOVES EAST...IT WILL ALLOW THE UPPER
RIDGE TO BUILD EASTWARD OVER THE AREA...WITH RISING HEIGHTS AND
THICKNESSES. THIS ALL MEANS THAT MOSTLY SUNNY SKIES WILL CONTINUE
OVER THE AREA INTO THE FIRST PART OF NEXT WEEK...WITH A SLOW
WARMING TREND INTO THE WEEKEND.

THE UPPER RIDGE WILL CONTINUE OVER THE REGION THROUGH THE EXTENDED
PORTION OF THE FORECAST PERIOD. WE WILL NEED TO KEEP AN EYE ON
TROPICAL STORM OPHELIA...NOW OFF OF THE FLORIDA EAST COAST...FOR THE
END OF THE EXTENDED PERIOD OR BEYOND...AS THERE IS STILL MUCH
UNCERTAINTY WITH THE FORECAST TRACK AND INTENSITY. AT THIS POINT...IT
APPEARS THAT THE SYSTEM WILL STAY NEARLY STATIONARY OFF THE SOUTHEAST
U.S. COAST FOR THE NEXT SEVERAL DAYS. SO OPHELIA WILL MOST LIKELY NOT
EFFECT OUR WEATHER THROUGH THE FORECAST PERIOD IF AT ALL. SO KEPT DRY
FORECAST GOING THROUGH THE NEXT SEVEN DAYS WITH NEAR OR SLIGHTLY
ABOVE NORMAL TEMPERATURES.

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 070922
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
422 AM CDT WED SEP 7 2005

.DISCUSSION...

ANOTHER QUIET NIGHT ACROSS THE MID-SOUTH WITH SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE
NOW CENTERED OVER THE NORTHEAST U.S. RIDGING DOWN OVER THE MID-
SOUTH. SKIES HAVE REMAINED MOSTLY CLEAR WITH PATCHY FOG AND
TEMPERATURES FROM THE LOW 60S EAST TO AROUND 70 WEST. EXPECT
TRANQUIL CONDITIONS TO PERSIST THROUGH SUNRISE.

SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE WILL CONTINUE OVER THE AREA THROUGH THE
BEGINNING OF NEXT WEEK. A WEAK UPPER LEVEL SHORTWAVE TROUGH WILL
CONTINUE TO SKIRT ACROSS THE NORTHERN TIER OF THE UNITED STATES
THROUGH THE END OF THE WEEK AND ACROSS THE NORTHEASTERN STATES OVER
THE WEEKEND. THIS FEATURE SHOULD REMAIN FAR ENOUGH NORTH AND NOT
VERY AMPLIFIED...SO NOT EXPECTING ANY SURFACE FRONTS TO MAKE IT
THIS FAR SOUTH. UPPER LEVEL RIDGING WILL BUILD OVER THE MID-SOUTH
OVER THE WEEKEND AND REMAIN STRONG AND IN PLACE INTO NEXT WEEK.
THIS MEANS DRY WEATHER WILL PERSIST INTO THE BEGINNING OF NEXT WEEK
AS WELL. UPPER LEVEL HEIGHTS AND THICKNESSES WILL ALSO BEGIN TO
RISE THIS WEEKEND...SO TEMPERATURES WILL PROGRESSIVELY BECOME WARMER
ON SATURDAY...SUNDAY...AND INTO NEXT WEEK. SO EXPECT ABOVE AVERAGE
TEMPERATURES...ESPECIALLY OVER THE WEEKEND AND BEGINNING OF NEXT
WEEK.

LATE INTO THE EXTENDED PERIOD...WE WILL NEED TO KEEP OUR EYES ON
WHAT EVENTUALLY HAPPENS WITH NOW TROPICAL STORM OPHELIA...
STRENGTHENING OFF OF THE EAST COAST OF FLORIDA. MODEL GUIDANCE IS
VERY SCATTERED WITH THE EVENTUAL TRACK AND STRENGTH OF THE SYSTEM...
BUT THERE WILL BE SOME CHANCE OF MOISTURE ASSOCIATED WITH THIS SYSTEM
GETTING INTO OUR AREA BY THE MIDDLE OF NEXT WEEK...IF THE FURTHER
WEST TRACK PROJECTED BY SOME OF THE MEDIUM RANGE MODELS PANS OUT.
STILL LOTS OF UNCERTAINTY WITH THIS SYSTEM...SO AT THIS POINT HAVE
FOUND IT BEST TO LEAVE POPS OUT OF THE EXTENDED FORECAST. BUT WILL
KEEP A CLOSE EYE ON THE TROPICS OVER THE NEXT SEVERAL DAYS.
OTHERWISE...LOOKS LIKE TYPICAL LATE SUMMER WEATHER WITH WARMER
TEMPERATURES AND CONTINUED DRY CONDITIONS FOR THE NEXT SEVERAL DAYS.

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.

.DISCUSSION...
HIGH PRESSURE CONTINUES OVER MOST OF EASTERN UNITED STATES...WITH

.SHORT TERM (THROUGH FRIDAY)...
HIGH PRESSURE CONTINUES ACROSS THE AREA THROUGH FRIDAY. NO
PRECIPITATION EXPECTED...AND ONLY AFTERNOON CUMULUS CLOUDS.
OVERALL...LITTLE DAY TO DAY CHANGE IN TEMPERATURES. PERSISTANCE
PRETTY GOOD ON HIGHS TOMORROW...AND MAYBE 1-2 DEGREES WARMER ON
THURSDAY AND FRIDAY. OVERNIGHT LOWS SHOULD BE RATHER CONSISTENT.
DEWPOINTS LAST NIGHT RAN A LITTLE HIGHER THAN FORECAST. DONT SEE
THEM MOVING MUCH OVER THE NEXT FEW DAYS...SO WITH LIGHT WINDS...
EXPECT LITTLE CHANGE IN OVERNIGHT LOWS THROUGH THE SHORT TERM.
&&

.LONG TERM (AFTER FRIDAY)...
CURRENTLY...MODELS KEEP UPPER AND SURFACE RIDGES AROUND THE AREA
THROUGH THE EXTENDED PERIOD. WILD CARD WILL BE TD 16 CURRENTLY OFF
FLORIDA COAST. AS USUAL WITH WEAK/DEVELOPING SYSTEMS...SEVERAL
MODEL SOLUTIONS...INCLUDING A FEW NORTHWEST INTO GEORGIA...AND A FEW
WEST ACROSS FLORIDA INTO THE GULF OF MEXICO. WILL CONTINUE THE DRY
TREND UNTIL SIGNALS FOR RAIN BECOME A LITTLE STRONGER.

WITH LITTLE CHANGE IN AIRMASS...TEMPERATURES ARENT GOING TO VARY
MUCH EITHER. EXPECT THAT MEX DATA LIKELY TRENDING TOWARD CLIMO AT
END OF PERIOD...SO DONT PLAN ON SHOWING COOLING TREND.
&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 060800
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
300 AM CDT TUE SEP 6 2005

.DISCUSSION...

UPPER LEVEL HIGH PRESSURE OVER THE FORECAST AREA HAS ALLOWED FOR
MOSTLY CLEAR SKIES THIS MORNING. TEMPERATURES HAVE FALLEN BACK INTO
THE MID 60S TO LOWER 70S...AND SHOULD ONLY DROP A FEW MORE DEGREES...
AS DEWPOINTS REMAIN MAINLY IN THE 60S...WHICH IS A BIT HIGHER THAN
THE PAST FEW MORNINGS. THIS SHOULD KEEP TEMPS FROM BOTTOMING OUT
ANY LOWER.

A WEAK INVERTED SURFACE TROUGH IS ALIGNED GENERALLY ALONG THE
MISSISSIPPI RIVER THIS MORNING. THIS SUBTLE FEATURE SHOULD CONTINUE
TO MOVE WESTWARD ALLOWING SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE TO BUILD BACK OVER
THE AREA. LOW LEVEL MOISTURE HAS INCREASED OVER THE PAST DAY OR SO...
AND SHOULD PERSIST OVER THE AREA WITH DEWPOINTS REMAINING IN THE 60S
OVER THE NEXT SEVERAL DAYS. THEREFORE...EXPECT AFTERNOON CU FIELDS
TO DEVELOP OVER THE NEXT SEVERAL DAYS AS WELL...AND HAVE GONE WITH
PARTLY CLOUDY SKIES DURING THE DAY WITH MOSTLY CLEAR SKIES AT
NIGHT. UPPER LEVEL RIDGING WILL ALSO PERSIST OVER THE AREA THROUGH
MOST OF THE PERIOD...KEEPING PRECIPITATION CHANCES VERY LOW THROUGH
AT LEAST NEXT MONDAY. A SHORTWAVE TROUGH WILL SKIRT ACROSS THE
NORTHERN TIER OF THE COUNTRY THROUGH THE WEEK...BUT SHOULD REMAIN FAR
ENOUGH TO OUR NORTH AND NOT VERY AMPLIFIED...SO NOT EXPECTING ANY
FRONTS TO MAKE IT THIS FAR SOUTH. SO CONTINUED DRY WEATHER WITH NEAR
OR SLIGHTLY ABOVE NORMAL TEMPERATURES.

WILL NEED TO WATCH THE TROPICS FOR FAR INTO THE EXTENDED PERIOD...
AS A DEVELOPING POSSIBLY TROPICAL LOW NOW OFF THE EAST COAST OF
FLORIDA MAY DRIFT NORTHWEST OVER THE NEXT SEVERAL DAYS...AND SOME
MOISTURE ASSOCIATED WITH THIS SYSTEM MAY WORK ITS WAY INTO PORTIONS
OF OUR AREA BY EARLY NEXT WEEK. STILL MANY QUESTION MARKS WITH THIS
SYSTEM...SO HAVE LEFT THE END OF THE EXTENDED DRY AT THIS POINT.
AT SOME POINT...MAY NEED TO ADD SOME POPS FOR THIS TIME PERIOD. WILL
BE KEEPING AN EYE ON THIS SITUATION OVER THE NEXT FEW DAYS TO SEE HOW
THINGS UNFOLD.

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.

$$

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 050124
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
823 PM CDT SUN SEP 4 2005

.DISCUSSION...SURFACE AND UPPER AIR ANALYSIS THIS EVENING PLACES 
HIGH PRESSURE ACROSS THE MISSISSIPPI RIVER VALLEY. SOME CIRRUS 
DRIFTING ACROSS SOUTHERN ARKANSAS BUT WILL NOT MOVE ACROSS THE 
FORECAST AREA. TEMPERATURES HAVE COOLED THUS FAR INTO THE 70S WITH 
SURFACE DEWPOINTS IN THE MIDDLE 50S TO AROUND 60. TEMPERATURES WILL 
FALL INTO THE MIDDLE 50S TO MIDDLE 60S WITH DECOUPLED WINDS AND CLEAR 
SKIES. CURRENT FORECAST PACKAGE ON TRACK AND WILL NOT ISSUE AN 
UPDATE.

CJC

.PREV DISCUSSION...ISSUED 117 PM CDT SUN SEP 4 2005...

HIGH PRESSURE EXTENDS FROM THE OHIO VALLEY THROUGH ARKANSAS. 
CIRCULATION AROUND THE HIGH HAS ADVECTED COOLER AND DRIER AIR INTO 
THE REGION FROM THE NORTHEAST. AN UPPER LEVEL RIDGE IS ASSOCIATED 
WITH THE SURFACE HIGH. THERE IS A WEAK INVERTED SURFACE TROUGH THAT 
EXTENDS FROM SOUTHERN LOUISIANA THROUGH CENTRAL ALABAMA. 

THE UPPER LEVEL RIDGE AND SURFACE HIGH WILL REMAIN THE DOMINANT 
FEATURES AFFECTING THE MIDSOUTH OVER THE NEXT SEVERAL DAYS. TOMORROW 
THE GFS/NAM SHOW THE INVERTED TROUGH MOVING THROUGH THE REGION. THE 
850-500MB MOISTURE IS EXTREMELY LOW. ALTHOUGH A LONE SHOWER IS 
POSSIBLE DURING THE AFTERNOON OVER NORTH MS TOMORROW...THE 
COMBINATION OF COVERAGE/PROBABILITY DOES NOT JUSTIFY MENTIONING IN 
THE FORECAST. OTHERWISE...THERE SHOULD BE JUST ENOUGH LOW LEVEL 
MOISTURE FOR AFTERNOON CU DEVELOPMENT BUT POSITION OF UPPER 
RIDGE...SURFACE HIGH AND LACK OF DEEP MOISTURE SHOULD KEEP THE VAST 
MAJORITY OF THE AREA DRY THROUGH NEXT WEEKEND. TEMPS WILL REMAIN 
NEAR NORMAL THROUGH THE PERIOD. SEE NO REASON TO STRAY FAR FROM 
GUIDANCE EXCEPT AT JACKSON FOR OVERNIGHT LOWS OVER THE NEXT COUPLE 
OF NIGHTS WHERE GUIDANCE MAY NOT FULLY ACCOUNT FOR LOCAL CONDITIONS.

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.

STATES. WITH THIS SOLUTION THE SURFACE HIGH WL SLIP OFF THE EASTERN 
SEABOARD RESULTING IN A RETURN OF SOUTHERLY FLOW AND MARGINALLY 
HIGHER DEWPOINTS ON SAT. THE 12Z ECMWF SOLUTION KEEPS THE TROF 
FURTHER NORTH WITH A STRONGER RIDGE ACRS THE SOUTHERN STATES.

WEEKEND. HIGHS TEMPS WL BE A COUPLE DEGREES COOLER THAN FRIDAY WHILE 
DEWPOINTS WL DROP TO AROUND 60 RESULTING IN A VERY PLEASANT WEEKEND.

AXIS WL SHIFT FROM THE MID MS VALLEY SOUTHEAST TO THE MID SOUTH BY 
THE END OF THE WEEK. SFC HIGH PRESSURE WL CONT ACRS THE EASTERN HALF 
OF THE U.S. DURING THE WEEK. EXPECT PLENTY OF SUNSHINE THROUGH 
THE WEEK WITH COMFORTABLE HUMIDITIES. HIGH TEMPS SHOULD RANGE FROM

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
820 PM CDT FRI SEP 2 2005

.DISCUSSION...SURFACE ANALYSIS AND UPPER AIR PLOTS THIS EVENING 
PLACE HIGH PRESSURE ACROSS THE LOWER MISSISSIPPI VALLEY. SOME 
ALTOCUMULUS/CIRRUS HAS BEEN DRIFTING ACROSS THE CENTRAL/SOUTHERN 
PLAINS THIS EVENING BUT DISSIPATING AS IT MOVES INTO DRIER AIR.  
WILL NOT ISSUE AN UPDATE AS OVERALL FORECAST IS ON TRACK. 

CJC

.PREV DISCUSSION...ISSUED 201 PM CDT FRI SEP 2 2005...

SURFACE MAP SHOWS A GENERAL AREA OF HIGH PRESSURE THAT EXTENDS ALONG 
THE MISSISSIPPI RIVER VALLEY. THIS IS ASSOCIATED WITH AN UPPER RIDGE 
THAT IS DEVELOPING ACROSS THE CENTRAL US. 

THE ORIENTATION OF THE SURFACE HIGH IS NOTABLY DIFFERENT THAN 
YESTERDAY AND NAM/GFS RELATIVELY AGREE THAN THE ORIENTATION WILL 
CONTINUE TO CHANGE. THE ORIENTATION WILL GRADUALLY SHIFT INTO A 
SOUTHWEST TO NORTHEAST DIRECTION FROM OKLAHOMA INTO THE GREAT LAKES 
AS A RESULT OF A BUILDING RIDGE OVER THE CENTRAL US. SHOULD START 
SEEING LOWER DEW POINTS ADVECT INTO THE REGION STARTING TONIGHT. AS 
A RESULT...LOWS SHOULD BE A TOUCH COOLER THAN LAST NIGHT. COOLER 
TEMPS WILL GRADUALLY FILTER INTO THE AREA SATURDAY AND AGAIN ON 
SUNDAY AS COOLER AIR ADVECTS IN FROM THE NORTHEAST. HIGH PRESSURE 
SHOULD REMAIN IN CONTROL THROUGH NEXT WEEK WITH THE UPPER RIDGE 
BLOCKING ANY SIGNIFICANT WEATHER SYSTEMS FROM AFFECTING THE AREA. 
WITH THE HIGH CENTER REMAINING NORTH OF THE REGION...NORTHEASTERLY 
FLOW SHOULD CONTINUE TO HOLD HIGHS IN THE 80S.

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES
AR...NONE.

INTO THE CENTRAL PLAINS THIS WEEKEND. SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE WILL 
SHIFT FROM THE NORTHERN AND CENTRAL PLAINS EASTWARD INTO THE OHIO 
VALLEY THIS WEEKEND. THIS WILL RESULT IN A DRIER AND SLIGHTLY COOLER 
AIRMASS BY SUNDAY. MEAN RH FIELDS INDICATE PERHAPS A FEW CLOUDS FROM 
TIME TO TIME THIS WEEKEND.

MON-WED...THE UPPER LEVEL RIDGE AXIS WILL SHIFT SOUTHEAST ACROSS THE 
MID SOUTH NEXT WEEK AS AN UPPER TROF MOVE INTO THE NORTHERN PLAINS. 
SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE MOVES TO THE EASTERN U.S. AS THE DRY AIRMASS 
CONTINUES ACROSS THE REGION WITH PLEASANT HIGH TEMPERATURES IN THE 
UPPER 80S AND LOWS IN THE 60S. 

WED NIGHT-THU...WEAKENING UPPER RIDGE LOCATED FROM TEXAS EAST TO

.DISCUSSION...

SURFACE MAP PLACES A WEAKENING COLD FRONT EXTENDING FROM INDIANA 
INTO SOUTHERN MISSOURI. HIGH PRESSURE IS OVER THE MIDSOUTH REGION 
AND HAS BROUGHT MOSTLY SUNNY CONDITIONS TO THE AREA. THE UPPER FLOW 
IS GENERALLY RATHER FLAT ACROSS MOST OF THE NATION. 

OVER THE NEXT FEW DAYS...AN UPPER RIDGE WILL BE BUILDING OVER THE 
PLAINS. AS THIS DOES SO...THE SURFACE AREA OF HIGH PRESSURE THAT 
EXTENDS FROM THE MIDSOUTH INTO NORTHEAST KANSAS WILL BEGIN TO SHIFT 
MORE INTO THE OHIO VALLEY. THE END RESULT IS THAT THE FLOW AROUND 
THE HIGH WILL BRING IN COOLER AIR INTO THE MIDSOUTH OVER THE 
WEEKEND. 

THE SURFACE FRONT WILL LIKELY MOVE INTO THE REGION TONIGHT...BUT IT 
IS EXTREMELY WEAK WITH LITTLE MOISTURE TO WORK WITH. SO NO RAIN IS 
EXPECTED TONIGHT OR TOMORROW. THERE IS REALLY NO APPRECIABLY COOLER 
AIR BEHIND THIS FRONT FOR THE MIDSOUTH...PERHAPS A DEGREE OR TWO. 
GFS/ETA/EUROPEAN ALL SHOW COOLER AIR MOVING INTO THE 
REGION...ALTHOUGH IT MAY BE MORE LIKE SUNDAY. BASED UPON TRENDS 
TODAY THE FWC GUIDANCE LOOKS TO BE TOO WARM. COOLER AND DRY WEATHER 
ARE EXPECTED THROUGH THE REMAINDER OF THE FORECAST WITH NO SYSTEMS 
APPROACHING THE AREA AND LITTLE MOISTURE TO WORK WITH.

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.

$$

VALLE

FXUS64 KMEG 011513
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
1013 AM CDT THU SEP 1 2005

.DISCUSSION...

HIGH PRESSURE REMAINS IN CONTROL OF THE WEATHER OVER THE REGION. 
THERE IS A WEAK COLD FRONT THAT EXTENDS ACROSS SOUTHERN ILLINOIS AND 
SOUTHERN MISSOURI. A FEW MID LEVEL CLOUDS ARE ASSOCIATED WITH THE 
FRONT BUT THESE CLOUDS ARE QUICKLY BEING GOBBLED UP AS THEY MOVE 
SOUTHWARD AND INTO A GOOD DEAL OF DRY AIR THAT CAN BE SEEN ON THE 
WATER VAPOR IMAGERY. MODELS SHOW THIS FRONT CONTINUING TO WEAKEN AS 
IT ARRIVES INTO NORTHERN SECTIONS OF THE MIDSOUTH AND MAY DISSIPATE 
ENTIRELY THIS EVENING. HIGH TEMPS FOR TODAY LOOK REASONABLE BASED 
UPON MORNING GUIDANCE AND TRENDS. UPDATED SKY COVER TO MOSTLY SUNNY 
SINCE CLOUDS TO THE NORTH ARE BECOMING MORE RAGGED. ALTHOUGH CU WILL 
DEVELOP THIS AFTERNOON...DONT EXPECT IT TO BE SIGNIFICANT ENOUGH TO 
JUSTIFY PARTLY CLOUDY. WILL HAVE TO TAKE A SECOND LOOK AT HIGH TEMPS 
FOR TOMORROW WHEN THE AFTERNOON FORECAST IS ISSUED SINCE THE 06Z 
GUIDANCE HINTING THAT THE COOLER AIR MAY HOLD OFF UNTIL SATURDAY. 

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
245 AM CDT THU SEP 1 2005

...DISCUSSION...

WEAK COLD FRONT EXTENDS FROM EASTERN WISCONSIN THROUGH CENTRAL
MISSOURI INTO NORTHERN OKLAHOMA. THIS FRONT WILL PASS THROUGH THE
REGION TODAY AND TONIGHT. VERY LITTLE MOISTURE AHEAD OF THE FRONT SO
NO RAIN IS EXPECTED. BY FRIDAY...FRONT WILL MOVE OUT AND WEAKEN
LEAVING TEMPERATURES A COUPLE OF DEGREES COOLER. UPPER LEVEL RIDGE
WILL BUILD OVER THE CENTRAL U.S. DURING THE WEEKEND PUTTING US IN
NORTHWEST FLOW. THIS SHOULD MEAN DRY WEATHER AND TEMPERATURES A
LITTLE COOLER THAN IT HAS BEEN WITH HIGHS MAINLY IN THE 80S.

NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
329 PM CDT TUE AUG 30 2005

...DISCUSSION...

SOME GUSTY WINDS AND A FEW SHOWERS ARE ALL THAT ARE LEFT OF
KATRINA IN OUR AREA. KATRINA REMNANTS WILL BE IN NW PA BY
WEDNESDAY MORNING. THE PRESSURE GRADIENT WILL RELAX AND SKIES
WILL CLEAR OUT QUITE A BIT TONIGHT.

HIGH PRESSURE FROM THE PLAINS WILL FILL INTO THE MIDSOUTH
WEDNESDAY AND THEN DOMINATE OUR WEATHER SCENE ON THROUGH THE
WEEKEND AND EVEN THROUGH NEXT TUESDAY. NET RESULTS FROM THIS HIGH
WILL BE COOLER AND DRIER WEATHER. HIGHS IN THE 90S WEDNESDAY AND
THURSDAY WILL DROP DOWN INTO THE 80S FRIDAY ON THROUGH NEXT
TUESDAY.

NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
440 AM CDT TUE AUG 30 2005

...DISCUSSION...

HECTIC EARLY MORNING HERE WITH PHONE LINES GOING DOWN AND OTHER
ISSUES WITH KATRINA. KATRINA WILL CONTINUE TO MOVE NORTHEAST TODAY
INTO MIDDLE TENNESSEE. THREAT OF FLOODING NOW LIMITED TO WEST 
TENNESSEE SO HAVE TRIMMED FLOOD WATCH. IN ADDITION WITH KATRINA 
MOVING QUICKER THAN EARLIER EXPECTED HAVE TRIMMED INLAND TROPICAL 
STORM WARNING BACK AND CHANGED THE EXPIRATION TIME TO 10 AM. ONCE 
KATRINA MOVES OUT OF THE AREA DRY WEATHER AND NEAR NORMAL 
TEMPERATURES SHOULD BE THE STORY FOR MUCH OF THE NEXT SEVEN DAYS.

MISSISSIPPI AND INTO WEST TENNESSEE NEAR THE TENNESSEE RIVER 
TONIGHT...

STRONG WINDS CONTINUE TO MOVE INTO NORTH MISSISSIPPI AND WEST 
TENNESSEE ASSOCIATED WITH KATRINA. WIND GUSTS OF OVER 50 MPH ARE 
BEING REPORTED FROM COLUMBUS AND TUPELO. OTHER WINDS ACROSS WEST 
TENNESSEE HAVE PRODUCED SOME DAMAGE AS FAR WEST AS TIPTON COUNTY. 

THE INLAND TROPICAL STORM WARNING HAS BEEN EXPANDED WESTWARD TO THE 
MISSISSIPPI RIVER AND INCLUDE TIPTON...HAYWOOD AND MADISON COUNTIES. 
HEAVY RAIN AND FLOODING WILL OCCUR ACROSS PARTS OF NORTHEASTERN 
MISSISSIPPI AND WESTERN TENNESSEE.

REMNANTS OF KATRINA WILL PASS THROUGH NORTHEAST MISSISSIPPI AND
EASTERN WEST TENNESSEE TONIGHT. WHAT REMAINS OF THE EYE WILL COME
UP THROUGH THE TUPELO AREA ON UP TO NORTH OF SAVANNAH AND PRODUCE
WINDS OF 45 TO 55 MPH WITH GUSTS TO 65 MPH. LOWER WINDS WILL BE
TO THE NORTHWEST OF THE CORE PATH, BUT IT STILL WILL BE VERY
WINDY ELSEWHERE.

FLOODING RAINS WILL BE POSSIBLE TONIGHT WITH THE STORM. A FLOOD
WATCH IS POSTED UNTIL 1 PM TUESDAY FOR ALL COUNTIES WEST OF THE
MISSISSIPPI RIVER. THREE TO 6 INCHES OF RAIN WITH LOCALLY HEAVIER
AMOUNTS COULD FALL.

...DISCUSSION...

   FROM 7PM THIS EVENING TO 1 PM TUESDAY...

...DANGEROUS HURRICANE KATRINA EXPECTED TO MAKES LANDFALL ON THE
SOUTHEAST LOUISIANA COASTLINE THIS MORNING...

REMNANTS OF KATRINA STILL EXPECTED TO PASS NORTH UP THROUGH
MISSISSIPPI AND WEST TENNESSEE TONIGHT WITH THE EYE PASSING NEAR
TUPELO AND SAVANNAH. RAINBANDS FROM THIS STORM HAVE ALREADY
ENTERED SOUTHEASTERN COUNTIES AND AN INVERTED TROUGH IS BRINGING
SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS IN A BAND FROM PARIS TO FOREST CITY.

THIS AFTERNOON...RAINBANDS WILL MOVE NORTHWEST INTO THE REST OF
THE MIDSOUTH. HEAVY RAINFALL IS ANTICIPATED IN THE TUPELO AREA.
WINDS WILL INCREASE AND HAVE GUSTS TO 45 MPH IN SOUTHEASTERN
COUNTIES.

TONIGHT...STRONGEST PARTS OF KARTINA WILL COME DIRECTLY UP
NORTHEAST MISSISSIPPI INTO SOUTHEASTERN WEST TENNESSEE. SUSTAINED
WINDS UP TO 55 MPH WITH GUSTS TO 65 MPH ARE ANTICIPATED AROUND
TUPELO WITH LESSER WINDS TO THE NORTHWEST. LOTS OF DAMAGE TO
TREES IS PROBABLY GOING TO OCCUR WHILE STRUCTURAL DAMAGE OCCURS.

&&

AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED 
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
433 AM CDT MON AUG 29 2005

...DISCUSSION (UPDATED COUNTIES IN WARNING/ADVISORY)...

...DANGEROUS HURRICANE KATRINA EXPECTED TO MAKE LANDFALL ON THE
SOUTHEAST LOUISIANA COASTLINE THIS MORNING...

REMNANTS OF OUTER RAINBAND RUNNING FROM PARIS TENNESSEE TO ABOUT 
WYNNE ARKANSAS AND MOVING SLOWLY NORTH. ANOTHER BAND MOVING INTO 
NORTHEAST MISSISSIPPI FROM THE SOUTH. EYEWALL OF STORM PROBABLY 
MAKING LANDFALL ON LOUISIANA COAST AROUND 11Z OR 12Z.

CURRENT CONDITIONS ACROSS MIDSOUTH ARE MAINLY CLOUDY WITH TEMPS IN
THE 70S. WINDS NOT AN ISSUE...YET.
&&

.SHORT TERM (THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...
KATRINA...OF COURSE...IS THE FORECAST PROBLEM. FORECAST TRACK
CHANGES OVER THE LAST 24 HOURS HAVE BEEN NEGLIGIBLE...AND VERY
CONSISTENT WITH RESPECT TO LOCATION. GFS MODEL SOLUTION MOVES
SYSTEM QUICKER THAN NAM...BY ABOUT 12 HOURS. NHC SOLUTION RATHER
CLOSE TO GFS AT PRESENT. AS LONG AS THERE ARENT SIGNIFICANT
CHANGES ON 08Z CONFERENCE CALL...CURRENT BOUNDARIES OF WIND/WATER
ISSUANCES LOOK REASONABLE. WILL UPGRADE INLAND TROPICAL STORM WATCH
TO WARNING WITH THIS ISSUANCE.

HPC STILL INDICATING POTENTIAL FOR SIGNIFICANT RAINS WITH THIS
SYSTEM...ON THE ORDER OF 3 TO 5 INCHES...MAINLY OVERNIGHT TONIGHT.
SEE NO REASON TO MESS WITH FLOOD WATCH AT THIS TIME.

TIME OF GREATEST THREAT FOR BOTH WIND AND RAIN STILL LOOKS TO BE 00Z-
18Z TUESDAY. SEVERE THREAT ALSO POSSIBLE ALONG AND EAST OF STORM
TRACK.

ASSUMING THAT GFS SOLUTION IS CLOSE...CONDITIONS WILL BEGIN EASING
TUESDAY AFTERNOON AND EVENING...WITH WEDNESDAY BEING DRY.

SEE NO REASON TO MAKE SIGNIFICANT CHANGES TO CLOUD AND TEMPERATURE
GRIDS IN SHORT TERM. CATEGORICAL POPS FOR MOST OF CWA FOR THIS
AFTERNOON INTO TUESDAY AFTERNOON.
&&

.LONG TERM (AFTER WEDNESDAY)...
CONSIDERING ISSUES IN SHORT TERM PORTION OF FORECAST...OPTED TO
LEAVE LONG TERM FORECAST STAND AS IS. BASICALLY DRY WITH
TEMPERATURES NEAR NORMAL FOR LATE AUGUST-EARLY SEPTEMBER.
&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES
AR...WIND ADVISORY 7 PM TONIGHT TO 1 PM TUESDAY ALL COUNTIES. 
MO...WIND ADVISORY 7 PM TONIGHT TO 1 PM TUESDAY ALL COUNTIES. 
MS...FLOOD WATCH 7 PM TONIGHT TO 1 PM TUESDAY ALL COUNTIES.          
     INLAND TROPICAL STORM WARNING 7 PM TONIGHT TO 1 PM TUESDAY      
     FOR MSZ002>006-009-011>017-020>024. WIND ADVISORY SAME TIME     
     PERIOD ELSEWHERE.
TN...FLOOD WATCH 7 PM TONIGHT TO 1 PM TUESDAY ALL COUNTIES ALONG AND
     SOUTH OF INTERSTATE 40. INLAND TROPICAL STORM WARNING 7 PM      
     TONIGHT TO 1 PM TUESDAY FOR TNZ053>055-090>092. WIND ADVISORY   
     SAME TIME PERIOD ELSEWHERE.

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 290320
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
1020 PM CDT SUN AUG 28 2005

...DISCUSSION...

...EXTREMELY DANGEROUS HURRICANE KATRINA CONTINUING TO BEAR DOWN ON
THE SOUTHEAST LOUISIANA COASTLINE...

THE FIRST OUTER RAINBAND ASSOCIATED WITH KATRINA HAS BEEN ROTATING
NORTHWESTWARD THROUGH THE FORECAST AREA THIS EVENING. ENHANCED LOW
LEVEL CONVERGENCE ASSOCIATED WITH THE KATRINA ALTERED WIND FIELD HAS
ALLOWED FOR THIS CONVECTIVE BAND TO DEVELOP. HAVE HAD SEVERE WINDS
WITH THE STRONGEST STORMS EMBEDDED WITHIN THIS BAND...WITH TREES
REPORTED DOWN ACROSS THE RIPLEY AREA IN TIPPAH COUNTY EARLIER THIS
EVENING. EXPECT CONTINUED THUNDERSTORMS WITHIN SPIRAL BANDS THAT
ROTATE INTO THE AREA. ANOTHER ONE OF THESE BANDS CURRENTLY STRETCHED
ACROSS CENTRAL ALABAMA AND MISSISSIPPI MOVING TOWARDS US. WITH THIS
CONTINUING THROUGH THE NIGHT...HAVE KEPT CHANCE POPS IN PLACE ACROSS
THE ENTIRE AREA. EXPECT A QUICK SHOT OF STRONG GUSTY WINDS AND
PERIODS OF HEAVY RAIN POSSIBLE AS THESE BANDS MOVE QUICKLY NORTHWEST
THROUGH THE NIGHT. CANNOT RULE OUT ISOLATED SEVERE WINDS WITH ANY OF
THE STRONGEST CONVECTION. HAVE HIGHLIGHTED THIS THREAT IN THE LATEST
HWO AND WILL MENTION IN AN UPDATED SPS TO BE ISSUED BEFORE MIDNIGHT.

LATEST INFORMATION FROM 9 PM HURRICANE CONFERENCE CALL KEEPS THE
HURRICANE TRACKING NORTH-NORTHWEST FOR THE NEXT 12 HOURS BEFORE A
TURN TO THE NORTH AND EVENTUALLY NORTH-NORTHEAST ACROSS SOUTHEAST
PORTIONS OF OUR AREA. THE INTENSITY REMAINS SIMILAR TO THE PREVIOUS
ADVISORY WITH 160 MPH SUSTAINED WINDS WITH HIGHER GUSTS. THE LATEST
FORECAST LANDFALLS KATRINA AS A STRONG CATEGORY 4 OR CATEGORY 5
HURRICANE NEAR NEW ORLEANS ON MONDAY MORNING. SHOULD BE A DEVASTATING
SITUATION ALONG AND JUST EAST OF WHERE LANDFALL OCCURS.

EFFECTS TO OUR WEATHER TOMORROW...

WE WILL CONTINUE TO SEE OUTER RAINBANDS ROTATE ACROSS THE AREA WITH
GUSTY WINDS AND BRIEF HEAVY RAIN POSSIBLE. REFER TO THE LATEST
STATEMENTS FOR UPDATED INFORMATION THROUGH THE DURATION OF THIS
EVENT. JUST A FINAL COMMENT...CONFIDENCE IS INCREASING SOMEWHAT IN
THE FACT THAT SIGNIFICANT WEATHER IMPACTS WILL BE FELT ACROSS
PORTIONS OF THE MID-SOUTH MONDAY NIGHT AND TUESDAY...ESPECIALLY
OVER PORTIONS OF NORTHEAST MISSISSIPPI.

UPDATED GRIDS AND ZONES OUT SHORTLY. SORRY FOR THE DELAY...VERY BUSY
NIGHT.

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...FLOOD WATCH 00Z TUESDAY TO 18Z TUESDAY ALL COUNTIES.
     INLAND TROPICAL STORM WATCH 00Z TUESDAY TO 18Z TUESDAY
     FOR MSZ002>006-009-011>017-020>024.
TN...FLOOD WATCH 00Z TUESDAY TO 18Z TUESDAY ALL COUNTIES ALONG AND
     SOUTH OF INTERSTATE 40. INLAND TROPICAL STORM WATCH 00Z TUESDAY
     TO 18Z TUESDAY FOR TNZ090>092.

NORTHWESTWARD THROUGH THE FORECAST AREA THIS EVENING. ENHANCED LOW
LEVEL CONVERGENCE ASSOCIATED WITH THE KATRINA ALTERED WIND FIELD HAS
ALLOWED FOR THIS CONVECTIVE BAND TO DEVELOP. HAVE HAD SEVERE WINDS
WITH THE STRONGEST STORMS EMBEDDED WITHIN THIS BAND...WITH TREES
REPORTED DOWN ACROSS THE RIPLEY AREA IN TIPPAH COUNTY EARLIER THIS
EVENING. EXPECT CONTINUED THUNDERSTORMS WITHIN SPIRAL BANDS THAT
ROTATE INTO THE AREA. ANOTHER ONE OF THESE BANDS CURRENTLY STRETCHED
ACROSS CENTRAL ALABAMA AND MISSISSIPPI MOVING TOWARDS US. WITH THIS
CONTINUING THROUGH THE NIGHT...HAVE KEPT CHANCE POPS IN PLACE ACROSS
THE ENTIRE AREA. EXPECT A QUICK SHOT OF STRONG GUSTY WINDS AND
PERIODS OF HEAVY RAIN POSSIBLE AS THESE BANDS MOVE QUICKLY NORTHWEST
THROUGH THE NIGHT. CANNOT RULE OUT ISOLATED SEVERE WINDS WITH ANY OF
THE STRONGEST CONVECTION. HAVE HIGHLIGHTED THIS THREAT IN THE LATEST
HWO AND WILL MENTION IN AN UPDATED SPS TO BE ISSUED BEFORE MIDNIGHT.

LATEST INFORMATION FROM 9 PM HURRICANE CONFERENCE CALL KEEPS THE
HURRICANE TRACKING NORTH-NORTHWEST FOR THE NEXT 12 HOURS BEFORE A
TURN TO THE NORTH AND EVENTUALLY NORTH-NORTHEAST ACROSS SOUTHEAST
PORTIONS OF OUR AREA. THE INTENSITY REMAINS SIMILAR TO THE PREVIOUS
ADVISORY WITH 160 MPH SUSTAINED WINDS WITH HIGHER GUSTS. THE LATEST
FORECAST LANDFALLS KATRINA AS A STRONG CATEGORY 4 OR CATEGORY 5
HURRICANE NEAR NEW ORLEANS ON MONDAY MORNING. SHOULD BE A DEVASTATING
SITUATION ALONG AND JUST EAST OF WHERE LANDFALL OCCURS.

EFFECTS TO OUR WEATHER TOMORROW...

WE WILL CONTINUE TO SEE OUTER RAINBANDS ROTATE ACROSS THE AREA WITH
GUSTY WINDS AND BRIEF HEAVY RAIN POSSIBLE. REFER TO THE LATEST
STATEMENTS FOR UPDATED INFORMATION THROUGH THE DURATION OF THIS
EVENT. JUST A FINAL COMMENT...CONFIDENCE IS INCREASING SOMEWHAT IN
THE FACT THAT SIGNIFICANT WEATHER IMPACTS WILL BE FELT ACROSS
PORTIONS OF THE MID-SOUTH MONDAY NIGHT AND TUESDAY...ESPECIALLY
OVER PORTIONS OF NORTHEAST MISSISSIPPI.

UPDATED GRIDS AND ZONES OUT SHORTLY. SORRY FOR THE DELAY...VERY BUSY
NIGHT.

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...FLOOD WATCH 00Z TUESDAY TO 18Z TUESDAY ALL COUNTIES.
     INLAND TROPICAL STORM WATCH 00Z TUESDAY TO 18Z TUESDAY
     FOR MSZ002>006-009-011>017-020>024.
TN...FLOOD WATCH 00Z TUESDAY TO 18Z TUESDAY ALL COUNTIES ALONG AND
     SOUTH OF INTERSTATE 40. INLAND TROPICAL STORM WATCH 00Z TUESDAY
     TO 18Z TUESDAY FOR TNZ090>092.

FXUS64 KMEG 282155
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
454 PM CDT SUN AUG 28 2005

...HURRICANE KATRINA EXPECTED TO HAVE IMPACTS ON THE MID SOUTH 
MONDAY AND TUESDAY...

.DISCUSSION...LATEST INFORMATION FROM TPC AND AND USAF RECONAISSANCE 
AIRCRAFT IN THE GULF OF MEXICO PLACE HURRICANE KATRINA 150 MILES 
SOUTH OF THE MOUTH OF THE MISSISSIPPI RIVER. MAXIMUM SUSTAINED WINDS 
OF 165 MPH...AND HIGHER GUSTS CLASSIFY THIS SYSTEM NEAR A 
CATASTROPHIC CATEGORY 5 HURRICANE. MEANWHILE...THE COLD FRONT 
APPROACHING YESTERDAY BECAME QUASI-STATIONARY ACROSS SOUTHERN 
ILLINOIS AND MISSOURI TODAY.

TONIGHT...HURRICANE KATRINA IS EXPECTED TO MAKE LANDFALL SOMEWHERE 
NEAR NEW ORLEANS TOWARD MORNING WHILE QUASI-STATIONARY BOUNDARY WILL 
STILL BE UPSTREAM OF THE FORECAST AREA. CONVECTION FROM THIS 
AFTERNOON HAS MAINLY BEEN ALONG AND SOUTH OF A LINE FROM PARIS 
TENNESSEE TO FORREST CITY ARKANSAS. AS A RESULT WILL CARRY SCATTERED 
POPS ACROSS THE AREA TONIGHT.

MONDAY THROUGH TUESDAY WENT WITH CATEGORICAL POPS MONDAY AFTERNOON 
THROUGH TUESDAY MORNING ACROSS MUCH OF THE AREA AS THE TROPICAL 
SYSTEM MOVES ACROSS PORTIONS OF NORTHERN MISSISSIPPI. MODEL 
SUSTAINED WINDS ACROSS THE INLAND TROPICAL STORM WATCH AREA SUGGEST 
SUSTAINED WINDS WILL BE 40 TO 50 MPH WITH WINDS UP TO 65 MPH ACROSS 
THE SOUTHEAST SECTION OF THE FORECAST AREA WITH WIND GRADIENT 
RELAXING A BIT AWAY FROM THE CENTER. PRIMARY SEVERE THUNDERSTORM 
THREAT AREA WILL BE ACROSS SOUTHEAST SECTIONS OF THE AREA. HEAVY 
RAINFALL DEFINITELY NOT OUT OF THE QUESTION WITH PRECIPITABLE WATER 
VALUES BETWEEN 2.5 TO 3 INCHES ACROSS NORTHERN MISSISSIPPI MONDAY 
NIGHT INTO THE FIRST HALF OF TUESDAY. WINDS WILL BEGIN TO RELAX 
ACROSS THE MID SOUTH DURING THE DAY ON TUESDAY AS THE TROPICAL 
SYSTEM CONTINUES TO WEAKEN AND MOVE NORTHEAST. STILL TOO EARLY TO 
UPGRADE WATCH AREAS TO WARNINGS AT THIS TIME BUT EXPANDED INLAND 
TROPICAL STORM WATCH WEST TO AREAS PRIMARILY ALONG AND EAST OF A 
MICHIGAN CITY TO CHARLESTON LINE.

LONG TERM...THURSDAY THROUGH SUNDAY...DECENT MODEL AGREEMENT WITH 
THE HANDLING OF THE FUTURE REMNANTS OF HURRICANE KATRINA. 00Z 
CANADIAN AND 06Z GFS SPEED UP THE MERGING OF THE REMNANTS WITH UPPER 
LEVEL TROUGHT ACROSS THE EASTERN UNITED STATES. HOWEVER THE PAST 
COUPLE OF EUROPEAN RUNS HAVE BEEN A BIT SLOWER WITH THE PRORGRESSION 
OF THIS FEATURE. BASED ON CURRENT ACCELERATION OF THE HURRICANE WILL 
LEAN TOWARDS GFS/CANADIAN SOLUTION.  

MANY THANKS TO HUN...BMX...JAN FOR COORDINATION.

GRIDS ALREADY PUBLISHED.

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...FLOOD WATCH 00Z TUESDAY TO 18Z TUESDAY ALL COUNTIES.            
  INLAND TROPICAL STORM WATCH 00Z TUESDAY TO 18Z TUESDAY FOR         
  MSZ002>006-009-011>017-020>024
. TN...FLOOD WATCH 00Z TUESDAY TO 18Z TUESDAY ALL COUNTIES ALONG     
  AND SOUTH OF INTERSTATE 40.
  INLAND TROPICAL STORM WATCH 00Z TUESDAY TO 18Z TUESDAY FOR         
  TNZ090>092.

FXUS64 KMEG 281619
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
1120 AM CDT SUN AUG 28 2005

.DISCUSSION...LATEST INFORMATION FROM TPC AND AND USAF RECONAISSANCE 
AIRCRAFT IN THE GULF OF MEXICO PLACE HURRICANE KATRINA 225 MILES 
SOUTH-SOUTHEAST OF THE MOUTH OF THE MISSISSIPPI RIVER. MAXIMUM 
SUSTAINED WINDS OF 175 MPH...AND HIGHER GUSTS CLASSIFY THIS SYSTEM 
NEAR A CATASTROPHIC CATEGORY 5 HURRICANE. MEANWHILE...THE COLD FRONT 
APPROACHING YESTERDAY BECAME QUASI-STATIONARY ACROSS SOUTHERN 
ILLINOIS AND MISSOURI. 

THIS AFTERNOON...MODEL SOUNDINGS SITUATED ACROSS THE MID SOUTH THIS 
AFTERNOON PRODUCE LI/S AROUND -7...SURFACE BASED CAPES AROUND 3000 
J/KG...AND WEAK WINDS ALOFT. THIS SUGGESTS ISOLATED PULSE SHOWERS 
AND THUNDERSTORMS POSSIBLE NEARLY ANYWHERE ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA 
THIS AFTERNOON. FORECAST TODAY OVERALL IS ON TRACK AND WILL NOT 
ISSUE AN UPDATE AT THIS TIME.

CJC
&&
.PREV DISCUSSION ISSUED AT 351 AM...

...HURRICANE KATRINA EXPECTED TO HAVE SIGNIFICANT IMPACTS TO
PORTIONS OF THE MID-SOUTH MONDAY NIGHT INTO TUESDAY...

LOOKS LIKE MOISTURE BOUNDARY IS NORTH OF OHIO RIVER THIS MORNING...
WITH NOT A WHOLE LOT GOING ON IN OUR CWA AT THIS TIME. SOME PATCHY
FOG...WITH TEMPS MAINLY 70 TO 75 AT 07Z.

.SHORT TERM (THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...
THE BIG STORY...CAT 4 HURRICANE KATRINA CHURNING ITS WAY WEST
NORTHWEST ACROSS THE SOUTHEAST GULF OF MEXICO. JUST GOT OFF OF
CONFERENCE CALL WITH THE HURRICANE CENTER AND CURRENT NHC TRACK
BRINGS THE SYSTEM ACROSS NORTHEAST MISSISSIPPI AND WEST CENTRAL
TENNESSEE ON TUESDAY AS A TROPICAL STORM. KATRINA IS FORECAST TO
LANDFALL NEAR NEW ORLEANS ON MONDAY MORNING AS A STRONG CATEGORY 4
HURRICANE. THE CURRENT FORECAST TRACK LOOKS VERY REASONABLE AS A MID
LATITUDE TROUGH MOVING INTO THE PLAINS STATES IS BEGINNING TO ERODE
THE EASTERN SIDE OF THE UPPER LEVEL RIDGE...WHICH HAS BEEN STEERING
KATRINA WESTWARD OVER THE PAST COUPLE OF DAYS. THE HURRICANE SHOULD
START TO BEND TO THE NORTHWEST AND EVENTUALLY NORTH OVER THE NEXT ONE
TO TWO DAYS AS A RESULT OF THE TROUGH.

WEATHER IMPACTS MAY BE SIGNIFICANT ACROSS PORTIONS OF THE MID SOUTH
BEGINNING MONDAY NIGHT AND CONTINUING TUESDAY...WITH A HEAVY RAIN...
AND HIGH WIND THREAT POSSIBLE...ESPECIALLY OVER EASTERN PORTIONS OF
THE AREA. WILL HOLD OFF ON TROPICAL STORM WIND WATCH FOR LATE MONDAY
NIGHT INTO TUESDAY. LATEST COORDINATION CALL WIND RADII WOULD HAVE
TROPICAL STORM FORCE WINDS JUST REACHING OUR CWA AROUND 10-12Z
TUESDAY. CONSIDERING HPC FORECAST OF 4 INCHES OF RAIN...WILL GO WITH
FLOOD WATCH EAST OF MISSISSIPPI RIVER AND SOUTH OF INTERSTATE 40
FOR MIDNIGHT MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH 18Z TUESDAY. WILL REISSUE SPS
WITH UPDATED WORDING ON THREATS.

ANY SIGNIFICANT PRECIPITATION SHOULD LEAVE AREA BY 00Z WEDNESDAY...
AND WILL KEEP SMALL POPS FOR TUESDAY NIGHT...AND DRY WEDNESDAY.

NO SIGNIFICANT ADJUSTMENTS TO TEMPERATURE OR CLOUD FORECASTS...THOSE
WERE ALREADY IN GOOD SHAPE.
&&

.LONG TERM (AFTER WEDNESDAY)...
CONSIDERING ISSUES IN SHORT TERM FORECAST...AND BENIGN WEATHER IN
EXTENDED...NO CHANGES TO EXTENDED FORECAST GRIDS.
&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...FLOOD WATCH 00Z TUESDAY TO 18Z TUESDAY ALL COUNTIES.
     INLAND TROPICAL STORM WATCH 00Z TUESDAY TO 18Z TUESDAY ALONG
     AND EAST OF A LINE FROM PITTSBORO TO NEW ALBANY TO CORINTH.
TN...FLOOD WATCH 00Z TUESDAY TO 18Z TUESDAY ALL COUNTIES ALONG AND
     SOUTH OF INTERSTATE 40.
     INLAND TROPICAL STORM WATCH 00Z TUESDAY TO 18Z TUESDAY FOR
     HARDIN COUNTY.

.UPDATED DISCUSSION...
KATRINA STRONGER AND LARGER THAN EARLIER FORECAST. NOW CAT

REACH AREA A LITTLE EARLIER THAN ANTICIPATED MONDAY NIGHT. WILL GO
AHEAD AND ISSUE INLAND TROPICAL STORM WATCH FOR 00Z TUESDAY TO 18Z
TUESDAY FOR NORTHEAST MISSISSIPPI AND HARDIN COUNTY IN WEST TN.

FXUS64 KMEG 280246
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
946 PM CDT SAT AUG 27 2005

.DISCUSSION...

...HURRICANE KATRINA MAY HAVE SIGNIFICANT IMPACTS TO PORTIONS OF
   THE MID-SOUTH FOR THE BEGINNING OF THIS WEEK...

A NEARLY STATIONARY BOUNDARY IS STRETCHED TO OUR NORTH ACROSS
SOUTHERN ILLINOIS...SOUTHERN MISSOURI...AND WEST INTO KANSAS
TONIGHT. SOME CONVECTION HAS FIRED ALONG THE FRONT AND IS ONLY
MOVING SLOWLY SOUTH. DO NOT THINK THAT THE FRONT WILL MAKE MUCH MORE
PROGRESS TO THE SOUTH. IN THE UPPER LEVELS...A WEAK 500 MB TROUGH
AXIS REMAINS STRETCHED TO OUR SOUTH. NOT ANYTHING IN THE WAY OF
CONVECTION WITH THIS FEATURE...AND WITH LOSS OF DAYTIME HEATING AND
NO DEFINITIVE LOW LEVEL BOUNDARY TO FOCUS CONVECTIVE DEVELOP...
THINK OVERALL CHANCES ARE LOW. WILL THEREFORE REDUCE POPS TO SLIGHT
CHANCE FOR THE OVERNIGHT HOURS WITH AN ISOLATED SHOWER OR
THUNDERSTORMS STILL POSSIBLE DUE TO THE WARM/MOIST AIRMASS.
OVERNIGHT LOWS CURRENTLY FORECAST IN THE LOW TO MID 70S LOOKS GOOD
AT THIS POINT. DID ALSO MAKE A MINOR ADJUSTMENT TO CLOUD GRIDS TO
GO MOSTLY CLOUDY TO REFLECT CURRENT TRENDS.

NOW TO THE BIG STORY...DANGEROUS HURRICANE KATRINA CHURNING ITS WAY
WEST NORTHWEST ACROSS THE SOUTHEAST GULF OF MEXICO. JUST GOT OFF OF
CONFERENCE CALL WITH THE HURRICANE CENTER AND CURRENT NHC TRACK
BRINGS THE SYSTEM ACROSS NORTHEAST MISSISSIPPI AND WEST CENTRAL
TENNESSEE ON TUESDAY AS A TROPICAL STORM. KATRINA IS FORECAST TO
LANDFALL NEAR NEW ORLEANS ON MONDAY MORNING...POSSIBLY AS A STRONG
CATEGORY 4 HURRICANE. THE CURRENT FORECAST TRACK LOOKS VERY
REASONABLE AS A MID LATITUDE TROUGH MOVING INTO THE PLAINS STATES IS
BEGINNING TO ERODE THE EASTERN SIDE OF THE UPPER LEVEL RIDGE...WHICH
HAS BEEN STEERING KATRINA WESTWARD OVER THE PAST COUPLE OF DAYS. THE
HURRICANE SHOULD START TO BEND TO THE NORTHWEST AND EVENTUALLY
NORTH OVER THE NEXT ONE TO TWO DAYS AS A RESULT OF THE TROUGH.
WEATHER IMPACTS MAY BE SIGNIFICANT ACROSS PORTIONS OF THE MID SOUTH
BEGINNING MONDAY NIGHT AND CONTINUING TUESDAY...WITH A HEAVY RAIN...
HIGH WIND...AND SEVERE THREAT POSSIBLE...ESPECIALLY OVER EASTERN
PORTIONS OF THE AREA. A SPECIAL WEATHER STATEMENT WILL BE ISSUED
SHORTLY TO HIGHLIGHT POTENTIAL THREATS.

UPDATED ZONES AND GRIDS OUT MOMENTARILY.

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.

$$

JLH





000 
FXUS64 KMEG 272047
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
345 PM CDT SAT AUG 27 2005

.DISCUSSION...LATEST SURFACE ANALYSIS PLACES COLD FRONT ACROSS 
SOUTHERN ILLINOIS....SOUTHEAST MISSOURI...AND BECOMES NEARLY 
QUASI-STATIONARY ACROSS NORTHWEST ARKANSAS. MEANWHILE HURRICANE 
KATRINA OVER 200 MILES WEST OF KEY WEST FLORIDA HAS ITS SIGHTS ON 
THE LOUISIANA COASTLINE. MAIN CHALLENGE THIS FORECAST PACKAGE WILL 
BE RELATED TO THE POTENTIAL EFFECTS OF THE HURRICANE ON THE MID 
SOUTH. AS A RESULT...SIGNIFICANT CHANGES TO THE FORECAST WERE MADE 
BASED ON CURRENT MODEL/TPC GUIDANCE. 

TONIGHT...COLD FRONT WILL SLOWLY TRY TO MOVE THROUGH THE MID SOUTH 
TONIGHT...POSSIBLY MOVING AS FAR SOUTH AS I-40. INSTABILITY HAS BEEN 
LIMITED TODAY BY EXTENSIVE CLOUD COVER ACROSS MUCH OF THE MID SOUTH 
WITH TEMPERATURES ONLY REACHING THE UPPER 70S TO AROUND 80 IN MOST 
AREAS. WILL KEEP SCATTERED POPS IN TONIGHT WITH FRONT IN VICINITY. 

SUNDAY...FRONT IS ANTICIPATED TO STALL OUT ACROSS THE MID SOUTH WITH 
SURFACE FLOW PARALLEL TO UPPER LEVEL FLOW. SOUTH OF THE 
BOUNDARY...LI/S AROUND -5...AROUND 2000 J/KG CAPE...AND WEAK UPPER 
LEVEL WINDS SUGGEST CONVECTIVE ACTIVITY WILL RESEMBLE PULSE TYPE 
CONVECTION. CURRENTLY THINK THAT MOST IF NOT ALL STORMS WILL REMAIN 
BELOW SEVERE LIMITS WITH CLOUD COVER ACROSS THE REGION. 

MONDAY AND MONDAY NIGHT...HURRICANE KATRINA SHOULD MAKE LANDFALL 
DURING THE MORNING HOURS SOMEWHERE NEAR NEW ORLEANS. LAST FEW RUNS 
OF THE GFS/EUROPEAN/CANADIAN/UKMET AND TPC DISCUSSIONS BRING THE 
CENTER NEAR THIS MENTIONED AREA. MEANWHILE...QUASI-STATIONARY 
BOUNDARY WILL BEGIN TO RETROGRADE NORTH DURING THE DAY. AS A 
RESULT...WENT WITH PRIMARILY CHANCE POPS IN THE MORNING INCREASING 
TO LIKELY BY AFTERNOON ACROSS NORTHERN MISSISSIPPI AS THE OUTER 
BANDS FROM KATRINA BEGIN TO AFFECT THE MID SOUTH. 

MONDAY NIGHT AND TUESDAY...HURRICANE KATRINA WILL MOVE AS FAR NORTH 
AS CENTRAL MISSISSIPPI BY 12Z TUESDAY MORNING WITH MOST AREAS UNDER
CATEGORICAL POPS. MODEL SOUNDINGS SHOW 20-25 KT SUSTAINED WINDS NEAR THE 
SURFACE ACROSS THE SOUTHERN TIER OR TWO OF COUNTIES BY EARLY 
TUESDAY. STILL TOO FAR OUT AT THIS POINT TO ISSUE ANY WIND 
HEADLINES...BUT LATER SHIFTS WILL ISSUE IF FORECAST DATA SUPPORTS 
CURRENT THINKING. WILL MENTION HEAVY RAINFALL WORDING IN THE HWO 
WITH PRECIPITABLE WATER VALUES BETWEEN 2-3 INCHES. 

WEDNESDAY AND BEYOND...WILL CARRY 20 POPS DURING THE DAY ON 
WEDNESDAY WITH FORECAST AREA ON SOUTHWEST FRINGE OF THE FUTURE 
REMNANTS OF KATRINA. HIGH PRESSURE WILL BEGIN TO BUILD BACK INTO THE 
MID SOUTH BY THURSDAY.
&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.

FXUS64 KMEG 271523
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
1025 AM CDT SAT AUG 27 2005

.DISCUSSION...LATEST SURFACE ANALYSIS THIS MORNING PLACES SURFACE 
COLD FRONT FROM CHAMPAIGN ILLINOIS SOUTHWEST ALONG I-44 IN MISSOURI 
AND OKLAHOMA. IN ADDITION...A PRE-FRONTAL SURFACE TROUGH STRETCHES 
FROM NORTHEAST MISSISSIPPI WEST TO SOUTHERN ARKANSAS AND NORTHERN 
TEXAS. 

MODEL SOUNDINGS SHOW ATMOSPHERE SATURATED ACROSS THE MID SOUTH TODAY 
ALONG AND AHEAD OF SURFACE COLD FRONT. NOT ANTICIPATING MUCH IF ANY 
SEVERE THREAT WITH EXTENSIVE CLOUD COVER FROM ONGOING CONVECTION 
ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA LIMITING INSTABILITY. ADJUSTED POPS BASED 
ON CURRENT TRENDS AND WENT WITH SCATTERED POPS FOR THE AFTERNOON. 
TEMPERATURES WILL BE A BIT LOWER THAN ANTICIPATED AND ADJUSTED THEM 
ACCORDINGLY. 

UPDATED GRIDS ALREADY SENT.

.PREV DISCUSSION...ISSUED 251 AM CDT SAT AUG 27 2005...

A LINE OF THUNDERSTORMS EXTENDS ACROSS THE NORTHERN PART OF THE
FORECAST AREA THIS MORNING AND IS GRADUALLY MOVING SOUTH. THIS
ACTIVITY SHOULD CONTINUE TO SOME EXTENT THIS MORNING OVER THE
FORECAST AREA SO WILL KEEP CHANCE POPS IN THE FORECAST FOR TODAY.
WOULD NOT BE SURPRISED TO SEE ADDITIONAL THUNDERSTORMS FIRE UP
DURING THE AFTERNOON AS WELL. BY TONIGHT...ANY THUNDERSTORMS THAT DO
DEVELOP SHOULD DIMINISH FAIRLY QUICKLY SO LEFT ONLY SLIGHT CHANCE
POPS IN FOR TONIGHT. BY SUNDAY...THE ONLY AREA THAT MIGHT SEE ANY
THUNDERSTORMS WOULD BE THE EXTREME SOUTHEAST WHERE 20 POPS LOOK FINE
FOR THAT PERIOD. FROM SUNDAY NIGHT INTO MONDAY...FORECAST HINGES ON
TRACK OF HURRICANE KATRINA. IT APPEARS THAT KATRINA WILL MAKE
LANDFALL SOMEWHERE ALONG THE CENTRAL GULF COAST MONDAY NIGHT. HAVE
ADDED POPS TO FORECAST FOR MONDAY AND MONDAY NIGHT. ONCE KATRINA IS
OUT OF THE PICTURE...DRY WEATHER WILL RETURN TO THE REGION FOR THE
BULK OF NEXT WEEK.

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES

FXUS64 KMEG 270321
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
1021 PM CDT FRI AUG 26 2005

.DISCUSSION...

THUNDERSTORMS FORMED EARLIER THIS EVENING ALONG A WEAK SURFACE
TROUGH TO THE NORTH OF THE FORECAST AREA. THIS CONVECTIVE COMPLEX
MOVED SOUTHEAST AND CONTINUES TO MOVE SOUTHEAST ACROSS WEST
TENNESSEE. THE AIRMASS REMAINS VERY WARM AND HUMID WITH
TEMPERATURES PRIMARILY IN THE 70S WHERE RAIN HAS FALLEN AND 80S
ELSEWHERE.

UPPER RIDGE STILL FIRMLY ENTRENCHED OVER THE SOUTHERN U.S. WITH A
SERIES OF SHORTWAVE TROUGH MOVING UP OVER THE NORTHERN PERIPHERY
OF THE RIDGE INTO PORTIONS OF THE MID-SOUTH. EXPECT THESE UPPER LEVEL
DISTURBANCES COMBINED WITH CONVECTIVE BOUNDARIES AND A WARM/HUMID
AIRMASS TO CONTINUE CONVECTION THROUGH THE NIGHT. BEST CHANCES
SHOULD REMAIN ACROSS THE NORTHERN HALF OF THE AREA...CLOSEST TO THE
UPPER LEVEL SUPPORT. SHEAR REMAINS WEAK ACROSS MOST OF THE AREA...
WITH THE BETTER SHEAR PROFILES TO OUR NORTH. SINCE SHEAR IS WEAK
AND WITH THE LOSS OF DAYTIME HEATING...THINK THAT OVERALL SEVERE
THREAT CONTINUES TO DIMINISH.

WITH ALL THIS IN MIND...HAVE MADE SOME MINOR GRID CHANGES TO
REFLECT ONGOING WEATHER. WILL HAVE UPDATED GRIDS AND FORECAST OUT
SHORTLY.

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.

FXUS64 KMEG 262034
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
332 PM CDT FRI AUG 26 2005

.DISCUSSION...LATEST SURFACE ANALYSIS PLACES COLD FRONT FROM CENTRAL 
IOWA TO KANSAS AND OKLAHOMA. AHEAD OF THE FRONT...A PRE-FRONTAL 
SURFACE TROUGH WAS LOCATED FROM SAINT LOUIS TO SOUTH CENTRAL 
MISSOURI. MAIN FORECAST CONCERNS THIS PACKAGE IS CONVECTIVE 
POTENTIAL THROUGH AT LEAST EARLY NEXT WEEK AND THE POTENTIAL EFFECTS 
OF HURRICANE KATRINA ON THE LOWER MISSISSIPPI VALLEY.

TONIGHT...PRE-FRONTAL TROUGH WILL MOVE THROUGH SOUTHEAST MISSOURI 
DURING THE EARLY EVENING. WILL CARRY A CHANCE TO LIKELY POPS ACROSS 
NORTHERN SECTIONS WHERE BETTER CONVERGENCE WILL BE PRESENT AND 
TAPERED OF POPS AFTER MIDNIGHT. MOST IF NOT ALL CONVECTION SHOULD 
GRADUALLY DIMINISH WITH THE LOSS OF DAYTIME INSTABILITY. 

SATURDAY AND SUNDAY...COLD FRONT WILL BEGIN TO MOVE THROUGH THE MID SOUTH 
BY SATURDAY EVENING. NOT TOO IMPRESSED WITH THE UPPER LEVEL DYNAMICS 
OF THIS SYSTEM AS THE BETTER FORCING WILL BE UP ACROSS MICHIGAN. 
ADDITIONALLY...WEAK WINDS ALOFT /PRIMARILY BELOW 20 KTS/...WEAKENING 
INSTABILITY WITH THE LOSS OF DAYTIME HEATING /MLCAPES DROPPING DOWN 
TO AROUND 1000 J/KG/ SUGGEST ANY CONVECTION THAT DEVELOPS SHOULD 
REMAIN BELOW SEVERE LIMITS AND PRIMARILY EXHIBIT PULSE THUNDERSTORM 
CHARACTERISTICS DURING THE DAY. WILL CARRY A SLIGHT CHANCE OF 
SHOWERS/THUNDERSTORMS FOR SUNDAY WITH FRONT ACROSS THE SOUTHERN 
SECTION OF THE FORECAST AREA.

TUESDAY THROUGH FRIDAY...SOME CONSISTENCY ISSUES WITH HANDLING OF 
HURRICANE KATRINA AS IT MOVES ONSHORE ACROSS THE GULF COAST AND THE 
EFFECTS THAT THE MID SOUTH MAY EXPERIENCE NEXT WEEK. LATEST GFS/UKMET 
TAKE THE SYSTEM THROUGH NEW ORLEANS/GULFPORT WHILE EUROPEAN SOLUTION 
IS CLOSER TOWARDS MOBILE/PENSACOLA. INTERESTINGLY ENOUGH...THE 12Z 
GFS TAKES THE REMNANTS UP THE MISSISSIPPI RIVER DELTA THROUGH 
WESTERN TENNESSEE THEN THROUGH THE OHIO VALLEY. MEANWHILE THE NAM 
TAKES KATRINA FURTHER EAST THROUGH THE PANHANDLE OF FLORIDA. FOR NOW 
THINK 00Z/12Z GFS AND 06Z EUROPEAN SOLUTION HAVE BETTER CONSENSUS 
WITH TRACK NEAR SOUTHERN ALABAMA/PANHANDLE OF FLORIDA. ADDED SLIGHT 
CHANCE POPS INTO THE FORECAST FOR TUESDAY ACROSS THE EXTREME 
SOUTHEAST SECTION OF NORTHERN MISSISSIPPI. LATER SHIFTS WILL ADJUST 
THE FORECAST AS THE MODEL RUNS SHOW BETTER CONSENSUS ON THE EXACT 
TRACK. STAY TUNED...
&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
1057 AM CDT FRI AUG 26 2005

.DISCUSSION...LATEST SURFACE ANALYSIS THIS MORNING PLACES COLD FRONT 
ACROSS SOUTHEAST NEBRASKA THEN SOUTHWEST BACK INTO KANSAS AND 
OKLAHOMA. AHEAD OF THIS FRONT A PRE-FRONTAL SURFACE TROUGH IS 
LOCATED FROM THE LAKE OF THE OZARKS TO JOPLIN MISSOURI. MAIN 
FORECAST CONCERN FOR THIS AFTERNOON WILL BE CONVECTIVE CHANCES. 

PRE-FRONTAL SURFACE TROUGH WILL CONTINUE TO MOVE ACROSS SOUTHERN 
MISSOURI THIS AFTERNOON. MODEL SOUNDINGS SHOW 2000-3000 J/KG SURFACE 
BASED CAPE...LI/S AROUND -6...AND RELATIVELY WEAK WINDS ALOFT 
ESPECIALLY ACROSS NORTHERN MISSISSIPPI. THIS SUGGESTS CONVECTIVE 
ACTIVITY WILL PRIMARILY BE PULSE TYPE ACROSS MUCH OF THE FORECAST 
AREA BUT COULD SEE SOME CONVECTION DEVELOP INTO A LINE LATER IN THE 
AFTERNOON AS ABOVE MENTIONED TROUGH APPROACHES NORTHERN SECTIONS OF 
THE AREA WHERE MID/UPPER LEVEL WINDS ARE MORE FAVORABLE. WILL MAKE 
MINOR TWEAKS TO AFTERNOON GRIDS FOR CURRENT TRENDS BUT FORECAST 
OVERALL ON TRACK.

UPDATED GRIDS WILL BE PUBLISHED SHORTLY.
 

.PREV DISCUSSION...ISSUED 237 AM CDT FRI AUG 26 2005...

QUIET MORNING AS SKIES ARE MOSTLY CLEAR ACROSS THE REGION. COLD
FRONT LOCATED ACROSS EASTERN NEBRASKA INTO CENTRAL KANSAS WILL MOVE
SOUTHEAST TOWARD THE FORECAST AREA TODAY AND SATURDAY. EXPECT SOME
THUNDERSTORMS TO DEVELOP AHEAD OF THE FRONT BEGINNING THIS AFTERNOON
AND CONTINUING TONIGHT AND INTO SATURDAY. SPC HAS NORTHWEST CORNER
OF FORECAST AREA IN SLIGHT RISK FOR THE DAY ONE OUTLOOK AND SEE NO
REASON WHY THERE COUNLDNT BE AN ISOLATED SEVERE STORM. WILL MENTION
THREAT IN HWO BUT NOT IN ZONES. AFTER SATURDAY...CHANCE OF RAIN
DIMINISHES FOR SATURDAY NIGHT AND SUNDAY TO SLIGHT CHANCE AND THEN
DRY WEATHER SHOULD RETURN FOR THE BEGINNING OF NEXT WEEK.
TEMPERATURES WILL NOT BE QUITE AS HOT AS THEY HAVE BEEN AFTER TODAY
WITH READINGS FAIRLY CLOSE TO NORMAL

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 260130
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
828 PM CDT THU AUG 25 2005

.DISCUSSION...
CONVECTION STILL OCCURRING ACROSS PART OF NORTHEAST MS THIS EVENING
AND MOVING SLOWLY SOUTHEASTWARD. THINK THIS CONVECTION WILL BE
DIEING OUT WITH LOSS OF DAYTIME HEATING OR MOVING OUT OF OUR AREA
SOON. ADDITIONAL THUNDERSTORMS ARE OCCURRING FROM SOUTHERN MO INTO
SOUTHERN IL IN ASSOCIATION WITH A WEAK SHORT WAVE THAT IS OVERRIDING
THE UPPER LEVEL RIDGE COVERING THE MIDSOUTH. SATELLITE INDICATES THAT
TOPS ARE WARMING IN ASSOCIATION WITH THESE THUNDERSTORMS. PLAN TO
KEEP IN 20 PERCENT OF THUNDERSTORMS OVERNIGHT FROM EXTREME
NORTHEAST AR ACROSS THE MO BOOTHEEL INTO EXTREME NORTHWEST TN...IN
CASE ANY THUNDERSTORMS ASSOCIATED WITH THE SHORT WAVE MOVE DOWN
INTO THIS AREA. WILL REMOVE THE CHANCE OF THUNDERSTORMS OVERNIGHT
ELSEWHERE. OTHERWISE THE CURRENT FORECAST IS FINE.

.PREV DISCUSSION...
ISSUED 329 PM CDT THU AUG 25 2005

LATEST SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS NUMEROUS OUTFLOW
BOUNDARIES PRESENT ACROSS THE MID SOUTH THIS AFTERNOON. AS A
RESULT...ISOLATED SCATTERED SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS DEVELOPED
EARLY THIS AFTERNOON. MAIN FORECAST CONCERN IS FRONTAL PASSAGE THIS
WEEKEND ACROSS THE REGION.

TONIGHT...SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS WILL CONTINUE THROUGH SUNSET
BEFORE DIMINISHING IN COVERAGE THIS EVENING WITH THE LOSS OF DAYTIME
INSTABILITY. WILL CARRY SCATTERED POPS FOR THE FIRST HALF OF THE
NIGHT AND TAPERING OFF AREAS DOWN TO SLIGHT CHANCE.

FRIDAY...SIMILAR PRE-CONVECTIVE ENVIRONMENT EXPECTED ACROSS THE MID
SOUTH ON FRIDAY. CONVECTION WILL AGAIN DEVELOP AS TEMPERATURES RISE
INTO THE 90S. 3000 J/KG SURFACE BASED CAPE...LI/S AROUND -5...AND
WEAK MID LEVEL WINDS POINT TO PULSE TYPE CONVECTION. SURFACE
DEWPOINTS WILL REMAIN IN THE LOWER 70S PRODUCING HEAT INDICES IN
THE 100 TO 105 DEGREE RANGE. WILL HOLD OFF ISSUING A HEAT ADVISORY
AT THIS TIME AS CLOUD COVER FROM CONVECTION SHOULD KEEP MOST AREAS
BELOW ADVISORY CRITERIA.

FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY...LOW PRESSURE WILL MOVE INTO THE MIDDLE
MISSISSIPPI FRIDAY NIGHT GRADUALLY DRAGGING A SURFACE COLD FRONT
THROUGH THE MID SOUTH ON SATURDAY AND SUNDAY. BETTER UPPER LEVEL
DYNAMICS WILL BE UPSTREAM OF THE FORECAST AREA AND WENT WITH
SCATTERED POPS FOR NOW.

MONDAY THROUGH THURSDAY...LONG RANGE MODELS IN DECENT AGREEMENT WITH
OVERALL SYNOPTIC PATTERN ACROSS THE CONTINENTAL UNITED STATES. ONLY
MAIN DIFFERENCES BETWEEN THE MODELS IS THE GFS RUN FLATTENS OUT
RIDGE AXIS MORE THAN THE AMPLIFIED EUROPEAN SOLUTION. UPPER LEVEL
RIDGING WILL BUILD IN ACROSS THE MISSISSIPPI VALLEY AS A LONGWAVE
TROUGH ENTERS THE PACIFIC NORTHWEST AND DEPARTING TROUGH MOVES OFF
THE EAST COAST. AS A RESULT...WILL LEAVE TUESDAY THROUGH THURSDAY
DRY FOR NOW AS CAPPING INVERSION WILL KEEP CONVECTION FROM
DEVELOPING.

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.
