000 
FXUS64 KMEG 251634
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
1132 AM CDT THU AUG 25 2005

.DISCUSSION...LATEST SURFACE ANALYSIS PLACES 1018 MB HIGH PRESSURE 
ACROSS THE MID SOUTH. ALOFT...ELONGATED RIDGE AXIS STRETCHES FROM 
HUDSON BAY DOWN TO SOUTHERN TEXAS. TEMPERATURES ALREADY IN THE 
UPPER 80S TO LOWER 90S IN MANY SPOTS. MAIN FORECAST CONCERNS THIS 
AFTERNOON IS HEAT ISSUES AND CONVECTIVE POTENTIAL THIS AFTERNOON.

A SHORTWAVE WILL MOVE ACROSS THE MIDDLE MISSISSIPPI VALLEY THIS 
AFTERNOON. LATEST VISIBLE SATELLITE SHOWS DIURNAL BASED CUMULUS 
ALREADY DEVELOPING ACROSS THE MID SOUTH. MODEL SOUNDINGS PRODUCE 
AROUND 2000-3000 J/KG SURFACE BASED CAPE...LI/S AROUND -6...AND 
RELATIVELY WEAK WINDS ALOFT. ANY CONVECTION THAT DEVELOPS THIS 
AFTERNOON WILL BE PULSE TYPE CONVECTION DRIVEN BY DIURNAL 
INSTABILITY. KNQA WSR-88D TRENDS ALREADY SHOWING CONVECTION 
DEVELOPING JUST WEST OF THE MS RIVER NEAR MEMPHIS. WILL CONTINUE TO 
MONITOR BUT HOLD OFF AT THIS TIME ON ISSUING A HEAT ADVISORY AS 
CLOUD COVER MAY HOLD TEMPERATURES DOWN A FEW DEGREES FROM YESTERDAY 
BUT STILL PRODUCE HEAT INDICIES IN SPOTS BETWEEN 100 TO 105 DEGREES. 
WILL MAKE SOME MINOR ADJUSTMENTS TO POPS BASED ON CURRENT TRENDS AND 
TWEAK TEMPERATURES SLIGHTLY. 

UPDATED GRIDS WILL BE PUBLISHED SHORTLY. 
 

.PREV DISCUSSION...ISSUED 200 AM CDT THU AUG 25 2005...

UPPER LEVEL HIGH PRESSURE WILL REMAIN IN PLACE OVER THE MIDSOUTH 
TODAY. DYING MCS LOCATED ACROSS SOUTHERN MISSOURI AND KANSAS MAY 
SKIRT NORTHERN SECTIONS OF THE MIDSOUTH TODAY OTHERWISE EXPECT ONLY 
ISOLATED SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS TO DEVELOP. WILL KEEP 30 POPS IN 
THE NORTH WITH 20 ELSEWHERE. WITH LITTLE ACTIVITY AROUND...EXPECT 
TEMPERATURES TO REACH INTO THE MID TO UPPER 90S AGAIN FOR HIGHS. 
DEWPOINTS SHOULD MIX DOWN DURING AFTERNOON...LEAVING HEAT INDICES 
BELOW HEAT ADVISORY CRITERIA. 

BY FRIDAY...THE UPPER LEVEL HIGH PRESSURE WILL WEAKEN ALLOWING FOR 
MORE SCATTERED DIURNAL CONVECTION TO DEVELOP. TEMPERATURES SHOULD BE 
A TAD COOLER WITH MORE ACTIVITY AROUND. EXPECT HIGHS IN LOWER TO MID 
90S.

BY FRIDAY NIGHT...A COLD FRONT WILL MOVE INTO PORTIONS OF THE 
MIDSOUTH AND WILL BECOME STATIONARY OVER THE MIDSOUTH FOR THE 
WEEKEND. THE FRONT WILL BE THE FOCUS OF SHOWER AND THUNDERSTORM 
ACTIVITY THROUGHOUT THE WEEKEND. EXPECT SLIGHTLY BETTER CHANCES FOR 
RAIN THAN TYPICAL DIURNAL CONVECTION.

BY THE BEGINNING OF NEXT WEEK...HIGH PRESSURE AT THE SFC WILL BUILD 
INTO THE AREA...ALLOWING FOR DRY CONDITIONS TO AT MOST ISOLATED 
CONVECTION DURING THE AFTERNOON. THESE CONDITIONS WILL REMAIN 
THROUGH THE END OF THE FORECAST PERIOD.

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES
AR...NONE.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
929 PM CDT WED AUG 24 2005

.DISCUSSION...
CONVECTION HAS DIED OUT ACROSS THE MIDSOUTH WITH LOSS OF DAYTIME
HEATING. WITH HIGH PRESSURE ALOFT COVERING THE MIDSOUTH...WILL
UPDATE THE FORECAST TO REMOVE THE SLIGHT CHANCE OF THUNDERSTORMS
PRESENTLY IN SOME LOCATIONS. SATELLITE SHOWS CIRRUS SPREADING
INTO THE MIDSOUTH FROM THE WEST ASSOCIATED WITH EARLIER CONVECTION.
WILL INCREASE SKY COVER A LITTLE IN SOME AREAS...ALTHOUGH THE CIRRUS
WILL BE THINNING DURING THE NIGHT. OVERNIGHT LOWS LOOK OK...ALTHOUGH
DID BUMP THE LOW UP FOR MEMPHIS A COUPLE OF DEGREES...SINCE THE
AIRPORT IS STILL A TOASTY 91 DEGREES AT 9 PM. INCREASED THE HIGHS A
FEW DEGREES FOR MOST OF THE MIDSOUTH FOR THURSDAY...FORECAST MAXIMUM
TEMPERATURES TODAY SOARED ABOVE GUIDANCE HIGHS WITH THE CURRENT
DROUGHT CONDITIONS. COULD BE A LITTLE BETTER CHANCE OF THUNDERSTORMS
ACROSS EXTREME NORTHWESTERN AREAS THURSDAY THAN TODAY...IF ANY
OUTFLOW BOUNDARIES DO MANAGE TO MOVE SOUTHWARD FROM CONVECTION MOVING
ACROSS MO TONIGHT. NEVERTHELESS...THINK MOST AREAS OF THE MIDSOUTH
TOMORROW WILL BE CLOSE TO HIGHS OBSERVED TODAY.

.PREV DISCUSSION...
ISSUED 243 PM CDT WED AUG 24 2005

ISOLATED SHOWERS POPPING UP NEAR THE TN RIVER VALLEY THIS AFTERNOON
OTRW SCT CU ACRS THE REGION WITH TEMPS IN THE LOW TO MID 90S. EXPECT
ISOLATED CONVECTION MAINLY SOUTH OF A JBR-MKL LINE THROUGH THE EARLY
EVENING THEN MOSTLY CLEAR SKIES OVERNIGHT WITH MILD TEMPS IN THE
70S.

AN UPPER LEVEL RIDGE WL DOMINATE THE WEATHER PATTERN ACRS THE REGION
THROUGH THU. EXPECT ANOTHER WARM..HUMID DAY ON THU WITH HIGHS IN THE
LOWER TO MID 90S. ISOLATED AFTN/EVE TSTMS POSSIBLE. ALSO IT LOOKS
LIKE MCS DEVELOPMENT WL BE POSSIBLE ACRS MO LATER TONIGHT ALONG THE
NRN PERIPHERY OF THE UPPER RIDGE. IT IS POSSIBLE THAT A DYING MCS
COULD MOVE INTO THE NRN PARTS OF THE REGION SOMETIME ON THU SO WL
CONT WITH SLIGHTLY HIGHER IN THAT AREA.

THU NIGHT INTO THE WEEKEND...UPPER RIDGE WL START TO WEAKEN ACRS THE
REGION AS UPPER FLOW BECOMES NWLY AT 500 MB. AS A RESULT MCS
DEVELOPMENT MAY SAG SOUTHWARD INTO OUR REGION...ESPECIALLY NRN SXNS
FRI AND SAT. WL INCREASE POPS TO 40 IN THIS AREA. CONDITIONS WL CONT
TO BE WARM AND MUGGY WITH TEMPS IN THE LOWER 90S.

SUN THROUGH WED...A BROAD TROF FORECAST TO DEVELOP ACRS THE REGION
BY EARLY NEXT WEEK TROPICAL SYSTEM KATRINA SHOULD REMAIN SOUTH AND
EAST OF THE REGION. THE BROAD TROF...LACK OF SFC FEATURES AND
RELATIVELY LOW MEAN RHS ADD UP TO SMALL CHANCES FOR PRECIP AND
SEASONABLE TEMPS.

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 241638
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
1138 AM CDT WED AUG 24 2005

.UPDATE...
WEAK STATIONARY FRONT JUST TO THE SOUTH OF THE AREA THIS MORNING. 
SOME LOWER DEWPOINTS DID BRIEFLY WORK INTO EXTREME NRN SXNS OF THE 
MID SOUTH THIS MORNING OTRW CONTINUED WARM AND MUGGY ACRS THE 
REGION. WL ADJUST TEMPS UPWARD SLIGHTLY AS READINGS WERE QUICKLY 
WARMING ACRS THE AREA UNDER A GOOD DEAL OF SUNSHINE. MEM ALREADY UP 
TO 89 SO WL BUMP HIGH TO 94. ELSW ADDED A DEGREE OR TWO. CURRENT POP 
FORECAST ON TRACK WITH BEST CHANCES...30-40 PERCENT...ACRS N MS 
CLOSER TO THE FRONT. 

.PREV DISCUSSION ISSUED AT 200 AM CDT...
STATIONARY FRONT THAT HAS BEEN HELPING TO PRODUCE SCATTERED SHOWERS 
AND THUNDERSTORMS AROUND THE MIDSOUTH OVER THE PAST WEEK HAS NOW 
SHIFTED SOUTH AND IS CURRENTLY LOCATED ACROSS CENTRAL MISSISSIPPI. 
THIS WILL AGAIN BE THE FOCUS OF ACTIVITY TODAY BUT WITH THE CURRENT 
LOCATION...EXPECT MOST OF THE MIDSOUTH TO BE DRY TODAY. HOWEVER WILL 
LEAVE A 20 POP TO THE NORTH TO A 30 POP TO THE SOUTH. EXPECT HIGHS 
TO BE A LITTLE COOLER TODAY WITH HIGHS IN THE UPPER 80S TO LOWER 90S.

UPPER LEVEL HIGH PRESSURE WILL BEGIN TO BUILD INTO THE AREA BY 
TONIGHT AND WILL PERSIST OVER THE AREA THROUGH AT LEAST THE 
BEGINNING PART OF THE WEEKEND. EXPECT ONLY DIURNAL CONVECTION TO 
DEVELOP SO WILL GO WITH 30 POPS FOR THE DAYTIME WITH 20 AT NIGHT. 
TEMPERATURES WILL BE BACK IN THE LOWER TO MID 90S FOR HIGHS.

MODELS ARE SHOWING DIFFERENT SOLUTIONS SINCE LAST NIGHTS RUN FOR THE 
LATTER PART OF THE FORECAST. MODELS SHOWING AN UPPER TROUGH WITH AN 
ASSOCIATED WEAK COLD FRONT MOVING THROUGH THE CWA FOR THE LATTER 
PART OF THE WEEKEND WITH SFC HIGH PRESSURE BUILDING IN FOR THE 
BEGINNING OF NEXT WEEK. FRONT MAY NOT REALLY BRING ANY COOLER 
WEATHER TO THE AREA BUT MAY BRING BETTER CHANCES FOR RAIN TO THE 
CWA. BEHIND THE FRONT...DRY CONDITIONS MAY PREVAIL. FOR 
NOW...HESITANT ON MAKING ANY CHANGES TO CURRENT FORECAST AS MODELS 
HAVE BEEN EAGER TO PUSH FRONTS THROUGH CWA AS OF LATE WHICH HASN/T 
HAPPENED. 
&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.

$$

KRM/SJM

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 240128
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
828 PM CDT TUE AUG 23 2005

.DISCUSSION...
CONVECTIVE COMPLEX MOVING EAST-SOUTHEASTWARD INTO NORTH-CENTRAL MS
THIS EVENING. SATELLITE INDICATED TOPS ARE WARMING ACROSS OUR
FORECAST AREA IN ASSOCIATION WITH THIS COMPLEX. RADARS INDICATING
THE PRECIPITATION GRADUALLY DISSIPATING FROM NEAR MEMPHIS SOUTHWARD
ACROSS NORTHWEST MS. THE ONLY REMAINING THUNDERSTORMS AS INDICATED
BY THE LIGHTNING DETECTORS ARE NEAR BATESVILLE MS AND SOUTHWARD...AS
THE ATMOSPHERE BECOMES CAPPED WITH LOSS OF DAYTIME HEATING.

HARD TO PINPOINT THE EXACT LOCATION OF THE NEARLY STATIONARY SURFACE
FRONT THIS EVENING...BUT BASED ON DEWPOINTS IT RUNS FROM MIDDLE TN
ACROSS NORTHWEST TN INTO SOUTHWEST MO.

CURRENT THINKING IS THAT PRECIPITATION WILL CONTINUE TO DIMINISH
ACROSS NORTH MS IN ASSOCIATION WITH THE CONVECTIVE COMPLEX. WILL
LEAVE IN A 20 PERCENT CHANCE OF SHOWERS TONIGHT ACROSS THE MIDSOUTH
WITH THE SURFACE FRONT THROUGH THE AREA. IN ADDITION...A WEAK SHORT
WAVE IS FORECAST TO MOVE ACROSS THE AREA FROM THE WEST. HOWEVER...
WILL WAIT UNTIL THE PRECIPITATION OVER NORTH MS DECREASES FURTHER
BEFORE UPDATING. MAY NEED TO LEAVE IN A CHANCE OF THUNDERSTORMS FOR
PART OF NORTHEAST MS DEPENDING ON HOW THE NORTHERN PART OF THE
CONVECTIVE COMPLEX MOVING TOWARD THIS AREA EVOLVES.

WILL INCREASE THE SKY COVER ACROSS THE AREA SOME...ALTHOUGH DO THINK
THE CLOUDS WILL THIN LATER TONIGHT. FORECAST LOWS LOOK OK.


.PREV DISCUSSION...
ISSUED 215 PM CDT TUE AUG 23 2005

MUCH MORE CLOUD COVER ESPECIALLY OVER NORTHEAST ARKANSAS AND WEST
TENNESSEE TODAY VS YESTERDAY. THUS MAX TEMPERATURES HAVE BEEN
SLIGHTLY COOLER THAN CURRENT FORECAST. THUNDERSTORMS HAVE FORMED
OVER CENTRAL ARKANSAS TODAY. A BOUNDARY SEPARATING SOME SLIGHTLY
DRIER/COOLER AIR STRETCHES ACROSS NORTHEAST ARKANSAS...JUST SOUTH OF
THE MISSOURI BOOTHEEL TO JUST NORTH OF JACKSON TN. OTHER
THUNDERSTORMS WERE BEGINNING TO DEVELOP OVER PARTS OF NORTH
MISSISSIPPI. LAST FEW DAYS HAVE BEEN CHALLENGING TO SAY THE LEAST

OVERNIGHT THE CLUSTER OF THUNDERSTORMS OVER CENTRAL ARKANSAS WILL
MOVE EASTWARD INTO NORTHEAST ARKANSAS AND WEST TENNESSEE. SOME MUCH
NEEDED RAIN WILL HAVE A GOOD CHANCE TO FINALLY MOVE INTO THE
MIDSOUTH TONIGHT.

THIS COMPLEX SHOULD HOLD TOGETHER OVERNIGHT AND INTO THE MID MORNING
HOURS. BELIEVE THAT ONCE CLOUDS THIN OUT OVER THE AREA...
TEMPERATURES SHOULD WARM UP INTO THE LOWER 90S. EXPECTING SOME
SCATTERED AFTERNOON THUNDERSTORMS ONCE AGAIN WEDNESDAY.

FORECASTING THE RAIN CHANCES THURSDAY AND FRIDAY ARE TOUGH. ANY
SMALL SCALE FEATURE THAT RIDES ON THE NORTH SIDE OF THE UPPER RIDGE
WILL HAVE THE POSSIBILITY OF SPARKING SOME CONVECTION IN THE
MOIST/UNSTABLE ATMOSPHERE OVER THE MIDSOUTH. GENERALLY MAX TEMPS
WILL REMAIN IN THE LOWER 90S WITH MIN TEMPS IN THE LOWER 70S.

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
1010 AM CDT TUE AUG 23 2005

.DISCUSSION...
LATEST RADAR IMAGERY SHOWING SHOWERS TRACKING ACROSS NORTHEAST 
ARKANSAS TOWARD THE MEMPHIS METRO AREA. AN OUTFLOW BOUNDARY HAS 
ADVANCED AHEAD OF THE LEADING SHOWERS...CAUSING THEM TO WEAKEN. 
APPEARS THAT SOME RAINFALL WILL REACH AT LEAST INTO CENTRAL SHELBY 
COUNTY AND NORTHWARD. ADDITIONAL SHOWERS WILL BE POSSIBLE THIS 
AFTERNOON AND EVENING.

THE MAIN CHALLENGE TODAY WILL BE MAX TEMPERATURES WHERE CLOUD COVER 
IS RATHER EXTENSIVE. FROM 24 HOURS AGO...STATIONS ARE REPORTING ONLY 
A DEGREE COOLER. SO WILL NOT MESS WITH MAX TEMPS TODAY AND ALL OTHER 
PARAMETERS LOOK OKAY FOR NOW.

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 230641
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
200 AM CDT TUE AUG 23 2005

.DISCUSSION...
CURRENT RADAR IMAGES SHOW A FEW SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS OVER 
SOUTHERN MISSOURI/NORTH-CENTRAL ARKANSAS THIS MORNING. IN 
ADDITION...A MCS HAS DEVELOPED OVER SOUTHWESTERN KANSAS AND THE 
OKLAHOMA PANHANDLE. LOOKING AT THE 00Z MODELS...THE NAM HAS 
INITIATED WELL WITH THESE FEATURES THUS HAVE BASED FORECAST FOR THE 
NEXT 24 HOURS ON THE NAM. THE SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS OVER 
SOUTHERN MISSOURI AND NORTHERN ARKANSAS ARE DEVELOPING ALONG A 
STATIONARY FRONT THAT HAS MEANDER OVER THE REGION OVER THE LAST FEW 
DAYS. EXPECT ACTIVITY FROM SOUTHERN MISSOURI/NORTHERN ARKANSAS TO 
MOVE INTO NORTHERN PORTIONS OF THE MIDSOUTH LATER THIS MORNING. 
EXPECT OTHER TYPICAL SCATTERED SUMMERTIME SHOWER/THUNDERSTORM 
ACTIVITY TO FIRE UP THIS AFTERNOON. REMNANTS FROM MCS IN 
KANSAS/OKLAHOMA WILL STAY WEST OF THE CWA. WILL LOWER POPS TO 30/40 
ACROSS THE ENTIRE CWA. WITH REGARDS TO TEMPERATURES...THERE IS A 
FAIR AMOUNT OF CLOUDS ACROSS EASTERN PORTIONS OF THE CWA AT THIS 
TIME. IF SIMILAR TRENDS WERE TO HAPPEN LAST NIGHT...THESE CLOUDS 
THINNED OUT BY MORNING LEAVING FOR ABUNDANT SUNSHINE AT LEAST FOR 
THE MORNING HOURS BEFORE THE CU DEVELOPS...WHICH EXPECT TO HAPPEN 
AGAIN TODAY. THIS WILL ALLOW TEMPERATURES TO WARM UP TO HIGHS IN THE 
LOW 90S TO THE NORTH AND MID 90S TO THE SOUTH. WITH THESE VALUES 
HEAT INDEX READINGS SHOULD STAY BELOW HEAT ADVISORY CRITERIA.

TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY...EXPECT MUCH OF THE SAME WITH STATIONARY 
FRONT STILL LINGERING AROUND TO PRODUCE ISOLATED TO SCATTERED 
SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS AROUND THE AREA. LOWS WILL AGAIN BE IN THE 
70S AND HIGHS IN THE 90S.

UPPER LEVEL HIGH PRESSURE WILL BUILD OVER THE MIDSOUTH WEDNESDAY 
NIGHT THROUGH THE BEGINNING OF THE WEEKEND. THIS WILL HELP TO 
DIMINISH RAIN CHANCES TO NONE TO ISOLATED AT MOST. TEMPERATURES WILL 
STAY MUCH AS THE SAME.

BY SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH THE END OF THE FORECAST PERIOD...AN UPPER 
LEVEL TROUGH WILL BRING SLIGHTLY BETTER CHANCES FOR RAIN TO THE 
AREA. EXPECT A LITTLE MORE CLOUD COVER AROUND WHICH MAY HELP 
TEMPERATURES BE A TAD COOLER.

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.

KRM

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 230317
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
1015 PM CDT MON AUG 22 2005

.DISCUSSION...00Z UPPER AIR ANALYSIS PLACES LOW PRESSURE OVER THE 
CANADIAN MARITIMES WITH A LONGWAVE TROUGH EXTENDING THROUGH 
MISSOURI. AT THE SURFACE...QUASI-STATIONARY BOUNDARY IS PLACED 
ACROSS MISSOURI. MAIN FORECAST CONCERN FOR OVERNIGHT IS CONVECTIVE 
POTENTIAL. 

REGIONAL RADAR TRENDS OVER THE PAST FEW HOURS HAVE SHOWN CONVECTION 
HAVING A HARD TIME SUSTAINING ITSELF ACROSS THE MID SOUTH WITH LESS 
THAN IDEAL MOISTURE AT 850 MB. IN ADDITION...INFRARED SATELLITE HAS 
SHOWN WARMING CLOUD TOPS ALONG WITH A DECREASE IN LIGHTNING ACROSS 
THE LOWER MISSISSIPPI VALLEY WITH THE EXCEPTION ACROSS SOUTH CENTRAL 
KANSAS WHERE SOME CONVECTION OVER THE PAST HOUR HAS DEVELOPED. 
CURRENT THINKING IS THAT THIS FEATURE WILL MOVE ACROSS THE MID SOUTH 
OVERNIGHT AND WEAKEN AS IT ENTERS A LESS THAN FAVORABLE AIR MASS.  
ATMOSPHERE WILL REMAIN UNSTABLE WITH 2000 J/KG OF MOST UNSTABLE CAPE 
AND LI/S AROUND -4. HOWEVER WITH CONVECTIVE INHIBITION 
PRESENT...POOR 850-700 MB/700-500 MB LAYER LAPSE RATES BELOW 6 
C/KM...AND CURRENT CONVECTIVE TRENDS DO NOT JUSTIFY MORE THAN 
SCATTERED POPS AT THIS TIME FOR OVERNIGHT AND ON TUESDAY. WILL ALSO 
ADJUST TEMPERATURES BASED ON CURRENT TRENDS.    

UPDATED GRIDS WILL BE PUBLISHED SHORTLY.

CJC

.PREV DISCUSSION...ISSUED 302 PM CDT MON AUG 22 2005...
CONVECTION DIED OUT ACROSS THE NORTHERN HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA. 
ACROSS NORTHERN MISSISSIPPI THUNDERSTORMS FORMED NEAR THE OUTFLOW 
BOUNDARY FROM EARLIER STORMS TO THE NORTH. TEMPERATURES ACROSS PARTS 
OF NORTH MISSISSIPPI AND WEST TENNESSEE HAVE REACHED THE MID 90S 
WHERE HEAT INDICES WERE AT LEAST 105 DEGREES. THE HEAT ADVISORY WILL 
CONTINUE THROUGH 7 PM TONIGHT BEFORE EXPIRING.

THE LATEST WATER VAPOR IMAGERY INDICATES A SERIES OF SHORTWAVES THE 
MIDSOUTH WILL HAVE TO CONTEND WITH. FEEL THAT THE LATEST GFS/NAM 
MODELS SUPPORT RAIN CHANCES INCREASING TONIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY. 
THE DISTURBANCE ASSOCIATED WITH THE CONVECTION THAT DISSIPATED OVER 
OKLAHOMA EARLY THIS MORNING WILL MOVE ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA 
TONIGHT. MUCH LIKE LAST NIGHT...THIS WILL SPARK LIKELY CHANCES FOR 
THUNDERSTORMS FOR MOST AREAS AND HIGH CHANCES FOR THE REMAINDER OF  
THE AREA. WE WILL CONTINUE THE CHANCE TO LIKELY CHANCES OF  
THUNDERSTORMS TOMORROW. THIS IS MAINLY FOR WHATEVER SHOWERS ARE 
STILL AROUND BY MORNING. ADDITIONAL STORMS MAY FIRE AGAIN IN THE 
AFTERNOON AND PERSIST INTO THE EVENING HOURS. THE ASSOCIATED CLOUD 
COVER AND SOME WET GROUND SHOULD KEEP TEMPERATURES IN CHECK WITH 
HEAT INDEX VALUES WELL BELOW DANGEROUS LEVELS.

BY WEDNESDAY...THE UPPER LEVEL HIGH WILL TAKE OVER AGAIN AS THE 
MIDSOUTH MISSES OUT ON A LATE SUMMER FRONTAL PASSAGE. WILL HAVE TO 
KEEP EYES ON ANY BOUNDARIES FROM OUTFLOW TUESDAY NIGHT. OBVIOUSLY 
NOT EASY TO DO RIGHT NOW...BUT SOME MESOSCALE PHENOMENA WILL HAVE A 
CHANCE TO SPARK SOME CONVECTION ESPECIALLY ACROSS NORTHERN 
MISSISSIPPI. 

RAIN CHANCES DIMINISH AND WARM TEMPERATURES WILL PERSIST FROM 
THURSDAY THROUGH THE WEEKEND.

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES
AR...HEAT ADVISORY CONTINUES THROUGH 7PM FOR EAST-CENTRAL
     ARKANSAS.
MO...NONE.
MS...HEAT ADVISORY CONTINUES THROUGH 7PM FOR ALL OF NORTH
     MISSISSIPPI.
TN...HEAT ADVISORY CONTINUES THROUGH 7PM FOR THE SHELBY...
     FAYETTE...HARDEMAN...MCNAIRY...AND HARDIN COUNTIES.

$$

AC

1007 AM CDT MON AUG 22 2005

.DISCUSSION...
ONGOING CONVECTION ACROSS THE NORTHERN BOOTHEEL AND NORTHWEST 
TENNESSEE. EXTENSIVE CLOUD COVER ACROSS THE NORTHERN THIRD OF THE 
FORECAST AREA WILL LIKELY HOLD TOUGH THROUGH MUCH OF THE DAY. AN 
OUTFLOW BOUNDARY WAS MOVING INTO NORTHWESTERN SHELBY COUNTY AND 
EXTENDED NORTHEASTWARD TOWARD PARIS TN. ADDITIONAL SHOWERS WERE 
DEVELOPING OVER DYER AND GIBSON COUNTIES. THIS BOUNDARY MAY SERVE AS 
A FOCUS FOR ADDITIONAL DEVELOPMENT THIS AFTERNOON. PERHAPS THE 
MEMPHIS METRO AREA COULD GET SOME MUCH NEEDED RAINFALL...HOWEVER 
LITTLE MAY ACTUALLY FALL.

HAVE NOT TWEAKED TEMPERATURES FOR THIS AFTERNOON BUT HAVE NOTICED 
THAT CURRENT TEMPERATURES VS 24 HOURS AGO ARE ANYWHERE FROM 4 TO 11 
DEGREES LOWER. IN ADDITION DEW POINTS ARE ALSO LOWER THAN 
YESTERDAY/S VALUES. THIS TREND WILL PROBABLY PLAY THROUGH THE DAY 
AND MAXIMUM TEMPERATURES MAY BE A FEW DEGREES COOLER THAN CURRENT 
FORECAST ACROSS THE SOUTH AND PERHAPS 5 DEGREES COOLER ACROSS THE 
NORTH. WILL CONTINUE HEAT ADVISORY FOR SOUTHERN HALF OF THE FORECAST 
AREA.  

&&

     ARKANSAS.

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 212035
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
335 PM CDT SUN AUG 21 2005

.DISCUSSION...

A BROAD UPPER RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE REMAINS ENTRENCHED OVER THE MID-
SOUTH THIS AFTERNOON. VERY HOT TEMPERATURES AND HIGH HUMIDITY
LEVELS ONCE AGAIN EXIST THIS AFTERNOON...WITH MANY LOCATIONS ONCE
AGAIN AROUND 100 DEGREES AND HEAT INDICES NEAR 110 DEGREES AT MANY
LOCATIONS. THE INTENSE HEATING ALONG WITH A MOIST AIRMASS HAS
ALLOWED THE THERMODYNAMIC ENVIRONMENT TO BECOME FAVORABLE FOR
THUNDERSTORM DEVELOPMENT ACROSS THE AREA...ESPECIALLY OVER NORTH
MISSISSIPPI. LAPS DATA INDICATING SB-CAPES AROUND 4000 J/KG AND
LIS TO -6. ALTHOUGH ATMOSPHERIC WINDS AND SHEAR ARE WEAK...THE
UNSTABLE THERMODYNAMIC ENVIRONMENT WILL SUPPORT ISOLATED PULSE
SEVERE THUNDERSTORMS THROUGH THIS EVENING. THE PRIMARY THREAT
FROM ANY SEVERE STORM THAT DEVELOPS WILL BE DAMAGING WINDS. ALREADY
REPORTS OF WIND DAMAGE FROM CHICKASAW COUNTY. THUNDERSTORM ACTIVITY
SHOULD BEGIN TO DIMINISH AS WELL AS THE ATTENDANT SEVERE THREAT
AFTER SUNSET. TEMPERATURES IN AREAS OUTSIDE OF THUNDERSTORMS WILL
REMAIN VERY HOT.

THE LATEST SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A WEAK STATIONARY FRONT STRETCHED
ACROSS EXTREME NORTHERN COUNTIES OF THE FORECAST AREA...WITH A
STRONGER FRONT STRETCHED ACROSS CENTRAL ILLINOIS...NORTHERN
MISSOURI...BACK INTO NEBRASKA. THE OPERATIONAL MODELS HAVE DONE A
RATHER POOR JOB WITH FORECASTING THE SOUTHWARD PROGRESSION OF THE
FRONTS. LOOKING AT THE LATEST UPPER AIR DATA AND ACTUAL TRENDS
TODAY...NOW BELIEVE THAT THE FRONT WILL HAVE A REALLY TOUGH TIME
MAKING PROGRESS SOUTH THROUGH OUR FORECAST AREA...AS THE UPPER FLOW
HAS BECOME ALIGNED WITH THE FRONTAL BOUNDARIES AND THE UPPER TROUGH
NOW MOVING ACROSS THE GREAT LAKES HAS NOT BECOME AS AMPLIFIED AS
PREVIOUSLY THOUGHT. THERE WILL STILL BE SOME AMPLIFICATION OF THE
UPPER TROUGH AS A SHORTWAVE DIGS THROUGH THE BASE OF THE TROUGH
INTO THE MID ATLANTIC REGION AND THE UPPER RIDGE BUILDS OVER THE
INTER-MOUNTAIN WEST IN RESPONSE TO THE DIGGING TROUGH. BUT STILL
THINK THAT THE RIDGE OVER THE AREA WILL HOLD STRONG ENOUGH TO SHUNT
THE MAJORITY OF THE COOLER AND DRIER AIR TO OUR NORTHEAST.

UNFORTIONATELY THIS MEANS MORE HOT AND HUMID WEATHER TO CONTINUE
THROUGH THE WEEK. THINK THAT TEMPERATURES WILL BE A FEW DEGREES
COOLER TOMORROW AS COMPARED TO TODAY AS LIGHT NORTHEAST WINDS TRY
AND FILTER SLIGHTLY COOLER AIRMASS SOUTHWARD. BUT STILL VERY HUMID
CONDITIONS...AND THIS COMBINED WITH TEMPERATURES STILL IN THE MID
90S IN THE SOUTH HALF OF THE AREA...BELIEVE HEAT INDICES OVER THESE
AREAS WILL ONCE AGAIN REACH ABOVE 105 AND HAVE EXTENDED THE HEAT
ADVISORY THROUGH MONDAY OVER THESE AREAS. ALSO EXPECT OLD
CONVECTIVE OUTFLOW BOUNDARIES TO COMBINE WITH DAYTIME HEATING TO
PRODUCE MORE SCATTERED AFTERNOON THUNDERSTORMS (AGAIN SOME PULSE
SEVERE POSSIBLE) ON MONDAY AFTERNOON. MODELS SHOWING BULLS-EYE OF
QPF OVER THE AREA IN RESPONSE TO AN MCV OVER SOUTHWEST MISSOURI
TRYING TO MOVE SOUTHEAST. THINK THAT THIS FEATURE WILL STAY NORTH AND
WE WILL BE LEFT WITH PRIMARILY DIURNAL CONVECTION.

HOT AND HUMID WEATHER SHOULD CONTINUE THROUGH THE WEEK AS THE EASTERN
TROUGH DEPARTS AND UPPER RIDGING SLOWLY BUILDS OVERHEAD. THINK THAT
DAYTIME HEATING...OLD CONVECTIVE BOUNDARIES...AND PROXIMITY OF
SLOWLY SOUTHWARD MOVING FRONT WILL SUPPORT MORE SCATTERED
THUNDERSTORMS FOR TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY. FRONT SHOULD WASH OUT BY
THURSDAY AND WE WILL BE LEFT WITH DRY AND HOT WEATHER AND
DIMINISHED CHANCES FOR SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS.

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES
AR...HEAT ADVISORY CONTINUES THROUGH 7PM MONDAY FOR EAST-CENTRAL
     ARKANSAS...TO THE SOUTH OF INTERSTATE 40.
MO...NONE.
MS...HEAT ADVISORY CONTINUES THROUGH 7PM MONDAY FOR ALL OF NORTH
     MISSISSIPPI.
TN...HEAT ADVISORY CONTINUES THROUGH 7PM MONDAY FOR THE SOUTH HALF
     OF WEST TENNESSEE...TO THE SOUTH OF INTERSTATE 40.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
1042 AM CDT SUN AUG 21 2005

.DISCUSSION...

WEAK HIGH PRESSURE REMAINS IN PLACE OVER THE MID-SOUTH THIS
MORNING AND THIS HAS ALLOWED TEMPERATURES TO WARM AT A PACE SIMILAR
TO YESTERDAY ACROSS THE SOUTHERN TWO-THIRDS OF THE AREA.
TEMPERATURES ARE A FEW DEGREES COOLER ACROSS NORTHERN TIER
COUNTIES. SURFACE DEWPOINTS ARE ALSO HIGHER AREAWIDE THIS MORNING AS
COMPARED TO YESTERDAY.

IN THE UPPER LEVELS...A VERY WEAK SHORTWAVE TROUGH WAS NOTED ON
REGIONAL WATER VAPOR IMAGERY MOVING ACROSS EASTERN ARKANSAS INTO
WEST TENNESSEE AND NORTH MISSISSIPPI THIS MORNING. ALSO...VISIBLE
SATELLITE IMAGERY SHOWING CONVECTIVE CLOUD COVER OVER THESE AREAS
IN RESPONSE TO THIS FEATURE. DUE TO THE SUBTLE NATURE OF THIS SYSTEM
AND NO SIGNIFICANT LOW LEVEL FEATURES PRESENT TO FOCUS CONVECTION...
THINK THAT CURRENT FORECAST OF LOW END CHANCE POPS LOOKS GOOD.
SHOULD SEE A BIT OF AN INCREASE IN SCATTERED THUNDERSTORM COVERAGE
LATER TODAY...AS REGIONAL 12Z SOUNDINGS SHOW A MOIST AND UNCAPPED
ENVIRONMENT...AND CONTINUED DAYTIME HEATING SHOULD LEAD TO
INCREASINGLY UNSTABLE CONDITIONS.

SINCE TEMPERATURES AND HUMIDITY LEVELS ARE ON TRACK TO PRODUCE HEAT
INDICES BETWEEN 105-110 DEGREES ACROSS MOST OF THE MID-SOUTH AGAIN
THIS AFTERNOON...HAVE DECIDED TO EXPAND THE CURRENT HEAT ADVISORY
FURTHER NORTH TO INCLUDE ALL BUT OUR FAR NORTHERN TIER COUNTIES. IN
ADDITION...DUE TO THE SCATTERED NATURE OF ANY CONVECTION THAT
DEVELOPS...THIS SHOULD NOT HINDER HEATING ACROSS MOST OF THE
ADVISORY AREA.

UPDATED ZONES...GRIDS...AND HEADLINES OUT SHORTLY.

&&

     ARKANSAS...TO THE SOUTH OF A JONESBORO TO BLYTHEVILLE LINE
     THROUGH 7PM SUNDAY.

     THROUGH 7PM SUNDAY.
TN...HEAT ADVISORY EXPANDED TO INCLUDE ALL OF WEST TENNESSEE...TO THE
     SOUTH OF A DYERSBURG TO HUNTINGDON LINE THROUGH 7PM SUNDAY.

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 202029
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
329 PM CDT SAT AUG 20 2005

.DISCUSSION...

HIGH PRESSURE REMAINS ENTRENCHED OVER MOST OF THE MID-SOUTH THIS
AFTERNOON. THE EXCEPTION IS ACROSS NORTHERN PORTIONS OF THE
FORECAST AREA WHERE A PRE-FRONTAL / CONVECTIVE OUTFLOW BOUNDARY IS
ADVANCING SLOWLY SOUTHWARD FROM SOUTHERN MISSOURI AND KENTUCKY.
EXPECT SCATTERED THUNDERSTORMS TO CONTINUE TO DEVELOP SOUTHWARD
INTO NORTHERN COUNTIES FOR THE REMAINDER OF THE AFTERNOON AND INTO
TONIGHT. ELSEWHERE...VERY ISOLATED SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS HAVE
DEVELOPED AS A RESULT OF INTENSE HEATING AND ABUNDANT LOW LEVEL
MOISTURE. THESE SHOWERS AND STORMS SHOULD TEND TO DISSIPATE WITH
THE LOSS OF DAYTIME HEATING. VERY HOT TEMPERATURES AROUND 100
DEGREES IN MOST AREAS...COMBINED WITH DEWPOINTS IN THE LOW 70S WILL
KEEP HEAT INDICES BETWEEN 105-110 DEGREES THIS EVENING.

THE BOUNDARY STRETCHED JUST TO THE NORTH OF THE FORECAST AREA THIS
AFTERNOON WILL CONTINUE TO SLOWLY PUSH SOUTHWARD THIS EVENING. AS
THIS OCCURS EXPECT CHANCES FOR SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS TO
CONTINUE ACROSS THE NORTHERN HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA.
THERMODYNAMIC PARAMETERS (CAPES 2500-3000 J/KG / LI -2 TO -4)
SUGGEST THAT THUNDERSTORMS THAT DEVELOP OVER NORTHERN COUNTIES THIS
EVENING MAY BECOME PULSE SEVERE...WITH ISOLATED DAMAGING WIND GUSTS
BEING THE PRIMARY THREAT. ANY SEVERE THREAT WILL DIMINISH LATER
THIS EVENING WITH THE LOSS OF DAYTIME HEATING. WIDESPREAD SEVERE
WEATHER IS NOT ANTICIPATED AT THIS POINT...AS ENVIRONMENTAL WINDS
(FROM REGIONAL PROFILERS) ARE NOT VERY STRONG AND SHEAR PROFILES
REMAIN WEAK.

ON SUNDAY...THE PRE-FRONTAL BOUNDARY SHOULD SINK FURTHER SOUTH
ACROSS OUR AREA AS THE UPPER TROUGH OVER THE GREAT LAKES TODAY
BECOMES MORE AMPLIFIED OVER THE EASTERN STATES AS UPPER RIDGING
BUILDS OUT WEST. THIS PRE-FRONTAL BOUNDARY...ALONG WITH CONVECTIVE
OUTFLOW BOUNDARIES WILL COMBINE WITH SURFACE HEATING...LOW LEVEL
MOISTURE...AND AN UNCAPPED ATMOSPHERE TO TRIGGER SCATTERED SHOWERS
AND THUNDERSTORMS AREAWIDE. THE BEST CHANCES WILL BE ACROSS
THE NORTHERN HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA...CLOSEST TO THE PRE-FRONTAL
BOUNDARY. AS FOR TEMPERATURES...THEY WILL ONCE AGAIN BE HOT...
ESPECIALLY ACROSS THE SOUTHERN HALF OF THE REGION...WHERE CONVECTIVE
COVERAGE WILL BE LESS TO DISRUPT HEATING. THINK THAT HEAT AND
HUMIDITY COMBINATIONS WILL ALLOW HEAT INDICES TO EXCEED 105 DEGREES
ACROSS SOUTHERN AREAS AND WILL LET EXTENDED HEAT ADVISORY CONTINUE
OVER THESE AREAS THROUGH SUNDAY EVENING. FURTHER NORTH...ENOUGH
THUNDERSTORM ACTIVITY AND CONVECTIVE CLOUD COVER SHOULD KEEP HEAT
INDICES BELOW ADVISORY CRITERIA.

THE SYNOPTIC COLD FRONT...WITH COOLER AND MUCH LOWER HUMIDITY
LEVELS IS CURRENTLY STRETCHED ACROSS THE MIDWEST AND CENTRAL PLAINS
STATES THIS AFTERNOON WILL EVENTUALLY MOVE ACROSS THE MID-SOUTH
SUNDAY NIGHT AND MONDAY. OPERATIONAL MODELS HAVE SLOWED THE
MOVEMENT OF THE FRONTAL BOUNDARY DOWN AND LOOKING AT CURRENT UPPER
AIR DATA...TEND TO AGREE WITH THE SLOW DOWN. HAVE ADDED POPS IN FOR
SUNDAY NIGHT AREAWIDE AND ACROSS THE SOUTHERN HALF OF THE REGION ON
MONDAY.

CANADIAN HIGH PRESSURE WILL BUILD SOUTH INTO THE REGION FOR TUESDAY
THROUGH THURSDAY WITH DRY WEATHER...COOLER TEMPERATURES...AND MUCH
LOWER HUMIDITIES. THIS HIGH PRESSURE SYSTEM WILL SLIDE EAST BY THE
END OF THE WEEK ALLOWING FOR MODERATING TEMPERATURES AND HUMIDITY
LEVELS. AN UPPER RIDGE WILL ALSO BUILD BY MID WEEK BUT BEGIN TO
AGAIN BREAK DOWN BY THE END OF NEXT WEEK AND WEEKEND. THIS WILL
ALLOW FOR ISOLATED CHANCES FOR SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS TO AGAIN
RETURN FOR NEXT WEEKEND.

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES
AR...HEAT ADVISORY EXTENDED THROUGH 7PM SUNDAY FOR PORTIONS OF
     NORTHEAST ARKANSAS...SOUTH OF INTERSTATE 40.
MO...NONE.
MS...HEAT ADVISORY EXTENDED THROUGH 7PM SUNDAY FOR MOST OF NORTHERN
     MISSISSIPPI. MISSISSIPPI COUNTIES NOT INCLUDED IN THE HEAT
     ADVISORY INCLUDE ALCORN...PRENTISS...AND TISHOMINGO. ALL OTHER
     COUNTIES REMAIN UNDER THE ADVISORY.
TN...HEAT ADVISORY EXTENDED THROUGH 7PM SUNDAY FOR SHELBY AND FAYETTE
     COUNTIES IN SOUTHWEST TENNESSEE.

FXUS64 KMEG 201552
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
1052 AM CDT SAT AUG 20 2005

.DISCUSSION...

HIGH PRESSURE ONCE AGAIN IN CONTROL OF THE MID-SOUTHS WEATHER THIS
MORNING. TEMPERATURES ARE QUICKLY WARMING TO NEAR OR ABOVE 90
DEGREES AS OF 15Z...AND ANOTHER HOT AND HUMID DAY IS IN STORE FOR
THE ENTIRE AREA. PLAN TO KEEP HEAT ADVISORY IN PLACE ACROSS THE
ENTIRE AREA TODAY...AS HIGH TEMPERATURES IN THE UPPER 90S TO AROUND
100 COMBINED WITH DEWPOINTS IN THE 70S WILL AGAIN SUPPORT HEAT
INDICES BETWEEN 105 AND 110 DEGREES.

AS FOR THUNDERSTORM CHANCES...A WEAKENING CONVECTIVE OUTFLOW
BOUNDARY FROM OVERNIGHT STORMS IN MISSOURI IS CURRENTLY MOVING
SOUTHWARD ACROSS NORTHEAST ARKANSAS AND NORTHWEST TENNESSEE. IT
APPEARS THAT THE BOUNDARY HAS WEAKENED SIGNIFICANTLY AS IT
CONTINUES TO MOVE UNDER THE UPPER RIDGE...AND EARLIER STRATOCU
ASSOCIATED WITH THE BOUNDARY HAS FIZZLED. THINK THAT ALTHOUGH
SUBSIDENCE UNDER THE UPPER RIDGE IS WEAK...THAT THE BOUNDARY WILL
BE DISSIPATED AND LACK THE ABILITY TO FORCE ANY ADDITIONAL
CONVECTION.

THINK THAT THUNDERSTORM DEVELOPMENT WILL BE POSSIBLE LATER TODAY
ACROSS NORTHERN ZONES...AS SUBSIDENCE AND ASSOCIATED CAPPING IS
WEAK AND ADDITIONAL THUNDERSTORM OUTFLOWS FROM ONGOING CONVECTION
ACROSS SOUTHWEST MISSOURI PUSHES SOUTHEAST INTO THESE AREAS. PLAN
TO LEAVE CURRENT SLIGHT CHANCE/LOW END CHANCE POPS (20%-30%) IN
PLACE FOR NOW. ELSEWHERE...ALTHOUGH REGIONAL 12Z SOUNDINGS SHOW
LITTLE IN THE WAY OF ATMOSPHERIC CAPPING...THERE WILL BE NO
SIGNIFICANT FEATURES TO FORCE CONVECTION. THEREFORE THUNDERSTORM
CHANCES WILL BE VERY LOW (<15% CHANCES).

ALTHOUGH CURRENT FORECAST LOOKS IN GOOD SHAPE...WILL DO A QUICK
UPDATE TO REMOVE FALLING TEMPERATURE WORDING FROM CURRENT ZONES.
UPDATE OUT SHORTLY.

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES
AR...HEAT ADVISORY IN EFFECT FOR ALL OF NORTHEAST ARKANSAS THROUGH
     7PM THIS EVENING. HEAT ADVISORY EXTENDED THROUGH 7PM SUNDAY FOR
     PORTIONS OF NORTHEAST ARKANSAS...SOUTH OF INTERSTATE 40.
MO...HEAT ADVISORY IN EFFECT THROUGH 7PM THIS EVENING.
MS...HEAT ADVISORY IN EFFECT FOR ALL OF MISSISSIPPI THROUGH 7PM THIS
     EVENING. HEAT ADVISORY EXTENDED THROUGH 7PM SUNDAY FOR MOST OF
     MISSISSIPPI...EXCEPT FOR ALCORN...PRENTISS...AND TISHOMINGO
     COUNTIES.
TN...HEAT ADVISORY IN EFFECT FOR ALL OF WEST TENNESSEE THROUGH
     7PM THIS EVENING. HEAT ADVISORY EXTENDED THROUGH 7PM SUNDAY FOR
     SHELBY AND FAYETTE COUNTIES.

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 191945
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
245 PM CDT FRI AUG 19 2005

.DISCUSSION...

HOT AND VERY UNCOMFORTABLE WEATHER CONTINUES ACROSS THE MID-SOUTH
AGAIN THIS AFTERNOON. TEMPERATURES AREAWIDE ARE IN THE UPPER 90S
WITH SOME PLACES NEARING 100 DEGREES AT THIS HOUR. WOULD NOT BE
SURPRISED TO SEE A FEW LOCATIONS MAINLY ALONG OR WEST OF THE
MISSISSIPPI RIVER EXCEEDING THE CENTURY MARK. HEAT INDICES WILL
CONTINUE TO RANGE BETWEEN 105 AND 110 DEGREES INTO THIS EVENING. VERY
ISOLATED SHOWERS (<20% COVERAGE) HAVE DEVELOPED OVER AREAS SOUTH OF
TUPELO...WHERE DEEPER MOISTURE EXISTS...BUT HIGH PRESSURE IS
SUPPRESSING THE DEVELOPMENT OF MOST ACTIVITY. EXPECT HOT AND HUMID
CONDITIONS TO CONTINUE THROUGH THIS EVENING.

SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE OVER THE SOUTHEAST U.S. WILL SLOWLY MOVE SOUTH
INTO THE GULF OF MEXICO THROUGH SATURDAY AS UPPER LEVEL RIDGING
DOMINATES OVER THE AREA. THIS WILL LEAD TO ONE MORE HOT AND HUMID
DAY OVER THE MID-SOUTH ON SATURDAY...WITH A 595 UPPER HIGH OVERHEAD
AND 850 MB TEMPERATURES AROUND 22C AREAWIDE. THIS MEANS HIGH
TEMPERATURES WILL ONCE AGAIN REACH INTO THE MID TO UPPER 90S. THIS
COMBINED WITH DEWPOINTS IN THE LOW TO MID 70S...WILL ALLOW HEAT
INDICES TO ONCE AGAIN RANGE BETWEEN 105 AND 110 DEGREES...WHICH
JUSTIFIES KEEPING THE HEAT ADVISORY IN PLACE THROUGH SATURDAY
AREAWIDE.

AN UPPER LEVEL TROUGH MOVING INTO THE NORTHERN PLAINS STATES THIS
AFTERNOON WILL CONTINUE TO MOVE EAST THROUGH THE WEEKEND. A
SHORTWAVE IMPULSE WILL DIVE SOUTHEAST OUT OF CANADA...ACROSS THE
GREAT LAKES REGION AND INTO THE MID-ATLANTIC REGION THROUGH SUNDAY...
HELPING THE UPPER FLOW TO AMPLIFY AND THE UPPER TROUGH TO DIG ACROSS
THE EASTERN STATES. AS THE UPPER TROUGH AMPLIFIES...THE UPPER FLOW
OVER OUR AREA WILL PROGRESSIVELY BECOME NORTHWESTERLY AND PUSH A
STRONG COLD FRONT ACROSS OUR AREA SATURDAY NIGHT AND SUNDAY. JUST
ENOUGH DEEP MOISTURE IS EXPECTED ALONG THE FRONT TO PRODUCE
SCATTERED SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS AS IT MOVES THROUGH. ALTHOUGH
WITH WEAK SURFACE CONVERGENCE AND MOST OF THE UPPER LEVEL SUPPORT
REMAINING TO OUR NORTH...DO NOT EXPECT WIDESPREAD THUNDERSTORM
COVERAGE. HAVE ADDED 20%-30% POPS AREAWIDE TO ACCOUNT FOR ACTIVITY
ASSOCIATED WITH THE FRONTAL PASSAGE LATE SATURDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH
SUNDAY.

SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE WILL FOLLOW BEHIND THE FRONT FOR SUNDAY NIGHT
INTO NEXT WEEK...USHERING IN COOLER TEMPERATURES AND MUCH LOWER
HUMIDITY LEVELS. VERY PLEASANT WEATHER WILL PERSIST FOR MONDAY
THROUGH WEDNESDAY...WITH SOME MODERATION IN TEMPERATURES AND
HUMIDITY LEVELS BY THE END OF NEXT WEEK AS SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE
SLIDES EAST. THE BAD NEWS WILL BE THE CONTINUED DRY CONDITIONS
THROUGH THE EXTENDED PERIOD. THIS WILL ALLOW FOR A WORSENING AND
EXPANSION OF THE DROUGHT CONDITIONS THAT CONTINUE TO PLAGUE
PORTIONS OF THE AREA.

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES
AR...HEAT ADVISORY IN EFFECT THROUGH 7PM SATURDAY.
MO...HEAT ADVISORY IN EFFECT THROUGH 7PM SATURDAY.
MS...HEAT ADVISORY IN EFFECT THROUGH 7PM SATURDAY.
TN...HEAT ADVISORY IN EFFECT THROUGH 7PM SATURDAY.

$$

JLH

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 191621
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
1121 AM CDT FRI AUG 19 2005

.DISCUSSION...

HIGH PRESSURE BOTH AT THE SURFACE AND UPPER LEVELS OF THE ATMOSPHERE
OVER THE MID-SOUTH THIS MORNING. SURFACE OBSERVATIONS FROM 15Z
SHOWING TEMPERATURES ALREADY NEARING OR AT 90 DEGREES ALONG WITH
DEWPOINTS RUNNING IN THE LOW TO MID 70S. IN ADDITION...HEAT INDICES
ALREADY IN THE UPPER 90S TO NEAR 100. THE PRIMARY QUESTIONS FOR
THIS AFTERNOONS FORECAST IS HOW HIGH WILL TEMPERATURES AND HEAT
INDICES GET AND WHERE ISOLATED THUNDERSTORMS MAY DEVELOP?

AS FOR THE HEAT...THINK THAT SINCE TEMPERATURES AND DEWPOINTS WERE
HIGH ENOUGH YESTERDAY TO REACH ADVISORY CRITERIA...THAT WITH
TEMPERATURES RUNNING A FEW DEGREES HIGHER THAN AT THIS POINT
YESTERDAY AND WITH SIMILAR DEWPOINTS...SHOULD HAVE NO PROBLEMS
REACHING HEAT ADVISORY CRITERIA AT MOST LOCATIONS.

AS FOR THUNDERSTORM POTENTIAL...BELIEVE THAT THE BEST CHANCES...AND
ISOLATED COVERAGE AT BEST...WILL BE ACROSS EXTREME NORTHERN AND
EXTREME SOUTHERN COUNTIES IN THE FORECAST AREA. FOR NORTHERN AREAS...
THERE IS AN OLD CONVECTIVE OUTFLOW BOUNDARY (AS ANALYZED BY REGIONAL
VISIBLE SATELLITE AND KPAH RADAR) STRETCHED ACROSS SOUTHERN
KENTUCKY AND MISSOURI. THIS BOUNDARY COMBINED WITH CONTINUED DAYTIME
HEATING AND SUFFICIENT LOW LEVEL MOISTURE MAY LEAD TO ISOLATED
THUNDERSTORM DEVELOPMENT LATER TODAY. FOR SOUTHERN AREAS...THERE
APPEARS TO BE SLIGHTLY DEEPER MOISTURE IN PLACE AS NOTED FROM WATER
VAPOR IMAGERY. THIS COMBINED WITH DAYTIME HEATING MAY ALSO LEAD TO
THE DEVELOPMENT OF ISOLATED THUNDERSTORMS. ALL CHANCES FOR
THUNDERSTORMS WILL REMAIN AT OR BELOW 20% ACROSS THESE AREAS...SO
NOT EXPECTING MUCH RELIEF FROM THE HEAT...EVEN IN AREAS THAT GET
THUNDER.

HAVE UPDATED THE GRIDS AND ZONES TO REFLECT CURRENT THINKING.
UPDATES OUT SHORTLY.

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES
AR...HEAT ADVISORY IN EFFECT THROUGH 7PM SATURDAY.
MO...HEAT ADVISORY IN EFFECT THROUGH 7PM SATURDAY.
MS...HEAT ADVISORY IN EFFECT THROUGH 7PM SATURDAY.
TN...HEAT ADVISORY IN EFFECT THROUGH 7PM SATURDAY.

$$

JLH

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
255 AM CDT FRI AUG 19 2005

.DISCUSSION...

A SURFACE HIGH OVER THE SOUTHEASTERN PART OF THE COUNTRY WILL
KEEP THE MIDSOUTH VERY HOT AND HUMID TODAY AND SATURDAY. A HEAT
ADVISORY WILL REMAIN IN EFFECT THROUGH 7 PM SATURDAY AS A RESULT.
HEAT INDICES OF 105 TO 110 DEGREES CAN BE EXPECTED.

SATURDAY NIGHT AND SUNDAY...A COLD FRONT WILL DROP SOUTH OUT OF
THE MIDWEST AND BREAK THIS SPELL OF STIFLING WEATHER. HIGHS WILL
ONLY GET UP INTO THE UPPER 80S SUNDAY INSTEAD OF UPPER 90S
CURRENTLY ON THE DOCKET. ON THE FLIP SIDE OF THE WEATHER
RECORDING...NOT MUCH RAIN IS EXPECTED WITH THE FRONT.

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 190203
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
903 CDT THU AUG 18 2005

.UPDATE...
EVENING CONVECTION HAS DIED OFF ACRS ERN SECTIONS OF THE FORECAST 
AREA. WL UPDATE TO REMOVE POPS. OTRW FORECAST ON TRACK WITH MOSTLY 
CLEAR SKIES AND WARM OVERNIGHT TEMPS.

SJM

.PREV DISCUSSION ISSUED AT 344 PM...

A VERY HOT AFTERNOON CONTINUES WITH TEMPERATURES RANGING FROM THE
MID TO UPPER 90S AREAWIDE...EXCEPT FOR THOSE ISOLATED AREAS WITH
THUNDERSTORMS. ISOLATED SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS ARE CONFINED TO
EASTERN AREAS THIS AFTERNOON WHERE ATMOSPHERIC MOISTURE IS DEEPER.
THESE STORMS ARE BEING DRIVEN BY THE DEEPER MOISTURE AND DAYTIME
HEATING AND MAY LINGER INTO THIS EVENING OVER THESE AREAS BEFORE
DISSIPATING AFTER SUNSET. SKIES SHOULD CLEAR OUT LATER THIS EVENING
WITH UNCOMFORTABLE TEMPERATURES AND HUMIDITY LEVELS CONTINUING
THROUGH THE NIGHT.

SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE WILL REMAIN ANCHORED OVER THE SOUTHEAST U.S.
THROUGH SATURDAY AS UPPER LEVEL RIDGING BUILDS AND PERSISTS OVER
THE REGION. THIS RIDGING SHOULD HELP TO CAP THE ATMOSPHERE
AND CONTINUE DRYING OUT THE ATMOSPHERE IN THE MID LEVELS. THIS WILL
PREVENT MOST AFTERNOON CONVECTION BOTH FRIDAY AND SATURDAY. LOW LEVEL
WINDS WILL REMAIN FROM THE SOUTHWEST AND LOW LEVEL MOISTURE SHOULD
REMAIN IN PLACE...WITH DEWPOINTS IN THE LOW TO MID 70S. VERY WARM 850
MB TEMPERATURES BETWEEN 20C AND 22C AREAWIDE WILL TRANSLATE TO
AFTERNOON TEMPERATURES IN THE MID TO UPPER 90S. WOULD NOT BE
SURPRISED TO SEE A FEW AREAS TOP THE CENTURY MARK...ESPECIALLY AREAS
ALONG AND WEST OF THE MISSISSIPPI RIVER. WITH THESE HOT TEMPERATURES
COMBINED WITH HIGH DEWPOINTS...FELT IT PRUDENT TO ISSUE A HEAT
ADVISORY AREAWIDE THROUGH SATURDAY EVENING. HEAT INDICES SHOULD RANGE
BETWEEN 105 AND 110 DEGREES ON FRIDAY AFTERNOON AND AROUND 105 ON
SATURDAY AFTERNOON. SO ALL IN ALL...A VERY HOT END TO THE WEEK AND
FIRST HALF OF THE WEEKEND.

THE HOT WEATHER WILL COME TO AN END SATURDAY NIGHT AS AN UPPER
LEVEL TROUGH CURRENTLY NOTED OVER THE NORTHERN ROCKIES DIGS EAST
SOUTHEAST ACROSS THE NORTHERN PLAINS AND INTO THE EASTERN HALF OF
THE U.S. THROUGH THE WEEKEND. THIS WILL HELP TO SEND A STRONG COLD
FRONT SOUTHEAST ACROSS THE MID-SOUTH SATURDAY NIGHT AND SUNDAY.
DEEP MOISTURE APPEARS LIMITED IN ADVANCE OF THE FRONT...BUT ISOLATED
SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS WILL BE POSSIBLE RIGHT ALONG THE FRONT SAT.
NIGHT ACROSS THE NORTHERN HALF OF THE AREA AND ON SUN. ACROSS NORTH
MISSISSIPPI.

BEHIND THE FRONT FOR LATER ON SUNDAY INTO THE FIRST HALF OF NEXT
WEEK...EXPECT A COOLER AND MUCH LESS HUMID AIRMASS TO ADVECT INTO
THE REGION. THIS WILL BRING A REFRESHING CHANGE FROM THE HOT WEATHER
PATTERN OF LATE...ALTHOUGH MORE DRY CONDITIONS WILL CONTINUE
THROUGH THIS PERIOD WHICH IS BAD NEWS FOR THE WORSENING DROUGHT
CONDITIONS CONTINUING TO EXPAND ACROSS THE AREA. SURFACE HIGH
PRESSURE WILL REMAIN IN PLACE OVER THE AREA EARLY NEXT WEEK BEFORE
SLOWLY MOVING EAST BY WEDNESDAY AND ALLOWING FOR A MODERATION IN
TEMPERATURES AND HUMIDITY LEVELS FOR WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY OF NEXT
WEEK.

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES
AR...HEAT ADVISORY IN EFFECT THROUGH 7PM SATURDAY.
MO...HEAT ADVISORY IN EFFECT THROUGH 7PM SATURDAY.
MS...HEAT ADVISORY IN EFFECT THROUGH 7PM SATURDAY.
TN...HEAT ADVISORY IN EFFECT THROUGH 7PM SATURDAY.

$$

JLH

FXUS64 KMEG 181512
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
1012 AM CDT THU AUG 18 2005

.DISCUSSION...

THE WEAKENING STATIONARY BOUNDARY THAT WAVERED ACROSS THE MID SOUTH
YESTERDAY HAS MOVED TO OUR NORTH AND DISSIPATED. A WEAK SHORTWAVE
TROUGH MOVING THROUGH THIS MORNING TRIGGERED CONVECTION OVER NORTHERN
PORTIONS EARLIER THIS MORNING AND THIS FEATURE CONTINUES TO MOVE EAST
WITH THE ONLY CONVECTION AT 15Z CONFINED TO EXTREME NORTHEAST
SECTIONS OF THE FORECAST AREA. THINK THAT THIS AREA OF ENHANCED
CONVECTION WILL CONTINUE EAST WITH THE DEPARTING SHORTWAVE.

SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE WILL CONTROL THE MID-SOUTH WEATHER THIS
AFTERNOON. PLENTY OF LOW LEVEL MOISTURE WILL LINGER ACROSS THE ENTIRE
REGION THROUGH THE DAY. DEEPER MOISTURE AS NOTED FROM REGIONAL WATER
VAPOR IMAGERY WILL STAY IN PLACE OVER SOUTHEASTERN PORTIONS OF THE
FORECAST AREA...WITH SOME MID LEVEL DRYING NOTED OVER NORTHWESTERN
AREAS. THIS AFTERNOON...NOT SEEING ANY SIGNIFICANT FOCUS FOR
CONVECTION AT THIS TIME. BUT WITH DEEPER MOISTURE REMAINING EAST...
COMBINED WITH CONTINUED DAYTIME HEATING...AND ONLY WEAK UPPER
RIDGING...PLAN TO KEEP LOW END CHANCE POPS OVER THESE AREAS. ALSO
PLAN TO LEAVE SLIGHT CHANCE POPS OVER AREAS ALONG AND WEST OF THE
MISSISSIPPI RIVER. AS FOR TEMPS...CURRENT FORECAST HAS A GOOD HANDLE
ON THE SITUATION...AS WELL AS ALL OTHER FORECAST PARAMETERS.

SLIGHT POP ADJUSTMENTS MADE TO THE GRIDS...BUT CURRENT ZONE FORECAST
REFLECTS CURRENT THINKING FOR THIS AFTERNOON...AND WILL MAKE NO
MORNING UPDATE TO THE ZONE FORECAST AT THIS TIME.

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 181014
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
514 AM CDT THU AUG 18 2005

.UPDATE...

UPDATED FORECAST FOR SUNRISE SURPRISE MOVING INTO WEST TN. REMOVED 
AFTERNOON WORDING.

.DISCUSSION...

SURFACE FRONT THAT HAD PROVIDED BETTER CHANCES FOR RAIN HAS LIFTED 
WELL NORTH OF THE AREA. SATELLITE AS OF 08Z SHOWS MAINLY CLEAR SKIES 
OVER THE REGION. WATER VAPOR STILL SHOWS FAIR AMOUNT OF DEEPER 
MOISTURE OVER THE AREA BUT DRIER MID LEVEL AIR ASSOCIATED WITH THE 
UPPER RIDGE IS GRADUALLY MOVING TOWARDS THE AREA.

SCATTERED AFTERNOON THUNDERSTORMS WILL ONCE AGAIN BE POSSIBLE TODAY. 
THESE STORMS SHOULD BE LESS NUMEROUS WITH THE FRONT OUT OF THE AREA. 
A WEAK NORTH/SOUTH ORIENTED SHORTWAVE THAT IS CURRENTLY OVER 
OKLAHOMA WILL ARRIVE INTO THE REGION THIS AFTERNOON. THIS COULD HELP 
FOCUS THUNDERSTORMS. RAIN CHANCES WILL BE SLIGHTLY BETTER WEST OF 
THE MS RIVER THIS AFTERNOON SINCE THE DEEPER MOISTURE WILL BE 
LINGERING THERE. SEVERE PARAMETERS ONCE AGAIN NOT SUPPORTIVE OF 
SEVERE WEATHER OR AT LEAST WIDESPREAD SEVERE WEATHER. UPPER RIDGE 
AND ASSOCIATED DRY 850-500MB AIR ON FRIDAY AND SATURDAY SHOULD KEEP 
THE AREA MAINLY DRY. 850 TEMPS WILL SLOWLY BE RISING OVER THE NEXT 
24 HOURS.  TEMPS SHOULD BE IN THE LOW TO MID 90S TODAY. BORDERLINE 
HEAT ADVISORY CRITERIA TODAY INTO SATURDAY. HEAT INDICIES WILL BE 
OVER 100 AND BE FLIRTING WITH 105 DURING THE AFTERNOON. WILL LARGELY 
DEPEND UPON HOW MUCH THE ATMOSPHERE MIXES DOWN DURING THE AFTERNOON. 
WITH THE EXPECTED HIGHS...WOULD HAVE TO HOLD 73 DEGREE DEW POINTS 
THIS AFTERNOON. WITH MID AND UPPER 90S LIKELY FRIDAY AND 
SATURDAY...ONLY NEED TO HOLD 71 DEGREE DEW POINTS TO REACH HEAT 
ADVISORY CRITERIA OF 105.

GFS AND NAM CONTINUE TO SPEED UP THE ARRIVAL OF THE NEXT COLD FRONT. 
NOW LOOKS LIKE LATE SATURDAY AFTERNOON INTO NORTHEAST ARKANSAS AND 
THE BOOTHEEL...SATURDAY NIGHT ELSEWHERE. DEEP MOISTURE ALONG THE 
FRONT IS NOT VERY IMPRESSIVE ON THE MODELS SO DO NOT EXPECT THERE TO 
BE MUCH COVERAGE WITH THE FRONT. THE MORE NOTICEABLE IMPACT OF THIS 
FRONT WILL BE THE TEMPS. THE GFS CONTINUES TO SHOW A GREATER 
AMPLIFICATION OF THE WESTERN RIDGE AND A RESULTING DEEPENING OF THE 
EASTERN TROUGH THAT THE MIDSOUTH WILL BE ON THE EDGE OF. IF THIS 
PANS OUT...THERE WILL ONLY BE A SLIGHT CHANCE OF THUNDERSTORMS OVER 
NORTH MS AS THE FRONT CLEARS THE REGION AND DIVES TOWARDS THE GULF 
COAST. SUNDAY WILL BE SLIGHTLY COOLER BUT LOWER DEW POINTS WILL BE 
ADVECTING INTO THE REGION. COULD HAVE A TASTE OF FALL EARLY TO MID 
NEXT WEEK WITH MEX GUIDANCE SHOWING HIGHS IN THE 80S AREAWIDE...LOWS 
IN THE LOW AND MID 60S AND DEW POINTS IN THE LOWER 60S. NO OTHER 
RAIN CHANCES IN THE EXTENDED WITH THE UPPER TROUGH PREVAILING AND 
PREVENTING ANY SIGNIFICANT SYSTEMS FROM IMPACTING THE REGION.

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.
&&

FXUS64 KMEG 180217
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
915 PM CDT WED AUG 17 2005

.UPDATE...
MOST OF THE CONVECTION HAS DISSIPATED WITH LOSS OF HEATING THIS 
EVENING. THERE ARE JUST A FEW STRAY SHOWERS LEFT AND THEY WILL 
DISSIPATE SOON. DOES NOT LOOK LIKE MUCH AROUND TO TRIGGER ANYTHING 
DURING THE REMAINDER OF THE NIGHT SO WL TAKE POPS DOWN TO 20 
PERCENT. TEMPS LOOK FINE. 

SJM

.PREV DISCUSSION ISSUED AT 130 PM...
NO REAL DEFINITION TO WHERE SURFACE FRONT IS LOCATED THIS
AFTERNOON. CONSIDERING IT TO BE A NON-FACTOR...AS MESOSCALE
FACTORS ARE ASSOCIATED WITH PRECIPITATION DEVELOPMENT THIS
AFTERNOON. DIURNAL CONVECTION IS SCATTERED ACROSS THE AREA...MOST
CONCENTRATED IN SE CORNER OF CWA. TEMPS IN MOST AREAS OUTSIDE OF
CONVECTION ARE IN THE UPPER 80S TO LOWER 90S.
&&

.SHORT TERM (THROUGH SATURDAY)...
TONIGHT...MESOSCALE INFLUENCES WILL DETERMINE CHANCE OF
PRECIPITATION. RADAR TRENDS AT MID-AFTERNOON SHOULD BE A GOOD
INDICATION OF AREAL COVERAGE FOR THE EARLY EVENING HOURS. PROBABLY
WILL GO WITH SCATTERED POPS...AREAL COVERAGE TERMS. MOST DIURNAL
CONVECTION SHOULD DIE OUT BY 03Z. CURRENT FORECAST CARRIES 20 POPS
AFTER THIS...AND WILL HOLD IN...JUST IN CASE ANOTHER MCV DEVELOPS
LATER THIS AFTERNOON. EXPECT SIMILAR CONDITIONS ON THURSDAY...WITH
A LITTLE LESS AREAL COVERAGE OF PRECIPITATION.

RIDGE BUILDS OVER AREA FOR FRIDAY AND SATURDAY. ENVIRONMENT LESS
CONDUCIVE FOR CONVECTION DUE TO WARM MID LEVEL TEMPERATURES. WHILE
ISOLATED CONVECTION COULD OCCUR...FEEL AREAL COVERAGE WILL BE TOO
LOW TO MENTION IN FORECAST.

TEMPERATURES...OUTSIDE OF RAIN COOLED AREAS...TEMPERATURES ARE
EXPECTED TO REMAIN ABOVE NORMAL THROUGH SATURDAY...WITH SATURDAY
BEING THE WARMEST DAY...MID AND UPPER 90S IN MANY AREAS. WITH
MODERATE HUMIDITIES...WE WILL BE BORDERLINE ON HEAT INDICES BOTH
FRIDAY AND SATURDAY. 
&&

.LONG TERM (AFTER SATURDAY)...
GFS AND ECMWF ARE IN AGREEMENT ON BRINGING COLD FRONT THROUGH THE
ENTIRE CWA DURING THE CALENDAR DAY SUNDAY. THIS FRONT WILL BRING A
TEMPORARY END TO THE HEAT OF THE PAST FEW WEEKS. IF THERE IS ANY
PRECIPITATION ASSOCIATED WITH THE FRONT...IT WOULD OCCUR SATURDAY
NIGHT INTO SUNDAY. THERE ARE SMALL CHANCES ALREADY IN THE
FORECAST...AND WILL LEAVE THEM THERE. MONDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY
WILL BE DRY. 

LOOKING AT 850 TEMPS AND BOUNDARY LAYER TEMPERATURES...HIGHS
MONDAY AND TUESDAY EXPECTED TO BE 10-15 DEGREES COOLER THAN ON
FRIDAY AND SATURDAY. TEMPERATURES WILL RETURN TO AROUND NORMAL FOR
LATE AUGUST ON WEDNESDAY.

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.
&&

$$

WAGNER








000 
FXUS64 KMEG 171830
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
130 PM CDT WED AUG 17 2005

.DISCUSSION...
NO REAL DEFINITION TO WHERE SURFACE FRONT IS LOCATED THIS
AFTERNOON. CONSIDERING IT TO BE A NON-FACTOR...AS MESOSCALE
FACTORS ARE ASSOCIATED WITH PRECIPITATION DEVELOPMENT THIS
AFTERNOON. DIURNAL CONVECTION IS SCATTERED ACROSS THE AREA...MOST
CONCENTRATED IN SE CORNER OF CWA. TEMPS IN MOST AREAS OUTSIDE OF
CONVECTION ARE IN THE UPPER 80S TO LOWER 90S.
&&

.SHORT TERM (THROUGH SATURDAY)...
TONIGHT...MESOSCALE INFLUENCES WILL DETERMINE CHANCE OF
PRECIPITATION. RADAR TRENDS AT MID-AFTERNOON SHOULD BE A GOOD
INDICATION OF AREAL COVERAGE FOR THE EARLY EVENING HOURS. PROBABLY
WILL GO WITH SCATTERED POPS...AREAL COVERAGE TERMS. MOST DIURNAL
CONVECTION SHOULD DIE OUT BY 03Z. CURRENT FORECAST CARRIES 20 POPS
AFTER THIS...AND WILL HOLD IN...JUST IN CASE ANOTHER MCV DEVELOPS
LATER THIS AFTERNOON. EXPECT SIMILAR CONDITIONS ON THURSDAY...WITH
A LITTLE LESS AREAL COVERAGE OF PRECIPITATION.

RIDGE BUILDS OVER AREA FOR FRIDAY AND SATURDAY. ENVIRONMENT LESS
CONDUCIVE FOR CONVECTION DUE TO WARM MID LEVEL TEMPERATURES. WHILE
ISOLATED CONVECTION COULD OCCUR...FEEL AREAL COVERAGE WILL BE TOO
LOW TO MENTION IN FORECAST.

TEMPERATURES...OUTSIDE OF RAIN COOLED AREAS...TEMPERATURES ARE
EXPECTED TO REMAIN ABOVE NORMAL THROUGH SATURDAY...WITH SATURDAY
BEING THE WARMEST DAY...MID AND UPPER 90S IN MANY AREAS. WITH
MODERATE HUMIDITIES...WE WILL BE BORDERLINE ON HEAT INDICES BOTH
FRIDAY AND SATURDAY. 
&&

.LONG TERM (AFTER SATURDAY)...
GFS AND ECMWF ARE IN AGREEMENT ON BRINGING COLD FRONT THROUGH THE
ENTIRE CWA DURING THE CALENDAR DAY SUNDAY. THIS FRONT WILL BRING A
TEMPORARY END TO THE HEAT OF THE PAST FEW WEEKS. IF THERE IS ANY
PRECIPITATION ASSOCIATED WITH THE FRONT...IT WOULD OCCUR SATURDAY
NIGHT INTO SUNDAY. THERE ARE SMALL CHANCES ALREADY IN THE
FORECAST...AND WILL LEAVE THEM THERE. MONDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY
WILL BE DRY. 

LOOKING AT 850 TEMPS AND BOUNDARY LAYER TEMPERATURES...HIGHS
MONDAY AND TUESDAY EXPECTED TO BE 10-15 DEGREES COOLER THAN ON
FRIDAY AND SATURDAY. TEMPERATURES WILL RETURN TO AROUND NORMAL FOR
LATE AUGUST ON WEDNESDAY.

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.
&&

$$

WAGNER






000 
FXUS64 KMEG 171450
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
950 AM CDT WED AUG 17 2005

.DISCUSSION...
SCATTERED SHOWERS ACROSS NORTH CENTRAL AND NORTHWEST ARKANSAS THIS
MORNING...MOVING TOWARD NORTHWEST SECTIONS OF OUR AREA. THERE HAVE
BEEN FEW...IF ANY...LIGHTNING STRIKES IN ARKANSAS THIS MORNING.

OBSERVATIONS DO NOT GIVE A CLEAR INDICATION OF WHERE FRONT IS
LOCATED THIS MORNING. SUSPECT IT IS NEAR...OR JUST NORTH OF MEMPHIS.
CLOUD COVER MUCH MORE EXTENSIVE NORTH OF INTERSTATE 40...AND THAT
IS WHERE ALL THE PRECIPITATION IS LOCATED. BOUNDARY EXPECTED TO MOVE
NORTHWARD THROUGH THURSDAY.

QUESTION OF THE DAY IS WHETHER CLOUD COVER OVER NORTHERN HALF OF CWA
WILL BREAK UP. SCATTERED THUNDERSTORMS WILL DEVELOP THIS AFTERNOON
ACROSS SOUTHERN HALF OF CWA. THAT IS ALREADY ACCOUNTED FOR IN
FORECAST. IF CLOUD COVER REMAINS OVER NORTH...THAT AREA SHOULD JUST
SEE SHOWERS. CLOUD COVER WILL ALSO DETERMINE HIGH TEMPERATURE
FORECAST. FORECAST HIGHS IN NORTH MAY BE TOO WARM...AND TOO COOL IN
THE SOUTH. WILL CONTINUE TO MONITOR.

WILL NEED AN UPDATE FOR MORNING WORDING...AT A MINIMUM. LIKELY TO
HOLD OFF ON UPDATE UNTIL ABOUT 1600Z OR SO.

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.

$$

WAGNER





000 
FXUS64 KMEG 170845
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
345 AM CDT WED AUG 17 2005

.DISCUSSION...

AN ILL-DEFINED STATIONARY FRONT IS ORIENTED EAST-WEST ACROSS THE 
REGION. VERY DIFFICULT TO PLACE THE FRONT EXACTLY DUE TO THE 
NUMEROUS SURFACE TROUGHS THAT ARE PRESENT AHEAD OF THE FRONT. RADAR 
HAS SHOWN A FEW ISOLATED SHOWERS POP UP ACROSS NORTHWEST MS THIS 
MORNING PROBABLY IN RESPONSE TO A WEAK DISTURBANCE WORKING ITS WAY 
ALONG THE FRONT. 

BOTH GFS AND NAM SHOW THE FRONT LIFTING NORTHWARD THIS AFTERNOON TO 
BE NEARLY OUT OF THE AREA BY 00Z. A GOOD DEAL OF 850-500MB MOISTURE 
PERSISTS ACROSS THE REGION. EXPECT CONVECTION ALL DAY AS MINOR 
DISTURBANCES MOVE THEIR WAY ALONG THE FRONT. CONVECTION SHOULD 
BECOME MORE PREVALENT THIS AFTERNOON AS DIURNAL HEATING BECOMES A 
FACTOR. THERE DOES NOT APPEAR TO BE ANY SIGNIFICANT SYSTEMS MOVING 
ACROSS THE AREA SO EXPECT CONVECTION TO REMAIN SCATTERED. 
INSTABILITY IS SIMILAR TO YESTERDAY SO NOT EXPECTING ANY OF THESE 
STORMS TO BECOME DAMAGING TODAY. HAVE FORECASTED HIGHS TO BE WARMER 
THAN MAV WITH CONDITIONS EXPECTED TO BE PARTLY SUNNY THROUGH THE 
MORNING. A FEW MORE CLOUDS THIS AFTERNOON COMBINED AND COOLER 850 
TEMPS OF AROUND +18 SHOULD TRANSLATE INTO TEMPS THAT ARE ABOUT 3 OR 
4 DEGREES COOLER THAN YESTERDAY.

CONVECTION SHOULD DIMINISH THIS EVENING DUE TO THE LOSS OF DAYTIME 
HEATING. WITH THE FRONT EXPECTED TO BE WELL NORTH OF THE 
AREA...CONVECTION SHOULD BE LIMITED TO THE EVENING HOURS. 850-500MB 
MOISTURE LOOKS PRETTY DESCENT ON THURSDAY STILL SO EXPECT SCATTERED 
THUNDERSTORMS TO REDEVELOP IN THE AFTERNOON. TEMPS WILL BE GRADUALLY 
INCREASING OVER THE NEXT COUPLE DAYS AS WINDS TURN TOWARDS THE SOUTH 
AND SOUTHWEST AND THE UPPER RIDGE BUILDS BACK OVER THE AREA.

DRIER AIR WILL BE WORKING IN WITH THE RIDGE ON FRIDAY. MODELS 
INDICATE THAT THE ONLY PLACE WHERE 850-500MB MOISTURE WILL BE DEEP 
ENOUGH TO JUSTIFY EVEN SLIGHT CHANCES OF AFTERNOON THUNDERSTORMS 
WILL BE ACROSS NORTH MS. DRY AIR WORKS IN ACROSS THE ENTIRE REGION 
ON SATURDAY SO RAIN CHANCES LOOK PRETTY LOW. WITH 850 TEMPS ABOVE 
+20...LOOKS LIKE HIGHS WILL BE IN THE MID TO UPPER 90S AREAWIDE 
AGAIN.

ANOTHER COLD FRONT WILL ARRIVE SATURDAY NIGHT AND SUNDAY. DEEP 
MOISTURE IS FAIRLY LIMITED ALONG THE FRONT SO ONLY EXPECT SCATTERED 
SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS WITH THE FRONT. THE GFS SHOWS THE FRONT 
MAKING IT WELL SOUTH OF THE AREA AND THERE IS SOME COOLER AIR BEHIND 
THE FRONT. ENOUGH TO COOL MUCH OF THE AREA INTO THE 80S FOR HIGHS. 
THIS SOLUTION LOOKS REASONABLE WITH THE GFS SHOWING IN THE UPPER AIR 
PATTERN THAT THE RIDGE OVER THE WESTERN US WILL BE AMPLIFIED WITH A 
PROGRESSIVE TROUGH MOVING THROUGH THE EASTERN US. 

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.

$$

VALLE

AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
847 PM CDT TUE AUG 16 2005

.DISCUSSION...
WEAK STATIONARY FRONT LOCATED EAST-WEST ALONG MO/AR TO KY/TN BORDERS 
THIS EVENING. SCATTERED THUNDERSTORMS WERE CONTINUING ACRS MAINLY 
THE NRN ONE THIRD OF THE MID SOUTH...NORTH OF WALNUT RIDGE AR TO 
JACKSON TN LINE. EXPECT ACTIVITY TO DIMINISH AS THE EVENING 
PROGRESSES. MCV OVER NW OK WAS MOVING VERY SLOWLY TOWARD THE NE AND 
MAY NOT IMPACT MUCH OF THE REGION BEFORE 12Z. JUDGING BY CURRENT 
TRENDS WL RANGE POPS FROM 50 PERCENT NORTH TO 40 PERCENT TROUGH MEM 
AND 30 PERCENT SOUTH OF TUP. TEMPS LOOK FINE.

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 162039
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
340 PM CDT TUE AUG 16 2005

.DISCUSSION...LATEST SURFACE ANALYSIS THIS AFTERNOON PLACES 
QUASI-STATIONARY BOUNDARY ACROSS SOUTHERN MISSOURI AND WESTERN 
KENTUCKY. 88D REGIONAL RADAR TRENDS SHOW SCATTERED SHOWERS AND 
THUNDERSTORMS OCCURRING ACROSS THE MIDDLE OF THE FORECAST AREA WITH 
MOSTLY ISOLATED CONVECTION NORTH AND SOUTH. MAIN FORECAST CONCERNS 
THIS PACKAGE IS PRECIPITATION CHANCES ASSOCIATED WITH THIS BOUNDARY.

SHORTWAVE IN WEAK ZONAL FLOW WILL MOVE ACROSS THE MID SOUTH TONIGHT 
WITH SURFACE BOUNDARY POSSIBLY MOVING AS FAR SOUTH AS THE 
TENNESSEE/MISSISSIPPI STATE LINE. BASED ON CURRENT TRENDS THIS 
AFTERNOON WILL GO WITH SCATTERED SHOWERS/THUNDERSTORMS FOR THE FIRST 
HALF OF THE NIGHT...AND LIKELY POPS TO THE NORTH OVERNIGHT AS MCV 
OVER OKLAHOMA MOVES ALONG THE FRONT. PRECIPITABLE WATER VALUES 
AROUND 2 INCHES AND WEAK WINDS ALOFT WILL SUPPORT HEAVY RAINFALL 
WITH ANY SHOWERS/THUNDERSTORMS.  

QUASI-STATIONARY BOUNDARY WILL THEN START TO RETREAT BACK NORTH 
AGAIN AS A WARM FRONT WEDNESDAY NIGHT INTO THURSDAY. AS A 
RESULT...WENT WITH SCATTERED POPS THROUGH THURSDAY AND TAPERED POPS 
TO SLIGHT CHANCE AS BOUNDARY MOVES FURTHER NORTH ACROSS THE LOWER 
MISSISSIPPI VALLEY.  

LONG RANGE...SATURDAY THROUGH TUESDAY...SOME MINOR MODEL 
DISAGREEMENTS BY THE END OF THE LONG RANGE WITH THE HANDLING OF THE 
QUASI-STATIONARY FRONT THAT FINALLY BEGINS TO MOVE SOUTH ACROSS THE 
MID SOUTH. LATEST GFS RUN SHOWS COLD FRONT MOVING AS FAR SOUTH AS 
THE GULF COAST BEFORE STALLING OUT WHILE EUROPEAN TAKES BOUNDARY 
DOWN TO AROUND NORTHERN/CENTRAL MISSISSIPPI/SOUTHERN ARKANSAS. WILL 
GO WITH EUROPEAN SOLUTION FOR NOW. EXPECT FRONT TO GET HUNG UP ACROSS 
THE SOUTHERN SECTION OF THE FORECAST AREA BY SUNDAY/MONDAY AND 
RETREAT NORTH AGAIN. AS A RESULT...WILL KEEP 20 POPS IN FOR DAYS 6 
AND 7.
&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.

$$





000 
FXUS64 KMEG 161557
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
1056 AM CDT TUE AUG 16 2005

.DISCUSSION...LATEST SURFACE ANALYSIS PLACES QUASI-STATIONARY FRONT 
FROM SOUTHERN ILLINOIS TO SOUTHWEST MISSOURI WITH NUMEROUS OUTFLOW 
BOUNDARIES PRESENT ACROSS THE MID SOUTH FROM YESTERDAY/S CONVECTION. 
VISIBLE SATELLITE SHOWS MOSTLY MID/HIGH CLOUDS NORTH OF 
TENNESSEE/MISSISSIPPI STATE LINE UP TOWARDS THE MISSOURI BOOTHEEL. 
MAIN FORECAST CONCERN FOR THIS AFTERNOON IS CONVECTIVE POTENTIAL. 

MODEL SOUNDINGS SHOW AT LEAST 3000 J/KG SURFACE BASED CAPE...LI/S 
AROUND -5...AND PRECIPITABLE WATER VALUES AROUND 2 INCHES IN AREAS 
WHICH RECEIVE SOME SUNSHINE. IN ADDITION...WEAK UPPER LEVEL WINDS 
SUGGEST PULSE SHOWERS/THUNDERSTORMS WILL BE THE PRIMARY MODE OF 
CONVECTION...ESPECIALLY ACROSS POINTS ALONG AND SOUTH OF I-40. 

WILL ISSUE AN UPDATE TO ADJUST TIMING OF SHOWERS/THUNDERSTORMS AND 
BUMP THE REST OF THE NORTHERN THIRD OF THE FORECAST AREA UP TO 
LIKELY POPS DUE TO VICINITY OF THE FRONT AND CONVECTIVE TRENDS. WILL 
ALSO ADJUST TEMPERATURES DOWN SLIGHTLY ACROSS NORTHERN SECTIONS 
WHERE CLOUD COVER WILL KEEP TEMPERATURES FROM ANTICIPATED HIGHS.

UPDATED GRIDS WILL BE PUBLISHED SHORTLY. 

.PREV DISCUSSION...ISSUED 325 AM CDT TUE AUG 16 2005...

A WEAK UPPER AIR DISTURBANCE IS MOVING OVER THE REGION AS OF 08Z. 
THE RESULT HAS BEEN A FEW SCATTERED LIGHT THUNDERSHOWERS ACROSS 
NORTHEAST ARKANSAS...NORTHWEST TENNESSEE AND THE BOOTHEEL. THE 
STATIONARY FRONT ALTHOUGH ILL-DEFINED DUE TO THE LIGHT WINDS AND 
OUTFLOW BOUNDARIES MOST LIKELY RUNS FROM KENTUCKY ACROSS SOUTHERN 
MISSOURI AND INTO EASTERN OKLAHOMA. A BULLSEYE OF UPPER LEVEL 
POSITIVE VORTICITY IS PRESENT OVER NORTHEAST OKLAHOMA. 

THE 00Z NAM AND GFS ARE IN DESCENT AGREEMENT TO AROUND 42 HOURS. AN 
UPPER SHORTWAVE OVER THE UPPER MISSISSIPPI VALLEY WILL TRANSLATE 
EASTWARD TODAY. AS IT DOES SO...IT WILL GRADUALLY TURN THE STEERING 
FLOW ACROSS THE REGION TOWARDS THE NORTHWEST OVER THE NEXT 24 HOURS. 
THIS SHOULD ALLOW FOR THE FRONT TO SAG SOUTHWARD INTO THE REGION. 
MODELS SHOW CONVECTION FIRING LATE THIS MORNING AND THIS AFTERNOON 
ALONG THE FRONT IN NORTHEAST ARKANSAS AS THE ATMOSPHERE BEGINS TO 
HEAT UP AND THE VORT MAX OVER NORTHEAST OKLAHOMA MOVES TOWARDS THE 
EAST NORTHEAST. THE MODELS...ESPECIALLY THE ETA...MAY BE TOO FAST IN 
BRINGING THE FRONT THROUGH THE AREA. THIS IS PROBABLY BECAUSE THEY 
ARE PICKING UP ON THE AFTERNOON CONVECTION. BY 00Z...EXPECT THE 
FRONT TO EXTEND FROM NEAR JONESBORO THROUGH DYERSBURG AND PARIS. 
ANTICIPATE THAT CONVECTION WILL REMAIN NEAR THE FRONT ZONE AND BE 
MORE NUMEROUS OVER NORTHEAST ARKANSAS CLOSER TO THE PROXIMITY OF THE 
VORT MAX. UNCERTAIN AS TO WHAT THE AREAL COVERAGE WILL BE OVER 
NORTHWEST TN SINCE IT IS UNCLEAR IF THE STORMS WILL ORGANIZE INTO A 
LINE OR NOT. BASED UPON THE AMOUNT OF HEATING THAT OCCURRED 
YESTERDAY MORNING AND LOOKING AT A SIMILAR SITUATION THIS 
MORNING...EXPECT HIGHS TO BE WARMER THAN GUIDANCE. LIKELY CLOSE TO 
YESTERDAYS HIGHS EXCEPT IN THE VICINITY OF THE FRONTAL ZONE WHERE 
AFTERNOON THUNDERSTORMS SHOULD RESULT IN SLIGHTLY COOLER TEMPS THAN 
YESTERDAY. WITH TEMPS IN THE LOWER 90S...CAPES ARE EXPECTED TO BE 
GREATER THAN 3000 J/KG AND LIS AROUND -5. ALTHOUGH UPPER LEVEL WINDS 
ARE PATHETIC AND SHEAR IS VIRTUALLY NONEXISTENT CANT ENTIRELY RULE 
THE POSSIBILITY OF A LOCALIZED DOWNBURST IF A STORM OR TWO WERE TO 
BECOME REALLY HEALTHY. PRECIPITABLE WATER VALUES ARE IN EXCESS OF 2 
INCHES WHILE STORM MOTION IS APPROXIMATELY 11KTS. SO THE STORMS 
SHOULD MOVE BUT THEY COULD HAVE SOME IMPRESSIVE RAINFALL RATES. 

EXPECT THE FRONT TO CONTINUE TO SLIP FURTHER INTO THE REGION 
TONIGHT...POSSIBLY MAKING IT THROUGH MEMPHIS. AREAL COVERAGE 
SHOULD DIMINISH WITH THE LOSS OF DIURNAL INSTABILITY. THE FRONT WILL 
REMAIN STALLED ACROSS THE REGION ON WEDNESDAY WITH BEST CHANCES FOR 
RAIN IN THE VICINITY OF THE FRONT. GFS SHOWS A GOOD VORT MAX MOVING 
INTO THE REGION WHILE THE ETA DOES NOT SHOW THIS. EXPECT CONVECTION 
TO BE AROUND REGARDLESS DUE TO DIURNAL INSTABILITY AND THE PRESENCE 
OF THE FRONT...JUST UNCERTAIN IF AREAL COVERAGE WILL REMAIN 
SCATTERED OR WIDESPREAD. 

THE ETA LIFTS THE FRONT BACK NORTHWARD ON WEDNESDAY NIGHT WHILE THE 
GFS HOLDS OFF UNTIL THURSDAY. A LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM WILL BE MOVING 
ACROSS THE UPPER MIDWEST ON THURSDAY. THE CIRCULATION AROUND THE LOW 
SHOULD INDEED LIFT THE FRONT NORTHWARD. AT THIS POINT...THE GFS IS A 
LITTLE MORE BELIEVABLE SINCE THE ETA LOOKS WAY TOO FAST GIVEN THE 
TIME OF YEAR AND THE WIND SPEEDS ALOFT. CONVECTION WILL ONCE AGAIN 
BE AROUND ESPECIALLY IN THE VICINITY OF THE FRONT ON THURSDAY. 
HIGHER POPS FROM THE TN/MS BORDER SOUTHWARD AS A RESULT. CONVECTION 
SHOULD SUBSIDE WITH THE SETTING SUN ON THURSDAY NIGHT WITH NO 
SIGNIFICANT VORT MAXS TO ENHANCE CONVECTION. STILL LOOKS HOT WITH 
850 TEMPS HOLDING AT +20 AT LEAST.

FRONT SHOULD BE NORTH OF THE REGION BY FRIDAY WITH ISOLATED HEAT OF 
THE DAY VARIETY THUNDERSTORMS LIKELY GOING INTO THE WEEKEND. ANOTHER 
FRONT WILL ARRIVE TOWARDS THE LATTER HALF OF THE WEEKEND ALTHOUGH 
THE 850-500MB MOISTURE DOES NOT LOOK ALL THAT IMPRESSIVE. EXPECT 
COVERAGE TO REMAIN SCATTERED AS THE FRONT MOVES INTO THE AREA ON 
SUNDAY. NOT CERTAIN IF THE FRONT WILL ACTUALLY MOVE THROUGH THE AREA 
AS EARLIER FORECASTS HAD SUGGESTED. GFS THIS MORNING SHOWS A WAVE 
DEVELOPING ALONG THE FRONT AND MOVING ACROSS THE REGION TOWARDS 
MIDWEEK. NOT SURE IF THIS IS REAL OR CONVECTIVE FEEDBACK. AS A 
RESULT...ESSENTIALLY FORECASTED CLIMATOLOGY FOR DAYS 6 AND 7.

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.

$$

VALLE






THE ETA LIFTS THE FRONT BACK NORTHWARD ON WEDNESDAY NIGHT WHILE THE 
GFS HOLDS OFF UNTIL THURSDAY. A LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM WILL BE MOVING 
ACROSS THE UPPER MIDWEST ON THURSDAY. THE CIRCULATION AROUND THE LOW 
SHOULD INDEED LIFT THE FRONT NORTHWARD. AT THIS POINT...THE GFS IS A 
LITTLE MORE BELIEVABLE SINCE THE ETA LOOKS WAY TOO FAST GIVEN THE 
TIME OF YEAR AND THE WIND SPEEDS ALOFT. CONVECTION WILL ONCE AGAIN 
BE AROUND ESPECIALLY IN THE VICINITY OF THE FRONT ON THURSDAY. 
HIGHER POPS FROM THE TN/MS BORDER SOUTHWARD AS A RESULT. CONVECTION 
SHOULD SUBSIDE WITH THE SETTING SUN ON THURSDAY NIGHT WITH NO 
SIGNIFICANT VORT MAXS TO ENHANCE CONVECTION. STILL LOOKS HOT WITH 
850 TEMPS HOLDING AT +20 AT LEAST.

FRONT SHOULD BE NORTH OF THE REGION BY FRIDAY WITH ISOLATED HEAT OF 
THE DAY VARIETY THUNDERSTORMS LIKELY GOING INTO THE WEEKEND. ANOTHER 
FRONT WILL ARRIVE TOWARDS THE LATTER HALF OF THE WEEKEND ALTHOUGH 
THE 850-500MB MOISTURE DOES NOT LOOK ALL THAT IMPRESSIVE. EXPECT 
COVERAGE TO REMAIN SCATTERED AS THE FRONT MOVES INTO THE AREA ON 
SUNDAY. NOT CERTAIN IF THE FRONT WILL ACTUALLY MOVE THROUGH THE AREA 
AS EARLIER FORECASTS HAD SUGGESTED. GFS THIS MORNING SHOWS A WAVE 
DEVELOPING ALONG THE FRONT AND MOVING ACROSS THE REGION TOWARDS 
MIDWEEK. NOT SURE IF THIS IS REAL OR CONVECTIVE FEEDBACK. AS A 
RESULT...ESSENTIALLY FORECASTED CLIMATOLOGY FOR DAYS 6 AND 7.

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.

$$

VALLE





000 
FXUS64 KMEG 160257
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
958 PM CDT MON AUG 15 2005

.UPDATE...

UPPER LEVEL HIGH PRESSURE ACROSS THE SE U.S. THIS EVENING WITH A 500 
MB SHORTWAVE MOVING FROM NE OK INTO NW AR/SW MO. THIS FEATURE WAS 
HELPING TO PRODUCE TSTMS ACRS NRN/N CNTRL AR THIS EVENING. AS THIS 
SHORTWAVE MOVES ACRS THE AR/MO BORDER EXPECT TSTMS TO CONT INTO THE 
OVERNIGHT HOURS WITH THE BEST CHANCE ACRS NE AR/MO BOOTHEEL AND NW 
TN...GENERALLY N OF I-40. PLACES SOUTH OF I-40 WL PROBABLY REMAIN 
DRY. THOUGH SEVERE WX THREAT APPEARS TO HAVE DIMINISHED WITH LOSS OF 
SFC HEATING AN ISOLD SEVERE STORM IS STILL POSSIBLE. WL ADJUST POPS 
A BIT OTRW FORECAST LOOKS GOOD.

SJM

.PREV DISCUSSION ISSUED AT 331 PM...

SCATTERED THUNDERSTORMS HAVE DEVELOPED THIS AFTERNOON FROM WEST TN
INTO NORTH MS...DESPITE STRONG UPPER LEVEL RIDGING ACROSS MOST OF
THE MIDSOUTH. THESE THUNDERSTORMS APPARENTLY DEVELOPED ALONG AN
OUTFLOW BOUNDARY FROM EARLIER CONVECTION. A NEARLY STATIONARY FRONT
REMAINS NORTH OF THE MIDSOUTH FROM NORTHEAST OK ACROSS SOUTHERN MO
INTO SOUTHERN IL. A SHORT WAVE WILL OVERRIDE THE UPPER LEVEL RIDGE
AND MOVE ACROSS SOUTHERN MO TONIGHT. LAPS INDICATES CAPES BETWEEN
2000 AND 3000 J/KG ACROSS THE MIDSOUTH. THUS THINK ADDITIONAL
THUNDERSTORMS WILL DEVELOP LATER THIS AFTERNOON AND EVENING ACROSS
NORTHEAST AR AND THE MO BOOTHEEL ASSOCIATED WITH THIS SHORT WAVE...
POSSIBLY MOVING INTO WEST TN / NORTHWEST MS.

THE MIDSOUTH IS FORECAST TO BE IN A LITTLE WETTER PATTERN THE NEXT
COUPLE OF DAYS. THE H5 RIDGE THAT COVERS THE MIDSOUTH THIS
AFTERNOON IS FORECAST TO SINK SOUTHWARD WITH HEIGHTS LOWERING
ACROSS THE MIDSOUTH. THIS WILL ALLOW THE FRONTAL ZONE TO OUR NORTH
TO SHIFT SOUTHWARD WITH ANY ASSOCIATED OUTFLOW BOUNDARIES MAKING IT
FURTHER SOUTHWARD INTO THE MIDSOUTH. WARM...MOIST AND UNSTABLE AIR
AHEAD OF THE FRONT / OUTFLOW BOUNDARIES WILL ALLOW FOR THE
DEVELOPMENT OF SCATTERED THUNDERSTORMS. TEMPERATURES WILL BE A FEW
DEGREES LESS HOT...ESPECIALLY ACROSS THE NORTHERN HALF OF THE
MIDSOUTH...DUE TO THE INCREASED CONVECTION.

A H5 RIDGE IS FORECAST TO ONCE AGAIN STRENGTHEN ACROSS THE MIDSOUTH
FRIDAY AND SATURDAY. THE RESULT WILL BE A RETURN TO A SMALL CHANCE
OF MAINLY AFTERNOON AND EVENING THUNDERSTORMS FOR A COUPLE OF DAYS.

THE GFS INDICATES A FAIRLY GOOD COLD FRONT FOR THIS TIME OF THE
YEAR COMING THROUGH THE MIDSOUTH LATE IN THE WEEKEND OR EARLY NEXT
WEEK...AS THE RIDGE BREAKS DOWN AND A UPPER LEVEL TROUGH MOVES TO
OUR NORTH. MANY TIMES THE GFS OVER AMPLIFIES THE TROUGHS IN
THESE SITUATIONS PUSHING THE COLD FRONT THROUGH TOO FAST AND TOO
STRONG. AS A RESULT...ATTM WILL GO WITH A SLOWER MOVEMENT OF THE
FRONT AND NOT AS STRONG...BUT WILL INDICATE A DRY FORECAST FOR
MONDAY FROM NORTHEAST AR INTO WEST TN.

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.

$$


000 
FXUS64 KMEG 151502
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
1002 AM CDT MON AUG 15 2005

.DISCUSSION...

WILL NEED TO UPDATE THE FORECAST FOR TODAY TO MAKE A NUMBER OF
CHANGES. 12Z UPPER AIR ANALYSES INDICATES THE RIDGE COVERING THE
SOUTHEASTERN UNITED STATES IS STRONGER THAN FORECAST THIS MORNING.
THIS WILL ALLOW FOR MORE SUN ACROSS THE MIDSOUTH WITH MAXIMUM
TEMPERATURES A LITTLE WARMER THAN FORECAST IN MOST LOCATIONS. WILL
NEED TO MONITOR HEAT INDICES WHICH WILL LIKELY APPROACH 105 DEGREES
IN SOME LOCATIONS. WILL ALSO LOWER POPS IN MOST LOCATIONS. THE
GREATEST CHANCE OF RAIN WILL BE ACROSS PARTS OF NORTHEAST AR INTO
THE MO BOOTHEEL...A WEAK UPPER LEVEL SHORT WAVE OVERRIDING THE RIDGE
WILL MOVE ACROSS SOUTHERN MO THIS AFTERNOON ENHANCING THE CHANCE OF
THUNDERSTORMS IN THESE AREAS. A NEARLY STATIONARY FRONT EXTENDS
FROM NORTHEAST OK ACROSS SOUTHERN MO INTO SOUTHERN IL THIS MORNING.
AN OUTFLOW BOUNDARY FROM EARLIER THUNDERSTORMS IN ADVANCE OF THIS
FRONT EXTENDS FROM NORTHEAST AR INTO WEST TN. THIS BOUNDARY WILL ALSO
SERVE AS A FOCUS FOR THUNDERSTORMS THIS AFTERNOON.

.PREV DISCUSSION...
ISSUED 210 AM CDT MON AUG 15 2005

EARLY THIS MORNING THE ATMOSPHERE OVER THE MID SOUTH IS CHAOTIC. THE
WESTERN EDGE OF THE SUBTROPICAL RIDGE IS KEEPING THE MAJORITY OF THE
CONVECTION WEST OF THE FORECAST AREA WITH THE EXCEPTION OF SOME
SCATTERED SHOWERS OVER NORTHEAST ARKANSAS. THE STATIONARY FRONTAL
BOUNDARY HAS LOST SOME OF ITS IDENTITY DUE TO THE ONGOING CONVECTION
OVER THE AREA. THE SHOWERS OVER NORTHEAST ARKANSAS HAVE SENT OUT
OUTFLOW BOUNDARIES AS SEEN ON KNQA BASE REFLECTIVITY.

THE ATMOSPHERE OVER THE AREA WILL REMAIN MOIST AND UNSTABLE TODAY.
TEMPERATURES ACROSS THE AREA WILL RANGE FROM THE LOWER TO MID 90S
AND CHANCES FOR RAIN WILL REMAIN HIGHEST ACROSS THE NORTHERN HALF OF
THE FORECAST AREA TODAY AND TONIGHT. THIS IS IN ASSOCIATION WITH THE
WEAK BOUNDARY IN THE VICINITY AND THE WESTERN EDGE OF THE
SUBTROPICAL HIGH SLIDING FARTHER EAST. WE SURE COULD USE ANY RAIN
SENT OUR WAY FROM THIS SYSTEM

MODELS STILL HAVING A DIFFICULT TIME AGREEING ON THE POSITION OF THE
BOUNDARY AFTER THE CONVECTION OF TODAY AND TONIGHT. HAVE NOT VEERED
MUCH FROM PREVIOUS FORECAST DUE TO THE UNCERTAINTY.

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.

FXUS64 KMEG 150336 CCA
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
1040 PM CDT SUN AUG 14 2005

.DISCUSSION...
SCATTERED SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS ASSOCIATED WITH A STATIONARY 
FRONT CONTINUE TO MOVE ACROSS THE REGION. CURRENT KNQA RADAR SHOWS 
INITIAL ROUND ACTIVITY HAS PUSHED EASTWARD OUT THE CWA. 
HOWEVER...NEXT ROUND WILL BEGIN TO PUSH INTO THE CWA OVER THE NEXT 
HOUR...MAINLY ALONG THE I-40 CORRIDOR. THUS WILL KEEP CHANCE POPS 
ACROSS THIS AREA WITH SLIGHT CHANCE POPS ALONG THE EXTREME NORTHERN 
AND EXTREME SOUTHERN ZONES. TEMPERATURES ARE CURRENTLY RANGE FROM 
THE MID 70S TO LOWER 80S AND LOOK ON TRACK TO REACH FORECASTED LOWS 
IN THE LOWER TO MID 70S FOR THE MOST PART. MAY ONLY ADJUST EXTREME 
NORTHWESTERN ZONES DOWN A CATEGORY WHERE MUCH OF THE PRECIPITATION 
FELL THIS EVENING. UPDATE WILL BE OUT SHORTLY.

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 142033 CCA
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...CORRECTED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
330 PM CDT SUN AUG 14 2005

.DISCUSSION...LATEST SURFACE ANALYSIS PLACES STATIONARY FRONT ALONG 
I-44 IN MISSOURI. SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS HAVE DEVELOPED ALONG AND 
AHEAD OF THE BOUNDARY IN THE UNSTABLE ATMOSPHERE. MAIN FORECAST 
CONCERN IS PRECIPITATION CHANCES IN THIS PACKAGE WHICH DEPENDS ON 
PLACEMENT OF THE MEANDERING STATIONARY FRONT. 

TONIGHT...QUASI-STATIONARY FRONT ACROSS SOUTHEAST MISSOURI WILL 
BEGIN TO MOVE AS FAR SOUTH AS THE NORTHERN/NORTHWESTERN THIRD OF THE 
FORECAST AREA.  EXPECTING TO SEE CONVECTION DIMINISH WITH LOSS OF 
DAYTIME HEATING AND WILL KEEP ONGOING SCATTERED POPS.  

MONDAY...ANOTHER SHORTWAVE IN MID LEVEL SOUTHWEST FLOW WILL MOVE 
ACROSS THE MIDDLE/LOWER MISSISSIPPI VALLEY. ASSOCIATED SURFACE FRONT 
/PARALLEL TO UPPER LEVEL FLOW/ WILL MEANDER AROUND THE 
REGION...POSSIBLY REACHING AS FAR SOUTH AS I-40. WEAK MID LEVEL 
FORCING WITH CAPES AROUND 2000-3000 J/KG...LI/S AROUND -7...AND 
PRECIPITABLE WATER VALUES AROUND 2 INCHES SUGGEST ANY CONVECTION 
THAT DEVELOPS WILL BE PULSE SHOWERS/THUNDERSTORMS AND MADE MINOR 
ADJUSTMENTS TO SCATTERED POPS. 

TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY...QUASI-STATIONARY FRONT SHOULD MOVE NORTH AS 
A WARM FRONT THEN STALL OUT OVER MISSOURI AGAIN. MODEL PERFORMANCE 
POOR WITH RESOLVING STATIONARY FRONT...NAM PLACING FRONT AS FAR 
SOUTH AS THE GULF COAST AND GFS KEEPING THE FRONT ACROSS THE 
FORECAST AREA. NOT CONVINCED THAT FRONT WILL MAKE PROGRESS THAT FAR 
SOUTH AND THINK THAT GFS HAS A BETTER HANDLE ON SITUATION. WILL GO 
WITH SCATTERED POPS FOR NOW DUE TO MODEL PERFORMANCE ISSUES BUT 
LATER SHIFTS MAY NEED TO RAISE POPS A CATEGORY.

LONG RANGE...THURSDAY THROUGH SUNDAY...6Z GFS IN BETTER AGREEMENT 
WITH 00Z EUROPEAN RUN THAN 00Z GFS. STATIONARY FRONT CURRENTLY 
AFFECTING AREA WILL MOVE NORTH INTO THE MID MISSISSIPPI OHIO VALLEYS 
ON FRIDAY THEN RETURN SOUTH AS A COLD FRONT BY SATURDAY/SUNDAY. AS A 
RESULT...EXPECTING A CHANCE OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS THROUGH 
SUNDAY.
&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.

$$



000 
FXUS64 KMEG 141539
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
1038 AM CDT SUN AUG 14 2005

.DISCUSSION...14Z SURFACE ANALYSIS THIS MORNING PLACES STATIONARY 
FRONT FROM NEAR VANDALIA ILLINOIS WEST TO THE LAKE OF THE OZARKS 
WITH OUTFLOW BOUNDARIES FROM PREVIOUS CONVECTION ACROSS SOUTHEAST 
MISSOURI. MAIN FORECAST CONCERN FOR THIS AFTERNOON IS PRECIPITATION 
CHANCES AND SEVERE WEATHER POTENTIAL. 

MODEL SOUNDINGS ACROSS THE AREA SHOW INSTABILITY VALUES AROUND 2000 
J/KG OR ABOVE...LI/S AROUND -6...PRECIPITABLE WATER VALUES NEAR 2 
INCHES. ALSO WEAK WIND FIELDS SUGGEST THAT ANY CONVECTION THAT FORMS 
WILL BE PULSE TYPE SHOWERS/THUNDERSTORMS WITH WIND AS THE MAIN 
THREAT AS FREEZING LEVELS AROUND 15 KFT. AS MID LEVEL FORCING IS NOT 
THAT GREAT AND LITTLE IF ANY CONVECTION ON REGIONAL RADAR 
YET...CANNOT JUSTIFY RAISING POPS ABOVE SCATTERED AT THIS TIME. 
TEMPERATURES FOR THIS AFTERNOON ARE ON TRACK WITH TEMPERATURES 
ALREADY IN THE UPPER 80S IN MANY SPOTS. NO UPDATE IS ANTICIPATED AT 
THIS TIME.

.PREV DISCUSSION...ISSUED 306 AM CDT SUN AUG 14 2005...

A LITTLE MORE INTERESTING WEATHER THIS MORNING. SO FAR THE UPPER 
RIDGE HAS KEPT THE MOISTURE AND CONVECTION WELL NORTH AND WEST 
TODAY. IT HAS ALSO PRODUCED SOME VERY WARM TEMPERATURES ACROSS THE 
REGION. HEAT INDEX VALUES AGAIN WILL APPROACH 105 DEGREES.

CONVECTION THAT FORMED ALONG THE FRONT IN SOUTHEASTERN MISSOURI 
OVERNIGHT HAS SENT AN OUTFLOW BOUNDARY INTO NORTHWESTERN TENNESSEE. 
THIS BOUNDARY WILL PROBABLY BE A FOCUS FOR SOME THUNDERSTORMS TO 
DEVELOP THIS AFTERNOON ACROSS THIS AREA. IN ADDITION...THE COLD 
FRONT WILL SLOWLY SAG INTO THE MID SOUTH. SOME STORMS THAT FORM THIS 
AFTERNOON ACROSS THE NORTHERN FORECAST AREA  COULD BE SEVERE AND 
PRODUCE WINDS IN EXCESS OF 60 MPH.

THE CHANGE IN THIS FORECAST...I.E. HIGHER CHANCES FOR RAIN IS COMING 
FROM THE FUTURE MOVEMENT OF THE FRONTAL BOUNDARY AND ANTICIPATED 
BOUNDARIES FORMED BY AFTERNOON CONVECTION. ALSO...THE NORTHERN EDGE 
OF THE UPPER RIDGE WILL MOVE A LITTLE FARTHER SOUTH. THE AREA WILL 
BE SANDWICHED WITH THE MOISTURE SEEN ACROSS TEXAS...OKLAHOMA AND 
MISSOURI THROUGH WEDNESDAY. THUS HIGHER CHANCES FOR RAIN HAVE BEEN 
INCLUDED IN THE FORECAST AND MAY BE RAISED IN LATER SHIFTS AS THINGS 
BECOME BETTER DEFINED. 

NO OTHER MAJOR CHANGES HAVE OCCURRED WITH THIS FORECAST THROUGH NEXT 
WEEK.

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.

$$

AC

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 140314
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
1015 PM CDT SAT AUG 13 2005

.DISCUSSION...
SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS FROM EARLIER AFTERNOON ACTIVITY HAS DIED 
OUT. HOWEVER...A BROKEN LINE OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS ASSOCIATED 
WITH THE STATIONARY FRONT ACROSS MISSOURI HAS BEEN SLOWLY 
APPROACHING THE NORTHWESTERN PORTION OF THE CWA. WILL LEAVE A SMALL 
POP IN THIS AREA AND WILL REMOVE MENTION OF PRECIP. WILL ALSO UPDATE 
SKY CONDITIONS TO MOSTLY CLEAR WITH THE EXCEPTION OF THE 
NORTHWESTERN PART OF THE CWA. CURRENT TEMPERATURES ARE STILL IN THE 
LOWER TO MID 80S FOR THE MOST PART AND LOOK ON TRACK TO REACH 
EXPECTED LOWS IN THE LOWER TO MID 70S. UPDATE WILL BE OUT SHORTLY.

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.

$$

KRM

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 132032
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
330 PM CDT SAT AUG 13 2005

.DISCUSSION...LATEST VISIBLE SATELLITE IMAGERY SHOWS PARTLY SUNNY 
SKIES ACROSS THE MID SOUTH WITH ISOLATED SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS 
OCCURRRING ACROSS NORTHEAST MISSISSIPPI AND THE FAR TIP OF NORTHEAST 
ARKANSAS. TEMPERATURES ACROSS THE REGION RANGE FROM THE LOWER TO 
MIDDLE 90S EAST OF THE MISSISSIPPI RIVER AND MIDDLE TO UPPER 90S 
WEST. MAIN CONCERN THIS FORECAST PACKAGE IS PRECIPITATION CHANCES.

TONIGHT...ANY DIURNAL CONVECTION SHOULD COME TO AN END TONIGHT WITH 
THE LOSS OF DAYTIME HEATING. WINDS WILL DECOUPLE AS RADIATIONAL 
INVERSION SETS UP. NOT MUCH DIFFERENCE EXPECTED IN LOW TEMPERATURES 
TONIGHT AS COMPARED TO THIS MORNING WITH CURRENT SURFACE DEWPOINTS 
IN THE LOWER TO MIDDLE 70S. 

SUNDAY AND SUNDAY NIGHT...MODEL DISCREPANCIES BEGIN TO SHOW UP 
BETWEEN THE NAM AND GFS. GFS BRINGS STATIONARY FRONT ACROSS MISSSOURI 
DOWN INTO FORECAST AREA BY 18Z. MEANWHILE NAM SOLUTION ONLY BRINGS 
FRONT DOWN AS FAR SOUTH AS A CAPE GIRARDEAU/SPRINGFIELD LINE. THIS 
SOLUTION SEEMS TO BE MORE REASONABLE AT THIS TIME WITH PARALLEL 
UPPER LEVEL FLOW SLOWING PROGRESSION TO THE SOUTH. AS A RESULT WILL 
LEAN TOWARD NAM SOLUTION. CANNOT SEE MUCH MORE THAN ISOLATED SHOWERS 
AND THUNDERSTORMS WITH THE EXCEPTION OF NORTHEAST MISSISSIPPI AS 
SCATTERED POPS. MOST OF THE CONVECTION SHOULD COME TO AN END AGAIN 
WITH THE LOSS OF DIURNAL INSTABILITY WITH THE EXCEPTION OF THE 
NORTHERN ONE THIRD OF THE FORECATST AREA WHICH IS CLOSER TO THE 
MEANDERING FRONT. LOWS WILL DROP BACK INTO THE MIDDLE TO UPPER 70S.

MONDAY AND TUESDAY...FRONT WILL CONTINUE TO MEANDER WITHIN VICINITY 
OF THE MID SOUTH. CANNOT RULE OUT A CHANCE OF SHOWERS AND 
THUNDERSTORMS ACROSS THE AREA WITH HIGHER POPS PRIMARILY ACROSS THE 
NORTHERN ONE THIRD. 

LONG RANGE...WEDNESDAY THROUGH SATURDAY...STILL LITTLE IF ANY MOVEMENT 
EXPECTED WITH COLD FRONT UPSTREAM ACOSS THE MIDDLE MISISSIPPI 
VALLEY.  EUROPEAN DEEPENS LONG WAVE TROUGH ACROSS THE WESTERN UNITED 
STATES...ALLOWING RIDGE TO REMAIN IN PLACE LONGER ACROSS THE EASTERN 
HALF OF THE COUNTRY AND HOLDS OFF BRINGING THE FRONT THROUGH THE MID 
SOUTH UNTIL MONDAY. MEANWHILE LAST COUPLE OF GFS SOLUTIONS BRING 
FRONT AS FAR SOUTH AS THE GULF COAST BY SATURDAY MORNING. AS A 
RESULT...WILL TAKE A FASTER EUROPEAN SOULUTION...BRINGING THE FRONT 
THROUGH BY NEXT SUNDAY. AS A RESULT WILL CARRY 20 POPS THROUGH THE 
LONG RANGE FORECAST.
&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.

FXUS64 KMEG 131602
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
1102 AM CDT SAT AUG 13 2005

.DISCUSSION...LATEST SURFACE ANALYSIS PLACES HIGH PRESSURE ACROSS 
THE MID SOUTH WITH A STATIONARY FRONT EXTENDING ACROSS THE OHIO AND 
MIDDLE MISSISSIPPI VALLEYS. VISIBLE SATELLITE ACROSS THE REGION SHOWS 
MAINLY SOME CIRRUS/CIRROSTRATUS PRIMARILY ALONG THE DELTA. 

SOME INITIALIZATION ISSUES WITH THE 12Z NAM THIS MORNING AND RUC 
SEEMS TO HAVE THE BEST HANDLE ON THE SITUATION. A LIFTED SURFACE 
PARCEL (96/72) ON MODEL FORECAST SOUNDINGS PRODUCE AROUND 3000 J/KG 
SURFACE BASED CAPE...LI/S AROUND -7...AND PRECIPITABLE WATER VALUES 
AROUND 1.5. THINK BEST CHANCE OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS WILL BE 
ACROSS THE SOUTHEAST SECTION OF THE FORECAST AREA. ISSUED AN UPDATE 
TO EXTEND BACK SLIGHT CHANCE OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS ACROSS A 
PORTION OF NORTHWEST MISSISSIPPI.

UPDATED GRIDS ALREADY PUBLISHED

CJC

.PREV DISCUSSION...ISSUED 141 AM CDT SAT AUG 13 2005...

NOT MUCH TO ADD FROM PREVIOUS FORECASTS. FAIRLY UNEVENTFUL WEATHER 
AS FAR AS RAIN OR COOLER TEMPS ARE CONCERNED. THE MAIN CONCERN WILL 
BE THE ABOVE NORMAL TEMPERATURES AND ASSOCIATED HEAT INDICES WHICH 
WILL APPROACH 105 DEGREES. THIS PATTERN IS LIKELY TO PERSIST THROUGH 
THE WEEKEND AND INTO NEXT WEEK. MAXIMUM DAYTIME TEMPERATURES ARE 
EXPECTED TO STILL BE IN THE 90S AND DEW POINTS WILL REMAIN IN THE 
LOWER 70S. 

LOOK FOR MAINLY AFTERNOON SCATTERED THUNDERSTORMS OVER NORTHEAST MS 
AND PARTS OF W TN TODAY AND SUNDAY. SLIGHTLY BETTER CHANCES FOR RAIN 
WILL OCCUR MONDAY AHEAD OF A WEAK FRONTAL BOUNDARY STRETCHED ACROSS 
CENTRAL/SOUTHERN MISSOURI. ADDITIONAL RAIN CHANCES ARE POSSIBLE BY 
MID WEEK AS THE UPPER HIGH OVER THE SE U.S. DRIFTS FARTHER EAST.

&&

NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
1015 PM CDT FRI AUG 12 2005

.DISCUSSION...
ISOLATED AFTERNOON AND EVENING SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS HAVE 
DISSIPATED OVER THE LAST FEW HOURS. WILL UPDATE TO REMOVE MENTION OF 
PRECIP. HIGH CLOUDS CONTINUE TO MOVE NORTHWARD OVER THE MIDSOUTH 
THIS EVENING. THE CLOUDS ARE IN ASSOCIATION WITH A LOW PRESSURE 
SYSTEM LOCATED ALONG THE GULF COAST. EXPECT THE CLOUDS TO REMAIN 
OVER THE AREA THROUGH THE OVERNIGHT AREA SO WILL UPDATE TO GO PARTLY 
CLOUDY ACROSS THE ENTIRE MIDSOUTH. WITH THE CLOUD 
COVER...TEMPERATURES HAVE NOT DROPPED OFF AS MUCH AS EXPECTED. 
CURRENT TEMPERATURES ARE STILL IN THE LOWER TO MID 80S FOR THE MOST 
PART. WILL UPDATE TO RAISE LOWS FOR MOST LOCATIONS AT LEAST A 
CATEGORY. UPDATE WILL BE OUT SHORTLY.
