000 
FXUS64 KMEG 122031
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
330 PM CDT FRI AUG 12 2005

.DISCUSSION...
A WEAK ELONGATED UPPER LEVEL TROUGH STRETCHES FROM WEST TN THROUGH
NORTH MS TO THE NORTHERN GULF COAST THIS AFTERNOON. LAPS DATA
INDICATES CAPES BETWEEN 1500 AND 3500 J/KG FROM EASTERN PARTS OF WEST
TN INTO NORTHEAST MS ALONG AND TO THE EAST OF THE UPPER LEVEL TROUGH.
ISOLATED TO SCATTERED THUNDERSTORMS WERE DEVELOPING IN THESE AREAS.
FOR TONIGHT...WILL HAVE 30 PERCENT POPS FROM ABOUT JACKSON TN
SOUTHWARD INTO NORTHEAST MS....20 PERCENT ELSEWHERE EXCEPT ONLY 10
PERCENT NORTHEAST AR AND MO BOOTHEEL. SKIES WILL BECOME MOSTLY CLEAR
LATER THIS EVENING WITH THE THUNDERSTORMS ENDING...ALTHOUGH THE UPPER
LEVEL TROUGH MAY KEEP SKIES PARTLY CLOUDY IN PARTS OF NORTHEAST MS.

OVERALL...THE PATTERN REMAINS A HOT ONE WITH NO SIGNIFICANT RAIN
FOR THE NEXT 7 DAYS AS HIGH PRESSURE ALOFT DOMINATES WEATHER OVER THE
SOUTHEASTERN UNITED STATES. DRY AIR HAS MIXED DOWN ENOUGH TO KEEP
HEAT INDICES FROM REACHING THE CRITICAL LEVEL OF 105 DEGREES THE
PAST COUPLE OF DAYS...THINK THIS WILL CONTINUE TO BE THE CASE OVER
THE WEEKEND...HOWEVER IT WILL BE CLOSE SO NEEDS TO BE MONITORED.
A COLD FRONT WILL COME CLOSE ENOUGH TO THE MIDSOUTH TO ENHANCE OUR
RAIN CHANCES BY MONDAY...MAINLY A RESULT OF MOISTURE FEEDING INTO THE
MIDSOUTH AHEAD OF THE FRONT. DO NOT THINK THE COLD FRONT WILL MAKE IT
INTO THE MIDSOUTH...AS MODELS INDICATE HIGH PRESSURE ALOFT ACTUALLY
BUILDING OVER THE MIDSOUTH EARLY NEXT WEEK. THE HIGH MOVES EASTWARD
AROUND THE MIDDLE OF THE WEEK ALLOWING FOR SOME INCREASE IN
MOISTURE...AND CONTINUED SMALL CHANCES OF RAIN.

&&


.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 121453
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
951 AM CDT FRI AUG 12 2005

.DISCUSSION...
UPPER LOW ALONG THE NORTHERN GULF COAST IS HELPING TO INCREASE
MOISTURE ACROSS THE MIDSOUTH FROM THE SOUTHEAST. WATER VAPOR
SATELLITE IMAGERY INDICATES MORE MOIST AIR AT THE MID AND UPPER
LEVELS GRADUALLY SHIFTING NORTHWARD INTO THE MIDSOUTH. A COUPLE OF
THUNDERSTORMS HAVE ALREADY POPPED UP THIS MORNING ACROSS WEST TN
AND NORTH MS. CURRENT FORECAST OF 30 PERCENT POPS ACROSS NORTHEAST
MS AND 20 PERCENT ELSEWHERE FOR THIS AFTERNOON STILL LOOKS GOOD.
WILL CONTINUE TO MONITOR HEAT INDEX VALUES THIS AFTERNOON...CURRENT
THINKING IS THAT THEY WILL REMAIN JUST BELOW THE CRITICAL THRESHOLD
OF 105 DEGREES. EXPECT SURFACE DEWPOINTS WILL LOWER SOME THIS
AFTERNOON WITH MIXING ESPECIALLY FROM NORTHEAST AR INTO NORTHWEST TN
WHERE WATER VAPOR IMAGERY SHOWS DRIER AIR ALOFT.

.PREV DISCUSSION...
ISSUED 200 AM CDT FRI AUG 12 2005

CONDITIONS WILL CHANGE LITTLE FROM THE PAST FEW DAYS AND WILL BE
DIFFICULT TO BEAT PERSISTENCE.

A WEAK LOW PRESSURE AREA WAS NOTED OVER THE GULF COAST OF ALABAMA
AND THE FLORIDA PANHANDLE. THIS WAS A PLAYER IN SOME OF THE
CONVECTION THAT FORMED OVER THE MID SOUTH YESTERDAY AND WILL LIKELY
PLAY A ROLE IN ADDITIONAL CONVECTION THIS AFTERNOON. COVERAGE WILL
PROBABLY BE CONFINED TO NORTHEASTERN MISSISSIPPI WITH A FEW ISOLATED
STORMS DEVELOPING ACROSS PARTS OF WEST TENNESSEE AND THE REMAINDER
OF NORTH MISSISSIPPI. NORTHEASTERN MISSISSIPPI WILL HAVE SLIGHTLY
HIGHER INSTABILITY AND SOME WEAK LOW LEVEL CONVERGENCE TO AID THE
CONVECTION TODAY. TEMPERATURES WILL BE WELL ABOVE NORMAL AGAIN TODAY
AND HEAT INDICES IN THE MEMPHIS METRO AREA WILL BE FROM 100 TO 105
DEGREES.

THE MID SOUTH WILL SEE SIMILAR CONDITIONS ON SATURDAY.

A VERY WEAK FRONTAL BOUNDARY WILL APPROACH THE MID SOUTH SATURDAY
AND HANG UP ACROSS CENTRAL MISSOURI. IT APPEARS THAT THE LATEST
MODELS SUPPORT THE FRONT SEEPING INTO THE NORTHWESTERN FORECAST AREA
ON MONDAY. RAIN CHANCES SLIGHTLY INCREASE ACROSS THE REGION AS
PLENTY OF LOW LEVEL MOISTURE ENGULFS THE AREA.

TEMPERATURES WILL REMAIN ABOVE NORMAL THROUGH NEXT WEEK.

&&


.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES

.EVENING DISCUSSION...
AS HAS BEEN THE CASE THE LAST SEVERAL NIGHTS...JUST WAITING FOR
DIURNAL CONVECTION TO DIE OUT. STILL HAVE A LITTLE BIT OVER HAYWOOD
COUNTY TENNESSEE. EXPECT THIS TO DIE OUT IN THE NEXT HOUR OR SO.
FORECAST WILL THEN BE UPDATED. GRIDS APPEAR TO BE IN FINE SHAPE.
&&

.PREVIOUS DISCUSSION ISSUED AT 318 PM...
A FEW THUNDERSTORMS HAVE FORMED FROM WEST TN INTO NORTH MS THIS
AFTERNOON WHERE LAPS INDICATES CAPES HAVE INCREASED TO BETWEEN 1500
AND 3000 J/KG. WILL INDICATE ISOLATED THUNDERSTORMS IN THE FORECAST
THROUGH EARLY EVENING FOR THESE AREAS. THE THUNDERSTORMS SHOULD
QUICKLY DISSIPATE WITH LOSS OF DAYTIME HEATING LEAVING MOSTLY CLEAR
SKIES FOR THE NIGHT.

THE NEXT 7 DAYS LOOK MOSTLY HOT WITH THE CHANCE OF ANY SIGNIFICANT
RAIN SLIM. THE UPPER LEVEL RIDGE COVERING THE MIDSOUTH WILL MOVE
EAST FRIDAY INTO THE WEEKEND. THIS WILL ALLOW FOR SOME INCREASE IN
MOISTURE ACROSS THE AREA RESULTING IN SMALL CHANCES FOR AFTERNOON
AND EVENING THUNDERSTORMS. WITH UPPER LEVEL HEIGHTS LOWERING ACROSS
THE MIDSOUTH...A COLD FRONT MAY COME CLOSE ENOUGH TO NORTHEAST
AR...THE MISSOURI BOOTHEEL...AND NORTHWEST TN ON SUNDAY TO ENHANCE
THE CHANCE OF RAIN A LITTLE.

THE LATEST GFS INDICATES THE UPPER LEVEL RIDGE BUILDING BACK STRONG
ACROSS THE MIDSOUTH EARLY NEXT WEEK. THIS SPELLS MORE HOT WEATHER
WITH JUST A SLIGHT CHANCE OF AFTERNOON AND EVENING THUNDERSTORMS. THE
HIGH WILL MOVE EAST OF THE MIDSOUTH ABOUT THURSDAY WITH MOISTURE
INCREASING ACROSS THE MIDSOUTH...LEADING TO SLIGHTLY BETTER CHANCES
OF RAIN.

FXUS64 KMEG 111455
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
955 AM CDT THU AUG 11 2005

.DISCUSSION...

UPDATED FORECAST MAINLY TO REMOVE MORNING WORDING. CURRENT
FORECAST IS ON TRACK. UPPER LEVEL RIDGE COVERS THE MIDSOUTH THIS
MORNING. WATER VAPOR SATELLITE IMAGERY SHOWS BAND OF DRY MID AND
UPPER LEVEL AIR STRETCHING WEST TO EAST FROM OK ACROSS THE MIDSOUTH
INTO EAST TN. DRY AIR MIXED DOWN SOME YESTERDAY AFTERNOON LOWERING
SURFACE DEWPOINTS...AND HELPING TO HOLD HEAT INDICES DOWN SOMEWHAT.
THINK THIS WILL BE THE CASE AGAIN THIS AFTERNOON...HOWEVER WILL
NEED TO MONITOR MEMPHIS WHICH WILL BE THE SPOT MOSTLY LIKE TO
APPROACH THE 105 DEGREE HEAT INDEX MARK THIS AFTERNOON. 20 PERCENT
POP FOR AREAS SOUTH OF THE TN BORDER LOOKS OK FOR THIS AFTERNOON...
WHICH IS CLOSER TO AN ELONGATED UPPER LEVEL TROUGH TO OUR SOUTH.

.PREV DISCUSSION...
ISSUED 333 AM CDT THU AUG 11 2005

00Z UPPER AIR ANALYSIS CENTERS HIGH PRESSURE ACROSS SOUTHWEST
MISSOURI AND TROUGH AXIS BISECTING THE EASTERN US FROM THE EASTERN
GREAT LAKES TO THE PANHANDLE OF FLORIDA. BETTER MOISTURE POOLING
LOCATED ACROSS THE NORTHERN PERIPHERY OF THE RIDGE WHERE IR SATELLITE
TRENDS SHOW A WEAKENING MESOSCALE CONVECTIVE COMPLEX MOVING ACROSS
THE CENTRAL PLAINS. MAIN FORECAST CONCERNS THIS PACKAGE WILL BE
CONVECTIVE CHANCES AND HEAT ADVISORY POTENTIAL.

TODAY AND TONIGHT...NOT EXPECTING MUCH CHANGE IN THE CONVECTIVE
CHANCES ACROSS THE MID SOUTH TODAY. WEAK WINDS ALOFT...LI/S AROUND -6
AND SURFACE BASED CAPES AROUND 3000 J/KG POINT TO PULSE TYPE
CONVECTION IF ANY PARCELS ARE ABLE TO DEVELOP AND SUSTAIN THEMSELVES.
MADE ONLY SLIGHT ADJUSTMENTS TO POPS FOR THIS AFTERNOON...KEEPING A
SLIGHT CHANCE ACROSS A PORTION OF EASTERN ARKANSAS AND NORTHERN
MISSISSIPPI WHERE PROXIMITY TO TROUGH AXIS MAY HELP TO PRODUCE A
SHOWER OR THUNDERSTORM. 850 TEMPERATURES AROUND 19-20C WILL PRODUCE
HIGHS IN THE LOWER TO MIDDLE 90S WITH SURFACE DEWPOINTS IN THE LOWER
TO MIDDLE 70S COMBINING TO PRODUCE HEAT INDICIES IN A FEW PLACES
AROUND 105 DEGREES. MINIMAL IF ANY CONVECTION WILL COME TO AN END
ACROSS THE NORTHERN MISSISSIPPI/EASTERN ARKANSAS TONIGHT WITH LOW
TEMPERATURES SIMILAR TO THIS MORNING AS SOUTHERLY FLOW SETS UP
DURING THE LATE AFTERNOON/EARLY EVENING.

FRIDAY THROUGH SATURDAY NIGHT...NAM/GFS BOTH SHOW A WEAKNESS WITHIN
THE MID LEVEL SOUTHWEST FLOW. STILL THINK 20 POPS ACROSS THE AREA
ARE JUSTIFIED ACROSS MUCH OF THE AREA BUT ADJUSTED THE FAR SOUTHEAST
SECTION IN NORTHEAST MISSISSIPPI UP TO CHANCE POPS WITH PULSE TYPE
CONVECTION EXPECTED FRIDAY AFTERNOON AND SATURDAY AFTERNOON.
TEMPERATURES WILL BE SOMEWHAT SIMILAR TO TODAY WITH 850 MB
TEMPERATURES AROUND 19C. WILL NOT ISSUE A HEAT ADVISORY AT THIS TIME
BUT DAY SHIFT WILL RE-EVALUATE SITUATION AFTER 12Z RUN COMES IN THIS
MORNING.

SUNDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY...LATEST MODEL RUNS TAKE FRONT THROUGH
LOWER/MIDDLE MISSISSIPPI VALLEY A BIT SLOWER THAN PREVIOUS RUNS AND
WILL CONTINUE 30 POPS THROUGH THE END OF THE LONG RANGE FORECAST.

&&


.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES
AR...NONE.

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 102046
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
345 PM CDT WED AUG 10 2005

.DISCUSSION...

A WEAK UPPER TROUGH EXTENDING FROM THE SE STATES INTO TX WILL 
GRADUALLY DISSIPATE THROUGH THURSDAY. ISOLATED TSTMS WILL BE 
MAINLY NEAR THIS TROUGH THROUGH EARLY EVENING OVER THE SE PART OF 
THE CWA.

A BROAD SUBTROPICAL HIGH WILL BE CENTERED OVER THE OZARKS AND THE 
MIDSOUTH TONIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY...THEN SLOWLY DRIFT TO THE SE 
STATES FRI. THIS HIGH WILL BE CENTERED OVER THE SE ATLANTIC COAST 
SAT-SUN AS IT MERGES WITH THE BERMUDA HIGH TO THE EAST. A SECOND 
UPPER HIGH WILL BE OVER THE GULF OF MEXICO OVER THE WEEKEND. HOT AND 
HUMID CONDITIONS WILL PREVAIL THROUGH THE WEEKEND. HEAT INDICES WILL 
NEED TO BE WATCHED THU-FRI...BUT AT THIS TIME IT LOOKS TO BE JUST 
BELOW HEAT ADVISORY CRITERIA.

TSTMS WILL BE ISOLATED OVER MAINLY THE S-SE PART OF THE CWA 
AGAIN ON THURSDAY. THE ISOLATED PM TSTMS COULD DEVELOP ANYWHERE 
ACROSS THE CWA FRI-WEEKEND AS THE HIGH DRIFTS TO OUR EAST AND A FEW 
WEAK SHORTWAVES TRACK CLOSER TO THE FORECAST AREA. THE CHCS OF TSTMS 
WILL BE A LITTLE HIGHER MON-WED AS MOISTURE INCREASES MON-TUE AND A 
COLD FRONT APPROACHES FROM THE N BY WEDNESDAY.

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 100747
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
245 AM CDT WED AUG 10 2005

.DISCUSSION...SURFACE ANALYSIS THIS MORNING PLACES A STATIONARY 
FRONT ACROSS THE UPPER MISSISSIPPI VALLEY AND A WEAK SURFACE TROUGH 
ACROSS SOUTHERN ALA/GA/MS. BETWEEN THESE TWO FEATURES A RIDGE OF 
HIGH PRESSURE IS SUPRESSING CONVECTION ACROSS THE MID SOUTH. 
REGIONAL WSR-88D RADAR SHOWS A FEW CELLS WHICH DEVELOPED FROM FULTON 
TO OSAGE BEACH MISSOURI BUT QUICKLY DIMINISHED AS IT ENCOUNTERED THE 
RIDGE. 

TODAY AND TONIGHT...SURFACE AND UPPER LEVEL RIDGING CENTERED ACROSS 
SOUTHERN MISSOURI WILL KEEP MOST CONVECTIVE ACTIVITY TO A MINIMUM 
ACROSS THE THE MID SOUTH THIS AFTERNOON. MODEL SOUNDINGS SHOW 
2000-3000 CAPES ACROSS MUCH OF THE AREA...LI/S AROUND -6 AND WEAK 
WINDS ALOFT. ALL OF THESE PARAMETERS POINT TO PULSE TYPE CONVECTION. 
BETTER INSTABILITY WILL BE ACROSS NORTHERN MISSISSIPPI AND TRIMMED 
SLIGHT CHANCE POPS BACK TO AREAS ALONG AND SOUTH OF I-40. STILL NO 
MID/UPPER LEVEL SUPPORT FOR ANY CONVECTIVE ACTIVITY AND THINK MOST 
AREAS SHOULD REMAIN DRY. ANY CONVECTIVE ACTIVITY THAT DEVELOPS WILL 
COME TO AN END EARLY THIS EVENING AS INSTABILITY DIMINISHES WITH THE 
LOSS OF DAYTIME HEATING. WINDS WILL REMAIN LIGHT AND VARIABLE 
WITH LOWS DROPPING BACK INTO THE LOWER TO MIDDLE 70S ACROSS THE 
FORECAST AREA.

THURSDAY AND THURSDAY NIGHT...SURFACE/UPPER LEVEL RIDGING WILL GRADUALLY 
SHIFT EAST DURING THE DAY ALLOWING A LIGHT SOUTHERLY RETURN FLOW TO 
DEVELOP. NOT MUCH CHANGE IN FORECASTED POPS COMPARED TO TODAY/S 
FORECAST WITH HIGHS IN THE 90S AND LOWS IN THE 70S.

FRIDAY THROUGH TUESDAY...BOTH NAM/GFS IN AGREEMENT WITH DEVELOPING A 
500 MB SHORTWAVE IN THE MID LEVEL SOUTHWEST FLOW ON FRIDAY. WILL NOT 
MAKE ANY CHANGES TO CURRENT POPS FOR FRIDAY AFTERNOON. MINOR 
WEAKNESSES IN THE FLOW WILL BRING A CHANCE OF SHOWERS AND 
THUNDERSTORMS TO THE MID SOUTH THROUGH NEXT WEEK WITH BETTER CHANCES 
BY MONDAY AS A COLD FRONT APPROACHES AND STALLS OUT ACROSS THE AREA 
INTO MID WEEK.
&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
140 PM CDT TUE AUG 9 2005

.DISCUSSION...
PARTLY TO MOSTLY SUNNY SKIES PREVAIL ACRS THE MID SOUTH THIS AFTN 
WHILE A COUPLE OF SHOWERS HAVE POPPED UP ACRS NRN MS. TEMPS HAVE 
CLIMBED TO ABOUT 90 BY EARLY AFTERNOON...A COUPLE OF DEGREES AHEAD 
OF YESTERDAY. ISOLD SHOWERS/TSTMS ARE POSSIBLE THROUGH THE EARLY 
EVENING HOURS THEN EXPECT MOSTLY CLEAR SKIES.

THROUGH THE END OF THE WEEK...A BROAD UPPER RIDGE WILL CONTINUE ACRS 
THE SRN U.S. HIGH TEMPS WL CLIMB INTO THE MID 90S ON WED AND CONT 
THROUGH THE END OF THE WORK WEEK. EXPECT MILD OVERNIGHT LOWS WITH 
MOSTLY CLEAR SKIES. DURING THE DAY EXPECT SCT CU...ISOLD AFTN/EARLY 
EVE TSTMS CANNOT BE RULED OUT WED-FRI.

WEEKEND INTO MON...NOT MUCH CHANGE EXPECTED...UPPER RIDGE 
CONSOLIDATES OVER THE SE U.S. WITH A RETURN OF SOUTHERLY SFC FLOW 
ACRS THE MID SOUTH. EXPECT WARM AND HUMID CONDS TO CONT WITH MAINLY 
AFTN AND EVENING ISOLD TSTMS. 

MON NIGHT INTO TUE...PATTERN SHOWING SIGNS OF BREAKING DOWN A LITTLE 
IN LONG RANGE MODELS. 12Z GFS INDICATES A 500 MB TROF MOVING INTO 
THE CENTER OF THE U.S. BY TUE WITH A WEAK FRONT WEAKENING ACRS THE 
MID SOUTH. THIS WOULD LEAD TO A BETTER CHANCE FOR PRECIP MON NIGHT 
INTO TUE AND SLIGHTLY COOLER TEMPS.

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 091552
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
1048 AM CDT TUE AUG 9 2005

.UPDATE...
WEAK UPPER TROF REMAINS OVER THE SE U.S. THIS MORNING. CU FIELDS 
DEVELOPING ACRS ERN SXNS ONCE AGAIN THIS MORNING. EXPECT MOST OF THE 
CONVECTIVE ACTIVITY TO REMAIN TO THE EAST OF THE REGION TODAY WHERE 
DEEPER MOISTURE EXISTS. FOR OUR AREA EXPECT CONVECTION TO BE SIMILAR 
IN COVERAGE TO MONDAY AFTERNOON. SINCE NE MS AND AREAS ALONG THE TN 
RIVER IN W TN ARE CLOSEST TO THE WEAK UPPER TROF THEY PROBABLY STAND 
THE HIGHEST CHANCE OF AN AFTN/EVE SHOWER/TSTM. AREAS IN THE DELTA 
PROBABLY STAND THE LEAST CHANCE WHILE THE HIGHER TERRAIN OF NE AR 
INCLUDING CROWLEYS RIDGE HAS BEEN A DAILY FOCUS FOR ISOLD 
CONVECTION. TEMPS RUNNING ABOUT 3 DEGREES HIGHER THAN MONDAY SO 
ADDED A DEGREE OR TWO TO HIGH TEMPS FOR THIS AFTN.

SJM

.PREV DISCUSSION ISSUED AT 255 AM CDT...00Z UPPER AIR MAPS PLACE 
UPPER LEVEL LOW ACROSS NORTHERN/CENTRAL ALABAMA WITH A FEW 
SHORTWAVES ROTATING AROUND THIS FEATURE. 850 MB MOISTURE AXIS 
EXTENDS FROM THE GULF OF MEXICO INTO MOST OF THE TENNESSEE VALLEY. 
INFRARED SATELLITE IMAGERY THIS MORNING SHOWING SOME 25KFT CIRRUS 
MOVING ACROSS ARKANSAS. 

TODAY...NOT MUCH CHANGE EXPECTED IN THE AIR MASS ACROSS THE MID 
SOUTH TODAY. MODEL SOUNDINGS INDICATE ISOLATED SHOWERS AND 
THUNDERSTORMS MIGHT POSSIBLY DEVELOP BY MID TO LATE AFTERNOON AS 
TEMPERATURES REACH THE LOWER 90S WITH CONVECTIVE INDICIES PRODUCING 
CAPES AROUND 3000 J/KG...LI/S AROUND -6/-7...AND RELATIVELY WEAK 
WINDS ALOFT. THIS SUGGESTS PULSE TYPE CONVECTION FOR ANY AREAS THAT 
REACH CONVECTIVE TEMPERATURES IN THE LOWER TO MIDDLE 90S. 850 MB 
TEMPERATURES AROUND 20 C WILL PRODUCE HIGHS IN THE LOWER 90S. CANNOT 
JUSTIFY MAKING ANY SIGNIFICANT CHANGES TO TODAY/S POPS AT THIS TIME 
WITH BEST CHANCES REMAINING EAST OF THE MISSISSIPPI RIVER. 

TONIGHT...ANY ISOLATED CONVECTION THAT DEVELOPS SHOULD COME TO AN 
END BY MID EVENING WITH THE LOSS OF DAYTIME INSTABILITY. 
TEMPERATURES WILL DROP BACK INTO THE 70S WITH DECOUPLING WINDS 
DURING THE NIGHT.

WEDNESDAY AND WEDNESDAY NIGHT WILL BE A DEGREE OR TWO HIGHER THAN 
TODAY WITH HIGHS IN THE 90S AND LOWS IN THE 70S. MADE ONLY SLIGHT 
ADJUSTMENTS TO POPS WITH THE BEST CHANCE OF PRECIPITATION EAST OF 
THE MISSISSIPPI RIVER. 

THURSDAY...UPPER LEVEL RIDGING WILL INCREASE ACROSS THE MID SOUTH AS 
UPPER LEVEL LOW ACROSS ALABAMA MOVES OFF THE EAST COAST OF THE 
UNITED STATES. BEST CHANCE OF ANY ISOLATED CONVECTION WILL BE MAINLY 
ACROSS SOUTHERN MISSISSIPPI. 

FRIDAY THROUGH MONDAY...SOUTHERLY RETURN FLOW WILL BEGIN TO SET UP 
ACROSS THE MID SOUTH AS HIGH PRESSURE BEGINS TO MOVE OFF TO THE 
EAST. WILL CARRY 20 POPS THROUGH THE END OF THE LONG RANGE FORECAST 
AS AREA WILL BE IN SOUTHWEST FLOW WITH AFTERNOON/EARLY EVENING 
ISOLATED SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS. 

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES

EXPECTING EARLY THIS EVENING THEN MOSTLY CLEAR SKIES. 

WEAK UPPER TROF OVER THE SE U.S. WL SLOWLY LIFT OUT OF THE AREA OVER 
THE NEXT COUPLE OF DAYS AS A BROAD UPPER RIDGE BUILDS ACRS THE 
REGION BY THU. AIRMASS BECOMES A LITTLE DRIER AS THE WEEK PROGRESSES 
SO EXPECT JUST ISOLD AFTN/EARLY EVENING SHOWERS/TSTMS AT MOST TUE 
AND WED. WL KEEP THU DRY WITH RIDGE RIGHT OVER THE REGION BUT WOULD 
NOT BE SURPRISED TO SEE A FEW TSTMS LATE IN THE DAY.  HIGH TEMPS WL 
SLOWLY START TO CLIMB EACH DAY REACHING THE MID 90S BY MID WEEK. 

TOWARD THE END OF THE WEEK THE RIDGE WL BEGIN TO SHIFT EAST TOWARD 
THE SE U.S. THIS WL NOT REALLY RESULT IN MUCH CHANGE IN THE SENSIBLE 
WEATHER WITH CONT WARM/MUGGY CONDS AND ISOLD AFTN/EVE TSTMS.

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 081521
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
1021 AM CDT MON AUG 8 2005

.UPDATE...
CU FIELD STARTING TO DEVELOP ACRS NE MS AND ALONG THE TN RIVER IN 
WRN TN. CLEAR SKIES ELSEWHERE THIS MORNING WITH TEMPS AROUND THE 80 
DEGREE MARK. CURRENT FORECAST HAS A GOOD HANDLE ON THE SITUATION. 
WEAKENING LOW OVER AL SHOULD BE FOCUS OF CONVECTIVE ACTIVITY TODAY 
SO EXPECT BEST CHANCES FOR PRECIP ACRS ERN SXNS OF OUR FORECAST 
AREA...40 POPS ACRS NE MS/TN RIVER...WITH DECREASING CHANCES TOWARD 
THE WEST...20 POPS ACRS ERN AR. HIGH TEMPS FORECAST ON 
TRACK...EXPECT SLIGHTLY COOLER HIGHS...UPPER 80S...ACRS NE MS/TN 
RIVER WHERE CU IS ALREADY DEVELOPING AND PRECIP CHANCES ARE THE 
HIGHEST. NO CHANGES TO FORECAST EXPECTED ATTM WL REMOVE TIME 
SENSITIVE WORDING FROM ZONES. 

SJM

.PREV DISCUSSION ISSUED AT 350 AM CDT...
TRANQUIL SUMMER NIGHT WEATHERWISE ACROSS THE MIDSOUTH. SATELLITE 
SHOWS MOSTLY CLEAR SKIES ACROSS THE AREA. THERE HAS BEEN ENOUGH 
GRADIENT TO EVEN KEEP VISIBILITIES IN THE FOG FROM GETTING TOO LOW...
ALTHOUGH DO EXPECT VISIBILITIES TO DROP SOME CLOSER TO SUNRISE IN 
AREAS THAT RECEIVED RAIN YESTERDAY.

FOR TODAY...WILL HAVE POPS OF 30 TO 40 PERCENT EAST OF THE MS
RIVER...20 PERCENT WEST. THE LOW PRESSURE AREA MOVING INTO
SOUTHWEST GA WILL CONTINUE NORTH-NORTHEASTWARD..AND CONTINUE TO
WEAKEN. MEANWHILE...DRIER AIR WILL SPREAD INTO THE MIDSOUTH FROM
THE NORTHWEST. WATER VAPOR IMAGERY INDICATES THE DRIER AIR ALREADY
SPREADING INTO THE MIDSOUTH. DEEPER MOISTURE AND EFFECTS OF THE
WEAKENING LOW PRESSURE AREA WILL GIVE THE GREATEST CHANCE OF
THUNDERSTORMS TO EASTERN AREAS TODAY.

WE WILL CONTINUE TO SEE DIMINISHING CHANCES OF RAIN AS THE WEEK
PROGRESSES. HIGH PRESSURE ALOFT WILL SLOWLY BUILD INTO THE AREA BY
MIDWEEK AND WILL BE OVERHEAD THURSDAY. THUS WILL REMOVE ANY CHANCE
OF RAIN FOR THURSDAY (POPS LESS THAN 15 PERCENT). AS THE HIGH MOVES
EASTWARD TOWARD THE WEEKEND...MOISTURE WILL INCREASE SOME ALLOWING
FOR SMALL CHANCES OF THUNDERSTORMS.

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.

FXUS64 KMEG 080141
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
841 PM CDT SUN AUG 7 2005

.DISCUSSION...

LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM CONTINUES TO SIT OVER SOUTHERN ALABAMA. 
AFTERNOON CONVECTION IS BEGINNING TO DIMINISH WITH THE LOSS OF THE 
DAYTIME HEATING. THE SEVERITY OF THE STORMS WAS MUCH LESS THAN 
YESTERDAY PROBABLY BECAUSE IT WAS NOT NEARLY AS WARM. STILL...THE 
STORMS HAD A HEALTHY AMOUNT OF LIGHTNING...HEAVY DOWNPOURS AND 30-40 
MPH WINDS. ALTHOUGH CANT ENTIRELY RULE OUT A THUNDERSHOWER 
REDEVELOPING OVERNIGHT...IT IS PROBABLY UNLIKELY. WILL EITHER REMOVE 
POPS ENTIRELY OR REDUCE THEM TO SLIGHT CHANCE. FOG FORMATION ONCE 
AGAIN POSSIBLE WITH WINDS GOING LIGHT. THE MORE LIKELY AREAS WILL BE 
THOSE AREAS THAT SAW RAIN THIS AFTERNOON. TEMP FORECAST LOOKS 
REASONABLE. UPDATE WILL BE ISSUED ONCE CONVECTION HAS DIMINISHED A 
BIT FURTHER.

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.

.DISCUSSION...
PATTERN WILL REMAIN STAGNANT OVER THE CWA AS AN UPPER LEVEL LOW WILL 
CONTINUE TO PRODUCE OFF AND ON SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS THROUGH THE 
MIDDLE OF NEXT WEEK. EXPECT CHANCES FOR RAIN TO RANGE FROM 20 TO 40 
PERCENT FOR THE MOST PART DURING THIS TIME. HIGH TEMPERATURES WILL 
RANGE FROM UPPER 80S TO LOWER 90S DURING THIS TIME. 

BY THURSDAY...HIGH PRESSURE WILL BEGIN TO BUILD INTO THE MIDSOUTH. 
DURING THIS TIME...CHANCES FOR RAIN WILL DIMINISH TO ISOLATED 
DIURNAL CONVECTION AND TEMPERATURES WILL JUMP BACK INTO THE MID 90S 
FOR HIGHS. BY THE END OF THE FORECAST PERIOD...THE HIGH WILL BEGIN 
TO BREAK DOWN ALLOWING FOR MORE SCATTERED SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS TO 
DEVELOP OVER THE AREA.

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 070926
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
426 AM CDT SUN AUG 7 2005

.DISCUSSION...

SKIES HAVE CLEARED ACROSS MUCH OF THE MIDSOUTH THIS MORNING. AS A
RESULT...AREAS OF DENSE FOG HAVE FORMED WHERE IT RAINED YESTERDAY.
HAVE ISSUED A DENSE FOG ADVISORY FOR THE AREAS LISTED BELOW.

THE MIDSOUTH WILL HAVE A GOOD CHANCE OF THUNDERSTORMS TODAY. LOW
PRESSURE ALONG THE GULF COAST WILL LIFT SLOWLY NORTH-NORTHEASTWARD
THROUGH THE SOUTHERN HALF OF AL. MEANWHILE...AN ELONGATED WEST
TO EAST TROUGH WILL MOVE SOUTHWARD THROUGH EASTERN AR. THESE FEATURES
WILL COMBINE WITH ABUNDANT MOISTURE ACROSS THE MIDSOUTH TO PRODUCE
THE THUNDERSTORMS. SPC INDICATES A SLIGHT RISK OF SEVERE FOR THE
ENTIRE MIDSOUTH TODAY...SIMILAR TO THE LAST COUPLE OF DAYS WITH HIGH
WINDS BEING THE MAIN THREAT...AND POSSIBLY SOME LARGE HAIL. THE
NAM INDICATES THE HIGHEST CAPES THIS AFTERNOON ALONG THE MS RIVER
WESTWARD ACROSS EASTERN AR AND THE MO BOOTHEEL. THINK WE WILL
RECEIVE A DECENT AMOUNT OF SUNSHINE TO HELP BOOST MAXIMUM
TEMPERATURES INTO THE LOWER 90S.

OVER THE NEXT COUPLE OF DAYS THE LOW OVER SOUTHERN ALABAMA WILL MOVE
GRADUALLY NORTH-NORTHEASTWARD INTO EAST TENNESSEE...AND WEAKEN.
MEANWHILE...THE UPPER LEVEL TROUGH MOVING THROUGH EAST ARKANSAS TODAY
WILL MOVE TO OUR SOUTH WITH SOME RIDGING SPREADING INTO WESTERN AREAS
OF THE MIDSOUTH. DRIER AIR WILL GRADUALLY SPREAD INTO THE AREA FROM
THE NORTHWEST. THUS FOR THE FORECAST OVER THE NEXT COUPLE OF DAYS...
WE WILL SEE A GRADUAL DECREASE IN POPS. AFTER TODAY...HIGHEST POPS
WILL BE ACROSS EASTERN AREAS OF WEST TN AND NORTH MS...WITH LOWEST
POPS NORTHEAST AR AND THE MO BOOTHEEL.

TOWARD THE END OF THE WEEK...STRONG HIGH PRESSURE ALOFT WILL BUILD
ACROSS THE MIDSOUTH WITH A RETURN TO JUST A SLIGHT CHANCE OF
AFTERNOON AND EVENING THUNDERSTORMS.

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES
AR...DENSE FOG ADVISORY UNTIL 10 AM CDT THIS MORNING GENERALLY ALONG
AND NORTH OF A LINE FROM WALNUT RIDGE TO PARAGOULD...AND
GENERALLY ALONG AND SOUTH OF A LINE FROM FORREST CITY TO TURRELL.
MO...NONE.
MS...DENSE FOG ADVISORY UNTIL 10 AM CDT THIS MORNING.
TN...DENSE FOG ADVISORY UNTIL 10 AM CDT THIS MORNING GENERALLY ALONG
AND SOUTH OF A LINE FROM COVINGTON TO ALAMO TO DECATURVILLE.

PATCHY PERHAPS EVEN DENSE FOG IS POSSIBLE OVER PORTIONS OF THE 
REGION. INTEND TO DO AN UPDATE ALTHOUGH WILL WAIT UNTIL THE COVERAGE 
DIMINISHES A LITTLE MORE BEFORE DOING SO.

AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
419 AM CDT SAT AUG 6 2005

.DISCUSSION...

THE MIDSOUTH IS LOCATED EARLY THIS MORNING BETWEEN LOW PRESSURE ALONG
THE NORTHERN GULF COAST AND A DYING COLD FRONT TO OUR NORTH.
AN IMPULSE ROTATING AROUND THE LOW HAS SPARKED A FEW THUNDERSTORMS
ACROSS NORTH ALABAMA THIS MORNING WHICH ARE MOVING WEST. THE COLD
FRONT TO OUR NORTH HAS BECOME RATHER DIFFUSE WITH LOWER DEWPOINTS
LOCATED ACROSS MISSOURI. A WEST TO EAST UPPER LEVEL TROUGH WHICH
HELPED TO PUSH THE COLD FRONT SOUTHWARD IS LOCATED THROUGH MO AND
IL AND HAS SET OFF A FEW THUNDERSTORMS IN SOUTHERN MO THIS MORNING.
THE UPPER LEVEL TROUGH TO OUR NORTH WILL MOVE SLOWLY SOUTHEASTWARD
TODAY AND CONTINUE TO WEAKEN. MEANWHILE...LOW PRESSURE WILL
CONTINUE TO MEANDER ALONG THE NORTHERN GULF COAST. THE COMBINATION
OF THESE WEATHER FEATURES HAS INCREASED THE MEAN ATMOSPHERIC MOISTURE
ACROSS THE MIDSOUTH. THIS IN COMBINATION WITH DAYTIME HEATING WILL
CAUSE SCATTERED THUNDERSTORMS ACROSS THE AREA. MID LEVEL DRY AIR
WRAPPING AROUND THE NORTHWEST PERIPHERY OF THE LOW ALONG THE GULF
COAST HELPED TO SET OFF SEVERE THUNDERSTORMS...MAINLY WITH
MICROBURSTS...YESTERDAY AFTERNOON ACROSS EASTERN PARTS OF THE
MIDSOUTH. WATER VAPOR IMAGERY INDICATES SOME MID LEVEL DRY AIR
STILL WRAPPING IN ACROSS THE MIDSOUTH...BUT NOT NEARLY AS EXTENSIVE
AS YESTERDAY AS THE MIDSOUTH ATMOSPHERE CONTINUES TO MOISTEN. WILL
MENTION THE THREAT OF ISOLATED SEVERE FOR TODAY IN THE HAZARDOUS
WEATHER OUTLOOK WITH HIGH WINDS THE MAIN THREAT...BUT THINK THE
THREAT WILL BE LESS THAN YESTERDAY. ADDED HAZE TO THE GRIDS FOR
TODAY...HOPEFULLY THUNDERSTORMS TODAY WILL HELP TO CLEAN THE
ATMOSPHERE SOME. DAYTIME HIGHS WILL BE REDUCED A LITTLE AS A RESULT
OF THE INCREASE IN CONVECTION.

THE LOW ALONG THE GULF COAST WILL LIFT SLOWLY NORTHWARD THROUGH
ALABAMA THE NEXT COUPLE OF DAYS...AND GRADUALLY WEAKEN. WILL HAVE
THE GREATEST POPS ACROSS EASTERN AREAS CLOSER TO THE LOW. BROAD
UPPER LEVEL TROFINESS WILL PERSIST ACROSS THE MIDSOUTH INTO THE
MIDDLE OF NEXT WEEK...CONTINUING THE CHANCE OF THUNDERSTORMS. HIGH
PRESSURE IS FORECAST TO BUILD ONCE AGAIN ACROSS THE MIDSOUTH TOWARD
THE END OF THE WEEK REDUCING OUR CHANCES OF RAIN.

EXTENDING FROM ROUGHLY CLARKSDALE MS THROUGH MEMPHIS AND JACKSON TO 
PARIS. HAVE LEFT IN LOW POPS OVER NORTHEAST ARKANSAS/BOOTHEEL AND 
NORTHEAST MS WHERE THE PROXIMITY OF THE FRONT AND THE VORT MAX IN 
COMBINATION WITH THE MOISTURE IN THOSE AREAS COULD STILL TRIGGER A

MOVE NORTHWARD ALONG THE MISSISSIPPI/ALABAMA BORDER AND BY

MAY NEED TO BE RAISED EVEN FURTHER...ESPECIALLY FOR MONDAY WHEN THE 
LOW PASSES OVER PORTIONS OF THE MIDSOUTH. CONVECTION SHOULD ALSO 
KEEP TEMPERATURES A TAD COOLER WITH HIGHS IN THE UPPER 80S TO LOWER 
90S.

HIGH PRESSURE WILL RETURN TO THE CWA BY MIDWEEK AND WILL DOMINATE 
THE WEATHER THROUGH THE END OF THE FORECAST PERIOD. EXPECT TYPICAL 
SUMMERTIME DIURNAL CONVECTION AROUND THE MIDSOUTH. WILL PUT 30 POPS 
DURING THE DAY WITH 20 AT NIGHT. HIGH TEMPERATURES WILL ALSO RETURN 
TO THE MID 90S.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
358 AM CDT FRI AUG 5 2005

.DISCUSSION...
SATELLITE SHOWED MOSTLY CLEAR SKIES ACROSS THE MIDSOUTH EARLY THIS
MORNING. SURFACE OBSERVATIONS INDICATED PATCHY FOG. TEMPERATURES
WERE AT SEASONAL LEVELS.

ANOTHER HOT DAY IS IN STORE FOR THE MIDSOUTH AS UPPER LEVEL HIGH
PRESSURE TRIES TO HOLD ACROSS THE MIDSOUTH. AN UPPER LEVEL TROUGH
FROM THE GREAT LAKES THROUGH THE UPPER MIDWEST WILL MOVE SLOWLY
SOUTHEASTWARD TODAY. THIS WILL HELP TO PUSH A COLD FRONT LOCATED
FROM CENTRAL IL TO SOUTHWEST MO TOWARD THE MIDSOUTH. HOWEVER...
THE FRONT WILL HAVE A HARD TIME MAKING IT VERY FAR SOUTHEASTWARD WITH
THE STRONG UPPER LEVEL HIGH ACROSS THE MIDSOUTH. WILL CONTINUE
WITH THE PREVIOUS FORECAST OF 30 PERCENT POPS FOR TODAY...ALTHOUGH
THIS COULD BE A LITTLE ON THE HIGH SIDE. THE NAM DOES INDICATE AN
EAST TO WEST SURFACE TROUGH / WIND SHIFT DEVELOPING WELL AHEAD OF THE
FRONT ACROSS THE MIDSOUTH THIS AFTERNOON. LOW LEVEL CONVERGENCE
ALONG THIS BOUNDARY COULD HELP TO SPARK SOME THUNDERSTORMS.
LOOKING AT THE FORECAST DEWPOINT GRADIENTS...NOT SURE THE TRUE COLD
FRONT WILL EVER MAKE IT INTO THE MIDSOUTH.

THE UPPER LEVEL RIDGE OVER THE MIDSOUTH WILL WEAKEN AFTER TODAY...
BASICALLY LEAVING THE MIDSOUTH IN A WEAKNESS BETWEEN ONE HIGH TO THE
WEST AND ANOTHER TO THE EAST. THIS WILL ALLOW FOR AN INCREASE IN RAIN
CHANCES OVER THE WEEKEND...POSSIBLY INTO EARLY NEXT WEEK. BY
SATURDAY...THE COLD FRONT MOVING TOWARD THE MIDSOUTH WILL WEAKEN
ACROSS OR JUST NORTH OF THE AREA. MEANWHILE...LOW PRESSURE ALONG THE
NORTHERN GULF COAST WILL HELP TO PUSH INCREASING MOISTURE INTO
THE MIDSOUTH. ALL OF THIS COMBINED WITH DAYTIME HEATING...WILL LEAD
TO SCATTERED THUNDERSTORMS THIS WEEKEND. AN INCREASE IN CLOUDS AND
RAIN WILL HELP TO HOLD DAYTIME TEMPERATURES DOWN SOME.

WILL CONTINUE WITH CHANCE POPS INTO NEXT WEEK. HOWEVER...THE GFS
HINTS THE LOW ALONG THE NORTHERN GULF MAY MOVE NORTHWARD. IF THIS
OCCURS...POPS MAY NEED TO BE RAISED SOME FOR MONDAY. HIGH PRESSURE
ALOFT WILL ONCE AGAIN BUILD OVER THE MIDSOUTH TOWARD THE END OF
NEXT WEEK REDUCING OUR CHANCES OF RAIN.

THE BEST CHANCE AS FRONT WILL BE CENTERED OVER THE MIDSOUTH. WILL 
INCREASE POPS TO 40.

FRONT WILL WASH OUT OVER THE AREA BY SUNDAY. EXPECT THE REMNANT 
TROUGH TO REMAIN OVER THE CWA THROUGH THE END OF THE FORECAST 
PERIOD. THIS WILL HELP PRODUCE ISOLATED TO SCATTERED DIURNAL 
CONVECTION THROUGH THE END OF THE FORECAST PERIOD. TEMPERATURES WILL

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 040808
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
308 AM CDT THU AUG 4 2005

.DISCUSSION...

HIGH PRESSURE REMAINS THE DOMINANT WEATHER FEATURE OVER THE MID-
SOUTH THIS MORNING. MOSTLY CLEAR SKIES WITH TEMPERATURES RANGING
FROM THE UPPER 60S EAST TO THE MID AND UPPER 70S ACROSS THE
REMAINDER OF THE FORECAST AREA. TEMPERATURES HAVE BOTTOMED OUT
NEAR THE DEWPOINTS OVER EASTERN AREAS AND THIS HAS ALLOWED AREAS OF
FOG TO ONCE AGAIN DEVELOP OVER THESE LOCATIONS.

UPPER LEVEL RIDGING WILL CONTINUE OVER THE AREA TODAY WITH SURFACE
HIGH PRESSURE CENTERED TO THE EAST CONTINUING TO RIDGE WESTWARD
OVER THE MID-SOUTH. IN ADDITION...PLENTY OF DRY MID LEVEL AIR NOTED
ON LATEST WATER VAPOR IMAGERY AND THIS ALONG WITH SUBSIDENCE SHOULD
PREVENT CONVECTION FROM DEVELOPING OVER MOST OF THE AREA TODAY.
WITH THIS IN MIND WILL KEEP PRECIPITATION CHANCES OUT OF THE FORECAST
FOR THIS AFTERNOON. IN ADDITION...SOME OF THE DRY AIR ALOFT MAY TEND
TO MIX DOWN INTO THE LOWER LEVELS AS DAYTIME HEATING BEGINS AND THIS
WILL ALLOW TEMPERATURES TO HEAT UP A FEW DEGREES ABOVE YESTERDAYS
MAXES. ALSO...AFTER A SUNNY MORNING EXPECT SOME DIURNAL CU TO DEVELOP
AND RESULT IN PARTLY CLOUDY SKIES THIS AFTERNOON ALONG WITH HOT
AFTERNOON TEMPERATURES INTO THE MIDDLE 90S.

AS WE APPROACH THE WEEKEND...AN UPPER LEVEL TROUGH NOW MAKING ITS
WAY EASTWARD ACROSS SOUTHERN CANADA AND THE NORTHERN PLAINS STATES
WILL SEND A COLD FRONT...NOW STRETCHED FROM THE GREAT LAKES
REGION SOUTHWEST ACROSS IOWA INTO NORTHERN KANSAS...TOWARDS THE MID-
SOUTH BY FRIDAY NIGHT. THE ORIENTATION OF THE UPPER PATTERN AND
UPPER LEVEL WIND FLOW SUGGESTS THAT THE FRONT WILL SLOW DOWN AND
STALL ACROSS THE MID-SOUTH OVER THE WEEKEND. WITH THE FRONT
STRETCHED ACROSS THE AREA...HAVE KEPT CHANCES FOR SHOWERS AND
THUNDERSTORMS IN THE FORECAST FOR LATE FRIDAY THROUGH SUNDAY...WITH
THE HIGHEST CHANCES BEING DIURNALLY DRIVEN AND COINCIDING WITH PEAK
AFTERNOON HEATING. THE FRONT WILL TEND TO WASH OUT OVER THE AREA BY
THE END OF THE WEEKEND. WITH THE FRONT IN THE VICINITY AND CHANCES
FOR SHOWERS...THUNDERSTORMS...AND INCREASED CLOUD COVER...HAVE
KNOCKED TEMPERATURES BACK A FEW DEGREES FOR THE WEEKEND AS WELL.
STILL NOT LOOKING FOR A WASH OUT BY ANY MEANS THIS WEEKEND...AND
CONVECTIVE COVERAGE SHOULD REMAIN SCATTERED.

FOR THE EXTENDED PERIOD...A WEAKNESS IN THE UPPER LEVELS OF THE
ATMOSPHERE...LEFT BEHIND BY THE DEPARTING TROUGH OVER THE WEEKEND
WILL PERSIST INTO EARLY NEXT WEEK. AT THE SAME TIME...MEDIUM RANGE
MODELS ARE CONTINUING TO INDICATE THE PERSISTENT SURFACE TROUGH
CURRENTLY STRETCHED ALONG THE GULF COAST...SLOWLY LIFTING BACK TO THE
NORTH DURING THIS TIME PERIOD...ALONG WITH ASSOCIATED DEEPER
MOISTURE. THEREFORE...HAVE DECIDED TO LEAVE CHANCES FOR SCATTERED
SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS IN THE FORECAST FOR EARLY NEXT WEEK.
TEMPERATURES SHOULD REMAIN NEAR OR SLIGHTLY BELOW CLIMATOLOGY DURING
THE EXTENDED PERIOD...DUE TO EXPECTED CLOUD COVER AND POSSIBLE
CONVECTION.

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES

MO...NONE
MS...NONE

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
200 PM CDT WED AUG 3 2005

.DISCUSSION...
A WEAK RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE WAS IN CONTROL OF THE SOUTHERN TWO 
THIRDS OF THE U.S. SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE HAS BUILT SOUTHWEST INTO 
EASTERN TENNESSEE TODAY AND PUSHED THE MAJORITY OF CONVECTION INTO 
CENTRAL MISSISSIPPI. A FEW ISOLATED SHOWERS COULD STILL DEVELOP 
BETWEEN NOW AND SUNSET BUT NOTHING TO HANG OUR HAT ON.

A DECENT TROUGH WILL MOVE ACROSS SOUTH/CENTRAL CANADA OVERNIGHT. 
THIS WILL HELP PUSH A COLD FRONT CLOSER TO THE MID SOUTH. TRANQUIL 
WEATHER I.E. HOT AND DRY WILL PERSIST UNTIL THE BEGINNING OF THE 
WEEKEND WHEN THIS FRONT WILL SLOWLY ENTER THE FORECAST AREA.

THE SPEED OF THE FRONT WILL DETERMINE IF CHANCES OF RAIN FRIDAY 
NIGHT. THEY WILL NEED TO BE HIGHER IF THE FRONT MOVES FASTER THAN WE 
ARE THINKING FOR THIS FORECAST. ALSO CONCERNED ABOUT THE FRONT 
STALLING AND BISECTING THE AREA. IN ADDITION...THERE IS A WEAK 
SHORTWAVE TRANSLATING ACROSS MISSOURI SATURDAY NIGHT. THIS SHORTWAVE 
WILL BE SLOW TO EXIT THE AREA AS IT WILL JUST DEEPEN A TROUGH THAT 
SETS UP OVER THE MISSISSIPPI VALLEY. THE TROUGH WILL SLOWLY PUSH 
EAST AS THE RIDGE OVER THE WESTERN U.S. DRIFTS EASTWARD TOWARD THE 
END OF NEXT WEEK.

LOW LEVEL MOISTURE REMAINS HIGH OVER THE WHOLE AREA THROUGH THE 
FIRST HALF OF NEXT WEEK. THUS RAIN CHANCES WILL BE HIGHLY DEPENDENT 
ON THE FEATURES DESCRIBED ABOVE.

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 030821
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
321 AM CDT WED AUG 3 2005

.DISCUSSION...

ANOTHER QUIET MORNING ACROSS THE MID-SOUTH WITH CLEAR SKIES AND
TEMPERATURES PRIMARILY IN THE 70S AREAWIDE. SOME PATCHY FOG AND
HAZE HAS DEVELOPED ACROSS PORTIONS OF THE AREA AS WELL.

THE OVERALL WEATHER PATTERN WILL REMAIN THE SAME TODAY WITH SURFACE
HIGH PRESSURE CENTERED OVER THE OHIO VALLEY EXTENDING SOUTHWARD
OVER THE FORECAST AREA. UPPER LEVEL RIDGING WILL CONTINUE TO BUILD
OVER THE NORTHERN HALF OF THE AREA...WITH WEAK UPPER LEVEL
TROUGHING STILL REMAINING IN PLACE OVER SOUTHERN SECTIONS. THIS WEAK
UPPER SUPPORT COMBINED WITH INCREASED INSTABILITY FROM SUFFICIENT
LOW LEVEL MOISTURE AND DAYTIME HEATING WILL AGAIN SUPPORT THE
DEVELOPMENT OF ISOLATED SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS OVER THE SOUTHERN
THIRD OF THE FORECAST AREA. THINK THAT OVERALL COVERAGE MAY BE A
BIT LESS THAN THAT SEEN YESTERDAY AFTERNOON...BUT STILL ENOUGH TO
WARRANT THE 20 POP SOUTH. TEMPERATURES SHOULD ONCE AGAIN BE SIMILAR
TO OR A DEGREE OR TWO WARMER THAN YESTERDAYS HIGHS.

THE UPPER LEVEL TROUGHING OVER SOUTHERN PORTIONS OF THE AREA TODAY
WILL GIVE WAY TO RISING HEIGHTS AND UPPER LEVEL RIDGING OVER MOST
OF THE MID-SOUTH ON THURSDAY. THIS SHOULD HELP FURTHER LIMIT
CONVECTIVE DEVELOPMENT AND HAVE LEFT MENTION OF SHOWERS AND
THUNDERSTORMS OUT OF THE ZONES (14% POPS). WITH INCREASED RIDGING...
LESS CLOUD COVER AND CONVECTION...BELIEVE THAT TEMPERATURES WILL BE
EVEN A DEGREE OR TWO WARMER ON THURSDAY.

A SHORTWAVE TROUGH CURRENTLY MOVING ACROSS THE NORTHERN ROCKIES
WILL MOVE EASTWARD ACROSS THE NORTHERN PLAINS STATES AND INTO THE
GREAT LAKES REGION THROUGH FRIDAY. THIS WILL HELP TO SEND A COLD
FRONT TOWARDS THE REGION FOR THE END OF THE WEEK. MODELS HAVE
TRENDED SLOWER AND LESS AGGRESSIVE WITH THE SOUTHWARD PROGRESSION
OF THE FRONT. LOOKING AT CURRENT UPPER AIR PATTERN...TEND TO FAVOR
LESS SOUTHWARD MOVEMENT. THINK FRONT WILL MOVE INTO NORTHERN AREAS
ON FRIDAY INTO FRIDAY NIGHT BEFORE STALLING OUT ON SATURDAY...AND
WASHING OUT COMPLETELY ON SUNDAY. HAVE TRIMMED POPS BACK ON THURSDAY
NIGHT TO JUST SLIGHT CHANCE OVER NORTHERN SECTIONS AND KEPT LOW END
CHANCE POPS AREAWIDE ON FRIDAY TO ACCOUNT FOR WEAK FRONT IN AREA AND
DAYTIME INSTABILITY. LINGERED SLIGHT CHANCE POPS INTO SATURDAY IN
ASSOCIATION WITH STALLED FRONT. TEMPERATURES SHOULD BE HELD BACK A
FEW DEGREES FRIDAY AND SATURDAY DUE TO MORE CLOUDS AND PRECIPITATION
CHANCES.

WEAK HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS BACK IN ON SUNDAY WITH A DRY DAY...BEFORE
A STALLED SURFACE TROUGH AND DEEPER MOISTURE TO THE SOUTH MOVES BACK
INTO THE AREA FOR THE BEGINNING OF NEXT WEEK UNDER SOUTHERLY FLOW.
HAVE THEREFORE KEPT LOW END POPS INTO EARLY NEXT WEEK TO ACCOUNT FOR
THIS POSSIBILITY. TEMPERATURES WILL REMAIN NEAR NORMAL THROUGH THE
EXTENDED PERIOD.

&&

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
155 PM CDT TUE AUG 2 2005

.DISCUSSION...
AGAIN...PATTERN HAS CHANGED LITTLE OVER THE PAST 24 HOURS...WITH
UPPER HIGH OVER ERN COLORADO AND SURFACE HIGH OVER OHIO RIVER
VALLEY. WEAK INVERTED SURFACE TROF OVER MISSISSIPPI...AND A VERY
WEAK VORT IN THE AREA.

CUMULUS FIELD ACROSS ENTIRE AREA...WITH ISOLATED CONVECTION...MOST
NUMEROUS ACROSS NORTH MISSISSIPPI. WILL BASE EARLY POPS ON AREAL
COVERAGE AT 19 OR 20Z. CONVECTIVE TEMPERATURE APPEARS TO BE A DEGREE
OR SO LOWER THAN YESTERDAY. THIS HAS BROUGHT TEMPERATURES DOWN
A COUPLE OF DEGREES FROM YESTERDAYS TRENDS.
&&

.SHORT TERM (THROUGH FRIDAY)...
NOT MUCH CHANGE IN THE FORECAST SCENARIO FROM PREVIOUS FORECASTS.
WEAKNESS IN UPPER PATTERN SHOULD SINK SLOWLY SOUTHWARD...AND EXPECT
INVERTED TROF TO SLOWLY DISSIPATE. COLD FRONT WILL MOVE INTO THE
AREA ON FRIDAY...FROM THE NORTHWEST. AREAL COVERAGE OF CONVECTION
TOMORROW SHOULD BE SMALL ENOUGH TO LIMIT MENTION TO NORTH
MISSISSIPPI. EXPECT THURSDAY DAYTIME HOURS TO BE DRY. WITH APPROACH
OF FRONT FROM NORTHWEST THURSDAY NIGHT INTO FRIDAY...WILL KEEP
CURRENT MENTION OF PRECIPITATION GOING.

TEMPERATURES...EXPECT HIGHS WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY TO BE A DEGREE
OR TWO WARMER THAN TODAY...AND CURRENT PACKAGE ACCOUNTS FOR THIS.
FRIDAY MAX TEMPS SHOULD BE SIMILAR TO TODAY. OVERNIGHT LOWS NEXT
TWO NIGHTS SHOULD BE IN SAME VICINITY AS THEY WERE THIS MORNING.
&&

.LONG TERM (AFTER FRIDAY)...
PRECIPITATION ASSOCIATED WITH WEAK COLD FRONT MAY LINGER INTO
SATURDAY AS BOUNDARY WEAKENS. WILL HOLD ONTO SMALL POPS THAT
MIDSHIFT LEFT US. AFTER THAT...SURFACE HIGH RE-ESTABLISHES ITSELF
OVER EASTERN U.S.. WILL GO WITH DRY FORECAST FOR NOW.

TEMPERATURES...NO SIGNIFICANT REASON TO STRAY VERY MUCH FROM
GUIDANCE...WHICH IS VERY CLOSE TO SEASONAL NORMS.

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 020830
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
330 AM CDT TUE AUG 2 2005

.DISCUSSION...

A TRANQUIL WEATHER PATTERN EXISTS OVER THE MID-SOUTH THIS MORNING.
SKIES REMAIN CLEAR WITH AREAS OF PATCHY FOG ACROSS AREAS OF
NORTHEAST MISSISSIPPI WHERE LOW LEVEL MOISTURE LEVELS REMAIN
HIGHEST. TEMPERATURES RANGE FROM THE LOW 70S IN RURAL AREAS TO THE
UPPER 70S IN THE MEMPHIS URBAN AREA.

SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE CENTERED OVER THE OHIO VALLEY TODAY WILL
RIDGE DOWN ACROSS NORTHERN PORTIONS OF THE FORECAST AREA. THIS WILL
HELP SUPPRESS CONVECTION OVER THESE AREAS. FURTHER SOUTH...A
PERSISTENT WEAK SURFACE TROUGH EXTENDS ACROSS MISSISSIPPI INTO
ALABAMA. IN ADDITION...A WEAK UPPER TROUGH OVER THE SOUTHERN
TENNESSEE VALLEY WILL CONTINUE TO MOVE SLOWLY SOUTH INTO SOUTHERN
PORTIONS OF THE FORECAST AREA. OVER THESE AREAS...ENOUGH LOW LEVEL
MOISTURE COMBINED WITH DAYTIME HEATING WILL LEAD TO INCREASED
INSTABILITY...AND WITH THE PRESENCE OF THE TROUGH...WILL ALLOW FOR
THE DEVELOPMENT OF ISOLATED SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS. THE UPPER
TROUGH AXIS WILL LINGER OVER PORTIONS OF NORTHEAST MISSISSIPPI INTO
TOMORROW...THEREFORE WILL KEEP ISOLATED CHANCES FOR CONVECTION IN
PLACE ON WEDNESDAY ACROSS THESE AREAS. AS FOR TEMPERATURES DURING
THE NEXT COUPLE OF DAYS...WITH DRY CONDITIONS AND STRONGER RIDGING
OVER THE NORTHERN HALF OF THE AREA...EXPECT TEMPERATURES TO REACH
THE MIDDLE 90S. ELSEWHERE...ISOLATED CONVECTION AND MOISTER
CONDITIONS WILL HOLD TEMPERATURES BACK A FEW DEGREES IN THE LOWER
90S.

ON THURSDAY...THE WEAK UPPER TROUGH SLIPS FURTHER SOUTH AND UPPER
LEVEL RIDGING STRENGTHENS. THIS SHOULD KEEP MOST AREAS DRY...
ALTHOUGH A VERY ISOLATED SHOWER OR THUNDERSTORM WILL STILL BE
POSSIBLE DURING THE MAXIMUM HEATING OF THE DAY. WITH STRONGER
RIDGING AND DRY CONDITIONS...EXPECT THURSDAY TO BE THE WARMEST DAY
THIS WEEK...WITH MID 90S COMMON IN MOST AREAS. BY LATER THURSDAY...
A SHORTWAVE TROUGH MOVING SOUTHEAST OUT OF THE NORTHERN PLAINS WILL
HELP PUSH A COLD FRONT TOWARDS THE MID-SOUTH THURSDAY NIGHT.
SCATTERED SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS WILL DEVELOP AHEAD OF THE FRONT
ON THURSDAY NIGHT AND CONTINUE INTO FRIDAY AS THE FRONT STALLS OUT
OVER THE REGION. CHANCES FOR SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS WILL
CONTINUE INTO SATURDAY WITH THE FRONT WASHING OUT OVER THE AREA THIS
WEEKEND. WITH INCREASED CLOUD COVER AND RAIN CHANCES...TEMPERATURES
WILL BE HELD BACK A FEW DEGREES.

WEAK UPPER LEVEL RIDGING WILL BUILD BACK OVER THE AREA FOR THE END
OF THE WEEKEND AND FIRST PART OF NEXT WEEK...ALLOWING FOR THE RETURN
OF DRY WEATHER AND SEASONABLY HOT WEATHER.

&&

FXUS64 KMEG 011847
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
147 PM CDT MON AUG 1 2005

.DISCUSSION...
THERE HAS BEEN VERY LITTLE SIGNIFICANT CHANGE IN THE SURFACE AND
UPPER AIR PATTERNS FOR THE LAST 48 HOURS. AIRMASS IS BECOMING
SOMEWHAT STAGNANT OVER THE AREA...AND IS BEING REFLECTED BY HAZE
REDUCING SOME VISIBILITIES BELOW 7 SM. CUMULUS DEVELOPMENT IS MAINLY
OVER SOUTHEAST HALF OF CWA. ISOLATED CONVECTION WILL CONTINUE TO
DEVELOP ACROSS SOUTHEAST HALF OF CWA. TEMPERATURE TRENDS THROUGH
17Z SHOW MOST AREAS 2-3 DEGREES WARMER THAN SUNDAY.
&&

.SHORT TERM (THROUGH THURSDAY)...
MID-AFTERNOON AREAL COVERAGE OF PRECIPITATION (20-30 PCT) WILL
DICTATE POPS FOR THE EVENING HOURS. WOULD EXPECT MOST...IF NOT ALL...
CONVECTION TO DIE OUT BY 03Z TONIGHT.

PATTERN CONTINUES RATHER STAGNANT THROUGH THURSDAY...SO NOT MUCH
CHANGE IN FORECAST OTHER THAN PRECIPITATION CHANCES. AIRMASS WILL BE
SOMEWHAT LESS FAVORABLE FOR CONVECTION TOMORROW...AND WILL PRETTY
MUCH LIMIT PRECIPITATION TO SOUTH OF THE TENNESSEE-MISSISSIPPI STATE
LINE. EVEN THERE...POPS GENERALLY AT OR BELOW 30 PERCENT. FOR NOW...
WILL KEEP WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY DRY...BUT WOULD NOT BE ABSOLUTELY
SHOCKED TO SEE VERY ISOLATED CONVECTION OVER NORTH MISSISSIPPI.
COLD FRONT WILL APPROACH THE AREA FROM THE NORTH ON THURSDAY NIGHT...
SO WILL HOLD MENTION IN THERE...SINCE SPEED OF FRONT VARIES ON THE
DIFFERENT MODELS.

TEMPERATURES...GOING FORECAST LOOKS FINE FOR TONIGHT...AND PROBABLY
DONT NEED TO ADJUST ANY FOR TOMORROW THROUGH WEDNESDAY NIGHT.
THURSDAY WILL PROBABLY BE THE WARMEST DAY OF THE WEEK...AND BUMPED
UP PREVIOUS FORECAST A DEGREE. MOST AREAS SHOULD BE IN THE MIDDLE
90S.
&&

.LONG TERM (AFTER THURSDAY)...
FRONTAL SYSTEM TO MOVE INTO THE AREA ON FRIDAY...THEN LIKELY TO WASH
OUT. USUALLY PRETTY DIFFICULT TO GET A COLD FRONT ENTIRELY THROUGH
THE CWA DURING THE MIDDLE OF THE SUMMER...AND THERE IS NO SIGNIFICANT
FORCING TO MOVE IT OUT OF THE AREA. MOISTURE LACKING WITH THIS
SYSTEM...AND SURFACE CONVERGENCE IS RATHER WEAK. WILL KEEP IN 20-30
POPS FOR THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY NIGHT...AS THIS IS BEST
CHANCE FOR PRECIPITATION IN THE EXTENDED PERIOD. WEAK UPPER RIDGE
BECOMES ESTABLISHED OVER SOUTHEAST STATES OVER THE WEEKEND. THIS
SHOULD KEEP THE LAST FEW DAYS OF THE EXTENDED DRY...ALTHOUGH...
AGAIN...VERY ISOLATED THUNDERSTORMS WOULD NOT BE A SURPRISE.

TEMPERATURES...FRIDAY MAY BE A DEGREE OR TWO COOLER THAN THURSDAY...
MORE DUE TO ADDITIONAL CLOUDS THAN ANYTHING. FRONTAL SYSTEM IN THE
AREA WITH A FEW MORE CLOUDS...WILL HOLD TEMPS TO NEAR NORMAL FOR
SATURDAY THROUGH MONDAY.
&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES

THE PLAINS IS LOOKING MORE DOMINATE THAN PREVIOUS GFS MODEL RUNS 
HAVE SHOWN...MORE IN LINE WITH PREVIOUS ETA/ECMWF RUNS. DEEPER 
MOISTURE MAY REMAIN SUPPRESSED ACRS THE GULF COAST TUE AND WED. HAVE

CHANCES FOR PRECIP WL CONT TO BE ACRS NRN MS TUE AND WED. 

BY THE END OF THE WEEK SFC FRONT TRIES TO PUSH SOUTH INTO THE REGION 
AS UPPER RIDGE WEAKENS SLIGHTLY. LOOKS LIKE BEST CHANCE FOR 
PRECIP WL BE FRI/FRI NIGHT. NOT CONFIDENT IN CURRENT FRONT PUSHING 
ENTIRELY THROUGH THE REGION SO WL LEAVE LOW POPS IN FOR THE WEEKEND.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
921 PM CDT SUN JUL 31 2005

.DISCUSSION...WATER VAPOR/INFRARED SATELLITE AND 00Z UPPER AIR 
ANALYSIS THIS EVENING SHOWS A WEAK INVERTED TROUGH ACROSS CENTRAL 
ALABAMA AND SOUTHERN MISSISSIPPI. ISOLATED SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS 
ASSISTED BY THE UPPER LEVEL FEATURE FINALLY AFFECTING THE FAR 
SOUTHEASTERN SECTION OF THE FORECAST AREA. MAIN FORECAST CONCERN FOR 
OVERNIGHT IS CONVECTIVE POTENTIAL ACROSS THE ABOVE MENTIONED AREA. 

MODEL SOUNDINGS SHOW SOME INSTABILITY PRESENT DURING THE OVERNIGHT 
HOURS WITH CAPES AROUND 2000 J/KG AND LITTLE IF ANY CONVECTIVE 
INHIBITION. HOWEVER...LATEST SATELLITE TRENDS AND WSR-88D RADAR DATA 
SHOW ACTIVITY ALREADY HAVING DIFFICULTY SUSTAINING ITSELF WITH THE 
LOSS OF DAYTIME INSTABILITY. WILL ISSUE AN UPDATE TO ADJUST FOR 
CURRENT TRENDS AND TO REMOVE EVENING WORDING. 

UPDATED GRIDS WILL BE PUBLISHED SHORTLY.

CJC

.PREV DISCUSSION...ISSUED 142 PM CDT SUN JUL 31 2005...

UPPER AND SURFACE PATTERNS HAVE CHANGED LITTLE SINCE YESTERDAY.
UPPER RIDGE STILL CENTERED NEAR DEN. SURFACE HIGH OVER GREAT LAKES
RIDGING SOUTHWESTWARD TO OKLAHOMA. WEAK INVERTED SURFACE TROF OVER
MISSISSIPPI. AGAIN...CONVECTION DEVELOPING EAST OF TROF LINE...BUT
MAINLY A LITTLE FURTHER SOUTH THAN YESTERDAY...OVER BMX AND JAN
CWAS. TEMPERATURES RUNNING A DEGREE OR TWO ABOVE YESTERDAYS TEMPS
AT 18Z.
&&

.SHORT TERM (THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...
NO MAJOR CHANGES TO FORECAST. UPPER AND SURFACE PATTERNS CHANGE
LITTLE THROUGH WEDNESDAY. BEST CHANCES OF PRECIPITATION WILL BE
SOUTHEAST HALF OF CWA...AND MAINLY DURING THE AFTERNOON AND
EVENING HOURS. WILL KEEP NORTHWEST HALF OF CWA DRY TOMORROW...
AND 20-30 POPS FOR MOST OF THE AREA TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY.

HIGHS TOMORROW MAY BE A DEGREE OR SO WARMER THAN TODAY...OTHERWISE...
LITTLE CHANGE IN FORECAST TEMPERATURES THROUGH WEDNESDAY.
&&

.LONG TERM (AFTER WEDNESDAY)...
AGAIN...LITTLE CHANGE IN THE PATTERN AS IT AFFECTS THE MIDSOUTH.
GFS INDICATES UPPER RIDGE WILL WEAKEN A LITTLE...BUT MOVE
EASTWARD TOWARD OUR AREA. WITH DECENT MOISTURE IN THE AREA...
AND POSSIBLY SURFACE BOUNDARIES...CANNOT PICK OUT ONE DRY DAY
TO KEY ON. ECMWF HAS BEEN BACK AND FORTH THE LAST COUPLE OF RUNS
WHETHER RIDGE MOVES OVER AREA OR NOT. CONSIDERING THE DIFFERENCE IN
SOLUTIONS FROM RUN TO RUN...WONT MAKE SIGNIFICANT CHANGES TO
EXTENDED. FINE TUNED TEMPERATURES A LITTLE TO FIT IN WITH
SURROUNDING OFFICES. EXPECT TEMPS NEAR OR JUST ABOVE NORMAL THROUGH
THE EXTENDED PERIOD.

SKIES ACRS NRN SXNS WITH PLEASANT HUMIDITIES. WEAK SFC TROF REMAINS 
ACRS NE MS THIS AFTN. SFC DEWPOINTS AROUND 70 DEGREES AND HEATING WL 
PRODUCE CAPES AROUND 2000 J/KG SO EXPECT A REPEAT OF YESTERDAYS 
ISOLD CONVECTION. HIGH TEMPS SHOULD BE A DEGREE OR TWO HIGHER THAN 
YESTERDAY. ANY CONVECTION WL END EARLY THIS EVENING. 

OVER THE NEXT FEW DAYS SFC TROF WL MOVE VERY SLOWLY NORTH AND WEST 
BRINGING INCREASING MOISTURE NORTHWARD INTO THE REGION. MEANWHILE 
THERE WILL CONT TO BE A WEAKNESS IN THE 500 MB HEIGHT FIELD BETWEEN 
THE STRONG HIGH OVER THE WRN PLAINS AND THE BERMUDA HIGH. AS A 
RESULT EXPECT CONVECTION TO INCREASE IN COVERAGE DURING THE EARLY 
PART OF THE WEEK. NORTHERN SXNS SHOULD REMAIN DRY ON MON BUT BY TUE 
AND WED EXPECT A THREAT OF PRECIP EVERYWHERE WITH BEST CHANCES ACRS 
SRN HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA. DUE TO PRECIP AND CLOUD POTENTIAL WL 
SHAVE A COUPLE DEGREES OFF HIGH TEMP FORECAST FOR TUE-THU. 

BY LATER IN THE WEEK THE UPPER LEVEL TROF ACRS THE REGION STARTS TO 
SLIP SOUTH AS 500 MB RIDGING TRIES TO NOSE IN FROM THE WEST AND SFC 
HIGH PRESSURE REDEVELOPS ACRS THE MID MS VALLEY. HOWEVER...STILL A 
SFC TROF INVOF THE MID SOUTH SO LOW POP FORECAST CONTINUES TO LOOK 
GOOD. 

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES
AR...NONE
MO...NONE
MS...NONE
TN...NONE

SJM

FXUS64 KMEG 310202
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
901 PM CDT SAT JUL 30 2005

.DISCUSSION...00Z UPPER AIR ANALYSIS THIS EVENING PLACES HIGH 
PRESSURE ACROSS THE CENTRAL PLAINS AND A TROUGH EXTENDING ACROSS THE 
EASTERN UNITED STATES FROM EASTERN ONTARIO DOWN TO SOUTHERN ALABAMA. 
PULSE TYPE SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS WHICH DEVELOPED WITH ASSISTANCE 
FROM THIS UPPER FEATURE HAVE ALREADY DIMINISHED WITH THE LOSS OF 
DAYTIME INSTABILITY. WILL MAKE MINOR ADJUSTMENTS TO GRIDS FOR 
CURRENT TRENDS AND TO REMOVE EVENING WORDING.

UPDATED GRIDS WILL BE OUT SHORTLY.

CJC

.PREV DISCUSSION...ISSUED 226 PM CDT SAT JUL 30 2005...

UPPER RIDGE CENTERED NEAR DEN...WITH SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE CENTERED
OVER LAKE HURON...RIDGING SOUTHWEST INTO NORTH TEXAS. WEAK
LOW/INVERTED TROF FROM GOMEX NORTHWARD INTO NORTHERN MISSISSIPPI.
MOST SIGNIFICANT CLOUD COVER IS EAST OF TROF AXIS. A FEW SHOWERS HAVE
POPPED UP OVER NORTHERN ALABAMA AND NORTHEAST MISSISSIPPI...ROTATING
TO THE SOUTHWEST.
&&

.SHORT TERM (THROUGH TUESDAY)...
WILL HOLD POPS IN WHERE THEY ARE AT NOW...FOR EARLY EVENING HOURS
TONIGHT WITH AREAL COVERAGE SIMILAR TO CURRENT. WILL RUN THEM UNTIL
03Z. TROF AXIS FORECAST TO DRIFT WEST TO MISSISSIPPI RIVER BEFORE
DISSIPATING ABOUT MONDAY OR TUESDAY. THIS WILL GRADUALLY BRING A FEW
MORE CLOUDS INTO THE AREA FROM EAST TO WEST OVER THE NEXT TWO DAYS.
NOT EXPECTING ANY WIDESPREAD PRECIPITATION ON SUNDAY...BUT WOULDNT
BE SHOCKED TO SEE ISOLATED SHOWERS IN SAME AREA AS TODAY. CHANCES OF
PRECIPITATION WILL INCREASE A LITTLE ON MONDAY...MAINLY SOUTHEAST. AS
TROF AXIS CONTINUES WESTWARD...MOST OF AREA SHOULD HAVE AT LEAST A
CHANCE OF PRECIPITATION ON TUESDAY. EXTREME NORTHERN TIER OF COUNTIES
WILL KEEP A DRY FORECAST UNTIL TUESDAY NIGHT.

HIGHS SUNDAY SHOULD BE A COUPLE OF DEGREES WARMER THAN TODAY. HIGHS
MONDAY SIMILAR TO SUNDAY. DUE TO MORE CLOUDS AND POTENTIAL FOR
PRECIPITATION...HIGHS TUESDAY EXPECTED TO BE A COUPLE OF DEGREES
COOLER THAN MONDAY.
&&

.LONG TERM (AFTER TUESDAY)...
WEAKNESS IN UPPER PATTERN REMAINS OVER THE AREA DURING THE EXTENDED
PERIOD. CANNOT REALLY DISCERN A PARTICULAR DRY DAY. EXTENDED WILL
MENTION CHANCE OF PRECIPITATION EVERY DAY...MAINLY AFTERNOON AND
EVENING. TEMPERATURES EXPECTED TO BE NEAR OR SLIGHTLY ABOVE NORMAL
THROUGH THE EXTENDED.
&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES
AR...NONE
MO...NONE
MS...NONE

AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
245 AM CDT SAT JUL 30 2005

.DISCUSSION...
A BEAUTIFUL MID SUMMER WEEKEND ON TAP. SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE WILL 
DOMINATE THE TN AND MS RIVER VALLEYS THIS WEEKEND. EXPECT 
COMFORTABLE HUMIDITIES AND SLOWING WARMING TEMPS. HIGHS SHOULD REACH 
90 ACRS WRN SXNS TODAY AND EVERYWHERE ON SUN. NIGHTS WILL BE 
PLEASANTLY COOL...LOWER 60S POSSIBLE ALONG TN RIVER VALLEY TONIGHT. 
WATER VAPOR IMAGERY SHOWS VERY DRY AIRMASS ACRS THE REGION SO EXPECT 
PLENTY OF SUNSHINE THIS WEEKEND WITH ONLY A FEW CU ACRS NRN MS 
CLOSER TO SFC TROF ACRS THE SE U.S. 

SOME UNCERTAINTY WITH FORECAST NEXT WEEK. GFS CONTINUES TO 
ADVERTISE WEAKNESS IN 500 MB HEIGHT FIELD ACRS THE LOWER MS VALLEY 
EARLY NEXT WEEK WITH 1000-500 MB MOISTURE AXIS BEGINNING TO MOVE 
BACK NORTH ACRS THE MID SOUTH. MEANWHILE ETA AND ECMWF HINTING THAT 
MOISTURE MAY REMAIN MORE SUPPRESSED ACRS THE GULF COAST STATES AS 
UPPER RIDGE REMAINS MORE DOMINATE ACRS THE MID MS RIVER VALLEY. WL 
CONT CURRENT FORECAST WITH SLIGHT CHC/LOW CHC POPS ACRS THE 
AREA...WITH BEST CHANCES ACRS NRN MS.

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 300210
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
910 PM CDT FRI JUL 29 2005

.DISCUSSION...LATEST INFRARED SATELLITE SHOWS MOSTLY CLEAR TO CLEAR 
SKIES ACROSS THE MID SOUTH THIS EVENING. WSR-88D IMAGERY THE PAST 
COUPLE OF HOURS SHOWING RAIN SHOWER ACTIVITY ACROSS NORTHERN AND 
CENTRAL ALABAMA STARTING TO DIMINISH WITH THE LOSS OF DAYTIME 
HEATING. THIS ACTIVITY WAS ASSOCIATED WITH A MID LEVEL TROUGH AXIS 
BISECTING THE EASTERN UNITED STATES. 

SOUNDINGS FROM KLZK AND KSGF SHOW MID LEVEL SUBSIDENCE INVERSION 
DEEPENING ACROSS THE MID SOUTH BUT SOME ADDITIONAL MOISTURE PRESENT 
AT KJAN. AS A RESULT...NOT EXPECTING ANY PRECIPITATION ACROSS THE 
FORECAST AREA OVERNIGHT. WINDS HAVE ALREADY BEGUN TO DECOUPLE ACROSS 
MOST AREAS WITH THE EXCEPTION OF KMEM THUS FAR. WILL MAKE MINOR 
ADJUSTMENTS TO TEMPERATURE GRIDS BASED UPON CURRENT TRENDS BUT LOW 
TEMPERATURES ARE ON TRACK WITH CURRENT SURFACE DEWPOINTS IN THE 60S.
WILL NOT ISSUE AN UPDATE AT THIS TIME.

CJC

.PREV DISCUSSION...ISSUED 240 PM CDT FRI JUL 29 2005...
BELOW NORMAL TEMPERATURES AND COMFORTABLE HUMIDITY LEVELS HAVE 
GRACED THE MIDSOUTH TODAY THANKS TO NW FLOW ALOFT. THIS FLOW IS 
BRINGING DRIER AIR INTO THE REGION AND HAS BROUGHT AN END TO THE 
SHOWERS AND MOSTLY CLOUDY SKIES OVER NE MS.

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY NIGHT)...
A FAIRLY STRAIGHT FORWARD FORECAST FOR THE AREA OVER THE WEEKEND. AT 
THE SURFACE...HIGH PRESSURE WILL BUILD IN RESPONSE TO THE RIDGE OVER 
THE SOUTHERN PLAINS NOSING INTO THE AREA. THE AIRMASS IS EXPECTED TO 
REMAIN RATHER DRY...AS EVIDENT TODAY BY THE 0.74 INCH PRECIPITABLE 
WATER AT LZK. DO NOT EXPECT MUCH IN THE WAY OF CU DEVELOPMENT 
ALTHOUGH CANNOT RULE OUT A FEW CU WITH THE MAX DAYTIME HEATING. A 
LITTLE MORE CLOUD COVER MAY OCCUR OVER SOUTHERN SECTIONS OF THE CWA 
AS IT WILL BE CLOSER TO A SFC TROUGH. TEMPS WILL GRADUALLY WARM BACK 
TO NEAR NORMAL...BUT DEWPOINTS WILL REMAIN IN THE 60S AS A NORTHEAST 
SFC FLOW WILL NOT PROMOTE MUCH OF A RISE. IT WILL CERTAINLY BE A 
VERY NICE WEEKEND FOR THIS TIME OF THE YEAR.

.LONG TERM (MONDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...
MODELS IN FAIR AGREE ON DEVELOPING A WEAKNESS OVER THE REGION BY 
MONDAY...AS THE AREA SITS BETWEEN A BUILDING WESTERN RIDGE AND THE 
BERMUDA HIGH. A SFC TROUGH IS FORECAST TO LIFT NORTHWEST IN 
RESPONSE...PLACING THE MIDSOUTH IN AN UNSETTLED WEATHER PATTERN. THE 
QUESTION FOR PRECIP CHANCES WILL BE HOW MUCH MOISTURE RETURN WILL 
THERE BE? GFS SHOWS DECENT 850-700MB MOISTURE RETURNING WHICH WOULD
FAVOR MORE PRECIP ACROSS THE AREA. THE ECMWF HOLDS THE MOISTURE 
FURTHER SOUTH AND DOES NOT DEVELOP THE WEAKNESS LIKE THE GFS DOES. 
OVERALL GLOBAL MODEL CONSENSUS IS THAT A SFC TROUGH WILL BE LOCATED
OVER THE GENERAL AREA THROUGH FRIDAY. THIS RESULTS IN PUTTING SLIGHT 
CHANCE TO CHANCE POPS OVER THE AREA. LACK OF CONFIDENCE IN MOISTURE 
RETURN PRECLUDES ANY HIGHER POPS AT THIS TIME. THE CURRENT EXTENDED 
FORECAST SHOWS THIS WELL AND ONLY MADE SOME MINOR TWEAKS TO THE 
GRIDS. TEMPERATURES WILL STILL BE NEAR NORMAL AND DEWPOINTS WILL NOT 
BEGIN TO REALLY CLIMB UNTIL THE THURSDAY/FRIDAY TIME PERIOD.

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES
AR...NONE
MO...NONE
MS...NONE
TN...NONE

$$

JFB

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 291537
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
1036 AM CDT FRI JUL 29 2005

.UPDATE...
THERE IS QUITE A SPREAD IN WEATHER CONDITIONS ACROSS THE CWA THIS 
MORNING. THE WEATHER RANGES FROM SUNNY IN NW AREAS TO CLOUDY WITH 
ISOLATED SHOWERS OVER NE MS. WATER VAPOR IMAGERY AND RUC ANALYSIS 
SHOWS SIGNIFICANT DRY AIR WORKING INTO THE REGION UNDER NW FLOW. 
THERE IS ALSO A SHORTWAVE EMBEDDED IN THE NW FLOW OVER ARKANSAS AT 
THIS TIME. LOW LEVEL MOISTURE AND ASSOCIATED CLOUDS AND PRECIP 
HAVING A TOUGH TIME MOVING OUT OF NE MS. WILL UPDATE THE FORECAST TO 
ADJUST CLOUD COVER ACROSS THE CWA. SLIGHT CHANCE POPS WILL BE LEFT 
AS IS FOR NE MS DUE TO THE LOW LEVEL MOISTURE AND AN APPROACHING 
SHORTWAVE. ALSO DROPPED HIGH TEMPS A CATEGORY IN NE MS DUE TO ALL OF 
THE CLOUDS. 850 TEMPS OF 14C TO 15C SUPPORT HIGHS IN THE MID TO 
UPPER 80S IN THOSE LOCATIONS THAT RECEIVE SUN TODAY AND THE CURRENT 
FORECAST HAS A GOOD HANDLE ON THIS.

THE REST OF THE FORECAST LOOKS GOOD AND THE UPDATED ZONES WILL BE 
SENT SHORTLY.

JFB

.PREVIOUS DISCUSSION ISSUED AT 315 AM FRI JUL 29...

COLD FRONT SITUATED WELL SOUTH OF THE REGION TODAY...FROM THE MID 
ATLANTIC THROUGH CNTRL AL TO THE NORTHERN GULF. QUITE A BIT OF POST 
FRONTAL CLOUDINESS ACRS NRN MS THIS MORNING WITH A FEW SHOWERS SOUTH 
AND EAST OF TUPELO. HIGH PRESSURE WAS PUSHING INTO THE AREA FROM THE 
MID MS VALLEY. 

CLOUDS WILL DECREASE ACRS NRN MS TODAY AS COLD FRONT AND ASSOCD POST 
FRONTAL MOISTURE PUSHES SOUTHEAST OF THE REGION. STILL ENUF 
MOISTURE TO JUSTIFY A 20 POP ACRS NE MS TO COVER ANY SHOWERS THAT 
REDEVELOP AS MID LEVEL SHORTWAVE PUSHES THROUGH. WEAK HIGH PRESSURE 
WL CONT TO BUILD ACRS THE AREA WITH LIGHT NORTHERLY FLOW. TEMPS WL 
REMAIN BELOW SEASONAL NORMS WITH HIGHS IN THE UPPER 80S AND LOW 
HUMIDITIES.

TONIGHT THRU SUN NIGHT...SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE ACRS THE OH AND MID 
MS VALLEYS AND A STRONG UPPER RIDGE OVER THE WESTERN PLAINS DOMINATE 
THE WEATHER PATTERN. EXPECT DRY CONDS WITH A SLOW WARMING TREND FOR 
THE MID SOUTH AND COMFORTABLE HUMIDITIES. 

BY MON/MON NIGHT GFS INDICATING A WEAK UPPER LOW DEVELOPING ACRS THE 
SRN MS VALLEY. MEANWHILE THE STALLED SFC FRONT ACRS THE GULF AND THE 
SE U.S. WL START TO RETURN NORTHWARD WITH INCREASING MOISTURE ACRS 
AT THE SRN PARTS OF THE FORECAST AREA LATER MON. CURRENT FORECAST 
ADDRESSES THIS WELL WITH POPS ACRS NRN MS STARTING MON. ACCORDING TO 
THE GFS...MOISTURE AND RAIN CHANCES WL PUSH NORTH THROUGH MID WEEK. 
ECMWF SEEMS TO KEEP MOISTURE MORE SUPPRESSED TO THE SOUTH SO  
UNCERTAINTY WITH FORECAST BEYOND MON IS HIGH. WL NOT MAKE ANY 
CHANGES ATTM. CURRENT SLIGHT CHC/CHC FOR THE TUE-THU TIME FRAME IS 
REASONABLE.

&&

.DISCUSSION...
LIGHT NORTH AND NORTHEASTERLY WINDS WERE OCCURRING OVER THE MID 
SOUTH THIS EVENING AS SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS INTO THE AREA. IT 
WAS MOSTLY CLOUDY ACROSS NORTHEAST MISSISSIPPI WITH SCATTERED 
SHOWERS FARTHER SOUTH IN CENTRAL MISSISSIPPI. 

DRY SLOT EVIDENT ON WATER VAPOR IMAGERY WITH MOISTURE AXIS 
STRETCHING ACROSS NORTHEAST MISSISSIPPI INTO CENTRAL TENNESSEE. 
APPEARS THAT SOME SHOWER DEVELOPMENT WILL BE POSSIBLE MAINLY OVER 
NORTHEAST MISSISSIPPI AROUND OR JUST AFTER MIDNIGHT AND PERSIST INTO 
THE MORNING HOURS. THIS IS IN ASSOCIATION WITH A WEAK SHORTWAVE 
CURRENTLY MOVING ACROSS SOUTHERN ARKANSAS.

HAVE ADJUSTED RAIN CHANCES AND WEATHER GRIDS ACCORDINGLY...WHILE LOW 
TEMPERATURES OVERNIGHT LOOK REASONABLE AND SEE NO REASON TO CHANGE.

NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
345 PM CDT THU JUL 28 2005

.DISCUSSION...
COLD FRONT LOCATED ACROSS CENTRAL MISSISSIPPI WILL CONTINUE MOVING 
SOUTH TONIGHT. THE FRONT HAS PRODUCED SHOWERS WITH A FEW EMBEDDED 
THUNDERSTORMS ACROSS SOUTHERN PORTIONS OF THE MIDSOUTH TODAY. EXPECT 
THIS TO CONTINUE THIS EVENING INTO FRIDAY. WILL KEEP CHANCE POPS 
ACROSS THE EXTREME SOUTHERN ZONES FOR TONIGHT AND SLIGHT CHANCE POPS 
FOR FRIDAY. ELSEWHERE...HIGH PRESSURE WILL CONTINUE TO BUILD 
SOUTHWARD INTO THE NORTHERN TWO-THIRDS OF THE CWA.

BY FRIDAY NIGHT...FRONT WILL BE FAR ENOUGH SOUTH TO KEEP THE ENTIRE 
MIDSOUTH DRY. HIGH PRESSURE WILL DOMINATE THE WEATHER THROUGH THE 
WEEKEND. HIGH TEMPERATURES WILL BE IN THE UPPER 80S TO LOWER 90S 
DURING THIS TIME WITH LOWS IN THE UPPER 60S TO LOWER 70S. 

ON MONDAY...MODELS SHOWING A WARM FRONT MOVING NORTHWARD FROM THE 
GULF OF MEXICO. THE FRONT WILL HANG AROUND THE CWA THROUGH THE END 
OF THE FORECAST PERIOD. HAVE ADDED CHANCES FOR SHOWERS AND 
THUNDERSTORMS TO THE FORECAST.

FXUS64 KMEG 280740
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
240 AM CDT THU JUL 28 2005

.DISCUSSION...
COLD FRONT HAS MOVED SOUTH OF THE FORECAST AREA EARLY THIS MORNING.
SOME SCATTERED SHOWERS CAN BE FOUND OVER MOST OF THE REGION BUT AS
THE MORNING PROGRESSES THIS ACTIVITY SHOULD BE FURTHER SOUTH THAN
ITS CURRENT TRACK. WILL KEEP CHANCE POPS OVER ROUGHLY THE SOUTHERN
HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA. THERE STILL MAY BE A POSSIBLE THUNDERSTORM
ACROSS OUR EXTREME SOUTHERN COUNTIES WITH THE FRONT NOT TOO FAR AWAY.
BY TONIGHT...FRONT SHOULD HAVE WEAKENED FURTHER AND MOVED AWAY FROM
THE FORECAST AREA THAT ONLY EXTREME SOUTHEAST CORNER HAS ANY CHANCE
OF SEEING RAIN SO LEFT SLIGHT CHANCE POPS DOWN THERE. FROM FRIDAY ON
HAVE KEEP DRY FORECAST GOING WITH TEMPERATURES GRADUALLY RETURNING TO
SEASONAL LEVELS. MODELS TRY TO BRING SOME WEAK UPPER LEVEL TROUGH
INTO REGION TOWARD THE BEGINNING OF NEXT WEEK. THE MODELS HAVE BEEN
INCONSISTENT WITH THIS FEATURE OVER THE PAST COUPLE OF DAYS SO WILL
NOT PUT ANY MENTION OF RAIN IN FOR NOW.

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES
AR...NONE
MO...NONE
MS...NONE
TN...NONE

$$





FXUS64 KMEG 280141
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
841 PM CDT WED JUL 27 2005

.DISCUSSION...
THE COLD FRONT HAS MOVED THROUGH THE MAJORITY OF THE FORECAST AREA. 
RAIN STILL LINGERS JUST SOUTH OF COLUMBUS...THE FRONT LAGS JUST 
BEHIND FROM NEAR TISHOMINGO TO TUPELO TO GREENWOOD. OTHER SHOWERS 
OVER SOUTHEAST ARKANSAS WERE MOVING EASTWARD INTO NORTHWEST 
MISSISSIPPI. MESOSCALE MODELS AND THE 18Z OF THE NAM INDICATE THAT 
ADDITIONAL SHOWERS WILL BE POSSIBLE OVERNIGHT. BELIEVE THAT THIS IS 
IN RESPONSE TO THE RIGHT ENTRANCE REGION OF THE JET...WHICH WILL BE 
ACROSS NORTHWEST TENNESSEE/WESTERN KENTUCKY OVERNIGHT. HAVE LOWERED 
RAIN CHANCES ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA...WITH LOWEST CHANCES ACROSS 
NORTHEAST ARKANSAS. LOW TEMPERATURES...CLOUD COVER AND WINDS APPEAR 
REASONABLE AND WILL NOT TWEAK.

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES
AR...NONE
MO...NONE
MS...NONE
TN...NONE

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 272041
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
341 PM CDT WED JUL 27 2005

.DISCUSSION...
A STRONG COLD FRONT FOR THIS TIME OF THE YEAR BISECTS THE MIDSOUTH
THIS AFTERNOON. TEMPERATURES RANGE FROM THE LOWER 70S IN EXTREME
NORTHEAST ARKANSAS TO THE MID 90S AROUND TUPELO. LATEST SURFACE
ANALYSIS INDICATES THE FRONT EXTENDS FROM ABOUT LEXINGTON TN TO
TUNICA MS TO JUST SOUTH OF STUTTGART AR. A BROKEN BAND OF STRONG
THUNDERSTORMS HAS DEVELOPED AHEAD OF THE FRONT. WITH CAPES
RANGING FROM 2000 TO 4000 J/KG ACROSS NORTH MS...THERE COULD BE A FEW
STRONG TO POSSIBLY SEVERE THUNDERSTORMS INTO THIS EVENING AHEAD
OF THE FRONT WITH THE THREATS BEING STRONG WINDS AND HAIL. LIGHT
SHOWERS ARE LOCATED BEHIND THE FRONT ACROSS PARTS OF NORTHEAST AR AND
THE MO BOOTHEEL. THINK THE FRONT WILL CONTINUE TO PUSH SLOWLY THROUGH
THE MIDSOUTH TONIGHT AND EARLY THURSDAY. WILL HAVE POPS TONIGHT
RANGING FROM 60 PERCENT ACROSS MUCH OF NORTH MS TO 30 PERCENT
NORTHEAST AR / MO BOOTHEEL. PRECIPITATION CHANCES WILL END FROM THE
NORTH THURSDAY AS THE FRONT CONTINUES TO SAG SOUTHWARD AND DRIER AIR
WORKS ITS WAY INTO THE MIDSOUTH. BAND OF LOW CLOUDS WILL SPREAD
ACROSS THE MIDSOUTH BEHIND THE FRONT TONIGHT...BUT WILL GRADUALLY
CLEAR FROM THE NORTH THURSDAY.

WILL LEAVE IN A SLIGHT CHANCE OF SHOWERS AROUND TUPELO THURSDAY
NIGHT IN ASSOCIATION WITH THE FRONT. OTHERWISE...WILL HAVE A DRY
FORECAST FOR THE ENTIRE AREA FOR THE REMAINDER OF THE FORECAST.
SOME WEAK UPPER LEVEL TROFFINESS DEVELOPS MAINLY OVER THE EASTERN
PARTS OF THE MIDSOUTH INTO THIS WEEKEND...BUT DOES NOT SEEM TO BE
ENOUGH MOISTURE TO SUPPORT ANY MORE THAN A FEW SHOWERS AT MOST...
AND NOT ENOUGH TO MENTION IN THE FORECAST. HIGH PRESSURE WILL
DOMINATE OUR WEATHER EARLY NEXT WEEK WITH TEMPERATURES ONCE AGAIN
CLIMBING TO ABOVE NORMAL BY THE MIDDLE OF NEXT WEEK.

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES
AR...NONE
MO...NONE
MS...NONE
TN...NONE

$$





000 
FXUS64 KMEG 271618
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
1017 AM CDT WED JUL 27 2005

.DISCUSSION...
WILL UPDATE TO MAKE SOME SMALL CHANGES TO THE CURRENT FORECAST / 
GRIDS FOR THIS AFTERNOON. A RATHER STRONG COLD FRONT FOR THIS TIME OF
THE YEAR CONTINUES TO PUSH INTO THE MIDSOUTH. LATEST SURFACE 
ANALYSIS INDICATES THAT THE FRONT STRETCHES FROM NEAR PARIS TN TO 
AROUND MEMPHIS TN TO STUGGART AR. THE FRONT WILL PUSH INTO NORTH MS 
BY LATE THIS AFTERNOON. WIDESPREAD CLOUDS EXTEND MAINLY BEHIND THE 
FRONT WITH A BAND OF SHOWERS AND EMBEDDED THUNDERSTORMS PUSHING INTO 
NORTHEAST AR. CUMULUS CLOUDS ARE ALSO INCREASING AHEAD OF THE FRONT 
AND THINK THUNDERSTORM DEVELOPMENT IS POSSIBLE AHEAD OF THE FRONT 
WITH FURTHER HEATING. WILL MENTION THE CHANCE OF STRONG 
THUNDERSTORMS IN THE HAZARDOUS WEATHER OUTLOOK AHEAD OF THE FRONT 
THIS AFTERNOON AND EVENING FROM THE SOUTHEAST CORNER OF WEST TN INTO 
NORTH MS AS CAPES PUSH TO BETWEEN 2000 AND 3000 J/KG...MAINLY THE 
THREAT OF STRONG GUSTY WINDS AND SMALL HAIL. IN THE UPDATE WILL 
CHANGE SKY TO PARTLY CLOUDY ACROSS NORTHEAST MS WHERE WILL TAKE 
LONGER FOR THE MORE EXTENSIVE BAND OF CLOUDS TO MOVE INTO. 
TEMPERATURES HAVE BEEN FALLING SLOWLY THROUGH THE 70S IN EXTREME 
NORTHEAST AR. WILL LOWER MAX TEMPS FOR NORTHEAST AR THIS AFTERNOON 
AND RAISE THEM SLIGHTLY ACROSS NORTHEAST MS. WILL NOT ARGUE WITH 
LIKELY POPS FOR THE ENTIRE MIDSOUTH FOR THIS AFTERNOON.

.PREV DISCUSSION...
ISSUED 245 AM CDT WED JUL 27 2005

COLD FRONT APPROACHING THE FORECAST AREA EARLY THIS MORNING WITH
SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS BEHIND THE FRONT ACROSS SOUTHERN MISSOURI
AND NORTHWEST ARKANSAS.

.SHORT TERM (THROUGH FRIDAY)...
THE COLD FRONT WILL CONTINUE TO MOVE SOUTHEAST TODAY AND TONIGHT.
STILL APPEARS THAT WE WILL SE SOME RAIN IN THE FORECAST AREA SO HAVE
KEPT LIKELY POPS FOR TODAY. THE BIG STORY WILL BE TEMPERATURES AS
READINGS WILL SOME 5-10 DEGREES COOLER THAN THEY WERE ON TUESDAY.
COLD FRONT WILL REMAIN ACROSS REGION TONIGHT SO WILL SEE SOME
SCATTERED SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS. HAVE KEPT CHANCE POPS IN THE
FORECAST FOR TONIGHT. COLD FRONT SHOULD HAVE MOVED INTO NORTH
MISSISSIPPI BY THURSDAY SO RAIN CHANCE SHOULD DIMINISH OVER NORTHERN
AREAS. THE FRONT SHOULD CONTINUE TO PUSH FURTHER SOUTH AND WEAKEN BY
THURSDAY NIGHT SO ONLY HAVE CHANCE POPS IN SOUTHEAST CORNER OF THE
FORECAST AREA. FRIDAY SHOULD REMAIN DRY AS WHAT IS LEFT OF THE FRONT
IS SOUTH OF FORECAST AREA. TEMPERATURES SHOULD REMAIN BELOW NORMAL
FOR THURSDAY AND FRIDAY.

.LONG TERM (AFTER FRIDAY)...
GRADUAL WARMUP SHOULD START OVER THE WEEKEND AS UPPER LEVEL RIDGE
ATTEMPTS TO REESTABLISH ITSELF. DRY WEATHER SHOULD CONTINUE THROUGH
THE WEEKEND INTO THE BEGINNING OF NEXT WEEK. ANOTHER COLD FRONT
TRIES TO MOVE INTO THE REGION ON TUESDAY SO THERE MAY BE SOME RAIN
WITH THIS SYSTEM.

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES
AR...NONE
MO...NONE
MS...NONE
TN...NONE

$$

AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
838 PM CDT TUE JUL 26 2005

.DISCUSSION...
A COLD FRONT EXTENDED FROM NORTHWEST OHIO THROUGH CENTRAL MISSOURI 
THROUGH THE PERMIAN BASIN OF WEST TEXAS. SOME THUNDERSTORMS HAVE 
FORMED ALONG THE FRONT THIS AFTERNOON AND PERSIST THIS EVENING.

THE FRONT WILL SLOWLY OOZE INTO THE NORTHWESTERN FORECAST AREA WELL 
AFTER MIDNIGHT BRINGING CHANCES FOR RAIN TO MAINLY THE NORTHERN 
FORECAST AREA. THE CURRENT FORECAST HANDLES THIS SCENARIO WELL. 

THE EXCESSIVE HEAT WARNING AND HEAT ADVISORY WILL BE ALLOWED TO 
EXPIRE AT 10 PM. THE CURRENT FORECAST REMAINS ON TRACK OVERNIGHT AND 
NO CHANGES ARE PLANNED OTHER THAN TO UPDATE THE WARNING AND 
ADVISORY. THE UPDATE WILL BE OUT AT 10 PM. 

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES
AR...EXCESSIVE HEAT WARNING 
ARZ008-009-017-018-026>028-035-036-048-049-058 AND HEAT ADVISORY 
ELSEWHERE THROUGH 10 PM
MO...EXCESSIVE HEAT WARNING MOZ113-115 AND HEAT ADVISORY THROUGH 10 
PM.
MS...EXCESSIVE HEAT WARNING MSZ001-007-008-010>013-015>017-020>024 
AND HEAT ADVISORY ELSEWHERE THROUGH 10 PM.
TN...EXCESSIVE HEAT WARNING TNZ001-002-019-048-049-088 AND HEAT 
ADVISORY THROUGH 10 PM.

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 262038
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
338 PM CDT TUE JUL 26 2005

.DISCUSSION...
UPPER RIDGE CONTINUES TO SLIDE FURTHER EAST WHILE AN UPPER TROUGH 
AND COLD FRONT ARE PROGRESSING TOWARD THE MIDSOUTH. TEMPERATURES ARE 
IN THE MID 90S WITH HEAT INDICES FROM 105 TO 110. A FEW SHOWERS AND 
THUNDERSTORMS HAVE DEVELOPED BUT ARE SHORT LIVED.
&&

.SHORT TERM (THROUGH FRIDAY)...
MAIN FORECAST CONCERN WILL BE ADVANCEMENT OF FRONT AND PRECIP 
CHANCES ACROSS THE REGION. FIRST THINGS FIRST...WILL KEEP A MENTION 
OF ISOLATED SHWRS/TSTMS DURING THE EVENING JUST TO ACCOUNT FOR ANY 
DIURNAL DRIVEN CONVECTION. AFTER THAT...POPS WILL INCREASE ACROSS 
NORTHWESTERN PORTIONS OF THE CWA AS THE FRONT ADVANCES SOUTHEAST. 
MODELS IN GOOD AGREEMENT ON THE TIMING OF THE FRONT...ENTERING IT 
INTO NE AR AROUND 10-11Z. BOTH GFS AND NAM SHOW THAT MOST OF THE 
PRECIP WILL BE POST FRONTAL AS THE MAIN FORCING WITH THE TROUGH WILL 
LAG BEHIND THE FRONT. HOWEVER...CERTAINLY CANNOT RULE OUT 
DEVELOPMENT AHEAD OF THE FRONT GIVEN THE WARM AND MOIST AIRMASS IN 
PLACE. THE HEAT ADVISORY AND WARNING WILL BE ALLOWED TO EXPIRE AT 10 
PM. REGARDING SEVERE POTENTIAL...SPC KEEPS SLIGHT RISK NORTH OF THE 
AREA TONIGHT. AGREE WITH THIS SINCE THE FRONT WILL COME THROUGH IN 
THE EARLY MORNING HOURS. ALSO...MID LEVEL LAPSE RATES OF LESS THAN 6 
C/KM WILL INHIBIT SEVERE POTENTIAL. 

FRONT WILL CONTINUE TO PROGRESS THROUGH THE CWA DURING THE DAY 
TOMORROW. AGAIN...MODELS SHOWING MOSTLY POST FRONTAL PRECIP BUT 
CONVECTION AHEAD OF THE FRONT IS CERTAINLY A POSSIBILITY. HAVE GONE 
WITH 60 POPS AREAWIDE. COULD BE A FEW STRONG STORMS IN NORTH MS 
WHERE THERE WILL BE MORE TIME TO HEAT UP THE ATMOSPHERE. 
AGAIN...SEVERE WEATHER NOT ANTICIPATED BUT WILL MENTION THE THREAT 
OF A FEW STRONG STORMS.

CHANCES OF PRECIP WILL LINGER INTO THURSDAY AS THE MODELS HINT AT 
CONTINUED POST FRONTAL PRECIP AS THE FRONT STALLS OVER CENTRAL 
MS/AL. AS NW FLOW BECOMES ESTABLISHED...THIS WILL HELP TO END THE 
PRECIP OVER THE AREA BY THURSDAY EVENING. THERE WILL BE A NOTICEABLE 
AIRMASS CHANGE BEHIND THE FRONT. HIGHS FOR THE END OF THE WEEK WILL 
BE IN THE 80S WITH DEWPOINTS IN THE 60S...CERTAINLY COMFORTABLE FOR 
THIS TIME OF THE YEAR.

&&

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...

THE WEEKEND LOOKS DRY...WITH WEAK NW FLOW CONTINUE. THE REGION WILL 
BE IN A WEAKNESS IN THE UPPER FLOW AS UPPER RIDGING BUILDS TO OUR 
WEST AND EAST. LITTLE MOISTURE WILL EXIST ABOVE 850 MB SO THAT 
SHOULD PREVENT ANY PRECIP. TEMPS WILL WARM TO NEAR SEASONABLE LEVELS 
BUT DEWPOINTS WILL STAY IN THE MID TO UPPER 60S. A SLIGHT CHANCE OF 
RAIN RETURNS TO EASTERN AREAS ON MONDAY AND TO THE WHOLE AREA ON 
TUESDAY AS DAYTIME HEATING AND INCREASED MOISTURE INCREASE.

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES
AR...EXCESSIVE HEAT WARNING 
ARZ008-009-017-018-026>028-035-036-048-049-058 AND HEAT ADVISORY 
ELSEWHERE THROUGH 10 PM
MO...EXCESSIVE HEAT WARNING MOZ113-115 AND HEAT ADVISORY THROUGH 10 
PM.
MS...EXCESSIVE HEAT WARNING MSZ001-007-008-010>013-015>017-020>024 
AND HEAT ADVISORY ELSEWHERE THROUGH 10 PM.
TN...EXCESSIVE HEAT WARNING TNZ001-002-019-048-049-088 AND HEAT 
ADVISORY THROUGH 10 PM.

$$

JFB

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 261546
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
1045 AM CDT TUE JUL 26 2005

.UPDATE...

THE AXIS OF THE UPPER RIDGE IS BEGINNING TO SHIFT EAST OF THE 
MIDSOUTH. MEANWHILE...AN UPPER TROUGH IS PROGRESSING EAST ACROSS THE 
PLAIN STATES. THIS IS PUTTING THE MIDSOUTH UNDER INCREASING SW BOTH 
AT THE SFC AND ALOFT. 

HAVE REINTRODUCED A SLIGHT CHANCE OF AFTERNOON SHOWERS AND 
THUNDERSTORMS. A FEW STORMS MANAGED TO DEVELOP LATE YESTERDAY 
AFTERNOON EVEN WHEN THE RIDGE WAS DIRECTLY OVER THE REGION. MORNING 
SOUNDINGS DO NOT SHOW MUCH OF A CAP TODAY AND WITH THE RIDGE TO THE 
EAST NOW...CANNOT RULE OUT A FEW SHOWERS OR TSTMS IN THE PRIME 
HEATING OF THE DAY. 

TEMPS WILL BE SIMILAR TO YESTERDAY (MID TO UPPER 90S.) HEAT INDICES 
WILL RANGE FROM 105 TO JUST ABOVE 110. THE HEAT WARNING AND 
ADVISORY WILL BE LEFT AS IS...EXPIRING AT 10 PM TONIGHT. MADE JUST A 
FEW TWEAKS WITH T/TD/HI GRIDS...BUT NO MAJOR CHANGES. UPDATE TO 
GRIDS ALREADY OUT. ZONES WILL BE OUT MOMENTARILY.

JFB

.PREVIOUS DISCUSSION ISSUED AT 250 AM TUE JUL 26...

COLD FRONT EXTENDS FROM NEAR MILWAUKEE TO AMARILLO THIS MORNING WITH
TEMPERATURES IN THE MID 70S TO LOWER 80S.
&&

.SHORT TERM (THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...
THE COLD FRONT WILL SLOWLY MOVE SOUTHEAST TODAY AND TONIGHT. DO NOT
THINK FRONT WILL BE CLOSE ENOUGH TO PRODUCE ANY THUNDERSTORMS OVER
THE FORECAST AREA TODAY SO HAVE REMOVED POPS. TEMPERATURES WILL BE
AS HOT AS THEY HAVE FOR THE PAST FEW DAYS AND HEAT INDICES WILL BE
CLOSE TO IF NOT REACH 110 CRITERIA SO WILL LEAVE HEAT ADVISORIES AND
WARNINGS LIKE THEY HAVE BEEN.

BY TONIGHT COLD FRONT IS CLOSER TO THE FORECAST AREA SO MAY SEE SOME
THUNDERSTORMS OVER MAINLY NORTHERN SECTIONS SO HAVE CHANCE POPS
THERE AND SLIGHT CHANCE POPS ELSEWHERE. BY WEDNESDAY...FRONT WILL BE
MOVING INTO THE FORECAST AREA WHICH WILL HELP BRING RAIN TO THE
REGION AND ALSO KEEP TEMPERATURES FROM GETTING AS HIGH AS THEY HAVE
BEEN WITH READINGS SOME 10 DEGREES COOLER BEHIND THE FRONT ON
WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY. WILL KEEP CHANCE POPS FOR ENTIRE FORECAST
AREA FOR WEDNESDAY AND WEDNESDAY NIGHT. FRONT SHOULD SLIDE INTO NORTH
MISSISSIPPI FOR THURSDAY SO ONLY HAVE POPS THERE.

&&

.LONG TERM (AFTER THURSDAY)...
FRONT SHOULD MOVE SOUTH OF FORECAST AREA AND DIE OUT. PREVIOUS
FORECAST HAD MENTION OF SLIGHT CHANCE POPS OVER NORTHEAST
MISSISSIPPI FOR MUCH OF THE EXTENDED PERIOD. NEW GFS RUN TRIES TO
KEEP UPPER LEVEL LOW OVER THE REGION THROUGH EXTENDED BUT AT THIS
POINT WILL GO WITH DRY FORECAST THROUGH THE EXTENDED PERIOD.

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES
AR...EXCESSIVE HEAT WARNING ARZ008-009-017-018-026>028-035-036-
048-049-058 AND HEAT ADVISORY ELSEWHERE THROUGH THIS EVENING.
MO...EXCESSIVE HEAT WARNING MOZ113-115 AND HEAT ADVISORY THROUGH
THIS EVENING ELSEWHERE.
MS...EXCESSIVE HEAT WARNING MSZ001-007-008-010>013-015>017-020>024
AND HEAT ADVISORY ELSEWHERE THROUGH THIS EVENING.
TN...EXCESSIVE HEAT WARNING TNZ001-002-019-048-049-088 AND HEAT
ADVISORY THROUGH THIS EVENING ELSEWHERE.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
250 AM CDT TUE JUL 26 2005

.DISCUSSION...
COLD FRONT EXTENDS FROM NEAR MILWAUKEE TO AMARILLO THIS MORNING WITH
TEMPERATURES IN THE MID 70S TO LOWER 80S.
&&

.SHORT TERM (THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...
THE COLD FRONT WILL SLOWLY MOVE SOUTHEAST TODAY AND TONIGHT. DO NOT
THINK FRONT WILL BE CLOSE ENOUGH TO PRODUCE ANY THUNDERSTORMS OVER
THE FORECAST AREA TODAY SO HAVE REMOVED POPS. TEMPERATURES WILL BE
AS HOT AS THEY HAVE FOR THE PAST FEW DAYS AND HEAT INDICES WILL BE
CLOSE TO IF NOT REACH 110 CRITERIA SO WILL LEAVE HEAT ADVISORIES AND
WARNINGS LIKE THEY HAVE BEEN.

BY TONIGHT COLD FRONT IS CLOSER TO THE FORECAST AREA SO MAY SEE SOME
THUNDERSTORMS OVER MAINLY NORTHERN SECTIONS SO HAVE CHANCE POPS
THERE AND SLIGHT CHANCE POPS ELSEWHERE. BY WEDNESDAY...FRONT WILL BE
MOVING INTO THE FORECAST AREA WHICH WILL HELP BRING RAIN TO THE
REGION AND ALSO KEEP TEMPERATURES FROM GETTING AS HIGH AS THEY HAVE
BEEN WITH READINGS SOME 10 DEGREES COOLER BEHIND THE FRONT ON
WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY. WILL KEEP CHANCE POPS FOR ENTIRE FORECAST
AREA FOR WEDNESDAY AND WEDNESDAY NIGHT. FRONT SHOULD SLIDE INTO NORTH
MISSISSIPPI FOR THURSDAY SO ONLY HAVE POPS THERE.

&&

.LONG TERM (AFTER THURSDAY)...
FRONT SHOULD MOVE SOUTH OF FORECAST AREA AND DIE OUT. PREVIOUS
FORECAST HAD MENTION OF SLIGHT CHANCE POPS OVER NORTHEAST
MISSISSIPPI FOR MUCH OF THE EXTENDED PERIOD. NEW GFS RUN TRIES TO
KEEP UPPER LEVEL LOW OVER THE REGION THROUGH EXTENDED BUT AT THIS
POINT WILL GO WITH DRY FORECAST THROUGH THE EXTENDED PERIOD.

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES
AR...EXCESSIVE HEAT WARNING ARZ008-009-017-018-026>028-035-036-
048-049-058 AND HEAT ADVISORY ELSEWHERE THROUGH THIS EVENING.
MO...EXCESSIVE HEAT WARNING MOZ113-115 AND HEAT ADVISORY THROUGH
THIS EVENING ELSEWHERE.
MS...EXCESSIVE HEAT WARNING MSZ001-007-008-010>013-015>017-020>024
AND HEAT ADVISORY ELSEWHERE THROUGH THIS EVENING.
TN...EXCESSIVE HEAT WARNING TNZ001-002-019-048-049-088 AND HEAT
ADVISORY THROUGH THIS EVENING ELSEWHERE.

$$

FXUS64 KMEG 251926
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
230 PM CDT MON JUL 25 2005

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)...
THE UPPER LEVEL RIDGE CENTERED OVER THE MIDSOUTH TODAY WILL BEGIN TO 
SLIDE EASTWARD AS A TROUGH OVER THE INTERMOUNTAIN WEST TRANSLATES 
EAST OVER THE NEXT FEW DAYS.

BEFORE THE RIDGE GIVES WAY TO THE TROUGH...ANOTHER WARM AND MUGGY 
NIGHT TONIGHT AND A HOT DAY TOMORROW CAN BE EXPECTED. HIGHS TOMORROW 
WILL STILL BE IN THE MID TO UPPER 90S. GUIDANCE CONTINUES TO 
OVERPLAY HIGH TEMPS...PROBABLY DUE TO MOIST SOIL CONDITIONS. WILL 
FOLLOW THE TREND FROM THE PREVIOUS SHIFT AND UNDERCUT GUIDANCE ONE 
OR TWO DEGREES TOMORROW. HEAT INDICES LOOK TO RUN FROM 105 TO 110 
TOMORROW. LOCATIONS UNDER THE HEAT WARNING MAY NOT QUITE REACH 
CRITERIA OF 110 OR GREATER...BUT IT IS TOO CLOSE TO CALL RIGHT NOW 
AND WILL LEAVE ALL ADVISORIES AND WARNINGS AS IS. DO NOT WANT 
ANYBODY TO THINK THAT CONDITIONS WILL NOT BE DANGEROUS TOMORROW. THE 
MIDNIGHT SHIFT CAN REEVALUATE THE SITUATION. THERE WILL BE A SLIGHT 
CHANCE OF AFTERNOON CONVECTION WITH THE RIDGE MOVING EAST.

UPPER TROUGH WILL BEGIN TO PUSH IN TUESDAY NIGHT INTO 
WEDNESDAY...SENDING A COLD FRONT THROUGH THE REGION. LATEST MODELS 
QUICKER IN BRINGING FRONT THROUGH...BUT WILL DELAY THE TIMING A 
LITTLE JUST BASED ON THE FACT THAT IT IS NOT UNCOMMON FOR FRONTS TO 
SLOW DOWN THIS TIME OF YEAR. WILL INCREASE POPS TO HIGH CHANCE FOR 
NW AREAS OVERNIGHT TUESDAY...AND HIGH CHANCE EVERYWHERE ON 
WEDNESDAY. MODELS ALSO HINT AT POST FRONTAL PRECIP...SO WILL BE SLOW 
TO REMOVE POPS ON THURSDAY. LOWER DEWPOINTS AND SLIGHTLY BELOW 
NORMAL TEMPS WILL FILTER INTO THE AREA FOR THE END OF THE WEEK. IT 
WILL DEFINITELY BE SOME WELCOMED RELIEF.

&&

.LONG TERM (FRIDAY THROUGH MONDAY)...
THE FRIDAY THROUGH MONDAY TIME PERIOD WILL BE FAIRLY TRANQUIL FOR 
MOST OF THE AREA. GLOBAL MODELS INDICATE THE REGION WILL BE UNDER 
THE INFLUENCE OF A BROAD TROUGH...BASICALLY A WEAKNESS IN THE 
PATTERN BETWEEN THE BUILDING RIDGE TO THE WEST AND THE BERMUDA HIGH 
TO THE EAST. THE ATMOSPHERE WILL REMAIN DRY SO NO PRECIP EXPECTED AT 
THIS TIME. THE EXCEPTION WOULD BE ACROSS AREAS OF NORTH MS. GFS 
INDICATES A SFC LOW DEVELOPING OVER CENTRAL MS/AL IN RESPONSE TO THE 
UPPER WEAKNESS. A SFC TROF WOULD EXTEND NORTH FROM THE 
LOW...POSSIBLY AFFECTING NE MS. CONFIDENCE NOT HIGH AT THIS 
TIME...BUT FELT IT PRUDENT TO KEEP A SLIGHT CHANCE POP IN THOSE 
AREAS THROUGH THE FORECAST. TEMPS WILL WARM TO NEAR SEASONABLE 
LEVELS OVER THE WEEKEND BUT DEWPOINTS WILL REMAIN IN THE 60S SINCE 
THERE IS NOT MUCH OF A  RETURN FLOW OFF OF THE GULF TO BRING THEM 
BACK UP.

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES
AR...EXCESSIVE HEAT WARNING ARZ008-009-017-018-026>028-035-036-
048-049-058 AND HEAT ADVISORY ELSEWHERE THROUGH TUESDAY EVENING.
MO...EXCESSIVE HEAT WARNING MOZ113-115 AND HEAT ADVISORY THROUGH
TUESDAY EVENING ELSEWHERE.
MS...EXCESSIVE HEAT WARNING MSZ001-007-008-010>013-015>017-020>024
AND HEAT ADVISORY ELSEWHERE THROUGH TUESDAY EVENING.
TN...EXCESSIVE HEAT WARNING TNZ001-002-019-048-049-088 AND HEAT
ADVISORY THROUGH TUESDAY EVENING ELSEWHERE.

$$

JFB






