FXUS64 KMEG 251554
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
1054 AM CDT MON JUL 25 2005

.UPDATE...

A STRONG 500MB RIDGE IS CENTERED DIRECTLY OVER THE MIDSOUTH THIS 
MORNING AND WILL PROVIDE ANOTHER DAY OF EXCESSIVE HEAT ACROSS THE 
REGION. 850MB TEMPS RANGE FROM 19C AT LZK TO 23C AT OHX. THIS WILL 
RESULT IN ANOTHER DAY OF TEMPS IN THE MID TO UPPER 90S. TEMPS THIS 
MORNING ARE CLOSE TO WHAT THEY WERE AT THIS TIME YESTERDAY...SO 
SHOULD SEE SIMILAR NUMBERS THIS AFTERNOON. MOIST SOIL CONDITIONS ARE 
EXPECTED TO ONCE AGAIN KEEP TEMPS FROM TOPPING THE CENTURY MARK. 
DEWPOINTS IN THE MID TO UPPER 70S WILL RESULT IN HEAT INDICES OF 105 
TO 115. CURRENT HEAT WARNINGS AND ADVISORIES LOOK GOOD AS DOES THE 
REST OF THE FORECAST. NO UPDATES ARE NEEDED AT THIS TIME.

JFB

.PREVIOUS DISCUSSION ISSUED AT 300 AM MON JUL 25...

SURFACE HIGH REMAINS ANCHORED OVER SOUTHEAST U.S. LITTLE CHANGE IN
CONDITIONS FROM LAST NIGHT...WITH DEWPOINTS MAINLY IN MIDDLE 70S.
&&

.SHORT TERM (THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...
AS ANTICIPATED LAST NIGHT...HEAT WILL HANG ON THROUGH TUESDAY.
WHILE MOS GUIDANCE HAS BEEN RUNNING 3-4 DEGREES HIGH LAST COUPLE
OF DAYS...HIGH DEWPOINTS HAVE MADE UP FOR IT...KEEPING US IN HEAT
ADVISORY/WARNING CRITERIA. WILL UNDERCUT FORECAST MAXES ONE
CATEGORY FOR TODAY...AND A DEGREE OR TWO ON TUESDAY.

HEAT PRODUCTS WILL BE CONTINUED THROUGH TUESDAY. WARNING AREAS MAY
NOT ACTUALLY REACH THE 110 HI CRITERIA ON TUESDAY...BUT WILL BE
CLOSE. SINCE IT WOULD BE DAY 6 OF THE HEAT WAVE...DONT WANT TO GIVE
PUBLIC IMPRESSION THAT THREAT HAS DIMINISHED. PATH OF LEAST REGRET IS
TO KEEP WARNING/ADVISORY GOING AS IS...AND WARNING CAN ALWAYS BE
DOWNGRADED TOMORROW MORNING.

WEAK FRONT WILL MOVE INTO THE AREA TUESDAY NIGHT AND WEDNESDAY.
LOOKS LIKE MOST PRECIPITATION WILL BE WITH OR BEHIND FRONT. WILL GO
SLIGHT CHANCE ACROSS THE AREA TUESDAY NIGHT. NOTED THAT SPC HAS
NORTHERN QUARTER OF AREA OUTLOOKED FOR TUESDAY. IF PRECIP HOLDS OFF
UNTIL LATE TUESDAY NIGHT AS EXPECTED...FEEL THREAT OF SEVERE LOW
ENOUGH TO LEAVE OUT FOR NOW.

CLOUD COVER/PRECIPITATION LIKELY TO HOLD TEMPERATURES BELOW NORMAL
WEDNESDAY...AND PROBABLY THURSDAY. WILL GO WITH HIGH CHANCE POPS
WEDNESDAY AND WEDNESDAY NIGHT.
&&

.LONG TERM (AFTER WEDNESDAY)...
NAM/GFS/ECMWF ALL SHOW FRONT TO THE SOUTH OF THE CWA BY FRIDAY.
WHILE THE FRONT MAY NOT ACTUALLY MAKE IT THAT FAR SOUTH...IT SHOULD
LOSE ITS EFFECTIVENESS TO PRODUCE PRECIPITATION BY FRIDAY. WILL
START TAPERING POPS FROM NORTH TO SOUTH ON THURSDAY...WITH THINGS
DRY BY FRIDAY.

WE GET INTO WEAK NORTHWESTERLY UPPER FLOW BY FRIDAY...AND SEE NO
BIG PRECIPITATION THREAT THROUGH THE WEEKEND. TEMPERATURES BELOW
NORMAL THURSDAY AND FRIDAY...THEN AROUND NORMAL FOR THE WEEKEND.
EXPECT DEWPOINTS TO REMAIN BELOW LEVELS WE HAVE SEEN THIS WEEKEND.
&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES
AR...EXCESSIVE HEAT WARNING ARZ008-009-017-018-026>028-035-036-
048-049-058 AND HEAT ADVISORY ELSEWHERE THROUGH TUESDAY EVENING.
MO...EXCESSIVE HEAT WARNING MOZ113-115 AND HEAT ADVISORY THROUGH
TUESDAY EVENING ELSEWHERE.
MS...EXCESSIVE HEAT WARNING MSZ001-007-008-010>013-015>017-020>024
AND HEAT ADVISORY ELSEWHERE THROUGH TUESDAY EVENING.
TN...EXCESSIVE HEAT WARNING TNZ001-002-019-048-049-088 AND HEAT
ADVISORY THROUGH TUESDAY EVENING ELSEWHERE.

$$

WAGNER

AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
855 PM CDT SUN JUL 24 2005

.DISCUSSION...

HOT AND HUMID WEATHER CONTINUES THIS EVENING AND WILL PERSIST
INTO THE BEGINNING OF THIS WEEK. HIGH PRESSURE HAS SUPPRESSED
CONVECTION AND HAS ALLOWED FOR THE VERY HOT...HUMID...AND
UNCOMFORTABLE CONDITIONS. EXPECT LOW TEMPERATURES TONIGHT TO RANGE
FROM THE MID 70S TO AROUND 80...WITH DEWPOINTS CONTINUING IN THE
MID TO UPPER 70S. SKIES SHOULD REMAIN MOSTLY CLEAR AS WELL...AND THE
CURRENT FORECAST HAS A GOOD HANDLE ON THE SITUATION.

REMEMBER TO EXERCISE AND URGE OTHERS TO EXERCISE ALL HEAT SAFETY
PRECAUTIONS AS EXCESSIVE HEAT WARNING (HEAT INDICES 105-115
DEGREES) / HEAT ADVISORY (HEAT INDICES >105 DEGREES) CRITERIAS WILL
BE MET ACROSS THE MID-SOUTH THROUGH AT LEAST MONDAY EVENING. THESE
ADVISORIES MAY BE CARRIED INTO TUESDAY BY LATER SHIFTS IF CONDITIONS
WARRANT.

NO FORECAST UPDATES ARE PLANNED FOR THIS EVENING AND ALL HEAT
RELATED WARNINGS AND ADVISORIES WILL REMAIN IN PLACE.

&&

JLH

$$

.PREVIOUS DISCUSSION FROM 335 PM...

VISIBLE SATELLITE SHOWS A 4000 FT BASED CUMULUS DECK
ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA THIS AFTERNOON WHILE THE AREA IS UNDER THE
INFLUENCE OF 1019 MB HIGH PRESSURE. MAIN FORECAST CONCERNS THIS
PACKAGE IS HEAT HEADLINES.

TONIGHT THROUGH MONDAY NIGHT...SKIES WILL BECOME MOSTLY CLEAR WITH
VARIABLE TO CALM WINDS ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA WITH HIGH PRESSURE
OVERHEAD. TEMPERATURES WILL REMAIN AT OR ABOVE 75 DEGREES. ANOTHER
UNCOMFORTABLE DAY EXPECTED ACROSS THE MID SOUTH AS HIGH PRESSURE
REMAINS IN PLACE ACROSS THE AREA. NOT EXPECTING MUCH CHANGE IN
TEMPERATURES AND DEWPOINTS...SO HEAT INDICES WILL REMAIN AROUND 105
TO 115 DEGREES WITH TEMPERATURES IN THE MIDDLE TO UPPER 90S. CURRENT
OBS THIS AFTERNOON IN WARNING AREA AND NEAR DYERSBURG JUSTIFY KEEPING
WARNING UP AND ADDING A TIER OF TN COUNTIES NORTH OF SHELBY COUNTY
THROUGH MONDAY NIGHT.

TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY...SOUTHERLY FLOW RETURNS TUESDAY AS THE RIDGE
OF HIGH PRESSURE BEGINS TO MOVE EAST OF THE FORECAST AREA. WILL KEEP
20 POPS GOING FOR TUESDAY AFTERNOON AS GULF MOISTURE WILL ALLOW
DIURNALLY DRIVEN PULSE TYPE CONVECTION TO DEVELOP ESPECIALLY ACROSS
THE SOUTHERN HALF OF THE AREA. FRONT WILL BEGIN TO APPROACH THE
LOWER MISSISSIPPI VALLEY BY WEDNESDAY...BRINGING A BETTER CHANCE OF
SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS TO THE AREA. HEAT INDICES DURING THE DAY
ON TUESDAY SHOULD BE AROUND 5 TO 10 DEGREES COOLER. HOWEVER...THE
NEXT FEW SHIFTS WILL EXTEND THE ADVISORY/WARNING OUT THROUGH TUESDAY
IF CONDITIONS ARE NOT ANTICIPATED TO IMPROVE AS QUICKLY.

LONG TERM...(THURSDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...
FAIRLY DECENT MODEL AGREEMENT THROUGH THE EXTENDED BETWEEN THE
GFS/DGEX/AND EUROPEAN. ONLY BIG DIFFERENCES AT THIS POINT IS 00Z/24
EUROPEAN NOT AS AGGRESSIVE WITH DROPPING TROUGH DOWN ACROSS THE
EASTERN US ON SATURDAY AND DGEX HOLDING PRECIPITATION ACROSS THE
FORECAST AREA THROUGH SATURDAY. AS A RESULT...WILL KEEP CHANCE POPS
IN ACROSS THE AREA THURSDAY AND FRIDAY AND 20 POPS FOR A PORTION OF
SATURDAY AS A COLD FRONT STALLS OUT ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA AND
EVENTUALLY FIZZLES OUT.

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES
AR...EXCESSIVE HEAT WARNING ARZ008-009-017-018-026>028-035-036-
048-049-058 AND HEAT ADVISORY ELSEWHERE THROUGH MONDAY EVENING.
MO...EXCESSIVE HEAT WARNING MOZ113-115 AND HEAT ADVISORY THROUGH
MONDAY EVENING ELSEWHERE.
MS...EXCESSIVE HEAT WARNING MSZ001-007-008-010>013-015>017-020>024

AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
1050 AM CDT SUN JUL 24 2005

.DISCUSSION...SURFACE AND UPPER AIR ANALYSIS PLACES STACKED 1019 MB 
HIGH PRESSURE ACROSS SOUTHERN MISSISSIPPI AND THE MID SOUTH. MAIN 
SHORT TERM CONCERN FOR THIS AFTERNOON IS ONGOING HEADLINES DUE TO 
THE HEAT. VISIBLE SATELLITE SHOWS ONLY A FEW CIRRUS FROM THE EASTERN 
EDGE OF THE RIDGE DRIFTING WEST ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA. 850 
TEMPERATURES AROUND 22C THIS MORNING ON KLZK SOUNDING SUGGESTS 
TEMPERATURES AT LEAST SIMILAR IF NOT A COUPLE OF DEGREES HIGHER THAN 
YESTERDAY. UNFORTUNATELY SURFACE DEWPOINTS IN THE MIDDLE TO UPPER 
70S ARE ALREADY PRODUCING HEAT INDICIES IN THE 100 TO 105 DEGREE 
RANGE ACROSS MANY AREAS IN THE FORECAST AREA. WILL NOT MAKE ANY 
CHANGES TO CURRENT TRENDS OTHER THAN MINOR TWEAKS TO TEMPERATURES 
AND DEWPOINTS. WILL MONITOR TRENDS AND UPGRADE THE HEAT ADVISORY 
AREA TO AN EXCESSIVE HEAT WARNING IF CONDITIONS JUSTIFY A CHANGE. 

NO UPDATE WILL BE ISSUED AT THIS TIME.

CJC

.PREV DISCUSSION...ISSUED 209 AM CDT SUN JUL 24 2005...
SURFACE HIGH OVER THE APPALACHIANS THIS MORNING...WITH UPPER RIDGE
NEAR STL. SKIES ARE MOSTLY CLEAR ACROSS THE AREA WITH LITTLE OR NO
WIND. CONDITIONS STILL RATHER STEAMY...MEM STILL 84/75 AT 06Z. MOST
DEWPOINTS IN MIDDLE OR UPPER 70S.
&&

.SHORT TERM (THROUGH TUESDAY)...
RIDGE MOVES ONLY VERY SLOWLY EAST...AND WILL BE CENTERED OVER THE
CAROLINAS BY TUESDAY. 1000 AND 850 MB TEMPERATURES NOT CHANGING MUCH
OVER THE NEXT FEW DAYS...SO DONT EXPECT MUCH CHANGE IN HIGH
TEMPERATURES. HIGHS IN UPPER 90S NEXT COUPLE OF DAYS STILL APPEARS TO
BE VERY REASONABLE. AFTERNOON DEWPOINTS WILL BE DETERMINING FACTOR
WHETHER ADVISORY OR WARNING CRITERIA ARE MET. LAST COUPLE OF
AFTERNOONS...HIGHEST DEWPOINTS HAVE BEEN IN DELTA AREA. CURRENT
CONFIGURATION OF WARNING/ADVISORY WILL BE HELD. DAY SHIFT WILL NEED
TO CONSIDER DRAGGING THESE PRODUCTS INTO TUESDAY. ALTHOUGH
TEMPERATURES MAY BE A DEGREE OR TWO COOLER TUESDAY...STILL NO RELIEF
FROM THE SITUATION.

FRONTAL BOUNDARY TO THE NORTH APPEARS TO BE SLOWER IN APPROACHING THE
AREA THAN EARLIER RUNS INDICATED. THIS WILL HAVE TWO EFFECTS ON THE
FORECAST. PRECIPITATION LIKELY TO BE DELAYED IN REACHING THE AREA.
STABILITY AND MOISTURE PARAMETERS ACTUALLY A LITTLE MORE FAVORABLE
FOR CONVECTION MONDAY THAN THEY ARE TUESDAY. ANY CONVECTIVE
DEVELOPMENT EITHER DAY LIKELY TO BE RATHER ISOLATED. MONDAY FORECAST
WAS ALREADY DRY...AND WILL HOLD WITH THAT. WE HAVE SLIGHT CHANCE
MENTIONED ON TUESDAY...BUT CONFIDENCE RATHER LOW. NEIGHBORS STILL
HAVE MENTION OF PRECIP TUESDAY...SO WILL HOLD THE CURRENT 20 POPS.
&&

.LONG TERM (AFTER TUESDAY)...
EXPECT WEAK COLD FRONT TO BE IN THE AREA FOR THE WEDNESDAY THROUGH
FRIDAY PERIOD. THIS WILL NECESSITATE KEEPING MENTION OF
PRECIPITATION IN THE FORECAST. ECMWF AND GFS RUNS AT 00Z INDICATE
FRONT TO BE SOUTH OF THE AREA BY SATURDAY. THIS WOULD MAKE FOR A
DRY FORECAST ON SATURDAY. SINCE MOST NEIGHBORS STILL HAVE MENTION
OF PRECIP FOR SATURDAY...WILL CONTINUE MENTION ONE MORE DAY. WILL
BRIEF DAY SHIFT ON TREND.

WITH FRONT IN THE AREA...WE WILL SEE MORE CLOUDINESS STARTING
WEDNESDAY...AT A MINIMUM. THIS WILL ALLOW US TO SEE MAX TEMPERATURES
A LITTLE CLOSER TO NORMAL BY THE END OF THE WEEK.

BOTTOM LINE IS THAT THERE ARE NO SIGNIFICANT ADJUSTMENTS TO LONG
TERM PORTION OF THE FORECAST THIS PACKAGE.
&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES
AR...EXCESSIVE HEAT WARNING ARZ008-009-017-018-026>028-035-036-
048-049-058 AND HEAT ADVISORY ELSEWHERE THROUGH MONDAY EVENING.
MO...EXCESSIVE HEAT WARNING MOZ113-115 AND HEAT ADVISORY THROUGH
MONDAY EVENING ELSEWHERE.
MS...EXCESSIVE HEAT WARNING MSZ001-007-008-010>013-015>017-020>024
AND HEAT ADVISORY ELSEWHERE THROUGH MONDAY EVENING.
TN...EXCESSIVE HEAT WARNING TNZ088 AND HEAT ADVISORY THROUGH MONDAY
EVENING ELSEWHERE.

WAGNER

FXUS64 KMEG 240709
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
209 AM CDT SUN JUL 24 2005

.DISCUSSION...
SURFACE HIGH OVER THE APPALACHIANS THIS MORNING...WITH UPPER RIDGE
NEAR STL. SKIES ARE MOSTLY CLEAR ACROSS THE AREA WITH LITTLE OR NO
WIND. CONDITIONS STILL RATHER STEAMY...MEM STILL 84/75 AT 06Z. MOST
DEWPOINTS IN MIDDLE OR UPPER 70S.
&&

.SHORT TERM (THROUGH TUESDAY)...
RIDGE MOVES ONLY VERY SLOWLY EAST...AND WILL BE CENTERED OVER THE
CAROLINAS BY TUESDAY. 1000 AND 850 MB TEMPERATURES NOT CHANGING MUCH
OVER THE NEXT FEW DAYS...SO DONT EXPECT MUCH CHANGE IN HIGH
TEMPERATURES. HIGHS IN UPPER 90S NEXT COUPLE OF DAYS STILL APPEARS TO
BE VERY REASONABLE. AFTERNOON DEWPOINTS WILL BE DETERMINING FACTOR
WHETHER ADVISORY OR WARNING CRITERIA ARE MET. LAST COUPLE OF
AFTERNOONS...HIGHEST DEWPOINTS HAVE BEEN IN DELTA AREA. CURRENT
CONFIGURATION OF WARNING/ADVISORY WILL BE HELD. DAY SHIFT WILL NEED
TO CONSIDER DRAGGING THESE PRODUCTS INTO TUESDAY. ALTHOUGH
TEMPERATURES MAY BE A DEGREE OR TWO COOLER TUESDAY...STILL NO RELIEF
FROM THE SITUATION.

FRONTAL BOUNDARY TO THE NORTH APPEARS TO BE SLOWER IN APPROACHING THE
AREA THAN EARLIER RUNS INDICATED. THIS WILL HAVE TWO EFFECTS ON THE
FORECAST. PRECIPITATION LIKELY TO BE DELAYED IN REACHING THE AREA.
STABILITY AND MOISTURE PARAMETERS ACTUALLY A LITTLE MORE FAVORABLE
FOR CONVECTION MONDAY THAN THEY ARE TUESDAY. ANY CONVECTIVE
DEVELOPMENT EITHER DAY LIKELY TO BE RATHER ISOLATED. MONDAY FORECAST
WAS ALREADY DRY...AND WILL HOLD WITH THAT. WE HAVE SLIGHT CHANCE
MENTIONED ON TUESDAY...BUT CONFIDENCE RATHER LOW. NEIGHBORS STILL
HAVE MENTION OF PRECIP TUESDAY...SO WILL HOLD THE CURRENT 20 POPS.
&&

.LONG TERM (AFTER TUESDAY)...
EXPECT WEAK COLD FRONT TO BE IN THE AREA FOR THE WEDNESDAY THROUGH
FRIDAY PERIOD. THIS WILL NECESSITATE KEEPING MENTION OF
PRECIPITATION IN THE FORECAST. ECMWF AND GFS RUNS AT 00Z INDICATE
FRONT TO BE SOUTH OF THE AREA BY SATURDAY. THIS WOULD MAKE FOR A
DRY FORECAST ON SATURDAY. SINCE MOST NEIGHBORS STILL HAVE MENTION
OF PRECIP FOR SATURDAY...WILL CONTINUE MENTION ONE MORE DAY. WILL
BRIEF DAY SHIFT ON TREND.

WITH FRONT IN THE AREA...WE WILL SEE MORE CLOUDINESS STARTING
WEDNESDAY...AT A MINIMUM. THIS WILL ALLOW US TO SEE MAX TEMPERATURES
A LITTLE CLOSER TO NORMAL BY THE END OF THE WEEK.

BOTTOM LINE IS THAT THERE ARE NO SIGNIFICANT ADJUSTMENTS TO LONG
TERM PORTION OF THE FORECAST THIS PACKAGE.
&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES
AR...EXCESSIVE HEAT WARNING ARZ008-009-017-018-026>028-035-036-
048-049-058 AND HEAT ADVISORY ELSEWHERE THROUGH MONDAY EVENING.
MO...EXCESSIVE HEAT WARNING MOZ113-115 AND HEAT ADVISORY THROUGH
MONDAY EVENING ELSEWHERE.
MS...EXCESSIVE HEAT WARNING MSZ001-007-008-010>013-015>017-020>024
AND HEAT ADVISORY ELSEWHERE THROUGH MONDAY EVENING.
TN...EXCESSIVE HEAT WARNING TNZ088 AND HEAT ADVISORY THROUGH MONDAY
EVENING ELSEWHERE.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
400 PM CDT SAT JUL 23 2005

.DISCUSSION...THIS AFTERNOON/S SURFACE ANALYSIS PLACES 1018MB HIGH 
PRESSURE ACROSS THE MID SOUTH. VISIBLE SATELLITE TRENDS SHOW DIURNAL 
BASED CUMULUS ACROSS THE MIDDLE/LOWER MISSISSIPPI VALLEY WITH ONLY 
CONVECTION THUS FAR ACROSS WESTERN ARKANSAS AND ALONG THE I-44 
CORRIDOR IN MO ALONG SURFACE CONVERGENCE AXIS. MAIN FORECAST 
CONCERNS THIS PACKAGE FOCUSES AROUND HEAT ADVISORY/HEAT WARNING 
POTENTIAL THROUGH MONDAY AND PRECIPITATION CHANCES AS NEXT COLD 
FRONT APPROACHES THE MID SOUTH BY MID WEEK. 

TONIGHT...SKIES WILL BECOME MOSTLY CLEAR ACROSS THE MID SOUTH AS 
DIURNAL CUMULUS DECREASES WITH THE LOSS OF DAYTIME HEAT. LOW 
TEMPERATURES TONIGHT SHOULD BE SIMILAR TO LAST NIGHT/S WITH HIGH 
PRESSURE OVERHEAD AND LOWER DEWPOINTS ACROSS EASTERN TENNESSEE 
TRYING TO SPILL IN ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA ON A VERY LIGHT EAST 
WIND.   

SUNDAY AND MONDAY...ANOTHER HOT DAY EXPECTED ACROSS THE MID SOUTH AS 
22-23C 850MB AIR MIXES DOWN TO THE SURFACE DURING THE AFTERNOON 
PRODUCING HIGHS APPROACHING THE CENTURY MARK. DEWPOINTS IN THE 
MIDDLE 70S WILL PRODUCE HEAT INDICIES IN THE 105-115 DEGREE MARK 
JUSTIFYING AN UPGRADE TO A EXCESSIVE HEAT WARNING ACROSS PORTIONS OF 
THE FORECAST AREA. 

TUESDAY THROUGH SATURDAY...LONG RANGE MODELS IN DECENT AGREEMENT AT 
LEAST THROUGH DAY 5. BY DAY 6 /NEXT SATURDAY/ BOTH THE 18Z/22 DGEX 
AND 00Z/23 GFS SHOW A TROUGH MOVING THROUGH THE MID SOUTH LATE 
TUESDAY INTO WEDNESDAY AND ANOTHER LONGWAVE TROUGH ASSOCIATED WITH 
AN UPPER LEVEL LOW ACROSS ONTARIO MOVING ACROSS THE MID/LOWER 
MISSISSIPPI VALLEY FRIDAY NIGHT INTO SUNDAY THIS WILL BRING A 
CHANCE OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS EACH DAY. 

&&

FXUS64 KMEG 231622
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
1121 AM CDT SAT JUL 23 2005

DISCUSSION...12Z UPPER AIR ANALYSIS THIS MORNING SHOWS A RIDGE OF 
HIGH PRESSURE CENTERED ACROSS THE CENTRAL PLAINS AND MIDDLE 
MISSSISSIPPI VALLEY. LOW LEVEL MOISUTRE HAS DIMINISHED FROM 
YESTERDAY WITH 850MB MOISTURE TONGUE EXTENDING FROM THE GULF TO NEAR 
JACKSON MS. VISIBLE SATELLITE TRENDS THE PAST COUPLE OF HOURS 
SHOWING DIURNAL BASED CU DECK DEVELOPING ACROSS THE EASTERN ONE 
THIRD OF THE FORECAST AREA. FORECAST CONCERNS THIS AFTERNOON ARE 
TEMPERATURES...HEAT INDEX...AND ISOLATED CONVECTIVE POTENTIAL. 

850MB TEMPERATURES AROUND 19C ON KJAN/KBMX RAOBS AND 24C AT KSGF 
SUGGEST TEMPERATURES COULD REACH THE CENTURY MARK THIS AFTERNOON 
ACROSS A PORTION OF THE AREA MAINLY ACROSS NORTHEAST ARKANSAS AND IN 
MEMPHIS. THESE TEMPERATURES COMBINED WITH SURFACE DEWPOINTS IN THE 
70S WILL PRODUCE HEAT INDICIES UP TO AROUND 105-108F. WILL NOT 
UPGRADE HEAT ADVISORY TO A WARNING AT THIS TIME BUT WILL CLOSELY 
MONITOR TRENDS THIS AFTERNOON.   

CONVECTIVE POTENTIAL WILL BE HARD TO COME BY THIS AFTERNOON WITH NO 
UPPER LEVEL ATMOSPHERIC SUPPORT FOR CONVECTION. SHORT TERM MODEL 
SOUNDINGS SUGGEST THAT A MODIFIED SURFACE BASED PARCEL LATE THIS 
AFTERNOON (99/73) WILL PRODUCE 4000 J/KG CAPE...LI/S AROUND -8 AND 
PRECIPITABLE WATER VALUES AROUND 2 INCHES. HOWEVER...CONVECTIVE 
INHIBITION SHOULD KEEP MOST IF NOT ALL AREAS DRY. THUS...WILL LEAVE 
FORECAST FOR THIS AFTERNOON DRY.

CURRENT GRIDS HANDLING FORECAST WELL AND WILL NOT ISSUE AN UPDATE AT 
THIS TIME.

CJC

.PREV DISCUSSION...ISSUED 310 AM CDT SAT JUL 23 2005...

WEAK SURFACE RIDGING OVER THE AREA WITH UPPER RIDGE TO THE WEST.
DEWPOINTS RECOVERING QUICKLY FROM EARLIER CONVECTION OVER WEST HALF
OF CWA. TEMPS MID 70S TO LOWER 80S AT 07Z WITH CALM WINDS.
&&

.SHORT TERM (THROUGH MONDAY)...
UPPER RIDGE TO BE CENTERED OVER THE AREA BY THE END OF THE DAY TODAY.
CANNOT RULE OUT ISOLATED CONVECTION DURING THE HEAT OF THE
AFTERNOONS...BUT NO ORGANIZED LIFT INDICATED THROUGH MONDAY. WILL NOT
MENTION PRECIPITATION IN SHORT TERM SECTION OF FORECAST.

IT APPEARS THAT HEAT WILL CONTINUE THROUGH MONDAY...AT LEAST. WE
SHOULD SEE A FEW DEGREES OF HEATING ACROSS MOST OF THE CWA TODAY.
EAST OF THE MISSISSIPPI RIVER...GUIDANCE HAS BEEN A LITTLE WARM LAST
2 DAYS...PROBABLY DUE TO THE HIGHER GROUND MOISTURE. MET DEWPOINT
GUIDANCE OVERDONE WITH DEWPOINTS AROUND 80. MAV GUIDANCE A LITTLE
MORE REASONABLE. MOST LIKELY AREA TO REACH CENTURY MARK TODAY WILL BE
NORTHEAST ARKANSAS...ESPECIALLY JONESBORO. PERSISTANCE FORECAST FOR
SUNDAY...MAYBE A DEGREE OR TWO COOLER ON MONDAY.

ALL AREAS REACHED HEAT ADVISORY CRITERIA ON FRIDAY...AND EXPECT
SIMILAR LEVELS TODAY AND SUNDAY...SO WILL CONTINUE ADVISORY. THE
ADVISORY WILL LIKELY NEED TO BE EXTENDED THROUGH MONDAY LATER TODAY.
&&

.LONG TERM (AFTER MONDAY)...
BOTH GFS AND ECMWF BRING A COLD FRONT INTO THE AREA ON
WEDNESDAY. THE FRONT MAY BE CLOSE ENOUGH TUESDAY TO PRODUCE
SOME CONVECTION...WITH BETTER CHANCES ON WEDNESDAY. FRONT
EXPECTED TO REMAIN IN THE AREA THROUGH THE END OF THE FORECAST
PERIOD...SO WILL NEED MENTION OF CHANCE OF PRECIPITATION FOR AT
LEAST AFTERNOON AND EVENING HOURS THROUGH THE EXTENDED PERIOD.

GRADUAL MODERATION (LOWERING) IN TEMPERATURES FOR TUESDAY THROUGH
FRIDAY WITH TEMPERATURES BY FRIDAY ACTUALLY A DEGREE OR TWO BELOW
NORMAL.

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES
AR...HEAT ADVISORY THROUGH SUNDAY EVENING.
MO...HEAT ADVISORY THROUGH SUNDAY EVENING.
MS...HEAT ADVISORY THROUGH SUNDAY EVENING.
TN...HEAT ADVISORY THROUGH SUNDAY EVENING.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
1018 PM CDT FRI JUL 22 2005

.DISCUSSION...

SEVERE WEATHER THREAT COMING TO AN END THIS EVENING WITH MOST OF THE
THUNDERSTORMS MOVING OUT OF OUR COUNTY WARNING AREA. CANNOT RULE OUT
ADDITIONAL ISOLATED SHOWERS OR STORMS FOR THE REMAINDER OF THE
NIGHT...BUT ANY OF THESE STORMS WILL REMAIN BELOW SEVERE LIMITS.
SEVERAL WIND DAMAGE...LARGE HAIL...AND EVEN A TORNADO REPORT RECEIVED
THIS EVENING AND HAVE ISSUED A SUMMARY LSR TO COVER THESE DAMAGE
REPORTS. WILL ADD TO THE LSR IF ANY ADDITIONAL REPORTS ARE RECEIVED.

WITH STORMS ON THE DECREASE...WILL UPDATE THE FORECAST TO JUST CARRY
A 20 POP AREAWIDE. OTHERWISE...FORECAST LOOKS ON TRACK. THE UPPER
RIDGE WILL BUILD IN TOMORROW...WITH STRONGER CAPPING...SO EXPECT
HOTTER AND DRY WEATHER. WILL KEEP HEAT ADVISORY IN PLACE...AS WE
SHOULD REACH THESE CRITERIAS FOR HEAT OVER THE NEXT COUPLE OF DAYS.
TRY AND STAY COOL AND FOLLOW ALL ADVISED PRECAUTIONS FOR HEAT.

UPDATED ZONES AND GRIDS WILL BE SENT SHORTLY.

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 221949
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
249 PM CDT FRI JUL 22 2005

.DISCUSSION...

THE HEAT ADVISORY HAS ALREADY VERIFIED TODAY OVER MOST AREAS WITH 
HEAT INDICES RANGING FROM 105 TO 108. ALL AREAS WILL SEE 105 PLUS 
HEAT INDICES BEFORE THE DAY IS THROUGH. SUNNY TO MOSTLY SUNNY SKIES 
PREVAIL ACROSS THE REGION.

THE HOT TEMPERATURES WILL ONLY GET WORSE OVER THE WEEKEND AS THE 
UPPER LEVEL RIDGE BECOMES CENTERED OVER THE MIDSOUTH. 850MB TEMPS 
WILL RANGE FROM 22C TO 24C WHICH SUPPORTS HIGHS IN THE UPPER 90S TO 
LOWER 100S. AS HAS BEEN STATED IN PREVIOUS DISCUSSIONS...WE FEEL 
THAT THE MOIST AIRMASS WILL PREVENT MOST AREAS FROM REACHING TRIPLE 
DIGITS. THE ONE EXCEPTION MIGHT BE IN THE JONESBORO AREA AS THEY ARE 
RUNNING A FEW DEGREES WARMER THAN THE REST OF THE AREA. HAVE DECIDED 
TO GO AHEAD FORECAST 100 FOR THEM ON SUNDAY. REGARDLESS IF IT 
REACHES 100 OR NOT...THE HEAT INDICES WILL BE BETWEEN 105 AND 110. 
THE HEAT ADVISORY WILL CONTINUE. NO PRECIP EXPECTED OVER THE WEEKEND 
AS DRIER MIDLEVEL AIR WORKS INTO THE AREA AND SUBSIDENCE FROM THE 
UPPER RIDGE DOMINATES.

THE RIDGE AXIS WILL BEGIN TO SHIFT EAST ON MONDAY. 850 TEMPS STILL 
HANG AROUND 22C WHICH WOULD SUGGEST HIGHS REMAIN IN THE UPPER 90S 
WITH CONTINUED HEAT INDICES OF 105 PLUS. THERE IS A POSSIBILITY THE 
HEAT ADVISORY MAY NEED TO BE EXTENDED INTO MONDAY. WILL PASS ON TO 
ONCOMING SHIFTS AND A DECISION WILL BE MADE OVER THE WEEKEND 
REGARDING THIS. A MENTION WILL ALSO BE MADE IN THE HWO. 

THE EXTENDED PART OF THE FORECAST (TUE-FRI) IS NOT CLEAR CUT TO SAY 
THE LEAST. THE BIGGEST FACTOR IN THIS PART OF THE FORECAST IS HOW 
FAST AND HOW FAR SOUTH DOES A COLD FRONT FROM THE UPPER PLAINS MOVE 
INTO OUR REGION? THE GFS CONTINUES TO OFFER A FASTER 
SOLUTION...BARRELLING THE FRONT THROUGH THE MIDSOUTH TUESDAY 
NIGHT/WEDNESDAY MORNING. MEANWHILE...THE ECMWF IS MUCH SLOWER AND 
HANGS THE FRONT UP OVER THE REGION BY THE END OF THE WEEK. THE UKMET 
AGREES MORE WITH THE GFS WHILE THE NOGAPS IS IN LINE WITH THE ECMWF. 
GIVEN IT IS LATE JULY...I HAVE A HARD TIME SEEING A FRONT RAPIDLY 
MOVING THROUGH OUR AREA. CLIMATOLOGY IS STRONGLY AGAINST THIS. FOR 
NOW...WILL LEAN CLOSER TO THE ECMWF SOLUTION. WILL KEEP A MENTION OF 
CHANCE POPS FROM THE MIDDLE TO THE END OF THE WEEK WITH TEMPERATURES 
NEAR SEASONABLE LEVELS. NEEDLESS TO SAY...THERE IS MUCH MORE 
UNCERTAINTY THAN USUAL REGARDING THE EXTENDED FORECAST.   

AS FOR THE TROPICS...TROPICAL STORM FRANKLIN IS FORECAST TO STAY OFF 
THE SOUTHEAST COAST AND TURN OUT TO SEA AHEAD OF AN UPPER TROUGH. 
ANOTHER AREA OF INTEREST MAY DEVELOP IN THE BAY OF CAMPECHE OVER THE 
WEEKEND...BUT SHOULD MOVE WEST AND NOT BE A FACTOR IN OUR WEATHER.

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES
AR...HEAT ADVISORY THROUGH SUNDAY EVENING.
MO...HEAT ADVISORY THROUGH SUNDAY EVENING.
MS...HEAT ADVISORY THROUGH SUNDAY EVENING.
TN...HEAT ADVISORY THROUGH SUNDAY EVENING.

$$

JFB









000 
FXUS64 KMEG 221611
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
1110 AM CDT FRI JUL 22 2005

.UPDATE...

UPPER RIDGE CONTINUES TO BUILD INTO THE MIDSOUTH. 12Z LZK SOUNDING 
SHOWS 850 TEMPS HAVE RISEN TO 21C. A LOOK AT LOCAL ACARS SOUNDINGS 
FROM MEM INTERNATIONAL ALSO CONFIRMED THE 21C TEMPS HAVE MADE INTO 
OUR AREA. THIS SUGGEST TEMPS IN THE MID TO UPPER 90S TODAY. THROW IN 
LOW TO MID 70 DEWPOINTS AND HEAT INDICES WILL CLIMB TO ABOVE 105 
THIS AFTERNOON. SOME CLOUDS REMAIN ACROSS NORTHEAST MISSISSIPPI AS 
AN OUTFLOW BOUNDARY FROM AN OVERNIGHT MCS PUSHES THROUGH THE AREA. 
THIS MAY HELP TO TRIGGER AN ISOLATED SHOWER OR THUNDERSTORM. 
ELSEWHERE...THERE SHOULD BE MORE SUN THAN CLOUDS TODAY AS MEAN RH 
VALUES CONTINUE TO GO DOWN AND SUBSIDENCE INCREASES FROM THE UPPER 
LEVEL RIDGE. CURRENT FORECAST HAS A GOOD HANDLE ON THE SITUATION AND 
NO UPDATES WILL BE ISSUED. 


JFB

.PREVIOUS DISCUSSION ISSUED AT 218 AM FRI JUL 22...

UPPER LEVEL RIDGE IS BEGINNING TO BUILD MORE INTO THE MIDSOUTH
FROM THE WEST...SIGNALING SEVERAL HOTTER DAYS WITH VERY LITTLE RAIN.
MOST CONVECTION ON THURSDAY WAS ACROSS SOUTHERN HALF OF AREA.
TEMPERATURES AT 06Z WERE MAINLY IN THE UPPER 70S. CONVECTION OVER KY
AND INDIANA THIS MORNING WILL REMAIN EAST OF THE MIDSOUTH AREA.
&&

.SHORT TERM (THROUGH SUNDAY)...
UPPER RIDGE BUILDING IN FROM THE WEST SHOULD PUSH CONVECTION
FURTHER SOUTH AND EAST TODAY. IF THERE IS ANY CONVECTION THIS
AFTERNOON...WOULD EXPECT IT TO BE ACROSS EXTREME SOUTHEAST
PORTION OF CWA. NAM SOLUTION APPEARS TO HAVE CONVECTIVE FEEDBACK
ISSUES OVERNIGHT TONIGHT...AND WILL DISCOUNT FOR NOW. AIRMASS DRIES
OUT A LITTLE MORE SATURDAY AND SUNDAY. NO PLAN TO MENTION
PRECIPITATION IN SHORT TERM AFTER THIS AFTERNOON.

TEMPERATURES...HOT. MOST AREAS FELL A DEGREE OR TWO SHORT OF
FORECAST MAXES ON THURSDAY...BUT EXPECT ABOUT A CATEGORY WORTH OF
WARMING TODAY. THIS WOULD PUT US WITHIN A DEGREE OR SO OF GOING
FORECAST AND WILL NOT SPLIT HAIRS. SIMILAR TEMPERATURES EXPECTED
SATURDAY AND SUNDAY. MOST AREAS LIKELY TO STAY JUST SHORT OF
CENTURY MARK IN THE UPPER 90S...ALTHOUGH A FEW TRIPLE DIGIT HIGHS
WOULD NOT BE A SHOCK. WILL NOT SEE SIGNIFICANT RELIEF DURING THE
NIGHTTIME HOURS EITHER...WITH MOST AREAS MID AND UPPER 70S FOR LOWS.

WHEN WE BROKE THE CENTURY MARK IN JUNE IN MEMPHIS AND JONESBORO...
GROUND AND ATMOSPHERIC MOISTURE LEVELS WERE LOWER...DEWPOINTS
IN MID AND UPPER 60S...ALLOWING MORE SURFACE WARMING. IF WE HAD THOSE
MOISTURE CONDITIONS THIS WEEKEND...WE WOULD PROBABLY BE LOOKING AT
HIGHS 102 TO 105 OR SO IN MEMPHIS...ESPECIALLY ON SATURDAY.

DO NOT SEE ANY INFLUX OF DRIER AIR AT THE SURFACE IN THE NEXT FEW
DAYS. EXPECT DEWPOINTS TO REMAIN IN THE MIDDLE 70S. THIS WILL KEEP
HEAT INDICES IN THE ADVISORY CATEGORY. HEAT ADVISORY TO CONTINUE AS
CURRENTLY POSTED.
&&

.LONG TERM (AFTER SUNDAY)...
EXPECT MONDAY WILL BE SIMILAR TO SUNDAY...BUT WILL HOLD OFF ON
EXTENDING ADVISORY INTO MONDAY FOR NOW. FRONTAL SYSTEM STILL WELL TO
THE NORTH ON MONDAY...AND PLAN TO DROP MENTION OF PRECIPITATION FOR
MONDAY. AFTER THAT...MEDIUM RANGE MODELS TRY TO DROP A FRONT INTO THE
AREA AS UPPER RIDGE MOVES EAST. THIS WILL LEAVE A WEAKNESS IN THE
UPPER PATTERN TO PROVIDE A CHANCE FOR A FROPA SOMETIME AROUND MID TO
LATE WEEK. NO CHANGES TO FORECAST POPS AFTER MONDAY. BASED ON
POSSIBLE FRONT INTO OR THROUGH THE AREA...TEMPERATURE FORECAST LOOKS
OK.
&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES


000 
FXUS64 KMEG 220718
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
218 AM CDT FRI JUL 22 2005

.DISCUSSION...
UPPER LEVEL RIDGE IS BEGINNING TO BUILD MORE INTO THE MIDSOUTH
FROM THE WEST...SIGNALING SEVERAL HOTTER DAYS WITH VERY LITTLE RAIN.
MOST CONVECTION ON THURSDAY WAS ACROSS SOUTHERN HALF OF AREA.
TEMPERATURES AT 06Z WERE MAINLY IN THE UPPER 70S. CONVECTION OVER KY
AND INDIANA THIS MORNING WILL REMAIN EAST OF THE MIDSOUTH AREA.
&&

.SHORT TERM (THROUGH SUNDAY)...
UPPER RIDGE BUILDING IN FROM THE WEST SHOULD PUSH CONVECTION
FURTHER SOUTH AND EAST TODAY. IF THERE IS ANY CONVECTION THIS
AFTERNOON...WOULD EXPECT IT TO BE ACROSS EXTREME SOUTHEAST
PORTION OF CWA. NAM SOLUTION APPEARS TO HAVE CONVECTIVE FEEDBACK
ISSUES OVERNIGHT TONIGHT...AND WILL DISCOUNT FOR NOW. AIRMASS DRIES
OUT A LITTLE MORE SATURDAY AND SUNDAY. NO PLAN TO MENTION
PRECIPITATION IN SHORT TERM AFTER THIS AFTERNOON.

TEMPERATURES...HOT. MOST AREAS FELL A DEGREE OR TWO SHORT OF
FORECAST MAXES ON THURSDAY...BUT EXPECT ABOUT A CATEGORY WORTH OF
WARMING TODAY. THIS WOULD PUT US WITHIN A DEGREE OR SO OF GOING
FORECAST AND WILL NOT SPLIT HAIRS. SIMILAR TEMPERATURES EXPECTED
SATURDAY AND SUNDAY. MOST AREAS LIKELY TO STAY JUST SHORT OF
CENTURY MARK IN THE UPPER 90S...ALTHOUGH A FEW TRIPLE DIGIT HIGHS
WOULD NOT BE A SHOCK. WILL NOT SEE SIGNIFICANT RELIEF DURING THE
NIGHTTIME HOURS EITHER...WITH MOST AREAS MID AND UPPER 70S FOR LOWS.

WHEN WE BROKE THE CENTURY MARK IN JUNE IN MEMPHIS AND JONESBORO...
GROUND AND ATMOSPHERIC MOISTURE LEVELS WERE LOWER...DEWPOINTS
IN MID AND UPPER 60S...ALLOWING MORE SURFACE WARMING. IF WE HAD THOSE
MOISTURE CONDITIONS THIS WEEKEND...WE WOULD PROBABLY BE LOOKING AT
HIGHS 102 TO 105 OR SO IN MEMPHIS...ESPECIALLY ON SATURDAY.

DO NOT SEE ANY INFLUX OF DRIER AIR AT THE SURFACE IN THE NEXT FEW
DAYS. EXPECT DEWPOINTS TO REMAIN IN THE MIDDLE 70S. THIS WILL KEEP
HEAT INDICES IN THE ADVISORY CATEGORY. HEAT ADVISORY TO CONTINUE AS
CURRENTLY POSTED.
&&

.LONG TERM (AFTER SUNDAY)...
EXPECT MONDAY WILL BE SIMILAR TO SUNDAY...BUT WILL HOLD OFF ON
EXTENDING ADVISORY INTO MONDAY FOR NOW. FRONTAL SYSTEM STILL WELL TO
THE NORTH ON MONDAY...AND PLAN TO DROP MENTION OF PRECIPITATION FOR
MONDAY. AFTER THAT...MEDIUM RANGE MODELS TRY TO DROP A FRONT INTO THE
AREA AS UPPER RIDGE MOVES EAST. THIS WILL LEAVE A WEAKNESS IN THE
UPPER PATTERN TO PROVIDE A CHANCE FOR A FROPA SOMETIME AROUND MID TO
LATE WEEK. NO CHANGES TO FORECAST POPS AFTER MONDAY. BASED ON
POSSIBLE FRONT INTO OR THROUGH THE AREA...TEMPERATURE FORECAST LOOKS
OK.
&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES
AR...HEAT ADVISORY THROUGH SUNDAY EVENING.
MO...HEAT ADVISORY THROUGH SUNDAY EVENING.
MS...HEAT ADVISORY THROUGH SUNDAY EVENING.
TN...HEAT ADVISORY THROUGH SUNDAY EVENING.

$$

WAGNER





000 
FXUS64 KMEG 220205
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
905 PM CDT THU JUL 21 2005

.DISCUSSION...
UPPER LEVEL RIDGE IS BEGINNING TO BUILD MORE INTO THE MIDSOUTH
FROM THE WEST TODAY...SIGNALING A BEGINNING TO SEVERAL HOTTER DAYS
WITH LESS IF ANY RAIN. LESS CONVECTION WAS OBSERVED THIS AFTERNOON
THAN THE PAST SEVERAL DAYS...AND THE RAIN HAS COME TO AN EARLIER
END. WILL UPDATE TO REMOVE POPS FROM THE FORECAST FOR THE REMAINDER
OF THE NIGHT. REMAINDER OF THE FORECAST IS FINE.

.PREV DISCUSSION...
ISSUED 245 PM CDT THU JUL 21 2005

THE DOG DAYS OF SUMMER ARE KICKING INTO HIGH GEAR ACROSS THE
MIDSOUTH. MANY PLACES ACROSS THE MIDSOUTH ALREADY REPORTING HEAT
INDICES OF 105 TO 108 DEGREES. A WEAK 500MB TROUGH HAS PROMOTED
SCATTERED SHOWER AND THUNDERSTORMS DEVELOPMENT...WHICH IS PROVIDING
A FEW AREAS SOME TEMPORARY HEAT RELIEF.

WILL MAINTAIN SLIGHT CHANCE POPS NORTH TO CHANCE POPS SOUTH FOR THE
EVENING HOURS. THINGS WILL SETTLE DOWN WITH THE LOSS OF DAYTIME
HEATING. IT WILL BE A VERY WARM AND MUGGY NIGHT WITH MID TO UPPER
70S EXPECTED FOR LOWS. COULD BE A LITTLE PATCHY FOG IN THOSE AREAS
THAT SEE RAIN...BUT IT SHOULD BE VERY ISOLATED IN NATURE.

THE FORECAST FOR THE NEXT SEVERAL DAYS IS FAIRLY STRAIGHT FORWARD.
UPPER RIDGE CURRENTLY CENTERED OVER COLORADO WILL CONTINUE TO SHIFT
EAST. 850MB TEMPS WILL INCREASE TO AROUND 22C OR 23C. THIS YIELDS
MAXIMUM HIGHS IN THE UPPER 90S TO POSSIBLE LOW 100S. GIVEN THE
RELATIVELY MOIST SOIL CONDITIONS AFTER SEVERAL DAYS OF RAIN ALONG
WITH DEWPOINTS IN THE 70S...HAVE A FEELING THAT 100 MAY BE HARD TO
REACH. IT CERTAINLY CANNOT RULED OUT BUT THE MAIN POINT IS THAT HEAT
INDICES WILL STILL BE BETWEEN 105 AND 109 DEGREES REGARDLESS IF 100
IS HIT ON THE THERMOMETER. A HEAT ADVISORY WILL REMAIN IN EFFECT FOR
THE ENTIRE AREA UNTIL 10PM SUNDAY.

RAIN CHANCES WILL DIMINISH GREATLY BEGINNING TOMORROW. ONLY A SLIGHT
CHANCE IN SOUTHEASTERN AREAS WHERE SOME MID LEVEL MOISTURE WILL
REMAIN. OTHERWISE...MEAN RH VALUES WILL DROP TO LEVELS THAT WILL NOT
SUPPORT CONVECTION. DRY WEATHER WILL LAST THROUGH THE WEEKEND.

RIDGE AXIS SHIFTS EAST BY MONDAY INTO TUESDAY. THE CORE OF THE HEAT
WILL SHIFT WITH IT AND A SLIGHT CHANCE OF RAIN WILL RETURN TO THE
AREA. MODELS PERSISTENT IN SHOWING A FRONT APPROACHING ON WEDNESDAY
AND STALLING/WASHING OUT OVER THE AREA BY THE END OF THE WEEK. WITH
THIS IN MIND...LOW CHANCE POPS ARE WARRANTED. TEMPERATURES WILL BE
CLOSER TO SEASONABLE LEVELS AS WELL.

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES
AR...HEAT ADVISORY THROUGH SUNDAY EVENING.
MO...HEAT ADVISORY THROUGH SUNDAY EVENING.
MS...HEAT ADVISORY THROUGH SUNDAY EVENING.
TN...HEAT ADVISORY THROUGH SUNDAY EVENING.

$$

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 211531
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
1031 AM CDT THU JUL 21 2005

.UPDATE...
ITS DEFINITELY GOING TO BE A HOT ONE ACROSS THE MIDSOUTH TODAY AND 
THERE APPEARS TO BE NO LIGHT AT THE END OF THE TUNNEL. 500MB RIDGE 
CENTERED STILL WELL TO OUR WEST WITH ITS EASTERN EXTENT NOSING INTO 
THE REGION. 850MB TEMPS OF AROUND 19C WILL PROMOTE HIGHS IN THE MID 
TO UPPER 90S. WITH DEWPOINTS IN THE LOW TO MID 70S...HEAT INDICES 
WILL BE BETWEEN 105 AND 107 THIS AFTERNOON...HENCE THE HEAT ADVISORY 
THAT IS IN EFFECT.

IN REGARDS TO PRECIP CHANCES...FEEL SOUTHERN AND EASTERN PORTIONS 
WILL SEE THE BEST CHANCE FOR CONVECTION THIS AFTERNOON. THIS IS 
WHERE THE BEST 850 MOISTURE RESIDES. IN ADDITION...A WEAK 500MB 
TROUGH AXIS WAS NOTED JUST TO THE NORTH OF THE AREA AND THIS MAY 
SERVE AS A SUBTLE TRIGGER FOR STORMS. DUE TO WEAK WIND FIELDS AND 
HIGH PRECIPITABLE WATERS...ANY STORMS THAT DO DEVELOP WILL BE 
CAPABLE OF HEAVY RAIN. HWO AND ZONES HANDLE THIS WELL. CURRENT 
FORECAST IS GOOD AND NO UPDATES ARE NEEDED AT THIS TIME.

JFB

.PREVIOUS DISCUSSION ISSUED AT 344 AM THU JUL 21 2005...

SATELLITE SHOWS A SCATTERED DECK OF MID LEVEL CLOUDINESS OVER WEST 
TN AND NORTH MS THIS MORNING. THE WATER VAPOR SHOWS AN UPPER VORT 
SPINNING THROUGH SOUTHERN MISSOURI WITH A DRY PUNCH MOVING WEST TO 
EAST ACROSS ARKANSAS. THE UPPER HIGH ASSOCIATED WITH HOT WEATHER IS 
CENTERED OVER COLORADO THIS MORNING BUT WILL SLOWLY BEGIN TO EXPAND 
TOWARDS THE EAST. 

FORECAST REMAINS RELATIVELY UNCHANGED. BOTH GFS AND NAM SHOW 
850-500MB MOISTURE STILL REMAINS OVER MUCH OF THE REGION BUT SHOULD 
BEGIN TO LESSEN SOMEWHAT OVER EASTERN ARKANSAS AND WEST TN AS THE 
DRIER WORKS IN FROM THE WEST. MODEL SOUNDINGS CONTINUE TO SHOW A 
RELATIVELY UNCAPPED ATMOSPHERE AREAWIDE. SO STILL EXPECT SCATTERED 
THUNDERSTORMS TODAY BUT THE COVERAGE MAY BE LESS NORTH OF THE TN/MS 
BORDER DUE TO THE LESSER MOISTURE. PRECIPITABLE WATER VALUES AND 
WEAK STORM MOTION OF AROUND 5 KTS STILL SUGGEST A HEAVY RAIN/FLASH 
FLOOD THREAT TODAY. GUSTY TO MARGINALLY SEVERE WINDS ALSO POSSIBLE 
DUE TO WET MICROBURSTS. ONLY MENTIONING THESE THREATS IN THE HIGHER 
POP AREAS. THE OTHER STORY IS THE HEAT. THE UPPER RIDGE WILL BEGIN 
TO NOSE INTO THE AREA TODAY AND HIGH TEMPS WILL BEGIN TO CLIMB INTO 
THE MID 90S FOR HIGHS AS 850 MB TEMPS RISE TO NEAR +20. SURFACE DEW 
POINTS HAVE NOT BEEN DROPPING MUCH OVER THE PAST COUPLE OF 
AFTERNOONS AS THEY HAD BACK IN JUNE. AS A RESULT...LOW TO MID 70S 
DEW POINTS TRANSLATES INTO HEAT INDICIES OF 105-108 OR SO. THUS THE 
HEAT ADVISORY. 

ON FRIDAY...THE CENTER OF THE UPPER HIGH SHOULD MOVE INTO EASTERN 
KANSAS. THE FLOW AROUND THIS HIGH WILL PUSH A WIND SHIFT THROUGH THE 
REGION DURING THE LATE MORNING AND AFTERNOON. TYPICALLY...THIS WOULD 
BE CLASSIFIED AS A COLD FRONT BUT TEMPS ARE NOT GOING TO BE COLDER 
BEHIND THE FRONT. IN ANY CASE...THIS WILL SCOUR OUT THE REMAINING 
DEEPER MOISTURE FROM THE AREA AND SET THE STAGE FOR THE HOT 
TEMPERATURES. AFTERNOON CONVECTION SHOULD REMAIN AHEAD OF THIS 
TROUGH AND IN AN ISOLATED/SCATTERED FASHION. THE NAM DOES FOR SOME 
REASON IS HANGING THE CENTER OF THE HIGH BACK WEST THROUGH THE 
ENTIRE RUN WHILE GFS/EUROPEAN/UKMET ALL BRING IT EASTWARD AND ALL 
ARE RELATIVELY SIMILAR IN THEIR POSITIONING. AM DISREGARDING THE NAM 
SOLUTION SINCE IT IS THE OUTLIER. AS A RESULT...GFS 850 MB TEMPS 
WILL RANGE FROM +20 TO +22 WHICH SUPPORTS HIGHS IN THE UPPER 90S TO 
AROUND 100 DEGREES. SOME MIXING CAN BE EXPECTED BEHIND THE 
FRONT...BUT STILL IF DEW POINTS ONLY FALL TO THE LOWER 70S THIS WILL 
PRODUCE HEAT INDICIES IN THE 105-110 RANGE THROUGH THE WEEKEND. 
INTERPOLATING HIGH TEMPS DOWN WITH FULL SUN WOULD PLACE AFTERNOON 
SURFACE HIGHS IN THE LOWER 100S. CU DEVELOPMENT ALTHOUGH POSSIBLE 
MAY ONLY IMPACT THE HIGH TEMPS A DEGREE OR TWO. IF MAV DEW POINTS 
VERIFY WITH 100 DEGREE TEMPS AND MID 70 DEW POINTS...IT IS VERY 
CONCEIVABLE THAT HEAT INDICIES COULD BE ABOVE 110 PERHAPS NEARING 
115. AT WHICH POINT THE ADVISORY WOULD NEED TO BE UPGRADED TO A HEAT 
WARNING. AT THIS POINT...GUT FEELING IS THAT THERE WILL BE SOME 
MIXING DOWN OF DRIER AIR AND THAT THOSE DEW POINTS WILL REMAIN IN 
THE LOWER 70S DURING THE AFTERNOON HOURS. 

SAME STORY PRETTY MUCH THROUGH THE WEEKEND. AS THE UPPER HIGH MOVES 
OVERHEAD...MID LEVEL CAPPING AND LOW MOISTURE CONTENT THROUGH THE 
COLUMN SHOULD PREVENT CONVECTION FROM DEVELOPING. BY MONDAY 
AFTERNOON THE HIGH SHOULD BE POSITIONED JUST FAR ENOUGH EAST THAT A 
RETURN OF LOW LEVEL MOISTURE AND A WEAKENING OF THE CAP MAY RESULT 
IN AN ISOLATED THUNDERSTORM OR TWO. ALSO...THE CORE HEAT WILL HAVE 
SHIFTED AWAY FROM THE REGION. BETTER CHANCES FOR SCATTERED HEAT OF 
THE DAY THUNDERSTORMS TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY AS THE LOW LEVEL 
MOISTURE INCREASES THROUGHOUT THE REGION.

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES
AR...HEAT ADVISORY NOON TODAY THROUGH SUNDAY EVENING.
MO...HEAT ADVISORY NOON TODAY THROUGH SUNDAY EVENING.
MS...HEAT ADVISORY NOON TODAY THROUGH SUNDAY EVENING.
TN...HEAT ADVISORY NOON TODAY THROUGH SUNDAY EVENING.

$$

VALLE

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
913 PM CDT WED JUL 20 2005

.DISCUSSION...
CONVECTION HAS MOSTLY DIED OUT ACROSS THE MIDSOUTH. HOWEVER...THERE
ARE A COUPLE OF HEALTHY THUNDERSTORMS STILL RUMBLING ACROSS THE
AREA...ONE OVER WEAKLEY COUNTY TN AND ANOTHER IN ALCORN COUNTY MS.
WILL LOWER POPS TO 20 PERCENT FOR THE REMAINDER OF THE NIGHT. WILL
NEED TO LOWER TEMPS SLIGHTLY IN A FEW LOCATIONS BASED ON CURRENT
TEMPS / DEWPOINTS...OTHERWISE CURRENT FORECAST IS FINE.

.PREV DISCUSSION...
ISSUED 330 PM CDT WED JUL 20 2005

A VERY WEAK UPPER TROUGH EXTENDS NE-SW ACROSS OUR REGION WITH A
RESULTING MOISTURE AXIS OVER THE SAME AREA. SCT TSTMS HAVE DEVELOPED
AGAIN FROM DAYTIME HEATING. EXPECT THESE STORMS TO BECOME NUMEROUS
LATER THIS AFTERNOON BEFORE DECREASING IN COVERAGE THIS EVENING.
HEAVY RAIN AND FREQUENT LIGHTNING WILL BE THE PRIMARY THREATS FROM
THESE STORMS.

A STRONG UPPER HIGH WILL BUILD IN FROM NW THU-WEEKEND PROVIDING A
SUBSTANTIAL DECREASE IN TSTM CHCS BUT WITH HIGHER TEMPERATURES.
DEWPOINTS WILL REMAIN HIGH FROM THE MOIST GROUND...SO HEAT INDICES
WILL BE HIGH ENOUGH THE WARRANT A HEAT ADVISORY FROM THURSDAY
THROUGH SUNDAY. EXPECT AFTERNOON HEAT INDICES 105-110 IN MOST AREAS
DURING THE AFTERNOONS WITH OVERNIGHT LOWS IN THE MID TO UPPER 70S.

THE UPPER HIGH WILL MOVE EAST OF THE CWA MONDAY ALLOWING FOR THE
TSTM CHCS TO INCREASE AGAIN WITH A SLIGHT LOWERING OF TEMPERATURES
EARLY NEXT WEEK.

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES
AR...HEAT ADVISORY NOON THURSDAY THROUGH SUNDAY EVENING.
MO...HEAT ADVISORY NOON THURSDAY THROUGH SUNDAY EVENING.
MS...HEAT ADVISORY NOON THURSDAY THROUGH SUNDAY EVENING.
TN...HEAT ADVISORY NOON THURSDAY THROUGH SUNDAY EVENING.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
950 AM CDT WED JUL 20 2005

.DISCUSSION...

A VERY WEAK UPPER TROUGH EXTENDS NE-SW ACROSS OUR REGION WITH A 
RESULTING MOISTURE AXIS OVER THE SAME AREA. SEVERAL WEAK SFC 
BOUNDARIES LINGER FROM THE TSTMS FROM YESTERDAY. WITH A LOT OF 
MOISTURE AND INSTABILITY IN PLACE...CONDITIONS WILL AGAIN BE 
FAVORABLE FOR NUMEROUS SHWRS/TSTMS THIS AFTERNOON.

A STRONG UPPER HIGH WILL BUILD IN FROM NW THU-WEEKEND PROVIDING A 
SUBSTANTIAL DECREASE IN THE CHC OF TSTMS BUT WITH HIGHER 
TEMPERATURES. COMBINED HEAT AND HUMIDITY MAY PRODUCE HEAT INDICES 
ABOVE 105 DEG MAINLY FROM FRI TO SUN.

THE UPPER HIGH WILL MOVE EAST OF THE CWA MONDAY ALLOWING FOR THE 
TSTM CHCS TO INCREASE AGAIN WITH A SLIGHT LOWERING OF TEMPERATURES 
EARLY NEXT WEEK.

253 AM CDT WED JUL 20 2005

.DISCUSSION...

LITTLE CHANGE TO CONDITIONS THE WEATHER PATTERN AND HENCE FORECAST 
SINCE YESTERDAY. SATELLITE SHOWS A SCATTERED TO BROKEN DECK OF MID 
AND HIGH CLOUDS OVER THE AREA WITH A DECK OF LOWER STRATUS BEGINNING 
TO FORM OVER WESTERN TENNESSEE. THERE REMAINS A WEAK UPPER TROUGH 
STRETCHING FROM TEXAS THROUGH EASTERN OKLAHOMA AND THROUGH ARKANSAS. 
MEANWHILE THERE IS A POSITIVE AREA OF VORTICITY OVER CENTRAL 
MISSISSIPPI. AN UPPER RIDGE IS OVER THE CONTINENTAL DIVIDE AND 
SHOULD BEGIN TO PUSH INTO THE PLAINS TODAY. AT THE SURFACE...HIGH 
PRESSURE REMAINS OVER THE SOUTHEASTERN US WITH SOUTH TO 
SOUTHWESTERLY WINDS OVER THE MIDSOUTH. SURFACE DEW POINTS ARE IN THE 
LOWER 70S AND WATER VAPOR IMAGERY STILL SHOWS A FAIR AMOUNT OF 
MOISTURE AROUND. THE 850-500MB RH FIELD CONFIRMS THIS. EXPECT AREAS 
TO START OUT PARTLY CLOUDY OR BECOME PARTLY CLOUDY DEPENDING UPON 
JUST WHERE THE STRATUS DECK SETS UP. ETA SOUNDINGS ARE NEARLY 
IDENTICAL TO YESTERDAY WITH GOOD INSTABILITY OF AROUND -5 ON LI AND 
CAPES 2500-3000 J/KG. PRECIPITABLE WATERS ARE STILL IN EXCESS OF 2 
INCHES (2.15). AS A RESULT...EXPECT NUMEROUS THUNDERSTORMS TO FIRE 
ONCE AGAIN IN THE LATE MORNING/EARLY AFTERNOON HEATING AREAWIDE. 
0-3KM STORM MOTION IS ONLY PROJECTED TO BE ABOUT 3 KTS WHICH 
TRANSLATES INTO A LOCAL FLASH FLOODING THREAT. WITH THE INSTABILITY 
AS HIGH AS IT IS...GUSTY WINDS FROM THUNDERSTORMS ARE POSSIBLE AS 
WELL. MAV GUIDANCE GENERALLY FAIRED WELL YESTERDAY AND SEE NO 
JUSTIFICATION FOR DEVIATING FROM IT MUCH TODAY. 

CONVECTION SHOULD DIMINISH SHORTLY AFTER SUNSET DUE TO LOSS OF 
DAYTIME HEATING. NO SIGNIFICANT SYSTEMS EXPECTED SO JUST LOW CHANCES 
TONIGHT TO COVER SPILL OVER FROM AFTERNOON ACTIVITY. 

UPPER RIDGE WILL BEGIN TO NOSE INTO NORTHEAST ARKANSAS ON THURSDAY. 
BOTH GFS AND ETA SHOWING THE DEEPER MOISTURE BEING PUSHED SOUTHWARD 
AS THE RIDGE MOVES IN. HAVE REMOVED POPS FROM NORTHEAST ARKANSAS FOR 
THURSDAY AND BELIEVE THAT MOST OF THE CONVECTION SHOULD BE IN 
NORTHERN MS. THIS RIDGE HAS BEEN ASSOCIATED WITH EXTREME HEAT OVER 
THE SOUTHWESTERN US AND IT WILL BRING A TASTE OF THAT HEAT HERE. 
TEMPS ON THURSDAY WILL WARM INTO THE MID TO UPPER 90S AS 850 MB 
TEMPS RISE TO NEAR +20. THE UPPER RIDGE WILL BUILD INTO THE REGION 
ON FRIDAY. FAVOR THE GFS SOLUTION WHICH SHUNS ANY OVERNIGHT MCS 
DEVELOPMENT NORTH AND EAST OF THE REGION. SOUNDINGS LOOK TOO DRY 
THROUGHOUT THE COLUMN TO JUSTIFY AFTERNOON CONVECTION. 850MB TEMPS 
WILL CLIMB TO AROUND +22 BY SATURDAY WHICH FITS WITH HIGHS NEAR 100 
GOING INTO THE WEEKEND. ASSUMING DEW POINTS IN THE LOW 70S THIS 
WOULD PRODUCE HEAT INDICIES BETWEEN 105 AND 110. WILL CONTINUE TO 
EMPHASIS THIS THREAT IN THE HAZARDOUS WEATHER OUTLOOK. 

THE UPPER RIDGE AXIS IS EXPECTED TO MOVE EAST OF THE REGION ON 
MONDAY. THIS WILL RESULT IN RETURN FLOW OF MOISTURE BACK INTO THE 
REGION AND REINTRODUCE THE POSSIBILITY OF AFTERNOON CONVECTION. 
ALSO...THE CORE OF THE HEAT SHOULD MOVE AWAY FROM THE AREA WITH THE 
AXIS. 

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 200222
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
921 PM CDT TUE JUL 19 2005

.DISCUSSION...

ANOTHER ROUND OF THUNDERSTORMS WITH HEAVY RAIN IS COMING TO AN END
ACROSS THE MIDSOUTH THIS EVENING. SATELLITE AND RADAR INDICATES MOST
OF THE CONVECTION HAS ENDED ACROSS THE MIDSOUTH...AND WHAT IS LEFT
IS CONTINUING TO DIMINISH. THERE ARE A FEW THUNDERSTORMS MOVING
INTO EXTREME SOUTHWEST KY...THESE ARE WEAKENING BUT MAY MOVE INTO
PARTS OF NORTHWEST TN / MO BOOTHEEL IF THEY HOLD TOGETHER. 00Z LZK
SOUNDING INDICATES A VERY MOIST AIR MASS OVER THE MIDSOUTH WITH A
PRECIPITABLE WATER VALUE OF 2.04 INCHES. WILL LEAVE IN A 30
PERCENT CHANCE OF SHOWERS / THUNDERSTORMS FOR THE REMAINDER OF THE
NIGHT...AS WILL NOT TAKE MUCH OF A WEAK UPPER LEVEL DISTURBANCE TO
TRIGGER A SHOWER / THUNDERSTORM. RAIN HAS COOLED TEMPERATURES A
LITTLE BELOW FORECAST MINS IN SOME SPOTS...SO WILL NEED TO LOWER
MINS FOR TONIGHT IN THESE LOCATIONS. OTHERWISE CURRENT FORECAST IS
FINE.

&&

.PREV DISCUSSION...
ISSUED 217 PM CDT TUE JUL 19 2005

SCATTERED THUNDERSTORMS FORMED LATE THIS MORNING IN WEST TENNESSEE
ALONG THE TENNESSEE RIVER. THESE THUNDERSTORMS EXTENDED NORTHEAST
INTO CENTRAL AND EAST TENNESSEE. ADDITIONAL THUNDERSTORMS HAVE SINCE
FIRED FARTHER SOUTH ACROSS PARTS OF NORTHEAST MISSISSIPPI. BACK TO
THE WEST THUNDERSTORMS HAVE DEVELOPED AS WELL.

A LARGE SCALE UPPER LEVEL RIDGE HAS ANCHORED ITSELF ACROSS THE
WESTERN U.S. THIS HAS PRODUCED RECORD HEAT ACROSS THE DESERT
SOUTHWEST. AS A RESULT...THE FLOW OVER THE MID SOUTH REGION HAS BEEN
WEAK. THIS HAS CAUSED THUNDERSTORMS TO MOVE VERY SLOW AND PRODUCE
LOCALLY HEAVY RAIN. WITH A WEAK BOUNDARY IN THE AREA AND A NARROW
BAND OF MID/UPPER LEVEL MOISTURE...THUNDERSTORMS WILL CONTINUE TO
AFFECT THE REGION.

EXPECT MOST AREAS TO SEE A CHANCE OF RAIN THIS AFTERNOON AND THROUGH
THE NIGHT. BY WEDNESDAY...THUNDERSTORMS WILL BE LIKELY FOR MOST
LOCATIONS...ESPECIALLY IN THE AFTERNOON. DAYTIME HIGH TEMPERATURES
WILL BE SIMILAR TO TEMPS TODAY. THE CHANCES FOR RAIN WILL SLOWLY
COME TO AN END BY SATURDAY. THIS WILL BE IN RESPONSE TO THE UPPER
LEVEL RIDGE OUT WEST...BUILDING FARTHER EAST. AS IT APPROACHES THE
MISSISSIPPI VALLEY TEMPERATURES WILL RETURN TO THE UPPER 90S TO NEAR
100. HEAT INDICES BY FRIDAY AFTERNOON WILL BEGIN TO REACH DANGEROUS
LEVELS. THE HEAT WILL CONTINUE THROUGH THE WEEKEND.

AS THE UPPER RIDGE AXIS SHIFTS EAST...RETURN FLOW OF MOISTURE WILL
BE POSSIBLE. LOOK FOR AFTERNOON THUNDERSTORMS TO RETURN TO THE
REGION BY MID WEEK NEXT WEEK.

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.



000 
FXUS64 KMEG 190818
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
318 AM CDT TUE JUL 19 2005

.DISCUSSION...

WEATHER FEATURES THIS MORNING INCLUDE A SURFACE FRONT THAT EXTENDS 
FROM NORTHWEST INDIANA THROUGH EAST CENTRAL MISSOURI AND INTO 
SOUTHWEST KANSAS. THIS FRONT IS SLOWING ITS SOUTHWARD PROGRESS AND 
IS EXPECTED TO BECOME STATIONARY ACROSS SOUTHERN MISSOURI THIS 
MORNING. HIGH PRESSURE IS LOCATED OVER THE SOUTHEASTERN US. THERE IS 
AN UPPER TROUGH THAT EXTENDS FROM CENTRAL TEXAS THROUGH EASTERN 
OKLAHOMA AND INTO NORTHERN ARKANSAS THIS MORNING. RADAR HAS SHOWN 
CONVECTION ACROSS NORTHEAST ARKANSAS INTO NORTHWEST TENNESSEE MOVING 
EASTWARD IN RESPONSE TO A VORT MAX MOVING OUT OF THIS TROUGH. NEARLY 
STATIONARY THUNDERSTORMS HAVE DEVELOPED OVER SOUTHWEST MISSOURI IN 
THE VICINITY OF THE STATIONARY FRONT. MEANWHILE...SMALLER CELLS HAVE 
DEVELOPED OVER NORTH CENTRAL ARKANSAS IN RESPONSE TO THE TROUGH AXIS 
AND ARE MOVING EASTWARD. RUC ANALYSIS SHOWS AN AREA OF NEGATIVE 
VORTICITY OVER MUCH OF NORTH MS AND SOUTHWEST TENNESSEE WHICH HAS 
PREVENTED MOST OF THE STRATUS FROM FORMING OVER THIS AREA. AN AREA 
OF POSITIVE VORTICITY EXIST ACROSS THE SOUTHERN HALF OF MS.

SCATTERED THUNDERSTORMS WILL ONCE AGAIN BE POSSIBLE TODAY. THE 
BETTER CHANCES WILL BE ACROSS NORTHEAST ARKANSAS INTO NORTHWEST 
TENNESSEE WHERE SMALL VORT MAXS ARE EXPECTED TO EJECT OUT OF THE 
TROUGH AXIS AT VIRTUALLY ANYTIME. STILL THERE SHOULD BE SOME DRY 
TIME WITH A FEW BREAKS OF SUN THERE. POPS TAIL OFF FROM MEMPHIS TO 
JACKSON AND SOUTHWARD DUE TO POSITIONING WITH RESPECT TO HOW THE 
UPPER TROUGH IS ALIGNED. HERE DEVELOPMENT IS MORE LIKELY TO BE HEAT 
OF THE DAY GENERATED. WAS TEMPTED TO FORECAST 30 PERCENT FROM 
CLARKSDALE TO TUPELO AND SOUTHWARD BUT THE ETA SHOWS THE VORT MAX 
OVER SOUTHERN MS BECOMING MORE ALIGNED NORTHWARD WHICH MAY AID AREAL 
COVERAGE HERE. THERE IS A FLASH FLOODING POTENTIAL TODAY WITH ETA 
AND GFS SHOWING PRECIPITABLE WATER VALUES OF AROUND 2.15 INCHES AND 
A STORM MOTION OF ABOUT 6 KTS. THIS COULD POSSIBLY INDICATE STORMS 
WITH LITTLE MOVEMENT YET DUMPING A LOT OF WATER. HIGH TEMPS WILL BE 
LARGELY DEPENDENT UPON THE AMOUNT OF SUNSHINE THE AREA GETS TODAY. 
MAV TEMPS ARE NOT UNREASONABLE IF THE AREA GETS JUST A FEW HOURS OF 
SUN TODAY...OTHERWISE UPPER 80S TO AROUND 90 WILL OCCUR. 

CONVECTION SHOULD GREATLY DIMINISH TONIGHT ONCE THE SOLAR HEATING 
COMPONENT IS LOST. AT THIS TIME...THE MODELS SHOW NO REAL 
SIGNIFICANT SYSTEMS OR VORT MAXS MOVING THROUGH. CONVECTION SHOULD 
REFIRE AGAIN TOMORROW WITH SLIGHTLY BETTER CHANCES FROM THE TN/MS 
LINE NORTHWARD AS THE UPPER FLOW BECOMES MORE NORTHWESTERLY IN 
RESPONSE TO THE UPPER RIDGE OVER THE WESTERN US BUILDING INTO THE 
REGION AND THE TROUGH AXIS GRADUALLY SLIDES SOUTHWARD. ONCE AGAIN NO 
SIGNIFICANT VORT MAXS SEEN COMING OUT OF THIS TROUGH. CONVECTION 
SHOULD ONCE AGAIN DIMINISH TOMORROW NIGHT ONCE THE SUN SETS. ON 
THURSDAY THE UPPER RIDGE BEGINS TO NOSE INTO THE REGION. SUBSIDENCE 
FROM THIS RIDGE WILL RESULT IN SLIGHTLY LOWER CHANCES ACROSS 
NORTHEAST ARKANSAS. OTHERWISE...CONVECTION SHOULD BE LARGELY 
DIURNALLY DRIVEN. WILL BEGIN TO SEE AN INCREASE IN TEMPS WITH MID 
90S POSSIBLE AS 850 TEMPS ARE EXPECTED TO DRAW CLOSER TO +20. 

GOING INTO THE WEEKEND LOOKS REALLY HOT. THE NEW MEX NUMBERS DO NOT 
LOOK TOO UNREASONABLE. ALL MODELS SHOWING THE UPPER RIDGE BUILDING 
OVER THE REGION BRINGING WITH IT 850 TEMPS IN EXCESS OF +20. IF THE 
GFS VERIFIES WITH 850 TEMPS OF AROUND +23...LOW 100S ARE NOT OUT OF 
THE QUESTION. AM CONCERNED WITH AMOUNT OF CU DEVELOPMENT AND SFC DEW 
POINTS WITH RESPECT TO RECENT RAINFALL. THIS IS LIKELY THE ONLY 
FACTORS THAT COULD HOLD THE REGION IN THE UPPER 90S. STILL HEAT 
INDICIES WILL LIKELY BE AT LEAST AROUND 105 IF NOT BETWEEN 105 AND 
110. THIS HEAT WILL LIKELY HOLD AT LEAST MONDAY WHEN THE GFS SHOWS 
THE RIDGE AXIS MOVING EASTWARD TAKING THE CORE OF THE HEAT WITH IT. 

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.

FXUS64 KMEG 190114
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
814 PM CDT MON JUL 18 2005

.DISCUSSION...
AFTERNOON CONVECTION HAS JUST ABOUT ENDED ACROSS THE MIDSOUTH.
HOWEVER...AM NOW WATCHING BAND OF THUNDERSTORMS EXTENDING FROM
SOUTHERN IL ACROSS SOUTHERN MO ASSOCIATED WITH AN ELONGATED UPPER
LEVEL TROUGH AND WELL AHEAD OF A SURFACE COLD FRONT. THINK THIS
CONVECTION WILL DIMINISH WITH LOSS OF DAYTIME HEATING.
NEVERTHELESS...WILL KEEP 40 PERCENT POPS GOING ACROSS THE NORTHERN
PARTS OF THE MIDSOUTH FROM NORTHEAST AR ACROSS THE MO BOOTHEEL INTO
PARTS OF WEST TN IN CASE THIS CONVECTION CONTINUES EAST-SOUTHEASTWARD
INTO OUR AREA. ALSO...AN OUTFLOW BOUNDARY FROM THESE THUNDERSTORMS
COULD MOVE INTO NORTHERN AREAS DURING THE NIGHT. WILL LOWER POPS TO
20 PERCENT FROM ABOUT MEMPHIS SOUTHWARD. REMAINDER OF THE FORECAST IS
FINE.

&&

.PREV DISCUSSION...
ISSUED 330 PM CDT MON JUL 18 2005

THE PERSISTENT UPPER TROUGH WHICH BROUGHT NUMEROUS SHOWERS AND
THUNDERSTORMS TO THE REGION OVER THE WEEKEND HAS WEAKENED
CONSIDERABLY TODAY AND WILL DISSIPATE ENTIRELY TONIGHT. SCT TSTMS
HAVE DEVELOPED MAINLY FROM DAYTIME HEATING THIS AFTERNOON. EXPECT A
CONTINUATION OF TSTM DEVELOPMENT THROUGH THE REST OF THE AFTERNOON
BUT COVERAGE SHOULD BE LOWER THAN OVER THE WEEKEND.

A BERMUDA HIGH WILL BUILD IN FROM THE EAST THROUGH MIDWEEK CAUSING
MORE OF A TYPICAL SUMMER SCENARIO WITH HOT AND HUMID CONDITIONS
ALONG WITH A CHANCE OF THUNDERSTORMS. A COLD FRONT WILL MOVE THROUGH
THE OHIO VALLEY DURING THIS TIME BUT THE BERMUDA HIGH SHOULD PREVENT
THE FRONT FROM PUSHING INTO THE MIDSOUTH. HOWEVER...THE FRONT WILL
BE CLOSE ENOUGH TO INCREASE THE CHC OF SHWRS/TSTMS BY A TAD ON
TUESDAY...ESPECIALLY IN THE NORTH. THE REST OF THE WEEK WILL CONTAIN
THE TYPICAL SCT PM TSTMS WITH A POSSIBLE DECREASE IN COVERAGE WITH
TIME.

ANOTHER COLD FRONT WILL APPROACH THE MIDSOUTH FROM THE NORTH FRIDAY
AND SATURDAY...BUT THE BLOCKING HIGH OVER THE SE STATES MAY LIMIT
THE SOUTHWARD PROGRESS OF THE FRONT OVER THE WEEKEND.

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.

NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
955 AM CDT MON JUL 18 2005

.DISCUSSION...

A PERSISTENT UPPER TROUGH WILL REMAIN OVER THE REGION TODAY. THIS 
SYSTEM COMBINED WITH PLENTY OF INSTABILITY AND MOISTURE WILL KEEP 
THE CHANCE OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS HIGHER THAN NORMAL ALONG 
WITH PLENTY OF CLOUDS.

A BERMUDA HIGH WILL TRY TO BUILD IN FROM THE EAST THROUGH MIDWEEK 
AND FURTHER WEAKEN OR DISSIPATE THE TROUGH. THIS WILL LEAVE MORE 
IN THE WAY OF TYPICAL JULY WEATHER WITH HOT AND HUMID CONDITIONS AND 
A CHANCE OF MAINLY PM THUNDERSTORMS. A COLD FRONT WILL MOVE THROUGH 
THE OHIO VALLEY DURING THIS TIME BUT THE BERMUDA HIGH SHOULD PREVENT 
IT FROM PUSHING INTO THE MIDSOUTH.

ANOTHER COLD FRONT WILL APPROACH THE MIDSOUTH FROM THE NORTH FRIDAY

835 PM CDT SUN JUL 17 2005

.DISCUSSION...

THE SHOWER AND THUNDERSTORM ACTIVITY HAS BEGUN TO DIE DOWN WITH THE
SETTING OF THE SUN. AS HAS BEEN THE CASE OVER THE LAST COUPLE OF DAYS
THE RAIN SHOULD DIE OUT BY 10 PM. WILL NEED TO UPDATE THEN AND REMOVE
ALL MENTION OF RAIN. UNTIL THEN FORECAST SEEMS FINE SO NO CHANGE
WILL BE NEEDED UNTIL THEN.



000 
FXUS64 KMEG 171958
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
258 PM CDT SUN JUL 17 2005

.DISCUSSION...

NUMEROUS SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS WILL CONTINUE TO DEVELOP OVER THE
MID-SOUTH THIS AFTERNOON AND MOVE NORTHEASTWARD ACROSS THE AREA.
THE ATMOSPHERE REMAINS VERY MOIST (PRECIPITABLE WATERS AT OR ABOVE 2
INCHES) AND IS BECOMING INCREASINGLY UNSTABLE AS AFTERNOON HEATING
CONTINUES. ANY OF THE THUNDERSTORMS THAT DEVELOP THIS AFTERNOON AND
EVENING WILL BE CAPABLE OF PRODUCING HEAVY RAINFALL AMOUNTS...AND
POSSIBLE FLASH FLOODING...ESPECIALLY WHERE STORMS TRAIN ACROSS THE
SAME AREAS. OVERALL CONVECTIVE COVERAGE WILL DIMINISH LATER TONIGHT
WITH THE LOSS OF DAYTIME HEATING. THERE WILL STILL BE SOME CHANCES
FOR SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS AFTER MIDNIGHT...AS THE AIRMASS WILL
CONTINUE TO REMAIN VERY MOIST AND A WEAKENING UPPER LEVEL TROUGH AXIS
WILL REMAIN ACROSS PORTIONS OF THE MID-SOUTH.

A BERMUDA HIGH PRESSURE SYSTEM POSITIONED OVER THE SOUTHEAST U.S.
THIS AFTERNOON WILL CONTINUE TO SLOWLY BUILD WESTWARD OVER THE AREA
THROUGH MONDAY. THE AIRMASS WILL REMAIN VERY MOIST OVER THE REGION
ON MONDAY AND WITH ONLY LIMITED SUBSIDENCE OVER THE AREA...EXPECT
SCATTERED AIRMASS THUNDERSTORMS TO DEVELOP ONCE AGAIN ON MONDAY.
HEAVY RAIN WILL ONCE AGAIN BE POSSIBLE WITH ANY STORMS THAT
DEVELOP. THE OVERALL COVERAGE WILL BE LESS ON MONDAY THOUGH AS THERE
WILL BE SLIGHTLY HIGHER HEIGHTS IN ASSOCIATION WITH THE BUILDING
BERMUDA HIGH. THIS FEATURE WILL HELP TO REPLACE THE PERSISTENT
WEAK UPPER LEVEL TROUGH THAT HAS BEEN OVER THE REGION THIS WEEKEND.

BY MONDAY NIGHT INTO TUESDAY...AN UPPER LEVEL TROUGH THAT IS
CURRENTLY MOVING EAST ACROSS THE NORTHERN PLAINS STATES TODAY WILL
HELP TO SEND A COLD FRONT TOWARDS THE MID-SOUTH BY MONDAY NIGHT.
MODELS ARE CURRENTLY INDICATING THAT THE FRONT WILL STALL OUT JUST
TO OUR NORTH...AND THIS MAKES SENSE SINCE THE UPPER TROUGH WILL BE
LIFTING UP INTO SOUTHEAST CANADA AND THE UPPER RIDGE OVER THE
SOUTHEAST U.S. WILL CONTINUE TO STRENGTHEN. DUE TO THE CLOSE
PROXIMITY OF THE FRONT THOUGH...AND POSSIBLE OUTFLOW BOUNDARIES
MOVING SOUTH INTO OUR AREA FROM CONVECTION THAT SHOULD DEVELOP ALONG
THE FRONT TO OUR NORTH...HAVE KEPT POPS IN THE HIGH CHANCE RANGE FOR
MONDAY NIGHT AND TUESDAY.

FOR THE EXTENDED...A STRONG UPPER RIDGE WILL BUILD OVER THE WESTERN
STATES FOR THE MIDDLE AND END OF THE WEEK. THIS WILL LEAVE SLIGHTLY
LOWER HEIGHTS OVER OUR AREA THROUGH THE END OF THE WEEK...WHICH
WILL ALLOW FOR A CONTINUED CHANCE FOR MAINLY DIURNAL THUNDERSTORMS
THROUGH FRIDAY...ALTHOUGH LOWER CHANCES THAN THOSE SEEN DURING THE
BEGINNING OF THE WEEK. THE UPPER RIDGE WILL EVENTUALLY SPILL
EASTWARD OVER THE MID-SOUTH NEXT WEEKEND...WITH INCREASING HEIGHTS.
THIS WILL BRING AN END TO THE DAILY THUNDERSTORM CHANCES AND ALSO
ALLOW FOR AN INCREASE IN TEMPERATURES. SO NEXT WEEKEND SHOULD BE
RATHER HOT AND CONTINUED HUMID WITH LITTLE CHANCES FOR RAIN.

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.

$$

JLH





000 
FXUS64 KMEG 171525
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
1024 AM CDT SUN JUL 17 2005

.DISCUSSION...

ANOTHER DAY SIMILAR TO YESTERDAY IS EXPECTED ACROSS THE MID-SOUTH...
WITH NUMEROUS SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS EXPECTED OVER THE AREA WITH
AGAIN A HEAVY RAIN POTENTIAL WITH STORMS THAT TRAIN OVER THE SAME
AREAS FOR SEVERAL HOURS. LOOKING AT REGIONAL 12Z SOUNDINGS
(LZK/JAN/OHX)...ALL SITES SHOWING VERY MOIST PROFILES AND
PRECIPITABLE WATER VALUES NEAR OR IN EXCESS OF 2 INCHES. ANOTHER
INTERESTING FEATURE TO NOTE THAT HAS INCREASED MY CONFIDENCE IN
INCREASED AFTERNOON CONVECTIVE COVERAGE AND PUSHED ME TO INCREASE
POPS...WAS ENHANCED LOW-LEVEL CONVERGENCE ALONG A SUBTLE SURFACE
BOUNDARY THAT HAS SET UP ACROSS SOUTH-CENTRAL ARKANSAS INTO NORTH
MISSISSIPPI THIS MORNING. SOUTHWESTERLY SURFACE WINDS WERE OBSERVED
NORTH OF THIS BOUNDARY...WITH SOUTHEASTERLY WINDS TO THE SOUTH. IN
ADDITION...CONVECTION IS NOW BUILDING ALONG THE BOUNDARY OVER SOUTH-
CENTRAL ARKANSAS AS NOTED FROM THE KLZK RADAR IN LITTLE ROCK. ALSO...
PERSISTENT UPPER TROUGH REMAINS STRETCHED ACROSS NORTHWESTERN
PORTIONS OF THE REGION. WITH ALL THIS IN MIND...THINK LIKELY POPS IS
PRUDENT FOR THIS AFTERNOON AND HAVE UPDATED THE GRIDS TO REFLECT
THIS. ALL OTHER WEATHER PARAMETERS LOOK ON TRACK...SO NO OTHER
CHANGES MADE.

HEAVY RAIN AND LOCALIZED FLASH FLOODING MAY BECOME A PROBLEM LATER
THIS AFTERNOON IN AREAS WHERE STORMS...PRODUCING HEAVY RAIN...TRAIN
ACROSS THE SAME AREAS. THERE MAY BE AN INCREASED HEAVY RAIN AND FLOOD
THREAT...WITH TRAINING THUNDERSTORMS...ALONG THE LOW-LEVEL
BOUNDARY. WE WILL CONTINUE TO MONITOR THUNDERSTORM AND HEAVY RAIN
TRENDS THROUGH THIS AFTERNOON AND THE POTENTIAL FOR A SHORT
DURATION FLOOD WATCH (FOR FLASH FLOODING) FOR SOME PORTIONS OF OUR
FORECAST AREA. WILL ALSO UPDATE THE HWO THIS MORNING TO INCLUDE FLASH
FLOOD POTENTIAL. UPDATED GRIDS AND ZONE FORECAST OUT SHORTLY.

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.

.SYNOPSIS...
ABUNDANT MOISTURE CONTINUES TO ENGULF THE MID SOUTH. A BROKEN LINE

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 161933
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
235 PM CDT SAT JUL 16 2005

.SYNOPSIS...
SFC PRES TROF HAS MOVED NORTH OF THE FORECAST AREA.  THUNDERSTORMS 
SCATTERED ACROSS THE REGION. HEAVY RAIN IS BECOMING MORE BRIEF WITH 
CELLS MOVING NORTHEAST AT 15 TO 20 MPH.  

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND SUNDAY)
WITHOUT ANY FEATURE TO ANCHOR THE THUNDERSTORMS THE THREAT FOR 
WIDESPREAD FLASH FLOODING IS DIMINISHED.  PRECIPITABLE WATER VALUES 
ARE IMPRESSIVE...SO IF THUNDERSTORMS CAN TEMPORARILY ANCHOR ON A 
MESOSCALE BOUNDARY THEN FLASH FLOODING PSBL.  CANNOT DETERMINE WHERE 
THAT COULD BE AT THIS TIME...THEREFORE WILL NOT ISSUE A FLOOD WATCH 
FOR FLASH FLOODING.  DIURNAL TREND SHOULD RESULT IN A WEAKENING OF 
TSTMS BY MID EVENING.

BERMUDA HIGH BUILDS INTO THE REGION ON SUNDAY.  STILL A LOT OF LOW 
LEVEL MOISTURE WITH DIURNAL CONVECTION ANTICIPATED...HOWEVER WITH 
SOME SUBSIDENCE THANKS TO THE SFC HI...TSTMS SHOULD BE MORE 
SCATTERED THAN IN RECENT DAYS.  

.LONGER TERM...(SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)
ECMWF AND GFS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT WITH A SHORTWAVE MOVING ACROSS 
THE GRTLKS STATES MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY.  THIS WILL PUSH A 
CDFNT INTO THE OH VLY OVERNIGHT MONDAY.  THE FRONT BECOMES 
STATIONARY ACROSS NORTHERN PORTIONS OF OUR SERVICE AREA ON TUESDAY.  
THIS SHOULD HELP THE POSSIBILITY FOR TSTMS FROM MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH 
TUESDAY.  

FOR DAYS 4 THROUGH 7 (WED/SAT) THERE IS A DISCREPANCY IN THE 
MODELS.  THE GFS GOES INTO A MORE ZONAL FLOW WHILE THE ECMWF LINGERS 
A UPPER TROF ACROSS THE MIDSOUTH.  TEND TO FAVOR THE ECMWF SOLUTION 
SINCE BOTH MODELS HAVE A BUILDING UPR RIDGE ACROSS THE WESTERN 
STATES.  THIS WOULD FAVOR LOWER HEIGHTS OVER THE SOUTHEAST US.  AS A 
RESULT...LEANING TOWARD SLIGHTLY COOLER TEMPS AND A BETTER CHANCE 
FOR TSTMS.  WITH GREATER CLOUDS AND SLIGHT COOLER TEMPS FCST DURING 
THIS PERIOD...THE HEAT INDEX SHOULD REMAIN BELOW ADVISORY LEVELS.  

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES

.DISCUSSION...
HAVE CONTEMPLATED A FLOOD WATCH FOR FLASH FLOODING.  HAVE ALREADY

FLOOD ADVISORIES AND FLASH FLOOD WARNINGS.  RECENT TRENDS HAVE US 
THINKING OF HOLDING OFF WITH THE WATCH.  FIRST THE PRESSURE TROF 
THAT WAS ACROSS THE REGION YESTERDAY APPEARS TO HAVE MOVED NORTH OF 
THE FORECAST AREA.  ALSO RADAR TRENDS INDICATE THUNDERSTORMS MOVING 
MUCH MORE QUICKLY THAN YESTERDAY.  SO DESPITE PRECIPITABLE WATER AT 
2 INCHES WITHOUT A COHERENT TROF TO FOCUS THE CONVECTION WILL HOLD 
OFF ON ANY WATCHES.  

ALSO...WITH THE TROF SHIFTING NORTH AND THE BERMUDA HIGH BUILDING 
WEST...LOOKS LIKE WERE TRANSITIONING INTO MORE SCATTERED DIURNAL 
CONVECTION THIS AFTERNOON AND EVENING.  WILL ADJUST THE FORECAST 
ACCORDINGLY. UPDATE OUT BY 11 AM.

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 160022
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
722 PM CDT FRI JUL 15 2005

.DISCUSSION...
SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS DEVELOPED ALONG A TROUGH AXIS SITUATED 
ROUGHLY FROM THE NORTHEAST CWA TO THE SOUTHWEST CWA...BISECTING THE 
MEMPHIS METRO AREA. SEVERAL CONVERGING OUTFLOW BOUNDARIES CAME 
TOGETHER OVER SOUTHERN SHELBY COUNTY LATE THIS AFTERNOON. THE WEAK 
FLOW ALOFT CAUSED THE THUNDERSTORMS WITH VERY HEAVY RAIN TO MOVE 
VERY LITTLE. THIS CAUSED FLASH FLOODING TO OCCUR OVER SHELBY COUNTY. 

THEN THE SLOW MOVING AXIS BEGAN TO SHOW DEVELOPING STORMS OVER LEE 
COUNTY ARKANSAS WHICH WAS EXHIBITING SIMILAR BEHAVIOR TO THE SHELBY 
COUNTY STORMS...HOWEVER IT WAS LACKING THE CONVERGING OUTFLOW 
BOUNDARIES. THESE STORMS DID NOT LAST NEAR AS LONG...THEREFORE NOT 
AS MUCH RAIN FELL OVER LEE COUNTY.

THE STORM OVER SOUTHERN SHELBY COUNTY BEGAN TO SPREAD INTO NORTHERN 
DESOTO COUNTY WHICH PROMPTED THE THIRD FLASH FLOOD WARNING. A STORM 
SPOTTER NEAR HORN LAKE REPORTED AN INCH AND A HALF OF RAIN FELL IN 
ONE HALF HOUR. THE TREMENDOUS RAINFALL IN A SHORT PERIOD OF TIME 
CAUSED RESCUE WORKERS TO BEGIN PULLING THE PUBLIC FROM CARS NEAR 
AIRWAYS ROAD AND GOODMAN HIGHWAY. IN ADDITION...THE HEAVY RAIN 
CAUSED A ROOF TO COLLAPSE IN SOUTHAVEN. NO INJURIES WERE REPORTED.

OTHER STORMS ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA WERE MOVING MUCH QUICKER AND 
NOT PROVIDING FLASH FLOODING RAINS. ADDITIONAL LIGHT RAIN WILL 
LIKELY OCCUR OVER SHELBY AND DESOTO COUNTIES THROUGH 9 PM. THE 
HEAVIEST RAINFALL WILL PROBABLY OCCUR WHERE THE TROUGH AXIS IS 
SLOWER TO MOVE...MAINLY SOUTH OF A SENATOBIA TO NEW ALBANY LINE.

IF NEEDED...WILL UPDATE ZONE FORECAST AND GRIDS ACCORDINGLY.

&&

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 152045
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
345 PM CDT FRI JUL 15 2005

.DISCUSSION...

SCATTERED SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS HAVE ONCE AGAIN DEVELOPED ACROSS
THE MID-SOUTH THIS AFTERNOON. THIS CONVECTION HAS DEVELOPED ALONG A
WEAK SURFACE TROUGH WHICH BISECTS THE REGION AND IN RESPONSE TO AN
UPPER LEVEL TROUGH AXIS ALONG WITH DAYTIME HEATING. OTHER
CONVECTION FURTHER SOUTH HAS ALSO INITIATED ALONG OLD OUTFLOW
BOUNDARIES LEFT AROUND FROM CONVECTION THAT OCCURRED EARLIER THIS
MORNING. EXPECT CHANCES FOR SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS TO CONTINUE
THROUGH THIS EVENING WITH A REDUCTION IN THE OVERALL COVERAGE LATER
TONIGHT WITH THE LOSS OF DAYTIME HEATING. ANY THUNDERSTORMS WILL BE
CAPABLE OF PRODUCING HEAVY RAIN (HIGH PWATS)...GUSTY WINDS...AND
DANGEROUS CLOUD TO GROUND LIGHTNING. ALTHOUGH A FEW STORMS MAY BECOME
STRONG...THINK THAT MOST WILL STAY BELOW SEVERE LIMITS...ALTHOUGH
CANNOT COMPLETELY RULE OUT AN ISOLATED PULSE SEVERE STORM IN AREAS
THAT RECEIVED GOOD HEATING AND RESULTANT POCKETS OF INCREASED
INSTABILITY. TEMPERATURES THIS AFTERNOON HAVE BEEN HELD BACK ACROSS
MOST AREAS DUE TO THE CLOUD COVER AND SCATTERED THUNDERSTORMS.

THIS WEATHER PATTERN WILL CONTINUE INTO SATURDAY...WITH THE UPPER
TROUGH AXIS REMAINING ORIENTED OVER THE AREA. EXPECT ANOTHER DAY
SIMILAR TO TODAY...WITH SCATTERED THUNDERSTORMS DEVELOPING ALONG
OLD MESOSCALE SURFACE BOUNDARIES...ESPECIALLY DURING THE MAXIMUM
HEATING OF THE DAY. THINK THAT TEMPERATURES WILL REACH INTO THE UPPER
80S AGAIN ON SATURDAY...WITH WIDE RANGES IN AFTERNOON TEMPERATURES
BASED UPON WHERE ONGOING CONVECTION EXISTS. IN ADDITION...WITH A VERY
MOIST AIRMASS IN PLACE AND PRECIPITABLE WATER VALUES NEARING 2
INCHES...CANNOT RULE OUT A HEAVY RAIN POTENTIAL WITH ANY SLOW MOVING
THUNDERSTORMS.

THE BERMUDA HIGH OFF OF THE SOUTHEAST U.S. COAST TODAY WILL BUILD
WESTWARD FOR SUNDAY AND INTO THE FIRST PART OF NEXT WEEK. THIS WILL
ALLOW FOR DRIER MID LEVEL AIR TO MOVE OVER THE AREA AND WITH UPPER
LEVEL HEIGHT RISES SHOULD LEAD TO MORE SUBSIDENCE OVER THE REGION.
ALTHOUGH DIURNAL CONVECTION CANNOT BE RULED OUT FOR THE END OF THE
WEEKEND AND EARLY NEXT WEEK...THE OVERALL CHANCES AND COVERAGE WILL
BE DIMINISHED.

AN UPPER LEVEL SHORTWAVE TROUGH NOW MOVING INTO THE PACIFIC
NORTHWEST WILL MOVE EAST THROUGH THE WEEKEND ACROSS THE NORTHERN
PLAINS AND AMPLIFY THROUGH THE BEGINNING OF NEXT WEEK. THIS WILL
HELP TO SEND A COLD FRONT TOWARDS THE AREA ON MONDAY NIGHT AND
TUESDAY. THE UPPER TROUGH WILL BEGIN TO DE-AMPLIFY BY MID-WEEK
CAUSING THE FRONT TO STALL ALONG OUR NORTHERN PERIPHERY ON TUESDAY
AND WASH OUT BY WEDNESDAY. HAVE RAISED POPS A BIT ON TUESDAY TO
ACCOUNT FOR THUNDERSTORM DEVELOPMENT IN ASSOCIATION WITH THE FRONT.
UPPER LEVEL RIDGING WILL AGAIN BUILD OVER THE AREA FOR THE END OF
NEXT WEEK WITH DRY WEATHER AND INCREASING SUMMER HEAT EXPECTED.

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES

CLOUD COVER...MOSTLY CLOUDY SKIES CAN BE EXPECTED ACROSS THE EASTERN
HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA TODAY...WITH PARTLY CLOUDY WEST. CANNOT
RULE OUT SOME BREAKS LATER THIS AFTERNOON EVEN ACROSS EASTERN
AREAS.

THE CLOUDS AND RAIN WILL KEEP TEMPERATURES COOLER OVER EASTERN AREAS
SO HAVE LOWERED THEM A FEW DEGREES. OVER AREAS WEST OF THE RIVER
WHERE PARTLY CLOUDY SKIES EXIST...TEMPERATURES SHOULD GET INTO THE
LOW 90S.

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 141945
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
245 PM CDT THU JUL 14 2005

.DISCUSSION...
SCATTERED CONVECTION BEGINNING TO BREAK OUT ACROSS THE MIDSOUTH THIS 
AFTERNOON...PRIMARILY TO THE NORTH AND SOUTH OF MEMPHIS. CONVECTION 
BEING SPARKED BY A PERSISTENT UPPER LEVEL WEAKNESS (PARTLY THE 
REMNANTS OF DENNIS) AND A STATIONARY SFC TROUGH STRETCHED FROM NW TN 
TO SOUTHERN AR. TEMPS HAVE WARMED INTO THE UPPER 80S TO LOWER 90S 
UNDER A DEVELOPING CU FIELD.

CONVECTION WILL DIMINISH TONIGHT WITH THE LOSS OF DAYTIME HEATING. 
LOWS WILL BE SIMILAR TO LAST NIGHT...LOWER 70S MOST PLACES TO 
MIDDLE 70S IN THE MEMPHIS METRO.

TOMORROW APPEARS TO BE A REPEAT. ALTHOUGH GUIDANCE IS GIVING 60 TO 
70 POPS...WILL LEAVE AT 50. AS HAS BEEN THE CASE...GUIDANCE HAS BEEN 
OVERDOING POPS THE PAST COUPLE OF DAYS. THESE FORECASTED HIGHER POPS 
HAVE ALSO RESULTED IN GUIDANCE BEING TOO LOW ON DAYTIME HIGHS. 
THEREFORE...WILL GO ABOVE MOS ON HIGHS AND SHOULD BE CLOSE TO WHAT 
WE ARE SEEING TODAY.

BERMUDA HIGH BEGINS TO BUILD IN OVER THE WEEKEND. THIS WILL SERVE TO 
REDUCE RAIN CHANCES AND INCREASE TEMPERATURES. WILL REFLECT THIS IN 
THE GRIDS. MODEL RH FIELDS SHOW THE 850 TO 700 MB LAYER DRYING OUT 
CONSIDERABLY BY SUNDAY AND INTO MUCH OF NEXT WEEK. THIS COMBINED 
WITH AN INCREASING MID LEVEL CAP WILL REDUCE RAIN CHANCES EVEN 
FURTHER. IT WILL FEEL VERY MUCH LIKE SUMMER WITH HIGHS IN THE 90S 
AND DEWPOINTS IN THE 70S. 

OP GFS HAS CHANGED ITS TUNE ABOUT THE FRONTAL BOUNDARY DURING THE 
TUESDAY/WEDNESDAY TIME FRAME. YESTERDAY IT TRIED TO BRING THE FRONT 
THROUGH THE MIDSOUTH AND THIS WAS MET WITH MUCH SKEPTICISM. 
NOW...THE OP GFS...GFS ENSEMBLES...AND THE ECMWF ALL AGREE THE FRONT 
WILL WASH OUT TO OUR NORTH AND WEST AS IT ENCOUNTERS THE STRONG SE 
UPPER RIDGE. THEREFORE...CURRENT EXTENDED FORECAST IS RIGHT ON TRACK.

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
1027 AM CDT THU JUL 14 2005

.UPDATE...
UPPER AIR ANALYSIS PLACES A BROAD TROUGH LOCATED FROM THE OHIO 
VALLEY DOWN THROUGH THE ARKLATEX. IN ADDITION...A SURFACE TROUGH IS 
DRAPED ACROSS THE MIDSOUTH. THESE FEATURES ALONG WITH DAYTIME 
HEATING WILL RESULT IN SCATTERED CONVECTION THIS AFTERNOON. SFC 
BASED CAPES WILL RANGE FROM 2000 TO 3000 J/KG. SEVERE WEATHER IS NOT 
ANTICIPATED ESPECIALLY WITH VERY MEAGER LAPSE RATES...BUT HEAVY 
RAINFALL IS A THREAT WITH ANY STORMS THAT DEVELOP GIVEN VERY LIGHT 
WIND FIELDS AND PRECIPITABLE WATERS APPROACHING 2 INCHES (NEAR 125% 
OF NORMAL.) POP FORECAST RIGHT ON TRACK FOR TODAY.

DID BUMP UP TEMPS ACROSS WESTERN AREAS. TEMPERATURES AS OF 15Z 
ALREADY RUNNING 3 TO 5 DEGREES WARMER THAN YESTERDAY. LOWER 90S 
SHOULD NOT BE HARD TO REACH. THIN CLOUD DECK OVER THE REGION SHOULD 
BEGIN TO BREAK UP AS HEATING INCREASES...SIMILAR TO YESTERDAY. ALL 
OTHER FORECAST PARAMETERS LOOKS GOOD.

UPDATE TO ZONES WILL BE OUT SHORTLY.


JFB

.PREVIOUS DISCUSSION ISSUED 221 AM THU JUL 14 2005...

THE CENTER OF THE REMNANTS OF DENNIS ARE NOW OVER SOUTHERN INDIANA. 
THERE IS AN ELONGATED TROUGH THAT HAS SET UP FROM THE CENTER THROUGH 
THE OHIO VALLEY...ARKANSAS AND INTO NORTHEAST TEXAS. 

FORECAST IS QUICKLY BECOMING A BROKEN RECORD. DENNIS WILL SLOWLY 
RETROGRADE STARTING TODAY WHILE THE MAIN TROUGH REMAINS IN THE 
VICINITY. THIS WILL BE THE PATTERN INTO THE WEEKEND. ATMOSPHERE WILL 
REMAIN MOIST AND UNSTABLE WITH THUNDERSTORMS POSSIBLE AT JUST ABOUT 
ANY TIME. OTHERWISE...PARTLY CLOUDY CONDITIONS AND HIGHS AROUND 90 
DEPENDING UPON THE AMOUNT OF SUN. 

OVER THE WEEKEND A BERMUDA HIGH WILL MOVE INTO THE REGION AND PUSH 
THIS TROUGH OFF TO THE EAST. ALTHOUGH...THIS WILL HAVE LITTLE IMPACT 
ON THE FORECAST. BIGGEST DIFFERENCE WILL BE IN THE COVERAGE AND 
CHANCES. UNFORTUNATELY...HEAT OF THE DAY VARIETY CONVECTION WILL 
STILL BE POSSIBLE DUE TO THE AIR MASS IN PLACE.

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 132021
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
320 PM CDT WED JUL 13 2005

.DISCUSSION...

THE REMNANTS OF DENNIS THE MENACE CONTINUE TO SPIN OVER THE LOWER 
OHIO VALLEY. THE CYCLONIC FLOW AROUND THIS HAS BROUGHT A VORTICITY 
MAX THROUGH OKLAHOMA THIS AFTERNOON. THE END RESULT HAS BEEN PLENTY 
OF SHOWERS TO OUR EAST AND CONVECTIVE DEVELOPMENT TO OUR 
WEST...LEAVING THE MIDSOUTH IN THE MIDDLE WITH VERY LITTLE COVERAGE 
EXCEPT FOR A FEW SHOWERS IN NE MS. 

WENT BELOW GUIDANCE ON POPS TONIGHT AS MUCH SHOULD NOT CHANGE IN 
REGARDS TO LIFTING MECHANISMS OVER THE REGION. SLIGHT CHANCE SHOULD 
SUFFICE. TEMPS SIMILAR TO LAST NIGHT...LOWER 70S MOST PLACES WITH 
MID 70S IN THE MEMPHIS METRO.

MODELS AGREE THAT A WEAKNESS WILL REMAIN OVER THE AREA FROM DENNIS 
WITH A SURFACE TROUGH REMAINING OVER THE MIDSOUTH. GUIDANCE IS 
RATHER ROBUST IN PUTTING OUT HIGH CHANCE TO LIKELY POPS FOR THE NEXT 
COUPLE OF DAYS. HAVE DECIDED TO GO A LITTLE LOWER THAN GUIDANCE. THE 
COVERAGE THE PAST COUPLE OF DAYS HAS BEEN BELOW MODEL EXPECTATIONS. 
IN ADDITION...MID LEVEL LAPSE RATES ARE VERY MEAGER (LESS THAN 5.5 
C/KM.) EVEN THE MODELS ARE SHOWING THE AREA REMAINING BETWEEN TWO 
VORT MAXES...VERY MUCH LIKE TODAY. TEMPS WILL BE NEAR CLIMO. 

THE BERMUDA HIGH WILL BEGIN TO SHOW ITS INFLUENCE BY SUNDAY AND INTO 
NEXT WEEK. TEMPERATURES WILL SLOWLY WARM AND RAIN CHANCES WILL BE 
REDUCED TO DIURNAL CONVECTION. 12Z GFS TRIES TO BRING A FRONT 
THROUGH THE AREA BY TUESDAY AS A TROUGH AMPLIFIES OVER THE CENTRAL 
PORTION OF THE COUNTRY. A LOOK AT THE GFS ENSEMBLES GOES AGAINST 
THIS SOLUTION AND LEANS MORE TOWARD THE FRONT WASHING OUT WELL TO 
OUR WEST AS IT ENCOUNTERS THE UPPER RIDGE. WILL NOT MAKING ANY 
CHANGES...KEEPING JUST SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR DAYS 6 AND 7. ECMWF 
ALSO IS IN LINE WITH THIS FORECAST. IT IS JUST VERY TOUGH FOR A 
FRONT TO MAKE IT THROUGH THIS PART OF THE COUNTRY IN MID JULY. AS 
ALWAYS...WILL MONITOR LATER MODEL TRENDS.

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.

$$

JFB

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 131521
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
1020 AM CDT WED JUL 13 2005

.UPDATE...
THE REMNANTS OF DENNIS CONTINUE TO SLOWLY MEANDER OVER SOUTHERN 
INDIANA AT THIS HOUR. SATELLITE IMAGERY SHOWS THE WRAP AROUND CLOUDS 
STILL AFFECTING NORTHERN AND EASTERN PORTIONS OF THE REGION. EXPECT 
THESE CLOUDS TO REMAIN RATHER PERSISTENT TODAY. ANOTHER BAND OF 
CLOUDS NOTED FURTHER SOUTH...DRAPED FROM SOUTH OF JONESBORO TO NEAR 
TUPELO IS MUCH THINNER AND IS EXPECTED TO BREAK UP WITH INCREASED 
HEATING. THEREFORE...THERE WILL BE QUITE A TEMP GRADIENT TODAY WITH 
LOWER 90S SOUTHWEST TO ONLY NEAR 80 IN THE FAR NORTHEAST COUNTIES.

HAD TO MAKE SOME ADJUSTMENTS TO POPS AS WELL. CURRENT 88-D ONLY 
SHOWING A FEW SHOWERS NEAR THE TN RIVER AT THIS TIME. DECIDED TO 
COVER EVERYBODY WITH CHANCE POPS TODAY. THOSE AREAS THAT SEE SUN 
WILL HAVE THE CHANCE FOR CONVECTIVE DEVELOPMENT WHILE AREAS IN THE 
PERSISTENT CLOUD COVER WILL ONLY DEAL WITH MORE OF A STRATIFORM 
RAIN. MADE ADJUSTMENTS TO GRIDS TO REFLECT THIS. UPDATE TO ZONES OUT 
IN A FEW.


JFB

.PREVIOUS DISCUSSION ISSUED AT 309 AM CDT WED JUL 13...

THE CENTER OF THE CIRCULATION FORMERLY KNOWN AS DENNIS IS OVER 
SOUTHWESTERN INDIANA AND IS BEGINNING TO SLOW ITS EASTWARD 
PROGRESSION. SATELLITE HAS SHOWN A BAND OF LOW AND MID LEVEL 
CLOUDINESS EXTENDING FROM THE CENTER THROUGH WESTERN TENNESSEE AND 
THROUGH NORTHEAST ARKANSAS. THERE IS AN AREA OF POSITIVE VORTICITY 
ASSOCIATED WITH THESE CLOUDS AND A BAND OF RAIN SHOWERS HAS MOVED 
THROUGH THIS AREA AS WELL. SATELLITE TRENDS HAVE SHOWN THE WESTERN 
EXTENT OF THESE CLOUDS THINNING SOMEWHAT AS THE WESTERN PORTION OF 
THE UPPER VORT WEAKENS. BASED UPON THESE TRENDS EXPECT PORTIONS OF 
NORTHEAST ARKANSAS AND SOUTHWEST TENNESSEE TO BECOME PARTLY CLOUDY 
TODAY IF THEY DONT START OUT THAT WAY. CLOUD COVER WILL LIKELY HOLD 
TOUGH AGAIN OVER MUCH OF NORTHWEST TENNESSEE. BETTER CHANCES FOR 
RAIN WILL BE IN THIS AREA AS WELL DUE TO PROXIMITY TO UPPER VORT. 
ELSEWHERE...CHANCES WILL BE MAINLY HEAT OF THE DAY DRIVEN ALTHOUGH 
THE PRESENCE OF THE UPPER VORT MAY SLIGHTLY INFLUENCE DEVELOPMENT 
OVER NORTHWEST MS LATER THIS MORNING AND AFTERNOON. INSTABILITY 
LOOKS MORE IMPRESSIVE FROM MEMPHIS SOUTHWARDS SO HAVE REMOVED 
THUNDER WORDING ACROSS NORTHWEST TENNESSEE INTO THE BOOTHEEL AND 
NORTHEAST ARKANSAS.

NOT MUCH CHANGES OVER THE NEXT SEVERAL DAYS. A SECONDARY VORT MAX IS 
EXPECTED TO DEVELOP OVER NORTHEAST TEXAS TONIGHT. AS A RESULT AN 
AREA OF UPPER LEVEL TROUGH SHOULD DEVELOP FROM THE REMNANTS OF 
DENNIS TO THIS SECONDARY VORT MAX. THIS MAY BE A BETTER FOCUS FOR 
RAIN CHANCES OVER THE NEXT COUPLE DAYS AS THE REMNANTS BEGIN TO 
RETROGRADE BACK TOWARDS MISSOURI AND LOW LEVEL WINDS BECOME MORE 
SOUTHERLY AHEAD OF THIS TROUGH WHICH WILL PUMP ADDITIONAL LOW LEVEL 
MOISTURE INTO THE AREA. 

TOWARDS EARLY NEXT WEEK A BERMUDA HIGH WILL GRADUALLY SLIDE INTO THE 
REGION BUT THIS WILL HAVE LITTLE IMPACT UPON THE WEATHER. MAY SEE A 
BIT MORE SUNSHINE BUT THREAT FOR RAIN WILL STILL BE AROUND DUE TO 
THE UNSTABLE AIR MASS IN PLACE. 

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.

.PREVIOUS DISCUSSION ISSUED AT 802 PM...
HAVE ALREADY UPDATED ONCE TO LOWER POPS ACROSS MUCH OF THE AREA. BAND
OF RAIN ASSOCIATED WITH DENNIS HAS NOT MADE MUCH SOUTHWARD PROGRESS
OVER THE LAST SEVERAL HOURS...AND HAS MAINLY BEEN LIMITED TO NORTHERN
2 TIERS OF COUNTIES. WILL CONTINUE CATEGORICAL POPS THERE...BUT
EXPECT A DIMINSHING TREND AS THE NIGHT GOES ON.

CONVECTION THAT WAS EARLIER HEADED TOWARD CENTRAL AND SOUTHERN
PORTIONS OF CWA FROM THE WEST HAS DISSIPATED OR MOVED SOUTH OF THE
AREA. WILL KEEP A 20 PERCENT MENTION OVER THESE AREAS...JUST IN CASE
SOMETHING DEVELOPS OVER NEXT HOUR OR TWO.

WILL BE OBSERVING THESE FOR POTENTIAL UPDATES OVER THE NEXT FEW

RESULTING CHANGES IN THE ZFP.

FXUS64 KMEG 120845
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
345 AM CDT TUE JUL 12 2005

.DISCUSSION...

REMNANTS OF DENNIS ARE OVER SOUTHERN ILLINOIS THIS MORNING. 11-3.9 
MICRON SATELLITE IMAGERY HAS SHOWN CLOUDS OVER THE REGION SLOWLY 
RETREATING TOWARDS THE NORTH AS THE SYSTEM PULLS AWAY FROM THE 
REGION. RADAR SHOWS WIDESPREAD RAIN CIRCULATING AROUND THE REMNANTS 
OF DENNIS OVER SOUTHERN MISSOURI INTO NORTHERN ARKANSAS AND 
NORTHWEST TENNESSEE. MEANWHILE...CONVECTION HAS DEVELOPED OVER 
CENTRAL MISSISSIPPI. THIS CONVECTION IS ASSOCIATED WITH ONE OF THE 
TENTACLES ASSOCIATED WITH DENNIS. 

GREAT DISPARITY IN THE FORECAST FROM NORTH TO SOUTH TODAY. THE 
CENTER OF FORMER DENNIS SHOULD SLOWLY MOVE TOWARD EVANSVILLE INDIANA 
TODAY. EXPECT CLOUD COVER ASSOCIATED WITH THE CENTER TO MOVE 
NORTHWARD JUST A FEW MORE MILES AND HALT SOUTH OF JONESBORO TO 
AROUND JACKSON. THE BETTER RAIN CHANCES WILL BE TOWARDS THE BOOTHEEL 
AND INTO NORTHWEST TENNESSEE WHERE RADAR SHOWS RAIN ABOUT TO MOVE 
INTO THAT REGION. CLOUDS AND RAIN WILL KEEP THIS AREA COOL ONCE 
AGAIN. SOUTH OF THIS AREA...OVER EAST CENTRAL ARKANSAS INTO 
SOUTHWEST TENNESSEE AND ROUGHLY THE FIRST COUPLE ROWS OF COUNTIES IN 
MISSISSIPPI...EXPECT CU DEVELOPMENT TODAY ALTHOUGH UNCERTAIN AS TO 
THE EXTENT. GUT FEELING IS THAT PARTLY SUNNY CONDITIONS WILL BE 
EXPECTED. MOST AREAS HERE SHOULD REMAIN DRY ALTHOUGH AM CONCERNED 
ABOUT POP UP THUNDERSTORMS THIS AFTERNOON IN THE HEATING OF THE DAY 
(WITH HIGHS POTENTIALLY AROUND 90) AND THE PROXIMITY TO THE REMNANTS 
PROVIDING ADDITIONAL LIFT.  SOUTH OF OXFORD AND TUPELO...THIS 
TENTACLE OF MOISTURE AND INSTABILITY WILL RESULT IN SLIGHTLY BETTER 
CHANCES FOR THUNDERSTORMS TODAY AS IS ALREADY THE CASE. 

DENNIS SHOULD STALL OVER SOUTHWEST INDIANA ON TUESDAY AND BEGIN TO 
RETROGRADE BACK TOWARDS MISSOURI TOWARDS THE END OF THE WEEK AS A 
BERMUDA HIGH OVER THE SOUTHEASTERN US BEGINS TO SLIDE WESTWARD. RAIN 
CHANCES PAST TODAY ARE LARGELY DUE TO OUR PROXIMITY TO THE REMNANTS. 
FURTHERMORE...CLOUDS WILL LIKELY BE SLOW TO BUDGE OVER NORTHWEST TN 
INTO NORTHEAST ARKANSAS UNTIL THE SYSTEM WEAKENS ENOUGH THAT THE SUN 
CAN FINALLY BURN THROUGH. THIS WOULD BE POSSIBLY WEDNESDAY OR 
THURSDAY BUT NO GUARANTEES HERE. TEMPERATURE AND HUMIDITY WILL BEGIN 
TO RISE ONCE AGAIN AS SOUTHERLY WINDS RETURN TO THE ENTIRE AREA BY 
MIDWEEK.

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.

.DISCUSSION...

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 110836
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
336 AM CDT MON JUL 11 2005

.DISCUSSION...
THIS MORNING PIECES OF DENNIS WERE MOVING ACROSS PARTS OF THE MID 
SOUTH REGION AFFECTING ALL OF NORTH MISSISSIPPI AND MOST OF WEST 
TENNESSEE. WINDS ASSOCIATED WITH DENNIS HAVE CAUSED SOME TREE DAMAGE 
IN TUPELO EARLY THIS MORNING. WIND SPEEDS HAVE BEEN SLOWLY COMING 
DOWN IN TUPELO WITH WINDS SUSTAINED AT 25 MPH GUSTING TO 32 MPH 
WHICH IS DOWN FROM A COUPLE OF HOURS AGO WHEN WINDS WERE SUSTAINED 
AT 29 MPH WITH GUSTS NEAR 40 MPH.

RAINFALL RATES HAVE BEEN MUCH LESS THAN ANTICIPATED THE PAST FEW 
NIGHTS. THE BULK OF THE RAINFALL HAS OCCURRED OVER ALABAMA. WITH THE 
RAIN ENDING A LITTLE SOONER OVER NORTHERN MISSISSIPPI BY LATE THIS 
MORNING...EXPECT AT MOST ABOUT TWO MORE INCHES BEFORE LETTING UP. 
WILL CANCEL OUR FLOOD WATCH TODAY.

THE WIND ADVISORY WILL LIKELY BE CANCELED BY MID DAY IF NOT SOONER 
FOR MOST OF THE FORECAST AREA. 

THE INLAND TROPICAL STORM WARNING WILL ALSO BE CANCELLED THIS 
MORNING. 

DENNIS WILL MOVE INTO SOUTHERN ILLINOIS/MISSOURI AND THEN LINGER IN 
THIS GENERAL VICINITY THROUGH THE END OF THE WEEK. THUS CHANCES FOR 
RAIN WILL REMAIN ACROSS THE REGION. ONE FEATURE NOTED WAS A 
SHORTWAVE TRANSLATING OVER THE RIDGE ANCHORED OVER THE WEST/CENTRAL 
U.S. THIS WAVE GETS GETS INGESTED INTO THE UPPER LOW OVER THE OHIO 
VALLEY. BY WEDNESDAY THIS WAVE WILL MOVE ACROSS THE MID SOUTH 
INCREASING THE CHANCES FOR RAIN. IN RESPONSE A WEAK BOUNDARY IS 
LIKELY TO FORM ACROSS NORTHERN MISSISSIPPI PUTTING THE MAIN FOCUS OF 
HEAVIEST RAINFALL TO OCCUR THERE LATE THIS WEEK.

$$

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES
AR...WIND ADVISORY FOR ALL ARKANSAS COUNTIES TODAY THROUGH 7 PM.
MO...WIND ADVISORY FOR THE MISSOURI BOOTHEEL TODAY THROUGH 7 PM.
MS...WIND ADVISORY FOR NORTH MISSISSIPPI TODAY THROUGH 7 PM.
TN...WIND ADVISORY FOR WEST TENNESSEE TODAY THROUGH 7 PM.

$$

.SECOND EVENING UPDATE...

METRO AREA OUT OF INLAND TROPICAL STORM WARNING...BUT HOLD IT...
FOR NOW...EAST OF A JACKSON TN TO OXFORD LINE. ADVISORIES AND

WILL BE TORNADO THREAT EAST OF TRACK OF LOW IF DEEP CONVECTION
DEVELOPS TOMORROW.
