SUSTAINED WINDS OF BETWEEN 100 & 105 KTS. OF COURSE THESE NUMBERS ARE
PRELIMINARY AND HIGHER WINDS MAY BE REPORTED OVER THE NEXT COUPLE
OF HOURS AND THE LANDFALL INTENSITY MAY EVENTUAL BE ADJUSTED TO FIT
ACTUAL REPORTS. DENNIS CONTINUES TO MOVE TOWARDS THE NORTH-
NORTHWEST THIS EVENING AND A TRACK EVENTUALLY ACROSS PORTIONS OF
NORTHEAST MISSISSIPPI AND WEST TENNESSEE LATE TONIGHT THROUGH
MONDAY LOOKS APPROPRIATE. OUTER RAINBANDS ASSOCIATED WITH DENNIS
CONTINUE TO MOVE NORTHWEST ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA...WITH THE
FIRST SIGNIFICANT RAINBAND/SQUALL NOW ENTERING SOUTHEAST PORTIONS OF
THE FORECAST AREA.

RAINBANDS SHOULD CONTINUE TO INCREASE IN COVERAGE AND INTENSITY
FROM SOUTHEAST TO NORTHWEST ACROSS THE REGION AS DENNIS CONTINUES TO
TRACK INLAND. THE WEATHER SHOULD TAKE A TURN FOR THE WORSE LATER
THIS EVENING ACROSS NORTHEAST MISSISSIPPI...AFTER MIDNIGHT FOR
NORTHWEST MISSISSIPPI AND WEST TENNESSEE...AND SPREADING ACROSS
AREAS WEST OF THE MISSISSIPPI RIVER DURING THE EARLY MORNING HOURS
OF MONDAY. FOR LATER TONIGHT AND THROUGH MONDAY...EXPECT PERIODS OF
HEAVY POSSIBLY FLOODING RAINS (4-8+ WITH LOWEST AMOUNTS WEST AND
HIGHEST AMOUNTS OVER EASTERN AREAS), VERY STRONG WINDS (SUSTAINED 40-
50 MPH WITH HIGHER GUSTS ACROSS SOUTHERN AND SOUTHEASTERN PORTIONS
OF THE AREA, WITH SUSTAINED 25-35 MPH WITH HIGHER GUSTS OVER
NORTHWESTERN SECTIONS OF THE AREA), AND POSSIBLE SEVERE WEATHER
WITH ISOLATED TORNADOES AND DAMAGING THUNDERSTORM WIND GUSTS...OVER
PRIMARILY EASTERN PORTIONS OF THE FORECAST AREA.

DENNIS SHOULD CONTINUE TO WEAKEN AND SLOW AS IT CROSSES THE AREA AND
THIS MAY LEAD TO EVEN HIGHER RAIN TOTALS THAN CURRENTLY POSTED...
STAY TUNED. HAVE HOISTED A FLOOD WATCH OVER THE ENTIRE AREA TO
ACCOUNT FOR THE HEAVY RAIN THREAT. IN ADDITION...DUE TO THE THREAT OF
HIGH WINDS HAVE POSTED AN INLAND TROPICAL STORM WARNING FOR WEST
TENNESSEE...INCLUDING COUNTIES ALONG AND SOUTH OF INTERSTATE 40...
AND FOR ALL COUNTIES IN NORTH MISSISSIPPI. FOR EXPLANATIONS OF ALL
EXPECTED HAZARDS REFER TO INDIVIDUAL WARNINGS...STATEMENTS...AND
ADVISORIES.

CONTINUE TO MONITOR THE LATEST UPDATES THAT WILL BE ISSUED THROUGH
TONIGHT AND ON MONDAY CONCERNING DENNIS.

ONCE DENNIS DEPARTS THE AREA...EXPECT WARM AND HUMID CONDITIONS
WITH SCATTERED SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS FOR TUESDAY THROUGH NEXT
WEEKEND.

$$

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES
AR...FLOOD WATCH AND WIND ADVISORY FOR ALL ARKANSAS COUNTIES FROM
MIDNIGHT TONIGHT THROUGH 7 PM MONDAY.
MO...FLOOD WATCH AND WIND ADVISORY FOR DUNKLIN AND PEMISCOT COUNTIES
FROM MIDNIGHT TONIGHT THROUGH 7 PM MONDAY.
MS...FLOOD WATCH FOR ALL MISSISSIPPI COUNTIES FROM MIDNIGHT TONIGHT
THROUGH 7 PM MONDAY.
INLAND TROPICAL STORM WARNING FROM MIDNIGHT TONIGHT THROUGH 7 PM
MONDAY EAST OF ASHLAND TO WATER VALLEY LINE...WIND ADVISORY FOR

TN...INLAND TROPICAL STORM WARNING FROM MIDNIGHT TONIGHT THROUGH 7 PM
MONDAY FOR TENNESSEE COUNTIES GENERALLY ALONG AND SOUTH OF INTERSTATE
40 AND EAST OF JACKSON TO BOLIVAR LINE. WIND ADVISORY FOR THE
REMAINDER OF WEST TENNESSEE FROM MIDNIGHT TONIGHT THROUGH 7 PM. FLOOD

AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
818 PM CDT SUN JUL 10 2005

.EVENING UPDATE...
AT THIS POINT IN THE EVENING...SEE LITTLE NEED FOR AN IMMEDIATE
UPDATE. DENNIS PRETTY MUCH REMAINS ON FORECAST TRACK FROM HURRICANE
CENTER. CENTER OF REMNANTS OF DENNIS WOULD PROBABLY MOVE INTO
SOUTHEAST CORNER OF CWA AROUND 08Z OR 09Z AT CURRENT SPEED. NORTHWEST
EDGE OF RAIN CURRENTLY ALONG A CORINTH-OXFORD-GRENADA LINE WORKING
SLOWLY NORTHWEST. KNQA RADAR CURRENTLY OVERESTIMATING PRECIP
AMOUNTS...KGWX A LITTLE MORE REASONABLE. THIS MAY BECOME AN ISSUE
LATER TONIGHT.

WILL NOT MAKE ANY CHANGES TO WIND BASED PRODUCTS...WARNINGS AND
ADVISORIES...AT THIS TIME. THE CENTER OF THE STORM IS IN AN
OBSERVATION-SPARSE AREA OF SOUTHWEST ALABAMA. AS STORM GETS A LITTLE
CLOSER TO MERIDIAN MISSISSIPPI IN THE NEXT COUPLE OF HOURS...WE MAY
GET A BETTER IDEA OF HOW WINDS ARE MATCHING UP TO FORECAST. THEY ARE
ALREADY SEEING GUSTS TO AROUND 50 MPH ON THE 01Z OB.

NO UPDATES ARE IMMINENT. WILL REASSESS AFTER 02Z NHC CONFERENCE
CALL. WE WILL EVENTUALLY NEED TO UPDATE ZFP...NPW...FFA...FOR
WORDING PRIOR TO MIDNIGHT.

.PREVIOUS DISCUSSION ISSUED AT 4 PM CDT...

HURRICANE DENNIS RECENTLY MADE LANDFALL IN PENSACOLA FLORIDA WITH
SUSTAINED WINDS OF BETWEEN 100 & 105 KTS. OF COURSE THESE NUMBERS ARE
PRELIMINARY AND HIGHER WINDS MAY BE REPORTED OVER THE NEXT COUPLE

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
1044 AM CDT SUN JUL 10 2005

.DISCUSSION...

HURRICANE DENNIS IS STILL APPROACHING THE NORTHEAST GULF COAST AS
FORECAST AND THINGS ARE STILL ON TRACK FOR THE REMNANT STORM TO
MOVE OVER THE MID-SOUTH ON MONDAY. CURRENT FORECAST FOR LATER
TONIGHT AND TOMORROW HAS A GOOD HANDLE ON THE SITUATION. REFER TO
CURRENT ADVISORIES AND THE HAZARDOUS WEATHER OUTLOOK FOR MORE
DETAILED INFORMATION.

AS FOR THIS AFTERNOON...SEEING THE VERY OUTER BANDS STARTING TO
MOVE INTO SOUTHEASTERN PORTIONS OF THE FORECAST AREA. EXPECT
COVERAGE OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS TO INCREASE FROM SOUTHEAST TO
NORTHWEST THROUGH THE DAY. HAVE BUMPED POPS UP A BIT TO ACCOUNT
FOR CURRENT PRECIP TRENDS. INCREASED RAIN CHANCES ALONG WITH
THICKENING CLOUD COVER WILL HELP TO HOLD TEMPERATURES DOWN A BIT...
AND HAVE ADJUSTED AFTERNOON MAXES DOWN A FEW DEGREES FROM GENERALLY
THE MISSISSIPPI RIVER EASTWARD TO ACCOUNT FOR THIS. OTHERWISE...ALL
OTHER FORECAST PARAMETERS LOOK ON TRACK.

UPDATED GRIDS AND ZONE FORECAST WILL BE SENT SHORTLY.

$$

AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
335 AM CDT SUN JUL 10 2005

.DISCUSSION...
THE CATEGORY 4 HURRICANE DENNIS CONTINUES ON ITS PATH TOWARD MOBILE 
BAY THIS MORNING. SOME OUTER BANDS OF CLOUDS FROM DENNIS HAVE MOVED 
ACROSS THE MID SOUTH LATE LAST NIGHT. ADDITIONAL CLOUD COVER FROM 
DENNIS WILL FLOW INTO THE AREA TODAY.

SOME SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS MAY DEVELOP TODAY. THE BULK OF THE 
RAINFALL WILL OCCUR LATER TONIGHT. AS DENNIS TRACKS INTO CENTRAL 
MISSISSIPPI LATE TONIGHT...WIND PROFILES WILL SUPPORT THE CHANCE FOR 
TORNADIC ACTIVITY. IN ADDITION STRONG WINDS ASSOCIATED WITH DENNIS 
WILL ALSO AFFECT THE REGION. SOME TREE DAMAGE...MINOR ROOF DAMAGE 
AND POSSIBLY DOWNED POWER LINES WILL BE POSSIBLE LATE TONIGHT AND 
MONDAY.

REMNANTS OF DENNIS WILL BRING SOME MUCH NEEDED RAINFALL TO THE 
REGION...HOWEVER THE RAIN WILL FALL QUICKLY WHICH COULD BE 
DANGEROUS. THUS THE FLOOD WATCH WILL CONTINUE FOR THE REGION. THE 
INLAND TROPICAL WIND STORM WATCH HAS BEEN EXTENDED FARTHER NORTH AND 
WEST WHICH WILL INCLUDE THE MEMPHIS METRO AREA. 

THE RAINFALL WILL PERSIST ALL DAY MONDAY AND MOST LIKELY INTO MONDAY 
NIGHT AS THE SURFACE WINDS SLOWLY RELAX. AS DENNIS WEAKENS IT 
APPEARS IT WILL STALL OUT OVER SOUTHERN MISSOURI TUESDAY NIGHT. IT 
WILL THEN SHEAR OUT OVER THE MID SOUTH PROVIDING CHANCES FOR 
ADDITIONAL RAINFALL CHANCES THROUGH THE WEEK AND INTO THE WEEKEND. 

$$

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES
AR...FLOOD WATCH AND WIND ADVISORY FOR ALL ARKANSAS COUNTIES FROM 
MIDNIGHT TONIGHT THROUGH 7 PM MONDAY.
MO...FLOOD WATCH AND WIND ADVISORY FOR DUNKLIN AND PEMISCOT COUNTIES 
FROM MIDNIGHT TONIGHT THROUGH 7 PM MONDAY.
MS...FLOOD WATCH FOR ALL MISSISSIPPI COUNTIES FROM MIDNIGHT TONIGHT 
THROUGH 7 PM MONDAY. 
INLAND TROPICAL STORM WIND WATCH FROM MIDNIGHT TONIGHT THROUGH 7 PM 
MONDAY FOR MSZ001>017-020>024. 
TN...INLAND TROPICAL STORM WIND WATCH FROM MIDNIGHT TONIGHT THROUGH 
7 PM MONDAY FOR TNZ052>055-088>092. WIND ADVISORY FOR THE REMAINDER 
OF WEST TN FROM MIDNIGHT TONIGHT THROUGH 7 PM.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
1015 PM CDT SAT JUL 9 2005

.DISCUSSION...

FIRST BAND ORIGINALLY ASSOCIATED WITH HURRICANE DENNIS HAS BEEN 
MOVING NORTHEAST THROUGH THE EVENING HOURS THROUGH PORTIONS OF CENTRAL 
ALABAMA AND EAST CENTRAL MISSISSIPPI. THE BAND HAS BEEN WEAKENING 
OVER THE LAST COUPLE OF HOURS. SOME REMNANTS MAY ENTER INTO 
NORTHEAST MISSISSIPPI DURING THE OVERNIGHT HOURS. IN ADDITION...A 
FEW SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS DEVELOPED DURING THE EVENING HOURS OUT 
AHEAD OF THIS BAND OVER PORTIONS OF THE MIDSOUTH BUT MOST HAVE SINCE 
DISSIPATED. HOWEVER CAN/T RULE OUT A FEW MORE POPPING DURING THE 
OVERNIGHT HOURS THUS WILL KEEP POPS IN FORECAST. TEMPERATURES ARE 
CURRENTLY IN THE MID 70S TO LOWER 80S AND LOOK ON TRACK TO REACH 
FORECASTED LOWS IN THE 70S. CURRENT FORECAST LOOKS GOOD...NO UPDATES 
ARE EXPECTED.

$$

THROUGH 7 PM MONDAY. INLAND TROPICAL STORM WATCH ISSUED FOR 
NORTHEAST MISSISSIPPI COUNTIES FROM MIDNIGHT MONDAY THROUGH 7 PM 
MONDAY. WIND ADVISORY ISSUED FOR THE REMAINDER OF THE NORTHWEST 
MISSISSIPPI COUNTIES FROM MIDNIGHT MONDAY THROUGH 7 PM MONDAY. 
TN...FLOOD WATCH FOR ALL TENNESSEE COUNTIES FROM MIDNIGHT MONDAY

FXUS64 KMEG 092132 CCA
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...CORRECTED...
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
431 PM CDT SAT JUL 9 2005

....UPDATED ZONE FORECAST TO SPECIFY TIME PERIOD FOR WIND ADVISORY 
AND HAVE ADDED HEADLINES TO BOTTOM OF THIS DISCUSSION...

.DISCUSSION...

AN UPPER LEVEL TROUGH CONTINUES TO INTERACT WITH INCREASING LOW
LEVEL MOISTURE AND INSTABILITY TO PRODUCE ISOLATED TO SCATTERED
SHOWERS THIS AFTERNOON. EXPECT THIS ACTIVITY TO BE POSSIBLE THROUGH
TONIGHT AS THE UPPER TROUGH CONTINUES TO RETROGRADE NORTHWESTWARD
IN ADVANCE OF THE OUTER FLOW FIELD ASSOCIATED WITH HURRICANE DENNIS.

AFTER TONIGHT THE MAIN PLAYER TO AFFECT THE WEATHER ACROSS THE MID-
SOUTH WILL BE STRENGTHENING HURRICANE DENNIS. THE HURRICANE HAS
BECOME MUCH BETTER ORGANIZED THIS AFTERNOON AND IS SHOWING A MUCH
IMPROVED SATELLITE PRESENTATION AS IT CONTINUES TO MOVE NORTHWEST
ACROSS THE EASTERN GULF OF MEXICO. THE HURRICANE IS FORECAST TO
CONTINUE STRENGTHENING THROUGH TONIGHT AND IS FORECAST TO LEVEL OFF
JUST PRIOR TO LANDFALL...BUT STILL FORECAST AS AT LEAST A MAJOR
CATEGORY 3 HURRICANE...MOST LIKELY BETWEEN THE MISSISSIPPI COAST AND
THE WESTERN FLORIDA PANHANDLE ON SUNDAY AFTERNOON OR EVENING.

MOST OF THE TROPICAL AND GLOBAL MODELS HAVE CONTINUED TO CLUSTER
ALONG THE EAST CENTRAL GULF COAST IN REGARDS TO LANDFALL LOCATION AND
THEN MOVE THE HURRICANE REMNANTS INTO THE MID-SOUTH FOR SUNDAY NIGHT
CONTINUING THROUGH MONDAY NIGHT. EXPECTING WITH THIS ANTICIPATED
TRACK TO EXPERIENCE HEAVY FLOODING RAINS (4-8 POSSIBLE LOCALLY
HIGHER)...STRONG WINDS (30-50 MPH WITH HIGHER GUSTS POSSIBLE)...AND
POSSIBLE SEVERE WEATHER ACROSS EASTERN AREAS (POSSIBLE ISOLATED
TORNADOES AND DAMAGING THUNDERSTORM WIND GUSTS OVER PORTIONS OF
WEST TENNESSEE & NORTHEAST MISSISSIPPI). HAVE ISSUED FLOOD WATCHES
FOR THE ENTIRE AREA...INLAND TROPICAL STORM WATCH FOR NORTHEAST
MISSISSIPPI AND EXTREME SOUTHEAST TENNESSEE COUNTIES...AND A WIND
ADVISORY FOR THE REMAINDER OF THE AREA FROM MIDNIGHT MONDAY MORNING
UNTIL 7 PM MONDAY. THE REMNANT STORM SYSTEM SHOULD SLOW DOWN AS IT
GETS UNDER AN UPPER RIDGE BY MONDAY NIGHT AND THEN SLOWLY MOVE EAST
THROUGH MID WEEK...AS AN UPPER LEVEL TROUGH OVER THE NORTHWEST U.S.
MOVES EAST AND CAPTURES THE STORM REMNANTS. SO GOOD CHANCES FOR
SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS...WITH POSSIBLE HEAVY RAINS CONTINUING
THROUGH MOST OF THE WEEK.

ALTHOUGH CONFIDENCE HAS INCREASED QUITE A BIT TODAY ON THE
EXPECTED TRACK...PLEASE STAY TUNED TO THE LATEST UPDATES AND EVENTUAL
IMPACTS TO THE MID-SOUTH.

$$

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES
AR...FLOOD WATCH AND WIND ADVISORY FOR ALL ARKANSAS COUNTIES FROM 
MIDNIGHT MONDAY THROUGH 7 PM MONDAY.
MO...FLOOD WATCH AND WIND ADVISORY FOR DUNKLIN AND PEMISCOTT COUNTIES FROM 
MIDNIGHT MONDAY THROUGH 7 PM MONDAY.
MS...FLOOD WATCH FOR ALL MISSISSIPPI COUNTIES FROM MIDNIGHT MONDAY 
THROUGH 7 PM MONDAY. INLAND TROPICAL STORM WATCH ISSUED FOR 
NORTHEAST MISSISSIPPI COUNTIES FROM MIDNIGHT MONDAY THROUGH 7 PM 
MONDAY. WIND ADVISORY ISSUED FOR THE REMAINDER OF THE NORTHWEST 
MISSISSIPPI COUNTIES FROM MIDNIGHT MONDAY THROUGH 7 PM MONDAY. 
TN...FLOOD WATCH FOR ALL TENNESSEE COUNTIES FROM MIDNIGHT MONDAY 
THROUGH 7 PM MONDAY. INLAND TROPICAL STORM WATCH ISSUED FOR HARDIN 
AND MCNAIRY COUNTIES FROM MIDNIGHT MONDAY THROUGH 7 PM MONDAY. WIND 
ADVISORY ISSUED FOR THE REMAINDER OF THE WEST TENNESSEE COUNTIES FROM 
MIDNIGHT MONDAY THROUGH 7 PM MONDAY.

MISSISSIPPI AND EXTREME SOUTHEAST TENNESSEE COUNTIES...AND A WIND
ADVISORY FOR THE REMAINDER OF THE AREA FROM MIDNIGHT MONDAY MORNING
UNTIL 7 PM MONDAY. THE REMNANT STORM SYSTEM SHOULD SLOW DOWN AS IT
GETS UNDER AN UPPER RIDGE BY MONDAY NIGHT AND THEN SLOWLY MOVE EAST
THROUGH MID WEEK...AS AN UPPER LEVEL TROUGH OVER THE NORTHWEST U.S.
MOVES EAST AND CAPTURES THE STORM REMNANTS. SO GOOD CHANCES FOR
SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS...WITH POSSIBLE HEAVY RAINS CONTINUING
THROUGH MOST OF THE WEEK.

ALTHOUGH CONFIDENCE HAS INCREASED QUITE A BIT TODAY ON THE
EXPECTED TRACK...PLEASE STAY TUNED TO THE LATEST UPDATES AND EVENTUAL
IMPACTS TO THE MID-SOUTH.

$$

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES

.DISCUSSION...

A PERSISTENT UPPER LEVEL TROUGH AXIS REMAINS STRETCHED ACROSS THE
MID-SOUTH THIS MORNING. THIS UPPER LEVEL FEATURE WAS RESPONSIBLE FOR
THE INCREASED CLOUD COVER OVER THE AREA THIS MORNING AND MAY HELP
TO INITIATE ISOLATED CONVECTION THIS AFTERNOON AS THE TROUGH AXIS
RETROGRADES NORTHWESTWARD. REGIONAL 12Z SOUNDINGS AND LOCAL FORECAST
SOUNDINGS SHOW THE THAT THE AIRMASS WILL BE UNCAPPED BY THIS
AFTERNOON AND WITH INCREASED HEATING AND INSTABILITY THE AIRMASS WILL
SUPPORT AT LEAST ISOLATED SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS. AS FOR
TEMPERATURES...CLOUDS WILL ONLY LIMIT TEMPERATURES SLIGHTLY AND GOING
TEMPERATURE FORECAST LOOKS ON TRACK.

ALL OTHER PARAMETERS LOOK FINE AS WELL AND WILL ONLY MAKE UPDATES
TO EXPAND THE SLIGHT CHANCE POPS TO INCLUDE THE ENTIRE AREA. UPDATED
GRIDS ALREADY SENT AND UPDATED ZONE FORECAST OUT SHORTLY.

AS A SIDE NOTE...HURRICANE DENNIS STILL ON TRACK TO MAKE LANDFALL
ALONG THE EAST-CENTRAL GULF COAST ON SUNDAY AND CONFIDENCE IS
CONTINUING TO INCREASE THAT THERE WILL BE SOME IMPACTS FROM THIS
SYSTEM HERE IN THE MID-SOUTH SUNDAY NIGHT INTO EARLY NEXT WEEK. MUCH
MORE INFORMATION ON DENNIS WILL BE PROVIDED LATER THIS AFTERNOON.

MISSISSIPPI TO SOUTHWESTERN LOUISIANA IN ASSOCIATION WITH A WEAK 
DISTURBANCE NEAR HOUSTON TEXAS. THIS FEATURE CAN BE SEEN ON IR AND 
WATER VAPOR IMAGERY. MID LEVEL CLOUDS HAVE FORMED ON THE EAST SIDE

SLIGHT CHANCE OF SOME ISOLATED THUNDER AND SHOWERS MAINLY ACROSS

INTO TONIGHT. DAYTIME TEMPERATURES MAY BE SLIGHTLY HINDERED BY 
THICKER CIRRUS...MUCH LIKE YESTERDAY. HOWEVER...LOWER TO MID 90S IS 
STILL QUITE WARM DESPITE THE CLOUD COVER

THE MAIN FEATURE AS MENTIONED EARLIER WILL BE REMNANTS OF DENNIS 
MOVING ACROSS THE MID SOUTH. APPEARS MORE AND MORE LIKE HEAVY RAIN 
AND WINDS ABOVE 30 MPH WILL BE LIKELY ESPECIALLY ACROSS NORTHEAST 
MISSISSIPPI. THE RAIN WILL SPREAD OVER WEST TENNESSEE...NORTHEAST 
ARKANSAS AND THE MISSOURI BOOTHEEL MONDAY. MOST LOCATIONS WILL SEE 
RAIN WHICH WILL HOPEFULLY PUT A HALT TO THE CURRENT DROUGHT 
SITUATION OVER THE MID SOUTH. HAVE INCREASED RAIN CHANCES SUNDAY  
AND MONDAY DUE TO CONTINUED HIGHER CONFIDENCE IN THE TRACK OF DENNIS.

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 082049
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
349 PM CDT FRI JUL 8 2005

.DISCUSSION...

AN UPPER LEVEL TROUGH REMAINS STRETCHED ACROSS CENTRAL TO
NORTHEAST MISSISSIPPI THIS AFTERNOON AND HAS TRIGGERED SOME
ISOLATED SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS OVER NORTHEAST MISSISSIPPI THIS
AFTERNOON. TEMPERATURES IN MOST AREAS RANGED FROM THE UPPER 80S TO
LOWER 90S AREAWIDE. WITH THE LOSS OF DAYTIME HEATING...EXPECT ANY
SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS ACROSS NORTHEAST MISSISSIPPI TO DIMINISH.

ON SATURDAY...THE UPPER TROUGH TO THE SOUTH WILL WEAKEN AS IT MOVES
NORTH DURING THE DAY. CANNOT COMPLETELY RULE OUT AN ISOLATED SHOWER
OR THUNDERSTORM ON SATURDAY...ESPECIALLY ACROSS THE SOUTHERN HALF
OF THE AREA WHERE BETTER MOISTURE EXISTS...BUT COVERAGE WILL BE LOW
ENOUGH TO PRECLUDE IT FROM THE FORECAST. TEMPERATURES SHOULD AGAIN BE
SEASONABLY HOT ON SATURDAY.

THE MAJOR STORY THIS AFTERNOON CONTINUES TO BE WHAT HAPPENS WITH
DANGEROUS HURRICANE DENNIS OVER THE WEEKEND AND ITS POSSIBLE
IMPACTS TO THE MID-SOUTH AT THE END OF THE WEEKEND AND BEGINNING OF
NEXT WEEK. MOST OF THE FORECAST MODELS HAVE COME INTO MUCH BETTER
AGREEMENT TODAY AND HAVE CLUSTERED ALONG A TRACK THAT SENDS THE
HURRICANE NORTHWESTWARD ACROSS THE GULF OF MEXICO...MAKES LANDFALL
IN THE VICINITY OF THE EAST-CENTRAL GULF COAST ON SUNDAY...AND THEN
SENDS THE REMNANTS IN THE DIRECTION OF THE MID-SOUTH FOR THE
BEGINNING OF NEXT WEEK. IN FACT...MOST OF THE MODELS NOW SHOW THE
WEAKENING SYSTEM MOVING OVER SOME PORTION OF THE FORECAST AREA
DURING THIS TIME PERIOD. AS WITH ANY TROPICAL SYSTEM THAT IS STILL A
COUPLE OF DAYS OUT...ERRORS CAN STILL BE QUITE LARGE. BUT WITH THE
MODELS STARTING TO CONVERGE ON A SOLUTION...CONFIDENCE IS
INCREASING THAT THERE WILL BE SOME IMPACTS...POSSIBLY SIGNIFICANT...
ACROSS PORTIONS OF THE MID-SOUTH FROM LATE SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH
MONDAY NIGHT. SOME OF THE POSSIBLE THREATS WILL INCLUDE THE
POSSIBILITY OF FLOODING RAINFALL...STRONG AND GUSTY WINDS...AND
POSSIBLE SEVERE WEATHER...MAINLY TO THE EAST OF WHERE THE CENTER OF
THE STORM TRACKS. THE GREATEST IMPACTS FROM INCLEMENT WEATHER AT THIS
TIME APPEARS TO BE ACROSS SOUTHEASTERN PORTIONS OF OUR FORECAST AREA.
AGAIN...THIS FORECAST IS SUBJECT TO CHANGE OVER THE NEXT COUPLE OF
DAYS UP UNTIL AND BEYOND LANDFALL.

AS FOR SOME OF THE METEOROLOGY THAT MAY DIRECT THE REMNANT LOW INTO
THE MID-SOUTH...INCLUDES THE PERSISTENT MID AND UPPER LEVEL SUB-
TROPICAL RIDGE THAT STILL EXTENDS ACROSS THE FLORIDA PENINSULA INTO
THE EASTERN GULF AND THE NORTHEAST U.S. UPPER TROUGH. THE STORM
SHOULD BE GUIDED NORTHWEST AROUND THE PERIPHERY OF THE SUBTROPICAL
RIDGE...FORCING IT TO MAKE LANDFALL ALONG THE EAST-CENTRAL GULF
COAST. AFTER THAT IT SHOULD MOVE INLAND AND SHOULD CONTINUE TO MOVE
NORTHWEST AND SLOW DOWN AS IT APPROACHES OUR AREA. THIS NORTHWEST
TRAJECTORY SHOULD CONTINUE INLAND...AS IT APPEARS THAT MOST OF THE
FORECAST MODELS ARE LIFTING THE NORTHEAST U.S. TROUGH OUT TO THE
NORTHEAST AND LEAVING THE REMNANTS OF DENNIS BEHIND AND UNDER A
BUILDING UPPER LEVEL RIDGE. THIS IS WHY THE SYSTEM SHOULD
EVENTUALLY SLOW DOWN ITS MOVEMENT. WITH THE SYSTEM SIGNIFICANTLY
WEAKENING...BUT POSSIBLY STILL LINGERING ACROSS SOME PORTION OF THE
AREA...WILL CONTINUE CHANCES FOR SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS THROUGH
THE REMAINDER OF THE EXTENDED PERIOD. TEMPERATURES WILL BE BELOW
NORMAL THROUGH MID WEEK WITH THE RAIN AND CLOUDS...BUT SLOWLY WARMING
THROUGH THE END OF THE EXTENDED PERIOD.

JUST TO REITERATE...THE EXTENDED PORTION OF THE FORECAST IS SUBJECT
TO CHANGE...SO STAY TUNED TO THE LATEST UPDATES ON THE EVENTUAL TRACK
AND INTENSITY OF DENNIS AND POSSIBLE IMPACTS TO THE MID-SOUTH.

$$

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES

HURRICANE PRODUCING WINDS AROUND 135 MPH EARLIER TONIGHT NEAR CUBA.

ONLY A FEW MINOR TWEAKS MADE TO ONGOING FORECAST THIS MORNING. TODAY 
WILL BE SLIGHTLY WARMER THAN YESTERDAY AND REMAIN DRY FOR MOST OF 
THE FORECAST AREA. OVERNIGHT LOWS RANGE FROM THE MID 60S TO LOWER 
70S TONIGHT AND SATURDAY NIGHT. DAYTIME HIGHS ON SATURDAY WILL BE 
NEAR TODAY/S HIGHS. ON SUNDAY...EASTERN AREAS SHOULD BE COOLER WITH 
HURRICANE DENNIS AND ITS ASSOCIATED CLOUD COVER SEEPING INTO THE MID 
SOUTH. 

FEEL THAT CIRRUS CLOUDS STREAMING ACROSS THE REGION TODAY WILL BE 
THIN ENOUGH TO ALLOW FOR PLENTY OF INSOLATION. THUS MAX TEMPS 
REACHING THE LOW TO MID 90S SEEM REASONABLE.

THE MAIN WEATHER CHALLENGE WILL CONTINUE TO BE THE LOCATION OF WHERE 
DENNIS MAKES LANDFALL AND HOW MUCH OF DENNIS WILL IMPACT THE MID 
SOUTH. WITH MORE CONFIDENCE EACH DAY...HAVE INCREASED RAIN CHANCES 
IN ASSOCIATION WITH DENNIS FOR SUNDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH MONDAY 
NIGHT. IT APPEARS THAT SHOULD DENNIS FOLLOW THE CURRENT NHC FORECAST 
PATH...THE HEAVIEST RAINFALL WILL OCCUR OVER NORTHEAST MISSISSIPPI 
AND WEST TENNESSEE ESPECIALLY ALONG THE TENNESSEE RIVER.

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 072048
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
348 PM CDT THU JUL 7 2005

.DISCUSSION...

A WEAK SHORTWAVE TROUGH CONTINUES TO PUSH EASTWARD ACROSS THE MID-
SOUTH THIS AFTERNOON. REGIONAL 88D RADARS STILL SHOWING MAINLY
ISOLATED SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS OVER MAINLY NORTHEAST
MISSISSIPPI. TEMPERATURES RANGED FROM THE UPPER 80S TO LOW 90S
AREAWIDE...WITH THE COOLER TEMPERATURES BEING OBSERVED OVER AREAS
WITH RAINFALL. EXPECT THIS SHORTWAVE TO CONTINUE MOVING SLOWLY
SOUTHEAST TONIGHT...BRINGING AN END TO ANY LINGERING SHOWERS.

HIGH PRESSURE ALONG WITH RISING HEIGHTS WILL MOVE INTO THE AREA ON
FRIDAY AND PERSIST INTO THE FIRST HALF OF THE WEEKEND. THIS WILL
BRING DRY WEATHER AND SEASONABLY HOT TEMPERATURES THROUGH SATURDAY.

THE BIG STORY FOR THE EXTENDED PERIOD WILL BE POSSIBLE IMPACTS FROM
REMNANTS OF HURRICANE DENNIS. CURRENTLY DENNIS IS SCOOTING JUST TO
THE NORTH OF JAMAICA AS A MAJOR CATEGORY 3 HURRICANE. THERE HAVE
BEEN SOME INCONSISTENCIES IN THE MODEL TRENDS WITH REGARDS TO
FORECAST TRACK OF THE SYSTEM. MOST OF THE MODEL GUIDANCE HAS
SHIFTED TO THE EAST THIS MORNING AS COMPARED WITH YESTERDAYS
GUIDANCE. OF COURSE THE EVENTUAL TRACK OF THE SYSTEM WILL MAKE A BIG
DIFFERENCE ON POSSIBLE IMPACTS TO THE AREA. THE 12Z RUNS OF THE
GFDL/GFS AND 18Z RUN OF THE BAMM HAVE SHIFTED FURTHER EAST...WITH
LANDFALL ESTIMATES IN THE FLORIDA PANHANDLE. IF THIS WERE TO OCCUR...
THE GREATEST THREATS OF HEAVY RAIN AND SEVERE WEATHER WOULD LIKELY
REMAIN EAST OF THE AREA...WITH JUST OUTER BANDS ON THE WESTERN SIDE
OF THE SYSTEM IMPACTING OUR AREA. THE 12Z RUNS OF THE UKMET/ECMWF
REMAINED FURTHER WEST WITH POSSIBLE LANDFALL ALONG THE LOUISIANA OR
MISSISSIPPI GULF COAST...AND HAVING A MORE SIGNIFICANT RAIN AND
POSSIBLE SEVERE THREAT TO THE MID-SOUTH. LOOKING AT WATER VAPOR
IMAGERY THIS AFTERNOON...MID AND UPPER LEVEL TROPOSPHERIC RIDGING
WHICH IS CURRENTLY STEERING THE SYSTEM REMAINS ENTRENCHED ACROSS
THE PENINSULA OF FLORIDA...WITH EASTERLY FLOW EXTENDING INTO THE
EASTERN GULF OF MEXICO. THIS SHOULD KEEP THE SYSTEM ON ITS GENERAL
NORTHWEST OR WEST NORTHWEST HEADING FOR THE NEXT DAY OR TWO. UPPER
LEVEL TROUGHING WAS NOTED ACROSS THE NORTHWEST GULF AND IT IS THE
STRENGTH OF THIS FEATURE WHICH WILL MOST LIKELY DETERMINE THE
ULTIMATE PATH OF DENNIS...AND HOW FAR WEST IT TRACKS.

WITH ALL THIS BEING SAID...THERE IS STILL QUITE A BIT OF UNCERTAINTY
WITH THE EVENTUAL TRACK OF THE SYSTEM AND THERE ARE LIKELY TO BE
SOME CHANGES TO THE FORECAST FOR SUNDAY NIGHT AND BEYOND. PREFER
TO REMAIN SOMEWHAT CONSISTENT WITH THE GOING FORECAST AND ONLY MADE
MINOR CHANGES TO POPS IN THE EXTENDED PERIOD. AS WE GET CLOSER TO
THE EVENT...IMPACTS TO THE FORECAST AREA WILL BECOME BETTER DEFINED.
BUT AT THIS TIME...STILL THINK A PORTION OF THE FORECAST AREA WILL
HAVE AT LEAST THE POTENTIAL FOR SOME RAIN AND GUSTY WINDS AND HAVE
INCLUDED THIS IN THE FORECAST FOR SUNDAY AFTERNOON AND BEYOND.

$$

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 070911
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
413 AM CDT THU JUL 7 2005

.DISCUSSION...LATEST SURFACE ANALYSIS PLACES COLD FRONT ACROSS 
CENTRAL/SOUTHERN MISSISSIPPI. ALOFT A TROUGH EXTENDS FROM THE LOWER 
PENINSULA OF MICHIGAN BACK TO THE LOWER MISSISSIPPI VALLEY. MAIN 
FORECAST CONCERNS THIS PACKAGE WILL BE RESIDUAL PRECIPITATION 
CHANCES FOR THIS MORNING AND UPCOMING TROPICAL WEATHER AFFECTING THE 
FORECAST AREA BY EARLY NEXT WEEK. 

TODAY...THE REMNANTS OF TROPICAL STORM CINDY WILL CONTINUE TO MOVE 
EAST TOWARD THE APPALACIANS. UPPER LEVEL TROUGH WILL CONTINUE TO 
SWING THROUGH THE LOWER/MIDDLE MISSISSIPPI VALLEY. MODEL SOUNDINGS 
DO INDICATE SOME INSTABILITY WITH 700-500MB LAYER LAPSE RATES AROUND 
6 C/KM DURING THE MORNING. RECENT 88D TRENDS SHOW SOME LIGHT RETURNS 
JUST BEGINNING TO ENTER THE SW SECTION OF THE FORECAST AREA. AS A 
RESULT WILL KEEP A CHANCE OF AN ISOLATED SHOWER FROM AREAS ALONG AND 
SOUTH OF A LINE FROM FORREST CITY TO SAVANNAH WITH SHOWER ACTIVITY 
COMING TO AN END BY THIS AFTERNOON. 15KT 850 MB TEMPERATURES AROUND 18C 
MIXING DOWN TO THE SURFACE WILL SUPPORT HIGHS AROUND 90 BUT SOME 
RESIDUAL LOW LEVEL MOISTURE PRESENT MAY KEEP TEMPERATURES DOWN A 
DEGREE OR TWO. 

TONIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY...UPPER LEVEL TROUGH WILL DEPART AS RIDGING 
BUILDS IN ACROSS THE REGION. SOME CLEARING WILL TAKE PLACE ACROSS 
THE AREA...ESPECIALLY ACROSS AREAS WEST OF THE MISSISSIPPI RIVER 
WHERE MOISTURE WILL MIX OUT DURING THE DAYTIME AND DECOUPLING WINDS 
WILL ALLOW LOWS TO DROP BACK INTO THE UPPER 60S TO LOWER 70S. 
TEMPERATURES THROUGH SATURDAY WILL BE NEAR NORMAL VALUES.

SUNDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY...STILL SOME UNCERTAINTY WITH THE TRACK OF 
HURRICANE DENNIS. MADE ONLY SLIGHT ADJUSTMENTS UPWARD ON POPS FOR 
EARLY NEXT WEEK AS LONG RANGE MODELS HAVING DIFFICULTY RESOLVING 
SOLUTIONS BEYOND LANDFALL. NONETHELESS...HURRICANE DENNIS SHOULD MAKE 
LANDFALL SUNDAY NIGHT INTO MONDAY SOMEWHERE BETWEEN THE PANHANDLE OF 
FLORIDA TO JUST EAST OF HOUSTON. ONCE IT MAKES 
LANDFALL...GFS/EUROPEAN SOLUTION TAKE THE REMNANTS ACROSS THE 
MIDSOUTH AND EVENTUALLY WEST ACROSS OKLAHOMA. THE 18Z DGEX SOLUTION 
DEPICTS THE REMNANTS BEING ABSORBED BY AN EAST COAST TROUGH. LATER 
SHIFTS WILL MAKE NECESSARY ADJUSTMENTS TO THE FORECAST AS THE EVENT 
UNFOLDS.


000 
FXUS64 KMEG 062041
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
341 PM CDT WED JUL 6 2005

.DISCUSSION...

SCATTERED SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS CONTINUE ACROSS PORTIONS OF THE
MID-SOUTH THIS AFTERNOON...ALONG WITH PARTLY TO MOSTLY CLOUDY
SKIES. THE CLOUDS AND PRECIPITATION HAS HELPED TO KEEP TEMPERATURES
BELOW NORMAL TODAY. ADDITIONAL CHANCES FOR SHOWERS AND
THUNDERSTORMS WILL CONTINUE INTO THIS EVENING...OVER MAINLY THE
SOUTHEASTERN 2/3RDS OF THE AREA...AS TROPICAL MOISTURE LINGERS.
THESE RAIN CHANCES WILL DIMINISH LATER TONIGHT...AS THE REMNANTS OF
CINDY PULL NORTHEAST AWAY FROM THE AREA AND DRIER AIR ADVECTS IN
BEHIND THE DEPARTING SYSTEM.

ANOTHER WEAK SHORTWAVE WILL MOVE ACROSS THE AREA ON THURSDAY...BUT
WITH THE AIRMASS BECOMING MUCH DRIER...NOT EXPECTING MORE THAN A
FEW CLOUDS WITH THIS SYSTEM. UPPER LEVEL RIDGING WILL BUILD OVER THE
MID-SOUTH BEGINNING FRIDAY AND CONTINUING THROUGH MOST OF THE
WEEKEND. THIS WILL ALLOW FOR A RETURN TO DRY AND SEASONABLY HOT
WEATHER FOR FRIDAY THROUGH SUNDAY.

THE EXTENDED PORTION OF THE FORECAST WILL BE HIGHLY DEPENDENT UPON
THE EVENTUAL TRACK OF WHAT IS EXPECTED TO BE HURRICANE DENNIS. THIS
PORTION OF THE FORECAST WILL CARRY MUCH UNCERTAINTY...BUT CURRENT
INDICATIONS ARE THAT DENNIS WILL MOVE INTO THE SOUTHEAST GULF
OF MEXICO BY SATURDAY MORNING AND IMPACT SOME PORTION OF EITHER THE
CENTRAL OR EASTERN GULF COAST BY THE BEGINNING OF NEXT WEEK AS
POSSIBLY A MAJOR HURRICANE.

THERE IS THE POSSIBILITY THAT THIS TROPICAL SYSTEM WILL AFFECT SOME
PORTIONS OF THE FORECAST AREA DURING THE SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY
TIME PERIOD. IF THE SYSTEM WERE TO TRACK JUST TO OUR WEST...AS
INDICATED BY SOME OF THE MEDIUM RANGE GUIDANCE...THERE WOULD BE THE
POTENTIAL FOR FLOODING RAINS...SEVERE WEATHER...AND STRONG WINDS
ACROSS PORTIONS OF THE MID-SOUTH. IF THE SYSTEM TRACKS FAR ENOUGH
AWAY FROM THE AREA...ONLY TYPICAL SUMMER WEATHER (HOT AND MAINLY DRY)
WOULD BE EXPECTED UNDER UPPER LEVEL RIDGING. THIS SYSTEM IS SEVERAL
DAYS AWAY AND THERE WILL BE PLENTY OF TIME TO REFINE THE ULTIMATE
STRENGTH AND TRACK. THEREFORE...HAVE DECIDED TO INCLUDE CHANCE POPS
INTO THE EXTENDED FORECAST TO ACCOUNT FOR POSSIBLE TROPICAL IMPACTS.
AGAIN...THE EXTENDED FORECAST IS HIGHLY UNCERTAIN AT THIS TIME AND IS
SUBJECT TO CHANGE.

$$

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.

$$

JLH

FXUS64 KMEG 061456
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
956 AM CDT WED JUL 6 2005

.DISCUSSION...

A WEAK SURFACE BOUNDARY REMAINS STRETCHED ACROSS PORTIONS OF WEST
TENNESSEE...SOUTHWESTWARD ACROSS EAST ARKANSAS...AND INTO NORTHWEST
LOUISIANA. ABUNDANT TROPICAL MOISTURE IN ASSOCIATION WITH TROPICAL
STORM CINDY CONTINUES TO MOVE NORTHWARD AS WELL...AS SEEN FROM LATEST
WATER VAPOR IMAGERY. THIS MOISTURE IS INTERACTING WITH THE WEAK
FRONTAL BOUNDARY AND A WEAK UPPER LEVEL SHORTWAVE MOVING ACROSS THE
AREA TO PRODUCE A BAND OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS...FOCUSED ALONG
THE FRONTAL BOUNDARY. SOME HEAVY RAIN WILL BE POSSIBLE WITHIN THIS
CONVECTIVE BAND FOR THE NEXT COUPLE OF HOURS.

SCATTERED SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS WILL ALSO CONTINUE TO DEVELOP TO
THE SOUTH OF THE FRONT ACROSS PORTIONS OF WEST TENNESSEE AND NORTH
MISSISSIPPI. MOSTLY CLOUDY SKIES WILL PERSIST ACROSS MOST OF THE
AREA TODAY. THERE MAY BE A FEW BREAKS IN THE CLOUDS AND SOME
REDUCTION IN THE OVERALL CONVECTIVE COVERAGE LATER THIS AFTERNOON...
AS THE REMNANTS OF CINDY MOVE FURTHER EAST AND DRIER AIR ATTEMPTS TO
FILTER INTO THE AREA FROM THE NORTHWEST.

PLAN TO ALSO LOWER TEMPERATURES A FEW DEGREES AS A RESULT OF THE
ENHANCED CLOUD COVER AND SCATTERED CONVECTION. OTHER FORECAST
PARAMETERS LOOK OK FOR NOW. UPDATES TO THE FORECAST AND GRIDS WILL
BE OUT SHORTLY.

$$

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.

FXUS64 KMEG 060850
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
350 AM CDT WED JUL 6 2005

.DISCUSSION...LATEST SURFACE ANALYSIS PLACES TROPICAL STORM CINDY 
JUST SOUTH OF NEW ORLEANS. FURTHER NORTH...HIGH PRESSURE ACROSS THE 
TENNESSEE VALLEY RESULTED IN A DECREASE OF RAIN ACROSS PORTIONS OF 
THE FORECAST AREA EARLY THIS MORNING AS 50KT 250MB UPPER LEVEL JET 
DEPARTS THE MIDDLE/LOWER MISSISSIPPI VALLEY. LATEST INFRARED 
SATELLITE IMAGERY SHOWS MID/UPPER LEVEL CLOUD SHIELD BEGINNING TO 
OVERSPREAD THE MID SOUTH. RECENT 88D TRENDS THIS MORNING SHOWING 
ACTIVITY SLOWLY BEGINNING TO INCREASE ONCE AGAIN ACROSS EASTERN 
ARKANSAS. MAIN FORECAST CONCERN THIS PACKAGE IS PRECIPITATION 
CHANCES ACROSS THE MID SOUTH OVER THE NEXT COUPLE OF DAYS.

TODAY...T.S. CINDY WILL COME ASHORE TODAY AND MOVE NORTHEAST INTO 
CENTRAL ALABAMA. MEANWHILE...A SHORTWAVE IN NORTHWEST FLOW ALOFT 
WILL INTO THE MISSISSIPPI VALLEY. WEAK MID LEVEL DYNAMICAL FORCING 
/700-500MB Q-VECTOR CONVERGENCE/ WILL MOVE EAST ACROSS THE LOWER 
MISSISSIPPI VALLEY DURING THE MORNING. CANNOT JUSTIFY POPS HIGHER 
THAN SCATTERED IN THE MORNING WITH 700-500 MB MID LEVEL LAPSE RATES 
WEAKENING TO AROUND 5 C/KM AS THE MORNING PROGRESSES. BY THIS 
AFTERNOON...WILL KEEP POPS AS SCATTERED OR LESS ACROSS NORTHERN 
MISSISSIPPI WITH AREAS NORTH REMAINING DRY. 850MB TEMPERATURES 
AROUND 17C...WILL PRODUCE HIGHS AGAIN LIKE YESTERDAY WITH HIGHS 
AROUND 90 DEGREES. CLOUD COVER ASSOCIATED WITH THE TROPICAL STORM 
SHOULD HOLD TEMPERATURES DOWN A FEW DEGREES ACROSS THE SOUTHEAST 
SECTION OF THE CWA INTO THE MIDDLE 80S. 

TONIGHT...MID LEVEL SHORTWAVE IN NORTHWEST FLOW AND ASSOCIATED 
SURFACE FRONT WILL DEPART THE FORECAST AREA. PRECIPITATION GRADIENT 
WILL BE VERY TIGHT ON THE BACKSIDE OF THE TROPICAL SYSTEM AS 
COMPETING SUBSIDENCE WILL KEEP RAIN CHANCES TO A MINIMUM ACROSS THE 
AREA. MADE SOME MODIFICATIONS TO LOWS BASED ON CLOUD COVER AND 
TEMPERATURE TRENDS DURING THE DAY ACROSS NORTHERN MISSISSIPPI. 

THURSDAY AND THURSDAY NIGHT...HIGH PRESSURE WILL BUILD BACK IN 
ACROSS THE LOWER MISSISSIPPI VALLEY AS UPPER LEVEL RIDGING REPLACES 
THE TROUGH AND TROPICAL LOW. 850MB TEMPERATURES AROUND 18C SHOULD 
PRODUCE HIGHS AGAIN AROUND 90 AND LOWS IN THE UPPER 60S TO AROUND 
70. 

LONG RANGE...FRIDAY THROUGH TUESDAY...NO MAJOR CHANGES TO LONG RANGE 
FORECAST AS UPPER LEVEL RIDGING WILL BRING PRECIPITATION FREE 
WEATHER TO THE MID SOUTH THIS WEEKEND. GFS/EUROPEAN RUN IN OVERALL GOOD 
AGREEMENT THOUGH THE GFS TAKES THE NEXT TROPICAL SYSTEM INLAND 
ACROSS THE SAME LOCATION AS T.S. CINDY AND EUROPEAN MOVES TROPICAL 
SYSTEM FURTHER EAST ACROSS THE PANHANDLE OF FLORIDA BY EARLY NEXT 
WEEK.  
$$

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 051915 RRA
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
217 PM CDT TUE JUL 5 2005

.DISCUSSION...
SURFACE FRONT BISECTS THE AREA ROUGHLY ALONG THE TN/MS BORDER. 
SCT-NUMEROUS THUNDERSTORMS HAVE DEVELOPED IN UNSTABLE AIRMASS SOUTH 
OF THE FRONT ACRS NRN MS. THOUGH INSTABILITY IS DECENT WITH CAPES 
AROUND 2500 J/KG...UPPER LEVEL WINDS AND LAPSE RATES ARE MARGINAL. A 
FEW STORMS HAVE APPROACHED SEVERE LIMITS BUT THE MAIN THREAT WL BE 
HEAVY RAIN AND FREQUENT LIGHTNING. PRECIP H20 VALUES GREATER THAN 2 
INCHES AND SLOW STORM MOVEMENT MAY RESULT IN HEAVY RAIN TOTALS IN 
AREAS THAT DO EXPERIENCE THUNDERSTORMS. WL MENTION HEAVY RAIN THREAT 
EARLY THIS EVENING. EXPECT STORMS TO DIMINISH WITH LOSS OF HEATING. 
HOWEVER SOME REDEVELOPMENT POSSIBLE OVERNIGHT AS WEAK SHORTWAVE 
MOVES INTO THE REGION FROM THE NORTHWEST. 

TROPICAL STORM CINDY WL PROBABLY NOT IMPACT THE MID SOUTH MUCH. 
MODELS AND HPC TRACK INDICATE MOST OF THE PRECIP IMPACTS WITH THIS 
SYSTEM WL STAY ON THE EASTERN SIDE OF THE SYSTEM. ON WED SFC FRONT 
WL BE HUNG UP OVER NORTHERN MS WHILE CINDY TRACKS TO THE SRN MS/AL 
BORDER BY 00Z THU. EXPECT SCT TSTMS DEVELOPMENT ACRS NE MS WHILE 
DRIER AIR ALONG THE PERIPHERY OF THE SYSTEM WORKS INTO NW SXNS OF 
THE FORECAST AREA. WED NIGHT CINDY TRACKS INTO CNTRL AL AND PRECIP 
CHANCES WL DIMINISH ACRS NE MS. MEANWHILE DRY SINKS OVER EVEN MORE 
OF THE CWFA. 

THU THROUGH WEEKEND...HIGH PRESSURE IN CONTROL OF THE REGION WITH A 
LESS HUMID NORTHEAST WIND PREVAILING THROUGH THE PERIOD. TEMPS WILL 
BE SEASONABLY WARM. EARLY NEXT WEEK STARTED TO ADD POPS TO ACCOUNT 
FOR POSSIBILITY OF TS DENNIS IMPACTING THE REGION.

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 041916 RRA
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
218 PM CDT MON JUL 4 2005

.DISCUSSION...

A COUPLE AREAS OF CONVECTION TO DEAL WITH THIS AFTERNOON. FIRST 
BATCH DEVELOPED ACRS NE MS IN RESPONSE TO A WEAK SHORTWAVE AND 
SOME SFC CONVERGENCE IN AN AREA OF STRONG INSTABILITY WITH CAPES 
AROUND 3000 J/KG. A FEW OF THESE STORMS HAVE BEEN SEVERE WITH PENNY 
SIZE HAIL AND DAMAGING WIND. THIS STORMS WILL GRADUALLY WEAKEN BY 
EVENING. 

THE NEXT AREA OF CONCERN IS NE AR AND THE MO BOOTHEEL. AN OLD 
OUTFLOW BOUNDARY THAT WAS GENERATED BY AN MCS EARLIER TODAY IS 
MOVING INTO NE AR ATTM. THE AIRMASS ACRS NE AR HAS DESTABILIZED 
RAPIDLY THIS AFTN AS HIGH DEWPOINTS...73 AT JBR... HAVE SURGED NORTH 
AND TEMPS HAVE BUMPED TEMPS INTO THE MID 90S. THE LATEST LAPS 
ANALYSIS INDICATES CAPES GREATER THAN 4000 J/KG. MEANWHILE A DECENT 
SHORTWAVE WAS MOVING ACRS MO WITH SOME STRONGER MID LEVEL WINDS. 
STORMS HAVE ALREADY STARTED TO DEVELOP ALONG THE OUTFLOW BOUNDARY 
AND WITH NO CAP ACRS NE AR EXPECT THIS TREND TO CONTINUE INTO THE 
EVENING HOURS. A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WATCH IS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM 
ACRS NE AR AND THE MO BOOTHEEL. THE MAIN THREATS WILL BE LARGE HAIL 
AND DAMAGING WINDS. 

THE COLD FRONT WILL PUSH INTO THE AREA LATER TONIGHT SO MORE 
THUNDERSTORM DEVELOPMENT WILL BE POSSIBLE. SEVERE POTENTIAL WL 
DIMINISH SOME AS THE EVENING WEARS AND SFC HEATING WINDS DOWN. SFC 
FRONT WL BE STALLED ACRS THE REGION ON TUESDAY. WL BUMP UP POPS A 
LITTLE...TO 50 PERCENT...ACRS THE SRN 2/3RDS OF THE AREA WITH HIGH 
TEMPS A LITTLE COOLER DUE TO CLOUDS AND PRECIP. 

WL BEGIN TO TAPER POPS FROM NORTH TO SOUTH ON TUESDAY NIGHT AS THE 
FRONT SLOWLY PUSHES SOUTHWARD. THE FRONT SHOULD BE LOCATED NEAR THE 
SRN EDGE OF THE FORECAST AREA BY 12Z WED. WL GO WITH A DRY FORECAST 
ACRS NRN HALF WED AND WED NIGHT WITH SMALL POPS ACRS NRN MS WITH 
WEAK FRONT IN THE AREA. 

BY THU GFS DEPICTS A SFC WAVE DEVELOPING ALONG THE FRONT HELPING TO 
DRAG THE FRONT SOUTH OF THE AREA AND SFC HIGH PRESSURE BUILDING OVER 
THE AREA. THIS SOLUTION SEEMS REASONABLE AND HAS SHOWN SOME 
CONSISTENCY OVER THE PAST FEW MODELS RUN. EXPECT DRY AND SEASONABLY 
WARM WEATHER THU THROUGH THE WEEKEND. 

$$

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES

FXUS64 KMEG 051541 RRA
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
1042 AM CDT MON JUL 4 2005

.UPDATE...
15Z SFC ANALYSIS INDICATES THE SFC FRONT FROM HELENA THROUGH MEMPHIS 
TO JUST SOUTH OF JACKSON TN. THIS FRONT SHOULD NOT MOVE MUCH TODAY. 
SOUTH OF THE FRONT AIRMASS BECOMING UNSTABLE WITH SFC CAPES ALREADY 
1500-2000 J/KG. HOWEVER THERE IS A GOOD DEAL OF CLOUD COVER ACRS THE 
REGION AND THIS MAY INHIBIT DEVELOPMENT THIS AFTN. NOT MUCH UPPER 
SUPPORT TODAY AND LAPSE RATES ARE LESS THAN 6 C/KM SO EXPECT ANY 
CONVECTION TO BE PULSE IN NATURE AND MOST LIKELY NOT SEVERE. WL 
DECREASE POPS ACRS NE MS SINCE MORNING ACTIVITY JUST ABOUT OUT OF 
THE AREA OTRW ISOLD-SCT SHOWERS/TSTMS EXPECTED...MORE NUMEROUS 
TOWARD SRN SXNS. TWEAKED TEMPS A BIT FOR THIS AFTN.

MADE A SMALL CHANGE FOR TONIGHT...EXPECT THE FRONT TO REMAIN NEARLY 
STATIONARY. ETA SHOWING A SHORTWAVE MOVING INTO THE REGION WITH SOME 
PRECIP DEVELOPMENT ALONG THE FRONT. WENT AHEAD AND MOVED POPS A 
LITTLE FURTHER NORTH INTO THE MEMPHIS AREA. WL CONT TO LOOK AT THIS 
FOR THE AFTN PACKAGE.

.PREV DISCUSSION ISSUED AT 415 AM...
LATEST SURFACE ANALYSIS PLACES COLD FRONT FROM NEAR JONESBORO TO 
BACK ACROSS SOUTHERN ARKANSAS AND INTO THE ARKLATEX. CONVECTION FROM 
LAST EVENING ALMOST COMPLETELY OUT OF THE FORECAST AREA.

TODAY...COLD FRONT WILL SLOWLY MOVE THROUGH A PORTION OF THE MID 
SOUTH DURING THE DAY. AHEAD OF THE FRONT...SURFACE BASED CAPES OF 
2500 J/KG...LI/S AROUND -6...AND RELATIVELY WEAK WINDS ALOFT WILL 
SUPPORT MAINLY PULSE TYPE CONVECTION...THOUGH MID LEVEL LAPSE RATES 
WILL BE POOR AROUND 5 C/KM. BOTH NAM/GFS SIMILAR WITH TIMING OF 
FRONT. WILL MONITOR TRENDS THIS MORNING AND ISSUE AN UPDATE TO TRIM 
POPS IF FRONT MAKES SOME PROGRESS ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA.

TONIGHT...COLD FRONT WILL BECOME NEARLY STATIONARY AS A SECONDARY 
AREA OF LOW PRESSURE DEVELOPS ACROSS EASTERN TEXAS AND MOVES EAST. 
WILL CARRY CHANCE POPS ACROSS THE SOUTHERN TIER OF COUNTIES IN 
FORECAST AREA WITH TAPERING POPS OFF TOWARDS THE TN/MS BORDER.

WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY...FORECAST BECOMES A BIT TRICKY ACROSS THE 
LOWER MISSISSIPPI VALLEY. TROPICAL DEPRESSION NUMBER 3 /CURRENTLY 
LOCATED ACROSS THE CENTER OF THE GULF OF MEXICO/ WILL MOVE INLAND 
AROUND THE MOUTH OF THE MISSISSIPPI. NAM/GFS BOTH HAVE SLIGHTLY 
DIFFERENT SOLUTIONS ON THE TRACK OF THE LOW AS IT MOVES ACROSS 
MISSISSIPPI AND ALABAMA. THE NAM TAKES A MORE NORTHERLY TRACK ACROSS 
NORTHERN MISSISSIPPI WHILE THE GFS HAS A NORTHEASTERLY TRAJECTORY 
ASSOCIATED WITH IT. WILL LEAN TOWARDS THE GFS SOLUTION AND TPC 
GUIDANCE FOR THE TRACK OF THE TROPICAL LOW. WILL ONLY CARRY 20 POPS 
ACROSS THE SOUTHERN THIRD OF THE FORECAST AREA ON WEDNESDAY AND NOT 
CARRY ANY POPS ON THURSDAY. BEYOND THURSDAY...AN UPPER LEVEL RIDGE 
WILL MOVE EAST INTO THE MISSISSIPPI VALLEY BRINGING PRECIPITATION 
FREE WEATHER TO THE MID SOUTH INTO THE WEEKEND.

NO CHANGES MADE BEYOND THURSDAY.
$$

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 041540 RRA
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
1040 AM CDT MON JUL 4 2005

.UPDATE...

MOSTLY SUNNY SKIES ACRS THE FORECAST AREA THIS MORNING. SOUTHERLY 
WINDS HAVE TRANSPORTED HIGHER DEWPOINTS...LOWER 70S...INTO THE 
REGION RESULTING IN MORE HUMIDITY. EXPECT A MOSTLY DRY AFTERNOON 
WITH PERHAPS A FEW THUNDERSTORMS DUE TO SFC HEATING AND/OR THE 
WEAKENING OUTFLOW BOUNDARY PUSHING ACRS AR ATTM. HIGH TEMP FORECAST 
ON TRACK WITH READINGS WELL INTO THE 90S. HEAT INDEX VALUES WILL TOP 
100 ACRS THE SW HALF OF THE REGION INCLUDING THE MEMPHIS METRO. 

THE BETTER CHANCE FOR RAIN WILL COME TONIGHT AND TUESDAY AS A SLOW 
MOVING FRONT PUSHES INTO THE REGION. 

.PREV DISCUSSION ISSUED AT 420 AM...

LATEST SURFACE ANALYSIS THIS MORNING PLACES COLD FRONT FROM WESTERN 
LAKE SUPERIOR BACK INTO THE CENTRAL PLAINS. WATER VAPOR/INFRARED 
SATELLITE IMAGERY SHOWS CONVECTIVE COMPLEX ACROSS THE CENTRAL PLAINS 
INTO THE MISSOURI VALLEY. 00Z UPPER AIR ANALYSIS FROM LAST EVENING 
SHOWS 850 MB RIDGING ACROSS THE MID SOUTH BUT A WEAK 500 MB TROUGH 
ACROSS THE AREA AND ONE UPSTREAM ACROSS THE ROCKIES. MAIN CONCERNS 
FOR THIS FORECAST PACKAGE WILL BE CONVECTIVE POTENTIAL ASSOCIATED 
WITH THE FRONTAL PASSAGE. 00Z GFS HAS SOME CONVECTIVE FEEDBACK 
ISSUES IN THE SHORT TERM AND WILL LEAN FORECAST TOWARDS NAM SOLUTION.

TODAY...LOW LEVEL RIDGING IN PLACE WILL MOVE EAST AS COLD FRONT 
SLOWLY MOVES TOWARD THE MID SOUTH. MAIN FOCUSING MECHANISM FOR ANY 
CONVECTIVE POTENTIAL WILL BE DIURNAL INSTABILITY AS WIND FLOW ALOFT 
IS WEAK WITH AREA BETWEEN SYSTEMS. A MODIFIED SURFACE BASED PARCEL 
ON MODEL SOUNDINGS (96/66) PRODUCES 1700 J/KG SURFACE BASED 
CAPE...AND LI/S AROUND -4. PRECIPITABLE WATER VALUES AROUND 1.75 
INCHES SUGGEST HEAVY RAIN WILL BE POSSIBLE WITH ANY ISOLATED 
THUNDERSTORMS THAT DEVELOP BY LATE AFTERNOON. FREEZING LEVELS WILL 
BE AROUND 15KFT...SO ANY SEVERE WEATHER THREAT WOULD MAINLY BE 
DOWNBURST WINDS. DEBRIS CLOUD ASSOCIATED WITH COMPLEX ALREADY 
STARTING TO AFFECT THE WESTERN EDGE OF THE FORECAST AREA AND TWEAKED 
DOWN HIGHS SLIGHTLY THIS AFTERNOON TO ACCOUNT FOR MORE CLOUD COVER.

TONIGHT...500MB SHORTWAVE AND ASSOCIATED SURFACE REFLECTION WILL 
MOVE THROUGH THE LOWER MISSISSIPPI VALLEY. SURFACE LOW ACROSS THE 
CENTRAL PLAINS WILL MOVE INTO EAST CENTRAL MISSOURI/WEST CENTRAL 
ILLINOIS...DRAGGING A TRAILING COLD FRONT WITH IT. A 60 KT UPPER 
LEVEL JET WILL MOVE ACROSS MISSOURI...PLACING THE MID SOUTH REGION 
UNDER THE RIGHT ENTRANCE REGION OF THE UPPER LEVEL JET. NAM/GFS BOTH 
BRING LEADING EDGE OF FRONTAL PRECIPITATION INTO THE FORECAST AREA 
AROUND OR SLIGHTLY AFTER 00Z. EVEN WITH SBCAPES AROUND 2000 
J/KG...LI/S AROUND -7...BETTER MID LEVEL FORCING /700-500MB Q-VECTOR 
CONVERGENCE/ WILL BE UP ACROSS THE UPPER/MIDDLE MISSISSIPPI VALLEY 
AND RATHER WEAK 700-500MB LAYER MID LEVEL LAPSE RATES ACROSS THE MID 
SOUTH. CONSEQUENTLY...MAIN MODE OF CONVECTION WILL BE PULSE RELATED 
WITH DOWNBURST WINDS AS THE POTENTIAL SEVERE WEATHER THREAT. 
PRECIPITABLE WATER VALUES ALONG THE FRONT AROUND 2 INCHES SUGGEST 
HEAVY RAIN POTENTIAL MAY BE POSSIBLE WITH THE THUNDERSTORMS. 

TUESDAY THROUGH THURSDAY...MODELS BEGIN TO DIVERGE ON PROGRESSION OF 
COLD FRONT ACROSS THE MID SOUTH. NAM PUSHES MOST IF NOT ALL RAINFALL 
OUT OF THE AREA BY 00Z WEDNESDAY WHILE GFS HOLDS ONTO RAINFALL UNTIL 
00Z THURSDAY. AS A RESULT...MADE SOME ADJUSTMENTS TO TRIM BACK POPS 
WEDNESDAY NIGHT INTO THURSDAY.

NO OTHER CHANCES MADE TO EXTENDED FORECAST.

$$

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES

MISSISSIPPI AND ALABAMA. THE NAM TAKES A MORE NORTHERLY TRACK ACROSS 
NORTHERN MISSISSIPPI WHILE THE GFS HAS A NORTHEASTERLY TRAJECTORY 
ASSOCIATED WITH IT. WILL LEAN TOWARDS THE GFS SOLUTION AND TPC 
GUIDANCE FOR THE TRACK OF THE TROPICAL LOW. WILL ONLY CARRY 20 POPS 
ACROSS THE SOUTHERN THIRD OF THE FORECAST AREA ON WEDNESDAY AND NOT 
CARRY ANY POPS ON THURSDAY. BEYOND THURSDAY...AN UPPER LEVEL RIDGE 
WILL MOVE EAST INTO THE MISSISSIPPI VALLEY BRINGING PRECIPITATION 
FREE WEATHER TO THE MID SOUTH INTO THE WEEKEND.

NO CHANGES MADE BEYOND THURSDAY.
$$

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.

FXUS64 KMEG 031839 RRA
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
200 PM CDT SUN JUL 3 2005

.DISCUSSION...
STATIONARY FRONT LOCATED TO THE SOUTH HAS TRIGGERED SOME ISOLATED 
SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS ACROSS PORTIONS OF NORTHEAST MISSISSIPPI. 
EXPECT ACTIVITY TO DIE OFF EARLY THIS EVENING SO WILL KEEP DRY 
FORECAST GOING. EXPECT MOSTLY CLEAR/PARTLY CLOUDY SKIES WITH TEMPERATURES 
FALLING INTO THE 70S FOR THE MOST PART. 

FRONT WILL STILL BE HUNG UP SOUTH OF THE CWA TOMORROW. EXPECT A FEW 
SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS TO DEVELOP OVER NORTHEAST MISSISSIPPI 
DURING THE AFTERNOON HOURS. ELSEWHERE CAN EXPECT DRY BUT HOT WEATHER 
FOR THE HOLIDAY. EXPECT HIGHS IN THE MID TO UPPER 90S.

A COLD FRONT CURRENTLY LOCATED ACROSS WESTERN IOWA...SOUTHEASTERN 
NEBRASKA...AND CENTRAL KANSAS WILL BEGIN TO MOVE INTO NORTHWESTERN 
PORTIONS OF THE MIDSOUTH MONDAY NIGHT. EXPECT A LINE OF SHOWERS AND 
THUNDERSTORMS TO DEVELOP ALONG THE FRONT. A FEW THUNDERSTORMS COULD 
BE SEVERE WITH DAMAGING WINDS AND LARGE HAIL BEING THE MAIN THREAT. 
WILL GO WITH AT LEAST 40/50 POPS ACROSS NORTHWESTERN HALF OF CWA.

FRONT WILL CONTINUE PUSHING THROUGH AREA ON TUESDAY. THE 
SOUTHEASTERN HALF OF CWA...WILL SEE THE BEST CHANCES OF SHOWERS AND 
THUNDERSTORMS. WILL GO WITH 40 POPS IN THIS AREA. MODELS ARE NOW 
SHOWING FRONT PUSHING ALL THE WAY TO THE GULF OF MEXICO INSTEAD OF 
STALLING OUT OVER THE CWA. THIS WOULD ALLOW HIGH PRESSURE TO REBUILD 
INTO THE AREA...BRINGING DRY CONDITIONS BACK TO THE ENTIRE MIDSOUTH. 
TOO EARLY TO PULL POPS OUT OF FORECAST ENTIRELY...THUS WILL KEEP 
SLIGHT CHANCE/CHANCE POPS ACROSS SOUTHERN SECTIONS OF MIDSOUTH 
THROUGH THE ENTIRE FORECAST PERIOD.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
411 AM CDT SUN JUL 3 2005

.DISCUSSION...
ANOTHER QUIET NIGHT WEATHERWISE ACROSS THE MIDSOUTH. SOME MID AND
HIGH LEVEL CLOUDS ARE SPREADING ACROSS MAINLY THE SOUTHEAST CORNER
OF THE MIDSOUTH IN ASSOCIATION WITH AN UPPER LEVEL TROUGH. OVERALL...
TODAY WILL BE ANOTHER HOT DAY WITH LITTLE IF ANY RAIN...POPS TOO LOW
TO MENTION IN THE ZONE FORECASTS. MEAN ATMOSPHERIC RELATIVE HUMIDITY
VALUES WILL REMAIN LOW. CAN NOT TOTALLY RULE OUT AN ISOLATED
THUNDERSTORM AROUND TUPELO SOUTHWARD WHERE THE MOISTURE IS FORECAST
TO BE SLIGHTLY HIGHER THAN ELSEWHERE...BUT THE CHANCE APPEARS TOO
SLIM TO MENTION IN THE FORECAST. MAXIMUM TEMPERATURES WILL CLIMB NEAR
OR SLIGHTLY ABOVE GUIDANCE VALUES WITH DROUGHT CONDITIONS CONTINUING.

LITTLE CHANGE IS SEEN FOR JULY 4TH DURING THE DAY. MOISTURE WILL
INCREASE SOME AND CAN NOT RULE OUT A FEW THUNDERSTORMS. HOWEVER...
WITH THE BERMUDA HIGH FORECAST TO STRENGTHEN ACROSS THE SOUTHEASTERN
UNITED STATES BY MONDAY WILL LEAVE OUT ANY CHANCE OF RAIN DURING THE
DAY MONDAY. HEAT INDEX READINGS WILL CLIMB TO NEAR 105 MONDAY
AFTERNOON FROM AROUND MEMPHIS SOUTHWARD ACROSS THE MISSISSIPPI
RIVER DELTA.

CHANGES WILL TAKE PLACE MONDAY NIGHT OFFERING A CHANCE FOR SOME
RAIN...AND A LITTLE COOLER TEMPERATURES. MODELS ARE IN FAIRLY GOOD
AGREEMENT THAT THE RIDGE WILL WEAKEN WITH A WEAK COLD FRONT MOVING
INTO THE MIDSOUTH FROM THE NORTHWEST MONDAY NIGHT. THE NAM
INDICATES A DECENT SHORT WAVE APPROACHING FROM THE WEST WHICH WILL
HELP TO INITIATE SCATTERED THUNDERSTORMS. A FEW OF THE THUNDERSTORMS
COULD BE STRONG TO SEVERE FROM NORTHEAST ARKANSAS INTO PART OF WEST
TENNESSEE MONDAY EVENING WITH DAMAGING WIND AND LARGE HAIL BEING THE
MAIN THREATS.

THE COLD FRONT IS FORECAST TO STALL WEST TO EAST ACROSS THE
MIDSOUTH TUESDAY INTO THE MIDDLE PART OF NEXT WEEK. THE NAM AND GFS
DIFFER ON EXACT PLACEMENT OF THE FRONT. NEVERTHELESS...THE FRONT WILL
BE IN THE VICINITY CONTINUING TO GIVE THE MIDSOUTH A CHANCE OF
THUNDERSTORMS.

BEST CHANCE OF RAIN TO THE CENTRAL PART OF CWA . AFTER 
TUESDAY...MODELS SHOWING THE FRONT MEANDERING OVER THE CWA THROUGH THE 
END OF THE FORECAST PERIOD. THIS KEEP CHANCES FOR RAIN IN THE 
FORECAST THROUGH SATURDAY. HARD TO PINPOINT THE BEST CHANCES FOR 
RAIN AND WHERE THE BEST CHANCES WILL OCCUR BUT DO EXPECT SCATTERED 
SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS TO DEVELOP DURING THE AFTERNOONS DUE TO 
DAYTIME HEATING. THE SHOWERS/THUNDERSTORMS SHOULD GRADUALLY DIE OUT 
DURING THE OVERNIGHT HOURS. WILL PUT CHANCE POPS DURING THE DAY WITH 
SLIGHT CHANCE POPS AT NIGHT. PRECIP AND CLOUD COVER WILL HOLD 
TEMPERATURES IN THE UPPER 80S TO LOWER 90S DURING THIS TIME. LOW 
TEMPERATURES WILL BE IN THE UPPER 60S TO LOWER 70S.

FXUS64 KMEG 020925
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
425 AM CDT SAT JUL 2 2005

.DISCUSSION...
A QUIET NIGHT WEATHERWISE ACROSS THE MIDSOUTH. ONLY PATCHY MID AND
HIGH LEVEL CLOUDS ARE BEING OBSERVED ACROSS THE MIDSOUTH WITH
SPOTTY FOG. LIGHT NORTHEAST WINDS ARE FEEDING IN SLIGHTLY DRIER AIR
AT THE SURFACE. ALSO THE WATER VAPOR SATELLITE IMAGERY INDICATES DRY
AIR AT THE MID AND UPPER LEVELS SPREADING ACROSS THE MIDSOUTH FROM
THE WEST.

THE WEAK COLD FRONT THAT MOVED INTO THE MIDSOUTH LAST NIGHT HAS
JUST ABOUT WASHED OUT AND IS DIFFICULT TO LOCATE. REMNANTS OF THE
FRONT WILL LIE ACROSS SOUTHERN PARTS OF NORTH MS THIS AFTERNOON.
WILL LEAVE IN A 20 PERCENT CHANCE OF AFTERNOON THUNDERSTORMS FOR
THAT PART OF NORTHEAST MS GENERALLY NEAR TUPELO AND SOUTHWARD.
MOISTURE AND INSTABILITY FORECAST FOR THIS AFTERNOON COMBINED WITH
CLOSENESS OF THE FRONT INDICATE MARGINAL CONDITIONS FOR ISOLATED
THUNDERSTORMS THIS AFTERNOON.

MODELS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT IN THE SHORT TERM. MEAN ATMOSPHERIC
RELATIVE HUMIDITY VALUES WILL BE LOW ACROSS THE MIDSOUTH TONIGHT
INTO INDEPENDENCE DAY. THUS A CONTINUED FORECAST OF NO RAIN STILL
LOOKS GOOD. TEMPERATURES WILL BE ON THE REBOUND SUNDAY AND MONDAY
WITH H5 HEIGHTS INCREASING ACROSS THE MIDSOUTH. 850 MB TEMPERATURES
ARE FORECAST BY THE NAM TO CLIMB TO AROUND 22 DEGREES C MONDAY
AFTERNOON ACROSS THE NORTHWEST HALF OF THE MIDSOUTH. WE INCREASED THE
FORECAST MAXIMUM TEMPERATURES A LITTLE FOR MONDAY...BUT THIS STILL
MAY NOT BE HIGH ENOUGH CONSIDERING THE DROUGHT CONDITIONS WE ARE
IN. IF HIGHS NEED TO BE INCREASED FURTHER FOR JULY 4TH...THEN HEAT
INDEX VALUES COULD CLIMB TO AROUND 105 FOR PARTS OF THE AREA...SO
THIS WILL NEED TO BE MONITORED CLOSELY.

MODELS ARE INDICATING THE RIDGING WEAKENING SOME OVER THE MIDSOUTH
TUESDAY AND BEYOND WITH A WEAK COLD FRONT PUSHING INTO THE AREA FROM
THE NORTH. HOWEVER...THE 00Z NAM WAS HOLDING THE RIDGE STRONGER
OVER THE MIDSOUTH THAN THE GFS. ATTM...WILL CONTINUE WITH SLIGHT
CHANCE POPS. WILL BE KEEPING AN EYE ON THE TROPICAL WAVE FORECAST TO
MOVE FROM THE NORTHWEST CARIBBEAN INTO THE GULF EARLY NEXT WEEK FOR
ANY DEVELOPMENT. TOO SOON TO TELL IF THIS WILL BRING US ANY
MOISTURE..BUT SOMETHING TO WATCH.

$$

FXUS64 KMEG 010924
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
424 AM CDT FRI JUL 1 2005

.DISCUSSION...
THE WEATHER PATTERN IS CHANGING SOMEWHAT FROM THE VERY HOT AND DRY
PATTERN OBSERVED RECENTLY...AT LEAST FOR THE SHORT TERM. THE UPPER
LEVEL RIDGE THAT HAS DOMINATED OUR WEATHER HAS RETROGRADED WESTWARD
LEAVING THE MIDSOUTH IN NORTHWEST FLOW ALOFT. A COLD FRONT STRETCHES
FROM CENTRAL MO INTO NORTHERN OK THIS MORNING. THIS FRONT WILL PUSH
INTO THE MIDSOUTH DURING THE DAY. THUNDERSTORM COMPLEXES HAVE
DEVELOPED AHEAD OF THIS FRONT. ONE MCS MOVED INTO NORTHEAST AR AND
WEST TN OVERNIGHT..BUT GRADUALLY DISSIPATED. ANOTHER MCS IS MOVING
SOUTHEASTWARD THROUGH NORTHERN AR. THIS MCS IS TRYING TO BUILD BACK
TO THE WEST...BUT WILL LIKELY AFFECT PARTS OF EAST AR THIS MORNING.
OUTFLOW BOUNDARIES FROM THESE CONVECTIVE COMPLEXES ALONG WITH THE
COLD FRONT WILL COMBINE WITH AN UNSTABLE ATMOSPHERE (CAPES 1500 TO
2500 J/KG) ACROSS THE MIDSOUTH TO PRODUCE SCATTERED THUNDERSTORMS
TODAY. ISOLATED PULSE-TYPE THUNDERSTORMS JUST ABOUT ANYWHERE ACROSS
THE MIDSOUTH COULD CAUSE DAMAGING WINDS AND LARGE HAIL. HOWEVER...THE
STORM PREDICTION CENTER SHOWS THE BEST CHANCE OF SEVERE WEATHER FROM
NORTH MS INTO EAST-CENTRAL AR LATER TODAY AHEAD OF THE APPROACHING
COLD FRONT. MAXIMUM TEMPERATURES WILL BE SUPPRESSED SOME FROM RECENT
DAYS BY MORE CLOUDS AND THE SCATTERED THUNDERSTORMS...ALTHOUGH IT
WILL STILL BE HOT OUTSIDE OF THE RAIN AREAS.

WILL MAKE ONLY MINOR IF ANY CHANGES TO THE ONGOING FORECAST / GRIDS
TONIGHT AND BEYOND. THE LATEST GFS IS NOT INDICATING THE COLD
FRONT WILL MAKE IT AS FAR SOUTH AS EARLIER EXPECTED AND AS FAR SOUTH
AS FORECAST BY THE LATEST NAM. AS A RESULT...LATER FORECASTS MAY NEED
TO RAISE POPS ACROSS PARTS OF NORTH MS FOR SATURDAY...AND INCLUDE
THEM FOR PARTS OF NORTH MS ON SUNDAY. ATTM...DUE TO THE
UNCERTAINTY...WILL LET LATER SHIFTS TAKE A LOOK AT FURTHER MODEL
RUNS TO SEE IF THESE ADJUSTMENTS WILL BE NEEDED. INDEPENDENCE DAY
LOOKS HOT AND MAINLY DRY AS THE BERMUDA HIGH BUILDS OVER THE
MIDSOUTH...ALTHOUGH CAN NOT RULE OUT AN ISOLATED THUNDERSTORM.

$$

THE GFS SHOWS FRONT NOT EXITING MIDSOUTH UNTIL SATURDAY AFTERNOON. 
CURRENT FORECAST HAS PRECIP IN UNTIL SATURDAY SO WILL KEEP AS IS FOR 
NOW.

DRY AND SLIGHTLY COOLER CONDITIONS FOR REST OF THE HOLIDAY WEEKEND. 
EXPECT HIGH TEMPERATURES IN THE UPPER 80S TO LOWER 90S WITH LOWS IN 
THE 60S TO LOWER 70S.

FRONT STALLING OUT OVER CWA THROUGH THE END OF THE FORECAST PERIOD. 
THIS WILL BRING SMALL CHANCES FOR SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS TO THE 
MIDSOUTH DURING THIS TIME. WILL ADD 20 POPS TO THE FORECAST.

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 300922
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
422 AM CDT THU JUN 30 2005

.DISCUSSION...

AN UPPER RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE WILL REMAIN OVER THE MID-SOUTH FOR
ONE MORE DAY...ALLOWING FOR ANOTHER HAZY...HOT...AND SEASONABLY
HUMID DAY. THE UPPER RIDGING SHOULD SUPPRESS MOST CLOUD COVER...
ALTHOUGH SOME CU AND AN ISOLATED SHOWER CANNOT BE RULED OUT THIS
AFTERNOON WITH PEAK HEATING...ALTHOUGH PRECIPITATION COVERAGE
SHOULD REMAIN VERY LOW AND WILL BE LEFT OUT OF THE FORECAST.
TEMPERATURES WILL ONCE AGAIN REACH THE MID TO UPPER 90S AREAWIDE...
WITH A FEW LOCATIONS POSSIBLY TOUCHING THE CENTURY MARK. 850 MB
TEMPERATURES BETWEEN 20C EAST AND 22C WEST SUPPORT THESE TYPE OF
TEMPERATURES AND WITH ONLY SCATTERED CU SHOULD ALLOW MAXIMUM
FORECAST TEMPERATURES TO BE REACHED. THESE TEMPERATURES COMBINED
WITH THE HUMIDITY WILL ONCE AGAIN SEND HEAT INDICES TO BETWEEN 105
AND 107 DEGREES THIS AFTERNOON. HEAT WILL ONCE AGAIN BE HIGHLIGHTED
IN THE HWO FOR TODAY.

THE UPPER RIDGE WILL BEGIN TO BREAK DOWN TONIGHT AS AN UPPER LEVEL
TROUGH OVER THE NORTHERN PLAINS STATES THIS MORNING MOVES EAST
ACROSS THE GREAT LAKES FRIDAY AND INTO THE NORTHEAST U.S. FOR THE
FIRST PART OF THE WEEKEND. NORTHERN PORTIONS OF THE AREA SHOULD
BEGIN TO SEE SOME UPPER LEVEL HEIGHT FALLS LATER TONIGHT AND ACROSS
THE ENTIRE AREA ON FRIDAY. IN ADDITION...THE UPPER TROUGH WILL HELP
TO SEND A COLD FRONT ACROSS THE MID-SOUTH FRIDAY THROUGH SATURDAY.
EXPECT SCATTERED SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS TO DEVELOP OVER MAINLY
NORTHERN PORTIONS OF THE AREA TONIGHT AND AREAWIDE ON FRIDAY.
ALTHOUGH THE BEST LAPSE RATES REMAIN TO OUR NORTH...CLOSER TO THE
UPPER TROUGH...GOOD SURFACE HEATING AND SUFFICIENT LOW LEVEL MOISTURE
SHOULD ALLOW FOR MODERATE INSTABILITY LEVELS. THIS WILL SUPPORT
ISOLATED SEVERE THUNDERSTORMS...WITH LOCALIZED STRONG WINDS AND
HAIL...ON FRIDAY...WITH PULSE-TYPE CHARACTERISTICS. NOT EXPECTING
WIDESPREAD SEVERE AT THIS TIME...WITH ATMOSPHERIC SHEAR REMAINING
WEAK. WILL HIGHLIGHT THIS MARGINAL SEVERE THREAT IN HWO. A FEW
SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS WILL BE POSSIBLE AGAIN ON SATURDAY ACROSS
EXTREME SOUTHERN PORTIONS OF THE AREA AS THE FRONT BEGINS TO STALL
AND EVENTUALLY WASH OUT BY SUNDAY.

SUNDAY SHOULD BE A DRIER AND SLIGHTLY COOLER AND LESS HUMID DAY
BEHIND THE FRONT...WITH SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE MOVING EAST ACROSS
THE AREA. THE SURFACE HIGH SHOULD MOVE EAST OF THE AREA BY MONDAY...
ALLOWING LOW LEVEL WINDS TO RETURN OUT OF THE SOUTH. IN ADDITION...
UPPER LEVEL RIDGING WILL BUILD BACK OVER THE MID-SOUTH FOR THE
FIRST PART OF NEXT WEEK. THIS MEANS A RETURN TO SUMMERTIME WEATHER...
WITH INCREASING TEMPERATURES AND HUMIDITY LEVELS. THINK DAYTIME
CONVECTION WILL BE HELD TO A MINIMUM ON MONDAY AND TUESDAY
AFTERNOONS...WITH THE DEGREE OF UPPER RIDGING. SLIGHT CHANCES FOR
THUNDERSTORMS WILL RETURN BY THE MIDDLE OF NEXT WEEK...AS MODELS
ARE ADVERTISING ANOTHER COLD FRONT APPROACHING THE AREA.

$$

256 PM CDT WED JUN 29 2005

.DISCUSSION...

A FEW ISOLATED THUNDERSTORMS HAVE POPPED UP THIS AFTERNOON DURING

FRONT NOW LOCATED ACROSS EASTERN NEBRASKA INTO NORTHWEST KANSAS.
THERE WILL BE A FEW ISOLATED THUNDERSTORMS DURING THE EARLY EVENING
HOURS BUT THEY SHOULD DISSIPATE QUICKLY. ANOTHER WARM HAZY NIGHT ON
TAP AS HIGH PRESSURE REMAINS IN CONTROL. COLD FRONT WILL MOVE SLOWLY
TOWARD THE REGION AND BY THURSDAY AFTERNOON MAY SPREAD SOME
THUNDERSTORMS INTO THE NORTHERN PART OF THE FORECAST AREA SO HAVE
KEPT 20 POPS IN FOR ROUGHLY THE NORTHERN HALF. IN ADDITION TO THE
SMALL CHANCE OF RAIN THERE SHOULD BE MORE CLOUDS THURSDAY THAN TODAY
WHICH WILL HELP KEEP TEMPERATURES FROM GETTING ANY HIGHER THAN THIS
AFTERNOONS READING SO WE SHOULD STAY IN THE MID TO UPPER 90S. BY
THURSDAY NIGHT FRONT WILL BE CLOSE ENOUGH THAT WE SHOULD SEE SOME
SCATTERED THUNDERSTORMS ACROSS THE REGION. SPC HAS NORTHERN HALF OF
THE FORECAST AREA IN A SLIGHT RISK FOR THURSDAY AND CANT RULE OUT A
SEVERE STORM OR TWO. MODELS TRY TO BRING THE FRONT THROUGH REGION
FRIDAY SO HAVE KEPT CHANCE POPS FOR FRIDAY AND FRIDAY NIGHT WITH
SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR SATURDAY. BEHIND THE FRONT TEMPERATURES WILL
BE ABOUT 5 DEGREES COOLER FOR FRIDAY. SATURDAY NIGHT AND SUNDAY WILL
BE DRY BUT THEN WE RETURN TO MORE OF THE DIURNAL CONVECTIVE PATTERN
FOR THE BEGINNING OF NEXT WEEK.

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 290857
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
357 AM CDT WED JUN 29 2005

.DISCUSSION...

ANOTHER CALM WEATHER NIGHT HAS BEEN EXPERIENCED ACROSS THE MID-SOUTH
TONIGHT...WITH CLEAR SKIES...LIGHT WINDS...AND TEMPERATURES
REMAINING WARM IN THE 70S. AREAS OF FOG AND HAZE ALSO PERSIST
AREAWIDE...WITH SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE TO OUR EAST CONTINUING TO
DOMINATE THE WEATHER PICTURE.

ANOTHER HOT AND HAZY DAY IS ON TAP FOR THE MID-SOUTH TODAY AND
SHOULD PERSIST THROUGH MOST OF THURSDAY...AS UPPER LEVEL RIDGING
CONTINUES TO BUILD OVER THE AREA. VERY WARM 850 MB TEMPERATURES
APPROACHING 20C EASTERN AREAS AND 22C WESTERN AREAS WILL SUPPORT
HIGH TEMPERATURES INTO THE MID TO UPPER 90S. THINK MOST AREAS WILL
REALIZE THESE HIGH TEMPERATURES THIS AFTERNOON AS ONLY EXPECTING
SOME CU DEVELOPMENT THIS AFTERNOON AND EVEN THOUGH AN ISOLATED
THUNDERSTORM MAY DEVELOP...OVERALL COVERAGE SHOULD REMAIN LOW
(BELOW 14%). THURSDAY WILL SEE SIMILAR CONDITIONS...SO ONCE AGAIN
EXPECTING MID TO UPPER 90S. TEMPERATURES MAY BE KNOCKED DOWN A FEW
DEGREES BY LATE AFTERNOON ACROSS NORTHERN AREAS...AS ISOLATED
THUNDERSTORMS AND INCREASED CLOUD COVER WILL BE POSSIBLE. IN
ADDITION TO THE HOT TEMPERATURES...HUMIDITY LEVELS SHOULD REMAIN
SEASONABLY HIGH. THIS WILL LEAD TO HEAT INDICES IN THE 100 TO 105
DEGREE RANGE. PLAN TO HIGHLIGHT HEAT ONCE AGAIN IN THE HWO.

AN UPPER LEVEL TROUGH OVER THE NORTHERN ROCKIES TODAY WILL PROGRESS
EAST ACROSS THE NORTHERN PLAINS AND INTO THE GREAT LAKES REGION
THROUGH FRIDAY. THIS WILL HELP TO SEND A COLD FRONT ACROSS THE MID-
SOUTH DURING THE THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY TIME FRAME. MODELS
HAVE TRENDED FASTER AND FURTHER SOUTH WITH THE FRONTAL PASSAGE...
SENDING IT TO A POSITION SOUTH OF THE REGION BY SATURDAY NIGHT.
HAVE KEPT 20 POPS ACROSS NORTHERN AREAS FOR THURSDAY AFTERNOON...30
POPS NORTH HALF / 20 POPS SOUTH THURSDAY NIGHT. RAISED POPS TO 40
EVERYWHERE FRIDAY WITH FRONTAL PASSAGE AND KEPT 20 POPS SATURDAY TO
ACCOUNT FOR POSSIBLE TIMING ISSUES. SATURDAY POPS MAY NEED TO BE
REMOVED IF CURRENT MODEL TRENDS CONTINUE...BUT WILL HOLD OFF FOR
NOW UNTIL TRENDS CONTINUE A FEW MORE CYCLES. THINK AT THIS TIME THE
POTENTIAL EXISTS FOR A FEW STRONG STORMS NORTHERN AREAS THURSDAY
EVENING AND AREAWIDE FRIDAY. STRONG INSTABILITY AND STEEPENING MID-
LEVEL LAPSE RATES MAY SUPPORT STRONG PULSE-TYPE STORMS. WILL ALSO
HIGHLIGHT THIS THREAT IN HWO.

THE COLD FRONT SHOULD BEGIN TO WASH OUT TO OUR SOUTH ON SUNDAY...AND
WITH DRIER AIRMASS EXPECTED OVER THE AREA...WILL KEEP SUNDAY DRY
AND A BIT COOLER AND LESS HUMID. LOW LEVEL SOUTHERLY FLOW RETURNS
FOR THE BEGINNING OF NEXT WEEK...SO EXPECT A RETURN OF MORE TYPICAL
SUMMERTIME WEATHER...WITH INCREASING TEMPERATURES AND HUMIDITY
LEVELS ALONG WITH ISOLATED DAILY CHANCES FOR SHOWERS AND
THUNDERSTORMS.

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 280852
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
352 AM CDT TUE JUN 28 2005

.DISCUSSION...

SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE IS IN PLACE ACROSS THE MID-SOUTH THIS MORNING
WITH MOSTLY CLEAR SKIES AND TEMPERATURES REMAINING IN THE LOWER
70S AND DEWPOINTS AROUND 70. WITH SAME AIRMASS IN PLACE...HAVE
CONTINUED TO SEE HAZE AND SOME FOG...AND THIS SHOULD CONTINUE
THROUGH THE MORNING HOURS.

THE SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE SYSTEM SHOULD REMAIN IN PLACE WITH A
WEAKENING UPPER LEVEL TROUGH REMAINING STRETCHED ACROSS THE AREA
TODAY. THIS UPPER TROUGH ALONG WITH RELATIVELY MOIST AIRMASS AND
DAYTIME HEATING SHOULD LEAD TO THE DEVELOPMENT OF ISOLATED SHOWERS
AND THUNDERSTORMS THIS AFTERNOON. THE OVERALL COVERAGE SHOULD BE
LESS THAN THE PAST COUPLE OF DAYS...AS THE UPPER LEVEL SYSTEM
CONTINUES TO WEAKEN. ALSO...BEST COVERAGE (ALTHOUGH STILL ISOLATED)
SHOULD BE ACROSS EASTERN SECTIONS. WITH LESS CLOUD COVER AND STORM
COVERAGE...EXPECT TEMPERATURES TO BE A FEW DEGREES WARMER THAN
YESTERDAYS READINGS...WITH LOW TO MID 90S AREAS ALONG AND WEST OF
THE MISSISSIPPI RIVER...WITH SLIGHTLY COOLER READINGS TO THE EAST
(AROUND 90 TO LOW 90S). THE OVERALL SURFACE GRADIENT SHOULD REMAIN
WEAK...SO WITH LIGHT WINDS AND SAME AIRMASS IN PLACE...SHOULD SEE
MORE IN THE WAY OF HAZY SKIES THIS AFTERNOON.

THE WEAK UPPER TROUGH SHOULD MOVE EAST OF THE AREA BY WEDNESDAY...
WITH UPPER LEVEL RIDGING BUILDING OVER THE AREA ALONG WITH
INCREASING 850 MB TEMPERATURES. THIS UPPER RIDGE WILL REMAIN OVER
THE AREA INTO THURSDAY. THIS MEANS MOSTLY DRY CONDITIONS FOR
WEDNESDAY INTO MIDDAY THURSDAY. CANNOT COMPLETELY RULE OUT AN
ISOLATED THUNDERSTORM OVER EASTERN SECTIONS ON WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON...
BUT BELIEVE COVERAGE WILL REMAIN LIMITED (14% OR LESS). TEMPERATURES
WILL ALSO BECOME EVEN HOTTER FOR MID WEEK...WITH MID TO UPPER 90S
COMMON ON WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY...ESPECIALLY OVER THE WESTERN HALF
OF THE AREA WHERE SOILS ARE VERY DRY DUE TO ONGOING DROUGHT
CONDITIONS. 850 MB TEMPERATURES SUPPORT THESE HOT TEMPERATURES AS
WELL WITH MODELS INDICATING 18C EAST TO 21C WEST ON WEDNESDAY AND
20C EAST TO 22C WEST ON THURSDAY. BOTTOM LINE...IT WILL BE HAZY AND
HOT FOR WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY...AND HIGH HUMIDITY LEVELS WILL MAKE
THINGS FEEL EVEN HOTTER WITH HEAT INDICES RANGING FROM 100-105
DEGREES DURING THE AFTERNOON HOURS.

FOR THE END OF THE WEEK...A SHORTWAVE TROUGH NOW OVER THE PACIFIC
NORTHWEST IS FORECAST TO MOVE EAST ACROSS THE NORTHERN PLAINS
STATES AND INTO THE GREAT LAKES REGION. THIS UPPER SYSTEM WILL HELP
TO SEND A COLD FRONT TOWARDS THE AREA LATER THURSDAY AFTERNOON AND
INTO THURSDAY NIGHT. EXPECT CHANCES FOR SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS
TO BEGIN TO INCREASE...ESPECIALLY ACROSS NORTHERN SECTIONS
THURSDAY AFTERNOON AND NIGHT. THE ATMOSPHERE WILL BECOME
INCREASINGLY UNSTABLE DURING THIS TIME PERIOD...WITH INCREASING CAPE
VALUES AND STEEPENING LAPSE RATES...CANNOT RULE OUT A FEW STRONG
PULSE-TYPE THUNDERSTORMS IN NORTHERN AREAS.

THIS FRONT IS FORECAST TO STALL ACROSS THE AREA FOR FRIDAY AND INTO
THE FIRST PART OF THE WEEKEND. IN ADDITION...THE UPPER FLOW IS
FORECAST TO TURN MORE NORTHWESTERLY ON FRIDAY AND SATURDAY. THIS
PATTERN MAY SUPPORT THE DEVELOPMENT OF A FEW MCS THAT WOULD BE
DIRECTED THROUGH THE MID-SOUTH. A BIT TOO EARLY TO SAY FOR SURE...BUT
WITH THE FRONT IN THE AREA AND THE NAM/GFS/ECMWF HINTING AT THIS
SCENARIO...THOUGHT IT PRUDENT TO UP POPS FOR THE FRIDAY THROUGH
SATURDAY TIME FRAME.

UPPER RIDGING WILL BUILD BACK OVER THE AREA FOR THE END OF THE
WEEKEND AND THE 4TH OF JULY HOLIDAY...WITH DECREASING RAIN CHANCES
AND INCREASING TEMPERATURES.

&&

INTO WRN SXNS DURING THE AFTN SO HIGH TEMPS WL START TO REBOUND WITH 
LOWER 90S WEST OF THE MS RIVER.

SUSPICIOUS AND WL BE IGNORED FOR NOW. BY WED THE UPPER TROF SHIFTS 
INTO MID TN WITH HIGHEST POPS ACRS ERN SXNS...DISSIPATING DURING THE 
EVENING. AS SW SFC GRADIENT DEVELOPS MUCH WARMER AND DRIER AIR WL 
CONT TO WORK INTO WRN SXNS OF THE CWFA. EXPECT MID 90S ACRS THE WRN 
HALF OF THE AREA WITH LOWER 90S TO THE EAST WED AFTN.

THU WL BE QUITE WARM WITH WSW SFC FLOW. MAYBE A FEW AFTN TSTMS BUT 
FOR THE MOST PART DRY. TEMPS WL ONCE AGAIN CLIMB INTO THE MID 90S 
WRN SXNS.

LAKES WITH ASSOCD COLD FRONT PERHAPS MOVING INTO THE AREA. REPEATING 
MCS DEVELOPMENT A POSSIBILITY BUT THERE CONTINUES TO BE SOME 
UNCERTAINTY WITH THIS FEATURE. WL CONT LOW POP FORECAST THROUGH

FXUS64 KMEG 270132
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
833 PM CDT SUN JUN 26 2005

.DISCUSSION...LATEST UPPER AIR ANALYSIS DEPICTS INVERTED TROUGH 
EXTENDING FROM UPPER LEVEL LOW ACROSS THE GULF OF MEXICO. WSR-88D 
TRENDS THE PAST FEW HOURS THIS EVENING HAVE SHOWN A DECREASE IN 
INTENSITY OF CONVECTION WITH ONLY RAIN SHOWERS ACROSS NORTHWEST 
TENNESSEE AND ELEVATED THUNDER NEAR THE TENNESSEE/ALABAMA STATE LINE. 
VISIBLE/IR SATELLITE IMAGERY SHOWS CLOUD TOPS WARMING ACROSS THE 
FORECAST AREA. MAIN FORECAST CONCERN FOR OVERNIGHT WILL BE 
PRECIPITATION CHANCES. 

FORECAST MODEL SOUNDINGS INDICATE INSTABILITY WILL WEAKEN OVERNIGHT 
ALONG WITH MID-LEVEL /850-700 AND 700-500 MB/ LAPSE RATES DROPPING 
DOWN TO NEAR 5 C/KM WITH ANY INSTABILITY REMAINING ELEVATED. UPDATE 
WILL BE ISSUED TO LOWER POPS OVERNIGHT TO ISOLATED AND ADJUST CLOUD 
COVER...TEMPERATURES...AND WINDS BASED UPON CURRENT TRENDS. 

GRIDS WILL BE PUBLISHED SHORTLY.

CJC

.PREV DISCUSSION...ISSUED 153 PM CDT SUN JUN 26 2005...

AN UPPER LOW IS OVER SOUTHERN MISSISSIPPI THIS AFTERNOON. A TROUGH 
EXTENDS NORTHWARD FROM THE LOW. AN AREA OF SCATTERED TO NUMEROUS 
SHOWERS AND THUNDERSHOWERS IS ASSOCIATED WITH THIS TROUGH. AFTERNOON 
HEATING HAS GREATLY AIDED THE COVERAGE OF THESE STORMS. THESE 
STORMS ARE NOT EXPECTED TO REACH SEVERE CRITERIA ALTHOUGH VERY 
IMPRESSIVE AND FREQUENT LIGHTNING ALONG WITH HEAVY DOWNPOURS HAS 
ACCOMPANIED THESE STORMS. THE COVERAGE SHOULD GRADUALLY DIMINISH 
THIS EVENING AS HEATING DIMINISHES BUT THE TROUGH WILL STILL REMAIN 
IN THE VICINITY KEEPING THE THREAT FOR CONVECTION IN TONIGHT. 

THE UPPER LOW WILL MOVE OVER THE REGION TOMORROW. WIND FIELDS ARE SO 
WEAK THAT IT IS REALLY DIFFICULT TO PINPOINT EXACTLY WHERE OR WHEN 
CONVECTION WILL BREAK OUT. SO HAVE BROADBRUSHED THE AREA WITH 40 
POPS. EXPECT A FAIR AMOUNT OF CLOUDS...PARTLY TO MOSTLY CLOUDY WHICH 
SHOULD KEEP THE TEMPS DOWN A LITTLE.

THE LOW MOVES OFF TO THE NORTH ON TUESDAY BUT A TROUGH STILL REMAINS 
BEHIND. THIS COULD BE A FOCUS FOR THUNDERSTORMS ONCE AGAIN ON 
TUESDAY. MID WEEK LOOKS LIKE A RETURN TO THE TYPICAL SUMMER PATTERN 
FOR A COUPLE OF DAYS WITH WARM TEMPS AND AFTERNOON THUNDERSTORMS 
POSSIBLE. THE COVERAGE SHOULDNT BE AS GREAT WITH THE GFS SHOWING 
SOME DRIER AIR ADVECTING IN FROM THE SOUTHWEST. TOWARDS THE END OF 
THE WEEK AND OVER THE WEEKEND...A FRONT IS EXPECTED TO AT LEAST 
APPROACH THE REGION FROM THE NORTH. IF THE GFS IS CORRECT AND IT 
STALLS OUT OVER THE REGION...THIS COULD RESULT IN DAILY MCS 
DEVELOPMENT ALONG THE FRONT. AM LEARY OF THE SOLUTION AND THUS 
HESITANT TO GO WITH MORE THAN 20 POPS SINCE THE GFS HASNT BEEN VERY 
CONSISTENT AS TO WHERE THE FRONT WILL STALL OUT. 

VALLE

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.

$$





FXUS64 KMEG 261513
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
1013 AM CDT SUN JUN 26 2005

.DISCUSSION...

AN UPPER LOW IS OVER SOUTHERN MISSISSIPPI THIS MORNING. A TROUGH 
EXTENDS NORTHEASTWARD FROM THE LOW. AN AREA OF SCATTERED SHOWERS AND 
THUNDERSHOWERS IS ASSOCIATED WITH THIS TROUGH. MODELS AND RADAR 
TRENDS SHOW THE TROUGH AND ASSOCIATED CONVECTION CONTINUING TO MOVE 
WEST THIS AFTERNOON ALTHOUGH WEAKENING SOMEWHAT. HAVE RAISED POPS 
ALONG AND EAST OF THE MISSISSIPPI RIVER IN ANTICIPATION OF THIS 
CONVECTION. ALTHOUGH STILL BELIEVE THAT IT WILL REMAIN SCATTERED. 
INCREASED CLOUD COVER DUE TO SATELLITE TRENDS EAST OF MEMPHIS 
DYERSBURG AND CLARKSDALE. ALSO LOWERED HIGH TEMPS IN THOSE AREAS AS 
WELL DUE TO CLOUD COVER.

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 260653
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
155 AM CDT SUN JUN 26 2005

.DISCUSSION...
UPPER LOW OVER THE CNTRL GULF COAST THIS MORNING WITH SCT TSTMS 
MOVING ACRS NRN AL TOWARD NE MS. ELSW ACRS THE REGION...CLEAR SKIES 
AND MILD TEMPS WITH 3-5 MILES IN HAZE AND FOG. 

UPPER LOW WILL SLOWLY RETROGRADE WEST INTO MS/AL BY LATE TODAY. WITH 
MOISTURE INCREASING AND THE PERSISTENT CAP AROUND 600 MB FINALLY 
WEAKENING EXPECT MORE SHOWER/TSTM COVERAGE TODAY. EXPECT GREATEST 
COVERAGE ACRS AREAS CLOSEST TO UPPER LOW WITH 50 POPS ACRS NE MS 
DECREASING TO 20 POPS AS YOU HEAD NW TOWARD JBR. UPPER LOW WILL 
IMPACT HIGH TEMPS ACRS NE MS WITH READINGS IN THE UPPER 80S WHILE 
TEMPS SHOULD STILL CLIMB INTO THE MID 90S ACRS NE AR AND THE MO 
BOOTHEEL WHERE MORE SUNSHINE/LESS PRECIP IS FORECAST. 

EXPECT CONVECTION TO DIMINISH THIS EVENING AS HEATING ENDS THOUGH 
STILL A SMALL CHANCE THROUGHOUT THE NIGHT WITH UPPER FEATURE OVER 
THE REGION. MILD OVERNIGHT LOWS ONCE AGAIN. 

UPPER LOW CENTERED OVER THE REGION ON MONDAY. EXPECT SCT 
SHOWERS/TSTMS TO REDEVELOP DURING THE DAY. CLOUDS AND PRECIP WL 
RESULT IN SLIGHTLY COOLER TEMPS...THOUGH STILL MUGGY...WITH 
READINGS IN THE UPPER 80S EAST TO AROUND 90 WEST. 

TUE AND WED THE UPPER TROF STARTS SLOWLY LIFTING NE.  BEST PRECIP 
CHANCES ACRS ERN SXNS OF THE FORECAST AREA TUE/WED AFTN. TEMPS WL 
START TO REBOUND AS LOWER MEAN RH VALUES WORK IN FROM THE WEST BY 
WED. HIGH TEMPS WL BE BACK IN THE MID 90S WEST OF THE RIVER BY WED 
AFTN.

THU INTO THE WEEKEND...UPPER FLOW BECOMING MORE ZONAL ACRS THE 
REGION AS TROF MOVES THROUGH THE GREAT LAKES PUSHING A COLD FRONT 
SOUTH INTO THE OH VALLEY BY FRI MORNING. HOW FAR SOUTH THIS FRONT 
ENDS UP IS STILL IN QUESTION. WL CONT SMALL POPS INTO THE WEEKEND 
WITH THIS FEATURE. 

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.

$$

SJM










000 
FXUS64 KMEG 260158
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
857 PM CDT SAT JUN 25 2005

.DISCUSSION...LATEST INFRARED SATELLITE AND RADAR TRENDS SHOW 
DIURNAL PULSE CONVECTION HAS DIMINISHED ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA 
THIS EVENING WITH THE LOSS OF DAYTIME HEATING. 00Z UPPER AIR 
ANALYSIS DEPICTS A WEAK INVERTED MID LEVEL TROUGH MOVING ACROSS THE 
MID SOUTH...BUT I/M NOT ANTICIPATING ANY RAINFALL WITH THIS FEATURE 
AS IT WILL CONTINUE TO MOVE WEST OF THE FORECAST AREA OVERNIGHT AND 
THE LOSS OF INSTABILITY. NEXT CHANCE OF RAIN WILL COME AS NEXT SPOKE 
OF ENERGY FROM RETROGRADING LOW AFFECTS THE AREA DURING THE DAY ON 
SUNDAY. CURRENT FORECAST IN GRIDS HANDLED WELL AND WILL NOT MAKE ANY 
CHANGES WITH LOWS SIMILAR TO PAST NIGHT OR TWO. 

CJC 

.PREV DISCUSSION...ISSUED 204 PM CDT SAT JUN 25 2005.

WATER VAPOR SHOWS A WEAK UPPER LOW NEAR THE COAST OF MISSISSIPPI 
THIS AFTERNOON. SPOKES OF ENERGY ARE COMING OFF OF THE LOW AND 
COMBINED WITH THE AFTERNOON HEATING HAVE RESULTED IN A FEW ISOLATED 
SHOWERS AND THUNDERSHOWERS. THESE THUNDERSHOWERS WILL LIKELY 
DISSIPATE TOWARDS SUNSET. EXPECT TONIGHT/S FORECAST TO BE VERY 
SIMILAR TO LAST NIGHT.

ON SUNDAY THE UPPER LOW WILL APPROACH THE REGION. THIS WILL RESULT 
IN A BETTER CHANCE FOR THUNDERSTORMS ESPECIALLY OVER WEST TN AND 
NORTH MS. THE CAP AT 600MB WHICH HAS BEEN INHIBITING CONVECTION 
SOMEWHAT WILL BE ERODED MORE NOTICEABLY OVER THESE AREAS BY THE 
APPROACH OF THE UPPER LOW. AM EXPECTING MORE CLOUDS OVER WEST TN AND 
NORTH MS DURING THE AFTERNOON WHICH MAY HOLD TEMPS DOWN A LITTLE. ON 
MONDAY THE UPPER LOW WILL BE OVER THE REGION AND SHOULD RESULT IN 
THE BEST CHANCES FOR RAIN THROUGHOUT THE ENTIRE AREA. SINCE THE 
SYSTEM IS RATHER WEAK...ANTICIPATE CONVECTION TO REMAIN SCATTERED. 
POTENTIAL CLOUD COVER WITH THE SYSTEM MAY HOLD TEMPS IN THE UPPER 
80S TO AROUND 90 FOR HIGHS. BY TUESDAY THE SYSTEM WILL HAVE LIFTED 
NORTHWARD BUT A WEAK UPPER TROUGH AND ENOUGH LOW LEVEL MOISTURE MAY 
BE AROUND STILL TO PROVIDE FOR SOME LATE MORNING AND AFTERNOON 
THUNDERSTORMS THROUGH THE REST OF NEXT WEEK. NO OTHER SIGNIFICANT 
SYSTEMS ARE FORESEEN AT THIS POINT. RAIN CHANCES TAIL DOWN A LITTLE 
TOWARDS THE END OF THE WEEK WITH THE GFS SHOWING A LITTLE DRIER 
850-500MB MOISTURE WORKING INTO THE REGION. TEMPS SHOULD REMAIN WARM 
WITH HIGHS IN THE LOW TO MID 90S.

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.

$$

VALLE

1000 AM CDT SAT JUN 25 2005

.DISCUSSION...

THERE IS A WEAK UPPER LOW ALONG THE SOUTHEASTERN US GULF COAST. 
SPOKES OF ENERGY ARE COMING OFF OF THE LOW AND COMBINED WITH THE 
AFTERNOON HEATING COULD RESULT IN A FEW SHOWERS AND THUNDERSHOWERS. 
ACARS SOUNDINGS STILL SHOW A CAP OVER THE AREA NEAR 650MB. 
HOWEVER...AS APPEARS THE CASE YESTERDAY AFTERNOON THERE IS JUST 
ENOUGH LIFT BELOW THE INVERSION TO FIRE A FEW ISOLATED STORMS. 
OTHERWISE...FORECAST FOR TODAY LOOKS LIKE A REPEAT WITH HAZY 
SKIES...PARTLY CLOUDY CONDITIONS AND TEMPS IN THE LOW TO MID 90S.

FXUS64 KMEG 250801
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
302 AM CDT SAT JUN 25 2005

.DISCUSSION...
UPPER RIDGE REMAINS IN CONTROL ONCE AGAIN TODAY WITH TEMPS CLIMBING 
INTO THE MID 90S WEST AND LOWER 90S EAST. STRONG CAP AROUND 600 MB 
BUT STEEP LAPSE RATES EXIST BELOW THE CAP AND LIKE YESTERDAY THIS 
MAY ALLOW A FEW SHOWERS TO DEVELOP DURING THE HEAT OF THE 
DAY...COVERAGE SHOULD BE MINIMAL. 

BY SUN UPPER LOW CURRENTLY OVER NRN FL MOVES WEST TOWARD THE MID 
SOUTH. NAM MORE AGGRESSIVE AT BRINGING MOISTURE INTO THE AREA WHILE 
GFS SLOWER. WL CONT TO FAVOR A MOSTLY DRY FORECAST THOUGH A FEW 
SHOWERS/TSTMS POSSIBLE...ESPECIALLY ACRS NE MS. STILL HOT WITH MID 
90S WEST AND LOWER 90S EAST ONCE AGAIN. 

THE UPPER LOW SLOWLY WEAKENS INTO UPPER TROF OVER THE MIDSOUTH MON 
INTO WED WITH SMALL CHANCES FOR AFTN/EVE PRECIP. EVEN THOUGH TEMPS 
MAY RETREAT A LITTLE A RETURN FLOW DEVELOPS DURING THE EARLY PART OF 
THE WEEK RESULTING IN MORE HUMIDITY. 

GFS CONTINUES TO FLIP FLOP ON FRONT MOVING SOUTH POSSIBLY INTO THE 
MID SOUTH AT THE END OF THE WEEK. ECMWF INDICATES POSSIBILITY AS 
WELL. CONSIDERING THE UNCERTAINTY SEEMS PRUDENT TO ADD SLIGHT CHANCE 
POPS THU NIGHT INTO FRI.

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 250137
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
835 PM CDT FRI JUN 24 2005

.DISCUSSION...LATEST INFRARED SATELLITE IMAGERY SHOWS PRIMARILY CIRRUS 
ACROSS THE MID SOUTH. ISOLATED PULSE TYPE CONVECTION DEVELOPED LATE 
THIS AFTERNOON/EARLY EVENING MOSTLY ACROSS PORTIONS OF THE MISSOURI 
BOOTHEEL AND NORTHERN MISSISSIPPI...BUT DIDN/T PRODUCE MUCH MORE 
THAN A RAIN SHOWER AT BEST BEFORE DIMINISHING. THIS DIMINISHING 
TREND WILL CONTINUE AS DAYTIME HEATING HAS ENDED AND LATEST RADAR 
TRENDS NOT SHOWING MUCH RETURNS AT THIS TIME. WILL MAKE SOME MINOR 
ADJUSTMENTS TO CLOUD COVER BUT NOT ANTICIPATING AN UPATE AS FORECAST 
OVERALL ON TRACK. 

CJC

.PREV DISCUSSION...ISSUED 205 PM CDT FRI JUN 24 2005...

YET ANOTHER DAY OF HOT AND DRY WEATHER HAS TAKEN SHAPE ACROSS THE 
MIDSOUTH DUE TO A PERSISTENT UPPER LEVEL RIDGE. TEMPS AS OF THIS 
WRITING ARE IN THE LOW TO MID 90S ACROSS THE AREA WITH ANOTHER 
COUPLE OF DEGREES TO GO. A DECENT CUMULUS FIELD HAS ALSO DEVELOPED.

MORE OF THE SAME CAN BE EXPECTED TOMORROW. MID 90S WEST TO LOW 90S 
EAST. CUMULUS FIELD IS EXPECTED ONCE AGAIN. CAN NOT RULE OUT AN 
ISOLATED SHOWER (AS BEING SEEN JUST TO OUR SOUTH AND EAST TODAY) BUT 
FEEL POPS ARE NOT WARRANTED DUE TO VERY SPARSE COVERAGE. IN 
ADDITION...IT WILL BE ANOTHER DAY OF DEEP MIXING WITH THE DRY 
ADIABAT ON FORECAST SOUNDINGS REACHING UP TO NEAR 10KFT. THIS WILL 
SERVE TO BRING DRY AIR DOWN TO THE SURFACE...KEEPING DEWPOINTS IN 
CHECK AND LIMITING ANY CONVECTIVE DEVELOPMENT.

AN UPPER LOW CURRENTLY SPINNING OVER SOUTHERN FLORIDA WILL 
RETROGRADE TOWARD THE WEST ON SUNDAY. NAM TRIES TO GENERATE SOME 
PRECIP OVER THE SOUTHERN HALF OF THE AREA...BUT THE GFS IS NOT AS 
ENTHUSIASTIC. A LOT OF DRY AIR WILL STILL BE PRESENT AS THE UPPER 
RIDGE IS SLOW TO RELEASE ITS GRIP. THEREFORE...HAVE ELECTED TO KEEP 
POPS OUT FOR NOW BUT WILL MONITOR THE PROGRESS OF THE UPPER LOW.

THE UPPER LOW WILL LEAVE A WEAKNESS IN THE UPPER PATTERN OVER THE 
MIDSOUTH BY LATE MONDAY INTO TUESDAY. WENT WITH LOW END CHANCE POPS 
FOR TUESDAY GIVEN THIS FEATURE. JUST A SLIGHT CHANCE OF AFTERNOON 
CONVECTION CAN BE EXPECTED FOR THE REST OF THE WEEK. TEMPS WILL BE 
CLOSE TO CLIMATOLOGICAL NORMALS BUT WITH A RETURN FLOW...DEWPOINTS 
WILL BE A BIT HIGHER.

GFS FLIP FLOPPING ON AN APPROACHING COLD FRONT BY THE END OF NEXT 
WEEK. OTHER GLOBAL MODELS DIFFER AS WELL. GIVEN LACK OF CONFIDENCE 
THIS FAR OUT WILL NOT MAKE ANY CHANGES.

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.

$$

JFB

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 241521
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
1020 AM CDT FRI JUN 24 2005

.UPDATE...
TODAY IS VIRTUALLY A REPEAT PERFORMANCE OF YESTERDAY. UPPER RIDGE 
CONTINUES TO DOMINATE THE WEATHER OVER THE MIDSOUTH...PROVIDING FOR 
HOT AND HAZY WEATHER. TEMPERATURES AT 15Z ARE ALMOST IDENTICAL TO 
WHAT THEY WERE 24 HRS AGO. WITH THIS IN MIND...EXPECT TEMPS TO COME 
CLOSE TO WHAT THEY WERE YESTERDAY. THE 12Z RUC AND NAM DO SHOW 
INCREASING 850MB TEMPS (AROUND 19-20C) OVER THE WESTERN HALF OF THE 
AREA WHICH MAY ALLOW FOR TEMPS TO BE A DEGREE OR TWO WARMER. EXPECT 
A CU FIELD TO DEVELOP WITHIN THE NEXT COUPLE OF HOURS AS WELL. 
CURRENT FORECAST HAS A GOOD HANDLE ON THIS AND NO ZONE UPDATE WILL 
BE NEEDED. DID MAKE SOME MINOR TWEAKS IN THE DEWPOINT GRIDS TO ALLOW 
FOR SOME LOWER DEWPOINTS THIS AFTERNOON AS DEEP MIXING UP TO 650MB 
WILL OCCUR TODAY.

FYI...RECORD HIGH AT KMEM IS 100 SET IN 1953. CURRENT FORECAST IS 
FOR 98...BUT KNOWING KMEM LIKE WE DO...CANNOT RULE OUT THE CENTURY 
MARK. HOWEVER..EXPECT THE CU FIELD TO KEEP THEM SOMEWHAT IN 
CHECK...JUST LIKE WHAT OCCURRED YESTERDAY.

.PREVIOUS DISCUSSION ISSUED AT 320 AM FRI JUN 24...
UPPER RIDGE CONTINUES TO DOMINATE THE MS RIVER VALLEY THROUGH SAT 
WITH HOT AND DRY WEATHER. STAGNANT AIRMASS WILL CONTINUE WITH HIGH 
POLLUTION LEVELS IN THE MEMPHIS METRO AREA...OZONE AND PARTICULATE 
MATTER...THROUGH AT LEAST SATURDAY. TODAY SHOULD BE VERY SIMILAR TO 
YESTERDAY. 850 MB TEMPS APPROACH 20C OVER WESTERN SXNS AND SFC TEMPS 
SHOULD BE 1-2 DEGREES HIGHER THAN YESTERDAYS NUMBERS. THIS WL RESULT 
IN UPPER 90S WEST WITH LOWER/MID 90S EAST THIS AFTN. SIMILAR CONDS 
FOR SAT. SFC DEWPOINTS WL SLOWLY BE INCREASING THROUGHOUT THE PERIOD 
SO IT WILL BEGIN TO FEEL MORE MUGGY. HEAT INDICES WILL REACH 100 
DEGREES ACRS MEMPHIS METRO...NW MS AND ERN AR TODAY AND SAT.

BY SUN AFTN RIDGE STARTS TO RETROGRADE A LITTLE AS WEAK UPPER TROF 
PUSHES INTO THE AREA FROM THE WEST. 00Z GFS AND NAM IN FAIRLY GOOD 
AGREEMENT WITH THIS FEATURE THROUGH GFS A LITTLE FASTER. GFS 
INDICATES POSSIBILITY OF A ISOLD TSTMS SUN AFTN BUT WL HOLD OFF FOR 
NOW. STILL HOT AND MUGGY SUN THOUGH A TAD COOLER THAN FRI/SAT.

WEAK UPPER TROF AND SFC RETURN FLOW PERSIST FROM MON THROUGH WED. 
THIS WL SET THE STAGE FOR ISOLD AFTN TSTMS AND CONTINUED WARM AND 
MUGGY CONDS. 00Z GFS CONTINUES TO PUSH A COLD FRONT TOWARD THE 
REGION BY THE END OF NEXT WEEK. SLIGHT CHC POPS FOR THU STILL LOOK 
FINE. 

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.

$$

SJM/JFB

AGREEMENT WITH THIS FEATURE THROUGH GFS A LITTLE FASTER. GFS 
INDICATES POSSIBILITY OF A ISOLD TSTMS SUN AFTN BUT WL HOLD OFF FOR 
NOW. STILL HOT AND MUGGY SUN THOUGH A TAD COOLER THAN FRI/SAT.

WEAK UPPER TROF AND SFC RETURN FLOW PERSIST FROM MON THROUGH WED. 
THIS WL SET THE STAGE FOR ISOLD AFTN TSTMS AND CONTINUED WARM AND 
MUGGY CONDS. 00Z GFS CONTINUES TO PUSH A COLD FRONT TOWARD THE 
REGION BY THE END OF NEXT WEEK. SLIGHT CHC POPS FOR THU STILL LOOK 
FINE. 

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
