

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 231953
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
253 PM CDT THU JUN 23 2005

.DISCUSSION...
HOT AND DRY WEATHER WILL CONTINUE TO PERSIST OVER THE MIDSOUTH FOR 
THE NEXT SEVERAL DAYS. UPPER RIDGE WILL REMAIN IN CONTROL 
SUPPRESSING ANY CHANCES FOR CONVECTION. TOMORROW SHOULD BE VERY 
SIMILAR TO TODAY. ETA IS FORECASTING 850MB TEMPS TO RISE NEAR 21C 
OVER THE WESTERN HALF OF THE AREA...WHILE GFS KEEPS IT BETWEEN 18C 
AND 19C. BOTTOM LINE IS THAT WITH DRY SOIL AND HIGH 850 
TEMPS...EXPECT TEMPS TO CLIMB BACK INTO THE UPPER 90S OVER THE 
WESTERN HALF OF THE AREA...WITH LOWER 90S EAST WHERE SOIL MOISTURE 
IS CLOSER TO NORMAL. KMEM WILL LIKELY REACH CLOSE TO THE CENTURY 
MARK TOMORROW (MAY STILL GET THERE TODAY.) FYI...THE LAST 100 DEGREE 
WEATHER EXPERIENCED IN MEMPHIS OCCURRED WAY BACK IN AUGUST AND 
SEPTEMBER OF 2000. HEAT INDICES WILL NOT BE AS BAD AS THEY COULD BE. 
MODEL SOUNDINGS SHOW THAT MIXING WILL OCCUR ALL THE WAY UP TO 
600MB...QUITE IMPRESSIVE. THIS WILL HELP TO MIX DOWN DRIER AIR AND 
KEEP DEWPOINTS IN CHECK. 

THE WEEKEND WILL BE A VIRTUAL REPEAT. ETA AND GFS TRY TO DEVELOP A 
TROPICAL SYSTEM OVER THE BAHAMAS AND SEND IT TO THE SE US COAST ON 
SUNDAY. THE ETA BRINGS A GOOD BIT OF MOISTURE TO THE MIDSOUTH WHILE 
THE GFS CONFINES IT TO THE EASTERN SEABOARD. ECMWF NOT ON BOARD WITH 
THIS FEATURE AND THE UKMET IS MUCH WEAKER. THEREFORE...WILL MAINTAIN 
THE STATUS QUO FOR NOW AND KEEP THINGS DRY AND HOT.

A RETURN FLOW WILL BEGIN TO DEVELOP BY MONDAY AND WILL PERSIST 
THROUGH THE WEEK. THIS WILL HELP BRING DEWPOINTS UP. THE AXIS OF THE 
UPPER RIDGE WILL SHIFT EAST...LEAVING SOMEWHAT OF A WEAKNESS OVER 
THE CWA. WILL INTRODUCE A SLIGHT CHANCE OF AFTERNOON TSTMS MONDAY 
THROUGH THURSDAY. CERTAINLY NOT A DROUGHT BUSTER. TEMPS SHOULD ALSO 
RETURN CLOSER TO NORMAL WITH MORE CU DEVELOPMENT EXPECTED...ALTHOUGH 
IT WILL DEFINITELY FEEL MORE MUGGY OUT. 

12Z GFS BREAKS DOWN THE EAST COAST RIDGE...ALLOWING FOR A SHORTWAVE 
TO PUSH A COLD FRONT CLOSE TO THE REGION. THIS IS THE FIRST TIME THE 
GFS HAS ADVERTISED THIS AND OTHER GLOBAL GUIDANCE NOT AGREEING AT 
THIS TIME. WILL HOLD ONTO SLIGHT CHANCE POPS AND WAIT FOR GUIDANCE 
TO COME INTO SOME BETTER AGREEMENT.

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.

JFB

FXUS64 KMEG 231532
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
1030 AM CDT THU JUN 23 2005

.UPDATE...
HOT...HAZY...AND HUMID JUST ABOUT SUMS UP THE WEATHER OVER THE 
MIDSOUTH. PERSISTENT UPPER LEVEL RIDGE CONTINUES TO HAVE A FIRM GRIP 
OVER OUR WEATHER. TEMPS RISING QUICKLY THIS MORNING. HAVE ADJUSTED 
TEMPS ACROSS THE AREA TO REFLECT CURRENT TRENDS. AS HAS BEEN THE 
CASE...WESTERN AREAS WILL BE WARMER WITH AXIS OF HIGHER 850 TEMPS 
AND DRIER SOILS HELPING TEMPERATURES TO CLIMB EVEN HIGHER. KMEM 
ALREADY AT 90 DEGREES...THEREFORE HAVE BUMPED THEIR HIGH TODAY TO 
THE CENTURY MARK (RECORD HIGH IS 101 SET IN 1988.) CERTAINLY SEEMS 
REASONABLE GIVEN THE FACT THAT DRY ATMOSPHERIC LAYER WILL SUPPRESS 
AN ABUNDANT CU FIELD...ALTHOUGH DO EXPECT A FEW CU TODAY. ALSO WILL 
INCLUDE MENTION OF HAZE IN GRIDS AND ZONES. GRIDS ALREADY OUT. 
UPDATE TO ZONES OUT SHORTLY.

.PREVIOUS DISCUSSION ISSUED AT 240 AM JUN 23 2005...

PERSISTENT WEATHER PATTERN WILL CONTINUE ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA
FOR THE NEXT FEW DAYS. UPPER LEVEL RIDGE WILL HOLD OVER THE REGION
FOR MUCH OF THE NEXT SEVEN DAYS. THE RESULT WILL BE LITTLE CHANCE OF
RAIN AND AFTERNOON TEMPERATURES IN THE LOW TO MID 90S AT LEAST
THROUGH THE WEEKEND. MODELS ARE SHOWING A WEAK UPPER LOW POSSIBLY
MAKING ITS WAY FROM FLORIDA TOWARD THE REGION FOR THE BEGINNING OF
NEXT WEEK. THERE DOES NOT SEEM TO BE MUCH AGREEMENT ON WHERE THIS
LOW MAY END UP BUT IT MAY BE ENOUGH TO KICK OFF SOME AFTERNOON
THUNDERSTORMS EARLY NEXT WEEK.



000 
FXUS64 KMEG 222005
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
305 PM CDT WED JUN 22 2005

.DISCUSSION...

AN AREA OF BROAD SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE IS OVER THE LOWER MISSISSIPPI 
VALLEY REGION. THIS IS ASSOCIATED WITH A STRONG RIDGE OVER THE 
CENTRAL US. AFTERNOON CU DEVELOPED THIS AFTERNOON OVER MUCH OF THIS 
REGION. SURFACE DEW POINTS ARE NOTABLY LOW...IN THE LOWER 60S. THIS 
IS LIKELY DUE TO DEEP MIXING OF DRY AIR FROM ALOFT TO THE SURFACE. 

THE UPPER RIDGE WILL CONTINUE TO BUILD OVER THE REGION. AS A 
RESULT...TEMPERATURES SHOULD CONTINUE TO WARM INTO THE WEEKEND. 
MODEL SOUNDINGS SUPPORT UPPER 90S FOR THE REMAINDER OF THE 
WEEK...HOWEVER AFTERNOON CU DEVELOP MAY INHIBIT THAT. HAVE MIN TEMPS 
GOING BELOW GUIDANCE DURING THE SHORT TERM SINCE THE MODELS ARE NOT 
HANDLING THE LOW DEW POINTS THAT ARE BEING MIXED DOWN DURING THE 
AFTERNOON WELL AT ALL. RAIN CHANCES LOOK VIRTUALLY NONEXISTENT FOR 
THURSDAY AND FRIDAY SINCE THERE IS A STRONG CAP IN PLACE AND TEMPS 
WOULD HAVE TO GET INTO THE TRIPLE DIGITS JUST FOR POPCORN 
THUNDERSTORMS TO FIRE. OVER THE WEEKEND...THE MODELS SHOW MOISTURE 
BEGINNING TO WORK BACK INTO THE AREA. THIS WILL PROVIDE A SLIGHTLY 
BETTER CHANCE AND AN ISOLATED THUNDERSTORM CANT BE ENTIRELY RULED 
OUT. STILL...THE POSITION OF THE UPPER RIDGE WILL WORK AGAINST 
DEVELOPMENT. AT THIS POINT...IF ANY STORMS WERE TO FIRE COVERAGE 
WOULD LIKELY BE VERY VERY LOW. 

THERE IS SOME HOPE FOR RAIN PERHAPS EARLY NEXT WEEK. GFS SHOWS THE 
POSITION OF THE RIDGE MOVING FURTHER AWAY FROM THE REGION AND 
SLIGHTLY DEEPER MOISTURE MOVING UP FROM THE SOUTH. THERE DOES NOT 
LOOK LIKE ANY ORGANIZED FEATURE WITH THIS. BUT THINK THAT ISOLATED 
TO SCATTERED AFTERNOON SHOWERS AND THUNDERSHOWERS MAY BE POSSIBLE. 

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.

AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
1000 AM CDT WED JUN 22 2005

.DISCUSSION...

HIGH PRESSURE IS CENTERED NEAR THE FORT SMITH AREA. THIS IS 
ASSOCIATED WITH A BROAD RIDGE OVER THE CENTRAL US. THE UPPER LOW 
THAT HAD BROUGHT THUNDERSTORM ACTIVITY TO THE SOUTHEAST HAS MOVED 
OFFSHORE AND HAS BEEN REPLACED BY AN UPPER TROUGH ALONG THE COAST. 
SOUNDINGS FROM LZK/JAN/OHX/SGF AND ACARS SOUNDINGS FROM MEMPHIS ALL 
SHOW A STRONG CAP OVER THE REGION WITH A MAX TEMP OF AT LEAST 100 
DEGREES NEEDED TO BREAK IT. NO DISTURBANCES ARE MOVING THROUGH SO 
LOOKS LIKE ANOTHER DRY DAY. FORECAST TEMPS LOOKS REASONABLE WITH 
GUIDANCE AND SOUNDINGS SUPPORTING MID 90S ACROSS MUCH OF EASTERN 
ARKANSAS...BOOTHEEL AND INTO NORTHWEST MS AND SOUTHWEST TN. 
ELSEWHERE...LOW 90S CAN BE EXPECTED. THERE IS SOME POTENTIAL FOR CU 
DEVELOPMENT TODAY BUT SHOULD REMAIN WITH MORE CLEAR SKIES THAN 
CLOUDS.

.SYNOPSIS...
WEATHER NIL ACROSS THE MIDSOUTH.  DYING THUNDERSTORM COMPLEX 
STAYING WEST OF THE REGION ACROSS THE PLAINS.  ANY CLOUD DEBRIS 
SHOULD STAY TO OUR WEST.    

&&

.SHORT TERM (THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...
BOTH THE GFS AND ETA INDICATE A WEAK FRONT MOVING TO KY/TN BORDER 
BY 12Z WED.  SOME CONCERN ABOUT A THUNDERSTORM COMPLEX FORMING 
OVERNIGHT ACROSS THE CENTRAL UNITED STATES THEN PUSHING SOUTH.  IF 
THAT HAPPENS IT COULD REACH THE NORTHERN PORTION OF OUR FORECAST 
AREA BY MORNING.  STILL THERE IS WAY TOO MUCH UNCERTAINTY ABOUT 
TIMING AND PLACEMENT...SO WILL KEEP A DRY FORECAST GOING.  MODELS 
MOVE THE BOUNDARY THROUGH THE FORECAST AREA ON WEDNESDAY...MODEL 
SOUNDINGS INDICATE A SIGNIFICANT CAP...BUT MESOSCALE CONTRIBUTION 
COULD RESULT IN ISOLATED TSTMS IN THE AFTERNOON.  AGAIN WILL LEAVE 
OUT SINCE SIGNIFICANT WARM DOME ALOFT AND PROBABILITY OF THIS 
HAPPENING IS SO LOW. 

&&

.LONG TERM (AFTER WEDNESDAY)...
HOT PATTERN.  UPPER RIDGE BUILDS INTO THE MID-MISSISSIPPI VALLEY BY 
THIS WEEKEND.  ECMWF IS HINTING AT THE CURRENT EASTERN US TROF 
CLOSING OFF AND RETROGRADING INTO THE DEEP SOUTH.  12Z GFS IS 
SIMILAR WITH DEVELOPING THE CLOSED LOW...BUT IT KEEPS THE SYSTEM 
FARTHER EAST.  EITHER WAY THE INFLUENCE ON THE MIDSOUTH WEATHER IS 
NOT ENOUGH TO MERIT A POP FOR THUNDERSTORMS.

DISSIPATE BEFORE 4 AM. UPPER LEVEL RIDGE NOW CENTERED OVER THE
SOUTHERN ROCKIES WILL SLOWLY MOVE EAST OVER THE NEXT COUPLE OF DAYS.
THE RIDGE WILL CONTINUE TO LIMIT ANY THUNDERSTORM ACTIVITY FOR THE
NEXT SEVEN DAYS TO POSSIBLY AN ISOLATED THUNDERSTORM OR TWO. AS THE
RIDGE BECOMES MORE ENTRENCHED OVER THE REGION LATER THIS WEEK...
TEMPERATURES WILL CLIMB SOME AS WELL WITH MOST LOCATIONS SEEING
READINGS IN THE MID 90S. NOT MUCH CHANGE IN THE WEATHER PATTERN IS
SEEN WITH TEMPERATURES REMAINING ABOVE NORMAL THROUGH EARLY NEXT

NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
220 AM CDT MON JUN 20 2005

.DISCUSSION...
ONLY CHANGE IN SURFACE PATTERN FROM PREVIOUS TWO DAYS...SURFACE HIGH
JUST A LITTLE FURTHER EAST OVER GREAT LAKES. NO SIGNIFICANT CLOUD
COVER THIS MORNING. EARLY MORNING TEMPS IN THE 60S...EXCEPT MEMPHIS
HEAT ISLAND. DEWPOINTS ARE A LITTLE HIGHER THIS MORNING...UPPER 50S
TO LOWER 60S.
&&

.SHORT TERM (THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...
UPPER RIDGE GRADUALLY MOVES OVER AREA THOUGH WEDNESDAY. WHILE IT
ISNT ABSOLUTELY OUT OF QUESTION THAT CONVECTION COULD SLIDE DOWN
EAST EDGE OF RIDGE INTO THE AREA ON TUESDAY OR WEDNESDAY...NOT A BIG
ENOUGH SIGNAL UPSTREAM TO MENTION IN FORECAST. GFS DEPICTION OF
UPPER LOW SOUTH OF PENSACOLA BY WEDNESDAY NOT ACCEPTED. NAM MORE
REPRESENTATIVE OF EXPECTED CONDITIONS.

TEMPERATURE FORECAST ONLY REAL ISSUE FOR THIS PACKAGE. LITTLE OR NO
SIGNIFICANT CLOUD COVER EXPECTED. DELTA-TS AT 1000 AND 850 MB BOTH
INDICATE SIGNIFICANT WARMING OVER NEXT FEW DAYS. NAM SOLUTION A
LITTLE MORE AGGRESSIVE IN WARMING. EVEN GFS SHOWS 2-3 DEGREES OF
WARMING EACH DAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY. THIS WOULD PUT MOST AREAS IN
MID 90S BY WEDNESDAY. IF NAM VERIFIES...MORE LIKE UPPER 90S ON
WEDNESDAY. MAV/MEX GUIDANCE APPEARS TO BE SLIGHTLY CONSERVATIVE.
OVERNIGHT LOWS WILL GRADUALLY WARM THROUGH WEDNESDAY.
&&

.LONG TERM (AFTER WEDNESDAY)...
LITTLE CHANGE IN PATTERN WITH UPPER RIDGE REMAINING OVER THE AREA
THROUGH NEXT WEEKEND. AS IN SHORT TERM...MEX GUIDANCE COULD BE A
LITTLE CONSERVATIVE. MID TO UPPER 90S EXPECTED FOR HIGHS DURING THE
EXTENDED PERIOD. OVERNIGHT LOWS FAIRLY CLOSE TO CLIMO.

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 200239
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
939 PM CDT SUN JUN 19 2005

.DISCUSSION...

PATTERN REMAINS VERY SIMILAR TO LAST NIGHT AT THIS TIME...WITH AN
UPPER LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM STILL SPINNING OVER THE CAROLINAS WITH AN
UPPER RIDGE EXTENDING ACROSS THE PLAINS STATES. ONCE AGAIN...THE MID-
SOUTH IS IN BETWEEN THESE TWO UPPER LEVEL SYSTEMS WITH DRY NORTHERLY
UPPER LEVEL FLOW PERSISTING. SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE STILL ANCHORED
OVER THE GREAT LAKES REGION AND EXTENDING SOUTHWARD INTO OUR AREA.
THIS MEANS ANOTHER DRY AND MOSTLY CLEAR NIGHT IN STORE...WITH ONLY A
FEW THIN HIGH CIRRUS PASSING OVERHEAD. THE ATMOSPHERE SHOULD
CONTINUE TO DECOUPLE THIS EVENING AND TEMPERATURES SHOULD DROP
TOWARDS THE DEWPOINT TEMPERATURES LATER TONIGHT.

AS WAS SEEN DURING THE PAST COUPLE NIGHTS...DEWPOINTS HAVE COME UP A
BIT AFTER DECOUPLING AS WE LOSE THE AFTERNOON MIXING OF DRYER AIR
FROM ALOFT...BUT SHOULD SEE DEWPOINTS SETTLE BACK DOWN A FEW DEGREES
LATER TONIGHT. WITH THIS IN MIND...HAVE DECIDED TO SHAVE A FEW
DEGREES OFF OF OVERNIGHT LOWS...ESPECIALLY ACROSS EASTERN SECTIONS...
WITH LOWS AROUND 60 EASTERN AREAS...LOW 60S NORTH AND SOUTHEAST
ZONES...AND MID 60S IN THE NORMALLY WARMER DELTA REGION AND MEMPHIS
URBAN CORRIDOR. OTHER THAN TEMPERATURES...ALL OTHER FORECAST
PARAMETERS LOOK FINE.

UPDATED TEMPERATURE GRIDS AND ZONE FORECAST OUT SHORTLY.

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.

DIURNAL CUMULUS ACROSS A PORTION OF THE FORECAST AREA DIMINISHES AND 
WINDS DECOUPLE AS INVERSION SETS UP WITH LOWS FALLING INTO THE 60S.

MONDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY...SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE WILL GRADUALLY MOVE 
EAST...AND SOUTHERLY FLOW ON THE BACKSIDE OF HIGH PRESSURE WILL 
ALLOW DEWPOINTS TO RISE INTO THE MIDDLE TO UPPER 60S BY MID WEEK AND 
HIGHS IN THE LOWER TO MIDDLE 90S.

.THURSDAY THROUGH SUNDAY...MODELS IN DECENT AGREEMENT WITH SURFACE 
AND UPPER LEVEL RIDGING REMAINING IN PLACE ACROSS THE MID SOUTH THROUGH 
THE END OF THE PERIOD WITH NO MEASURABLE PRECIPITATION YET IN SIGHT. 
WENT WITH HIGHS A DEGREE OR TWO ABOVE MEX GUIDANCE AS THE GFS MAY BE 
SLIGHTLY TOO COOL BASED ON RECENT TRENDS AND LATEST EUROPEAN RUNS 
BEING WARMER THAN THE GFS.

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 191603 RRA
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
1101 AM CDT SUN JUN 19 2005

.DISCUSSION...THIS MORNING/S SURFACE AND UPPER AIR MAPS PLACE RIDGE 
OF HIGH PRESSURE ACROSS THE PLAINS AND INTO THE MISSISSIPPI RIVER 
VALLEY. VISIBLE SATELLITE IMAGERY ONLY SHOWING A SMALL AREA OF 
CIRRUS MOVING ACROSS A PORTION OF MIDDLE AND WESTERN TENNESSEE. MAIN 
FORECAST CONCERN THIS AFTERNOON WILL FOCUS ON FIRE WEATHER 
PARAMETERS. 

RUC MODEL SOUNDINGS SEEM TO HAVE THE BEST HANDLE ON DEWPOINTS THIS 
AFTERNOON THAN THE HIGHER DEWPOINT MODEL GUIDANCE. THINK THAT CONDITIONS 
WILL NOT REACH RED FLAG CONDITIONS THIS AFTERNOON AS SUSTAINED WINDS 
WILL BE BELOW 10 KTS AND RH/S ABOBVE 25 PERCENT. 850 MB TEMPERATURES 
AROUND 15C THIS MORNING SHOULD PROCUCE HIGH TEMPERATURES A DEGREE OR 
TWO HIGHER THAN YESTERDAY UNDER SUNNY SKIES. SENT UPDATED DEWPOINT 
GRIDS TO ADJUST FOR CURRENT TRENDS...OTHERWISE FORECAST IS ON TRACK. 

CJC


.PREV DISCUSSION...ISSUED 233 AM CDT SUN JUN 19 2005...

SURFACE HIGH STILL CENTERED OVER GREAT LAKES THIS MORNING WITH RIDGE
AXIS JUST NORTHWEST OF OUR AREA. ONLY A FEW CIRRUS AROUND THIS
MORNING. EARLY MORNING TEMPERATURES MAINLY IN THE 60S WITH DEWPOINTS
IN THE 50S.
&&

.SHORT TERM (THROUGH TUESDAY)...
UPPER LOW TO THE EAST AND RIDGE TO THE WEST. NO SIGNIFICANT MOISTURE
AROUND TO PRODUCE PRECIPITATION THROUGH TUESDAY.

TEMPERATURES...TODAY SHOULD SEE TEMPS SIMILAR TO SATURDAY...AS
AIRMASS HAS CHANGED VERY LITTLE. MAYBE A DEGREE OR TWO WARMER...BUT
THAT IS IT. WE START SEEING A LITTLE BIT OF A SOUTHERLY COMPONENT
TO LOW LEVEL WINDS ON MONDAY...AND AIRMASS WILL BEGIN TO WARM A BIT.
TEMPS MONDAY ABOUT A CATEGORY WARMER THAN TODAY...AND ANOTHER
CATEGORY ON TUESDAY. THIS SHOULD PUT MOST AREAS IN THE 90 TO 95
RANGE FOR TUESDAY.
&&

.LONG TERM (BEYOND TUESDAY)...
UPPER RIDGE IS FORECAST BY MOST...BUT NOT ALL...MEDIUM RANGE MODELS
TO BE CENTERED NEAR THE MISSISSIPPI RIVER BY THE END OF THE WEEK.
WITH NO MOIST INFLOW...AND NO SIGNIFICANT IMPULSES...A DRY FORECAST
REMAINS THE WAY TO GO.

TEMPERATURES...FORECAST BOUNDARY LAYER AND H85 TEMPERATURES WILL
WARM SIGNIFICANTLY DURING THE EXTENDED PERIOD. BY WEDNESDAY AND
THURSDAY...H85 TEMPS ABOUT 6C WARMER THAN THEY WERE ON SATURDAY. THIS
SHOULD PUT MANY AREAS IN THE MIDDLE 90S...AT LEAST. THESE
TEMPERATURES EXPECTED TO CONTINUE THROUGH THE END OF THE FORECAST
PERIOD. ONLY LIMITING FACTOR MIGHT BE CLOUD DEVELOPMENT. SUSPECT
THAT MOISTURE AROUND H85 MAY BE A LITTLE OVERDONE LATE IN THE WEEK
ON THE GFS. WOULD NOT BE SURPRISED TO SEE THE TEMPERATURE FORECAST
FOR THE END OF THE WEEK GET RAISED AT SOME POINT IN THE NEXT FEW
DAYS. ALSO WOULD NOT BE SHOCKED IF A FEW AREAS THAT HAVE BEEN DRY...
APPROACH THE CENTURY MARK SOMETIME AFTER WEDNESDAY.
&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.

$$

WAGNER

1100 AM CDT SUN JUN 19 2005

.DISCUSSION...THIS MORNING/S SURFACE AND UPPER AIR MAPS PLACE RIDGE

VALLEY. VISIBLE SATELLITE IMAGERY ONLY SHOWING A SMALL AREA OF 
CIRRUS MOVING ACROSS A PORTION OF MIDDLE AND WESTERN TENNESSEE. MAIN 
FORECAST CONCERN THIS AFTERNOON WILL FOCUS ON FIRE WEATHER 
PARAMETERS.

AFTERNOON THAN THE HIGHER DEWPOINT MODEL GUIDANCE. THINK THAT CONDITIONS

FXUS64 KMEG 190243
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
943 PM CDT SAT JUN 18 2005

.DISCUSSION...

THE MID-SOUTH IS POSITIONED BETWEEN AN UPPER LEVEL LOW PRESSURE
SYSTEM OVER THE SOUTHEASTERN STATES AND A BUILDING UPPER LEVEL
RIDGE OVER THE PLAINS. THIS WILL KEEP A DRY NORTHERLY UPPER LEVEL
FLOW OVER THE AREA TONIGHT. AT THE SURFACE...HIGH PRESSURE IS
CENTERED OVER THE GREAT LAKES REGION AND EXTENDS SOUTHWARD OVER OUR
AREA. A FEW HIGH THIN CIRRUS ASSOCIATED WITH AN UPPER LEVEL JET
STREAK WILL CONTINUE TO MOVE OVERHEAD THIS EVENING. THESE CLOUDS
SHOULD REMAIN THIN ENOUGH TO KEEP MOSTLY CLEAR SKIES IN THE FORECAST.
ALSO...ANOTHER DRY NIGHT IS IN STORE AND WITH SEASONABLY LOW
DEWPOINTS IN PLACE...EXPECT GOOD RADIATIONAL CONDITIONS OVER THE
REGION. THIS WILL ALLOW TEMPERATURES TO DROP INTO THE UPPER 50S OVER
EASTERN AREAS TO UPPER 60S IN THE NORMALLY WARMER DELTA REGION AND
MEMPHIS URBAN CORRIDOR.

CURRENT FORECAST HAS A GOOD HANDLE ON THE CURRENT WEATHER
SITUATION...SO NO UPDATES TO THE FORECAST ARE PLANNED AT THIS TIME.

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.

FXUS64 KMEG 182021
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
320 PM CDT SAT JUN 18 2005

.DISCUSSION...WATER VAPOR IMAGERY AND UPPER AIR MAPS INDICATE BLOCKING 
RIDGE ACROSS THE WESTERN U.S. AND A TROUGH ACROSS THE EAST. VISIBLE 
SATELLITE THIS AFTERNOON SHOWS SCATTERED CUMULUS/ALTOCUMULUS 
ASSOCIATED WITH SHORTWAVE TROUGH LOCATED ACROSS SOUTHERN 
ARKANSAS/NORTHERN MISSISSIPPI AND AN ABSENCE OF CLOUDS BEHIND THIS 
BOUNDARY. DRY WEATHER EXPECTED FOR THIS FORECAST PACKAGE WITH NO 
MAJOR WEATHER CONCERNS OTHER THAN TEMPERATURES BY MID WEEK. 

UPPER LEVEL RIDGING WILL CONTINUE TO BUILD INTO THE LOWER MISSISSIPPI 
VALLEY WITH TEMPERATURES GRADUALLY RISING TO ABOVE NORMAL VALUES AS 
SURFACE/UPPER LEVEL RIDGING STRENGTHENS ACROSS THE CENTRAL/SOUTHERN 
PLAINS WITH ORGANIZED CONVECTIVE ACTIVITY REMAINING CLOSER TO THE 
CANADIAN BORDER.  AS 850 MB TEMPERATURES RISE BY MIDWEEK TO AROUND 
20C...HIGH TEMPERATURES SHOULD REACH INTO THE 90S AND POSSIBLY NEAR 
100 IN AN ISOLATED SPOT OR TWO. BOTH GFS/DGEX SHOW A COLD FRONT 
MOVING ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA ON THURSDAY AS UPPER LEVEL ENERGY 
TRIES TO SPILL OVER THE RIDGE AND WEAKENS BEFORE REACHING THE 
FORECAST AREA. HOWEVER...PROBABILITIES FOR RAIN REMAIN TOO LOW AT 
THIS TIME TO JUSTIFY ADDING RAIN CHANCES TO FORECAST IN THIS PACKAGE.
&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES

FXUS64 KMEG 181610
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
1110 AM CDT SAT JUN 18 2005

.DISCUSSION...LATEST UPPER AIR ANALYSIS SHOWS A TROUGH AXIS 
EXTENDING FROM NEW ENGLAND INTO THE SOUTHEAST UNITED STATES WITH 
RIDGING ACROSS THE MISSISSIPPI VALLEY AND PLAINS STATES. A MID LEVEL 
SHORTWAVE IS ALSO PRESENT ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA AS DENOTED BY 
SCATTERED CU/ALTOCU ON VISIBLE SATELLITE...BUT NOT ANTICIPATING ANY 
PRECIPITATION WITH THIS FEATURE. 850 MB TEMPERATURES AROUND 15C 
SHOULD MIX DOWN TO SURFACE TEMPERATURES IN THE MIDDLE TO UPPER 80S. 
MADE SOME MINOR ADJUSTMENTS TO CLOUD COVER TO ACCOUNT FOR CURRENT 
TRENDS. ALL OTHER FORECAST PARAMETERS ON TRACK.

CJC

.PREV DISCUSSION...ISSUED 252 AM CDT SAT JUN 18 2005...
HIGH PRESSURE CENTERED OVER LAKE MICHIGAN THIS MORNING...WITH AXIS TO
NEAR OKC. CLEAR SKIES AND LIGHT WINDS WITH TEMPS IN THE 60S AT 07Z.
&&

.SHORT TERM (THROUGH MONDAY)...
DRY NORTHWEST FLOW MEANS QUIET WEATHER IN THE SHORT TERM...WITH NO
INDICATIONS OF MCS DEVELOPMENT UPSTREAM THAT WOULD AFFECT US IN NEXT
COUPLE OF DAYS.

TEMPERATURES...BOUNDARY AND 850 TEMPS SIMILAR TO FRIDAY...BUT WITH
NO MID AND HIGH CLOUD COVER...EXPECT READINGS TODAY TO BE 3-5
DEGREES WARMER. MAYBE A DEGREE OR SO OF WARMING ON SUNDAY...AND
ABOUT 3 MORE DEGREES ON MONDAY. LITTLE CHANGE IN DEWPOINTS OVER NEXT
COUPLE OF DAYS...SO DONT SEE A LOT OF CHANGE IN OVERNIGHT LOWS
TONIGHT...MAYBE A FEW DEGREES WARMER SUNDAY NIGHT.
&&

.LONG TERM (AFTER MONDAY)...
MEDIUM RANGE MODELS STILL STRUGGLING WITH LOCATION OF UPPER LOW TO
OUR EAST. LOW SHOULD BE FAR ENOUGH EAST TO KEEP US DRY THROUGH THE
EXTENDED PERIOD. NAM CURRENTLY APPEARS TO BE AN OUTLIER ACCORDING
TO NCEP. CURRENT FORECAST MOST RESEMBLES GFS SOLUTION.

TEMPERATURES COULD BE INTERESTING BY MIDWEEK. FRANKLY...FEEL CURRENT
HIGH TEMPERATURE FORECAST DAYS 4-7 MAY BE LOW...POSSIBLY BY A
CATEGORY OR MORE. FOR THURSDAY AND FRIDAY...BOTH GFS AND DGEX SHOWING
850 TEMPS AROUND 20C. WITH FULL SUN...IF ONE MIXES THIS DOWN DRY
ADIABATICALLY...WE ARE LOOKING AT TEMPERATURES APPROACHING 100F IN
AREAS WHERE THE GROUND IS PRETTY DRY. BASICALLY WEST HALF OF AREA.
MEX DATA IS SEVERAL DEGREES WARMER THIS MORNING THAN YESTERDAYS RUN.
FOR NOW...WILL NUDGE TEMPS UP A DEGREE OR TWO...AND BRIEF DAY SHIFT
THAT MEDIUM RANGE TEMPS MAY NEED RAISED SOME MORE. WILL GRADUALLY
RAISE LOW TEMPS THROUGH PERIOD AS WELL.
&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES
AR...NONE.

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 180235
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
935 PM CDT FRI JUN 17 2005

.UPDATE...
UPPER LEVEL RIDGE AXIS POSITIONED OVER THE PLAIN STATES IS RESULTING 
IN A DEEP NORTHERLY FLOW ACROSS THE MIDSOUTH WHICH IS HELPING TO 
USHER IN MORE DRY AIR. VORT MAX THAT BROUGHT CLOUDS TO THE REGION 
TODAY CONTINUES TO MOVE SOUTHEAST WITH SKIES CLEARING ACROSS THE 
CWA. WILL UPDATE THE FORECAST TO MENTION MOSTLY CLEAR TO CLEAR 
SKIES. TEMPERATURES A BIT TRICKY TONIGHT. CONSIDERING THE BOTTOM 
FELL OUT OVER NORTHEASTERN AREAS LAST NIGHT...CURRENT FORECAST OF 
MIDDLE 50S IS CERTAINLY REASONABLE. DROPPED TEMPS A DEGREE OR TWO 
ACROSS THE REST OF THE CWA GIVEN TEMPS AND DEWPOINTS ARE A LITTLE 
LOWER THAN LAST NIGHT. REST OF THE FORECAST LOOKS GOOD. GRIDS 
ALREADY SENT AND THE ZONES WILL BE OUT SHORTLY.

.PREVIOUS DISCUSSION ISSUED AT 200 PM FRI JUN 17...

.SYNOPSIS
WEAK 500 MB TROF MOVING INTO THE DEEP SOUTH...MEANWHILE A DRY 
NORTHEAST SURFACE FLOW IS OVERSPREADING THE MID-SOUTH.  TEMPERATURES 
ARE A LITTLE BELOW AVERAGE FOR MID-JUNE. 

&&

.SHORT TERM (THROUGH SUNDAY)...
SIGNIFICANT TROF ACROSS THE EASTERN UNITED STATES WILL DOMINANT OUR 
WEEKEND WEATHER.  THIS UPPER AIR PATTERN WILL RESULT IN COOLER THAN 
AVERAGE TEMPERATURES AND SIGNIFICANTLY LOWER DEW POINTS. NO 
PRECIPITATION IS FORECAST.

&&

.LONG TERM (AFTER SUNDAY)...
GFS AND ECMWF ARE IN FAIRLY GOOD AGREEMENT.  AT THE START OF THE 
FORECAST PERIOD NORTHERLY FLOW ALOFT CONTINUES WITH EASTERN TROF.  
DRY WEATHER IS LIKELY FOR MONDAY AND TUESDAY.  FOR DAYS 5 THROUGH 
7 A DECENT RIDGE DEVELOPS ACROSS THE CENTRAL UNITED STATES AS THE 
EASTERN TROF GRADUALLY SLIPS AWAY.  THERE IS SOME SLIGHT DEBATE THAT 
NIGHTTIME MESOSCALE COMPLEXES MAY DEVELOP (RING OF FIRE) OVER THE 
NATIONS MIDSECTION AND DROP INTO THE MID-SOUTH BY MORNING...SINCE 
THE 500 MB FLOW REMAINS WEAKLY NORTHWEST.  AT THIS TIME...THERE 
ISNT ENOUGH CERTAINTY IN THE TIMING AND PLACEMENT OF EXPECTED 
THUNDERSTORM COMPLEXES TO INCLUDE POPS FOR DAYS 5 THROUGH 7. FOR NOW 
WERE GOING A 7 DAY DRY FORECAST.

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.

&&

$$

FXUS64 KMEG 171557

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
1050 AM CDT FRI JUN 17 2005

.DISCUSSION...
UPDATED FOR RAINFALL AND TEMPERATURES.  COMBINATION OF TEMPERATURE 
PROFILE AND CLOUD DEBRIS FROM THUNDERSTORM COMPLEX WILL KEEP TEMPS 
FROM REBOUNDING GREATLY.  HAVE DROPPED MAX TEMPERATURES JUST A BIT.  
ALSO, THUNDERSTORMS FEEDING OFF OF BEST INSTABILITY OVER SOUTHERN 
MISSISSIPPI AND LOUISIANA...OTHERWISE DISSIPATING RAINFALL OVER 
NORTHEAST ARKANSAS.  THIS TREND SHOULD CONTINUE WITH DRY NORTHEAST 
SURFACE FLOW...SO HAVE DROPPED POPS FROM THE AFTERNOON FORECAST.

 BELLES





000 
FXUS64 KMEG 170744
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
244 AM CDT FRI JUN 17 2005

.DISCUSSION...
CURRENT WEATHER ALMOST A CARBON COPY OF YESTERDAY MORNING...WITH A
MCS TO OUR WEST. THIS ONE APPEARS TO BE SLIGHTLY FURTHER WEST THAN
YESTERDAY. STARTING TO SEE THE CIRRUS SHIELD ARRIVE FROM THE WEST.
AIRMASS PRETTY STABLE...FOR MID-JUNE...WITH DEWPOINTS MID 50S TO
LOWER 60S FOR MOST PART. TEMPS RANGE FROM MID 50S NORTHEAST TO LOWER
70S IN THE DELTA.
&&

.SHORT TERM (THROUGH SUNDAY)...
ONLY PRECIPITATION QUESTION FOR THE ENTIRE WEEKEND APPEARS TO BE
WHETHER CURRENT MCS WILL SCRAPE THE EXTREME WEST PORTIONS OF THE CWA
LATER TODAY. WE HAVE LOW POPS THERE...WHICH FITS WITH JAN AND LZK...
AND WILL LEAVE THEM THERE FOR NOW. TEMPS MAINLY IN THE MID 80S TODAY
LOOK REASONABLE BASED ON EXPECTED CLOUD COVER.

MODEL DATA INDICATES THREAT FOR A MCS TO AFFECT THE CWA WILL DECREASE
AFTER THE CURRENT ONE PASSES BY. HEIGHTS BEGIN RISING...AND NO
SIGNIFICANT IMPULSE TO RIDE OVER TOP OF RIDGE TO OUR WEST. THIS
SHOULD ALLOW FOR LESS CLOUD COVER OVER THE WEEKEND AND TEMPERATURES
SLIGHTLY WARMER.
&&

.LONG TERM (AFTER SUNDAY)...
EXTENDED MODELS HAVE BACKED AWAY FROM EARLIER SOLUTIONS WITH AN
UPPER LOW NEAR OUR AREA. CURRENT SOLUTIONS NOW FORECAST OUR CWA
TO BE UNDER THE INFLUENCE OF UPPER RIDGE FOR THE EXTENDED PERIOD.

THIS WILL MEAN A DRY FORECAST FOR THE ENTIRE EXTENDED. GUESS AN
ISOLATED THUNDERSTORM COULD BE POSSIBLE DURING THE EXTENDED...BUT
NO SIGNIFICANT IMPULSES TO TRIGGER ORGANIZED CONVECTION...AND
DEWPOINTS WILL BE RUNNING LOWER THAN NORMAL.

THIS SOLUTION WOULD MEAN LESS CLOUD COVER AND WARMER TEMPERATURES.
THIS IS REFLECTED IN THIS MORNINGS MEX DATA. HIGH TEMPERATURES IN
EXTENDED PORTION OF FORECAST HAVE BEEN RAISED ABOUT 1 CATEGORY.

SOIL CONDITIONS MAY AFFECT MAX TEMPS MORE THAN ANYTHING NEXT WEEK.
EASTERN PORTION OF CWA RECEIVED CONSIDERABLE RAINFALL FROM TS
ARLENE OVER THE WEEKEND. AREAS NEAR AND WEST OF THE MISSISSIPPI
RIVER ARE RATHER DRY FOR THE MOST PART. DURING THE PAST COUPLE OF
WEEKS...MAX TEMPS IN AREAS WITH DRY SOILS HAVE BEEN RUNNING ABOVE
GUIDANCE...USUALLY ABOUT 3 TO 5 DEGREES. WOULD NOT BE SURPRISED IF
THIS MORNINGS MEX DATA IS ACTUALLY COOLER THAN WHAT WE SEE NEXT
WEEK.
&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.

$$

WAGNER





000 
FXUS64 KMEG 170136
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
833 PM CDT THU JUN 16 2005

.UPDATE...
THE SHORTWAVE THAT BROUGHT MOSTLY CLOUDS SKIES AND SOME SPRINKLES TO 
THE MIDSOUTH TODAY IS BEGINNING TO DEPART THE REGION. AS A 
RESULT...CLOUDS ARE DECREASING AND ALL SPRINKLES HAVE ENDED. WILL 
ISSUE UPDATE TO REMOVE ALL MENTION OF SPRINKLES AND TO UPDATE CLOUD 
COVER FROM MOSTLY CLEAR IN THE NE AREAS TO PARTLY CLOUDY ELSEWHERE.

TWO VIGOROUS THUNDERSTORM COMPLEXES HAVE DEVELOPED FROM SOUTHERN 
KANSAS DOWN TO THE TEXAS PANHANDLE. AN OVERNIGHT MCS WILL RESULT 
FROM THESE COMPLEXES AND MOVE SOUTHEAST OVERNIGHT. THE MCS SHOULD 
STAY TO THE SOUTH AND WEST OF THE MIDSOUTH AS IT RIDES JUST TO THE 
NORTH OF A STALLED FRONTAL BOUNDARY LOCATED FROM THE OK PANHANDLE 
DOWN TO THE LOUISIANA GULF COAST. THIS IS WHERE THE RICHEST AREA OF 
THETA-E AIR IS LOCATED. CURRENT FORECAST HAS SLIGHT CHANCE POPS OVER 
THE SW PORTION OF THE CWA AND WILL LEAVE AS IS. CANNOT RULE OUT A 
FEW LIGHT SHOWERS SKIRTING THOSE AREAS DURING THE EARLY MORNING 
HOURS...BUT MOST AREAS WILL STAY DRY.

TEMP FORECAST LOOKS GOOD AND NO CHANGES ARE NEEDED. ZONE UPDATE WILL 
BE OUT SHORTLY. UPDATED GRIDS ALREADY SENT.

.PREVIOUS DISCUSSION ISSUED 323 PM THU JUN 16 2005...

LATEST VISIBLE SATELLITE AND RADAR TRENDS SHOW AN MCV MOVING SLOWLY 
EAST ACROSS ARKANSAS. RADAR RETURNS THUS FAR HAVE ONLY SHOWN MID TO 
HIGH LEVEL CLOUDS WITH VIRGA...AND POSSIBLY A SPRINLKE PRECIPITATING 
OUT AT BEST WITH A STABLE LOW LEVEL DRY LAYER NEAR THE SURFACE. 

ANOTHER NORTHWEST FLOW SHORTWAVE WILL MOVE ACROSS THE LOWER AND 
MIDDLE MISSISSIPPI VALLEY TONIGHT. AN MCS IS EXPECTED TO DEVELOP 
ACROSS EASTERN NEBRASKA AND MOVE SOUTH SOUTHEAST TONIGHT ALONG A 
THERMAL GRADIENT UPSTREAM. NEARLY ALL OF THE CONVECTIVE 
ACTIVITY SHOULD REMAIN WEST OF THE FORECAST AREA WHERE BETTER 
INSTABILITY LIES. AS A RESULT...WILL CARRY A SLIGHT CHANCE OF 
SPRINKLES EARLY THIS EVENING TO ACCOUNT FOR MCV...AND TRIMMED BACK 
POPS TO A SLIGHT CHANCE OF RAIN SHOWERS WITH POOR CONVECTIVE 
INDICIES ACROSS THE AREA. 

SOME MODEL DISAGREEMENT EXISTS IN HANDLING OF NEXT LOBE OF ENERGY IN 
NORTHWEST FLOW ON FRIDAY. NONETHELESS...ANOTHER MCS WILL DEVELOP 
ALONG THERMAL GRADIENT OVER SE KS/N OK AND SLIDE 
SOUTHEAST...PRIMARILY MISSING THE FORECAST AREA ONCE AGAIN AND 
TRIMMED BACK POPS TO SLIGHT CHANCE ACROSS THE WESTERN ONE THIRD OF 
THE AREA. 

LONG RANGE...(SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...AN UPPER LEVEL BLOCKING 
PATTERN WILL SET UP THIS WEEKEND ACROSS THE CENTRAL U.S....BRINGING 
DRY WEATHER THROUGH THE END OF THE FORECAST PACKAGE.  OVERALL UPPER 
AIR PATTERN OVER NORTH AMERICA WILL CONSIST OF BROAD UPPER LEVEL 
RIDGING ACROSS MOST OF THE U.S. WITH THE EXCEPTION OF CYCLONIC FLOW 
ACROSS THE NORTHERN GREAT LAKES. STILL SOME UNCERTAINTY IN THE LONG 
RANGE FORECAST WITH HANDLING OF A TROPICAL SYSTEM IN THE GULF OF 
MEXICO. 00Z GFS/EURO/CANADIAN ALL PICK UP ON THE TROPICAL WAVE 
TOWARDS THE END OF THE PERIOD WITH THE EUROPEAN BEING THE MOST 
AGGRESSIVE OF THE LONG RANGE MODELS.  NONETHELESS...WILL KEEP 
EXTENDED FORECAST DRY FOR NOW. &&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 161525
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
1025 AM CDT THU JUN 16 2005

.DISCUSSION...500 MB UPPER AIR ANALYSIS THIS MORNING DEPICTS A 
SHORTWAVE ACROSS MO/AR. 88D REGIONAL RADAR TRENDS SHOW SOME LIGHT 
RAIN ASSOCIATED FROM REMNANTS OF AN OVERNIGHT MCS ACROSS WESTERN 
ARKANSAS. HOWEVER 12Z SOUNDINGS FROM KSGF/KLZK SHOW QUITE A BIT OF 
LOW LEVEL DRY AIR IN PLACE ACROSS THE LOWER MISSISSIPPI VALLEY AND 
THINK THAT RAIN SHOULD EVAPORATE BEFORE REACHING THE NORTHWEST TIP 
OF THE FORECAST AREA. UPDATED GRIDS WILL BE OUT SHORTLY TO COVER 
CURRENT CLOUD AND TEMPERATURE TRENDS.

CJC

.PREV DISCUSSION...ISSUED 100 AM CDT THU JUN 16 2005...

PLEASANT NIGHT OCCURRING ACROSS THE MIDSOUTH. SKIES ARE CLEAR AND 
TEMPERATURES ARE CURRENTLY IN THE LOWER 70S FOR THE MOST PART. TO 
THE WEST...ACROSS OKLAHOMA AND KANSAS...A MCS HAS DEVELOPED. MODELS 
SHOWING REMNANTS OF THE MCS MOVING SOUTHEASTWARD THIS MORNING ACROSS 
ARKANSAS...BUT FAR ENOUGH TO THE SOUTHWEST THAT IT SHOULD AVOID THE 
CWA. WILL GO WITH A DRY FORECAST TODAY. 

ANOTHER MCS IS EXPECTED TO DEVELOP TONIGHT A LITTLE FURTHER NORTH 
THAN THE ONE THIS EVENING. THIS COULD BRING THE REMNANTS OVER THE 
SOUTHWESTERN HALF OF THE CWA TONIGHT INTO FRIDAY. WILL CONTINUE WITH 
SLIGHT CHANCE TO CHANCE POPS.

ANOTHER MCS COULD DEVELOP FRIDAY NIGHT AND BRING A SIMILAR SCENARIO 
FOR FRIDAY NIGHT INTO SATURDAY AS WHAT IS EXPECTED FOR TONIGHT INTO 
FRIDAY. HOWEVER THE GFS DISAGREES WITH THE NAM ON THIS SOLUTION. THE 
GFS KEEPS FRIDAY NIGHT AND SATURDAY DRY WITH ANY POTENTIAL MCS 
DEVELOPMENT TO THE SOUTHWEST OF THE CWA. CURRENT FORECAST HAS 20 
POPS IN FOR EARLY FRIDAY EVENING AND DRY AFTER THAT. WILL KEEP AS IS 
FOR NOW UNTIL THERE IS SOME AGREEMENT.

HIGH PRESSURE IS EXPECTED TO BUILD FURTHER INTO THE MIDSOUTH ON 
SUNDAY AND BRING DRY AND PLEASANT WEATHER THROUGH THE REST OF THE 
FORECAST PERIOD. EXPECT HIGHS IN THE MID TO UPPER 80S AND LOWS IN 
THE 60S FOR THE MOST PART. HOWEVER...THERE IS STILL A CHANCE THAT AN 
UPPER LOW WILL DEVELOP ALONG EAST COAST AND RETROGRADE TO THE WEST 
BY TUESDAY BRINGING A CHANCE OF RAIN TO THE CWA. THE LATEST GFS DOES 
NOT SUPPORT THIS SOLUTION. HOWEVER THE LATEST ECMWF DOES. CURRENT 
FORECAST HAS DRY CONDITIONS SO WILL KEEP AS IS FOR NOW.

KRM

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 160207
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
905 PM CDT WED JUN 15 2005

.UPDATE...
NW FLOW ALOFT HAS CREATED A CLEAR AND TRANQUIL NIGHT ACROSS THE 
MIDSOUTH. A LOOK AT 00Z LZK SOUNDING SHOWS A VERY DRY ATMOSPHERE 
WITH ONLY 0.83 INCHES OF PRECIPITABLE WATER (COMPARED TO A NORMAL 
NEAR 1.5 INCHES.) THIS WILL ALLOW FOR A GOOD RADIATIONAL COOLING 
NIGHT. TEMPS ALREADY RUNNING 2 TO 4 DEGREES COOLER THAN LAST NIGHT 
AND THE CURRENT FORECAST HAS A GOOD HANDLE ON OVERNIGHT LOWS. NO 
UPDATES PLANNED AT THIS TIME. JUST MADE SOME MINOR TWEAKS TO 
DEWPOINT AND HUMIDITY GRIDS TO ACCOUNT FOR CURRENT OBS...BUT NOTHING 
SIGNIFICANT.

.PREVIOUS DISCUSSION ISSUED 230 PM WED JUN 15 2005...

HIGH PRESSURE OVER EASTERN OKLAHOMA IS PROVIDING THE REGION WITH DRY 
WEATHER TODAY. THE WEATHER OVER THE NEXT 24 HOURS WILL BE DOMINATED 
BY HIGH PRESSURE. CLEAR SKIES AND LIGHT WINDS WILL ALLOW TEMPS 
TONIGHT TO DROP INTO THE 60S. WOULDNT BE SURPRISED IF A FEW UPPER 
50S ARE REPORTED SINCE DEW POINTS THIS AFTERNOON FELL INTO THE UPPER 
50S. 

TOMORROW...BOTH GFS AND ETA SHOW AN MCS DEVELOPING OVERNIGHT 
OVER EASTERN KANSAS IN ASSOCIATION WITH A POSITIVE VORT MAX MOVING 
THROUGH THE AREA. WITH THE REGION IN NORTHWEST FLOW...THE AREA 
SHOULD BEGIN TO SEE CLOUDS FROM THIS STORM SYSTEM BY THE AFTERNOON 
WITH PORTIONS OF EASTERN ARKANSAS POSSIBLY SEEING RAIN LATE 
AFTERNOON. BOTH MODELS SHOW A TIGHT THERMAL GRADIENT AT 850 MB 
EXTENDING FROM AROUND FAYETTEVILLE ARKANSAS THROUGH PINE BLUFF. 
EXPECT THAT THE MCS WILL TRACK ALONG THIS BOUNDARY. MODELS CONTINUE 
TO SHOW THAT THE INSTABILITY OVER THE REGION WILL REMAIN VERY STABLE 
WITH LIS AROUND 0 OR -1 AND CAPE UNDER 500 J/KG. SO EXPECT THE MCS 
TO WEAKEN AS IT APPROACHES THE REGION. THE BETTER CHANCES FOR RAIN 
WILL BE TOMORROW NIGHT AS A LOW LEVEL JET OUT OF THE SOUTHWEST 
ARRIVES INTO THE REGION. THE AREA OF POSITIVE VORTICITY WILL BE 
MOVING THROUGH AS WELL AND A 60KT UPPER LEVEL JET WILL BE MOVING 
INTO THE AREA. THE BEST CHANCES WILL BE SOUTHWEST OF MEMPHIS WHERE 
THE LOW LEVEL THERMAL GRADIENT SETS UP. TIMING OF CLOUD COVER WILL 
DICTATE HIGHS TOMORROW. THEREFORE AREAS ACROSS EASTERN ARKANSAS 
SHOULD SEE HIGHS IN THE MID 80S. ELSEWHERE...HIGHS IN THE UPPER 80S 
TO AROUND 90 SHOULD BE COMMON. 

ON FRIDAY...THE PRESENCE OF THE UPPER JET MOVING THROUGH THE REGION 
WILL RESULT IN A THREAT FOR RAIN AREAWIDE WITH ONCE AGAIN THE BETTER 
CHANCES SOUTH OF A LINE FROM CLARKSDALE TO TUPELO DUE TO THEIR 
PROXIMITY OF THE THERMAL GRADIENT. AN OMEGA BLOCK WILL BE SETTING UP 
ACROSS THE US. AM REASONABLY CONFIDENT THAT THE FORECAST FOR OVER 
THE WEEKEND WILL REMAIN DRY AND COOLER THAN THE PAST FEW DAYS WITH 
THE UPPER RIDGE PROVIDING DRY WEATHER BUT STILL CLOSE ENOUGH TO THE 
THERMAL TROUGH. AFTER THE WEEKEND THERE IS MUCH DOUBT IN THE 
FORECAST. LAST NIGHTS RUN OF THE GFS WAS IN AGREEMENT WITH THE 
EUROPEAN WITH A LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM DEVELOPING IN THE BASE OF THE 
TROUGH OVER THE CAROLINAS AND SLOWLY RETROGRADING TOWARDS THE 
REGION. HOWEVER THIS MORNINGS RUN OF THE GFS IS VERY DIFFERENT WITH 
THE PATTERN REMAINING ESSENTIALLY THE SAME WITH THE UPPER RIDGE 
REMAINING IN CONTROL...PERHAPS A TROPICAL SYSTEM COMING UP TO VISIT 
US TOWARDS MID WEEK. GIVEN THE UNCERTAINTY...WILL GO WITH A DRY 
FORECAST INTO EARLY NEXT WEEK UNTIL THE MODELS BECOME MORE CLEAR.

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.

$$

VALLE/JFB

FXUS64 KMEG 150603
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
115 AM CDT WED JUN 15 2005

.DISCUSSION...

LATEST SFC ANALYSIS SHOWS A COLD FRONT LOCATED OVER NORTH 
MISSISSIPPI. FRONT IS EXPECTED TO PUSH ENTIRELY THROUGH CWA BY 
12Z. HIGH PRESSURE WILL BUILD INTO THE MIDSOUTH BEHIND THE FRONT. 
THE HIGH WILL BRING COOLER AND DRIER AIR TO THE AREA OVER THE NEXT 
SEVERAL DAYS. THE ONE EXCEPTION WILL BE DURING THE THURSDAY-FRIDAY 
TIME PERIOD WHEN MODELS SHOW AN MCS DEVELOPING OVER OKLAHOMA. THE 
MCS IS EXPECTED TO MOVE SOUTHEASTWARD AND MAY CLIP THE SOUTHWESTERN 
PART OF THE CWA. WILL CONTINUE THE 20-30 POPS DURING THIS TIME. 
OTHER THAN THAT DRY WEATHER WILL PREVAIL THROUGH THE BEGINNING OF 
THE WEEK. EXPECT MOSTLY CLEAR TO PARTLY CLOUDY SKIES WITH HIGH 
TEMPERATURES IN THE MID TO UPPER 80S AND LOWS IN THE 60S DURING THIS 
TIME.

ON MONDAY...MODELS ARE SHOWING AN UPPER LEVEL LOW RETROGRADING 
WESTWARD FROM GEORGIA/SOUTH CAROLINA TO NORTH MISSISSIPPI BY 
TUESDAY. CURRENT FORECAST HAS 20 POPS ACROSS NORTH MISSISSIPPI FOR 
TUESDAY. THIS MAY NEED TO BE EXPANDED ACROSS THE ENTIRE CWA AND 
EXTENDED INTO AT LEAST MONDAY NIGHT IF NOT MONDAY.

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 150031
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
731 PM CDT TUE JUN 14 2005

.DISCUSSION...

WILL GO AHEAD AND UPDATE TO REMOVE THE CHANCE OF THUNDERSTORMS FROM
NORTH MS AND THE SOUTHEAST CORNER OF WEST TN FOR THE NIGHT. BASED ON
THE SURFACE DEWPOINT GRADIENT...THE COLD FRONT STRETCHES FROM NEAR
GREENVILLE MS TO SAVANNAH TN AND ON INTO MIDDLE TN. DEWPOINTS HAVE
FALLEN INTO THE 50S ACROSS NORTHEAST AR. LAPS DATA INDICATES THE
ATMOSPHERE IS STABILIZING AHEAD OF THE FRONT...AND KNQA 88D SHOWS
THAT THE EARLIER CONVECTION HAS DIED OUT ACROSS OUR FORECAST AREA.
WILL FORECAST CLEAR SKIES AREA WIDE FOR THE REMAINDER OF THE NIGHT.
WATER VAPOR SATELLITE IMAGERY SHOWS DRY AIR ALSO AT THE MID AND HIGH
LEVELS WORKING ITS WAY INTO THE MIDSOUTH. WITH THE LOWER SURFACE
DEWPOINTS...THE ENTIRE MIDSOUTH SHOULD ENJOY A LITTLE COOLER AIR BY
SUNRISE WEDNESDAY AS THE COLD FRONT MOVES SOUTHEAST.

.PREV DISCUSSION...
ISSUED 210 PM CDT TUE JUN 14 2005

A FRONT EXTENDS FROM WESTERN INDIANA TO PADUCAH TO MEMPHIS TO
CLARKSDALE. WINDS WERE GUSTING TO 18 KNOTS BEHIND THE FRONT WITH
LITTLE RELIEF FROM THE HEAT. A FEW THUNDERSTORMS HAVE DEVELOPED OVER
NORTHERN MISSISSIPPI WHERE THE GREATEST INSTABILITY AND CONVERGENCE
RESIDES.

THE FRONT WILL CONTINUE ITS EASTWARD PROGRESSION THIS EVENING AND
WILL SHIFT SOUTH AND EAST OF THE FORECAST AREA BY 8 PM.
THUNDERSTORMS WILL FOLLOW THE FRONT AND LEAVE SLIGHTLY DRIER AIR IN
ITS WAKE.

THE UPPER LEVEL RIDGE WILL AMPLIFY OVER THE CENTRAL U.S. WEDNESDAY
AND THURSDAY. THIS WILL BRING THE MID SOUTH INTO A NORTHWEST FLOW
PATTERN. BOTH THE NAM AND GFS ARE IN AGREEMENT WITH AN MCS
DEVELOPING OVER KANSAS LATE WEDNESDAY NIGHT. SHOULD THIS COMPLEX
HOLD TOGETHER THROUGH THE DAY...SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS HAVE A
CHANCE OF AFFECTING THE FORECAST AREA BY THURSDAY EVENING. OTHERWISE
HOT AND DRY CONDITIONS WILL OCCUR THROUGH THE WEEKEND.

EARLY NEXT WEEK...MODELS HAVING A DIFFICULT TIME FIGURING OUT HOW
THE EVOLUTION OF THE NEXT RAIN CHANCES WILL OCCUR. THE HIGHLY
AMPLIFIED RIDGE OVER THE MAJORITY OF THE U.S. LOOKS LIKE IT WILL
BUILD INTO THE EAST COAST TROUGH...CUTTING OFF THE SOUTHERN EDGE OF
THE TROUGH. THE POSITION OF THE CUTOFF LOW IS WHAT COMES INTO
QUESTION MONDAY AND MONDAY NIGHT. RAIN CHANCES WILL INCREASE IF THIS
LOW MOVES INTO CENTRAL MS/AL. FORECAST FOR TUESDAY AND TUESDAY NIGHT
WILL INCLUDE A SLIGHT CHANCE FOR RAIN.

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.

210 PM CDT TUE JUN 14 2005

.DISCUSSION...
A FRONT EXTENDS FROM WESTERN INDIANA TO PADUCAH TO MEMPHIS TO 
CLARKSDALE. WINDS WERE GUSTING TO 18 KNOTS BEHIND THE FRONT WITH 
LITTLE RELIEF FROM THE HEAT. A FEW THUNDERSTORMS HAVE DEVELOPED OVER 
NORTHERN MISSISSIPPI WHERE THE GREATEST INSTABILITY AND CONVERGENCE
RESIDES. 

THE FRONT WILL CONTINUE ITS EASTWARD PROGRESSION THIS EVENING AND 
WILL SHIFT SOUTH AND EAST OF THE FORECAST AREA BY 8 PM. 
THUNDERSTORMS WILL FOLLOW THE FRONT AND LEAVE SLIGHTLY DRIER AIR IN 
ITS WAKE. 

THE UPPER LEVEL RIDGE WILL AMPLIFY OVER THE CENTRAL U.S. WEDNESDAY 
AND THURSDAY. THIS WILL BRING THE MID SOUTH INTO A NORTHWEST FLOW 
PATTERN. BOTH THE NAM AND GFS ARE IN AGREEMENT WITH AN MCS 
DEVELOPING OVER KANSAS LATE WEDNESDAY NIGHT. SHOULD THIS COMPLEX 
HOLD TOGETHER THROUGH THE DAY...SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS HAVE A 
CHANCE OF AFFECTING THE FORECAST AREA BY THURSDAY EVENING. OTHERWISE 
HOT AND DRY CONDITIONS WILL OCCUR THROUGH THE WEEKEND. 

EARLY NEXT WEEK...MODELS HAVING A DIFFICULT TIME FIGURING OUT HOW 
THE EVOLUTION OF THE NEXT RAIN CHANCES WILL OCCUR. THE HIGHLY 
AMPLIFIED RIDGE OVER THE MAJORITY OF THE U.S. LOOKS LIKE IT WILL 
BUILD INTO THE EAST COAST TROUGH...CUTTING OFF THE SOUTHERN EDGE OF 
THE TROUGH. THE POSITION OF THE CUTOFF LOW IS WHAT COMES INTO 
QUESTION MONDAY AND MONDAY NIGHT. RAIN CHANCES WILL INCREASE IF THIS 
LOW MOVES INTO CENTRAL MS/AL. FORECAST FOR TUESDAY AND TUESDAY NIGHT 
WILL INCLUDE A SLIGHT CHANCE FOR RAIN.

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.

FXUS64 KMEG 141433

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
935 AM CDT TUE JUN 14 2005

.DISCUSSION...
FRONTAL BOUNDARY EXTENDS FROM JUST EAST OF KENNETT TO HARRISBURG. 
NORTHWEST WINDS GUSTING TO 16 KNOTS ARE IN THE WAKE OF THE FRONT AS 
WELL AS SLIGHTLY LOWER DEW POINTS. HIGHER MOISTURE WAS POOLING AHEAD 
OF THE FRONT...ESPECIALLY OVER NORTHEASTERN MISSISSIPPI AND PARTS OF 
WEST TENNESSEE. THERE IS SUFFICIENT CONVERGENCE ALONG THE SURFACE 
TROUGH TO PRODUCE SOME THUNDERSTORMS TO DEVELOP BY THIS AFTERNOON. 
THE BEST PLACE FOR STORMS TO DEVELOP AND POSSIBLY REACH SEVERE 
LIMITS WILL BE MAINLY SOUTH OF I-40 AND EAST OF A SOMERVILLE TO 
OXFORD TO PITTSBORO LINE. WILL CONTINUE TO MONITOR THIS FOR 
THUNDERSTORM DEVELOPMENT.

MAX TEMPERATURES TODAY...MAINLY OVER NORTHEAST MISSISSIPPI WILL BE 
NUDGED UP A FEW DEGREES. ALL OTHER AREAS LOOK FINE AS FRONTAL 
PASSAGE IS RIGHT ON TIME. NO OTHER CHANGES AT THIS TIME.

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 140559
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
100 AM CDT TUE JUN 14 2005

.DISCUSSION...

LATEST SFC ANALYSIS SHOWS A COLD FRONT CURRENTLY STRETCHING FROM 
AROUND KANSAS CITY TO OKLAHOMA CITY. A DYING LINE OF SHOWERS AND 
THUNDERSTORMS LOCATED OUT AHEAD OF THE FRONT IS APPROACHING THE 
MIDSOUTH AT THIS TIME. LINE SHOULD MOVE INTO EXTREME NORTHEAST 
ARKANSAS IN THE NEXT HOUR. LINE SHOULD DIE OUT BY SUNRISE IF NOT 
BEFORE THEN. COLD FRONT WILL CONTINUE PUSHING SOUTHEASTWARD TODAY 
INTO THE MIDSOUTH. MODELS DO NOT SHOW A LOT OF SHOWER/THUNDERSTORM 
DEVELOPMENT UNTIL LATE THIS AFTERNOON WHEN SFC HEATING IS AT ITS 
MAXIMUM AND THE FRONT IS LOCATED ACROSS NORTH MISSISSIPPI. CAN/T RULE OUT 
ISOLATED ACTIVITY DEVELOPING ACROSS THE REST OF THE CWA AS THE FRONT 
MOVES THROUGH SO WILL LEAVE 20 POP GOING. HOWEVER WILL RAISE TO 30 
POP ACROSS NORTH MISSISSIPPI.

FRONT WILL CONTINUE PUSHING THROUGH NORTHEAST MISSISSIPPI THIS 
EVENING. WILL KEEP POPS THROUGH MIDNIGHT ACROSS THIS AREA THROUGH 
MIDNIGHT. SKIES WILL CLEAR OUT BEHIND THE FRONT ACROSS THE REST OF 
THE CWA AS DRIER AIR MOVES INTO THE CWA.

DRIER AIR WILL CONTINUE TO BUILD INTO THE MIDSOUTH ON WEDNESDAY AS 
HIGH PRESSURE WILL BUILD INTO THE AREA. MODELS SHOWING PLEASANT 
WEATHER FOR THE REST OF THE FORECAST PERIOD. EXPECT DRY CONDITIONS 
WITH HIGH TEMPERATURES IN THE MID TO UPPER 80S AND LOW TEMPERATURES 
IN THE 60S. HOWEVER THERE IS A SMALL CHANCE OF POPS THURSDAY NIGHT 
AND FRIDAY ACROSS SOUTHWESTERN PART OF CWA AS MODELS SHOW AN MCS 
DEVELOPING OVER OKLAHOMA. THE MCS IS EXPECTED TO MOVE SOUTHEAST 
ACROSS ARKANSAS AND MAY SKIRT THE SOUTHWESTERN ZONES. EXPECT MOST OF 
THE PRECIP TO BE FURTHER SOUTHWEST BUT WILL LEAVE POPS IN FOR NOW.

&&

FXUS64 KMEG 140138
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
838 PM CDT MON JUN 13 2005

.DISCUSSION...

A BAND OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS STRETCHES FROM SOUTHWESTERN MO
INTO EASTERN OK THIS EVENING. THIS CONVECTION IS LOCATED AHEAD OF A
COLD FRONT. THE FRONT WILL MOVE EASTWARD TOWARD THE MIDSOUTH
TONIGHT. THE GREATEST UPPER AIR PUSH IS LOCATED NORTH OF THE
MIDSOUTH...THUS THINK THE FRONT WILL MOVE FASTER THROUGH MO THAN
THROUGH AR. THE CONVECTION IS EXPECTED TO DIMINISH AS IT APPROACHES
THE MIDSOUTH TONIGHT WITH NOCTURNAL COOLING. HOWEVER...WILL ADD A
SLIGHT CHANCE OF THUNDERSTORMS FOR LATE TONIGHT FOR THE MO BOOTHEEL
AND NORTHEAST AR. A FEW STRONG STORMS ARE POSSIBLE FROM EXTREME
NORTHEAST AR INTO THE MO BOOTHEEL. WILL CONTINUE TO MONITOR THIS
CONVECTION IN CASE HOLDS TOGETHER MORE THAN EXPECTED LATER TONIGHT AS
IT APPROACHES THE MIDSOUTH.

OTHERWISE...CURRENT FORECAST IS FINE.

&&

.PREV DISCUSSION...
ISSUED 221 PM CDT MON JUN 13 2005

A VERY WARM DAY TODAY IN ADVANCE OF THE APPROACHING COLD FRONT. SOME
TEMPERATURES HAVE REACHED THE MID 90S THIS AFTERNOON WITH AT LEAST A
COUPLE MORE HOURS OF HEATING LEFT. THUNDERSTORMS HAVE DEVELOPED OVER
THE NORTHERN MISSOURI BOOTHEEL AND MOVED QUICKLY NORTH INTO THE
SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WATCH OVER SOUTHEAST MISSOURI AND SOUTHERN
ILLINOIS.

SOUTHWEST LOW LEVEL FLOW WILL STREAM GOOD MOISTURE AHEAD OF THE COLD
FRONT OVERNIGHT. HOWEVER...LIMITED INSTABILITY WILL PROBABLY HINDER
WIDESPREAD SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS TO DEVELOP ALONG THE FRONT.
CURRENT FORECAST HANDLES THIS SCENARIO WELL AND SEE NO REASON TO
DEVIATE FROM IT AT THIS TIME. PRE-FRONTAL WARMING A GOOD BET...AS
TIMING OF THE FRONT SHOULD MOVE THROUGH THE NORTHWEST PORTIONS OF
THE FORECAST AREA BY MID MORNING AND THROUGH MEMPHIS AROUND 2 PM.
WITH THIS IN MIND...WE FEEL JUSTIFIED WITH TEMPERATURES NEAR VALUES
OF TODAY OVER AREAS ROUGHLY ALONG AND SOUTH OF I-40 AND SLIGHTLY
COOLER NORTH.

ANOTHER REINFORCING SHOT OF COOL AIR WILL ROTATE SOUTHWARD
WEDNESDAY. THE COOLER MORNING WILL LIKELY OCCUR THURSDAY RATHER THAN
WEDNESDAY AS THE HIGH PRESSURE WILL BE DELAYED UNTIL THE SECOND PUSH
OF COOLER AIR PUSHES THROUGH. EXPECT WEDNESDAY DAYTIME TEMPERATURES
TO BE PLEASANT FROM THE MID TO UPPER 80S FOR MOST LOCATIONS. THIS
SLIGHTLY COOLER TREND WILL PERSIST THROUGH THE WEEKEND.

THE LONGER RANGE MODELS ARE HINTING AT SOME CONVECTION FIRING OVER
WESTERN OKLAHOMA/KANSAS WEDNESDAY NIGHT. THIS IS AT LEAST THE SECOND
MODEL RUN THAT SHOWS THIS FEATURE. SHOULD IT FORM INTO AN MCS...THE
NORTHWEST FLOW OVER THE REGION WOULD STEER IT INTO THE SOUTHWESTERN
THIRD OF THE FORECAST AREA THURSDAY AFTERNOON/EVENING. HAVE
ACCOUNTED FOR THIS POSSIBILITY IN THE FORECAST FOR THURSDAY NIGHT
AND INTO FRIDAY.

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.

245 AM MON JUN 13 2005

.DISCUSSION...

MOST PLACES ARE CLEAR AT THE PRESENT TIME. BUT AN AREA OF SCT
CLDS IS CURRENTLY NORTH TO SOUTH OVER CENTRAL AR. THE LEADING
EDGE HAS REACHED EVENING SHADE...LITTLE ROCK AND PINE BLUFF.
THINK THESE CLDS WILL CONTINUE EAST AND BE AFFECTING WESTERN
COUNTIES BEFORE DAYBREAK. THINK THERE WILL BE ENOUGH BREAKS IN
THE CLDS TO LET IT GET INTO THE LOWER 90S AGAIN TDA.

ANOTHER FRONT WILL BE ON THE WESTERN EDGE OF THE MIDSOUTH BY
TUESDAY MORNING. THERE WILL BE ENOUGH MOISTURE AND INSTABILITY TO
BRING MORE SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS TUESDAY AND TUESDAY NIGHT.

AFTER TUE NIGHT WE ARE EXPECTING ANOTHER DRY AND COOLER AIR MASS
TO MOVE IN. IT SHOULD VISIT THE AREA THROUGH THE COMING WEEKEND.
WEATHER SYSTEMS SHOULD COME THROUGH WESTERN AND CENTRAL AR. ONLY
PLACES NEAR COAHOMA COUNTY MS ARE PEGGED TO GET SHOWERS FROM
THESE SYSTEMS RIDING DOWN THE EASTERN SIDE OF THE RIDGE.

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 122007
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
307 PM CDT SUN JUN 12 2005

.DISCUSSION...

THE REMNANTS OF ARLENE CONTINUE TO MOVE SLOWLY NORTHEAST THIS
AFTERNOON. RAINFALL ASSOCIATED WITH THE SYSTEM HAS NOW ENDED...BUT
ABUNDANT CLOUD COVER CONTINUES OVER MOST OF WEST TENNESSEE AND
NORTHEAST MISSISSIPPI. THIS HAS HELPED KEEP TEMPERATURES COOL TODAY
ACROSS THESE AREAS.

CLOUDS WILL EVENTUALLY CLEAR FROM WEST TO EAST OVERNIGHT AND ONCE
SKIES SCATTER OUT ACROSS EASTERN AREAS...EXPECT AREAS OF FOG TO
DEVELOP. HIGH PRESSURE WILL BUILD BACK OVER THE MID-SOUTH ON MONDAY
IN THE WAKE OF ARLENE ALLOWING FOR PARTLY CLOUDY SKIES AND WARMER
TEMPERATURES. LOW LEVEL WARM ADVECTION WILL ALLOW TEMPERATURES TO
WARM BACK INTO THE LOW 90S WEST TO AROUND 90 EAST...WHERE WET SOIL
WILL HOLD TEMPS BACK A BIT. ALSO EXPECT A CU FIELD TO DEVELOP
TOMORROW...ESPECIALLY OVER EASTERN SECTIONS. DRY WEATHER AND VERY
WARM TEMPERATURES CAN BE EXPECTED AGAIN ON TUESDAY.

THE UPPER TROUGH NOW POSITIONED OVER THE WESTERN STATES WILL
CONTINUE TO LIFT OUT INTO THE PLAINS STATES ON TUESDAY AND ACROSS
THE MISSISSIPPI VALLEY TUESDAY NIGHT AND WEDNESDAY. THIS WILL HELP
TO SEND A COLD FRONT ACROSS THE AREA TUESDAY AFTERNOON AND NIGHT.
12Z NAM/GFS BOTH IN GOOD AGREEMENT WITH THE TIMING OF FRONTAL
PASSAGE. IN ADDITION...BOTH MODELS INDICATING LIMITED AMOUNTS OF
MOISTURE IN ADVANCE OF THE FRONT...SO ONLY EXPECTING ISOLATED
CONVECTION WITH THE FRONT AT BEST. HAVE ADDED 20 POPS FOR TUESDAY
AFTERNOON AND NIGHT WITH FRONTAL PASSAGE. ALSO BEST UPPER LEVEL
DYNAMICS AND SHEAR SHOULD REMAIN NORTH OF THE AREA...SO THINK ANY
STORMS THAT CAN DEVELOP WILL REMAIN BELOW SEVERE LIMITS.

SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE WILL BUILD INTO THE AREA BEHIND THE FRONT FOR
WEDNESDAY THROUGH NEXT WEEKEND. THE UPPER TROUGH WILL PERSIST OVER
THE NORTHEAST STATES WITH DRY NORTHWESTERLY FLOW ALOFT REMAINING
OVER THE AREA. SO EXPECT DRY WEATHER ALONG WITH LESS HUMIDITY AND
COOLER TEMPERATURES FOR THE END OF THE WEEK AND INTO NEXT WEEKEND.

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.

FXUS64 KMEG 121551
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
1051 AM CDT SUN JUN 12 2005

.DISCUSSION...

THE REMNANTS OF ARLENE ARE NOW MOVING NORTHEAST ACROSS THE EASTERN
PORTIONS OF THE FORECAST AREA THIS MORNING. THIS SYSTEM WILL
CONTINUE TO MOVE NORTHEAST AND AWAY FROM THE MID-SOUTH THIS
AFTERNOON. RAINBANDS ASSOCIATED WITH THE SYSTEM ARE STILL AFFECTING
PORTIONS OF WEST TENNESSEE...MAINLY ALONG AND EAST OF A LINE FROM
OBION TO JACKSON TO SELMER EASTWARD AT 15Z. THE RAINFALL INTENSITY
HAS DECREASED SIGNIFICANTLY OVER THE PAST COUPLE OF HOURS SO HAVE
GONE AHEAD AND CANCELLED THE FLOOD WATCH THAT WAS IN PLACE. THIS
RAIN WILL CONTINUE TO TAPER OFF THROUGH EARLY AFTERNOON AND MOST
PLACES SHOULD BE DRY AFTER 20Z.

THE CLOUD COVER WILL TAKE A BIT LONGER TO CLEAR ACROSS THE EASTERN
HALF OF THE AREA...BUT EVEN THESE AREAS WITH THE EXCEPTION OF
NORTHEASTERN PORTIONS OF THE FORECAST AREA WILL BECOME PARTLY
CLOUDY BY LATE AFTERNOON. ACROSS THE WESTERN HALF OF THE AREA...
SKIES HAVE CLEARED OUT...BUT EXPECT CU FIELD TO DEVELOP OVER THESE
AREAS OVER THE NEXT HOUR OR SO. TEMPERATURES WILL BE WARMEST IN THE
WEST...WHERE SKIES WILL BE PARTLY CLOUDY AND LESS RAIN HAS FALLEN...
AND COOLEST ACROSS THE EAST...WHERE CLOUDS LINGER LONGEST AND THE
GROUND IS SATURATED FROM LAST NIGHTS RAINFALL. ALSO ADJUSTED
DEWPOINTS DOWN A BIT TO ACCOUNT FOR CURRENT TRENDS. ALL OTHER
FORECAST PARAMETERS LOOK GOOD.

UPDATES TO THE GRIDS AND ZONES HAVE ALREADY BEEN SENT.

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...CORRECTION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
418 AM CDT SUN JUN 12 2005

TROPICAL STORM ARLENE IS NOW IN WEST CENTRAL ALABAMA. RAINS BANDS
FROM THE STORM COVER MOST OF WEST TENNESSEE AND MUCH OF NORTHEAST
MISSISSIPPI ATTM. DO NOT THINK RAIN WILL MOVE MUCH FARTHER
WEST...THUS THERE WILL BE A SHARP CUTOFF OF RAIN CHANCES JUST TO
THE WEST OF CURRENT RADAR IMAGES TO START WITH THIS MORNING.
HEAVY RAIN STILL POSSIBLE EASTERN PARTS OF THE CWA. GOING TO KEEP
FLOOD WATCH FOR THAT AREA TODAY.

ARLENE TO GET INTO W KY BY THIS EVENING. THINK RAIN WILL QUICKLY
END AFTER THE CENTER OF THE STORM MOVE NORTH PAST US. IN OTHER
WORDS...RAIN SHOULD BE ENDING THIS AFTERNOON AT MOST ALL PLACES.

BY TUESDAY ANOTHER FRONT WILL DRAW NEAR FROM THE WEST AND INDUCE
SHOWERS TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY. COOLER DRIER AIR WILL THEN BE
DRAGGED IN WEDNESDAY NIGHT. DO NOT FORESEE ANYMORE RAIN THROUGH
SATURDAY NIGHT.

$$

TN...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM SATURDAY THROUGH 6 PM SUNDAY
FOR AREAS EAST OF A LINE FROM MARTIN TO JACKSON TO BOLIVAR. THIS
INCLUDES TNZ003-TNZ004-TNZ020-TNZ021-TNZ052-TNZ053-TNZ054-TNZ055-
TNZ090-TNZ091-TNZ092.

$$









000 
FXUS64 KMEG 112054 CCB
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...CORRECTION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
351 PM CDT SAT JUN 11 2005

.DISCUSSION...

TROPICAL STORM ARLENE IS THE MAIN WEATHER FEATURE OF INTEREST THIS
AFTERNOON AND THE AFFECTS FROM THE REMNANTS OF THIS SYSTEM WILL
IMPACT PORTIONS OF THE MID-SOUTH INTO THE WEEKEND. T.S. ARLENE IS
CURRENTLY MAKING LANDFALL NEAR PENSACOLA FLORIDA AT THE CURRENT
TIME AND IS MOVING TO THE NORTH AT ABOUT 13 MPH. AN OUTER RAINBAND
IN ASSOCIATION WITH THE STORM IS ALREADY ENTERING EXTREME EASTERN
PORTIONS OF THE FORECAST AREA AND WILL CONTINUE TO SLOWLY PROGRESS
WESTWARD THIS EVENING AND OVERNIGHT. ACROSS WESTERN PORTIONS OF THE
AREA...THERE HAVE BEEN MANY MORE BREAKS IN THE CLOUD COVER AND
SOLAR HEATING HAS LED TO THE DEVELOPMENT OF DIURNAL CONVECTION. THIS
SHOULD CONTINUE INTO THE EVENING HOURS...BEFORE DIMINISHING AFTER
SUNSET.

AS FOR THE FORECAST MODELS AND THEIR HANDLING OF THE TROPICAL
STORM. MODEL GUIDANCE STILL A BIT DIVERGENT ON THE EVENTUAL TRACK
OF THE REMNANTS OF ARLENE. THE 12Z AND EVEN TO SOME EXTENT THE 18Z
NAM WANT TO BRING THE REMNANTS TO THE NORTHWEST...TRACKING THE
SYSTEM OVER MEMPHIS ON SUNDAY. THE 12Z GFS AND THE TROPICAL SUITE
(GFDL...UKMET...BAMS...NOGAPS) ARE FURTHER EAST WITH THE REMNANT
LOW...TRACKING IT NORTHWARD BASICALLY ACROSS EXTREME WESTERN ALABAMA.
CURRENTLY AM FAVORING THE MORE EASTERN TRACK OF THE GFS AND
TROPICAL SUITE AS THE TREND AS OF LATE HAS BEEN TO REMAIN FURTHER
EAST WITH ITS LANDFALL AND IT APPEARS THAT THE SYSTEM WILL TRACK
ALONG A NORTH OR NORTH-NORTHWEST TRACK BETWEEN THE LONGWAVE TROUGH
OVER THE WEST AND THE WESTERN ATLANTIC UPPER LEVEL ANTICYCLONE.

A BAND OF HEAVIER RAIN HAS DEVELOPED WELL TO THE NORTHWEST OF THE
CENTER OF ARLENE AND THIS BAND NOW OVER FAR EASTERN PORTIONS OF THE
FORECAST AREA WILL SLOWLY BACK WEST. YET THE FURTHEST WESTWARD
EXTENT OF THIS BAND WILL LIKELY STAY EAST OF MEMPHIS AND I-55 IN
NORTH MISSISSIPPI. SCATTERED SHOWERS WILL LIKELY DEVELOP WEST OF
THIS MAIN BAND...BUT RAINFALL AMOUNTS SHOULD REMAIN ON THE LIGHT
SIDE. FURTHER EAST...ACROSS NORTHEAST MISSISSIPPI AND WEST
TENNESSEE NEAR THE TENNESSEE RIVER...PERIODS OF HEAVY RAIN WILL BE
POSSIBLE TONIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY. RAINFALL TOTALS BETWEEN 2-3 INCHES
WILL BE COMMON ACROSS THESE AREAS...WITH ISOLATED HIGHER AMOUNTS.
THEREFORE HAD NO STRONG REASONING TO DISCONTINUE FLOOD WATCH ISSUED
EARLIER AND WILL LEAVE GOING THROUGH SUNDAY AFTERNOON WITH SAME
AREAS COVERED BY THE WATCH.

WINDS WILL ALSO INCREASE...MAINLY ACROSS EASTERN AREAS...INCLUDING
NORTHEAST MISSISSIPPI AND EAST PORTIONS OF WEST TENNESSEE AS THE
REMNANT LOW MOVES CLOSER AND THE PRESSURE GRADIENT TIGHTENS.
CURRENT THINKING IS THAT WINDS WILL INCREASE TO 15-25 MPH WITH GUSTS
BETWEEN 30-35 MPH IN THESE AREAS. ALTHOUGH WINDS WILL BE GUSTY...
BELIEVE WINDS WILL REMAIN BELOW ADVISORY CRITERIA AT THIS TIME.
LATER SHIFTS WILL STILL NEED TO KEEP AN EYE ON THIS THOUGH.

FOR THE EXTENDED PERIOD...THE REMNANTS OF ARLENE WILL DEPART THE
AREA LATER SUNDAY NIGHT...WITH A TROPICAL AIRMASS REMAINING IN
PLACE THROUGH TUESDAY...ESPECIALLY ACROSS EASTERN AREAS. SUBSIDENCE
BEHIND THE PARTING TROPICAL SYSTEM MAY INITIALLY LIMIT OVERALL
CONVECTIVE COVERAGE ON MONDAY...ESPECIALLY WEST...BUT DIURNAL
COVERAGE SHOULD INCREASE IN COVERAGE AGAIN ON TUESDAY. A COLD FRONT
WILL MOVE ACROSS THE AREA TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY...WITH
ADDITIONAL CHANCES FOR SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS. DRIER...LESS
HUMID...AND SLIGHTLY COOLER WEATHER WILL MOVE IN FOR THE END OF NEXT
WEEK AS HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS IN UNDER DRIER NORTHWESTERLY FLOW
ALOFT.

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM SATURDAY THROUGH 6 PM SUNDAY
FOR AREAS EAST OF A LINE FROM ASHLAND TO CALHOUN CITY. THIS
INCLUDES MSZ003-MSZ004-MSZ005-MSZ006-MSZ009-MSZ014-MSZ015-MSZ016-
MSZ017-MSZ022-MSZ023-MSZ024.
TN...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM SATURDAY THROUGH 6 PM SUNDAY
FOR AREAS EAST OF A LINE FROM MARTIN TO JACKSON TO BOLIVAR. THIS
INCLUDES TNZ003-TNZ004-TNZ020-TNZ021-TNZ052-TNZ053-TNZ054-TNZ055-
TNZ090-TNZ091-TNZ092.

$$

JLH





NORTHEAST MISSISSIPPI AND EAST PORTIONS OF WEST TENNESSEE AS THE
REMNANT LOW MOVES CLOSER AND THE PRESSURE GRADIENT TIGHTENS.

BETWEEN 30-35 MPH IN THESE AREAS. ALTHOUGH WINDS WILL BE GUSTY...
BELIEVE WINDS WILL REMAIN BELOW ADVISORY CRITERIA AT THIS TIME.
LATER SHIFTS WILL STILL NEED TO KEEP AN EYE ON THIS THOUGH.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
347 PM CDT SAT JUN 11 2005

.DISCUSSION...

AFTERNOON AND THE AFFECTS FROM THE REMNANTS OF THIS SYSTEM WILL
IMPACT PORTIONS OF THE MID-SOUTH INTO THE WEEKEND. T.S. ARLENE IS

FXUS64 KMEG 111559
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
1059 AM CDT SAT JUN 11 2005

.DISCUSSION...

THE BIG WEATHER STORY THIS MORNING AND FOR THE WEEKEND WILL BE
TROPICAL STORM ARLENE...WHICH IS NEARING THE ALABAMA GULF COAST. THE
OUTER CLOUD SHIELD ASSOCIATED WITH ARLENE HAS ADVANCED WESTWARD INTO
PORTIONS OF WEST TENNESSEE AND NORTHEAST MISSISSIPPI AS OF 15Z THIS
MORNING...WITH THE WESTERN EDGE OF THE PRECIPITATION SHIELD TO THE
MISSISSIPPI/ALABAMA BORDER AND SLOWLY MOVING WEST. SOME SHOWER
ACTIVITY HAS ALSO BROKEN OUT ACROSS WEST TENNESSEE...MAINLY TO THE
EAST OF JACKSON.

DEEP TROPICAL MOISTURE WILL CONTINUE TO BACK WESTWARD INTO EASTERN
PORTIONS OF THE FORECAST AREA THIS AFTERNOON. WITH THIS IN MIND...
HAVE BUMPED UP POPS ACROSS THESE AREAS. ALSO WILL INCREASE CLOUD
COVER FROM EAST TO WEST IN THE CLOUD GRIDS THROUGH THIS AFTERNOON.
OVER THE WESTERN HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA THERE HAS BEEN A GOOD
AMOUNT OF SUN THIS MORNING. PLAN TO GO WITH 50 POPS OVER THESE
AREAS...WITH MORE DIURNAL SCATTERED CONVECTION DEVELOPING DUE TO
LEFT OVER CONVECTIVE BOUNDARIES FROM YESTERDAYS STORMS...INCREASING
MOISTURE...AND DAYTIME HEATING. HAVE KEPT TEMPERATURES LOWER IN THE
EAST DUE TO GREATER CLOUD COVER AND RAIN CHANCES AND HIGHER WEST
WHERE MORE SOLAR HEATING IS ANTICIPATED.

UPDATED GRIDS AND ZONE FORECAST WILL BE OUT SHORTLY.

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM SATURDAY THROUGH 6 PM SUNDAY
FOR AREAS EAST OF A LINE FROM ASHLAND TO CALHOUN CITY. THIS
INCLUDES MSZ003-MSZ004-MSZ005-MSZ006-MSZ009-MSZ014-MSZ015-MSZ016-
MSZ017-MSZ022-MSZ023-MSZ024.
TN...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM SATURDAY THROUGH 6 PM SUNDAY
FOR AREAS EAST OF A LINE FROM MARTIN TO JACKSON TO BOLIVAR. THIS
INCLUDES TNZ003-TNZ004-TNZ020-TNZ021-TNZ052-TNZ053-TNZ054-TNZ055-
TNZ090-TNZ091-TNZ092.

FXUS64 KMEG 110908
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
500 CDT SAT JUN 11 2005

THE BIG WEATHER NEWS FOR THE MIDSOUTH TODAY IS TROPICAL STORM
ARLENE. EXPECT REMNENTS OF THIS STORM TO MOVE NORTH NEAR THE
EASTERN BORDER OF THE CWA SUNDAY. WITH THIS IN MIND...EASTERN
COUNTIES HAVE BE PLACED UNDER A FLOOD WATCH TONIGHT AND SUNDAY.
EASTERN COUNTIES ALSO HAVE A SLIGHT CHANCE OF SEVERE WEATHER WITH
ISOLATED TORNADOES THE MAIN THREAT.

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...FLOOD WATCH TONIGHT AND SUNDAY
TN...FLOOD WATCH TONIGHT AND SUNDAY
&&

$$

WER





000 
FXUS64 KMEG 110406
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
1104 PM CDT FRI JUN 10 2005

.UPDATE...

STUBBORN AREA OF CONVECTION OVER NE AR AND THE MO BOOTHEEL WILL MEAN 
THAT HIGHER POPS WILL BE NEED IN THE ZONE UPDATE. WILL UPDATE TO 50 
POPS FOR THOSE AREA...20S ELSEWHERE. ZONE PACKAGE WILL BE OUT IN A 
FEW.

HERE IS THE REST OF THE PREVIOUS UPDATE...

CONVECTION IS COMING TO AN END ACROSS MOST OF THE CWA...WITH THE 
EXCEPTION OF NE AR AND THE MO BOOTHEEL WHERE AN OUTFLOW BOUNDARY IS 
SUSTAINING CONVECTION. AS THE OUTFLOW CONTINUES TO MOVE NW...EXPECT 
CONVECTION TO SLOWLY DIMINISH OVER THESE AREAS. WILL ISSUE AN UPDATE 
BETWEEN 04-05Z TO BRING DOWN POPS TO SLIGHT CHANCE OVERNIGHT. REST 
OF THE ONGOING FORECAST IS IN GOOD SHAPE.

THE BIGGER FORECAST STORY...ESPECIALLY FOR TOMORROW NIGHT INTO 
SUNDAY...WILL BE THE TRACK OF TROPICAL STORM ARLENE. AS OF THIS 
WRITING...ARLENE HAS STRENGTHENED TO 70 MPH AND IS MOVING TOWARD THE 
NW. IT IS 270 MILES SOUTHEAST OF PENSACOLA FL. 

THE QUESTION WILL BE WHERE DOES THE REMNANTS OF ARLENE TRACK? THIS 
WILL HAVE A LARGE IMPACT ON THE AMOUNT OF RAIN THE CWA RECEIVES. THE 
LATEST NHC TRACK IS SLIGHTLY TO THE WEST OF THE PREVIOUS 
TRACK...COMING RATHER CLOSE TO NE MS. THIS WOULD HAVE GREATER 
IMPLICATIONS FOR THE AREA. THERE IS DEFINITELY A HEAVY RAINFALL 
POTENTIAL AND THE HWO COVERS THIS VERY WELL. DECIDED NOT TO ISSUE 
ANY SORT OF FLOOD WATCH AT THIS TIME. THE MIDNIGHT SHIFT CAN 
REEVALUATE...ESPECIALLY AFTER HPC ISSUES THEIR LATEST QPF FORECAST. 
STILL FEEL THERE IS UNCERTAINTY AS TO HOW FAR WEST THE HEAVY RAINS 
WILL MAKE IT. 

.PREVIOUS DISCUSSION ISSUED AT 342 PM FRI JUN 10 2005...

A SUMMER-LIKE WEATHER PATTERN CONTINUES AGAIN THIS AFTERNOON WITH
DIURNAL CONVECTION ONCE AGAIN DEVELOPING. NOT QUITE AS WIDESPREAD
AS YESTERDAY AT THIS TIME...WITH UPPER LEVEL CONFLUENCE A BIT
STRONGER TODAY BETWEEN THE WESTERN TROUGH AND TROPICAL STORM
ARLENE. STILL EXPECTING ADDITIONAL SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS TO
DEVELOP THIS AFTERNOON AND EVENING WITH HEAVY RAINFALL AND GUSTY
WINDS BEING THE GREATEST THREAT WITH ANY STORMS...AS PWATS ON THE
HIGH SIDE. ALSO CAPE VALUES RANGING FROM 1500 TO 2500 J/KG OVER
MOST OF THE AREA...SO ISOLATED PULSE SEVERE STORMS ARE POSSIBLE.

CHANCES FOR SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS WILL CONTINUE INTO TONIGHT
WITH MOIST AIRMASS IN PLACE. BEST CHANCES WILL BE ACROSS EASTERN
SECTIONS OVERNIGHT WITH INCREASING TROPICAL MOISTURE AND LOW-LEVEL
CONVERGENCE PRECEDING TROPICAL STORM ARLENE.

THE BIG WEATHER STORY FOR THE WEEKEND WILL CONTINUE TO BE AFFECTS
FROM THE REMNANTS OF ARLENE. 12Z MODEL GUIDANCE INITIALIZED THE
TROPICAL SYSTEM POORLY...WITH THE NAM AND ECMWF FURTHER WEST WITH
LANDFALL AS COMPARED WITH THE GFS. CURRENTLY LIKE 12Z GFS SOLUTION
BETTER AND PREFER A FURTHER EAST SOLUTION AS THE TREND HAS BEEN TO
MOVE ALONG A TRACK FURTHER EASTWARD TODAY. IN ADDITION...THE MEAN
TROUGH/RIDGE CONFIGURATION APPEARS TO SUPPORT THE FURTHER
EASTWARD TRACK AND DOES NOT APPEAR THAT IT WILL CHANGE GREATLY
THROUGH THE WEEKEND.

WITH A FURTHER EAST TRACK...THIS WILL HAVE IMPLICATIONS ON THE
WEEKEND FORECAST ACROSS THE MID-SOUTH...AS THE GREATEST HEAVY
RAINFALL THREAT WILL BE ALONG AND TO THE EAST OF THE EVENTUAL TRACK
OF THE REMNANTS OF ARLENE. BEST THINKING AT THIS POINT IS THAT ARLENE
WILL CONTINUE TO TRACK NORTH TO NORTH-NORTHWEST MAKING LANDFALL ALONG
THE NORTHERN GULF COAST TOMORROW EVENING. THEN THE REMNANT LOW SHOULD
TRACK NORTH...WITH BEST ESTIMATES ALONG THE EASTERN BORDER OF OUR
CWA...FROM SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY. THIS WOULD KEEP THE
GREATEST THREAT FOR VERY HEAVY RAIN TO OUR EAST. STILL...WITH
MOISTURE ADVANCING NORTHWARD IN ADVANCE OF THIS SYSTEM...HAVE DECIDED
TO RAISE POPS TO LIKELY ACROSS EASTERN SECTIONS AND CHANCE POPS IN
THE WEST. ALSO...THE EVENTUAL TRACK AND INTENSITY OF THIS TROPICAL
SYSTEM IS SUBJECT TO CHANGE. IF THE SYSTEM TRACKS FURTHER WEST THAN
CURRENTLY EXPECTED...THEN THE HEAVY RAIN THREAT WOULD BE POSSIBLE...
ESPECIALLY ACROSS EASTERN AREAS. STAYED TUNED FOR UPDATED INFORMATION
ON THIS STORM SYSTEM THROUGH THE WEEKEND...BUT AT THIS TIME WILL
KEEP QPF VALUES ON THE ORDER OF 1-2 INCHES ACROSS EASTERN AREAS...
WITH LESSER VALUES WEST. WITH THE DRY CONDITIONS AS OF LATE...THESE
TOTALS WILL NOT LIKELY RESULT IN MAJOR FLOODING ISSUES. IF RAINFALL
INTENSITIES ARE GREAT...CANNOT RULE OUT SOME AREAS OF FLASH
FLOODING AND PONDING OF ROADWAYS. THESE RAINFALL AMOUNTS WILL
CONTINUE TO BE REVISED AS NEW INFORMATION BECOMES AVAILABLE.

FOR NEXT WEEK...A TROPICAL AIRMASS WILL BE LEFT IN THE WAKE OF
ARLENE FOR MONDAY AND TUESDAY. THEREFORE...DIURNAL CONVECTION WILL
ONCE AGAIN BE POSSIBLE FOR THESE TIME PERIODS WITH TEMPERATURES
RISING BACK TO SLIGHTLY ABOVE NORMAL VALUES. THE NEXT COLD FRONT IS
PROGGED TO MOVE ACROSS THE AREA FOR MID WEEK WITH ADDITIONAL
CHANCES FOR SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS. DRY WEATHER AND LOWER
HUMIDITY LEVELS WILL MOVE INTO THE AREA BEHIND THE FRONT WITH HIGH
PRESSURE BUILDING IN FOR THE END OF NEXT WEEK.

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.
&&

$$

JLH/JFB









000 
FXUS64 KMEG 110308

DEVELOP THIS AFTERNOON AND EVENING WITH HEAVY RAINFALL AND GUSTY
WINDS BEING THE GREATEST THREAT WITH ANY STORMS...AS PWATS ON THE
HIGH SIDE. ALSO CAPE VALUES RANGING FROM 1500 TO 2500 J/KG OVER
MOST OF THE AREA...SO ISOLATED PULSE SEVERE STORMS ARE POSSIBLE.

CHANCES FOR SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS WILL CONTINUE INTO TONIGHT
WITH MOIST AIRMASS IN PLACE. BEST CHANCES WILL BE ACROSS EASTERN
SECTIONS OVERNIGHT WITH INCREASING TROPICAL MOISTURE AND LOW-LEVEL
CONVERGENCE PRECEDING TROPICAL STORM ARLENE.

THE BIG WEATHER STORY FOR THE WEEKEND WILL CONTINUE TO BE AFFECTS
FROM THE REMNANTS OF ARLENE. 12Z MODEL GUIDANCE INITIALIZED THE
TROPICAL SYSTEM POORLY...WITH THE NAM AND ECMWF FURTHER WEST WITH
LANDFALL AS COMPARED WITH THE GFS. CURRENTLY LIKE 12Z GFS SOLUTION
BETTER AND PREFER A FURTHER EAST SOLUTION AS THE TREND HAS BEEN TO
MOVE ALONG A TRACK FURTHER EASTWARD TODAY. IN ADDITION...THE MEAN
TROUGH/RIDGE CONFIGURATION APPEARS TO SUPPORT THE FURTHER
EASTWARD TRACK AND DOES NOT APPEAR THAT IT WILL CHANGE GREATLY
THROUGH THE WEEKEND.

WITH A FURTHER EAST TRACK...THIS WILL HAVE IMPLICATIONS ON THE
WEEKEND FORECAST ACROSS THE MID-SOUTH...AS THE GREATEST HEAVY
RAINFALL THREAT WILL BE ALONG AND TO THE EAST OF THE EVENTUAL TRACK
OF THE REMNANTS OF ARLENE. BEST THINKING AT THIS POINT IS THAT ARLENE
WILL CONTINUE TO TRACK NORTH TO NORTH-NORTHWEST MAKING LANDFALL ALONG
THE NORTHERN GULF COAST TOMORROW EVENING. THEN THE REMNANT LOW SHOULD
TRACK NORTH...WITH BEST ESTIMATES ALONG THE EASTERN BORDER OF OUR
CWA...FROM SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY. THIS WOULD KEEP THE
GREATEST THREAT FOR VERY HEAVY RAIN TO OUR EAST. STILL...WITH
MOISTURE ADVANCING NORTHWARD IN ADVANCE OF THIS SYSTEM...HAVE DECIDED
TO RAISE POPS TO LIKELY ACROSS EASTERN SECTIONS AND CHANCE POPS IN
THE WEST. ALSO...THE EVENTUAL TRACK AND INTENSITY OF THIS TROPICAL
SYSTEM IS SUBJECT TO CHANGE. IF THE SYSTEM TRACKS FURTHER WEST THAN
CURRENTLY EXPECTED...THEN THE HEAVY RAIN THREAT WOULD BE POSSIBLE...
ESPECIALLY ACROSS EASTERN AREAS. STAYED TUNED FOR UPDATED INFORMATION
ON THIS STORM SYSTEM THROUGH THE WEEKEND...BUT AT THIS TIME WILL
KEEP QPF VALUES ON THE ORDER OF 1-2 INCHES ACROSS EASTERN AREAS...
WITH LESSER VALUES WEST. WITH THE DRY CONDITIONS AS OF LATE...THESE
TOTALS WILL NOT LIKELY RESULT IN MAJOR FLOODING ISSUES. IF RAINFALL
INTENSITIES ARE GREAT...CANNOT RULE OUT SOME AREAS OF FLASH
FLOODING AND PONDING OF ROADWAYS. THESE RAINFALL AMOUNTS WILL
CONTINUE TO BE REVISED AS NEW INFORMATION BECOMES AVAILABLE.

FOR NEXT WEEK...A TROPICAL AIRMASS WILL BE LEFT IN THE WAKE OF
ARLENE FOR MONDAY AND TUESDAY. THEREFORE...DIURNAL CONVECTION WILL
ONCE AGAIN BE POSSIBLE FOR THESE TIME PERIODS WITH TEMPERATURES
RISING BACK TO SLIGHTLY ABOVE NORMAL VALUES. THE NEXT COLD FRONT IS
PROGGED TO MOVE ACROSS THE AREA FOR MID WEEK WITH ADDITIONAL
CHANCES FOR SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS. DRY WEATHER AND LOWER
HUMIDITY LEVELS WILL MOVE INTO THE AREA BEHIND THE FRONT WITH HIGH
PRESSURE BUILDING IN FOR THE END OF NEXT WEEK.

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.
&&

$$

JLH/JFB

FXUS64 KMEG 102042
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
342 PM CDT FRI JUN 10 2005

.DISCUSSION...

A SUMMER-LIKE WEATHER PATTERN CONTINUES AGAIN THIS AFTERNOON WITH
DIURNAL CONVECTION ONCE AGAIN DEVELOPING. NOT QUITE AS WIDESPREAD
AS YESTERDAY AT THIS TIME...WITH UPPER LEVEL CONFLUENCE A BIT
STRONGER TODAY BETWEEN THE WESTERN TROUGH AND TROPICAL STORM
ARLENE. STILL EXPECTING ADDITIONAL SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS TO
DEVELOP THIS AFTERNOON AND EVENING WITH HEAVY RAINFALL AND GUSTY
WINDS BEING THE GREATEST THREAT WITH ANY STORMS...AS PWATS ON THE
HIGH SIDE. ALSO CAPE VALUES RANGING FROM 1500 TO 2500 J/KG OVER

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 101536
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
1036 AM CDT FRI JUN 10 2005

.DISCUSSION...

LATEST VISIBLE SATELLITE IMAGERY SHOWING MUCH LESS CLOUD COVER THIS
MORNING AS COMPARED TO YESTERDAY AT THIS TIME. GREATEST CLOUD
COVERAGE THIS MORNING HAS REMAINED OVER NORTHEAST ARKANSAS AND THE
MISSOURI BOOTHEEL. WITH LESS CLOUD COVER IN PLACE ELSEWHERE...SHOULD
SEE TEMPERATURES WARM AGAIN TO NEAR 90 DEGREES OVER MOST AREAS. ONLY
NORTHEAST ARKANSAS AND THE MISSOURI BOOTHEEL MAY SEE TEMPERATURES
HELD BACK IN THE UPPER 80S. WITH MORE SUN...WOULD BE TEMPTED
TO GO A BIT HIGHER ON TEMPS...BUT WITH YESTERDAYS RAIN ADDING
MOISTURE TO THE SOIL...EVAPOTRANSPORATION WILL KEEP TEMPERATURES
FROM GETTING MUCH HIGHER THAN 90 DEGREES. WITH THIS IN MIND...HAVE
ADJUSTED TEMPERATURE GRIDS TO FIT THIS SCENARIO.

AS FOR PRECIPITATION CHANCES...HAVE ADJUSTED GRIDS TO REFLECT 50
POPS AREAWIDE. SEE NO REASON TO JUSTIFY HIGHER OR LOWER POPS IN ANY
ONE SPECIFIC AREA OVER ANOTHER. THE WEAK UPPER LEVEL TROUGH AXIS
THAT HAS BEEN STALLED OVER THE REGION REMAINS IN PLACE...AND THIS
COMBINED WITH THE CONTINUED HIGH HUMIDITY LEVELS AND DAYTIME
HEATING SHOULD TRIGGER SCATTERED THUNDERSTORM ACTIVITY ACROSS THE
AREA THIS AFTERNOON. CONVECTIVE ACTIVITY SHOULD FOCUS ALONG OLD
CONVECTIVE OUTFLOW BOUNDARIES LEFT AROUND FROM YESTERDAYS ACTIVITY
AND IN AREAS THAT RECEIVE MAXIMUM HEATING. WITH HIGH PRECIPITABLE
WATER VALUES AND HIGH CAPE IN PLACE...EXPECTING STORMS TO ONCE AGAIN
BE CAPABLE OF PRODUCING LOCALIZED HEAVY RAINFALL...GUSTY WINDS...AND
POSSIBLE SMALL HAIL. HAVE ADDRESSED THE SPECIFICS IN THE LATEST HWO.
ALL OTHER FORECAST PARAMETERS LOOK GOOD.

UPDATED GRIDS AND ZONE FORECAST OUT SHORTLY.

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.
&&

$$

JLH

FXUS64 KMEG 100819
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
305 AM CDT FRI JUN 10 2005

.DISCUSSION...

PRESENTLY...RADAR IS SHOWING SHOWERS MOVING NORTH OVER NORTH
MISSISSIPPI INTO SOUTHERN WEST TENNESSEE. WITH THIS IN MIND AND
CONSIDERING THAT WE HAVE A WEAK UPPER TROUGH OVER THE MIDSOUTH...
THINK THERE WILL BE A GOOD ROUND OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS
AGAIN TODAY LIKE YDA. ACTIVITY SHOULD SLACK SOME TONIGHT DUE TO
DIURNAL EFFECTS.

BOTH NAM AND GFS INDICATE MOISTURE FROM TROPICAL STORM ARLENE
COULD BE PUSHED UP INTO THIS AREA SATURDAY ON THROUGH THE
WEEKEND. BELIEVE ARLENE WILL TRACK NORTHWARD IN MISSISSIPPI. THIS
WILL BOOST RAIN CHANCES A LOT FOR AN EXTENDED PERIOD OF TIME.
RAINFALL WILL BE HEAVY.



000 
FXUS64 KMEG 100151
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
850 PM CDT THU JUN 9 2005

.UPDATE...
IT HAS BEEN AN ACTIVE AFTERNOON AND EVENING WITH A GOOD DEAL OF 
DIURNAL CONVECTION. FLOODING WAS REPORTED IN EAST SHELBY COUNTY AND 
CRAIGHEAD COUNTY...BUT MEM AIRPORT ONLY RECEIVED 0.20 INCHES. SO GOES
THE WAYS OF DIURNAL CONVECTION.

SHOWER AND THUNDERSTORM ACTIVITY IS SLOW TO QUIET DOWN THIS EVENING 
DUE TO NUMEROUS OUTFLOW BOUNDARIES HELPING TO SUSTAIN CONVECTION. 
CURRENT FORECAST HAS 50 POPS THROUGH MIDNIGHT...TAPERING OFF TO 30 
POPS AFTERWARDS. THIS SEEMS REASONABLE AND WILL NOT MAKE ANY CHANGES 
FOR THE TIME BEING. 

TEMP FORECAST LOOKS ON TRACK. TEMP/DPTS ALREADY CLOSE TOGETHER AND 
DONT EXPECT MUCH OF A DROP OVERNIGHT. PATCHY FOG MAY BE AN ISSUE 
OVERNIGHT AND WILL MONITOR THE SITUATION.

WILL WATCH CONVECTIVE TRENDS AND WILL PROBABLY MAKE AN UPDATE TO THE 
GRIDS AND ZONES JUST BEFORE 05Z.

.PREVIOUS DISCUSSION ISSUED 338 PM CDT JUNE 9 2005...

SCATTERED SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS CONTINUE ACROSS PORTIONS OF THE
MID-SOUTH THIS AFTERNOON. THESE STORMS HAVE BEEN UNORGANIZED AND OF
THE PULSE VARIETY...AND WITH CAPE VALUES RANGING BETWEEN 2000-3000
J/KG A FEW OF THESE STORMS MAY BRIEFLY BECOME SEVERE...WITH WET
MICROBURST AND MARGINALLY SEVERE HAIL THE MOST LIKELY SEVERE THREATS
THROUGH EARLY THIS EVENING. THIS ACTIVITY SHOULD BEGIN TO DIMINISH
LATE THIS EVENING WITH THE LOSS OF DAYTIME HEATING.

THE SUMMER-LIKE PATTERN OVER THE MID-SOUTH WILL CONTINUE INTO THE
FIRST HALF OF THE WEEKEND AS THE BERMUDA HIGH REMAINS IN PLACE OVER
THE SOUTHEAST U.S. AND KEEPS THE AIRMASS OVER THE AREA VERY WARM
AND HUMID. A WEAK UPPER LEVEL TROUGH WILL REMAIN STALLED ACROSS THE
REGION THROUGH SATURDAY. SO WILL STICK WITH A PERSISTENCE FORECAST
THROUGH SATURDAY. EXPECT CONTINUED PARTLY CLOUDY SKIES AND DAILY
CHANCES FOR SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS...WHICH WILL BE MOST ABUNDANT
WITH THE HIGHEST COVERAGE DURING PEAK MAXIMUM DAYTIME HEATING. ONCE
AGAIN...HIGH CAPE VALUES BETWEEN 2000-3000 J/KG BY FRIDAY AFTERNOON
WILL LEAD TO ANOTHER ROUND OF POSSIBLE PULSE SEVERE STORMS. THE
MAIN THREATS FRIDAY AFTERNOON WILL ONCE AGAIN BE WET MICROBURSTS AND
MARGINALLY SEVERE HAIL.

BEYOND SATURDAY...THE FORECAST WILL HINGE ON THE CONTINUED
DEVELOPMENT AND EXACT TRACK OF TROPICAL STORM ARLENE. CURRENT MODEL
GUIDANCE SHOWING A TRACK OVER EASTERN PORTION OF OUR FORECAST AREA...
AS THE TROPICAL SYSTEM MOVES ALONG THE WESTERN PERIPHERY OF THE
BUILDING UPPER LEVEL HIGH PRESSURE SYSTEM CURRENTLY OVER THE
WESTERN ATLANTIC. THIS UPPER LEVEL ANTICYCLONE IS FORECAST TO REMAIN
IN PLACE THROUGH THE WEEKEND. THE 12Z NAM IS WEAKER AND FASTER WITH
THE TROPICAL STORM AS COMPARED WITH THE 12Z GFS/ECMWF. THE 12Z
ECMWF/GFS ALSO FURTHER WEST WITH LANDFALL ALONG MISSISSIPPI GULF
COAST AS COMPARED WITH 12Z NAM...WHICH WAS FURTHER EAST. LATEST 18Z
NAM NOW ALSO FURTHER WEST. THE EVENTUAL TRACK AND STRENGTH OF THIS
SYSTEM WILL DETERMINE ITS ULTIMATE IMPACTS ON THE MID-SOUTH.
CURRENTLY PREFER THE SLOWER MODEL SOLUTIONS AS THE SYSTEM REMAINS
OVER THE NORTHWEST CARIBBEAN SEA THIS EVENING...EVEN THOUGH SYSTEM
SHOULD INCREASE ITS FORWARD SPEED A BIT. SINCE THIS SYSTEM IS STILL
DEVELOPING AND A COUPLE OF DAYS OUT...HAVE DECIDED TO ONLY INCREASE
POPS SLIGHTLY...ESPECIALLY OVER EASTERN SECTIONS FOR SATURDAY NIGHT
AND SUNDAY. IF WESTWARD MODEL TRENDS CONTINUE TOMORROW...WILL NEED
TO RAMP UP POPS AREAWIDE FOR THIS TIME PERIOD. PREFER TO TAKE A
WAIT AND SEE APPROACH FOR NOW...AND MAKE MAJOR POP DECISION FRIDAY
AFTERNOON. BUT COULD BE A WET PERIOD FOR SATURDAY NIGHT AND SUNDAY
IF SYSTEM GOES OVERHEAD OR TO THE WEST. TEMPERATURES WILL BE ABOVE
NORMAL...BUT WILL BE HELD DOWN BY ANY RAINFALL.

FOR MONDAY AND BEYOND...TROPICAL AIRMASS WILL REMAIN IN PLACE BEHIND
THE DEPARTURE OF THE TROPICAL SYSTEM. THEREFORE...EXPECT MORE
DIURNAL CONVECTION DURING THE DAY MONDAY WITH VERY WARM TEMPERATURES
AND HIGH HUMIDITY LEVELS. NEXT COLD FRONT PROGGED FOR TUESDAY...
WITH MORE CHANCES FOR SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS. HIGH PRESSURE WILL
FOLLOW FOR THE MIDDLE TO END OF NEXT WEEK...BRINGING DRIER WEATHER
AND LOWER HUMIDITY LEVELS.

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.
&&

$$

JLH/JFB

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 091524
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
1024 AM CDT THU JUN 9 2005

.DISCUSSION...

PLENTY OF MID AND HIGH LEVEL CLOUDS LEFT OVER FROM OVERNIGHT
CONVECTION LINGERS ACROSS MAINLY NORTHWEST PORTIONS OF THE MID-
SOUTH. IN THESE AREAS HAVE UPDATED CLOUD GRIDS TO MOSTLY CLOUDY FOR
THIS AFTERNOON AND AS A RESULT HAVE BUMPED TEMPERATURES DOWN A FEW
DEGREES (UPPER 80S). ELSEWHERE...KEPT PARTLY CLOUDY SKIES IN THE
FORECAST WITH TEMPERATURES NEARING THE 90 DEGREE MARK BY LATER THIS
AFTERNOON.

A PERSISTENT WEAK UPPER LEVEL TROUGH AXIS REMAINS STALLED ACROSS THE
AREA. THIS WEAK DISTURBANCE COMBINED WITH LEFTOVER MESOSCALE
CONVECTIVE BOUNDARIES...HIGH HUMIDITY LEVELS...AND DAYTIME HEATING
WILL LEAD TO THE CONTINUED DEVELOPMENT OF SHOWERS AND
THUNDERSTORMS...ESPECIALLY DURING THE MAXIMUM HEATING OF THE DAY.
THERE MAY BE A BIT MORE COVERAGE EAST OF THE MISSISSIPPI RIVER THIS
AFTERNOON...WHERE MORE HEATING WILL OCCUR...BUT NOT ENOUGH TO CHANGE
CURRENT FORECAST POPS. THEREFORE...WILL KEEP CHANCE 50 POPS GOING
AREAWIDE.

UPDATED GRIDS AND ZONE FORECAST WILL BE OUT SHORTLY.

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.
&&

JLH





000 
FXUS64 KMEG 090724
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
224 AM CDT THU JUN 9 2005

.DISCUSSION...

THE FORECAST INTO THE WEEKEND CAN BE SUMMED UP AS PERSISTENCE. A 
DECAYING MCS THAT DEVELOPED OVER EASTERN MISSOURI PUSHED THROUGH THE 
REGION OVERNIGHT. A SECOND MCS DEVELOPED OVER SOUTHEAST KANSAS INTO 
SOUTHWEST MISSOURI WITH ITS OUTFLOW HEADED TOWARDS THE REGION. A 
POSITIVE VORT MAX IS POSITIONED SQUARELY OVER THE REGION AND THE 
ATMOSPHERE REMAINS MOIST AND UNSTABLE. THE FORECAST TODAY WILL BE 
DICTATED BY MESOSCALE FEATURES SUCH AS OLD OUTFLOW BOUNDARIES THAT 
WILL PLAY A ROLE AS THE ATMOSPHERE BEGINS TO HEAT UP. WITH THAT 
SAID...LOOKS LIKE EVERYBODY WILL HAVE EQUAL CHANCES OF RAIN TODAY. 
MADE LITTLE CHANGES TO THE TEMP FORECAST SINCE TEMPS HAVE BEEN IN 
THE 90S WITH THE AIR MASS THUNDERSTORMS. SEVERE POTENTIAL REMAINS 
ISOLATED DUE TO THE WEAK MID LEVEL LAPSE RATES...WIND SHEAR AND WEAK 
UPPER LEVEL WINDS. AS WAS THE CASE YESTERDAY...A STORM OR TWO COULD 
BECOME SEVERE WITH LOCALLY DAMAGING WINDS...HAIL UP TO NICKELS AND 
TORRENTIAL DOWNPOURS POSSIBLE.

UPPED POPS TO 40 FOR TONIGHT SINCE IT SEEMS LIKE THUNDERSTORM 
ACTIVITY IS NOT QUICKLY DISSIPATING AFTER SUNSET. AS MOIST AND 
UNSTABLE AS THE ATMOSPHERE IS...IT HAS TAKEN A WHILE FOR STORMS TO 
SIMMER DOWN. FRIDAY/SATURDAY ARE LIKELY A REPEAT OF TODAY WITH 
MODELS SHOWING THE UPPER FLOW BECOMING MORE SOUTHERLY AND A 
CONTINUED AREA OF POSITIVE VORTICITY OVER THE REGION. A TROPICAL 
SYSTEM SHOULD MAKE LANDFALL SATURDAY NIGHT OR SUNDAY SOMEWHERE ALONG 
THE GULF COAST FROM NEAR NEW ORLEANS INTO THE FLORIDA PANHANDLE. THE 
REMNANTS OF THIS SYSTEM SHOULD MOVE DUE NORTH ONCE IT MAKES LANDFALL 
SO THE FORECAST FOR SUNDAY INTO MONDAY WILL LARGELY DEPEND UPON 
WHERE LANDFALL OCCURS. GUT FEELING IS THAT LANDFALL MAY BE MORE 
TOWARDS THE ALABAMA/FLORIDA SHORE RESULTING IN BETTER RAIN CHANCES 
EAST OF THE DELTA. TOWARDS MID WEEK GFS/EUROPEAN SUGGEST THAT A 
FRONT MAY ARRIVE BRINGING AN AIR MASS CHANGE TO THE REGION FOR THAT 
LATTER HALF OF NEXT WEEK.

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.
&&

$$

VALLE





000 
FXUS64 KMEG 090348
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
1048 PM CDT WED JUN 8 2005

.UPDATE...
ANOTHER UPDATE TO THE ZONES FORTHCOMING TO RAISE POPS ONCE AGAIN 
BASED ON CURRENT RADAR TRENDS. LINE OF SHOWERS AND 
THUNDERSTORMS...FOCUSED BY AN OUTFLOW BOUNDARY...CONTINUE TO MOVE 
SOUTH ACROSS NORTHERN PARTS OF THE REGION. WILL TAKE POPS UP TO 
LIKELY FROM MEMPHIS NORTHWARD. WILL MAINTAIN CHANCE POPS SOUTH DUE 
TO AREA ALREADY WORKED OVER BY PREVIOUS CONVECTION. HAVE RECEIVED 
REPORTS OF SOME WIND GUSTS ON THE ORDER OF 40 TO 50 MPH WITH THE 
LEADING EDGE OF THE ACTIVITY. EXPECT THAT TO BE THE EXTENT OF THE 
WINDS AND WE WILL ISSUE SPS PRODUCTS WHEN APPROPRIATE. DO NOT 
FORESEE ANY SEVERE WEATHER.
