000 
FXUS64 KMEG 090122
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
822 PM CDT WED JUN 8 2005

.UPDATE...
DIURNAL CONVECTION BEGINNING TO DIMINISH OVER THE REGION WITH 
ACTIVITY STILL LINGERING NEAR THE TN RIVER AND NE MISSISSIPPI. 
EXPECT THIS ACTIVITY TO CONTINUE DIMINISHING WITH THE LOSS OF 
DAYTIME HEATING.

TO THE NORTH OF THE CWA...CONTINUE TO MONITOR THE WEAKENING MCS THAT 
IS CURRENTLY MOVING SOUTH TOWARD THE AREA. APPEARS CONVECTION IS 
BEING SUSTAINED ALONG AN OUTFLOW BOUNDARY. THE COMBINATION OF A 
SOUTHERLY WIND FLOW INTO THE SYSTEM AND 1500-2500 J/KG OF CAPE WILL 
SUSTAIN THIS LINE OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS AS IT MOVES INTO THE 
CWA...ALTHOUGH THERE SHOULD BE A WEAKENING TREND WITH INSTABILITY 
SLOWLY DECREASING AS WE HEAD FURTHER INTO THE EVENING. BEST TIMING 
PLACES THE LINE INTO NORTHEAST ARKANSAS...THE MISSOURI 
BOOTHEEL...AND NORTHWEST TENNESSEE BY 0230Z. WILL UPDATE FORECAST 
FOR 50 POPS NORTH TO 30 POPS SOUTH. 

REST OF THE FORECAST LOOKS GOOD. NO CHANGES PLANNED FOR TEMPS AT 
THIS TIME. COULD BE SOME PATCHY FOG LATE TONIGHT BUT NOT CONFIDENT 
ENOUGH YET TO MENTION IN ZONES. WILL CONTINUE TO MONITOR. UPDATE OUT 
SHORTLY.

.PREVIOUS DISCUSSION ISSUED AT 221 PM WED JUN 8 2005...
CUMULUS FIELD HAS DEVELOPED OVER THE MIDSOUTH AND ISOLATED AFTERNOON
CONVECTION OCCURRING. TEMPERATURES IN THE LOW 90S MOST AREAS THAT ARE
NOT RECEIVING PRECIPITATION.
&&

.SHORT TERM (THROUGH FRIDAY)...
ONGOING ISOLATED CONVECTION OVER NORTHWEST MISSISSIPPI AND MCS OVER
NORTHERN MISSOURI...INDICATES A THREAT OF PRECIPITATION ACROSS MUCH
OF THE CWA AT ONE POINT OR ANOTHER DURING THE NIGHT TONIGHT. WILL
KEEP CURRENT 30 POPS ACROSS THE ENTIRE AREA...AND NOT GET PICKY ABOUT
THE TIMING.

SHEAR AXIS IN THE MID-LEVELS APPEARS TO REMAIN JUST ABOUT STATIONARY
THROUGH FRIDAY. AFTERNOON CAPES THURSDAY AND FRIDAY EXPECTED TO RANGE
FROM ABOUT 2500 ON THE NAM...TO NEAR 4000 ON GFS. NOT ALL THAT MUCH
DIFFERENT THAN TODAY. CONVECTIVE TEMPERATURES APPEAR TO BE AROUND 90
DEGREES THROUGH FRIDAY.

PLAN ON A PERSISTENCE TYPE FORECAST THROUGH FRIDAY...SINCE VERY
LITTLE IS CHANGING. THIS WOULD INDICATE DIURNALLY BASED CONVECTION...
FROM ABOUT 17Z TO 03Z. WILL NOT MAKE MAJOR TEMPERATURE ADJUSTMENTS...
ALTHOUGH AREAS THAT END UP UNDER THUNDERSTORMS DURING THE DAY WILL
NOT REACH FORECAST LEVELS.
&&

.LONG TERM (AFTER FRIDAY)...
SHEAR AXIS EITHER DISSIPATES OR MOVES NORTH OUT OF THE AREA FRIDAY
NIGHT...DEPENDING ON THE CHOICE OF MODELS. AIRMASS ITSELF NOT
CHANGING MUCH...SO WILL HOLD SCATTERED POPS IN FOR SATURDAY.

AFTER SATURDAY...UNCERTAINTY FACTOR GETS LARGER. QUESTION WILL BE
WHAT CURRENT TROPICAL CIRCULATION IN THE CARRIBEAN ENDS UP DOING.
MODEL DISCUSSIONS INDICATE SYSTEM INITIALIZED TOO FAR WEST. MOST
MODEL SOLUTIONS I HAVE LOOKED AT INDICATE LANDFALL ALONG THE GULF
COAST SATURDAY OR SUNDAY. STILL A RATHER WIDE SPREAD IN POSSIBLE
SOLUTIONS. IF GFS VERIFIES...IT COULD BE RATHER WET ON SATURDAY
AND SUNDAY...WITH LANDFALL NEAR NEW ORLEANS. NCEP NOT DISCOUNTING
THIS SOLUTION YET...AS CANADIAN ISNT FAR OFF OF IT. HURRICANE MODELS
TRACK SYSTEM A COUPLE OF HUNDRED MILES EAST OF GFS/NAM SOLUTIONS.

WILL DELAY RAISING POPS FOR THE WEEKEND AND EARLY NEXT WEEK...UNTIL
WE HAVE A LITTLE MORE DEFINED SYSTEM. WILL LET CURRENT FORECAST FOR
SATURDAY THROUGH TUESDAY RIDE FOR THE MOST PART.

AS FLOW BECOMES NORTHWESTERLY BY EARLY NEXT WEEK...A COLD FRONT MAY
GET DRAGGED THROUGH THE AREA TUESDAY NIGHT. THIS WOULD INDICATE
THAT WEDNESDAY WOULD BE DRY BEHIND THE FRONT. NO BIG TEMPERATURE
SWINGS IN THE EXTENDED.

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.
&&

$$

WAGNER/JFB







FXUS64 KMEG 081539
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
1039 AM CDT WED JUN 8 2005

.DISCUSSION...
SKIES MOSTLY SUNNY ACROSS THE MIDSOUTH AT MID-MORNING...AS ONLY
ONGOING CONVECTION IS TO THE EAST OF THE TENNESSEE RIVER.
TEMPERATURES AT 15Z GENERALLY IN THE LOWER TO MIDDLE 80S WITH
SOUTHWEST WINDS. DEWPOINTS UPPER 60S TO LOWER 70S.

WEAK SHEAR AXIS EXPECTED TO CONTINUE ACROSS OUR AREA THROUGH AT
LEAST FRIDAY. FORECAST SOUNDINGS FOR MEMPHIS INDICATE THAT THE
AIRMASS IS CERTAINLY CAPABLE OF PRODUCING CONVECTION. RUC SOUNDING
MORE UNSTABLE THAN THE NAM WITH CAPES 4000 ON THE RUC WITH 2500 ON
THE NAM THIS AFTERNOON.

SEE NO REASON TO MAKE MUCH CHANGE TO GOING FORECAST. NO UPDATES
CURRENTLY PLANNED.


000 
FXUS64 KMEG 080758
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
258 AM CDT WED JUN 8 2005

.DISCUSSION...

AN ELONGATED AREA OF POSITIVE VORTICITY ASSOCIATED WITH A WEAK UPPER 
SHORTWAVE EXTENDS FROM SOUTHEAST MISSOURI THROUGH ARKANSAS AND INTO 
LOUISIANA THIS MORNING. AN AREA OF NEGATIVE VORTICITY EXTENDS FROM 
WEST TENNESSEE INTO MOST OF MISSISSIPPI. GENERALLY THE UPPER AIR 
PATTERN SHOWS POLAR JET EXTENDING FROM THE SOUTHERN HIGH PLAINS 
THROUGH THE UPPER MIDWEST. THE SUBTROPICAL JET RUNS FROM SOUTHERN 
TEXAS INTO AN UPPER LOW IN THE SOUTHERN GULF WHICH MAY EVOLVE INTO 
THE FIRST TROPICAL DISTURBANCE IN THE ATLANTIC BASIN THIS YEAR. 

MODELS SHOW THE ELONGATED VORT GRADUALLY MAKING ITS WAY INTO THE 
REGION TODAY. ALTHOUGH UPPER LEVEL WINDS ARE WEAK...THERE IS ENOUGH 
INSTABILITY (LIS AROUND -4 AND CAPE 2000-2500J/KG) IN PLACE FOR 
SCATTERED SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS TO ONCE AGAIN DEVELOP. SEVERE 
POTENTIAL IS LOW DUE TO THE WEAK UPPER WINDS (5-10KTS) AND WEAK MID 
LEVEL LAPSE RATES THAT ARE AROUND 5.5C/KM. GIVEN THE LI AND CAPE...A 
STORM OR TWO COULD STILL RESULT IN A WET MICROBURST WITH VERY 
LOCALIZED WIND DAMAGE AND FAIRLY SMALL HAIL. THE TREND THE PAST 
COUPLE DAYS IN THIS PATTERN HAS BEEN FOR HIGHS TO BE NEAR 90 OR IN 
THE LOWER 90S AND WITH NO LOW CLOUDS THIS MORNING TO HINDER TEMPS 
THIS LOOKS REASONABLE FOR TODAY.

BASICALLY FORECASTING PERSISTENCE FOR THE REMAINDER OF THE WEEK WITH 
MODELS SHOWING THE ELONGATED AREA OF POSITIVE VORTICITY REMAINING 
FIXED OVER THE AREA. THE FORECAST WILL LARGELY BE DEPENDENT UPON THE 
MESOSCALE FEATURES LIKE OUTFLOW BOUNDARIES AND CONVECTIVE VORTS 
WHICH ARE DIFFICULT TO PINPOINT AT THIS TIME.

EUROPEAN/GFS/ETA ALL HINTING AT A TROPICAL SYSTEM DEVELOPING NEAR 
THE YUCATAN CHANNEL LATER THIS WEEK. THE GFS IS VERY AGGRESSIVE WITH 
THE SYSTEM AND CONTINUES TO SHOW LANDFALL IN THE LOWER MISSISSIPPI 
RIVER BASIN ON SATURDAY WITH THE REMNANTS MOVING NORTH THROUGH THE 
BASIN ON SUNDAY. ETA/EUROPEAN MORE CONSERVATIVE IN THE NORTHERN 
MOVEMENT OF THIS SYSTEM. OTHERWISE...THE WEATHER PATTERN OVER THE 
CONUS LOOKS MAINLY UNCHANGED WITH A BROAD TROUGH REMAINING OVER THE 
WESTERN US AND A RIDGE OVER THE EAST.

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.
&&

$$

VALLE





000 
FXUS64 KMEG 080200
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
857 PM CDT TUE JUN 7 2005

.UPDATE...

AN OUTFLOW BOUNDARY MOVING ACROSS EAST CENTRAL ARKANSAS HAS SPARKED 
A CLUSTER OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS THIS EVENING. THIS CONVECTION
HAS MAINLY AFFECTED OUR CWA IN AREAS ALONG AND SOUTH OF INTERSTATE 
40 IN EASTERN ARKANSAS. A SUBTLE 500 MB SHORTWAVE OVER NORTHERN 
ARKANSAS HAS ALSO AIDED THIS ACTIVITY. CONVECTION IS BEGINNING TO 
DIMINISH WITH THE LOSS OF DAYTIME HEATING AND WE EXPECT THIS TREND 
TO CONTINUE. CURRENT FORECAST HAS CHANCE POPS WEST OF THE RIVER AND 
WILL LEAVE AS IS FOR NOW DUE TO THE OUTFLOW BOUNDARY AND CONVECTION 
MOVING TOWARD NORTHEAST ARKANSAS. IT IS QUITE POSSIBLE THAT POPS CAN 
BE LOWERED LATE THIS EVENING...BUT WILL MONITOR CONVECTIVE TRENDS FOR
NOW.

WILL TAKE ALL POPS OUT EAST OF THE RIVER...WITH THE EXCEPTION OF 
EXTREME NW MS. ALL TSTM ACTIVITY ENDED AND DO NO EXPECT ANY 
ADDITIONAL DEVELOPMENT OVERNIGHT. THE REST OF THE FORECAST LOOKS 
GOOD WITH ANOTHER WARM AND HUMID NIGHT ON TAP. DID ADJUST SKY GRIDS 
TO ACCOUNT FOR CURRENT ANALYSIS. ZONE UPDATE WILL BE OUT SHORTLY.

.PREVIOUS DISCUSSION ISSUED 318 PM TUE JAN 7 2005...

MUCH LESS CONVECTION THAN YESTERDAY...BUT WE STILL ARE SEEING
SCATTERED THUNDERSTORMS. LAPS INDICATES CAPES ARE AROUND 2000 J/KG
AND 12Z LZK SOUNDING SHOWED A PRECIPITABLE WATER OF 1.66 INCHES.
THUNDERSTORMS ARE DEVELOPING DUE TO AFTERNOON HEATING. IN ADDITION...
THERE IS A WEAK SHORT WAVE FROM SOUTHERN MO INTO WEST TN HELPING TO
SET OFF THUNDERSTORMS.

FOR TONIGHT...WILL MENTION ISOLATED TO SCATTERED THUNDERSTORMS.
WEAK SHORT WAVE LOCATED THROUGH WEST TN THIS AFTERNOON WILL MOVE
EAST-NORTHEASTWARD OUT OF OUR AREA THIS EVENING. IN
ADDITION...CONVECTION WILL DIMINISH WITH LOSS OF DAYTIME HEATING.
ANOTHER SHORT WAVE IS PROGGED BY THE MODELS TO APPROACH FROM THE
WEST AND TO AFFECT MAINLY THE WEST HALF OF OUR FORECAST AREA LATER
TONIGHT. AS A RESULT...WILL CONTINUE 30 PERCENT POPS FOR THE ENTIRE
NIGHT FOR THE WEST HALF OF THE MIDSOUTH.

DO NOT REALLY SEE MUCH CHANGE IN THE WEATHER FOR THE NEXT FEW DAYS.
TIMING AND PINPOINTING MINOR SHORT WAVES REALLY BECOMES DIFFICULT
AFTER TOMORROW. FOR WEDNESDAY INTO THURSDAY...THE SHORT WAVE TO OUR
WEST MOVES INTO THE MIDSOUTH...AND STALLS OVER US ESTABLISHING A
WEAKNESS IN THE UPPER LEVEL RIDGE OFF THE ATLANTIC COAST AND THE
UPPER LEVEL HIGH TO OUR SOUTHWEST. WILL CONTINUE WITH A CHANCE OF
THUNDERSTORMS DURING THIS TIME PERIOD AS THE ATMOSPHERE REMAINS
MOIST AND UNSTABLE. GFS INDICATES MORE RIDGING OVER THE MIDSOUTH
FRIDAY INTO SATURDAY...SO POPS WILL BE A LITTLE LOWER DURING THIS
TIME.

SOME OF THE MODELS ARE INDICATING TROPICAL DEVELOPMENT IN THE
NORTHWEST CARIBBEAN MOVING TOWARD THE NORTH-CENTRAL GULF COAST OVER
THE WEEKEND. THE GFS IS THE STRONGEST WITH THE SURFACE DEVELOPMENT IN
THE GULF. SATELLITE DOES INDICATE CONVECTION OVER THE NORTHWEST
CARIBBEAN THIS AFTERNOON. CAN NOT DISCOUNT THIS MOISTURE GRADUALLY
WORKING ITS WAY INTO THE MIDSOUTH AROUND THE BERMUDA HIGH LATE
THIS WEEKEND OR EARLY NEXT WEEK.

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.
&&

$$

JFB

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
318 PM CDT TUE JUN 7 2005

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 071426
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
926 AM CDT TUE JUN 7 2005

.DISCUSSION...
CURRENT FORECAST IS ON TRACK AND NO UPDATES NEEDED AT THIS TIME.
LARGE SCALE UPPER LEVEL RIDGE IS CENTERED ALONG THE SOUTHEASTERN
UNITED STATES COAST WITH AN UPPER LEVEL TROUGH OVER THE WESTERN
US. AN EMBEDDED WEAK SHORT WAVE IN WESTERLY FLOW ALOFT IS LOCATED
OVER EASTERN AR. THIS SHORT WAVE WITH INTERACT WITH THE MOIST AND
UNSTABLE AIR MASS COVERING THE MIDSOUTH TO CAUSE SCATTERED
THUNDERSTORMS THIS AFTERNOON. 12Z LZK SOUNDING INDICATED POTENTIAL
CAPES THIS AFTERNOON OF ABOUT 1700 J/KG. THE PRECIPITABLE WATER FROM
THE LZK SOUNDING IS 1.66 INCHES...A LITTLE HIGHER THAN YESTERDAY.
THUNDERSTORMS THAT DEVELOP COULD PRODUCE LOCALLY HEAVY RAINFALL AS
FLOW AT 500 MB IS ONLY ABOUT 5 KNOTS. THERE IS QUITE A BIT OF LOW
CLOUDS IN PARTS OF THE MIDSOUTH THIS MORNING...BUT THINK THESE CLOUDS
WILL BREAK UP...AND PARTLY CLOUDY WITH SUFFICE FOR SKY COVER. UPPER
80S STILL LOOKS GOOD FOR HIGHS WITH CLOUD COVER AND HIGHER MOISTURE
LIMITING MAXIMUM TEMPERATURES FROM GETTING MUCH WARMER.

&&

.PREV DISCUSSION...
ISSUED 314 AM CDT TUE JUN 7 2005

FORECAST OVER THE NEXT SEVERAL DAYS WILL BE LARGELY DETERMINED BY
MESOSCALE FEATURES. THE UPPER PATTERN IS GENERALLY CHARACTERIZED BY
AN UPPER TROUGH OVER THE WESTERN US WITH A RIDGE OVER THE REMAINDER
OF THE COUNTRY. THERE ARE TWO AREAS OF POSITIVE VORTICITY NEAR THE
REGION. THE FIRST REGION EXTENDS FROM EAST TENNESSEE OVER MUCH OF
ALABAMA AND INTO EAST CENTRAL MISSISSIPPI. THE SECOND AREA IS ACROSS
CENTRAL ARKANSAS. NEGATIVE VORTICITY EXISTS OVER THE MIDSOUTH
REGION. A CONVECTIVE COMPLEX ASSOCIATED WITH THE VORT MAX OVER
ARKANSAS FELL APART AS IT REACHED THE NEGATIVE VORT MAX OVER THE
REGION. BOTH GFS AND MESOETA PICK UP THESE FEATURES VERY WELL.

EXPECT THE VORT MAX OVER ARKANSAS TO GRADUALLY PUSH INTO THE
MIDSOUTH TODAY. KEY FEATURE MISSING FROM THIS MORNING AS OPPOSED TO
YESTERDAY MORNING IS THAT THE REGION LAY IN THE ENTRANCE REGION TO A
50KT 250MB JET. THIS AIDED CONVECTION EARLY YESTERDAY MORNING DURING
THE PREDAWN HOURS. THE WIND FIELDS THIS MORNING ARE NOTICEABLY
WEAKER WITH ONLY ABOUT 10KTS OVER THE AREA. AS A RESULT...EXPECT
THAT DEVELOPMENT WILL MAINLY HOLD OFF UNTIL AT LEAST MID MORNING
WHEN SOLAR HEATING CAN WORK WITH THE VORT MAX TO TRIGGER STORMS.
FEEL THAT THERE ARE LESSER CHANCES ACROSS NORTHWEST TENNESSEE TODAY
WITH THE MESOETA SHOWING THE NEGATIVE VORT POSITIONED OVER NORTHWEST
TENNESSEE WITH CONVECTION BREAKING OUT ALONG THE PERIPHERY OF THE
NEGATIVE VORT. DO NOT FEEL THAT THERE IS A WIDESPREAD SEVERE WEATHER
THREAT DUE TO THE WEAK UPPER WIND FIELDS. ALTHOUGH FREQUENT
LIGHTING...HEAVY DOWNPOURS AND SMALL HAIL ARE POSSIBLE. DAYTIME
TEMPS WILL BE LARGELY DEPENDENT UPON THE AMOUNT OF SUNSHINE.
YESTERDAY JONESBORO REACHED 95 WITH NO RAIN WHILE TUPELO ONLY 83
WITH RAIN AROUND FOR A GOOD PORTION OF THE MORNING AND EARLY
AFTERNOON. GENERALLY WILL SHOOT FOR UPPER 80S TO NEAR 90 WITH SOME
HEATING EXPECTED THIS MORNING AND CONVECTION AND CLOUDS LIMITING
HEATING THIS AFTERNOON.

CONVECTION SHOULD DIMINISH QUICKLY THIS EVENING WITH THE LOSS OF THE
SOLAR HEATING AND UPPER WINDS STILL WEAK. THE POSITIVE VORT OVER
ARKANSAS SHOULD BE NEAR THE TENNESSEE RIVER BY WEDNESDAY MORNING
THUS BETTER CHANCES FURTHER EAST. OVERALL PATTERN REMAINS LARGELY
UNCHANGED THROUGHOUT THE WEEK. SPLIT UPPER FLOW WILL PREVAIL OVER
THE REGION WITH THE NORTHERN BRANCH OF THE JET RUNNING FROM THE
SOUTHERN HIGH PLAINS INTO THE UPPER MIDWEST AND TH SOUTHERN BRANCH
RUNNING FROM SOUTH TEXAS AND DIPPING WELL INTO THE GULF. THIS
PATTERN SHOULD CARRY MOST OF THE STRONGER SYSTEMS NORTH AND SOUTH OF
THE AREA. THE AIRMASS OVER THE REGION WILL REMAIN RATHER MOIST AND
UNSTABLE WITH AFTERNOON THUNDERSTORMS POSSIBLE EVERY DAY. THE GFS
CAME IN WITH A RATHER INTERESTING SOLUTION FOR THE END OF THE WEEK
WITH WHAT APPEARS TO BE THE FIRST TROPICAL SYSTEM IN THE ATLANTIC
BASIN OF THE YEAR DEVELOPING IN THE GULF AND MAKING LANDFALL IN THE
NORTHERN GULF OVER THE WEEKEND. THE EUROPEAN AND UKMET DO NOT
SUPPORT SUCH A SOLUTION AND THE CANADIAN SHOWS DEVELOPMENT BUT
REMAINING MUCH FURTHER SOUTH AND REMAINING IN THE GULF. THE GFS
APPEARS TO BE WORKING OFF OF A MUCH STRONGER SOUTHERN BRANCH OF THE
JET THAN THE OTHER MODELS. EXTENDED FORECAST FOR NOW WILL BE ONE OF
PERSISTENCE.

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.
&&

$$

FXUS64 KMEG 070815
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
314 AM CDT TUE JUN 7 2005

.DISCUSSION...

FORECAST OVER THE NEXT SEVERAL DAYS WILL BE LARGELY DETERMINED BY 
MESOSCALE FEATURES. THE UPPER PATTERN IS GENERALLY CHARACTERIZED BY 
AN UPPER TROUGH OVER THE WESTERN US WITH A RIDGE OVER THE REMAINDER 
OF THE COUNTRY. THERE ARE TWO AREAS OF POSITIVE VORTICITY NEAR THE 
REGION. THE FIRST REGION EXTENDS FROM EAST TENNESSEE OVER MUCH OF 
ALABAMA AND INTO EAST CENTRAL MISSISSIPPI. THE SECOND AREA IS ACROSS 
CENTRAL ARKANSAS. NEGATIVE VORTICITY EXISTS OVER THE MIDSOUTH 
REGION. A CONVECTIVE COMPLEX ASSOCIATED WITH THE VORT MAX OVER 
ARKANSAS FELL APART AS IT REACHED THE NEGATIVE VORT MAX OVER THE 
REGION. BOTH GFS AND MESOETA PICK UP THESE FEATURES VERY WELL.

EXPECT THE VORT MAX OVER ARKANSAS TO GRADUALLY PUSH INTO THE 
MIDSOUTH TODAY. KEY FEATURE MISSING FROM THIS MORNING AS OPPOSED TO 
YESTERDAY MORNING IS THAT THE REGION LAY IN THE ENTRANCE REGION TO A 
50KT 250MB JET. THIS AIDED CONVECTION EARLY YESTERDAY MORNING DURING 
THE PREDAWN HOURS. THE WIND FIELDS THIS MORNING ARE NOTICEABLY 
WEAKER WITH ONLY ABOUT 10KTS OVER THE AREA. AS A RESULT...EXPECT 
THAT DEVELOPMENT WILL MAINLY HOLD OFF UNTIL AT LEAST MID MORNING 
WHEN SOLAR HEATING CAN WORK WITH THE VORT MAX TO TRIGGER STORMS. 
FEEL THAT THERE ARE LESSER CHANCES ACROSS NORTHWEST TENNESSEE TODAY 
WITH THE MESOETA SHOWING THE NEGATIVE VORT POSITIONED OVER NORTHWEST 
TENNESSEE WITH CONVECTION BREAKING OUT ALONG THE PERIPHERY OF THE 
NEGATIVE VORT. DO NOT FEEL THAT THERE IS A WIDESPREAD SEVERE WEATHER 
THREAT DUE TO THE WEAK UPPER WIND FIELDS. ALTHOUGH FREQUENT 
LIGHTING...HEAVY DOWNPOURS AND SMALL HAIL ARE POSSIBLE. DAYTIME 
TEMPS WILL BE LARGELY DEPENDENT UPON THE AMOUNT OF SUNSHINE. 
YESTERDAY JONESBORO REACHED 95 WITH NO RAIN WHILE TUPELO ONLY 83 
WITH RAIN AROUND FOR A GOOD PORTION OF THE MORNING AND EARLY 
AFTERNOON. GENERALLY WILL SHOOT FOR UPPER 80S TO NEAR 90 WITH SOME 
HEATING EXPECTED THIS MORNING AND CONVECTION AND CLOUDS LIMITING 
HEATING THIS AFTERNOON.

CONVECTION SHOULD DIMINISH QUICKLY THIS EVENING WITH THE LOSS OF THE 
SOLAR HEATING AND UPPER WINDS STILL WEAK. THE POSITIVE VORT OVER 
ARKANSAS SHOULD BE NEAR THE TENNESSEE RIVER BY WEDNESDAY MORNING 
THUS BETTER CHANCES FURTHER EAST. OVERALL PATTERN REMAINS LARGELY 
UNCHANGED THROUGHOUT THE WEEK. SPLIT UPPER FLOW WILL PREVAIL OVER 
THE REGION WITH THE NORTHERN BRANCH OF THE JET RUNNING FROM THE 
SOUTHERN HIGH PLAINS INTO THE UPPER MIDWEST AND TH SOUTHERN BRANCH 
RUNNING FROM SOUTH TEXAS AND DIPPING WELL INTO THE GULF. THIS 
PATTERN SHOULD CARRY MOST OF THE STRONGER SYSTEMS NORTH AND SOUTH OF 
THE AREA. THE AIRMASS OVER THE REGION WILL REMAIN RATHER MOIST AND 
UNSTABLE WITH AFTERNOON THUNDERSTORMS POSSIBLE EVERY DAY. THE GFS 
CAME IN WITH A RATHER INTERESTING SOLUTION FOR THE END OF THE WEEK 
WITH WHAT APPEARS TO BE THE FIRST TROPICAL SYSTEM IN THE ATLANTIC 
BASIN OF THE YEAR DEVELOPING IN THE GULF AND MAKING LANDFALL IN THE 
NORTHERN GULF OVER THE WEEKEND. THE EUROPEAN AND UKMET DO NOT 
SUPPORT SUCH A SOLUTION AND THE CANADIAN SHOWS DEVELOPMENT BUT 
REMAINING MUCH FURTHER SOUTH AND REMAINING IN THE GULF. THE GFS 
APPEARS TO BE WORKING OFF OF A MUCH STRONGER SOUTHERN BRANCH OF THE 
JET THAN THE OTHER MODELS. EXTENDED FORECAST FOR NOW WILL BE ONE OF 
PERSISTENCE.

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.
&&

$$

VALLE

.UPDATE...
WILL ISSUE ANOTHER UPDATE TO REDUCE POPS TO 20 PERCENT ACROSS THE

DIMINISHING DUE TO THE LOSS OF DAYTIME HEATING AND THE FACT AN 
OUTFLOW BOUNDARY MOVED OUT WELL AHEAD OF THE CONVECTION. STILL 
CANNOT RULE OUT AN ISOLATED SHOWER OR THUNDERSTORM DUE TO THE VORT 
MAX OVER ARKANSAS. UPDATE OUT SHORTLY.

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 070147
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
847 PM CDT MON JUN 6 2005

.UPDATE...
AN AREA OF CONVECTION OVER CENTRAL ARKANSAS IS ASSOCIATED WITH A 
MESOSCALE CONVECTIVE VORTEX LOCATED OVER THE WESTERN PORTION OF THE 
STATE. THIS ACTIVITY WILL CONTINUE MOVING EAST TOWARD THE MIDSOUTH. 
A WEAKENING TREND HAS ALREADY BEGUN ON THE NORTH SIDE OF THE 
ACTIVITY AND EXPECT AN OVERALL DIMINISH IN INTENSITY WITH THE WHOLE 
SYSTEM NOW THAT INSTABILITY IS DECREASING WITH THE SUN SETTING. WILL 
UPDATE POPS TO CHANCE WEST OF THE RIVER. WILL MAINTAIN A SLIGHT 
CHANCE POP EAST OF THE RIVER. THE AIRMASS IS MUCH LESS UNSTABLE OVER 
W TN AND N MS...ALREADY HAVING BEEN WORKED OVER BY PREVIOUS 
CONVECTION. STILL CANNOT RULE OUT ISOLATE CONVECTION ASSOCIATED WITH 
THE MCV AS IT MOVES ACROSS THE REGION OVERNIGHT. 

THE WHOLE AREA SHOULD BECOME MOSTLY CLOUDY OVER THE NEXT SEVERAL 
HOURS WITH THE BLOWOFF FROM CONVECTION TO THE SOUTH AND WEST. THE 
CLOUDS WILL LIKELY INHIBIT MUCH FOG FORMATION TONIGHT SO WILL REMOVE 
MENTION OF FOG FROM THE FORECAST. TEMPS FORECAST LOOKS GOOD. UPDATE 
TO GRIDS ALREADY OUT AND ZONE UPDATE IS FORTHCOMING.


.PREVIOUS DISCUSSION ISSUED 326 PM MON JUN 6 2005...

TODAY HAS BEEN A DAY OF MESOSCALE FEATURES. WEAK UPPER LOW / VORT MAX
LOCATED OVER NORTHERN MS THIS AFTERNOON IS MOVING EAST-
NORTHEASTWARD. COMPLEX OF THUNDERSTORMS ASSOCIATED WITH THIS
FEATURE MOVED NORTHWARD THROUGH NORTH MS AND AND MUCH OF WEST TN
THIS MORNING AND EARLY AFTERNOON...BUT HAS NOW FALLEN APART.
MEANWHILE...A MESOSCALE CONVECTIVE COMPLEX MOVED THROUGH MISSOURI
THIS MORNING. THIS COMPLEX CAUSED A SURFACE OUTFLOW BOUNDARY WHICH
NOW STRETCHES FROM SOUTHERN KY THROUGH SOUTHEAST MO INTO NORTHERN
AR. THUNDERSTORMS HAVE FIRED ALONG THIS BOUNDARY WHERE CAPES WERE
GREATER THAN 2000 J/KG. THE STORMS ARE MOVING MOSTLY EAST BUT
PERHAPS WITH SOME SOUTHERN MOVEMENT ALSO. IF THAT IS NOT ENOUGH...
THERE IS A MESOSCALE CONVECTIVE VORT MAX MOVING INTO WESTERN AR.
THUNDERSTORMS HAVE ALSO FIRED IN ASSOCIATION WITH THIS FEATURE...BUT
EXPECT THEY WILL DIMINISH AFTER DARK. WE WILL MOSTLY LIKELY DEAL WITH
THIS FEATURE TOMORROW (OR MAYBE LATE TONIGHT)...ALTHOUGH DO NOT
EXPECT TOMORROWS SHOWERS / THUNDERSTORMS TO BE AS WIDESPREAD AS
TODAY.

FOR TONIGHT...WILL MENTION 30 PERCENT CHANCE OF THUNDERSTORMS FROM
PART OF NORTHEAST AR INTO NORTHWEST TN AS THE THUNDERSTORMS ALONG
THE NORTHERN OUTFLOW BOUNDARY SINK SOUTHWARD THIS EVENING.
FOR THE REMAINDER OF THE AREA...WILL MENTION 20 PERCENT CHANCE OF
SHOWERS / THUNDERSTORMS TO COVER LINGERING AFTERNOON CONVECTION...
AND TO COVER ANY CONVECTION THAT DEVELOPS LATER TONIGHT AS THE
WESTERN AR TROUGH APPROACHES THE MIDSOUTH.

FOR TUESDAY...VORT MAX / UPPER LEVEL TROUGH OVER WESTERN AR WILL
BE OVER THE MIDSOUTH. THIS WILL CAUSE SCATTERED THUNDERSTORMS AS IT
COMBINES WITH THE MOIST AND UNSTABLE AIR MASS COVERING THE AREA.
HOWEVER...THINK THE AREAS THAT RECEIVED WIDESPREAD RAIN TODAY
WILL SEE MORE SUN TUESDAY. AS A RESULT...HEAT AND HUMIDITY WILL
RETURN TO THE ENTIRE MIDSOUTH.

FOR WEDNESDAY INTO THURSDAY...HIGH PRESSURE ALOFT STRENGTHENS OFF
THE ATLANTIC COAST WITH SOUTHWESTERLY FLOW ALOFT ACROSS THE
MIDSOUTH. CAN NOT PIN DOWN ANY SHORT WAVES AFFECTING US DURING THIS
TIME. AS A RESULT...WILL HAVE POPS RANGING FROM 20 TO 30 PERCENT
WITH THE HIGHER POPS TO THE EAST WHERE THE MOISTURE IS A LITTLE
GREATER.

THE HIGH PRESSURE ALOFT STRENGTHENS OVER THE MIDSOUTH FRIDAY
HELPING TO KEEP THUNDERSTORM CHANCES LOW AND HEAT HIGH. THE RIDGE
IS FORECAST TO WEAKEN BY EARLY NEXT WEEK...PERHAPS GIVING US A
LITTLE BETTER CHANCE OF THUNDERSTORMS.

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.
&&

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 061458
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
957 AM CDT MON JUN 6 2005

.DISCUSSION...
CURRENT FORECAST IS ON TRACK FOR THIS AFTERNOON AND WILL MAKE ONLY
MINOR CHANGES. WEAK H5 LOW CENTERED OVER WEST-CENTRAL MS IS
FORECAST TO MOVE EAST-NORTHEAST DURING THE DAY. THIS LOW IN
COMBINATION WITH INCREASING MOISTURE AND INSTABILITY ACROSS THE
MIDSOUTH HAS HELPED TO CAUSE A CLUSTER OF THUNDERSTORMS OVER NORTH
MS. THESE STORMS WILL PUSH INTO WEST TN THIS AFTERNOON HELPING TO
HOLD TEMPERATURES DOWN FROM WHAT THEY HAVE BEEN THE LAST FEW DAYS.
ELSEWHERE...THINK THUNDERSTORMS ARE POSSIBLE DUE TO AFTERNOON
HEATING. 12Z LZK SOUNDING INDICATED POSSIBLE CAPES AROUND 3000 J/KG
THIS AFTERNOON.

&&

.PREV DISCUSSION...
ISSUED 208 AM CDT MON JUN 6 2005

THE COMPLEX OF STORMS THAT DEVELOPED SUNDAY EVENING OVER
SOUTH/CENTRAL MISSISSIPPI DECREASED RAPIDLY AFTER MIDNIGHT. MUCH OF
THE CLOUD COVER OVER THE MID SOUTH IS ASSOCIATED WITH THE SHOWERS
THAT FORMED OVER MISSISSIPPI. ADDITIONAL THUNDERSTORMS DEVELOPED
OVER LOUISIANA AND WILL LIKELY TRACK TO THE EAST/NORTHEAST OVER THE
NEXT SEVERAL HOURS. A FEW LIGHTNING STRIKES HAVE POPPED UP OVER
PHILLIPS AND COAHOMA COUNTIES. KNQA 88-D PICKS UP ON THE OUTFLOW
BOUNDARY SENT OUT FROM THE CONVECTION EARLIER. THIS IS SERVING AS
THE FOCUS MECHANISM FOR THESE SHOWERS.

FARTHER WEST OVER THE RED RIVER VALLEY A MCS WAS TRANSLATING SLOWLY
EASTWARD. NEEDLESS TO SAY THE ATMOSPHERE OVER THE SOUTHEAST U.S. IS
CHAOTIC AND THE MODELS HAVE BEEN DIFFICULT TO DECIPHER.

BOTH THE GFS AND NAM SHOW A WEAKNESS IN THE MID LEVELS THROUGH
THURSDAY. FEEL THAT RAIN CHANCES TODAY MAY BE BETTER THAN PREVIOUS
DAYS DUE TO A SLIGHT INCREASE IN STEEPENING LAPSE RATES MAINLY OVER
NORTHEAST ARKANSAS. THE INSTABILITY OVER NORTHERN MISSISSIPPI IS
ALSO A CONCERN AS FAR AS DEVELOPING SOME SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS.
WILL BE INTERESTING TO SEE HOW THE OUTFLOW BOUNDARY MENTIONED ABOVE
WILL PLAY A PART IN ADDITIONAL SHOWER DEVELOPMENT TODAY. IT APPEARS
THAT WHATEVER DEVELOPS WILL NOT REACH SEVERE LIMITS. MOST AREAS SURE
COULD USE THE RAIN.

AS FAR AS TEMPERATURES ARE CONCERNED...TODAY THE NAM IS MUCH COOLER
THAN THE MAV. THIS IS PROBABLY DUE TO THE INCREASED CLOUD COVER AND
CONVECTION THAT IS INFLUENCING THE LOWER TEMPS. THIS MAY COME TO
FRUITION HOWEVER WE ARE LEANING TOWARD THE WARMER MAV TEMPS JUST
BASED ON CONSISTENCY.

WITH SUCH LOW CONFIDENCE IN THE LATEST MODEL RUNS...CANNOT ARGUE
AGAINST CURRENT FORECAST ESPECIALLY IN DAYS 2 THROUGH 7.

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
245 PM CDT SUN JUN 5 2005

.DISCUSSION...
SKIES REMAIN MOSTLY SUNNY ACROSS THE ENTIRE FORECAST AREA THIS
AFTERNOON AND TEMPERATURES ARE IN THE LOW TO MID 90S. THERE WERE
SOME ISOLATED SHOWERS THAT POPPED UP IN THE EXTREME SOUTHEAST CORNER
OF THE FORECAST AREA BUT THEY MOVED INTO ALABAMA. MODELS BRING WEAK
SYSTEM THROUGH THE REGION MONDAY. THIS MAY TRIGGERS SOME SHOWERS AND
THUNDERSTORMS SO WILL KEEP CHANCE POPS IN FOR MONDAY. BY MONDAY
NIGHT CHANCE FOR RAIN DIMINISHES AS WE APPROACH 00Z SO WILL GO BACK
TO SLIGHT CHANCE POPS. ANOTHER WEAK SYSTEM MAY MOVE THROUGH ON
TUESDAY SO HAVE KEPT CHANCE POPS IN DURING THE DAY. FROM TUESDAY
NIGHT ON...IT APPEARS THAT ANY RAIN THAT WE MIGHT GET WILL BE MAINLY
LATE AFTERNOON OR EARLY EVENING. TEMPERATURES ARE DIFFICULT TO GET A
HANDLE ON. IF WE DONT SEE MUCH IN THE WAY OF CLOUDS MONDAY...WE
MIGHT BE AS HOT AS TODAY BUT WITH THE ANTICIPATION OF MORE CLOUDS
HAVE GONE LOWER THAN TODAY. REMAINDER OF WEEK IS NO EASIER WITH MUCH
DOUBT ABOUT AMOUNT OF CLOUDS FOR THE NEXT SEVERAL DAYS. FOR MUCH OF
THE WEEK WENT AROUND THE VALUES WE HAVE GOING FOR MONDAY.

THIS IS ABOUT 3-5 DEGREES WARMER THAN YESTERDAY WHEN WE REACHED THE

HIGH AT MEMPHIS. I GUESS THATS WHAT HAPPENS IN JUNE WHEN YOU HAD
ONE OF THE DRIEST MONTH OF MAY ON RECORD. HAVE BUMPED HIGHS TODAY
OVER THE ENTIRE FORECAST AREA TO MID TO UPPER 90S. WITH THE
POTENTIAL FOR MEMPHIS TO REACH THE UPPER 90S...THERE MAY BE HEAT
INDICES APPROACHING THE 105 MARK. THE SHOWERS THAT DEVELOP OVER THE

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 050714
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
215 AM CDT SUN JUN 5 2005

.DISCUSSION...
SKIES ACROSS THE MID SOUTH THIS MORNING WERE CLEAR AND WINDS WERE 
SOUTH GENERALLY LESS THAN 5 MPH. A BROKEN LINE OF CONVECTION 
STRETCHED FROM WISCONSIN THROUGH WESTERN ILLINOIS AND THEN FROM 
SOUTHWESTERN MISSOURI INTO NORTHEAST TEXAS. THIS AREA OF RAIN WAS 
MOVING EAST AND SHOWING WEAKENING TRENDS. HIGH...THIN DEBRIS CLOUDS  
WERE EDGING CLOSER TO THE FORECAST AREA.

HAVE CONCENTRATED ON THE FIRST THREE DAYS OF THE FORECAST FOR THIS 
PACKAGE. A VERY CHALLENGING FORECAST FOR THE NEXT COUPLE OF DAYS AS 
FAR AS RAIN CHANCES GOES. LOW LEVEL MOISTURE VALUES ARE SUFFICIENT 
FOR THUNDERSTORMS TO DEVELOP AND BECOME SEVERE. HOWEVER...TRIGGER 
MECHANISM SEEMS TO BE LACKING. THE ONE THING OF CONCERN MAY BE A 
MESOSCALE BOUNDARY FROM ANY CONVECTION THAT DOES DEVELOP TODAY NEAR 
THE FORECAST AREA AS WELL AS ANY BOUNDARIES FORMED BY THE CONVECTION 
OUT WEST. THEREFORE...WILL FORECAST A SLIGHT CHANCE OF RAIN WEST OF 
THE MISSISSIPPI RIVER AND NO MENTION OF RAIN ACROSS THE REMAINDER OF 
THE AREA FOR TODAY. RAIN CHANCES TONIGHT ONLY RISE SLIGHTLY WITH 
MENTION OF RAIN EVERYWHERE EXCEPT PARTS OF NORTHEAST MISSISSIPPI. 
THE BETTER CHANCES FOR RAIN STILL APPEAR TO BE MONDAY. 

TEMPERATURES TODAY WILL BE VERY WARM AGAIN WITH MAX TEMPS IN MEMPHIS 
REACHING 95. FAR FROM THE RECORD OF 99. TEMPS MAY BE HINDERED BY 
DEBRIS CLOUDS DEPENDING ON HOW THINGS EVOLVE THROUGH THE DAY BUT 
HAVE TRIED TO ACCOUNT FOR THIS. OVERNIGHT LOWS SUNDAY NIGHT WILL BE 
MILD ONCE AGAIN MAINLY WITH UPPER 60S TO LOWER 70S. SLIGHTLY COOLER 
MONDAY WITH EXPECTED RAIN AND CLOUD COVER BUT STILL ABOVE NORMAL 
WITH TEMPS IN THE UPPER 80S. 

NO OTHER CHANGES HAVE BEEN MADE TO THE REMAINDER OF THE FORECAST. 
WITH ALL THE LOW LEVEL MOISTURE AND WEAK FLOW ALOFT OVER THE MID 
SOUTH...THE MENTION OF DIURNAL THUNDERSTORMS THROUGH THE WEEK SEEMS 
REASONABLE. 

&&

LITTLE IF ANY THUNDERSTORM ACTIVITY HAS DEVELOPED ANYWHERE NEAR THE

SUNDAY BUT NOT AS MUCH AS EARLIER THOUGHT SO HAVE DROPPED POPS FROM
CHANCE TO SLIGHT CHANCE. MODELS INDICATE ANY DISTURBANCE THAT WOULD
BRING THUNDERSTORMS ON SUNDAY MAY NOT MAKE IT HERE UNTIL MONDAY.
HAVE LOWERED POPS FOR SUNDAY NIGHT AND RAISED THEM A LITTLE FOR
MONDAY AND MONDAY NIGHT. FROM TUESDAY THROUGH NEXT SATURDAY...
PATTERN WILL REMAIN TYPICAL FOR THIS TIME OF YEAR WITH THE MAIN
THREAT OF RAIN BEING MAINLY WIDELY SCATTERED LATE AFTERNOON AND
EARLY EVENING THUNDERSTORMS. TEMPERATURES WILL BE PRETTY CLOSE TO

FXUS64 KMEG 040741
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
241 AM CDT SAT JUN 4 2005

.DISCUSSION...
LATEST SURFACE MAP OVER THE MID SOUTH INDICATES TEMPERATURES RANGING 
FROM THE 60S TO 70S. THIN CIRRUS CLOUDS WERE DRIFTING ACROSS 
NORTHEAST ARKANSAS. THE MOST SIGNIFICANT FEATURE IS THE CURRENT DEW 
POINTS...WHICH ARE MUCH LOWER THAN PREVIOUS AND CURRENT MODEL RUNS.

THE UPPER PATTERN OVER THE FORECAST AREA WILL SHIFT TO A SOUTHWEST 
FLOW. THE CURRENT SHORTWAVE OVER KANSAS WAS PRODUCING STRONG 
THUNDERSTORMS OVER EASTERN KANSAS AND NORTHWESTERN MISSOURI. THIS 
WAVE WILL WEAKEN OVER THE NEXT SEVERAL HOURS AND SWING INTO 
MINNESOTA THIS AFTERNOON. THE MAIN TROUGH OVER COLORADO WAS AIDING 
CONVECTION OVER SOUTHERN KANSAS. THIS MAIN WAVE WILL TRANSLATE INTO 
THE GREAT LAKES REGION BY SUNDAY MORNING PASSING WELL NORTH OF THE 
FORECAST AREA.

DIFFICULTY COMES IN GETTING A HANDLE ON WEAK WAVES IN THE SOUTHWEST 
FLOW MOVING OVER DATA SPARSE REGIONS. THE SURFACE LOW TO THE NORTH 
AND HIGH PRESSURE OFF THE COAST OF FLORIDA WILL HELP INCREASE 
MOISTURE ADVECTION INTO THE MID SOUTH THROUGH THE WEEKEND. AN 
ISOLATED SHOWER WILL BE POSSIBLE LATE THIS AFTERNOON HOWEVER CHANCES 
ARE SO SLIM THAT IT WILL NOT BE MENTIONED IN THE ZONES AT THIS TIME. 

A BETTER CHANCE OF FOR RAIN WILL BEGIN SUNDAY AFTERNOON AND CONTINUE 
THROUGH MONDAY AS THE UPPER FLOW INCREASES AND BETTER DYNAMICS 
OCCURS. 

SUMMERTIME CONVECTION POSSIBLE THROUGH THE REMAINDER OF THE WEEK 
WITH THE PRESENCE OF HIGH MOISTURE LEVELS AND WEAK INSTABILITY.

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.
&&

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 030837
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
336 AM CDT FRI JUN 3 2005

.DISCUSSION...

UPPER LOW NOW LOCATED OVER MIDDLE TN AND KY AND CONTINUES TO MOVE 
EAST. BACK EDGE OF THE CLOUD DECK HAS MOVED OUT OF THE CWA WITH 
RADIATION FOG DEVELOPING ACROSS THE ENTIRE AREA. DENSE FOG ADVISORY 
REMAINS IN EFFECT FOR EASTERN AREAS UNTIL 9 AM WHERE VISIBILITIES OF 
ONE QUARTER MILE CAN BE EXPECTED. VISIBILITIES WILL IMPROVE BY MID 
MORNING.

AS THE UPPER LOW CONTINUES EAST...UPPER RIDGE WILL BUILD INTO THE 
MIDSOUTH TODAY. TEMPS WILL WARM BACK TO NORMAL LEVELS AND DEWPOINTS 
WILL CONTINUE TO INCREASE...MAKING FOR A WARM AND MUGGY DAY. 
SUBSIDENCE WITH THE RIDGE WILL PREVENT CONVECTION TODAY. PATCHY FOG 
MAY AGAIN BE A PROBLEM TONIGHT. GFS SHOWS INCREASING HIGH MOISTURE 
ENTERING THE AREA TONIGHT WHICH MAY HELP CUT DOWN ON THE FOG...BUT 
FEEL WITH THE ABUNDANT LOW LEVEL MOISTURE...LIGHT WINDS...AND AT 
LEAST PARTLY CLOUDY SKIES...PATCHY FOG IS WORTH MENTIONING IN THE 
ZONES AGAIN. INCLUDED SLIGHT CHANCE POPS IN EXTREME NE ARKANSAS AS 
OVERNIGHT MCS MAY CLIP THOSE AREAS...BUT OVERALL CWA SHOULD REMAIN 
DRY.

UPPER FLOW TRANSITIONS TO SOUTHWESTERLY FOR THE WEEKEND AS THE RIDGE 
SLIDES EAST. MODELS AGREE THAT BEST LIFTING WILL STAY WELL TO OUR 
NORTHWEST. THERE WILL BE PLENTY OF SURFACE BASED INSTABILITY WITH 
CAPES GREATER THAN 2500 J/KG AND LITTLE TO NO CAPPING INVERSION SO 
DIURNAL CONVECTION IS POSSIBLE. HOWEVER...WITH NO FOCUSING 
MECHANISMS EVIDENT...CANNOT GO ANY HIGHER THAN LOW CHANCE POPS. 
THERE IS A POSSIBILITY OF A SUBTLE SHORTWAVE MOVING THROUGH THE SW 
FLOW THAT WOULD PROVIDE A BETTER CHANCE FOR CONVECTION...BUT IT IS 
VIRTUALLY IMPOSSIBLE TO PREDICT SUCH THINGS THIS FAR OUT. 850 TEMPS 
APPROACHING 18C WILL SUPPORT HIGHS IN THE UPPER 80S TO NEAR 90. 

PATTERN TURNS MORE ZONAL BY LATE MONDAY INTO TUESDAY. CHANCES FOR 
AFTERNOON CONVECTION WILL CONTINUE THROUGH THIS TIME. TEMPS WILL 
REMAIN WARM AND IT WILL STILL FEEL RATHER MUGGY OUT WITH UPPER 60S 
TO NEAR 70 DEWPOINTS PRESENT. GLOBAL MODELS INDICATES THAT THE SE 
RIDGE MAY TRY TO FLEX ITS MUSCLE BY MIDDLE TO LATE NEXT WEEK. THIS 
WILL SERVE TO DIMINISH AFTERNOON CONVECTIVE DEVELOPMENT. 

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...DESNE FOG ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM                         
     MSZ002>006-009-013>017-021>024.
TN...DENSE FOG ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM 
     TNZ002>004-020-021-050>055-089>092.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
1015 PM CDT THU JUN 2 2005

.DISCUSSION...
SKIES REMAIN MOSTLY CLEAR THIS EVENING AS AN UPPER RIDGE IS IN PLACE 
OVER THE MIDSOUTH. DON/T EXPECT THE MOSTLY CLEAR CONDITIONS TO 
CONTINUE THROUGH THE NIGHT AS A BAND OF CIRRUS IS CURRENTLY LOCATED 
ACROSS CENTRAL AND WESTERN ARKANSAS. THE CIRRUS IS ASSOCIATED WITH A 
SHORTWAVE THAT IS CURRENTLY OVER OKLAHOMA AND KANSAS. MODELS ARE 
SHOWING THE SHORTWAVE MOVING NORTH OF THE CWA. THUS WILL REMOVE 
MENTION OF PRECIP AFTER MIDNIGHT ACROSS WESTERN PORTIONS OF THE CWA. 
HOWEVER THE CIRRUS WILL MOVE INTO THE AREA OVERNIGHT AND WILL GIVE 
THE AREA PARTLY CLOUDY CONDITIONS. EVEN WITH THE CLOUDS...STILL 
EXPECT SOME PATCHY FOG TO DEVELOP...MAINLY OVER EASTERN PORTIONS OF 
THE CWA. WILL ALSO UPDATE TO BUMP LOW TEMPERATURES A CATEGORY ACROSS 
WESTERN PORTIONS OF THE CWA AS TEMPERATURES STILL REMAIN IN THE 
UPPER 70S. UPDATE WILL BE OUT SHORTLY.

.DISCUSSION...
BACK EDGE OF CLOUDS JUST BEGINNING TO MOVE THROUGH EXTREME WESTERN
SECTIONS OF THE FORECAST AREA. SCATTERED LIGHT RAIN CONTINUES OVER
MUCH OF WEST TENNESSEE AND NORTH MISSISSIPPI THIS AFTERNOON AS UPPER
LEVEL LOW LOCATED NEAR THE TENNESSEE RIVER MOVES SLOWLY EAST. STILL
EXPECT TO SEE SOME WIDELY SCATTERED SHOWERS ON THE BACK SIDE OF THE
LOW TONIGHT SO HAVE SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR THE EASTERN HALF OF THE
FORECAST AREA THROUGH MIDNIGHT. OVERNIGHT...SKIES SHOULD CLEAR OVER
MUCH OF THE REGION AND WITH A MOIST GROUND FROM THE RAIN SINCE
WEDNESDAY...EXPECT SOME PATCHY DENSE FOG BEFORE SUNRISE. UPPER
LEVEL RIDGE WILL BEGIN TO DEVELOP ON FRIDAY SO CONDITIONS WILL
BECOME MORE SUMMER LIKE. BY FRIDAY NIGHT WE WILL START SEEING A
SLIGHT CHANCE FOR THUNDERSTORMS AS PATTERN CONTINUES REMAINS MORE
SEASONAL WITH MOST OF THE CONVECTION BEING DIURNAL IN NATURE.
THROUGH THE WEEKEND AND THE BEGINNING OF NEXT WEEK THERE WILL BE A
CHANCE OF THUNDERSTORMS IN THE AFTERNOON AND EARLY EVENING HOURS.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION

215 PM CDT THU JUN 2 2005

.DISCUSSION...
SKIES ARE GENERALLY MOSTLY SUNNY WITH SOME AFTERNOON CUMULUS CLOUDS
DEVELOPING ACROSS THE FORECAST. UPPER LEVEL RIDGE HAS BEGUN TO BUILD
OVER THE EASTERN HALF OF THE COUNTRY. THIS WILL HELP GIVE US SUMMER
LIKE WEATHER OVER THE NEXT FEW DAYS. CURRENT CONVECTION OVER NORTH
TEXAS MAY HOLD TOGETHER ENOUGH THAT IT MAY REACH THE FAR WEST PART
OF THE FORECAST AREA SO LEFT SLIGHT CHANCE POPS IN FOR AFTER
MIDNIGHT. IN ADDITION WITH MOST AREAS SEEING CLEAR SKIES OVERNIGHT...
MAY SEE SOME PATCHY FOG BUT NEARLY AS DENSE AS THIS MORNING. THE
NEXT FEW DAYS WILL BE HIGHLIGHTED BY DAYTIME TEMPERATURES AROUND 90
DEGREES AND THE CHANCE OF AFTERNOON AND EARLY EVENING THUNDERSTORMS.
NOT EXPECTING ANY FRONTS TO APPROACH THE AREA SO GENERALLY 30 POPS
FOR THE DAYTIME HOURS AND 20 POPS FOR THE EVENING HOURS WILL DO.

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 020851
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
351 AM CDT THU JUN 2 2005

.DISCUSSION...

CURRENT WATER VAPOR AND UPPER AIR ANALYSES PLACES UPPER LEVEL LOW 
DIRECTLY OVER THE MIDSOUTH. AT THE SURFACE...A 1006 LOW IS LOCATED 
JUST NORTH OF TUPELO MISSISSIPPI. 88D RADAR INDICATES LIGHT SHOWERS 
ROTATING AROUND THE LOW AFFECTING MAINLY WEST TN AND NORTH MS.

ETA AND GFS IN FAIR AGREEMENT ABOUT MOVING THE UPPER LOW EAST OF THE 
CWA BY THIS EVENING. ETA ONCE AGAIN GENERATES A LOT OF QPF 
TODAY...BUT FEEL THIS IS OVERDONE AS IT DID THE SAME THING 
YESTERDAY. WILL GO WITH CHANCE POPS EAST TO SLIGHT CHANCE POPS WEST. 
MOST OF THE ACTIVITY WILL BE LIGHT SINCE LAPSE RATES CONTINUE TO BE 
UNIMPRESSIVE ALONG WITH THE LACK OF STRONG FORCING. POPS WILL LINGER 
IN EASTERN SECTIONS THIS EVENING BUT WILL END BY MIDNIGHT. SKIES 
WILL BEGIN TO CLEAR OUT FROM WEST TO EAST TODAY. AS A RESULT...HAVE 
WENT HIGHER THAN GUIDANCE FOR HIGHS TODAY. GUIDANCE HAS BEEN WAY TOO 
LOW IN AREAS THAT HAVE SEEN LESS PRECIP AND CLOUDS OVER THE PAST 
COUPLE OF DAYS AND FEEL THIS IS THE SITUATION AGAIN TODAY. 

WITH CLEARING SKIES...ABUNDANT LOW LEVEL MOISTURE...AND LIGHT 
WINDS...FOG FORMATION IS CERTAINLY A POSSIBILITY TONIGHT. HAVE 
INCLUDED PATCHY FOG IN THE ZONES TONIGHT FOR AREAS EAST OF THE 
RIVER. SOME OF THE FOG COULD BE DENSE AND WILL PASS THIS CONCERN TO 
THE THE UPCOMING SHIFT. ALSO WILL MAKE MENTION IN THE HWO.

AS UPPER LOW DEPARTS...AN UPPER RIDGE WILL BUILD INTO THE AREA FOR 
FRIDAY. WHILE TEMPS WILL WARM NICELY AND CONDITIONS WILL BE 
MUGGY...LACK OF MOISTURE ABOVE THE SURFACE DUE TO SUBSIDENCE WILL 
PRECLUDE MUCH DIURNAL CONVECTION. THE ONE EXCEPTION MIGHT BE NE 
ARKANSAS...WHERE SLIGHT CHANCE OF PRECIP WILL BE MENTIONED FOR THE 
AFTERNOON.

THE MIDSOUTH COMES UNDER THE INFLUENCE OF SW FLOW ALOFT FROM 
SATURDAY THROUGH TUESDAY. LACK OF CONFIDENCE IN TIMING AND STRENGTH 
OF ANY SHORTWAVES THAT MAY APPROACH IN THE FLOW JUSTIFIES JUST 
KEEPING LOW CHANCE POPS FOR NOW...MAINLY FOR DIURNAL CONVECTION. 
MODELS ARE CERTAINLY NOT IN AGREEMENT ON BEST AREAS FOR PRECIP. 
MEDIUM RANGE GLOBALS DIVERGE BY WEDNESDAY...GFS BUILDING THE BERMUDA 
HIGH INTO THE MIDSOUTH WHILE ECMWF KEEPS ZONAL FLOW ALOFT. NO 
CHANGES WILL BE MADE ON DAY 7 AT THIS TIME.

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 010831
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
330 AM CDT WED JUN 1 2005

.DISCUSSION...

THE MONTH OF MAY HAS GONE OUT AS THE DRIEST EVER IN JACKSON AND 
JONESBORO...THE SECOND DRIEST IN TUPELO...AND THE FIFTH DRIEST IN 
MEMPHIS. THE QUESTION IN THIS FORECAST PACKAGE IS IS THERE ANY 
RELIEF IN SIGHT?

TAKING A LOOK AT THE CURRENT SITUATION...500MB LOW BEGINNING TO 
CLOSE OFF OVER W CNTRL AL WITH A WEAK SFC LOW LOCATED VERY CLOSE TO 
THE UPPER LOW. A LARGE SHIELD OF PRECIP NOTED OVER MOST OF N AL 
WHICH CONTINUES TO MOVE NORTHWEST INTO NE MS. PRECIP HAVING A HARD 
TIME GETTING EAST OF A ALCORN MS TO CALHOUN CITY MS LINE.

MODELS HAVE STARTED TO COME INTO BETTER AGREEMENT IN THE EVOLUTION 
OF THE SYNOPTIC PATTERN...BUT DIFFERENCES DO REMAIN. UPPER LOW OVER 
W CNTRL AL WILL CONTINUE TO MOVE NORTH TOWARD THE CWA TODAY...WHILE 
SHORTWAVE OVER NE TX WILL MOVE EAST AND CONSOLIDATE WITH THE LOW 
OVER THE MIDSOUTH. BEST POPS WILL ONCE AGAIN BE IN THE SOUTHEAST 
CWA. CATEGORICAL POPS ARE WARRANTED OVER THAT AREA...WITH POPS 
DIMINISHING TO CHANCE CATEGORY IN THE WEST. DID NOT BUY OFF ON THE 
MET GUIDANCE HIGH POPS FURTHER WEST AS HISTORY OF THE SYSTEM 
DICTATES THAT PRECIP HAS HAD A DIFFICULT TIME MOVING WEST. DO FEEL 
THAT MORE AREAS WILL SEE RAIN TODAY DUE TO THE UPPER LOW OVER THE 
REGION BUT SHOULD BE MORE SCATTERED OUTSIDE THE MAIN PRECIP SHIELD. 
WILL CONTINUE TO ONLY MENTION ISOLATED THUNDER AS LAPSE RATES AND 
INSTABILITY PARAMETERS REMAIN MEAGER. MOST PLACES WILL NOT REACH 80 
TODAY DUE TO ABUNDANT CLOUD COVER.

RAIN CHANCES WILL CONTINUE INTO THURSDAY AS UPPER LOW WILL BE SLOW 
TO DEPART. THINGS SHOULD FINALLY START TO CALM DOWN BY THURSDAY 
NIGHT AS THE LOW DEPARTS. ONCE AGAIN BEST POPS IN THE EAST. 

UPPER RIDGE BUILDS IN FOR FRIDAY. WAA WILL BE ON THE INCREASE 
HELPING TEMPS TO CLIMB BACK TO NEAR CLIMO LEVELS. ALTHOUGH SOME 
SUBSIDENCE WILL BE PRESENT WITH THE RIDGE...AIRMASS BECOMES UNSTABLE 
WITH CAPES GREATER THAN 2000 J/KG. FELT IT PRUDENT TO INCLUDE A 20 
POP AS A FEW AIRMASS STORMS MAY BE ABLE TO FIRE UP.

SW FLOW ALOFT INCREASES OVER THE WEEKEND WITH WARM AND HUMID AIRMASS 
IN PLACE. CHANCE POPS EACH DAY THROUGH TUESDAY FOR MAINLY DIURNAL 
CONVECTION. GFS IS ADVERTISING A RATHER POTENT SHORTWAVE TO MOVE 
THROUGH ON SATURDAY. WILL NOT GO WITH THIS SOLUTION FOR NOW SINCE 
IT IS A NEW FEATURE IN THE MODEL AND THE OTHER GLOBALS DO NOT 
SUPPORT IT. TEMPS WILL BE SEASONABLE THROUGH THE EXTENDED.

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 312000
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
300 PM CDT TUE MAY 31 2005

.DISCUSSION...

SFC LOW LOCATED ALONG NEAR NEW ORLEANS THIS AFTN WITH UPPER TROF 
ACRS THE LOWER MS VALLEY. LIGHT RAIN CONTINUES TO PUSH INTO NE MS 
BEFORE DISSIPATING SOUTH OF THE TN BORDER. WL CONT WITH HIGHEST POPS 
ACRS NE MS THIS EVENING TAPERING TO THE NORTH. WL GO WITH A DRY 
EVENING FROM THE TN BORDER NORTHWARD. 

LATER TONIGHT...MODELS ARE FINALLY APPROACHING A CONSENSUS WITH THIS 
SYSTEM AND THE NAM SEEMS TO HAVE BEEN ON THE RIGHT TRACK...AT LEAST 
WITH SYNOPTIC FEATURES. BY 12Z WED 500 MB UPPER TROF WL ROTATE NE 
TOWARD N MS. SFC LOW WL MOVE EAST INTO SRN MS. THE MAIN MOISTURE/ 
LIFT AXIS WL ROTATE FURTHER NORTHWARD TOWARD MORNING SO WL INCREASE 
POPS A LITTLE TONIGHT AND PUSH THEM FURTHER NORTH. WL DEEMPHASIZE 
THUNDER WITH INSTABILITY PARAMETERS MARGINAL.

WED...UPPER LOW BEGINS TO CLOSE OFF OVER THE MID SOUTH WITH SFC LOW 
ALONG THE CNTRL MS/AL BORDER. DEEPEST MOISTURE ACRS ERN SXNS SO WL 
TAPER POPS FM LIKELY ACRS NE MS TO LOW CHC ACRS NE AR. EXPECT TEMPS 
TO BE FAIRLY COOL UNDER THE UPPER LOW WITH PLENTY OF CLOUD COVER AND 
WL SUBTRACT 3-4 DEGREES FROM PREVIOUS FORECAST WITH COOLER READINGS 
ACRS ERN SXNS. INSTABILITY PARAMETERS VERY MARGINAL SO HAVE PLAYED 
THUNDER POTENTIAL DOWN. 

WED NIGHT THROUGH THU NIGHT...UPPER LOW PARKED SOMEWHERE INVOF OF 
MEM AT 12Z THU. CONT TREND OF HIGHER POPS ACRS ERN SXNS WED NIGHT. 
BY LATE THU UPPER LOW WL SLOWLY BEGIN TO MOVE OUT...ACCORDING TO THE 
SLIGHTLY MORE PROGRESSIVE NAM...AND WL BEGIN TO DECREASE POPS FROM W 
TO E. THU SHOULD BE ANOTHER BELOW NORMAL DAY WITH RESPECT TO TEMPS. 

FRI AND FRI NIGHT...WEAK UPPER RIDGING BUILDS INTO THE REGION. 
EXPECT CWFA TO BE IN AN AREA OF SUBSIDENCE ON FRI WITH GOOD LOW 
LEVEL WAA. TEMPS SHOULD WARM UP NICELY BY FRI AFTN WITH READINGS 
WELL INTO THE 80S. 

SAT AND SUN...UPPER RIDGE ACRS THE SRN U.S. WITH WARM AND MUGGY 
CONDS. DECENT AFTN/EVENING INSTABILITY WL RESULT IN ISOLATED 
AFTN/EVENING TSTMS. 

MON AND TUE...UPPER RIDGE BREAKS DOWN SOME AS AN UPPER TROF MOVES 
ACRS THE AREA. THIS WL RESULT IN A LITTLE BETTER CHANCE OF 
SHOWERS/TSTMS. 

&&

FXUS64 KMEG 311555
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
1055 AM CDT TUE MAY 31 2005

.UPDATE...

WEAK SFC LOW NEAR NEW ORLEANS THIS MORNING WITH A SLOW MOVING UPPER 
TROF ACRS THE LOWER MS VALLEY. PRECIP CONTINUES TO SLOWLY SPREAD 
NORTHWARD INTO NORTHEAST MS AND DISSIPATE SOUTH OF THE TN 
BORDER...WHERE THE DEFORMATION AXIS IS LOCATED. CURRENT POP FORECAST 
HANDLES THIS WELL. TEMPS ALSO ON TRACK WITH NW SXNS...JBR...RUNNING 
ABOUT 10 DEGREES WARMER THAN SE SXNS...TUP. CURRENT FORECAST ON 
TRACK WITH THESE TRENDS AS WELL. NO UPDATES PLANNED. 

TUP HAS RECEIVED 0.12 INCHES SINCE MIDNIGHT FOR A TOTAL OF 0.71 
INCHES FOR THE MONTH A MAY. THE RECORD DRIEST WAS 0.85 INCHES IN 
1941. 

.PREV DISCUSSION ISSUED AT 328 AM...

THIS FORECAST PACKAGE CONSISTS OF MANY MODEL INCONSISTENCIES IN THE 
SHORT TERM WHICH IN TURN MAKES FOR HIGHER THAN NORMAL UNCERTAINTY IN 
THE FORECAST.

CURRENTLY...A WEAK SOUTHERN STREAM TROUGH CONTINUES TO SLOWLY MOVES 
ACROSS THE SOUTHERN STATES. AT THE SURFACE...A STATIONARY FRONT 
REMAINS ALONG THE SHORE OF THE NORTHERN GULF OF MEXICO. REGIONAL 
RADAR SHOWS AN INCREASE IN SHOWER DEVELOPMENT OVER CENTRAL 
MISSISSIPPI...MOVING NORTH TOWARD THE SOUTHERN SECTIONS OF THE CWA. 

THE ETA AND GFS CONTINUE TO HANDLE THE ABOVE FEATURES 
DIFFERENTLY...PLAYING HAVOC ON THE FORECAST. THE 00Z ETA APPEARS 
BETTER INITIALIZED THAN THE GFS. ALSO...THE GFS SUFFERS FROM 
CONVECTIVE FEEDBACK THROUGH 60HR. WILL LEAN TOWARD THE ETA IN THE 
SHORT TERM AS IT APPEARS TO HANDLE THE MOVEMENT OF THE FRONTAL 
BOUNDARY MORE REASONABLY. EXPECT THE BOUNDARY TO REMAIN WELL SOUTH 
OF THE CWA...WITH WEAK LOW PRESSURE DEVELOPING ALONG THE FRONT. AS 
HAS BEEN THE CASE THE PAST COUPLE OF DAYS...WILL HAVE A TIGHT POP 
GRADIENT WITH LIKELY POPS IN THE SOUTHERN THIRD OF COUNTIES FOR 
TODAY...DOWN TO A SLIGHT CHANCE ACROSS THE MS/TN BORDER. NO POPS 
NORTH OF THERE. TEMP GRADIENT WILL LIKELY REFLECT THAT OF YESTERDAY 
WITH HIGHER TEMPS ACROSS THE NORTHWEST CWA AND LOWER TEMPS ACROSS 
THE SOUTHEAST WHERE THE BETTER CLOUD COVER WILL BE. WENT A FEW 
DEGREES ABOVE GUIDANCE FROM MEMPHIS AND JACKSON. CHANCE POPS WILL 
CONTINUE OVER THE SOUTHEAST TONIGHT. MID LEVEL LAPSE RATES OF LESS 
THAN 6 C/KM AND POSITIVE LIFTED INDICES SUGGEST ANY THUNDER WILL BE 
ISOLATED.

EVEN THOUGH THE MODELS HAVE DIFFERENCES IN OPINION...A WEAK TROUGH 
WILL CONTINUE OVER THE FORECAST AREA THROUGH THURSDAY AS A WEAK 
SURFACE LOW TRAVERSES ENE ACROSS CENTRAL ALABAMA. WILL MAINTAIN 
CHANCE POPS EAST TO SLIGHT CHANCE WEST. ABUNDANT 850 MOISTURE ON 
WEDNESDAY WILL ALLOW FOR PLENTIFUL CLOUDS WHICH WILL KEEP TEMPS A 
FEW DEGREES COOLER. 

UPPER LEVEL RIDGING FINALLY BEGINS TO BUILD IN ON  
FRIDAY...PERSISTING INTO THE WEEKEND. TEMPERATURES WILL GRADUALLY 
WARM TO NEAR CLIMO LEVELS IN RESPONSE TO WARMER 850 TEMPS ADVECTING 
INTO THE AREA. ALSO...SINCE THE RIDGE IS RATHER BROAD AND THE CWA 
WILL COME UNDER THE INFLUENCE OF SW FLOW ALOFT...WILL MENTION A 
SLIGHT CHANCE OF SHWRS/TSTMS...MAINLY OF THE DIURNAL VARIETY. THIS 
WEATHER PATTERN IS PROGGED TO CONTINUE THROUGH NEXT TUESDAY WITH NO 
MAJOR WEATHER SYSTEMS AFFECTING THE REGION.

FYI...AS IT STANDS RIGHT NOW THREE OF THE CLIMATOLOGICAL SITES IN 
THE MIDSOUTH ARE APPROACHING THEIR DRIEST MAY ON RECORD. THE 
FOLLOWING ARE THE CURRENT MONTHLY PRECIP TOTALS FOR ALL FOUR CLIMATE 
LOCATIONS...

JACKSON...0.42 INCHES (CURRENTLY DRIEST MAY EVER)
JONESBORO...0.22 INCHES (CURRENTLY DRIEST MAY EVER)
TUPELO...0.59 INCHES (CURRENTLY DRIEST MAY EVER)
MEMPHIS...1.10 INCHES (CURRENTLY 5TH DRIEST MAY EVER)

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.
&&

$$

JFB/SJM

.DISCUSSION...

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 302018
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
320 PM CDT MON MAY 30 2005

.DISCUSSION...
STNRY FRONT LOCATED FROM NRN LA INTO CNTRL MS THIS AFTN. NOT MUCH 
GOING ON ACRS THE REGION WITH PRECIP WELL TO THE SOUTH AND WEST OF 
THE REGION WITH SOME SUN ACRS NRN SXNS. FRONT WL REMAIN SOUTH OF THE 
REGION TONIGHT AS UPPER TROF STARTS TO MOVE OUT OF THE WRN GULF INTO 
LA BY 12Z TUE. GFS TRIES TO DEVELOP SFC LOW OVER SRN MS AND MOVES IT 
TO N CNTRL MS BY 12Z BUT THIS SEEMS UNREALISTIC...ALONG WITH ITS QPF 
FIELDS. THE NAM SOLUTION OF WEAKER LOW FURTHER SOUTH SEEMS MORE 
REASONABLE FOR TONIGHT. AS A RESULT WL LOWER POPS TONIGHT AND GO 
WITH A DRY FORECAST NORTH OF MEMPHIS WITH CHC POPS ACRS N MS. SHOULD 
SEE SOME STARS ACRS THE NRN HALF AS WELL. CUT A COUPLE DEGREES OFF 
TEMPS ACRS THE NORTH DUE TO LOWER DEWPOINTS AND PARTLY CLOUDY SKIES. 

TUESDAY...STNRY FRONT WL CONT TO REMAIN ACRS THE LOWER MS VALLEY 
WHILE THE UPPER TROF MOVES INTO MS BY 00Z WED. BEST LIFT AND 
MOISTURE WL BE ALONG AND NEAR THE FRONT SO WL TAPER POPS FROM SOUTH 
TO NORTH. EXPECT WARMEST TEMPS ALONG KY/MO BORDERS WHERE SOME SUN IS 
POSSIBLE. 

TUESDAY NIGHT...DIVERGENCE IN THE MODELS BEYOND THIS POINT. HOWEVER 
18Z NAM AND 12Z GFS IN BETTER AGREEMENT. LOOKS LIKE NAM IS STARTING 
TO COME AROUND TO SLIGHTLY FAVORED GFS SOLUTION THOUGH IT STILL HAS 
MORE TROFINESS TO THE WEST ACRS THE ARKLATEX. FRONT STILL TO THE 
SOUTH ON TUE NIGHT WITH WEAK SFC LOW PRESSURE ACRS CNTRL MS. ONCE 
AGAIN HIGHEST POPS ACRS SRN AREAS. 

WED AND WED NIGHT...UPPER TROF REMAINS ACRS THE AREA AND CANNOT RULE 
OUT SOME TSTM/SHRA ACTIVITY. BEST GUESS...MORE NUMEROUS IN EASTERN 
SXNS. EXPECT TEMPS TO BE A LITTLE BELOW NORMAL WITH PLENTY OF CLOUDS.

THU AND FRI...UPPER TROF SLOWLY LIFTING OUT OF THE AREA WITH UPPER 
RIDGING BUILDING IN. EXPECT MOSTLY DRY CONDS WITH JUST SMALL POPS 
AND WARMING TEMPS. 

SAT THROUGH MON...UPPER RIDGE CONTS TO BUILD INTO THE AREA WITH WARM 
TEMPS AND MUGGY CONDS. PRECIP CHCS BECOME MORE AFTN/EVENING VARIETY.

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 301445
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
945 AM CDT MON MAY 30 2005

.UPDATE...
STNRY FRONT LOCATED FROM SRN AR INTO CNTRL MS THIS MORNING. 12Z ETA 
AND 06Z GFS SHOW THIS BOUNDARY MOVING VERY LITTLE TODAY. NOT MUCH 
ACTIVITY THIS MORNING WITH PRECIP CONFINED TO THE GULF COAST ATTM. 
WITH FRONT NOT MOVING MUCH AND MAIN AREA OF LIFT AND MOISTURE 
REMAINING TO THE SOUTH OF THE REGION MUCH OF THE AREA SHOULD BE DRY 
AND PLEASANT TODAY. BOTH MODELS SHOW LOW MEAN RH VALUES FROM TN 
BORDER NORTHWARD. AIRMASS NORTH OF THE FRONT QUITE STABLE. AS A 
RESULT WL PULL POPS NORTH OF MEMPHIS AND CUT POPS A CATEGORY TO THE 
SOUTH. WL STILL GO WITH LIKELY POPS SOUTH OF TUP...THESE AREAS ARE 
CLOSEST TO THE FRONT. HOWEVER THIS MAY BE OVERDONE. NOT CONFIDENT IN 
MODELS SOLUTIONS OF MOVING PRECIP BACK INTO THE AREA THIS AFTN. GFS 
SEEMS OVERDONE WITH THE SFC LOW BOTH IN STRENGTH AND SPEED. ETA SFC 
PATTERN SEEMS MORE REASONABLE. UPDATE ALREADY OUT. 

.PREV DISCUSSION ISSUED AT 344 AM...

LATEST SURFACE ANALYSIS PLACES STATIONARY BOUNDARY ACROSS SOUTHERN 
ARKANSAS AND CENTRAL MISSISSIPPI. WATER VAPOR IMAGERY SHOWS UPPER 
LEVEL LOW ACROSS SOUTHEAST TEXAS...BROAD TROUGHING ACROSS GREAT 
LAKES REGION...AND AN AREA OF CONFLUENCE ACROSS THE MIDDLE 
MISSISSIPPI VALLEY/MID SOUTH. 

TODAY...STATIONARY FRONT ACROSS MISSISSIPPI AND ARKANSAS WILL BE 
FOCUS OF PRECIPITATION CHANCES TODAY AS IT TRIES TO MOVE NORTH...BUT 
SHOULD NOT MAKE IT MUCH FURTHER THAN THE TENNESSEE/MISSISSIPPI 
BORDER. MODEL SOUNDINGS PRODUCE 700 J/KG CAPE...AND LI/S AROUND -2. 
HOWEVER...NOT TOO IMPRESSED WITH CHANCES FOR THUNDERSTORMS TODAY 
WITH DISMAL 700-500MB LAPSE RATES BELOW 6 C/KM AND SHOWALTER 
INDICIES MOSTLY POSITIVE. THUS...WILL MENTION ONLY 
ISOLATED/SCATTERED CHANCES FOR THUNDERSTORMS AT THIS TIME WITH 
LOWER POPS ACROSS THE NORTHERN ONE THIRD OF THE FORECAST AREA.

TONIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY..MODELS DIVERGE ON HANDLING OF SOUTHERN 
STREAM SURFACE/UPPER LEVEL LOW. 00Z NAM MODEL RUN SHOWS UPPER LEVEL 
LOW CLOSING OFF ACROSS THE MID SOUTH AND LAGGING BEHIND MORE 
PROGRESSIVE GFS SOLUTION WITH LOW PRESSURE ACROSS GEORGIA BY 
WEDNESDAY. WILL TREND FORECAST TOWARDS A SLOWER MODIFIED VERSION OF 
THE GFS AS IT HAS BEEN MORE RELIABLE THAN THE NAM. THUNDER CHANCES 
WILL REMAIN MINIMAL NORTH OF THE BOUNDARY TONIGHT AND MADE 
ADJUSTMENTS TO AN ISOLATED MENTION OF THUNDER. NO CHANGES TO POPS 
THROUGH TUESDAY NIGHT AS FORECAST AREA WILL BE WITHIN DEFORMATION 
ZONE. ADDED POPS TO WEDNESDAY FOR LINGERING PRECIPITATION ASSOCIATED 
WITH SLOWER MOVEMENT OF SURFACE LOW.

NO CHANGES MADE BEYOND WEDNESDAY.

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.
&&

.DISCUSSION...LATEST SURFACE ANALYSIS PLACES STATIONARY BOUNDARY

IMAGERY SHOWS UPPER LEVEL LOW ACROSS SOUTHEAST TEXAS...BROAD 
TROUGHING ACROSS GREAT LAKES REGION...AND AN AREA OF CONFLUENCE 
ACROSS THE MIDDLE MISSISSIPPI VALLEY/MID SOUTH. 

TODAY...STATIONARY FRONT ACROSS MISSISSIPPI AND ARKANSAS WILL BE 
FOCUS OF PRECIPITATION CHANCES TODAY AS IT TRIES TO MOVE NORTH...BUT 
SHOULD NOT MAKE IT MUCH FURTHER THAN THE TENNESSEE/MISSISSIPPI 
BORDER. MODEL SOUNDINGS PRODUCE 700 J/KG CAPE...AND LI/S AROUND -2. 
HOWEVER...NOT TOO IMPRESSED WITH CHANCES FOR THUNDERSTORMS TODAY 
WITH DISMAL 700-500MB LAPSE RATES BELOW 6 C/KM AND SHOWALTER 
INDICIES MOSTLY POSITIVE. THUS...WILL MENTION ONLY 
ISOLATED/SCATTERED CHANCES FOR THUNDERSTORMS AT THIS TIME WITH

LOW CLOSING OFF ACROSS THE MID SOUTH AND LAGGING BEHIND MORE

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
1111 PM CDT SUN MAY 29 2005

.DISCUSSION...
HAVE DECIDED TO LOWER POPS FURTHER DUE TO CURRENT RADAR TRENDS AND
ABSENCE OF DECENT FORCING MECHANISM TO GENERATE WIDESPREAD
PRECIPITATION. IN ADDITION...CONFLUENT FLOW ALOFT TENDING TO
LIMIT ATMOSPHERIC LIFT. THEREFORE...POPS DROPPED IN THE NORTH...
LOWERED TO SLIGHT CHANCE CENTRAL SECTIONS...AND CHANCE POPS SOUTH.
UPDATED GRIDS AND ZONE FORECAST OUT SHORTLY.

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 300154
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
854 PM CDT SUN MAY 29 2005

.DISCUSSION...
A STATIONARY FRONT REMAINS STRETCHED ACROSS NORTH-CENTRAL MISSISSIPPI
INTO SOUTHERN ARKANSAS THIS EVENING. RAIN SHOWERS CONTINUE MAINLY
ALONG AND SOUTH OF THIS BOUNDARY...WITH NORTHEAST MISSISSIPPI SEEING
SOME LIGHT RAIN SHOWERS. THE BEST MOISTURE AND LIFT APPEARS TO BE
REMAINING TO OUR SOUTH...WITH MOST OF THE SHOWER AND THUNDERSTORM
ACTIVITY STAYING OVER SOUTHERN ARKANSAS INTO CENTRAL MISSISSIPPI.
THINK THAT BEST RAIN CHANCES WILL REMAIN ACROSS SOUTHERN PORTIONS OF
THE MIDSOUTH TONIGHT WITH DECREASING CHANCES CENTRAL AND NORTH. WITH
ALL OF THIS IN MIND...HAVE LOWERED POPS A BIT ACROSS NORTHERN AND
CENTRAL SECTIONS AND LOWERED QPF AMOUNTS AREAWIDE. WILL CONTINUE TO
MONITOR PRECIP TRENDS THROUGH THE EVENING. UPDATED GRIDS AND ZONE
FORECAST OUT SHORTLY.

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 291927
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
230 PM CDT SUN MAY 29 2005

.DISCUSSION...
SHOWERS WITH A FEW EMBEDDED THUNDERSTORMS CONTINUE TO MOVE ACROSS 
NORTH MISSISSIPPI. THESE SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS ARE ASSOCIATED 
WITH A STATIONARY FRONT THAT IS CURRENTLY LOCATED ACROSS CENTRAL 
MISSISSIPPI. MODELS ARE SHOWING THIS FRONT REMAINING STATIONARY OVER 
NORTH CENTRAL MISSISSIPPI THROUGH AT LEAST TUESDAY EVENING. SHOWERS 
AND TUNDERSTORMS WILL CONTINUE TO DEVELOP ALONG AND NORTH OF THE 
FRONT AS SEVERAL DISTURBANCES MOVE ALONG THE FRONT OVER THE NEXT FEW 
DAYS. QUESTION IS HOW FAR NORTH WILL THE PRECIPITATION GO. MODELS 
SHOWING THE BULK OF PRECIP WILL STAY SOUTH OF A MEMPHIS TO SAVANNAH 
LINE. CAN/T RULE OUT A FEW ISOLATED TO SCATTERED SHOWERS NORTH OF 
THIS LINE SO WILL HAVE A RANGE OF 20/30 POPS IN NORTHWESTERN ZONES 
TO 80 POPS IN THE THE SOUTHEAST THROUGH TUESDAY NIGHT. HIGH 
TEMPERATURES WILL RANGE IN THE UPPER 70S WHERE THE BULK OF THE 
PRECIP OCCURS TO LOW 80S ELSEWHERE. IN ADDITION...SKIES WILL REMAIN 
MOSTLY CLOUDY TO CLOUDY DURING THIS TIME.

MODELS BEGIN TO DIFFER ON WEDNESDAY. GFS PUSHES FRONT EAST GIVING 
THE MIDSOUTH A BREAK WHILE THE NAM KEEPS THE FRONT OVER THE AREA. 
WILL LEAVE WEDNESDAY DRY FOR NOW.

ANOTHER SYSTEM WILL APPROACH THE AREA ON FRIDAY AND WILL BRING 
CHANCES FOR RAIN THROUGH THE END OF THE FORECAST. 
&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.

FXUS64 KMEG 291510
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
1015 AM CDT SUN MAY 29 2005

.DISCUSSION...
LATEST SFC ANALYSIS SHOWS STATIONARY FRONT LOCATED ACROSS CENTRAL 
MISSISSIPPI. FRONT HAS NOT MOVED MUCH OVER THE LAST FEW HOURS. 
SHOWERS WITH A FEW THUNDERSTORMS CONTINUE TO DEVELOP AND MOVE 
EASTWARD NORTH OF THE FRONT. THUS FAR...THE PRECIP HAS STAYED MAINLY 
SOUTH OF THE TENNESSEE/MISSISSIPPI LINE. MODELS ARE SHOWING FRONT 
GRADUALLY MOVING NORTHWARD TODAY. EVEN WITH THE MOVEMENT...DON/T 
EXPECT MUCH PRECIP TO MOVE INTO AREAS NORTH OF A MEMPHIS. WILL 
UPDATE TO REMOVE POPS ACROSS EXTREME NORTHERN SECTIONS OF THE 
MIDSOUTH. TEMPERATURES ARE CURRENTLY IN THE 70S. EXPECT TEMPS TO 
STAY IN THE 70S IN ACROSS SOUTHERN HALF OF CWA WHERE PRECIP IS 
FALLING...ELSEWHERE TEMPS SHOULD GET UP INTO THE LOWER 80S. REST OF 
CURRENT FORECAST LOOKS GOOD... UPDATE WILL BE OUT SHORTLY.



000 
FXUS64 KMEG 290857
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
356 AM CDT SUN MAY 29 2005

.DISCUSSION...
THE MIDSOUTH LIES IN AN AREA OF CONFLUENCE BETWEEN THE NORTHERN
STREAM AND AN ACTIVE SOUTHERN STREAM THIS MORNING. THIS WILL MAKE
FOR A DIFFICULT FORECAST THE NEXT FEW DAYS. SEVERAL
COMPLEXES OF THUNDERSTORMS ARE RUMBLING FROM EAST TX TO CENTRAL MS
THIS MORNING. A WARM FRONT LIES FROM SOUTHERN AR TO SOUTHERN AL.
SHOWERS ARE SPREADING INTO NORTH MS AHEAD OF THIS FRONT BUT ARE
ENCOUNTERING DRY AIR AS THEY SPREAD NORTHWARD.

THE GFS SEEMS TO BE HANDLING THE CURRENT SITUATION BETTER THAN
THE NAM...SO WILL GENERALLY FOLLOW IT IN THE UPCOMING FORECAST.
THIS LEADS TO A TIGHT NORTH TO SOUTH GRADIENT IN THE POPS THE NEXT
COUPLE OF DAYS ACROSS THE MIDSOUTH WITH THE HIGHEST POPS FROM
EAST-CENTRAL AR INTO NORTH MS AND THE LOWEST POPS FROM NORTHEAST AR
INTO NORTHWEST TN. FOR TODAY...THE WARM FRONT WILL PUSH SLOWLY
NORTHWARD INTO NORTH MS AS AN ELONGATED UPPER TROUGH MOVING INTO THE
SOUTHERN PLAINS ALLOWS THE UPPER FLOW TO BECOME MORE SOUTHWESTERLY
ACROSS NORTH MS. SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS WILL GRADUALLY SPREAD
NORTHWARD TODAY AHEAD OF THE WARM FRONT. NORTHWESTERLY FLOW ALOFT
IN ASSOCIATION WITH THE NORTHERN STREAM WILL HELP TO SUPPRESS MUCH OF
THE RAIN SOUTH OF A JONESBORO TO JACKSON LINE...ALTHOUGH WILL
CONTINUE WITH CHANCE POPS FROM NORTHEAST AR INTO NORTHWEST TN.

FOR TONIGHT AND MONDAY...FRONTAL SYSTEM BECOMES NEARLY STATIONARY
WEST TO EAST FROM EAST-CENTRAL AR INTO NORTH MS. MEANWHILE...
UPPER LEVEL DISTURBANCES WILL MOVE ACROSS NORTH MS. WILL CONTINUE
WITH LOWEST POPS NORTH TO HIGHEST POPS SOUTH.

FOR MONDAY NIGHT...THE GFS INDICATES A SURFACE LOW MOVING ALONG THE
FRONT ACROSS NORTH MS. CURRENT FORECAST LOOKS GOOD SHOWING LOWEST
POPS NORTHEAST AR TO HIGHEST POPS NORTHEAST MS.

COULD BE SOME HEAVY RAINFALL TOTALS FROM EAST-CENTRAL AR INTO NORTH
MS OVER THE NEXT COUPLE OF DAYS. HOWEVER...WILL NOT MENTION IN
THE FORECAST AT THIS TIME SINCE THUNDERSTORM COMPLEXES WITH THE
HEAVIER RAIN ARE MOSTLY MOVING TO THE SOUTH OF THIS AREA AT THIS
TIME. IN ADDITION...WE HAVE BEEN RATHER DRY AT LEAST THE LAST COUPLE
OF WEEKS.

WILL NOT MAKE ANY CHANGES TO CURRENT FORECAST TUESDAY AND BEYOND.
MODELS CONTINUE TO NOT BE IN VERY GOOD AGREEMENT.

&&

.DISCUSSION...
CLOUDS ARE SLOWLY INCREASING FROM THE SOUTHWEST AS AN AREA OF

STILL QUITE A BIT DRIER THAN OVER SOUTHERN ARKANSAS WHERE THE
THUNDERSTORMS ARE. THAT HAS MADE IT DIFFICULT FOR THE RAIN TO GET
MUCH CLOSER. EVENTUALLY THE ATMOSPHERE WILL MOISTEN UP AND RAIN WILL
ENTER THE REGION SOMETIME AFTER MIDNIGHT. CURRENT FORECAST HAS A
GOOD HANDLE ON THIS SITUATION SO NO CHANGES ARE NEEDED AT THIS TIME.

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 281902
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
300 PM CDT SAT MAY 28 2005

.DISCUSSION...
MODEL DIFFERENCES CONTINUE TO PRESENT FORECAST ISSUES THIS FORECAST 
PACKAGE. THE ONE ITEM THAT LOOKS CERTAIN IS THAT THE PLEASANT AND 
DRY WEATHER WILL BE COMING TO AN END BY SUNDAY. THE BIG QUESTION IS 
WHEN WILL THE RAIN START AND WHEN WILL THE RAIN WILL END. IF THE GFS 
IS RIGHT...THE MIDSOUTH MAY BE IN FOR A WET WEEK WHILE THE NAM IS A 
LITTLE MORE OPTIMISTIC. A STATIONARY FRONT LOCATED ACROSS NORTHERN 
LOUISIANA AND SOUTH-CENTRAL MISSISSIPPI WILL BEGIN TO LIFT NORTHWARD 
AS A WARM FRONT TONIGHT. THE GFS BEGINS TO SPREAD RAIN INTO SOUTHERN 
PORTIONS OF THE CWA AROUND MIDNIGHT WHILE THE NAM DOESN/T START THE 
PRECIP UNTIL SUNDAY AFTERNOON. WITH THESE DIFFERENCES WILL TRY TO GO 
IN BETWEEN. WILL ADD A SLIGHT CHANCE TO CHANCE POP ACROSS SOUTHERN 
ZONES FOR LATE TONIGHT.

THE NEXT DIFFERENCE IS HOW FAR NORTH WILL THE WARM FRONT WILL GO. THE 
NAM BRINGS THE FRONT THROUGH THE ENTIRE MIDSOUTH WHILE THE GFS HANGS 
IT UP ACROSS NORTH MISSISSIPPI. THIS DIFFERENCE BETWEEN THE MODELS 
PRESENT PROBLEMS WITH TEMPERATURES...POPS...CLOUDS...ETC THROUGH 
MUCH OF THE WEEK. THE GFS KEEPS THE FRONT HUNG UP ACROSS THE MIDDLE 
PART OF THE CWA. SEVERAL LOW PRESSURE CENTERS DEVELOP AND MOVE ALONG 
THE FRONT THROUGH THE MIDDLE PART OF THE WEEK. THIS KEEPS THE 
MIDSOUTH WET WITH EVEN THE POTENTIAL FOR HEAVY RAINFALL. 
TEMPERATURES WILL ALSO BE ON THE COOL SIDE. ON THE OTHER HAND...THE 
NAM PUSHES THE WARM FRONT NORTH OF THE CWA SUNDAY NIGHT AND BRINGS 
THE ASSOCIATED COLD FRONT THROUGH THE CWA MONDAY INTO MONDAY 
EVENING. BEHIND THE FRONT...HIGH PRESSURE MOVES INTO THE AREA 
THROUGH THE MIDDLE PART OF THE WEEK. WILL TRY TO GO WITH A 
COMPROMISE BETWEEN THE MODELS AND KEEP POPS IN THROUGH TUESDAY AND 
THEN GO DRY THROUGH THURSDAY. 

MODEL SHOWS ANOTHER SYSTEM MOVING INTO THE AREA TOWARD THE END OF 
THE FORECAST PERIOD. WILL INTRODUCE SMALL POPS IN FORECAST.

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 280854
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
354 AM CDT SAT MAY 28 2005

.DISCUSSION...
BAND OF MID LEVEL CLOUDS STRETCHES ACROSS THE MIDSOUTH THIS MORNING
AHEAD OF AN APPROACHING SHORT WAVE IN WEST-NORTHWESTERLY FLOW
ALOFT. ONLY A FEW SPOTS OF RAIN ARE PRESENTLY BEING OBSERVED ACROSS
NORTH MS. WILL GO WITH A DRY FORECAST FOR TODAY. WATER VAPOR IMAGERY
SHOWS DRY AIR ALOFT WORKING ITS WAY INTO THE MIDSOUTH AND EXPECT THAT
TO CONTINUE TODAY. THINK CLOUDS WILL GRADUALLY CLEAR FROM THE
NORTHWEST WITH MOST OF THE AREA MOSTLY SUNNY BY THIS AFTERNOON. ANY
REMAINING RAIN WILL SOON BE OUT OF NORTH MS. WEAK HIGH PRESSURE WILL
SPREAD INTO THE MIDSOUTH WITH HIGH TEMPERATURES FORECAST TO BE
ABOUT THE SAME AS YESTERDAY.

FOR TONIGHT...LOW LEVEL WINDS WILL GRADUALLY TURN TO THE SOUTH.
A WARM FRONT WILL LIFT TOWARD THE MIDSOUTH FROM THE SOUTH. HOWEVER...
THINK THAT RAIN WILL REMAIN TO OUR WEST AND SOUTH.

WE FINALLY GET INTO A WET PATTERN SUNDAY INTO MEMORIAL DAY...AND
POSSIBLY LONGER. THE WARM FRONT WILL LIFT INTO THE MIDSOUTH SUNDAY
WITH THE ATMOSPHERE DESTABILIZING. CAPES CLIMB TO BETWEEN 1500 AND
2500 J/KG. MEANWHILE...A SHORT WAVE WILL APPROACH FROM THE WEST.
WILL INCREASE POPS TO 50 PERCENT...LATER FORECASTS MAY NEED TO GO
EVEN HIGHER FOR PART OF THE AREA. THE GFS INDICATES A STRONG VORT
MAX APPROACHING FROM THE WEST EARLY SUNDAY. THIS SEEMS OVERDONE AND
PROBABLY CONVECTIVE FEEDBACK...BUT WILL NOT TOTALLY DISCOUNT
REMNANTS OF AN MCS APPROACHING THE MIDSOUTH FROM THE WEST SUNDAY.
SPC HAS PART OF THE MIDSOUTH IN A SLIGHT RISK OF SEVERE FOR SUNDAY.
ATTM...IT SEEMS THE THREAT WOULD BE ISOLATED WITH POSSIBLY SOME
LARGE HAIL AND HIGH WINDS.

FOR SUNDAY NIGHT AND MEMORIAL DAY...WILL HAVE LIKELY POPS FOR
SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS FOR MOST OF THE AREA. A COLD FRONT AND
UPPER LEVEL TROUGH WILL MOVE NEAR THE MIDSOUTH FROM THE NORTHWEST.
MEANWHILE...MODELS DIFFER ON HOW FAR THE WARM FRONT WILL MOVE NORTH.
THE NAM PUSHES THE FRONT NORTH OF THE MIDSOUTH...WHILE THE GFS KEEPS
IT WEST TO EAST THROUGH THE MIDSOUTH. WITH A MOSTLY WEST TO EAST
UPPER LEVEL FLOW AND THE DEVELOPMENT OF THUNDERSTORMS HELPING TO
SUPPRESS THE WARM FRONT SOUTH...TEND TO FAVOR THE GFS PLACEMENT OF
THE WARM FRONT. REGARDLESS...EITHER WAY STILL MEANS HIGH POPS FOR THE
MIDSOUTH.

WILL INCREASE THE POPS MONDAY NIGHT...AND EXTEND THEM INTO TUESDAY.
MODELS NOW INDICATE A SLOWER MOVEMENT OF THE COLD FRONT. IF THE GFS
IS CORRECT AND LATER MODEL RUNS CONTINUE THE TREND...POPS WILL NEED
TO BE EXTENDED INTO TUESDAY NIGHT FOR PARTS OF THE MIDSOUTH. MODELS
ARE REALLY HAVING A DIFFICULT TIME HANDLING THIS WEATHER SITUATION.

&&

LINGER IN THE SOUTHEASTERN HALF OF THE CWA SATURDAY MORNING. THE

FOR HIGH PRESSURE TO REBUILD INTO THE REGION.

HOWEVER...HIGH PRESSURE WILL BE SHORT LIVED AS WARM FRONT WILL BEGIN 
LIFTING NORTHWARD BY SUNDAY AFTERNOON. THIS WILL BRING BETTER 
CHANCES FOR RAIN SUNDAY NIGHT AND MONDAY ACROSS THE ENTIRE MIDSOUTH. 
LOW PRESSURE WITH AN ASSOCIATED COLD FRONT WILL MOVE ACROSS THE CWA 
MONDAY INTO MONDAY EVENING. WILL BUMP POPS TO LIKELY ACROSS ENTIRE 
CWA FOR MONDAY.

BY TUESDAY...HIGH PRESSURE WILL REBUILD INTO THE AREA RETURNING DRY 
WEATHER TO THE AREA. THE QUIET WEATHER WILL STICK AROUND UNTIL 
FRIDAY WHEN ANOTHER LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM WILL BEGIN TO APPROACH THE 
AREA.

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 270857
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
357 AM CDT FRI MAY 27 2005

.DISCUSSION...
IT IS ANOTHER TRANQUIL NIGHT WEATHERWISE ACROSS THE MIDSOUTH. THE
WEAK COLD FRONT THAT MOVED INTO THE MIDSOUTH YESTERDAY HAS ALL BUT
DISSIPATED. THERE DOES REMAIN A WEAK DEWPOINT GRADIENT ACROSS THE
NORTHWEST PART OF THE MIDSOUTH. SOME MID AND HIGH LEVEL CLOUDS ARE
OBSERVED ON SATELLITE. THESE CLOUDS ARE THINNING OUT AS ANY
REMAINING UPPER LEVEL SUPPORT PULLS TO THE EAST.

00Z NAM AND GFS ARE IN SOMEWHAT BETTER AGREEMENT THIS MORNING FOR THE
SHORT TERM. TODAYS WEATHER WILL BE MUCH LIKE YESTERDAYS. A DRY WEST
TO NORTHWEST FLOW ALOFT WILL OCCUR ACROSS THE MIDSOUTH. SKIES WILL BE
MOSTLY SUNNY TO PARTLY CLOUDY WITH MOST CLOUDS BEING SUPPRESSED
ACROSS NORTH MS THIS MORNING. THE ATMOSPHERE WILL REMAIN STABLE AND
CAPPED...THUS WE CAN EXPECT ANOTHER DRY DAY.

FOR TONIGHT...DO NOT LIKE THE SPURIOUS VORT MAX THE GFS MOVES
TOWARD THE MIDSOUTH FROM THE WEST ACCOMPANIED BY STRONG LIFT.
INSTEAD PREFER THE NAM SOLUTION. THE NAM BRINGS A WEAK
TROUGH...SURFACE AND ALOFT...THROUGH THE MIDSOUTH FROM THE NORTHWEST.
WILL MENTION 20 PERCENT CHANCE OF SHOWERS / THUNDERSTORMS ACROSS
MOST OF THE MIDSOUTH. THE EXCEPTION IS THE SOUTHERN REACHES OF NORTH
MS INCLUDING TUPELO WHERE WILL MENTION 30 PERCENT POPS. THE
INSTABILITY / MOISTURE IS FORECAST TO BE A LITTLE BETTER IN THIS
AREA. HOWEVER...NOT REALLY THAT IMPRESSED WITH THE CHANCES FOR RAIN
ANYWHERE TONIGHT SINCE THE ATMOSPHERE BECOMES QUICKLY CAPPED AFTER
SUNSET AND THE UPPER LEVEL DYNAMICS ARE WEAK.

FOR SATURDAY...WILL REMOVE THE CHANCE OF THUNDERSTORMS. THE NAM
SHOWS THE WEAK TROUGH MOVING SOUTHEAST OUT OF THE MIDSOUTH EARLY IN
THE MORNING. DRY AIR ALOFT WILL SPREAD INTO THE MIDSOUTH BEHIND
THIS SYSTEM.

SATURDAY NIGHT...LOW LEVEL WINDS TURN TO THE SOUTH ALLOWING FOR
SOME INCREASE IN MOISTURE...BUT PRECIPITATION IS FORECAST TO REMAIN
TO OUR NORTH AND WEST.

SUNDAY NIGHT INTO MONDAY...RAIN CHANCES INCREASE AND HOPEFULLY WE
CAN GET SOME NEEDED RAINFALL. THE ATMOSPHERE BECOME UNSTABLE SUNDAY
WITH CAPES CLIMBING TO BETWEEN 1500 AND 3000 J/KG AS SHOWN BY THE
NAM. MEANWHILE...UPPER LEVEL DISTURBANCES WILL APPROACH THE AREA
IN WEST-N0RTHWEST FLOW ALOFT.

IN THE LONGER RANGE...THE GFS IS BRINGING A MODERATE COLD FRONT
THROUGH THE MIDSOUTH MONDAY NIGHT. LATER FORECASTS MAY BE ABLE TO
REMOVE POPS FOR MUCH OF THE AREA TUESDAY IF THE CURRENT FORECAST
SPEED OF THE FRONT PERSIST IN LATER MODEL RUNS.

FXUS64 KMEG 270128
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
828 PM CDT THU MAY 26 2005

.UPDATE...

THE WEAK FRONTAL BOUNDARY THAT HAD APPROACHED THE MIDSOUTH FROM THE 
WEST TODAY HAS WASHED OUT ACROSS THE REGION AS IT IS VERY DIFFICULT 
TO ANALYZE A BOUNDARY ON THE SURFACE CHART. SOME MID TO HIGH LEVEL 
CLOUDS CONTINUE TO STREAM THROUGH AS A WEAK IMPULSE MOVES OVER THE 
AREA IN THE WNW UPPER FLOW. CURRENT FORECAST OF PARTLY CLOUDY WILL 
WORK FROM THE MS/TN LINE NORTHWARD BUT WILL ADJUST SKIES TO MOSTLY 
CLEAR OVER NORTH MISSISSIPPI.

DEWPOINTS RUNNING SEVERAL DEGREES WARMER TONIGHT COMPARED TO LAST 
NIGHT. THEREFORE...EXPECT OVERNIGHT LOWS TO BE SEVERAL DEGREES 
WARMER...ESPECIALLY WHERE THE MID AND HIGH LEVEL CLOUDS WILL BE. 
CURRENT FORECAST HANDLES THIS WELL AND NO CHANGES ARE NEEDED FOR 
TEMPS TONIGHT. REST OF THE FORECAST PARAMETERS ALSO LOOK GOOD.

UPDATE TO GRIDS ALREADY OUT. ZONE UPDATE OUT SHORTLY.

.PREVIOUS DISCUSSION ISSUED AT 245 PM THU MAY 26 2005

QUIET WEATHER WILL COME TO AN END BY THE END OF THE WEEKEND. A WEAK 
COLD FRONT IS CURRENTLY APPROACHING FROM THE NORTHWEST AND WILL MOVE 
THROUGH THE CWA TONIGHT. NAM HINTING AT A FEW SHOWERS ACCOMPANYING 
WITH THE PASSAGE OF THE FRONT...WHILE GFS IS DRY. CURRENT RADAR 
IMAGES SHOW NOT MUCH SHOWER ACTIVITY ALONG FRONT RIGHT NOW SO WILL 
MONITOR AND MAKE A LAST MINUTE DECISION BUT RIGHT NOW LEANING TOWARD 
A DRY FORECAST. 

EXPECT FRIDAY TO BE ANOTHER PLEASANT DAY ACROSS THE MIDSOUTH. 
TEMPERATURES WILL BE A TAD BIT COOLER THAN TODAY DUE TO THE COLD 
FRONT BUT HIGHS WILL STILL GET INTO THE LOWER 80S.

MODELS BEGIN TO SHOW BIG DIFFERENCES IN THE FORECAST A BEGINNING 
FRIDAY NIGHT. THE GFS BRINGS ANOTHER COLD FRONT THROUGH THE CWA 
FRIDAY NIGHT. BEHIND THE FRONT...HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS INTO THE AREA 
KEEPING THE MIDSOUTH DRY THROUGH SATURDAY NIGHT. BY SUNDAY...THE GFS 
BRINGS THE FRONT BACK NORTHWARD AS A WARM FRONT. HOWEVER THE 
NAM...IS MUCH SLOWER WITH THE NEXT COLD FRONT AND DOES NOT BRING THE 
FRONT INTO THE CWA UNTIL SATURDAY. THE NAM ALSO HANGS THE FRONT UP 
ACROSS THE AREA THROUGH THE REST OF THE WEEKEND. CURRENT FORECAST IS 
MUCH CLOSER TO THE GFS SOLUTION SO WILL LEAN TOWARD THE GFS FOR NOW. 
HOWEVER CONFIDENCE IS LOW ON WHICH SOLUTION WILL BE RIGHT. WILL PUT 
POPS IN FOR FRIDAY NIGHT AND SUNDAY.

BY SUNDAY NIGHT...MODELS IN AGREEMENT THAT A FRONT WILL BE HUNG UP 
OVER THE MIDSOUTH. LOW PRESSURE WILL DEVELOP ALONG THE FRONT AND 
WILL MOVE ACROSS NORTH CENTRAL MISSISSIPPI MONDAY AFTERNOON INTO 
MONDAY NIGHT. THIS WILL KEEP RAIN CHANCES IN THE FORECAST DURING 
THIS TIME.

AN UPPER TROUGH WILL MOVE THROUGH THE MIDSOUTH FROM TUESDAY INTO 
TUESDAY EVENING. WILL KEEP SMALL POPS IN FORECAST.

BY WEDNESDAY...HIGH PRESSURE WILL BUILD INTO THE FORECAST AND WILL 
BRING DRY CONDITIONS BACK TO THE CWA THROUGH THE END OF THE FORECAST 
PERIOD WITH NEAR NORMAL TEMPERATURES OCCURRING BY THURSDAY.

ANOTHER NICE DAY IS SHAPING UP ACROSS THE MIDSOUTH. SKIES ARE MOSTLY

FAR THIS MORNING. SKIES WILL BECOME PARTLY CLOUDY THIS AFTERNOON AS



000 
FXUS64 KMEG 260952
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
452 AM CDT THU MAY 26 2005

.DISCUSSION...

HIGH PRESSURE REMAINS OVER THE MID-SOUTH THIS MORNING AND THIS HAS
ALLOWED FOR MOSTLY CLEAR SKIES AND LIGHT WINDS. TEMPERATURES
CONTINUE TO BOTTOM OUT IN THE UPPER 40S EAST WHERE THE ATMOSPHERE HAS
DECOUPLED TO LOW 60S OVER THE DELTA AND THE MEMPHIS HEAT ISLAND. THIS
HIGH PRESSURE SYSTEM WILL SLIDE EAST TODAY AS A WEAK COLD FRONT...NOW
STRETCHED ACROSS CENTRAL MISSOURI INTO NORTHEAST OKLAHOMA...
APPROACHES THE AREA. THIS FRONT WILL MOVE ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA
THIS AFTERNOON AND TONIGHT. AT THIS TIME NOT EXPECTING ANY PRECIP
WITH THE FRONT...AS THERE IS NO RETURN FLOW AHEAD OF THIS SYSTEM AND
THE ATMOSPHERE REMAINS DRY. TEMPERATURES SHOULD WARM INTO THE LOW TO
MID 80S ACROSS THE AREA...UNDER A DECENT AMOUNT OF LATE MAY
SUNSHINE...NEUTRAL LOW LEVEL TEMPERATURE ADVECTION...AND DRY
CONDITIONS. THIS GOES ABOVE GUIDANCE WHICH HAS BEEN TOO COOL AS OF
LATE DUE IN PART TO THE DRY CONDITIONS. THIS FRONTAL BOUNDARY SHOULD
STALL OUT OVER NORTH MISSISSIPPI ON FRIDAY AND WASH OUT. THIS MEANS
ANOTHER DRY DAY FRIDAY...WITH TEMPERATURES GETTING BACK INTO THE
LOWER 80S.

THE REGION SHOULD STAY UNDER NORTHWEST FLOW ALOFT INTO THE WEEKEND...
AS THE BLOCKING PATTERN THAT HAS BEEN IN PLACE ACROSS THE COUNTRY
BREAKS DOWN AND ALLOWS THE UPPER LOW NOW OVER SOUTHERN MANITOBA
CANADA TO SLIDE SOUTHEAST OVER THE GREAT LAKES REGION. THE FIRST IN
A SERIES OF SHORTWAVE TROUGHS ROTATING THROUGH THE BASE OF THIS
TROUGH WILL BE RESPONSIBLE FOR SENDING THROUGH TONIGHTS COLD FRONT.
ANOTHER WEAK SHORTWAVE WILL EJECT EAST OUT OF THE LONGWAVE TROUGH
AND SEND ANOTHER WEAK COLD FRONT TOWARDS THE AREA ON FRIDAY
AFTERNOON. THINK AT THIS TIME THAT THIS FRONT WILL STALL AND
DISSIPATE NORTH OF OUR AREA. AGAIN...WITH LACK OF RETURN FLOW IN
ADVANCE OF THIS FRONT...NOT EXPECTING ANY PRECIPITATION WITH THIS
FEATURE.

THE FRONTAL BOUNDARY OF INTEREST...THAT WILL PLAY A ROLE IN THIS
WEEKENDS WEATHER IS CURRENTLY STALLED ALONG THE GULF COAST INTO
CENTRAL TEXAS. MODEL GUIDANCE HAS DIFFERED QUITE A BIT WITH THE
OVERALL HANDLING OF THIS FRONTS MOVEMENT...WITH THE 00Z NAM QUICKER
THAN THE 00Z GFS WITH RETURN NORTHWARD OF THE GULF FRONT AND
ASSOCIATED LOW LEVEL MOISTURE. GOT A QUICK LOOK AT THE 06Z NAM AND
IT IS A BIT SLOWER THAN THE 00Z RUN WITH RETURNING THE FRONT
NORTHWARD...AND THIS MAKES SENSE WITH NORTHWEST FLOW ALOFT ONLY
SLOWLY TRANSITIONING TO A MORE ZONAL FLOW THROUGH THE WEEKEND. TO
ACCOUNT FOR THE NORTHWARD RETURN OF THE FRONT...HAVE ADDED SLIGHT
POPS CENTRAL AREAS AND CHANCE POPS SOUTH. LATER SHIFTS WILL NEED TO
EVALUATE TIMING OF THE FRONT...AS MAY NEED TO SLOW THINGS DOWN AND
DOWNPLAY SATURDAY RAIN CHANCES. BUT WITH CURRENT INCONSISTENCIES
WITH THE MODELS...FEEL THAT IT IS PRUDENT TO LEAVE AS IS FOR NOW.

FOR SATURDAY NIGHT INTO SUNDAY...CURRENTLY THINK THAT AN MCS MAY
DEVELOP OVER THE SOUTHERN PLAINS STATES SATURDAY EVENING...AS LOW
LEVEL WINDS RETURN TO THE SOUTH AND LOW LEVEL JET INCREASES TO OUR
WEST. WITH FRONT ANTICIPATED TO BE IN THE VICINITY...ANY DEVELOPING
MCS SHOULD DEVELOP SOUTHEASTWARD INTO THE MOISTURE AXIS IN PLACE
OVER SOME PORTIONS OF OUR AREA. THEREFORE...HAVE INCREASED POPS
SATURDAY NIGHT AND SUNDAY TO ACCOUNT FOR THIS POSSIBILITY.
CONFIDENCE ON THIS ENTIRE SCENARIO IS LOW AT THIS TIME THOUGH...DUE
TO MODEL INCONSISTENCY.

BEYOND SUNDAY...MEDIUM RANGE MODELS DIVERGE FURTHER...SO FEEL THAT
WITH ZONAL FLOW SETTING UP OVER THE AREA AND A STALLED FRONT IN THE
VICINITY...A SERIES OF UPPER DISTURBANCES SHOULD MOVE THROUGH THE
FLOW AND TRIGGER PERIODS OF WET WEATHER THROUGH THE EXTENDED. SKILL
AT TIMING THESE PARTICULAR SYSTEMS IS FAIRLY LOW THIS FAR OUT...SO
HAVE MADE FEW CHANGES TO THE EXTENDED AND HAVE KEPT CHANCE POPS IN
PLACE THROUGH WEDNESDAY. PRECIP SPECIFICS WILL BE WORKED OUT AS WE
GET CLOSER TO THESE PERIODS. TEMPERATURES WILL REMAIN BELOW NORMAL
THROUGH THE EXTENDED PERIOD...DUE TO EXPECTED PERIODS OF UNSETTLED
WEATHER.

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.
&&

JLH

FXUS64 KMEG 260147
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
845 PM CDT WED MAY 25 2005

.UPDATE...

ANOTHER TRANQUIL NIGHT TAKING SHAPE ACROSS THE MIDSOUTH. SEVERAL 
COMPLEXES OF STORMS CURRENTLY OCCURRING OVER TEXAS WILL STAY WELL 
WEST OF THE REGION AS THE MIDSOUTH REMAINS UNDER THE INFLUENCE OF AN 
UPPER LEVEL RIDGE. ONLY A FEW THIN CIRRUS MOVING THROUGH THIS 
EVENING AND THESE WILL HAVE LITTLE AFFECT ON TEMPERATURES AND SKIES 
WILL STAY MOSTLY CLEAR.

HAVE DECIDED TO LOWER TEMPS A CATEGORY ACROSS THE BOARD. TEMP AND 
DEWPOINT COMPARISONS TO TWENTY FOUR HOURS AGO SHOW LOWER DEWPOINTS 
TONIGHT ALONG WITH TEMPS A DEGREE OR TWO COOLER. TONIGHT WILL BE A 
GOOD RADIATIONAL COOLING NIGHT WITH LIGHT WINDS AND DRY AIR ALOFT AS 
EVIDENT ON THE 00Z LZK SOUNDING. THEREFORE...TEMPS SHOULD BE SIMILAR 
TO LAST NIGHT ESPECIALLY SINCE THERE IS LESS CLOUD COVER TO CONTEND 
WITH TONIGHT. ALSO TWEAKED THE WIND GRIDS DUE TO WINDS ALREADY 
DECOUPLING.

UPDATE TO GRIDS ALREADY OUT. ZONE UPDATE OUT SHORTLY.

JFB

.PREVIOUS DISCUSSION ISSUED 244 PM WED MAY 25

QUIET WEATHER TO CONTINUE OVER THE FORECAST AREA FOR THE NEXT COUPLE
OF DAYS. SKIES REMAIN MOSTLY SUNNY OVER THE REGION WITH TEMPERATURES
IN THE UPPER 70S TO NEAR 80. FRONTAL BOUNDARY EXTENDS FROM WESTERN
MINNESOTA INTO CENTRAL KANSAS THIS AFTERNOON AND IS FORECAST TO MOVE
SLOWLY SOUTHEAST OVER THE NEXT COUPLE OF DAYS. BY THE TIME THE FRONT
MAKES IT TOWARD THE FORECAST AREA THURSDAY NIGHT AND FRIDAY...THERE
STILL WILL BE A LACK OF MOISTURE AROUND SO NOT EXPECTING ANY RAIN
THROUGH SATURDAY NIGHT. AFTER THAT MODELS NOT CLEAR ON STATUS OF ANY
FRONTAL BOUNDARIES THAT WILL BE AROUND SO HAVE LEFT MENTION OF POPS
IN FOR EXTENDED PORTION OF THE FORECAST.

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 250919
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
419 AM CDT WED MAY 25 2005

.DISCUSSION...

SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE EXTENDS FROM THE GREAT LAKES REGION SOUTHWARD
OVER THE MID-SOUTH THIS MORNING. SEASONABLY LOW DEWPOINTS HAVE
FILTERED INTO THE AREA ALONG WITH PLEASANTLY COOL TEMPERATURES.
THE SURFACE FRONT THAT MOVED ACROSS THE REGION YESTERDAY IS CURRENTLY
STRETCHED ACROSS SOUTH-CENTRAL MISSISSIPPI INTO SOUTHERN ARKANSAS
WITH CONVECTION NOTED OVER SOUTHERN MISSISSIPPI AND NORTHEAST
LOUISIANA IN ASSOCIATION WITH THE FRONT AND A WEAKENING MESOSCALE
CONVECTIVE VORTEX. THIS SYSTEM AND THE ASSOCIATED FRONT SHOULD SINK
EVEN FURTHER SOUTH TODAY AND AWAY FROM THE MID-SOUTH.

ANOTHER MCS DEVELOPED OVER THE PLAINS STATES OVERNIGHT AND CONTINUES
TO MOVE SOUTHWARD INTO TEXAS THIS MORNING. SOME HIGH CIRRUS
CONTINUES TO STREAM SOUTHEAST TOWARDS THE LOWER MISSISSIPPI VALLEY.
SOME OF THIS CIRRUS MAY STREAM ACROSS PORTIONS OF THE AREA THIS
MORNING...BUT THIS CLOUD COVER SHOULD DIMINISH LATER TODAY AS THE
CONVECTIVE COMPLEX CONTINUES TO WEAKEN. SO EXPECT MOSTLY SUNNY SKIES
OVER THE MID-SOUTH TODAY. AS FOR THIS AFTERNOONS HIGH TEMPERATURES...
THEY WILL BE INFLUENCED BY THE LOW LEVEL NORTHEASTERLY FLOW IN PLACE
OVER THE AREA. CONTINUED LOW LEVEL COLD ADVECTION...SHOULD KEEP
TEMPERATURES BETWEEN 5 AND 10 DEGREES COOLER THAN YESTERDAYS HIGHS.

THE UPPER LEVEL ANALYSIS THIS MORNING STILL SHOWING A PERSISTENT
BLOCKING PATTERN IN PLACE WITH AN UPPER LEVEL LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM
SPINNING OVER THE MID ATLANTIC STATES...A FLAT RIDGE OVER THE DESERT
SOUTHWEST...AND ANOTHER UPPER LOW SPINNING OVER CENTRAL MANITOBA
CANADA. THIS BLOCKING PATTERN IS BEGINNING TO BREAK DOWN...AND THIS
SHOULD ALLOW THE UPPER LOW OVER SOUTHERN CANADA TO DROP SOUTHEAST
OVER THE GREAT LAKES REGION THROUGH FRIDAY. AS THIS OCCURS...A
NORTHERN STREAM SHORTWAVE TROUGH ROTATING AROUND THE UPPER LOW WILL
EJECT SOUTHEAST ACROSS THE MIDWEST. THIS WILL HELP TO SEND A WEAK
COLD FRONT SOUTHEAST ACROSS OUR AREA THURSDAY AND THURSDAY NIGHT.
WITH LACK OF RETURN FLOW FROM THE GULF OF MEXICO...EXPECT LIMITED
MOISTURE IN ADVANCE OF THIS FRONT. THIS WILL ALLOW THE FRONT TO MOVE
THROUGH DRY.

AS FOR THE EXTENDED PERIOD (FRIDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...THE WEAK FRONT
FROM THURSDAY NIGHT WILL STALL TO OUR SOUTH FRIDAY NIGHT AND WASH
OUT. A DEVELOPING WARM FRONT WILL MOVE NORTH TOWARDS THE AREA BY THE
END OF THE WEEKEND. IN ADDITION...A SERIES OF UPPER LEVEL
DISTURBANCES WILL RIPPLE ACROSS THE AREA DURING THE SUNDAY THROUGH
TUESDAY TIME FRAME...AS THE UPPER LEVEL FLOW BECOMES INCREASINGLY
ZONAL. MEDIUM RANGE MODELS STILL A BIT INCONSISTENT WITH HANDLING
MOVEMENT AND EVENTUAL PLACEMENT OF THE FRONTAL BOUNDARY...AND THIS
WILL IMPACT OVERALL RAIN CHANCES THROUGH THIS PERIOD. AT THIS TIME...
PLAN TO REMAIN CONSISTENT WITH EARLIER FORECASTS AND KEEP EXTENDED
PERIOD AS IS UNTIL OVERALL PATTERN IS CLEARER...WITH FRIDAY AND
SATURDAY REMAINING DRY...AND SLIGHT CHANCE TO CHANCE POPS SUNDAY
THROUGH TUESDAY. TEMPERATURES SHOULD REMAIN NEAR OR SLIGHTLY BELOW
NORMAL THROUGH THE EXTENDED PERIOD.

&&
