000 
FXUS64 KMEG 250138
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
837 PM CDT TUE MAY 24 2005

.UPDATE...

A WELL DEFINED MESOSCALE CONVECTIVE VORTEX AND ASSOCIATED
MESOSCALE CONVECTIVE SYSTEM CURRENTLY IN PROGRESS OVER WEST
CENTRAL ARKANSAS WITH ADDITIONAL THUNDERSTORMS FURTHER SOUTH AND
WEST ALONG A STATIONARY BOUNDARY. THE MCV AND MCS SHOULD STAY JUST
TO THE WEST OF THE MEMPHIS CWA AS IT CONTINUES TO MOVE SOUTHWEST
UNDER THE INFLUENCE OF NORTHWEST FLOW ALOFT. IMPRESSIVE OUTFLOW 
FROM THE MCS HAS RESULTED IN A DENSE CIRRUS SHIELD OVER THE
MIDSOUTH. AS A RESULT...WILL HAVE TO UPDATE CLOUD COVER TO MOSTLY
CLOUDY IN MOST AREAS. THIS WILL ALSO HAVE AN AFFECT ON  
TEMPERATURES...THEREFORE WILL RAISE TEMPS UP ABOUT THREE DEGREES.
WOULD RAISE THEM MORE BUT WILL ALLOW SOME ROOM FOR COOLING LATER
TONIGHT AS THE DENSER CIRRUS MOVES FURTHER SOUTH.

REST OF THE FORECAST LOOKS ON TRACK. UPDATE TO GRIDS ALREADY SENT
AND THE ZONE FORECAST UPDATE IS FORTHCOMING.

JFB

&&

.PREV DISCUSSION... (ISSUED 203 PM CDT TUE MAY 24 2005) 

DISCUSSION...
WEAK FRONTAL BOUNDARY SOUTH OF THE CWA. DEWPOINT FIELD IS BEST
INDICATION OF WHERE THE EFFECTIVE BOUNDARY IS AT. DEWPOINTS ACROSS
THE CWA ARE GENERALLY IN THE 50S...AND RUNNING A LITTLE LOWER THAN
MOST GUIDANCE. TEMPERATURES RUNNING FROM MIDDLE 70S EXTREME
NORTHEAST TO UPPER 80S SOUTH.

COMPLEX OF THUNDERSTORMS OVER NORTHWEST ARKANSAS IS WEAKENING AS IT
MOVES INTO A MORE STABLE AIRMASS. ADDITIONAL THUNDERSTORMS DEVELOPING
OVER EXTREME SOUTHEAST ARKANSAS...BUT THOSE ARE ALREADY PAST OUR
AREA.

SHORT TERM (THROUGH FRIDAY)...
WE REMAIN IN NORTHWEST FLOW THROUGH FRIDAY. EXPECT COMPLEX TONIGHT TO
REMAIN WEST OF OUR AREA...BUT RESERVE THE RIGHT TO MAKE A LAST MINUTE
CHANGE IF SOMETHING DEVELOPS. FORECAST QUESTION WILL BE WHETHER ANY
MCS AFFECTS OUR CWA. NAM SOLUTION KEEPS THESE TO OUR WEST...WHILE GFS
TRIES TO BRING ONE ACROSS ON FRIDAY. NAM SOLUTION HAS CONTINUITY FROM
PREVIOUS RUNS FOR FRIDAY...AND BOTH MODELS ARE NOW DRY ON THURSDAY.
HAVE REMOVED MENTION FROM DAYTIME HOURS ON THURSDAY...AND WILL KEEP
FRIDAY DRY FOR NOW.

TEMPERATURES...FOR WEDNESDAY...HIGHS WILL BE NEAR TODAYS LEVELS
ACROSS THE EXTREME NORTHEAST...AND 5-7 DEGREES COOLER ACROSS THE
SOUTHWEST HALF. SHOULD SEE A DECENT REBOUND ON THURSDAY AND FRIDAY...
ALTHOUGH NOT QUITE AS WARM AS THE SOUTHWEST HALF IS TODAY. TRENDED
THURSDAY AND FRIDAY MAX TEMPS UP A COUPLE OF DEGREES. DIDNT MAKE
MANY CHANGES TO LOWS FOR TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY NIGHT...BUT DID
RAISE MINS THURSDAY NIGHT A FEW DEGREES.

LONG TERM (AFTER FRIDAY)...
NO CONSISTENT STRONG SIGNALS FOR WIDESPREAD PRECIPITATION THROUGH THE
EXTENDED FORECAST. MODELS HAVE DIFFERING SOLUTIONS...AND SINCE
SURROUNDING OFFICES AND GUIDANCE BOTH ARE ALREADY CARRYING
PRECIPITATION FROM SUNDAY ONWARD...WILL NOT MAKE ANY CHANGES TO
THAT PORTION OF THE FORECAST AT THIS TIME. TEMPERATURES NEAR TO
SLIGHTLY BELOW NORMAL FOR THE EXTENDED PERIOD.

&&

.DISCUSSION...
WEAK FRONTAL BOUNDARY APPEARS TO BE SOUTH OF THE CWA THIS MORNING.
DEWPOINT FIELD IS PROBABLY BEST INDICATION OF WHERE THE EFFECTIVE
BOUNDARY IS AT. DEWPOINTS ACROSS THE CWA THIS MORNING ARE IN THE

RUNNING FROM MIDDLE 70S TO LOWER 80S AT 15Z.

COMPLEX OF THUNDERSTORMS CONTINUES OVER SOUTHEAST KANSAS...SOUTHWEST
MISSOURI AND NORTHWEST ARKANSAS. SEEMS TO BE WEAKENING SLIGHTLY...
BUT NOT AT THE PACE THAT THE COMPLEX YESTERDAY DISSIPATED. GUIDANCE
FORECASTS DROP THIS SYSTEM TO THE SOUTH...KEEPING IT WEST OF OUR
AREA.

EXPECTING PRECIPITATION TO REMAIN TO OUR WEST TODAY. FORECAST
PROBLEM WILL BE HIGH TEMPERATURES. WE ALREADY HAVE SEVERAL SIGHTS
WITHIN 3 TO 5 DEGREES OF FORECAST HIGHS. WILD CARD WILL BE STRENGTH
OF COOL ADVECTION. CURRENT INDICATIONS ARE THAT FORECAST OVER
SOUTHERN HALF OF AREA WILL NEED BUMPED UP ONE CATEGORY. WILL LOOK
AT 16Z OBS BEFORE MAKING FINAL DECISION.

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 240932
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
432 AM CDT TUE MAY 24 2005

.DISCUSSION...
A WEAK AND BROAD FRONTAL BOUNDARY IS BISECTING THE FORECAST AREA
THIS MORNING...WITH DRIER AIR TO THE NORTH OF THE FRONT OVER
NORTHERN PORTIONS OF THE AREA AND MORE HUMID AIRMASS TO THE SOUTH.
THIS FRONT WILL CONTINUE TO SINK SOUTH THROUGH THE DAY WITH DRIER
AIRMASS AND LOWER DEWPOINTS FILTERING SOUTHWARD ACROSS THE
REMAINDER OF THE MIDSOUTH. THIS FRONT SHOULD REMAIN WEAK AND
DIFFUSE...SO NOT EXPECTING ANY PRECIPITATION WITH THIS FEATURE.

ANOTHER MCS HAS DEVELOPED OVER THE SOUTHERN PLAINS STATES AND IS
MOVING SOUTHEASTWARD TOWARDS THE LOWER MISSISSIPPI VALLEY. THIS
FEATURE IS EXPECTED TO STAY TO OUR WEST AND WEAKEN TODAY...WITH ONLY
SOME HIGH CIRRUS MOVING THROUGH MAINLY WESTERN PORTIONS OF THE AREA
THIS MORNING. CLOUD COVER SHOULD REMAIN THIN ENOUGH AND SCATTERED TO
ALLOW FOR MOSTLY SUNNY SKIES AREAWIDE. TEMPERATURES SHOULD ONLY
REACH THE LOW 80S NORTH...WHERE LOW LEVEL COLD ADVECTION BEHIND THE
FRONT KEEPS TEMPERATURES DOWN. ELSEWHERE...THE COLD ADVECTION WILL
BE WEAKER...SO EXPECT TEMPERATURES TO REACH THE MID 80S CENTRAL AND
UPPER 80S SOUTHERN SECTIONS.

THE MIDSOUTH WILL REMAIN ANCHORED BETWEEN AN UPPER LOW PRESSURE
SYSTEM SPINNING OVER THE NORTHEAST U.S. AND AN UPPER RIDGE OVER THE
DESERT SOUTHWEST. THIS MEANS NORTHWEST FLOW ALOFT WILL PERSIST OVER
THE AREA THROUGH THE END OF THE WEEK. MODELS ARE INDICATING THAT
ANOTHER MCS WILL FORM OVER THE PLAINS STATES TONIGHT AND DIVE
SOUTHEASTWARD ALONG THE EASTERN PERIPHERY OF THE UPPER RIDGE
THROUGH WEDNESDAY NIGHT/THURSDAY MORNING. THE NAM/GFS HANDLING THIS
FEATURE A BIT DIFFERENTLY...WITH THE NAM FURTHER WEST THAN GFS. AT
THIS POINT...THINK THAT WITH CURRENTLY EVOLVING UPPER PATTERN THAT
THIS MCS SHOULD REMAIN TO OUR WEST. SO HAVE KEPT POPS OUT OF THE
FORECAST THROUGH WEDNESDAY NIGHT.

AS FOR TEMPERATURES ON WEDNESDAY...HAVE TRIMMED A FEW DEGREES OFF OF
HIGH TEMPS AS LOW LEVEL COLD ADVECTION CONTINUES OVER THE AREA.
STILL HAVE REMAINED ABOVE GUIDANCE THOUGH...AS THINK MODELS ARE
OVERDOING THE COLD ADVECTION SCENARIO.

A NORTHERN STREAM SHORTWAVE TROUGH WILL MOVE TO THE NORTHEAST OF THE
MIDSOUTH ON THURSDAY...AND WILL HELP TO SEND A WEAK COLD FRONT
SOUTHEAST ACROSS THE AREA. MOISTURE IN ASSOCIATION WITH THIS FRONT
WILL REMAIN LIMITED...SO HAVE ONLY INCLUDED A 20 POP FOR SHOWERS
AND THUNDERSTORMS WITH THIS FEATURE. IF MODEL TRENDS CONTINUE
DRIER...MAY NEED TO REMOVE POPS ALL TOGETHER IN LATER FORECASTS.

THIS FRONT WILL STALL ON FRIDAY SOUTH OF THE AREA AS THE UPPER FLOW
BECOMES MORE ZONAL....THEN START TO SLOWLY LIFT BACK TO THE NORTH
AS A WARM FRONT TOWARDS THE END OF THE WEEKEND. AT THE SAME TIME...A
SERIES OF WEAK UPPER LEVEL DISTURBANCES WILL MOVE THROUGH THE ZONAL
FLOW ALOFT...SO HAVE INCLUDED SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR SUNDAY AND
MONDAY TO ACCOUNT FOR THESE FEATURES. TEMPERATURES WILL SLOWLY WARM
UP AGAIN FOR THE END OF THE WEEKEND AND FIRST PART OF NEXT WEEK.

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...

.SHORT TERM (THROUGH THURSDAY)...
FLOW REMAINS NORTHWESTERLY THROUGH THE SHORT TERM FORECAST PERIOD.
CURRENT UPPER LOW OVER NE U.S. EXPECTED TO REMAIN NEARLY IN PLACE
THROUGH THURSDAY. SECOND UPPER LOW OVER CANADIAN ROCKIES/PRAIRIES
ISNT EXPECTED TO MOVE MUCH EITHER. THIS SYSTEM MAY EJECT A COUPLE
OF IMPULSES OVER THE NORTHERN MEXICO RIDGE OVER THE NEXT COUPLE OF
DAYS. BEST AREAS FOR MCS DEVELOPMENT WILL BE WELL TO OUR NORTH IN
THE GREAT LAKES...AND WELL TO OUR WEST OVER OK AND KS. IF ANYTHING
DEVELOPS OVER OK-KS...IT SHOULD TRACK OVER THE SW HALF OF ARKANSAS...
KEEPING OUR AREA DRY.

IF THERE IS TO BE A DAY WITH PRECIPITATION...IT WOULD LIKELY BE
THURSDAY...WITH THE STRONGEST IMPULSE PASSING TO OUR NORTHEAST.
MODELS SHOW THE SHORTWAVE RIDGE BETWEEN THE TWO UPPER LOWS BREAKING
DOWN. SEE NO REASON TO MAKE A MAJOR CHANGE TO THE GOING FORECAST OF
20 POPS FOR WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND THURSDAY.

TEMPERATURES...BOUNDARY LAYER TEMPERATURES WOULD INDICATE THAT MOST
AREAS SHOULD BE 3-5 DEGREES COOLER TOMORROW THAN TODAY...AND
WEDNESDAY WILL BE 3-5 DEGREES COOLER THAN TOMORROW. THIS WOULD PUT
MOST HIGHS IN THE LOWER TO MIDDLE 80S TOMORROW AND WITHIN A COUPLE
OF DEGREES OF 80 ON WEDNESDAY. THURSDAY SHOULD SEE TEMPERATURES
MODERATE A FEW DEGREES...EVEN WITH CLOUDS.
&&

.LONG TERM (AFTER THURSDAY)...
FLOW REMAINS NORTHWESTERLY THROUGH MONDAY. MAIN TRACK FOR CONVECTIVE
COMPLEXES APPEARS TO REMAIN WEST OF US THROUGH AT LEAST SUNDAY.
GFS/NAM/HPC GUIDANCE ALL INDICATE CHANCES FOR PRECIPITATION ON MONDAY
AS UPPER RIDGE SLOWLY RETROGRADES OFF THE WEST COAST. WILL INTRODUCE
CHANCE OF PRECIPITATION FOR DAY 7...BUT CONFIDENCE NOT VERY HIGH AT
THIS TIME.

VERY LITTLE WARM OR COLD ADVECTION GOING ON DURING THE EXTENDED
PERIOD...THEREFORE LITTLE CHANGE IN TEMPERATURES IN FORECAST.
READINGS PRETTY CLOSE TO NORMAL FOR FRIDAY THROUGH THE MEMORIAL DAY
HOLIDAY.

1019 AM CDT MON MAY 23 2005

.DISCUSSION...
REMNANTS OF DYING MCS MOVING ACROSS OUR CWA AT 15Z. NO SIGNIFICANT
LIGHTNING TO SPEAK OF ACROSS THE AREA. CURRENT TEMPERATURES IN THE
70S ACROSS THE ENTIRE AREA...WITH SOME VERY LIGHT RAIN ACROSS
SOUTHWEST HALF OF AREA.

EFFECTIVE BOUNDARY SHOULD END UP JUST TO THE SOUTH OF OUR AREA BY
THIS AFTERNOON. CANNOT RULE OUT REDEVELOPMENT ACROSS SOUTHWEST HALF
OF AREA...SO WILL LEAVE CURRENT POPS IN FORECAST. WET MICROBURST
POTENTIAL ACROSS ARKANSAS WITH SOME SUNSHINE...BUT THREAT SHOULD BE
MAINLY TO WEST AND SOUTH OF OUR CWA...WITH LZK CAPE AROUND 3500...
AND LI OF -9...ASSUMING A HIGH TEMPERATURE AROUND 90.

CLOUDS MAY HAVE SOME AFFECT ON HIGH TEMPERATURES THIS AFTERNOON.
EXPECT SOME DISSIPATION OF CLOUDS...WHICH SHOULD ALLOW US TO GET AT
LEAST TO FORECAST HIGHS IN MIDDLE 80S. IF CLOUDS DISSIPATE BEFORE
ABOUT 18Z...OUR FORECAST MAY NEED TO BE RAISED.

WILL NEED TO DO A MINOR UPDATE FOR WORDING BY 17Z...BUT NO MAJOR
CHANGES TO GOING FORECAST.
&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.
&&

$$

WAGNER





000 
FXUS64 KMEG 230827
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
327 AM CDT MON MAY 23 2005

.DISCUSSION...
LARGE MCS OVER NE OK/SW MO AND NW AR WL BE THE MAIN FACTOR FOR 
TODAYS WEATHER ACRS MUCH OF THE MID SOUTH. THE SYSTEM WL TRACK SE 
ACRS AR INTO THE SWRN SXNS OF THE CWFA THIS MORNING AS IT MOVES 
ALONG THE NOSE OF THE SHIFTING 850 MB LOW LEVEL JET. GOOD MOISTURE 
TRANSPORT INTO THIS AREA WITH PRECIP H20 VALUES AROUND 2 INCHES. 
THIS MCS WL BE IN ITS WEAKENING STAGE AS IT MOVES THROUGH THE SW 
SXNS OF OUR AREA...BASICALLY SW OF MEM. HOWEVER WITH DEEP MOISTURE 
IN PLACE AND MARGINAL INSTABILITY...LIFTED INDICES OF -2C TO 
-4C...SOME HEAVY RAINFALL MAY BE POSSIBLE SW OF MEM...ESPECIALLY IN 
THE CLARKSDALE REGION. 

WEAK SFC FRONT WL START NOSING SOUTH INTO NRN SXNS BY 00Z. DUE TO 
THE SLOWER MOVEMENT OF THE FRONT WL EXPAND PRECIP CHANCES NORTH A 
LITTLE INTO JBR AND JUST SOUTH OF MKL TODAY. TEMPS WL BE DIFFICULT 
TODAY. LIKELY TO BE WARMER FROM MKL TOWARD THE NE WHERE MORE SUN IS 
POSSIBLE. COOLER UNDER MCS BUT IF THE SUN BREAKS OUT RECOVERY WILL 
TAKE A VERY SHORT TIME. MID 80S SEEMS LIKE A GOOD COMPROMISE.

WITH FRONT HUNG UP A LITTLE WL KEEP A SMALL POP ACRS SW SXNS IN THE 
EVENING OTRW DRY TONIGHT. WEAK HIGH PRESSURE SETTLES IN TUE 
THROUGH WED AS THE FRONT WL REMAIN STNRY JUST WEST AND SOUTH OF THE 
AREA TUE AND WED. ANY TSTM ACTIVITY SHOULD REMAIN SW OF THE REGION. 

NEXT SYSTEM DROPS OUT OF THE CNTRL PLAINS ON THU. EXPECT ANOTHER 
WEAK FRONT TO SWING THROUGH THU/THU NIGHT. THE WEAKENING FRONT LOOKS 
STARVED FOR MOISTURE AND ONLY SMALL POPS ARE NEEDED.

FRI THROUGH THE WEEKEND...TROF SETTLES IN ACRS THE ERN U.S. WITH DRY 
AND COOLER NW FLOW ACRS THE MID SOUTH. 00Z SHOWS CONSISTENCY WITH 
KEEPING PRECIP SUPPRESSED ACRS TX AND THE LOWER MS VALLEY THROUGH 
THE WEEKEND. WL PULL THE SMALL POPS AND GO FOR A DRY WEEKEND. 

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.

SJM

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 230127
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
827 PM CDT SUN MAY 22 2005

.DISCUSSION...LATEST SURFACE ANALYSIS PLACES COLD FRONT STILL 
ROUGHLY ALONG I-44 FROM SAINT LOUIS TO TULSA THIS EVENING. MCS LOCATED ACROSS 
CENTRAL ARKANSAS CONTINUES TO MOVE SOUTHEAST BUT INFRARED IMAGERY 
OVER THE PAST COUPLE OF HOURS HAS INDICATED WARMING CLOUD 
TOPS...INDICATIVE OF DECAYING CONVECTIVE SYSTEM. CURRENT TRENDS 
SUGGEST ANY CONVECTION WILL BE ISOLATED AT BEST ACROSS THE MID SOUTH 
WITH BEST CHANCES ACROSS SOUTHWEST ONE THIRD OF AREA. AS A 
RESULT...WILL LOWER POPS TO SLIGHT CHANCE WITH MOST AREAS REMAINING 
DRY OVERNIGHT. ANY ISOLATED THUNDERSTORMS THAT DO DEVELOP SHOULD 
REMAIN BELOW SEVERE LIMITS. SPC DAY1 OUTLOOK AGREES WITH CURRENT 
THINKING FOR OVERNIGHT.

UPDATED GRIDS WILL BE OUT SHORTLY.

CJC

.PREV DISCUSSION...ISSUED 224 PM CDT SUN MAY 22 2005

A CUT OFF LOW IS IN PLACE OVER THE NORTHEASTERN U.S. WHILE A SECOND 
LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM IS OVER LAKE SUPERIOR. AN UPPER RIDGE IS 
ORIENTED OVER THE MOUNTAIN WEST AND CENTERED OVER THE LOWER ROCKIES. 
A COLD FRONT EXTENDS FROM NEAR ST LOUIS TO NEAR TULSA AND INTO THE 
TEXAS PANHANDLE WHERE THERE IS ANOTHER LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM. THE 
REMNANTS OF THE MCS FROM EARLY THIS MORNING HAVE DISSIPATED AS 
EXPECTED. TEMPERATURES HAVE YET TO WARM OVER MUCH OF NORTHWEST 
TENNESSEE WHERE A WAKE LOW FROM THIS MCS STILL PERSIST. ELSEWHERE 
TEMPS HAVE RISEN INTO THE UPPER 80S. A BANK OF LOW CLOUDS IS PRESENT 
ALONG THE FRONT IN MISSOURI AND CONVECTION HAS BLOSSOMED OVER 
NORTHWEST ARKANSAS WHERE MID LEVEL LAPSE RATES ARE MUCH 
BETTER...AROUND 7.5 C/KM AND THERE IS A PILING UP OF MASS IN THAT 
AREA DUE TO THE WINDS FROM THE  LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM IN THE TEXAS 
PANHANDLE TOGETHER WITH THE COLD FRONT.

THE COLD FRONT SHOULD MOVE INTO AND THROUGH MUCH OF THE AREA 
TONIGHT. HOWEVER...THERE REALLY IS NOT A WHOLE LOT OF FORCING 
PRESENT OR UPPER LEVEL SUPPORT TO JUSTIFY MUCH MORE THAN ISOLATED 
CONVECTION ALONG THE FRONT. IT APPEARS THAT THE BEST CHANCES FOR 
RAIN ARE DUE TO CONVECTION THAT WILL FIRE OVER NORTHEAST ARKANSAS 
AND MOVE SOUTHEASTWARD IN THE STEERING FLOW. GFS/ETA BOTH AGREE WITH 
THIS SCENARIO AND BETTER CHANCES WOULD BE SOUTH OF A LINE FROM 
JONESBORO TO MEMPHIS TO TUPELO. EVEN THOUGH SPC CONTINUES TO HAVE 
PORTIONS OF THE REGION OUTLOOKED FOR SLIGHT RISK...FEEL THAT THE 
THREAT IS REALLY MINIMAL WITH MARGINALLY SEVERE SIZE HAIL BEING THE 
ONLY CONCEIVABLE THREAT SINCE THE BEST INSTABILITY AND UPPER SUPPORT 
IS OVER TOWARDS THE ARKANSAS/OKLAHOMA BORDER. 

GFS/ETA INDICATE THAT THE CHANCES FOR SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS WILL 
CONTINUE THROUGH THE DAY TOMORROW ACROSS SOUTHEAST ARKANSAS AND 
NORTH MISSISSIPPI AS THE FRONT SLOWLY SAGS SOUTHWARD AND CONVECTION 
FROM NORTHEAST ARKANSAS RUNS ALONG THE FRONT. HIGH TEMPS FROM 
MEMPHIS SOUTHWARD WILL LIKELY BE HINDERED SOMEWHAT DUE TO CLOUD 
COVER TOMORROW.

DRY WEATHER THEN SETS UP UNTIL MIDWEEK AS THE TWO LOW PRESSURE 
SYSTEMS MERGE OVER THE NORTHEASTERN U.S. AND FORM ONE RATHER LARGE 
CUT OFF LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM WITH MULTIPLE VORT MAXS REVOLVING AROUND 
IT. TEMPS FOR NEXT WEEK ARE GOING TO BE HIGHLY DEPENDENT ON THE 
POSITION OF THIS CUT OFF LOW. IF THE CUT OFF LOW IS POSITIONED WHERE 
THE GFS HAS BEEN ADVERTISING IT...THEN TEMPS SHOULD BE RATHER 
PLEASANT WITH HIGHS IN THE UPPER 70S TO LOW 80S. HOWEVER...IF THIS 
SYSTEM IS EVEN SLIGHTLY EAST THAN THE GFS IS SHOWING THAN HIGHS 
COULD BE IN THE MID 80S TO NEAR 90 AS THE FWC NUMBERS ARE HINTING 
AT. FOR NOW WILL CONTINUE WITH WHAT CURRENT FORECAST SINCE THERE IS 
REALLY NO STRONG EVIDENCE TO SWAY FROM IT AT THIS POINT. 

LATER IN THE WEEK AND OVER THE WEEKEND...THE FORECAST BECOMES VERY 
COMPLICATED. GFS/EUROPEAN SHOW ANOTHER LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM THAT WILL 
BE MOVING ALONG THE TOP OF THE RIDGE. THE MODELS TRY TO ERODE THE 
EASTERN PERIPHERY OF THE RIDGE. THIS WOULD FORCE THE REGION INTO 
NORTHWEST FLOW WITH SEVERAL SMALL IMPULSES MOVING ALONG THE FLOW. 
ALL OF THESE IMPULSES ARE CAPABLE OF PRODUCING RAIN AND TIMING THESE 
SYSTEMS AND DISTINGUISHING REAL SHORTWAVE FROM MODEL NOISE IS NEARLY 
IMPOSSIBLE AT THIS POINT. UNFORTUNATELY HAVE TO BROAD BRUSH THE 
EXTENDED WITH LOW CHANCE POPS UNTIL THE MODELS CAN GET A BETTER 
HANDLE ON THE PATTERN FOR END WEEK.

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.

&&

$$

VALLE

FXUS64 KMEG 221436
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
936 AM CDT SUN MAY 22 2005

.DISCUSSION...

MCS THAT HAD ENTERED NORTHWEST TENNESSEE AND NORTHEAST ARKANSAS IS 
IN THE DISSIPATING STAGES AS INDICATED BY SATELLITE AND RADAR 
TRENDS. SKIES OVER WEST TENNESSEE...NORTHEAST ARKANSAS AND THE 
BOOTHEEL WILL LIKELY REMAIN CLOUDY THROUGH THE REMAINDER OF THE 
MORNING BUT SHOULD BECOME PARTLY SUNNY EARLY THIS AFTERNOON RAPIDLY 
AS THE MCS FINISHES ITS DECAY. NOT SURE WHAT TO DO WITH TEMPS FOR 
THIS AFTERNOON. SURELY THE MCS HAS HAD SOME IMPACT ON TEMPS FOR 
TODAY...BUT ONCE THE SUN BREAKS OUT IT COULD WARM UP VERY QUICKLY. 
CONSIDERING THAT LOCATIONS OVER NORTH MISSISSIPPI AND SOUTHWEST TN 
ARE NOT GOING TO GET MUCH IF ANY RAIN FROM THIS MCS AND SO TEMPS AS 
OF 14Z ARE IN THE MID 70S...THINK A RISE OF 15 DEGREES THIS 
AFTERNOON IS CERTAINLY POSSIBLE. THIS WOULD PUT HIGHS IN THESE 
LOCATIONS IN THE UPPER 80S TO NEAR 90. FURTHER NORTH ACROSS THE 
BOOTHEEL...NORTHWEST TENNESSEE AND NORTHEAST ARKANSAS WHERE TEMPS 
ARE IN THE MID 60S...LOWER TO MID 80S SEEMS MORE REALISTIC. WILL 
MONITOR TEMPS AT 15Z...BUT MAY LEAVE TEMPS ALONE FOR NOW OR RISE 
THEM TO NEAR 90 AROUND TUPELO WHERE CLOUD COVER HASNT BEEN AS THICK. 
RAIN CHANCES FOR THIS AFTERNOON STILL LOOK PRETTY MEAGER WITH THE 
FRONT NOT ARRIVING UNTIL TONIGHT AND THE MCS LIKELY FURTHER 
SUPPRESSING THE INSTABILITY POTENTIAL THAT WAS ALREADY RATHER 
MARGINAL.

FXUS64 KMEG 220956
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
455 AM CDT SUN MAY 22 2005

.UPDATE...
MO MCS JUST WL NOT QUIT THIS MORNING. CONSIDERING THE CURRENT 
SAT/RADAR TRENDS TODAYS FORECAST MAY BE GOING DOWN THE TUBES. UNLESS 
THIS MCS STARTS TO REALLY FALL APART...WHICH THE MODELS INDICATE 
SHOULD HAPPEN...THEN POPS WL NEED TO BE INCREASED ACRS MUCH OF THE 
AREA. PROBABLY SHOULD NOT PUT MUCH STOCK INTO THE MODELS AT THIS 
POINT SINCE THEY HAVE TOTALLY MISSED THIS EVENT. FOR NOW HAVE 
INCREASED POPS ACRS NRN HALF THIS MORNING WITH HIGHEST VALUES ACRS 
NE AR/MO BOOTHEEL. WL CONT TO MONITOR. GRIDS UPDATED. 

.DISCUSSION...
WEAKENING MCS THAT DEVELOPED AHEAD OF A COLD FRONT MOVING INTO NRN 
MO EARLIER NOW MOVING INTO SRN MO EARLY THIS MORNING. DENSE CIRRUS 
SHIELD BEGINNING TO MOVE INTO NORTHERN SXNS OF THE CWFA. 
ELSW...MOSTLY CLEAR SKIES ARE THE RULE. WL ADD A SMALL POP ACRS NRN 
SXNS ALONG WITH MOSTLY CLOUDY SKIES THIS MORNING TO ACCOUNT FOR THE 
WEAKENING MCS. 

WEAKENING COLD FRONT MOVING INTO SRN MO THIS AFTN WHILE LEFTOVER 
CONVECTIVE BOUNDARIES FROM ACTIVITY ACRS MO WL LIKELY MOVE SOUTH 
INTO THE CWFA. UPPER SUPPORT REMAINS WELL TO THE NE WITH EVEN SOME 
RIDGING AT 500 MB ACRS THE MID SOUTH. BEST INSTABILITY REMAINS TO 
THE WEST ACRS ERN OK/WRN AR WHILE LIFTED INDICES RANGE FROM -2C TO 
-4C ACRS THE CWFA. CAPES FORECAST TO RANGE FROM 1500-2500 J/KG FROM 
EAST TO WEST ACRS THE AREA. WITH WEAK UPPER RIDGING ACRS THE AREA 
LAPSE RATES WL BE ONLY MARGINAL. BEST CHANCES FOR PRECIP THIS AFTN 
ACRS NRN HALF OF THE CWFA. SEVERE CHANCES WL BE VERY MARGINAL. SOME 
STORMS MAY BE STRONG WITH SOME SMALL HAIL AND GUSTY WINDS. WESTERLY 
FLOW AND VERY WARM 850 MB TEMPS WL LEAD TO A WARM DAY...90 DEGREES 
AT MEM. CLOUDS MAY FACTOR IN AND PREVENT AN EVEN WARMER DAY.

COLD FRONT WL MOVE SOUTH THROUGH THE CWFA TONIGHT WITH A CHANCE OF 
THUNDERSTORMS ACRS THE AREA. PARAMETERS FOR SEVERE WEATHER CONT TO 
BE UNIMPRESSIVE. INSTABILITY...SHEAR AND TRIGGERS ARE ALL MARGINAL. 

BY 12Z MON THE FRONT WL BE LOCATED ACRS NRN MS AND WL CONT SMALL 
POPS THERE. BY MON AFTN FRONT SHOULD BE LOCATED TO THE SOUTH WITH 
DRY AIR WORKING INTO NRN SXNS OF THE CWFA. HIGH PRESSURE BUILD INTO 
THE REGION FOR MON NIGHT INTO THE MIDDLE OF THE WEEK.

00Z GFS INDICATING NEXT SYSTEM MOVING THROUGH WITH A WEAK FRONT 
WED NIGHT AND THU. END OF THE WEEK STARTING TO UNFOLD A LITTLE 
DIFFERENTLY THAN EXPECTED. ERN U.S. TROF MAY BE A LITTLE DEEPER 
ACCORDING TO THE 00Z GFS AND 12Z ECMWF AND AS A RESULT THE REGION 
MAY BE DRIER AND COOLER. WL LEAVE THE SMALL POPS IN FOR NOW FROM FRI 
INTO SAT AND LET THE MODELS ESTABLISH SOME CONSISTENCY.

&&

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 220118
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
817 PM CDT SAT MAY 21 2005

.DISCUSSION...LATEST SURFACE ANALYSIS PLACES STATIONARY FRONT ALONG 
GULF COAST AND A WARM FRONT ACROSS EASTERN OKLAHOMA/WESTERN 
ARKANSAS. VISIBLE/INFRARED SATELLITE IMAGERY SHOWS SOME 20-25KFT 
CIRRUS FROM UPSTREAM CONVECTION TRYING TO WORK ITS WAY SOUTH ACROSS 
THE LOWER MISSISSIPPI VALLEY. ISSUED AN UPDATE TO TWEAK CLOUD COVER 
AND WINDS WITH CIRRUS DEBRIS AFFECTING PART OF THE FORECAST AREA 
OVERNIGHT AND WINDS HAVE ALREADY DECOUPLED ACROSS MUCH OF THE AREA.

UPDATED FORECAST GRIDS ALREADY OUT.

CJC


.PREV DISCUSSION...ISSUED 202 PM CDT SAT MAY 21 2005...

MAIN UPPER LEVEL FEATURES INVOLVE A RIDGE CENTERED OVER THE SOUTHERN 
ROCKIES AND A LOW OVER THE NORTHEASTERN U.S. AT THE SURFACE...HIGH 
PRESSURE EXTENDING FROM TEXARKANA THROUGH THE MISSOURI BOOTHEEL AND 
UP INTO MICHIGAN IS PROVIDING THE MIDSOUTH WITH DRY WEATHER TODAY. A 
FEW CU HAVE DEVELOPED OVER THE REGION THIS AFTERNOON DUE TO SOMEWHAT 
MOIST LOW LEVELS STILL. TEMPS HAVE BEHAVED AS FORECASTED FOR THE 
MOST PART. THE AIRPORT READING IS A BIT HIGHER THAN SURROUNDING 
OBS...PERHAPS ITS A LITTLE DRIER THERE. A LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM IS 
MOVING ALONG THE TOP OF THE RIDGE ROUGHLY ALONG THE CANADIAN/NORTH 
DAKOTA BORDER. THERE IS A COLD FRONT THAT EXTENDS SOUTHWARD INTO THE 
CENTRAL PLAINS FROM THIS LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM.

THE HIGH PRESSURE AREA WILL MOVE THROUGH THE AREA TONIGHT RESULTING 
IN LIGHT WINDS AND MAINLY CLEAR SKIES. MODELS INDICATE SOME HIGH 
LEVEL DEBRIS MOVING IN OVERNIGHT FROM POSSIBLE CONVECTION OVER THE 
NORTHERN PLAINS...BUT WILL ALLOW EVENING SHIFT TO TAKE A LOOK AT IT 
AND UPDATE TO PARTLY CLOUDY IF WARRANTED. 

ON SUNDAY...HIGH PRESSURE MOVES OFF TO THE EAST BRINGING 
SOUTHWESTERLY FLOW BACK INTO THE REGION. THE AREA IS OUTLOOKED BY 
SPC FOR A SLIGHT RISK FOR SEVERE THUNDERSTORMS TOMORROW. THIS FOCUS 
IS MAINLY WEST OF THE MIDSOUTH WHERE THE FRONT MAY IGNITE SOME 
THUNDERSTORMS IN THE LATE MORNING AND EARLY AFTERNOON OVER SOUTHEAST 
KANSAS AND SOUTHWEST MISSOURI. THE AIR MASS OUT THERE IS VERY 
UNSTABLE WITH LIS AROUND -6 AND CAPE AROUND 3500 J/KG. THE MID LEVEL 
LAPSE RATES OUT THERE ARE FAVORABLE FOR SEVERE WEATHER AS 
WELL...GREATER THAN 7 C/KM. THE ENVIRONMENT OVER OUR AREA IS NOT AS 
GOOD...LIS AROUND -4 WITH CAPE 2000-2500 J/KG AND MID LEVEL LAPSE 
RATES 6 TO 6.5 C/KM WHICH IS LESS FAVORABLE. IF THUNDERSTORMS FIRE 
IN SOUTHERN MISSOURI TOMORROW AFTERNOON...THEY SHOULD OUTRUN THE 
FRONT SINCE THE STEERING FLOW IS OUT OF THE NORTHWEST. IF THEY 
SHOULD HAPPEN TO MAKE IT INTO EASTERN ARKANSAS AND POINTS 
WESTWARD....WOULD EXPECT THEM TO AT LEAST BE NOT AS STRONG AS THEY 
WERE. ANY SEVERE POTENTIAL HERE IS MORE LIKELY TO BE MORE OF A 
MARGINAL HAIL THREAT WITH SOME GUSTY WINDS. WITH THE WINDS TURNING 
SOUTHWESTERLY TOMORROW...TEMPS SHOULD WARM INTO THE MID 80S TO 
AROUND 90...WITH SOME AREAS FROM MEMPHIS SOUTHWARD POSSIBLY GETTING 
INTO THE LOWER 90S DEPENDING UPON AMOUNT OF CLOUD COVER TOMORROW. 
CONTINUING WITH LOW POPS TOMORROW SINCE THE BETTER FORCING IS WELL 
NORTHEAST OF US AND THE BEST INSTABILITY IS WEST OF US. THE FRONT 
WILL MOVE THROUGH THE REGION TOMORROW NIGHT WITH CONTINUED RAIN 
CHANCES ACROSS THE REGION. 

THE FRONT SHOULD BE MAINLY SOUTH OF THE REGION BY MONDAY MORNING. 
GFS IS BEGINNING TO SUGGEST MORE AND MORE THAT THE AIR BEHIND THIS 
FRONT IS NOT AS COOL AS EXPECTED WITH OUR REGION BEING MORE 
INFLUENCED BY THE RIDGE THAN EXPECTED. AS A RESULT...HAVE ONLY 
LOWERED TEMPS FROM SUNDAY A FEW DEGREES. IT WILL BE VERY INTERESTING 
TO SEE HOW THE UPPER AIR PATTERN UNFOLDS FOR NEXT WEEK. LAST NIGHTS 
RUN OF THE GFS SHOWED ONE OF THE VORT MAXS WITH THE NORTHEAST UPPER 
LOW RETROGRADING BACK TOWARDS THE NORTHWEST INTO CENTRAL CANADA. IF 
THAT SOLUTION WOULD VERIFY THAN NEXT WEEKS FORECAST TEMPS MAY BE TOO 
COOL. TODAYS SOLUTION OF THE GFS MORE OR LESS AGREES WITH PREVIOUS 
RUNS AND WITH THIS MORNINGS RUN OF THE ETA WITH THAT PARTICULAR VORT 
STAYING WITH THE WHOLE NORTHEASTERN US SYSTEM AND MAKING A SWING 
SOUTHWARD. AS A RESULT...THE COOLER AIR SHOULD BEGIN TO FILTER INTO 
THE REGION ON TUESDAY AND LINGER THROUGH A GOOD PART OF THE WEEK. 
STILL MUCH UNCERTAINTY IN THE FORECAST FROM MID WEEK ONWARDS. THE 
FORECAST WILL BE DEPENDENT UPON HOW FAR SOUTH THE UPPER CUT OFF LOW 
MEANDERS. THIS MORNINGS SOLUTION SHOWS THE MIDSOUTH ON THE WESTERN 
PERIPHERY WHICH WOULD KEEP THE REGION DRY TILL LATE WEEK. 
HOWEVER...IF IT DOES NOT MOVE QUITE THAT FAR SOUTH...THAN NORTHWEST 
FLOW BETWEEN THAT LOW AND THE RIDGE WILL SET UP OVER THE REGION. IN 
THIS CASE...RAIN CHANCES WILL BE DEPENDENT UPON THE WEAK IMPULSES 
MOVING ALONG IN THE FLOW. 

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.

&&

$$

VALLE







000 
FXUS64 KMEG 211903
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
202 PM CDT SAT MAY 21 2005

.DISCUSSION...
MAIN UPPER LEVEL FEATURES INVOLVE A RIDGE CENTERED OVER THE SOUTHERN 
ROCKIES AND A LOW OVER THE NORTHEASTERN U.S. AT THE SURFACE...HIGH 
PRESSURE EXTENDING FROM TEXARKANA THROUGH THE MISSOURI BOOTHEEL AND 
UP INTO MICHIGAN IS PROVIDING THE MIDSOUTH WITH DRY WEATHER TODAY. A 
FEW CU HAVE DEVELOPED OVER THE REGION THIS AFTERNOON DUE TO SOMEWHAT 
MOIST LOW LEVELS STILL. TEMPS HAVE BEHAVED AS FORECASTED FOR THE 
MOST PART. THE AIRPORT READING IS A BIT HIGHER THAN SURROUNDING 
OBS...PERHAPS ITS A LITTLE DRIER THERE. A LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM IS 
MOVING ALONG THE TOP OF THE RIDGE ROUGHLY ALONG THE CANADIAN/NORTH 
DAKOTA BORDER. THERE IS A COLD FRONT THAT EXTENDS SOUTHWARD INTO THE 
CENTRAL PLAINS FROM THIS LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM.

THE HIGH PRESSURE AREA WILL MOVE THROUGH THE AREA TONIGHT RESULTING 
IN LIGHT WINDS AND MAINLY CLEAR SKIES. MODELS INDICATE SOME HIGH 
LEVEL DEBRIS MOVING IN OVERNIGHT FROM POSSIBLE CONVECTION OVER THE 
NORTHERN PLAINS...BUT WILL ALLOW EVENING SHIFT TO TAKE A LOOK AT IT 
AND UPDATE TO PARTLY CLOUDY IF WARRANTED. 

ON SUNDAY...HIGH PRESSURE MOVES OFF TO THE EAST BRINGING 
SOUTHWESTERLY FLOW BACK INTO THE REGION. THE AREA IS OUTLOOKED BY 
SPC FOR A SLIGHT RISK FOR SEVERE THUNDERSTORMS TOMORROW. THIS FOCUS 
IS MAINLY WEST OF THE MIDSOUTH WHERE THE FRONT MAY IGNITE SOME 
THUNDERSTORMS IN THE LATE MORNING AND EARLY AFTERNOON OVER SOUTHEAST 
KANSAS AND SOUTHWEST MISSOURI. THE AIR MASS OUT THERE IS VERY 
UNSTABLE WITH LIS AROUND -6 AND CAPE AROUND 3500 J/KG. THE MID LEVEL 
LAPSE RATES OUT THERE ARE FAVORABLE FOR SEVERE WEATHER AS 
WELL...GREATER THAN 7 C/KM. THE ENVIRONMENT OVER OUR AREA IS NOT AS 
GOOD...LIS AROUND -4 WITH CAPE 2000-2500 J/KG AND MID LEVEL LAPSE 
RATES 6 TO 6.5 C/KM WHICH IS LESS FAVORABLE. IF THUNDERSTORMS FIRE 
IN SOUTHERN MISSOURI TOMORROW AFTERNOON...THEY SHOULD OUTRUN THE 
FRONT SINCE THE STEERING FLOW IS OUT OF THE NORTHWEST. IF THEY 
SHOULD HAPPEN TO MAKE IT INTO EASTERN ARKANSAS AND POINTS 
WESTWARD....WOULD EXPECT THEM TO AT LEAST BE NOT AS STRONG AS THEY 
WERE. ANY SEVERE POTENTIAL HERE IS MORE LIKELY TO BE MORE OF A 
MARGINAL HAIL THREAT WITH SOME GUSTY WINDS. WITH THE WINDS TURNING 
SOUTHWESTERLY TOMORROW...TEMPS SHOULD WARM INTO THE MID 80S TO 
AROUND 90...WITH SOME AREAS FROM MEMPHIS SOUTHWARD POSSIBLY GETTING 
INTO THE LOWER 90S DEPENDING UPON AMOUNT OF CLOUD COVER TOMORROW. 
CONTINUING WITH LOW POPS TOMORROW SINCE THE BETTER FORCING IS WELL 
NORTHEAST OF US AND THE BEST INSTABILITY IS WEST OF US. THE FRONT 
WILL MOVE THROUGH THE REGION TOMORROW NIGHT WITH CONTINUED RAIN 
CHANCES ACROSS THE REGION. 

THE FRONT SHOULD BE MAINLY SOUTH OF THE REGION BY MONDAY MORNING. 
GFS IS BEGINNING TO SUGGEST MORE AND MORE THAT THE AIR BEHIND THIS 
FRONT IS NOT AS COOL AS EXPECTED WITH OUR REGION BEING MORE 
INFLUENCED BY THE RIDGE THAN EXPECTED. AS A RESULT...HAVE ONLY 
LOWERED TEMPS FROM SUNDAY A FEW DEGREES. IT WILL BE VERY INTERESTING 
TO SEE HOW THE UPPER AIR PATTERN UNFOLDS FOR NEXT WEEK. LAST NIGHTS 
RUN OF THE GFS SHOWED ONE OF THE VORT MAXS WITH THE NORTHEAST UPPER 
LOW RETROGRADING BACK TOWARDS THE NORTHWEST INTO CENTRAL CANADA. IF 
THAT SOLUTION WOULD VERIFY THAN NEXT WEEKS FORECAST TEMPS MAY BE TOO 
COOL. TODAYS SOLUTION OF THE GFS MORE OR LESS AGREES WITH PREVIOUS 
RUNS AND WITH THIS MORNINGS RUN OF THE ETA WITH THAT PARTICULAR VORT 
STAYING WITH THE WHOLE NORTHEASTERN US SYSTEM AND MAKING A SWING 
SOUTHWARD. AS A RESULT...THE COOLER AIR SHOULD BEGIN TO FILTER INTO 
THE REGION ON TUESDAY AND LINGER THROUGH A GOOD PART OF THE WEEK. 
STILL MUCH UNCERTAINTY IN THE FORECAST FROM MID WEEK ONWARDS. THE 
FORECAST WILL BE DEPENDENT UPON HOW FAR SOUTH THE UPPER CUT OFF LOW 
MEANDERS. THIS MORNINGS SOLUTION SHOWS THE MIDSOUTH ON THE WESTERN 
PERIPHERY WHICH WOULD KEEP THE REGION DRY TILL LATE WEEK. 
HOWEVER...IF IT DOES NOT MOVE QUITE THAT FAR SOUTH...THAN NORTHWEST 
FLOW BETWEEN THAT LOW AND THE RIDGE WILL SET UP OVER THE REGION. IN 
THIS CASE...RAIN CHANCES WILL BE DEPENDENT UPON THE WEAK IMPULSES 
MOVING ALONG IN THE FLOW. 

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.

FXUS64 KMEG 210717
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
217 AM CDT SAT MAY 21 2005

.DISCUSSION...
HIGH PRESSURE EXTENDS FROM THE GREAT LAKES INTO THE LOWER MS VALLEY 
THIS MORNING WITH CLEAR SKIES AND MILD TEMPS ACRS THE REGION. 
EXPECT THE AREA OF HIGH PRESSURE TO SINK SE TODAY AND TONIGHT. SKIES 
WILL BE MOSTLY SUNNY THIS MORNING WITH SOME SCT AFTN CU. TEMPS WL 
WARM INTO THE LOWER AND MID 80S UNDER SLIGHTLY COOLER LOW LEVEL NE 
FLOW. CU WL DISSIPATE IN THE EVENING LEAVING SKIES MOSTLY CLEAR 
FOLLOWED BY AN INCREASE IN CLOUDS AFT MIDNIGHT AS THE NEXT SYSTEM 
APPROACHES.

NEXT SHORTWAVE MOVES INTO THE GREAT LAKES ON SUN WITH A WEAK FRONT 
PUSHING SOUTH THROUGH THE MID MS VALLEY. BEST UPPER DYNAMICS STAY 
WELL TO THE NE OF THE REGION WITH CONVERGENCE AND MOISTURE FAIRLY 
MARGINAL INVOF FRONT. GFS AND ETA DIFFER ON HOW QUICKLY THE FRONT 
MOVES THROUGH. ETA IS STRONGER AND QUICKER WHILE THE GFS IS SLOWER. 
WL COMPROMISE ATTM. WL CONT LOW POPS FOR NRN AREAS SUN...EVERYWHERE 
SUN NIGHT AND NRN MS EARLY MON. SEVERE POTENTIAL APPEAR LOW ATTM 
WITH MARGINAL INSTABILITY AND LITTLE UPPER SUPPORT.

WEAK HIGH PRESSURE IN CONTROL MON NIGHT THROUGH WED WITH SEASONABLE 
TEMPS. UPPER FLOW BECOMES MORE ZONAL WITH WEAK DISTURBANCES MOVING 
THROUGH AND CHANCES OF RAIN WED NIGHT INTO THE EARLY PART OF THE 
WEEKEND. 

&&

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 202352
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
630 PM CDT FRI MAY 20 2005

.DISCUSSION...LATEST SURFACE ANALYSIS PLACES COLD FRONT ACROSS 
CENTRAL MISSISSIPPI. CONVECTION HAS MOVED SOUTH OF THE AREA AS UPPER 
LEVEL RIDGING AND LOWER DEWPOINT AIR TRYING TO ADVANCE SOUTH. LATEST 
VISIBLE SATELLITE SHOWS DIURNAL CUMULUS DIMINISHING IN COVERAGE AND 
AN AREA OF 2500FT STRATOCU ACROSS EAST CENTRAL MISSOURI/WEST CENTRAL 
ILLINOIS NOT MAKING MUCH IF ANY PROGRESS SOUTH INTO SOUTHEAST 
MISSOURI. WILL ISSUE AN UPDATE TO REMOVE PRECIPITATION ACROSS 
SOUTHERN TIER OF ZONES. OTHERWISE FORECAST GRIDS HANDLING SITUATION 
WELL AND NOT ANTICIPATING ANOTHER UPDATE THIS EVENING.

UPDATED GRIDS WILL BE OUT SHORTLY.

CJC

.PREV DISCUSSION...ISSUED 229 PM CDT FRI MAY 20 2005...

SYNOPTIC PATTERN CONSISTS OF A RIDGE THAT IS POSITIONED OVER THE 
MOUNTAIN WEST...A CLOSED LOW OFF OF THE EASTERN MOST CANADIAN 
PROVINCES AND A LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM OVER EASTERN KENTUCKY. A COLD 
FRONT EXTENDS SOUTHWESTWARD FROM THE LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM. THIS FRONT 
RUNS FROM THE LOW INTO NORTH ALABAMA TO NEAR TUPELO AND CLARKSDALE. 
THE BETTER INSTABILITY HAS BEEN SOUTH OF TUPELO WHERE CAPES HAVE 
BEEN NEAR 3000 J/KG WITH LIS AROUND -6/-7. THUNDERSTORMS HAVE 
DEVELOPED ALONG THE FRONT THIS AFTERNOON IN NORTH MISSISSIPPI. THE 
ACTIVITY HAS BEEN VERY LIMITED DUE TO THE PROXIMITY OF THE UPPER 
RIDGE AND RESULTING SUBSIDENCE. MOST OF THE THUNDERSTORMS HAVE BEEN 
ACROSS ALABAMA AND MIDDLE TN WHERE UPPER DYNAMICS WITH REGARDS TO 
THE LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM ARE AIDING DEVELOPMENT. TEMPERATURES WERE 
MUCH WARMER THAN ANTICIPATED MAINLY BECAUSE THE COOLER AIR INDICATED 
BY 850MB TEMPS WAS LAGGING WELL BEHIND THE FRONT. 

THE COLD FRONT AND ASSOCIATED CHANCES OF THUNDERSTORMS WILL CONTINUE 
TO PRESS SOUTHWARD AND GFS/ETA INDICATE THAT THEY WILL BE INTO 
CENTRAL MISSISSIPPI BY 00Z. THE AFTERNOON CU SHOULD DISSIPATE. THERE 
IS A STRATUS DECK OVER EAST CENTRAL MISSOURI AND ILLINOIS THAT COULD 
DROP SOUTHWARD. HOWEVER SUSPECT THAT IT WILL NOT MAKE IT DUE TO 
STRONG SUBSIDENCE MOVING THROUGH THE REGION IN THE WAKE OF THE LOW 
PRESSURE SYSTEM. 

AFTERNOON CU IS POSSIBLE ONCE AGAIN TOMORROW WITH A FAIR AMOUNT OF 
LOW LEVEL MOISTURE STILL AROUND. OTHERWISE IT SHOULD BE COOLER WITH 
GUIDANCE NUMBERS WITHIN REASON. ON SUNDAY/SUNDAY NIGHT A LOW 
PRESSURE SYSTEM WILL MOVE OVER THE TOP OF THE RIDGE AND FORCE A COLD 
FRONT THROUGH THE AREA. THE AMOUNT OF MOISTURE DOES NOT LOOK 
TERRIBLY IMPRESSIVE SO LOW POPS SEEMS JUSTIFIED FOR NOW. THIS LOW 
PRESSURE SYSTEM WILL MERGE WITH THE CUT OFF LOW (CURRENTLY OFF SHORE 
OF THE EASTERN CANADIAN PROVINCES) OVER THE NORTHEASTERN U.S. ON 
MONDAY. THIS WILL FILTER IN A GOOD DEAL OF COOLER DRIER AIR INTO THE 
REGION. THE BEGINNING OF NEXT WEEK LOOKS PLEASANT WITH TEMPS IN THE 
UPPER 70S OR LOW 80S AND DEW POINTS IN THE 50S. THE NEXT THREAT FOR 
RAIN IS MID TO LATE WEEK. THE UPPER FLOW BECOMES MORE NORTHWESTERLY 
WITH THE HUGE TROUGH OVER THE NORTHEAST AND STRONG UPPER RIDGE OVER 
THE SOUTHWEST. SEVERAL MINOR DISTURBANCES WILL BE EMBEDDED IN THE 
FLOW WHICH COULD RESULT IN SOME RAIN ANYTIME DURING THIS PERIOD.

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.

FXUS64 KMEG 201529
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
1029 AM CDT FRI MAY 20 2005

.DISCUSSION...
SYNOPTIC PATTERN CONSISTS OF AN UPPER RIDGE THAT IS POSITIONED OVER 
THE MOUNTAIN WEST...A CLOSED LOW OFF OF THE EASTERN MOST CANADIAN 
PROVINCES AND A LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM OVER THE MID OHIO VALLEY REGION. 
A COLD FRONT EXTENDS WESTWARD FROM THE LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM AND IS 
ROUGHLY ALONG I 40 AT THIS TIME. THE 850MB FRONT LAGS 
BEHIND...LIKELY JUST ENTERING ARKANSAS AND WEST TENNESSEE. TEMPS 
AHEAD OF THE FRONT ARE ALREADY IN THE LOWER 80S IN MANY PLACES AHEAD 
OF THE 850 FRONT. CU FIELD IS ALREADY BEGUN. MODELS SHOWING THAT 
THUNDERSTORM POTENTIAL MAY BE HINDERED THIS AFTERNOON DUE TO OUR 
PROXIMITY TO THE UPPER RIDGE AND LACK OF FORCING. 
STILL...INSTABILITY AHEAD OF THE FRONT IS VERY IMPRESSIVE WITH 
AFTERNOON LIS AROUND -7 AND CAPES ABOVE 3000 J/KG POSSIBLE. THIS IS 
ASSUMES TEMPS NEAR 90 WHICH LOOKS VERY POSSIBLE GIVEN THE MORNING 
TRENDS. THERE DOES NOT APPEAR TO BE MUCH OF A CAP AHEAD OF THE FRONT 
SO THINK THAT THUNDERSTORMS WILL DEVELOP AHEAD OF THE FRONT IN 
MISSISSIPPI AND BE MORE WIDESPREAD TOWARDS THE ALABAMA BORDER WHERE 
THE UPPER DYNAMICS ARE BETTER. WITH THIS MUCH INSTABILITY IN PLACE 
THERE IS A SEVERE THREAT TODAY...WITH THE MAIN THREAT BEING LARGE 
HAIL AND POSSIBLY SOME LOCALIZED GUSTY WINDS. IN REGARDS TO 
AFTERNOON TEMPS...HAVE RAISED TEMPS FOR THIS AFTERNOON. THINK THAT 
90S WILL BE FROM MEMPHIS TO SAVANNAH AND SOUTH...UPPER 80S NORTH OF 
THIS LINE WITH THE 850 COLD AIR ADVECTION TAKING HOLD THIS AFTERNOON.

&&

FXUS64 KMEG 200732
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
233 AM CDT FRI MAY 20 2005

.DISCUSSION...
MILD...TRANQUIL ACRS THE CWFA ATTM WITH JUST SOME HIGH CLOUDS 
BLOWING SOUTH ACRS THE BOOTHEEL...NE AR AND W TN FROM TSTMS ACRS 
MO/IL/WRN KY. TEMPS STILL IN THE 70S MOST PLACES THOUGH DEWPOINTS 
ARE ONLY IN THE UPPER 50S AND LOWER 60S FROM MEM NORTHWARD. 

STRONG SHORTWAVE AND ASSOCD CDFNT MOVING OUT OF NRN IL/IN THIS 
MORNING ARE RESPONSIBLE FOR TSTMS ACRS THE OH VALLEY. CURRENTLY THE 
WESTERN END OF THE LINE IS LOCATED E-W NEAR CAPE GIRARDEAU MO AND 
PADUCAH KY MOVING STEADILY SOUTH. THIS ACTIVITY HAS BEEN SLOWLY 
WEAKENING AND REMAINS BLO SEVERE LIMITS. AS THIS LINE MOVES SOUTH 
INTO W TN THIS MORNING THERMODYNAMIC CONDS ACRS OUR CWFA DO NOT 
SUGGEST STRENGTHENING. LOWER SFC DEWPOINTS AND CAPES ACRS W TN 
SUGGEST THESE STORMS SHOULD STAY BLO SEVERE LIMITS THIS 
MORNING...THOUGH GUSTY WINDS AND SMALL HAIL ARE STILL POSSIBLE. 

THE SHORTWAVE AND FRONT WILL MAKE STEADY PROGRESS SOUTHWARD TODAY. 
BY 18Z THE FRONT WL BE LOCATED E-W THROUGH MEM. EXPECT STRONG 
HEATING IN ADVANCE OF THE FRONT TODAY AND WITH THE SHORTWAVE 
APPROACHING...INCREASING MID LEVEL LAPSE RATES. DUE TO TIMING IT 
LOOKS LIKE PARAMETERS FOR SEVERE WX LINE UP BEST FOR N MS. SFC BASED 
CAPES OF 3000-5000 J/KG FORECAST THIS AFTN ACRS N MS. EXPECT STORMS 
TO RE-INTENSIFY ACRS N MS THIS AFTN. STORMS MAY BE SEVERE WITH LARGE 
HAIL AND DAMAGING WINDS. 

ACTIVITY SHOULD DIMINISH BY EARLY EVENING AS FRONT AND SHORTWAVE 
MOVES SOUTH OF THE CWFA. HIGH PRESSURE WILL BUILD IN OVERNIGHT AND 
CONTROL THE WEATHER THROUGH SAT NIGHT. 

BOTH MODELS IN GOOD AGREEMENT WITH NEXT SYSTEM ON SUN/SUN NIGHT. 
LOOKS LIKE ANOTHER STRONG SHORTWAVE WILL MOVE THROUGH THE OH VALLEY 
DURING THIS TIME FRAME WITH A FRONT SWINGING THROUGH THE MID SOUTH. 
HAVE ADDED CHC POPS FOR SUN/SUN NIGHT. HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS IN 
BEHIND THIS SYSTEM FOR THE MON THROUGH WED PERIOD. 

WED NIGHT THROUGH THU NIGHT LOOKS UNSETTLED. AS HIGH PRESSURE SLIPS 
EAST SHORTWAVES MOVING THROUGH WNW FLOW MAY TRIGGER SOME TSTMS. JUST 
ADDED SLIGHT CHC POPS FOR NOW.

801 PM CDT THU MAY 19 2005

.DISCUSSION...
THUNDERSTORMS HAVE HAD A DIFFICULT TIME DEVELOPING OVER THE FORECAST 
AREA THIS EVENING. NUMEROUS SEVERE THUNDERSTORMS WERE ONGOING OVER 
WESTERN KENTUCKY. THAT ACTIVITY WAS MOVING SOUTHEAST INTO MIDDLE AND 
EAST TENNESSEE. 

THROUGH MIDNIGHT...MOST SHOWER ACTIVITY WILL BE LIMITED HOWEVER AS 
THE UPPER LEVEL LOW OVER NORTHERN ILLINOIS SWINGS ACROSS SOUTHERN 
OHIO AND NORTHERN KENTUCKY ADDITIONAL THUNDERSTORM WILL MAKE THEIR 
WAY INTO THE MID SOUTH. THIS SHOULD BEGIN TO AFFECT THE FORECAST 
AREA BETWEEN 3 AM AND 6 AM. WE WILL CONTINUE TO MONITOR THIS 
DEVELOPING SYSTEM AND UPDATE THE FORECAST AS NEEDED. 

HAVE UPDATED CLOUD COVER AND THUNDERSTORM TRENDS FOR TONIGHT. DID 
NOT TOUCH TEMPERATURES OVERNIGHT AS THEY LOOK FINE.

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 191951
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
250 PM CDT THU MAY 19 2005

.DISCUSSION...

A STRONG LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM IS OVER WISCONSIN AT THIS TIME. AN 
UPPER RIDGE IS BUILDING OVER THE WESTERN HALF OF THE U.S. WHILE A 
CUT OFF LOW IS ANCHORED OFF OF THE NEW ENGLAND COAST. A STATIONARY 
FRONT EXTENDS SOUTHWARD FROM THE UPPER MIDWEST LOW TO NEAR KANSAS 
CITY AND THEN SOUTHWESTWARD THROUGH THE OKLAHOMA AND TEXAS 
PANHANDLES. AN UPPER LEVEL SHORTWAVE AHEAD OF THE SURFACE FRONT IS 
MOVING THROUGH NORTHEAST ARKANSAS AT THIS TIME. SCATTERED 
THUNDERSTORMS HAVE DEVELOPED AHEAD OF THIS SHORTWAVE IN THE 
AFTERNOON INSTABILITY. THERE REMAINS A SLIGHT RISK OVER MUCH OF 
SEVERE WEATHER INTO THIS EVENING BECAUSE OF THE ONGOING CONVECTION. 
LARGE HAIL AND LOCALLY DAMAGING WINDS ARE POSSIBLE. THERE MAY BE A 
SECOND THREAT OVERNIGHT. 

AT LAST MODELS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT. THE TRACK OF THE LOW PRESSURE 
SYSTEM WILL DIVE SOUTHEASTWARD THROUGH ILLINOIS...MIDDLE KY AND 
WESTERN HALF OF TN. THIS LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM WILL DRAG A COLD FRONT 
THROUGH THE AREA LATE TONIGHT AND DURING THE DAY ON FRIDAY. 
INSTABILITY AHEAD OF THE FRONT WILL REMAIN HIGH WITH LIS AROUND -6 
AND CAPE GREATER THAN 2000 J/KG. EXPECT AT THE VERY LEAST FOR 
SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS TO DEVELOP ALONG THE FRONT OVER 
SOUTHEASTERN MO...POSSIBLY EVOLVING INTO AN MCS. THE BETTER CHANCES 
FOR RAIN WILL BE OVER W TN AND CLOSER TO THE TN RIVER WHERE DYNAMICS 
WITH RESPECT TO THE LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM ARE BETTER. SEVERE THREAT 
STILL LOOKS LIKE LARGE HAIL AND LOCALLY DAMAGING WINDS. 

EXPECT THE FRONT TO BE ENTERING NORTH MS BY TOMORROW AFTERNOON. SO 
RAIN CHANCES ACROSS WEST TN...NORTHEAST ARKANSAS AND THE BOOTHEEL 
SHOULD BE MAINLY IN THE MORNING. THE SEVERE THREAT WILL REMAIN THE 
SAME AND MOVE WITH THE FRONT. WITH THE TRACK MOVING FURTHER 
EAST...THE COOLER AIR SHOULD STAY EAST OF THE REGION. 850 TEMPS WILL 
ONLY SLIP A FEW DEGREES SO SURFACE HIGHS WILL STILL BE IN THE LOW TO 
MID 80S FOR FRIDAY AND SATURDAY.

INTERESTING PATTERN SETTING UP ON SUNDAY AND GOING INTO NEXT WEEK. 
ANOTHER SYSTEM WILL MOVE OVER THE TOP OF THE RIDGE AND HEAD TOWARDS 
THE NORTHEASTERN US. THIS WILL DRAG A COLD FRONT THROUGH ON SUNDAY. 
THE UPWARD VERTICAL MOTION AND DEPTH OF MOISTURE WITH THE FRONT ARE 
REALLY MARGINAL SO HAVE LEFT RAIN CHANCES OUT FOR NOW. THE GFS FOR 
THE PAST COUPLE OF RUNS...SUPPORTED BY THE EUROPEAN...SHOWS THIS 
SYSTEM MERGING WITH THE CUT OFF LOW OVER NEW ENGLAND. THE RESULT IS 
A LARGE UPPER TROUGH OVER THE EASTERN THIRD OF THE US. AS IT STANDS 
RIGHT NOW...LOOKS LIKE WE WILL REMAIN ON THE VERY WESTERN PERIPHERY 
OF THIS TROUGH. MAY NEED TO BEGIN TO TREND TEMPS DOWN INTO THE 70S 
FOR HIGHS FOR NEXT WEEK IF THIS SOLUTION CONTINUES TO HOLD. THE GFS 
SHOWS A SHORTWAVE ARRIVING NEXT THURSDAY RESULTING IN A CHANCE FOR 
RAIN. ALTHOUGH...THE SYSTEM LOOKS RATHER WEAK AND AM NOT VERY 
CONFIDENT IN THIS SOLUTION THIS FAR OUT.

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.

FXUS64 KMEG 191541

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
1041 AM CDT THU MAY 19 2005

.DISCUSSION...

A STRONG LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM IS ENTERING WESTERN WISCONSIN AT THIS 
TIME. AN UPPER RIDGE IS BUILDING OVER THE WESTERN HALF OF THE US 
WHILE A CLOSED LOW IS ANCHORED OFF OF THE NEW ENGLAND COAST. A 
STATIONARY FRONT EXTENDS SOUTHWARD FROM THE UPPER MIDWEST LOW TO 
NEAR KANSAS CITY AND THEN SOUTHWESTWARD THROUGH THE OKLAHOMA AND 
TEXAS PANHANDLES. AN UPPER LEVEL SHORTWAVE AHEAD OF THE SURFACE 
FRONT IS MOVING THROUGH SOUTH CENTRAL MISSOURI. A DECK OF LOW LEVEL 
CU AND STRATUS LIES JUST AHEAD OF THE SHORTWAVE ACROSS NORTH CENTRAL 
ARKANSAS AND THROUGH SOUTH CENTRAL MISSOURI. OVER THE 
MIDSOUTH...SKIES ARE PARTLY TO MOSTLY SUNNY AT THIS TIME. EXPECT CU 
DEVELOPMENT SHORTLY. TEMPS WITH THE MORNING SUN HAVE SHOT UP WITH 
MANY LOCATIONS IN THE 80S. ALTHOUGH PARTLY SUNNY SKIES THIS 
AFTERNOON WILL SLOW DOWN THE TEMPS...THINK THAT MANY AREAS WILL BE 
IN THE UPPER 80S TO AROUND 90 DUE TO THE HEAD START ON TEMPS THIS 
MORNING. WILL LEAVE IN RAIN CHANCES FOR THIS AFTERNOON DUE TO THE 
SHORTWAVE MOVING SOUTHEASTWARD. ALSO AIR MASS VARIETY THUNDERSTORMS 
ARE ALSO POSSIBLE SINCE THERE REALLY ISNT MUCH OF A CAP IN PLACE AND 
INSTABILITY IS DESCENT...LI AROUND -4 AND CAPES AROUND 1500 J/KG. 
THE AREA IS OUTLOOKED BY SPC FOR SLIGHT RISK. THIS THREAT IS MAINLY 
A HAIL THREAT WITH ADDED FORCING ALONG THE SHORTWAVE AS IT MOVES 
INTO THE AREA THIS AFTERNOON. 

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.

VALLE

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 190743
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
243 AM CDT THU MAY 19 2005

.DISCUSSION...

SKIES ARE PARTLY CLOUDY ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA EARLY THIS MORNING.
MCS MOVING OUT OF SOUTHERN KANSAS CONTINUES TO MOVE SOUTH INTO
EASTERN OKLAHOMA. UPPER LOW NOW MOVING EAST THROUGH SOUTHERN
MINNESOTA. MODELS STILL NOT IN AGREEMENT REGARDING TRACK OF UPPER LOW
AS IT BEGINS TO TAKE MORE OF A SOUTHERLY TRACK. DEPENDING ON WHEN
THIS OCCURS WILL FACTOR INTO HOW MUCH OF A CHANCE OF THUNDERSTORMS
WE WILL SEE. AT THIS POINT...CHANCE POPS STILL SEEM THE WAY TO GO
FOR TODAY...TONIGHT AND FRIDAY. SPC HAS MOST OF FORECAST AREA IN
SLIGHT RISK TODAY AND MOST OF NORTH MISSISSIPPI IN DAY TWO SLIGHT
RISK. CANT COMPLETELY RULE OUT A SEVERE STORM BUT NOT CONFIDENT
THAT WE WILL SEE MUCH IF ANY SEVERE STORMS. WILL NOT MENTION SEVERE
IN THE ZONES BUT SOME MENTION WILL REMAIN IN THE HAZARDOUS WEATHER
OUTLOOK. MOST AREAS WILL NOT SEE ANY RAIN FRIDAY NIGHT EXCEPT FOR
EXTREME SOUTHERN PART OF FORECAST AREA WHERE KEPT SLIGHT CHANCE POPS
IN FOR FRIDAY EVENING. WEEKEND SHOULD BE DRY AND WHILE A WEAK FRONT
MOVES THROUGH THE REGION MONDAY...NO RAIN IS EXPECTED MONDAY OR
TUESDAY. NEXT CHANCE OF RAIN SHOULD BE WEDNESDAY WHEN ANOTHER COLD
FRONT APPROACHES THE REGION.


000 
FXUS64 KMEG 181942
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
242 PM CDT WED MAY 18 2005

.DISCUSSION...

FAIR WEATHER CUMULUS HAS DEVELOPED ACROSS THE MIDSOUTH WHICH
INDICATES A RETURN OF MORE SIGNIFICANT LOW LEVEL MOISTURE. THE 60
DEGREE ISODROSOTHERM HAS FINALLY REACHED MEM AND TUP. EXPECT
DEWPOINTS TO CONTINUE TO GRADUALLY RISE UNDER A LIGHT TO MODERATE
SOUTHERLY WIND. 

THE UPPER RIDGE WHICH HAS PROVIDED THE REGION WITH SUCH NICE
WEATHER WILL GIVE WAY TO THE NEXT SHORTWAVE...CURRENTLY OVER THE
DAKOTAS. MODEL AGREEMENT IS CERTAINLY LACKING IN REGARDS TO THE
TRACK OF THIS SHORTWAVE. THE MAIN QUESTION IS HOW THE SHORTWAVE
INTERACTS WITH THE CLOSED UPPER LOW OVER NEW ENGLAND.
NAM/UKMET/CANADIAN TEND TO BRING THE SHORTWAVE FURTHER
EAST...TRYING TO PHASE IT WITH A PIECE OF THE UPPER LOW.
MEANWHILE...THE GFS/NOGAPS/EURO BRING THE SHORTWAVE MUCH FURTHER
SOUTH...RIGHT OVER THE CWA. OF COURSE...THESE DIFFERENT TRACKS
MAKE ALL THE DIFFERENCE IN WHAT TYPE OF RAIN CHANCES THE MIDSOUTH
WILL HAVE. WILL LEAN TOWARD A BLEND OF THE GFS/NOGAPS/EURO SOLUTION.
THIS HAS BEEN THE MORE CONSISTENT SOLUTION. ALSO...WITH THE NORTH
ATLANTIC OSCILLATION (NAO) BEING STRONGLY NEGATIVE THERE WILL TEND
TO BE STRONGER BLOCKING UPSTREAM...ALLOWING THE SHORTWAVE TO TAKE
A FURTHER SOUTH SOLUTION. 

MODELS DO HINT AT AN MCS DEVELOPING OVERNIGHT OVER THE SOUTHERN
PLAINS. THIS WOULD LIKELY TRACK INTO THE MIDSOUTH DURING THE
MIDDLE OF THE DAY TOMORROW WITH A GOOD AMOUNT OF HEATING
OCCURRING AHEAD OF THE SYSTEM. NOT TOO IMPRESSED WITH THE PROSPECTS
OF SEVERE WEATHER. MID LEVEL LAPSE RATES ARE MARGINAL (APPROX 6
C/KM) AND WIND FIELDS ARE FAIRLY LIGHT. CANNOT RULE OUT AN
ISOLATED PULSE SEVERE WITH STRONG WINDS AND HAIL AS THE MAIN
THREAT. WILL MAKE A MENTION OF ISOLATED SEVERE IN THE HWO BUT WILL
DOWNPLAY FOR NOW. FOR POPS...WENT HIGH CHANCE NORTH WHERE THE
BETTER FORCING WILL BE TO LOW END CHANCE TOWARD THE SOUTH.

CHANCE POPS WILL CONTINUE OVERNIGHT THURSDAY INTO FRIDAY AS THE
SHORTWAVE SYSTEM MOVES INTO THE AREA ALONG WITH ITS ASSOCIATED
FRONT. THE SYSTEM LOOKS RATHER PROGRESSIVE SO HAVE ENDED ALL POPS
BY 6Z SATURDAY. UPPER RIDGE OVER TEXAS WILL NOSE INTO THE AREA FOR
THE WEEKEND MAKING FOR A DRY FORECAST. 

A WEAK FRONT WILL PUSH THROUGH THE MIDSOUTH UNDER NORTHEAST FLOW
ALOFT LATE SUNDAY INTO MONDAY. DEEP MOISTURE REALLY LACKING WITH
THE SYSTEM SO LEFT POPS OUT. ANOTHER FRONT APPROACH WEDNESDAY INTO
THURSDAY. THIS SYSTEM WILL HAVE SOME BETTER MOISTURE TO WORK WITH
SO INCLUDED A SLIGHT CHANCE OF PRECIP. TEMPS THROUGHOUT THE
FORECAST WILL BE AT OR JUST SLIGHTLY ABOVE NORMAL.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
MEM  68  86  67  83 /  10  40  40  50 
MKL  64  84  65  81 /  10  50  40  50 
JBR  66  85  66  83 /  20  50  40  40 
TUP  65  86  67  82 /  10  30  40  50 

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 181541
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
1041 AM CDT WED MAY 18 2005

.UPDATE...

THE MIDSOUTH IS ENJOYING YET ANOTHER TRANQUIL DAY UNDER THE
INFLUENCE OF AN UPPER LEVEL RIDGE. WITH SURFACE HIGH POSITIONED
WELL TO THE EAST...STARTING TO SEE DEWPOINTS COME UP SLOWLY.
RETURN FLOW IS STILL FAIRLY WEAK (WINDS LESS THAN 10 KTS) SO UPPER
60 DEWPOINTS OBSERVED JUST TO THE SOUTH OF THE CWA HAVING A HARD
TIME MAKING IT THIS FAR NORTH. FEEL SOUTHERN AREAS MAY SEE A FEW
CUMULUS TODAY...BUT MOST CU DEVELOPMENT WILL BE JUST TO OUR SOUTH.
ACARS SOUNDINGS FROM MEM SHOW THE AREA MIXING ALL THE WAY UP TO
ABOVE 850 MB AS WELL. THIS WILL HELP TO MIX DOWN SOME DRIER AIR
DURING THE AFTERNOON. WILL KEEP MOSTLY CLEAR WORDING FOR TODAY.

TEMPS ALREADY 10 DEGREES AHEAD OF WHERE THEY WERE THIS TIME
YESTERDAY. AS A RESULT...BUMPED HIGHS UP IN THE GRIDS A DEGREE OR
SO. ALSO TWEAKED WINDS UP A BIT AS THE GOOD MIXING TODAY SHOULD
ALLOW MOST AREAS SEE CLOSER TO 10 KTS AT TIMES.

UPDATE TO GRIDS ALREADY OUT. NO UPDATE TO ZONES IS NEEDED AT THIS
TIME.

&&

.PREV DISCUSSION... (ISSUED 255 AM CDT WED MAY 18 2005) 

DISCUSSION...

SKIES REMAIN MOSTLY CLEAR ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA EARLY THIS
MORNING. UPPER LEVEL LOW NOW MOVING THROUGH SOUTH DAKOTA. THERE WILL
BE A SLOW INCREASE IN CLOUDS DURING THE DAY TODAY WHICH WILL ALLOW
TEMPERATURES TO WARM INTO THE MID 80S OVER MOST OF THE FORECAST AREA.
MODELS NOT IN COMPLETE AGREEMENT REGARDING TRACK OF UPPER LOW AS
BEGIN TO TURN SOUTH BY THURSDAY MORNING. ONLY NORTHERN PART OF
FORECAST AREA HAS ANY CHANCE OF SEEING RAIN LATE TONIGHT AND THAT
WOULD BE A 20 PERCENT CHANCE. WITH UNCERTAINTY ABOUT THE TRACK OF
THE UPPER LOW...KEPT POPS FOR THURSDAY...FRIDAY AND SATURDAY WHERE
THEY WERE. ALSO WITH THE UNCERTAINTY OF THE UPPER LOW TRACK...BROUGHT
TEMPERATURES UP A LITTLE FOR FRIDAY AND SATURDAY. ONCE THE UPPER LOW
EXITS THE REGION...DRY WEATHER RETURNS UNTIL MONDAY NIGHT WHEN AN
UPPER LEVEL DISTURBANCE IS FORECAST TO MOVE THROUGH THE REGION.

AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
300 PM CDT TUE MAY 17 2005

THE MIDSOUTH IS SUNNY AT THE PRESENT TIME AND TEMPERATURES HAVE
WARMED INTO THE LOW TO UPPER 70S.

TONIGHT...CLEAR SKIES ARE EXPECTED...BUT IT SHOULD NOT BE AS COLD
DUE TO SOUTHEASTERLY WINDS THAT SHOULD STAY UP A LITTLE.

CLOUDINESS SHOULD INCREASE FROM THE SOUTH WEDNESDAY AND IT WILL
BE SEVERAL DEGREES WARMER. WHILE THIS IS GOING ON THE NEXT FRONT
WILL BE FORMING IN THE NORTHERN AND CENTRAL PLAINS DUE TO AN
UPPER LEVEL CUTOFF LOW IN THE DAKOTAS.

WEDNESDAY NIGHT THE CUTOFF LOW GETS CAUGHT IN THE FLOW AROUND A
MAJOR TROUGH IN NEW ENGLAND AND MOVES SOUTH RIGHT AT US...UNUSUAL
FOR THIS TIME OF YEAR. SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS WILL STAKE UP
ALONG THE FRONT AND PROBABLY PROVIDE SOME DECENT AMTS THURSDAY
INTO FRIDAY.

THE CUTOFF LOW WILL SLOWLY MOVE TO THE GULF...BUT THE ALIGNMENT
OF THE UPPER LEVEL FEATURE WILL MAKE IT COOLER THAN NORMAL WITH
LOTS OF CLOUDS INTO THE WEEKEND.

FXUS64 KMEG 170804
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
304 AM CDT TUE MAY 17 2005

QUIET WEATHER PATTERN WITH SURFACE HIGH OFF TO THE NORTHEAST. THIS
HAS KEPT SKIES CLEAR WITH LIGHT WINDS SO TEMPERATURES HAVE FALLEN
INTO THE MID 40S TO MID 50S. SURFACE HIGH WILL CONTINUE TO PUSH EAST
AND BY THIS AFTERNOON WINDS SHOULD SHIFT TO THE SOUTH. THIS COUPLED
WITH MOSTLY SUNNY SKIES SHOULD HELP TEMPERATURES SOME 5-7 DEGREES
FROM MONDAY. TONIGHT WILL REMAIN MOSTLY CLEAR AND WITH WINDS
REMAINING FROM THE SOUTH...TEMPERATURES WONT BE NEARLY AS COOL AS
THE PAST COUPLE OF NIGHTS.

THE NEXT SIGNIFICANT WEATHER FEATURE WILL BEGIN TO EFFECT OUR
WEATHER BY WEDNESDAY. UPPER LEVEL TROUGH OVER THE GREAT BASIN THIS
MORNING WILL LIFT NORTHEAST...DEVELOP A CLOSED LOW AND REACHES THE
NORTHERN PLAINS BY WEDNESDAY MORNING. BY WEDNESDAY NIGHT THE UPPER
LEVEL LOW THEN DROP SOUTH OUT OF MINNESOTA AND HEADS STRAIGHT FOR
THE FORECAST AREA WHERE IT SHOULD ARRIVE SOMETIME FRIDAY. THIS UPPER
LOW WILL MAKE FOR SOME UNSETTLED WEATHER POSSIBLY AS EARLY AS
WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND THERE WILL BE A THREAT OF RAIN THROUGH SATURDAY
NIGHT. ONCE THE UPPER LOW EXITS THE REGION...DRY WEATHER SHOULD
RETURN FOR SUNDAY AND MONDAY.

330 PM CDT MON MAY 16 2005

SHOULD SEE LOTS OF OPEN SKIES TONIGHT DUE TO ZONAL FLOW ALOFT AND

TAKES PLACE ALOFT.

WEDNESDAY NIGHT A CUT OFF LOW WILL SLIDE OVER THE RIDGE AND MOVE
INTO THE MIDSOUTH...AND UNUSUAL WEATHER PATTERN. THIS WILL BRING
PCPN TO THE AREA AND CONSEQUENT SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS. THE
CUT OFF SHOULD MOVE SLOWLY SOUTH AND KEEP US CLOUDY...RAINY AND
COOL THROUGH FRIDAY. AS THE UPPER TROUGH MOVES FARTHER SOUTH...

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 161522
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
1015 AM CDT MON MAY 16 2005

MID/HI CLDS MOVING OVER AREA FROM SOUTHWEST. THIS PATCH OF CLDS
SHOULD MOVE ON EAST OUT OF THE AREA BY EARLY AFTER IAW TRENDS AND
MODELS. WINDS PICKED UP QUICKER THAN EXPECTED DUE TO THE SHT WV
MOVING ACROSS AT THIS TIME. TEMPERATURES ARE RUNNING ALONG OK FOR
THIS TIME OF DAY AND THE CURRENT FCST. WL UPDATE AFTER 11 AM.

PREVIOUS DISCUSSION

.DISCUSSION...LATEST SURFACE ANALYSIS PLACES HIGH PRESSURE ACROSS
THE MIDDLE MISSISSIPPI VALLEY. INFRARED SATELLITE SHOWS CIRRUS
ASSOCIATED WITH MID LEVEL SHORTWAVE MOVING ACROSS THE FORECAST
AREA. MAIN CONCERN IN THIS FORECAST PACKAGE IS PRECIPITATION
POTENTIAL FOR THURSDAY THROUGH SUNDAY.

TODAY...PLEASANT WEATHER ON TAP ACROSS THE MID SOUTH TODAY. WEAK
500 MB MID LEVEL SHORTWAVE WILL MOVE THROUGH THE LOWER
MISSISSIPPI VALLEY. HOWEVER...NOT EXPECTING MUCH MORE THAN SOME
CIRRUS WITH LOW/MID LEVELS OF THE ATMOSPHERE QUITE DRY AND WILL
GO WITH PARTLY CLOUDY SKIES TO START THE FORECAST. 850 MB
TEMPERATURES AROUND 5-6C SUPPORT HIGHS AT BEST IN THE UPPER 60S
TO LOWER 70S. WINDS WILL BE LIGHT WITH WIND GUSTS ONLY AS HIGH AS
11 KTS WITH MIXING HEIGHTS AROUND 4000 FT.

TONIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY NIGHT...MID/UPPER LEVEL RIDGING BUILDS
BACK IN ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA TONIGHT WITH WINDS DECOUPLING
AND MOSTLY CLEAR TO PARTLY CLOUDY SKIES. TEMPERATURES WILL FALL
BACK INTO THE UPPER 40S TO MIDDLE 50S TONIGHT.  AS SURFACE HIGH
MOVES OFF TO THE EAST AND LIGHT SOUTHERLY FLOW RETURNS
TEMPERATURES WILL MODERATE TO NORMAL VALUES BY WEDNESDAY ACROSS
THE LOWER MISSISSIPPI VALLEY. ADJUSTED POPS WEST OF THE
MISSISSIPPI RIVER FOR WEDNESDAY NIGHT TO CHANCE AS FRONT
APPROACHES AND ISENTROPIC ASCENT INCREASES TOWARD THURSDAY
MORNING.

THURSDAY THROUGH SUNDAY...SOME CONSISTENCY FINALLY STARTING TO
SHOW UP IN THE LONG RANGE FORECAST THOUGH SOME MINOR DIFFERENCES
STILL REMAIN. ONCE LARGE OUTLIER GFS HAS COME INTO CLOSE
AGREEMENT WITH 00Z EUROPEAN AND 18Z GFS. MAIN DIFFERENCES IN
LATEST LONG RANGE RUN IS PLACEMENT OF CUTOFF LOW THAT DEVELOPS
ACROSS THE NORTHERN PLAINS AND DROPS FURTHER SOUTH INTO THE GULF
OF MEXICO BY SUNDAY...INSTEAD OF STALLING OUT AND PINWHEELING
ACROSS THE MID SOUTH. CONSENSUS IN THE PAST FEW MODEL RUNS
JUSTIFIES SOME CHANGES TO PREVIOUS FORECAST. AS A RESULT...I
ADJUSTED POPS TO CHANCE ON THURSDAY AND ADDED ONLY 20 POPS TO
FORECAST THROUGH SUNDAY ACROSS A PORTION OF THE AREA AS LOW
GRADUALLY DRIFTS INTO THE GULF OF MEXICO.  LATER SHIFTS WILL
ADJUST PRECIPITATION CHANCES AS NECESSARY IN LATER MODEL RUNS AS
CONSISTENCY IMPROVES.

COORDINATED WITH BMX...JAN...THANKS.

&&

FXUS64 KMEG 160210
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
909 PM CDT SUN MAY 15 2005

.DISCUSSION...

SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE IS IN PLACE OVER THE MIDSOUTH THIS EVENING.
THIS SYSTEM SHOULD REMAIN OVER THE AREA OVERNIGHT KEEPING WEATHER
CONDITIONS DRY. EVENING IR SATELLITE IMAGERY SHOWING A FEW HIGH THIN
CIRRUS PASSING OVERHEAD AND THIS SHOULD CONTINUE THROUGH THE NIGHT.
THE CLOUD COVER SHOULD REMAIN THIN ENOUGH...SO CURRENT FORECAST OF
MOSTLY CLEAR LOOKS OK. IN ADDITION...WITH ONLY THIN CLOUD COVER AND
LIGHT NORTH WINDS...THINK CURRENT FORECAST LOW TEMPERATURES IN THE
MID TO UPPER 40S LOOKS GOOD. ALL OTHER FORECAST PARAMETERS LOOK GOOD
AT THIS TIME...SO NO EVENING UPDATE TO THE ZONE FORECAST OR GRIDS
ARE PLANNED AT THIS TIME.


.PREVIOUS DISCUSSION FROM 238 PM...

HIGH PRESSURE WILL BRING A COOL AND PLEASANT NIGHT TO
THE MID SOUTH TONIGHT. CLEAR SKIES AND SURFACE/UPPER LEVEL RIDGING
WILL ALLOW TEMPERATURES TO DROP TOWARD SURFACE DEWPOINTS THIS
AFTERNOON. ANOTHER SHORTWAVE WILL MOVE THROUGH THE LOWER MISSISSIPPI
VALLEY...BUT NOT EXPECTING ANY PRECIPITATION WITH THIS UPPER LEVEL
FEATURE BUT SOME HIGH CLOUDS MOVING OVERHEAD DURING THE DAY. UPPER
LEVEL RIDGING FINALLY TRANSLATES EAST ACROSS THE MISSISSIPPI VALLEY
BEFORE NEXT SYSTEM EJECTS OUT OF THE NORTHERN PLAINS AND INTO THE
REGION ON THURSDAY. MADE NO CHANGES TO PRECIPITATION TIMING
WEDNESDAY NIGHT.

THURSDAY THROUGH SUNDAY...LONG RANGE MODEL RUN TO RUN CONSISTENCY IS
WORSE TODAY AND THUS CONFIDENCE IS LOW. LONG RANGE FORECAST
WILL BE BASED UPON 06Z GFS/DGEX SOLUTIONS. MEANWHILE...COLD FRONT IN
NORTHWEST FLOW WILL PASS THROUGH THE MID SOUTH ON THURSDAY. 06Z DGEX
RUN A BIT SLOWER THAN 06Z GFS WITH FRONTAL PASSAGE AND WITH MORE
ENERGY. LATEST 12Z GFS HAS SUDDENLY DECIDED TO AGREE WITH 00Z
EUROPEAN RUN...WHICH IS A 180 DEGREE TURN AND COMPLETELY OUT OF
PHASE FROM EARLIER RUNS. 12Z GFS AND EUROPEAN DEVELOP LOW PRESSURE
ALONG THE FRONT AS IT DROPS INTO THE LOWER MISSISSIPPI VALLEY. THIS
AREA OF LOW PRESSURE BECOMES CUT OFF FROM THE NORTHWEST FLOW UNDER
BLOCKING RIDGE AND SPINS OVERHEAD THROUGH THE END OF THE PERIOD
PRODUCING WET WEATHER. NOT READY TO BUY THIS SOLUTION AT LEAST UNTIL
THE NEXT MODEL RUN OR TWO TRENDS THIS WAY...BUT WOULDN/T BE
SURPRISED IF POPS NEED TO BE ADDED FOR NEXT WEEKEND. WILL PLAN TO
LEAVE FRIDAY AND BEYOND DRY FOR THIS FORECAST PACKAGE.

COORDINATED WITH PAH...LZK...JAN...THANKS.

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.
&&

$$

CJC/JLH





000 
FXUS64 KMEG 151939
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
238 PM CDT SUN MAY 15 2005

.DISCUSSION...HIGH PRESSURE WILL BRING A COOL AND PLEASANT NIGHT TO 
THE MID SOUTH TONIGHT. CLEAR SKIES AND SURFACE/UPPER LEVEL RIDGING 
WILL ALLOW TEMPERATURES TO DROP TOWARD SURFACE DEWPOINTS THIS 
AFTERNOON. ANOTHER SHORTWAVE WILL MOVE THROUGH THE LOWER MISSISSIPPI 
VALLEY...BUT NOT EXPECTING ANY PRECIPITATION WITH THIS UPPER LEVEL 
FEATURE BUT SOME HIGH CLOUDS MOVING OVERHEAD DURING THE DAY. UPPER 
LEVEL RIDGING FINALLY TRANSLATES EAST ACROSS THE MISSISSIPPI VALLEY 
BEFORE NEXT SYSTEM EJECTS OUT OF THE NORTHERN PLAINS AND INTO THE 
REGION ON THURSDAY. MADE NO CHANGES TO PRECIPITATION TIMING 
WEDNESDAY NIGHT.

THURSDAY THROUGH SUNDAY...LONG RANGE MODEL RUN TO RUN CONSISTENCY IS 
WORSE TODAY AND THUS CONFIDENCE IS LOW. LONG RANGE FORECAST 
WILL BE BASED UPON 06Z GFS/DGEX SOLUTIONS. MEANWHILE...COLD FRONT IN 
NORTHWEST FLOW WILL PASS THROUGH THE MID SOUTH ON THURSDAY. 06Z DGEX 
RUN A BIT SLOWER THAN 06Z GFS WITH FRONTAL PASSAGE AND WITH MORE 
ENERGY. LATEST 12Z GFS HAS SUDDENLY DECIDED TO AGREE WITH 00Z 
EUROPEAN RUN...WHICH IS A 180 DEGREE TURN AND COMPLETELY OUT OF 
PHASE FROM EARLIER RUNS. 12Z GFS AND EUROPEAN DEVELOP LOW PRESSURE 
ALONG THE FRONT AS IT DROPS INTO THE LOWER MISSISSIPPI VALLEY. THIS 
AREA OF LOW PRESSURE BECOMES CUT OFF FROM THE NORTHWEST FLOW UNDER 
BLOCKING RIDGE AND SPINS OVERHEAD THROUGH THE END OF THE PERIOD 
PRODUCING WET WEATHER. NOT READY TO BUY THIS SOLUTION AT LEAST UNTIL 
THE NEXT MODEL RUN OR TWO TRENDS THIS WAY...BUT WOULDN/T BE 
SURPRISED IF POPS NEED TO BE ADDED FOR NEXT WEEKEND. WILL PLAN TO 
LEAVE FRIDAY AND BEYOND DRY FOR THIS FORECAST PACKAGE.

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 151600
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
1100 AM CDT SUN MAY 15 2005

.DISCUSSION...LATEST SURFACE OBSERVATIONS AND VISIBLE SATELLITE PLACE 
SECONDARY COLD FRONT ACROSS NORTHERN ALABAMA/CENTRAL MISSISSIPPI. 
ONLY A FEW CIRRUS AT BEST ACROSS THE MID SOUTH THIS MORNING. MODEL 
SOUNDINGS SHOW SOME RESIDUAL MOISTURE AROUND 850 MB BELOW SUBSIDENCE 
INVERSION AND SOME COLD AIR STRATOCUMULUS MAINLY ALONG AND NORTH OF 
I-44...BUT SUSPECT MOST OF THE MOISTURE WILL MIX OUT ACROSS THE MID 
SOUTH. CURRENT FORECAST ON TRACK WILL NOT ISSUE AN UPDATE UNLESS 
CLOUDS INCREASE MORE THAN ANTICIPATED. 

CJC

.PREV DISCUSSION...ISSUED 222 AM CDT SUN MAY 15 2005...

COLD FRONT HAS SLOWED CONSIDERABLY AND HAS HUNG UP OVER PORTIONS OF
NORTH MISSISSIPPI...NEAR A MSL-TUP-GLH LINE. STILL A FEW SHOWERS OVER
EXTREME SOUTHEAST CORNER OF CWA. MAY NEED TO LINGER THESE INTO THE
FIRST COUPLE OF HOURS OF THE FORECAST. TEMPERATURES RANGE FROM MID
50S NORTH TO MID 60S SOUTH.
&&

.SHORT TERM (THROUGH TUESDAY)...
AFTER FRONT MOVES OUT OF AREA THIS MORNING...NO SIGNIFICANT WEATHER
THROUGH TUESDAY. TEMPERATURES IN GOING FORECAST FOR TODAY LOOK
REASONABLE...WITH A DEGREE OR TWO OF WARMING ON MONDAY. ADDITIONAL
WARMING OF ABOUT 5 OR 6 DEGREES FOR TUESDAY. CLEAR SKIES AND LIGHT
WINDS TONIGHT SHOULD ALLOW TEMPS TO FALL NEAR DEWPOINTS IN NORMALLY
COOLER AREAS. DRY AIRMASS SHOULD ALLOW GROUND TO DRY OUT TODAY...
WHICH SHOULD LESSEN POTENTIAL FOR WIDESPREAD FOG TONIGHT. MINOR
MODERATION IN DEWPOINTS AND FLOW GOING SOUTHEASTERLY SHOULD ALLOW
MINS MONDAY NIGHT TO BE A LITTLE WARMER.
&&

.LONG TERM (AFTER TUESDAY)...
SHORTWAVE RIDGE OVER CENTRAL PORTION OF THE COUNTRY ON TUESDAY
SHOULD BREAK DOWN OVER THE FOLLOWING SEVERAL DAYS. THIS WILL ALLOW A
COLD FRONT TO GET PUSHED THROUGH THE AREA ON THURSDAY. WIND PATTERNS
WILL NOT PERMIT SIGNIFICANT MOISTURE RETURN AHEAD OF THIS FRONT...
SO CURRENT POPS IN FORECAST APPEAR TO BE GOOD. FRIDAY AND SATURDAY
SHOULD BE DRY. MEX GUIDANCE FOR END OF WEEK A LITTLE WARMER THAN
LAST NIGHT. HAVE TRENDED HIGHS UP A COUPLE OF DEGREES...BUT NOT TO
THE EXTENT OF MEX GUIDANCE. RUNNING ABOVE MOST NEIGHBORS ON
TEMPERATURES. STILL QUITE A SPREAD AMONG EXTENDED MODELS...BUT
TEMPERATURES SUPPORTED BY 14/18Z DGEX SOLUTION.
&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.
&&

$$

WAGNER

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 150430
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
1130 PM CDT SAT MAY 14 2005

.DISCUSSION...

FRONT HAS SLOWED CONSIDERABLY OVER THE PAST COUPLE OF HOURS AND HAS
HUNG UP OVER PORTIONS OF NORTHEAST MISSISSIPPI...MAINLY SOUTHEAST
OF TUPELO. HAVE UPDATED FORECAST TO LINGER SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS
OVER THESE AREAS UNTIL AROUND 3 AM. SHOULD SEE RAIN DIMINISH OVER
THESE AREAS AFTER 3 AM...WITH SKIES GRADUALLY BECOMING PARTLY CLOUDY
OVER THESE AREAS BEFORE SUNRISE. UPDATES OUT SHORTLY.


.PREVIOUS DISCUSSION FROM 924 PM...

AT 02Z...SURFACE COLD FRONT WAS STRETCHED ACROSS EXTREME SOUTHERN
PORTIONS OF THE CWA. SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS CONTINUE ALONG AND
JUST BEHIND THE COLD FRONT THIS EVENING. EXPECT THE COLD FRONT TO
CONTINUE TO MOVE FURTHER SOUTHEAST OVERNIGHT. THIS WILL BRING AN END
TO CONVECTION AFTER MIDNIGHT ACROSS SOUTHERN AREAS.

THE BACK EDGE OF THE THICKER CLOUDS NOW EXTENDING ROUGHLY FROM
MARTIN TENNESSEE TO MEMPHIS TENNESSEE TO CLARKSDALE MISSISSIPPI.
EXPECT SKIES TO CONTINUE TO CLEAR FROM THIS LINE EAST OVERNIGHT.

AS FOR TEMPERATURES...KEPT FORECAST LOWS FROM AROUND 50 NORTHWEST
TO UPPER 50S SOUTHEAST. DECENT LOW LEVEL COLD ADVECTION BEHIND THE
FRONT WILL HELP TO FILTER COOLER AIRMASS SOUTHWARD. DEWPOINTS WILL
ALSO CONTINUE TO FALL BEHIND THE FRONT.

HIGH PRESSURE WILL BRING VERY PLEASANT WEATHER TO THE MIDSOUTH ON
SUNDAY...WITH MOSTLY SUNNY SKIES AND TEMPERATURES ABOUT 10 DEGREES
BELOW NORMAL WITH LOW HUMIDITIES.

UPDATED ZONE FORECAST AND GRIDS OUT SHORTLY.

&&

.PREVIOUS DISCUSSION FROM 326 PM...

LATEST SURFACE ANALYSIS PLACES COLD FRONT STRETCHING
FROM LEXINGTON TN TO PINE BLUFF AR. A SECONDARY COLD FRONT WITH A
REINFORCING SHOT OF COOL AIR STRETCHES FROM EASTERN LAKE SUPERIOR TO
THE CENTRAL PLAINS. MAIN FORECAST CONCERN THIS PACKAGE IS ONGOING
SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS ALONG THE COLD FRONT LATE THIS AFTERNOON.

TONIGHT...COLD FRONT WILL CONTINUE TO PROGRESS EAST FROM THE MID
SOUTH. SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS RE-DEVELOPED OVER THE PAST COUPLE
OF HOURS ACROSS SOUTHERN ARKANSAS AND WILL AFFECT THE SOUTHERN ONE
THIRD OF THE AREA TONIGHT. EXPECTING SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS TO
COME TO AN END MOSTLY BY MIDNIGHT ACROSS NORTHERN MISSISSIPPI WITH
ONLY AN ISOLATED HAIL THREAT THIS EVENING WITH THE THUNDERSTORMS.
SKIES WILL CLEAR TONIGHT AS MID/UPPER LEVEL SUBSIDENCE BUILDS DOWN
TOWARD THE SURFACE.

SUNDAY...PLEASANT BUT COOLER DAY EXPECTED AS HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS
INTO THE MID SOUTH. MODEL SOUNDINGS SHOW SOME HIGH BASED
STRATOCUMULUS DEVELOPING ACROSS PORTIONS OF THE FORECAST AREA AS
RESIDUAL LOW LEVEL MOISTURE BECOMES TRAPPED UNDER SUBSIDENCE
INVERSION. HIGHS WILL BE IN THE UPPER 60S TO MIDDLE 70S AS MODIFIED
COOLER AIR FILTERS IN ACROSS THE AREA.

SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY...A WEAK SHORTWAVE EMBEDDED IN NORTHWEST
FLOW WILL AFFECT THE LOWER MISSISSIPPI VALLEY SUNDAY NIGHT AND
MONDAY. HOWEVER...NOT EXPECTING ANY PRECIPITATION WITH THIS FEATURE
AND ONLY CLOUDS WITH LIMITED MOISTURE AND ISENTROPIC DESCENT.
SOUTHERLY FLOW WILL BEGIN TO RETURN TO THE MID SOUTH ON TUESDAY AS
UPPER LEVEL RIDGING BUILDS AND TEMPERATURES GRADUALLY INCREASE.

WEDNESDAY THROUGH SATURDAY...SOME MODEL DISAGREEMENTS IN THE LONG
RANGE FORECAST...ESPECIALLY WITH THE PAST FEW RUNS OF THE EUROPEAN.
GFS/DGEX PRODUCE ZONAL FLOW WITH NW FLOW ACROSS THE EASTERN U.S. 00Z
EUROPEAN HAS STARTED TO TREND TOWARDS THE OTHER SOLUTIONS BUT IS
STILL AN OUTLIER WITH A STRONGER BLOCKING PATTERN ACROSS NORTH
AMERICA. AS A RESULT...WILL LEAN TOWARDS GFS/DGEX SOLUTION.

NORTHERN STREAM TROUGH AND ASSOCIATED SURFACE COLD FRONT WILL DROP
SOUTH FROM THE NORTHERN PLAINS INTO THE MID SOUTH WEDNESDAY NIGHT
AND THURSDAY AND ADDED POPS TO FORECAST. HIGH PRESSURE WILL THEN
BUILD BACK IN ACROSS THE MID SOUTH THROUGH SATURDAY.

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.
&&

$$

CJC/JLH

FXUS64 KMEG 141539
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
1040 AM CDT SAT MAY 14 2005

.DISCUSSION...15Z SURFACE ANALYSIS PLACES COLD FRONT FROM THE OHIO 
VALLEY SOUTHWEST THROUGH THE MISSOURI BOOTHEEL AND CENTRAL ARKANSAS. 
MAIN CONCERN IS CONVECTIVE POTENTIAL THIS AFTERNOON. LATEST RADAR 
TRENDS SHOW CONVECTION MAINLY ACROSS NORTHEAST MISSISSIPPI AND 
MIDDLE TENNESSEE. 12Z MODEL INITIALIZATION NOT HANDLING ONGOING 
CONVECTION WELL RIGHT NOW ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA BUT THINK THAT 
FRONT WILL REACH NORTHEAST MISSISSIPPI BY LATE AFTERNOON. 

VERY MARGINAL SEVERE THREAT WILL BEGIN TO DIMINISH ACROSS THE 
FORECAST AREA AS CONVECTIVE BOUNDARY IS ABOUT TO DEPART NORTHERN 
MISSISSIPPI. WILL ISSUE AN UPDATE BASED UPON CURRENT FORECAST TRENDS.

UPDATE WILL BE OUT SHORTLY.

CJC

.PREV DISCUSSION...ISSUED 243 AM CDT SAT MAY 14 2005...
COLD FRONT NEAR A STL-DFW LINE AT 06Z. LARGE AREA OF CONVECTION
ASSOCIATED WITH THE FRONT...BUT SEVERE POTENTIAL HAS DIMINISHED.
TEMPERATURES UPPER 60S TO LOWER 70S.
&&

.SHORT TERM (THROUGH MONDAY)...
COLD FRONT WILL MOVE THROUGH THE MIDSOUTH DURING THE DAYTIME HOURS
TODAY...CROSSING THE MISSISSIPPI RIVER AROUND 18Z OR SO. WHILE SOME
OF THE CURRENT CONVECTION WILL DIMINISH...EXPECT MOST OF THE AREA TO
SEE SOME PRECIPITATION TODAY...AND WILL GO WITH LIKELY POPS FOR MOST
OF THE AREA.

SEVERE PARAMETERS ARE NOT AS STRONG TODAY AS THEY WERE YESTERDAY...
WHEN THERE WERE ONLY 2 REPORTS. LI OF -3 TO -5 AHEAD OF FRONT...WITH
SURFACE CAPES 1000-1500 J/KG. 700-500 MB LAPSE RATES GENERALLY BELOW
6C/KM. WHILE WE COULD SEE A COUPLE OF SEVERE REPORTS...TIMING OF
CONVECTION AND WEAKER INSTABILITY ARGUE AGAINST MENTIONING IN
ZONES. HAVE LOWERED HIGH TEMPERATURES FOR TODAY A COUPLE OF DEGREES
DUE TO ABUNDANT CLOUD COVER. WILL HOLD LOW POPS IN FOR SOUTHEAST
PORTION OF CWA FOR TONIGHT. SEE LITTLE NEED TO CHANGE TEMPERATURES
FOR TONIGHT.

HIGH PRESSURE MOVES IN FROM GREAT PLAINS FOR SUNDAY AND MONDAY. MUCH
DRIER AND COOLER AIR TO BE CENTERED OVER THE AREA WITH PARTLY TO
MOSTLY SUNNY SKIES. TEMPERATURES AROUND 10 DEGREES BELOW NORMAL FOR
BOTH SUNDAY AND MONDAY.
&&

.LONG TERM (BEYOND MONDAY)...
SURFACE HIGH MOVES OFF TO THE EAST TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY. AS UPPER
RIDGE BUILDS OVER THE 4 CORNERS AREA TOWARD THE END OF THE WEEK...
OUR UPPER FLOW BECOMES NORTHWESTERLY. GFS/DGEX BOTH BRING A
FRONT THROUGH THE AREA ABOUT THURSDAY OR SO. NO REAL RETURN
FLOW...SO MOISTURE WILL BE LACKING. FOR NOW...WILL CONTINUE DRY
EXTENDED FORECAST...BUT MAY NEED TO EVENTUALLY ADD POPS FOR
SOMEWHERE AROUND THURSDAY. HAVE LOWERED SOME MAX TEMPERATURES TOWARD
THE END OF THE WEEK...AS NORTHWEST FLOW WILL BRING IN COOLER AIR.
&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.
&&

$$

WAGNER

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 140245
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
945 PM CDT FRI MAY 13 2005

.DISCUSSION...

PULSE DIURNAL CONVECTION THAT DEVELOPED THIS AFTERNOON AND EARLY
THIS EVENING ACROSS THE MIDSOUTH HAS DIMINISHED WITH THE LOSS OF
DAYTIME HEATING. HAVE REDUCED TO 20 POPS AREAWIDE BEFORE MIDNIGHT...
WITH POPS INCREASED FROM WEST TO EAST AFTER MIDNIGHT.

UPPER TROUGH AXIS TO OUR WEST TONIGHT WILL CONTINUE TO MOVE EAST AND
ACROSS THE REGION TOMORROW. THIS WILL HELP TO DRAG A COLD FRONT NOW
STRETCHED FROM THE GREAT LAKES ACROSS THE CENTRAL PLAINS STATES
THIS EVENING...SLOWLY ACROSS THE MIDSOUTH ON SATURDAY. CONVECTION
CONTINUES TO DEVELOP OVER PARTS OF NORTHERN ARKANSAS AND SOUTHERN
MISSOURI THIS EVENING IN ADVANCE OF THIS WEATHER SYSTEM. EXPECT
THIS ACTIVITY TO SPREAD EAST AND DEVELOP OVER OUR AREA LATER TONIGHT
AND CONTINUE INTO SATURDAY.

UPDATES TO THE ZONE FORECAST AND GRIDS OUT SHORTLY.

-JLH

.PREVIOUS DISCUSSION FROM 332 PM...

SURFACE ANALYSIS THIS AFTERNOON PLACES STATIONARY FRONT ACROSS THE
OHIO VALLEY...LOW PRESSURE CENTERED CENTRAL IOWA...AND A COLD FRONT
EXTENDING FROM THE LOW INTO THE CENTRAL PLAINS. ACROSS THE MID
SOUTH...AN INSTABILITY AXIS HAS PRODUCED SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS
PRIMARILY ALONG AND EAST OF THE MISSISSIPPI RIVER DELTA. MAIN
FORECAST CONCERN THIS PACKAGE IS CONVECTIVE CHANCES TONIGHT INTO
SATURDAY.

COLD FRONT WILL BEGIN TO PROGRESS TOWARDS THE MID SOUTH TONIGHT.
BETTER MODERATE LAPSE RATES 6.5 C/KM WILL REMAIN OFF WEST OF I-55
TONIGHT. THINK THAT THUNDERSTORMS WILL BE MOSTLY ELEVATED ACROSS THE
FORECAST AREA TONIGHT AS SURFACE LAYER BEGINS TO STABILIZE. AN
ISOLATED SEVERE THUNDERSTORM IS POSSIBLE BUT THINK THAT MOST IF NOT
ALL WILL REMAIN BELOW SEVERE LIMITS. COLD FRONT WILL PASS THROUGH
THE FORECAST AREA SATURDAY AFTERNOON/SATURDAY EVENING. ADDITIONAL
SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS WILL DEVELOP AS MID LEVEL TROUGH MOVES
ACROSS THE LOWER MISSISSIPPI VALLEY. SEVERE POTENTIAL WILL BE
LIMITED BY AMOUNT OF DAYTIME INSTABILITY AVAILABLE AND WEAK WIND
PROFILES ALOFT AS BETTER MID LEVEL FORCING WILL BE CONFINED TO THE
GREAT LAKES REGION AND OHIO VALLEY. HIGH PRESSURE WILL BUILD INTO THE
AREA ON SUNDAY AND CONTINUE INTO NEXT WEEK AS UPPER LEVEL RIDGING
BUILDS IN ACROSS THE SOUTHERN PLAINS AND LOWER MISSISSIPPI
VALLEY.

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.

&&

$$

FXUS64 KMEG 132032
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
332 PM CDT FRI MAY 13 2005

.DISCUSSION...SURFACE ANALYSIS THIS AFTERNOON PLACES STATIONARY 
FRONT ACROSS THE OHIO VALLEY...LOW PRESSURE CENTERED CENTRAL 
IOWA...AND A COLD FRONT EXTENDING FROM THE LOW INTO THE CENTRAL 
PLAINS. ACROSS THE MID SOUTH...AN INSTABILITY AXIS HAS PRODUCED 
SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS PRIMARILY ALONG AND EAST OF THE 
MISSISSIPPI RIVER DELTA. MAIN FORECAST CONCERN THIS PACKAGE IS 
CONVECTIVE CHANCES TONIGHT INTO SATURDAY. 

COLD FRONT WILL BEGIN TO PROGRESS TOWARDS THE MID SOUTH TONIGHT. 
BETTER MODERATE LAPSE RATES 6.5 C/KM WILL REMAIN OFF WEST OF I-55 
TONIGHT. THINK THAT THUNDERSTORMS WILL BE MOSTLY ELEVATED ACROSS THE 
FORECAST AREA TONIGHT AS SURFACE LAYER BEGINS TO STABILIZE. AN 
ISOLATED SEVERE THUNDERSTORM IS POSSIBLE BUT THINK THAT MOST IF NOT 
ALL WILL REMAIN BELOW SEVERE LIMITS. COLD FRONT WILL PASS THROUGH 
THE FORECAST AREA SATURDAY AFTERNOON/SATURDAY EVENING. ADDITIONAL 
SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS WILL DEVELOP AS MID LEVEL TROUGH MOVES 
ACROSS THE LOWER MISSISSIPPI VALLEY. SEVERE POTENTIAL WILL BE 
LIMITED BY AMOUNT OF DAYTIME INSTABILITY AVAILABLE AND WEAK WIND 
PROFILES ALOFT AS BETTER MID LEVEL FORCING WILL BE CONFINED TO THE 
GREAT LAKES REGION AND OHIO VALLEY. HIGH PRESSURE WILL BUILD INTO THE 
AREA ON SUNDAY AND CONTINUE INTO NEXT WEEK AS UPPER LEVEL RIDGING 
BUILDS IN ACROSS THE SOUTHERN PLAINS AND LOWER MISSISSIPPI 
VALLEY.

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 131430
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
930 AM CDT FRI MAY 13 2005

.DISCUSSION...LATEST VISIBLE SATELLITE IMAGERY SHOWS SOME AC ACROSS 
AREAS ALONG AND WEST OF THE MISSISSIPPI RIVER THIS MORNING. 88D 
REGIONAL RADAR SHOW ISOLATED CONVECTION MOVING ACROSS THE MISSOURI 
BOOTHEEL THIS MORNING IN RESPONSE TO A SHORTWAVE MOVING ACROSS THE 
MISSOURI VALLEY. SHORT TERM MODEL SOUNDINGS SHOW SURFACE BASED CAPES 
BEGINNING TO INCREASE TO AT OR ABOVE 2000 J/KG BY MID DAY...LI/S 
INCREASING TO -5...AND WEAK WINDS ALOFT. AS A RESULT...PULSE 
SHOWERS/THUNDERSTORMS WILL BE THE MODE OF CONVECTION DURING THE DAY. 
WILL ISSUE AN UPDATE TO ADJUST PRECIPITATION TIMING ACROSS THE 
FORECAST AREA BASED ON CURRENT TRENDS. 

UPDATE WILL BE OUT SHORTLY.  

CJC

.PREV DISCUSSION...ISSUED 317 AM CDT FRI MAY 13 2005...

COLD FRONT FROM NEAR OMA TO OK PANHANDLE AT 07Z...WITH OUTFLOW
BOUNDARY FROM CONVECTION NEAR INTERSTATE 44 IN MISSOURI. MID-SOUTH
IN WEAK SOUTHERLY FLOW WITH TEMPERATURES RANGING FROM LOWER 60S TO
LOWER 70S.
&&

.SHORT TERM (THROUGH SUNDAY)...
UPPER LEVEL RIDGING WILL BREAK DOWN AS HIGH PRESSURE MOVES OFF
TOWARDS THE CAROLINA COAST. A WEAK RIPPLE IN SOUTHWEST FLOW ALOFT MAY
ASSIST IN PROVIDING ENOUGH LIFT TO PRODUCE SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS
ACROSS THE MID SOUTH.

TODAYS MODEL SOUNDINGS OFF GFS MODEL AGAIN LOOK TO BE A LITTLE TOO
MOIST AT THE SURFACE...AS HAS BEEN THE CASE MUCH OF THIS SPRING. THIS
GIVES INDICES THAT ARE A LITTLE TOO ROBUST FOR WHAT IS ACTUALLY
EXPECTED. GFS WOULD HAVE SURFACE DEWPOINTS NEAR 70...WHERE MID 60S
MUCH MORE REASONABLE..AND THAT COULD EVEN BE A LITTLE TOO HIGH. NAM
SOUNDINGS A LITTLE MORE REASONABLE BOTH TODAY AND TONIGHT...AT LEAST
FROM A MOISTURE STANDPOINT. BEST INSTABILITY AND CAPE ARE THIS
MORNING...BEFORE WE HAVE ANY ORGANIZED LIFT. 700-500MB LAYER MID
LEVEL LAPSE RATES GENERALLY LESS THAN 6 C/KM...2000 J/KG SURFACE
BASED CAPE...LI/S -3 TO -5...AND WEAK WINDS ALOFT SUGGEST MODE OF
CONVECTION AGAIN WILL BE OF THE ISOLATED PULSE VARIETY. 850 MB
TEMPERATURES AROUND 16-17C WILL PRODUCE HIGHS IN THE MIDDLE 80S TO
AROUND 90 ACROSS THE MID SOUTH...ABOUT 3-5 DEGREES COOLER THAN
THURSDAY.

TONIGHT AND SATURDAY...NEARLY STATIONARY COLD FRONT WILL FINALLY
BEGIN TO MOVE TOWARDS THE FORECAST AREA TONIGHT. NOT VERY IMPRESSED
SEVERE POTENTIAL ACROSS THE MID SOUTH. BETTER MID LEVEL DYNAMICAL
FORCING WILL REMAIN UP ACROSS THE MIDDLE AND UPPER MISSISSIPPI
VALLEY. IN ADDITION 700-500 MB LAYER LAPSE RATES WILL BE AT OR BELOW
6 C/KM...EVEN WITH 2000 J/KG OF CAPE...AND LI/S AROUND -5. TIMING OF
MAIN CONVECTION WILL BE IN THE 06Z-12Z TIMEFRAME. THIS IS ANOTHER
ARGUMENT AGAINST SEVERE THREAT. WHILE SPC HITTING NORTHWEST CORNER OF
CWA WITH POTENTIAL SEVERE TONIGHT AND WEST TENNESSEE FOR SATURDAY...
DO NOT FEEL THAT WIDESPREAD WEATHER IS LIKELY. SATURDAY MAXES
DEPENDING ON CLOUD COVER...MAY NOT MAKE 80 DEGREES.

SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY NIGHT...PRECIPITATION EXITING ENTIRE
CWA BY MIDNIGHT SATURDAY NIGHT...WITH CLEARING AND DRYING BEHIND
FRONT. TEMPERATURES SUNDAY WILL BE 15 DEGREES COOLER THAN THOSE
WE SAW ON THURSDAY...MID TO UPPER 70S MOST AREAS.
&&

.LONG TERM (AFTER SUNDAY)...
RIDGE REBUILDS OVER THE MIDDLE OF THE COUNTRY EARLY IN THE
WORKWEEK...AND CONTROLS THE WEATHER FOR MUCH OF THE WEEK. ANY MAJOR
IMPULSES THAT COULD BRING CLUSTERS OF THUNDERSTORMS APPEAR TO STAY
NORTH OF OUR AREA. ENTIRE EXTENDED PERIOD WILL BE A DRY FORECAST.
TEMPERATURES WILL BE COOLER THAN NORMAL ON MONDAY...WARMING TO
SLIGHTLY ABOVE NORMAL FOR WEDNESDAY THROUGH FRIDAY.
&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.

&&

$$

WAGNER







