000 
FXUS64 KMEG 130122 AAA
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
822 PM CDT THU MAY 12 2005

.UPDATE...
AFTERNOON CONVECTION IS QUICKLY DISSIPATING AND IS JUST ABOUT GONE
WITH LOSS OF DAYTIME HEATING. WILL UPDATE TO REMOVE SHOWERS /
THUNDERSTORMS FROM THE FORECAST FOR TONIGHT. THERE REMAINS SOME
CIRRUS BLOWUP...BUT THINK THIS WILL THIN OUT DURING THE NIGHT
LEAVING MOSTLY CLEAR TO PARTLY CLOUDY SKIES. UPPER LEVEL RIDGE WILL
DOMINATE OUR WEATHER TONIGHT. FORECAST LOWS LOOK FINE.

.PREV DISCUSSION...
ISSUED 332 PM CDT THU MAY 12 2005

LATEST VISIBLE SATELLITE SHOWS 5-6 KFT DIURNAL CU/AC HAS FORMED
ACROSS THE MID SOUTH THIS AFTERNOON. 88D RADAR TRENDS FROM KNQA/KGWX
INDICATE ISOLATED THUNDERSTORMS HAVE REMAINED BELOW SEVERE LIMITS
ACROSS A PORTION OF WESTERN TENNESSEE AND NORTHEAST MISSISSIPPI. MAIN
CONCERN THIS FORECAST PACKAGE IS CONVECTIVE POTENTIAL THROUGH
SATURDAY.

TONIGHT...DIURNAL CONVECTION RESULTING FROM HEAT AND INSTABILITY
SHOULD BEGIN TO DIMINISH BY SUNSET ACROSS AREAS ALONG AND EAST OF A
SAVANNAH TO NEW ALBANY LINE. ANOTHER WARM NIGHT EXPECTED AS
TEMPERATURES WILL DROP INTO THE MIDDLE 60S TO AROUND 70.

FRIDAY...UPPER LEVEL RIDGING WILL BREAK DOWN AS HIGH PRESSURE MOVES
OFF TOWARDS THE CAROLINA COAST. A WEAK RIPPLE IN SOUTHWEST FLOW
ALOFT MAY ASSIST IN PROVIDING ENOUGH LIFT TO PRODUCE SHOWERS AND
THUNDERSTORMS ACROSS THE MID SOUTH. MODERATE 700-500MB LAYER MID
LEVEL LAPSE RATES AROUND 6.5 C/KM...2000 J/KG SURFACE BASED
CAPE...LI/S AROUND -6/-7...AND WEAK WINDS ALOFT SUGGEST MODE OF
CONVECTION AGAIN WILL BE OF THE PULSE VARIETY. 850 MB TEMPERATURES
AROUND 16-17C WILL PRODUCE HIGHS IN THE MIDDLE 80S TO AROUND 90
ACROSS THE MID SOUTH.

FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY...NEARLY STATIONARY COLD FRONT WILL
FINALLY BEGIN TO MOVE TOWARDS THE FORECAST AREA BY FRIDAY NIGHT. NOT
THAT IMPRESSED SEVERE POTENTIAL ACROSS THE MID SOUTH. BETTER MID
LEVEL DYNAMICAL FORCING WILL REMAIN UP ACROSS THE MIDDLE AND UPPER
MISSISSIPPI VALLEY. IN ADDITION 700-500 MB LAYER LAPSE RATES WILL BE
AT OR BELOW 6 C/KM...EVEN WITH 1500 J/KG OF CAPE...AND LI/S AROUND
-4. COLD FRONT WILL MAKE PROGRESS ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA ON
SATURDAY WITH PRECIPITATION COMING TO AN END BY SATURDAY EVENING AS
HIGH PRESSURE RETURNS WITH NORMAL TEMPERATURES BACK TO THE REGION.

MONDAY THROUGH THURSDAY...LONG RANGE MODELS ALL SHOW UPPER LEVEL
RIDGING RETURNING ACROSS THE LOWER MISSISSIPPI VALLEY NEXT WEEK BUT
SOME DIFFERENCES EXIST BY MID WEEK AS MODELS DISAGREE ON AMOUNT OF
MID LEVEL AMPLIFICATION ACROSS THE U.S. 00Z EUROPEAN SOLUTION A BIT
MORE AMPLIFIED THAN GFS AND DGEX. WILL KEEP FORECAST DRY FOR NOW AS
PROBABILITIES REMAIN TOO LOW AT THIS TIME TO ADD POPS IN FOR DIURNAL
SHOWERS/THUNDERSTORMS.

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.

&&

$$





000 
FXUS64 KMEG 121642
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
1145 AM CDT THU MAY 12 2005

.DISCUSSION...12Z SURFACE AND UPPER AIR ANALYSIS THIS MORNING SHOWS 
SURFACE AND UPPER LEVEL RIDGING ACROSS THE SOUTHEAST UNITED STATES. 
850 MB TEMPERATURES AROUND 17C ON KLZK SOUNDING THIS MORNING SUPPORT 
HIGHS IN THE UPPER 80S TO LOWER 90S. SURFACE TEMPERATURES ALREADY A 
COUPLE OF DEGREES HIGHER THAN YESTERDAY AND WOULD NOT BE SURPRISED 
TO SEE AT LEAST ONE OF THE TEMPERATURE RECORDS TIED OR BROKEN AT THE 
OBSERVATION SITES. MOST AREAS SHOULD STAY DRY THIS AFTERNOON WITH 
WEAK SURFACE AND UPPER LEVEL RIDGING IN PLACE. LATEST 88D TRENDS 
FROM KNQA/KGWX SHOW ISOLATED CONVECTION BEGINNING TO DEVELOP ACROSS 
THE EASTERN EDGE OF THE FORECAST AREA MAINLY ALONG AND EAST OF A 
LINE FROM SAVANNAH TO RIPLEY. STABILITY PARAMETERS INDICATE 3000 
J/KG CAPE...LI/S AROUND -8...HIGH FREEZING LEVELS...AND WEAK UPPER 
LEVEL WINDS. AS A RESULT...EXPECTING CONVECTION TO REMAIN AS PULSE 
TYPE AND BELOW SEVERE LIMITS. IN ADDITION...MODEL SOUNDINGS 
INDICATE SOME HIGH BASED DIURNAL CUMULUS MAY DEVELOP THIS AFTERNOON. 
WILL MONITOR CONVECTIVE TRENDS THIS AFTERNOON BUT THINK CONVECTION 
WILL REMAIN MOSTLY ACROSS AREAS CURRENTLY BEING AFFECTED.

UPDATED GRIDS WILL BE OUT SHORTLY.

CJC

HIGH TEMPERATURE RECORDS FOR THURSDAY 05/12/2005...            
HIGH        DATE    NORMAL
MEMPHIS     91          1880    79
JACKSON, TN 92          1962    78
JONESBORO   92          1902    78
TUPELO      92          1963    80

.PREV DISCUSSION...ISSUED 200 AM CDT THU MAY 12 2005...

MIDSOUTH EXPERIENCING ANOTHER QUIET NIGHT AS UPPER RIDGE CONTINUES 
TO BE IN PLACE OVER THE CWA. THE RIDGE WILL CONTINUE TO DOMINATE THE 
WEATHER THROUGH FRIDAY. THIS WILL CONTINUE TO BRING ABOVE NORMAL 
TEMPERATURES AND DRY CONDITIONS TO THE AREA. SKIES WILL REMAIN PARTLY 
CLOUDY DURING THE DAY AND MOSTLY CLEAR AT NIGHT. EXPECT HIGHS TO 
REACH NEAR 90 DEGREES AGAIN THIS AFTERNOON. FRIDAY WILL BE A TAD 
COOLER AS RIDGE WILL SHIFT FURTHER EAST. EXPECT A LITTLE MORE CLOUD 
COVER AND ISOLATED SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS TO DEVELOP DURING THE 
AFTERNOON AND EVENING HOURS.

BY LATE FRIDAY NIGHT...A COLD FRONT WILL BEGIN TO PUSH INTO THE CWA. 
THE FRONT WILL BRING BETTER CHANCES FOR SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS TO 
THE AREA. SATURDAY WILL BE THE BEST CHANCE FOR RAIN AS THE FRONT 
PUSHES THROUGH MUCH OF THE CWA. EXPECT FRONT TO LINGER ACROSS 
SOUTHEASTERN PORTIONS OF THE CWA SATURDAY EVENING.

BEHIND THE FRONT...HIGH PRESSURE WILL BUILD INTO THE MIDSOUTH AND 
WILL BRING COOLER BUT DRY CONDITIONS BACK TO THE AREA. THE HIGH WILL 
DOMINATE THE WEATHER THROUGH THE END OF THE FORECAST PERIOD. EXPECT 
TEMPERATURES TO BE SLIGHTLY BELOW SUNDAY AND MONDAY WITH HIGHS IN 
THE LOWER TO MID 70S AND LOWS IN THE 50S. BY TUESDAY...HIGHS WILL 
REACH BACK INTO THE 80S AND LOWS IN THE 60S.

KRM
&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.

&&

$$

FXUS64 KMEG 121548
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
1050 AM CDT THU MAY 12 2005

.DISCUSSION...12Z SURFACE AND UPPER AIR ANALYSIS THIS MORNING SHOWS 
SURFACE AND UPPER LEVEL RIDGING ACROSS THE SOUTHEAST UNITED STATES. 
850 MB TEMPERATURES AROUND 17C ON KLZK SOUNDING THIS MORNING SUPPORT 
HIGHS IN THE UPPER 80S TO LOWER 90S. SURFACE TEMPERATURES ALREADY A 
COUPLE OF DEGREES HIGHER THAN YESTERDAY AND WOULD NOT BE SURPRISED 
TO SEE AT LEAST ONE OF THE TEMPERATURE RECORDS TIED OR BROKEN AT THE 
OBSERVATION SITES. NOT EXPECTING ANY PRECIPITATION THIS AFTERNOON 
WITH UPPER LEVEL RIDGE STILL IN PLACE. MODEL SOUNDINGS INDICATE SOME 
HIGH BASED DIURNAL CUMULUS MAY DEVELOP THIS AFTERNOON. CURRENT 
FORECAST GRIDS ON TRACK...AND DO NOT PLAN TO ISSUE AN UPDATE AT THIS 
TIME.

CJC

HIGH TEMPERATURE RECORDS FOR THURSDAY 05/12/2005...
            HIGH        DATE    NORMAL
MEMPHIS     91          1880    79
JACKSON, TN 92          1962    78
JONESBORO   92          1902    78
TUPELO      92          1963    80

.PREV DISCUSSION...ISSUED 200 AM CDT THU MAY 12 2005...

MIDSOUTH EXPERIENCING ANOTHER QUIET NIGHT AS UPPER RIDGE CONTINUES 
TO BE IN PLACE OVER THE CWA. THE RIDGE WILL CONTINUE TO DOMINATE THE 
WEATHER THROUGH FRIDAY. THIS WILL CONTINUE TO BRING ABOVE NORMAL 
TEMPERATURES AND DRY CONDITIONS TO THE AREA. SKIES WILL REMAIN PARTLY 
CLOUDY DURING THE DAY AND MOSTLY CLEAR AT NIGHT. EXPECT HIGHS TO 
REACH NEAR 90 DEGREES AGAIN THIS AFTERNOON. FRIDAY WILL BE A TAD 
COOLER AS RIDGE WILL SHIFT FURTHER EAST. EXPECT A LITTLE MORE CLOUD 
COVER AND ISOLATED SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS TO DEVELOP DURING THE 
AFTERNOON AND EVENING HOURS.

BY LATE FRIDAY NIGHT...A COLD FRONT WILL BEGIN TO PUSH INTO THE CWA. 
THE FRONT WILL BRING BETTER CHANCES FOR SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS TO 
THE AREA. SATURDAY WILL BE THE BEST CHANCE FOR RAIN AS THE FRONT 
PUSHES THROUGH MUCH OF THE CWA. EXPECT FRONT TO LINGER ACROSS 
SOUTHEASTERN PORTIONS OF THE CWA SATURDAY EVENING.

BEHIND THE FRONT...HIGH PRESSURE WILL BUILD INTO THE MIDSOUTH AND 
WILL BRING COOLER BUT DRY CONDITIONS BACK TO THE AREA. THE HIGH WILL 
DOMINATE THE WEATHER THROUGH THE END OF THE FORECAST PERIOD. EXPECT 
TEMPERATURES TO BE SLIGHTLY BELOW SUNDAY AND MONDAY WITH HIGHS IN 
THE LOWER TO MID 70S AND LOWS IN THE 50S. BY TUESDAY...HIGHS WILL 
REACH BACK INTO THE 80S AND LOWS IN THE 60S.

KRM

FXUS64 KMEG 111923
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
225 PM CDT WED MAY 11 2005

.DISCUSSION...
LARGE UPPER LEVEL RIDGE WL CONT TO DOMINATE THE WEATHER PATTERN 
THROUGH THU NIGHT. WARM AND HUMID CONDS ACRS THE MID SOUTH WL CONT 
THROUGH THE END OF THE WEEK WITH AFTN HIGH NEARING 90 AND LOWS IN 
THE 60S. 

TONIGHT...CU WL DISSIPATE LEAVING MOSTLY CLEAR SKIES AND LIGHT 
WINDS. EXPECT A MILD NIGHT THANKS TO SFC DEWPOINTS IN THE 60S. 

THU AND THU NIGHT...ANOTHER WARM DAY IN STORE WITH RIDGE OVERHEAD. 
EXPECT TEMPS TO CLOSE IN ON 90 ONCE AGAIN WITH DEWPOINTS IN THE 60S 
AND LIGHT SOUTHERLY WINDS. MOSTLY SUNNY IN THE MORNING FOLLOWED BY 
SCT CU IN THE AFTN. RIDGE BEGINNING TO SLIDE TO THE EAST THU NIGHT 
SO PERHAPS THERE WL BE A LITTLE MORE MID/HIGH CLOUDINESS. LIGHT 
SOUTHERLY FLOW AND SFC DEWPOINTS CONTINUING IN THE 60S WL RESULT IN 
ANOTHER MILD NIGHT. 

FRI...BY 00Z SAT UPPER RIDGE WL BE CENTERED OF THE SE U.S. COAST 
WITH UPPER TROF AND ASSOCD CDFNT MOVING INTO THE CNTRL PLAINS. WITH 
RIDGE BREAKING DOWN ACRS THE REGION AND DECENT INSTABILITY EXPECT 
ISOLATE THUNDERSTORMS FRI AFTN.

FRI NIGHT THROUGH SAT NIGHT...COLD FRONT WL ENTER NE AR EARLY SAT 
MORNING AND PUSH THROUGH THE REGION DURING THE DAY. THIS FRONT LOOKS 
WEAK WITH LITTLE UPPER SUPPORT. BOTH INSTABILITY AND SHEAR 
APPEARS TO BE MARGINAL SO SEVERE WEATHER NOT ANTICIPATED ATTM. 
CURRENT 50 POPS FOR SAT LOOKS GOOD. EXPECT PRECIP CHANCES TO 
DECREASE SAT NIGHT AS HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS IN.

EXTENDED...COOL HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS IN WITH A MUCH DRIER AIRMASS 
FOR SUN INTO NEXT WEEK. EXPECT HIGHS IN THE 70S WITH LOWS IN THE 50S 
SUN AND MON. BY TUE THE SFC RIDGE WL SLIP EAST AND SOUTHERLY FLOW WL 
RETURN ALONG WITH HIGHER DEWPOINTS AND CLIMBING TEMPS. 

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.

&&

$$

SJM






000 
FXUS64 KMEG 111633
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
1133 AM CDT WED MAY 11 2005

.UPDATE...
FORECAST ON TRACK NO UPDATES PLANNED.

.PREV DISCUSSION ISSUED AT 200 AM...
UPPER RIDGE WILL DOMINATE THE WEATHER THROUGH THURSDAY NIGHT. THIS 
WILL BRING ABOVE NORMAL TEMPERATURES AND DRY CONDITIONS TO THE 
MIDSOUTH. SKIES WILL REMAIN MOSTLY CLEAR TO PARTLY CLOUDY DURING 
THIS TIME. EXPECT HIGHS TO REACH INTO THE LOWER 90S ACROSS MUCH OF 
THE CWA THIS AFTERNOON. HIGH TEMPERATURE RECORDS IN MEM...JBR...AND 
MKL COULD BE IN JEOPARDY. EXPECT A LITTLE MORE CLOUDS OVER THE AREA 
ON THURSDAY WHICH MAY KEEP TEMPERATURES A TAD BIT COOLER THAN TODAY 
BUT STILL EXPECT HIGHS IN THE UPPER 80S TO NEAR 90.

BY FRIDAY...THE RIDGE WILL SHIFT EAST. THIS WILL ALLOW ISOLATED TO 
SCATTERED SUMMERTIME SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS TO DEVELOP FRIDAY 
AFTERNOON AND EVENING. 

A COLD FRONT WILL BEGIN TO MOVE INTO NORTHWESTERN SECTIONS OF THE 
CWA LATE FRIDAY NIGHT. THIS WILL BRING BETTER CHANCES FOR PRECIP TO 
THE AREA. THE BETTER CHANCES FOR RAIN WILL CONTINUE INTO SATURDAY AS 
THE FRONT PUSHES THROUGH MOST OF THE CWA. EXPECT SHOWERS AND 
THUNDERSTORMS TO LINGER INTO SATURDAY NIGHT ACROSS SOUTHEASTERN 
PORTIONS OF THE CWA. 

BEHIND THE FRONT...COOLER AIR WILL FILTER INTO THE REGION AS HIGH 
PRESSURE BUILDS INTO THE MIDSOUTH. HIGH AND LOW TEMPERATURES WILL BE 
NEAR NORMAL DURING THIS TIME.
&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.
&&

$$

KRM/SJM

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 110120
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
819 PM CDT TUE MAY 10 2005

.UPDATE...
TRANQUIL NIGHT ACROSS THE MIDSOUTH. LARGE SCALE RIDGE AXIS IS
STRETCHES JUST TO THE WEST OF OUR AREA THIS EVENING. OTHER THAN A FEW
LINGERING CLOUDS...SATELLITE INDICATES MOSTLY CLEAR SKIES ACROSS
THE MIDSOUTH...WHICH WILL PERSIST THROUGH THE NIGHT. WILL UPDATE SKY
GRIDS. OTHERWISE CURRENT FORECAST / GRIDS ARE FINE.

.PREV DISCUSSION...
ISSUED 305 PM CDT TUE MAY 10 2005

DRY CONDITIONS ARE EXPECTED TO PREVAIL THROUGH MUCH OF TONIGHT
THROUGH FRIDAY NIGHT. ABUNDANT LOW LEVEL MOISTURE ACROSS THE REGION
CAN FELT WITH THE HIGHER DEW POINTS AND SCT/BKN CU FIELD. ISOLATED
STORMS HAVE DEVELOPED IN NORTHWESTERN ALABAMA THIS AFTERNOON.
SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE WAS ANCHORED OVER THE SOUTHEAST U.S.

THE UPPER LEVEL RIDGE AXIS OVER THE MIDWEST WILL TRANSLATE SLOWLY
EASTWARD TONIGHT. THIS WILL CAUSE NEAR RECORD WARMTH FOR MUCH OF THE
AREA WITH MAXIMUM TEMPERATURES REACHING NEAR 90 DEGREES. SOME HIGH
CLOUDS WILL ALSO ADVANCE INTO THE REGION TOMORROW BUT THEY SHOULD BE
THIN ENOUGH TO ALLOW MAX TEMPS TO REACH NEAR 90.

THE UPPER RIDGE WILL BREAK DOWN AND MOVE FARTHER EAST FRIDAY NIGHT
AS THE NEXT SYSTEM BEGINS TO AFFECT THE REGION SATURDAY.

A SHORTWAVE WILL BE APPROACHING THE MID SOUTH SATURDAY...AND IT WILL
BE FOLLOWED QUICKLY BY A WEAKER WAVE ON SUNDAY. RIDGING WILL TAKE
PLACE OVER THE AREA...AS AN UPPER LOW DEVELOPS OVER THE DEEP SOUTH
JUST NORTH OF THE GULF COAST. AT THE SURFACE...A BROAD AREA OF LOW
PRESSURE OVER THE OHIO RIVER VALLEY WILL BRING SCATTERED SHOWERS AND
THUNDERSTORMS TO THE MID SOUTH SATURDAY AND SATURDAY NIGHT. DRY
WEATHER WILL SETTLE IN ACROSS THE AREA SUNDAY THROUGH MONDAY.
TEMPERATURES WILL BE JUST BELOW NORMAL FOR LOWS AND CLOSE TO NORMAL
FOR HIGHS SATURDAY AND SUNDAY...WITH A SMALL WARM UP IN STORE MONDAY
WITH THE DRY AIR.

MUCH THANKS TO LZK.

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.
&&

$$

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
ISSUED BY NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
1035 AM CDT TUE MAY 10 2005

.DISCUSSION...
SATELLITE IMAGERY INDICATES AN A AREA OF LOW CLOUDS OVER CENTRAL AND 
SOUTHWEST SECTIONS OF THE FORECAST AREA...SLOWLY DECREASING IN COVERAGE.  
NEAR TERM FORECASTS APPEAR ON TRACK...BUT WILL CONTINUE TO MONITOR TEMPERATURE 
TRENDS

LZK/55


&&

.PREV DISCUSSION... 
ISSUED 215 AM CDT TUE MAY 10 2005

DISCUSSION...
SATELLITE IMAGES SHOW ONLY A FEW HIGH CLOUDS STREAMING ACROSS 
PORTIONS OF WEST TENNESSEE THIS MORNING. AN UPPER RIDGE WILL BUILD 
OVER THE MIDSOUTH BY TONIGHT. THE RIDGE WILL CONTROL THE WEATHER 
THROUGH THURSDAY NIGHT. THIS WILL BRING SEVERAL WARMER THAN NORMAL 
DAYS AS WELL AS DRY CONDITIONS TO THE AREA DURING THIS TIME. EXPECT 
PARTLY CLOUDY DAYS AND MOSTLY CLEAR NIGHTS AS CU WILL DEVELOP DURING 
THE AFTERNOON AND WILL DISSIPATE BY EVENING. THE EXCEPTION MAY BE ON 
WEDNESDAY AS FEWER CU MAY DEVELOP IN THE AFTERNOON TO BE ABLE TO GO 
WITH MOSTLY SUNNY WORDING.

BY FRIDAY...CLOUDS WILL BEGIN TO INCREASE AHEAD OF AN APPROACHING 
COLD FRONT. A FEW ISOLATED SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS MAY DEVELOP 
ACROSS THE AREA FRIDAY AFTERNOON BUT EXPECT THE BULK OF THE PRECIP 
CHANCES TO OCCUR FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY EVENING WITH THE 
PASSAGE OF THE FRONT. 

BEHIND THE FRONT...HIGH PRESSURE WILL BUILD INTO THE CWA THROUGH THE 
END OF THE FORECAST PERIOD. THIS WILL BRING DRY CONDITIONS WITH NEAR 
NORMAL TEMPERATURES BACK TO THE MIDSOUTH.

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 100127
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
827 PM CDT MON MAY 9 2005

.UPDATE...
WILL UPDATE FORECAST / GRIDS TO REMOVE CHANCE OF SHOWERS AND
THUNDERSTORMS FOR THE REMAINDER OF TONIGHT. EARLIER CONVECTION HAS
DISSIPATED WITH SUNSET. 00Z 500 MB ANALYSIS INDICATES UPPER LEVEL
TROUGH LOCATED THROUGH THE EASTERN HALF OF THE MIDSOUTH. CAN NOT
TOTALLY RULE OUT A SHOWER OR THUNDERSTORM POPPING UP AS THIS TROUGH
CONTINUES MOVING EAST...BUT DO NOT THINK PROBABILITY IS HIGH ENOUGH
TO MENTION IN THE FORECAST. OTHERWISE MOSTLY JUST CIRRUS IS BEING
OBSERVED...AND SATELLITE INDICATES THIS IS THINNING SOME. REMAINDER
OF THE FORECAST IS ON TRACK.

.PREV DISCUSSION...
ISSUED 303 PM CDT MON MAY 9 2005

AN UPPER LEVEL VORT IS MOVING INTO EASTERN ARKANSAS THIS AFTERNOON.
SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS HAVE DEVELOPED IN THE DRY SLOT AS SEEN ON
WATER VAPOR OVER MS. A LINE OF STORMS ASSOCIATED WITH AN UPPER LEVEL
SHORTWAVE EXTENDING NORTH OF THE VORT IS PRESENT OVER MISSOURI.
ALSO...THERE IS SOME SCATTERED LIGHT RAIN SHOWERS OVER CENTRAL
ARKANSAS ASSOCIATED WITH THE VORT ITSELF.

EXPECT THAT THE ACTIVITY OVER MS WILL BE ABOUT TO MOVE INTO ALABAMA
BY 00Z. MOST OF THE ENERGY ASSOCIATED WITH THE CONVECTION OVER MO
WILL LIKELY STAY JUST NORTH OF THE REGION. SO THIS LEAVES THE LIGHT
RAIN SHOWERS OVER CENTRAL ARKANSAS THAT WILL MOVE THROUGH THIS
EVENING...RESULTING IN LOW CHANCES OF MEASURABLE RAIN. THE SLIGHT
RISK FOR SEVERE THUNDERSTORMS WILL CONTINUE INTO THE EVENING WITH
THE THREAT MAINLY IN THE FORM OF HAIL. THE INSTABILITY HAS BEEN
INCREASING THIS AFTERNOON WITH LIS OVER CENTRAL ARKANSAS AROUND -4
AND CAPE OF 1500 J/KG. THIS INSTABILITY WILL LIKELY MOVE EASTWARD.
SO ITS POSSIBLE THAT A STORM OR TWO COULD REACH SEVERE LIMITS.

GREAT INSTABILITY CONTINUES INTO TUESDAY WITH CAPE GREATER THAN
3000J/KG AND LIS AROUND -6. THE PROBLEM IS THAT THE UPPER RIDGE WILL
BE BUILDING OVER THE AREA AND THERE IS NO TRIGGER. SUPPOSE AN
ISOLATED AFTERNOON THUNDERSTORM IS POSSIBLE...BUT THE MOISTURE
REALLY DOES NOT LOOK DEEP ENOUGH. THERE SHOULD BE ENOUGH LOW LEVEL
MOISTURE AROUND FOR AFTERNOON CU FIELD. 850 TEMPS WILL BE AROUND +15
TOMORROW SUPPORTING HIGHS IN THE MID TO UPPER 80S. 850 TEMPS WILL
RISE TO AROUND +16 ON WEDNESDAY WITH THE RIDGE AXIS OVERHEAD. 90
DEGREES VERY POSSIBLE. FYI...90 DEGREES IS THE RECORD HIGH FOR
MEMPHIS ON WEDNESDAY. 850 TEMPS LOOK TO COOL SLIGHTLY TOWARDS THE
END OF THE WEEK AS THE AIR MASS COMING OUT OF THE SOUTHWEST US
MODIFIES. SO DO NOT EXPECT AFTERNOON HIGHS TO BE AS WARM. RIDGE
SHOULD HOLD IN TACT UNTIL FRIDAY NIGHT. MOISTURE DOES NOT LOOK DEEP
ENOUGH TO SUPPORT AFTERNOON THUNDERSTORMS DURING THIS PERIOD.

OVER THE WEEKEND...THE RIDGE WILL MOVE OFF TO THE EAST AND AN UPPER
TROUGH AND ASSOCIATED COLD FRONT WILL MOVE THROUGH THE REGION. THIS
WILL BRING A GOOD CHANCE FOR SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS SOMETIME OVER
THE WEEKEND...IF MODELS REMAIN CONSISTENT THIS WILL MOST LIKELY BE
SATURDAY.

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.
&&

FXUS64 KMEG 091438
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
938 AM CDT MON MAY 9 2005

.DISCUSSION...
AN UPPER LEVEL VORT IS OVER ARKANSAS THIS MORNING. LITTLE IN TERMS 
OF SURFACE FEATURES...JUST SOUTHERLY FLOW OVER THE REGION. SHOWERS 
AND THUNDERSTORMS CONTINUE TO REDEVELOP AHEAD OF THE VORT IN EASTERN 
ARKANSAS AND THEN MOVE THROUGH NORTH MS AND WEST TN. SEVERE 
POTENTIAL THIS AFTERNOON WILL BE LARGELY DEPENDENT UPON AMOUNT OF 
SUN THAT THE AREA CAN RECEIVE AND DRY SLOT AHEAD OF UPPER VORT. 
CURRENT CONVECTION OVER EASTERN ARKANSAS IS BEING GENERATED BY DRY 
SLOT PUNCHING INTO THE REGION. SUBSIDENCE WITH UPPER VORT MAY BE TOO 
GREAT FOR SUBSTANTIAL CONVECTION. THINK THAT THE BETTER THREAT MAY 
ACTUALLY BE OVER SOUTHWEST TN AND NORTH MS THIS AFTERNOON AS THE DRY 
SLOT MOVES THROUGH THAT AREA. EVENSO...SHEAR IS REALLY WEAK 
AREAWIDE. SO LOOKING MAINLY AT PULSE VARIETY THUNDERSTORMS IF 
ANYTHING. ONLY CHANGE TO FORECAST IS TO INCREASE TO LIKELY POPS OVER 
NORTHEAST MS THIS AFTERNOON. AM VERY UNCERTAIN ABOUT AFTERNOON TEMPS 
SINCE THEY WILL BE DEPENDENT UPON CLOUD/RAIN EARLY THIS AFTERNOON.

&&

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 090758
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
220 AM CDT MON MAY 9 2005

.DISCUSSION...

AN UPPER LEVEL TROUGH OVER ARKANSAS AND THE MIDSOUTH IS PROVIDING
SOME LIFT THAT IS TOUCHING OFF AN AREA OF RAIN THAT HAS NOW MOVED
INTO EAST CENTRAL AR. THIS AREA OF RAIN SHOULD MOVE INTO NE AR...
THE BOOTHEEL AND EXTREME NW TN BY DAYBREAK.

ANOTHER BIT OF ENERGY FROM THE TROUGH WILL IMPINGE ON THE
MIDSOUTH BY MID-MORNING ALONG WITH COLDER TEMPERATURES ALOFT.
THIS WOULD BE ENOUGH TO GENERATE SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS...BUT
EXTENSIVE CLD COVER IS EXPECTED THIS MORNING ALONG COOLER SURFACE
TEMPERATURES FROM THE CURRENT RAIN. IF BREAKS IN THE CLDS OCCUR
THIS MORNING...CAN EXPECT ISOLATED STORMS TO PRODUCE LARGE HAIL
LATER TDA.

THE AXIS OF THE UPPER SHT WV SHOULD BE INTO MIDDLE TN AND AL THIS
EVENING. THIS WILL LIMIT SUPPORT FOR THUNDERSTORMS...ESPECIALLY
AFTER MIDNIGHT.

MORE SHOWERS COULD OCCUR TUE BUT CHANCES ARE MUCH LESS.

DRY WEATHER IS PROGGED TUE NIGHT THROUGH THU NIGHT. AFTER THAT
ANOTHER FRONT COULD SLAP US WITH SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS FRI
DUE TO AN APPROACHING FRONT.

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...

SOME MID AND HIGH LEVEL CLOUDS ARE MOVING INTO THE WESTERN HALF OF
THE FORECAST AREA THIS EVENING. ONE AREA OF THUNDERSTORMS CONTINUES
TO MOVE NORTHEAST THROUGH NORTH CENTRAL ARKANSAS WITH ANOTHER AREA
OF SHOWERS BEGINNING TO MOVE INTO SOUTHEAST ARKANSAS. TEMPERATURES
HAVE COOLED INTO THE 70S ACROSS THE REGION AND SHOULD MAKE IT DOWN
INTO THE 60S OVERNIGHT. CURRENT FORECAST SEEMS FINE FOR NOW SO WILL
NOT MAKE ANY CHANGES AT THIS TIME.

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 082052
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
352 PM CDT SUN MAY 8 2005

.DISCUSSION...

THE UPPER LEVEL RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE THAT HAS REMAINED OVER THE
MIDSOUTH DURING THE PAST COUPLE OF DAYS IS BEGINNING TO BREAK DOWN
AND MOVE EAST. THIS HAS RESULTED IN INCREASED CU DEVELOPMENT ACROSS
MOST OF THE AREA...WITH TOWERING CU AND ISOLATED SHOWERS AND
THUNDERSTORMS DEVELOPING OVER AREAS WEST OF THE MISSISSIPPI RIVER
THIS AFTERNOON...WHERE INSTABILITY CONTINUES TO INCREASE AND
WEAKENING UPPER LEVEL SHORTWAVE WAS APPROACHING. TEMPERATURES HAVE
REACHED THE LOW TO MID 80S AS OF 20Z AND THEY MAY CLIMB ANOTHER FEW
DEGREES DURING THE REMAINDER OF THIS AFTERNOON.

THE AIRMASS OVER THE AREA WILL CONTINUE TO MOISTEN AND BECOME
INCREASINGLY UNSTABLE OVER THE MIDSOUTH THROUGH MONDAY...AS AN
UPPER LEVEL TROUGH POSITIONED OVER THE PLAINS STATES THIS AFTERNOON
MOVES EAST. A SERIES OF SHORTWAVE DISTURBANCES EMBEDDED WITHIN THE
UPPER TROUGH WILL ROTATE THROUGH THE AREA THROUGH TUESDAY...BEFORE
THE UPPER TROUGH PULLS EAST OF THE REGION BY TUESDAY NIGHT. THE
FIRST SHORTWAVE DISTURBANCE NOW OVER ARKANSAS WILL CONTINUE TO
WEAKEN AS IT MOVES EAST ACROSS THE AREA THIS EVENING. SCATTERED
SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS HAVE DEVELOPED AHEAD OF THIS FEATURE AND
WILL AFFECT MAINLY WESTERN PORTIONS OF THE CWA EARLY TONIGHT.

A SECOND SHORTWAVE NOW ANALYZED ON WATER VAPOR IMAGERY OVER NORTH-
CENTRAL TEXAS WILL MOVE ACROSS THE SOUTHERN PLAINS STATES THIS
EVENING AND TOWARDS THE AREA LATER TONIGHT. EXPECT A DEVELOPING MCS
OVER NORTH-CENTRAL TEXAS THIS AFTERNOON TO MOVE TOWARDS THE AREA
LATER TONIGHT INTO MONDAY MORNING. CURRENTLY EXPECTING THIS COMPLEX
OF THUNDERSTORMS TO WEAKEN OVERNIGHT AS IT APPROACHES THE MIDSOUTH...
AS MODEST LOW LEVEL JET CURRENTLY DRIVING THE CONVECTION EXPECTED
TO WEAKEN. SCATTERED SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS MAY BE ONGOING
EARLY MONDAY MORNING ACROSS MAINLY WESTERN PORTIONS OF THE REGION.
THIS ACTIVITY MAY DISSIPATE DURING THE MORNING HOURS. EXTENSIVE
CLOUD SHIELD IN ASSOCIATION WITH THIS SYSTEM WILL BE OVER THE AREA
MONDAY MORNING...WHICH MAY LIMIT DAYTIME HEATING DURING THE DAY
MONDAY. ADDITIONAL SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS ARE EXPECTED TO
REDEVELOP OVER THE AREA ON MONDAY AND PERSIST INTO MONDAY EVENING.
SPC HAS OUTLOOKED PORTIONS OF THE AREA IN A SLIGHT RISK FOR SEVERE
THUNDERSTORMS FOR MONDAY. CURRENT THINKING IS THAT THE SEVERE
POTENTIAL WILL REMAIN ISOLATED ACROSS THE AREA. THE SEVERE THREAT
WILL REMAIN HIGHLY DEPENDENT UPON THE AMOUNT OF BREAKS IN MORNING
CLOUD COVER THAT CAN DEVELOP BY MONDAY AFTERNOON TO PROMOTE LOW LEVEL
HEATING AND ENHANCED INSTABILITY. THE MID LEVEL COOLING ASSOCIATED
WITH THE UPPER TROUGH WILL PROMOTE ADDITIONAL THUNDERSTORM
DEVELOPMENT...BUT OVERALL CLOUD COVER MAY LIMIT STORM INTENSITY. WILL
KEEP MENTION OF ISOLATED SEVERE IN THE HWO FOR NOW AND LET LATER
SHIFTS DETERMINE ANY CHANGES IN THE OVERALL THREAT.

ANOTHER WEAKER SHORTWAVE DISTURBANCE MAY AFFECT THE MIDSOUTH ON
TUESDAY WITH ADDITIONAL CHANCES FOR THUNDERSTORMS AGAIN ON TUESDAY
AFTERNOON. MID-LEVEL WARMING AND A STRONGER CAPPING INVERSION WILL
LIMIT THE OVERALL COVERAGE OF CONVECTION ON TUESDAY...BUT WITH
INCREASED LEVELS OF INSTABILITY (LARGE SFC BASED CAPE)...ANY STORMS
THAT CAN INITIATE WILL HAVE THE POTENTIAL TO BECOME PULSE SEVERE.
AGAIN...COVERAGE MAY BE RATHER LIMITED.

THE UPPER LEVEL TROUGH WILL LIFT OUT OF THE REGION BY TUESDAY
NIGHT...WITH A RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE BUILDING OVER THE MIDSOUTH
FOR THE MIDDLE AND END OF THE WEEK. WITH RISING HEIGHTS AND
THICKNESSES...EXPECT DAYTIME TEMPERATURES TO RISE INTO THE MID TO
UPPER 80S WITH LOWS IN THE 60S WITH HUMID CONDITIONS. UPPER LEVEL
RIDGING WILL SUPPRESS ANY CONVECTION...SO CONDITIONS WILL REMAIN DRY
WEDNESDAY THROUGH FRIDAY. ADDITIONAL CHANCES FOR SHOWERS AND STORMS
ARE EXPECTED FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY AS A COLD FRONT SLOWLY MOVES
ACROSS THE AREA.

&&

EXPECT MID 80S AREAWIDE FOR DAYTIME MAX TEMPS. ALSO HAVE BUMPED UP
DEWPOINTS A FEW DEGREES TO ACCOUNT FOR CURRENT TRENDS. ALL OTHER
FORECAST PARAMETERS LOOK GOOD. UPDATED ZONE FORECAST AND GRIDS OUT

FXUS64 KMEG 072016
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
315 PM CDT SAT MAY 7 2005

.DISCUSSION...

HIGH PRESSURE BOTH SURFACE AND ALOFT HAS PROVIDED FOR ANOTHER GREAT
WEATHER DAY ACROSS THE MIDSOUTH...WITH ONLY THIN HIGH CIRRUS MOVING
OVER THE AREA...AND SCATTERED CU TO THE SOUTH. TEMPERATURES HAVE
CLIMBED INTO THE LOWER 80S THIS AFTERNOON...AND MAY CLIMB ANOTHER
DEGREE OR TWO OVER THE NEXT FEW HOURS.

THE UPPER LEVEL RIDGE OVER THE MIDSOUTH TODAY WILL REMAIN IN PLACE
INTO SUNDAY. THIS WILL KEEP WEATHER CONDITIONS DRY AND ALLOW
TEMPERATURES TO WARM BACK INTO THE LOW TO MID 80S BY SUNDAY
AFTERNOON. THIS UPPER RIDGE WILL BEGIN TO BREAK DOWN BY SUNDAY
NIGHT AS AN UPPER LEVEL TROUGH OVER THE WESTERN U.S. TODAY MOVES
EAST. A SERIES OF SHORTWAVES WILL ROTATE ACROSS THE AREA FROM SUNDAY
NIGHT INTO TUESDAY...WITH THE STRONGEST EXPECTED ON MONDAY. BOTH THE
ETA/GFS INDICATING THAT AN MCS WILL DEVELOP OVER PORTIONS OF EASTERN
OKLAHOMA AND TEXAS SUNDAY AFTERNOON AND MOVE EAST TOWARDS OUR AREA
SUNDAY NIGHT. CURRENT THINKING IS THAT THIS CLUSTER OF STORMS WILL
WEAKEN AS IT MOVES EAST SUNDAY NIGHT...AS THE BEST UPPER LEVEL
DYNAMICS REMAIN TO OUR NORTH AND WEST. WEAKENING SHOWERS AND
THUNDERSTORMS MAY AFFECT PORTIONS OF THE REGION SUNDAY NIGHT...SO
HAVE INCLUDED CHANCE POPS WEST AND SLIGHT CHANCE POPS EAST.

PLENTY OF CLOUDS FROM OVERNIGHT CONVECTION WILL BE OVER THE REGION ON
MONDAY...BUT A FEW BREAKS MAY DEVELOP LATER IN THE DAY...AND AS MID
LEVEL COOLING IN ASSOCIATION WITH THE UPPER LEVEL TROUGH
OVERSPREADS THE WARM AND MOIST AIRMASS IN PLACE OVER THE AREA...
EXPECT ADDITIONAL SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS TO DEVELOP ON MONDAY.
THESE STORMS SHOULD REMAIN PULSE IN NATURE...AS ATMOSPHERIC WINDS
WILL REMAIN FAIRLY WEAK. DUE TO LIMITED DEEP LAYER SHEAR AND
LEFTOVER CLOUDS FROM SUNDAY NIGHTS CONVECTION OUT WEST...THINK THAT
CHANCES FOR SEVERE WEATHER WILL REMAIN LIMITED. IF ENOUGH BREAKS IN
THE CLOUD COVER DEVELOP LATER MONDAY AFTERNOON...THEN A FEW ISOLATED
PULSE THUNDERSTORMS COULD BECOME SEVERE. THINK THIS THREAT IS FAIRLY
LIMITED AT THIS TIME AND WILL PRECLUDE ANY MENTION OF SEVERE FOR NOW.

SCATTERED SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS WILL BE POSSIBLE AGAIN ON
TUESDAY AS A WEAK SHORTWAVE MOVES OVER THE AREA. THE LOW LEVEL
AIRMASS WILL REMAIN WARM AND HUMID TO SUPPORT THIS CONVECTION.
AGAIN...IT APPEARS THAT THIS ACTIVITY WILL BE PULSE IN NATURE.
BY TUESDAY NIGHT...THE UPPER LEVEL TROUGH WILL LIFT NORTHEAST
ALLOWING FOR A RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE TO BUILD BACK OVER THE AREA.
WITH UPPER LEVEL HEIGHT RISES AND INCREASING 850 MB TEMPERATURES...
EXPECT TEMPERATURES TO RISE INTO THE MID TO UPPER 80S...WITH HUMID
CONDITIONS UNDER PARTLY CLOUDY SKIES FOR WEDNESDAY THROUGH FRIDAY.
MEDIUM RANGE MODELS HAVE BACKED OFF CONSIDERABLY ON FRONTAL PASSAGE
FRIDAY NIGHT...AND KEEP THE UPPER RIDGE IN CONTROL OF THE WEATHER
PATTERN INTO NEXT WEEKEND. SINCE THIS IS A NEW MODEL TREND...WOULD
PREFER TO SEE THIS TREND CONTINUED FOR A FEW MORE DAYS BEFORE
PULLING OUT POPS FOR THE END OF THE EXTENDED. AT THIS TIME WILL
KEEP 20 POPS IN FOR FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY NIGHT...WITH
TEMPERATURES REMAINING NEAR OR SLIGHTLY ABOVE AVERAGE.

FXUS64 KMEG 062034
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
334 PM CDT FRI MAY 6 2005

.DISCUSSION...

ANOTHER VERY PLEASANT WEATHER DAY ACROSS THE MIDSOUTH THIS AFTERNOON
WITH MOSTLY SUNNY SKIES AND TEMPERATURES RANGING FROM THE MID 70S TO
AROUND 80 DEGREES AREAWIDE. EXPECT AFTERNOON HIGHS TO TOP OUT AROUND
80 DEGREES IN MOST LOCATIONS. THIS PLEASANT WEATHER WILL CONTINUE
THROUGH THE WEEKEND...WITH CONTINUED DRY WEATHER AND WARM
TEMPERATURES.

SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE ANCHORED OVER THE AREA THIS AFTERNOON WILL
GRADUALLY SLIDE SOUTHEAST TO A POSITION OVER THE SOUTHEASTERN U.S.
BY SUNDAY. UPPER LEVEL RIDGING WILL ALSO CONTINUE TO BUILD OVER THE
REGION THROUGH SATURDAY AND REMAIN IN PLACE OVER THE AREA THROUGH
SUNDAY. EXPECT MOSTLY SUNNY SKIES ONCE AGAIN ON SATURDAY...WITH
ONLY SCATTERED MAINLY AFTERNOON CUMULUS (CU) CLOUDS DEVELOPING AS LOW
LEVEL HUMIDITY LEVELS SLOWLY INCREASE. MORE EXPANSIVE CU DEVELOPMENT
WILL BE POSSIBLE ON SUNDAY...AS HUMIDITY LEVELS CONTINUE INCREASING
AND UPPER LEVEL RIDGING BEGINS TO BREAK DOWN...ESPECIALLY BY LATER
SUNDAY AFTERNOON. HIGH PRESSURE WILL KEEP CONDITIONS DRY THOUGH
THROUGH THE WEEKEND. TEMPERATURES WILL ALSO BE A FEW DEGREES WARMER
BOTH SATURDAY AND SUNDAY AFTERNOONS...AS UPPER LEVEL HEIGHTS AND
THICKNESS LEVELS INCREASE AND LOW LEVEL WARM ADVECTION CONTINUES
AROUND THE WESTERN PERIPHERY OF THE SURFACE HIGH.

BY SUNDAY NIGHT...THE UPPER LEVEL RIDGING SHOULD BREAK DOWN AS AN
UPPER LEVEL SHORTWAVE TROUGH NOW OVER THE WESTERN U.S. MOVES OUT
ACROSS THE PLAINS STATES ON SUNDAY AND INTO THE MISSISSIPPI VALLEY
SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY. AS THIS UPPER TROUGH MOVES ACROSS THE
AREA...EXPECT SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS TO DEVELOP. THE BEST UPPER
LEVEL DYNAMICS ASSOCIATED WITH THIS SYSTEM SHOULD REMAIN TO OUR
NORTH AND WEST. IN ADDITION...A COLD FRONT ASSOCIATED WITH THIS
SYSTEM SHOULD STALL OUT WELL TO OUR NORTH. SHOWERS AND
THUNDERSTORMS SHOULD PRIMARILY DEVELOP IN RESPONSE TO THE MID-LEVEL
COOLING WITH NO REAL SURFACE FEATURE TO FOCUS THE CONVECTION. ALSO...
WITH THE UPPER LEVEL DYNAMICS REMAINING TO THE NORTH...EXPECT WIND
FIELDS TO REMAIN FAIRLY WEAK. SO CONVECTION THAT DOES DEVELOP
SHOULD BE MORE PULSE-LIKE IN NATURE ON MONDAY.

THE ATMOSPHERE SHOULD REMAIN WARM...MOIST...AND UNSTABLE INTO
TUESDAY...WITH STILL SOME UPPER LEVEL TROUGHING IN PLACE OVER THE
AREA. HAVE CONTINUED CHANCE POPS INTO TUESDAY...WITH MORE AIRMASS
THUNDERSTORMS EXPECTED. UPPER LEVEL RIDGING WILL BUILD BACK OVER
THE REGION FOR WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY BRINGING AN END TO THE
THUNDERSTORM ACTIVITY AND AN INCREASE IN TEMPERATURES. EXPECT
AFTERNOON TEMPERATURES TO BE WELL INTO THE 80S ALONG WITH RATHER
HUMID CONDITIONS. ANOTHER COLD FRONT AND ASSOCIATED UPPER LEVEL
SHORTWAVE TROUGH WILL APPROACH BY FRIDAY EVENING AND NIGHT...
BRINGING THE NEXT CHANCES FOR SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS.

FXUS64 KMEG 060202
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
903 PM CDT THU MAY 5 2005

.UPDATE...
SFC HIGH PRESSURE RIDGE WL REMAIN STNRY ACRS THE REGION OVERNIGHT. 
MOSTLY CLEAR SKIES...LIGHT WINDS AND COOL TEMPS EXPECTED. FORECAST 
ON TRACK AND NO UPDATED PLANNED. 

.PREV DISCUSSION ISSUED AT 230 PM...

SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE REMAINS IN FIRM CONTROL OF THE MIDSOUTH
WEATHER THIS AFTERNOON. THIS HAS KEPT SKIES MOSTLY SUNNY WITH
TEMPERATURES WARMING BACK INTO THE 70S. WINDS CONTINUE PRIMARILY OUT
OF THE NORTH AND NORTHEAST AND THEY HAVE OCCASIONALLY GUSTED IN
SOME AREAS. THIS SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE WILL REMAIN OVER THE AREA
THROUGH FRIDAY BEFORE GRADUALLY SLIDING EAST OVER THE WEEKEND TO A
POSITION OVER THE SOUTHEASTERN STATES. WINDS SHOULD BE LIGHTER ON
FRIDAY AND THEN GRADUALLY COME AROUND TO A SOUTHEAST AND EVENTUALLY
SOUTHERLY DIRECTION BY SATURDAY NIGHT WITH THE SURFACE HIGH TO OUR
EAST.

UPPER LEVEL RIDGING WILL ALSO BUILD OVER THE AREA BY FRIDAY AND
REMAIN IN PLACE THROUGH EARLY SUNDAY. WITH DECENT HEIGHT RISES AND
INCREASED LOW LEVEL WARM ADVECTION...TEMPERATURES WILL GRADUALLY
INCREASE THROUGH SUNDAY...REACHING BACK TO NEAR NORMAL VALUES ON
FRIDAY AND TO SLIGHTLY ABOVE SEASONAL LEVELS OVER THE WEEKEND.
HUMIDITY LEVELS WILL BEGIN TO INCREASE ON SATURDAY AFTERNOON AND
CONTINUE TO DO SO THROUGH THE REMAINDER OF THE WEEKEND AS THE GULF OF
MEXICO OPENS BACK UP AND LOW LEVEL SOUTHERLY FLOW ADVECTS HIGHER LOW
LEVEL MOISTURE NORTHWARD. WITH THE UPPER RIDGE AND SURFACE HIGH
PRESSURE IN PLACE THROUGH THE WEEKEND...EXPECT CONTINUED DRY WEATHER
THROUGH SUNDAY.

THE UPPER RIDGE WILL BEGIN TO BREAK DOWN BY SUNDAY AFTERNOON AS THE
UPPER LOW NOW CENTERED ALONG THE WEST COAST EJECTS EASTWARD ACROSS
THE PLAINS AND THEN NORTHEASTWARD INTO THE MIDDLE AND UPPER
MISSISSIPPI VALLEY SUNDAY NIGHT INTO MONDAY. AS THIS SHORTWAVE
TROUGH MOVES EAST IT WILL HELP TO SEND A COLD FRONT ACROSS PORTIONS
OF THE MID MISSISSIPPI VALLEY. AT THIS POINT...MOST OF THE MODEL
GUIDANCE SHOWS THIS FRONT STALLING JUST NORTH OF THE MIDSOUTH ON
MONDAY...BEFORE LIFTING BACK TO THE NORTH AS A WARM FRONT ON
TUESDAY. EXPECT SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS TO DEVELOP IN ADVANCE OF
THE APPROACHING SHORTWAVE TROUGH SUNDAY NIGHT ACROSS THE SOUTHERN
PLAINS AND MOVE EAST INTO WESTERN SECTIONS OF THE AREA AFTER MIDNIGHT
SUNDAY NIGHT. HAVE INCLUDED CHANCES FOR SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS
AREAWIDE FOR MONDAY AS THE UPPER LEVEL SYSTEM MOVES THROUGH. THE
UPPER LEVEL FLOW SHOULD BECOME MORE ZONAL ON TUESDAY...BUT WITH A
WARM...HUMID...AND UNSTABLE ATMOSPHERE IN PLACE EXPECT AIRMASS
SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS TO DEVELOP ON TUESDAY.

UPPER LEVEL RIDGING SHOULD ONCE AGAIN BUILD OVER THE MIDSOUTH FOR
THE MIDDLE OF NEXT WEEK...BRINGING AN END TO ANY THUNDERSTORM
ACTIVITY. EXPECT A WARM AND MORE HUMID AIRMASS TO REMAIN IN PLACE
ALONG WITH DRY WEATHER FOR THE MIDDLE AND END OF NEXT WEEK. ANOTHER
COLD FRONT MAY BRING ADDITIONAL CHANCES FOR STORMS TOWARDS NEXT
WEEKEND.

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.
&&

$$

JLH/SJM







000 
FXUS64 KMEG 051930
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
230 PM CDT THU MAY 5 2005

.DISCUSSION...

SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE REMAINS IN FIRM CONTROL OF THE MIDSOUTH
WEATHER THIS AFTERNOON. THIS HAS KEPT SKIES MOSTLY SUNNY WITH
TEMPERATURES WARMING BACK INTO THE 70S. WINDS CONTINUE PRIMARILY OUT
OF THE NORTH AND NORTHEAST AND THEY HAVE OCCASIONALLY GUSTED IN
SOME AREAS. THIS SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE WILL REMAIN OVER THE AREA
THROUGH FRIDAY BEFORE GRADUALLY SLIDING EAST OVER THE WEEKEND TO A
POSITION OVER THE SOUTHEASTERN STATES. WINDS SHOULD BE LIGHTER ON
FRIDAY AND THEN GRADUALLY COME AROUND TO A SOUTHEAST AND EVENTUALLY
SOUTHERLY DIRECTION BY SATURDAY NIGHT WITH THE SURFACE HIGH TO OUR
EAST.

UPPER LEVEL RIDGING WILL ALSO BUILD OVER THE AREA BY FRIDAY AND
REMAIN IN PLACE THROUGH EARLY SUNDAY. WITH DECENT HEIGHT RISES AND
INCREASED LOW LEVEL WARM ADVECTION...TEMPERATURES WILL GRADUALLY
INCREASE THROUGH SUNDAY...REACHING BACK TO NEAR NORMAL VALUES ON
FRIDAY AND TO SLIGHTLY ABOVE SEASONAL LEVELS OVER THE WEEKEND.
HUMIDITY LEVELS WILL BEGIN TO INCREASE ON SATURDAY AFTERNOON AND
CONTINUE TO DO SO THROUGH THE REMAINDER OF THE WEEKEND AS THE GULF OF
MEXICO OPENS BACK UP AND LOW LEVEL SOUTHERLY FLOW ADVECTS HIGHER LOW
LEVEL MOISTURE NORTHWARD. WITH THE UPPER RIDGE AND SURFACE HIGH
PRESSURE IN PLACE THROUGH THE WEEKEND...EXPECT CONTINUED DRY WEATHER
THROUGH SUNDAY.

THE UPPER RIDGE WILL BEGIN TO BREAK DOWN BY SUNDAY AFTERNOON AS THE
UPPER LOW NOW CENTERED ALONG THE WEST COAST EJECTS EASTWARD ACROSS
THE PLAINS AND THEN NORTHEASTWARD INTO THE MIDDLE AND UPPER
MISSISSIPPI VALLEY SUNDAY NIGHT INTO MONDAY. AS THIS SHORTWAVE
TROUGH MOVES EAST IT WILL HELP TO SEND A COLD FRONT ACROSS PORTIONS
OF THE MID MISSISSIPPI VALLEY. AT THIS POINT...MOST OF THE MODEL
GUIDANCE SHOWS THIS FRONT STALLING JUST NORTH OF THE MIDSOUTH ON
MONDAY...BEFORE LIFTING BACK TO THE NORTH AS A WARM FRONT ON
TUESDAY. EXPECT SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS TO DEVELOP IN ADVANCE OF
THE APPROACHING SHORTWAVE TROUGH SUNDAY NIGHT ACROSS THE SOUTHERN
PLAINS AND MOVE EAST INTO WESTERN SECTIONS OF THE AREA AFTER MIDNIGHT
SUNDAY NIGHT. HAVE INCLUDED CHANCES FOR SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS
AREAWIDE FOR MONDAY AS THE UPPER LEVEL SYSTEM MOVES THROUGH. THE
UPPER LEVEL FLOW SHOULD BECOME MORE ZONAL ON TUESDAY...BUT WITH A
WARM...HUMID...AND UNSTABLE ATMOSPHERE IN PLACE EXPECT AIRMASS
SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS TO DEVELOP ON TUESDAY.

UPPER LEVEL RIDGING SHOULD ONCE AGAIN BUILD OVER THE MIDSOUTH FOR
THE MIDDLE OF NEXT WEEK...BRINGING AN END TO ANY THUNDERSTORM
ACTIVITY. EXPECT A WARM AND MORE HUMID AIRMASS TO REMAIN IN PLACE
ALONG WITH DRY WEATHER FOR THE MIDDLE AND END OF NEXT WEEK. ANOTHER
COLD FRONT MAY BRING ADDITIONAL CHANCES FOR STORMS TOWARDS NEXT
WEEKEND.

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
1006 AM CDT THU MAY 5 2005

.DISCUSSION...

SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE IS SITUATED OVER THE MID-SOUTH THIS MORNING
WITH A WEAK UPPER LEVEL SHORTWAVE TROUGH MOVING EAST ACROSS THE
REGION. THE ATMOSPHERE REMAINS DRY (AS NOTED FROM REGIONAL
SOUNDINGS)...SO EXPECT A VERY NICE DAY ACROSS THE AREA WITH MOST
CLOUD COVER NOW OVER OKLAHOMA BEING SUPPRESSED AS IT MOVES EAST INTO
THE DRY AIRMASS. MOSTLY SUNNY SKIES WILL CONTINUE TODAY WITH
TEMPERATURES WARMING INTO THE MID TO UPPER 70S AREAWIDE. THE CURRENT
ZONE FORECAST AND GRIDS HAVE A GOOD HANDLE ON THE SITUATION...SO NO
UPDATES ARE PLANNED FOR THIS MORNING.

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 050805
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
305 AM CDT THU MAY 5 2005

.DISCUSSION...
AN AREA OF HIGH PRESSURE IS IN PLACE OVER THE REGION. AN UPPER LEVEL 
DISTURBANCE THAT BROUGHT A FAIR AMOUNT OF MID TO HIGH LEVEL CLOUDS 
ACROSS THE REGION LAST NIGHT IS MOVING OFF TO THE EAST AND CARRYING 
AWAY THOSE CLOUDS WITH IT. ANOTHER UPPER LEVEL DISTURBANCE PRODUCED 
SOME THUNDERSTORMS OVER NEBRASKA LAST NIGHT NIGHT. SOME HIGH CLOUDS 
LEFT OVER FROM THESE STORMS MAY DRIFT INTO THE AREA...OTHERWISE 
LOOKS LIKE A MAINLY SUNNY DAY ON TAP. 

UPPER RIDGE WILL BEGIN TO MOVE INTO THE REGION TODAY AND WILL BE THE 
SOLE WEATHER FEATURE THROUGH THE WEEKEND. 850 TEMPS WILL GRADUALLY 
RISE ABOUT 2 DEGREES EACH DAY INTO SATURDAY. LOOKING AT +6 TODAY AND 
AROUND +10 ON SATURDAY. WENT SLIGHTLY WARMER THAN GUIDANCE AT 
MEMPHIS FOR TODAY BASED UPON YESTERDAYS TRENDS...NEAR GUIDANCE 
ELSEWHERE. GUIDANCE NUMBERS LOOK OK FOR TONIGHT AT 
MEMPHIS...SLIGHTLY BELOW ELSEWHERE WITH MOST NOTICEABLE DIFFERENCE 
AT JACKSON. AM CONCERNED WITH HOW MODELS ARE HANDLING DEW POINTS 
TONIGHT AND INTO FRIDAY. THINK THAT THEY MAY BE MOISTENING UP TOO 
FAST. LOOKING AT DEW POINTS ACROSS THE REGION THIS MORNING...DOESNT 
REALLY LOOK LIKE THE REAL DEW POINT RISE WILL BE UNTIL THE SURFACE 
HIGH BEGINS TO SHIFT JUST EAST OF THE REGION AND THAT WILL NOT BE 
UNTIL FRIDAY. AS A RESULT...THINK THAT RADIATIONAL COOLING WILL 
RESULT IN SLIGHTLY LOWER TEMPS AT THESE SITES TONIGHT. DID NOT 
CHANGE FORECAST HIGHS FOR FRIDAY. ONCE AGAIN THINK THAT IT MAY BE 
WARMER DUE TO DRIER AIR THAN THE MODELS ARE FORECASTING. BY SATURDAY 
THE SURFACE HIGH SHOULD BE JUST EAST OF THE REGION AND SO EXPECT 
THAT THE DEW POINTS BY THIS POINT WOULD BE MORE REASONABLE. GUIDANCE 
GENERALLY ACCEPTED. 

THE NEXT CHANCE OF RAIN STILL LOOKS LIKE IT WILL BE SUNDAY NIGHT 
INTO EARLY NEXT WEEK AS THE UPPER RIDGE SHIFTS OFF TO THE EAST AND A 
STORM SYSTEM TRIES TO RIDE UP THE WESTERN SIDE OF THE RIDGE.

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.
&&

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 050234
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
934 PM CDT WED MAY 4 2005

.UPDATE...
SOME CLOUDINESS PASSING ACRS THE REGION KEEPING TEMPS A LITTLE 
HIGHER THAN PREVIOUS EVENINGS. CLOUDS SHOULD DECREASE DURING THE 
REMAINDER OF THE NIGHT SO FORECAST LOWS STILL SEEM REACHABLE WITH 
THE DRY AIRMASS IN PLACE AND SFC DEWPOINTS IN THE LOW 40S. NO UPDATE 
PLANNED.

.PREV DISCUSSION ISSUED AT 147 PM...
SURFACE HIGH EXTENDS FROM GREAT LAKES TO NEAR OKC...AND WILL ONLY
MOVE SLOWLY EASTWARD OVER THE NEXT FEW DAYS. TROF MOVING EASTWARD
FROM GREAT PLAINS IS RUNNING INTO MUCH DRIER AIR AND CLOUDS ARE
DISSIPATING. TEMPERATURES RUNNING MIDDLE 60S TO AROUND 70 ACROSS
THE AREA WITH DEWPOINTS IN THE 30S.
&&

.SHORT TERM (THROUGH SATURDAY)...
VERY SLOW EASTWARD MOVEMENT OF SURFACE RIDGE. UPPER PATTERN
CURRENTLY ZONAL TO SOMEWHAT NORTHWESTERLY FLOW. AS UPPER LOW DIGS
INTO THE WESTERN U.S...UPPER RIDGING BUILDS OVER THE MISSISSIPPI
RIVER VALLEY. THIS WILL ALLOW TEMPERATURES TO MODERATE...AND
WEATHER SHOULD REMAIN DRY THROUGH SATURDAY.

MODERATION IN TEMPERATURES OVER THE NEXT 36 HOURS WILL BE RATHER
SLOW...AS SOUTHERLY FLOW NOT YET WELL ESTABLISHED. AFTERNOON
DEWPOINTS ARE 5 TO 10 DEGREES LOWER THAN GUIDANCE FORECASTS. THIS HAS
BEEN THE TREND OVER THE LAST FEW DAYS. WITH LIGHT WINDS EXPECTED
TONIGHT AND FAIRLY CLEAR SKIES...MOS GUIDANCE IS TOO WARM...AND WILL
UNDERCUT BY A CATEGORY IN MOST AREAS.

HAVE RAISED TEMPS FOR TOMORROW A COUPLE OF DEGREES TO BETTER FIT
GUIDANCE AND NEIGHBORS. THIS IS ALSO SUPPORTED BY WARMING FORECAST
IN LOWER LEVELS OF THE ATMOSPHERE. DIDNT MESS WITH TOMORROW
NIGHTS TEMPERATURES TOO MUCH...BUT BUMPED FRIDAY HIGHS UP 2
DEGREES. FRIDAY NIGHT AND SATURDAY TEMPS WITHIN REASON.
&&

.LONG TERM (AFTER SATURDAY)...
RIDGE BREAKS DOWN ON SUNDAY...AND TROF MOVES THROUGH MONDAY AND
MONDAY NIGHT. GFS BRINGS A COLD FRONT THROUGH...DGEX AND ECMWF DO
NOT. ENOUGH DOUBT EXISTS IN A PARTICULAR SOLUTION TO CONTINUE GOING
FORECAST OF SMALL CHANCES OF PRECIPITATION ACROSS ARKANSAS SUNDAY
NIGHT...AND THE ENTIRE AREA MONDAY THROUGH TUESDAY.

TEMPERATURES IN THE EXTENDED PERIOD EXPECTED TO BE NEAR SEASONAL
NORMALS.
&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.
&&

FXUS64 KMEG 040730
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
230 AM CDT WED MAY 4 2005

.DISCUSSION...
FORTUNATELY A DIFFERENT WEATHER SITUATION THAN TWO YEARS AGO TODAY. 
SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE EXTENDS FROM THE UPPER OHIO VALLEY INTO THE 
MIDSOUTH REGION. THERE IS AN UPPER LEVEL DISTURBANCE OVER CENTRAL 
TEXAS THAT WILL MOVE ACROSS THE AREA TONIGHT. SATELLITE TRENDS THIS 
MORNING SHOWING SOME THIN CIRRUS FROM THIS SYSTEM THAT WILL MOVE 
THROUGH THE AREA TODAY. BY THIS AFTERNOON AND AS THE SYSTEM MOVES 
CLOSER...THE HIGH LEVEL CLOUDS MAY BE NOTICEABLE ENOUGH TO JUSTIFY 
PARTLY SUNNY CONDITIONS OVER NORTH MS. LITTLE ADJUSTMENTS MADE TO 
TEMP FORECAST TODAY. THE UPPER TROUGH THAT HAS BEEN PREVALENT OVER 
THE EASTERN US IS CONTINUING TO RECEDE RESULT IN A GRADUAL WARMING 
TREND OVER THE MIDSOUTH. 

THE UPPER SYSTEM WILL MOVE THROUGH THE AREA TONIGHT WITH SURFACE 
HIGH PRESSURE STILL IN CONTROL. LOW LEVELS REMAIN VERY DRY WITH 
DEEPER MOISTURE AND BETTER DYNAMICS WELL SOUTH OF THE REGION. SO NO 
RAIN IS EXPECTED. ONLY QUESTION WILL BE RATHER THE UPPER CLOUDS WILL 
BE THICK ENOUGH FOR PARTLY VS MOSTLY CLOUDY SKIES TONIGHT. WILL KEEP 
CURRENT FORECAST AS IT IS AND ALLOW NEXT SHIFT TACKLE IT. 

THE UPPER SYSTEM WILL BEGIN TO MOVE OUT OF THE REGION ON THURSDAY 
WITH SKIES BECOMING MOSTLY SUNNY. WARMER AS WELL AS THE UPPER RIDGE 
THAT WAS OVER THE WESTERN US BUILDS INTO THE REGION FOR THE WEEKEND. 
MOSTLY CLEAR SKIES FOR THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY WITH UPPER 
RIDGE OVERHEAD AND HIGH PRESSURE IN CONTROL. POTENTIALLY LOOKING AT 
TEMPS AROUND 80 FOR THE WEEKEND. THE NEXT CHANCE OF RAIN IS STILL 
EARLY NEXT WEEK AS AN UPPER TROUGH WILL BEGIN TO DISPLACE THE RIDGE. 

&&

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
843 PM CDT TUE MAY 3 2005

.UPDATE...
SFC HIGH PRESSURE WILL SETTLE ACRS THE REGION OVERNIGHT. EXPECT 
LIGHT WINDS AND MOSTLY CLEAR SKIES FOR MUCH OF THE NIGHT BEFORE SOME 
HIGH CLOUDINESS PUSHES INTO NRN MS FROM NE TX LATE. GOOD COOLING 
CONDS ACRS THE REGION WITH SFC DEWPOINTS IN THE MID 30S. RECORD LOW 
TEMPS AT MKL...37...UNDER PRESSURE ONCE AGAIN TONIGHT. WL EXPAND THE 
ISOLATED FROST SOUTH INTO THE MKL AND NE MS AREAS. 

.PREV DISCUSSION ISSUED AT 335 PM...VISIBLE SATELLITE IMAGERY THIS 
AFTERNOON SHOWS MOSTLY SUNNY TO PARTLY CLOUDY SKIES ACROSS THE MID 
SOUTH. MAIN FORECAST CONCERN IS FROST POTENTIAL 
TONIGHT...PRECIPITATION CHANCES WEDNESDAY NIGHT INTO THURSDAY AND 
ALSO BY EARLY NEXT WEEK. 

A WEAK SOUTHERN STREAM SHORTWAVE CURRENTLY LOCATED ACROSS THE 
SOUTHERN PLAINS WILL WEAKEN AND MOVE ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA 
TONIGHT. HIGH BASED DIURNAL CU WILL BEGIN TO DIMINISH AFTER SUNSET 
JUST AS MID LEVEL CLOUDS MOVE ACROSS THE SOUTHERN HALF OF THE AREA. 
DECOUPLING WINDS LACK OF CLOUDS AND CURRENT DEWPOINTS IN THE LOWER 
30S ACROSS THE FAR NORTHERN SECTION OF THE CWA SUPPORT A MENTION OF 
ISOLATED FROST WITH LOWS DROPPING INTO THE UPPER 30S.

ANOTHER WEAK SHORTWAVE WILL MOVE TO THE SOUTH OF THE AREA WEDNESDAY 
NIGHT AND THURSDAY. 305K ISENTROPIC SURFACE SHOWS VERY WEAK 
ISENTROPIC LIFT PASSING JUST TO THE SOUTH ACROSS CENTRAL/SOUTHERN 
MISSISSIPPI AND THINK FORECAST AREA WILL REMAIN DRY. UPPER LEVEL 
RIDGING WILL BUILD IN ACROSS THE LOWER MISSISSIPPI VALLEY THURSDAY 
THROUGH THE WEEKEND WITH THE NEXT CHANCE OF SHOWERS AND 
THUNDERSTORMS AS A COLD FRONT APPROACHES THE REGION. CURRENT 
THINKING IS THAT FRONT MAY GET HUNG UP JUST TO THE WEST OF THE AREA 
AS UPPER LEVEL RIDGING MOVES SLIGHTLY EAST WITH THE MID SOUTH 
REMAINING IN SOUTHWEST FLOW. BOTH GFS AND EUROPEAN SOLUTIONS SUPPORT 
THIS THINKING WHILE DGEX STALLS FRONT OUT ACROSS THE AREA MONDAY AND 
TUESDAY.

&&

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 031605
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
1105 AM CDT TUE MAY 3 2005

.DISCUSSION...LATEST SURFACE OBSERVATIONS PLACE 1024 MB HIGH 
PRESSURE ACROSS THE LOWER MISSISSIPPI VALLEY. VISIBLE SATELLITE 
TRENDS SHOW SUNNY SKIES ACROSS MOST OF THE FORECAST AREA WITH ONLY A 
BIT OF CIRRUS SOUTH OF KTUP AND SOME 6KFT DIURNAL CU DEVELOPING 
ACROSS SOUTHEAST MISSOURI. MAIN FORECAST CONCERNS FOR THIS AFTERNOON ARE 
TEMPERATURES AND CLOUD COVER. 

MODEL SOUNDINGS INDICATE SOME HIGH BASED DIURNAL CUMULUS WILL 
DEVELOP ACROSS THE MID SOUTH THIS AFTERNOON. CURRENT TEMPERATURES 
ACROSS THE AREA ARE IN THE UPPER 50S TO LOWER 60S AND WILL ISSUE AN 
UPDATE TO ADJUST FOR CLOUD COVER AND MINOR TEMPERATURE TRENDS.

UPDATED GRIDS WILL BE OUT SHORTLY.

CJC

.PREV DISCUSSION...ISSUED 1020 AM CDT TUE MAY 3 2005.

SURFACE HIGH HIGH PRESSURE IS OVER OKLAHOMA THIS MORNING. COOL 
CONDITIONS CONTINUE ACROSS THE REGION WITH JACKSON NEAR RECORD LOWS 
THIS MORNING. THIS IS DUE TO A BROAD UPPER TROUGH OVER THE EASTERN 
US. 

DRY WEATHER IS EXPECTED OVER THE NEXT 24 TO 36 HOURS AT LEAST. HIGH 
PRESSURE AND DRY LOW LEVELS WILL SEE TO THIS. SKIES WILL BE PARTLY 
TO MOSTLY SUNNY TODAY DEPENDING UPON JUST HOW MUCH HIGH AND MID 
LEVEL CLOUDS OVER THE SOUTHERN PLAINS MOVES THROUGH THE AREA TODAY. 
NO REAL BIG CHANGES MADE TO FORECAST TODAY...BUMPED UP HIGHS TODAY 
AROUND THE TUPELO AREA BASED UPON HIGHS YESTERDAY. LITTLE CHANGES 
MADE TO TONIGHT/S FORECAST. ETA AND GFS INDICATING THAT THIS EVENING 
MAY NOT BE VERY CLOUDY AT ALL AND THAT THE MID TO HIGH CLOUDS MAY 
HOLD OFF UNTIL AFTER MIDNIGHT. LITTLE CHANGES MADE TO TONIGHT 
TEMPS. DID LOWER TEMP AT JACKSON DUE TO CLEARER SKIES AND TEMP 
TRENDS LAST NIGHT/THIS MORNING. NO CHANGES MADE TO WEDNESDAYS 
FORECAST. THE UPPER TROUGH WILL SLOWLY LIFT WHICH WILL RESULT IN 
TEMPS A FEW DEGREES WARMER THAN TODAY. THE NEXT SYSTEM WILL STILL BE 
ORGANIZING ITSELF OVER THE SOUTHERN PLAINS. 

WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND THURSDAY...THE NEXT SYSTEM LOOKS LIKE IT WILL 
REMAIN A MID TO UPPER LEVEL FEATURE. SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE WILL 
STILL BE INFLUENCING THE REGION. THE UPPER TROUGH AND 700MB LOW WILL 
MOVE OVER THE AREA WITH THE DEEPER MOISTURE REMAINING MAINLY SOUTH 
OF THE REGION. SEE NO REASON TO INCREASING RAIN CHANCES FROM WHERE 
THEY ARE NOW WHICH IS SLIGHT CHANCE. LOWER ATMOSPHERE DOES NOT LOOK 
LIKE IT WILL MOISTEN UP ANY AND TRACK OF THE 700MB LOW MAY KEEP THE 
MEASURABLE RAIN OVER CENTRAL MS. 

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...

REMAIN A MID TO UPPER LEVEL FEATURE. SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE WILL 
STILL BE INFLUENCING THE REGION. THE UPPER TROUGH AND 700MB LOW WILL 
MOVE OVER THE AREA WITH THE DEEPER MOISTURE REMAINING MAINLY SOUTH 
OF THE REGION. SEE NO REASON TO INCREASING RAIN CHANCES FROM WHERE 
THEY ARE NOW WHICH IS SLIGHT CHANCE. LOWER ATMOSPHERE DOES NOT LOOK 
LIKE IT WILL MOISTEN UP ANY AND TRACK OF THE 700MB LOW MAY KEEP THE 
MEASURABLE RAIN OVER CENTRAL MS. 

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.
&&

VALLE

FXUS64 KMEG 030203
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
904 PM CDT MON MAY 2 2005

.UPDATE...
A WEAK SHORTWAVE PASSING THROUGH THE MID SOUTH THIS EVENING WITH A 
FEW SPRINKLES ACRS NRN MS. SPRINKLES HAVE DISSIPATED WITH CLEARING 
SKIES MOVING INTO NORTHERN SXNS BEHIND THE VORT. CLEARING SKIES WL 
SLOWLY PROGRESS SOUTH ACRS THE REGION OVERNIGHT. HIGH PRESSURE WL 
BUILD ACRS THE REGION THROUGH THE NEXT FEW DAYS. EXPECT CHILLY 
READINGS BY MORNING WITH RECORD LOWS AT MKL...39...AND 
MEM...43...UNDER PRESSURE. 

.PREV DISCUSSION ISSUED 334 PM...
LATEST SURFACE ANALYSIS PLACES WEAK HIGH PRESSURE ACROSS THE 
MID-SOUTH. MID/UPPER LEVEL LOW LOCATED ACROSS NORTHERN QUEBEC WILL 
CONTINUE TO BRING SHORTWAVES IN THE CYCLONIC FLOW THROUGH THE 
EASTERN UNITED STATES OVER THE NEXT FEW DAYS. A WEAK SHORTWAVE WILL 
PASS TO THE NORTH OF THE FORECAST AREA TONIGHT. REGIONAL 88D RADAR 
TRENDS THE PAST FEW HOURS SHOW RAINFALL DIMINISHING IN COVERAGE AS 
IT APPROACHES THE LOW LEVEL DRY AIR IN THE FORECAST AREA. I/M NOT 
EXPECTING MUCH MORE THAN SPRINKLES WITH THIS FEATURE AS THE LOW 
LEVEL AIRMASS IN PLACE IS NEARLY TOO DRY TO SUPPORT RAIN WITH 
SURFACE DEWPOINT DEPRESSIONS IN THE 30S. SOME DIFFERENCES BEGIN TO 
SHOW UP BETWEEN 12Z NAM/GFS SOLUTIONS BY WEDNESDAY. GFS SHOWS A WEAK 
IMPULSE DEVELOPING ACROSS CENTRAL MISSISSIPPI BY WEDNESDAY 
AFTERNOON. MODEL SOUNDINGS DO NOT SUPPORT ANY RAIN MENTION AT THIS 
TIME AS ATMOSPHERE WILL BE TOO DRY AND WILL KEEP FORECAST DRY UNTIL 
WEDNESDAY NIGHT. ADDITIONALLY...300K SURFACE SHOWS WEAK ISENTROPIC 
ASCENT INCREASING ON THE WESTERN AND SOUTHERN EDGES OF THE FORECAST 
AREA AND LOW CONDENSATION PRESSURE DEFICITS. AS A RESULT...MADE SOME 
MODIFICATIONS TO CHANGE POPS DOWN TO 20 PERCENT ACROSS SOUTHERN AND 
WESTERN SECTIONS OF THE FORECAST AREA WEDNESDAY NIGHT INTO THURSDAY.

.LONG TERM.../FRIDAY THROUGH MONDAY/...00Z LONG RANGE MODEL RUN IN 
CLOSER AGREEMENT WITH UPPER LEVEL FLOW ACROSS THE MID SOUTH. MODELS 
SUGGESTING AN OMEGA BLOCKING PATTERN SETTING UP AT LEAST TEMPORARILY 
ACROSS THE EASTERN UNITED STATES UNTIL EARLY NEXT WEEK. HOWEVER WEAK 
DISTURBANCES WILL RIDE UP AND OVER THE RIDGE WITH THE MID SOUTH ON 
THE WESTERN EDGE OF THE BLOCK. GFS/EUROPEAN/DGEX ALL SHOWING A 
NEGATIVELY TILTED TROUGH MOVING THROUGH THE MISSISSIPPI VALLEY BY 
MONDAY. THE BETTER FORCING WILL BE LOCATED MAINLY ACROSS THE UPPER 
AND MIDDLE MISSISSIPPI VALLEY AND ADDED A SLIGHT CHANCE OF 
SHOWERS/THUNDERSTORMS TO MONDAY ACROSS THE MISSOURI BOOTHEEL AND 
NORTHEAST ARKANSAS.  

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.
&&

CJC/SJM

1027 AM CDT MON MAY 2 2005

.DISCUSSION...LATEST WATER VAPOR IMAGERY SHOWS A DEPARTING SHORTWAVE

MORNING. ADDITIONALLY A SOUTHERN STREAM WAVE WAS MOVING ACROSS THE 
SOUTHERN PLAINS...EVENTUALLY SPREADING SOME MID/HIGH LEVEL 
CLOUDINESS ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA. MAIN FORECAST CONCERNS THIS 
AFTERNOON WILL BE CLOUD COVER...TEMPERATURES...AND PRECIPITATION 
CHANCES. 

MODEL SOUNDINGS SUGGEST LOW LEVELS WILL NOT SATURATE AND SURFACE OBS 
AGREE WITH CURRENT THINKING AS DEWPOINTS ARE MAINLY IN THE 30S 
ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA AND LOWER TO MIDDLE 20 DEWPOINTS ACROSS 
SOUTHEAST MISSOURI. CURRENT FORECAST ON TRACK WITH PARTLY TO MOSTLY 
CLOUDY SKIES AND HIGHS IN THE 60S. NO UPDATE ANTICIPATED AT THIS 
TIME.

CJC

.PREV DISCUSSION...ISSUED 226 AM CDT MON MAY 2 2005

NEAR ZONAL FLOW CONTINUES OVER THE MID SOUTH THIS MORNING AND WILL 
PERSIST THROUGH TUESDAY NIGHT. MODELS HAVE BEEN HAVING A TOUGH TIME 
DECIPHERING WEAK DISTURBANCES IN THE FAST FLOW AND WHAT SORT OF 
IMPACT THAT WILL HAVE FOR THE FORECAST AREA. TODAY THINGS HAVE 
SHIFTED TO A MUCH DRIER SOLUTION WITH THE BEST CHANCES FOR RAIN 
OCCURRING WEDNESDAY/WED NIGHT. 

TODAY COLD AIR ADVECTION WILL AFFECT THE FORECAST AREA ALONG WITH 
SOME EARLY MORNING CLOUDINESS. THIS COMBO WILL MAKE TEMPS SLIGHTLY 
COOLER THAN SUNDAY. ANOTHER COOL NIGHT ON TAP TONIGHT WITH UPPER 30S 
LIKELY ESPECIALLY NEAR JACKSON TN. 

BY WEDNESDAY A SHORTWAVE WILL MOVE OUT OF THE NORTHERN PLAINS AND 
DROP INTO SOUTHERN MO SOMETIME WED AFTERNOON. THIS WILL AID IN 
GETTING SOME SHOWERS GOING OVER THE AREA...ESPECIALLY NORTH 
MISSISSIPPI.

DISTURBANCES WILL ROTATE AROUND THE UPPER LOW AND ASSIST IN KEEPING 
THINGS SLIGHTLY COOLER THAN NORMAL OVER THE FORECAST AREA. SURFACE 
HIGH PRESSURE WILL CONTINUE TO BUILD INTO THE REGION PROVIDING THE 
COOLER...DRIER AIR. 

WATER VAPOR IMAGERY SHOWS HIGH LEVEL MOISTURE THAT WILL STREAM OVER 
THE MISSISSIPPI VALLEY TODAY AND TONIGHT. AN INCREASE IN LOW TO MID 
LEVEL CLOUDS WILL LIKELY OCCUR TONIGHT AS WELL. MODELS DIFFER ON 
RAIN CHANCES BUT STILL FEEL THAT MONDAY AFTERNOON WILL BE THE START 
OF A STRETCH OF WET WEATHER. WE WILL HAVE TO DEAL WITH DISTURBANCES 
MOVING OUT OF OKLAHOMA AND LATER...EAST TEXAS. 

THERE IS A SHORTWAVE THAT WILL MOVE ACROSS THE GREAT BASIN MONDAY 
NIGHT AND TRANSLATES ACROSS TEXAS WEDNESDAY. AHEAD OF THIS FEATURE A 
DEEPENING SURFACE LOW IS PROGGED TO DEVELOP ALONG THE LA GULF COAST. 
THIS SCENARIO WOULD PUMP IN DECENT MOISTURE FOR THE APPROACHING 
SHORTWAVE TO WORK WITH. RAIN CHANCES FROM WEDNESDAY THROUGH FRIDAY 
WILL HINGE ON THIS SYSTEM. SOMETHING TO WATCH THE NEXT FEW DAYS.

.DISCUSSION...
SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS ARE SLOWLY MOVING OUT OF THE SOUTHEASTERN

EXTEND WEST ACROSS THE WHOLE FORECAST AREA. 

THE RAIN WILL HAVE MOVED OUT OF NORTHEAST MISSISSIPPI BY 7 AM. 
CLOUDY CONDITIONS WILL PERSIST THROUGH THE MAJORITY OF THE DAY WHILE 
COOL...SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS INTO THE MID SOUTH. WITH THE 
CLOUDS HANGING ON FOR MOST OF THE DAY AND THE WET GROUND...MAX 
TEMPERATURES WILL ONLY REACH THE LOW TO MID 60S.

CLOUDS WILL BEGIN TO BREAK UP THIS EVENING. COUNTING ON MOSTLY CLEAR 
SKIES OVER MKL AND JBR SO MIN TEMPS THERE SHOULD REACH THE UPPER 30S 
TO AROUND 40. SUNDAY WILL BE WARMER WITH TEMPS REACHING THE UPPER 
60S TO NEAR 70 FOR SOME LOCATIONS. 

THE UPPER LOW SPINNING JUST NORTH OF THE GREAT LAKES REGION WILL 
KEEP ZONAL FLOW OVER THE MID SOUTH THROUGH TUESDAY. THE UPPER LEVEL 
JET WILL CONTINUE TO PROVIDE ENERGY FOR SHOWERS TO DEVELOP...
POSSIBLY SUNDAY BUT CERTAINLY BY MONDAY AFTERNOON. A WEAK COLD FRONT 
WILL OOZE INTO THE NORTHERN HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA MONDAY. MODEL 
SOUNDINGS SUGGEST THAT HIGH BASED SHOWERS/STORMS COULD DEVELOP 
MONDAY AFTERNOON AND INTO MONDAY NIGHT. A CHANCE FOR SHOWERS AND 
THUNDERSTORMS WILL CONTINUE THROUGH MID WEEK.

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 300306 CCA
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...CORRECTED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
1006 PM CDT FRI APR 29 2005

CORRECTED TIME

.DISCUSSION...01Z SURFACE ANALYSIS PLACES CENTER OF LOW PRESSURE 
ACROSS COAHOMA COUNTY MISSISSIPPI WITH TRAILING COLD FRONT ACROSS 
SOUTHEAST ARKANSAS. MAIN SHORT TERM CONCERN IS SEVERE WEATHER 
POTENTIAL. RUC/12KM NAM MODEL ANALYSIS SUGGESTS THAT COLD FRONT WILL 
MOVE TOWARDS MISSISSIPPI/ALABAMA BORDER BY 6Z. THREE HOUR PRESSURE 
CHANGES FINALLY STARTING TO SHOW EASTWARD MOVEMENT OF LOW. BEST 
INSTABILITY...THOUGH WEAK REMAINS ACROSS NORTHERN MISSISSIPPI WITH 
500-600 J/KG SURFACE BASED CAPE...LI/S AROUND -3 AND 0-6 KM BULK 
SHEAR VALUES AROUND 60 KTS...AND MLCAPES AROUND 1500 J/KG. 
ENVIRONMENT MENTIONED ABOVE STILL SUPPORTIVE OF SEVERE POTENTIAL 
WITH A NEW WATCH TO AFFECT PORTIONS OF NORTHERN MISSISSIPPI UNTIL 5 
AM CDT SATURDAY. IN ADDITION WILL MAKE SOME ADJUSTMENTS TO ARKANSAS 
ZONES BASED ON CURRENT TRENDS. 

UPDATED GRIDS WILL BE OUT SHORTLY.

CJC

.PREV DISCUSSION...ISSUED 248 PM CDT FRI APR 29 2005

FRONTAL BOUNDARY HAS BEGUN TO LIFT NORTH A LITTLE IN THE LAST COUPLE
OF HOURS IN RESPONSE TO THE STRENGTHENING SURFACE LOW NOW LOCATED
JUST NORTH OF TEXARKANA. ALL OF THE THUNDERSTORM ACTIVITY THAT HAS
DEVELOPED SO FAR HAS BEEN ALONG AND NORTH OF THE FRONT. EVENTUALLY
THERE SHOULD BE SOME THUNDERSTORM DEVELOPMENT SOUTH OF THE FRONT AND
ANY OF THESE STORMS SHOULD HAVE THE POTENTIAL TO BE AT LEAST SEVERE
IF NOT TORNADIC. THERE MAY ALSO BE LOCALLY HEAVY RAINFALL ALONG THE
FRONT AS WELL. FRONT WILL MOVE EAST OF THE FORECAST AREA BY 12Z SO
HAVE LEFT SATURDAY FORECAST DRY. THE WEEKEND SHOULD REMAIN DRY AS
HIGH PRESSURE HANGS IN OVER THE REGION. BY MONDAY NIGHT FRONTAL
BOUNDARY BEGINS TO SHIFT BACK NORTH AND STALL OUT NEAR THE FORECAST
AREA AND SHOULD BE CLOSE ENOUGH THAT WE WILL HAVE A RISK OF SHOWERS
AND THUNDERSTORMS FROM MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY.

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.
&&

FXUS64 KMEG 290826
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
326 AM CDT FRI APR 29 2005

.DISCUSSION...
VERY IMPRESSIVE WEATHER PATTERN HAS SET UP ACROSS THE U.S. THE 
ATMOSPHERE OVER THE SOUTHERN HALF OF THE COUNTRY IS VERY UNSTABLE. 
THE MAIN FOCUS THIS FORECAST PERIOD WILL BE THE POTENTIAL FOR SEVERE 
WEATHER THAT WILL LIKELY DEVELOP THIS AFTERNOON AND CONTINUE INTO 
THE EVENING.

A DEEP SURFACE LOW LOCATED OVER CENTRAL TEXAS WILL MIGRATE NORTHEAST 
TODAY AHEAD OF A SHORTWAVE TROUGH CURRENTLY MOVING ACROSS THE TEXAS 
PANHANDLE. LOW LEVEL SOUTHWEST WINDS WILL INCREASE THROUGH THE DAY 
TRANSPORTING MOISTURE RICH AIR INTO THE MID SOUTH. BY EARLY 
EVENING...THESE SOUTHWEST WINDS WILL REACH CLOSE TO 50 KNOTS. 

AS THE SURFACE LOW MOVES INTO THE MID SOUTH...THE SEVERE WEATHER 
POTENTIAL WILL INCREASE RAPIDLY PRIMARILY FOR AREAS ALONG AND SOUTH 
OF I-40. IT APPEARS THAT SEVERE STORMS COULD DEVELOP AS EARLY AS 
NOON AND CONTINUE INTO THE LATE EVENING HOURS. SHEAR PROFILES 
INDICATE SURFACE WINDS TO BE SOUTHERLY AND POSSIBLY A LITTLE EAST OF 
SOUTH WHICH WOULD PROVIDE GOOD INFLOW INTO STORMS THAT DEVELOP. 
ALSO...THE STORMS THAT DEVELOP WILL MOVE QUICKLY EASTWARD HOWEVER 
SEVERAL STORMS MAY MOVE OVER THE SAME AREAS...ESPECIALLY OVER 
NORTHERN MISSISSIPPI. THEREFORE THERE WILL BE A GOOD CHANCE FOR 
LOCALLY HEAVY RAIN I.E. 2+ INCHES... TO OCCUR FOR SOME AREAS.

THIS EVENING...THE SURFACE LOW WILL TRACK OFF TO THE NORTHEAST. 
BEHIND THE LOW...SURFACE WINDS WILL BE NORTHERLY AND GUSTY. 
THUNDERSTORMS WILL GRADUALLY SHIFT EAST OVERNIGHT. PERHAPS SOME RAIN 
WILL STILL BE OCCURRING OVER NORTHEAST MISSISSIPPI AND AREAS OF WE 
TENNESSEE CLOSE TO THE TN RIVER BY SATURDAY MORNING. EXPECT ALL THE 
RAIN TO SHIFT EAST OF THE FORECAST AREA BY SATURDAY AFTERNOON. 
DRY...COOL CONDITIONS ARE ANTICIPATED FOR SUNDAY AS SURFACE HIGH 
PRESSURE BUILDS INTO THE REGION.

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.
&&

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 281952
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
252 PM CDT THU APR 28 2005

.DISCUSSION...
CURRENT BOUNDARY EXTENDING FROM NORTH TEXAS THROUGH EASTERN OKLAHOMA
INTO SOUTHERN MISSOURI. SCATTERED SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS CONTINUE
TO MOVE ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA THIS AFTERNOON. CLOUD COVER OVER THE
REGION HAS KEPT TEMPERATURES IN THE 50S TO NEAR 60 IN MOST LOCATIONS
WHILE TO OUR SOUTH...TEMPERATURES HAVE WARMED INTO THE LOW TO MID
80S WHERE THERE HAS BEEN SUNSHINE MOST OF THE DAY. FRONTAL BOUNDARY
SHOULD NOT MOVE MUCH TONIGHT BUT EXPECT SURFACE LOW TO RIDE ALONG
BOUNDARY LATER TONIGHT. THIS SHOULD HELP SPARK SOME SCATTERED
CONVECTION MAINLY OVER OUR NORTHERN COUNTIES. SPC DOES HAVE MOST OF
FORECAST AREA IN A SLIGHT RISK FOR TONIGHT BUT RISK DOES NOT APPEAR
ENOUGH TO WARRANT MENTIONING IN ZONES.

MEANWHILE UPPER LEVEL TROUGH WILL MOVE OUT OF SOUTHERN CALIFORNIA
TONIGHT AND FRIDAY. AS IT APPROACHES THE REGION FRIDAY IT WILL HELP
PUSH THE FRONTAL BOUNDARY THROUGH OUR AREA. THIS WILL MEAN MORE
THUNDERSTORMS FRIDAY AND FRIDAY NIGHT. SPC DOES HAVE MOST OF THE
FORECAST AREA IN A MODERATE RISK. BIGGEST QUESTION IS MOISTURE
AVAILABILITY. CURRENT DEWPOINTS ARE IN THE MID 40S TO NEAR 50.
WINDS HAVE STARTED TO INCREASE TO OUR SOUTH AND THAT MAY HELP PUSH
GULF MOISTURE INTO THE REGION BEFORE THE COLD FRONT GETS HERE. HAVE
INCLUDED MENTION OF SEVERE STORMS FOR BOTH FRIDAY AND FRIDAY NIGHT.
COLD FRONT SHOULD BE OUT OF THE REGION BY SATURDAY MORNING SO HAVE
KEPT DRY FORECAST FOR SATURDAY. DRY WEATHER WILL CONTINUE THROUGH
THE WEEKEND WITH ANOTHER CHANCE OF RAIN FROM MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH
WEDNESDAY.

SURFACE LOW OVER CENTRAL OKLAHOMA THIS MORNING WITH WARM FRONT

THIS MORNING LEAVING JUST A CHANCE FOR ADDITIONAL SHOWERS AND
THUNDERSTORMS THIS AFTERNOON. SKIES ARE CLOUDY THIS MORNING BUT
SHOULD CLEAR OUT BY THIS AFTERNOON. HOWEVER...TEMPERATURES WILL NOT
WARM NEARLY AS MUCH AS EARLIER THOUGHT SO HAVE DROPPED HIGHS FOR
TODAY.

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 280956
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
455 AM CDT THU APR 28 2005

.DISCUSSION...LATEST SURFACE ANALYSIS PLACES WARM FRONT ACROSS 
SOUTHERN ARKANSAS. REGIONAL 88D TRENDS SHOW SHOWERS AND 
THUNDERSTORMS APPROACHING THE WESTERN EDGE OF THE FORECAST AREA. 
NUMEROUS CONCERNS IN THIS FORECAST PACKAGE WITH SEVERE WEATHER 
POTENTIAL TONIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY NIGHT. 00Z NAM/GFS IN DECENT OVERALL 
AGREEMENT AT LEAST THROUGH SATURDAY. 

.TODAY...WARM FRONT WILL MOVE NORTH TODAY ACROSS THE MID SOUTH. 
MODELS SUGGESTING WARM FRONT WILL PASS THROUGH THE ENTIRE FORECAST 
AREA BY EARLY THIS AFTERNOON. 40 KT LOW LEVEL JET WILL MOVE ACROSS 
THE FORECAST AREA BEFORE WEAKENING BY LATE AFTERNOON AS WARM FRONT 
STALLS OUT ACROSS THE MID MISSISSIPPI VALLEY AND RED RIVER VALLEY. 
UPPER LEVEL DYNAMICS LOOK WEAK AS THE FORECAST AREA WILL BE 
NEAR THE RIGHT EXIT REGION OF THE UPPER LEVEL JET. MODEL SOUNDINGS 
PRODUCE 700 J/KG OF SURFACE BASED CAPE...LI/S BETWEEN -4 TO -6...AND 
STEEP 700-500 MB MID LEVEL LAPSE RATES AROUND 7.5 C/KM. MADE 
SIGNIFICANT ADJUSTMENTS TO MORNING POPS BASED UPON CURRENT TRENDS. 
ANY THUNDERSTORMS SHOULD REMAIN BELOW SEVERE LIMITS DURING THE DAY. 
OTHER PROBLEM OF THE DAY IS WIND ADVISORY POTENTIAL ACROSS THE 
SOUTHERN TIER OR TWO OF COUNTIES ACROSS NORTHERN MISSISSIPPI. WINDS 
ARE EXPECTED TO INCREASE ACROSS NORTHERN MISSISSIPPI AFTER WARM 
FRONTAL PASSAGE. MODEL SOUNDINGS SHOW 20+ KT SUSTAINED WINDS ACROSS 
THE ABOVE MENTIONED AREA WITH GUSTS AROUND 30 KTS BY THIS AFTERNOON. 
HOWEVER...CURRENTLY THINK THAT WINDS MAY STAY BELOW ADVISORY 
CRITERIA AS CLOUD COVER LIMITING MIXING INTO BOUNDARY LAYER. DAY 
SHIFT WILL TAKE ANOTHER LOOK AT SITUATION AS 12Z DATA STARTS COMING 
IN.  

TONIGHT...SURFACE LOW WILL MOVE ACROSS NW ARKANSAS WITH WARM FRONT 
EXTENDING ACROSS MO/AR/KY BORDER. THIS WARM FRONT WILL BECOME 
STATIONARY OVERNIGHT ACROSS THE LOWER MISSISSIPPI VALLEY AS A 
SECONDARY LOW FORMS OVER THE RED RIVER VALLEY. MODEL ANALYSIS THIS 
MORNING SUGGESTS THAT A BACKWARD PROPAGATING MESOSCALE CONVECTIVE 
SYSTEM MAY FORM UPSTREAM TONIGHT ACROSS THE RED RIVER VALLEY AND 
MOVE ALONG THE STATIONARY FRONT TONIGHT. HEAVY RAIN POTENTIAL IS NOT 
OUT OF THE QUESTION WITH K-INDICIES INCREASING TO AROUND 36 ALONG 
THE BOUNDARY AND WITH PRECIPITABLE WATER VALUES NEAR 1.5 INCHES.

FRIDAY AND FRIDAY NIGHT...STRONG AREA OF LOW PRESSURE WILL DEVELOP 
IN THE RED RIVER VALLEY AND BEGIN TO MOVE UP THE STATIONARY 
BOUNDARY...MOVING ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA FRIDAY NIGHT. SEVERAL 
CONVECTIVE PARAMETERS SUPPORT SEVERE WEATHER POTENTIAL...ESPECIALLY 
FRIDAY AFTERNOON AND FRIDAY NIGHT. SURFACE BASED CAPES WILL INCREASE 
TO 2000+ J/KG...0-6KM BULK SHEAR VALUES EXCEEDING 60 KTS...LI/S NEAR 
-9...AND 0-1KM HELICITY VALUES AT LEAST 200 M2/S2. STRONG WIND 
FIELDS ALOFT AND DECENT 700 MB DEWPOINT DEPRESSIONS ARE INDICATIVE 
OF A DAMAGING WIND THREAT. CONVECTION SHOULD START OFF AS DISCRETE 
CELLS THAT WILL EVENTUALLY FORM INTO A SQUALL LINE...PRODUCING 
HAIL...DAMAGING WINDS AND TORNADOES. SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS WILL 
COME TO AN END ACROSS MOST AREAS AFTER MIDNIGHT WITH HIGH PRESSURE 
BUILDING IN ACROSS THE MID SOUTH ON SATURDAY.

NO CHANGES MADE TO LATER PERIODS.
 
&&

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 272027
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
326 PM CDT WED APR 27 2005

.DISCUSSION...

HIGH PRESSURE IS CENTERED OVER CENTRAL ARKANSAS THIS AFTERNOON. A 
STATIONARY FRONT EXTENDS FROM ALONG THE CENTRAL GULF COAST THROUGH 
THE SOUTHERN PLAINS AND INTO A LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM OVER COLORADO. 
ATMOSPHERE IS RATHER DRY WITH DEW POINTS IN THE 30S TODAY. QUICK 
CHANGES ARE EXPECTED OVER THE NEXT 48 HOURS WITH A SIGNIFICANT STORM 
SYSTEM EXPECTED TO MOTOR THOUGH THE REGION ON FRIDAY.

TONIGHT...THE LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM WILL MOVE INTO OKLAHOMA TONIGHT 
WITH THE STATIONARY FRONT RISING NORTHWARD AS A WARM FRONT. BY 12Z 
THE WARM FRONT WILL BE FROM NORTH CENTRAL ARKANSAS TO NEAR PINE 
BLUFF TO NEAR GREENWOOD MS. BETTER LIFT SHOULD REMAIN WEST OF THE 
REGION AND SINCE THE ATMOSPHERE IS SO DRY...NOT EXPECTING ANY RAIN 
TONIGHT. ON THURSDAY THE LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM WILL MOVE THROUGH 
NORTHERN ARKANSAS AND BE WEAKENING THROUGH THIS TIME. WITH THE 
SYSTEM WEAKENING AND MOISTURE STILL LIMITED EXPECT ONLY LOW CHANCES 
OF RAIN AND MAINLY ACROSS NORTHEAST ARKANSAS AND NORTHWEST TN WHERE 
THE DYNAMICS ARE BETTER. A WIND ADVISORY MAY BE NEEDED FROM THE TN 
BORDER SOUTH TOMORROW AFTERNOON AS THE PRESSURE GRADIENT TIGHTENS. 
SUSTAINED WINDS OF NEAR 20MPH WITH WIND GUSTS UP TO 35 TO 40 MPH 
POSSIBLE. 

THE LOW WILL MOVE INTO THE OHIO VALLEY THURSDAY NIGHT AND THIS WILL 
LAY A STALLED FRONT OUT FROM SOUTHEAST MO THROUGH CENTRAL ARKANSAS 
AND BACK INTO A POTENT LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM OVER TEXAS. MOISTURE WILL 
BE INCREASING DURING THIS TIME WITH SFC DPS INTO THE 50S. BUT LIFT 
IS STILL MARGINAL SO CONFIDENCE IN RAIN STILL LOW AND STILL ACROSS 
NORTHEAST ARKANSAS INTO WEST TN. 

FRIDAY...GOOD CHANCES FOR SEVERE THUNDERSTORMS. THE LOW PRESSURE 
SYSTEM WILL MOVE THROUGH ARKANSAS AND INTO SOUTHEAST MO BY 00Z. 
MODELS SHOWING SFC DPS RISING INTO THE 60S. STRONG DYNAMICS WITH 
THIS SYSTEM. 850MB WINDS OF 50 TO 60KTS ARE PROBABLE...0-3KM 
HELICITY OF AROUND 250 M2/S2 ARE POSSIBLE. MOST OF THIS HELICITY 
WILL BE DUE TO WIND SPEED WITH SURFACE WINDS OUT OF THE SOUTH OR 
SOUTHWEST. INSTABILITY PARAMETERS ARE AROUND -5 LI AND 2000-2500 
J/KG CAPE. HAVE GOOD CONFIDENCE IN SEVERE WEATHER ACROSS THE REGION 
FRIDAY AFTERNOON AND FRIDAY EVENING. THE ONLY LIMITING FACTOR COULD 
BE MOISTURE RETURN AND UNLESS THERE IS A DRASTIC CHANGE IN THE TRACK 
OF THE SURFACE LOW. THE RUNS HAVE BEEN FAIRLY CONSISTENT AND IF THIS 
SCENARIO COMES TO LIFE...THE QUESTION WILL BE A SQUALL LINE OF 
MULTICELLULAR STORMS VS A LINE OF SUPERCELLS. SO...LARGE HAIL IS 
POSSIBLE ALONG WITH DAMAGING WINDS. IF SUPERCELLS DEVELOP...THEN 
TORNADOES ARE POSSIBLE. 

THE FRONT CLEARS THE REGION PROBABLY BY 06Z OR SHORTLY THEREAFTER. 
HIGH PRESSURE WILL BUILD IN OVER THE WEEKEND WITH THE NEXT FRONT 
ARRIVING EARLY NEXT WEEK AND STALLING OVER THE REGION. THIS WILL 
RESULT IN UNSETTLED WEATHER FOR THE FIRST PART OF NEXT WEEK.

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.

TO GRADUALLY LEVEL OFF THIS AFTERNOON. 850 TEMPS WILL REBOUND TO +5 
AFTER 21Z BUT THE BETTER HEATING WILL BE FINISHED BY THEN.

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 270854
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
355 AM CDT WED APR 27 2005

.DISCUSSION...LATEST INFRARED SATELLITE IMAGERY AND OBSERVATIONS 
SHOW SOME MID LEVEL CLOUDS MOVING ACROSS THE LOWER MISSISSIPPI 
VALLEY THIS MORNING. SHOWER ACTIVITY FROM LAST NIGHT HAS MOVED EAST 
OF THE FORECAST AREA AS 500 MB TROUGH IS LOCATED ACROSS CENTRAL 
TENNESSEE. MAIN CONCERNS THIS FORECAST PACKAGE IS CONVECTIVE 
POTENTIAL TONIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY NIGHT AND WIND ADVISORY POTENTIAL 
THURSDAY AFTERNOON.

.TODAY...HIGH PRESSURE WILL BUILD INTO THE MID SOUTH TODAY WITH WEAK 
UPPER LEVEL RIDGING. SKIES WILL BE PARTLY CLOUDY AS SOME LOW 
LEVEL MOISTURE HANGS AROUND NEAR 850 MB DURING THE DAY WITH HIGHS IN 
THE MID 60S TO AROUND 70. 

.TONIGHT...SURFACE/UPPER LEVEL RIDGING WILL GRADUALLY BEGIN TO 
MOVE EAST TONIGHT AS NEXT SURFACE LOW FORMS OVER THE ROCKIES 
AND MOVES INTO THE SOUTHERN PLAINS. WARM FRONT EXTENDING FROM THE 
LOW OVER TEXAS WILL MOVE NORTH DURING THE NIGHT AND EXPECTING CLOUDS 
TO INCREASE AS MID/UPPER LEVEL MOISTURE BEGINS TO RETURN OVERNIGHT. 
LATEST MODEL TRENDS SHOW MOISTURE RETURN OCCURRING AS EARLY AS 9Z 
THURSDAY. SO WILL ADD A SLIGHT CHANCE OF SHOWERS/THUNDERSTORMS TO 
FORECAST AFTER MIDNIGHT BUT MAINLY TOWARDS DAYBREAK.    

.THURSDAY AND THURSDAY NIGHT...WARM FRONT WILL MOVE AS FAR NORTH AS 
SOUTHEAST MISSOURI/OHIO VALLEY BEFORE STALLING OUT UNTIL SURFACE LOW 
SWINGS THROUGH THE FORECAST AREA FRIDAY NIGHT. 700-500 MB MID LEVEL 
LAPSE RATES WILL STEEPEN TO AROUND AN IMPRESSIVE 7.5 TO 8.0 C/KM 
ACROSS THE OZARKS AND A PORTION OF NORTHEAST ARKANSAS WITH LI/S 
APPROACHING -8 AND MLCAPES AROUND 800 J/KG EXTENDING THROUGH 
THURSDAY NIGHT. BEST CHANCES FOR SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS WILL PRIMARILY 
BE NEAR THE FRONT ACROSS THE NW THIRD OF FORECAST AREA WITH HAIL AND 
DAMAGING WIND GUSTS AS SEVERE WEATHER THREATS. OTHER CONCERN IS WIND 
POTENTIAL DURING THE DAY ON THURSDAY AS 850 MB LOW LEVEL JET MOVES 
OVERHEAD. MODEL CONSENSUS SUGGESTS SUSTAINED WINDS MAY BE AROUND 20 
KTS WITH A FEW GUSTS APPROACHING 35 TO 40 KTS. LATER SHIFTS WILL 
MONITOR TRENDS FOR POTENTIAL WIND ADVISORY FOR THURSDAY AFTERNOON.  

.FRIDAY...A STRONG LOW WILL EJECT OUT OF THE SOUTHERN PLAINS AND 
INTO THE TENNESSEE AND OHIO VALLEYS ON FRIDAY NIGHT. EVEN 
WITH SOME MINOR DIFFERENCES...NAM/GFS IN AGREEMENT WITH POTENTIAL 
FOR CONVECTION. 700-500 MB LAYER LAPSE RATES ARE EXPECTED TO BE AT 
LEAST 7 C/KM WITH DECENT MID-LEVEL DYNAMICAL FORCING /Q-VECTOR 
CONVERGENCE/. MODEL SOUNDINGS INDICATE AT LEAST 1500-2000 J/KG 
SURFACE BASED CAPE AVAILABLE...LI/S AROUND -6...AND 0-6KM BULK SHEAR 
VALUES AROUND 60 KTS. WIND PROFILES SUGGEST DAMAGING WINDS WILL BE 
POSSIBLE WITH THIS SYSTEM WITH 700 MB DEWPOINT DEPRESSIONS AT LEAST 
5C. THREAT FOR TORNADOES NOT OUT OF THE QUESTION WITH 0-1KM STORM 
RELATIVE HELICITIES ESTIMATED AROUND 200 M2/S2. THAT SAID...THE 
SEVERE WEATHER THREATS EXPECTED BASED ON CURRENT DATA WOULD BE 
DAMAGING WINDS...HAIL...AND TORNADOES. CURRENT HAZARDOUS WEATHER 
OUTLOOK HANDLING MENTION OF SEVERE POTENTIAL WELL AND WILL NOT MAKE 
ANY CHANGES TO WORDING AT THIS TIME. REMOVED POPS FROM SATURDAY 
AFTERNOON AS BOTH NAM/GFS TRENDING FASTER WITH PROGRESSION OF THIS 
SYSTEM.

NO CHANGES MADE BEYOND SATURDAY.

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...

FXUS64 KMEG 262013 CCA
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...CORRECTED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
314 PM CDT TUE APR 26 2005

.DISCUSSION...
COLD FRONT HAS SWEPT THROUGH THE MID SOUTH WITH CLEARING PROGRESSING 
QUICKLY ACRS THE AREA. TEMPS HAVE CLIMBED INTO THE 60S AS SFC 
DEWPOINTS DROP INTO THE 30S BEHIND THE FRONT. BREEZY WNW WINDS WL 
CONT UNTIL SUNSET. 

UPR TROF WL SWING THROUGH THIS EVENING. EXPECT BKN-OVC STRATOCU TO 
MOVE ACRS MAINLY THE NRN SXNS OF THE MID SOUTH THIS EVENING FOLLOWED 
BY DECREASING CLOUDS AFT MIDNIGHT. WL PUT IN A SMALL POP TO ACCOUNT 
FOR CURRENT RADAR IMAGERY ACRS MO WHERE SCT SHOWERS HAVE DEVELOPED. 
TEMPS WL BE COOL WITH READINGS FALLING WELL INTO THE 40S. HIGH 
PRESSURE WL MOVE ALONG THE GULF COAST ON WED RESULTING IN SUNSHINE 
AND MILD TEMPS. 

AS HIGH PRESSURE MOVES TO EAST RETURN FLOW REDEVELOPS ACRS THE 
REGION ON THU. THE FIRST IN A SERIES OF LOW PRESSURE SYSTEMS 
DEVELOPS IN THE LEE OF THE ROCKIES AND MOVES ACRS THE SOUTHERN 
PLAINS. MEANWHILE A WARM FRONT WL MOVE NORTH THROUGH THE AREA AND  
BECOME STNRY JUST NORTH OF THE MID SOUTH BY THU AFTN. BY 00Z FRI 60F 
DEWPOINTS SHOULD COVER MOST OF THE MID SOUTH. WL GO WITH CHC POPS 
ACRS NRN SXNS...NEAR THE FRONT...THU AND THU NIGHT. SOME STORMS MAY 
BE STRONG AS INSTABILITY INCREASES ACRS THE AREA.

FRI LOOKS MORE INTERESTING. A POTENT SHORTWAVE MOVES OUT OF THE SRN 
ROCKIES FRI MORNING AS A STRONG SFC LOW DEVELOPS ACRS NRN AR AND 
TRACK INTO SRN MO. A STRONG COLD FRONT WL MOVE ACRS THE AREA FRI 
EVENING. SEVERE WEATHER PARAMETERS LOOK FAVORABLE FOR A POTENTIAL 
OUTBREAK. BY 00Z SAT INSTABILITY VALUES ARE DECENT AND SHEAR WL BE 
INCREASING. BOTH MODELS IN GOOD AGREEMENT WITH THIS SYSTEM. WL 
INCREASE POPS AND ISSUED AN UPDATED HWO. 

HIGH PRESSURE BUILD IN FOR THE WEEKEND WITH NEXT PRECIP CHANCES ON 
TUESDAY.   

&&

FRI LOOKS MORE INTERESTING. A POTENT SHORTWAVE MOVES OUT OF THE SRN 
ROCKIES FRI MORNING AS A STRONG SFC LOW DEVELOPS ACRS NRN AR AND 
TRACK INTO SRN MO. A STRONG COLD FRONT WL MOVE ACRS THE AREA FRI 
EVENING. SEVERE WEATHER PARAMETERS LOOK FAVORABLE FOR A POTENTIAL 
OUTBREAK. BY 00Z SAT INSTABILITY VALUES ARE DECENT AND SHEAR WL BE 
INCREASING. BOTH MODELS IN GOOD AGREEMENT WITH THIS SYSTEM. WL 
INCREASE POPS AND ISSUED AN UPDATED HWO. 

HIGH PRESSURE BUILD IN FOR THE WEEKEND WITH NEXT PRECIP CHANCES ON 
TUESDAY.   

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.

&&

$$

SJM

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 261602 CCA
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
1103 AM CDT TUE APR 26 2005

.UPDATE...
COLD FRONT MOVING ACRS THE MID SOUTH ATTM AND LOCATED FROM MKL-GWO 
AT 16Z. DRY SLOT PUNCHING INTO THE REGION WITH CLEARING ACRS ERN AR 
PUSHING TOWARD THE MS RIVER. SCT LIGHT SHOWERS/DRIZZLE BASICALLY 
EAST OF THE RIVER. WL UPDATE THE ZONES TO TRIM BACK POPS DURING THE 
AFTN. EXPECT DRY SLOT TO MOVE ACRS THE AREA SO MOST PLACES WL SEE 
SUN DURING THE AFTN. EXPECT TEMPS TO REBOUND WITH SUNSHINE SO WL 
LEAVE ALONE FOR NOW. 

.PREV DISCUSSION ISSUED AT 329 AM...
WATER VAPOR AND 00Z UPPER AIR MAPS PLACE ELONGATED LOW PRESSURE 
STRETCHING FROM THE CANADIAN MARITIMES TO WESTERN LAKE SUPERIOR. A 
LONGWAVE TROUGH EXTENDS FROM THE LOW ACROSS THE MISSOURI VALLEY AND 
THE SOUTHERN PLAINS. SURFACE ANALYSIS PLACES LOW PRESSURE ACROSS THE 
MISSOURI BOOTHEEL AND NORTHEAST ARKANSAS WITH A COLD FRONT EXTENDING 
BACK TOWARDS EASTERN TEXAS. MAIN FORECAST CONCERNS THIS PACKAGE WILL 
BE CONVECTIVE POTENTIAL TODAY AND AGAIN ON THURSDAY.

.TODAY...COLD FRONTAL BOUNDARY CURRENTLY OVER CENTRAL ARKANSAS WILL 
PASS THROUGH THE MID SOUTH TODAY WITH ASSOCIATED WARM FRONT 
REMAINING ACROSS CENTRAL MISSISSIPPI. 700-500 MB LAYER LAPSE RATES 
WILL BECOME MODERATELY STEEP BY THIS AFTERNOON /6.5 C/KM/ BUT 
INSTABILITY WILL BE LIMITED WITH MIXED LAYER CAPE VALUES ONLY AROUND 
500 J/KG NORTH OF THE WARM FRONT. WIND PROFILES SUGGEST PRIMARY MODE 
OF CONVECTION WILL BE MAINLY LINEAR. BUT THINK SEVERE POTENTIAL WILL 
MOSTLY BE SOUTH OF THE WARM FRONT ACROSS CENTRAL AND SOUTHERN 
MISSISSIPPI WITH ONLY LIMITED PROBABILITIES ACROSS NORTHERN 
MISSISSIPPI WITH HAIL AND POSSIBLY WIND AS THE THREATS. SKIES WILL 
BE MOSTLY/CLOUDY TODAY WITH SKIES BECOMING PARTLY CLOUDY TEMPORARILY 
BY LATE AFTERNOON/EARLY EVENING AS DRY SLOT MOVES OVERHEAD. HIGHS 
WILL REACH THE MIDDLE TO UPPER 60S ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA TODAY.

.TONIGHT...SHEAR AXIS ASSOCIATED WITH PASSAGE OF TROUGH WILL MOVE 
ACROSS THE LOWER MISSISSIPPI VALLEY TONIGHT. NOT TOO CONFIDENT WITH 
PRECIPITATION CHANCES AS LOW LEVEL DRY AIR AND CONDENSATION PRESSURE 
DEFICITS WILL OFFSET DECENT ISENTROPIC ASCENT PRESENT IN 305K 
LAYER. AS A RESULT...WILL KEEP AREA DRY TONIGHT UNDER PARTLY CLOUDY 
SKIES.

.WEDNESDAY...A PLEASANT DAY EXPECTED ACROSS THE MID SOUTH ON 
WEDNESDAY AS SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE AND WEAK UPPER LEVEL RIDGING WILL 
MOVE OUT OF THE PLAINS AND INTO THE MISSISSIPPI VALLEY. 1000-500 MB 
LAYER RH/S WILL DROP TO AROUND 40 PERCENT BY AFTERNOON...WITH PARTLY 
CLOUDY SKIES BECOMING MOSTLY SUNNY BY LATE AFTERNOON. HIGHS WILL BE 
A FEW DEGREES WARMER THAN TUESDAY. 
 
.WEDNESDAY NIGHT...NEXT FRONT WILL EJECT OUT OF THE CENTRAL/SOUTHERN 
PLAINS IN UPPER LEVEL ZONAL FLOW. ANY SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS 
SHOULD REMAIN WEST OF THE FORECAST AREA AS MODEL SOUNDINGS DEPICT A 
SUBSTANTIAL LOW LEVEL DRY LAYER TO OVERCOME WITH SURFACE DEWPOINTS 
IN THE 30S. HOWEVER A DECENT SHEAR PROFILE MAY HELP TO MOISTEN UP 
THE ATMOSPHERE AND ADDED A SLIGHT CHANCE OF SPRINKLES ACROSS THE 
NORTHWEST TIP OF THE FORECAST AREA.

THURSDAY...COLD FRONT WILL MAKE SLOW PROGRESS TOWARD THE MID SOUTH. 
700-500 MB MID LEVEL LAPSE RATES WILL STEEPEN TO AN IMPRESSIVE 8 
C/KM BY THURSDAY AFTERNOON WITH A WEAK CAPPING INVERSION PRESENT /50 
J/KG CIN/ AROUND 800 MB. WIND PROFILES SUGGEST ANY THUNDERSTORMS 
THAT MIGHT DEVELOP WOULD BE IN THE FORM OF A LINE WITH DAMAGING 
WINDS. SOME QUESTION STILL REMAINS WITH SEVERE POTENTIAL AS 
INSTABILITY MAY BE LIMITED DUE TO CLOUD COVER. CURRENT GRIDS 
HANDLING POPS WELL AND MADE NO CHANGES. 

NO CHANGES MADE BEYOND THURSDAY.

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.

&&

$$

CJC/SJM

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
842 PM CDT MON APR 25 2005

.DISCUSSION...
SYSTEM PRETTY MUCH PROGRESSING ON SCHEDULE. SURFACE LOW OVER NORTH
TEXAS AS DEPICTED BY THE NAM. COLD FRONT JUST ENTERING THE OZARKS.

WHILE RADARS ARE SHOWING A GOOD BIT OF PRECIPITATION...AREAS EAST OF
THE MISSISSIPPI RIVER STILL HAVE ABOUT 25 DEGREE DEWPOINT
DEPRESSIONS. THIS DRY AIR WILL TAKE A WHILE TO OVERCOME BEFORE WE
START TO SEE MEASURABLE PRECIPITATION. MOST LIGHTNING STILL BACK IN
SW AR...OK AND TX.

CURRENT POPS AND WEATHER TRENDS LOOK FINE...BUT WILL NEED TO UPDATE
LATER THIS EVENING FOR TIME SENSITIVE WORDING. STILL EXPECTING COLD
FRONT TO CROSS MISSISSIPPI RIVER AROUND 12Z.

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 252043
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
344 PM CDT MON APR 25 2005

.DISCUSSION...
FAIRLY QUIET ACRS THE AREA AS HIGH PRESSURE RETREATS AND THE NEXT 
SYSTEM STARTS TO MOVE IN. MANAGED TO SALVAGE A PRETTY NICE DAY WITH 
SOME SUN AND MILD TEMPS. THINGS CHANGES TONIGHT AS A MAJOR TROF DIGS 
INTO THE CNTRL U.S. AND A COLD FRONT APPROACHES LATER TONIGHT. THE 
PRECIP CURRENTLY WORKING INTO WRN AR WL TAKE A WHILE TO REACH THE 
MID SOUTH AS DRY AIR MASS IN PLACE NEEDS SOME TIME TO MOISTEN. AS A 
RESULT EXPECT A MOSTLY DRY EVENING...ESPECIALLY EAST OF THE RIVER.

BEST COMBINATION OF LIFT AND DEEPER MOISTURE WL BE IN PLACE ACRS THE 
REGION AFTER 06Z. GFS AND ETA ARE IN SOME DISAGREEMENT WITH RESPECT 
TO QPF AMOUNTS FROM 06Z-12Z TUE. CONVECTION ALONG THE GULF COAST MAY 
KEEP AMOUNTS DOWN ACRS THE AREA ACCORDING TO THE GFS. BY 12Z COLD 
FRONT WL BE MOVING INTO ERN AR. SEVERE WEATHER IS QUESTIONABLE ATTM 
AND HINGES ON HOW FAR NORTH THE WARM FRONT PROGRESSES TUE MORNING. 
RIGHT NOW IT APPEARS TO MAKE IT INTO NORTH MS. AS A RESULT THERE IS 
A SMALL CHC OF SEVERE WX ACRS THIS AREA ON TUE....PROBABLY BEFORE 
NOON TUE. THE FRONT WL RACE EAST INTO MID TN AND AL BY EARLY AFTN. 
EXPECT SOME CLEARING BEHIND THE FRONT DURING THE AFTN.

SOME CLOUDS WL PROBABLY LINGER ACRS NRN SXNS AS UPPER TROF SWINGS 
THRU TUE EVENING WITH PERHAPS SOME SPRINKLES. WEAK HIGH PRESSURE 
BUILDS IN FOR WED.

AS HIGH PRESSURE RETREATS ON THU A WARM FRONT LIFTS NORTH THROUGH 
THE REGION AND STALLS JUST NORTH OF THE AREA. THIS FRONT WL BECOME 
THE FOCUS FOR THE REMAINDER OF THE WEEK INTO PART OF THE WEEKEND. 
ZONAL FLOW ALOFT WL KEEP THIS FEATURE NEAR THE AREA WITH A SERIES OF 
LOW PRESSURE SYSTEMS EXPECTED TO MOVE ALONG THE FRONT. A STRONGER 
SHORTWAVE KICKS THE FRONT THROUGH SAT NIGHT. HIGH PRESSURE WL THEN 
KEEP THE AREA DRY SUN-MON.

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
