000 
FXUS64 KMEG 251615
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
1115 AM CDT MON APR 25 2005

.UPDATE...
LOOKS LIKE WE WILL MANAGE ONE MORE DECENT DAY BEFORE THE WET WEATHER 
SETTLES IN TONIGHT AND TUESDAY. CLOUDS ON THE INCREASE FROM THE WEST 
THIS AFTN...THOUGH THERE ARE PLENTY OF BREAKS IN THE CLOUDS STILL 
PRESENT ACRS MUCH OF MID SOUTH AND ACRS AR ATTM. THERE WILL BE A MIX 
OF SUN AND CLOUDS THIS AFTN WITH TEMPS WARMING INTO THE UPPER 60S TO 
AROUND 70. BEST LIFT AND DEEPER MOISTURE STILL WELL TO THE WEST THIS 
MORNING. WITH DRY AIRMASS IN PLACE ACRS THE REGION IT WILL TAKE A 
WHILE TO MOISTEN UP. THERE MAY BE A FEW SPRINKLES LATER THIS AFTN 
BUT WILL CONFINE THE 20 POP TO NE AR FOR THE REST OF TODAY.

.PREV DISCUSSION ISSUED AT 344 AM...
LATEST MODELS IN GENERAL AGREEMENT WITH OUR CURRENT FORECAST SO NOT
MUCH CHANGE IS NEEDED THIS MORNING. RIDGE TO OUR WEST IS BREAKING
DOWN THIS MORNING ALLOWING THE UPPER LEVEL FLOW TO BECOME MORE
WESTERLY ACROSS THE MIDSOUTH. AS A RESULT...MID AND HIGH LEVEL
CLOUDS ARE QUICKLY SPREADING INTO THE MIDSOUTH. AN UPPER LEVEL
SHORT WAVE AND ASSOCIATED SURFACE LOW WILL MOVE INTO THE SOUTHERN
PLAINS TODAY. SURFACE WINDS WILL INCREASE FROM THE SOUTH TODAY
ACROSS THE MIDSOUTH RESULTING IN WARMER TEMPERATURES AND INCREASING
SURFACE DEWPOINTS. ISENTROPIC LIFT WILL DEVELOP ACROSS THE MIDSOUTH
AHEAD OF THE APPROACHING LOW PRESSURE. THIS WILL LEAD TO A SLIGHT
CHANCE OF RAIN THIS AFTERNOON FROM ABOUT THE MISSOURI BOOTHEEL TO
TUPELO...AND SOUTHWESTWARD.

SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS WILL BECOME WIDESPREAD ACROSS THE
MIDSOUTH TONIGHT. AN UPPER LEVEL TROUGH IN THE NORTHERN STREAM
WILL APPROACH THE MIDSOUTH TONIGHT WHILE THE SOUTHERN SHORT WAVE
WEAKENS AND MOVES TO THE EAST. AN ASSOCIATED COLD FRONT WILL MOVE
INTO EAST ARKANSAS FROM THE WEST BY 12Z WHILE A WARM FRONT PUSHES
TOWARD THE MIDSOUTH FROM THE SOUTH. 850 MB FLOW INCREASES TO 50
KNOTS FROM THE SOUTHWEST BY 12Z ACROSS PARTS OF THE MIDSOUTH.
GREATEST INSTABILITY REMAINS TO THE SOUTH OF THE MIDSOUTH...AND SPC
HAS A SLIGHT RISK OF SEVERE TO OUR SOUTH TONIGHT. COULD BE A FEW
STRONG THUNDERSTORMS LATE TONIGHT FROM ABOUT MARVELL AR IN PHILLIPS
COUNTY TO AMORY MS IN MONROE COUNTY. MARGINAL INSTABILITY WILL
COMBINE WITH STRONG WIND SHEAR THROUGH THIS AREA BY LATE TONIGHT
AS THE WARM FRONT NEARS.

THE COLD FRONT WILL PUSH EASTWARD THROUGH THE MIDSOUTH TUESDAY.
THERE WILL BE A SLIGHT CHANCE OF SEVERE THUNDERSTORMS FROM PHILLIPS
COUNTY AR ACROSS MOST OF NORTH MS. THE WARM FRONT WILL CONTINUE
TO PUSH NORTHWARD INTO NORTH MS DURING THE MORNING. ONCE AGAIN
INSTABILITY WILL BE QUESTIONABLE...DEPENDING ON HOW FAR NORTH THE
WARM FRONT GETS.

DRY AND COOLER WEATHER WILL PUSH INTO THE MIDSOUTH TUESDAY NIGHT...
BUT WEDNESDAY WILL SEE A QUICK WARM UP AS WINDS TURN TO AND
INCREASE FROM THE SOUTHWEST. THE MESOETA IS INDICATING THERE COULD
BE A CHANCE OF SHOWERS FROM NORTHEAST AR INTO NORTHWEST TN LATE
WEDNESDAY / WEDNESDAY NIGHT AS A SURFACE BOUNDARY SETS UP JUST TO
OUR NORTH. THE GFS IS NOT AGREEMENT WITH THIS. ATTM...WILL LEAVE
THE FORECAST DRY UNTIL MODELS IN BETTER AGREEMENT. NO CHANGES TO THE
REMAINDER OF THE FORECAST.

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.

&&

$$

SJM

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
937 PM CDT SUN APR 24 2005

.DISCUSSION...

HIGH CLOUDS ARE BEGINNING TO OVERSPREAD THE REGION FROM THE 
SOUTHWEST. TEMPS HAVE FALLEN OFF A LITTLE FASTER THAN ANTICIPATED IN 
THE DRY AIR. EXPECT THAT TEMPS SHOULD START LEVELING OFF WITH THE 
CLOUD COVER. ONLY TEMP ADJUSTMENT WILL BE TO THE SHELBY COUNTY 
AREA...WILL GO WITH A RANGE OF 40 TO 45 HERE.



000 
FXUS64 KMEG 242058
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
358 PM CDT SUN APR 24 2005

.DISCUSSION...
HIGH PRESSURE WILL CONTINUE TO BE IN CONTROL OF THE WEATHER TONIGHT. 
SKIES WILL REMAIN CLEAR TO MOSTLY CLEAR DURING THE EVENING. DON/T 
EXPECT LOW TEMPERATURES TO DROP AS MUCH AS LAST NIGHT. LOWS SHOULD 
BE INTO THE MID 30S TO MID 40S ACROSS THE AREA. EXPECT MID TO HIGH 
CLOUDS TO BEGIN TO MOVE INTO SOUTHWESTERN PORTIONS OF THE MIDSOUTH 
AFTER MIDNIGHT AHEAD OF A LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM THAT IS CURRENTLY 
LOCATED OVER THE SOUTHWESTERN UNITED STATES. 

CLOUDS WILL CONTINUE TO INCREASE ON MONDAY AND BY AFTERNOON EXPECT 
SHOWERS TO MOVE INTO SOUTHWESTERN HALF OF CWA AS A WARM FRONT BEGINS 
TO LIFT NORTHWARD.

WARM FRONT SHOULD LIFT INTO NORTH MISSISSIPPI MONDAY NIGHT INTO 
EARLY TUESDAY. THE FRONT WILL BE THE FOCUS OF SHOWERS AND 
THUNDERSTORM DEVELOPMENT. SOME OF THE THUNDERSTORMS COULD BE SEVERE 
DURING THIS TIME. THERE IS A SLIGHT RISK FOR SEVERE STORMS FOR 
PORTIONS OF EASTERN ARKANSAS AND NORTHWEST MISSISSIPPI DURING THIS 
TIME.

THE SEVERE THREAT WILL SHIFT TO NORTHEAST MISSISSIPPI ON TUESDAY AS 
THE WARM FRONT PUSHES EAST AND A COLD FRONT PUSHES INTO THE CWA. 
COLD FRONT WILL LINGER IN EXTREME EASTERN ZONES TUESDAY EVENING 
BEFORE EXITING AREA.

MIDSOUTH WILL SEE A BRIEF BREAK FROM PRECIPITATION CHANCES AS HIGH 
PRESSURE REBUILDS INTO THE AREA ON WEDNESDAY. BREAK WILL BE 
SHORT-LIVED AS ANOTHER LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM MOVES INTO THE REGION ON 
THURSDAY AND WILL BRING THE CHANCE FOR SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS TO 
THE AREA THROUGH THE END OF THE FORECAST PERIOD.
&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.

&&

EXPECTED HIGHS. FORECAST LOOKS GOOD...NO UPDATES ARE EXPECTED.

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 241233
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
733 AM CDT SUN APR 24 2005

.UPDATE...
WILL CANCEL ENTIRE FREEZE WARNING ISSUED EARLIER FOR PARTS OF THE
AREA FOR EARLY THIS MORNING.

.PREV DISCUSSION...
ISSUED 354 AM CDT...

UPDATE...
HAVE DECIDED TO REMOVE LAKE...OBION..AND DYER COUNTY FROM THE FREEZE
WARNING. TEMPERATURES ARE STILL WELL ABOVE FREEZING IN THESE
COUNTIES.

ISSUED 339 AM CDT...

WILL KEEP FREEZE WARNING AS ISSUED EARLIER UNTIL 14Z FOR PARTS OF
WEST TN AND NORTHEAST MS. HOWEVER...TEMPERATURES ARE HAVING A HARD
TIME DROPPING TO THE FREEZING MARK WITH A LIGHT NORTHWEST WIND
HELPING TO HOLD TEMPERATURES UP SOMEWHAT IN MANY LOCATIONS. SOME
MID-LEVEL CLOUDS ALSO MOVED THROUGH EARLIER...BUT THESE CLOUDS HAVE
NOW MOVED OUT OF THE AREA.

SATELLITE SHOWS CLEAR SKIES ACROSS THE MIDSOUTH THIS MORNING AND
THAT WILL BE THE FORECAST FOR TODAY. NORTHWEST WINDS AT THE SURFACE
AND ALOFT WILL FEED VERY DRY AIR INTO THE MIDSOUTH TODAY. SKIES WILL
BE SUNNY BUT TEMPERATURES WILL REMAIN UNSEASONABLY COOL.

THE GFS AND NAM ARE IN FAIRLY GOOD AGREEMENT WITH THE NEXT RAIN
SYSTEM TO AFFECT THE MIDSOUTH. THERE ARE SLIGHT TIMING DIFFERENCES
WITH ENDING OF THE RAIN TUESDAY WITH THE GFS ENDING IT FROM THE WEST
A LITTLE FASTER. A SOUTHERN STREAM UPPER LEVEL SHORT WAVE AND
ASSOCIATED SURFACE LOW WILL MOVE INTO THE SOUTHERN PLAINS MONDAY.
MEANWHILE...ANOTHER UPPER LEVEL TROUGH WILL APPROACH FROM THE
NORTHWEST. A WARM FRONT WILL DEVELOP TO THE SOUTHWEST MONDAY AND MOVE
TOWARD THE MIDSOUTH. STRONG ISENTROPIC LIFT WILL DEVELOP OVER THE
MIDSOUTH MONDAY NIGHT AS SOUTHWEST WINDS AT 850 MB INCREASE TO 45
KNOTS ACROSS PARTS OF THE AREA. WILL CONTINUE WITH A SLIGHT CHANCE OF
RAIN ALONG AND SOUTHWEST OF A LINE FROM JONESBORO TO MEMPHIS TO
TUPELO FOR MONDAY AFTERNOON. RAIN AND POSSIBLY A FEW THUNDERSTORMS
WILL SPREAD INTO THE MIDSOUTH MONDAY NIGHT. A COLD FRONT WILL PUSH
THROUGH THE MIDSOUTH TUESDAY AS THE SOUTHERN STREAM SHORT WAVE MOVES
TO THE EAST AND WEAKENS...AND THE NORTHERN TROUGH MOVES INTO THE
MIDSOUTH. THE RAIN IS EXPECTED TO BE OVER WITH BY TUESDAY NIGHT...AND
LATER FORECASTS MAY BE ABLE TO REMOVE FOR PART OF THE AREA FOR
TUESDAY AFTERNOON. GREATEST INSTABILITY IS FORECAST TO THE SOUTH OF
THE MIDSOUTH WITH THIS SYSTEM. HOWEVER...COULD BE A FEW STRONG STORMS
FROM EAST-CENTRAL ARKANSAS INTO NORTH MS LATE MONDAY NIGHT AND
TUESDAY...WITH MARGINAL INSTABILITY BUT RATHER STRONG WIND SHEAR.
WILL MENTION THIS THREAT IN THE HAZARDOUS WEATHER OUTLOOK.

DRY WEATHER RETURNS WEDNESDAY. NO CHANGES TO THE REMAINDER OF THE
CURRENT FORECAST.

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.

&&

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 231934
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
300 PM CDT SAT APR 23 2005

.DISCUSSION...

CLOUDS ON THE BACKSIDE OF THE UPPER LOW ARE STILL SLOW TO MOVE OUT 
OF THE CWA THIS AFTERNOON. EXPECT THE CLOUDS TO REMAIN DURING THE 
EVENING OVER THE NORTHEASTERN ZONES...WHILE THE REST OF THE CWA 
CLEARS OUT. AFTER MIDNIGHT...THE ENTIRE AREA SHOULD BE CLEAR AS HIGH 
PRESSURE BUILDS INTO THE AREA. WINDS WILL ALSO STAY UP DURING THE 
EVENING HOURS. WIND SPEEDS ARE CURRENTLY RUNNING AROUND 15 MPH WITH 
GUSTS TO 25 MPH. WITH THE WIND SPEEDS STAYING UP AND CLOUDS HANGING 
AROUND DURING THE EVENING HOURS...HAVE RAISED LOW TEMPS AROUND TWO 
DEGREES THAN WHAT THE PREVIOUS FORECAST HAD GOING. EVEN WITH RAISING 
THE TEMPERATURES...AREAS WEST TENNESSEE WILL DROP NEAR OR BELOW 
FREEZING. WILL UPGRADE FREEZE WATCH TO FREEZE WARNING FOR AREAS 
NORTHEAST OF A LINE FROM DYERSBURG TO SELMER. WILL ALSO KEEP MENTION 
OF SCATTERED FROST ACROSS NORTHEAST ARKANSAS...MO 
BOOTHEEL...PORTIONS OF WEST TENNESSEE...AND NORTHEAST MISSISSIPPI.

HIGH PRESSURE WILL STAY IN CONTROL FOR SUNDAY AND WILL GIVE THE 
MIDSOUTH A PLEASANT DAY WITH MOSTLY SUNNY SKIES. TEMPERATURES WILL 
STILL BE ON THE COOL SIDE WITH HIGHS IN THE UPPER 50S TO LOWER 60S.

CLOUDS WILL BEGIN TO INCREASE BY MONDAY AS A LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM 
APPROACHES THE AREA FROM THE SOUTHWEST. SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS 
WILL DEVELOP OUT AHEAD OF A WARM FRONT THAT WILL BE LOCATED OVER 
CENTRAL MISSISSIPPI LATE MONDAY AND MONDAY NIGHT. THE CHANCES FOR 
SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS WILL CONTINUE INTO TUESDAY AND TUESDAY 
NIGHT AS A COLD FRONT PUSHES THROUGH THE AREA.

MISOUTH WILL SEE QUIET WEATHER WEDNESDAY THROUGH THURSDAY AS HIGH 
PRESSURE MOVES BACK INTO THE AREA. HOWEVER ANOTHER COLD FRONT WILL 
MOVE INTO THE AREA BEGINNING FRIDAY AND WILL BRING RAIN CHANCES TO 
THE AREA THROUGH THE BEGINNING OF THE WEEKEND.
&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE. 
TN...FREEZE WARNING 05Z TONIGHT TO 14Z SUNDAY FOR PORTIONS OF WEST   
     TENNESSEE NORTHEAST OF A LINE FROM DYR TO SZY.

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 230840
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
340 AM CDT SAT APR 23 2005

.DISCUSSION...
H5 FLOW THIS MORNING SHOWS A STRONG WIND FLOW FROM CENTRAL CANADA TO
THE MIDSOUTH. THIS WILL STEER COLD HIGH PRESSURE FROM THE NORTHERN
PLAINS INTO THE MIDSOUTH THIS WEEKEND. LATEST SATELLITE SHOWS
MOSTLY CLEAR SKIES ACROSS THE MIDSOUTH. HOWEVER...LOW CLOUDS ARE
UPSTREAM OVER MO. THINK CLOUDS WILL SPREAD INTO OR DEVELOP ACROSS
MUCH OF THE MIDSOUTH THIS MORNING. THERE HAS BEEN SOME LIGHT RAIN
OVER MO ASSOCIATED WITH THESE CLOUDS. WILL MENTION A CHANCE
OF SPRINKLES FOR THIS MORNING FROM THE MO BOOTHEEL INTO MUCH OF WEST
TN AS AN UPPER LEVEL DISTURBANCE ROTATES AROUND A LARGE H5 LOW
CENTERED OVER THE OH RIVER VALLEY. WINDS WILL BE STRONG AND GUSTY
TODAY FROM THE NORTHWEST...BUT ATTM...THINK THEY WILL REMAIN BELOW
WIND ADVISORY CRITERIA.

FOR TONIGHT...WILL LEAVE FREEZE WATCH AS IS WHICH INCLUDES THE AREA
FROM THE MO BOOTHEEL...ACROSS MUCH OF WEST TN (EXCLUDING THE MEMPHIS
METRO AREA)...AND INTO EXTREME NORTHEAST MS. NAM 850 MB FORECAST
SHOWS MINUS 4 DEGREES C SPREADING INTO MUCH OF THE MIDSOUTH WITH
MINUS 6 DEGREES C OVER EXTREME NORTHERN REACHES OF WEST TN. WILL ALSO
KEEP IN SCATTERED FROST FOR MUCH OF THE FORECAST AREA EXCEPT FOR
SOUTHWESTERN AREAS...ALTHOUGH WINDS MAY STAY UP HIGH ENOUGH TO KEEP
MUCH FROST FROM FORMING EXCEPT IN WIND PROTECTED LOCATIONS. RH PROGS
INDICATE SKIES WILL BE CLEAR TONIGHT AND WILL CONTINUE THAT WAY
THROUGH SUNDAY. TEMPERATURES WILL REMAIN UNSEASONABLY COOL SUNDAY.

WILL ADD A SLIGHT CHANCE OF RAIN FOR MONDAY AFTERNOON ALONG AND
SOUTHWEST OF A JONESBORO TO MEMPHIS TO TUPELO LINE. NAM AND GFS
ARE IN AGREEMENT THAT AN UPPER LEVEL TROUGH WILL MOVE INTO THE
SOUTHERN PLAINS MONDAY WITH A STRONG SURFACE LOW DEVELOPING OVR TX. A
WARM FRONT WILL DEVELOP TO THE SOUTHWEST OF THE MIDSOUTH. ISENTROPIC
LIFT WILL SPREAD CLOUDS AND A SLIGHT CHANCE OF RAIN INTO THE AREA
FROM THE SOUTHWEST. A BETTER CHANCE OF SHOWERS...AND POSSIBLY
THUNDERSTORMS...WILL COME MONDAY NIGHT INTO TUESDAY AS THE UPPER
LEVEL LOW AND ASSOCIATED SURFACE LOW MOVES ACROSS THE MIDSOUTH FROM
THE WEST. SPC INDICATES A SLIGHT RISK OF SEVERE MONDAY NIGHT FOR
PART OF EAST-CENTRAL AR INTO NORTH MS. HOWEVER...THE LATEST NAM
KEEPS THE MORE UNSTABLE AIR FURTHER SOUTH THAN THE GFS. ATTM...WILL
HOLD OFF ON MENTIONING THE THREAT OF SEVERE WEATHER IN THE HAZARDOUS
WEATHER OUTLOOK.


&&

FXUS64 KMEG 230107
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
807 PM CDT FRI APR 22 2005

.UPDATE...
WIND ADVISORY HAS BEEN ALLOWED TO EXPIRE. 01Z OBS INDICATING THAT 
SUSTAINED WINDS ARE AROUND 15 MPH WITH GUSTS TO 25 OR 30 MPH. HAVE 
ALSO UPDATED FORECAST FOR CLOUD COVER OVERNIGHT. A BAND OF LOW 
CLOUDS WILL MOVE THROUGH THE AREA THIS EVENING. A SECONDARY BAND OF 
CLOUDS OVER WESTERN AND CENTRAL MISSOURI WILL MOVE IN OVERNIGHT. 
HOWEVER THESE CLOUDS DO NOT SEEM AS EXTENSIVE AS EXPECTED EARLIER. 
NO OTHER CHANGES MADE TO FORECAST.

.DISCUSSION...

COLD FRONT HAS MOVED THROUGH MKL AND WILL CONTINUE PUSHING 
SOUTHEAST. EXPECT FRONT TO BE THROUGH ENTIRE CWA BY 00Z. THIS WILL 
END CHANCES FOR REDEVELOPMENT OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS ACROSS 
AREA. WILL REMOVE POPS FOR THIS EVENING. HOWEVER AS SHORTWAVE SKIRTS 
ACROSS NORTHERN ZONES...AN ISOLATED SPRINKLE IS POSSIBLE.

COOL HIGH PRESSURE WILL BUILD INTO THE MIDSOUTH BY SATURDAY. HIGH 
TEMPERATURES ON SATURDAY WILL ONLY BE IN THE UPPER 50S. WINDS WILL 
GUSTY OUT OF THE NORTHWEST AND WILL MAKE IT FEEL EVEN COOLER. THE 
WINDS WILL DIE DOWN AFTER SUNSET ALLOWING FOR TEMPERATURES TO DROP 
TO BELOW FREEZING ACROSS PORTIONS OF WEST TENNESSEE...MISSOURI 
BOOTHEEL...AND EXTREME PORTIONS OF NORTHEAST MISSISSIPPI. WILL PUT A 
FREEZE WATCH IN THESE LOCATIONS. HAVE ALSO ADDED SCATTERED FROST TO 
THE REST OF WEST TENNESSEE...NORTHEAST ARKANSAS...AND NORTHEAST 
MISSISSIPPI.

TEMPERATURES WILL BEGIN TO REBOUND BY MONDAY AS WINDS SWITCH AROUND 
TO THE SOUTHWEST AHEAD OF AN APPROACHING LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM. CLOUDS 
WILL ALSO BEGIN TO INCREASE ON MONDAY. CHANCES FOR RAIN WILL BEGIN 
MONDAY NIGHT AS LOW BEGINS TO PUSH INTO ARKANSAS. THE CHANCES FOR 
RAIN WILL CONTINUE THROUGH TUESDAY NIGHT AS THE LOW AND ASSOCIATED 
COLD FRONT PUSHES THROUGH THE AREA. 

HIGH PRESSURE WILL AGAIN BUILD INTO THE AREA FOR WEDNESDAY AND 
THURSDAY. ANOTHER COLD FRONT WILL PUSH SOUTHWARD INTO THE MIDSOUTH 
ON FRIDAY.

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...WIND ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 01Z.
MO...WIND ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 01Z. FREEZE WATCH FOR SAT NGHT 5Z 
TO SUN MOR 14Z.
MS...WIND ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 01Z. FREEZE WATCH FOR EXTREME NE 
MS FOR SAT NGHT 5Z TO SUN MOR 14Z. 
TN...WIND ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 01Z. FREEZE WATCH FOR WEST 
TENNESSEE EXCPT MEM METRO FOR SAT NGHT 5Z TO SUN MOR 14Z.

.UPDATE...
CURRENT OBS SHOW SUSTAINED WINDS OF 25MPH WITH GUSTS TO NEAR 40MPH 
OVER MUCH OF THE REGION. EXPECT THESE WINDS TO STAY UP TILL JUST 
AFTER SUNSET WHEN THE WINDS WILL BEGIN TO DIMINISH. WIND ADVISORY IS 
NEEDED UNTIL AT LEAST 1Z.

.DISCUSSION...

COLD FRONT HAS MOVED THROUGH MKL AND WILL CONTINUE PUSHING 
SOUTHEAST. EXPECT FRONT TO BE THROUGH ENTIRE CWA BY 00Z. THIS WILL 
END CHANCES FOR REDEVELOPMENT OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS ACROSS 
AREA. WILL REMOVE POPS FOR THIS EVENING. HOWEVER AS SHORTWAVE SKIRTS 
ACROSS NORTHERN ZONES...AN ISOLATED SPRINKLE IS POSSIBLE.

COOL HIGH PRESSURE WILL BUILD INTO THE MIDSOUTH BY SATURDAY. HIGH 
TEMPERATURES ON SATURDAY WILL ONLY BE IN THE UPPER 50S. WINDS WILL 
GUSTY OUT OF THE NORTHWEST AND WILL MAKE IT FEEL EVEN COOLER. THE 
WINDS WILL DIE DOWN AFTER SUNSET ALLOWING FOR TEMPERATURES TO DROP 
TO BELOW FREEZING ACROSS PORTIONS OF WEST TENNESSEE...MISSOURI 
BOOTHEEL...AND EXTREME PORTIONS OF NORTHEAST MISSISSIPPI. WILL PUT A 
FREEZE WATCH IN THESE LOCATIONS. HAVE ALSO ADDED SCATTERED FROST TO 
THE REST OF WEST TENNESSEE...NORTHEAST ARKANSAS...AND NORTHEAST 
MISSISSIPPI.

TEMPERATURES WILL BEGIN TO REBOUND BY MONDAY AS WINDS SWITCH AROUND 
TO THE SOUTHWEST AHEAD OF AN APPROACHING LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM. CLOUDS 
WILL ALSO BEGIN TO INCREASE ON MONDAY. CHANCES FOR RAIN WILL BEGIN 
MONDAY NIGHT AS LOW BEGINS TO PUSH INTO ARKANSAS. THE CHANCES FOR 
RAIN WILL CONTINUE THROUGH TUESDAY NIGHT AS THE LOW AND ASSOCIATED 
COLD FRONT PUSHES THROUGH THE AREA. 

HIGH PRESSURE WILL AGAIN BUILD INTO THE AREA FOR WEDNESDAY AND 
THURSDAY. ANOTHER COLD FRONT WILL PUSH SOUTHWARD INTO THE MIDSOUTH 
ON FRIDAY.

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...WIND ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 01Z.
MO...WIND ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 01Z. FREEZE WATCH FOR SAT NGHT 5Z 
TO SUN MOR 14Z.
MS...WIND ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 01Z. FREEZE WATCH FOR EXTREME NE 
MS FOR SAT NGHT 5Z TO SUN MOR 14Z. 
TN...WIND ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 01Z. FREEZE WATCH FOR WEST 
TENNESSEE EXCPT MEM METRO FOR SAT NGHT 5Z TO SUN MOR 14Z.
&&

FIRE UP LATE THIS MORNING AND THIS AFTERNOON. SPC HAS EASTERN
SECTIONS OF THE FORECAST AREA IN A MODERATE RISK SO HAVE PUT SEVERE
WORDING IN THOSE AREAS. COLD FRONT SHOULD BE MOSTLY OUT OF THE
FORECAST BY 00Z SO FAR EASTERN SECTIONS WILL STILL HAVE A CHANCE OF
THUNDERSTORMS AFTER 00Z. MUCH COOLER AIR BEGINS TO MOVE IN BEHIND
THE FRONT TONIGHT WITH MOST LOCATIONS SEEING TEMPERATURES BELOW 50
DEGREES BY SATURDAY MORNING. COLD ADVECTION WILL BE CONTINUING
THROUGH THE DAY SATURDAY AS TEMPERATURES STRUGGLE TO GET ABOVE 60
DEGREES. BY SUNDAY MORNING...CLEAR SKIES AND LIGHT WINDS WILL ALLOW
TEMPERATURES TO DROP PRETTY LOW WITH SECTIONS OF NORTHWEST TENNESSEE
SEEING READINGS AT OR BELOW FREEZING. A GRADUAL WARMUP WILL BEGIN ON
SUNDAY AS TEMPERATURES REBOUND TOWARD NORMAL LEVELS BY MID WEEK. THE
NEXT CHANCE OF RAIN WILL START MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY NIGHT AS
A COLD FRONT MOVES THROUGH. BY WEDNESDAY THE FRONT SHOULD BE THROUGH
THE FORECAST AREA BUT SHOULD RETURN BACK NORTH BY THURSDAY SO THE
RAIN MAY ALSO RETURN.

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 211921
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
300 PM CDT THU APR 21 2005

.DISCUSSION...

THE MIDSOUTH IS EXPERIENCING PLEASANT WEATHER THIS AFTERNOON. SKIES 
ARE MOSTLY SUNNY TO PARTLY CLOUDY. DRY CONDITIONS WILL BE COMING TO 
AN END BY FRIDAY MORNING. A COLD FRONT WILL APPROACH THE AREA 
LATE TONIGHT. A LINE OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS ARE EXPECTED TO 
DEVELOP ALONG THE FRONT. THE LINE SHOULD BEGIN ENTERING NORTHWESTERN 
SECTIONS OF THE CWA AFTER MIDNIGHT. THE LINE IS CURRENTLY DEVELOPING 
AND IS EXPECTED TO BE SEVERE ACROSS MUCH OF MISSOURI...NORTHWEST 
ARKANSAS...SOUTHEAST KANSAS...AND NORTHWEST OKLAHOMA. BY THE TIME THE LINE 
REACHES THE MIDSOUTH IT SHOULD BE IN A DYING PHASE. HOWEVER...THERE 
IS A CHANCE THAT SOME OF THE STORMS COULD BE SEVERE WITH LARGE HAIL 
AND DAMAGING WINDS BEING THE MAIN THREAT. SPC HAS THE MISSOURI 
BOOTHEEL AND NORTHEAST ARKANSAS IN A SLIGHT RISK. IN ADDITION...SOME 
EVENING SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS COULD OCCUR AS A SHORTWAVE MOVES 
THROUGH THE CWA AHEAD OF THE FRONT. HOWEVER...ANY THUNDERSTORMS THAT 
OCCUR WILL STAY BELOW SEVERE LIMITS DURING THE EVENING HOURS.

FRIDAY MORNING...FRONT WILL BE LOCATED NEAR NORTHWESTERN SECTIONS OF 
THE CWA. INITIAL LINE SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS WILL BE LOCATED OVER 
EASTERN SECTIONS OF CWA. LINE SHOULD EXIT MIDSOUTH BY MIDDAY. AS THE 
DAY PROGRESSES...COLD FRONT WILL CONTINUE MOVING EASTWARD INTO THE 
REST OF THE CWA. SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS ARE EXPECTED TO REDEVELOP 
DURING THE AFTERNOON HOURS. THE ATMOSPHERE WILL BE VERY UNSTABLE OUT 
AHEAD OF THE FRONT WITH CAPES NEAR 3000 J/KG. THE AREA WILL ALSO BE 
IN A FAVORABLE REGION OF THE UPPER LEVEL JET. SOME OF THE 
THUNDERSTORMS THAT DEVELOP HAVE THE POTENTIAL OF BECOMING SEVERE. 
THERE IS A MODERATE RISK FOR MAINLY AREAS EAST OF THE MISSISSIPPI 
RIVER.  LARGE HAIL...DAMAGING WINDS...AND POSSIBLY A FEW ISOLATED 
TORNADOES ARE POSSIBLE. FRONT MAY LINGER INTO FRIDAY EVENING ALONG 
WITH THE THREAT FOR SEVERE WEATHER.

BY SATURDAY MORNING...COOLER AIR WILL MOVE INTO THE AREA AS HIGH 
PRESSURE BUILDS INTO THE MIDSOUTH. COOL AND DRY WEATHER WILL 
CONTINUE INTO EARLY NEXT WEEK. LOW TEMPERATURES MAY REACH FREEZING 
SUNDAY MORNING...MAINLY ACROSS PORTIONS OF NORTHWEST TENNESSEE.

SEVERAL COLD FRONTS WILL MOVE THROUGH THE MIDSOUTH THROUGH THE 
MIDDLE OF THE WEEK. THIS WILL BRING CHANCES FOR RAIN BACK TO THE 
AREA.

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.

WINDS AND LARGE HAIL. THE COLD FRONT WILL MOVE OUT OF THE REGION
FRIDAY NIGHT WITH SLIGHT CHANCE POPS IN THE WEST AND CHANCE POPS IN

REGION WITH LOWS SOME 10-15 DEGREES COOLER THAN FRIDAY MORNING.
NORTHWEST WINDS WILL HELP KEEP TEMPERATURES IN CHECK SATURDAY WITH
HIGH STRUGGLING TO GET INTO THE 60S. A CHILLY NIGHT IS IN STORE FOR
SATURDAY NIGHT AS BY SUNDAY MORNING MANY LOCATIONS WILL SEE LOW
TEMPERATURES IN THE 30S. A GRADUAL WARMUP WILL BEGIN ON SUNDAY AS
TEMPERATURES GRADUALLY REBOUND TOWARD NORMAL LEVELS BY MID WEEK WITH

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 202007
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
308 PM CDT WED APR 20 2005

.DISCUSSION...
A LONG LIVED MCS WAS MOVING SOUTHEAST THROUGH CENTRAL MISSOURI THIS 
AFTERNOON. THIS COMPLEX HAS BEEN HANDLED WELL BY THE NAM. EXPECT 
REMNANTS OF THIS COMPLEX TO AFFECT PARTS OF THE MID SOUTH THIS 
EVENING AND TONIGHT ESPECIALLY THE NORTHEASTERN HALF OF THE FORECAST 
AREA. A FEW SHOWERS POPPED UP NEAR THE TN RIVER THIS AFTERNOON...
HOWEVER LIFE CYCLE WAS RATHER SHORT. SURFACE DEW POINTS SURGED FROM 
THE LOWER 50S AT 8 AM TO LOWER 60S BY NOON TODAY. LOW LEVEL MOISTURE 
ALSO EVIDENT AROUND 5KFT WHERE SCT-BKN CU FIELD COVERS THE WHOLE 
REGION. 

THE HIGH DEW POINTS COMBINED WITH STEEPENING LAPSE RATES SHOULD 
ALLOW ANY THUNDERSTORMS THAT PERSIST WITH THE MCS IN MISSOURI TO 
MOVE THROUGH PARTS OF THE MID SOUTH OVERNIGHT. SOUTHERLY WINDS WILL 
CONTINUE TO KEEP THINGS MOIST ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA THURSDAY.  
THE REAL PROBLEMS WILL BE THE LIFTING MECHANISM AND THE CAP. MOSTLY 
CLOUDY CONDITIONS SHOULD HINDER STORM DEVELOPMENT. BUT IF  AIR 
PARCELS CAN BREAK THE RELATIVELY WEAK CAP...THEN ADDITIONAL 
THUNDERSTORM DEVELOPMENT WILL OCCUR THURSDAY AFTERNOON.

BY FRIDAY...A SHORTWAVE TROUGH ORIGINATING OUT OF THE CENTRAL 
ROCKIES THURSDAY AFTERNOON WILL TRANSLATE ACROSS MISSOURI FRIDAY. 
THE ASSOCIATED COLD FRONT WILL MOVE THROUGH THE MID SOUTH FRIDAY 
AFTERNOON. WE EXPECT THUNDERSTORMS TO DEVELOP ALONG AND AHEAD OF THE 
COLD FRONT WHERE VERY UNSTABLE AIR WILL BE LOCATED. SOME STORMS MAY 
BE SEVERE FRIDAY WITH LARGE HAIL AND DAMAGING WINDS. 

IN THE WAKE OF THE COLD FRONT...CONSIDERABLY COLDER TEMPERATURES 
WILL FILTER INTO THE REGION SATURDAY. RAIN WILL MOVE EAST OF THE 
AREA FRIDAY NIGHT LEAVING COLD NORTHERLY WINDS BEHIND. MAX 
TEMPERATURES WILL ONLY REACH THE 60S SATURDAY. SUNDAY MORNING COULD 
PRODUCE SOME FROST ACROSS PARTS OF THE FORECAST AREA...ESPECIALLY 
NORTHEASTERN SECTIONS. RAIN CHANCES WILL BEGIN AGAIN MONDAY EVENING 
AND CONTINUE THROUGH MID WEEK.  

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.

NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
240 AM CDT WED APR 20 2005

.DISCUSSION...

QUIET WEATHER OVER REGION RIGHT NOW WITH MOSTLY CLEAR SKIES EARLY

MID 60S WITH DEWPOINTS IN THE MID TO UPPER 40S. FRONTAL BOUNDARY
STRETCHES FROM SOUTHERN WISCONSIN THROUGH CENTRAL NEBRASKA WITH
QUITE A BIT OF THUNDERSTORM ACTIVITY THROUGH IOWA AND EASTERN

INTO NORTHERN MISSOURI. FEEL THAT THIS POSITION IS A LITTLE TOO FAR
NORTH FOR MUCH OF THE FORECAST AREA TO SEE ANY THUNDERSTORMS FOR
TONIGHT SO HAVE REMOVED POPS FROM THE SOUTHERN HALF OF THE FORECAST
AREA. BY THURSDAY...FRONT WILL CONTINUE TO SAG SOUTH AND THIS WILL
BRING A LITTLE BETTER CHANCE OF THUNDERSTORMS TO THE AREA. SPC DOES
HAVE MUCH OF THE FORECAST AREA OUTLOOK FOR SEVERE WEATHER FOR
THURSDAY NIGHT BUT FRONT STILL WONT BE CLOSE ENOUGH TO WARRANT
MENTION OF SEVERE RIGHT NOW. BY FRIDAY...FRONT SHOULD BEGIN TO MOVE
THROUGH REGION AND THIS IS WHEN WE WILL HAVE OUR BEST CHANCE OF
THUNDERSTORMS. WOULDNT BE COMPLETELY SURPRISED TO SEE A SEVERE
THUNDERSTORM OR TWO AHEAD OF THE FRONT. BY SATURDAY...FRONT HAS
CLEARED THE REGION ENDING ANY CHANCE OF RAIN. UNSEASONABLY COOL AIR
WILL MAKE ITS WAY INTO THE REGION AND TEMPERATURES WILL BE SOME 10-15
DEGREES COOLER THAN FRIDAY. SUNDAY MORNING WILL BE RATHER CHILLY WITH
NORTHERN AND EASTERN PARTS OF THE FORECAST SEEING TEMPERATURES BELOW
40. TEMPERATURES DO BEGIN TO REBOUND ON SUNDAY WITH A GRADUAL WARMUP
FOR THE BEGINNING OF NEXT WEEK. ANOTHER STORM SYSTEM APPROACHES THE
REGION LATE MONDAY WITH MORE THUNDERSTORMS EXPECTED FOR MONDAY NIGHT
AND TUESDAY.



000 
FXUS64 KMEG 191949
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
250 PM CDT TUE APR 19 2005

.DISCUSSION...
SURFACE HIGH CONTINUES ACROSS NORTHEASTERN GOMEX. WINDS HAVE COME
AROUND TO THE SOUTH WITH MOISTURE RETURNING. THE MOISTURE RETURN IS A
LITTLE MORE APPARENT TO OUR WEST...OVER OKLAHOMA AND WESTERN
ARKANSAS. WHILE OVERNIGHT DEWPOINTS WERE IN THE 50S. THEY HAVE
DROPPED BACK INTO THE 40S DURING THE AFTERNOON. EACH OF THE LAST 3
DAYS HAS SHOWN A DECREASE IN AFTERNOON DEWPOINTS AFTER THE CUMULUS
FIELD DEVELOPS. TEMPERATURES GENERALLY WITHIN A FEW DEGREES OF 80...
UNDER PARTLY CLOUDY SKIES.
&&

.SHORT TERM (THROUGH FRIDAY)...
SURFACE HIGH NOT IN A HURRY TO MOVE EASTWARD. MOISTURE WILL SLOWLY
INCREASE OVER THE NEXT 48 HOURS...BUT SHOULDNT REALLY BE NOTICED
BEFORE TOMORROW NIGHT. MODELS HAVING A DIFFICULT TIME HANDLING WEAK
IMPULSES TRYING TO MOVE OVER THE RIDGE. WHILE AN AREA OF SHOWERS
CANNOT BE RULED OUT THROUGH WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON...FEEL CHANCES ARE
LESS THAN 20 PERCENT OF ANYONE MEASURING...AND WILL KEEP FORECAST
DRY. PERSISTANCE LOOKS TO BE A GOOD TEMPERATURE FORECAST THROUGH
TOMORROW.

MODELS START BRINGING IMPULSES OVERTOP THE UPPER RIDGE WEDNESDAY
NIGHT. MOISTURE WILL BE A LITTLE BIT BETTER...AND WILL KEEP 20 POPS
IN THE FORECAST. CHANCES FOR PRECIPITATION GET BETTER FOR THURSDAY
AND FRIDAY AS FRONTAL SYSTEM APPROACHES FROM THE NORTH. BEST
CHANCES FOR RAIN WOULD BE ON FRIDAY...WITH APPARENT FRONTAL PASSAGE.
A FEW STRONG STORMS ARE POSSIBLE ON FRIDAY...BUT WILL NOT PLAY UP AT
THIS POINT. ADDITIONAL CLOUD COVER WILL DRAG TEMPERATURES DOWN A
COUPLE OF DEGREES FOR HIGHS ON THURSDAY AND FRIDAY...BUT STILL NEAR
OR ABOVE NORMAL.
&&

.LONG TERM (AFTER FRIDAY)...
SYSTEM SHOULD CLEAR THE AREA ON SATURDAY. FORECAST UPPER AIR PATTERN
OF DEEP TROF OVER EASTERN U.S. IS VERY UNSEASONABLE...AND WOULD NOT
BE SURPRISED IF MODEL GUIDANCE MODERATES ON THE DEPTH OF THE TROF.
HAVE TRENDED WEEKEND TEMPERATURES DOWN...BUT NOT QUITE TO THE EXTENT
OF THE GFS YET. IF TIME HEIGHTS ARE CORRECT ON GFS...MEMPHIS WOULD
LIKELY BE IN THE 50S OR LOWER 60S ON SATURDAY AND SUNDAY. IF THE
TREND BECOMES CONSISTENT OVER THE NEXT DAY OR SO...ADDITIONAL
LOWERING OF TEMPERATURES FOR THE WEEKEND IS POSSIBLE.

STRONG TROF MOVES OFF TO THE EAST RATHER QUICKLY...AND FLOW BECOMES
RATHER ZONAL. ANOTHER HEALTHY SYSTEM TO COME THROUGH ON TUESDAY...
WITH ANOTHER CHANCE OF PRECIPITATION.
&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.
&&

WAGNER





000 
FXUS64 KMEG 190925
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
425 AM CDT TUE APR 19 2005

.DISCUSSION...

A WEAK SHORTWAVE THAT BROUGHT SPRINKLES AND A FEW LIGHT SHOWERS TO
PORTIONS OF THE MID-SOUTH EARLY THIS MORNING WILL CONTINUE TO MOVE
TO THE EAST TODAY. THIS WILL BRING AN END TO ANY EARLY MORNING
SHOWER ACTIVITY. SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE OVER THE SOUTHEAST STATES
WILL CONTINUE TO DOMINATE THE MID-SOUTHS WEATHER THROUGH WEDNESDAY...
WITH MAINLY DRY CONDITIONS AND WARM TEMPERATURES.

THE NEXT WEATHER SYSTEM TO BRING CHANCES FOR SHOWERS AND
THUNDERSTORMS WILL AFFECT OUR WEATHER FOR THE END OF THIS WEEK AND
INTO THE UPCOMING WEEKEND. BY WEDNESDAY...A NORTHERN STREAM
SHORTWAVE WILL DROP ACROSS THE GREAT LAKES REGION AND CONTINUE INTO
THE MIDDLE ATLANTIC REGION THROUGH THURSDAY. AS THIS OCCURS...IT
SHOULD FORCE A COLD FRONT TO DROP SOUTHWARD...APPROACHING NORTHERN
SECTIONS OF THE MID-SOUTH BY WEDNESDAY NIGHT. THE FRONT IS EXPECTED
TO STALL JUST NORTH OF THE FORECAST AREA THROUGH THURSDAY BEFORE
SLOWLY LIFTING BACK NORTH AS A WARM FRONT BY THURSDAY NIGHT. WITH
THE CLOSE PROXIMITY OF THE FRONTAL BOUNDARY AND A MODERATELY
UNSTABLE AIRMASS IN PLACE...HAVE KEPT CHANCES FOR SHOWERS AND
THUNDERSTORMS IN THE FORECAST FOR WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY
NIGHT. THE HIGHEST CHANCES WILL BE ACROSS NORTHERN AREAS THROUGH
THURSDAY NIGHT.

ON FRIDAY...A STRONGER SHORTWAVE TROUGH WILL APPROACH THE AREA FROM
THE NORTHWEST. THIS SHOULD HELP TO SEND A COLD FRONT TOWARDS THE
AREA BY FRIDAY EVENING. THE FRONT SHOULD MOVE ACROSS THE MID-SOUTH
FOR THE BEGINNING OF THE WEEKEND. THERE ARE SOME TIMING ISSUES WITH
THE HANDLING OF THE FRONTAL PASSAGE. HAVE INCREASED CHANCES FOR
SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS FOR FRIDAY AND FRIDAY NIGHT AND LINGERING
POPS INTO SATURDAY...TO ACCOUNT FOR THE TIMING DIFFERENCES
ASSOCIATED WITH THE FRONTAL PASSAGE. THE AIRMASS WILL BECOME
INCREASINGLY UNSTABLE BY FRIDAY...AND WIND FIELDS IN THE ATMOSPHERE
WILL STRENGTHEN...SO WILL NEED TO WATCH FOR ORGANIZED THUNDERSTORMS
WITH POSSIBLE SEVERE POTENTIAL. STILL MANY DETAILS TO WORK OUT
ON THIS...SO WILL ONLY MENTION POSSIBILITY OF STRONG STORMS IN HWO
FOR NOW.

ONCE THE FRONT MOVES THROUGH...EXPECT HIGH PRESSURE TO BUILD BACK IN
WITH A COOLER AIRMASS FILTERING IN. SO EXPECT TEMPERATURES TO
RETURN TO NEAR OR BELOW SEASONAL AVERAGES...WITH DRY WEATHER FOR THE
END OF THE WEEKEND INTO THE FIRST PART OF NEXT WEEK.

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.
&&

$$

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 181943
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
245 PM CDT MON APR 18 2005

.DISCUSSION...
NOT MUCH HAPPENING WEATHER WISE OVER THE REGION THIS AFTERNOON AS
SOME FAIR WEATHER CUMULUS HAVE POPPED UP. TEMPERATURES HAVE WARMED
UP INTO THE MID 70S TO AROUND 80 OVER THE FORECAST AREA. FRONTAL
BOUNDARY IS WELL TO OUR NORTHWEST EXTENDING FROM EASTERN NORTH
DAKOTA SOUTHWEST INTO SOUTHERN NEVADA. THIS FRONT WILL BE THE NEXT
WEATHER MAKER FOR OUR REGION BUT NOT FOR A FEW MORE DAYS. EXPECT
LITTLE CHANGE IN THE WEATHER FROM TONIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY WITH
SOME CUMULUS CLOUDS TO DEVELOP IN THE AFTERNOON AND DIE OUT AFTER
SUNSET. BY WEDNESDAY NIGHT...FRONTAL BOUNDARY WILL BE CLOSE ENOUGH
TO THE FORECAST AREA THAT WE COULD SEE SOME ISOLATED THUNDERSTORMS
DURING THE NIGHTTIME HOURS. THE CHANCE OF RAIN INCREASES ON
THURSDAY AS THE BOUNDARY REACHES THE FORECAST AREA. ONCE THE FRONT
REACHES THE REGION...IT SLOWS DOWN TO A CRAWL AND WILL TAKE A
COUPLE OF DAYS TO MOVE THROUGH THE REGION. THIS WILL MEAN THAT THERE
WILL BE A CHANCE OF RAIN FROM THURSDAY THROUGH SATURDAY NIGHT. THE
FRONT SHOULD BE COMPLETELY OUT OF THE PICTURE BY SUNDAY WHICH SHOULD
ALLOW US TO SALVAGE A PART OF NEXT WEEKEND. DRY WEATHER SHOULD
CONTINUE INTO MONDAY AS WELL.

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 180128
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
828 PM CDT SUN APR 17 2005

.DISCUSSION...HIGH PRESSURE STILL IN CONTROL ACROSS THE MID SOUTH 
THIS EVENING. INFRARED SATELLITE IMAGERY SHOWS SOME SCATTERED 
MID/HIGH CLOUDS DRIFTING ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA BUT HAVE 
DIMINISHED A BIT OVER THE PAST COUPLE OF HOURS. BOTH KJAN/KLZK 00Z RAOBS 
SHOW A SUBSTANTIAL AMOUNT OF LOW LEVEL DRY AIR AS MID/UPPER LEVELS 
SLOWLY BEGIN TO MOISTEN AGAIN. CURRENT TEMPERATURES ARE IN THE UPPER 
60S TO LOWER 70S. WILL NOT ISSUE AN UPDATE AT THIS TIME AS GRIDS 
HANDLING FORECAST WELL OVERALL. 

CJC

.PREV DISCUSSION...ISSUED 214 PM CDT SUN APR 17 2004

HIGH PRESSURE CENTERED OVER GEORGIA REMAINS THE MAIN WEATHER FEATURE 
AFFECTING THE MIDSOUTH. WINDS ARE SOUTHWESTERLY AROUND THE HIGH. A 
GOOD DEAL OF CIRRUS BLOWOFF FROM THUNDERSTORMS OVER NEW MEXICO 
YESTERDAY IS OVER THE REGION. ALSO...DEVELOPED A CU FIELD OVER THE 
REGION THIS AFTERNOON. APPEARS A THIN LAYER OF MOISTURE JUST ABOVE 
THE SURFACE AS SEEN FROM JACKSON MS SOUNDING SNEAKED INTO THE AREA 
OVERNIGHT. DEW POINTS WERE CLOSER TO WHERE GUIDANCE EXPECTED BUT 
FELL ONCE THE CU DEVELOPED. 

CU SHOULD DIMINISH THIS EVENING LEAVING ONLY A FEW CIRRUS DRIFTING 
THROUGH THE REGION. EXPECT DEW POINTS TO RISE DURING THE EVENING SO 
MIN TEMPS SHOULD BE WARMER THAN LAST NIGHT. SHOULD HAVE A REPEAT ON 
MONDAY. MONDAY NIGHT GFS DEVELOPS CONVECTION ALONG THE DRY LINE IN 
WEST TEXAS AND IT DEVELOPS AN ASSOCIATED VORT THAT WOULD ARRIVE ON 
WEDNESDAY. ETA SHOWS NO INDICATION OF THIS VORT. AM BECOMING MORE 
CONCERNED THAT THIS FEATURE MAY BE A CONVECTIVE FEEDBACK PROBLEM 
WITH THE GFS. ALSO...DEW POINTS FAIL TO GET INTO THE 60S...STAY IN 
THE 50S. AS A RESULT...AM BECOMING LESS AND LESS CONFIDENT IN RAIN 
CHANCES FOR WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY. GFS COMING UP WITH A DIFFERENT 
SOLUTION FOR END WEEK ALMOST EVERYDAY NOW. TODAYS SOLUTION SHOWS THE 
RIDGE MOVING WESTWARD WITH A SHORTWAVE AND ASSOCIATED COLD FRONT 
MOVING INTO THE REGION FRIDAY INTO SATURDAY. 

VALLE

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.

FXUS64 KMEG 170812
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
311 AM CDT SUN APR 17 2005

.DISCUSSION...
ANOTHER PLEASANT DAY ON TAP FOR THE MID SOUTH AS AN UPPER LEVEL 
RIDGE SLOWLY TRANSLATES EAST ACROSS THE REGION. SURFACE HIGH 
PRESSURE WILL ANCHOR ITSELF OVER THE SOUTHEAST U.S. LATER TODAY 
THROUGH TUESDAY NIGHT. THE RESULT WILL BE DRY AND WARM TEMPERATURES. 

A RATHER ACTIVE PATTERN SETS UP ACROSS THE CENTRAL U.S. TODAY AS A 
STRONG LOW LEVEL JET PUMPS DEEPER MOISTURE ACROSS THE PLAINS OF WEST 
TEXAS INTO THE DAKOTAS. THIS TYPE OF MOISTURE PATTERN WILL MOVE 
TOWARDS THE MID SOUTH BY WEDNESDAY. CHANCES FOR SOME THUNDERSTORMS 
WILL BE POSSIBLE HOWEVER LATEST MODELS INDICATE MOISTURE BEING 
LIMITED. ALSO VERY WEAK WAVES IN THE MEAN FLOW SEEM TO BE POORLY 
HANDLED BY BOTH THE GFS AND NAM WHICH LOWERS CONFIDENCE IN CURRENT 
SOLUTIONS. BELIEVE THE BETTER RAIN CHANCES COME WITH THE PATTERN 
CHANGE TO NORTHWEST FLOW AND THE ASSOCIATED COLD FRONT. MOISTURE 
POOLING ALONG THE FRONT...DECENT ASCENT AND INSTABILITY SHOULD BRING 
RAIN TO THE REGION BY THURSDAY AFTERNOON. THE NORTHWEST FLOW PATTERN 
WILL PERSIST INTO THE FIRST HALF OF THE WEEKEND. THE LATEST GFS 
BUILDS A HIGHLY AMPLIFIED...BLOCKING RIDGE OVER THE MISSISSIPPI  
VALLEY EARLY SUNDAY THROUGH THE EARLY PART OF NEXT WEEK. THIS WOULD 
KEEP THE MID SOUTH DRY FROM SUNDAY THROUGH TUESDAY...SHOULD THIS PAN 
OUT.

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 170151
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
850 PM CDT SAT APR 16 2005

.DISCUSSION...SURFACE AND UPPER AIR ANALYSIS THIS EVENING PLACES A 
RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE ACROSS THE MID SOUTH WITH WINDS DECOUPLING 
ACROSS MUCH OF THE AREA AS A RESULT. INFRARED SATELLITE IMAGERY 
SHOWING CIRRUS ACROSS MO/AR WHICH WILL MOVE ACROSS A PORTION OF THE 
AREA OVERNIGHT. TEMPERATURES ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA ARE IN THE 
UPPER 60S TO LOWER 70S AND EXPECT LOWS TONIGHT TO FALL AT LEAST A 
COUPLE OF DEGREES WARMER THAN LAST NIGHT. CURRENT FORECAST HANDLED 
WELL IN GRIDS AND WILL NOT ISSUE AN UPDATE.

CJC

.PREV DISCUSSION...ISSUED 248 PM CDT SAT APR 16 2004.

AN AREA OF HIGH PRESSURE IS LOCATED ALONG THE APPALACHIANS. WINDS 
ARE MAINLY SOUTHEASTERLY AND LIGHT DUE TO THE HIGH. A FEW CIRRUS IS 
EXPECTED TO DRIFT THROUGH THE AREA RESULTING IN MAINLY SUNNY SKIES. 
TEMPS HAVE BEEN MUCH WARMER THAN MODELS HAVE INDICATED. THIS IS 
LIKELY DUE TO THE MODELS POOR HANDLING OF DEW POINTS. THE ATMOSPHERE 
IS MUCH DRYER THAN EXPECTED WITH THE NEAREST 50 DEGREE DEW POINTS 
ALONG THE GULF COAST. AS A RESULT OUR TEMP TRENDS HAVE BEEN 
DESERT-LIKE...COOL NIGHTS WITH QUICK WARMING. 

NO SIGNIFICANT CHANGES MADE TO TONIGHTS FORECAST. OVERNIGHT LOW 
DISTRIBUTION SHOULD BE SIMILAR TO LAST NIGHT...JUST A COUPLE DEGREES 
WARMER AS THE AIR MASS MODIFIES. A COUPLE OF WEAK SHORTWAVES WILL 
MOVE OVER THE TOP OF THE RIDGE THE NEXT COUPLE OF DAYS. A FEW HIGH 
CLOUDS CAN BE EXPECTED. HAVE WARMER FORECAST THAN GUIDANCE FOR 
SUNDAY BASED UPON SEVERAL REASONS. THE MOST SIGNIFICANT IS THAT THE 
MODELS ARE INDICATING MUCH MORE CLOUDS TOMORROW. GIVEN JUST HOW DRY 
THE LOWER LEVELS ARE...HAVE A HARD TIME BELIEVING THAT ENOUGH 
MOISTURE WILL ADVECT IN FOR CU DEVELOPMENT. SO MAINLY LOOKING AT 
JUST A FEW MORE CIRRUS THAN TODAY. ALSO...MODEL DEW POINTS STILL 
LOOK TOO HIGH. SO TEMPS SHOULD BE VERY SIMILAR TO TODAY. 

THE NEXT CHANCE OF RAIN STILL LOOKS LIKE ITS AROUND MIDWEEK. THE GFS 
INDICATES THE UPPER RIDGE BREAKING DOWN WITH THE FLOW ACROSS THE 
MIDDLE PORTION OF THE US BECOMING MORE ZONAL. THE GFS LOOKS RATHER 
NOISY IN ITS SOLUTION WHICH BRINGS SEVERAL SMALLER LOW PRESSURE 
SYSTEMS ACROSS THE AREA FOR THE LATER PART OF THE WEEK. NOT WILLING 
TO FORECAST ANY HIGH POPS FOR MID TO LATE WEEK AT THIS POINT DUE TO 
UNCERTAINTY WITH THIS SOLUTION. 

VALLE
&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.


000 
FXUS64 KMEG 160640
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
140 AM CDT SAT APR 16 2005

.DISCUSSION...
HIGH PRESSURE IN CONTROL OF WEATHER ACROSS THE MIDSOUTH...WITH AXIS
OF RIDGE NEAR THE MISSISSIPPI RIVER. TEMPERATURES AT 1 AM WERE MAINLY
IN THE 50S...WITH MEM AT 62 AND SNH AT 45 BEING THE BIG OUTLIERS.
DEWPOINTS UPPER 30S TO MIDDLE 40S. WINDS ARE LIGHT AND SKIES ARE
MOSTLY CLEAR...WITH ONLY A FEW CIRRUS MOVING ACROSS THE AREA.
&&

.SHORT TERM (THROUGH MONDAY)...
SURFACE RIDGE SLOWLY SINKS SOUTHWARD AND WILL EVENTUALLY BE CENTERED
OVER GEORGIA ON MONDAY. GULF OF MEXICO WILL REMAIN CLOSED FOR
MOISTURE RETURN. WE NEVER REALLY GET INTO DEEP SOUTHERLY FLOW EITHER.
THIS BASICALLY MEANS PARTLY TO MOSTLY SUNNY SKIES DURING THE DAY...
AND MOSTLY CLEAR AT NIGHT. TEMPERATURES ARE EXPECTED TO BE NEAR
NORMAL FOR THE SEASON...WITH ONLY A DEGREE OR TWO OF WARMING EACH
DAY. HAVE MADE ADJUSTMENTS TO HIGH TEMPERATURE GRIDS BASED ON MAX
TEMPERATURES OBSERVED YESTERDAY. WOULD NOT BE SHOCKED TO SEE COOLER
FWC LOWS VERIFY TONIGHT...REASONING BELOW.

MODEL SOLUTIONS IN THE SHORT RANGE ARE A LITTLE BIT IFFY. BOTH MODELS
FORECAST SOUNDINGS FOR MEMPHIS SHOW SURFACE DEWPOINTS AT LEAST 5 TO
10 DEGREES WARMER THAN THE ASSOCIATED MOS GUIDANCE INDICATES FOR
SUNDAY AND MONDAY. BY SUNDAY AFTERNOON...NAM/GFS FORECAST SOUNDINGS
SHOW SURFACE DEWPOINTS IN THE LOW TO MID 60S. SURFACE OBS SHOW
CLOSEST 60 DEGREE DEWPOINTS NEAR CORPUS CHRISTI TEXAS...AND MOST OBS
IN THE NORTHERN GULF HAVE DEWPOINTS IN THE 50S. EVEN THE DEWPOINTS IN
THE MOS GUIDANCE MAY BE TOO HIGH...AND THEY ARE IN THE MID 50S.

GFS SOLUTION ALSO RATHER NOISY WITH IMPULSES TRYING TO CLIMB OVER
THE RIDGE SUNDAY AND MONDAY. CONSIDERING THE MOISTURE ISSUES
MENTIONED ABOVE...FEEL ANY THREAT OF DEVELOPING CONVECTION EITHER
AFTERNOON IS EXTREMELY SMALL...AND WILL KEEP ENTIRE SHORT TERM
PORTION OF FORECAST DRY.
&&

.LONG TERM (BEYOND MONDAY)...
NOT VERY CONFIDENT IN PRECIPITATION FORECAST FOR MID-WEEK. 18Z/15
DGEX SOLUTION WOULD INDICATE THAT AREA COULD BE DRY UNTIL ABOUT
THURSDAY NIGHT. MODELS NOT INDICATING ANY MAJOR SYSTEMS TO AFFECT
OUR AREA THROUGH THE 7 DAY PERIOD. ANY IMPULSES KICKED OUT OF THE
WESTERN TROF SHOULD BE MAINLY TO OUR NORTH AND WEST.  DUBIOUS ABOUT
00Z/16 GFS DEPICTION OF IMPULSES BEING KICKED OUT OF MEXICO IN
SOUTHERN STREAM. BOTH MODELS PRETTY MUCH DRY FOR TUESDAY NIGHT...SO
REMOVED POPS FROM THERE...WHICH FITS WITH NEIGHBORS TO THE NORTH AND
SOUTH. WE HAVE LOW POPS MENTIONED FOR WEDNESDAY AND BEYOND...WHICH IS
SOMEWHAT SUPPORTED BY GUIDANCE. WILL NOT MAKE ADJUSTMENTS TO THOSE
FOR NOW.

TEMPERATURES SHOULD BE A FEW DEGREES ABOVE NORMAL...ESPECIALLY DURING
THE DAY. WITH AIR ACTUALLY A LITTLE DRIER THAN MODELS THINK...THE
FORECAST MINS MAY NEED TO BE LOWERED A COUPLE OF DEGREES...ESPECIALLY
IF CLOUDS ARE LACKING.
&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.
&&

.DISCUSSION...
AN AREA OF HIGH PRESSURE EXTENDS ROUGHLY ALONG INTERSTATE 57 IN 
ILLINOIS INTO CENTRAL ARKANSAS. A LIGHT NORTHEASTERLY WIND IS OVER 
THE REGION IN RESPONSE TO THE HIGH. SATELLITE SHOWS CLEAR SKIES OVER 
THE REGION AT THE MOMENT ALTHOUGH SOME CIRRUS IS PRESENT OVER 
NORTHERN ARKANSAS AND WILL BE PASSING THROUGH THE AREA THIS 
AFTERNOON RESULTING IN A MOSTLY SUNNY SKY. ACARS SOUNDINGS FROM 
MEMPHIS SUPPORT HIGHS IN THE MID 70S. FORECAST APPEARS TO BE ON 
TRACK WITH NO UPDATE PLANNED.


000 
FXUS64 KMEG 160217
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
916 PM CDT FRI APR 15 2005

.DISCUSSION...LATEST SURFACE AND UPPER AIR ANALYSIS PLACES A RIDGE 
OF HIGH PRESSURE ACROSS THE MID SOUTH THIS EVENING. INFRARED 
SATELLITE IMAGERY SHOWS MOSTLY CIRRUS MOVING ACROSS THE MID SOUTH. 
CURRENT TEMPERATURES ARE IN THE UPPER 50S TO MIDDLE 60S AND EXPECTING
TEMPERATURES TO FALL INTO UPPER 40S TO MIDDLE 50S OVERNIGHT. CURRENT 
GRIDS HANDLING FORECAST WELL AND WILL NOT ISSUE AN UPDATE AT THIS TIME.

CJC

.PREV DISCUSSION...ISSUED 235 PM CDT FRI APR 15 2005

SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE AND ASSOCIATED UPPER LEVEL RIDGE EXTENDS ALONG 
INTERSTATE 57 IN ILLINOIS THROUGH CENTRAL ARKANSAS. JUST A FEW 
CIRRUS MOVING THROUGH THE AREA TODAY. TEMPERATURES HAVE BEEN INTO 
THE 70S AREAWIDE TODAY AND HAVE BEEN RUNNING ABOVE GUIDANCE LAST TWO 
DAYS. A POSSIBLE REASON MAY BE BECAUSE OF THE AMPLE SUNSHINE 
RESULTING IN EXCELLENT MIXING. THIS HAS BEEN BRINGING VERY DRY AIR 
DOWN TO THE SURFACE. SINCE THE MODELS HAVE NOT HANDLED AFTERNOON DEW 
POINTS WELL AT ALL...TEMPS HAVE BEEN WARMING MORE THAN EXPECTED.

UPPER RIDGE AND ASSOCIATED HIGH PRESSURE WILL BE THE THEME OVER THE 
NEXT SEVERAL DAYS. ANOTHER COOL NIGHT CAN BE EXPECTED TONIGHT WITH 
LIGHT WINDS...LOW DEW POINTS AND JUST SOME CIRRUS DRIFTING THROUGH. 
THE AIR MASS HAS MODIFIED SO DO NOT EXPECT LOWS TONIGHT TO BE QUITE 
AS COOL AS LAST NIGHT. MAINLY SUNNY SKIES ONCE AGAIN TOMORROW WITH A 
FEW CIRRUS FROM TIME TO TIME. BASED UPON TEMP TRENDS LAST COUPLE 
DAYS HAVE RAISED HIGHS A COUPLE OF DEGREES TO JUST ABOVE GUIDANCE. 
MID TO UPPER 70S ARE LIKELY AND 80 CANT BE RULED OUT. 

A WEAK UPPER SHORTWAVE WILL MOVE OVER THE TOP OF THE RIDGE ON 
SUNDAY...RESULTING IN A FEW MORE CLOUDS BUT CONTINUED DRY. ADDED 
CLOUDS WILL LOWER TEMPS FROM SATURDAY BUT STILL IN THE 70S. THE NEXT 
THREAT OF RAIN IS LATE TUESDAY NIGHT AND WEDNESDAY. WHEN A WARM 
FRONT WILL MOVE THROUGH THE REGION. THIS WILL LEAVE THE AREA IN THE 
WARM SECTOR FOR THE REMAINDER OF THE WEEK TILL LATE FRIDAY OR 
SATURDAY WHEN THE NEXT FRONT PUSHES THROUGH. DURING THAT TIME...THE 
AIR MASS WILL REMAIN RELATIVELY MOIST AND UNSTABLE WITH SCATTERED 
THUNDERSTORMS POSSIBLE DURING THIS PERIOD.

VALLE

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.
&&

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 150559
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
100 AM CDT FRI APR 15 2005

.DISCUSSION...
HIGH PRESSURE IN CONTROL OF WEATHER ACROSS THE MIDSOUTH...WITH AXIS
OF RIDGE STILL WEST OF THE MISSISSIPPI RIVER. TEMPERATURES AT
MIDNIGHT WERE IN THE 50S...WITH DEWPOINTS UPPER 30S TO MIDDLE 40S.
WINDS ARE LIGHT AND SKIES ARE CLEAR. NOT SEEING ANY INDICATIONS OF
FOG AT PRESENT BUT WILL CONTINUE TO MONITOR FOR POSSIBLE DEVELOPMENT
TOWARD SUNRISE.
&&

.SHORT TERM (THROUGH SUNDAY)...
SURFACE RIDGE SLOWLY SINKS SOUTHWARD AND WILL EVENTUALLY BE
CENTERED OVER THE SMOKIES BY SUNDAY. GULF OF MEXICO WILL REMAIN
CLOSED FOR MOISTURE RETURN. WE NEVER REALLY GET INTO SIGNIFICANT
SOUTHERLY FLOW EITHER. THIS BASICALLY MEANS PARTLY TO MOSTLY SUNNY
SKIES DURING THE DAY...AND MOSTLY CLEAR AT NIGHT. TEMPERATURES ARE
EXPECTED TO BE NEAR NORMAL FOR THE SEASON...WITH ONLY A DEGREE OR
TWO OF WARMING EACH DAY. HAVE MADE ADJUSTMENTS TO HIGH TEMPERATURE
GRIDS BASED ON MAX TEMPERATURES OBSERVED YESTERDAY.
&&

.LONG TERM (BEYOND SUNDAY)...
RIDGING REMAINS IN PLACE...AT LEAST INTO TUESDAY. UPPER TROF OVER
WESTERN STATES WILL GRADUALLY REFORM TOWARD THE 4 CORNERS AREA BY
MIDWEEK...AND SEND PIECES OF ENERGY TOWARD OUR AREA...POSSIBLY AS
EARLY AS TUESDAY NIGHT. MOISTURE RETURN IS VERY WEAK...SO DONT SEE
A MAJOR PRECIPITATION EVENT IN THE EXTENDED PERIOD. ANY
PRECIPITATION FOR TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY WOULD BE IN THE
ISOLATED TO WIDELY SCATTERED AREAL COVERAGE RANGE. TEMPERATURES IN
THE EXTENDED TO BE NEAR OR SLIGHTLY ABOVE NORMAL FOR MID-APRIL.
&&

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 141950
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
250 PM CDT THU APR 14 2005

.DISCUSSION...

UPPER LEVEL LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM THAT WAS RATHER PERSISTENT OVER THE 
MIDSOUTH EARLIER THIS WEEK IS NOW OFF THE COAST OF THE CAROLINAS. 
LOW CLOUDINESS ASSOCIATED WITH THIS SYSTEM STILL LINGERS ACROSS 
ALABAMA AND INTO CENTRAL MISSISSIPPI. AN AREA OF HIGH PRESSURE 
ASSOCIATED WITH AN UPPER LEVEL RIDGE EXTENDS THROUGH THE PLAINS 
STATES. THIS IS RESULTING IN NORTHERLY WINDS AND DRY WEATHER ACROSS 
THE MIDSOUTH REGION. 

EXPECT CUMULUS FIELD OVER PORTIONS OF NORTHEAST MS TO DISSIPATE THIS 
EVENING...RESULTING IN CLEAR SKIES OVER THE REGION. HIGH PRESSURE 
ASSOCIATED WITH THE UPPER RIDGE WILL DOMINATE THE WEATHER THROUGH 
THE WEEKEND. WINDS WILL GO LIGHT OVER THE NEXT COUPLE OF NIGHTS. 
WILL BE RATHER CHILLY TONIGHT SINCE DEW POINTS ARE STILL IN THE 40S. 
MOST LOCATIONS WILL FALL INTO THE MID 40S TONIGHT. MEMPHIS HEAT 
ISLAND WILL KEEP TEMPS UP...AROUND 50 WITH LOWER 40S POSSIBLE OVER 
SOME OF THE COLD SPOTS ACROSS WEST TN AND NORTHEAST MS. 

850 TEMPS AROUND +8 SUPPORT TEMPS IN THE LOW TO MID 70S OVER THE 
WEEKEND WHICH IS BACKED UP BY GUIDANCE. TEMPS WILL WARM SLIGHTLY 
OVER THE WEEKEND AS THE AIR MASS MODIFIES. A POSSIBLE FLAW MAY BE ON 
SUNDAY AFTERNOON WHERE THE GFS SHOWS A VORT MOVING OUT OF THE PLAINS 
AND OVER THE AREA...POSSIBLY RESULTING IN AN ISOLATED AFTERNOON 
THUNDERSTORM. ETA AND EUROPEAN BOTH SHOW THIS VORT WEAKENING AS DID 
YESTERDAY/S RUN OF THE GFS. 

BY EARLY NEXT WEEK THE RIDGE AXIS WILL HAVE MOVED OVER THE 
APPALACHIAN REGION WITH A CLOSED LOW FORMING OVER THE MOUNTAIN WEST. 
GFS SHOWS A COUPLE OF WEEK SHORTWAVES EXITING FROM THE LOW AND 
MOVING UP THE SIDE OF THE RIDGE...POSSIBLY RESULTING IN AN AFTERNOON 
THUNDERSTORM MONDAY AND TUESDAY. THE MOISTURE STILL DOESNT LOOK DEEP 
ENOUGH THOUGH SO WILL KEEP DRY FORECAST TILL TUESDAY NIGHT AND 
WEDNESDAY. AT THIS TIME...DEEPER MOISTURE SETS UP OVER THE REGION. 
LATEST RUN OF THE GFS SUGGESTS THAT MIDWEEK MAY BE RATHER UNSETTLED. 
THE CLOSED LOW STALLS OVER THE WESTERN PLAINS WITH SEVERAL WEAK 
SHORTWAVES MOVING THROUGH THE AREA. GUT FEELING IS THAT CONVECTION 
MAY BE MORE DIURNALLY DRIVEN AND SCATTERED SINCE THERE APPEARS TO BE 
NO REAL STRONG SYSTEMS TO ASSIGN POPS TO.

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.
&&

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
245 AM CDT THU APR 14 2005

.DISCUSSION...

UPPER LEVEL LOW MOVING ACROSS NORTH GEORGIA THIS MORNING. SKIES
REMAIN MOSTLY CLOUDY EARLY THIS MORNING OVER MOST OF THE FORECAST
AREA BUT WILL BEGIN TO CLEAR OUT WITH NORTHERN SECTIONS CLEARING OUT
BEFORE SUNRISE AND REMAINDER OF FORECAST AREA CLEARING OUT BY THIS
AFTERNOON. WITH MOSTLY SUNNY SKIES...TEMPERATURES WILL WARM UP SOME
FROM YESTERDAY WITH MOST AREAS SEEING UPPER 60S TO NEAR 70. UPPER
LEVEL RIDGE BEGIN TO BUILD IN TODAY AND TONIGHT AND REMAIN OVER THE
REGION FOR THE NEXT SEVERAL DAYS. THIS WILL HELP ENCOURAGE A LENGTHY
DRY PERIOD OVER THE REGION. TEMPERATURES WILL ALSO WARM UP SOME AND
LEVEL OFF AT OR SLIGHTLY ABOVE NORMAL LEVELS DURING THIS DRY PERIOD.
THE NEXT CHANCE OF RAIN DOES NOT OCCUR UNTIL TUESDAY NIGHT. BY THEN
THE UPPER LEVEL RIDGE FINALLY BREAKS DOWN AND A STORM SYSTEM MOVES
FROM OUT OF THE ROCKIES AND BRINGS A COLD FRONT INTO THE PLAINS. THIS
FRONT WILL MOVE SLOWLY EAST ON WEDNESDAY KEEPING US IN THE THREAT OF
RAIN.

AFTER SUNRISE. THE REMAINDER OF THE WEEK LOOKS PLEASANT.

WILL UPDATE THE GRIDS TO ACCOMMODATE FOR THE INCREASED CLOUD COVER 
AND REMOVE SHOWER WORDING FROM EASTERN AREAS. OVERNIGHT TEMPERATURES 
WILL BE CLOSE TO FORECAST VALUES...PERHAPS SLIGHTLY HIGHER DUE TO 
THE CLOUD COVER BUT ONLY 2 TO 3 DEGREES. WILL WATCH THIS FOR 
POSSIBLE LATER UPDATES.

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 131838
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
138 PM CDT WED APR 13 2005

.DISCUSSION...
AFTER TODAY...THE MIDSOUTH WILL FINALLY ENJOY A PROLONGED PERIOD OF
DRY WEATHER WITH PLEASANT TEMPERATURES. THE NEXT CHANCE OF RAIN IS
NOT FORECAST UNTIL NEXT TUESDAY NIGHT AT THE EARLIEST.

WATER VAPOR IMAGERY INDICATES AN UPPER LOW SPINNING OVER
NORTHERN AL/SOUTHERN MIDDLE TN THIS AFTERNOON. THIS LOW WILL MOVE
SOUTHEASTWARD THROUGH THURSDAY AND LOSE INFLUENCE OVER MIDSOUTH
WEATHER. MEANWHILE...HIGH PRESSURE ALOFT WILL BUILD INTO THE
MIDSOUTH FROM THE WEST OVER THE NEXT FEW DAYS.

CLOUDS COVER THE MIDSOUTH THIS AFTERNOON WITH SOME BREAKS
DEVELOPING. THINK DRIER AIR WILL WORK ITS WAY INTO THE MIDSOUTH
OVERNIGHT...WITH SKIES BECOMING PARTLY CLOUDY ACROSS MUCH OF THE
AREA AFTER MIDNIGHT. THINK MOST OF THE RAIN WILL BE OUT OF THE AREA
BY 6 PM. HOWEVER...DEPENDING ON WHAT THE RADAR INDICATES THE NEXT
COUPLE OF HOURS...MAY LEAVE IN A 20 PERCENT CHANCE OF SHOWERS EAST OF
THE MS RIVER FOR EARLY THIS EVENING. OTHERWISE...SKIES WILL BE MOSTLY
SUNNY TO PARTLY CLOUDY THURSDAY...THEN WE CAN EXPECT CLEAR SKIES
AFTER THAT INTO THE WEEKEND.

A COLD FRONT IS FORECAST BY THE LATEST GFS TO MOVE INTO THE
MIDSOUTH NEXT WEDNESDAY. THIS FRONT WILL BRING OUR NEXT CHANCE OF
SHOWERS/THUNDERSTORMS...POSSIBLY AS EARLY AS TUESDAY NIGHT FOR PART
OF THE AREA.

LOWS WILL DIP INTO THE 40S THE NEXT FEW NIGHTS WITH NORTHEAST
WINDS...BUT WARMER AFTERNOONS CAN BE EXPECTED WITH THE RETURN OF
SUNSHINE.

.UPDATE...
UPPER LEVEL LOW IS MOVING SOUTHEASTWARD THROUGH MIDDLE TN THIS
MORNING. VORT LOBE ROTATING ON THE BACK SIDE OF THIS LOW IS CAUSING
SCATTERED SHOWERS ACROSS WEST TN AND NORTHEAST AR...WITH THE
SHOWERS MOVING INTO NORTH MS. SATELLITE SHOWS LOW CLOUDS ROTATING
AROUND THE LOW. WHILE TUPELO IS PRESENTLY SUNNY...THE CLOUDS WILL
SOON BE MOVING IN FROM THE NORTH. FORECAST HIGHS MAY BE A LITTLE
ON THE HIGH SIDE...BUT WITH THE DAYS BECOMING LONGER AND THE RAIN
REMAINING SCATTERED AND DIMINISHING FROM THE NORTH...WILL NOT LOWER
THEM ATTM BUT WILL CONTINUE TO MONITOR. NO UPDATES ATTM.

.PREV DISCUSSION...
ISSUED 241 AM CDT WED APR 13 2005

UPPER LEVEL LOW CURRENTLY SITUATED OVER SOUTHEAST MISSOURI WILL
TRACK SOUTHEAST TODAY AND IS EXPECTED TO REACH THE GEORGIA COAST BY
THURSDAY MORNING. SOME SHOWERS ARE JUST NORTH OF THE FORECAST AREA
AND SHOULD MOVE IN SHORTLY. EXPECT COVERAGE OF SHOWERS TODAY SHOULD
REMAIN SCATTERED SO CHANCE POPS SHOULD WORK JUST FINE. CLOUD COVER IN
ASSOCIATION WITH THE UPPER LOW WILL KEEP TEMPERATURES DOWN A FEW
DEGREES FROM YESTERDAY. UPPER LOW SHOULD BE FAR ENOUGH AWAY FROM THE
FORECAST AREA TONIGHT THAT WE SHOULD REMAIN DRY AFTER 00Z SO YANKED
WHAT LITTLE POPS THERE WERE. UPPER LEVEL RIDGE BUILDS INTO THE REGION
BY FRIDAY ALLOWING FOR A PROLONGED DRY PERIOD WHICH SHOULD LAST FROM
THURSDAY THROUGH NEXT TUESDAY. NEXT COLD FRONT APPROACHES BY LATE
TUESDAY SO HAVE KEPT SLIGHT CHANCE POPS IN FOR TUESDAY NIGHT.

930 CDT MON 12 2005

.DISCUSSION...
UPPER LOW CONTINUES TO MOVE EAST OVER SOUTHERN MO WHILE SURFACE
IS MOVING SOUTHEAST TOWARD KY/IL/IN TRISTATE AREA. CLOUDS ARE
MAINLY IN NORTHERN COUNTIES AND EASTERN PARTS OF W TN. UPPER LOW
ALSO WRAPPING CLDS INTO NW AR. UPPER LOW CLDS TO MOVE EAST AND
COVER N 2/3RDS OF MIDSOUTH THIS AFTER TO MAKE IT GO MTCLDY. CU TO
DEVELOP OVER REST OF SOUTHERN THIRD OF AREA THIS AFTN TO MAKE IT
PCLDY.

WINDS ARE SAILING ALONG AT A GOOD CLIP IN RESPONSE TO UPPER LOW
OUT OF THE WEST OR SOUTHWEST. STILL MENTIONING CHANCE OF SHOWERS
THIS AFTERNOON WITH AN OUTSIDE CHANCE OF THUNDERSHOWERS.

FCST UPDATED ALREADY.

NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
255 AM CDT TUE APR 12 2005

.DISCUSSION...
SOME SCATTERED RAIN SHOWERS CONTINUE OVER EASTERN HALF OF THE
FORECAST AREA THIS MORNING. RAIN IS GENERALLY MOVING NORTH WITH A
SLOW EASTWARD SHIFT. WILL KEEP CHANCE POPS IN FOR THIS MORNING IN
THE EASTERN HALF BUT OTHERWISE WITH UPPER LOW STILL OVER EASTERN
KANSAS IT APPEARS SLIGHT CHANCE POPS SHOULD BE GOOD ENOUGH FOR
TODAY. UPPER LOW WILL SLOWLY PUSH EAST TONIGHT AND REACH WESTERN
KENTUCKY. HAVE KEPT CHANCE POPS IN THE NORTHERN HALF OF THE FORECAST
AREA FOR TONIGHT WITH SLIGHT CHANCE POPS IN THE SOUTH. BY WEDNESDAY
MORNING...UPPER LOW INTERACTS WITH ANOTHER UPPER LOW CURRENTLY OVER
THE NEW ENGLAND COAST. THIS WILL CAUSE WESTERN KENTUCKY LOW TO TRACK
SOUTH THROUGH MIDDLE TENNESSEE AND NORTH ALABAMA. WITH CLOSE
PROXIMITY TO UPPER LOW WILL KEEP CHANCE POPS IN FOR WEDNESDAY. UPPER
LOW SHOULD WEAKEN AND MOVE FAR ENOUGH EAST BY WEDNESDAY NIGHT THAT
ONLY FAR NORTHEAST SECTIONS OF FORECAST MAY SEE RAIN WEDNESDAY
EVENING SO HAVE SLIGHT CHANCE POPS THEN. UPPER LEVEL RIDGE THEN
TAKES OVER GIVING US SEVERAL DAYS OF DRY WEATHER FROM THURSDAY
THROUGH SUNDAY. THE NEXT CHANCE OF RAIN WILL BE SUNDAY NIGHT AND
MONDAY AS A WEAK SYSTEM MOVES THROUGH THE REGION.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
341 PM CDT MON APR 11 2005

.DISCUSSION...SURFACE ANALYSIS THIS AFTERNOON PLACES COLD FRONT 
ACROSS OK/TN/AR BORDER. VISIBLE/88D TRENDS SHOW SHOWERS AND 
THUNDERSTORMS DEVELOPING ALONG THE FRONT WHERE ATMOSPHERE HAS BEEN 
ABLE TO DESTABILIZE.  MAIN FORECAST CONCERNS THIS FORECAST PACKAGE 
IS SEVERE WEATHER POTENTIAL THIS EVENING ACROSS THE MID SOUTH. 
EXPECTING CONVECTION ACROSS WESTERN ARKANSAS TO DEVELOP INTO A LINE 
AND MOVE ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA TONIGHT. MID LEVEL LAPSE RATES ARE 
FORECAST TO BECOME MODERATELY STEEP ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA 
TONIGHT. IF BOUNDARY LAYER CAN RECOVER BEFORE UPPER LEVEL DIVERGENCE 
MOVES EAST OF THE AREA...THINK THAT SEVERE POTENTIAL MAY LAST 
THROUGH MIDNIGHT WITH WIND PROFILES SUPPORTIVE OF DAMAGING WINDS. 
EVENING SHIFT WILL MONITOR CONVECTIVE TRENDS AND UPDATE AS NEEDED. 
THE COLD FRONT WILL PASS THROUGH THE FORECAST AREA TUESDAY MORNING 
AND WILL CONTINUE POPS INTO WEDNESDAY AS CUTOFF UPPER LEVEL LOW 
GRADUALLY MOVES SOUTHEAST ACROSS THE TENNESSEE VALLEY THROUGH 
WEDNESDAY AND ACROSS THE EAST COAST BY THURSDAY. HIGH PRESSURE WILL 
START TO BUILD IN ACROSS THE MID SOUTH ON THURSDAY AS CUTOFF LOW 
MOVES UP THE EAST COAST AND UPPER LEVEL RIDGING MOVES INTO THE 
MISSISSIPPI VALLEY WITH CLOUD COVER GRADUALLY DIMINISHING BY 
THURSDAY NIGHT. 

.FRIDAY THROUGH MONDAY...AN UPPER LEVEL RIDGE WILL BRING 
PRECIPITATION FREE WEATHER TO THE MID SOUTH THROUGH SUNDAY. ADDED A 
SLIGHT CHANCE OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS TO SUNDAY NIGHT AND 
MONDAY AS LONG RANGE MODELS DEPICT ANOTHER SHORTWAVE MOVING ACROSS THE 
MISSISSIPPI VALLEY AS THE UPPER LEVEL RIDGE BEGINS TO BREAK DOWN.

FXUS64 KMEG 111611
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
1110 AM CDT MON APR 11 2005

.DISCUSSION...SURFACE ANALYSIS THIS MORNING PLACES COLD FRONT ACROSS 
EASTERN OKLAHOMA AND TEXAS WITH A WARM FRONT EXTENDING ACROSS MAINLY 
CENTRAL MISSISSIPPI. VISIBLE SATELLITE SHOWING EXTENSIVE CLOUD COVER 
ACROSS THE MID SOUTH AS A LARGE AREA OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS 
AFFECTS THE FORECAST AREA THIS MORNING. WATER VAPOR IMAGERY OVER THE 
PAST COUPLE OF HOURS SHOWING DRY SLOT WIDENING ACROSS SOUTHWEST 
TEXAS. MAIN FORECAST CONCERN FOR THIS AFTERNOON AND TONIGHT IS 
SEVERE WEATHER POTENTIAL. 

12Z UPPER AIR ANALYSIS SHOWS 40KT 850MB LOW LEVEL JET ACROSS 
LOUISIANA TRANSPORTING +10-14C DEWPOINTS INTO THE LOWER MISSISSIPPI 
VALLEY...5C OR GREATER 700 MB DEWPOINT DEPRESSIONS UPSTREAM...AND 
UPPER LEVEL DIFLUENCE NOTED AT 250 MB ACROSS THE LOWER MISSISSIPPI 
VALLEY. CURRENT DATA SUGGESTS THAT BEST SEVERE POTENTIAL MAY BE 
POSSIBLE MAINLY THIS EVENING ESPECIALLY ALONG AND SOUTH OF 
I-40...ROUGHLY ABOUT THE SAME TIME UPPER LEVEL DIVERGENCE BEGINS TO 
MOVE EAST. MOST UNSTABLE CAPES WILL INCREASE TO AROUND 1400 J/KG BY 
MID TO LATE EVENING. NEARLY UNIDIRECTIONAL WINDS AT 850/500 MB 
SUGGEST PRIMARY THREAT WOULD BE IN THE FORM OF DAMAGING WINDS. A 
SUPERCELL OR CIRCULATIONS WITHIN THE CONVECTIVE LINE WILL BE 
POSSIBLE AS BACKING SURFACE WINDS AND 0-6KM BULK SHEAR VALUES AT OR 
ABOVE 40KTS ARE EXPECTED INTO THIS EVENING. WILL UPDATE GRIDS TO 
REFLECT CURRENT TRENDS.

GRIDS WILL BE PUBLISHED SHORTLY. 

CJC

.PREV DISCUSSION...ISSUED 330 AM CDT MON APR 11 2005.

UPPER LOW IN EXTREME WESTERN KANSAS WITH SURFACE LOW OVER CENTRAL
KANSAS EARLY THIS MORNING. COLD FRONT SOUTHWARD INTO TEXAS.
CONVECTION OVER MISSOURI IS LIFTING NORTH...BUT AREAS OF
THUNDERSTORMS OVER OK AND TX HAVENT BEEN MAKING MUCH PROGRESS
EASTWARD. ABUNDANT CLOUD COVER HAS BEEN KEEPING TEMPERATURES IN THE
MIDDLE 60S ACROSS MUCH OF THE CWA. &&

.SHORT TERM (THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...
MODELS TAKE UPPER AND SURFACE LOWS PRETTY MUCH DUE EASTWARD THROUGH
TUESDAY EVENING. 06Z NAM A LITTLE FURTHER NORTH WITH THESE FEATURES
THAN THE 00Z GFS...WITH SYSTEM NEAR STL AT 00Z WED. APPARENT THAT
GFS HAS FEEDBACK ISSUES AT 18Z TODAY OVER OUR AREA. THAT BEING
SAID...WE ARE STILL GOING TO SEE RAIN AND THUNDERSTORMS. SOME HINTS
ON WATER VAPOR OF A JET STREAK MOVING ACROSS BIG BEND AREA OF TEXAS
EARLY THIS MORNING. INSTABILITY STILL THE MAJOR LIMITING FACTOR IN
SIGNIFICANT CONVECTION DURING THE DAYTIME HOURS TODAY. SOUNDINGS VERY
MOIST DURING THE FIRST HALF OF THE DAY...AND SOME QUESTION AS TO THE
AMOUNT OF SUN WE WILL SEE. WE WILL NEED SOME HEATING TO BREAK THE CAP
ANYTIME BEFORE LATE AFTERNOON. SATELLITE SHOWS PLENTY OF BREAKS IN
CLOUD COVER ACROSS OUR CWA...BUT WITH SOUTHERLY FLOW...THIS COULD
FILL IN WITH STRATUS OVER THE NEXT FEW HOURS.

COULD SEE SOME SHOWERS THIS MORNING...BUT ANY SIGNIFICANT CONVECTION
WILL NEED TO WAIT UNTIL THE LATE AFTERNOON AND EVENING HOURS TO
DEVELOP. EARLY ON...THERE WILL BE ENOUGH TURNING TO PROMOTE
DEVELOPMENT OF SUPERCELLS...BUT EXPECT THE PREDOMINANT CONVECTIVE
MODE TO BECOME LINEAR BY SUNSET OR SO. HAIL AND DAMAGING WINDS WILL
BE MAIN THREATS...BUT CANT RULE OUT A TORNADO...ESPECIALLY SOUTHERN
PORTIONS OF CWA. MAIN IMPULSE SHOULD BE CLEAR OF THE AREA BY 09Z
TUESDAY...ENDING LARGEST THREAT OF SEVERE WEATHER.

MODELS SHOW WE SHOULD DRY SLOT FOR MOST OF THE DAY ON TUESDAY. AS
COLD CORE DRIFTS SOUTHEAST OVER THE AREA TUESDAY AFTERNOON...THERE
MAY BE JUST ENOUGH MOISTURE TO DEVELOP A FEW THUNDERSTORMS. WITH
STEEP LAPSE RATES AND COLD 500 MB TEMPS...COULD SEE A FEW HAILERS
NEAR THE UPPER LOW. WILL NOT PLAY UP THIS POTENTIAL AT THIS TIME...
BUT WILL KEEP AN EYE ON IT.

UPPER LOW WILL WOBBLE AROUND THE AREA TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY
NIGHT. SCATTERED SHOWERS/THUNDERSTORMS POSSIBLE UNDER THE LOW...WITH
PLENTY OF CLOUD COVER.

TEMPERATURES TODAY WILL DEPEND ON CLOUD COVER. GFS FEEDBACK ISSUES
LEAD ME TO DISCOUNT MAV HIGH TEMP GUIDANCE TODAY...ESPECIALLY SINCE
MEM CURRENTLY 68...MAV FORECAST HIGH 68. JBR SIMILAR. TENDING
TOWARD WARMER VALUES CURRENTLY IN FORECAST. FOR THE REMAINDER OF THE
SHORT TERM PERIOD...CURRENT FORECAST AND NUMERIC GUIDANCE CLOSE...
SO WONT MAKE MAJOR CHANGES.
&&

.LONG TERM (AFTER WEDNESDAY)...
UPPER LOW TO MOVE AWAY FROM THE AREA THURSDAY MORNING...WITH SHOWERS
DEPARTING WITH IT.

GFS CONTINUES YESTERDAYS TREND OF DEVELOPING A RIDGE OVER THE
MIDSOUTH. THIS WOULD KEEP WEEKEND FORECAST DRY. ONCE UPPER LOW MOVES
AWAY FROM THE AREA...EXPECT TEMPERATURES TO BE NEAR OR SLIGHTLY
ABOVE MID-APRIL NORMS.
&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
950 PM CDT SUN APR 10 2005

.DISCUSSION...

AN UPPER LEVEL RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE CONTINUES TO KEEP SKIES PARTLY
CLOUDY OVER THE AREA. THIS SHOULD CONTINUE THROUGH MOST OF THE
NIGHT WITH A GRADUAL INCREASE IN CLOUDS FROM THE WEST LATE TONIGHT
AHEAD OF AN APPROACHING DEEP UPPER LEVEL LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM NOW OVER
THE WESTERN HIGH PLAINS STATES. HAVE LOWERED POPS ACROSS THE AREA
TONIGHT WITH JUST 20 POPS ACROSS FAR WESTERN COUNTIES. 00Z LZK
SOUNDING WELL CAPPED OFF AROUND 750 MB...SO THINK THAT ANY CONVECTION
WILL REMAIN MOSTLY TO OUR WEST TONIGHT.

AS FOR TEMPERATURES...SOUTH TO SOUTHEASTERLY LOW LEVEL FLOW WILL
KEEP TEMPERATURES FROM FALLING TOO MUCH TONIGHT. 02Z SURFACE
OBSERVATIONS STILL SHOWING TEMPS IN THE LOW TO MID 70S AREAWIDE. HAVE
DECIDED TO BUMP TEMPS UP A FEW DEGREES TO ACCOUNT FOR THIS.

OTHERWISE...ALL OTHER FORECAST PARAMETERS LOOK GOOD. UPDATED GRIDS
AND FORECAST OUT SHORTLY.

FXUS64 KMEG 102039
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
330 PM CDT SUN APR 10 2005

.DISCUSSION...LATEST SURFACE ANALYSIS PLACES SURFACE LOW ACROSS 
EXTREME SOUTHEAST COLORADO WITH A TRAILING COLD FRONT/DRYLINE 
EXTENDING SOUTH ACROSS SOUTHERN TEXAS. SURFACE MOISTURE TONGUE 
EXTENDS ACROSS MUCH OF THE LOWER MISSISSIPPI VALLEY WITH 60+ SURFACE 
DEWPOINTS. VISIBLE SATELLITE SHOWING DIURNAL CUMULUS ACROSS MUCH OF 
THE AREA AND HIGH/MID CLOUDS GRADUALLY MOVING EAST WITH DEVELOPING 
CONVECTION OVER THE SOUTHERN PLAINS. MAIN CONCERNS THIS FORECAST 
PACKAGE IS SEVERE WEATHER POTENTIAL MONDAY INTO MONDAY NIGHT.

TONIGHT...45KT 850 MB LOW LEVEL JET WILL BEGIN TO MOVE INTO THE MID 
SOUTH TONIGHT TRANSPORTING 60+ SURFACE DEWPOINT AIR INTO THE AREA BY 
MONDAY AFTERNOON. LINE OF CONVECTION CURRENTLY DEVELOPING MOSTLY 
ALONG DRYLINE IN TEXAS AND OKLAHOMA THIS AFTERNOON WILL SPREAD 
ACROSS ARKANSAS TONIGHT. THINK THAT MOST IF NOT ALL SHOWERS AND 
THUNDERSTORMS WILL BEGIN TO FALL APART AS MODEL SOUNDINGS INDICATE A 
CAPPING INVERSION AND SOME LOW LEVEL DRY AIR TO BE OVERCOME ACROSS 
THE FORECAST AREA. BEST CHANCES FOR PRECIPITATION WILL BE AFTER 
MIDNIGHT...MOSTLY ALONG AND WEST OF THE MISSISSIPPI RIVER. THINK 
THAT ANY SEVERE THREAT WOULD BE MAINLY HAIL BUT EXPECT ANY 
THUNDERSTORMS THAT DO DEVELOP SHOULD STAY BELOW SEVERE LIMITS.

MONDAY AND MONDAY NIGHT...ADDITIONAL SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS ARE 
EXPECTED TO DEVELOP ACROSS THE MID SOUTH DURING THE DAY AS UPPER 
LEVEL LOW MOVES ACROSS THE CENTRAL PLAINS AND BECOMES NEGATIVELY 
TILTED. MID LEVEL DYNAMICAL FORCING /700-500 MB Q-VECTOR 
CONVERGENCE/ WILL INCREASE INTO THE EVENING. RATHER RESPECTIVE 700 MB 
DEWPOINT DEPRESSIONS /10C OR GREATER ALONG I-40 AND SOUTH)...SBCAPES 
APPROACHING 2000 J/KG...LI/S AROUND -5...AND A FAVORABLE WIND 
PROFILE SUPPORT A SEVERE WEATHER THREAT OF DAMAGING WINDS AND HAIL 
ACROSS THE AREA MONDAY AFTERNOON AND MONDAY NIGHT. 
ADDITIONALLY...BACKING SURFACE WINDS...0-6 KM BULK SHEAR VALUES AT 
OR ABOVE 40KTS...AND 0-1KM SRH VALUES AT OR ABOVE 200M2/S2 SUPPORT 
SUPERCELL DEVELOPMENT. HOWEVER...SURFACE BASED INSTABILITY MAY BE 
LIMITED...ESPECIALLY FURTHER NORTH OF I-40 IF THE FORECAST AREA 
REMAINS CLOUDY DURING THE DAY. CONVECTION IN THE AFTERNOON SHOULD 
DEVELOP AS ISOLATED/SCATTERED CONVECTION AHEAD OF A BOWING LINE AS 
EVENT PROGRESSES. BEST RISK OF SEVERE WEATHER WILL PRIMARILY RESIDE 
ACROSS NORTHERN MISSISSIPPI. HEAVY RAINFALL STILL A POSSIBILITY WITH 
SOME OF THE THUNDERSTORMS WITH PRECIPITABLE WATER VALUES AT OR ABOVE 
1.5 INCHES. LATEST 18Z NAM CURRENTLY COMING IN SUGGESTS PASSAGE OF 
TROUGH MAY BE DELAYED BY 3-6 HOURS FROM THE 12Z SOLUTION. EVENING 
SHIFT WILL FURTHER REFINE TIMING ON THIS POSSIBLE SEVERE WEATHER 
THREAT.  

UPPER LEVEL CUTOFF LOW WILL GRADUALLY MOVE EAST ACROSS KENTUCKY 
TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY. MADE ADJUSTMENTS TO POPS ON TUESDAY AS MAIN 
SHORTWAVE DEPARTS ON TUESDAY AND ANOTHER SHORTWAVE APPROACHES THE 
MID SOUTH FROM THE MIDDLE MISSISSIPPI VALLEY.

.THURSDAY THROUGH SUNDAY...STILL WAS SOME FEEDBACK ISSUES EARLY ON 
WITH THE GFS AND WILL LEAN MORE TOWARDS DGEX/EUROPEAN SOLUTION FOR 
THE LONG RANGE PERIOD. SHEAR AXIS ASSOCIATED WITH CUTOFF LOW WILL BRING A 
SLIGHT CHANCE OF SHOWERS TO THE MID SOUTH ON THURSDAY WITH DRY 
WEATHER EXPECTED FOR FRIDAY THROUGH THE WEEKEND AS BOTH DGEX AND 
EUROPEAN SHOW UPPER LEVEL RIDGE ACROSS THE EASTERN US...THOUGH THE 
EUROPEAN IS MORE AMPLIFIED WITH ITS SOLUTION.
&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.
&&

AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
1001 AM CDT SUN APR 10 2005

.DISCUSSION...LATEST VISIBLE SATELLITE IMAGERY SHOWS MOSTLY SUNNY 
SKIES ACROSS THE EASTERN ONE THIRD OF THE FORECAST AREA AND SOME 
ALTOCUMULUS DEVELOPING AND MOVING NNE ACROSS THE REMAINDER OF THE 
AREA. RUC MODEL SOUNDINGS AGREE WITH CURRENT TRENDS FOR PARTLY 
CLOUDY SKIES THIS AFTERNOON. 12-13C 850MB TEMPERATURES ON KJAN/KLZK 
RAOBS THIS MORNING SUPPORT HIGHS TODAY IN THE UPPER 70S TO LOWER 
80S...WITH TEMPERATURES ALREADY IN THE UPPER 60S TO LOWER 70S ACROSS 
MANY AREAS. CURRENT FORECAST HANDLING SITUATION WELL AND WILL NOT 
ISSUE AN UPDATE.

CJC

.PREV DISCUSSION...311 AM CDT SUN APR 10 2005.

HIGH PRESSURE WELL OFF TO THE EAST...WITH SURFACE LOW DEVELOPING OVER
COLORADO. WEAK SOUTHERLY FLOW HAS ALREADY STARTED ACROSS THE AREA...
WITH DEWPOINTS IN MIDDLE TO UPPER 50S. SKIES MOSTLY CLEAR...BUT UP TO
THIS TIME...NO HINTS OF DENSE FOG LIKE WE SAW YESTERDAY MORNING.
&&

.SHORT TERM (THROUGH TUESDAY)...
FIRST 18 TO 24 HOURS OF THE FORECAST RATHER QUIET AS SYSTEM OVER THE
ROCKIES GETS GOING. SKIES PARTLY TO MOSTLY SUNNY TODAY. TEMPERATURES
MAY BE A COUPLE OR 3 DEGREES WARMER THAN SATURDAY IF WE DONT GET AN
EXTENSIVE CUMULUS FIELD. CONVECTION WITH ROCKIES SYSTEM WILL APPROACH
THE WESTERN PORTIONS OF OUR CWA TOWARD SUNRISE MONDAY...IN A
WEAKENING PHASE. NOT SURE IT WILL MAKE IT HERE BY 12Z MONDAY...SO
WILL HOLD CURRENTLY FORECAST CHANCE POPS IN WEST OF THE MISSISSIPPI
RIVER. BUMPED UP MINS TONIGHT A DEGREE OR TWO. NOT CONFIDENT IN SPC
DAY 1 OUTLOOK OF SLIGHT RISK...SO WONT PLAY UP POTENTIAL FOR SEVERE
TONIGHT MUCH.

WEAKENING CONVECTION WILL PROBABLY LAY DOWN A BOUNDARY ACROSS WESTERN
PORTIONS OF THE AREA MONDAY MORNING. REDEVELOPMENT OF THUNDERSTORMS
LATE MONDAY AFTERNOON AND MONDAY NIGHT IS ALMOST CERTAIN. WIND FIELDS
CERTAINLY CONDUCIVE TO SEVERE WEATHER. INSTABILITY SOMEWHAT IN
QUESTION DURING THE DAYTIME HOURS ACROSS MUCH OF CWA...BUT NAM
SHOWING CAPES AROUND 1500 AND LIFTED INDICIES AROUND -5 AT MEMPHIS BY
06Z TUESDAY. SPC DAY 2 OUTLOOK FOR SLIGHT RISK ACROSS ENTIRE CWA
ACCEPTED...BUT WILL NOT MENTION IN ZONES...YET. HIGH TEMPS MONDAY
DEPENDENT ON CLOUD COVER. WITH GFS FEEDBACK ISSUES...FEEL CLOUD COVER
FORECAST FROM THAT MODEL IS TOO PESSIMISTIC...AND MAX TEMPS ON MAV
GUIDANCE ARE TOO COOL. CURRENT FORECAST MORE REASONABLE. BOUNDARY
WILL PUSH INTO THE AREA MONDAY NIGHT...WITH TEMPS ABOUT 5 DEGREES
COOLER TUESDAY MORNING THAN MONDAY MORNING. ALSO NOT BUYING GFS QPF
FORECAST FOR MONDAY AND MONDAY NIGHT DUE TO AFOREMENTIONED FEEDBACK
ISSUES. NAM TRENDS MORE REASONABLE.

ACTUAL PATH OF UPPER LOW WILL MAKE A LARGE DIFFERENCE IN FORECAST
TUESDAY. MODELS SHOWING TRACK A LITTLE FURTHER NORTH THAN LAST
SEVERAL DAYS...ACROSS NORTHERN MISSOURI ON TUESDAY. IF THIS TRACK
VERIFIES...WE WILL NEED TO LOWER POPS FOR TUESDAY AND TUESDAY
NIGHT. FOR NOW...WILL HOLD CHANCE POPS IN...AND SEE IF THE MODELS
HAVE SOME CONTINUITY ON THIS FEATURE. IF WE GET DRY SLOTTED...
FORECAST TEMPS WILL BE TOO LOW.
&&

.LONG TERM (AFTER TUESDAY)...
MODELS DROP REMNANTS OF UPPER LOW ACROSS US WEDNESDAY AND
THURSDAY. THIS WILL BRING SLIGHTLY COOLER TEMPERATURES...AND
SOME CHANCE OF PRECIPITATION. SMALL POPS LOOK REASONABLE.

00Z/10 GFS SOLUTION HAS CHANGED FROM PREVIOUS RUNS WITH FOLLOWING
SYSTEM. EARLIER RUNS WERE PROMOTING ANOTHER CLOSED LOW TYPE
SYSTEM OVER US FOR NEXT WEEKEND. 18Z DGEX AND 00Z GFS NOW CARRY AN
OPEN WAVE TO OUR NORTH...WHICH WOULD KEEP FORECAST FOR NEXT WEEKEND
DRY. SINCE 06Z DGEX/GFS RUNS WILL NOT BE AVAILABLE IN TIME TO CHECK
FOR MODEL CONTINUITY...WILL LEAVE MENTION OF PRECIP...20 POPS...IN
NEXT SATURDAYS FORECAST BUT BRIEF DAY SHIFT OF TRENDS. TEMPS FOR
NEXT WEEKEND SHOULD BE NEAR OR SLIGHTLY ABOVE CLIMO.
&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.
&&

$$

WAGNER

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 100811
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
311 AM CDT SUN APR 10 2005

.DISCUSSION...
HIGH PRESSURE WELL OFF TO THE EAST...WITH SURFACE LOW DEVELOPING OVER
COLORADO. WEAK SOUTHERLY FLOW HAS ALREADY STARTED ACROSS THE AREA...
WITH DEWPOINTS IN MIDDLE TO UPPER 50S. SKIES MOSTLY CLEAR...BUT UP TO
THIS TIME...NO HINTS OF DENSE FOG LIKE WE SAW YESTERDAY MORNING.
&&

.SHORT TERM (THROUGH TUESDAY)...
FIRST 18 TO 24 HOURS OF THE FORECAST RATHER QUIET AS SYSTEM OVER THE
ROCKIES GETS GOING. SKIES PARTLY TO MOSTLY SUNNY TODAY. TEMPERATURES
MAY BE A COUPLE OR 3 DEGREES WARMER THAN SATURDAY IF WE DONT GET AN
EXTENSIVE CUMULUS FIELD. CONVECTION WITH ROCKIES SYSTEM WILL APPROACH
THE WESTERN PORTIONS OF OUR CWA TOWARD SUNRISE MONDAY...IN A
WEAKENING PHASE. NOT SURE IT WILL MAKE IT HERE BY 12Z MONDAY...SO
WILL HOLD CURRENTLY FORECAST CHANCE POPS IN WEST OF THE MISSISSIPPI
RIVER. BUMPED UP MINS TONIGHT A DEGREE OR TWO. NOT CONFIDENT IN SPC
DAY 1 OUTLOOK OF SLIGHT RISK...SO WONT PLAY UP POTENTIAL FOR SEVERE
TONIGHT MUCH.

WEAKENING CONVECTION WILL PROBABLY LAY DOWN A BOUNDARY ACROSS WESTERN
PORTIONS OF THE AREA MONDAY MORNING. REDEVELOPMENT OF THUNDERSTORMS
LATE MONDAY AFTERNOON AND MONDAY NIGHT IS ALMOST CERTAIN. WIND FIELDS
CERTAINLY CONDUCIVE TO SEVERE WEATHER. INSTABILITY SOMEWHAT IN
QUESTION DURING THE DAYTIME HOURS ACROSS MUCH OF CWA...BUT NAM
SHOWING CAPES AROUND 1500 AND LIFTED INDICIES AROUND -5 AT MEMPHIS BY
06Z TUESDAY. SPC DAY 2 OUTLOOK FOR SLIGHT RISK ACROSS ENTIRE CWA
ACCEPTED...BUT WILL NOT MENTION IN ZONES...YET. HIGH TEMPS MONDAY
DEPENDENT ON CLOUD COVER. WITH GFS FEEDBACK ISSUES...FEEL CLOUD COVER
FORECAST FROM THAT MODEL IS TOO PESSIMISTIC...AND MAX TEMPS ON MAV
GUIDANCE ARE TOO COOL. CURRENT FORECAST MORE REASONABLE. BOUNDARY
WILL PUSH INTO THE AREA MONDAY NIGHT...WITH TEMPS ABOUT 5 DEGREES
COOLER TUESDAY MORNING THAN MONDAY MORNING. ALSO NOT BUYING GFS QPF
FORECAST FOR MONDAY AND MONDAY NIGHT DUE TO AFOREMENTIONED FEEDBACK
ISSUES. NAM TRENDS MORE REASONABLE.

ACTUAL PATH OF UPPER LOW WILL MAKE A LARGE DIFFERENCE IN FORECAST
TUESDAY. MODELS SHOWING TRACK A LITTLE FURTHER NORTH THAN LAST
SEVERAL DAYS...ACROSS NORTHERN MISSOURI ON TUESDAY. IF THIS TRACK
VERIFIES...WE WILL NEED TO LOWER POPS FOR TUESDAY AND TUESDAY
NIGHT. FOR NOW...WILL HOLD CHANCE POPS IN...AND SEE IF THE MODELS
HAVE SOME CONTINUITY ON THIS FEATURE. IF WE GET DRY SLOTTED...
FORECAST TEMPS WILL BE TOO LOW.
&&

.LONG TERM (AFTER TUESDAY)...
MODELS DROP REMNANTS OF UPPER LOW ACROSS US WEDNESDAY AND
THURSDAY. THIS WILL BRING SLIGHTLY COOLER TEMPERATURES...AND
SOME CHANCE OF PRECIPITATION. SMALL POPS LOOK REASONABLE.

00Z/10 GFS SOLUTION HAS CHANGED FROM PREVIOUS RUNS WITH FOLLOWING
SYSTEM. EARLIER RUNS WERE PROMOTING ANOTHER CLOSED LOW TYPE
SYSTEM OVER US FOR NEXT WEEKEND. 18Z DGEX AND 00Z GFS NOW CARRY AN
OPEN WAVE TO OUR NORTH...WHICH WOULD KEEP FORECAST FOR NEXT WEEKEND
DRY. SINCE 06Z DGEX/GFS RUNS WILL NOT BE AVAILABLE IN TIME TO CHECK
FOR MODEL CONTINUITY...WILL LEAVE MENTION OF PRECIP...20 POPS...IN
NEXT SATURDAYS FORECAST BUT BRIEF DAY SHIFT OF TRENDS. TEMPS FOR
NEXT WEEKEND SHOULD BE NEAR OR SLIGHTLY ABOVE CLIMO.
&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED TO REMOVE FOG ADVISORY
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
913 PM CDT SAT APR 9 2005

.DISCUSSION...

WATER VAPOR IMAGERY THIS EVENING INDICATES AN UPPER LEVEL RIDGE OF
HIGH PRESSURE OVER THE MIDSOUTH WITH SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE ANALYZED
OVER THE SOUTHEASTERN STATES. LIGHT SOUTHERLY WINDS WILL CONTINUE
OVER THE MIDSOUTH TONIGHT. THIS WILL HELP KEEP TEMPERATURES MILD
OVERNIGHT AND THE CURRENT FORECAST HAS THIS HANDLED WELL. PLENTY OF
SINKING AIR UNDER THE RIDGE WILL SUPPRESS MOST CLOUD COVER...SO SKIES
SHOULD REMAIN MOSTLY CLEAR. AREA DEWPOINTS REMAIN IN THE UPPER 50S
TO LOW 60S...AND WITH CLEAR SKIES SOME PATCHY FOG MAY DEVELOP IN
TYPICALLY FAVORED AREAS (IE. NEAR MKL AND ALONG THE TENNESSEE
RIVER). THIS FOG SHOULD REMAIN ISOLATED SO NOT PLANNING ON ADDING TO
THE GRIDS AT THIS TIME...BUT WILL CONTINUE TO MONITOR THROUGH THE
NIGHT FOR POSSIBLE UPDATES. OTHERWISE...THE CURRENT GRIDS AND
FORECAST LOOK GOOD...SO NO UPDATES ARE PLANNED AT THIS TIME.

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.

FXUS64 KMEG 092041
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
340 PM CDT SAT APR 9 2005

.DISCUSSION...SURFACE ANALYSIS THIS AFTERNOON PLACES HIGH PRESSURE 
ACROSS THE LOWER MISSISSIPPI VALLEY. HIGHS THIS AFTERNOON SO FAR 
ACROSS THE MID SOUTH RANGE FROM THE MIDDLE 70S TO AROUND 80. VISIBLE 
SATELLITE TRENDS OVER THE PAST FEW HOURS SHOW SOME DIURNAL CUMULUS 
DEVELOPMENT. MAIN FORECAST CONCERN THIS FORECAST PACKAGE IS SEVERE 
WEATHER/HEAVY RAINFALL POTENTIAL ON MONDAY/MONDAY NIGHT.

TONIGHT...QUIET EVENING EXPECTED ACROSS THE MID SOUTH TONIGHT. SOME 
DIURNAL CUMULUS WHICH FORMED ACROSS PORTIONS OF THE FORECAST 
AREA...MAINLY ACROSS ARKANSAS MISSISSIPPI AND THE SW PORTION OF TENNESSEE 
WILL DIMINISH TOWARDS SUNSET. SKIES WILL BECOME PARTLY CLOUDY 
OVERNIGHT AS SOME CIRRUS MOVES ACROSS THE MID SOUTH. NOT 
ANTICIPATING FOG TO BE MUCH OF A PROBLEM TONIGHT AS WINDS SHOULD 
STAY UP A BIT WITH AREA IN A SOUTHERLY RETURN FLOW ON THE BACK SIDE 
OF HIGH PRESSURE.

SUNDAY...EXPECTING A FEW MORE CLOUDS DURING THE DAY AS NEXT AREA OF 
LOW PRESSURE MOVES FROM THE ROCKIES INTO THE CENTRAL PLAINS. NAM/GFS 
DEVELOP A WEAK SHORTWAVE IN SOUTHWEST FLOW ACROSS THE MID SOUTH 
DURING THE AFTERNOON...BUT THINK AREA WILL STAY DRY WITH A CAPPING 
INVERSION PRESENT. 

SUNDAY NIGHT...SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS ARE EXPECTED TO DEVELOP 
ALONG A DRYLINE IN THE SOUTHERN PLAINS AND MOVE OVERNIGHT ACROSS 
ARKANSAS. THINK THAT SHOWERS/THUNDERSTORMS WILL REMAIN MOSTLY OFF TO 
THE WEST OF THE FORECAST AREA. AS A RESULT...WILL KEEP SLIGHT 
CHANCE/CHANCE POPS ACROSS THE WESTERN ONE THIRD OF THE CWA.

MONDAY...STILL UNCERTAIN IF THERE WILL BE A SEVERE WEATHER OUTBREAK 
ON MONDAY ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA WITH INSTABILITY THE BIG 
QUESTION. LATEST MODEL RUNS QUITE A BIT DIFFERENT THAN THE LAST 
COUPLE OF DAYS. MOISTURE LEFT OVER FROM PREVIOUS LINE OF CONVECTION 
SHOULD KEEP FORECAST AREA MOSTLY CLOUDY FOR MOST OF THE DAY. 
ADDITIONALLY...BETTER SUPPORT FROM MID LEVEL DYNAMICAL FORCING 
/700-500 MB Q-VECTOR CONVERGENCE/ WILL NOT ARRIVE UNTIL AROUND OR 
SLIGHTLY AFTER 00Z. WIND PROFILES SUGGEST THAT CONVECTION WILL 
DEVELOP INTO A LINE BUT THINK BEST SEVERE POTENTIAL WILL BE FURTHER 
SOUTH ACROSS CENTRAL MISSISSIPPI/LOUISIANA WHERE BETTER DAMAGING 
WIND POTENTIAL WILL BE POSSIBLE AS NOTED BY 700 MB DEWPOINT 
DEPRESSIONS. HEAVY RAIN POTENTIAL STILL LOOKS SOMEWHAT FAVORABLE 
ACROSS AT LEAST THE SOUTHERN HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA WITH 
PRECIPITABLE WATER VALUES AROUND 1.5 INCHES AND K-INDICIES AROUND 
35.  ON TUESDAY THE CUTOFF SURFACE LOW WILL MOVE EAST ACROSS THE 
MIDDLE MISSISSIPPI VALLEY PRODUCING ADDITIONAL SHOWERS AND 
THUNDERSTORMS ACROSS THE MID SOUTH.

TUESDAY THROUGH FRIDAY...CUTOFF LOW WILL WEAKEN AND WILL MOVE TOWARD 
THE EAST COAST BY THURSDAY NIGHT. RAIN CHANCES WILL GRADUALLY 
DIMINISH BY THURSDAY BEFORE ANOTHER SYSTEM APPROACHES THE MID SOUTH 
BY THE WEEKEND.

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE
MO...NONE
MS...NONE
TN...NONE
&&

$$

FXUS64 KMEG 091448
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
950 AM CDT SAT APR 9 2005

.SHORT TERM...LATEST SURFACE ANALYSIS PLACES HIGH PRESSURE ACROSS 
THE LOWER MISSISSIPPI VALLEY. VISIBLE SATELLITE SHOWS MOSTLY SUNNY 
SKIES ACROSS THE AREA WITH ONLY A SMALL AREA OF CIRRUS TRAVERSING 
ACROSS WESTERN TENNESSEE. FOG AND STRATUS HAS BEGUN TO BURN OFF 
ACROSS MOST LOCATIONS...WITH ONLY A FEW AREAS MAINLY ALONG THE 
TENNESSEE RIVER SLOWER TO DISSIPATE. HIGHS THIS AFTERNOON WILL REACH 
THE 70S TO AROUND 80 ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA THIS AFTERNOON WITH 
850 MB TEMPERATURES AROUND 12C ON 12Z KJAN/KLZK RAOBS. WILL ISSUE AN 
UPDATE TO REMOVE MENTION OF FOG ACROSS REMAINING EASTERN ZONES.

UPDATED GRIDS WILL BE PUBLISHED SHORTLY.

CJC

.PREV DISCUSSION...ISSUED 327 AM CDT SAT APR 9 2005.

SURFACE HIGH OVER GREAT LAKES AND MOVING EAST. LOW PRESSURE
DEVELOPING OVER THE ROCKIES. ACROSS THE LOCAL AREA...CIRRUS HAS
THINNED OUT. WINDS RATHER LIGHT...AND WITH WET GROUND...WIDESPREAD
FOG HAS DEVELOPED. HAVE ISSUED ADVISORY UNTIL 14Z...FOR MUCH OF AREA
EAST OF MISSISSIPPI RIVER. TEMPERATURES UPPER 40S EAST TO MIDDLE 50S
WEST. &&

.SHORT TERM (THROUGH MONDAY AFTERNOON)...
AFTER EARLY MORNING FOG...SOUTHERLY FLOW RETURNS TODAY. AIRMASS
RATHER DRY...BUT WITH WET GROUND...COULD SEE SOME STRATOCUMULUS
DEVELOPMENT DURING THE AFTERNOON HOURS. BOUNDARY LAYER TEMPERATURES
INDICATE THAT TODAYS HIGH TEMPERATURES SHOULD RUN ABOUT 10 DEGREES
WARMER THAN THOSE ON FRIDAY.

WINDS TONIGHT WILL HOLD TEMPERATURES UP AT LEAST 5 DEGREES OVER THIS
MORNINGS READINGS. AIRMASS REMAINS DRY SUNDAY...AND COULD SEE
ANOTHER 2 OR 3 DEGREES OF WARMING.

UPPER SYSTEM BEGINS TO KICK OUT OF ROCKIES SUNDAY AFTERNOON.
CONVECTION THAT DEVELOPS OVER GREAT PLAINS COULD REACH OUR AREA LATE
SUNDAY NIGHT...AND WILL KEEP CURRENT FORECAST POPS...MAINLY WEST OF
RIVER. EXPECT ADDITIONAL CONVECTION TO DEVELOP DURING THE HEAT OF THE
DAY ON MONDAY. NAM A LITTLE MORE BULLISH ON INSTABILITY FOR MONDAY
THAN GFS. CERTAINLY...A SURFACE AND UPPER LOW PATH OVER MISSOURI IS
CLIMATOLOGICALLY FAVORED FOR SEVERE WEATHER. WILL GO WITH LIKELY POPS
MONDAY AFTERNOON...AND CONTINUE MENTION OF POTENTIAL SEVERE WEATHER
IN HWO. MAV TEMP GUIDANCE LOOKS A COUPLE OF DEGREES TOO COOL FOR
MONDAY.
&&

.LONG TERM (MONDAY NIGHT AND BEYOND)...
THUNDERSTORM THREAT CONTINUES MONDAY NIGHT...AND WILL GO WITH LIKELY
POPS AS FRONT MOVES THROUGH.

QUESTION FOR TUESDAY AND BEYOND WILL BE DISPOSITION OF UPPER LOW.
00Z/09 GFS IS SOMEWHAT SLOWER...WEAKER AND FURTHER SOUTH THAN THE
18Z/08 DGEX. DGEX SOLUTION WOULD KEEP THE AREA DRY AFTER TUESDAY
MORNING THROUGH THE REMAINDER OF THE EXTENDED. GFS SOLUTION WOULD TRY
TO WRAP SOME RAIN INTO THE AREA FOR TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY AS UPPER
LOW WEAKENS AND OPENS UP. WE CURRENTLY HAVE SLIGHT CHANCE TO CHANCE
POPS IN THE FORECAST FOR TUESDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY NIGHT. WILL KEEP
THOSE RUNNING FOR NOW...BUT WILL CONTINUE TO MONITOR TRENDS.
TEMPERATURES SHOULD BE NEAR CLIMATOLOGIC NORMS FOR MOST OF THE
EXTENDED.

00Z GFS SOLUTION FOR NEXT WEEKEND BACKS AWAY FROM SOLUTION OF
ANOTHER UPPER LOW...MORE OF AN OPEN WAVE...BUT ANOTHER PRECIP EVENT
POSSIBLE FOR NEXT FRIDAY NIGHT AND SATURDAY. THIS IS JUST BEYOND
CURRENT FORECAST.
&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...DENSE FOG ADVISORY UNTIL 9 AM.
MO...DENSE FOG ADVISORY UNTIL 9 AM.
MS...DENSE FOG ADVISORY UNTIL 9 AM.
TN...DENSE FOG ADVISORY UNTIL 9 AM.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
854 PM CDT FRI APR 8 2005

.DISCUSSION...

UPPER LEVEL RIDGING SLOWLY BUILDING OVER THE MIDSOUTH THIS EVENING
BEHIND THE DEPARTING UPPER LEVEL LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM OVER THE
SOUTHEASTERN STATES. LINGERING LOW LEVEL MOISTURE TRAPPED IN THE
LOWER ATMOSPHERE KEEPING SOME LOW CEILINGS IN PLACE OVER MAINLY
THE SOUTHERN HALF OF THE AREA. TREND FROM SATELLITE IMAGERY SHOWS
LOW CLOUDS SLOWLY DISSIPATING...SO LOW LEVEL CLOUDS SHOULD CLEAR
OUT LATER TONIGHT. UPPER LEVEL WINDS BRINGING HIGH LEVEL MOISTURE
INTO WESTERN SECTIONS THIS EVENING AND THIS TREND SHOULD CONTINUE
WITH HIGH CLOUDS OVERSPREADING THE MIDSOUTH OVERNIGHT. WITH HIGH
CLOUDS OVERHEAD...EXPECT LOW TEMPERATURES TO REMAIN A BIT HIGHER
THAN ORIGINALLY ANTICIPATED. SO HAVE BUMPED TEMPERATURES UP A FEW
DEGREES. OTHERWISE...THE REMAINDER OF THE FORECAST LOOKS GOOD.
UPDATED GRIDS AND FORECAST OUT SHORTLY.
&&
