000 
FXUS64 KMEG 082024
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
324 PM CDT FRI APR 8 2005

.DISCUSSION...SURFACE ANALYSIS PLACES SURFACE LOW JUST OF THE COAST 
OF SOUTH CAROLINA THIS AFTERNOON. VISIBLE SATELLITE IMAGERY SHOWS 
CLOUDS FINALLY BEGINNING TO BREAK UP ACROSS THE MID SOUTH...MAINLY 
ALONG THE EDGES SO FAR. TEMPERATURES HAVE RECOVERED INTO THE MIDDLE 60S 
WHERE STRATUS HAS ERODED A BIT. MAIN FORECAST CONCERNS THIS PACKAGE 
IS FOG POTENTIAL TONIGHT AND PRECIPITATION CHANCES ON MONDAY.

TONIGHT...SKIES WILL CLEAR TONIGHT ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA AS LOW 
PRESSURE MOVES OFF THE EAST COAST AND 1000-500 MB LAYER RH/S DROP 
DOWN TO AROUND 40 PERCENT TONIGHT. ANTICIPATING FOG TO FORM FROM 
RECENT RAINFALL ACROSS THE MID SOUTH TONIGHT AS WINDS DECOUPLE AND 
SKIES BECOME MOSTLY CLEAR. I STILL THINK THAT BEST FOG POTENTIAL 
WILL BE ACROSS THE SOUTHERN TWO THIRDS OF THE FORECAST AREA. AS A 
RESULT...I/LL MENTION AREAS OF FOG ACROSS ABOVE MENTIONED AREA AND 
PATCHY FOG ELSEWHERE. LOWS TONIGHT ACROSS THE MID SOUTH WILL DROP 
INTO THE UPPER 40S TO LOWER 50S.

SATURDAY...PLEASANT DAY EXPECTED ACROSS THE MID SOUTH AS UPPER LEVEL 
RIDGING BUILDS IN ACROSS THE AREA. 850 MB TEMPERATURES WILL WARM TO 
AROUND 11C...PRODUCING HIGHS IN THE 70S. EXPECTING MOSTLY 
SUNNY/PARTLY CLOUDY SKIES WITH SOME CIRRUS AS AREA TRANSITIONS BACK 
INTO WARM AIR ADVECTION PATTERN. 

SATURDAY NIGHT...A VERY WEAK AND POORLY DEFINED WARM FRONT WILL PASS 
THROUGH THE LOWER MISSISSIPPI VALLEY BUT NOT EXPECTING ANY 
PRECIPITATION WITH THIS FEATURE AS MOISTURE WILL BE LACKING AND A 
700 MB CAPPING INVERSION PRESENT. 

SUNDAY NIGHT AND MONDAY...NAM/GFS AGREE ON CONVECTION DEVELOPING IN 
THE SOUTHERN PLAINS SUNDAY NIGHT AND SPREADING INTO THE MID SOUTH ON 
MONDAY. FIRST LINE OF CONVECTION MAY DISSIPATE BEFORE REACHING 
THE FORECAST AREA MONDAY. ANOTHER LINE OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS 
WILL DEVELOP ALONG A DRYLINE ACROSS EASTERN OKLAHOMA/TEXAS/AND 
WESTERN ARKANSAS DURING THE DAY...AND REACHING THE FORECAST AREA 
DURING THE AFTERNOON AND EVENING HOURS. STILL SOME ISSUES WITH 
AMOUNT OF INSTABILITY AVAILABLE AND THINK SEVERE POTENTIAL MAY 
BECOME A CONCERN BUT WILL WAIT FOR FURTHER RUNS WITH EVENT CURRENTLY 
IN THE 5TH TO 6TH PERIOD BEFORE MAKING ANY CHANGES TO CURRENT HWO.

TUESDAY THROUGH FRIDAY...CUTOFF LOW WITH TRAILING COLD FRONT WILL 
MOVE THROUGH THE FORECAST AREA TUESDAY WITH HIGH PRESSURE GRADUALLY 
BUILDING BACK IN ACROSS THE MID SOUTH. LOWERED POPS WEDNESDAY AS 
UPPER LEVEL RIDGING MOVES OVERHEAD ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA AND 
PROVIDES PRECIPITATION FREE WEATHER TO THE MID SOUTH...AT LEAST 
THROUGH THE FIRST HALF OF NEXT WEEKEND.

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.
&&

$$
CJC





000 
FXUS64 KMEG 081513
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
1012 AM CDT FRI APR 8 2005

.DISCUSSION...SURFACE ANALYSIS THIS MORNING PLACES SURFACE LOW 
PRESSURE ACROSS SOUTH CAROLINA. VISIBLE SATELLITE SHOWS MOSTLY 
CLOUDY/CLOUDY SKIES ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA WITH MOSTLY SUNNY/SUNNY 
SKIES ACROSS ARKANSAS AND SOUTHERN ILLINOIS. MAIN FORECAST CONCERNS 
FOR THIS AFTERNOON WILL BE CLOUD COVER AND TEMPERATURES. 

MODEL SOUNDINGS SHOW LOW LEVEL MOISTURE TRAPPED UNDER SUBSIDENCE 
INVERSION WILL GRADUALLY ERODE BY LATE AFTERNOON...AT LEAST ACROSS 
THE WESTERN HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA. TEMPERATURES SHOULD BEGIN TO 
RECOVER THIS AFTERNOON WHERE CLOUDS DIMINISH. 

CURRENT FORECAST IS ON TRACK AND WILL NOT ISSUE AN UPDATE UNLESS 
CLOUDS BEGIN TO ERODE QUICKER THAN ANTICIPATED.

CJC


.PREV DISCUSSION...ISSUED 252 AM CDT FRI APR 8 2005.

.SHORT TERM (THROUGH SUNDAY)...
UPPER LOW WILL CONTINUE TO MOVE EAST AND BE NEAR SAVANNAH GA TONIGHT.
LOW CLOUDS WILL GRADUALLY ROTATE EAST OF THE AREA. WILL WAIT UNTIL
THE LAST MINUTE TO DETERMINE POPS ACROSS WEST TENNESSEE THIS
MORNING...MAY JUST MENTION A FEW SPRINKLES. ANTICIPATE DECREASE IN
CLOUDS DURING THE DAY...AND SEVERAL HOURS OF SUNSHINE SHOULD ALLOW
TEMPERATURES TO WARM INTO THE MIDDLE 60S ACROSS MOST AREAS.

WEAK HIGH PRESSURE RIDGING ACROSS THE AREA TONIGHT. WET GROUND...
CLEAR SKIES AND LIGHT WINDS WILL AID IN POSSIBLE FOG FORMATION...
ESPECIALLY ACROSS SOUTHERN 2/3RDS OF AREA...WHERE GROUND IS
WETTEST. AIR IS NOT AS DRY AS EARLIER MODEL RUNS WOULD INDICATE.
RAISED LOWS TONIGHT FROM PREVIOUS FORECAST...BUT STILL SEVERAL
DEGREES BELOW NUMERICAL GUIDANCE.

SOUTHERLY FLOW RETURNS SATURDAY FOR THE REMAINDER OF THE WEEKEND.
SKIES SHOULD BE PARTLY TO MOSTLY SUNNY BOTH SATURDAY AND SUNDAY.
TEMPERATURES SATURDAY ABOUT 10 DEGREES WARMER THAN TODAY...AND
MAYBE ANOTHER 2 OR 3 DEGREES WARMER ON SUNDAY. BOOSTED TEMPERATURE
FORECAST FOR SATURDAY THROUGH SUNDAY NIGHT SEVERAL DEGREES...BUT
STILL REMAIN BELOW GUIDANCE ON LOWS SATURDAY NIGHT.

AS UPPER SYSTEM KICKS OUT OF 4 CORNERS AREA SUNDAY...IT MAY GET
CLOSE ENOUGH TO BRING A CHANCE OF PRECIPITATION TO THE WESTERN HALF
OF THE AREA LATE SUNDAY NIGHT. THIS IS ALREADY ACCOUNTED FOR IN
CURRENT FORECAST.
&&

.LONG TERM (AFTER SUNDAY)...
SOME DISAGREEMENT ON HOW QUICKLY UPPER SYSTEM MOVES ACROSS THE AREA
EARLY NEXT WEEK. UPPER LOW FORECAST TO BE OVER KANSAS MONDAY NIGHT
WITH TROF NEGATIVELY TILTED OVER OUR AREA. THIS WOULD BRING
POTENTIAL FOR SEVERE WEATHER AND HEAVY RAIN MONDAY NIGHT INTO
TUESDAY. ALREADY HAVE LIKELY POPS IN FOR MONDAY NIGHT.

THIS UPPER LOW FORECAST TO MOVE FURTHER NORTH THAN CURRENT SYSTEM.
THIS WOULD BRING LOWER PRECIPITATION CHANCES AND A LITTLE MILDER
WEATHER TO THE AREA THAN WHAT WE ARE EXPERIENCING NOW. DIDNT SEE A
REASON TO MAKE MAJOR ADJUSTMENTS FOR TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY. PRECIP
SHOULD BE NORTH AND EAST OF THE AREA THURSDAY...HAVE REMOVED PRECIP
FOR THAT PERIOD.
&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.
&&

$$

WAGNER

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
252 AM CDT FRI APR 8 2005

.DISCUSSION...
SURFACE LOW WELL OFF TO OUR EAST...NEAR TYS...WITH UPPER LOW OVER
EAST CENTRAL ALABAMA...MAYBE A LITTLE SLOWER THAN GUIDANCE DEPICTS.
A FEW SPRINKLES ROTATING AROUND UPPER LOW OVER WEST TENNESSEE...BUT
SIGNIFICANT PRECIPITATION HAS MOVED EAST OF THE AREA. SKIES REMAIN
CLOUDY...TEMPERATURES GENERALLY IN THE MIDDLE 50S WITH NORTHERLY
WINDS. CLEARING NOT VERY FAR AWAY...BUT UPPER LOW WILL HAVE TO MOVE
EAST BEFORE WE SEE ANY.
&&

FXUS64 KMEG 080124
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
824 PM CDT THU APR 7 2005

UPPER LOW OVER NORTHERN AL THIS EVENING IS CONTINUING TO MOVE
EASTWARD. SCATTERED SHOWERS WRAPPING AROUND THE BACKSIDE OF THE LOW
ARE CONTINUING TO AFFECT THE MIDSOUTH...BUT ARE DECREASING IN
COVERAGE AND INTENSITY. WILL UPDATE TO LOWER POPS TO 30 PERCENT FOR
THE REMAINDER OF THE NIGHT ACROSS THE MIDSOUTH AND REMOVE MENTION
OF THUNDERSTORMS. OVERNIGHT FORECAST LOWS LOOK FINE.

.PREV DISCUSSION...
ISSUED 332 PM CDT THU APR 7 2005

LATEST SURFACE ANALYSIS PLACES STACKED LOW PRESSURE
ACROSS WESTERN TENNESSEE. 88D TRENDS SHOW SHOWERS AND ISOLATED
THUNDERSTORMS CONTINUING TO ROTATE AROUND THE LOW. A FEW REPORTS
CAME IN THIS AFTERNOON OF MAINLY PEA SIZE HAIL AS FREEZING LEVELS
HAVE BEEN AROUND 8KFT. MAIN CONCERNS THIS FORECAST PACKAGE IS
PRECIPITATION POTENTIAL TONIGHT AND AGAIN FOR MONDAY.

TONIGHT...STACKED SURFACE AND UPPER LEVEL LOW CURRENTLY ACROSS SW
TENNESSEE WILL CONTINUE TO MOVE EAST TONIGHT INTO MIDDLE AND EASTERN
TENNESSEE. MID LEVEL SHEAR AXIS WILL ROTATE THROUGH THE AREA
TONIGHT. MODEL SOUNDINGS INDICATE ATMOSPHERE WILL REMAIN SATURATED
INTO THE EVENING...AND WILL CARRY NUMEROUS SHOWERS AND ISOLATED
THUNDER UNTIL LATE EVENING AND TAPER RAIN CHANCES OFF FROM LATE
EVENING ON. TEMPERATURES TONIGHT WILL DROP BACK INTO THE LOWER 50S
ACROSS THE MID SOUTH.

FRIDAY...MID UPPER LEVEL RIDGE WILL GRADUALLY SHIFT EAST ACROSS THE
MISSISSIPPI VALLEY DURING THE DAY. MODEL SOUNDINGS INDICATE SOME LOW
LEVEL MOISTURE AROUND 950 MB WILL PERSIST INTO AT LEAST EARLY
AFTERNOON AND SKIES GRADUALLY CLEARING BY LATE AFTERNOON.
TEMPERATURES WILL RECOVER A FEW DEGREES FROM THIS AFTERNOON/S HIGHS.

FRIDAY NIGHT...SKIES WILL CLEAR ACROSS THE MID SOUTH FRIDAY NIGHT.
THERE IS A GOOD POTENTIAL FOR FOG AMPLE SURFACE MOISTURE IN PLACE
FROM THE RECENT RAINFALL...CLEAR SKIES...AND DECOUPLED WINDS.
MENTIONED AREAS OF FOG IN FORECAST ACROSS THE SOUTHERN TWO THIRDS OF
THE FORECAST AREA...MAINLY AFTER MIDNIGHT. LOWS ARE EXPECTED TO DROP
BACK INTO THE LOWER 50S.

SATURDAY AND SUNDAY...UPPER LEVEL RIDGE WILL MOVE SLIGHTLY EAST BY
SATURDAY AFTERNOON. A WEAK MID LEVEL VORTICITY MAXIMUM WILL RIDE UP
THE RIDGE IN SOUTHWEST FLOW PATTERN...BUT NOT ANTICIPATING ANY
RAINFALL WITH THIS FEATURE. 850 MB TEMPERATURES WILL WARM TO AROUND
12C...PRODUCING HIGHS IN THE 70S.

.EXTENDED...LONG RANGE PATTERN LOOKS RATHER UNSETTLED AS LONG WAVE
TROUGH CURRENTLY LOCATED ACROSS THE WEST COAST OF U.S. WILL DEVELOP
A 500MB LOW. GFS CURRENTLY ADVERTISING A LINE OF SHOWERS AND
THUNDERSTORMS TO DEVELOP ALONG A DRYLINE ACROSS THE SOUTHERN PLAINS
SUNDAY NIGHT AND AFFECT THE MID SOUTH ON MONDAY. NAM/GFS SHOW SOME
POSSIBLE SEVERE POTENTIAL WITH THIS NEXT SYSTEM BUT WILL ONLY
MENTION POTENTIAL AS STRONG IN HWO FOR NOW AND WAIT FOR SOME LATER
MODEL RUNS BEFORE STRENGTHENING WORDING. THIS LOW WILL THEN BECOME
CUTOFF FROM THE UPPER LEVEL FLOW AND WOBBLE ACROSS THE SOUTHERN US
THROUGH THE END OF THE LONG RANGE FORECAST. AS A RESULT...WILL NOT
MAKE ANY MAJOR CHANGES TO CURRENT LONG RANGE FORECAST WITH A CHANCE
OF PRECIPITATION NEARLY EVERY DAY.

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.

FXUS64 KMEG 071553
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
1050 AM CDT THU APR 7 2005

.DISCUSSION...LATEST ANALYSIS PLACES STACKED SURFACE AND UPPER LEVEL 
LOW PRESSURE ACROSS SOUTHWEST TENNESSEE. 12Z UPPER AIR ANALYSIS 
DEPICTS SEVERAL SHORTWAVE LOBES ROTATING AROUND THE LOW. MAIN FORECAST 
CONCERNS FOR THIS AFTERNOON WILL BE THUNDER POTENTIAL AND 
TEMPERATURES. MODEL SOUNDINGS PRODUCE 600-700 J/KG OF CAPE...LI/S 
AROUND -2...AND SHOWALTER VALUES APPROACHING ZERO. WILL MENTION 
NUMEROUS RAIN SHOWERS WITH ISOLATED THUNDERSTORMS FOR THIS 
AFTERNOON. I THINK MOST AREAS WILL JUST HAVE A RUMBLE OR TWO AT BEST 
AS A COUPLE OF LIGHTNING REPORTS WERE REPORTED OVER THE PAST HOUR. 
TEMPERATURES ACROSS THE MID SOUTH ARE CURRENTLY IN THE UPPER 50S TO 
LOWER 60S AND WILL MAKE ADJUSTMENTS BASED UPON CURRENT TRENDS SINCE 
CLOUD COVER WILL KEEP TEMPERATURES MOSTLY STEADY OR RISE A FEW 
DEGREES AT BEST THIS AFTERNOON. PRECIPITATION SHOULD GRADUALLY BEGIN 
TO DIMINISH TONIGHT AS LOW PRESSURE MOVES EAST.

UPDATED GRIDS WILL BE PUBLISHED SHORTLY.

CJC

.PREV DISCUSSION...ISSUED 130 AM CDT THU APR 7 2005.

WEATHER HAS QUIETED DOWN THIS MORNING. LINE OF THUNDERSTORMS THAT 
PRODUCED SOME SEVERE WEATHER IN THE CWA DURING THE EVENING HAS 
PUSHED WELL EAST OF THE AREA. SOME SCATTERED SHOWERS AND A FEW ISOLATED 
THUNDERSTORMS ARE CURRENTLY MOVING ACROSS EASTERN ARKANSAS AT THIS 
TIME. THESE SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS ARE IN ASSOCIATION WITH AN 
UPPER LEVEL LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM CURRENTLY LOCATED OVER CENTRAL 
ARKANSAS THIS MORNING. THE UPPER LOW IS EXPECTED TO CONTINUE MOVING 
EASTWARD ACROSS NORTH MISSISSIPPI TODAY. SHOWERS AND SCATTERED 
THUNDERSTORMS WILL CONTINUE TO DEVELOP AS THE LOW MOVES ACROSS THE 
CWA. ANY THUNDERSTORMS THAT OCCUR TODAY IS EXPECTED TO STAY BELOW 
SEVERE LIMITS AS CLOUD COVER WILL KEEP INSTABILITY WEAK ACROSS THE 
CWA. UPPER LOW WILL EXIT CWA BY THIS EVENING. ALTHOUGH EXPECT 
CHANCES OF SHOWERS TO CONTINUE INTO TONIGHT AS THE CWA WILL BE ON 
THE BACK SIDE OF THE LOW. ANY PRECIPITATION THAT OCCURS TODAY AND 
TONIGHT WILL BE ON THE LIGHT SIDE SO WILL ALLOW THE FLOOD WATCH TO 
EXPIRE WITH THIS PACKAGE.

AN UPPER RIDGE WILL BUILD INTO THE MIDSOUTH BY FRIDAY NIGHT. THIS 
WILL ALLOW FOR DRY AND PLEASANT CONDITIONS TO OCCUR FOR MUCH OF THE 
WEEKEND ACROSS THE CWA. HIGH TEMPERATURES WILL BE IN THE MID TO 
UPPER 70S WITH LOWS IN THE MID TO UPPER 50S DURING THIS TIME.

CLOUDS WILL BEGIN TO INCREASE BY SUNDAY AS THE NEXT LOW PRESSURE 
SYSTEM BEGINS TO APPROACH THE AREA. EXPECT RAIN CHANCES TO HOLD OFF 
UNTIL LATE SUNDAY NIGHT. THE SYSTEM WILL BE SLOW TO MOVE OUT OF THE 
REGION SO CHANCES FOR SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS WILL OCCUR THROUGH 
THE END OF THE FORECAST PERIOD. RIGHT NOW...THE BEST CHANCE FOR RAIN 
OUT OF THIS TIME PERIOD WILL OCCUR MONDAY NIGHT AS THE WARM FRONT 
PUSHES NORTHWARD OVER THE CWA. 

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.

CWA. ANY THUNDERSTORMS THAT OCCUR TODAY IS EXPECTED TO STAY BELOW

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 070224
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
924 PM CDT WED APR 6 2005

.UPDATE...
WATER VAPOR SATELLITE SHOWS UPPER LOW OVER NORTHWEST AR...MOVING
TOWARD THE MIDSOUTH. COLD AIR ALOFT IN ASSOCIATION WITH THIS LOW
WILL CAUSE THE THREAT OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS TO CONTINUE
OVERNIGHT. LATEST LAPS DATA INDICATES SURFACE BASED INSTABILITY HAS
DECREASED ACROSS THE AREA WITH SUNSET. HOWEVER...AS THE LOW NEARS...
CAN NOT RULE A FEW SEVERE THUNDERSTORMS MAINLY DUE TO ELEVATED
INSTABILITY...LARGE HAIL WILL BE THE GREATEST THREAT. WILL CONTINUE
THE FLOOD WATCH FOR WEST TENNESSEE AND NORTH MISSISSIPPI
OVERNIGHT. 88D ESTIMATES AND SURFACE OBSERVATIONS INDICATE BETWEEN 1
1/2 INCHES AND 4 INCHES OF RAIN HAS OCCURRED ACROSS MUCH OF THE
WATCH AREA SINCE EARLY THIS MORNING. IT WILL NOT TAKE MUCH RAIN TO
CAUSE FLOODING IN THESE AREAS DUE TO THE SATURATED GROUND.

HAVE ALREADY UPDATED FORECAST / GRIDS TO REMOVE EARLIER TORNADO
WATCH. OTHERWISE...MADE ONLY SMALL CHANGES.

.PREV DISCUSSION...
ISSUED 316 PM CDT WED APR 6 2005

BUSY WEATHER DAY ACRS THE MID SOUTH. FIRST ROUND OF STORMS LEFT 1 TO
2 INCHES ACRS MUCH OF W TN AND N MS THIS MORNING. ROUND NUMBER 2 IS
WELL UNDER WELL ATTM. NEARLY VERTICALLY STACKED UPPER LEVEL LOW
STARTING TO MOVE INTO WRN AR. OCCLUDED FRONT STRETCHES IN AN ARC
FROM NRN AR TOWARD CLARKSDALE. THIS FRONT IS PUSHING EAST INTO THE
MID SOUTH. GOOD LOW LEVEL SHEAR WITH WINDS BACKED TO THE
EAST-SOUTHEAST TO THE NORTH/EAST OF THE FRONT CREATING LARGE VALUES
OF HELICITY INVOF FRONT. MEANWHILE DRY SLOT IS PUNCHING INTO ERN AR
WITH SFC TEMPS CLIMBING INTO THE UPPER 70S AT SGT. AIRMASS WILL CONT
TO DESTABILIZE SOUTH/WEST OF THE FRONT DURING THE REST OF THE AFTN.
STORMS WILL CONT TO FIRE ALONG AND SOUTH OF THIS BOUNDARY FROM NW MS
INTO ERN AR THIS AFTN. THESE STORMS WL PUSH NORTHEAST THROUGH THE
MID SOUTH INTO THE EVENING HOURS. THE MAIN THREAT CONTINUES TO BE
LARGE HAIL THOUGH WITH THE ENHANCED HELICITY ALONG THE FRONT
ISOLATED TORNADOES ARE POSSIBLE. A TORNADO WATCH IS IN EFFECT UNTIL
9 PM BASICALLY SOUTH AND WEST OF A DYERSBURG TO SAVANNAH LINE.

HAVE ISSUED A FLOOD WATCH FOR THE AREA EAST OF THE MS RIVER TONIGHT.
RAINFALL AMOUNTS OF 1 TO 2 INCHES EARLIER TODAY COMBINED WITH RADAR
TRENDS AND UPPER LOW TRACK PLACE WEST TN AND NRN MS IN POTENTIAL
HEAVY RAIN AREA. BEST THREAT FOR HEAVY RAIN PROBABLY UNTIL
MIDNIGHT...THOUGH WL CARRY WATCH UNTIL 6 AM SINCE UPPER LOW HAS BEEN
MOVING SLOWER THAN FORECAST.

UPPER LOW SHOULD BE APPROACHING THE MS RIVER BY 12Z THU MOVING ACRS
NRN MS DURING THE DAY. WL KEEP RELATIVELY HIGH POPS ACRS THE AREA.
EXPECT BEST CHANCE FOR PRECIP WL BE NORTH OF THE UPPER LOW IN THE
DEFORMATION AREA ACRS NE AR...MO BOOTHEEL AND NW TN. THUNDER CHANCES
HIGHEST EAST OF THE UPPER LOW DURING THE MORNING DIMINISHING AS THE
LOW TRACKS EAST.

UPPER LOW TRACKS TO NRN GA THU NIGHT AND PRECIP WL TAPER OFF. RIDGE
BUILDS ACRS THE AREA FRI THROUGH SUN WITH MILD TEMPS AND DRY
WEATHER.

BELIEVE IT OR NOT ANOTHER CLOSED UPPER LOW IS FORECAST TO IMPACT THE
AREA WITH CHANCES FOR PRECIP SUN NIGHT INTO WED.

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...FLOOD WATCH FOR NRN MS UNTIL 600 AM.
TN...FLOOD WATCH FOR WEST TN UNTIL 600 AM.
&&



000 
FXUS64 KMEG 070225
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
924 PM CDT WED APR 6 2005

.UPDATE...
WATER VAPOR SATELLITE SHOWS UPPER LOW OVER NORTHWEST AR...MOVING
TOWARD THE MIDSOUTH. COLD AIR ALOFT IN ASSOCIATION WITH THIS LOW
WILL CAUSE THE THREAT OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS TO CONTINUE
OVERNIGHT. LATEST LAPS DATA INDICATES SURFACE BASED INSTABILITY HAS
DECREASED ACROSS THE AREA WITH SUNSET. HOWEVER...AS THE LOW NEARS...
CAN NOT RULE A FEW SEVERE THUNDERSTORMS MAINLY DUE TO ELEVATED
INSTABILITY...LARGE HAIL WILL BE THE GREATEST THREAT. WILL CONTINUE
THE FLOOD WATCH FOR WEST TENNESSEE AND NORTH MISSISSIPPI
OVERNIGHT. 88D ESTIMATES AND SURFACE OBSERVATIONS INDICATE BETWEEN 1
1/2 INCHES AND 4 INCHES OF RAIN HAS OCCURRED ACROSS MUCH OF THE
WATCH AREA SINCE EARLY THIS MORNING. IT WILL NOT TAKE MUCH RAIN TO
CAUSE FLOODING IN THESE AREAS DUE TO THE SATURATED GROUND.

HAVE ALREADY UPDATED FORECAST / GRIDS TO REMOVE EARLIER TORNADO
WATCH. OTHERWISE...MADE ONLY SMALL CHANGES.

.PREV DISCUSSION...
ISSUED 316 PM CDT WED APR 6 2005

BUSY WEATHER DAY ACRS THE MID SOUTH. FIRST ROUND OF STORMS LEFT 1 TO
2 INCHES ACRS MUCH OF W TN AND N MS THIS MORNING. ROUND NUMBER 2 IS
WELL UNDER WELL ATTM. NEARLY VERTICALLY STACKED UPPER LEVEL LOW
STARTING TO MOVE INTO WRN AR. OCCLUDED FRONT STRETCHES IN AN ARC
FROM NRN AR TOWARD CLARKSDALE. THIS FRONT IS PUSHING EAST INTO THE
MID SOUTH. GOOD LOW LEVEL SHEAR WITH WINDS BACKED TO THE
EAST-SOUTHEAST TO THE NORTH/EAST OF THE FRONT CREATING LARGE VALUES
OF HELICITY INVOF FRONT. MEANWHILE DRY SLOT IS PUNCHING INTO ERN AR
WITH SFC TEMPS CLIMBING INTO THE UPPER 70S AT SGT. AIRMASS WILL CONT
TO DESTABILIZE SOUTH/WEST OF THE FRONT DURING THE REST OF THE AFTN.
STORMS WILL CONT TO FIRE ALONG AND SOUTH OF THIS BOUNDARY FROM NW MS
INTO ERN AR THIS AFTN. THESE STORMS WL PUSH NORTHEAST THROUGH THE
MID SOUTH INTO THE EVENING HOURS. THE MAIN THREAT CONTINUES TO BE
LARGE HAIL THOUGH WITH THE ENHANCED HELICITY ALONG THE FRONT
ISOLATED TORNADOES ARE POSSIBLE. A TORNADO WATCH IS IN EFFECT UNTIL
9 PM BASICALLY SOUTH AND WEST OF A DYERSBURG TO SAVANNAH LINE.

HAVE ISSUED A FLOOD WATCH FOR THE AREA EAST OF THE MS RIVER TONIGHT.
RAINFALL AMOUNTS OF 1 TO 2 INCHES EARLIER TODAY COMBINED WITH RADAR
TRENDS AND UPPER LOW TRACK PLACE WEST TN AND NRN MS IN POTENTIAL
HEAVY RAIN AREA. BEST THREAT FOR HEAVY RAIN PROBABLY UNTIL
MIDNIGHT...THOUGH WL CARRY WATCH UNTIL 6 AM SINCE UPPER LOW HAS BEEN
MOVING SLOWER THAN FORECAST.

UPPER LOW SHOULD BE APPROACHING THE MS RIVER BY 12Z THU MOVING ACRS
NRN MS DURING THE DAY. WL KEEP RELATIVELY HIGH POPS ACRS THE AREA.
EXPECT BEST CHANCE FOR PRECIP WL BE NORTH OF THE UPPER LOW IN THE
DEFORMATION AREA ACRS NE AR...MO BOOTHEEL AND NW TN. THUNDER CHANCES
HIGHEST EAST OF THE UPPER LOW DURING THE MORNING DIMINISHING AS THE
LOW TRACKS EAST.

UPPER LOW TRACKS TO NRN GA THU NIGHT AND PRECIP WL TAPER OFF. RIDGE
BUILDS ACRS THE AREA FRI THROUGH SUN WITH MILD TEMPS AND DRY
WEATHER.

BELIEVE IT OR NOT ANOTHER CLOSED UPPER LOW IS FORECAST TO IMPACT THE
AREA WITH CHANCES FOR PRECIP SUN NIGHT INTO WED.

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 061526
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
1025 AM CDT WED APR 6 2005

.UPDATE...
UPPER LOW SPINNING OVER ERN OK THIS MORNING. FIRST BAND OF 
CONVECTION MOVING SLOWLY OUT OF W TN AND NE MS. MEANWHILE AN 
EAST-WEST BAND OF STRONG STORMS ARE FIRING ACRS NW MS ATTM. THIS 
LINE SEEMS TO BE DEVELOPING ALONG A WARM FRONT THAT IS PUSHING NORTH 
THROUGH THE DELTA. DEWPOINTS ARE IN THE MID 60S SOUTH OF THE FRONT 
AND THE MID 50S TO THE NORTH. THERE HAVE BEEN REPORTS OF SMALL HAIL 
WITH THESE STORMS. THIS CONVECTION WL CONTINUE TO PUSH OFF TO THE 
NORTH DURING THE REMAINDER OF THE MORNING/EARLY AFTN. 

THE UPPER LOW WL PUSH SLOWLY INTO WRN AR THIS AFTN WHILE A DRY SLOT 
TRIES TO WORK INTO THE MID SOUTH. BIG QUESTION WL BE THE AMOUNT 
CLOUDINESS AND WHETHER SOME OF THE LOW CLOUDS MIX OUT. STILL FEEL 
SOME SUNSHINE IS POSSIBLE THIS AFTN AND SFC TEMPS SHOULD CLIMB 
ABOVE 70 DEGREES. THIS COMBINED WITH COLD AIR ALOFT MOVING INTO THE 
REGION WL STEEPEN LAPSE RATES AND CREATE DECENT INSTABILITY. 
SBCAPES SHOULD REACH 1500 J/KG THIS AFTN ACRS E CNTRL AR. SHOULD SEE 
REDEVELOPMENT ACRS AR LATER THIS AFTN MOVING ACRS THE MID SOUTH 
DURING THE EARLY EVENING HOURS. BEST SFC BASED INSTABILITY WL BE 
SOUTH OF THE SFC LOW TRACK...ACRS E CNTRL AR AND N MS. THAT AREA 
PROBABLY HAS THE BEST CHANCE OF LARGE HAIL AND DAMAGING WINDS LATE 
THIS AFTN AND EVENING. SVR WX IS ALSO POSSIBLE ACRS W TN AND NE AR 
THOUGH IT MAY BE MORE ELEVATED IN NATURE WITH LARGE HAIL THE MAIN 
THREAT. THINKING THAT THREAT WL EXTEND WELL INTO THE EVENING. 

WL MAKE A COUPLE SMALL ADJUSTMENTS TO THE ZONES...WL KNOCK A COUPLE 
DEGREES OFF THE HIGH TEMPS AND ADJUST POPS SLIGHTLY FOR THIS AFTN.

.PREV DISCUSSION ISSUED AT 215 AM...
DYING LINE OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS IS CURRENTLY MAKING ITS WAY 
INTO WESTERN PORTIONS OF THE CWA THIS MORNING. THIS LINE IS 
ASSOCIATED WITH A STRONG UPPER LEVEL LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM THAT IS 
CURRENTLY LOCATED OVER OKLAHOMA. EXPECT THIS INITIAL LINE OF 
CONVECTION TO CONTINUE MOVING EASTWARD ACROSS THE CWA TODAY. MODELS 
HAVE SHIFTED THE TRACK OF THE LOW FURTHER SOUTH THAN LAST NIGHTS 
RUN. LOW IS EXPECTED TO TRACK ACROSS NORTH MISSISSIPPI LATER 
TONIGHT. AFTER THE INITIAL LINE OF CONVECTION GOES THROUGH THIS 
MORNING...SOME CLEARING MAY OCCUR. EVEN IF ONLY A LITTLE BIT OF 
SUNSHINE OCCURS...HIGH TEMPERATURES WILL GET MUCH WARMER THAN WHAT 
GUIDANCE IS PREDICTING. WILL GO WITH HIGHS IN THE LOW TO MID 70S. 
WITH DAYTIME HEATING...EXPECT SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS TO REDEVELOP 
BY THIS AFTERNOON INTO TONIGHT. SOME OF THESE STORMS COULD BE SEVERE 
WITH LARGE HAIL AND DAMAGING WINDS BEING THE PRIMARY THREAT. THE 
BEST CHANCE FOR SEVERE WEATHER TO OCCUR WILL BE ACROSS PORTIONS OF 
EASTERN ARKANSAS AND NORTH MISSISSIPPI...WHERE THE UPPER LOW WILL 
TRACK.

EXPECT SHOWERS AND A FEW ISOLATED THUNDERSTORMS TO CONTINUE INTO 
THURSDAY AS UPPER LOW WILL NOT EXIT MIDSOUTH UNTIL MIDDAY THURSDAY. 
ANY THUNDERSTORMS THAT OCCUR THURSDAY MORNING SHOULD STAY BELOW 
SEVERE LIMITS AS INSTABILITY WILL BE WEAK ACROSS THE AREA. MIDSOUTH 
WILL BE ON BACK SIDE OF LOW BY THURSDAY AFTERNOON AND EVENING. SOME 
SCATTERED SHOWERS MAY MOVE THROUGH THE AREA DURING THIS TIME.

AN UPPER RIDGE WILL MOVE OVER THE MIDSOUTH BY FRIDAY EVENING AND 
WILL BRING DRY AND PLEASANT CONDITIONS FOR MOST OF THE WEEKEND TO 
THE MIDSOUTH. HIGHS WILL BE IN THE LOWER TO MID 70S AND LOWS WILL BE 
IN THE 50S DURING THIS TIME.

BY SUNDAY CLOUDS WILL BEGIN TO INCREASE ACROSS THE AREA IN ADVANCE 
OF THE NEXT LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM. RAIN CHANCES WILL BEGIN ACROSS 
SOUTHWESTERN PORTIONS OF THE MIDSOUTH SUNDAY NIGHT. THE EXACT TRACK 
OF THE LOW IS UNCERTAIN AT THIS TIME BUT THE MIDSOUTH WILL CONTINUE 
TO EXPERIENCE CHANCES FOR SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS FOR THE 
BEGINNING OF THE WEEK.

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.
&&

$$

SJM/KRM

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 060121
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
821 PM CDT TUE APR 5 2005

.UPDATE...
STRONG AND VERTICALLY STACKED LOW PRESSURE IS LOCATED OVER WESTERN
OK/WESTERN KS THIS EVENING. THIS LOW IS FORECAST TO GRADUALLY MOVE
EAST-SOUTHEAST OVERNIGHT. A LINE OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS AHEAD
OF THIS LOW IS MOVING INTO WESTERN AR ATTM...WITH SCATTERED SHOWERS
AND THUNDERSTORMS DEVELOPING JUST AHEAD OF THIS MAIN LINE. THINK
THE MAIN LINE OF THUNDERSTORMS WILL BE MOVING INTO EASTERN AR
AROUND 1 OR 2 AM. HOWEVER...THE THUNDERSTORMS DEVELOPING AHEAD OF
THIS LINE COULD ARRIVE A COUPLE OF HOURS EARLIER. THE STORMS WILL BE
MOVING INTO A MORE STABLE AIR MASS AS THEY MOVE INTO THE MIDSOUTH...
PARTICULARLY WITH DIURNAL COOLING. THEREFORE...THINK THE TREND WILL
BE FOR A DECREASE IN INTENSITY OF THE STORMS LATER TONIGHT.
HOWEVER...CAN NOT RULE OUT A FEW SEVERE THUNDERSTORMS...MAINLY WITH
LARGE HAIL AND DAMAGING WIND. 01Z SPC OUTLOOK OF SLIGHT RISK REMAINS
ABOUT THE SAME AS THE EARLIER OUTLOOK FOR OUR AREA...GENERALLY A
SLIGHT RISK OF SEVERE SOUTH AND WEST OF A LINE FROM JONESBORO TO
MEMPHIS TO TUPELO.

WILL UPDATE FOR SMALL CHANGES...MAINLY SKY COVER...AND TO REMOVE
POPS FOR MOST AREAS EAST OF THE MS RIVER UNTIL AFTER MIDNIGHT.


.PREV DISCUSSION...
ISSUED 308 PM CDT TUE APR 5 2005

VERY WET PATTERN ABOUT TO SET IN OVER THE AREA. A CLOSED LOW
PRESSURE SYSTEM OVER THE CENTRAL AND SOUTHERN PLAINS. SKIES HAVE
BEEN SLOW TO CLOUD OVER THIS AFTERNOON DUE TO GOOD HEAT OF THE DAY
MIXING. IF SKIES ARENT ALREADY CLOUDY BY NIGHTFALL...THEY SHOULD
QUICKLY CLOUD OVER. KLZK 88D SHOWS SOME LIGHT SHOWERS OVER CENTRAL
ARKANSAS MOVING EASTWARD. THE REFLECTIVITES ARE VERY LIGHT AND
PROBABLY NOT MEASURABLE HOWEVER STILL WARRANT A SLIGHT CHANCE FOR
THIS EVENING OVER OUR AREA AS THEY MOVE EASTWARD.

THE MORE SIGNIFICANT WEATHER WILL BE LATER TONIGHT. A LINE OF
THUNDERSTORMS HAVE DEVELOPED OVER OKLAHOMA THIS AFTERNOON ALONG THE
DRY LINE. THESE THUNDERSTORMS ARE EXPECTED TO MOVE EASTWARD THIS
EVENING THROUGH WESTERN AND CENTRAL ARKANSAS AS A SHORTWAVE
ASSOCIATED WITH THE LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM ADVANCES TOWARDS THE REGION.
SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS SHOULD ARRIVE INTO THE FORECAST AREA
ARRIVE AFTER MIDNIGHT. THE BETTER INSTABILITY IS WELL WEST OF THE
REGION. ALSO WITH THE STORMS ARRIVING AFTER MIDNIGHT...DIURNAL
INSTABILITY WILL BE AT A MINIMUM AS WELL. SO THE STORMS SHOULD
WEAKEN AS THEY MOVE ACROSS ARKANSAS AND EXPECT THE LINE TO BECOME
MORE BROKEN IN COVERAGE ACROSS THE AREA. THERE IS A SLIGHT RISK FOR
AREAS WEST OF A LINE FROM JONESBORO TO MEMPHIS TO TUPELO. THE SLIGHT
RISK AREA OVER THE MIDSOUTH IS DUE TO TIMING UNCERTAINTIES IN TERMS
OF WHEN THE LINE WILL BEGIN TO WEAKEN.

BOTH ETA AND GFS HAVE THE TRACK OF THE LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM FURTHER
SOUTH THAN PREVIOUS RUNS. THE EXPECTED TRACK WILL BRING IT OVER THE
MIDSOUTH REGION AND THE MODELS ARE SHOWING MAINLY CLOUDY CONDITIONS
THROUGHOUT THE DAY ON WEDNESDAY. SINCE THE AREA WILL NOT BE IN AS
MUCH OF THE WARM SECTOR AS PREVIOUSLY EXPECTED AND CLOUD COVER WILL
BE A FACTOR...THE SEVERE THREAT MAY BE SOMEWHAT LOWER THAN
PREVIOUSLY THOUGHT. HOWEVER...IF SOME AREAS DO HAPPEN TO GET
SUNSHINE THEN SEVERE POTENTIAL BECOMES MUCH MORE OF A CONCERN WITH
LARGE HAIL/DAMAGING WINDS BEING THE MAIN THREAT.

THE SYSTEM LOOKS LIKE IT WILL BE VERY SLOW TO EXIT THE REGION. THIS
WILL KEEP THE THREAT FOR RAIN IN THROUGH FRIDAY MORNING WHEN THE
SYSTEM WILL HAVE MOVED OFF INTO THE CAROLINAS. HIGH PRESSURE WILL
SETTLE IN FOR THE FIRST HALF OF THE WEAKEN. THEN ANOTHER SYSTEM
SIMILAR TO THE CURRENT SYSTEM IS EXPECTED TO ARRIVE FOR EARLY NEXT
WEEK.

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.
&&

$$

SETTLE IN FOR THE FIRST HALF OF THE WEAKEN. THEN ANOTHER SYSTEM 
SIMILAR TO THE CURRENT SYSTEM IS EXPECTED TO ARRIVE FOR EARLY NEXT 
WEEK.

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.

NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
1039 AM CDT TUE APR 5 2005

.DISCUSSION...

A LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM IS SITUATED OVER THE CENTRAL PLAINS. SOUTHERLY 
FLOW AHEAD OF THE SYSTEM IS BRINGING MOIST LOW LEVEL AIR INTO THE 
REGION. SFC DEW POINTS IN THE 50S THIS MORNING WILL BE APPROACHING 
BY LATE AFTERNOON. A DECK OF LOW STRATUS ASSOCIATED WITH THE LOW 
LEVEL MOISTURE IS OVER WESTERN ARKANSAS. IT HAS BEEN STEADILY MOVING 
EASTWARD BUT LAST COUPLE OF SATELLITE IMAGES HAVE SUGGESTED SOME 
BREAKS TRYING TO DEVELOP. BOTH LZK AND JAN SOUNDINGS THIS MORNING 
SHOW A STRONG CAP IN PLACE AROUND 800MB. THE RUC SEEMS TO HAVE THE 
BEST HANDLE ON THIS CAP AND ALTHOUGH IT SHOWS IT LIFTING...IT DOES 
NOT BREAK. SO DO NOT EXPECT THUNDERSTORM ACTIVITY TODAY. A LONE 
SHOWER IS POSSIBLE WEST OF THE RIVER DUE TO THE INCREASING MOISTURE 
THIS AFTERNOON. 850 THETA E VALUES WILL BE MOST NOTICEABLE ALONG AND 
WEST OF THE MS RIVER. EXPECT AT SOME POINT DURING THE AFTERNOON FOR 
CU TO DEVELOP IN THIS REGION AND BECOME MOSTLY CLOUDY. EAST OF THIS 
AREA...PARTLY CLOUDY CONDITIONS WILL PROBABLY HOLD AND HAVE NUDGED 
TEMPS UP A COUPLE OF DEGREES TO REFLECT THIS.

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 050747
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
300 AM CDT TUE APR 5 2005

.DISCUSSION...

HIGH PRESSURE IS CURRENTLY LOCATED LOCATED OVER THE SOUTHEASTERN 
UNITED STATES THIS MORNING. SOME CIRRUS CLOUDS CONTINUE TO MOVE 
ACROSS THE MIDSOUTH. LATEST SATELLITE IMAGES SHOW SOME LOWER CLOUDS 
DEVELOPING OVER CENTRAL AND WESTERN ARKANSAS OVER THE PAST FEW 
HOURS. EXPECT THESE CLOUDS TO CONTINUE TO DEVELOP DURING THE DAY AND 
SPREAD INTO THE MIDSOUTH BY AFTERNOON. WILL GO WITH BECOMING MOSTLY 
CLOUDY WORDING. EVEN WITH THE CLOUDS...EXPECT HIGH TEMPERATURES TO 
RISE INTO THE MID 70S ACROSS THE CWA. 

A LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM WILL APPROACH THE MIDSOUTH TONIGHT. EXPECT A 
LINE OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS TO DEVELOP OUT AHEAD OF THE LOW 
THIS EVENING. THE LINE SHOULD BEGIN TO MOVE INTO WESTERN AREAS OF 
THE CWA AROUND MIDNIGHT. EXPECT THE LINE TO BE DYING BY THE TIME IT 
REACHES THE CWA. HOWEVER SOME THUNDERSTORMS COULD BE SEVERE WITH 
LARGE HAIL AND DAMAGING WINDS BEING THE PRIMARY THREATS. CAN/T RULE 
OUT AN ISOLATED TORNADO EITHER AS HELICITY VALUES WILL BE AROUND 300 
M2/S2...HOWEVER CAPE VALUES WILL ONLY BE AROUND 500 J/KG. THE 
WESTERN HALF OF THE CWA REMAINS IN A SLIGHT RISK FOR TONIGHT.

EXPECT SOME SCATTERED SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS LINGERING AROUND THE 
AREA WEDNESDAY MORNING. AREA SHOULD THEN SEE A BRIEF BREAK AS THE 
MIDSOUTH MOVES INTO THE DRY SLOT. SOME SUNSHINE COULD OCCUR BY 
AFTERNOON. THIS WILL ONLY HELP THE INSTABILITY INCREASE ACROSS THE 
AREA. EXPECT SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS TO REDEVELOP DURING THE 
AFTERNOON INTO WEDNESDAY NIGHT AS THE COLD FRONT BEGINS TO MOVE INTO 
THE CWA. SOME THUNDERSTORMS COULD BE SEVERE WITH LARGE 
HAIL...DAMAGING WINDS...AND ISOLATED TORNADOES POSSIBLE. THE ENTIRE 
CWA IS IN A SLIGHT RISK FOR WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON INTO WEDNESDAY NIGHT.

SEVERE THREAT MAY CONTINUE INTO THURSDAY AS THE UPPER LOW WILL 
STILL BE LOCATED OVER THE CWA. HOWEVER THE THREAT WILL EVOLVE INTO 
MORE OF A HAIL THREAT BY THIS TIME. LOW WILL PUSH EAST OF THE 
MIDSOUTH BY THURSDAY EVENING. HOWEVER WILL KEEP CHANCES FOR SHOWERS 
IN FORECAST.

BY FRIDAY...HIGH PRESSURE WILL BUILD INTO THE MIDSOUTH AND WILL 
BRING PLEASANT CONDITIONS TO THE AREA THROUGH THE ENTIRE WEEKEND. 
HIGH TEMPERATURES WILL RANGE FROM NEAR 70 TO THE MID 70S DURING THIS 
TIME.

ON MONDAY...ANOTHER LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM WILL BEGIN TO APPROACH THE 
AREA. HOWEVER THE TRACK WILL BE MUCH FURTHER SOUTH. CLOUDS WILL 
INCREASE ACROSS THE ENTIRE CWA DURING THE DAY. EXPECT SOME PRECIP 
WILL ALSO BEGIN TO MOVE INTO THE SOUTHWESTERN PART OF THE CWA ON 
MONDAY.
&&

FXUS64 KMEG 050121
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
821 PM CDT MON APR 4 2005

.UPDATE...
WILL UPDATE TO REMOVE WIND GUSTS FOR THIS EVENING AS WINDS HAVE
DECREASED. OTHERWISE FORECAST IS FINE. SOUTH WINDS WILL CONTINUE 5
TO 15 MPH HELPING TO HOLD TEMPERATURES UP TONIGHT. SATELLITE SHOWS
QUITE A BIT OF HIGH CLOUDINESS ACROSS MUCH OF THE MIDSOUTH WHICH
WILL PERSIST TONIGHT.

.PREV DISCUSSION...
ISSUED 305 PM CDT MON APR 4 2005

HIGH PRESSURE WILL MOVE OFF THE SE U.S. COAST TONIGHT AS A STRONG
UPPER LOW MOVES TOWARD THE SOUTHERN PLAINS. A STRENGTHENING PRESSURE
GRADIENT WILL KEEP SOUTHERLY WINDS IN THE 10 TO 15 MPH RANGE
OVERNIGHT WITH LOW TEMPS FALLING ONLY TO THE LOWER AND MID 50S. THE
UPPER LOW WL TRACK ALONG THE KS/OK BORDER ON TUE. EXPECT GUSTY
SOUTHERLY WINDS OF 20 TO 25 MPH BY AFTN WITH A MIX OF SUN AND
CLOUDS. EXPECT ANOTHER MILD DAY WITH TEMPS IN THE MID 70S. SFC
DEWPOINTS WL CLIMB TO THE 60 DEGREE MARK ACRS THE DELTA BY LATE IN
THE DAY.

EXPECT A LINE OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS TO DEVELOP TUE EVENING
ALONG THE AR/OK BORDER AHEAD OF THE CDFNT PUSHING INTO THE ARKLATEX.
THIS LINE WL MOVE ACRS AR OVERNIGHT TO NEAR THE MS RIVER BY 12Z AND
TN RIVER BY NOON WED. THE SHEAR IS IMPRESSIVE ACRS THE REGION BUT
THE INSTABILITY IS LACKING...PARTLY DUE TO TIME OF DAY. AS A RESULT
THE LINE WILL PROBABLY BE WEAKENING AS IT MOVES ACROSS THE REGION.
THOUGH THE SEVERE THREAT APPEARS LIMITED WITH THIS LINE THERE IS A
55 KT 500 MB JET NOSING INTO THE AREA BY 12Z WED SO A FEW SEVERE
STORMS WITH DAMAGING WINDS ARE POSSIBLE.

THE NEXT SEVERE THREAT WL OCCUR DURING WED AFTN AS THE UPPER
LOW PUSHES INTO AR AND THE SFC CDFNT PUSHES INTO THE MID SOUTH. BY
AFTN STEEPER LAPSE RATES MOVE INTO THE AREA. DRY AIR PUNCHES IN FROM
THE SW AND SOME SUNSHINE MAY BE POSSIBLE. AS A RESULT SBCAPES SHOULD
CLIMB TO 1000 TO 1500 J/KG RANGE AND REDEVELOPMENT WL OCCUR ACRS E
AR DURING THE EARLY AFTN SHIFTING EAST TO THE MS RIVER BY LATE AFTN
AND ACRS W TN AND NE MS DURING THE EARLY EVENING. THERE IS SOME
DECENT VEERING IN THE LOW LEVELS WITH HELICITY OVER 300 M2/S2 ACROSS
MUCH OF THE AREA. THE MAIN THREAT WILL BE LARGE HAIL THOUGH AN
ISOLATED TORNADO CANNOT BE RULED OUT. AS FRONT MOVES EAST AND THE
SUN SETS THE SEVERE THREAT WL DIMINISH IN THE EVENING.

THE UPPER LOW WL TRACK EAST TO THE MO BOOTHEEL BY 12Z THU AND THEN
TO EAST TN BY 12Z FRI. WL LEAVE POPS ACRS THE AREA WED NIGHT THRU
THU NIGHT...HIGHER VALUES TOWARD THE TN RIVER...LOWER TOWARD THE SW
ACRS NW MS...WITH CLOUDY SKIES AND COOL TEMPS.

BY FRI...UPPER LOW LOSES INFLUENCE ACRS THE REGION WITH HIGH
PRESSURE BUILDING ACRS THE MID SOUTH. THIS DRY PATTERN SHOULD
CONTINUE THROUGH THE WEEKEND BEFORE THE NEXT SYSTEM THREATENS EARLY
NEXT WEEK.

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...

LOW. WINDS WILL REALLY INCREASE TUESDAY AHEAD OF THE SURFACE LOW
AND FRONT IN THE PLAINS. ENOUGH MOISTURE WILL SURGE NORTH TO

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 032045
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
345 PM CDT SUN APR 3 2005

.DISCUSSION...

HIGH PRESSURE IN CONTROL OF THE MIDSOUTH WEATHER THIS AFTERNOON.
THIS HAS KEPT SKIES CLEAR AND ALLOWED AFTERNOON TEMPERATURES TO
REBOUND INTO THE LOW TO MID 70S AREAWIDE. THIS HIGH PRESSURE WILL
SLIDE SLOWLY EAST OVER THE NEXT COUPLE OF DAYS AS UPPER LEVEL
RIDGING BUILDS THROUGH TUESDAY. THIS WILL KEEP DRY WEATHER AND WARM
TEMPERATURES IN PLACE FOR THE FIRST PART OF THE WEEK.

THE NEXT UPPER LEVEL SHORTWAVE TO AFFECT THE MIDSOUTH WEATHER IS
POSITIONED OFF OF THE COAST OF THE PACIFIC NORTHWEST THIS AFTERNOON.
THIS SHORTWAVE IS PROGGED TO DIG SOUTHEAST ACROSS THE INTERMOUNTAIN
WEST AND INTO THE CENTRAL PLAINS STATES BY MID WEEK. AS THIS
SHORTWAVE DIGS IT WILL CUT OFF FROM THE MAIN FLOW...SLOW DOWN...AND
CLOSE OFF INTO A DEEPENING UPPER LEVEL LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM BY TUESDAY
AFTERNOON IN THE CENTRAL PLAINS. ALSO...BY TUESDAY AFTERNOON A
100 KT UPPER LEVEL JET AND 70 KT MID LEVEL JET WILL EJECT OUT OF THE
BASE OF THE UPPER LEVEL TROUGH AS IT CONTINUES TO MOVE EAST TOWARDS
THE AREA. THIS WILL HELP TO INCREASE LARGE SCALE ASCENT AND WIND
SHEAR OVER THE MIDSOUTH LATE TUESDAY NIGHT/WEDNESDAY MORNING. IT
WILL ALSO ASSIST IN DEVELOPING A SURFACE LOW OVER KANSAS TUESDAY...
WHICH WILL MOVE NORTHEAST ACROSS THE PLAINS STATES WITH A COLD
FRONT EXTENDING SOUTHEAST OF THE LOW...MOVING ACROSS THE MIDSOUTH ON
WEDNESDAY.

LOW LEVEL MOISTURE SHOULD ALSO INCREASE JUST AHEAD OF THE SURFACE
BOUNDARY...AS A STRENGTHENING LOW LEVEL JET ADVECTS UPPER 50
DEWPOINTS INTO THE AREA BY TUESDAY AFTERNOON. EXPECT A LINE OF
SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS TO DEVELOP AHEAD OF THE FRONT TUESDAY
NIGHT OVER THE EASTERN PLAINS STATES WITH A LINEAR CONVECTIVE LINE
BEING THE MOST FAVORABLE CONVECTIVE MODE. THIS LINE OF STORMS IS
EXPECTED TO MOVE EAST INTO THE MIDSOUTH BY WEDNESDAY MORNING. SHEAR
PROFILES WILL BE SUFFICIENT TO SUPPORT A FEW THUNDERSTORMS BECOMING
SEVERE...BUT IT APPEARS THAT LOW LEVEL FRONTAL CONVERGENCE WILL
BE WEAKENING AND INSTABILITY MAY BE AT A DIURNAL MINIMUM WHEN THE
LINE OF THUNDERSTORMS MOVES ACROSS THE MISSISSIPPI RIVER AROUND
SUNRISE WEDNESDAY. SOME REINTENSIFICATION MAY OCCUR AS THE LINE
CONTINUES EAST THROUGH EASTERN SECTIONS BY AFTERNOON AS SOME DAYTIME
HEATING ENHANCES INSTABILITY OVER THESE AREAS.

BY WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON THE LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM APPEARS TO BECOME
OCCLUDED. THE UPPER LEVEL LOW WILL MOVE SLOWLY ACROSS THE AREA
WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND THURSDAY. AS COLDER MID LEVEL TEMPERATURES
ADVECT OVER THE AREA...EXPECT MID LEVEL LAPSE RATES TO STEEPEN AND
SHOWERS AND ISOLATED THUNDERSTORMS TO CONTINUE INTO THE DAY
THURSDAY. COOLER TEMPERATURES CAN ALSO BE EXPECTED FOR THURSDAY AND
FRIDAY.

HIGH PRESSURE WILL BUILD BACK IN FOR THE WEEKEND WITH DRIER WEATHER
AND WARMING TEMPERATURES.

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 030211
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
811 PM CST SAT APR 2 2005

.UPDATE...
SATELLITE SHOWS CLEAR SKIES COVERING MUCH OF THE CENTRAL AND
SOUTHERN UNITED STATES INCLUDING THE MIDSOUTH THIS EVENING. 00Z LZK
SOUNDING IS VERY DRY WITH A PRECIPITABLE WATER VALUE OF ONLY 0.29
INCH. INCREASING HIGH PRESSURE ALOFT WILL SPREAD TOWARD THE MIDSOUTH
FROM THE WEST OVERNIGHT WHILE A SURFACE HIGH MOVES TOWARD THE CENTRAL
GULF COAST. WINDS WILL GRADUALLY TURN MORE TO THE SOUTHWEST BY LATE
TONIGHT...ALTHOUGH LIGHT...SETTING THE STAGE FOR A NICE WARMUP
SUNDAY WITH SUNNY SKIES. WILL UPDATE THE FORECAST FOR TONIGHT TO
MAKE SOME ADJUSTMENTS TO THE WINDS SINCE THEY HAVE DIMINISHED.
FORECAST LOWS LOOK OK.

.PREV DISCUSSION...
ISSUED 349 PM CST SAT APR 2 2005

DEEP UPPER LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM OVER THE MID ATLANTIC STATES THIS
AFTERNOON WILL CONTINUE TO MOVE EAST. AS THIS OCCURS...UPPER LEVEL
HEIGHTS WILL CONTINUE TO RISE AS UPPER RIDGING BUILDS OVER THE
MIDSOUTH. WEAK UPPER LEVEL RIDGING WILL REMAIN IN PLACE OVER THE
AREA THROUGH NEXT TUESDAY. AT THE SURFACE...HIGH PRESSURE NOW
CENTERED OVER EAST TEXAS WILL CONTINUE TO SLIDE EAST AND BE LOCATED
OVER THE SOUTHEASTERN U.S. FOR THE SECOND HALF OF THE WEEKEND AND
THE FIRST PART OF NEXT WEEK. AS THE SURFACE HIGH SLIDES EAST...LOW
LEVEL WIND FLOW WILL RETURN BACK TO A INCREASINGLY SOUTHERLY
DIRECTION. LOW LEVEL WARM ADVECTION WILL BEGIN AGAIN SUNDAY MORNING
AND COMBINED WITH FULL SUN SHOULD ALLOW TEMPERATURES TO WARM ABOUT
10 DEGREES ABOVE SATURDAY HIGHS. SOUTHERLY FLOW WILL CONTINUE
SUNDAY THROUGH MID WEEK. WITH SEVERAL DAYS OF GOOD SOUTHERLY FLOW
FROM THE GULF OF MEXICO...EXPECT A GRADUAL INCREASE IN HUMIDITY
LEVELS AND LOW LEVEL MOISTURE THROUGH THE BEGINNING OF NEXT WEEK. IN
ADDITION...WITH HIGH PRESSURE IN PLACE...DRY CONDITIONS CAN BE
EXPECTED THROUGH TUESDAY.

THE NEXT UPPER LEVEL SHORTWAVE TROUGH ANALYZED OFF THE NORTHWEST
U.S. COAST IS FORECAST TO DIG ACROSS THE CENTRAL PLAINS STATES AND
BEGIN TO CUT OFF AS AN DEEP UPPER LEVEL LOW BY WEDNESDAY AS IT
MOVES ACROSS THE MIDDLE MISSISSIPPI VALLEY. THIS UPPER SYSTEM WILL
HELP TO INDUCE A SURFACE LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM OVER THE CENTRAL
PLAINS STATES WHICH SHOULD DRAG A COLD FRONT ACROSS THE MIDSOUTH BY
MID WEEK. SEVERAL OF THE FORECAST MODELS HANDLE THE TIMING OF THIS
SYSTEM A BIT DIFFERENTLY...WITH THE 12Z GFS/CANADIAN FASTER WITH THE
TIMING OF THE FRONT (TUESDAY NIGHT-WEDNESDAY TIME PERIOD) WITH THE
12Z ETA/EUROPEAN/UKMET BETWEEN 12-24 HOURS SLOWER (WEDNESDAY NIGHT-
THURSDAY MORNING). AT THIS TIME...STILL FAVOR THE SLOWER SOLUTIONS
AND EXPECT FRONTAL PASSAGE WEDNESDAY EVENING. THINK THAT WITH THE
UPPER TROUGH CUTTING OFF INTO AN UPPER LEVEL LOW PRESSURE...THIS
TREND FAVORS A SLOWER SYSTEM PROGRESSION.

AS THIS FRONT MOVES ACROSS THE AREA...EXPECT SHOWERS AND
THUNDERSTORMS TO DEVELOP IN ADVANCE OF THE FRONT...PRIMARILY ON
WEDNESDAY INTO WEDNESDAY NIGHT. SUFFICIENT LOW LEVEL MOISTURE RETURN
IS EXPECTED (IE. THREE DAYS PRIOR WITH SOUTHERLY FLOW FROM THE GULF
OF MEXICO) AND WITH STRENGTHENING WIND FIELDS...THE ATMOSPHERE SHOULD
BECOME INCREASINGLY UNSTABLE AND SUPPORTIVE OF POSSIBLE SEVERE
WEATHER. WITH THE STORM SYSTEM STILL SEVERAL DAYS OUT...THERE WILL
BE PLENTY OF TIME TO REFINE STORM INTENSITY ISSUES.

AFTER THE FRONT MOVES THROUGH...LINGERING SHOWERS AND COOLER
TEMPERATURES CAN BE EXPECTED AS THE TRAILING UPPER LOW MOVES ACROSS
THE MIDSOUTH. THIS UPPER LOW WILL MOVE EAST OF THE REGION BY FRIDAY
WITH DRY WEATHER AND WARMING TEMPERATURES EXPECTED INTO NEXT
WEEKEND.

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.

AND COMBINED WITH FULL SUN SHOULD ALLOW TEMPERATURES TO WARM ABOUT
10 DEGREES ABOVE SATURDAY HIGHS. SOUTHERLY FLOW WILL CONTINUE
SUNDAY THROUGH MID WEEK. WITH SEVERAL DAYS OF GOOD SOUTHERLY FLOW
FROM THE GULF OF MEXICO...EXPECT A GRADUAL INCREASE IN HUMIDITY
LEVELS AND LOW LEVEL MOISTURE THROUGH THE BEGINNING OF NEXT WEEK. IN
ADDITION...WITH HIGH PRESSURE IN PLACE...DRY CONDITIONS CAN BE
EXPECTED THROUGH TUESDAY.

THE NEXT UPPER LEVEL SHORTWAVE TROUGH ANALYZED OFF THE NORTHWEST
U.S. COAST IS FORECAST TO DIG ACROSS THE CENTRAL PLAINS STATES AND
BEGIN TO CUT OFF AS A DEEP UPPER LEVEL LOW BY WEDNESDAY AS IT
MOVES ACROSS THE MIDDLE MISSISSIPPI VALLEY. THIS UPPER SYSTEM WILL
HELP TO INDUCE A SURFACE LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM OVER THE CENTRAL
PLAINS STATES WHICH SHOULD DRAG A COLD FRONT ACROSS THE MIDSOUTH BY
MID WEEK. SEVERAL OF THE FORECAST MODELS HANDLE THE TIMING OF THIS
SYSTEM A BIT DIFFERENTLY...WITH THE 12Z GFS/CANADIAN FASTER WITH THE
TIMING OF THE FRONT (TUESDAY NIGHT-WEDNESDAY MORNING TIME PERIOD)
WITH THE 12Z ETA/EUROPEAN/UKMET BETWEEN 12-24 HOURS SLOWER (WEDNESDAY
EVENING-THURSDAY MORNING). AT THIS TIME...STILL FAVOR THE SLOWER
SOLUTIONS AND EXPECT FRONTAL PASSAGE WEDNESDAY EVENING. THINK THAT
WITH THE UPPER TROUGH CUTTING OFF INTO AN UPPER LEVEL LOW PRESSURE...
THIS TREND FAVORS A SLOWER SYSTEM PROGRESSION.

AS THIS FRONT MOVES ACROSS THE AREA...EXPECT SHOWERS AND
THUNDERSTORMS TO DEVELOP IN ADVANCE OF THE FRONT...PRIMARILY ON
WEDNESDAY INTO WEDNESDAY NIGHT. SUFFICIENT LOW LEVEL MOISTURE RETURN
IS EXPECTED (IE. THREE DAYS PRIOR WITH SOUTHERLY FLOW FROM THE GULF
OF MEXICO) AND WITH STRENGTHENING WIND FIELDS...THE ATMOSPHERE SHOULD
BECOME INCREASINGLY UNSTABLE AND SUPPORTIVE OF POSSIBLE SEVERE
WEATHER. WITH THE STORM SYSTEM STILL SEVERAL DAYS OUT...THERE WILL
BE PLENTY OF TIME TO REFINE STORM INTENSITY ISSUES.

AFTER THE FRONT MOVES THROUGH...LINGERING SHOWERS AND COOLER
TEMPERATURES CAN BE EXPECTED AS THE TRAILING UPPER LOW MOVES ACROSS
THE MIDSOUTH. THIS UPPER LOW WILL MOVE EAST OF THE REGION BY FRIDAY
WITH DRY WEATHER AND WARMING TEMPERATURES EXPECTED FOR FRIDAY INTO
NEXT WEEKEND.

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.
&&

JLH

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 021609
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
1009 AM CST SAT APR 2 2005

.DISCUSSION...
LARGE AND DEEP UPPER LEVEL LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM LOCATED OVER EAST
TENNESSEE THIS MORNING WILL CONTINUE TO MOVE EAST. HIGH PRESSURE HAS
SETTLED OVER MOST OF THE MID SOUTH THIS MORNING AND THIS WILL ALLOW
FOR A MOSTLY SUNNY DAY OVER MOST AREAS. THE ONLY EXCEPTION WILL BE
OVER FAR EASTERN SECTIONS...WHERE A FEW CLOUDS MAY PERSIST INTO
EARLY THIS AFTERNOON. TEMPERATURES WILL REMAIN COOL TODAY UNDER
NORTHWEST FLOW AT ALL LEVELS AND CONTINUED WEAK LOW LEVEL COLD AIR
ADVECTION. LOOKING AT MORNING SOUNDINGS...WE SHOULD MIX UP TO ABOUT
5 KFT. THIS COMBINED WITH FULL SUN WILL ALLOW HIGH TEMPERATURES TO
MAX OUT AROUND 60 DEGREES AROUND THE MEMPHIS AREA...WITH UPPER 50S
NORTHEAST SECTIONS AND LOW 60S OVER SOUTHWEST AREAS. THIS MIXING WILL
ALSO ALLOW FOR GUSTY WINDS OVER THE AREA TODAY...ESPECIALLY OVER
EASTERN AREAS WHERE THE PRESSURE GRADIENT WILL REMAIN TIGHTER. WINDS
WILL GRADUALLY DIMINISH IN INTENSITY FROM WEST TO EAST LATER THIS
AFTERNOON...AS THE UPPER LOW PULLS FURTHER AWAY. LOOKED AT CRITERIA
FOR WIND ADVISORY...BUT APPEARS WINDS WILL STAY JUST BELOW THRESHOLD
CRITERIA...SO NOT ANTICIPATING AN ADVISORY AT THIS TIME.

OTHERWISE...ALL OTHER FORECAST PARAMETERS LOOK GOOD. WILL SEND
UPDATED GRIDS AND ZONES TO REMOVE MORNING WORDING. UPDATES WILL BE
SENT SHORTLY.
&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
230 AM CST SAT APR 2 2005

UPPER TROUGH IS NOW OVER IL WHILE A SURFACE RIDGE IS OVER THE
PLAINS. EXPECT THE RIDGE TO MOVE INTO ARKANSAS BY THIS EVENING.
THESE FEATURES WILL PROVIDE THE MIDSOUTH WITH A MILD DAY AND LOTS
OF SUNSHINE.

THE RIDGE WILL MOVE ON INTO MIDDLE TENNESSEE AND ALABAMA BY
SUNDAY EVENING. LOOK FOR SUNDAY TO BE WARM AND MOSTLY SUNNY.

WEATHER FEATURES WILL CONTINUE TO MOVE QUICKLY EAST AND LET
ANOTHER RAIN MAKING FRONT INTO THE MIDSOUTH BY WEDNESDAY. CHANCES
ARE HIGH FOR SIGNIFICANT RAIN WEDNESDAY AND RAIN IS EXPECTED
AFTER THE FRONT PASSES INTO THURSDAY EVENING. WEATHER PATTERNS
HINT THAT THERE COULD BE SOME STRONG STORMS WITH THIS FRONT NEXT
WEEK.

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 020231
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
831 PM CST FRI APR 1 2005

MOST OF THE RAIN HAS MOVED WELL EAST OF THE MIDSOUTH THIS EVENING.
ECHOES SHOWING UP ON RADAR ARE MID-LEVEL CLOUDS...PERHAPS WITH
A SPRINKLE OR TWO. H5 LOW OVER THE UPPER MIDWEST IS FORECAST TO
DIG SOUTHEAST TOWARD MIDDLE TN BY 12Z SAT. WILL LEAVE IN A 20 PERCENT
CHANCE OF LIGHT RAIN OVERNIGHT ALONG AND NORTHEAST OF A TIPTONVILLE
TO JACKSON TO SAVANNAH TO ACCOUNT FOR THIS DIGGING LOW. THINK ANY
CHANCE OF RAIN WILL BE LESS THAN 20 PERCENT ELSEWHERE. OTHERWISE
DRIER AIR...SURFACE AND ALOFT...WILL BE SPREADING INTO THE MIDSOUTH.
SKIES WILL BECOME MOSTLY CLEAR TO PARTLY CLOUDY ACROSS THE AREA
OVERNIGHT. FORECAST LOWS LOOK FINE WITH WINDS HELPING TO HOLD
TEMPERATURES UP SOMEWHAT.

.PREV DISCUSSION...
ISSUED 330 PM CST FRI APR 1 2005

AFTER AN ACTIVE MIDDLE OF THE DAY ACROSS PORTIONS OF NORTHEAST
MISSISSIPPI...THE WEATHER IS FINALLY STARTING TO QUIET DOWN.
LATEST SFC ANALYSIS DEPICTS THE SURFACE LOW NEAR HUNTSVILLE AS IT
CONTINUES ITS NORTHEASTWARD TREK. ALL OF THE MIDSOUTH IS NOW UNDER
A NW SFC FLOW ON THE BACK SIDE OF THE LOW...ALLOWING LOWER
DEWPOINTS TO ENTER THE REGION. ALOFT...500MB LOW NOW OVER
NORTHWEST ARKANSAS MOVING EAST.

FOR TONIGHT...BACK EDGE OF THE MAIN AREA OF PRECIP EXITING THE
AREA AS THE SFC LOW MOVES FURTHER EAST. WILL LEAVE SMALL POPS IN
THE FORECAST FOR TONIGHT TO ACCOUNT FOR EXITING PRECIP AND ANY
ISOLATED SHOWERS THE COLD CORE PRODUCES. ANYTHING THAT FALLS WILL
BE VERY LIGHT. CLOUDS WILL BEGIN TO CLEAR IN EARNEST AFTER 06Z.
OVERNIGHT LOWS WILL BE NOTICEABLY COLDER HOWEVER AS STRONG 850MB
COLD AIR ADVECTION USHERS IN 850 TEMPS OF 0 TO -2. THIS WILL HELP
LOWS TO DROP LOWS INTO THE UPPER 30S ACROSS MOST OF THE CWA.

THE SATURDAY THROUGH MONDAY TIME FRAME WILL BE VERY TRANQUIL AS AN
UPPER RIDGE BUILDS OVER THE MIDSOUTH. TEMPERATURES WILL MODERATE A
FEW DEGREES EACH DAY AS WARM AIR ADVECTION INCREASES AND SOUTHERLY
WINDS SETUP WITH THE SFC HIGH MOVING OFF TO THE EAST. SKIES WILL
BE ABUNDANT WITH SUNSHINE.

MODELS IN AGREEMENT THAT ANOTHER POTENT SHORTWAVE WILL AFFECT THE
REGION SOMETIME LATE TUESDAY NIGHT INTO WEDNESDAY. AS ALWAYS THIS
FAR OUT...THERE ARE QUESTIONS REGARDING THE TIMING. THE GFS IS THE
QUICKEST OF THE MODELS...BRINGING A COLD FRONT PASSAGE BY 12Z
WEDNESDAY. THE CANADIAN/UKMET/EURO BRING THE FRONT THROUGH MID TO
LATE AFTERNOON ON WEDNESDAY. GIVEN THAT ALL OF THE MODELS BEGIN TO
CLOSE THE SHORTWAVE OFF AS AN UPPER LOW WOULD GIVE MORE WEIGHT TO
THE SLOWER MODEL SOLUTION...THUS THE FORECAST LEANS MORE TOWARDS
FRONTAL PASSAGE DURING THE DAY ON WEDNESDAY. DUE TO DECENT MODEL
AGREEMENT...HAVE LIKELY POPS GOING FOR WEDNESDAY. WILL HAVE TO
WATCH FOR THE POTENTIAL OF STRONG STORMS. THE ATMOSPHERE WILL HAVE
AT LEAST TWO DAYS OF RETURN FLOW AHEAD OF THE SYSTEM TO ALLOW
DEWPOINTS TO RECOVER. HWO ALREADY HAD A MENTION OF A FEW STRONG
STORMS AND WILL LEAVE AS IS.

THINGS SHOULD CLEAR OUT SOMETIME ON THURSDAY AS UPPER RIDGE BUILDS
BACK IN. TEMPERATURES NEAR SEASONAL LEVELS FOR FRIDAY.

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
1023 AM CST FRI APR 1 2005

.UPDATE...

16Z ANALYSIS PLACES A BROAD SURFACE LOW OVER CENTRAL MISSISSIPPI
WITH A WARM FRONT LOCATED BETWEEN TUPELO AND COLUMBUS MISSISSIPPI.
IN THE UPPER LEVELS...500MB LOW OVER NORTHWEST ARKANSAS CONTINUES
TO PROGRESS EASTWARD TOWARD THE MIDSOUTH.

PLENTY OF LIFT AHEAD OF THE APPROACHING COLD CORE LOW. KNQA 88-D
HAS RECENTLY SHOWED A MARKED INCREASE IN PRECIPITATION. FEEL THIS
TREND WILL CONTINUE AS STEEPER LAPSE RATES ASSOCIATED WITH THE LOW
OVERSPREAD THE MIDSOUTH. THEREFORE...RAISED POPS EVERYWHERE...90S
IN THE NORTHWEST TO 60S IN THE SOUTHEAST. ALSO INCLUDED A MENTION
OF THUNDER EVERYWHERE DUE TO THE GREATER THAN 7.0 CELSIUS MID
LEVEL LAPSE RATES. ALSO FEEL DEVELOPMENT WILL OCCUR NEAR THE WARM
FRONT DOWN IN MONROE COUNTY WHERE DEWPOINTS ARE IN THE LOWER 60S.

PRECIPITATION WILL BEGIN TO END THIS EVENING AS THE LOW TRACKS
FURTHER EAST. UPDATE TO GRIDS AND ZONE PACKAGE ALREADY SENT.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
415 AM CST FRI APR 1 2005

AN UPPER LEVEL TROUGH OVER OKLAHOMA WILL MOVE EAST OVER THE
MIDSOUTH TODAY AND TONIGHT. THE SURFACE LOW ASSOCIATED WITH THE
UPPER TROUGH IS IN SOUTHEAST LOUISIANA ATTM. IT SHOULD MOVE
NORTHEAST INTO VIRGINIA BY SATURDAY MORNING. THUNDERSTORMS WILL
BE CONFINED TO THE SOUTHEAST PART OF THE CWFA DUE TO THE PATH OF
THE LOW. RAIN WAS OCCURRING BEFORE DAYBREAK AND ANOTHER BATCH OF
RAIN WAS IN EASTERN OKLAHOMA AND ARKANSAS. THERE COULD BE A LULL
IN ACTIVITY BEFORE THE RAIN ASSOCIATED WITH THE UPPER TROUGH
COMES IN. RAINFALL BY SATURDAY MORNING COULD AMOUNT TO A HALF
INCH TO AN INCH.

LOTS OF CLOUDS AND NORTHERLY WINDS WILL KEEP IT COOL TODAY.

IT LOOKS LIKE THE WEEKEND WILL BE DRY WITH GRADUAL WARMING.

A STRONG FRONT COULD SWEEP THROUGH TOWARD THE MIDDLE OF NEXT
WEEK. A SIGNIFICANT AMOUNT OF RAIN WILL ACCOMPANY THE FRONT.

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 010428
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
1030 PM CST THU MAR 31 2005

.UPDATE...
STRONG UPPER LEVEL SYSTEM MOVING TOWARD THE ARKLATEX THIS EVENING. 
CONVECTION CONTINUING TO DEVELOPS ACRS NRN LA/SRN MS THIS EVENING. 
THIS ACTIVITY WL PUSH INTO PHILLIPS COUNTY AND CLARKSDALE MS REGION 
OF THE CWA BY 08Z AND THEN SPREAD ACRS NRN MS AND THE MEMPHIS METRO 
AREA BY 10Z...MKL/JBR AROUND 12Z. 00Z MODELS MOVE THE SFC LOW TRACK 
A LITTLE MORE TO THE NW. LOW WL PROBABLY TRACK VERY CLOSE TO THE SE 
CORNER OF THE CWA. AS A RESULT FEEL THE SEVERE THREAT ACRS NRN MS 
REMAINS SMALL. THERE WL BE SOME ELEVATED TSTMS ACRS NRN MS BUT THEY 
SHOULD REMAIN BELOW SEVERE LIMITS. RAISED THE POPS ACRS SW PART OF 
THE CWA AND LOWERED THEM ACRS THE NE. RAISED TEMPS A COUPLE OF 
DEGREES OTRW EVERYTHING ELSE OK.

.PREV DISCUSSION ISSUED AT 353 PM...
LATEST REGIONAL SURFACE ANALYSIS INDICATING A STATIONARY FRONT
STRETCHED FROM EAST TENNESSEE SOUTHWESTWARD ACROSS CENTRAL ALABAMA
AND ACROSS SOUTHERN MISSISSIPPI...LOUISIANA...AND BACK INTO
SOUTHEAST TEXAS. TO THE NORTH OF THIS BOUNDARY...DEWPOINTS REMAINED
LOW...RANGING FROM THE MID 30S TO MID 40S...WITH 60+ DEGREE DEWPOINTS
SOUTH AND EAST OF THE FRONT. THE MID SOUTH REMAINS WELL TO THE NORTH
OF THE FRONT...WITH HIGH PRESSURE PROVIDING MOSTLY SUNNY SKIES...LOW
DEWPOINTS...AND TEMPERATURES IN THE 70S.

AN UPPER LEVEL LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM LOCATED OVER THE TEXAS PANHANDLE
THIS AFTERNOON CONTINUES TO PROGRESS TOWARDS THE SOUTHEAST. A
STRONG 110 KT UPPER LEVEL JET STREAK AND STRONG MID LEVEL JET WILL
EJECT OUT OF THE BASE OF THE UPPER TROUGH TONIGHT. AS THIS OCCURS...
IT WILL INDUCE A SURFACE LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM OVER THE SOUTHERN
MISSISSIPPI VALLEY AND HELP TO INCREASE LARGE SCALE ASCENT OVER
THE MID SOUTH LATER TONIGHT AS THE AREA BECOMES POSITIONED WITHIN
THE RIGHT ENTRANCE REGION OF THE UPPER JET. ISENTROPIC ASCENT WILL
ALSO INCREASE AHEAD OF THIS WEATHER SYSTEM AND RAIN CHANCES WILL
INCREASE AFTER MIDNIGHT.

SEVERE WEATHER POTENTIAL LOOKS TO REMAIN PRIMARILY TO THE SOUTH AND
EAST OF THE MEMPHIS FORECAST AREA. IT APPEARS THAT MOST OF OUR AREA
WILL REMAIN IN THE COOL SECTOR...AS THE SURFACE LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM
MOVES ACROSS CENTRAL MISSISSIPPI INTO NORTH-CENTRAL ALABAMA. HAVE
FAVORED THE 12Z GFS MODEL TRACK OF THE LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM OVER THE
12Z NAM SOLUTION. SEEMS THAT THE GFS MODEL HAS A BETTER HANDLE ON THE
POSITIONING OF THE BAROCLINIC ZONE AND KEEPING THE BEST LOW LEVEL
MOISTURE ASSOCIATED WITH THE WARM SECTOR TO OUR SOUTH AND EAST. ONLY
CONCERN WILL BE ACROSS EXTREME SOUTHEAST COUNTIES. THE BOUNDARY LIES
BETWEEN BIRMINGHAM AL AND COLUMBUS MS...WITH 60+ DEWPOINTS EAST OVER
CENTRAL ALABAMA. DECENT ELEVATED INSTABILITY MAY BE PRESENT ACROSS
FAR SOUTHEAST AREAS TONIGHT TO PROMOTE DEEP ELEVATED CONVECTION...
WITH A MINIMAL LARGE HAIL THREAT. CONFIDENCE IS FAIRLY LOW THOUGH...
AND THINK CHANCES FOR SEVERE EVEN OVER THESE AREAS IS FAIRLY LOW.

THE LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM WILL MOVE NORTHEAST AND AWAY FROM THE AREA
BY LATER FRIDAY...WITH THE UPPER LEVEL LOW MOVING OVER THE REGION
ON FRIDAY INTO FRIDAY NIGHT. THIS WILL KEEP RAIN CHANCES THROUGH
FRIDAY NIGHT. ALSO...LOW UPPER HEIGHTS...CLOUDS...AND RAIN WILL
KEEP TEMPERATURES BELOW NORMAL FOR FRIDAY.

UPPER RIDGING WILL BUILD OVER THE AREA OVER THE WEEKEND WITH RISING
HEIGHTS...DRY WEATHER...AND WARMING TEMPERATURES. THIS WILL
CONTINUE INTO THE FIRST PART OF NEXT WEEK. THE NEXT SHORTWAVE TROUGH
AND ASSOCIATED COLD FRONT WILL APPROACH BY MID WEEK AND BRING THE
NEXT CHANCES FOR SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS. TEMPERATURES WILL BE
ABOVE NORMAL FOR THE FIRST TO MIDDLE PART OF NEXT WEEK.

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.

JLH/SJM

FXUS64 KMEG 311616
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
1016 AM CST THU MAR 31 2005

.DISCUSSION...
CURRENT 16Z SURFACE OBSERVATIONS SHOWING FRONTAL BOUNDARY THAT
MOVED ACROSS THE MID SOUTH LAST NIGHT IS NOW POSITIONED FROM NORTH-
CENTRAL ALABAMA SOUTHWESTWARD ACROSS SOUTHERN MISSISSIPPI...CENTRAL
LOUISIANA...INTO SOUTHEAST TEXAS. SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE HAS BUILT
OVER THE MID SOUTH FROM THE NORTH AND HAS BROUGHT A MUCH DRIER
AIRMASS INTO THE AREA...AS REFLECTED BY 16Z DEWPOINTS FROM THE
UPPER 30S NORTHWEST TO UPPER 40S SOUTHEAST. IN ADDITION...SKIES HAVE
CLEARED OUT ACROSS THE ENTIRE AREA. WITH THE FRONTAL BOUNDARY
EXPECTED TO REMAIN TO THE SOUTH AND EAST OF THE AREA...HAVE UPDATED
TO REMOVE POPS...AS TRIGGER (FRONTAL BOUNDARY) WONT BE CLOSE ENOUGH
TO INITIATE SHOWERS. ALSO WITH DRIER AIRMASS ADVECTING SOUTHWARD
HAVE UPDATED SKY GRIDS TO REDUCE CLOUD COVER. THERE MAY STILL BE
SOME INCREASE IN HIGH CLOUDS LATER THIS AFTERNOON AS UPPER
SHORTWAVE TROUGH APPROACHES FROM THE WEST AND HIGH LEVEL MOISTURE IS
TRANSPORTED OVER THE REGION IN SOUTHWEST FLOW ALOFT.

AS FOR TEMPERATURES...CURRENT FORECAST APPEARS TO HAVE GOOD HANDLE
ON THINGS...SO NO UPDATES FOR TEMPS PLANNED AT THIS TIME AND NEAR
70 NORTH TO UPPER 70S SOUTH LOOKS GOOD.

ALL OTHER FORECAST PARAMETERS APPEAR ON TRACK. UPDATED GRIDS AND
ZONE FORECAST WILL BE OUT SHORTLY.

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.
&&

$$

JLH





000 
FXUS64 KMEG 311056
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
455 AM CST THU MAR 31 2005

.DISCUSSION...LATEST SURFACE ANALYSIS PLACES COLD FRONT ACROSS 
NORTHWEST ALABAMA AND CENTRAL MISSISSIPPI. SURFACE DEWPOINTS BEHIND 
THE FRONT HAVE DROPPED OFF INTO THE MIDDLE TO UPPER 30S ACROSS THE 
MISSOURI BOOTHEEL...AND SURFACE DEWPOINTS GRADUALLY FALLING INTO THE 
40S ACROSS NORTHERN MISSISSIPPI. INFRARED SATELLITE SHOWS MAINLY A 
FEW SCATTERED MID CLOUDS BEHIND CLEARING LINE WHICH RESIDES ACROSS 
WESTERN TENNESSEE AND NORTHWEST MISSISSIPPI. MAIN FORECAST CONCERNS 
THIS FORECAST PACKAGE IS CONVECTIVE CHANCES TODAY AND TONIGHT.

TODAY...SURFACE COLD FRONT WILL CONTINUE TO MOVE SOUTHEAST TODAY 
BEFORE STALLING OUT THIS AFTERNOON ACROSS CENTRAL MISSISSIPPI THIS 
AFTERNOON. FORECAST AREA SHOULD REMAIN DRY BEHIND THE COLD FRONT AS 
BEST FORCING SHIFTS FURTHER SOUTH IN THE WARM SECTOR. WILL CARRY A 
SLIGHT CHANCE OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS ACROSS A PORTION OF 
NORTHERN MISSISSIPPI...ESPECIALLY THIS AFTERNOON NEAR THE FRONT.

TONIGHT...STATIONARY FRONT ACROSS MISSISSIPPI AND ALABAMA WILL 
MEANDER BACK NORTH AS A SURFACE LOW DEVELOPS ACROSS TEXAS AND MOVES 
TOWARD THE FORECAST AREA ON FRIDAY. EXPECTING SHOWERS AND 
THUNDERSTORMS TO GRADUALLY OVERTAKE THE MID SOUTH...ESPECIALLY 
OVERNIGHT. ANALYSIS OF MODEL SOUNDINGS INDICATES THE NORTHERN 
SECTION OF THE FORECAST AREA MAY TAKE UNTIL AFTER MIDNIGHT TO 
SATURATE THE LOW LEVELS...WITH PRECIPITATION BEFORE THEN AS VIRGA. 
SOME UNCERTAINTY STILL REMAINS WHETHER ANY SIGNIFICANT SEVERE WEATHER 
WILL OCCUR ACROSS A PORTION OF THE SOUTHERN TIER OR TWO OF COUNTIES 
IN THE FORECAST AREA. LATEST NAM RUN HAS WARM FRONT MEANDERING AS 
FAR NORTH AS THE SOUTHERN TIER OR TWO OF COUNTIES WHILE GFS KEEPS 
WARM FRONT PRIMARILY ACROSS CENTRAL AND SOUTHERN MISSISSIPPI. AN MCS 
MAY DEVELOP ACROSS LATER THIS AFTERNOON AND TRACK ALONG THE WARM 
FRONT INTO TONIGHT...WITH HAIL AND DAMAGING WINDS AS THE THREAT. 
OTHERWISE...IF FRONT REMAINS FURTHER TO THE SOUTH...CONVECTION WILL 
REMAIN ELEVATED WITH HAIL AS THE PRIMARY THREAT ACROSS THE AFFECTED 
AREA. DAY SHIFT WILL REANALYZE SEVERE WEATHER POTENTIAL FOR TONIGHT 
AFTER 12Z MODEL RUN COMES IN THIS MORNING. PRECIPITABLE WATER VALUES 
ACROSS NORTHERN MISSISSIPPI WILL REACH 1.5 INCHES TONIGHT AND 
MENTIONED HEAVY RAINFALL ACROSS A PORTION OF NORTHERN MISSISSIPPI.

FRIDAY THROUGH SATURDAY...SURFACE LOW WILL CONTINUE TO MOVE EAST DURING THE 
DAY ON FRIDAY WITH UPPER LEVEL LOW ACROSS NORTHERN ARKANSAS. 
TEMPERATURES WILL BE COOLER AS RAIN WILL CONTINUE THROUGH THE DAY. 
UPPER LEVEL LOW WILL DEPART THE FORECAST AREA OVERNIGHT AND MADE 
MINOR CHANGES TO POPS ACROSS EASTERN THIRD OF AREA. HIGH PRESSURE 
WILL GRADUALLY BUILD BACK IN ON SATURDAY WITH TEMPERATURES IMPROVING 
BY THE END OF THE WEEKEND.

NO CHANGES BEYOND SATURDAY.

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.
&&

AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
1050 PM CST WED MAR 30 2005

.DISCUSSION...04Z SURFACE ANALYSIS PLACES COLD FRONT FROM SOUTHERN 
ILLINOIS TO ALONG THE MISSISSIPPI RIVER ACROSS THE MID SOUTH. BEST 
CHANCES IN SHORT TERM FOR SEVERE WEATHER POTENTIAL WILL MAINLY BE ACROSS 
NORTHERN MISSISSIPPI WHERE DEEPER MOISTURE /60+ SURFACE DEWPOINTS 
AND 1000-1500 J/KG OF MUCAPE RESIDES. WILL ISSUE AN UPDATE BASED 
UPON CURRENT TRENDS. 

UPDATE WILL BE OUT SHORTLY.

CJC

.PREV DISCUSSION...ISSUED 306 PM CST WED MAR 30 2005.

SURFACE LOW OVER CENTRAL IOWA AT 20Z WITH DRY LINE NEAR WEST PLAINS-
LITTLE ROCK-SHREVEPORT LINE...AND COLD FRONT NEAR A JOPLIN-DALLAS
METROPLEX LINE. STARTING TO SEE A LITTLE CONVECTIVE DEVELOPMENT OVER
CENTRAL ARKANSAS...RIGHT ON THE DRY LINE. MORNING LZK...SHV...JAN
SOUNDINGS STRONGLY CAPPED AND 18Z JAN SOUNDING STILL CAPPED. AWAITING
21Z JAN SOUNDING TO SEE IF THINGS HAVE CHANGED. CURRENT FSL ACARS
SOUNDING AT MEMPHIS INTERNATIONAL SHOWS CONVECTIVE TEMPERATURE IS 91
DEGREES. TEMPS IN THE 70S WITH DEWPOINTS UPPER 50S TO LOWER 60S.
&&

.SHORT TERM (THROUGH SATURDAY)...
MAIN WEATHER IN FIRST 48 HOURS OF FORECAST. MODELS ARE A LITTLE MORE
CONSISTENT FOR FIRST 12-18 HOURS OF FORECAST. WIND FIELDS CONDUCIVE
FOR SEVERE WEATHER TONIGHT...QUESTIONS BEING WHETHER CAP WILL BE
BROKEN IN A SIGNIFICANT WAY...AND AREAL COVERAGE. MOISTURE IS
RATHER MEAGER...EXCEPT IN THE BOUNDARY LAYER. TO OVERCOME THE CAP
THIS EVENING...WE WOULD NEED TO SEE SEVERAL DEGREES OF COOLING
AROUND THE 750-850 MB LAYER...AND MODELS NOT REALLY HINTING AT THAT
HAPPENING MUCH BEFORE ABOUT 06Z. RUC MODEL AT MEMPHIS ESPECIALLY
UNIMPRESSIVE. WITH SPC CONTINUING SLGT/MDT OUTLOOKS...FEEL
CONSTRAINED TO CONTINUE POP FORECAST FOR TONIGHT. WILL MAKE
ADJUSTMENTS TO HWO BASED ON SPC DAY 1 OUTLOOK.

SHOULD BE A LULL IN PRECIP TOMORROW MORNING INTO THE AFTERNOON. AS
NEXT IMPULSE APPROACHES...ANOTHER AREA OF RAIN/THUNDERSTORMS WILL
MOVE OVER THE AREA. MODELS CONTINUE THEIR TREND OF DRAGGING THE
SURFACE SYSTEM ALONG OR SOUTH OF OUR CWA BORDER. WE WILL SEE
PRECIPITATION TOMORROW NIGHT AND FRIDAY MORNING. CONSIDERING
FORECAST TRACK OF SURFACE AND UPPER LOWS...AND THE FACT THAT THEY
WILL BE MOVING OVER THE AREA AT NIGHT...FEEL THAT ANY SIGNIFICANT
THREAT OF SEVERE WEATHER WILL BE MAINLY SOUTH AND EAST OF OUR CWA...
AND WILL NOT MENTION IN THE ZONES. PRECIPITATION WILL MOVE OUT OF
THE AREA DURING THE DAYTIME HOURS ON FRIDAY. SATURDAY WILL BE DRY.

LOW TEMPS TONIGHT BASED ON EXPECTED 12Z POSITION OF BOUNDARY...AND
HIGHS FOR THURSDAY PREDICATED ON SIGNIFICANT SUNSHINE. FRIDAY TEMPS
PROBABLY WILL REMAIN IN THE 50S...AND IF CLOUDS HANG AROUND ALL
DAY...FORECAST TEMPS A CATEGORY OR TWO TOO WARM. TEMPERATURES
MODERATE ON SATURDAY UNDER HIGH PRESSURE...BUT STILL BELOW NORMAL.
&&

.LONG TERM (AFTER SATURDAY)...
HIGH PRESSURE REIGNS THROUGH TUESDAY BEFORE NEXT SYSTEM APPROACHES.
WILL NOT GO CRAZY YET WITH THAT SYSTEM...AS MODELS HAVE FREQUENTLY
FORECAST LARGE CLOSED LOWS THAT HAVE NOT DEVELOPED IN THE MIDDLE
RANGES OF THE FORECAST. TEMPERATURES NEAR TO SLIGHTLY ABOVE NORMAL
FOR SUNDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY.
&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.

.DISCUSSION...
SURFACE LOW OVER NORTHWEST CORNER OF MISSOURI...WITH COLD FRONT/DRY
LINE EXTENDING ALONG THE OK/AR BORDER AT 15Z. ALMOST SOLID DECK OF
CU/SC ACROSS THE CWA THIS MORNING...HOLDING TEMPERATURES IN THE

UNLESS WE SEE SOME CLEARING...IT WILL BE TOUGH FOR CONVECTION TO
DEVELOP DUE TO CAPPING. CONVECTIVE POTENTIAL FOR THE AFTERNOON IS
BASED ON HIGHS REACHING UPPER 70S ACROSS MOST OF THE AREA. CLOUDY
SKIES WOULD HOLD TEMPERATURES MAINLY IN THE 60S. WILL BE MONITORING
TRENDS OVER THE NEXT COUPLE OF HOURS.

LIKELY TO DO A LATE MORNING UPDATE TO CLEAN UP WORDING...AND MAKE
ANY ADJUSTMENTS TO ZFP/HWO NECESSARY FROM UPDATED ISSUANCE OF
SWODY1 AROUND 1630-1700Z.

FXUS64 KMEG 301029
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
428 AM CST WED MAR 30 2005

.DISCUSSION...LATEST SURFACE ANALYSIS PLACES LOW PRESSURE ACROSS 
NORTH CENTRAL KANSAS WITH A DRYLINE EXTENDING FROM THE LOW ACROSS 
CENTRAL TEXAS. BEHIND THE DRYLINE...DEWPOINTS ARE IN THE 20S TO 
LOWER 30S...AND UPPER 50 TO LOWER 60 DEWPOINTS ACROSS SOUTHERN 
ARKANSAS GRADUALLY TRYING TO SURGE NORTH. INFRARED SATELLITE SHOWING 
AN AREA OF MID/UPPER LEVEL CLOUDS TRAVERSING ACROSS THE FORECAST 
AREA THIS MORNING...AND FAIRLY PRONOUNCED DRY SLOT ON WATER VAPOR 
UPSTREAM. MAIN FORECAST CONCERN THIS FORECAST PACKAGE IS SEVERE 
WEATHER POTENTIAL THIS AFTERNOON AND TONIGHT.

TODAY...UPPER LEVEL TROUGH OVER WESTERN KANSAS WILL MOVE NORTHEAST 
INTO THE UPPER MISSISSIPPI VALLEY THIS AFTERNOON AND TONIGHT AND 
BECOME NEGATIVELY TILTED. 40 KT 850 MB JET WILL SHIFT EAST OVER THE 
FORECAST AREA BY THIS AFTERNOON WITH FAVORABLE UPPER LEVEL DIFLUENCE 
AS FORECAST AREA RESIDES IN LEFT EXIT REGION OF UPPER LEVEL JET. 
SEVERAL PARAMETERS POINT TO A POTENTIAL SEVERE WEATHER OUTBREAK THIS 
AFTERNOON WITH SURFACE BASED AND MIXED LAYER CAPES OF AT LEAST 2000 
J/KG ACROSS MOST OF THE FORECAST AREA....7000-500MB LAYER LAPSE 
RATES INCREASING TO 6.5-/7.0 C/KM BY THIS AFTERNOON...850/500 MB 
WINDS ABOVE 20KTS/50KTS...0-6KM BULK SHEAR VALUES AT OR ABOVE 60 
KTS...0-3KM SRH VALUES ABOVE 200 M2/S2...AND FAVORABLE SHEAR 
PROFILE. AGREE AT THIS TIME WITH SPC DAY 1 THOUGHTS AS CAPPING 
INVERSION AT 850 MB SHOULD ERODE BY MID AFTERNOON. CURRENT THINKING 
IS THAT CONVECTION WILL INITIATE AS DISCRETE SUPERCELLS BUT THEN 
GRADUALLY TRANSITION OVER TO A SQUALL LINE /BOW ECHO/ WITH EMBEDDED 
CIRCULATIONS AS WIND PROFILES BECOME MORE DIRECTIONAL AFTER SUNSET. 
TEMPERATURES TODAY SHOULD NOT BE TOO MUCH DIFFERENT FROM YESTERDAY 
WITH INFRARED SATELLITE NOT SHOWING MUCH IN THE WAY OF CLOUD COVER 
UPSTREAM ACROSS WESTERN ARKANSAS.

TONIGHT...COLD FRONT WILL MOVE ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA OVERNIGHT 
AND WEAKEN. SEVERE THREAT SHOULD DIMINISH ACROSS THE FORECAST FROM NW TO 
SOUTHEAST...ESPECIALLY AFTER 04Z AND TAPERED POPS AFTER MIDNIGHT 
WITH BEST CHANCES MAINLY ACROSS THE SOUTHEAST SECTION OF THE 
FORECAST AREA. TEMPERATURES TONIGHT WILL DROP INTO THE 50S TO LOWER 
60S.

THURSDAY...SIGNIFICANT MODEL DIFFERENCES BEGIN TO ARISE WITH 
HANDLING OF DEVELOPING SURFACE LOW PRESSURE ACROSS THE SOUTHERN 
PLAINS. LATEST NAM RUN TAKING SURFACE LOW ACROSS SOUTHERN 
LOUISIANA/MISSISSIPPI THURSDAY AFTERNOON/THURSDAY NIGHT ALONG OLD 
FRONTAL BOUNDARY WHILE GFS HAS BEEN MORE CONSISTENT BRINGING SURFACE 
LOW ACROSS CENTRAL MISSISSIPPI BY THURSDAY NIGHT. WILL LEAN TOWARD 
GFS SOLUTION FOR THURSDAY AND BEYOND AT THIS TIME. AS A 
RESULT...THINK SEVERE WEATHER POTENTIAL IF ANY WILL BE LIMITED TO 
THE SOUTHERN TIER OR TWO OF COUNTIES AT BEST WITH MIXED LAYER CAPES 
AROUND 700 J/KG AND MODERATELY STEEP 700-500 MB LAYER LAPSE RATES 
AROUND 6.5 C/KM WITH CONVECTION LIKELY REMAINING ELEVATED WITH 
STABLE LOW LAYER.

THURSDAY NIGHT AND FRIDAY...SURFACE LOW PRESSURE WILL MOVE ACROSS CENTRAL 
MISSISSIPPI WITH PRECIPITATION CHANCES INCREASING ACROSS THE 
FORECAST AREA THROUGH FRIDAY. MADE MINOR ADJUSTMENTS TO POPS FOR 
THURSDAY NIGHT BASED UPON CURRENT MODEL TRENDS AND RAISED POPS UP 
FOR FRIDAY AS WRAP AROUND MOISTURE LIKELY TO AFFECT THE 
FORECAST AREA DURING THE DAY.  


NO CHANGES MADE BEYOND FRIDAY. 

&&

FXUS64 KMEG 300345
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
945 PM CST TUE MAR 29 2005

.UPDATE...
PLENTY OF HIGH CLOUDS SPILLING INTO THE REGION AS UPPER RIDGE MOVES 
OFF TO THE EAST AND A STRONG SYSTEM MOVES INTO THE SOUTHERN PLAINS. 
SFC/UPPER LOW TRACKS TO NE KS BY 12Z WED WITH CDFNT STRETCHING SOUTH 
THROUGH ERN OK INTO NE TX. RETURN FLOW STRENGTHENS TONIGHT AS 
DEWPOINTS...CURRENTLY IN THE 40S...CLIMB TO THE LOWER 50S BY 12Z. 
SFC WINDS SHOULD WL START TO INCREASE AFTER 06Z TONIGHT AS GRADIENT 
STRENGTHENS. FORECAST LOOKS GOOD...MAY NEED TO ADJUST WINDS.

WED EVENING COULD BE INTERESTING. STRONG SFC LOW MOVES NORTH TO IOWA 
WHILE SFC CDFNT PUSHES EAST INTO THE MID SOUTH BY 00Z. SFC DEWPOINTS 
FORECASTED TO CLIMB INTO THE LOWER 60S ACRS N MS AND W TN BY 00Z THU 
WITH SFC BASED CAPES > 1500 J/KG. 115 KT 300 MB JET PUNCHING INTO 
THE REGION WITH 80 KTS AT 500 MB. ALSO...STRONG LOW LEVEL SHEAR EAST 
OF THE FRONT ACRS W TN AND N MS. 00Z MKL ETA SOUNDING HAS 347 M2/S2 
OF HELCITY WITH GOOD VEERING. THERE WILL BE A STRONG CAP EARLY IN 
THE DAY BUT IT SHOULD WEAKEN BY LATE AFTN/EARLY EVENING AS SFC TEMPS 
CLIMB INTO THE UPPER 70S. SFC FRONT AND STRONG SHORTWAVE MOVING INTO 
LOWER/MID MS VALLEY SHOULD PROVIDE ENUF OF A TRIGGER TO KICK OFF 
TSTMS AFTER 00Z THU EAST OF THE MS RIVER. SOME OF THESE STORMS COULD 
BE SEVERE ACRS W TN AND NRN MS 00Z-06Z. 

.PREV DISCUSSION ISSUED AT 326 PM...
SURFACE HIGH TO THE EAST OF THE AREA. WINDS HAVE COME AROUND TO
THE SOUTH...WITH TEMPERATURES MAINLY IN THE 70S. ONLY CIRRUS CLOUD
COVER AFFECTING THE AREA AT THIS TIME.
&&

.SHORT TERM (THROUGH FRIDAY)...
ALL THE SIGNIFICANT WEATHER WILL BE IN THE SHORT TERM PORTION OF THE
FORECAST...EVEN WITH THE FIRST 24 HOURS BEING DRY.

UPPER SYSTEM KICKS OUT OF ROCKIES TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY WITH SURFACE
LOW MOVING INTO MINNESOTA BY TOMORROW NIGHT. GFS/NAM DIFFER ON
STRENGTH AND SPEED OF SYSTEM...WITH NAM BEING A LITTLE SLOWER. AS
FRONT BECOMES PARALLEL TO UPPER FLOW TOMORROW EVENING...MOVEMENT
SLOWS CONSIDERABLY. NAM BRINGS FRONT THROUGH MOST OF THE AREA...
WHILE GFS HANGS IT UP TO OUR WEST. IN FACT...QUICK GLANCE AT 18Z
NAM/ETA INDICATES THAT ENTIRE CWA WOULD BE IN COLD SECTOR FOR THE
ENTIRE EVENT...A SIGNIFICANT CHANGE FROM EARLIER RUNS.

EARLIER FORECASTS WERE BASED ON GFS SOLUTION...AND SEE NO STRONG
REASON TO CHANGE NOW...ESPECIALLY WITH NAM TRACK RECORD RECENTLY.
12Z EURO ALSO SUPPORTS GFS SOLUTION.

WEATHER DRY THROUGH TOMORROW AFTERNOON...ALTHOUGH WOULDNT BE SHOCKED
TO SEE A LITTLE GULF STRATUS AND MAYBE A SPRINKLE IN THE MORNING.  AS
UPPER JET SPLITS OVER NORTHERN MS TOMORROW NIGHT...CHANCE OF
CONVECTION THERE WITH UPPER DIVERGENCE. ELEVATED CONVECTION COULD
PRODUCE HAIL TOMORROW NIGHT. POPS WILL RANGE FROM DRY WEST OF
MISSISSIPPI RIVER TO LIKELY SOUTHEAST PORTION OF CWA. A RELATIVE LULL
DURING THE DAY THURSDAY WITH CHANCE POPS. WITH FRONT IN AREA THURSDAY
NIGHT...AND IMPULSE MOVING THROUGH...LIKELY POPS ALL AREAS. GFS
SOLUTION INDICATES PARAMETERS VERY CONDUCIVE FOR SEVERE WEATHER...NAM
SAYS LITTLE OR NO SEVERE WEATHER. WITH MODEL DIVERGENCE...WILL KEEP
MENTION OF SEVERE IN HWO...BUT NOT ZONES. CHANCE POPS FRIDAY AS
SYSTEM MOVES EAST.

TEMPERATURE FORECAST BASED ON GFS FOR MOST PART...BUT NOT
COMFORTABLE WITH HIGH TEMPERATURE FORECAST FOR THURSDAY AND FRIDAY.
WHILE CURRENT FORECAST FITS WITH SURROUNDING OFFICES...EXPECT
TEMPERATURES TO BE A COUPLE OF CATEGORIES HIGHER OR LOWER DEPENDING
ON WHICH MODEL VERIFIES.
&&

.LONG TERM (AFTER FRIDAY)...
WEAK RIDGING ACROSS CENTER OF THE COUNTRY FOR THE WEEKEND INTO EARLY
NEXT WEEK. DRY WEATHER ANTICIPATED. TEMPERATURES BELOW NORMAL FOR
SATURDAY...THEN MODERATING TO NEAR OR ABOVE NORMAL FOR THE END OF
THE FORECAST PERIOD.
&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.
&&

&&

.LONG TERM (AFTER FRIDAY)...
WEAK RIDGING ACROSS CENTER OF THE COUNTRY FOR THE WEEKEND INTO EARLY
NEXT WEEK. DRY WEATHER ANTICIPATED. TEMPERATURES BELOW NORMAL FOR
SATURDAY...THEN MODERATING TO NEAR OR ABOVE NORMAL FOR THE END OF
THE FORECAST PERIOD.
&&

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 291017
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
417 AM CST TUE MAR 29 2005

.DISCUSSION...LATEST SURFACE ANALYSIS PLACES HIGH PRESSURE ACROSS 
THE LOWER MISSISSIPPI VALLEY WITH NEXT COLD FRONT LOCATED ACROSS THE 
PLAINS. LATEST INFRARED SATELLITE IMAGERY SHOWING CIRRUS SHIELD WITH 
NEXT SYSTEM BEGINNING TO OVERTAKE THE WESTERN HALF OF THE FORECAST 
AREA. MAIN FORECAST CONCERNS FOR THIS FORECAST PACKAGE IS CONVECTIVE 
POTENTIAL TONIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY. 

TODAY...PLEASANT DAY EXPECTED TODAY AS UPPER LEVEL RIDGE WILL 
CONTINUE TO BUILD IN THE MID SOUTH. 850 MB TEMPERATURES WILL 
INCREASE TO AROUND 13-14C BY 00Z WEDNESDAY SUGGESTING HIGHS IN THE 
LOWER 80S. MODEL SOUNDINGS INDICATE MIXING HEIGHTS AROUND 3000 FT BY 
THIS AFTERNOON ALONG WITH SOME HIGH CIRRUS PASSING THROUGH THE 
FORECAST AREA DURING THE DAY AS SUPPORTED BY WATER VAPOR/INFRARED 
SATELLITE TRENDS THIS MORNING. CURRENT HIGH TEMPERATURE GRIDS 
HANDLING TEMPERATURES WELL TODAY WITH HIGHS IN THE MIDDLE 70S TO 
AROUND 80.

TONIGHT...UPPER LEVEL RIDGE WILL TRANSLATE EAST AS NEXT LONGWAVE 
TROUGH EJECTS OUT OF THE CENTRAL/SOUTHERN PLAINS AND INTO THE 
MID/LOWER MISSISSIPPI VALLEY. TROUGH IN SOUTHWEST FLOW ALOFT WILL 
PASS JUST NORTHWEST OF THE FORECAST AREA TONIGHT AS IT RIDES UP THE 
RIDGE. SOME MID LEVEL FORCING /700-500MB Q-VECTOR CONVERGENCE/ WILL 
BE PRESENT WITH THE NEGATIVELY TILTED TROUGH...BUT A CAPPING 
INVERSION AT 925MB AND RATHER DRY MID LEVELS WILL KEEP THE FORECAST 
AREA DRY OVERNIGHT. SOUTHERLY WINDS IN THE BOUNDARY LAYER WILL 
INCREASE THROUGHOUT THE NIGHT TO AROUND 40KTS BUT INVERSION NEAR 
SURFACE WILL KEEP GUSTS BELOW 20KTS DURING THE NIGHT.

WEDNESDAY...RIDGING WILL RE-ESTABLISH ITSELF TEMPORARILY ACROSS THE 
LOWER/MIDDLE MISSISSIPPI VALLEY AS TROUGH MOVES INTO GREAT LAKES 
REGION AND NEXT UPPER LEVEL TROUGH APPROACHES. 700-500 MB MID LEVEL 
LAPSE RATES WILL BE STEEP AT OR ABOVE 7.0 C/KM...WITH LI/S AROUND 
-5...SURFACE BASED CAPES AVERAGING 1100 J/KG...AND A NEARLY 
UNIDIRECTIONAL PROFILE. THIS WOULD SUPPORT A MENTION OF 
THUNDERSTORMS...BUT A CAPPING INVERSION PRESENT AT 900 MB SHOULD 
KEEP CONVECTION FROM INITIATING. 850MB TEMPERATURES WILL WARM TO 15C 
SUPPORTING HIGHS IN THE LOWER TO MIDDLE 80S. INCREASING CLOUDS 
SHOULD KEEP TEMPERATURES IN THE MIDDLE 70S TO AROUND 80. NO CHANGES 
TO HIGH TEMPERATURES WITH GRIDS REFLECTING THINKING WELL. 

WEDNESDAY NIGHT...MODELS BEGIN TO DIVERGE WITH HANDLING OF WEAK 
IMPULSE IN SOUTHWEST FLOW AS WEAK FRONTAL BOUNDARY PASSES ACROSS THE 
FORECAST AREA WHILE NEXT TROUGH OF LOW PRESSURE MOVES INTO THE 
SOUTHERN PLAINS AND DEVELOPS SURFACE LOW PRESSURE. FORECAST AREA 
WILL BE IN THE RIGHT ENTRANCE REGION OF UPPER LEVEL JET...RESULTING 
IN UPPER LEVEL DIVERGENCE ACROSS THE LOWER MISSISSIPPI VALLEY. 
1000J/KG OF CAPE...LI/S AROUND -4...AND FAVORABLE WIND PROFILE 
JUSTIFY CURRENT POPS. MODEL SOUNDINGS SUGGEST THAT THUNDERSTORMS 
WILL REMAIN ELEVATED WITH HAIL AS THE PRIMARY THREAT. 

THURSDAY AND FRIDAY...SURFACE LOW PRESSURE WILL MOVE THROUGH ARKANSAS 
DURING THE DAY. NAM MUCH STRONGER WITH INSTABILITY PARAMETERS THAN 
GFS. NONETHELESS...LI/S OF AT LEAST -6...CAPES 2000 J/KG...0-6KM 
BULK SHEAR VALUES ABOVE 40KTS...AND SOMEWHAT FAVORABLE WIND 
PROFILE...AND 700-500MB MID LEVEL LAPSE RATES BECOMING MODERATELY 
STEEP AROUND 6.5 C/KM SUPPORT MENTION OF THUNDERSTORMS. THINK THAT 
BEST SEVERE POTENTIAL WOULD BE MOSTLY ACROSS THE SOUTHERN THIRD OF 
THE FORECAST AREA IN THE WARM SECTOR...THOUGH ALL OF FORECAST AREA 
IN DAY 3 SLIGHT RISK FOR SEVERE THUNDERSTORMS.  SURFACE LOW PRESSURE 
WILL DEPART TO THE NORTHEAST ON FRIDAY WITH WRAP AROUND MOISTURE 
PRODUCING RAIN SHOWERS ACROSS THE REGION. 

NO CHANGES MADE BEYOND FRIDAY.

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.
&&

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 290413
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
1015 PM CST MON MAR 28 2005

.UPDATE...
WEAK HIGH PRESSURE RIDGE OVER THE MID SOUTH TONIGHT WITH LIGHT WINDS 
AND A FEW THIN CIRRUS CLOUDS. TEMPS HAVEN FALLEN BACK INTO THE 40S 
AND LOWER 50S. CURRENT FORECAST ON TRACK THOUGH A FEW COOLER SPOTS 
IN W TN AND NE MS MAY SEE MIN TEMPS DIP A LITTLE FORECASTED VALUES. 
NO CHANGES ATTM.

.PREV DISCUSSION ISSUED AT 130 PM...
UPPER LEVEL LOW HAS MOVED EAST OF THE AREA...TAKING RAIN AND CLOUDS
WITH IT. SKIES MOSTLY SUNNY ACROSS THE AREA WITH TEMPERATURES UPPER
50S TO MIDDLE 60S IN MOST LOCATIONS. NORTHWEST WINDS SHOULD GRADUALLY
DIE DOWN OVERNIGHT.
&&

.SHORT TERM (THROUGH THURSDAY)...
WEATHER FAIRLY QUIET EARLY IN THE SHORT TERM. SURFACE HIGH MOVES EAST
TONIGHT...AND WINDS COME BACK AROUND TO THE SOUTH. SEE NO MAJOR
REASONS TO MAKE ADJUSTMENTS TO OVERNIGHT LOWS. TEMPERATURES ON
TUESDAY WILL BE SIGNIFICANTLY WARMER THAN TODAY...UNDER MOSTLY SUNNY
SKIES. PROBABLY AT LEAST 8 TO 10 DEGREES WARMER THAN TODAY...WHICH
WOULD BE WELL INTO THE 70S ACROSS MOST AREAS. WITH SOUTHERLY WINDS
AROUND 10 KNOTS...TEMPS TUESDAY NIGHT A GOOD 10 DEGREES WARMER THAN
TONIGHT IN MOST AREAS.

MODELS BEGIN TO DIVERGE A LITTLE BIT WEDNESDAY THROUGH THURSDAY.
UPPER SYSTEM WILL MOVE ACROSS THE CENTER OF THE COUNTRY...WITH LOW
PRESSURE MOVING FROM KANSAS INTO WISCONSIN WEDNESDAY NIGHT. GFS A
LITTLE FASTER THAN THE NAM. SOME QUESTION WHETHER A COLD FRONT WILL
BODILY MOVE THROUGH AREA OR NOT. NAM/MET GUIDANCE INDICATES A WIND
SHIFT WEDNESDAY NIGHT...WHILE GFS/MAV DOES NOT. NAM PRETTY MUCH BONE
DRY ACROSS OUR AREA THROUGH 84 HOURS...WHICH WOULD KEEP FORECAST DRY
THROUGH THURSDAY. GFS A LITTLE MORE MOIST...AND WITH BOUNDARY IN THE
AREA...DONT FEEL THAT REMOVING PRECIPITATION FROM CURRENT FORECAST
FOR WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND THURSDAY WOULD BE PRUDENT. WILL KEEP CHANCE
POPS FOR NOW. WEDNESDAY HIGHS SIMILAR TO TUESDAY. WEDNESDAY NIGHT
TEMPERATURE FORECAST HAS BUST POTENTIAL. IF NAM/MET IS RIGHT...CLEAR
SKIES WOULD ALLOW TEMPS TO DROP...GFS/MAV WOULD SHOW CLOUDS HOLDING
TEMPS UP. WITH CURRENT FORECAST TRENDING TOWARD GFS...WILL USE MAV
NUMBERS. THURSDAY TEMPS TOO HIGH IF GFS SCENARIO WORKS OUT...BUT
WOULD LIKE TO SEE ANOTHER RUN OR TWO BEFORE MAJOR CHANGES.
&&

.LONG TERM (AFTER THURSDAY)...
FRONT WILL MOVE THROUGH THURSDAY NIGHT...BUT GFS FORECASTING CLOSED
LOW TO DEVELOP OVER TN ON FRIDAY...BEFORE MOVING EAST SATURDAY. THIS
COULD HAVE A SIGNIFICANT IMPACT ON FRIDAY MAX TEMPS. CLOUDS AND RAIN
WOULD HOLD TEMPS DOWN BELOW CURRENT FORECAST LEVELS. AFTER LOW MOVES
OUT OF AREA SATURDAY MORNING...DRY WEATHER EXPECTED THROUGH MONDAY.
TEMPERATURES WILL BE COOL FRIDAY...BUT RETURN TO NEAR NORMAL LEVELS
OVER THE WEEKEND.
&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.
&&

FXUS64 KMEG 280905
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
305 AM CST MON MAR 28 2005

.DISCUSSION...
THE UPPER LOW THAT BROUGHT HEAVY RAINS TO NORTHEAST ARKANSAS...THE 
MISSOURI BOOTHEEL AND PARTS OF WEST TENNESSEE WAS SPINNING OVER 
CENTRAL TENNESSEE THIS MORNING. WRAP AROUND SHOWERS WERE AFFECTING 
ALL OF WEST TENNESSEE...THE MISSOURI BOOTHEEL AND NORTHEAST 
MISSISSIPPI. THIS UPPER LOW WILL GRADUALLY SHIFT FARTHER EAST TAKING 
THE WRAP AROUND RAIN WITH IT. TIMING OF RAIN MOVING EAST OF THE TN 
RIVER IS AROUND NOON...OTHERWISE SKIES WILL GRADUALLY CLEAR FROM 
WEST TO EAST TODAY.

WEATHER BECOMES TRANQUIL AS A MID LEVEL RIDGE TRANSLATES ACROSS THE 
EAST CENTRAL U.S. A STRONG SHORTWAVE MOVING OUT OF THE CENTRAL 
ROCKIES ON TUESDAY WILL SWING ACROSS MISSOURI AND INTO ILLINOIS 
WEDNESDAY. ANY RAIN ASSOCIATED WITH THIS SYSTEM SHOULD REMAIN NORTH 
OF THE FORECAST AREA WEDNESDAY. 

ANOTHER SHORTWAVE MOVING OUT OF THE CENTRAL U.S. WILL BEGIN TO 
AFFECT THE MID SOUTH WEDNESDAY EVENING. AHEAD OF THIS 
SYSTEM...ABUNDANT LOW LEVEL MOISTURE ADVECTION WILL OCCUR DUE TO THE 
40+KT LOW LEVEL JET. NOT EXPECTING ANY RAINFALL WEDNESDAY...HOWEVER 
THIS WILL PRIME THE ATMOSPHERE FOR THUNDERSTORMS TO DEVELOP ON 
THURSDAY AS THE UPPER LEVEL STORM SYSTEM MOVES CLOSER. IN ADDITION 
TO THE MOISTURE AND INSTABILITY BEING IN PLACE...CURRENT MODELS 
AGREE ON THE POSITION OF THE FRONTAL BOUNDARY BISECTING THE MID 
SOUTH BY THURSDAY NIGHT. FEELING IS THAT THIS WILL BE SOMETHING TO 
WATCH THE NEXT SEVERAL DAYS AS FAR AS SEVERE POTENTIAL. IT APPEARS 
THAT THE SPEED OF THIS SYSTEM WILL DRAG THE PRECIP OUT OF THE AREA 
FRIDAY AFTERNOON FOLLOWED BY MUCH COOLER AIR. NEXT WEEKEND SHOULD BE 
DRY. 

&&

FXUS64 KMEG 270847
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
247 AM CST SUN MAR 27 2005

.DISCUSSION...
THE SURFACE LOW WAS LOCATED JUST SOUTH OF TUPELO THIS MORNING. GUSTY 
NORTH WINDS WERE OCCURRING ACROSS NORTHEAST ARKANSAS...THE MISSOURI 
BOOTHEEL AND WESTERN TENNESSEE. A LARGE AREA OF RAIN WAS ALSO MOVING 
NORTHEAST ACROSS THIS AREA. SCATTERED SHOWERS WITH A FEW EMBEDDED 
THUNDERSTORMS WERE MOVING ACROSS NORTHEAST MISSISSIPPI. THE LOCATION 
OF THE SURFACE LOW AND ASSOCIATED WARM FRONT DID NOT MAKE IT AS FAR 
NORTH AS WHAT WE WERE THINKING YESTERDAY...THUS THE SEVERE WEATHER 
THREAT WAS DIMINISHED. 

HOWEVER...THE UPPER LEVEL STORM SYSTEM LOCATED OVER CENTRAL TEXAS 
WAS MOVING CLOSER TO THE MID SOUTH. ANOTHER BATCH OF SHOWERS AND 
THUNDERSTORMS WILL AFFECT THE ENTIRE MID SOUTH BY THIS AFTERNOON. 
THE TRACK OF THE UPPER LOW WILL TAKE IT RIGHT OVER NORTHERN 
MISSISSIPPI OVERNIGHT. STEEP LAPSE RATES ASSOCIATED WITH THE COLD 
CORE OF THE UPPER LOW SHOULD BE ENOUGH TO PRODUCE THUNDERSTORMS. 
THERE WILL BE A THREAT OF LARGE HAIL WITH THE STRONGER STORMS. 

THIS SYSTEM WILL EXIT WEST TENNESSEE AND NORTHEAST MISSISSIPPI BY 
LATE MORNING MONDAY. SKIES WILL CLEAR AND TEMPERATURES WILL BE ON 
THE REBOUND BACK TO NEAR SEASONAL MONDAY. EXPECT EVEN WARMER DAYTIME 
TEMPERATURES ON TUESDAY. 

NO CHANGES MADE TO THE LONG RANGE FORECAST THIS EVENING. FORECAST 
APPEARS ON TRACK FOR THE NEXT ROUND OF THUNDERSTORMS TO AFFECT THE 
MID SOUTH THURSDAY AND FRIDAY.

&&
