930 PM CST SAT MAR 26 2005

.DISCUSSION...
SEVERE WEATHER HAS BEEN NON EXISTENT ACROSS THE WATCH AREA THUS FAR 
THIS EVENING. A NEW TORNADO WATCH HAS JUST BEEN ISSUED FOR THE SAME 
COUNTIES IN ADDITION TO PONTOTOC AND YALOBUSHA COUNTIES UNTIL 400 AM. 
RIGHT NOW THE WARM FRONT IS STILL LOCATED NEAR I-20 IN MISSISSIPPI. 
THIS IS WHERE ALL THE SEVERE WEATHER IS CURRENTLY OCCURRING. IT WILL 
BE SEVERAL HOURS IF AT ALL BEFORE ANY SEVERE WEATHER MOVES INTO THE 
CWA. DEWPOINTS ARE STILL IN THE 40S AND 50S ACROSS THE CWA AT THIS 
HOUR. SHOWERS HAVE BEEN SPREADING NORTHWARD INTO NORTHERN 
MISSISSIPPI AND EASTWARD INTO EASTERN ARKANSAS THIS EVENING. WILL 
KEEP HIGH POPS GOING AS LARGE AREA OF RAIN LOCATED ACROSS CENTRAL 
ARKANSAS NOW WILL MOVE INTO CWA OVERNIGHT. TEMPERATURES HAVE ALREADY 
DROPPED INTO THE MID 40S ACROSS EXTREME NORTHWESTERN ZONES WHERE 
RAIN HAS BEEN FALLING WILL UPDATE LOWS TO LOWER THEM AT LEAST A 
CATEGORY. REST OF FORECAST LOOKS GOOD...UPDATE WILL BE OUT SHORTLY.

THINGS SLOWLY STARTING TO LINE UP FOR A POTENTIAL SEVERE WEATHER

WILL MOVE NORTHWARD INTO THE SOUTHERN PART OF THE FORECAST AREA.
THIS WILL SET THE SCENE FOR SEVERE THUNDERSTORMS TONIGHT WITH LARGE
HAIL...DAMAGING WINDS AND TORNADOES POSSIBLE. THE SURFACE LOW WILL
BE MOVING OUT OF THE FORECAST AREA BY SUNRISE SUNDAY MORNING BUT
RAIN WILL CONTINUE ACROSS MUCH OF THE REGION WITH A THREAT OF SEVERE
WEATHER POSSIBLE IN THE EASTERN PART OF THE FORECAST AREA. THE RAIN
SHOULD END BY LATE SUNDAY NIGHT OVER THE REGION. THERE WILL BE A
PERIOD OF DRY WEATHER FROM MONDAY THROUGH THURSDAY. NEXT COLD FRONT
APPROACHES THURSDAY NIGHT AND FRIDAY WITH INDICATIONS THAT THERE
COULD BE SEVERE WEATHER WITH THIS FRONT AS WELL.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
940 AM CST SAT MAR 26 2005

.DISCUSSION...
SKIES ARE BECOMING CLOUDY THIS MORNING FROM WEST TO EAST. AN AREA OF
SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS IS MOVING INTO WESTERN ARKANSAS AND SHOULD
CONTINUE TO MOVE EAST THIS AFTERNOON. TEMPERATURES HAVE WARMED UP A
LITTLE MORE THAN EARLIER EXPECTED SO HAVE BUMPED UP HIGHS FOR THIS
AFTERNOON. ALSO UPDATED ZONES TO REMOVE MORNING WORDING. POTENTIAL
FOR SEVERE WEATHER STILL THERE ESPECIALLY LATE TONIGHT SO WILL
UPDATE HWO AS NEEDED.

FXUS64 KMEG 260914
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
314 AM CST SAT MAR 26 2005

.DISCUSSION...
A FEW LIGHT SHOWERS HAVE DEVELOPED OVER ARKANSAS STRETCHING FROM THE 
MISSOURI BOOTHEEL TO LITTLE ROCK. THE AREAS OF SHOWERS WERE MOVING 
NORTHEAST AT 30 MPH. THESE RAIN SHOWERS HAVE DEVELOPED ALONG THE 
NORTHERN HALF OF THE 130KT JET WHICH WAS ROUGHLY LOCATED FROM THE 
BIG BEND OF TEXAS TO HUNTSVILLE AL. MORE IMPRESSIVE THUNDERSTORMS 
HAVE DEVELOPED IN THE PERMIAN BASIN AND ROLLING PLAINS OF TEXAS. 
THIS ACTIVITY EXPLODED IN ADVANCE OF THE STRONG UPPER LOW MOVING OUT 
OF NEW MEXICO. THE MID SOUTH WILL HAVE TO DEAL WITH THIS STORM 
SYSTEM LATER TODAY AND SUNDAY.

TODAY THE FRONTAL BOUNDARY THAT HAS SET UP ACROSS THE NORTHERN HALF 
OF MISSISSIPPI WILL PLAY HAVOC WITH THE FORECAST. CURRENT MODELS 
AGREE THAT LATER THIS AFTERNOON THE CHANCES FOR SEVERE THUNDERSTORMS 
INCREASE. THE IMPRESSIVE UPPER LEVEL JET AND THE SHEAR PROFILES 
WOULD SUPPORT STRONG UPDRAFTS. THE WARM FRONT WILL MOVE NORTHWARD 
THIS AFTERNOON AND TONIGHT AS THE SURFACE LOW DEVELOPS OVER 
LOUISIANA AND DEEPENS OVER NORTHERN MISSISSIPPI TONIGHT. ANY STORMS 
THAT DEVELOP IN THE WARM SECTOR I.E. SOUTH OF THE WARM FRONT AND 
MOVE NORTHWARD ACROSS THE BOUNDARY WILL HAVE A GOOD CHANCE OF 
PRODUCING A TORNADO. NORTH OF THE WARM FRONT...ROTATING STORMS WILL 
PRODUCE LARGE HAIL AND DAMAGING WINDS. EXPECT THE EVOLUTION OF 
STORMS TO BEGIN MOVING INTO NORTHEAST ARKANSAS LATE THIS AFTERNOON 
WITH OTHER STORMS DEVELOPING NEAR THE WARM FRONT IN NORTHERN 
MISSISSIPPI. THE STORMS WILL PERSIST FOR THE MAJORITY OF THE EVENING 
ESPECIALLY OVER THE SOUTH AND EASTERN FORECAST AREAS.

AS THE UPPER LOW TRACKS ACROSS THE MID SOUTH SUNDAY...WIDESPREAD 
SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS WILL OCCUR DUE TO THE INSTABILITY PROVIDED 
BY THE COLD CORE LOW. EXPECT THE RAIN TO END LATE SUNDAY/EARLY 
MONDAY. PLEASANT WEATHER WILL RETURN TO THE AREA THROUGH WEDNESDAY. 

ANOTHER STRONG STORM SYSTEM WILL MOVE OUT OF THE SOUTHERN PLAINS AND 
AFFECT THE MID SOUTH THURSDAY AND POSSIBLY INTO FRIDAY. THIS SYSTEM 
COULD PRODUCE ANOTHER CHANCE FOR SEVERE WEATHER. STAY TUNED FOR THIS 
ONE.

&&

FORECAST AFTER MIDNIGHT. CONDITIONS SHOULD GRADUALLY WORSEN AS TIMES
GOES ON SATURDAY. BY SATURDAY NIGHT...ANOTHER WEAK SHORTWAVE MOVES
THROUGH THE REGION. IN ADDITION...UPPER LEVEL PULLS ACROSS THE TEXAS
PANHANDLE AND HELPS DEVELOP A SURFACE LOW OVER NORTHWEST LOUISIANA.
ALL OF THESE FACTORS WILL HELP PRODUCE SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS
DURING THE DAY SATURDAY. HAVE REDUCED POPS TO LIKELY CATEGORY FOR
SATURDAY. SATURDAY NIGHT COULD BE A BUSY NIGHT DEPENDING ON TRACK OF
THE SURFACE LOW. RIGHT NOW IT APPEARS THAT THE BULK OF THE WORST
SEVERE WEATHER SHOULD REMAIN TO THE SOUTH OF THE FORECAST AREA BUT
ANY NORTHWARD CHANGE IN THE TRACK OF THE LOW COULD MEAN A BETTER
CHANCE OF SEVERE STORMS FOR THE FORECAST AREA. BY SUNDAY SURFACE
LOW SHOULD BE EAST OF THE FORECAST AREA BUT CANT COMPLETELY RULE
OUT AN ISOLATED THUNDERSTORM DURING THE DAY. RAIN SHOULD END BY LATE
SUNDAY NIGHT AND DRY WEATHER RETURNS THROUGH WEDNESDAY. MODELS HAVE
SLOWED DOWN TRACK OF THE NEXT COLD FRONT SO HAVE REMOVED MENTION OF
RAIN FOR WEDNESDAY.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
325 AM CST FRI MAR 25 2005

.DISCUSSION...
ONGOING CONVECTION OVER CENTRAL ARKANSAS PROGRESSING TOWARD THE MID 
SOUTH THIS MORNING. OUTFLOW WAS WELL AHEAD OF THE STORMS. WEAKER 
SHOWERS WERE OCCURRING ACROSS NORTHEAST ARKANSAS WHILE THERE ARE 
STILL A FEW DISTINCT STRONG CELLS LOCATED BEHIND THE OUTFLOW 
BOUNDARY. THE POSSIBILITY OF A FEW SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS FROM 
THIS COMPLEX MAY PRODUCE SOME MEASURABLE RAINFALL OVER THE WESTERN 
PORTIONS OF THE FORECAST AREA MAINLY THIS MORNING. 

LIGHTER SHOWERS OVER THE CENTRAL FORECAST AREA WERE MOVING EASTWARD 
AT A GOOD PACE. THERE MAY BE SOME ENHANCEMENT OVER THE NEXT FEW 
HOURS BUT THIS WILL BE SHORT LIVED. EXPECT MOST OF THE RAIN ACTIVITY 
TO END BY 9 AM.

FORECAST MODEL SOUNDINGS INDICATING RATHER WEAK LIFT LATER THIS 
MORNING THROUGH OVERNIGHT. MID LEVEL LAPSE RATES ARE NOT THAT 
IMPRESSIVE UNTIL LATER TONIGHT OVER THE NORTHERN THIRD OF THE 
FORECAST AREA. THIS AREA WOULD BE THE BEST BET FOR ANY STORMS TO 
DEVELOP.

THE STRONG SOUTHWEST FLOW OF THE SUBTROPICAL JET WILL PROVIDE 
SUPPORT TO THUNDERSTORM DEVELOPMENT ON SATURDAY. A BOUNDARY WILL 
BISECT THE MID SOUTH SATURDAY. AFTERNOON THUNDERSTORMS WILL BE A 
GOOD POSSIBILITY ESPECIALLY ACROSS NORTHERN MISSISSIPPI...JUST SOUTH 
OF THE BOUNDARY. SATURDAY NIGHT...THE UPPER LOW OVER THE SOUTHERN 
PLAINS WILL APPROACH THE MID SOUTH. SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS WILL 
LIKELY ENVELOPE THE AREA AS ALL THE INGREDIENTS NECESSARY WILL BE 
OVER THE FORECAST AREA THROUGH THE DAY SUNDAY. BY SUNDAY EVENING THE 
UPPER LOW WILL BE JUST EAST OF THE AREA...BRINGING AN END TO THE 
RAINFALL.

IN THE WAKE OF THE TROUGH...A LONGWAVE RIDGE WILL PROVIDE FAIR 
WEATHER FOR THE REGION THROUGH AT LEAST THE MIDDLE OF NEXT WEEK.

NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
250 PM CST THU MAR 24 2005

.DISCUSSION...
LOW CLOUDS HAVE FINALLY EXITED THE REGION. SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS
CONTINUE TO SLOWLY MAKE THEIR WAY THROUGH CENTRAL AND SOUTHWEST
MISSOURI AND EXTREME NORTHWEST ARKANSAS. THIS AREA OF RAIN SHOULD
CONTINUE TO MAKE ITS WAY TOWARD THE FORECAST AREA TONIGHT. KEPT
CHANCE POPS IN FOR WEST OF THE MISSISSIPPI RIVER FOR BETWEEN 00Z AND
06Z AND CHANCE POPS FOR ALL BUT EXTREME SOUTHEAST FOR AFTER 06Z AND
SLIGHT CHANCE POPS EXTREME SOUTHEAST. SPC HAS NORTHWEST SECTIONS OF
CWA IN A SLIGHT RISK. WITH CONVECTION TO ELEVATED IN NATURE AND
INSTABILITY SOMEWHAT LIMITED DO NOT THINK WE WILL SEE TOO MUCH IN
THE WAY OF SEVERE WEATHER.

FRIDAY THE SURFACE BOUNDARY WILL HAVE SHIFTED NORTHWARD AND THAT
SHOULD KEEP ANY REMAINING SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS PRIMARILY OVER
THE NORTHERN HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA AND MAINLY DURING THE MORNING
HOURS. HAVE CHANCE POPS IN THE NORTH AND SLIGHT CHANCE POPS IN THE
SOUTH FOR FRIDAY MORNING.

BY FRIDAY NIGHT...BOUNDARY SLIPS BACK SOUTH AND UPPER LEVEL
SHORTWAVE APPROACHES THE REGION. WENT WITH CHANCE POPS ACROSS THE
ENTIRE FORECAST AREA. SATURDAY...A STRONGER SHORTWAVE MOVES THROUGH
THE REGION AND UPPER LEVEL LOW BEGINS TO MOVE INTO WEST TEXAS. HAVE
LIKELY POPS FOR DURING THE DAY SATURDAY. SATURDAY NIGHT AND SUNDAY
LOOK TO BE QUITE WET AS UPPER LEVEL LOW PULLS INTO THE REGION SO
HAVE CATEGORICAL POPS FOR BOTH SATURDAY NIGHT AND EASTER SUNDAY. GFS
SHOWS LIFTED INDICES OF -2 AND LOWER OVER THE SOUTHERN HALF OF THE
FORECAST AREA FOR FRIDAY NIGHT SO WILL HAVE TO KEEP AN EYE OUT FOR
THE POSSIBILITY OF SEVERE STORMS.

RAIN WILL DIMINISH ON SUNDAY NIGHT WITH DRY WEATHER FOR MONDAY AND
TUESDAY. ANOTHER COLD FRONT SLOWLY APPROACHES ON WEDNESDAY SO MORE
SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS WILL BE POSSIBLE FOR WEDNESDAY AND
THURSDAY.

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 241013
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
410 AM CST THU MAR 24 2005

.DISCUSSION...LATEST INFRARED SATELLITE SHOWS STRATOCUMULUS DECK 
GRADUALLY BEGINNING TO ERODE AND SHIFT EAST ACROSS THE MID SOUTH 
THIS MORNING. HOWEVER...AT THE SAME TIME...CIRRUS AND ALTOCUMULUS 
ASSOCIATED WITH NEXT SYSTEM OVER THE PLAINS BEGINNING TO APPROACH 
THE FORECAST AREA. TEMPERATURES THIS MORNING RAINGE FROM THE 40S 
UNDER CLOUD COVER TO 30S ACROSS PORTIONS OF ARKANSAS AND MISSISSIPPI 
THAT HAVE BROKEN OUT OVERNIGHT. MAIN FORECAST CONCERNS THIS FORECAST 
PACKAGE IS CONVECTIVE CHANCES TONIGHT AND CONTINUING THROUGH THE 
WEEKEND.

TODAY...MODEL SOUNDINGS AND SATELLITE TRENDS INDICATE THAT CLOUDS 
WILL STILL STICK AROUND THE MID SOUTH TODAY. AS THE LOW CLOUDS 
GRADUALLY DEPART DURING THE DAY MID/UPPER LEVEL CLOUDINESS WILL 
OVERTAKE THE FORECAST AREA AND ONLY EXPECT PARTLY SUNNY SKIES BY 
THIS AFTERNOON AT BEST. EVEN THOUGH 850MB TEMPERATURES WAIL BE 
WARMING TO AROUND 11C BY THIS AFTERNOON...CLOUD COVER WILL KEEP 
HIGHS IN THE 60S TO AROUND 70. 
 
TONIGHT...WARM FRONT CURRENTLY ACROSS THE PANHANDLE OF TEXAS IS 
FORECAST TO REACH THE MID SOUTH BY FRIDAY MORNING. 700-500 MB MID 
LEVEL LAPSE RATES WILL STEEPEN TO AROUND 7 C/KM BY FRIDAY MORNING 
WITH ASSISTANCE FROM A 850MB LOW LEVEL JET THAT WILL DEVELOP 
OVERNIGHT. LI/S UP TO AROUND -5...CAPES AROUND 1000 J/KG ACROSS 
NORTHEAST ARKANSAS WITH LESSER INSTABILITY TO THE EAST...AND 700 MB 
DRY AIR UPSTREAM SUGGEST THUNDERSTORMS NOT OUT OF THE QUESTION. 
HOWEVER I THINK THAT ANY CONVECTION WILL REMAIN ELEVATED WITH HAIL 
AS A POTENTIAL SEVERE WEATHER THREAT. MODEL SOUNDINGS INDICATE 
AMPLE LOW LEVEL DRY AIR WILL BE IN PLACE AT THE START OF THE EVENING 
AND WILL HOLD OFF BETTER PRECIPITATION CHANCES UNTIL AFTER MIDNIGHT. 
LOW TEMPERATURES WILL ONLY DROP INTO THE 50S WITH WARM AIR ADVECTION 
INCREASING ACROSS THE MID SOUTH. 

FRIDAY...COLD FRONT WILL MOVE ACROSS THE MID SOUTH DURING THE 
DAY...MOVING AS FAR AS THE TN/MS STATE LINE BEFORE STALLING OUT 
ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA. BOTH NAM/GFS ADVERTISE THE AREA DRY 
SLOTTING FRIDAY MORNING BEFORE PRECIPITATION TRIES TO ARRIVE AGAIN 
BY LATE AFTERNOON. A SURFACE BASED PARCEL (74/61) BASED NEAR KMEM 
PRODUCES 2000 J/KG OF CAPE...LI/S AROUND -6. THIS WOULD BE IDEAL FOR 
THUNDERSTORMS...HOWEVER MID LEVEL FORCING WILL BE WEAK AT BEST IN 
THE AFTERNOON WITH 700-500 MB LAPSE RATES WEAKENING TO UNDER 6 
C/KM...AND WILL LIKELY BE THE MISSING INGREDIENT. AS A RESULT...ONLY 
CARRYING SLIGHT CHANCE POPS IN THE AFTERNOON. ANY THUNDERSTORMS THAT 
CAN DEVELOP COULD PRODUCE SOME HAIL...BUT EXPECTING ANY 
THUNDERSTORMS TO REMAIN BELOW SEVERE LIMITS AT THIS TIME. 850 MB 
TEMPERATURES WILL WARM TO AROUND 13C...SUPPORTING HIGHS INTO THE 
MIDDLE 70S.  

FRIDAY NIGHT...STALLED OUT FRONT WILL REMAIN ACROSS THE MID SOUTH 
WHILE ANOTHER SHORTWAVE IN THE SOUTHWEST FLOW ALOFT PRODUCES ANOTHER 
CHANCE OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS WITH 700-500MB LAPSE RATES 
INCREASING TO AROUND 6.5 C/KM. 

SATURDAY...A SECONDARY SURFACE LOW WILL DEVELOP ACROSS THE SOUTHERN 
PLAINS AND MOVE INTO THE MID SOUTH SATURDAY NIGHT AND SUNDAY 
BRINGING ADDITIONAL SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS TO THE AREA SATURDAY 
AND SATURDAY NIGHT...AND RAIN SHOWERS ON THE BACKSIDE OF THE LOW ON 
SUNDAY.

MONDAY THROUGH THURSDAY...LATEST 00Z LONG RANGE MODEL RUN QUICKER 
THAN 12Z RUN WITH MOVEMENT OF LONGWAVE TROUGH ACROSS THE U.S. BY 
WEDNESDAY.  ZONAL FLOW ADVERTISED IN PREVIOUS MODEL RUNS HAS 
TRANSITIONED OVER TO A SOUTHWEST FLOW PATTERN. LATEST GFS RUN 
SHOWING A NEGATIVELY TILTED TROUGH TO MOVE ACROSS THE MIDDLE 
MISSISSIPPI VALLEY BY WEDNESDAY/THURSDAY...WHICH IS DIFFERENT FROM 
THE 12Z RUN. LATEST EUROPEAN RUN A BIT MORE AMPLIFIED THAN GFS AND 
SLOWER WITH UPPER LEVEL TROUGH. ADDED A SLIGHT CHANCE OF RAIN 
SHOWERS TO TUESDAY NIGHT AS NEXT SYSTEM APPROACHES BUT WILL NOT 
RAISE POPS AT THIS TIME TO FURTHER PERIODS UNTIL LATER RUNS SHOW 
MORE RUN TO RUN CONSISTENCY. 
&&

FXUS64 KMEG 231009
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
400 AM CST WED MAR 23 2005

.DISCUSSION...LATEST SURFACE ANALYSIS THIS MORNING CENTERS SURFACE 
LOW PRESSURE ACROSS WESTERN TENNESSEE WITH OCCLUDED FRONT EXTENDING 
DOWN ACROSS ALABAMA TO THE GULF OF MEXICO. MEANWHILE UPPER LEVEL LOW 
SPINNING ACROSS ROLLA MISSOURI AND SPREADING STRATO CUMULUS ACROSS 
THE MID/LOWER MISSISSIPPI VALLEYS. DRY SLOT ON WATER VAPOR IMAGERY 
HAS ALSO SHIFTED EAST WITH THE PASSAGE OF THE FRONT LAST NIGHT.

TODAY...MORE TRANQUIL WEATHER EXPECTED ACROSS THE MID SOUTH TODAY AS 
UPPER LEVEL RIDGING SLOWLY SHIFTS EAST FROM THE CENTRAL/SOUTHERN 
PLAINS. LATEST KNQA 88D RADAR TRENDS SHOWING A FEW LIGHT RETURNS 
JUST WEST OF THE MISSOURI BOOTHEEL. MODEL SOUNDINGS STILL SUGGEST 
SOME RESIDUAL MOISTURE WILL HANG AROUND THE FAR NORTHERN TIER OF 
COUNTIES THROUGH MID MORNING /ENOUGH TO PRODUCE A FEW SPRINKLES/ BUT 
MID/UPPER LEVELS WILL CONTINUE TO DRY AS SUBSIDENCE TAKES HOLD. WRAP 
AROUND LOW/MID CLOUDS ASSOCIATED WITH UPPER LEVEL LOW WILL AFFECT 
THE FORECAST AREA THROUGH THIS EVENING AND KEEP TEMPERATURES DOWN A 
FEW DEGREES IN THE 50S TO LOWER 60S EVEN THOUGH 850 MB TEMPERATURES 
WILL BE AROUND 2C. 

TONIGHT...SKIES WILL CLEAR OUT ACROSS THE REGION AS UPPER LEVEL 
RIDGING CONTINUES TO BUILD IN DURING THE EVENING WITH 1000-500 MB 
LAYER RH/S DROPPING DOWN TO AROUND 45 PERCENT. MOS GUIDANCE MOSTLY 
CONSISTENT WITH LOWS TONIGHT AND ONLY MADE MINOR LOW TEMPERATURE 
ADJUSTMENTS AS PREVIOUS GRID HANDLING TREND WELL. 

THURSDAY...UPPER LEVEL RIDGE WILL MOVE EAST TOWARD THE EAST COAST 
DURING THE DAY AS NEXT SURFACE LOW OVER THE PLAINS BEGINS TO AFFECT 
THE AREA AS EARLY AS THURSDAY EVENING AND THE LOWER MISSISSIPPI 
RIVER VALLEY TRANSITIONS BACK TO A MID/UPPER LEVEL SOUTHWEST FLOW 
PATTERN. AS A RESULT...CLOUDS WILL BEGIN TO INCREASE GRADUALLY 
THROUGH THE DAY WITH HIGHS ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA RISING INTO THE 
UPPER 60S TO LOWER 70S AS 850 MB TEMPERATURES RISE TO AROUND 14C 
/SUPPORTIVE OF UPPER 70S TO LOWER 80S WITH DECENT MIXING AND 
ABUNDANT SUNSHINE/ BY 03Z FRIDAY. I ADJUSTED HIGHS FOR THURSDAY UP A 
COUPLE OF DEGREES BASED ON THIS LATEST TREND.  

THURSDAY NIGHT...NEXT COLD FRONT WILL BEGIN TO AFFECT THE FORECAST 
AREA ESPECIALLY OVERNIGHT. SOME ISENTROPIC ASCENT WILL BE PRESENT 
ALONG WITH STEEP 700-500 MB LAYER MID LEVEL LAPSE RATES AROUND 7 
C/KM...BUT NOT INCLINED AT THIS POINT TO RAISE POPS ABOVE SLIGHT 
CHANCE WITH MOISTURE STILL BEING LIMITED WITH THIS FRONT. THUNDER 
CHANCES STILL LOOK REASONABLE WITH CAPES UP TO 1000 J/KG...LI/S 
-4...AND SHOWALTER INDICIES AROUND -2.

FRIDAY...COLD FRONT WILL MOVE ACROSS HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA 
BEFORE STALLING OUT BY FRIDAY NIGHT. AS A RESULT...A CHANCE OF 
SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORM CHANCES WILL PERSIST THROUGH THE DAY WITH 
THE BEST CHANCES FRIDAY AFTERNOON AND FRIDAY EVENING AS 700-500 MB 
LAYER LAPSE RATES BECOME MODERATELY STEEP AROUND 6.5 C/KM. AM A BIT 
CONCERNED ABOUT SEVERE WEATHER POTENTIAL DURING THE AFTERNOON AND 
EVENING AS MODEL SOUNDINGS PRODUCE 1000-2000 J/KG OF CAPE...LI/S 
AROUND -5 AND LITTLE IF ANY CAP. THINK THAT SEVERE WEATHER THREATS 
AT THIS POINT WOULD BE PRIMARILY HAIL AND POSSIBLY DAMAGING WINDS AS 
WIND FIELDS ARE NEARLY UNIDIRECTIONAL. BIG QUESTION STILL REMAINS 
HOW MUCH MOISTURE RETURN FROM THE GULF OF MEXICO WILL BE AVAILABLE 
AND THE AMOUNT OF SUNSHINE TO ASSIST SURFACE BASED INSTABILITY. HIGH 
TEMPERATURES WILL BE IN THE UPPER 60S TO MIDDLE 70S ACROSS THE AREA. 
WILL MENTION POSSIBILITY OF STRONG THUNDERSTORMS IN HWO IN DAYS 2-7 
SECTION FOR FRIDAY. 

SATURDAY THROUGH TUESDAY...LONG TERM RUN TO RUN CONSISTENCY STILL A 
BIT UNCERTAIN WITH LATEST RUN. BOTH 00Z GFS/EUROPEAN RUN STILL 
ADVERTISING ANOTHER CLOSED LOW TO DEVELOP ACROSS NEW MEXICO BY 
FRIDAY AND MOVE TOWARD THE MID SOUTH BY SATURDAY AND SUNDAY. 
EUROPEAN STILL A BIT QUICKER THAN GFS BUT BOTH MODELS WITH OVERALL 
SLOWER PROGRESSION OF THE LOW MOVING INTO THE SOUTHERN PLAINS. 
SURFACE LOW PRESSURE WILL MOVE ALONG THE STALLED FRONT ACROSS THE 
LOWER MISSISSIPPI VALLEY ON SATURDAY PRODUCING ADDITIONAL SHOWERS 
AND THUNDERSTORMS. SURFACE LOW WILL THEN MOVE OFF INTO THE OHIO 
VALLEY/APPALACIANS BY MONDAY WITH WRAP AROUND SHOWERS AFFECTING THE 
MID SOUTH ON EASTER SUNDAY. HIGH PRESSURE WILL THEN BUILD BACK IN 
ACROSS THE MID SOUTH AT LEAST FOR THE BEGINNING OF THE WEEK. THE 
OVERALL UPPER AIR PATTERN ACROSS THE UNITED STATES WILL BE ZONAL 
FLOW WHICH SUGGESTS AN UNSETTLED WEATHER PATTERN FOR NEXT WEEK.  
&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.

CAPES ABOUT 1000 J/KG WITH SFC DEWPOINTS CLIMBING INTO THE UPPER 50S 
ATTM. AS COLD POOL ALOFT...-22C AT 500 MB...MOVES CLOSER AND SFC 
TEMPS CONT TO WARM FOR A COUPLE OF HOURS CAPES SHOULD REACH 2000 
J/KG. STEEP LAPSE RATES...LOW WET BULB ZERO FAVOR LARGE HAIL WITH 
THESE STORMS. EXPECT THE ARC OF DEVELOPING STORMS TO MOVE ACRS THE 
CWFA THIS AFTN AND EVENING. SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WATCH 68 IN EFFECT 
THROUGH 8 PM. THERE IS SOME LEFTOVER SHEAR INVOF OF WARMFNT...SO 
CANNOT RULE OUT AN ISOLD TORNADO ACRS NE AR/MO BOOTHEEL/NW TN. 

STORMS WL MOVE INTO MID TN LATE THIS EVENING. EXPECT LINGERING 
SHOWERS ACRS NRN AND ERN SXNS AFTER MIDNIGHT INTO EARLY WED AS THE 
UPPER LOW MOVES INTO THE OH VALLEY. THE LOW PULLS AWAY ON WED AS 
WEAK HIGH PRESSURE BUILD IN DURING THE AFTN.  

NEXT SYSTEM STARTS TO APPROACH ON THU AS A DECENT SHORTWAVE MOVES 
OUT OF THE PLAINS WITH SFC CYCLOGENESIS KS/MO REGION. GOOD WAA ACRS 
THE MID SOUTH SO SFC TEMPS WL CLIMB TOWARD 70 DEGREES. THU NIGHT A 
WEAK FRONT MOVES INTO THE CWA. SYSTEM SEEMS MOISTURE STARVED SO A 
20 POP WL DO FOR NOW. 

FRONT THEN STALLS ACRS THE REGION FRI INTO THE WEEKEND. MODELS 
DEPICTING SFC WAVES MOVING ALONG THE FRONT RESULTING IN A 
POTENTIALLY WET PERIOD. THIS FRONT EVENTUALLY CLEARS THE AREA BY THE 
BEGINNING OF NEXT WEEK.

1010 AM CST TUE MAR 22 2005

.DISCUSSION...
UPPER LOW SPINNING OVER SRN KS/NRN OK THIS MORNING WITH A COUPLE

SFC WARM FRONT LOCATED FROM SRN AR TO N CNTRL MS AND STARTING TO 
SURGE NORTHWARD. FRONT HAS MOVED PASSED GWO WHERE THE SFC DEWPOINT 
HAS CLIMBED TO 58F. WARM FRONT WL MOVE THROUGH N MS AND INTO W TN 
THIS AFTN. NAM MOVES IT TO NEAR THE KY/TN BORDER BY ABOUT 3 
PM...THIS MAY BE A LITTLE AGGRESSIVE. MID LEVEL DRY PUNCH WORKING 
INTO SW SXNS OF THE CWFA ATTM. QUESTION WL BE HOW MUCH SUNSHINE WL 
THE AREA GET LATE THIS MORNING/EARLY THIS AFTERNOON. SHOULD BE ENUF 
MIXING TO BREAK UP LOW CLOUD COVER ACRS THE DELTA. WITH SFC WARM 
FRONT MOVING NORTH AND POSSIBLE SUNSHINE EXPECT TEMPS TO MOVE TOWARD 
THE 70 DEGREE MARK. ALSO VERY COLD AIR ALOFT MOVING OVER THE REGION 
AS 500 MB LOW MOVES CLOSER THIS AFTERNOON. 500 MB TEMPS OF -21C JUST 
TO THE WEST. THIS WL PRODUCE VERY STEEP LAPSE ACRS THE REGION THIS 
AFTERNOON. SFC BASED CAPES SOUTH OF THE WARM FRONT WL APPROACH 
1500-2000 J/KG. 

EXPECT REDEVELOPMENT AROUND 3 PM PROBABLY NEAR THE RIVER...MOVING 
EAST ACRS W TN AND N MS THROUGH THE LATE AFTN INTO THE EARLY 
EVENING. DEPENDING ON WHERE THE WARM FRONT ENDS UP WL DICTATE THE 
MODE OF CONVECTION. HAIL WL BE THE MAIN THREAT NORTH OF THE 
FRONT...PROBABLY NE AR...MO BOOTHEEL AND NW TN. ALONG AND SOUTH OF 
THE WARM FRONT HAIL WL STILL BE THE GREATEST THREAT BUT THERE WL 
ALSO BE A POSSIBILITY OF TORNADOES AND DAMAGING WIND. SHEAR IS 
ADEQUATE FOR ROTATING STORMS AND NAM SOUNDING DATA INDICATES 
HELICITIES IN THE 150-200 M2/S2 RANGE THIS AFTN.

ACTIVITY WL TAPER OFF AROUND 9 PM AS STORMS EXIT INTO MID TN.

FXUS64 KMEG 221025
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
425 AM CST TUE MAR 22 2005

.DISCUSSION...LATEST SURFACE ANALYSIS PLACES SURFACE LOW PRESSURE 
ACROSS CENTRAL OKLAHOMA WITH WARM FRONT EXTENDING DOWN INTO 
SOUTHWESTERN ARKANSAS AND LOUISIANA. A TRAILING COLD FRONT EXTENDS 
ACROSS WESTERN TEXAS. CONCERNS FOR THIS FORECAST PACKAGE WILL FOCUS 
MAINLY ON SEVERE WEATHER POTENTIAL TODAY AND TONIGHT.

TODAY...BIG QUESTION FOR SEVERE WEATHER POTENTIAL TODAY WILL BE HOW 
FAR NORTH WARM FRONT MOVES ACROSS THE MID SOUTH AND AMOUNT OF 
SUNSHINE THE FORECAST AREA SEES TODAY. CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS NOT 
SHOWING MUCH MOVEMENT ON WARM FRONT AS OF YET WHILE SHORT TERM 
MODELS SUGGESTING WARM FRONT REACHING AREAS AS FAR NORTH AS MEMPHIS 
BY 12Z. SURFACE FRONT SHOULD HOPEFULLY START TO MOVE NORTH ACROSS 
THE REGION LATER THIS MORNING. UPPER LEVEL LOW CENTERED ACROSS 
SOUTHERN KANSAS/WESTERN OKLAHOMA WILL MOVE EAST TODAY WITH 850 MB 
WINDS INCREASING TO 35 KTS BY THIS AFTERNOON. UPPER LEVEL SUPPORT 
STILL BEING INDICATED BY MODELS AND 00Z 250MB ANALYSIS WITH UPPER 
LEVEL DIVERGENCE PRESENT AS THE MID SOUTH IS IN THE LEFT EXIT REGION 
OF UPPER LEVEL JET. 88D REGIONAL RADAR TRENDS SHOW SHOWERS AND 
THUNDERSTORMS AFFECTING THE MID SOUTH THIS MORNING. LATEST INFRARED 
AND WATER VAPOR IMAGERY SHOWING DRY SLOT TRYING TO WORK ITS WAY EAST 
BEHIND CURRENT CONVECTION. AS A RESULT...WILL SEE A BREAK IN THE 
ACTION BEFORE ADDITIONAL SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS DEVELOP BY THIS 
AFTERNOON. LATEST MODEL RUNS OF GFS/NAM SUGGESTING THAT ALL OF THE 
FORECAST AREA WILL REMAIN MOSTLY CLOUDY BUT SUSPECT THAT AREAS 
ESPECIALLY ACROSS NORTHERN MISSISSIPPI WILL BECOME PARTLY SUNNY 
DURING THE DAY. SEVERE WEATHER PARAMETERS FOR THIS AFTERNOON LOOK 
RATHER GOOD WITH 0-6KM BULK SHEAR VALUES AT OR ABOVE 40KTS...CAPES 
OF 1100-1800 J/KG...700 MB DEWPOINT DEPRESSIONS UPSTREAM ABOVE 
5C...AND STEEP 700-500 MB LAYER MID LEVEL LAPSE RATES AROUND 7 C/KM. 
BACKING SURFACE WINDS ALONG WITH VEERING WIND PROFILE STILL SUGGEST 
SUPERCELL THREAT AT ONSET OF CONVECTION...BUT THINK THAT A 
TRANSITION TO LINEAR CONVECTION WITH BOWING SEGMENTS WILL OCCUR 
TOWARDS EVENING AS WINDS GRADUALLY BECOME MORE UNIDIRECTIONAL BY 
00Z. THAT SAID...THINK BEST POTENTIAL FOR SEVERE WEATHER TODAY WILL 
BE PRIMARILY ACROSS NORTHERN MISSISSIPPI AND THE BORDERING 
TENNESSEE/ARKANSAS COUNTIES. 850MB TEMPERATURES WILL WARM TO AROUND 
9C BY THIS AFTERNOON...BUT THINK TEMPERATURES WILL REACH AROUND 70 
WHERE LESS CLOUD COVER WILL BE PRESENT. 

TONIGHT...SURFACE COLD FRONT AND MAIN LINE OF CONVECTION WILL PASS 
THROUGH THE FORECAST AREA DURING FIRST PART OF THE EVENING WITH SOME 
WRAP AROUND MOISTURE FROM THE UPPER LEVEL LOW PRODUCING SOME 
RESIDUAL RAIN SHOWERS ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA THROUGH MORNING. LOWS 
WILL DROP DOWN INTO THE 40S. 

WEDNESDAY AND WEDNESDAY NIGHT...CLOUDS WILL GRADUALLY BECOME PARTLY 
CLOUDY AS HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS IN ACROSS THE LOWER MISSISSIPPI 
VALLEY AND LOW PRESSURE MOVES OFF TO NEW ENGLAND. 850MB TEMPERATURES 
AROUND 4-5 C WILL SUPPORT HIGHS IN THE UPPER 60S AT BEST...BUT WILL 
KEEP TEMPERATURES IN THE UPPER 50S TO MIDDLE 60S WITH SOME CLOUD 
COVER PRESENT. LOWS WEDNESDAY NIGHT WILL DROP INTO THE LOWER 40S.

NO CHANGES MADE BEYOND THURSDAY. 

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...

FXUS64 KMEG 220350
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
950 PM CST MON MAR 21 2005

.DISCUSSION...

A DEEP LOW BOTH SFC AND ALOFT WAS CENTERED OVER NW OK THIS EVENING. 
A WARM FRONT EXTEND THROUGH NE TX...LA AND SRN MS/AL. EXPECT THIS 
FRONT TO CONTINUE MOVING NWD LATE TONIGHT INTO TUESDAY. 

LARGE AREA OF LIFT ACROSS THE SOUTHERN PLAINS IN AREA OF STRONG 
DIFFLUENCE ALOFT. A LARGE AREA OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS CONTINUE 
TO DEVELOP ACROSS AR/LA. MAINLY SHOWERS OCCURRING OVER WRN TN/NRN MS 
WHERE AIRMASS IS MORE STABLE.

TONIGHT...EXPECT SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS TO BECOME WIDESPREAD ACRS 
THE MID SOUTH. STRONG JET MOVING AROUND THE BASE OF THE UPPER LOW 
WILL APPROACH THE AREA AFTER MIDNIGHT. THESE WILL HELP PRODUCE LARGE 
AMOUNTS OF LIFT AND PROMOTE PLENTY OF SHOWER AND THUNDERSTORM 
DEVELOPMENT. THE GOOD THING IS THAT SEVERE PARAMETERS DO NOT COME 
TOGETHER TONIGHT. THERE IS A LOT OF SHEAR BUT INSTABILITY IS 
LACKING. THE PRECIP OVERNIGHT SHOULD SLOW MOVEMENT OF THE WARM FRONT 
NORTHWARD. AS A RESULT SFC BASED INSTABILITY WILL BE MEAGER THRU 12Z 
WITH LIFTED INDICES GREATER THAN ZERO AND CAPES LESS THAN A COUPLE 
HUNDRED JOULES ACRS NRN MS. IF THE WARM FRONT DOES MAKE BETTER 
PROGRESS THAN EXPECTED THERE IS A SMALL CHANCE OF SEVERE WEATHER IN 
THE CLARKSDALE AREA LATER TONIGHT.

TUESDAY...ONGOING SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS WILL EXIT THE MID SOUTH 
DURING THE MORNING HOURS SETTING UP AN INTERESTING SCENARIO. EXPECT 
A STRONG DRY SLOT TO PUSH INTO THE AREA FROM THE SW. MEANWHILE UPPER 
LOW WL MOVE TO SRN MO BRINING VERY COLD AIR ALOFT ACRS THE MID 
SOUTH. WITH A LITTLE SUNSHINE AND SFC TEMPS WARMING TO NEAR 70 
INSTABILITY WILL BE IMPRESSIVE. 700-500MB LAPSE RATES ARE GRATER 
THAN 7 C/KM WHILE SFC BASED CAPES SHOULD TOP 2000 J/KG. THE COLD 
FRONT/DRY LINE/SFC TROF WL PUSH INTO THIS AIRMASS DURING THE 
AFTERNOON AND EVENING RESULTING IN REDEVELOPMENT. THERE IS A 
MODERATE RISK OF SEVERE STORMS ACRS MOST OF THE MID SOUTH. THE 
GREATEST THREAT WILL BE LARGE HAIL. THERE IS SOME LOW LEVEL SHEAR 
AND DEPENDING ON POSITION OF THE WARM FRONT...A FEW TORNADOES ARE 
POSSIBLE ALONG WITH DAMAGING WINDS. THE THREAT SHOULD LAST UNTIL 
ABOUT 9 PM. 

UPPER LOW WL PULL WAY ON WED AS WEAK HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS IN FOR MID 
WEEK. MORE UNSETTLED WEATHER IN THE OFFING FOR THE END OF THE WEEK 
AND THE WEEKEND AS ANOTHER FRONT GETS HUNG UP ACRS THE AREA.  

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...

FXUS64 KMEG 211000
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
400 AM CST MON MAR 21 2005

.DISCUSSION...
AN ACTIVE WEATHER PERIOD IS IN STORE FOR THE MIDSOUTH THE NEXT COUPLE
OF DAYS. HOWEVER...MOST OF THE MIDSOUTH WILL REMAIN DRY THIS
MORNING. A WEST TO EAST STATIONARY FRONT ANALYZED BY THE SURFACE
DEWPOINT GRADIENT EXTENDS FROM CENTRAL AR THROUGH NORTH MS INTO NORTH
AL EARLY THIS MORNING. MID-LEVEL CLOUDS ARE EXPANDING OVER THE
MIDSOUTH BUT LOCAL RADARS ARE ECHO FREE. MEANWHILE...A NEGATIVELY
TILTED UPPER LEVEL TROUGH AND AN ASSOCIATED LOW AT THE SURFACE ARE
MOVING INTO THE SOUTHERN PLAINS. THUNDERSTORMS EXTEND FROM KS
SOUTHWARD THROUGH OK AHEAD OF THIS LOW THIS MORNING.

FOR TODAY...THE LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM WILL MOVE SLOWLY EASTWARD
THROUGH OK WHILE THE STATIONARY FRONT LIFTS NORTHEASTWARD AS A WARM
FRONT. EXCELLENT UPPER LEVEL DIFFLUENCE WILL EXIST AHEAD OF THE LOW
WITH STRONG UPPER LEVEL VERTICAL VELOCITIES. A NORTH TO SOUTH BAND
OF OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS WILL MOVE ACROSS AR TODAY...MOVING
INTO EASTERN AR THIS AFTERNOON. THESE SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS
WILL CONTINUE ACROSS THE MIDSOUTH TONIGHT. WHILE SHEAR VALUES / WIND
FIELDS ARE VERY IMPRESSIVE TONIGHT WITH 0-3 KM HELICITY VALUES
REACHING 300 TO 500 M2/S2 ACROSS MUCH OF THE MIDSOUTH...INSTABILITY
VALUES ARE MEAGER. CAPE AS SHOWN BY THE NAM ONLY INCREASES TO BETWEEN
200 AND 300 J/KG FROM EAST-CENTRAL AR INTO NORTHWEST MS AFT 06Z.
SURFACE DEWPOINTS ARE ANOTHER LIMITING FACTOR TONIGHT...REACHING
ONLY INTO THE 50S. AS A RESULT...SPC HAS LIMITED A SLIGHT RISK OF
SEVERE FOR TONIGHT TO JUST OUR EXTREME SOUTHWEST COUNTIES...
INCLUDING PARTS OF EAST-CENTRAL AR INTO NORTHWEST MS.

IT NOW APPEARS THAT THE BEST CHANCE OF SEVERE WILL COME TUESDAY INTO
TUESDAY EVENING. THE BAND OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS THAT MOVE
THROUGH TONIGHT WILL EXIT EASTERN AREAS TUESDAY MORNING. MEANWHILE...
THE UPPER LEVEL / SURFACE LOW WILL MOVE INTO SOUTHERN MO /
NORTHERN AR TUESDAY. A TRAILING COLD FRONT WILL MOVE INTO EASTERN AR
BY LATE MORNING...THEN MOVE ACROSS THE MIDSOUTH TUESDAY AFTERNOON AND
EVENING. VERY UNSTABLE AIR WILL DEVELOP AHEAD OF THE FRONT WITH CAPES
FORECAST TO CLIMB TO NEAR 3000 J/KG. THE FORECAST SOUNDING FOR 18Z
FROM THE NAM AT MEM SHOWS A CAPE OF 2904 J/KG...0 TO 3 KM STORM
RELATIVE HELICITY OF 149 M2/S2...A WET BULB ZERO OF 7120 FT...AND A
500 MB TEMPERATURE OF MINUS 19 DEGREES C. THINK THAT LARGE HAIL AND
DAMAGING WINDS WILL BE THE MAIN THREAT. HOWEVER...THERE COULD BE
ENOUGH DIRECTIONAL SHEAR FOR ISOLATED TORNADOES...PARTICULARLY WITH
THE WARM FRONT FORECAST TO EXTEND WEST TO EAST JUST NORTH OF THE
MIDSOUTH. SPC HAS PLACED MUCH OF WEST TN AND NORTH MS IN A MODERATE
RISK FOR SEVERE TUESDAY...WITH A SLIGHT RISK ELSEWHERE ACROSS THE
MIDSOUTH.

DRY AND COOLER WEATHER IS FORECAST TO RETURN WEDNESDAY AS HIGH
PRESSURE MOVES INTO THE AREA. WILL NOT MAKE ANY CHANGES TO THE
REMAINDER OF THE FORECAST.

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
1146 PM CST SUN MAR 20 2005

.DISCUSSION...

WENT AHEAD AND UPDATED FORECAST TO REMOVE POPS ALL AREAS EXCEPT FOR
FAR SOUTHEAST COUNTIES FOR TONIGHT. ALSO RAISED TEMPS A FEW DEGREES
TO REFLECT CURRENT TRENDS.

.PREVIOUS DISCUSSION (942 PM)...

A VERY WEAK SURFACE BOUNDARY ANALYZED OVER NORTH-CENTRAL MISSISSIPPI
AT 03Z WITH PRIMARY STATIONARY FRONT SITUATED ALONG THE GULF COAST.
WEAK UPPER LEVEL SHORTWAVE CONTINUING TO MOVE ACROSS CENTRAL
MISSISSIPPI THIS EVENING. SHOWERS HAVE DEVELOPED AHEAD OF THIS
FEATURE AND ALONG THE VERY WEAK BOUNDARY NOTED IN NORTH-CENTRAL
MISSISSIPPI THIS EVENING. THESE LIGHT SHOWERS SHOULD CLIP MY FAR
SOUTHEAST COUNTIES BEFORE MIDNIGHT. ALSO HAVE LEFT SMALL POPS IN
ACROSS FAR SOUTHERN COUNTIES TONIGHT TO ACCOUNT FOR ANY SHOWERS THAT
MAY DEVELOP ALONG SUBTLE BOUNDARY...BUT KEPT POPS LOW AS CONFIDENCE
IS LOW AND WEAK SUBSIDENCE BEHIND DEPARTING SHORTWAVE MAY KEEP PRECIP
FROM DEVELOPING.

AS FOR THE UPCOMING EVENT PROGGED FOR MONDAY AND MONDAY NIGHT...
APPEARS THAT WARM FRONT WILL BE SLOWER TO REACH THE MID SOUTH.
THEREFORE...THINK BEST TIMING FOR ANY SEVERE WEATHER WILL BE AFTER
9 PM MONDAY EVENING THROUGH TUESDAY MORNING AS WARM FRONT ADVANCES
ACROSS THE REGION AND MID AND UPPER LEVEL JET EJECTS OUT OF THE
SOUTHERN PLAINS PLACING REGION UNDER STRONGLY DIFFLUENT UPPER
FLOW. SHEAR ALSO INCREASES MARKEDLY LATER MONDAY NIGHT. LOW LEVEL
MOISTURE STILL MAY BE LIMITING FACTOR WITH DELAY OF WARM FRONTAL
PASSAGE. BEST CHANCES FOR SEVERE WEATHER APPEARS OVER AREAS SOUTH
AND WEST OF THE MEMPHIS AREA...INCLUDING PORTIONS OF EAST ARKANSAS
AND NORTHWEST MISSISSIPPI. LATER SHIFTS WILL PROVIDE
ADDITIONAL UPDATES ON SEVERE WEATHER THREAT.

UPDATED GRIDS AND ZONES OUT SHORTLY.

FXUS64 KMEG 202027
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
300 PM CST SUN MAR 20 2005

.DISCUSSION...
BIGGEST ISSUE ON THIS FORECAST PACKAGE IS THE POTENTIAL FOR SEVERE 
WEATHER MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY ACROSS THE MIDSOUTH.

WARM FRONT WILL CONTINUE TO BE POSITIONED SOUTH OF THE CWA. SHOWERS 
AND THUNDERSTORMS WILL DEVELOP OUT AHEAD AND ALONG THE FRONT. EXPECT 
SOME OF THESE TO MOVE INTO SOUTHWESTERN SECTIONS OF THE CWA 
OVERNIGHT TONIGHT SO WILL KEEP POPS ACROSS THIS AREA. HOWEVER DO 
EXPECT CLOUDS TO INCREASE THROUGHOUT THE MIDSOUTH TONIGHT OUT AHEAD 
OF THE WARM FRONT.

WARM FRONT WILL PUSH INTO THE AREA ON MONDAY. THIS WILL SPREAD 
SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS INTO THE ENTIRE CWA. MODELS ARE DIFFERING 
ON HOW WIDESPREAD AND IF IT WILL LAST ALL DAY MONDAY. GUIDANCE HAS 
POPS ALL OVER THE PLACE. WILL TRY TO GO WITH A COMPROMISE. A BAND OF 
SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS WILL DEVELOP OUT AHEAD OF AN APPROACHING 
COLD FRONT OVER ARKANSAS/TEXAS/LOUISIANA AND WILL MAKE ITS WAY INTO 
WESTERN PORTIONS OF THE MIDSOUTH LATE MONDAY NIGHT INTO TUESDAY 
MORNING. QUESTION WILL BE WILL ANY SEVERE WEATHER OCCUR WITH IT. IF 
PRECIP OCCURS ALL DAY MONDAY THE ATMOSPHERE MAY BE TOO STABLE FOR 
ANYTHING SEVERE TO OCCUR. HOWEVER IF THE PRECIP ENDS EARLY AND WARM 
UNSTABLE AIR IS ABLE TO PENETRATE INTO THE MIDSOUTH THEN THE 
THUNDERSTORMS THAT OCCUR COULD BECOME SEVERE. MIDSOUTH WILL BE 
LOCATED IN THE LEFT EXIT REGION OF AN STRONG UPPER LEVEL JET. SO THE 
DYNAMICS ARE IN PLACE...WILL JUST HAVE TO WAIT AND SEE IF THE AREA 
WILL HAVE ENOUGH INSTABILITY. THINK THE BEST AREA TO SEE SEVERE IF 
IT OCCURS WILL BE NORTHWEST MISSISSIPPI LATE MONDAY NIGHT...MOVING 
INTO NORTHEAST MISSISSIPPI. TORNADOES...LARGE HAIL...AND DAMAGING 
WINDS WILL BE THE MAIN THREAT IF SEVERE WEATHER OCCURS MONDAY 
NIGHT/TUESDAY MORNING.

AFTER THE INITIAL ROUND OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS MOVES THROUGH 
THE AREA MONDAY NIGHT AND TUESDAY MORNING...EXPECT A BREAK IN PRECIP 
BEFORE REDEVELOPMENT OCCURS ALONG THE COLD FRONT. WITH THE BREAK IN 
PRECIP THE ATMOSPHERE WILL BECOME UNSTABLE ALLOWING FOR ANY STORMS 
THAT DEVELOP TO HAVE THE POTENTIAL OF BECOMING SEVERE. LARGE HAIL WILL 
BE THE MAIN THREAT WITH THESE STORMS WITH EASTERN PORTIONS OF THE 
MIDSOUTH SEEING THE BEST CHANCE FOR SEVERE WEATHER DURING THIS TIME.

HIGH PRESSURE WILL BUILD INTO THE AREA ON WEDNESDAY BRINGING DRY 
CONDITIONS BACK TO THE MIDSOUTH. THE NEXT CHANCE OF RAIN WILL OCCUR 
ON THURSDAY NIGHT WITH AN APPROACHING LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM. THE SYSTEM 
WILL BRING RAIN CHANCES TO THE AREA THROUGH THE EARLY PART OF THE 
WEEKEND. DRY WEATHER WILL RETURN BY SUNDAY.
&&

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
358 AM CST SUN MAR 20 2005

.DISCUSSION...
A COLD FRONT IS MOVING VERY SLOWLY SOUTH OF NORTH MS THIS MORNING.
HOWEVER...THE DRY AIR HAS BEEN SLOW TO SPREAD INTO THE SOUTHEAST
CORNER OF WEST TN AND INTO NORTH MS...STRATUS HAS FORMED IN THIS
AREA WITH DENSE FOG ACROSS NORTHEAST MS. ISSUED A DENSE FOG
ADVISORY FOR PART OF NORTHEAST MS UNTIL 14Z.

FOR TODAY...THINK HIGH PRESSURE WILL CONTINUE TO SPREAD INTO THE
MIDSOUTH WITH LOWER SURFACE DEWPOINTS. THINK THE STRATUS WILL THIN
OUT EARLY THIS MORNING. AN UPPER LEVEL SHORT WAVE WILL MOVE TO THE
SOUTH OF THE MIDSOUTH TODAY CAUSING THUNDERSTORMS. CIRRUS FROM THIS
SYSTEM WILL AFFECT THE SOUTHERN HALF OF THE MIDSOUTH. MEANWHILE...MID
AND HIGH LEVEL CLOUDS WILL SPREAD INTO THE AREA FROM THE SOUTHWEST
THIS AFTERNOON AS OVERRUNNING SETS UP OVER THE FRONTAL SYSTEM
STALLING TO OUR SOUTH AND WEST. BUT OVERALL THE FIRST DAY OF SPRING
WILL BE PLEASANT WEATHERWISE FOR THE MIDSOUTH.

FRONTAL SYSTEM WILL LIFT BACK TO THE NORTH TONIGHT AND MOVE THROUGH
THE MIDSOUTH MONDAY. MODELS DIFFER ON TIMING AND AMOUNT OF
PRECIPITATION ASSOCIATED WITH THIS FRONT. ATTM...WILL NOT MAKE MUCH
CHANGE TO CURRENT FORECAST FOR TONIGHT AND MONDAY. THINK THERE WILL
BE A CHANCE OF SHOWERS SPREADING INTO THE MIDSOUTH FROM THE SOUTHWEST
TONIGHT. ON MONDAY...SCATTERED TO NUMEROUS SHOWERS CAN BE EXPECTED
ALONG WITH A FEW THUNDERSTORMS.

A SIGNIFICANT STORM SYSTEM WILL AFFECT THE MIDSOUTH MONDAY NIGHT
INTO TUESDAY. A STRONG AND NEGATIVELY TILTED TROUGH WILL APPROACH THE
MIDSOUTH MONDAY NIGHT WITH SURFACE LOW PRESSURE MOVING THROUGH
THE SOUTHERN PLAINS. SPC HAS PLACED THE AREAS FROM MEMPHIS SOUTH
AND WEST IN A MODERATE RISK OF SEVERE...WITH A SLIGHT RISK ELSEWHERE
ACROSS THE MIDSOUTH. MODELS INDICATE A SQUALL LINE WILL MOVE THROUGH
THE MIDSOUTH MONDAY NIGHT AND EARLY TUESDAY. TORNADIC SUPERCELLS ARE
POSSIBLE AHEAD OF THIS LINE. DAMAGING WINDS...LARGE HAIL AND
ISOLATED TORNADOES CAN BE EXPECTED WITH THE SQUALL LINE. THE NAM
INDICATED CAPES OF 1000 TO 1500 J/KG ALONG WITH 0-3 KM HELICITY
BETWEEN 400 AND 500 M2/S2 DEVELOPING ACROSS NORTH MS MONDAY NIGHT.
A SOUTHERLY 850 MB JET WILL INCREASE TO 50 KNOTS WITH STRONG
DIFFLUENCE ALOFT.

THE ACTUAL COLD FRONT WILL NOT MOVE THROUGH THE MIDSOUTH UNTIL
TUESDAY AFTERNOON AS THE UPPER LEVEL LOW MOVES INTO THE AREA.
ADDITIONAL SEVERE THUNDERSTORMS ARE POSSIBLE ALONG THE COLD FRONT AND
IN ASSOCIATION WITH THE COLD POOL ALOFT WITH THE UPPER LOW IF THE
ENVIRONMENT CAN RECOVER BEHIND THE SQUALL LINE.

&&

INGREDIENTS...LARGE HAIL...DAMAGING WINDS...AND EVEN A FEW TORNADOES 
WILL BE POSSIBLE ACROSS THE AREA. 

HIGH PRESSURE WILL BUILD INTO THE AREA FOR WEDNESDAY THROUGH THURSDAY 
NIGHT ALLOWING FOR DRY CONDITIONS TO PREVAIL ACROSS THE CWA. 

THE NEXT LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM WILL BEGIN TO MOVE INTO THE CWA ON 
FRIDAY AND WILL BRING RAIN CHANCES BACK TO THE MIDSOUTH THROUGH THE

HAS COME TO AN END ACROSS MOST AREAS. THIS DRYING TREND WILL
CONTINUE WITH SKIES SLOWLY CLEARING FROM WEST TO EAST THROUGH THE
DAY AS THE UPPER TROUGH AXIS CONTINUES PUSHING EAST AND WEAK HIGH
PRESSURE BUILDS IN. CLOUDS WILL LINGER FOR MOST OF THE DAY ACROSS
NORTHEAST MISSISSIPPI AS THIS AREA WILL REMAIN UNDER THE INFLUENCE OF
THE UPPER TROUGH THE LONGEST. CLOUD COVER AND MOVEMENT OF THE UPPER
TROUGH WILL ALSO DIRECTLY INFLUENCE HIGH TEMPERATURES FOR THIS
AFTERNOON. WESTERN PORTIONS OF THE AREA WILL SEE TEMPERATURES REBOUND
INTO THE UPPER 50S...WITH AMPLE AMOUNTS OF SUNSHINE. EASTERN AREAS
WILL HOLD ONTO THE CLOUDS INTO LATER THIS AFTERNOON...HOLDING HIGH
TEMPERATURES BACK IN THE MID 50S. SKIES SHOULD CLEAR ACROSS THE
ENTIRE MID SOUTH TONIGHT UNDER THE INFLUENCE OF WEAK HIGH PRESSURE.

HIGH PRESSURE WILL SLIDE QUICKLY EAST ON FRIDAY...ALLOWING WINDS TO
VEER AROUND TO THE SOUTH AND LOW LEVEL WARM ADVECTION TO BEGIN IN
EARNEST. TEMPERATURES ON FRIDAY AFTERNOON SHOULD RESPOND TO THE
WARM ADVECTION AND WARM TO ABOVE SEASONAL AVERAGES. A NORTHERN
STREAM DISTURBANCE ANALYZED BY WATER VAPOR IMAGERY THIS MORNING OVER
THE PACIFIC NORTHWEST WILL CONTINUE TO TRAVERSE SOUTHEASTWARD
THROUGH THE END OF THE WEEK...EJECTING ACROSS THE CENTRAL PLAINS
STATES ON FRIDAY. THIS UPPER LEVEL FEATURE WILL HELP SEND A SURFACE
COLD FRONT TOWARDS THE MID SOUTH FRIDAY NIGHT...AND ACROSS THE AREA
SATURDAY MORNING. BOTH THE NAM/GFS INDICATING THAT A LINE OF
SHOWERS AND A FEW THUNDERSTORMS WILL DEVELOP AHEAD OF THE COLD FRONT
AND WILL MOVE ACROSS THE AREA FRIDAY NIGHT AND SATURDAY MORNING.
MODELS INDICATING SUFFICIENT FRONTAL CONVERGENCE AND GOOD MID LEVEL
LAPSE RATES (AND ENOUGH MID LEVEL INSTABILITY) TO SUPPORT THUNDER AT
THIS TIME. LOW LEVEL MOISTURE WILL REMAIN SOMEWHAT LIMITED...SO
THUNDERSTORMS SHOULD REMAIN MORE ISOLATED IN NATURE.

FRONT SHOULD SLIP SOUTH OF THE REGION ON SATURDAY AFTERNOON BEFORE
STALLING. A BRIEF PERIOD OF DRY WEATHER CAN BE EXPECTED FOR SATURDAY
AFTERNOON AND NIGHT. THE UPPER LEVEL FLOW WILL BECOME MORE
SOUTHWESTERLY BY SUNDAY...WITH MOISTURE OVERRUNNING THE STALLED
FRONTAL BOUNDARY. HAVE INCLUDED POPS IN THE FORECAST FOR SUNDAY TO
ACCOUNT FOR THIS. CHANCES FOR SHOWERS AND A FEW THUNDERSTORMS WILL
REMAIN IN THE FORECAST FOR THE FIRST HALF OF NEXT WEEK...AS A SERIES
OF SHORTWAVE DISTURBANCES MOVE ACROSS THE AREA IN THE SOUTHWEST FLOW
ALOFT.

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.

AND HAVE ADDED LIGHT RAIN OR SNOW WORDING TO FORECAST. PRECIPITATION
REMAINS VERY LIGHT...SO NOT EXPECTING ANY SNOW ACCUMULATIONS IN

910 PM CST WED MAR 16 2005

.DISCUSSION...

UPPER TROUGH WITH AXIS FROM STL TO FSM BRINGING RAIN TO THE
MIDSOUTH ATTM. AXIS OF TROUGH WILL MOVE TO MS RIVER BY DAYBREAK
ACCORDING TO THE RUC. THUS...SEE CONTINUED CHANCE OR RAIN FOR THE
AREA THROUGH THE NIGHT. WINDS TO BE NORTHEAST TO NORTH REST OF
TONIGHT. WIND SPD HAS BEEN QUITE VARIABLE FROM ONE PLACE TO THE
NEXT AND FORESEE SPD VARIABILITY TO CONTINUE THROUGH THE NIGHT.
RAIN AND WIND MAKING FOR A RATHER RAW NIGHT. EXPECT RAIN TO
DIMINISH FROM THE WEST TONIGHT...BUT LINGERING LIGHT RAIN WILL BE
NOTICE IN EASTERN PARTS OF THE AREA PAST DAWN THURSDAY.

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 161042
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
441 AM CST WED MAR 16 2005

.DISCUSSION...

A VARIETY OF WEATHER OCCURRING ACROSS THE MID SOUTH THIS MORNING...
WITH MAINLY RAIN ACROSS MOST OF THE AREA. REPORTS OF SNOW HAVE
BEEN RECEIVED FROM PORTIONS OF NORTHWEST TENNESSEE EARLY THIS
MORNING...WITH CARROLL COUNTY REPORTING SNOW COVERING THE GROUND
(MAINLY ON GRASSY SURFACES). TEMPERATURES ACROSS THIS AREA HAVE
HOVERED AROUND 32 DEGREES...SO MAY BE A FEW SLICK SPOTS ON ROADWAYS
ACROSS CARROLL COUNTY TENNESSEE. THIS OCCURANCE APPEARS RATHER
ISOLATED...SO HELD OFF ON ADVISORY...WITH PRECIPITATION TAPERING OFF
TO VERY LIGHT MIX. ELSEWHERE EXPECT RAIN TO BECOME INTERMITTENT AND
LIGHT THIS MORNING. DEEPER MOISTURE WILL CONTINUE TO MOVE EAST AS A
SURFACE LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM NOW OVER THE NORTH-CENTRAL GULF OF MEXICO
MOVES NORTHEAST AND FURTHER AWAY FROM THE AREA. THE MID SOUTH SHOULD
GET A BRIEF BREAK FROM ANY SIGNIFICANT RAIN TODAY...WITH ONLY SLIGHT
CHANCES FOR LIGHT RAIN OR DRIZZLE THROUGH EARLY THIS AFTERNOON.
TEMPERATURES WILL BE HELD BELOW AVERAGE DUE TO ABUNDANT CLOUD COVER
AND LIGHT RAIN CHANCES.

A STRONG UPPER SHORTWAVE TROUGH ANALYZED IN THE WATER VAPOR IMAGERY
OVER THE SOUTHERN PLAINS STATES THIS MORNING WILL CONTINUE TO MOVE
EAST OVER THE MID SOUTH TONIGHT. HAVE INCLUDED ADDITIONAL CHANCES FOR
MAINLY LIGHT RAIN OVER MAINLY SOUTHERN PORTIONS OF THE AREA...WHERE
BEST MOISTURE WILL REMAIN. ONCE THIS SHORTWAVE TROUGH CLEARS EAST
OF THE AREA...EXPECT DRY WEATHER FOR THURSDAY THROUGH FRIDAY AS WEAK
HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS IN. WINDS WILL ALSO VEER BACK AROUND TO A MORE
SOUTHERLY DIRECTION LATER ON THURSDAY INTO FRIDAY...ALONG WITH AN
INCREASE IN LOW LEVEL WARM ADVECTION. THIS WILL RESULT IN A WARMING
TREND FOR THE END OF THE WEEK...WITH TEMPERATURES REBOUNDING TO
NEAR OR ABOVE SEASONAL AVERAGES FOR FRIDAY.

A NORTHERN STREAM SHORTWAVE WILL APPROACH THE AREA LATER ON FRIDAY...
HELPING TO SEND A COLD FRONT EAST ACROSS THE MID SOUTH FRIDAY
NIGHT. LOW LEVEL MOISTURE RETURN MAY BE SOMEWHAT LIMITED WITH THIS
SYSTEM...BUT GOOD FRONTAL FORCING COMBINED WITH STEEPER MID LEVEL
LAPSE RATES AND UPPER LEVEL DIFLUENCE...SHOULD LEAD TO THE
DEVELOPMENT OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS FRIDAY NIGHT. THIS FRONT
SHOULD SWEEP ACROSS THE AREA BY SATURDAY MORNING BEFORE STALLING TO
OUR SOUTH. EXPECT A DRY AND SEASONABLY MILD SATURDAY AS WEAK HIGH
PRESSURE BRIEFLY BUILDS OVER THE REGION. MOISTURE SHOULD QUICKLY
RETURN ON SUNDAY...AS DEEPER MOISTURE OVERRUNS THE STALLED FRONT AS
THE UPPER FLOW TURNS MORE SOUTHWESTERLY. A SERIES OF SHORTWAVES
WILL MOVE THROUGH THE UPPER FLOW INTO THE BEGINNING OF NEXT WEEK
WITH CHANCES FOR RAIN AND THUNDERSTORMS INCREASING FOR SUNDAY
THROUGH MONDAY.

A MORE SIGNIFICANT SHORTWAVE WILL MOVE ACROSS THE AREA BY NEXT
TUESDAY WITH SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS POSSIBLE. TEMPERATURES WILL
CONTINUE TO WARM INTO THE 60S FOR THE FIRST HALF OF NEXT WEEK.


.MEG...WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MS...NONE.
MO...NONE.
TN...NONE.

AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...RETRANSMITTED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
1030 PM CST TUE MAR 15 2005

.DISCUSSION...

RAIN IN NORTHERN TWO THIRDS OF THE MIDSOUTH IS CHANGING TO SLEET
AND THEN SNOW. BELIEVE THIS ACTIVITY WILL LAST THIS EVENING IN
WESTERN COUNTIES AND TO AFTER SUNRISE NEARER THE TN RIVER AND
EXTREME NORTHEAST MISSISSIPPI. SLEET/SNOW SEEM TO MELTING AS IT
FALLS. ACCUMULATIONS WILL BE MAINLY ON GRASS AND BE LESS THAN AN
INCH. COUNTIES FARTHER NORTH SHOULD GET HEAVIEST AMTS. SNOW/SLEET
WILL END BY MID MORNING AND MELTING WILL QUICKLY OCCUR.

MODEL SOUNDINGS SUGGEST PRECIP NORTH OF TN MS BORDER MAY MIX OR
CHANGE COMPLETELY OVER TO SNOW...ESPECIALLY ACROSS THE NORTHERN
THIRD OF THE FORECAST AREA.

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 152104 AAA
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
303 PM CST TUE MAR 15 2005

.UPDATED DISCUSSION...HAVE RECEIVED SEVERAL REPORTS OF SLEET MIXED
WITH LIGHT RAIN ACROSS NORTHERN SECTIONS OF MISSISSIPPI...EVEN WITH
AIR TEMPS IN LOWER 50S. WITH DEWPOINTS IN LOWER 20S...CANNOT RULE
OUT THESE REPORTS. WILL CARRY MENTION OF CHANCE OF SLEET IN ALL
AREAS TONIGHT. REMAINDER OF DISCUSSION STILL APPLIES.

.PREVIOUS DISCUSSION ISSUED AT 137 PM....
LITTLE CHANGE IN SURFACE FEATURES SINCE MORNING DISCUSSION. STILL
SEEING PLENTY OF ECHOES ON RADAR...BUT LITTLE PRECIPITATION ACTUALLY
BEING REPORTED. TEMPERATURES RANGING FROM MID 40S NORTH TO MID 50S
SOUTH...WITH DEWPOINTS IN THE TEENS AND 20S UNDER BRISK NORTHEAST
WIND.
&&

.SHORT TERM (THROUGH FRIDAY)...
BIGGEST FORECAST ISSUE IS IN THE FIRST 18 HOURS...AND MAINLY
ABOUT PRECIPITATION TYPE. ISENTROPIC LIFT TRIGGERING PRECIPITATION
ECHOES ACROSS THE AREA...BUT NOT SEEING MANY GROUND TRUTH REPORTS OF
PRECIPITATION REACHING THE GROUND.

MODELS SATURATE THE AIRMASS ENOUGH TO WHERE THERE SHOULD BE SOME
MEASURABLE PRECIPITATION ACROSS THE AREA...BUT NOT A LOT. ETA
SOUNDINGS INDICATE PRECIPITATION COULD BE MIXED OR FROZEN ACROSS
ABOUT NORTHERN 2 TIERS OF COUNTIES. GFS ISNT QUITE AS BULLISH ON
COLD AIR...BUT WILL MENTION A MIX FAR NORTH AFTER MIDNIGHT. LIKELY TO
CATEGORICAL POPS DURING THE EVENING...THEN LOWERING SOME AFTER
MIDNIGHT. WILL LEAVE CHANCE POPS IN FOR WEDNESDAY...AS STORM TRACK
NEVER GETS VERY FAR SOUTH OF OUR AREA...AND IMPULSES CONTINUE TO MOVE
TOWARD US FROM THE SOUTHWEST.

LOOKS LIKE MAIN PIECE OF SOUTHWEST SYSTEM COMES AT US WEDNESDAY
NIGHT INTO THURSDAY. PRECIPITATION PROBABLY A LITTLE MORE LIKELY
SOUTH OF US THAN ACROSS OUR AREA. TEMPERATURES A LITTLE WARMER...SO
ALL LIQUID THAT TIME AROUND. A BREAK IN THE WEATHER FOR THURSDAY
NIGHT AND FRIDAY.

TEMPERATURES WILL BE WELL BELOW NORMAL THROUGH THURSDAY...WITH SOME
MODERATION FRIDAY. DIDNT SEE A NEED TO MAKE MAJOR CHANGES TO
FORECAST TEMPS BEYOND FIRST PERIOD.
&&

.LONG TERM (BEYOND FRIDAY)...
MEDIUM RANGE MODELS COMING INTO A LITTLE MORE AGREEMENT WITH THE
PATTERN...AS FLOW FINALLY BECOMES ZONAL TO SOUTHWEST OVER THE
WEEKEND. THIS WILL ALLOW MILDER WEATHER TO MOVE INTO THE MIDSOUTH...
BUT WITH CHANCES OF PRECIPITATION...PROBABLY SUNDAY AND MONDAY.
MODELS DO DISAGREE ON EXACT LOCATION AND STRENGTH OF THE MAIN
SYSTEM...SO WONT HIT POPS TOO HARD FOR NOW. HPC POPS DONT MATCH UP
WELL WITH THEIR SURFACE PROGS AROUND DAYS 5 AND 6...WENT OUR OWN WAY.
GFS RUN AT 12Z INDICATES OUR MINS FOR SUNDAY NIGHT ARE WAY TOO LOW.
BUMPED THEM UP A FEW DEGREES...BUT NOT AS HIGH AS GUIDANCE WOULD
INDICATE...BECAUSE WE ARE ALREADY WARMER THAN THE NEIGHBORS BY
SEVERAL DEGREES.

&&

.MEG...WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MS...NONE.
MO...NONE.
TN...NONE.
&&

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
1039 AM CST TUE MAR 15 2005

.DISCUSSION...
SURFACE HIGH NEAR CHICAGO THIS MORNING AND MOVING SLOWLY EASTWARD.
SOUTHWEST UPPER SYSTEM KICKING OUT A PIECE OF ENERGY THIS MORNING.
ISENTROPIC LIFT WELL UNDERWAY WITH PLENTY OF PRECIPITATION ECHOES
ACROSS ARKANSAS. NOT SEEING MANY GROUND TRUTH REPORTS OF
PRECIPITATION REACHING THE GROUND HOWEVER.

DEWPOINTS CONSIDERABLY HIGHER ACROSS ARKANSAS THAN THE REST OF THE
AREA. FIGURE THAT DRY AIR WILL CONTINUE TO WIN OVER THE AREAS EAST OF
THE MISSISSIPPI RIVER FOR SEVERAL MORE HOURS. WILL NEED TO
UPDATE ZONE PACKAGE BY NOON TO ACCOUNT FOR MORNING WORDING...BUT
ALSO PLAN TO RAISE POPS TO LIKELY ACROSS ENTIRE AREA...AND MAY GO
CATEGORICAL SOUTHWEST.

WILL FINE TUNE TEMPERATURE GRIDS AFTER 17Z OBS COME IN. MAY NEED
TO LOWER MAX TEMPS ACROSS THE NORTHERN PORTION OF THE AREA. NAM
MODEL STILL INDICATING POTENTIAL FOR SNOW TONIGHT OVER NORTHERN
SECTIONS. WILL ASSESS EARLY HOURS OF GFS TO SEE IF WE NEED TO MAKE
A CHANGE ON PRECIPITATION TYPE FOR TONIGHT IN THOSE AREAS.

FXUS64 KMEG 150859
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
259 AM CST TUE MAR 15 2005

.DISCUSSION...
FAIRLY ACTIVE WEATHER PATTERN IN STORE FOR THE NEXT FEW DAYS AS A
SERIES OF SHORTWAVES MOVE THROUGH THE REGION. CURRENTLY...SOME VERY
LIGHT RAIN IS FALLING OVER SOUTHERN HALF OF FORECAST AREA. MOST OF
THE RAIN IS NOT REACHING THE GROUND AND WHAT IS COMING DOWN AS
SPRINKLES. WILL LEAVE MENTION OF SPRINKLES IN THE FORECAST FOR THIS
MORNING OVER THOSE AREAS. RAIN CHANCE BEGIN TO INCREASE THIS
AFTERNOON AS FIRST SHORTWAVE APPROACHES THE REGION FROM NORTHEAST
TEXAS. BEST CHANCE OF RAIN WITH THIS SYSTEM IS TONIGHT WHERE HAVE
KEPT CATEGORICAL POPS IN. MODELS STILL NOT IN AGREEMENT REGARDING A
POSSIBLE RAIN/SNOW MIX. GFS IS THE WARMER MODEL WHILE THE NAM LEANS
MORE TOWARD A POSSIBLE MIX FOR THE NORTHERN HALF OF THE FORECAST
AREA. PREVIOUS FORECASTS HAVE LEANED TOWARD THE GFS AND SEE NO
REASON TO SWITCH AT THIS TIME SO NO MENTION OF SNOW AT THIS TIME.
THINGS BEGIN TO QUIET DOWN SOMEWHAT ON WEDNESDAY WITH CHANCE POPS
ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA AS SURFACE LOW WHICH IS FORECAST TO DEVELOP
IN THE NORTHERN GULF PULLS NORTHEAST TOWARD THE CAROLINA COAST. NEXT
SHORTWAVE MOVES THROUGH THE REGION THURSDAY SO THERE STILL BE A
CHANCE OF RAIN. THINGS FINALLY DRY OUT FOR THURSDAY NIGHT AND FRIDAY
BUT THEN UPPER LEVEL LOW PULLS INTO THE CENTRAL PLAINS ON FRIDAY
AND BRINGS ANOTHER SHOT OF RAIN FOR FRIDAY NIGHT. DRY WEATHER
RETURNS FOR SATURDAY AND SUNDAY BEFORE ANOTHER SHORTWAVE MOVES
THROUGH SUNDAY NIGHT AND MONDAY. TEMPERATURES WILL BEGIN TO WARM UP
SOME BY THE WEEKEND AND MORE SO DURING THE BEGINNING OF NEXT WEEK.

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 141955
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
155 PM CST MON MAR 14 2005

.DISCUSSION...
SURFACE HIGH OVER NORTHERN PLAINS WILL MOVE EASTWARD THROUGH
TONIGHT. ONLY A FEW HIGH AND MID CLOUDS ACROSS THE AREA THIS
AFTERNOON WITH TEMPERATURES MAINLY IN THE 50S. DEWPOINTS ARE
RATHER LOW...UPPER TEENS TO MID 20S.
&&

.SHORT TERM (THROUGH THURSDAY)...
QUIET EVENING TONIGHT UNDER SURFACE RIDGE. IMPULSE KICKING OUT OF
SOUTHWEST LOW WILL START TO INCREASE HIGH CLOUDS TONIGHT. COMBINED
WITH WINDS AROUND 10 KNOTS...DONT EXPECT LOWS TO BE QUITE AS COOL AS
THIS MORNING. IF WINDS DIE OFF...HOWEVER...FORECAST WILL BE AT LEAST
3 TO 5 DEGREES TOO WARM.

ISENTROPIC LIFT WILL ALLOW CEILINGS TO LOWER DURING THE DAY ON
TUESDAY...WITH RAIN DEVELOPING IN WESTERN SECTIONS BY LATE MORNING
OR EARLY AFTERNOON. IT WILL TAKE A WHILE FOR PRECIP TO REACH THE
SURFACE WITH EXTREMELY LOW DEWPOINTS TO OVERCOME. ONCE PRECIPITATION
STARTS...TEMPERATURES WILL BE STEADY OR FALL. POPS FOR THE 12 HOUR
PERIOD TOMORROW WILL RANGE FROM CHANCE NORTHEAST TO LIKELY
SOUTHWEST.

INVERTED TROF MOVES ACROSS THE AREA TUESDAY NIGHT INTO EARLY
WEDNESDAY. EXPECT EVERYONE TO RECEIVE RAIN OVERNIGHT. PRECIPITATION
TYPE MAY BECOME AN ISSUE. GFS IS QUITE A BIT WARMER THAN NAM...AND
HANDLED TEMPERATURE REGIME LAST SYSTEM BETTER. FORECAST WILL TREND
TOWARD GFS...KEEPING ALL PRECIPITATION TUESDAY NIGHT LIQUID...BUT
LATER FORECASTS WILL NEED TO MONITOR THIS.

PRECIPITATION SHOULD END DURING THE DAY WEDNESDAY...WITH THURSDAY
BEING DRY.

TEMPERATURES...TONIGHT AND TUESDAY ALREADY DISCUSSED ABOVE. LOWERED
MINS TUESDAY NIGHT AND MAXES WEDNESDAY FROM PREVIOUS FORECAST DUE
TO PRECIPITATION. KEEPING ALL SITES ABOVE FREEZING HOWEVER. NO
SIGNIFICANT COLD AIR ADVECTING INTO THE AREA BEHIND THIS SYSTEM...SO
TEMPERATURES SHOULD EVENTUALLY START MODERATING ON THURSDAY.
&&

.LONG TERM (AFTER THURSDAY)...
SYSTEMS MOVING THROUGH FRIDAY NIGHT AND SUNDAY NIGHT...AT LEAST
ACCORDING TO THE MEDIUM RANGE MODELS. CONSIDERING THE TRACK RECORD OF
THE PAST FEW WEEKS...WILL NOT JUMP TOTALLY ON A SOLUTION YET. THERE
IS A LITTLE MORE CONSISTENCY BETWEEN MODELS TODAY. IF TRENDS
CONTINUE...WILL BEEF UP POPS FOR THESE PERIODS TONIGHT AND TOMORROW.
&&

.MEG...WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 141620
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
1020 AM CST MON MAR 14 2005

.MORNING UPDATE DISCUSSION...
LITTLE NEED FOR AN UPDATE THIS MORNING. MID/HIGH LEVEL CLOUDS ACROSS
OK AND AR WILL MOVE INTO THE AREA THIS AFTERNOON...SO PARTLY CLOUDY
SHOULD SUFFICE. TEMPERATURES MAINLY IN THE 40S...AND WITH NORTHEAST
WINDS...HIGHS IN THE 50S STILL LOOK GOOD. NO UPDATES PLANNED AT THIS
TIME.
&&

.PREVIOUS DISCUSSION ISSUED AT 300 AM CST...
COLD FRONT HAS MOVED WELL SOUTH OF THE AREA THIS MORNING WITH JUST
SOME LEFT OVER CLOUD COVER ACRS NE MS WHICH WL CLEAR OUT THIS
MORNING. COOL HIGH PRESSURE WL PREVAIL TODAY WITH PLENTY OF SUNSHINE
AND TEMPS 5-10 DEGREES BLO NORMAL. CLOUDS WL START TO INCREASE LATER
TONIGHT AS HIGH PRESSURE BEGINS TO RETREAT AND THE NEXT SYSTEM
STARTS MOVING OUT OF THE SW U.S. CLOUDS THICKEN AND RAIN CHANCES
BEGIN TO INCREASE ON TUE AS FAST MOVING SW FLOW OVERRUNS COOL
AIRMASS ACRS THE LOWER MS VALLEY. CLOUDS AND PRECIP WL HELP KEEP
TEMPS ON THE COOL SIDE.

VERY ACTIVE PATTERN SETTING UP WITH A RAPID SUCCESSION OF SYSTEMS
THROUGH THIS PART OF THE COUNTRY FOR THE NEXT WEEK. LOOKS LIKE THE
BEST CHANCES FOR PRECIP...AT LEAST FOR THE SHORT TERM...WL BE TUE
NIGHT. SHORT TERM MODELS HAVE BEGUN TO RALLY AROUND A SOLUTION IN
WHICH A DECENT SHORTWAVE MOVES ACRS THE LOWER MS VALLEY. WIDESPREAD
LIFT AND DEEP MOISTURE DEPICTED SWINGING THROUGH THE REGION SO WL
INCREASE POPS TO LIKELY TUE NIGHT.

SHORTWAVE MOVES TO THE EAST OF THE REGION ON WED. WEAK HIGH PRESSURE
EXTENDS FROM THE GREAT LAKES ACRS MO WITH SFC FRONT ALONG THE GULF
COAST. THE AREA WL BE IN BETWEEN UPPER LEVEL SYSTEMS WITH DEEPER
MOISTURE SHUNTED TO THE EAST SO WL KEEP JUST CHC POPS. TEMPS WL
STILL BE COOL WITH PLENTY OF CLOUD COVER THOUGH.

AS WE MOVE INTO THE MID RANGE/EXTENDED FORECAST THE GFS HAS COME
AROUND TO THE MORE CONSISTENT ECMWF SOLUTION SO THERE IS SOME
GROWING CONFIDENCE IN FORECAST WHICH IS LIKELY TO BE WETTER THAN
PREVIOUSLY THOUGHT. EXPECT ANOTHER UPPER TROF TO SWING THROUGH THE
REGION WED NIGHT AND THU SO WL GO WITH CHC POPS. A SMALL BREAK IS
EXPECTED THU NIGHT AND FRI MORNING FOLLOWED BY ANOTHER SYSTEM ON
FRI/FRI NIGHT. ANOTHER BREAK SAT FOLLOWED BY THE NEXT SYSTEM SUN/SUN
NIGHT.

&&

.MEG...WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MS...NONE.
MO...NONE.
TN...NONE.

.DISCUSSION...
COLD FRONT HAS MOVED WELL SOUTH OF THE AREA THIS MORNING WITH JUST

MORNING. COOL HIGH PRESSURE WL PREVAIL TODAY WITH PLENTY OF SUNSHINE 
AND TEMPS 5-10 DEGREES BLO NORMAL. CLOUDS WL START TO INCREASE LATER 
TONIGHT AS HIGH PRESSURE BEGINS TO RETREAT AND THE NEXT SYSTEM 
STARTS MOVING OUT OF THE SW U.S. CLOUDS THICKEN AND RAIN CHANCES 
BEGIN TO INCREASE ON TUE AS FAST MOVING SW FLOW OVERRUNS COOL 
AIRMASS ACRS THE LOWER MS VALLEY. CLOUDS AND PRECIP WL HELP KEEP 
TEMPS ON THE COOL SIDE. 

VERY ACTIVE PATTERN SETTING UP WITH A RAPID SUCCESSION OF SYSTEMS 
THROUGH THIS PART OF THE COUNTRY FOR THE NEXT WEEK. LOOKS LIKE THE 
BEST CHANCES FOR PRECIP...AT LEAST FOR THE SHORT TERM...WL BE TUE 
NIGHT. SHORT TERM MODELS HAVE BEGUN TO RALLY AROUND A SOLUTION IN 
WHICH A DECENT SHORTWAVE MOVES ACRS THE LOWER MS VALLEY. WIDESPREAD 
LIFT AND DEEP MOISTURE DEPICTED SWINGING THROUGH THE REGION SO WL 
INCREASE POPS TO LIKELY TUE NIGHT. 

SHORTWAVE MOVES TO THE EAST OF THE REGION ON WED. WEAK HIGH PRESSURE 
EXTENDS FROM THE GREAT LAKES ACRS MO WITH SFC FRONT ALONG THE GULF 
COAST. THE AREA WL BE IN BETWEEN UPPER LEVEL SYSTEMS WITH DEEPER 
MOISTURE SHUNTED TO THE EAST SO WL KEEP JUST CHC POPS. TEMPS WL 
STILL BE COOL WITH PLENTY OF CLOUD COVER THOUGH.

AS WE MOVE INTO THE MID RANGE/EXTENDED FORECAST THE GFS HAS COME 
AROUND TO THE MORE CONSISTENT ECMWF SOLUTION SO THERE IS SOME 
GROWING CONFIDENCE IN FORECAST WHICH IS LIKELY TO BE WETTER THAN 
PREVIOUSLY THOUGHT. EXPECT ANOTHER UPPER TROF TO SWING THROUGH THE 
REGION WED NIGHT AND THU SO WL GO WITH CHC POPS. A SMALL BREAK IS 
EXPECTED THU NIGHT AND FRI MORNING FOLLOWED BY ANOTHER SYSTEM ON 
FRI/FRI NIGHT. ANOTHER BREAK SAT FOLLOWED BY THE NEXT SYSTEM SUN/SUN

958 PM CST SUN MAR 13 2005

.DISCUSSION...SURFACE ANALYSIS PLACES COLD FRONT SOUTH OF THE COUNTY 
WARNING AREA WITH SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS AFFECTING AREAS ALONG 
AND SOUTH OF THE FRONT ACROSS MISSISSIPPI. THUNDERSTORMS ACROSS THE 
SOUTHERN TWO TIERS OF COUNTIES HAVE REMAINED BELOW SEVERE LIMITS 
THUS FAR WITH ELEVATED CONVECTION NORTH OF THE BOUNDARY AND MID 30 
DEWPOINT DEPRESSIONS CONTINUING TO GRADUALLY PUSH SOUTH. HAIL 
REPORTS THUS FAR HAVE BEEN BELOW SEVERE LIMITS AS FREEZING LEVELS ON 
00Z KJAN RAOB WERE AT 11300 FT. TEMPERATURES ACROSS THE MID SOUTH 
RANGE FROM AROUND 40 NORTH TO AROUND 50 ACROSS THE FAR SOUTHEAST 
SECTION. ELSEWHERE...A FEW LIGHT SPRINKLES OR RAIN SHOWERS WERE 
FALLING ACROSS NORTHWEST TENNESSEE AND NORTHEAST ARKANSAS. WILL 
ISSUE ANOTHER UPDATE SHORTLY FOR CURRENT TRENDS.

UPDATED GRIDS WILL BE OUT SHORTLY

.PREV DISCUSSION...ISSUED 208 PM CST SUN MAR 13 2005

HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS INTO THE AREA TOMORROW. CLEARING SKIES WILL 
WORK IN FROM THE NORTHWEST. 850 TEMPS SUPPORTING HIGHS IN THE LOW TO 
MID 50S. HIGH PRESSURE WILL REMAIN IN CONTROL INTO TUESDAY. BOTH ETA 
AND GFS SHOWING THE NEXT SYSTEM MOVING OUT OF THE SOUTHWESTERN US 
LATE TUESDAY AND TUESDAY NIGHT. THE ASSOCIATED SHORTWAVE HAS TWO 
VORT MAXS. THE SOUTHERN VORT IS THE MAIN FOCUS FOR THE AREA. THE ETA 
IS FURTHER SOUTH WITH THE ASSOCIATED LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM THAN THE 
GFS. AS A RESULT...THERE COULD BE SOME PRECIP TYPE ISSUES IF THE ETA 
VERIFIES. THE GFS HAS BEEN MORE CONSISTENT WITH THE PRECIP TYPE 
REMAINING LIQUID. THIS TRACK BRINGS THE UPPER LEVEL SYSTEM OVER THE 
REGION TUESDAY NIGHT. BOTH MODELS SHOWING SOME RESIDUAL LOW LEVEL 
MOISTURE LINGERING BEHIND THE MAIN SYSTEM INTO WEDNESDAY. 

HIGH PRESSURE THEN BUILDS IN THURSDAY WITH A WEAK SHORTWAVE MOVING 
THROUGH FRIDAY NIGHT. THEN...A RIDGE BUILDS OVER THE AREA INTO THE 
WEEKEND WITH ANOTHER GOOD TROUGH ARRIVING LATE IN THE WEEKEND.

THROUGH THE AREA. GFS SEEMS TO HAVE THE BETTER HANDLE ON TONIGHTS 
SITUATION. THE GFS SHOWS AN AREA OF LIGHT RAIN IN ASSOCIATED TO 
POSITIVE VERTICAL MOTION DEVELOPING OVER CENTRAL ARKANSAS DEVELOPING

THE AREA WITH THE FRONT. THIS LEAVES ONLY LIGHT RAIN WITH THE 850MB 
SYSTEM. SINCE THE RAIN IS SO LIGHT...HAVE ONLY CHANCE POPS GOING. 
BETTER CHANCES PROBABLY SOUTH OF A LINE FROM HARRISBURG TO DYERSBURG 
TO PARIS.

MID 50S. HIGH PRESSURE WILL REMAIN IN CONTROL INTO TUESDAY. BOTH ETA

CHANCES OF RAIN BEHIND THE SURFACE FRONT. TEMPS AREAWIDE SHOULD NOT

ACRS THE REGION LATER TODAY AS THE CWFA IS PLACED IN THE RIGHT 
ENTRANCE REGION OF A VERY STRONG JET MOVING ACRS THE OH VALLEY. AS A

SLIGHTLY AS STRONG LOW LEVEL CAA OFFSETS SUNSHINE THIS MORNING.

00Z-06Z THE SFC FRONT WL BE LOCATED JUST TO THE SOUTH WITH STRONG 
LIFT ALOFT AND DEEPENING MOISTURE. WL GO WITH LIKELY POPS ACRS NE MS 
DECREASING TO THE NW. SOME INSTABILITY ABOVE THE BOUNDARY LAYER MAY 
RESULT IN ELEVATED CONVECTION ACRS NRN MS DURING THE EVENING. AFT 
06Z A DEVELOPING SFC WAVE MOVES ALONG THE FRONT INTO THE CAROLINAS 
HELPING PUSH THE WESTERN PART OF THE FRONT SOUTH INTO SRN MS/AL BY 
12Z MON. PRECIP CHANCE WL DIMINISH FROM NW TO SE BY MON MORNING. 

HIGH PRESSURE PREVAILS FOR MONDAY WITH SOME SUNSHINE AND COOL TEMPS. 
CLOUDS SHOULD START MOVING BACK IN LATE MON NIGHT IN RESPONSE TO 
DEVELOPING SYSTEM ACRS THE SW U.S. EVENTUAL EVOLUTION OF THIS SYSTEM

LOOKS LIKE CHANCES FOR RAIN LATER TUE CONTINUING INTO EARLY THU AS 
TROF MOVES OUT OF THE SW U.S. AND INTO THE MS RIVER VALLEY WED 
NIGHT/THU. SOMEWHAT DRIER PATTERN SETS UP FOR THE WEEKEND

AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
915 PM CST SAT MAR 12 2005

.DISCUSSION...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS PLACES COLD FRONT ALONG THE 
MO/AR/TN BORDER. INFRARED SATELLITE IMAGERY SHOWING AN AREA OF 
MID/HIGH CLOUDS BEGINNING TO DEVELOP ACROSS SOUTHEASTERN MISSOURI.
00Z RAOB FROM LZK...JAN...AND SGF SHOWING QUITE A BIT OF DRY AIR IN 
PLACE ACROSS SOUTHERN MISSOURI AND THE MID SOUTH. ADDITIONALLY A 
CAPPING INVERSION IS IN PLACE AROUND 770 MB. AS A RESULT...NOT 
EXPECTING ANY CHANCES FOR RAIN TONIGHT ACROSS THE MID SOUTH 
OVERNIGHT. SKIES ACROSS THE MID SOUTH WILL BECOME PARTLY CLOUDY AS 
MID LEVEL CLOUDS BEGIN TO DEVELOP AND SAG SOUTH. CURRENT 
TEMPERATURES IN THE 60S TO LOWER 70S WILL DROP INTO THE MID 40S TO 
LOWER 50S ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA AS DEWPOINTS SLOWLY BEGIN TO RISE.

WILL ISSUE AN UPDATE TO MAKE SOME MINOR ADJUSTMENTS TO CURRENT 
FORECAST GRIDS TONIGHT AND TO ADJUST RAIN CHANCES FOR SUNDAY TO THE 
AFTERNOON ONLY. 

UPDATED GRIDS WILL BE OUT SHORTLY

CJC

.PREV DISCUSSION...ISSUED 226 PM CST SAT MAR 12 2005

NEWEST RUNS OF THE ETA AND GFS NOW SHOW THE FRONT HANGING UP OVER 
NORTH MS BY MORNING. THE CHANCES FOR RAIN OVER PORTIONS OF THE AREA 
HAVE GONE UP FOR TOMORROW BECAUSE THE FRONT IS MUCH FURTHER NORTH 
THAN PREVIOUSLY EXPECTED. BOTH MODELS SHOWING MOISTURE POOLING ALONG 
THE FRONT RESULTING IN INCREASING CLOUDS THROUGHOUT THE NIGHT. THE 
850MB FRONT IS LAGGING WELL BEHIND THE SURFACE FRONT...JUST GETTING 
INTO NORTHEAST ARKANSAS BY MORNING. WHILE THE SURFACE LOW WILL RUN 
ALONG THE SURFACE FRONT AND AFFECT AREAS MAINLY ACROSS NORTHEAST 
MS...THE 850MB LOW AND FRONT WILL MOVE THROUGH THE REGION DURING THE 
AFTERNOON AND TOMORROW NIGHT. THIS WILL RESULT IN CHANCES OF RAIN 
MAINLY SOUTH OF I 40. THERE IS NOT A WHOLE LOT OF MOISTURE WITH THIS 
SYSTEM...HOWEVER THE SLOW PROGRESSION OF THE SYSTEM AND ENTRANCE 
REGION TO UPPER JET RESULTING IN EXCELLENT LIFT WILL PROVIDE GOOD 
CHANCES FOR RAIN. THERE IS SOME INSTABILITY SOUTH OF THE 
FRONT...ENOUGH TO MENTION THUNDER SOUTH OF TUPELO. IT WILL BE 
NOTICEABLY COLDER TOMORROW WITH THE FRONT SOUTH OF THE REGION AND 
STRONG COLD AIR ADVECTION POURING IN BEHIND IT. CLOUD COVER FURTHER 
COMPLICATING THINGS...TEMPS LIKELY TO RISE ONLY A FEW DEGREES. 

CHANCES FOR RAIN WILL LINGER INTO MONDAY MORNING OVER NORTHEAST 
MS...DUE TO TIMING OF THE SYSTEM. THEN...CANADIAN HIGH PRESSURE 
BUILDS OVER THE AREA RESULTING IN COOL TEMPS AGAIN. HIGH PRESSURE 
SHOULD BRING DRY WEATHER TO THE AREA THROUGH MIDWEEK. THEN...THE 
MODELS ARE VERY INCONSISTENT WITH THE NEXT SYSTEM. THE UPPER FLOW 
WILL HAVE CHANGED OVER THE WEEKEND FROM NORTHWEST TO WESTERLY AS THE 
UPPER RIDGE OVER THE WESTERN US BREAKS DOWN. MODELS ARE INCONSISTENT 
IN HOW AND WHEN THE NEXT SYSTEM EJECTS OUT OF THE SOUTHWESTERN US. 
FEEL THAT THERE IS A GOOD CHANCE OF RAIN SOMETIME DURING THE MIDDLE 
OF THE WEEK...BUT BEING ABLE TO SUCCESSFULLY PICK WHICH DAY WOULD BE 
MORE OF A FUNCTION OF LUCK AT THIS POINT. HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS BACK 
IN TOWARDS THE LATER HALF OF THE WEEK WITH PERHAPS ANOTHER WEAK 
SHORTWAVE ARRIVE TOWARDS NEXT WEEKEND.

&&

.MEG...WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
908 PM CST FRI MAR 11 2005

.DISCUSSION...00Z UPPER AIR ANALYSIS DEPICTS LONGWAVE TROUGH 
STRETCHING FROM EASTERN LAKE SUPERIOR TO THE PANHANDLE OF 
FLORIDA...ANOTHER SHORTWAVE ROTATING AROUND HUDSON BAY LOW FROM 
WISCONSIN TO MISSOURI PRODUCING AN AREA OF MID-LEVEL CLOUDS. WINDS 
HAVE BEGUN TO DECOUPLE AS LOW LEVEL INVERSION HAS FORMED ACROSS THE 
MID SOUTH. TEMPERATURES ARE CURRENTLY IN THE 40S TO AROUND 50. MID 
LEVEL CLOUDS WILL MOVE MAINLY ACROSS NORTHERN SECTIONS OF THE 
FORECAST AREA OVERNIGHT PRODUCING PARTLY CLOUDY SKIES NORTH...AND 
MOSTLY CLEAR SKIES TOWARDS NORTHERN MISSISSIPPI. WILL UPDATE GRIDS 
TO MAKE MINOR CLOUD AND TEMPERATURE CHANGES BASED UPON CURRENT 
TRENDS BUT DO NOT PLAN TO ISSUE AN UPDATE AT THIS TIME AS OVERALL 
FORECAST ON TRACK IN GRIDS. EARLY LOOK AT 00Z DATA STILL SUGGESTS 
WIND ADVISORY CRITERIA WILL BE MET DURING THE DAY WITH 33KT 925MB 
WINDS MIXING DOWN TO THE SURFACE BY SATURDAY AFTERNOON. 

CJC


.PREV DISCUSSION...ISSUED 247 PM CST FRI MAR 11 2005
SURFACE COLD FRONT HAS MOVED INTO THE GEORGIA AND THE FLORIDA 
PANHANDLE. THE PRESSURE GRADIENT BEHIND THE FRONT HAS RELAXED THIS 
AFTERNOON AND WINDS HAVE DIMINISHED SOMEWHAT. WINDS ARE EXPECTED TO 
DIMINISH THIS EVENING AS THE BETTER MIXING IS LOST WITH THE DAYTIME 
HEATING. THERE IS STILL A STRONG GRADIENT IN PLACE WITH 1000MB 
GEOSTROPHIC WINDS OVER 50KTS OVERNIGHT. 925MB WINDS ARE OVER 50KTS 
AS WELL OVERNIGHT AND INTO THE EARLY MORNING HOURS. EXPECT THAT 
WINDS WILL BECOME STRONG ONCE AGAIN IN THE MORNING AS DAYTIME 
HEATING ALLOWS US TO TAP INTO THOSE STRONGER WINDS OFF THE SURFACE. 
THE WIND ADVISORY WILL BE REISSUED FOR THE DAYTIME HOURS TOMORROW. 
THE STRONG WINDS OVER THE REGION ARE DUE TO A TROUGH OF COLD AIR 
OVER THE EASTERN US AND A RIDGE OF WARM AIR OVER THE WESTERN PLAINS. 
TOMORROW THE STRONG SOUTHWESTERLY WINDS WILL BOOST TEMPS INTO THE 
UPPER 60S AND 70S. 850 TEMPS WILL SOAR TO ABOVE +10 AND ABOVE +12 IN 
AREAS ALONG AND WEST OF THE MISSISSIPPI RIVER.

A COLD FRONT WILL MOVE THROUGH TOMORROW NIGHT. ALTHOUGH THERE WILL 
BE AN INCREASE IN CLOUD COVER...THE LOWER ATMOSPHERE IS SO DRY THAT 
ONLY A FEW SPRINKLES IS POSSIBLE. THERE WILL BE A NOTICEABLE 
DIFFERENCE IN HIGHS ON SUNDAY...PERHAPS AS MUCH AS 20 DEGREES 
COLDER. ETA NOW BEGINNING TO AGREE MORE WITH THE GFS THAT THERE 
COULD BE A GOOD DEAL OF CLOUD COVER BEHIND THE FRONT AS WELL. 

THE FRONT WILL SETTLE SOUTH OF THE REGION AND ANY PRECIP CHANCES 
WILL REMAIN SOUTH OF THE AREA NEAR THE FRONT. THE OVERALL UPPER AIR 
PATTERN WILL BE CHANGING THROUGH THIS PERIOD FROM HIGH AMPLITUDE 
RIDGE OVER THE WEST AND TROUGH OVER THE EAST...TO THE RIDGE BREAKING 
DOWN. AS A RESULT...THE UPPER FLOW WILL TRANSITION FROM 
NORTHWESTERLY TO WESTERLY. THE NEXT CHANCE FOR RAIN WILL BE MIDWEEK 
WHEN A STORM SYSTEM IS EXPECT TO EJECT OUT OF THE SOUTHWESTERN US 
AND MOVE THROUGH THE AREA.

&&

.MEG...WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...WIND ADVISORY FOR TOMORROW. 
MS...WIND ADVISORY FOR TOMORROW. 
MO...WIND ADVISORY FOR TOMORROW.
TN...WIND ADVISORY FOR TOMORROW.

&&

NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
247 PM CST FRI MAR 11 2005

.DISCUSSION...

SURFACE COLD FRONT HAS MOVED INTO THE GEORGIA AND THE FLORIDA 
PANHANDLE. THE PRESSURE GRADIENT BEHIND THE FRONT HAS RELAXED THIS 
AFTERNOON AND WINDS HAVE DIMINISHED SOMEWHAT. WINDS ARE EXPECTED TO 
DIMINISH THIS EVENING AS THE BETTER MIXING IS LOST WITH THE DAYTIME 
HEATING. THERE IS STILL A STRONG GRADIENT IN PLACE WITH 1000MB 
GEOSTROPHIC WINDS OVER 50KTS OVERNIGHT. 925MB WINDS ARE OVER 50KTS 
AS WELL OVERNIGHT AND INTO THE EARLY MORNING HOURS. EXPECT THAT 
WINDS WILL BECOME STRONG ONCE AGAIN IN THE MORNING AS DAYTIME 
HEATING ALLOWS US TO TAP INTO THOSE STRONGER WINDS OFF THE SURFACE. 
THE WIND ADVISORY WILL BE REISSUED FOR THE DAYTIME HOURS TOMORROW. 
THE STRONG WINDS OVER THE REGION ARE DUE TO A TROUGH OF COLD AIR 
OVER THE EASTERN US AND A RIDGE OF WARM AIR OVER THE WESTERN PLAINS. 
TOMORROW THE STRONG SOUTHWESTERLY WINDS WILL BOOST TEMPS INTO THE 
UPPER 60S AND 70S. 850 TEMPS WILL SOAR TO ABOVE +10 AND ABOVE +12 IN 
AREAS ALONG AND WEST OF THE MISSISSIPPI RIVER.

A COLD FRONT WILL MOVE THROUGH TOMORROW NIGHT. ALTHOUGH THERE WILL 
BE AN INCREASE IN CLOUD COVER...THE LOWER ATMOSPHERE IS SO DRY THAT 
ONLY A FEW SPRINKLES IS POSSIBLE. THERE WILL BE A NOTICEABLE 
DIFFERENCE IN HIGHS ON SUNDAY...PERHAPS AS MUCH AS 20 DEGREES 
COLDER. ETA NOW BEGINNING TO AGREE MORE WITH THE GFS THAT THERE 
COULD BE A GOOD DEAL OF CLOUD COVER BEHIND THE FRONT AS WELL. 

THE FRONT WILL SETTLE SOUTH OF THE REGION AND ANY PRECIP CHANCES 
WILL REMAIN SOUTH OF THE AREA NEAR THE FRONT. THE OVERALL UPPER AIR 
PATTERN WILL BE CHANGING THROUGH THIS PERIOD FROM HIGH AMPLITUDE 
RIDGE OVER THE WEST AND TROUGH OVER THE EAST...TO THE RIDGE BREAKING 
DOWN. AS A RESULT...THE UPPER FLOW WILL TRANSITION FROM 
NORTHWESTERLY TO WESTERLY. THE NEXT CHANCE FOR RAIN WILL BE MIDWEEK 
WHEN A STORM SYSTEM IS EXPECT TO EJECT OUT OF THE SOUTHWESTERN US 
AND MOVE THROUGH THE AREA.

PROVIDE THE MID SOUTH WITH A TIGHT SURFACE GRADIENT. THIS MEANS THAT 
WINDS WILL BE CLOSE TO 10 TO 15 MPH OVERNIGHT HELPING TO KEEP THE 
AIR MIXED CAUSING MILD OVERNIGHT TEMPERATURES. THIS IS HANDLED WELL 
IN THE CURRENT FORECAST. WILL UPDATE THE FORECAST FOR THE MENTION OF 
SPRINKLES IN A FEW HOURS...ONCE THE LIGHT RETURNS ON RADAR EXIT THE 
AREA.

SHORTWAVE TRANSLATING ACROSS THE REGION CAUSING WINDS FROM 25 TO 30 
MPH POSSIBLE...ESPECIALLY ACROSS THE SOUTHERN HALF OF THE FORECAST 
AREA. THIS WILL BE EXAMINED IN MORE DETAIL OVERNIGHT BUT THIS WILL

FXUS64 KMEG 102045
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
245 PM CST THU MAR 10 2005

.DISCUSSION...

A COLD FRONT EXTENDS FROM EAST CENTRAL MISSOURI THROUGH NORTHWEST 
ARKANSAS. RADARS FROM PADUCAH AND SPRINGFIELD HAVE SHOWN SOME ECHOS 
WITH THE FRONT. HOWEVER...THIS APPEARS TO BE MAINLY VIRGA WITH THE 
ECHOS DISSIPATING AS THEY APPROACH THE PADUCAH RADAR. SINCE THE LOW 
LEVELS ARE RATHER DRY...WILLL KEEP A DRY FORECAST GOING ALTHOUGH A 
SPRINKLE IS POSSIBLE BUT PROBABLY NOT WIDESPREAD ENOUGH TO MENTION. 
SATELLITE ALSO SHOWS THAT THE CLOUDS ARE FAIRLY PROGRESSIVE SO 
EXPECT THAT IF SKIES BECOME MOSTLY CLOUDY THAT IT WILL ONLY LAST FOR 
AN HOUR OR TWO. WINDS SHOULD STAY UP TONIGHT...SO NO FOG PROBLEMS 
EXPECTED TONIGHT. 

LOOKS LIKE ANOTHER WINDY DAY AGAIN TOMORROW. ETA HINTING THAT THE 
WINDS MAY BE JUST STRONG ENOUGH TO REACH WIND ADVISORY CRITERIA OF 
SUSTAINED 25 MPH OVER PORTIONS OF THE AREA TOMORROW. RIGHT NOW ITS 
BORDERLINE SO WILL LET OVERNIGHT SHIFT TAKE A LOOK AT IT. ANOTHER 
CLIPPER SYSTEM WILL ARRIVE LATE TOMORROW AFTERNOON AND TOMORROW 
NIGHT. THE SITUATION APPEARS VERY SIMILAR TO TODAY WITH THE ETA 
ATTEMPTING TO SHOW RAIN OUT OF A MID CLOUD DECK WHILE THE GFS 
REMAINS DRY. BASED UPON TRENDS...WILL NOT INCLUDE POPS BUT WILL 
MENTION SPRINKLES. THERE IS A FINE LINE BETWEEN THE REALLY COLD AIR 
ASSOCIATED WITH THE EASTERN US TROUGH AND WARMER AIR WITH THE 
WESTERN RIDGE...AND THE MIDSOUTH WILL BE VERY CLOSE TO THAT LINE. 
THE ETA AND NGM IS FURTHER WEST WITH THE COLD AIR WHILE THE GFS 
REMAINS FURTHER EAST. AS A RESULT THERE IS A BIG DIFFERENCE BETWEEN 
THE TEMPERATURE OUTPUT BETWEEN THE TWO MODELS. WITHOUT A STRONG 
REASON TO DISCREDIT EITHER SOLUTION AT THIS POINT...HAVE SPLIT THE 
DIFFERENCE BETWEEN THE TWO AND HOPE THAT LATER RUNS COME INTO BETTER 
AGREEMENT. HIGH PRESSURE SETTLES INTO THE REGION ON SATURDAY 
RESULTING IN DRY CONDITIONS.

UPPER LEVEL NORTHWEST FLOW WILL BEGIN TO BECOME MORE ZONAL TOWARDS 
EARLY NEXT WEEK AS THE WESTERN RIDGE BREAKS DOWN. ANOTHER CLIPPER 
SYSTEM WILL MOVE THROUGH SUNDAY NIGHT. BOTH MODELS ARE INDICATING 
THAT A FAIRLY STRONG DISTURBANCE WILL MOVE OVERHEAD AT THIS TIME 
POSSIBLY RESULTING IN SOME RAIN. THINK THAT ANY RAIN WILL REMAIN 
ALONG THE FRONT AND EXPECT THAT BY THE TIME THAT THIS DISTURBANCE 
ARRIVES THAT THE FRONT WILL ALREADY BE SOUTH OF THE REGION. BY 
MIDWEEK THE GFS SHOWS AN UPPER TROUGH PROGRESSING OUT OF THE WESTERN 
PLAINS AND INTO THE MS VALLEY REGION WHICH LOOKS LIKE THE BEST 
CHANCES FOR RAIN. 

&&

.MEG...WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...

MO...NONE.

ACROSS NORTH MS AND WILL MOVE INTO ALABAMA OVERNIGHT. 

HAVE INCREASED POPS MAINLY ACROSS NORTHEAST MS FOR THIS EVENING WITH 
THE RAIN EXITING THE AREA A LITTLE SLOWER THAN EXPECTED. AREA 
REMAINS IN NORTHWEST FLOW ALOFT...WHICH MEANS QUICK HITTING SYSTEMS. 
SO...SKIES WILL CLEAR TONIGHT FROM NORTHWEST TO SOUTHEAST. THE NEXT 
SHORTWAVE WILL ARRIVE TOMORROW. HOWEVER...IT LOOKS LIKE THE UPPER 
LEVEL SHORTWAVE WILL MOVE THROUGH DURING THE DAY WHILE THE SURFACE 
FRONT WILL NOT MOVE THROUGH UNTIL TOMORROW NIGHT. AS A RESULT...THE 
LIFT WITH THIS SYSTEM IS VERY WEAK AND HAVE DECIDED TO REMOVE THE 
MENTION OF RAIN WITH THIS SYSTEM. ANOTHER WEAK CLIPPER SYSTEM MOVES 
THROUGH FRIDAY NIGHT...ONCE AGAIN WEAK DYNAMICS AND LITTLE CHANCES 
FOR RAIN. 
GOOD WARM AIR ADVECTION TAKES PLACE ON SATURDAY AHEAD OF A STRONGER 
FRONT. HAVE LEFT IN A SLIGHT CHANCE OF RAIN WITH THE FRONT AS IT 
MOVES THROUGH FRIDAY NIGHT. ALTHOUGH THE LIFT IS NOT ALL THAT 
IMPRESSIVE...THE TEMP CONTRAST ALONG THE FRONT MAY BE STRONG ENOUGH 
FOR SOME RAIN. 

HIGH PRESSURE AND AN UPPER LEVEL SHORT RIDGE SHOULD PROVIDE DRY 
WEATHER FOR MONDAY INTO TUESDAY. THE UPPER FLOW BEGINS TO TRANSITION 
BY MIDWEEK AS A CUT OFF LOW DEVELOPS OVER THE SOUTHWESTERN US AND 
THE FLOW OVER THE REGION BECOMES MORE WESTERLY. THERE WILL BE 
CHANCES OF RAIN AROUND MIDWEEK AS SMALLER SYSTEMS SHEAR OFF OF THE 
MAIN LOW AND MOVE OVER THE REGION.

AND CONTINUING THROUGH EARLY THURSDAY NIGHT. RAIN SHOULD END BEFORE
06Z FRIDAY SO NO REASON TO THINK THERE WILL BE ANY MIXED
PRECIPITATION. NOT VERY CONFIDENT IN EXTENDED FORECAST AS MODELS
INDICATE MORE OF A ZONAL FLOW PATTERN. PREVIOUS MODEL RUNS HAD TRIED

OF A BOUNDARY. WILL LEAVE SLIGHT CHANCE POPS IN FOR SATURDAY NIGHT
THROUGH TUESDAY BUT WOULD NOT BE SURPRISED IF LATER MODEL RUNS SHOW

HIGH PRESSURE NOW OVER THE CENTRAL PLAINS WILL KEEP WEATHER QUIET

WEDNESDAY TO LIKELY FOR ENTIRE FORECAST AREA. AFTER 18Z WEDNESDAY...
ONLY RAIN IS EXPECTED. MOST AREAS SHOULD SEE RAIN END BEFORE 00Z
EXCEPT EXTREME SOUTHEAST CORNER WHERE ADDED CHANCE POPS FOR EARLY
WEDNESDAY NIGHT. DRY WEATHER RETURNS FOR THURSDAY BUT ANOTHER WEAK
DISTURBANCE MOVES THROUGH THURSDAY NIGHT SO KEPT SLIGHT CHANCE POPS
IN FOR THEN. FLOW THEN BECOME LESS AMPLIFIED AND MORE ZONAL BY THE
END OF THE WEEK BUT WITH A FRONTAL BOUNDARY IN THE AREA...MIGHT SEE
SOME RAIN SUNDAY NIGHT OR MONDAY.

&&

.MEG...WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MS...NONE.
MO...NONE.
TN...NONE.
&&

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 080231
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
830 PM CST MON MAR 7 2005

.DISCUSSION...
INITIAL SHOWERS SLOWLY COMING TO AN END WITH ADDITIONAL RAIN 
POPPING UP OVER PARTS OF WESTERN TN THIS EVENING. COLD FRONT HAS 
MOVED THROUGH THE MAJORITY OF THE FORECAST AREA THIS EVENING. 
NORTHWEST WINDS GUSTING TO 25 MPH AND TEMPERATURES FALLING INTO THE 
30S OVERNIGHT WILL OCCUR.

ANOTHER SHORTWAVE DRIFTING ACROSS ARKANSAS AS SEEN ON WATER VAPOR 
IMAGERY WILL MOVE TOWARDS THE AREA THROUGH MIDNIGHT. THIS FEATURE IS 
PICKED UP WELL BY THE RUC MODEL. SOME LIGHTNING STRIKES OCCURRING 
WITH THIS WAVE AS THE COLD CORE CAUSES THE INSTABILITY. THUS WILL 
MENTION A FEW MORE SHOWERS POSSIBLE ACROSS THE SOUTHERN HALF OF THE 
FORECAST AREA OVERNIGHT. 

MODEL DATA A LITTLE SLOW COMING IN THIS EVENING. THERE WAS SOME 
DISAGREEMENT WITH THE MODELS FROM EARLIER WITH THE GFS BEING THE 
COLDEST. THIS WILL PLAY A FACTOR IN THE CHANCES FOR SNOWFALL ACROSS 
THE REGION FOR WEDNESDAY. A STRONG SHORTWAVE DIVING OUT OF CANADA 
WILL DRIFT ACROSS THE CENTRAL PLAINS AND INTO THE MISSISSIPPI 
VALLEY. IF ENOUGH MOISTURE CAN BE REALIZED...THEN THE CHANCES FOR 
SNOW WILL INCREASE EARLY WEDNESDAY. THE GOOD THING IS THAT THE 
SYSTEM WILL BE FAST MOVING WHICH WOULD LIMIT SNOWFALL TOTALS. 
AGAIN..THIS IS LOOKING AT 18Z MODEL DATA FOR WEDNESDAY. THE MAIN 
AREA OF CONCERN FOR THIS TO  OCCUR WILL BE NORTH OF A DECATURVILLE 
TN TO SOMERVILLE TO MEMPHIS TO WYNN AR LINE. AS MENTIONED...THE GFS 
MODEL IS COLDER BUT SEEMS TO HANDLE THIS TYPE OF SCENARIO A TAD 
BETTER THAN OTHER MODELS. THERE IS ENOUGH UNCERTAINTY IN THE 
FORECAST TO JUSTIFY THE CURRENT MENTION OF RAIN OR SNOW FOR THIS 
TIME PERIOD FOR THE AREA OUTLINED ABOVE.

UPDATED INFORMATION ON THIS FORECAST WILL CONTINUE EARLY TOMORROW 
MORNING.

&&

.MEG...WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MS...NONE.
MO...NONE.
TN...NONE.

.DISCUSSION...

SCATTERED SHOWERS HAVE DEVELOPED OR MOVED INTO THE MIDSOUTH THE

HAS BEEN EAST NORTHEAST AROUND 40 MPH. MOST INGREDIENTS ARE HERE
FOR SEVERE WEATHER. STABILITY SEEMS TO BE LIMITED ATTM. MODELS
INDICATE BEST LIS IN N MS THIS AFTERNOON AND EVENING. SWATH OF
PCLDY SKIES NOW NORTH OF I40 WILL INCREASE INSTABILITY AS IT
MOVES SOUTHEAST THROUGH THE DAY.

CURRENT FCST SEEMS TO HAVE THINGS COVERED. WL NOT UPDATE AT THIS
TIME.

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 071052
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
452 AM CST MON MAR 7 2005

.UPDATED DISCUSSION...
SHOWERS HAVE RAPIDLY BROKEN OUT OVER NORTH MISSISSIPPI SINCE 1030Z.
HAVE UPDATED FORECAST TO CALL FOR SCATTERED SHOWERS EARLY THIS
MORNING BEFORE MAIN PRECIPITATION GETS GOING LATER TODAY. MAY ALSO
NEED TO CONSIDER LOWERING MAX TEMPS AS IT IS BEGINNING TO LOOK LIKE
CLOUDS MAY BE DIFFICULT TO GET RID OF TODAY. THIS MAY AID IN
LOWERING SEVERE WEATHER POTENTIAL LATER IN THE DAY.
&&

.PREVIOUS DISCUSSION ISSUED AT 322 AM...
COLD FRONT NEAR A LSE-MCI-AMA LINE AT 08Z. LOW LEVEL MOISTURE SURGING
TOWARD THE MIDSOUTH AS NOTED ON SATELLITE TRENDS. CONVECTION ACROSS
MISSOURI AND ILLINOIS MOVING EASTWARD AHEAD OF UPPER TROF DIVING
SOUTHEAST ACROSS NORTHERN PLAINS. ADDITIONAL CONVECTION FIRING OFF
OVER WEST TEXAS...AND SOME ISOLATED SHOWERS DEVELOPING OVER SOUTHERN
ARKANSAS. TEMPERATURES FROM THE UPPER 40S EAST TO UPPER 50S WEST.
&&

.SHORT TERM (THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...
FIRST CONCERN WILL BE POTENTIAL FOR SEVERE WEATHER TODAY. LOOKS LIKE
CAPES WONT BE MUCH ABOVE 500-700 J/KG AND LIFTED INDICES IN -1 TO -3
RANGE. WITH CLOUD COVER INCREASING RAPIDLY...DONT KNOW IF WE WILL
GET ENOUGH WARMING TO REALIZE THE FORECAST INSTABILITY. EXPECT THAT
BEST INSTABILITY AND CAPE WILL OCCUR TO OUR SOUTH. AS MOISTURE
INCREASES AND FRONT/TROF NEARS US...MAINLY DURING THE AFTERNOON
HOURS...EXPECT CONVECTION TO DEVELOP.

MID-LEVEL LAPSE RATES AND WIND FIELDS WOULD SUPPORT SEVERE WEATHER...
MAINLY DAMAGING WINDS...IF WE GET ORGANIZED CONVECTION TO DEVELOP.
PROBLEM IS...IF GULF COAST CONVECTION DEVELOPS AS EXPECTED...THIS MAY
DISRUPT THE DEVELOPMENT OF ORGANIZED CONVECTION IN OUR AREA BY
STEALING SOME OF THE AVAILABLE MOISTURE. WILL KEEP MENTION IN HWO...
BUT NOT IN GRIDS AT THIS TIME. PLANNING 70 POPS AREAWIDE. EXPECT
ACTUAL FRONT TO ENTER CWA AROUND 21Z...AND CLEAR EASTERN PORTIONS
BETWEEN 03Z AND 06Z. WILL HOLD CHANCE POPS IN DURING THE EVENING...
DRY AFTER MIDNIGHT. SKIES WILL CLEAR RAPIDLY BEHIND THE FRONT...AND
REMAIN CLEAR THROUGH AT LEAST THE EVENING HOURS TUESDAY NIGHT.

NEXT IMPULSE TO MOVE THROUGH THE AREA AFTER MIDNIGHT TUESDAY NIGHT
INTO WEDNESDAY. MODELS AGAIN HAVING TROUBLE AGREEING ON SCENARIO.
GFS STRONGER WITH A FURTHER SOUTH SURFACE LOW...NAM WEAKER AND
FURTHER NORTH. GFS LIKELY TO CATEGORICAL POPS...NAM ALMOST NONE.
ALSO SEEING ABOUT A 15 DEGREE DIFFERENCE IN FORECAST MAX TEMPS FOR
WEDNESDAY. CURRENT FORECAST IS ABOUT MIDWAY IN BETWEEN THE TWO...SO
WILL KEEP THAT AND HOPE THAT MODELS GET A LITTLE CLOSER ON A
SOLUTION SOON.
&&

.LONG TERM (BEYOND WEDNESDAY)...
THE ONE CONSISTENT TREND IN GFS EXTENDED GUIDANCE OVER THE LAST
WEEK...IS THAT IT HAS SWUNG BACK AND FORTH ON HANDLING OF COLD
AIR. MEDIUM RANGE MODELS DO INDICATE MODIFICATION FROM A NORTHWEST
FLOW OVER OUR AREA TO MORE OF A ZONAL ONE BY THE WEEKEND...BUT LITTLE
AGREEMENT ON THE DETAILS OVER THE PAST SEVERAL NIGHTS.

ANOTHER PRECIP EVENT...LIGHT...SOMETIME IN THE THURSDAY NIGHT TO
FRIDAY NIGHT RANGE...THEN DRY FOR THE WEEKEND.

WIDE SWINGS IN MEX GUIDANCE FOR A PARTICULAR DAY FROM NIGHT TO
NIGHT OVER THE PAST SEVERAL NIGHTS. UNTIL THE SOLUTION SETTLES DOWN
A LITTLE...WILL KEEP WHAT WE HAVE IN THE EXTENDED FORECAST...WHICH
IS FAIRLY CLOSE TO OUR SURROUNDING OFFICES.
&&

.MEG...WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MS...NONE.
MO...NONE.
TN...NONE.
&&

845 PM CST SUN MAR 6 2005

.DISCUSSION...CURRENT WATER VAPOR IMAGERY INDICATES SHORT WAVE TROF 
IN KS AND DRY-LINE THAT EXTENDS FROM CENTRAL KS INTO NW IA. CURRENT 
FORECAST OF MID/ HIGH CLOUDS GRADUALLY INCREASING AFTER MIDNIGHT 
LOOKS ON TARGET WITH ENCROACHMENT OF CLOUDS INTO CENTRAL ARKANSAS. 
AS SHORTWAVE CURRENTLY IN KS MOVES SOUTH AND EAST OVERNIGHT TOWARD 
SOUTHERN MISSOURI...SLGT CHANCE OF PRECIP BEFORE DAYBREAK LOOKS ON 
TARGET...ESPECIALLY ACROSS WESTERN PORTIONS OF THE FORECAST AREA. 
WILL MAKE NO CHANGES TO THE NOCTURNAL FORECAST.  

AS FOR MONDAY...WHEN THE COLD FRONT AND TROUGH SWING THROUGH DURING 
THE AFTERNOON...PERHAPS A HANDFUL OF STORMS MAY BECOME STRONG... 
PERHAPS MARGINALLY SEVERE ACROSS THE MID SOUTH. KEY QUESTION STILL 
REMAINS HOW MUCH SFC BASED HEATING AND DESTABILIZATION WILL OCCUR. 
LATEST 00Z ETA SHOWS DEWPOINTS NOT RISING AS MUCH...WITH PREVIOUS 
ETA RUN HAVING BETTER LOW LEVEL MOISTURE ADVECTION WITH 60 DEWPOINTS 
INTO NRN MISSISSIPPI WITH BETTER SFC CONVERGENCE.  BEST INSTABILITY 
LOOKS LIKE IT WILL RESIDE TO OUR SOUTH AND WEST IN ARK-LA-TEX REGION 
DURING THE AFTERNOON HOURS.
