000 
FXUS64 KMEG 062113
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
314 PM CST SUN MAR 6 2005

.DISCUSSION...LATEST VISIBLE SATELLITE SHOWS MOSTLY SUNNY SKIES 
ACROSS THE MID SOUTH AS TEMPERATURES HAVE WARMED INTO THE 60S TO 
NEAR 70 THUS FAR. WATER VAPOR IMAGERY SHOWS BOTH NORTHERN STREAM 
TROUGH AND SOUTHERN STREAM TROUGH SLOWLY BEGINNING TO PHASE ACROSS 
THE PLAINS. MAIN CONCERN THIS FORECAST PACKAGE IS SEVERE WEATHER 
POTENTIAL ON MONDAY. 

TONIGHT...CLOUDS WILL GRADUALLY INCREASE DURING THE EVENING AS 
MID/HIGH LEVEL MOISTURE ADVECTS ACROSS THE MID SOUTH. RAIN SHOULD 
HOLD OFF ACROSS MUCH OF THE FORECAST AREA OVERNIGHT...ESPECIALLY 
EAST OF THE MISSISSIPPI RIVER WHERE RATHER WEAK MID LEVEL LAPSE 
RATES /6.0 C/KM OR BELOW/ AND LOW LEVEL DRY AIR WILL BE PRESENT. MID 
LEVEL DYNAMICAL FORCING /700-500 MB Q-VECTOR CONVERGENCE/ AND BETTER 
LAPSE RATES WILL REMAIN ACROSS CENTRAL ARKANSAS. LOWS TONIGHT WILL 
BE CONSIDERABLY WARMER TONIGHT WITH THE AREA UNDER CLOUDS AND 
INCREASING WARM AIR ADVECTION. 

MONDAY...COLD FRONT WILL MOVE THROUGH THE MID SOUTH LATE MONDAY 
AFTERNOON/MONDAY EVENING. AGAIN...THE BIG QUESTION WILL BE AMOUNT OF 
SURFACE BASED HEATING AVAILABLE DURING THE DAY TO ASSIST OTHER 
PARAMETERS CURRENTLY SUPPORTIVE OF SEVERE WEATHER. 35KT LOW LEVEL 
JET CURRENTLY LOCATED ACROSS OKLAHOMA WILL GRADUALLY MOVE EAST OVER 
THE MISSISSIPPI VALLEY ON MONDAY AND INCREASE TO AROUND 45KTS. 60KT 
WINDS AT 500 MB ALONG...ADEQUATE BUT NOT IDEAL 700 MB DEWPOINT 
DEPRESSIONS GREATER THAN 5C...AND A NEARLY UNIDIRECTIONAL WIND 
PROFILE ACROSS THE LOWER MISSISSIPPI VALLEY SUGGEST CONVECTION WILL 
DEVELOP INTO A LINE WITH BOWING SEGMENTS. MODEL SOUNDINGS SHOW THE 
ATMOSPHERE REMAINING NEARLY SATURATED IN THE ENTIRE COLUMN. HOWEVER 
UPSTREAM VISIBLE SATELLITE TRENDS ACROSS SOUTHERN TEXAS OVER THE 
PAST COUPLE OF HOURS SHOWING SOME SMALL BREAKS IN THE CLOUDS. AT 
THIS POINT I THINK AREAS PRIMARILY SOUTH OF I-40...ESPECIALLY ACROSS 
NORTHERN MISSISSIPPI HAVE THE BEST CHANCE OF SEEING A LITTLE BIT OF 
SUNSHINE BEFORE THE PRE-FRONTAL CONVECTION ARRIVES. TEMPERATURES 
WILL DROP INTO THE 30S TO LOWER 40S OVERNIGHT AFTER FRONTAL PASSAGE. 
AT THIS TIME AGREE WITH SPC THAT BEST RISK OF SEVERE WEATHER SHOULD 
MAINLY BE ALONG AND SOUTH OF I-40 WHERE BETTER INSTABILITY WILL BE 
LOCATED IN THE AFTERNOON. EVENING SHIFT WILL AGAIN EVALUATE SEVERE 
WEATHER POTENTIAL AFTER 00Z MODEL RUN BEGINS TO COME IN TONIGHT. 

TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY...HIGH PRESSURE WILL BUILD IN ACROSS THE MID 
SOUTH ON TUESDAY. 850 MB TEMPERATURES WILL DROP TO AROUND -3 TO -4C 
SUPPORTING HIGHS IN THE 40S TO LOWER 50S UNDER MOSTLY SUNNY/PARTLY 
CLOUDY SKIES. ANOTHER SHORTWAVE WILL AFFECT THE REGION TUESDAY NIGHT 
AND WEDNESDAY. ONLY MADE TEMPERATURE ADJUSTMENTS AS WEATHER/POP GRIDS 
HANDLING SITUATION WELL. 

.LONG TERM (THURSDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...LONG RANGE MODELS IN DECENT 
AGREEMENT WITH OVERALL NORTH AMERICAN PATTERN TRANSITIONING FROM 
WESTERN US RIDGING/EASTERN US TROUGHING TO A ZONAL FLOW ACROSS THE 
US BY EARLY NEXT WEEK. NO MAJOR CHANGES TO LONG RANGE GRIDS...ONLY 
FOR TIMING AND MAKING MINOR ADJUSTMENTS FOR TEMPERATURES NEXT 
WEEKEND. UPPER LEVEL TROUGH WILL DEPART THE AREA ON THURSDAY. 12Z 
GFS WARMER THAN PREVIOUS GFS RUNS ALONG WITH BOUNDARY LAYER 
REMAINING WARM SHOULD KEEP ANY REMAINING PRECIP AS ALL RAIN BEFORE 
TAPERING OFF. ANOTHER SHORTWAVE IN THE NORTHWEST FLOW WILL AFFECT 
THE LOWER MISSISSIPPI VALLEY ON FRIDAY. HOWEVER THE BEST FORCING 
WILL REMAIN ACROSS THE MIDDLE MISSISSIPPI AND OHIO VALLEYS AND WILL 
KEEP MENTION OF SLIGHT CHANCE OF RAIN FOR NOW. TEMPERATURES WILL 
WARM OVER THE WEEKEND AS THE LATEST MODEL RUN SHOWS SIGNS OF 
TRANSITIONING TO SOUTHWEST FLOW.
&&

.MEG...WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MS...NONE.
MO...NONE.
TN...NONE.

FXUS64 KMEG 061627
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
1025 AM CST SUN MAR 6 2005

.DISCUSSION...12Z UPPER AIR ANALYSIS THIS MORNING SHOWS UPPER LEVEL 
RIDGING BUILDING ACROSS THE MID SOUTH IN ADVANCE OF LONGWAVE TROUGH 
OVER THE NORTHERN AND CENTRAL PLAINS TO AFFECT THE FORECAST AREA ON 
MONDAY. 850 MB AIR AROUND 9C WILL GRADUALLY SHIFT EAST THROUGHOUT 
THE DAY...WHICH WOULD SUGGEST HIGHS AT BEST IN THE LOWER TO MIDDLE 
70S. SOME MID AND HIGH LEVEL CLOUDINESS OVER ARKANSAS AND TEXAS MAY 
KEEP TEMPERATURES DOWN A COUPLE OF DEGREES OR SO. BUT CURRENT GRIDS 
HANDLING FORECAST WELL AND WILL NOT PLAN TO ISSUE AN UPDATE.   

CJC


.PREV DISCUSSION...ISSUED 317 AM CST SUN MAR 6 2005
MOISTURE KICKS IN TONIGHT...CLOUDS SHOULD LOWER SOME DURING THE
NIGHT. CANT RULE OUT A SHOWER EXTREME WEST TOWARD SUNRISE...BUT
WILL GO DRY FOR NOW. WITH CLOUDS AND SOUTH WINDS...UPPER 40S TO
LOWER 50S STILL LOOKS GOOD.

PRECIPITATION WILL MOVE INTO THE AREA ON MONDAY AS NORTHWEST FLOW
SHORTWAVE MOVES TOWARD THE AREA. GFS A LITTLE FASTER THAN NAM ON
FRONTAL PASSAGE...AND MAY BE A BIT TOO QUICK. GOING TO LOOK AT THE
06Z NAM SOLUTION BEFORE MAKING A FINAL TIMING DECISION. AIRMASS WILL
BE UNSTABLE ENOUGH FOR CONVECTION...BUT QUESTION WILL BE AMOUNT OF
INSTABILITY. NOT EXPECTING A LOT OF SUNSHINE...IF ANY...INSTABILITIES
ON NAM SOLUTION MAY BE A BIT OVERDONE. WHILE SPC HAS AREA OUTLOOKED
FOR DAY 2...WILL HOLD OFF ON MENTIONING SEVERE IN THE ZONES DUE TO
INSTABILITY QUESTIONS. PLANNING ON HIGH LIKELY POPS FOR SHOWERS AND
ISOLATED THUNDER. IF MORE SUNSHINE THAN EXPECTED...WOULD NEED TO
BEEF UP THUNDER CHANCES.

FRONT THROUGH THE AREA MONDAY NIGHT AND EARLY TUESDAY...AND SHOULD
SEE RAPID CLEARING BEHIND THE FRONT. GFS LIKELY OVERDOING COLD AIR
PUSH...ESPECIALLY WITH EXPECTED CLEAR SKIES. WILL TRIM A CATEGORY
OFF PREVIOUS FORECAST FOR LOWS MONDAY NIGHT...BUT STILL WELL ABOVE
MAV GUIDANCE. TUESDAY HIGHS ANYWHERE FROM 2 TO 5 DEGREES WARMER
THAN GFS GUIDANCE.
&&

.LONG TERM (BEYOND TUESDAY)...
AGAIN GUIDANCE IS ALL OVER THE PLACE ON SOLUTIONS IN THE EXTENDED
PERIOD...ESPECIALLY WITH REGARD TO TEMPERATURES. NEW GFS SWINGS 2
MORE SYSTEMS AROUND EASTERN TROF...WEDNESDAY EVENING AND ABOUT
FRIDAY...BEFORE BRINGING US INTO A MORE ZONAL FLOW. ECMWF ALSO
SEEMS TO BE TRENDING IN THAT GENERAL DIRECTION.

THERE WILL BE LIGHT PRECIPITATION WITH THE WEDNESDAY EVENT. WHILE
THICKNESSES WOULD INDICATE POTENTIAL FOR SNOW...BOUNDARY LAYER
TEMPERATURES A LITTLE TOO WARM FOR SNOW. GFS SOUNDINGS ALSO SAY
THAT MOISTURE WONT BE SUBSTANTIAL IN THE LAYER NECESSARY TO GET
ENOUGH ICE NUCLEI FOR SNOW. THIS SYSTEM JUST NOW STARTING TO GET IN
THE RANGE OF THE NAM...SO WILL NEED TO LOOK CLOSE AGAIN TOMORROW.

FRIDAY EVENT ALSO RATHER MINOR...AND PRECIP ALL LIQUID.

GFS AND ECMWF APPEAR TO BE CONSIDERABLY MILDER FOR NEXT WEEKEND
THAN EARLIER RUNS. MEX DATA FOR NEXT SATURDAY FOR MEMPHIS CAME
IN 8 DEGREES WARMER THIS MORNING THAN YESTERDAY MORNING...AND
HAS A HIGH OF 68 AT MEMPHIS NEXT SUNDAY. ECMWF FALLS SHORT OF
THAT...BUT STILL WARMER THAN PREVIOUS RUNS. WILL NOT JUMP ON
WARMING COMPLETELY...BUT BUMPING UP PREVIOUS FORECAST AT THE END
OF THE PACKAGE SEVERAL DEGREES.
&&

.MEG...WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.

MO...NONE.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
317 AM CST SUN MAR 6 2005

.DISCUSSION...
SURFACE HIGH SITTING OVER THE MIDSOUTH EARLY THIS MORNING. CIRRUS
FROM SOUTHWEST U.S. SYSTEM HAS OVERSPREAD A LARGE AMOUNT OF THE CWA.
THOSE AREAS THAT HAVE BEEN UNDER THE CIRRUS SHIELD THE LONGEST...
SOUTHWEST HALF OF CWA...TEMPERATURES ARE IN THE 40S. AREAS WHERE
SKIES WERE CLEAR FOR SEVERAL HOURS DURING THE EVENING WITH LIGHT
WINDS...ARE IN THE LOW AND MIDDLE 30S. NEXT 24 HOURS WILL BE RATHER
QUIET.
&&

.SHORT TERM (THROUGH TUESDAY)...
SHOULD ONLY SEE SOME CIRRUS TODAY...AS MOIST RETURN FLOW DOESNT
REALLY PLUG IN UNTIL TONIGHT. BOUNDARY LAYER AND H850 TEMPERATURES
WOULD INDICATE TODAY 5 TO 7 DEGREES WARMER THAN ON SATURDAY. CIRRUS
CLOUDS SHOULD KNOCK A FEW DEGREES OFF THAT. FIGURE ABOUT A CATEGORY
WARMER ON THE AVERAGE...EXCEPT SE PORTION OF CWA WHICH DIDNT GET
INTO COOLER AIR UNTIL LATE IN THE DAY SATURDAY. WILL GO SIMILAR
TEMPS THERE.

MOISTURE KICKS IN TONIGHT...CLOUDS SHOULD LOWER SOME DURING THE
NIGHT. CANT RULE OUT A SHOWER EXTREME WEST TOWARD SUNRISE...BUT
WILL GO DRY FOR NOW. WITH CLOUDS AND SOUTH WINDS...UPPER 40S TO
LOWER 50S STILL LOOKS GOOD.

FRIDAY...BEFORE BRINGING US INTO A MORE ZONAL FLOW. ECMWF ALSO
SEEMS TO BE TRENDING IN THAT GENERAL DIRECTION.

THERE WILL BE LIGHT PRECIPITATION WITH THE WEDNESDAY EVENT. WHILE
THICKNESSES WOULD INDICATE POTENTIAL FOR SNOW...BOUNDARY LAYER
TEMPERATURES A LITTLE TOO WARM FOR SNOW. GFS SOUNDINGS ALSO SAY
THAT MOISTURE WONT BE SUBSTANTIAL IN THE LAYER NECESSARY TO GET
ENOUGH ICE NUCLEI FOR SNOW. THIS SYSTEM JUST NOW STARTING TO GET IN
THE RANGE OF THE NAM...SO WILL NEED TO LOOK CLOSE AGAIN TOMORROW.

FRIDAY EVENT ALSO RATHER MINOR...AND PRECIP ALL LIQUID.

GFS AND ECMWF APPEAR TO BE CONSIDERABLY MILDER FOR NEXT WEEKEND
THAN EARLIER RUNS. MEX DATA FOR NEXT SATURDAY FOR MEMPHIS CAME
IN 8 DEGREES WARMER THIS MORNING THAN YESTERDAY MORNING...AND
HAS A HIGH OF 68 AT MEMPHIS NEXT SUNDAY. ECMWF FALLS SHORT OF
THAT...BUT STILL WARMER THAN PREVIOUS RUNS. WILL NOT JUMP ON
WARMING COMPLETELY...BUT BUMPING UP PREVIOUS FORECAST AT THE END
OF THE PACKAGE SEVERAL DEGREES.
&&

.MEG...WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MS...NONE.
MO...NONE.
TN...NONE.
&&

829 PM CST SAT MAR 5 2005

.DISCUSSION...ONGOING FORECAST ON TRACK IN TERMS OF DEPICTING

WILL ALLOW CURRENT TEMPERATURE FORECAST RIDE AT THIS TIME.

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 052142
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
341 PM CST SAT MAR 5 2005

.DISCUSSION...LATEST SURFACE ANALYSIS PLACES SURFACE COLD FRONT 
ACROSS THE SOUTHEAST U.S. WITH HIGH PRESSURE ACROSS THE MID SOUTH. 
TEMPERATURES ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA REACHED THE LOWER TO MIDDLE 
60S...EVEN THOUGH THE WINDS HAVE BEEN PRIMARILY FROM THE NORTHWEST 
ALL DAY. WATER VAPOR IMAGERY SHOWS TWO UPPER LEVEL LOWS...ONE ACROSS 
WYOMING AND THE OTHER ACROSS THE SOUTHWEST U.S. MAIN FOCUS THIS 
FORECAST PACKAGE IS MAINLY PRECIPITATION CHANCES ASSOCIATED WITH 
NEXT COLD FRONT WHICH WILL PASS THROUGH THE MID SOUTH ON MONDAY. 

TONIGHT...VISIBLE SATELLITE SHOWS CIRRUS SHIELD ASSOCIATED WITH LOW 
OVER THE SOUTHWEST GRADUALLY SPREADING EAST. TEMPERATURES WILL 
GRADUALLY BEGIN TO DROP TONIGHT INTO THE 30S WITH MOSTLY CLEAR TO 
PARTLY CLOUDY SKIES EXPECTED AS SOME OF THE CIRRUS WILL GRADUALLY 
SPREAD EAST.

SUNDAY...WINDS WILL GRADUALLY VEER TO THE SOUTH AS SURFACE HIGH AND  
UPPER LEVEL RIDGE MOVES EAST ACROSS THE MID SOUTH. WARM AIR 
ADVECTION WILL INCREASE THROUGHOUT THE DAY...ESPECIALLY IN THE 
AFTERNOON. 850MB TEMPERATURES WILL RISE TO 8C BY LATE 
AFTERNOON...WHICH SUPPORTS HIGHS IN THE UPPER 60S TO LOWER 70S UNDER 
MOSTLY SUNNY/PARTLY CLOUDY SKIES. 

SUNDAY NIGHT...WARM ADVECTION WILL CONTINUE TO INCREASE THROUGH THE 
NIGHT AS COLD FRONT INCHES CLOSER TO THE LOWER MISSISSIPPI VALLEY. 
MODEL SOUNDINGS SHOW LOW/MID LEVEL MOISTURE NOT ARRIVING UNTIL AFTER 
12Z...AND WILL LEAVE DRY FOR NOW.

MONDAY AND TUESDAY...COLD FRONT EXPECTED TO MOVE THROUGH THE MID SOUTH 
MONDAY AFTERNOON/MONDAY EVENING. SEVERE WEATHER POTENTIAL COULD BE 
QUITE TRICKY DEPENDING ON THE AMOUNT OF INSTABILITY AVAILABLE AS THE 
FRONT APPROACHES. 850MB LOW LEVEL JET WILL MOVE ACROSS THE MID SOUTH 
DURING THE DAY WITH 500 MB WINDS AROUND 50KTS AND DECENT 700MB 
DEWPOINT DEPRESSIONS UPSTREAM. UNDER IDEAL CONDITIONS THIS WOULD 
SUGGEST THE POSSIBILITY OF BOWING SEGMENTS WITH THE LINE...ESPECIALLY IF 
ENOUGH DAYTIME HEATING OCCURS. MODEL SOUNDINGS SHOW MUCH IF NOT ALL 
OF THE FORECAST AREA REMAINING MOSTLY CLOUDY/CLOUDY THROUGHOUT THE 
DAY AND THINK ORGANIZED SEVERE WEATHER POTENTIAL AT THIS TIME MAY BE 
TRENDING LOW. HIGH PRESSURE WILL BUILD IN BEHIND THE FRONT ON 
TUESDAY WITH HIGHS PRIMARILY IN THE 60S. 

WEDNESDAY THROUGH SATURDAY...LONG RANGE MODELS IN BETTER CONSENSUS 
TODAY WITH OVERALL UPPER AIR PATTERN...ESPECIALLY THE GFS. NOT 
EXPECTING A PATTERN CHANGE AT THIS TIME WITH OVERALL UPPER AIR 
PATTERN SUGGESTING WESTERN U.S. UPPER LEVEL RIDGE WILL RETROGRADE A 
BIT WITH ANOTHER SHORTWAVE RIDING UP AND OVER THE RIDGE INTO THE 
EASTERN U.S. BY THE END OF NEXT WEEKEND. AS A RESULT...EXPECTING 
SHORTWAVES IN NORTHWEST FLOW TO BRING A CHANCE OF PRECIPITATION TO 
THE REGION EVERY OTHER DAY OR TWO. 
&&

.MEG...WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MS...NONE.
MO...NONE.
TN...NONE.
&&

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 051653
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
1050 AM CST SAT MAR 5 2005

.DISCUSSION...SURFACE ANALYSIS THIS MORNING PLACES A WEAKLY DEFINED 
SURFACE BOUNDARY ACROSS EASTERN TENNESSEE AND NORTHEAST MISSISSIPPI. 
MODIFIED THERMAL TROUGH WILL PASS ACROSS THE MID SOUTH THIS 
AFTERNOON WITH 850 MB TEMPERATURES DROPPING TO AROUND 
1-2C...SUPPORTING TEMPERATURES AT BEST IN THE LOWER TO MIDDLE 60S 
WITH DECENT MIXING. CURRENT GRIDS HANDLING FORECAST WELL AND WILL 
NOT ISSUE AN UPDATE. 

CJC

.PREV DISCUSSION...ISSUED 309 AM CST SAT MAR 5 2005

SKIES PRETTY MUCH CLEAR TONIGHT AND SUNDAY...AND WINDS GRADUALLY 
COME AROUND TO THE SOUTHWEST AHEAD OF NEXT SYSTEM. AS WINDS DECOUPLE 
TONIGHT...TEMPERATURES SHOULD FALL TO NEAR THE DEWPOINT IN MOST 
AREAS. CURRENT FORECAST HAS THIS HANDLED. SOUNDING INFORMATION 
INDICATES HIGHS ON SUNDAY SHOULD BE CLOSE TO THOSE WE SAW ON FRIDAY. 
AS WINDS PICK UP AHEAD OF NEXT SYSTEM SUNDAY EVENING...OVERNIGHT 
LOWS SHOULD BE CONSIDERABLY WARMER...MAINLY IN THE 40S.

MOISTURE INCREASES SUNDAY NIGHT AND MONDAY AHEAD OF CLIPPER FRONT.
MODELS HAVE GOTTEN QUICKER OVER THE LAST DAY OR TWO WITH FRONTAL
MOVEMENT. PRECIPITATION COULD BEGIN AS EARLY AS MONDAY MORNING...
BUT EXPECT MAIN PRECIPITATION TO BE MONDAY AFTERNOON AND MONDAY
EVENING. SOME CONFLICT IN NAM/GFS SOLUTIONS AS TO STABILITY
PARAMETERS...WITH NAM BEING A LITTLE MORE UNSTABLE AND A LITTLE
MORE CAPE. FOR NOW...WILL MENTION THUNDER IN FORECAST...BUT ONLY
ISOLATED. SPC DAY 3 OUTLOOK MENTIONING IF NAM SOLUTION LOOKS LIKE
IT WILL VERIFY...THEY MAY NEED TO MENTION SLIGHT RISK IN LATER
FORECASTS. WITH H85 TEMPS IN THE +8 TO +10 RANGE MONDAY...HIGHS
WILL BE WELL INTO THE 60S WITH ANY SUN AT ALL. WILL BE CONSERVATIVE
FOR NOW...BUT WOULDNT BE SHOCKED TO SEE A FEW 70S ON MONDAY IF
CLOUDS TAKE A WHILE TO GET HERE.
&&

.LONG TERM (BEYOND MONDAY)...
PRETTY MUCH THE SAME STORY AS YESTERDAY MORNING. MODELS HAVE BEEN
VACILLATING ON THE SYSTEM EARLY IN THE WORKWEEK...ESPECIALLY WITH
RESPECT TO THE AMOUNT OF COLD AIR EXPECTED TO MOVE INTO OUR AREA.
ISSUE WILL BE WHETHER A PIECE OF SOUTHWEST U.S. SYSTEM PHASES WITH A
VORT COMING THROUGH LONGWAVE TROF ON MONDAY NIGHT.

HARD TO TIME SHORTWAVES MOVING THROUGH TROF IN EXTENDED. SINCE
SOLUTIONS ARE STILL RATHER VARIED...WILL NOT MESS WITH TIMING OF
PRECIPITATION CURRENTLY IN THE FORECAST.

TEMPERATURES...SHOULD BE BELOW NORMAL ON TUESDAY AFTER FRONTAL
PASSAGE. GFS HAS BEEN GOING BACK AND FORTH ON THE AMOUNT OF COLD AIR
FOR OUR AREA. OBVIOUSLY...AREAS TO OUR NORTH AND EAST WILL BE RATHER
CHILLY DURING THE MIDDLE OF NEXT WEEK. EXPECT TEMPERATURES TO BE
BELOW NORMAL ACROSS THE AREA FROM TUESDAY ONWARD.  IF THE SOUTHWEST
U.S. SYSTEM DOES END UP PHASING WITH THE EASTERN TROF...WE MAY NEED
TO LOWER TEMPERATURES IN LATER FORECAST...BUT CURRENT CONSENSUS IS
THAT COLD AIR WILL BE JUST A GLANCING BLOW HERE...AND NO WORSE THAN
WE HAVE SEEN IN THE LAST COUPLE OF WEEKS.

&&

.MEG...WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MS...NONE.
MO...NONE.
TN...NONE.

AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
915 PM CST FRI MAR 4 2005

.DISCUSSION...THIS EVENINGS SURFACE ANALYSIS PLACED A PRE-FRONTAL 
TROF BISECTING SOUTHERN ILLINOIS...THROUGH THE BOOTHEEL OF 
MISSOURI...INTO NORTHEAST ARKANSAS. AHEAD OF THIS PRE-FRONTAL TROUGH 
A HANDFUL OF SHOWERS WITH A COUPLE EMBEDDED LIGHTNING STRIKES HAVE 
OCCURRED ACROSS NORTHEAST ARKANSAS AND WEST TENNESSEE NORTH OF 
INTERSTATE 40. CURRENT FORECAST DEPICTS THIS SCENARIO FAIRLY WELL 
WHERE MARGINAL AND ELEVATED INSTABILITY EXISTS. 

ACTUAL COLD FRONT..RESIDES ACROSS CENTRAL MISSOURI AT THIS TIME. 
CURRENT 00Z SOUNDING FOR MEMPHIS AIRPORT FROM THE UNIVERSITY OF 
WISCONSIN (HTTP://CIMMS/SSEC/WISC.EDU/AERI/REALTIME/MEMPHIS) SHOWS 
MORE STABLE AND DRIER MID LEVELS THAN COMPARED TO THE NORTH WITH LI 
NEAR 5. HENCE...WILL MAKE NO CHANGES TO ONGOING FORECAST WITH VERY 
FEW RENEGADE SHOWERS NORTH OF INTERSTATE 40. 

WEAK DISTURBANCE CURRENTLY DEPICTED BY WATER VAPOR AND 00Z MODELS 
INDICATE SHORTWAVE SLIDING SOUTHEAST ALONG ILLINOIS/MISSOURI/IOWA 
TRI-STATE BORDER REGION.  THIS SHORT WAVE DISTURBANCE WILL MOVE 
SOUTHEAST ACROSS WESTERN TENNESSEE SATURDAY MORNING. THIS SHORTWAVE 
WILL HELP SEND A WEAK COLD FRONT INTO OUR CWA DURING THE LATE 
MORNING HOURS SATURDAY. THIS FRONT WILL BE MOISTURE STARVED AND IS 
EXPECTED TO PASS THROUGH THE AREA WITH NWLY WINDS AND SLIGHTLY 
COOLER AIR BEHIND IT WITH NIL PRECIPITATION.

FXUS64 KMEG 042132
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
330 PM CST FRI MAR 4 2005

.DISCUSSION...LATEST SURFACE ANALYSIS PLACES A SURFACE TROUGH ACROSS 
WESTERN MISSOURI/SE KANSAS/NE OKLAHOMA. TEMPERATURES ACROSS THE MID 
SOUTH THIS AFTERNOON ARE MOSTLY IN THE 60S. VISIBLE SATELLITE SHOWS 
AN ALTOCU FIELD ACROSS SOUTHEAST MISSOURI. MAIN FORECAST CONCERNS 
THIS PACKAGE WILL BE PRECIPITATION CHANCES TONIGHT AND MONDAY. 

TONIGHT...SHORTWAVE LOCATED ACROSS THE UPPER MIDWEST WILL SWING 
THROUGH THE MID SOUTH TONIGHT. 700-500 MB LAYER MID LEVEL LAPSE 
RATES WILL STEEPEN TO 7 C/KM IN RESPONSE TO THE TROUGH. MODEL 
SOUNDINGS INDICATE BEST AREA OF WEAK INSTABILITY WILL BE TOWARDS THE 
MO BOOTHEEL AND ACROSS N TENNESSEE NEAR THE KENTUCKY BORDER WITH 
600-700 J/KG OF CAPE AND LI/S AROUND -2.  

SATURDAY AND SATURDAY NIGHT...HIGH PRESSURE WILL BUILD BACK IN 
ACROSS THE AREA WITH TEMPERATURES A FEW DEGREES LOWER THAN TODAY AS 
THERMAL TROUGH MOVES THROUGH DURING THE DAY. 

SUNDAY...WARM ADVECTION BEGINS TO SETUP ACROSS THE MID SOUTH IN 
ADVANCE OF NEXT COLD FRONT TO ARRIVE ON MONDAY AND AS UPPER LEVEL 
RIDGE TRANSLATES EAST FROM THE SOUTHERN PLAINS. ADJUSTED 
TEMPERATURES UP A FEW DEGREES FROM PREVIOUS FORECAST AS 850 MB 
TEMPERATURES WILL RISE TO AROUND 8C BY 00Z MONDAY...WHICH WOULD 
SUPPORT HIGHS IN THE UPPER 60S TO LOWER 70S. MAY NEED TO RAISE 
TEMPERATURES A BIT MORE BUT WILL WAIT FOR ANOTHER RUN BEFORE DOING 
SO. 

MONDAY...MODELS BEGIN TO DIVERGE WITH HANDLING OF COLD FRONT SET TO 
ARRIVE MONDAY AFTERNOON/MONDAY EVENING. NAM /ETA/ IS A BIT SLOWER 
THAN THE GFS AND KEEPS THE BEST DYNAMICAL FORCING ACROSS THE MID 
MISSISSIPPI AND OHIO VALLEYS...WHILE THE GFS DIGS DEEPER ACROSS THE 
MISSISSIPPI VALLEY. 850MB LOW LEVEL JET WILL TRANSPORT SOME LOW 
LEVEL MOISTURE FROM THE GULF OF MEXICO. STABILITY PARAMETERS AT THIS 
TIME SUGGEST THAT ANY THUNDERSTORMS MAY BE ELEVATED WITH BEST 
CHANCES FOR THUNDER MOSTLY WEST OF THE MISSISSIPPI RIVER.

TUESDAY THROUGH FRIDAY...LATEST 00Z LONG RANGE MODEL RUN 
CONSISTENCY NOT THAT GREAT AS MODEL SOLUTIONS DIVERGE ON DAYS 6 AND 
7. GFS AND NOGAPS STILL BOTH HINTING AT WESTERN US RIDGE BREAKING 
DOWN BY NEXT WEEKEND BUT EUROPEAN SHOWING AMPLIFICATION OF THE 
RIDGE. AS A RESULT...WILL KEEP DAY 7 DRY FOR NOW UNTIL ANALYSIS OF 
LATER MODEL RUNS. HIGH PRESSURE WILL BUILD IN BEHIND THE COLD FRONT 
BY EARLY TUESDAY. ANOTHER SHORTWAVE WILL DROP DOWN FROM CANADA BY 
MID WEEK PRODUCING A CHANCE OF SHOWERS ACROSS THE MID SOUTH ON 
WEDNESDAY AND AGAIN ON THURSDAY NIGHT.

&&

FXUS64 KMEG 041719
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
1115 AM CST FRI MAR 4 2005

.DISCUSSION...UPPER AIR ANALYSIS THIS MORNING DEPICTS A SHORTWAVE 
ACROSS SOUTHWEST MISSOURI/EASTERN OKLAHOMA AND ANOTHER SHORTWAVE 
ASSOCIATED WITH AN UPPER LEVEL LOW ACROSS NORTHERN MINNESOTA. MAIN 
FORECAST CONCERNS THIS AFTERNOON WILL BE PRECIPITATION CHANCES.

MODIFIED RUC SOUNDINGS BASED ON A SURFACE BASED PARCEL(61/48) 
PRODUCES LIFTED INDICIES AROUND -2...500-600 J/KG CAPE AND LITTLE IF 
ANY CONVECTIVE INHIBITION. THINK CHANCES OF ANYWHERE SEEING ANY 
MEASUREABLE PRECIP DEFINITELY ISOLATED AT BEST. VISIBLE SATELLITE 
ACROSS THE MID SOUTH SHOWS SOME ALTOCU MOVING ACROSS THE MISSOURI 
BOOTHEEL AND THE NORTHEAST SECTION OF THE FORECAST AREA. 88D TRENDS 
SHOWING ONLY MID LEVEL RETURNS WITH NO PRECIP BEING REPORTED THUS 
FAR ACROSS SE MISSOURI. WILL BE ISSUING AN UPDATE SHORTLY TO ADD A 
SLIGHT CHANCE OF A SHOWER OR THUNDERSTORM ACROSS A PORTION OF THE 
NORTHEAST FORECAST AREA AND ALSO TO ADJUST HIGHS BASED UPON CURRENT 
TRENDS.

CJC  

.PREV DISCUSSION...ISSUED 325 AM CST FRI MAR 4 2005

SHORTWAVE MOVING THROUGH SOUTHERN MISSOURI EARLY THIS MORNING WITH
SCATTERED SHOWERS AHEAD OF IT. AN OCCASIONAL LIGHTNING STRIKE...BUT
NOTHING BIG. NOT SEEING MANY SURFACE REPORTS OF PRECIPITATION OVER
THE LAST COUPLE OF HOURS. WILL PROBABLY MAKE A LAST MINUTE DECISION
ON SHORT TERM POPS...LEANING TOWARD ISOLATED THIS MORNING...DRY
DURING THE AFTERNOON HOURS. TEMPS RANGING FROM LOWER 30S EXTREME EAST
TO MID 40S NORTHWEST. BATCH OF CLOUDS WITH AREA OF SHOWERS...BUT MOST
OF REMAINDER OF CWA IS CLEAR. &&

.SHORT TERM (THROUGH SUNDAY)...
CURRENT SHORTWAVE SHOULD MOVE OUT OF THE AREA DURING THE MORNING
HOURS...TAKING THE SHOWERS AND CLOUDINESS WITH IT...LEAVING
MOSTLY SUNNY SKIES. A SOMEWHAT STRONGER IMPULSE WILL MOVE THROUGH
THE LONGWAVE TROF OVERNIGHT TONIGHT. THIS ENERGY WILL BE A LITTLE
FURTHER NORTH AND EAST THAN WHAT IS GOING THROUGH THIS MORNING.
MOISTURE BORDERLINE...BUT LAPSE RATES INDICATE ANY PRECIP COULD BE
CONVECTIVE IN NATURE. WILL CHANGE TONIGHTS PRECIP MENTION FROM
SHOWERS TO THUNDERSTORMS ACROSS ABOUT NORTHEAST THIRD OF CWA...AND
MENTION OF THUNDER FITS WITH OUR NEIGHBORS. AGAIN...PRECIPITATION
AREA SHOULD CLEAR THE CWA BY SUNRISE ON SATURDAY. REST OF THE
WEEKEND SHOULD BE DRY.

TEMPERATURES TODAY SHOULD BE 3-5 DEGREES WARMER THAN ON THURSDAY...
SO HAVE BUMPED UP PREVIOUS FORECAST A COUPLE OF DEGREES. CLOUDS WITH
SHORTWAVE TONIGHT SHOULD HOLD TEMPERATURES UP IN THE 40S. SATURDAY
WILL BE A LITTLE COOLER THAN TODAY...ESPECIALLY IN THE NORTHEAST
QUARTER OF THE CWA. SATURDAY NIGHT WILL BE THE CHILLY ONE OF THE
BATCH...BUT STILL ABOVE FREEZING IN MOST AREAS. SUNDAY HIGHS FAIRLY
CLOSE TO SATURDAYS...WITH SOME MODERATION NORTHEAST.
&&

.LONG TERM (BEYOND SUNDAY)...
MODELS HAVE BEEN VACILLATING ON THE SYSTEM EARLY IN THE WORKWEEK...
ESPECIALLY WITH RESPECT TO THE AMOUNT OF COLD AIR EXPECTED TO MOVE
INTO OUR AREA. ISSUE WILL BE WHETHER A PIECE OF SOUTHWEST U.S.
SYSTEM PHASES WITH A VORT COMING THROUGH LONGWAVE TROF ON MONDAY
NIGHT.

CURRENT MODEL TIMING OF A FRONTAL PASSAGE MONDAY NIGHT APPEARS
REASONABLE. WILL HAVE ABOUT 12-18 HOURS OF LOW LEVEL MOISTURE
ADVECTION AHEAD OF THE FRONT. PLAN TO GO WITH MID-RANGE POPS FOR
NOW...AND EXPECT THAT I WILL BE RAISING THEM A LITTLE MORE IN A
FUTURE FORECAST...IF MODELS CONTINUE THEIR TRENDS.

ANOTHER SHORTWAVE TO MOVE THROUGH WEDNESDAY...WITH A CHANCE OF
RAIN. DRY DURING DAYTIME HOURS TUESDAY AND AGAIN ON THURSDAY.

TEMPERATURES...SHOULD BE NEAR NORMAL LEVELS ON MONDAY...BUT BELOW
NORMAL ON TUESDAY AFTER FRONTAL PASSAGE. GFS HAS BEEN GOING BACK AND
FORTH ON THE AMOUNT OF COLD AIR FOR OUR AREA. OBVIOUSLY...AREAS TO
OUR NORTH AND EAST WILL BE RATHER CHILLY DURING THE MIDDLE OF NEXT
WEEK. EXPECT TEMPERATURES TO BE BELOW NORMAL ACROSS THE AREA FROM
TUESDAY ONWARD.  IF THE SOUTHWEST U.S. SYSTEM DOES END UP PHASING
WITH THE EASTERN TROF...WE MAY NEED TO LOWER TEMPERATURES IN LATER
FORECAST...BUT CURRENT CONSENSUS IS THAT COLD AIR WILL BE JUST A
GLANCING BLOW HERE...AND NO WORSE THAN WE HAVE SEEN IN THE LAST
COUPLE OF WEEKS.

&&

.MEG...WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MS...NONE.
MO...NONE.
TN...NONE.
&&

AREA SHOULD CLEAR THE CWA BY SUNRISE ON SATURDAY. REST OF THE
WEEKEND SHOULD BE DRY.

TEMPERATURES TODAY SHOULD BE 3-5 DEGREES WARMER THAN ON THURSDAY...
SO HAVE BUMPED UP PREVIOUS FORECAST A COUPLE OF DEGREES. CLOUDS WITH
SHORTWAVE TONIGHT SHOULD HOLD TEMPERATURES UP IN THE 40S. SATURDAY
WILL BE A LITTLE COOLER THAN TODAY...ESPECIALLY IN THE NORTHEAST
QUARTER OF THE CWA. SATURDAY NIGHT WILL BE THE CHILLY ONE OF THE
BATCH...BUT STILL ABOVE FREEZING IN MOST AREAS. SUNDAY HIGHS FAIRLY
CLOSE TO SATURDAYS...WITH SOME MODERATION NORTHEAST.
&&

.LONG TERM (BEYOND SUNDAY)...
MODELS HAVE BEEN VACILLATING ON THE SYSTEM EARLY IN THE WORKWEEK...
ESPECIALLY WITH RESPECT TO THE AMOUNT OF COLD AIR EXPECTED TO MOVE
INTO OUR AREA. ISSUE WILL BE WHETHER A PIECE OF SOUTHWEST U.S.
SYSTEM PHASES WITH A VORT COMING THROUGH LONGWAVE TROF ON MONDAY
NIGHT.

CURRENT MODEL TIMING OF A FRONTAL PASSAGE MONDAY NIGHT APPEARS
REASONABLE. WILL HAVE ABOUT 12-18 HOURS OF LOW LEVEL MOISTURE
ADVECTION AHEAD OF THE FRONT. PLAN TO GO WITH MID-RANGE POPS FOR
NOW...AND EXPECT THAT I WILL BE RAISING THEM A LITTLE MORE IN A
FUTURE FORECAST...IF MODELS CONTINUE THEIR TRENDS.

ANOTHER SHORTWAVE TO MOVE THROUGH WEDNESDAY...WITH A CHANCE OF
RAIN. DRY DURING DAYTIME HOURS TUESDAY AND AGAIN ON THURSDAY.

TEMPERATURES...SHOULD BE NEAR NORMAL LEVELS ON MONDAY...BUT BELOW
NORMAL ON TUESDAY AFTER FRONTAL PASSAGE. GFS HAS BEEN GOING BACK AND
FORTH ON THE AMOUNT OF COLD AIR FOR OUR AREA. OBVIOUSLY...AREAS TO
OUR NORTH AND EAST WILL BE RATHER CHILLY DURING THE MIDDLE OF NEXT
WEEK. EXPECT TEMPERATURES TO BE BELOW NORMAL ACROSS THE AREA FROM
TUESDAY ONWARD.  IF THE SOUTHWEST U.S. SYSTEM DOES END UP PHASING
WITH THE EASTERN TROF...WE MAY NEED TO LOWER TEMPERATURES IN LATER
FORECAST...BUT CURRENT CONSENSUS IS THAT COLD AIR WILL BE JUST A
GLANCING BLOW HERE...AND NO WORSE THAN WE HAVE SEEN IN THE LAST
COUPLE OF WEEKS.

&&

.MEG...WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MS...NONE.
MO...NONE.
TN...NONE.
&&

$$

WAGNER





000 
FXUS64 KMEG 040216
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
807 PM CST THU MAR 3 2005

.UPDATE...
CURRENT FORECAST IS FINE AND NO UPDATES NEEDED AT THIS TIME. WILL
CONTINUE TO MONITOR THUNDERSTORMS UPSTREAM MOVING INTO SOUTHERN
MO. THESE STORMS ARE ASSOCIATED WITH AN UPPER LEVEL DISTURBANCE
THAT WILL BE MOVING INTO THE MIDSOUTH LATER TONIGHT. CURRENT LAPS
AND RUC DATA SHOWS THESE STORMS MOVING INTO A MORE STABLE AIR MASS
AS THEY APPROACH THE MIDSOUTH. THINK THEY WILL DECREASE IN
COVERAGE AND INTENSITY...THUS 20 PERCENT CHANCE OF THUNDERSTORMS
FOR OUR NORTHERN COUNTIES AFTER MIDNIGHT STILL LOOKS GOOD. 

&&

.PREV DISCUSSION... (ISSUED 308 PM CST THU MAR 3 2005) 

DISCUSSION...WATER VAPOR IMAGERY SHOWS WESTERN US RIDGE AMPLIFYING 
IN RESPONSE TO DIGGING TROUGH ACROSS THE PACIFIC...AND TYPICAL 
WINTER TIME CANADIAN TROUGHING ACROSS THE EASTERN US. SOME DIURNAL 
CUMULUS FORMED DURING THE MORNING IN RESPONSE TO SOME RESIDUAL LOW 
LEVEL MOISTURE AROUND 925 MB. 500 MB UPPER AIR AND WATER VAPOR 
IMAGERY SHOWS NEXT SHORTWAVE ACROSS THE UPPER MISSISSIPPI VALLEY 
DROPPING SOUTH TOWARDS THE MID SOUTH. MAIN FORECAST CONCERNS IN THE 
SHORT TERM IS PRECIPITATION CHANCES TONIGHT AND AGAIN FRIDAY NIGHT.

TONIGHT...WEAK SHORTWAVE FROM THE UPPER MISSISSIPPI VALLEY WILL DROP 
SOUTH IN THE NORTHWEST FLOW...RESULTING IN A CHANCE OF PRECIP ACROSS 
A PORTION OF THE NORTHERN FORECAST AREA. CANNOT RULE OUT A CHANCE OF 
ELEVATED THUNDER WITH 700-500 MB LAYER LAPSE RATES WILL STEEPENING 
TO AROUND 7 C/KM...WITH SHOWALTER LIFTED INDICES DROPPING TO AROUND 
0 OR SLIGHTLY BELOW. CURRENT GRIDS HANDLING 20 POPS WELL ACROSS THE 
NORTHERN THIRD OF THE FORECAST AREA AND WILL NOT MAKE ANY CHANGES AS 
BETTER RAIN CHANCES WILL BE FURTHER NORTH.

FRIDAY AND FRIDAY NIGHT...ANOTHER SHORTWAVE WILL AFFECT THE MID 
SOUTH BRINGING ANOTHER CHANCE OF RAIN TO THE FAR NORTHERN TIER OF 
COUNTIES BY LATE AFTERNOON AND INTO THE EVENING HOURS. MODEL 
SOUNDINGS SUGGEST THUNDER NOT OUT OF THE QUESTION AT THE ONSET WITH 
ALMOST 1000 J/KG OF CAPE...NEGATIVE LI/S AND SHOWALTER INDICES AND 
MODERATE TO STEEP 700-500 MB LAYER MID LEVEL LAPSE RATES /6.5-7.0 
C/KM/. HOWEVER...I THINK THE BIG LIMITING FACTOR WILL BE MOISTURE AS 
DEWPOINTS WILL STRUGGLE TO GET INTO THE LOWER 40S. CONSEQUENTLY...I 
WENT WITH 20 POPS ACROSS THE NORTHERN TIER AND SPREADING FURTHER 
SOUTH ACROSS PORTIONS OF NORTHEAST ARKANSAS AND WESTERN TENNESSEE 
DURING THE EVENING. HIGH PRESSURE WILL BUILD BACK IN ON SATURDAY AND 
RAISED TEMPERATURES SLIGHTLY FOR SATURDAY AND SUNDAY IN ADVANCE OF 
NEXT FRONT TO AFFECT THE AREA BY MONDAY.

MONDAY THROUGH THURSDAY...LONG RANGE MODELS MOSTLY IN AGREEMENT 
THROUGH EXTENDED BUT BEGIN TO DIVERGE TOWARDS DAYS 6 AND 7. LATEST 
COUPLE OF RUNS SHOWING PATTERN A LITTLE FASTER THAN PREVIOUS RUNS. 
GFS/CANADIAN SUGGESTING WESTERN RIDGE WILL FINALLY BREAK DOWN WHILE 
LATEST EUROPEAN/NAVY NOGAPS RUN SHOWS RIDGE HOLDING FIRM OR VERY 
SLIGHTLY BREAKING DOWN. AS A RESULT...LONG RANGE FORECAST WILL LEAN 
TOWARDS THE EUROPEAN/NOGAPS SOLUTION TOWARDS DAYS 6 AND 7. 

A COLD FRONT WILL PASS THROUGH THE MID SOUTH ON MONDAY BRINGING A 
CHANCE OF RAIN SHOWERS TO THE REGION WITH THE BEST CHANCES OF RAIN 
MAINLY IN THE AFTERNOON AND TAPERING OFF DURING THE EVENING. 
ADJUSTED POPS TO TRIM BACK RAIN CHANCES MONDAY EVENING WITH QUICKER 
PROGRESSION IN LATEST MODEL RUNS. HIGH PRESSURE WILL BUILD BACK IN 
ON TUESDAY ACROSS THE MID SOUTH. ANOTHER CLIPPER WILL MOVE THROUGH 
THE AREA BY WEDNESDAY...RESULTING IN ANOTHER CHANCE OF RAIN...THEN 
HIGH PRESSURE COMING BACK FOR THURSDAY. MADE SOME TEMPERATURE 
ADJUSTMENTS TO LATTER HALF OF EXTENDED WITH LATEST RUN TRENDING A 
BIT WARMER.

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.

&&

$$

FXUS64 KMEG 031659
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
1057 AM CST THU MAR 3 2005

.DISCUSSION...LATEST SURFACE AND UPPER LEVEL ANALYSIS PLACES HIGH 
PRESSURE ACROSS THE OHIO AND TENNESSEE VALLEYS. VISIBLE SATELLITE 
SHOWS SUNNY/MOSTLY SUNNY SKIES ACROSS MUCH OF THE FORECAST AREA THIS 
MORNING WITH STRATUS ACROSS NORTHERN MISSISSIPPI QUICKLY ERODING 
SOUTH OVER THE PAST COUPLE OF HOURS. AT THE SAME TIME...DIURNAL 
CUMULUS BEGINNING TO FORM MAINLY IN THE MISSISSIPPI RIVER DELTA. 
WILL ISSUE AN UPDATE TO ACCOUNT FOR CLOUD COVER TRENDS AND MINOR 
TEMPERATURE TRENDS.

UPDATED GRIDS WILL BE OUT SHORTLY.

CJC

.PREV DISCUSSION...ISSUED 200 AM CST THU MAR 3 2005.

SHORTWAVE HELPING TO PRODUCE LIGHT RAIN OVER SOUTHERN SECTIONS OF 
THE MIDSOUTH WILL CONTINUE PUSHING SOUTHWARD TODAY. EXPECT RAIN TO 
MOVE OUT OF THE MIDSOUTH BY 12Z. HOWEVER CLOUDS WILL HANG AROUND 
ESPECIALLY SOUTHERN SECTIONS OF THE CWA TODAY. EXPECT THERE TO BE A 
TIGHT GRADIENT ACROSS THE AREA BETWEEN MOSTLY SUNNY CONDITIONS TO 
THE NORTH AND MOSTLY CLOUDY CONDITIONS TO THE SOUTH. EXPECT THE LINE 
WILL BE SOMEWHERE NEAR MEMPHIS. 

AN UNSETTLED WEATHER PATTERN IS SETTING UP TO TAKE PLACE ACROSS THE 
MIDSOUTH THIS WEEK. SEVERAL SHORTWAVES WILL MOVE IN AND OUT OF THE 
CWA BETWEEN TODAY AND SATURDAY. THIS WILL BRING OFF AND ON CHANCES 
FOR RAIN TO PORTIONS OF THE MIDSOUTH. MODELS DO NOT HAVE A GOOD 
HANDLE ON TIMING OF THESE SHORTWAVES SO THIS DOESN/T HELP MAKE THE 
FORECAST ANY EASIER. RIGHT NOW... IT LOOKS LIKE NORTHERN SECTIONS 
WILL SEE A SHORTWAVE MOVE THROUGH TONIGHT INTO FRIDAY 
MORNING...WHILE SOUTHERN SECTIONS WILL SEE A SHORTWAVE MOVE THROUGH 
FRIDAY NIGHT. CLOUDS WILL HELP KEEP TEMPERATURES DOWN ACROSS 
SOUTHERN SECTIONS OF THE MIDSOUTH.

BRIEF HIGH PRESSURE WILL BUILD INTO THE AREA FOR THE WEEKEND 
ALLOWING FOR DRY CONDITIONS TO OCCUR FOR THE MIDSOUTH DURING THIS TIME.

SEVERAL COLD FRONTS WILL THEN SWING THROUGH THE AREA DURING THE 
BEGINNING TO MIDDLE PART OF NEXT WEEK. THIS WILL BRING RAIN CHANCES 
BACK TO THE MIDSOUTH. WOULDN/T BE SURPRISED TO SEE RAIN CHANGE OVER 
TO SNOW BRIEFLY AS PRECIPITATION ENDS(AT LEAST WITH THE SECOND 
FRONT) AS THESE FRONTS MOVE THROUGH THE AREA. MODELS ARE SHOWING 
MUCH COLDER AIR MOVING IN BEHIND THE FRONTS...BUT STILL TOO EARLY TO 
TELL IF ANY SNOW WILL OCCUR ESPECIALLY WITH THE MODEL 
INCONSISTENCIES. RIGHT NOW...LOOKS LIKE FIRST FRONT WILL MOVE 
THROUGH ON MONDAY WITH ANOTHER ONE MOVING THROUGH ON WEDNESDAY. THE 
SHOTS OF COLD AIR LOOK TO BE SHORT-LIVED AT LEAST WITH THE FIRST 
FRONT AS A QUICK WARM UP IS EXPECTED ON TUESDAY.

KRM

.MEG...WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MS...NONE.
MO...NONE.
TN...NONE.

AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
223 PM CST WED MAR 2 2005

.DISCUSSION...
SHORTWAVE MOVING INTO THE SOUTH PLAINS THIS AFTERNOON. CLOUDS CONT 
TO INCREASE  ACRS THE SW PART OF THE CWFA AS WEAK ISENTROPIC LIFT 
DEVELOPS ACRS THE LOWER MS VALLEY. ISOLD PRECIP COVERAGE ACRS AR 
WHILE MORE SIGNIFICANT PRECIP WAS OVER LA. 

EXPECT ISOLD/SCT COVERAGE THIS EVENING ACRS SW PARTS OF THE 
SW...BASICALLY SOUTH AND WEST OF MEMPHIS. BEST LIFT AND MOISTURE 
COMBINATION WILL REMAIN TO THE SOUTH OF THE AREA...ACRS LA AND SRN 
MS. ANY PRECIP SHOULD BE LIGHT WITH JUST A FEW HUNDRETHS IN PLACES 
THAT DO SEE SOME RAIN. THE NRN TIER OF THE MID SOUTH PROBABLY WL NOT 
EVEN GO CLOUDY SO EXPECT TEMPS TO FALL BELOW FREEZING FROM THE 
BOOTHEEL TO THE TN RIVER VALLEY. 

HIGH PRESSURE BUILD IN FOR THU WITH SLIGHTLY BELOW NORMAL TEMPS. A 
WEAK SHORTWAVE PASSES JUST TO THE NORTH THU NIGHT WITH PERHAPS MORE  
CLOUDS ACRS THE NRN TIER. WITH SURFACE HIGH PRES ALONG THE JUST 
COAST AND SW FLOW EXPECT A NICE WARM UP FOR FRI WITH TEMPS CLIMBING 
ABOVE 60 DEGREES. 

A DECENT SHORTWAVE PASSES NE OF THE REGION FRI NIGHT INTO SAT 
BRINGING A COLD FRONT THROUGH THE REGION. NOT A LOT OF MOISTURE WITH 
THIS SYSTEMS SO WL KEEP POPS IN THE SLIGHT CHC CATEGORY. HIGH 
PRESSURE BUILDS IN FOR SAT NIGHT AND SUN.

SIGNIFICANT SYSTEM ON TAP FOR EARLY NEXT WEEK. LOOKS LIKE A STRONG 
TROF WL MOVE THROUGH THE AREA WITH RAIN ON MON AND MUCH COLDER AIR 
TUE INTO WED. GFS AND ECMWF IN REASONABLE AGREEMENT AND HAVE COOLED 
THE EXTENDED SIGNIFICANTLY.

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 021633
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
1033 AM CST WED MAR 2 2005

.UPDATE...
500 MB SHORTWAVE WILL MOVE INTO THE SOUTHERN PLAINS WITH AN AREA OF 
WEAK ISENTROPIC LIFT CONTINUING TO DEVELOP ACRS THE LOWER MS VALLEY 
THIS AFTN. CLOUDS WL INCREASE THIS AFTN. THE DEEPEST MOISTURE AND 
LIFT LOOKS TO REMAIN SOUTH AND WEST OF THE AREA THIS AFTN THOUGH 
SOME LIGHT RAIN IS POSSIBLE ACRS NW PARTS OF MS/ERN AR THIS AFTN. 

12Z MODELS ARE TRENDING AWAY FROM PRECIP ACRS NRN MS TONIGHT. BOTH 
MODELS KEEP BULK OF MOISTURE ACRS LA/MS OVERNIGHT. POPS WL PROBABLY 
BE TRIMMED BACK IN THE AFTN PACKAGE. 

.PREV DISCUSSION ISSUED AT 235 AM...
SURFACE HIGH CURRENTLY CENTERED OVER CENTRAL MISSISSIPPI. SHORTWAVE
OVER THE SOUTHERN ROCKIES KICKING OFF PRECIPITATION OVER TEXAS.
SEEING SOME ECHOES OFF LZK RADAR...BUT NO INDICATIONS ANY
PRECIPITATION REACHING THE SURFACE. LOOKS LIKE BASE OF ECHOES IS
SOMEWHERE BETWEEN 4000 AND 5000 FEET.

SKIES OVER THE CWA ARE CURRENTLY MOSTLY CLEAR WITH MOST TEMPERATURES
IN THE 20S.
&&

.SHORT TERM (THROUGH FRIDAY)...
UPPER TROF OVER GREAT LAKES AND NORTHEAST U.S. WITH IMPULSES
MOVING THROUGH THE TROF. SOUTHWESTERN SYSTEM WILL BRING AN AREA OF
ISENTROPIC LIFT...BEST SHOWN ON 285-295K SURFACES...ACROSS NORTH
HALF OF MISSISSIPPI THIS AFTERNOON INTO THURSDAY. MOISTURE RATHER
MEAGER WITH THIS SYSTEM...AND GUIDANCE POPS HAVE BACKED OFF OF
THOSE OF 01/06Z MAV GUIDANCE. MOST OR ALL OF THE CWA SHOULD BE DRY
THROUGH MID-DAY TODAY...WITH CHANCES FOR PRECIPITATION GRADUALLY
INCREASING FROM SOUTHWEST TO NORTHEAST DURING THE AFTERNOON AND
EVENING HOURS. POPS WILL BE HIGHEST ACROSS THE EXTREME SOUTH...
LIKELY...TO A DRY FORECAST ACROSS NRN 2 TIERS OF COUNTIES. ALL
SOUNDING INFORMATION INDICATES ANY OF THE LIGHT PRECIPITATION WILL
BE LIQUID.

DONT TOTALLY GET RID OF CLOUDS DURING SHORT TERM PERIOD ONCE WE
CLOUD UP. PARTLY TO MOSTLY CLOUDY WILL BE THE WAY TO GO.

TEMPERATURES...MODELS INDICATE 5-10 DEGREES OF WARMING TODAY OVER
TUESDAY...ALTHOUGH EARLY ARRIVAL OF CLOUD COVER COULD TRASH THAT.
CURRENT FORECAST HAS THAT COVERED. WARMED MIN TEMPERATURE GRIDS FOR
THURSDAY NIGHT BY ABOUT A CATEGORY...OTHER THAN THAT...NOT MUCH
CHANGE IN FORECAST TEMPERATURES IN SHORT TERM.
&&

.LONG TERM (BEYOND FRIDAY)...
SHORTWAVES MOVE THROUGH SATURDAY MORNING AND AGAIN ON MONDAY
NIGHT...AS NORTHWEST FLOW REMAINS THE BOSS. MOISTURE AGAIN
LIMITED...SO LOW POPS WILL REMAIN IN FRIDAY NIGHT AND SATURDAY
FORECASTS...AGAIN ALL LIQUID.

SYSTEM MONDAY NIGHT INTO TUESDAY COULD BE A LITTLE MORE
SUBSTANTIAL...BUT MODEL CONSISTENCY ON DETAILS IN THIS TIME PERIOD
IS POOR.

TEMPERATURES FAIRLY CLOSE TO CLIMO FOR MOST OF THE EXTENDED
PERIOD.

NOT TOTALLY COMFORTABLE WITH GFS SOLUTION FOR DAY 7. LOOKS LIKE GFS
MAY HAVE PICKED UP AN EXTRA VORT...PHASES NORTHERN AND SOUTHERN
STREAMS. THIS WOULD ALLOW A STORM SYSTEM TO DEVELOP OVER THE OHIO
VALLEY...DRAGGING A COLD FRONT THROUGH THE AREA...FOLLOWED BY MUCH
COLDER AIR. GFS DROPS H850 TEMPS 20C FROM TUESDAY MORNING TO
WEDNESDAY MORNING OF NEXT WEEK.  MEX GUIDANCE SURE DOESNT SUPPORT
THIS ON MAX TEMPS...AND FROM WHAT I HAVE SEEN OF GEM/UKMET/ECMWF...
GFS OPERATIONAL SOLUTION IS PROBABLY OVERDONE. WILL NOT MAKE MAJOR
CHANGES TO DAY 7 FOR NOW...AND WILL BRIEF DAY SHIFT ON TREND.
&&

.MEG...WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MS...NONE.
MO...NONE.
TN...NONE.
&&

$$

WAGNER/SJM

SUBSTANTIAL...BUT MODEL CONSISTENCY ON DETAILS IN THIS TIME PERIOD
IS POOR.

TEMPERATURES FAIRLY CLOSE TO CLIMO FOR MOST OF THE EXTENDED
PERIOD.

NOT TOTALLY COMFORTABLE WITH GFS SOLUTION FOR DAY 7. LOOKS LIKE GFS
MAY HAVE PICKED UP AN EXTRA VORT...PHASES NORTHERN AND SOUTHERN
STREAMS. THIS WOULD ALLOW A STORM SYSTEM TO DEVELOP OVER THE OHIO
VALLEY...DRAGGING A COLD FRONT THROUGH THE AREA...FOLLOWED BY MUCH
COLDER AIR. GFS DROPS H850 TEMPS 20C FROM TUESDAY MORNING TO
WEDNESDAY MORNING OF NEXT WEEK.  MEX GUIDANCE SURE DOESNT SUPPORT
THIS ON MAX TEMPS...AND FROM WHAT I HAVE SEEN OF GEM/UKMET/ECMWF...
GFS OPERATIONAL SOLUTION IS PROBABLY OVERDONE. WILL NOT MAKE MAJOR
CHANGES TO DAY 7 FOR NOW...AND WILL BRIEF DAY SHIFT ON TREND.
&&

.MEG...WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MS...NONE.
MO...NONE.
TN...NONE.
&&

$$

WAGNER





000 
FXUS64 KMEG 020227
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
826 PM CST TUE MAR 1 2005

.UPDATE...
A VERY DRY AND STABLE AIR MASS COVERS THE MIDSOUTH THIS EVENING.
00Z SOUNDING FROM LZK SHOWS A PRECIPITABLE WATER VALUE OF ONLY 0.21
INCH AND A LIFTED INDEX OF PLUS 16. SATELLITE INDICATES CLEAR
SKIES COVERING THE MIDSOUTH. MID-LEVEL CLOUDS FROM OK TO NORTHERN
LA ARE NOT MAKING MUCH PROGRESS TOWARD THE MIDSOUTH AT THIS TIME.
SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE EXTENDS FROM THE CENTRAL PLAINS TO THE DEEP
SOUTH WITH LIGHT OR CALM WINDS ACROSS THE MIDSOUTH. SURFACE
DEWPOINTS ARE MOSTLY IN THE TEENS. BASED ON CURRENT TEMPERATURES
AND DEWPOINTS...OVERNIGHT LOWS MAY NOT BE QUITE COLD ENOUGH IN SOME
LOCATIONS. WILL UPDATE TO MAKE MINOR CHANGES TO FORECAST
OVERNIGHT.

&&

.PREV DISCUSSION... (ISSUED 204 PM CST TUE MAR 1 2005) 

DISCUSSION...
THERE WAS A DEEP TROUGH AXIS ACROSS THE EASTERN U.S. WITH AN 
AMPLIFIED RIDGE OVER THE WESTERN U.S. WATER VAPOR IMAGERY SHOWS A 
SHORTWAVE TRANSLATING EAST ACROSS NEW MEXICO. COLD AIR ADVECTION WAS 
IN PROGRESS ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA THIS AFTERNOON. TEMPERATURES 
ARE STRUGGLING TO REACH THEIR FORECAST HIGHS...ESPECIALLY WHERE 
SUFFICIENT CLOUD COVER REMAINS. BRISK NORTHWESTERLY WINDS MAKE IT 
FEEL MUCH COOLER THAN IT ACTUALLY IS.

THE SHORTWAVE OVER NEW MEXICO WILL CONTINUE ITS EASTWARD PROGRESSION 
THROUGH WEDNESDAY NIGHT. THIS SYSTEM WILL COMBINE WITH ANOTHER 
SHORTWAVE THAT WAS ANALYZED ON THE EAST SIDE OF THE CONTINENTAL 
DIVIDE NEAR SOUTH DAKOTA. ADDITIONALLY...LOW LEVEL MOISTURE POOLING 
ACROSS SOUTHEAST TEXAS TONIGHT WILL INTRODUCE ITSELF INTO THE 
APPROACHING WAVE. THE RESULT WILL BE WHEN THESE TWO SYSTEMS COME 
TOGETHER WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON INTO WEDNESDAY NIGHT TO PROVIDE A SHOT 
OF RAIN FOR PARTS OF THE FORECAST AREA. ISENTROPIC SURFACES AT 285K 
AND 290K INDICATE THAT SUFFICIENT MOISTURE AND LIFT WILL BE ENOUGH 
TO PRODUCE PRECIPITATION. MODELS DIFFER ON LOCATION/PLACEMENT OF  
THE ACTUAL EVENT WITH THE GFS MUCH FARTHER NORTH. WE FAVOR THE GFS 
PLACEMENT BUT DISAGREE WITH THE COLDER TEMPERATURE PROFILE. BOTH 
MODELS HAVE BEEN CONSISTENT IN THEIR PLACEMENT OF THE RAIN. HAVE 
ADJUSTED RAIN CHANCES A LITTLE FARTHER NORTH WITH THE BEST CHANCES 
OF RAIN STILL PINPOINTED ACROSS THE SOUTHERN PARTS OF THE FORECAST 
AREA. 

THURSDAY ANOTHER COOL SHOT OF AIR WILL ENTER THE REGION BUT SHOULD 
NOT AFFECT TEMPERATURES TOO MUCH. NORTHWEST FLOW ALOFT AND A FAST 
MOVING SHORTWAVE IN THE FLOW WILL BRING ANOTHER CHANCE OF RAIN 
FRIDAY NIGHT. THIS WILL BE ALONG AND AHEAD OF A COLD FRONT THAT WILL 
SWEEP ACROSS THE MID SOUTH SATURDAY.

WILL HAVE TO KEEP OUR EYES ON THE CUT OFF LOW OVER NORTHERN BAJA 
SATURDAY NIGHT. THE LATEST GFS KICKS IT OUT MONDAY AND IT BEGINS IT 
APPROACH INTO THE FORECAST AREA MONDAY NIGHT. LOOKS LIKE THE 
TROPICAL MOISTURE ASSOCIATED WITH THIS SYSTEM WILL INTERACT WITH THE 
NORTHERN STREAM TROUGH AND COLD FRONT. THIS WOULD PROVIDE THE REGION 
WITH ADDITIONAL RAIN MONDAY NIGHT INTO TUESDAY. STILL A LONG WAYS 
OUT BUT SOMETHING TO WATCH.

&&

.MEG WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MO...NONE.
MS...NONE.
TN...NONE.

&&

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
918 AM CST TUE MAR 1 2005

.DISCUSSION...
DEEP TROUGH OVER THE EASTERN U.S. HELPING TO DUMP COLD AIR THROUGH 
THE MS VALLEY. THE FLURRIES THAT OCCURRED EARLIER THIS MORNING HAVE 
DISSIPATED OVER THE FORECAST AREA. SHORTWAVES WILL MOVE THROUGH THE 
MEAN TROUGH TODAY CAUSING SOME WIND GUSTS TO 25 MPH AND MOSTLY 
CLOUDY CONDITIONS OVER THE NORTHEASTERN THIRD OF THE FORECAST AREA. 

UPDATE WILL FRESHEN UP WORDING TO REMOVE MENTION OF FLURRIES THIS 
MORNING AND UPDATE THE CLOUD COVER. TEMPERATURES ARE ON TRACK SO 
WONT FIDDLE WITH THOSE. THE UPDATE WILL BE OUT SHORTLY.

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 010803
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
203 AM CST TUE MAR 1 2005

.DISCUSSION...
REINFORCING TROF/COLD FRONT APPEARS TO BE NEAR A KHOP-KGWO LINE WITH
DRIER AIR BEHIND IT...AS WELL AS GUSTY WINDS. RADAR SHOWING SOME
ECHOES ACROSS ABOUT NORTHEAST QUARTER OF CWA...BUT SEE NO INDICATIONS
THAT ANY OF THIS IS ACTUALLY REACHING THE SURFACE. BASED ON RADAR...
LOOKS LIKE ECHOES DISSIPATE AROUND 2500 FEET. IF ANY PRECIPITATION
REACHES THE SURFACE...IT WOULD BE NORTHEAST OF A KDYR-KSNH LINE.
WILL MONITOR OBS...BUT CURRENT PLAN IS TO LEAVE FORECAST DRY FOR
EARLY MORNING HOURS.
&&

.SHORT TERM (THROUGH THURSDAY)...
UPPER LOW OVER THE OHIO VALLEY THIS MORNING WILL MOVE EASTWARD...
BUT LEAVE US IN NORTHWEST FLOW FOR THE FORESEEABLE FUTURE. WHILE
THERE MAY BE A FEW CUMULUS CLOUDS TODAY...EXPECTING DRY WEATHER
THROUGH WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON. ANOTHER SHORTWAVE WILL MOVE THROUGH
THE MEAN TROF WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON AND WEDNESDAY NIGHT. MOISTURE IS
SEVERELY LACKING WITH THIS SYSTEM. MAIN AREA OF PRECIPITATION IS
EXPECTED TO REMAIN TO THE SOUTH OF THE CWA...BUT CANNOT RULE OUT A
LITTLE BIT OF RAIN ACROSS ABOUT SOUTHERN HALF OF THE AREA WEDNESDAY
AFTERNOON INTO THURSDAY MORNING. WONT MESS WITH CURRENT POPS.
MODEL SOUNDINGS INDICATE THAT THE PRECIPITATION WILL REMAIN
LIQUID. DRYING OUT AGAIN THURSDAY.

TEMPERATURES WILL BE WELL BELOW NORMAL THROUGH THURSDAY...ROUGHLY
10 DEGREES ON HIGHS. CLEAR SKIES TONIGHT SHOULD ALLOW TEMPERATURES
TO PLUNGE INTO THE 20S ACROSS THE ENTIRE AREA. WOULDNT BE SHOCKED
TO SEE A FEW READINGS IN THE UPPER TEENS IN NORMALLY COLDER AREAS...
LIKE PARIS...SAVANNAH...AND IUKA. ON WEDNESDAY...WARMING ON MET/FWC
GUIDANCE LOOKS A LITTLE OVERDONE. MAV GUIDANCE MAY BE A LITTLE TOO
CLOUDY HOWEVER. DONT HAVE A GOOD REASON TO OVERRIDE CURRENT FORECAST
TEMPERATURES ON WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY. &&

.LONG TERM (BEYOND THURSDAY)...
ANOTHER SHORTWAVE MOVES THROUGH ON SATURDAY...AS FLOW REMAINS
NORTHWEST. AGAIN...THE SYSTEM WILL BE MOISTURE STARVED. TRIMMED POPS
TO SLIGHT CHANCE...AS MOST OF OUR NEIGHBORS ACTUALLY HAVE DRY
FORECAST. REMAINDER OF EXTENDED DRY AT CURRENT TIME. TEMPERATURES
WILL MODERATE TO CLOSER TO NORMAL VALUES...BUT STILL A LITTLE COOL.
&&

.MEG...WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MS...NONE.
MO...NONE.
TN...NONE.

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 010240
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
840 PM CST MON FEB 28 2005

.UPDATE...

REGIONAL RADARS CONTINUE TO SHOW PATCHY SPRINKLES ACROSS ARKANSAS
DOWN INTO NORTHERN MISSISSIPPI. THIS ACTIVITY IS BEING PRODUCED
BY A 500MB VORT MAX CURRENTLY OVER CENTRAL ARKANSAS ROUNDING 
THE BASE OF THE LONGWAVE TROUGH. HAVE DECIDED TO LEAVE MENTION
OF SPRINKLES IN THE ZONES (IN THE GRIDS THROUGH 09Z)BUT WILL TAKE
FLURRIES OUT. BOUNDARY LAYER TEMPS STILL RATHER WARM AND 00Z META
(NAM) FORECAST SOUNDINGS SHOW DRIER AIR WORKING ITS WAY INTO THE
MIDSOUTH AS THE COLDER BOUNDARY LAYER TEMPS ARRIVE. REST OF
FORECAST LOOKS GOOD. TEMPS WILL CONTINUE TO DROP AS STRONG SURFACE 
TO 850MB COLD AIR ADVECTION CONTINUES WITH 850MB TEMPS DROPPING TO 
NEAR -10C BY 12Z. WINDS SHOULD STAY UP WITH PRESSURE GRADIENT
STILL RATHER TIGHT. UPDATE TO ZONES TO FOLLOW SHORTLY.

&&

JFB

.PREV DISCUSSION... (ISSUED 309 PM CST MON FEB 28 2005) 

DISCUSSION...

SATELLITE AND RADAR SHOWS A BATCH OF LIGHT PRECIPITATION OVER 
WESTERN ARKANSAS MOVING TOWARDS THE SOUTHEAST. THIS PRECIPITATION IS 
ASSOCIATED WITH AN UPPER LEVEL DISTURBANCE. RADAR LOOP SHOWS THAT 
THE STRONGER ECHOS WOULD GO SOUTH OF THE FORECAST AREA IF THEY 
MAINTAIN THEIR INTENSITY. THIS JUST LEAVES A CHANCE OF SPRINKLES OR 
FLURRIES SOUTH OF A LINE FROM JONESBORO TO MEMPHIS TO TUPELO THIS 
EVENING. FLURRIES WOULD PROBABLY BE LATER THIS EVENING AND ONLY IF 
THEIR IS STILL ENOUGH MOISTURE AROUND WHEN THE COLDER AIR ARRIVES. 

UPPER LEVEL NORTHWEST FLOW CAN BE EXPECTED THROUGHOUT THE FORECAST 
PERIOD AS A RIDGE REMAINS IN TACT OVER THE WEST WITH A TROUGH OVER 
THE NORTHEAST. THIS WILL RESULT IN BELOW NORMAL TEMPS THROUGH THE 
PERIOD. TUESDAY SHOULD BE THE COLDEST DAY DUE TO OUR PROXIMITY TO 
THE BASE OF THE UPPER TROUGH. EVEN WITH SUN...HIGHS WILL ONLY BE IN 
THE 40S. HIGH PRESSURE WILL SETTLE OVER THE REGION TOMORROW NIGHT 
AND WITH MAINLY CLEAR SKIES...IT SHOULD BE A COLD NIGHT WITH TEENS 
NOT OUT OF THE QUESTION OVER PORTIONS OF WEST TN AND NORTHEAST MS. 

THE NEXT CHANCE OF RAIN WILL BE WEDNESDAY AND WEDNESDAY NIGHT. 
COMPLICATED FORECAST WITH SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE STILL NEARBY AND 
ASSOCIATED LOW LEVEL DRY AIR IN PLACE. THERE WILL BE AN UPPER 
SHORTWAVE THAT WILL MOVE THROUGH THE REGION. MODELS HAVE MUCH DEEPER 
MOISTURE ASSOCIATED WITH THIS SHORTWAVE THAN YESTERDAY. SO THERE IS 
SOME QUESTIONS IN TERMS OF RUN TO RUN CONSISTENCY HERE. ALSO IF THE 
SYSTEM IS WEAKER THAN TODAYS RUN SUGGESTS THAN THE LOW LEVEL DRY AIR 
WILL LIKELY WIN OUT. MODELS DO AGREE THAT THIS SYSTEM WILL MAINLY 
IMPACT NORTHERN MS WITH THE BETTER VERTICAL MOTION MOVING OVER THAT 
REGION. AREAS NORTH OF THE TN/MS BORDER WILL LIKELY REMAIN DRY. 
RIGHT NOW...IT LOOKS LIKE THE PRECIPITATION WOULD REMAIN LIQUID  
HOWEVER IT WILL BE CLOSE. DRY WEATHER CAN BE EXPECTED UNTIL THE 
WEEKEND. THEN ANOTHER FRONT WILL ARRIVE FROM THE NORTH ON SATURDAY 
BRINGING ANOTHER SHOT AT RAIN.

MEG...WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MS...NONE.
MO...NONE.
TN...NONE.

$$

FXUS64 KMEG 281531
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
931 AM CST MON FEB 28 2005

.DISCUSSION...

SATELLITE IMAGES SHOWS THE BACK EDGE OF LOW CLOUDS ASSOCIATED WITH 
STRONG COLD AIR ADVECTION MOVING ACROSS THE REGION. A FEW SPRINKLES 
OR PATCHES OF LIGHT RAIN HAS DEVELOPED ALONG THE EDGE OF THE CLOUD 
COVER WHERE COLD AIR IS SQUEEZING OUT THE MOISTURE. THE CLOUDS AND 
ASSOCIATED PRECIP SHOULD BE ENTERING ALABAMA AND MIDDLE TN SHORTLY 
AFTER NOON. SKIES WILL BE PARTLY TO MOSTLY SUNNY FOR A TIME. 
TEMPERATURES WILL HAVE A TOUGH TIME RISING THIS AFTERNOON DUE TO THE 
COLD AIR ADVECTION MOVING INTO THE REGION. ADJUSTED TEMPS UP A FEW 
DEGREES FROM CURRENT FORECAST...RANGING FROM UPPER 40S TO LOWER 50S. 
FURTHER UPSTREAM OVER OKLAHOMA...THERE IS AN UPPER LEVEL DISTURBANCE 
THAT HAS RESULTED IN SOME LIGHT PRECIPITATION. MODELS HAVE A GOOD 
HANDLE ON THIS FEATURE AND IT SHOULD ARRIVE BY LATE THIS AFTERNOON 
AND EXIT THE AREA THIS EVENING. THIS FEATURE COULD RESULT IN A FEW 
SPRINKLES...EVEN A FEW FLURRIES CANT BE RULED OUT ACCORDING TO THE 
GFS. THIS FEATURE WILL MAINLY AFFECT AREAS ALONG AND SOUTH OF THE 
TN/MS BORDER THIS EVENING.

FXUS64 KMEG 280900
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
245 AM CST MON FEB 28 2005

.DISCUSSION...

AN UPPER TROUGH AND ITS ASSOCIATED SURFACE FRONT IS MOVING EAST
THROUGH THE MIDSOUTH. NORTHWEST WINDS HAVE INVADED THE NORTHWEST
HALF OF THE AREA. RAIN HAS EXITED SOUTHWESTERN MIDSOUTH COUNTIES
AROUND CLARKSDALE...BUT THE REST OF THE AREA IS STILL RECEIVING
LIGHT TO MODERATE RAIN.

THE UPPER TROUGH AXIS WILL ROTATE SOUTHEAST THROUGH THE CWA TDA
AND SHOVE RAIN ON OUT MOSTLY BY NOON. WIND CHILL WILL BE
NOTICEABLE TODAY BECAUSE OF SPEEDS OF OVER 20 MPH AT TIMES...
ESPECIALLY THIS MORNING. THE HIGH BUILDING IN IS COLD AND TONIGHT
THROUGH WEDNESDAY NIGHT.

NORTHWEST UPPER LEVEL FLOW WILL DOMINATE ON THROUGH NEXT MONDAY.
THIS WILL KEEP IT DRY TONIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY.

FXUS64 KMEG 280200
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
800 PM CST SUN FEB 27 2005

.DISCUSSION...

CURRENT FORECAST ON TRACK WITH MOSTLY LIGHT RAIN OCCURRING ACROSS 
THE MID SOUTH REGION PER LATEST RADAR IMAGERY. SHORT WAVE TROF 
CURRENTLY RESIDES OVER NORTH CENTRAL ARKANSAS WITH PRE-FRONTAL TROF 
EXTENDING JUST WEST OF THE MISSISSIPPI RIVER. MAINLY LIGHT 
PRECIPITATION ANTICIPATED TO CONTINUE ON THROUGH THE OVERNIGHT 
HOURS. THEREFORE...NO CHANGES TO EXISTING FORECAST. 

DURING THE LATE MORNING TO MID-DAY TIME FRAME SURFACE GRADIENT IS 
ANTICIPATED TO INCREASE AS COLDER AIR CURRENTLY OVER IOWA AND 
NEBRASKA USHERS INTO THE REGION BEHIND THE COLD FRONT. THIS SETS
THE STAGE FOR BRISK NORTHWEST WINDS ACROSS THE AREA. THE RAIN SHOULD 
COME TO AN END AS THE COLD FRONT AND SHORT WAVE TROF EXITS TO THE 
EAST.

CORDERO







000 
FXUS64 KMEG 272140
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
340 PM CST SUN FEB 27 2005

.DISCUSSION...

AN UPPER LEVEL SHORTWAVE TROUGH OVER ARKANSAS CONTINUES TO MOVE
EAST. RAIN HAS BEEN SLOW TO BEGIN ACROSS PORTIONS OF THE AREA DUE
TO DRIER AIR IN THE LOW LEVELS. THE EXCEPTION HAS BEEN ACROSS
NORTHEAST MISSISSIPPI...WHERE DEEPER MOISTURE HAS WORKED IN AHEAD OF
THE SURFACE LOW MOVING OUT OF THE NORTHEAST GULF OF MEXICO AND
WIDESPREAD RAIN HAS FALLEN FOR MOST OF THIS AFTERNOON. THE LOW
LEVELS SHOULD MOISTEN ACROSS THE REMAINDER OF THE AREA THIS EVENING
WITH RAIN EXPECTED LATER TONIGHT.

.SHORT-TERM (TONIGHT-TUESDAY)...

THE SOUTHERN STREAM SHORTWAVE TROUGH WILL CONTINUE TO MOVE ACROSS
THE MISSISSIPPI VALLEY TONIGHT AND EARLY MONDAY MORNING. THIS WILL
ALLOW RAIN TO OVERSPREAD THE MID SOUTH AS THE LOW LEVELS CONTINUE
TO MOISTEN. THIS SOUTHERN STREAM SHORTWAVE WILL MOVE EAST OF THE
AREA BY MONDAY MORNING. THE RAIN SHOULD COME TO AN END AS THIS
SYSTEM DEPARTS TO THE EAST.

ANOTHER SHORTWAVE TROUGH MOVING SOUTHEAST ACROSS THE NORTHERN PLAINS
STATES IN THE NORTHERN STREAM WILL DIVE ACROSS THE AREA BEHIND THE
SOUTHERN STREAM SYSTEM ON MONDAY. THIS NORTHERN STREAM SHORTWAVE WILL
SEND A STRONG COLD FRONT ACROSS THE MID SOUTH BY MONDAY EVENING AND
USHER IN A MUCH COLDER CANADIAN AIRMASS. TEMPERATURES WILL FALL INTO
THE MID 20S NORTH TO AROUND 30 SOUTH ON MONDAY NIGHT AS STRONG COLD
ADVECTION PICKS UP OVER THE REGION. COLD WEATHER WILL CONTINUE ON
TUESDAY WITH 850 MB TEMPS RANGING FROM -5C SOUTHWEST TO AROUND -10C
NORTHEAST. DRY WEATHER WILL CONTINUE THROUGH TUESDAY.

.LONG-TERM (TUESDAY NIGHT-SUNDAY)...

BOTH THE NAM/GFS INDICATING A RETURN FLOW/WARM ADVECTION PATTERN
SETTING UP ACROSS THE SOUTHERN PLAINS STATES BY TUESDAY AFTERNOON.
WEAK ISENTROPIC LIFT WAS NOTED ACROSS NORTHEAST TEXAS INTO
LOUISIANA AND ARKANSAS BY TUESDAY EVENING. THIS WARM ADVECTION
PATTERN AND ASSOCIATED ISENTROPIC LIFT SLIDES EAST TUESDAY NIGHT.
PRECIPITATION SHOULD DEVELOP WITHIN THIS ZONE OF LIFT TO OUR
SOUTHWEST. AT THIS TIME...IT APPEARS THAT THE ATMOSPHERE WILL
REMAIN TOO DRY TO SUPPORT PRECIPITATION OVER SOUTHWEST PORTIONS OF
OUR AREA...BUT THIS WILL NEED TO BE WATCHED BY LATER SHIFTS...
ESPECIALLY SINCE TEMPERATURES SHOULD BE COLD ENOUGH TO SUPPORT
FROZEN PRECIP. ANOTHER WEAK COLD FRONT WILL MOVE ACROSS THE MID
SOUTH WEDNESDAY MORNING...BUT SHOULD MOVE THROUGH DRY WITH LIMITED
MOISTURE IN PLACE. HIGH PRESSURE WILL BUILD OVER THE AREA THROUGH
THE END OF THE WEEK. TEMPERATURES WILL REMAIN BELOW AVERAGE THROUGH
MID WEEK BEFORE SLOWLY MODERATING BY THE END OF THE WEEK...AS WINDS
RETURN BACK OUT OF THE SOUTH. ANOTHER CLIPPER TYPE SYSTEM WILL CROSS
THE AREA SATURDAY AND SATURDAY NIGHT BRINGING THE NEXT CHANCE FOR
RAIN.
&&

.MEG...WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MS...NONE.
MO...NONE.
TN...NONE.
&&

$$

JLH





000 
FXUS64 KMEG 271648
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
1048 AM CST SUN FEB 27 2005

.DISCUSSION...

AN UPPER LEVEL LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM NOW MOVING INTO SOUTHWEST
MISSOURI WITH A TROUGH AXIS EXTENDING SOUTH TO THE GULF COAST WILL
CONTINUE TO MOVE EAST THIS AFTERNOON. AT THE SAME TIME...A SURFACE
LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM NOW DEVELOPING ACROSS THE NORTH-CENTRAL GULF OF
MEXICO WILL MOVE NORTHEAST INTO THE SOUTHEAST STATES THROUGH TONIGHT.
TWO CONCENTRATED AREAS OF RAIN HAVE DEVELOPED AS SEEN ON REGIONAL
RADARS. ONE RAIN AREA OVER WESTERN ARKANSAS THIS MORNING...
ASSOCIATED WITH THE UPPER LEVEL SYSTEM...REMAINS SPOTTY WITH VERY FEW
SURFACE REPORTS OVER ARKANSAS AT THIS TIME. AS THIS AREA MOVES
EAST...EXPECT SCATTERED LIGHT RAIN SHOWERS TO DEVELOP OVER WESTERN
AREAS. THE SECOND RAIN AREA NOW SPREADING NORTH ACROSS EAST CENTRAL
MISSISSIPPI...WILL BRING A MORE CONCENTRATED AREA OF RAIN OVER
SOUTHEASTERN SECTIONS...SO HAVE RAISED POPS OVER THESE AREAS TO
REFLECT CURRENT TRENDS. OTHER THAN CHANGES TO POPS...ALL OTHER
PARAMETERS LOOK GOOD WITH ONLY MINOR CHANGES.

UPDATED GRIDS AND ZONES OUT SHORTLY.

&&

.MEG...WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MS...NONE.
MO...NONE.
TN...NONE.
&&

FXUS64 KMEG 270925
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
320 AM CST SUN FEB 27 2005

.DISCUSSION...

UPPER TROUGH KNOCKING ON THE DOOR OF THE MIDSOUTH. CLOUDINESS HAS
INCREASED WHILE RAIN HAS MADE ITS WAY IN WESTERN AR TO SE LA. LOW
PRESSURE CENTER RESULTING FROM THE TROUGH IS WELL DOWN IN THE
GULF SOUTH OF BILOXI. WILL HOLD OFF ON RAIN UNTIL THIS AFTERNOON.
BETTER CHANCES OF RAIN WILL EXIST TNGT. LOW GOES ON EAST AND RAIN
TAPERS OF MONDAY MORNING. MOST PLACES WILL GET RAIN...BUT AMTS TO
BE LIGHTER.

FRONT COMES THROUGH TONIGHT. COLD NORTHERLY WINDS WILL MAKE IT
COLDER TONIGHT...TUE NIGHT AND WED NIGHT. MID 20S TO LOWER 30S
ARE EXPECTED NIGHTLY.

NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
840 PM CST SAT FEB 26 2005

.DISCUSSION...
HIGH CLOUDS HAVE BEEN MOVING INTO THE REGION TONIGHT MAKING SKIES
PARTLY TO MOSTLY CLOUDY. CLOUDS WILL CONTINUE TO INCREASE OVERNIGHT
AS UPPER LEVEL STORM SYSTEM MOVES EAST OUT OF TEXAS TONIGHT AND
SUNDAY. CURRENT FORECAST LOOKS TO BE IN GOOD SHAPE SO NO CHANGES
HAVE BEEN MADE AT THIS TIME.

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 262141
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
341 PM CST SAT FEB 26 2005

.DISCUSSION...

HIGH PRESSURE OVER THE AREA THIS AFTERNOON CONTINUES TO SLIDE EAST.
THIS HIGH PRESSURE SYSTEM HAS ALLOWED FOR A VERY PLEASANT AFTERNOON
WITH PARTLY CLOUDY SKIES AND TEMPERATURES WARMING TO THE UPPER 50S
NORTH TO LOWER 60S SOUTH. THE NEXT STORM SYSTEM ORGANIZING OVER
THE SOUTHERN PLAINS THIS AFTERNOON WILL BRING A PERIOD OF WET WEATHER
FOR THE END OF THE WEEKEND. DRYER BUT MUCH COOLER TEMPERATURES WILL
MOVE IN FOR THE FIRST HALF OF NEXT WEEK.

.SHORT-TERM (TONIGHT-MONDAY)...

A SOUTHERN STREAM SHORTWAVE TROUGH MOVING ACROSS THE SOUTHERN PLAINS
STATES THIS AFTERNOON WILL CONTINUE TO MOVE EAST ACROSS THE
MISSISSIPPI VALLEY THROUGH SUNDAY. A 120 KT JET STREAK EJECTING
OUT OF THE BASE OF THE TROUGH WILL HELP TO INDUCE A SURFACE LOW
PRESSURE SYSTEM OVER THE GULF OF MEXICO...WHICH WILL DEEPEN AND
MOVE NORTHEAST ACROSS PORTIONS OF THE SOUTHEASTERN STATES SUNDAY.
DEEP MOISTURE IN ADVANCE OF THE UPPER TROUGH AND LOW PRESSURE
SYSTEM WILL OVERSPREAD THE MID SOUTH ON SUNDAY MORNING. RAIN CHANCES
WILL INCREASE ACROSS THE AREA TOMORROW MORNING AND BECOME LIKELY BY
SUNDAY AFTERNOON AS THE SHORTWAVE TROUGH CROSSES THE REGION. THIS
RAIN WILL CONTINUE INTO SUNDAY NIGHT...BEFORE TAPERING OFF TO LIGHT
RAIN AFTER MIDNIGHT AS THE SURFACE LOW AND ASSOCIATED SHORTWAVE
TROUGH DEPART TO THE NORTHEAST.

IN THE MEANTIME...THE ADVERTISED BLOCKING PATTERN OVER THE NORTHERN
ATLANTIC WILL HELP TO SEND A NORTHERN STREAM SHORTWAVE TROUGH
DIVING SOUTH FROM SASKATCHEWAN CANADA ACROSS THE NORTHERN PLAINS
STATES ON SUNDAY. PRECEDING THIS NORTHERN STREAM SHORTWAVE WILL BE A
STRONG COLD FRONT WITH A MODIFIED ARCTIC AIRMASS BEHIND IT. THE COLD
FRONT IS PROGGED TO MOVE ACROSS THE AREA MONDAY MORNING. MOST OF
THE DEEP MOISTURE WILL HAVE SWEPT TO THE EAST WITH THE LEAD SOUTHERN
STREAM SYSTEM...BUT THERE MAY BE ENOUGH LOW LEVEL MOISTURE TO
PRODUCE SOME LIGHT RAIN SHOWERS AHEAD OF THE FRONT. BEHIND THE
FRONT...COLDER TEMPERATURES WILL FILTER SOUTH ACROSS THE AREA.
HIGH TEMPERATURES ON MONDAY SHOULD ACTUALLY BE REACHED LATE IN THE
MORNING BEFORE FALLING THROUGH THE AFTERNOON AS STRONG COLD
ADVECTION BEGINS. SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE WILL BUILD OVER THE AREA
LATER ON MONDAY AND MONDAY NIGHT.

.LONG-TERM (TUESDAY-SATURDAY)...

THE EASTERN U.S. LONGWAVE TROUGH WILL PERSIST THROUGH THE REMAINDER
OF NEXT WEEK WITH WEAK SYSTEMS MOVING ACROSS THE AREA IN THE
NORTHWESTERLY FLOW ALOFT. DRY WEATHER AND COLD TEMPERATURES CAN BE
EXPECTED ON TUESDAY. WEDNESDAY SHOULD STILL REMAIN COOL AND DRY AS
A REINFORCING SHOT OF COOL AIR MOVES ACROSS THE AREA. THE
NORTHWESTERLY FLOW IN BOTH THE LOW LEVELS AND ALOFT SHOULD KEEP
MOISTURE SUPPRESSED WELL TO THE SOUTH THROUGH WEDNESDAY. LOW LEVEL
FLOW WILL RETURN BACK OUT OF THE SOUTH ON THURSDAY. ANOTHER NORTHERN
STREAM SHORTWAVE WILL DROP THROUGH THE WESTERN PERIPHERY OF THE
TROUGH ON THURSDAY NIGHT WITH A CLIPPER SYSTEM AND ASSOCIATED COLD
FRONT MOVING ACROSS THE AREA. ENOUGH MOISTURE RETURN IS EXPECTED WITH
20 POPS JUSTIFIED OVER NORTHEAST SECTIONS. DRY WEATHER WILL RETURN
FOR FRIDAY AFTERNOON AND SATURDAY WITH SLOWLY MODERATING
TEMPERATURES.
&&

.MEG...WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MS...NONE.
MO...NONE.
TN...NONE.
&&

AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
912 AM CST SAT FEB 26 2005

.DISCUSSION...

HIGH CLOUDS CONTINUE TO STREAM OVER THE AREA FROM THE SOUTHWEST AS
UPPER LEVEL SOUTHWESTERLY FLOW ALOFT BRINGS INCREASED UPPER LEVEL
MOISTURE OVER THE AREA. SO EXPECT SKIES TO BECOME PARTLY CLOUDY
AREAWIDE BY EARLY AFTERNOON. HIGH PRESSURE AT THE SURFACE WILL
CONTINUE TO SLIDE TO OUR NORTHEAST TODAY. WEAK WARM ADVECTION WILL
HELP TEMPERATURES WARM TO FORECAST HIGHS...WITH UPPER 50S NORTH TO
LOWER 60S SOUTH. CURRENT FORECAST AND GRIDS HAVE A GOOD HANDLE ON
TODAYS FORECAST...SO NO UPDATES ARE PLANNED AT THIS TIME.

FXUS64 KMEG 261016
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
415 AM CST FRI FEB 26 2005

.DISCUSSION...

NEXT RAIN MAKING SYSTEM NOW HEADING TOWARD THE MIDSOUTH. UPPER
LOW OVER CO AND HIGH CLDS NOW TRACKING THEIR WAY TO THIS AREA.
SKIES WILL BECOME PARTLY CLOUDY AS THE DAY WEARS ON. BY THIS
EVENING...THE UPPER LOW WILL BE IN THE CENTRAL PLAINS WITH A
SURFACE FRONT. RAIN WILL HAVE OCCURRED IN TX AND S LA.

OVERNIGHT...THE WEATHER FEATURES WILL HAVE MOVED FARTHER EAST.
THE ATMOSPHERE LOADS UP WITH MOISTURE AND WE WILL HAVE A SLIGHT
CHANCE OF RAIN AFTER MIDNIGHT. ADDITIONALLY...A LOW WILL DEVELOP
IN THE NC GULF OF MEXICO. THE GULF LOW AND FRONT WILL MERGE AND
BRING A GOOD RAIN SUNDAY ACCORDING TO BOTH THE ETA AND GFS.

THE FRONT WILL MOVE THROUGH THE MIDSOUTH MONDAY NIGHT REDUCING
RAIN CHANCES. WINDS SHOULD PICK UP QUITE A BIT AFTER THE FRONT
PASSES. MONDAY WILL BE BREEZY AND COOLER. THE HIGH FILLING IN
AFTER THE LOW IS COMING DOWN OUT OF CANADA. THIS WILL BRING
FREEZING TEMPS BACK TO THE AREA TUE...WED AND THU MORNING.

&&

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 252134
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
334 PM CST FRI FEB 25 2005

.DISCUSSION...
SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE HAS SETTLED OVER THE MID SOUTH THIS AFTERNOON.
THIS HAS ALLOWED FOR MOSTLY SUNNY SKIES AND COOL TEMPERATURES WITH
LIGHT NORTH WINDS. HIGH PRESSURE WILL REMAIN OVER THE AREA TONIGHT
BEFORE SLIDING EAST ON SATURDAY.

.SHORT-TERM (FRIDAY NIGHT-MONDAY NIGHT)...
SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE OVER THE AREA TONIGHT WILL KEEP SKIES MOSTLY
CLEAR FOR THE FIRST HALF OF THE NIGHT. THIS COMBINED WITH LIGHT
WINDS WILL ALLOW TEMPERATURES TO FALL OFF FAIRLY QUICKLY AFTER
SUNSET. THE UPPER LEVEL FLOW WILL CONTINUE TO TURN MORE
SOUTHWESTERLY LATER TONIGHT AND THIS MAY ALLOW SOME HIGH LEVEL
MOISTURE AND ASSOCIATED CIRRUS CLOUDS TO STREAM OVER WESTERN AREAS
AFTER MIDNIGHT. THESE CLOUDS MAY BE ENOUGH TO KEEP TEMPERATURES
FROM BOTTOMING OUT LIKE LAST NIGHT...ESPECIALLY ACROSS WESTERN
SECTIONS.

SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE WILL SLIDE EAST ON SATURDAY WITH LOW LEVEL
WINDS TURNING BACK OUT OF THE SOUTHEAST. THIS WILL ALLOW FOR LOW
LEVEL WARM ADVECTION TO RETURN ON SATURDAY...WITH HIGH TEMPERATURES
WARMING SEVERAL DEGREES WITH UPPER 50S NORTH TO LOWER 60S SOUTH.
UPPER LEVEL MOISTURE WILL CONTINUE TO STREAM OVER THE AREA UNDER
SOUTHWEST FLOW ALOFT...SO EXPECT MORE HIGH CLOUDS ON SATURDAY.
CLOUDS WILL BEGIN TO LOWER AND THICKEN BY SATURDAY NIGHT AHEAD OF
THE NEXT APPROACHING STORM SYSTEM.

AN UPPER LEVEL LOW PRESSURE OVER THE DESERT SOUTHWEST THIS AFTERNOON
(AS SEEN ON 21Z WATER VAPOR IMAGERY) IS PROGGED BY BOTH THE
NAM/GFS TO MOVE EAST AND WEAKEN TO AN UPPER TROUGH THIS WEEKEND. AS
THIS SOUTHERN STREAM SYSTEM EJECTS OUT ACROSS THE PLAINS ON
SATURDAY AND SATURDAY NIGHT...IT WILL HELP TO INDUCE A SURFACE LOW
PRESSURE IN THE NORTHWEST GULF OF MEXICO. THIS SURFACE LOW WILL MOVE
NORTHEAST AND DEEPEN AS IT MOVES ACROSS MISSISSIPPI ON SUNDAY AND
SUNDAY NIGHT. DEEP MOISTURE WILL SURGE NORTHWARD FROM THE GULF OF
MEXICO AHEAD OF THIS SYSTEM. EXPECT RAIN TO BREAK OUT ACROSS THE
AREA BY SUNDAY MORNING AND PERSIST THROUGH SUNDAY NIGHT.

IN THE MEANTIME...A BLOCKING RIDGE WILL STRENGTHEN OVER PORTIONS OF
THE NORTH ATLANTIC IN THE VICINITY OF GREENLAND OVER THE WEEKEND
WITH THE POLAR VORTEX OVER EASTERN ONTARIO RETROGRADING BACK TO THE
WEST. THIS BLOCKING PATTERN WILL FORCE A NORTHERN STREAM SHORTWAVE
TROUGH NOW OVER NORTHERN BRITISH COLUMBIA CANADA TO DIVE SOUTHEAST
ACROSS THE NORTHERN PLAINS STATES ON SUNDAY AND INTO THE LOWER
MISSISSIPPI VALLEY ON MONDAY. THIS NORTHERN STREAM SHORTWAVE WILL
SEND A COLD FRONT ACROSS THE AREA ON MONDAY...WITH A MODIFIED ARCTIC
AIRMASS FOLLOWING THE FRONT FOR MONDAY NIGHT AND TUESDAY. THIS WILL
MEAN COLDER TEMPERATURES CAN BE EXPECTED BY MONDAY AFTERNOON AND
ESPECIALLY MONDAY NIGHT. ALL OF THE RAIN WILL COME TO AN END AFTER
THE PASSAGE OF THE COLD FRONT ON MONDAY.

.LONG-TERM (TUESDAY-FRIDAY)...
NORTHWEST FLOW ALOFT WILL PERSIST THROUGH MID WEEK WITH ANOTHER
NORTHERN STREAM SHORTWAVE TROUGH APPROACHING IN THE FLOW ALOFT
ON WEDNESDAY. THIS WILL SEND ANOTHER COLD FRONT ACROSS THE AREA
ON WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON. MOISTURE SHOULD REMAIN LIMITED WITH THIS
SYSTEM SO HAVE INCLUDED ONLY A 20 POP FOR SHOWERS WEDNESDAY AND
WEDNESDAY NIGHT. HIGH PRESSURE WILL FOLLOW THIS FRONT WITH SLIGHTLY
BELOW NORMAL TEMPERATURES CONTINUING. ANOTHER COLD FRONT WILL
APPROACH ON FRIDAY...BUT DUE TO CONTINUED LIMITED MOISTURE HAVE LEFT
RAIN CHANCES OUT OF THE FORECAST AT THIS TIME.
&&

.MEG...WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MS...NONE.
MO...NONE.
TN...NONE.
&&

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
1002 AM CST FRI FEB 25 2005

.DISCUSSION...
HIGH PRESSURE WILL CONTINUE OVER THE MID SOUTH TODAY...KEEPING SKIES
MOSTLY SUNNY AND WINDS ON THE LIGHT SIDE. WEAK COLD AIR ADVECTION
THIS MORNING WILL BECOME NEUTRAL BY THIS AFTERNOON. TEMPERATURES
SHOULD WARM THIS AFTERNOON...BUT PLAN TO ADJUST TEMPS DOWN A FEW
DEGREES AS 16Z OBS STILL CHILLY AND TO ACCOUNT FOR CONTINUED WEAK
COLD ADVECTION.

OTHERWISE...CURRENT FORECAST LOOKS GOOD. UPDATES TO THE GRIDS AND
ZONES WILL BE OUT SHORTLY.

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 251002
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
400 AM CST FRI FEB 25 2005

A RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE IS DIRECTLY OVER THE MIDSOUTH ATTM. AS A
RESULT...WINDS HAVE CALMED IN THE NORTH HALF OF THE AREA AND THEY
ARE DIMINISHING IN SOUTHERN COUNTIES. THIN CIRRUS IS MOVING EAST
OVER MAINLY THE SOUTH HALF OF THE CWA. IT HAS GOTTEN COLD
OVERNIGHT. MID 20S HAVE BEEN REACHED AROUND PARIS AND LOW 30S
HAVE BEEN REACHED AROUND CLARKSDALE.

THE SURFACE RIDGE IS EXPECTED TO REMAIN OVER THE AREA TODAY AND
GIVE US LIGHT WINDS AND MOSTLY SUNNY SKIES. TEMPERATURES WILL GET
10 OR SO DEGREES HIGHER TODAY THAN YESTERDAY. MID 50S ARE
FORECAST.

TEMPERATURES WILL DIP INTO THE LOW TO MID 30S TONIGHT AS THE
RIDGE IS REINFORCED A LITTLE.

SATURDAY WILL BE NICE WITH SLIGHTLY WARMER TEMPERATURES. THINGS
CHANGE AFTER THAT. THE CUTOFF UPPER LOW OVER AZ WILL BE EJECTED
EAST FLINGING BITS OF LIFTING ENERGY OUT AHEAD OF IT. CLOUDINESS
WILL INCREASE SATURDAY NIGHT IN ASSOCIATION WITH THE UPPER TROUGH
AND A COLD FRONT FROM MINNEAPOLIS TO LUBBOCK. LIGHT TO MODERATE
SHOWERS WILL THEN DOUSE THE AREA OFF AND ON SUNDAY THROUGH MONDAY
MORNING. A STRONG CANADIAN COLD FRONT WILL PUT A STOP TO THE RAIN
AND ESCORT COLD WEATHER BACK INTO THE MIDSOUTH MONDAY INTO
WEDNESDAY OF NEXT WEEK.

&&

.MEG...WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MS...NONE.
MO...NONE.
TN...NONE.
&&

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 250302
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
902 PM CST THU FEB 24 2005

.UPDATE...
CURRENT FORECAST ON TRACK. LOW CLOUD LINE EXTENDS FROM MKL-GLH 
MOVING STEADILY TO THE SE. THESE CLOUDS SHOULD CLEAR OUT OF SE SXNS 
OF W TN BY 05Z AND NE MS BY 09-10Z. STILL SOME VERY THIN CI AROUND 
OTRW. TEMPS STEADILY FALLING WHERE LOW CLOUDS HAVE CLEARED. ALREADY 
30 ACRS PARIS TO UNION CITY. HAVE DROPPED TEMPS A FEW DEGREES THERE 
AND RAISED THEM SLIGHTLY WHERE CLOUDS ARE HANGING ON. UPDATE OUT 
SHORTLY.

.PREV DISCUSSION ISSUED AT 324 PM...
AN UPPER LEVEL TROUGH AXIS CONTINUES TO PUSH THROUGH THE MID SOUTH
THIS AFTERNOON. BEHIND THIS TROUGH AXIS SKIES ARE STARTING TO
SCATTER OUT ACROSS NORTHEAST ARKANSAS AS OF 20Z. THIS TREND WILL
CONTINUE SOUTHEASTWARD THIS EVENING...WITH SKIES CLEARING ACROSS
THE ENTIRE AREA BY LATE TONIGHT AS SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS IN.
TEMPERATURES WILL DROP OFF TO THE UPPER 20S NORTH TO LOWER 30S SOUTH
AS LOW LEVEL COLD ADVECTION CONTINUES TONIGHT.

.SHORT-TERM (FRIDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...
SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE WILL CONTINUE TO BUILD OVER THE AREA TONIGHT
INTO FRIDAY AND CONTINUE OVER THE MID SOUTH THROUGH THE FIRST PART
OF THE WEEKEND. THE UPPER LEVEL FLOW WILL BECOME NORTHWESTERLY
TONIGHT AND REMAIN THROUGH FRIDAY. THIS WILL SUPPRESS ANY MOISTURE
SOUTH ALONG THE GULF COAST. SKIES SHOULD BE MOSTLY SUNNY ON FRIDAY
WITH TEMPERATURES WARMING BACK INTO THE 50S WITH NEUTRAL TEMPERATURE
ADVECTION.

WEAK WARM ADVECTION SHOULD BEGIN AGAIN ON SATURDAY AS SURFACE HIGH
PRESSURE MOVES EAST AND LOW LEVEL WINDS COME BACK OUT OF THE
SOUTHEAST. THIS SHOULD ALLOW TEMPERATURES TO WARM FURTHER ON SATURDAY
TO HIGHS A FEW DEGREES ABOVE FRIDAYS MAXES. THE UPPER FLOW WILL
BECOME SOUTHWESTERLY AGAIN BY SATURDAY AFTERNOON AS THE NEXT TROUGH
APPROACHES THE AREA. THIS WILL ALLOW HIGH LEVEL MOISTURE TO SPREAD
BACK OVER THE MID SOUTH BRINGING PARTLY CLOUDY SKIES SATURDAY
AFTERNOON. CLOUDS WILL CONTINUE TO INCREASE SATURDAY NIGHT AND
SKIES SHOULD BECOME MOSTLY CLOUDY BY SUNDAY. SUNDAY HIGH
TEMPERATURES WILL BE SIMILAR TO SATURDAYS MAXIMUMS (UPPER 50S NORTH
TO NEAR 60 SOUTH) AS WARM ADVECTION CONTINUES AND CLOUDS INCREASE.

.LONG-TERM (SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)...
THE OVERALL PATTERN WILL SET UP TO ALLOW TEMPERATURES TO TREND COLDER
AGAIN FOR THE MIDDLE OF NEXT WEEK. THE MEDIUM RANGE MODEL GUIDANCE
(ECMWF/GFS/UKMET) INDICATING A BLOCKING UPPER LEVEL HIGH PRESSURE
BUILDING OVER GREENLAND FOR THE BEGINNING OF NEXT WEEK. THIS WILL
FORCE A COLD AIRMASS OVER NORTHERN CANADA TO MOVE SOUTHWARD
PRECEDED BY A POTENT NORTHERN STREAM SHORTWAVE TROUGH BY THE
BEGINNING OF NEXT WEEK. THIS NORTHERN STREAM SHORTWAVE WILL ATTEMPT
TO PHASE WITH A WEAKENING UPPER LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM IN THE SOUTHERN
STREAM MOVING EAST OUT OF THE DESERT SOUTHWEST. THE NORTHERN
STREAM SHORTWAVE WILL SEND A STRONG SURFACE COLD FRONT ACROSS THE
AREA ON MONDAY. ENOUGH LOW LEVEL MOISTURE SHOULD INCREASE AHEAD OF
THIS SYSTEM TO ALLOW FOR SHOWERS TO DEVELOP FOR SUNDAY NIGHT INTO
MONDAY. THEREFORE...HAVE KEPT CURRENT FORECAST POPS GOING...WITH 30
POP SUNDAY NIGHT AND 40 POPS ON MONDAY.

BEHIND THE COLD FRONT...COLD TEMPERATURES WILL FILTER INTO THE
AREA. TEMPERATURES SHOULD SLOWLY FALL BY MONDAY AFTERNOON AND ON
TUESDAY WILL STRUGGLE TO REACH THE LOW TO MID 40S. THE DEEP EASTERN
TROUGH WILL MOVE EAST FOR THE SECOND HALF OF NEXT WEEK WITH THE
UPPER FLOW FLATTENING OUT AND TEMPERATURES REBOUNDING. DRY
CONDITIONS WILL ALSO PERSIST FOR TUESDAY THROUGH THURSDAY.

&&

.MEG...WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MS...NONE.
MO...NONE.
TN...NONE.
&&

$$

JLH/SJM

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
924 AM CST THU FEB 24 2005

.DISCUSSION...
AN UPPER LEVEL TROUGH AXIS CENTERED OVER THE EASTERN PLAINS STATES
THIS MORNING WILL CONTINUE TO SWING EAST OVER THE AREA THROUGH THE
DAY. AHEAD OF THIS UPPER TROUGH A FEW LIGHT SHOWERS HAVE DEVELOPED
OVER NORTHEAST ARKANSAS...AS INDICATED BY KNQA RADAR. THESE SHOWERS
REMAIN ISOLATED IN COVERAGE AND HAVE SHOWN A WEAKENING TREND
THROUGH THE MORNING. PLAN TO UPDATE PRECIP GRIDS TO REMOVE MENTION
OF FROZEN...AS TEMPS HAVE REMAINED ABOVE FREEZING AND SHOULD THROUGH
THE DAY. ALSO WILL CARRY 20 POPS OVER NORTHEAST ARKANSAS AND THE
MISSOURI BOOTHEEL THROUGH 18Z TO ACCOUNT FOR ONGOING SHOWERS...AND
WILL ADD SPRINKLES FOR THIS AFTERNOON FOR WEST TENNESSEE AND EXTREME
NORTH MISSISSIPPI AS TROUGH CONTINUES SWINGING ACROSS THE MID SOUTH.
ALL OTHER GRID PARAMETERS LOOK GOOD SO WILL NOT CHANGE.

UPDATED GRIDS AND TEXT FORECAST OUT SHORTLY.
&&

.MEG...WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MS...NONE.
MO...NONE.
TN...NONE.
&&

$$

JLH





000 
FXUS64 KMEG 240925
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
325 AM CST THU FEB 24 2005

.DISCUSSION...

SURFACE MAP PLACES AN AREA OF LOW PRESSURE OVER CENTRAL ALABAMA WITH 
TRAILING COLD FRONT ALONG THE GULF COAST. ALOFT...AN UPPER TROUGH IS 
DIGGING INTO THE REGION. THIS TROUGH HAS SOME COLDER AIR WITH IT AND 
AHEAD OF THE TROUGH THERE IS ENOUGH LIFT FOR SOME LIGHT 
PRECIPITATION FROM SOUTHERN MISSOURI AND ARKANSAS. 

THIS AREA OF LIGHT PRECIPITATION WILL MOVE THROUGH THE REGION EARLY 
THIS MORNING. GFS AND ETA INDICATE THAT THE BETTER LIFT AND DEEPER 
MOISTURE IS ACROSS WEST TN INTO NORTHEAST ARKANSAS. HAVE SOME LOW 
POPS IN THESE AREAS WITH SPRINKLES POSSIBLE ELSEWHERE. THE REGION 
WILL BE EXPERIENCING GOOD COLD AIR ADVECTION ALL DAY TODAY. NORTH OF 
A LINE FROM JONESBORO TO DYERSBURG TO PARIS THE AIR ENOUGH COLD AIR 
MAY ARRIVE FOR SOME SNOWFLAKES TO MIX IN WITH THE RAIN/DRIZZLE. THE 
FREEZING LEVEL IS ABOUT 1000FT ALTHOUGH SURFACE TEMPS ARE TOO WARM 
FOR SNOW ACCUMULATIONS AND PRECIPITATION SHOULDNT BE THAT MUCH 
ANYWAY. LIQUID EQUIVALENT WILL PROBABLY BE ONLY ONE OR TWO 
HUNDRETHS. CLOUD COVER SHOULD HANG AROUND THE BETTER PART OF THE 
DAY...POSSIBLY BREAKING OUT OVER NORTHEAST ARKANSAS LATE IN THE DAY. 
TEMPS TODAY WILL ONCE AGAIN BE COOL DUE TO CLOUD COVER AND COLD AIR 
ADVECTION. SOUNDINGS SHOW DRIER AIR WORKING INTO THE REGION DURING 
THE EVENING AS HIGH PRESSURE SETTLES IN OVER THE AREA. WITH CLEARING 
SKIES AND LIGHT WINDS...BY DAWN TEMPS MAY BE IN THE UPPER 20 AND 
LOWER 30S.

HIGH PRESSURE WILL REMAIN IN CONTROL OVER THE WEEKEND WITH THE ONLY 
CLOUD COVER IN THE WAY OF CIRRUS. TEMPS SHOULD GRADUALLY RECOVER 
INTO THE MID AND UPPER 50S THROUGH THE WEEKEND AS THE THERMAL TROUGH 
PULLS AWAY FROM THE AREA. DEPENDING UPON HOW THICK THE CIRRUS 
IS...FRIDAY NIGHT COULD BE ANOTHER COLD NIGHT WITH LIGHT WINDS DUE 
TO THE POSITION OF THE SURFACE HIGH. 

THE NEXT SIGNIFICANT SYSTEM ARRIVES LATE IN THE WEEKEND AND EARLY 
NEXT WEEK WHEN A RIDGE BUILDS OVER THE WEST COAST AND KICKS THE 
UPPER LOW THAT IS CURRENTLY OVER THAT AREA OUT. THERE IS A SLIGHT 
CHANCE OF RAIN SUNDAY NIGHT AS A WEAK SHORTWAVE ASSOCIATED WITH THE 
SYSTEM MOVES THROUGH. THE BETTER CHANCE WILL BE ON MONDAY WHEN A 
STRONG COLD FRONT RACES THROUGH THE AREA. THE AIR BEHIND THIS FRONT 
IS COMING DOWN OUT OF CENTRAL CANADA. IF THE STRENGTH OF THIS COLD 
AIR IS AS STRONG AS THE GFS IS ADVERTISING...THEN TEMPS ON TUESDAY 
WOULD BE AT LEAST 10 DEGREES BELOW NORMAL AND PERHAPS AS MUCH AS 15 
DEGREES BELOW NORMAL.

&&

.MEG...WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MS...NONE.
MO...NONE.
TN...NONE.
&&

$$

VALLE

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 240150
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
750 PM CST WED FEB 23 2005

.UPDATE...
MOST OF THE PRECIP HAS LEFT THE AREA ATTM. CLOUDY SKIES PREVAIL WITH 
A COOL NE WIND ACRS THE MID SOUTH THIS EVENING. A FEW SHOWERS WERE 
DEVELOPING ACRS SRN MO/NRN AR IN RESPONSE TO APPROACHING SHORTWAVE 
SO WL LEAVE CHC POPS ACRS THE NRN TIER THRU MIDNIGHT WITH LOWER POPS 
TOWARD THE SOUTH. MENTION OF DRIZZLE AFTER MIDNIGHT LOOKS GOOD 
ACCORDING TO LATEST ETA FORECAST SOUNDINGS. UPDATE OUT SHORTLY.

.PREV DISCUSSION ISSUED 255 PM CST...
BACK EDGE OF MAIN RAIN AREA APPROACHING MISSISSIPPI RIVER AT
MID-AFTERNOON. SECONDARY AREA OF PRECIPITATION MAINLY OVER SOUTHWEST
MISSOURI...WITH SOME LIGHTER PRECIP OVER NORTHWEST ARKANSAS. WIDE
SPREAD IN TEMPERATURES ACROSS CWA FROM UPPER 30S NORTHWEST TO LOWER
60S EXTREME SOUTHEAST. ACTUAL FRONTAL BOUNDARY IS TO THE SOUTH OF THE
CWA WITH A SURFACE LOW NEAR JAN.
&&

.SHORT RANGE (THROUGH SATURDAY)...
ONLY SIGNIFICANT PRECIPITATION EVENT DURING THIS PERIOD WILL BE IN
THE FIRST 6-12 HOURS OF THE FORECAST. MAIN IMPULSE WILL BE MOVING
THROUGH THE AREA OVER THE NEXT 6 HOURS...AND TRYING TO BASE POPS ON
EXPECTED RADAR TRENDS THROUGH 06Z. HIGHEST POPS EXTREME EAST...CHANCE
POPS WEST. ANY THUNDER MENTION WILL BE LIMITED TO EXTREME EASTERN
PORTION OF NORTH MISSISSIPPI.

AFTER ABOUT 06Z...WE LOSE ANY SIGNIFICANT FORCING FOR PRECIPITATION.
WITH NO LIFT...EXPECTING ONLY SOME DRIZZLE. GUIDANCE SOUNDINGS
INDICATE ANY PRECIPITATION SHOULD REMAIN IN A LIQUID FORM...WITH
CURRENT DEWPOINTS REMAINING ABOVE FREEZING AREAWIDE. DRIZZLE COULD
LAST INTO THE MORNING HOURS THURSDAY BEFORE MOISTURE BECOMES TOO
LIMITED TO SUPPORT EVEN THAT. LOW CLOUDS DECREASE DURING THE
AFTERNOON THURSDAY...AND ANY CLOUD COVER AFTER THAT...THROUGH
SATURDAY...SHOULD BE LIMITED TO CIRRUS. NEXT PIECE OF ENERGY SHOULD
KEEP PRECIPITATION SOUTH AND WEST OF OUR CWA.

TEMPERATURES...CURRENT FORECAST LOOKS GOOD OVERNIGHT WITH NO REAL
PUSH OF COLD AIR. RAISED HIGHS THURSDAY A COUPLE OF DEGREES...WHICH
FITS WITH OUR NEIGHBORS. IF WE COMPLETELY LOSE CLOUDS THURSDAY
NIGHT...OUR LOWS WILL BE TOO WARM...BUT WITH CIRRUS EXPECTED...
CURRENT FORECAST FOR THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY NIGHT IS
REASONABLE. SATURDAY HIGHS CLOSE TO THOSE OF FRIDAY WITH NO WARM
ADVECTION AT THE SURFACE.
&&

.LONG RANGE (BEYOND SATURDAY)...
CONFIDENCE IN EXTENDED FORECAST RATHER LOW. MODELS ARE FORECASTING
NORTHERN STREAM TO BECOME A LITTLE MORE PREDOMINANT BY EARLY NEXT
WEEK. DEVIL IS IN THE DETAILS THOUGH...AS THE MEDIUM RANGE MODELS
DIFFER IN WHERE THE MEAN TROUGH SETS UP. THIS WILL HAVE A LARGE
EFFECT ON EXPECTED TEMPERATURES FOR MONDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY. WILL
HOLD ONTO THE LOW POPS FOR SUNDAY NIGHT AND MONDAY FOR NOW...WITH
COLD FRONT MOVING THROUGH FROM NORTHWEST. MOISTURE SOMEWHAT
LIMITED...BUT COULD SEE SOMETHING WITH FROPA.

SUNDAY WILL PROBABLY BE THE WARMEST DAY OF THE EXTENDED FORECAST...
BUT EVEN THEN NEAR OR BELOW NORMAL. REST OF EXTENDED WILL AVERAGE
BELOW NORMAL...QUESTION IS HOW MUCH. THICKNESS VALUES INDICATE MAIN
PUSH OF ARCTIC AIR WILL BE TO OUR NORTHEAST. MODELS DONT SHOW A
MASSIVE SURFACE HIGH MOVING INTO THE MIDWEST...SO CONFIDENCE IN
SOUTHWARD EXTENT OF COLD AIR A LITTLE LOW. WILL HOLD OFF ON EXTREME
CHANGES TO TEMPERATURES FOR MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH THE END OF THE
FORECAST FOR NOW.
&&

.MEG...WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MS...NONE.
MO...NONE.
TN...NONE.
&&

$$

WAGNER/SJM

FXUS64 KMEG 231703
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
1103 AM CST WED FEB 23 2005

.DISCUSSION...
CURRENT FORECAST IS HANDLING SITUATION FINE. WILL NEED TO KEEP AN EYE
ON TEMPERATURES...BUT PRECIPITATION TRENDS LOOK GOOD. HAVE BEEN
MONITORING AN ELEVATED SUPERCELL OVER TALLAHATCHIE COUNTY FOR LAST
HOUR THAT HAS PUT OUT QUARTER SIZE HAIL. CONVECTION SHOULD REMAIN
MAINLY LIMITED TO NORTHERN MISSISSIPPI AND NO WIDESPREAD SEVERE
WEATHER EXPECTED. WILL ADDRESS PRECIP CHANCES AND TYPE FOR TONIGHT IN
AFTERNOON PACKAGE.
