

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 231106
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
506 AM CST WED FEB 23 2005

.UPDATED DISCUSSION...
UPDATED TODAYS FORECAST BASED UPON RADAR TRENDS WITHIN THE LAST 
HOUR. RADAR SHOWS A SOLID LINE OF RAIN AND LIGHTNING ACTIVITY ACROSS 
ALL OF WESTERN ARKANSAS MOVING EASTWARD. THE LIGHTNING ACTIVITY 
APPEARS TO BE DUE TO ELEVATED INSTABILITY. GIVEN PROXIMITY OF 
LIGHTNING STRIKES TO THE AREA...GAVE A MENTION OF A RUMBLE OF 
THUNDER POSSIBLE. ESTIMATE THE RAIN TO ARRIVE THIS MORNING. ALSO 
RAISED POPS OVER ALL OF WEST TENNESSEE TO LIKELY BASED UPON THE 
DEGREE OF COVERAGE OVER ARKANSAS.

.PREVIOUS DISCUSSION...
SURFACE FRONT IS ORIENTED NEAR THE GULF COAST THIS MORNING. A STRONG 
UPPER LEVEL SHORTWAVE IS MOVING OUT OF THE SOUTHERN PLAINS. THIS 
SHORTWAVE IS RESPONSIBLE FOR AN AREA OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS 
MOVING INTO WESTERN ARKANSAS THIS MORNING. THE HIGH CLOUDS FROM 
THESE STORMS HAS MOVED OVER THE REGION. WINDS ARE OUT OF THE 
NORTHEAST IN RESPONSE TO HIGH PRESSURE OVER ILLINOIS. 

UPPER SHORTWAVE WILL MOVE THROUGH THE REGION THIS AFTERNOON AND 
EVENING. LIS AND CAPE SHOW THAT ATMOSPHERE IS VERY STABLE AND MID 
LEVEL LAPSE RATES ARE NOT TOO SUPPORTIVE OF THUNDER. EXPECT 
LIGHTNING ACTIVITY TO DECREASE OVER ARKANSAS THIS MORNING. EASTERLY 
WINDS IN THE LOW LEVELS MAY INHIBIT THE ONSET OF RAINFALL FOR A 
SHORT TIME AS DRY AIR IS PUMPED INTO THE SYSTEM. HOWEVER THE 
STRENGTH OF THE SYSTEM SHOULD EVENTUALLY WIN OUT WITH MOST LOCATIONS 
SEEING RAIN TODAY AND TONIGHT. THE RAIN SHOULD FIRST ARRIVE INTO 
AREAS ALONG AND WEST OF THE MISSISSIPPI RIVER BY LATE MORNING OR 
AROUND NOON AND WORK ITS WAY EASTWARD THROUGHOUT THE DAY. HAVE 
SLIGHTLY LOWER POPS EAST OF JACKSON DUE TO TIMING CONCERNS WITH 
RESPECT TO THE DRY EASTERLY WINDS. TEMPERATURES TODAY WILL BE 
IMPACTED BY THE NEUTRAL TEMP ADVECTION ASSOCIATED WITH THE EASTERLY 
WINDS...CLOUD COVER AND ESPECIALLY WHEN THE RAINFALL ARRIVES.

TONIGHT...MOST LOCATIONS SHOULD STILL HAVE SOME RAIN AROUND DURING 
THE EVENING BUT BY MIDNIGHT THE MAIN SHORTWAVE WILL HAVE MOVED EAST 
OF THE AREA. SOUNDINGS SHOWING THAT SOME DRIZZLE MAY STILL LINGER 
BEHIND THIS MAIN AREA OF RAIN. IN TERMS OF WINTRY POTENTIAL NORTH OF 
JONESBORO TO JACKSON...THE SOUNDINGS DO NOT SUPPORT MOISTURE UP TO 
THE -10 DEGREE MARK SO ICE CRYSTAL ACTIVATION IS UNLIKELY. THIS 
RULES OUT SNOW. FINALLY...THE BOUNDARY LAYER TEMPS...ALTHOUGH 
CLOSE...LOOK LIKE THEY ARE JUST ABOVE FREEZING. THIS RULES OUT 
FREEZING RAIN OR FREEZING DRIZZLE. STILL...THE SITUATION WILL NEED 
TO BE REEVALUATED ONCE THE 12Z DATA ARRIVES. 

LOOKING AT 925MB MOISTURE FIELDS AND SOUNDINGS...WILL LIKELY HAVE 
LOTS OF LOW STRATUS TO CONTEND WITH TOMORROW. CLOUDS WILL PROBABLY 
STICK AROUND JUST ABOUT ALL DAY BEFORE BREAKING UP TOMORROW NIGHT AS 
HIGH PRESSURE SETTLES OVER THE REGION. 

HIGH PRESSURE WILL REMAIN LOCKED OVER THE REGION INTO THE WEEKEND. 
DEPENDING UPON CLOUD COVER AND WIND SPEEDS...OVERNIGHT LOWS COULD BE 
CHILLY WITH TEMPS IN THE 20S POSSIBLE. ANOTHER STORM SYSTEM WILL 
ARRIVE ON MONDAY WITH WARM AIR ADVECTION VARIETY SHOWERS POSSIBLE 
SUNDAY NIGHT BEFORE A STRONG COLD FRONT MOVES THROUGH ON MONDAY. 
ATMOSPHERE STILL LOOKS RATHER STABLE WITH THE FRONT FOR MENTION OF 
THUNDER. THE GFS IS ADVERTISING A GOOD DEAL OF COLD AIR BEHIND THIS 
SYSTEM...WHICH MAY BE A BIT OVERDONE. STILL...HAVE LOWERED TEMPS 
BELOW MEX GUIDANCE IN THE EXTENDED TO ABOUT 8 DEGREES BELOW 
CLIMATOLOGY AS A FIRST GUESS.

&&

.MEG...WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MS...NONE.
MO...NONE.
TN...NONE.
&&

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
320 AM CST WED FEB 23 2005

.DISCUSSION...
SURFACE FRONT IS ORIENTED NEAR THE GULF COAST THIS MORNING. A STRONG 
UPPER LEVEL SHORTWAVE IS MOVING OUT OF THE SOUTHERN PLAINS. THIS 
SHORTWAVE IS RESPONSIBLE FOR AN AREA OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS 
MOVING INTO WESTERN ARKANSAS THIS MORNING. THE HIGH CLOUDS FROM 
THESE STORMS HAS MOVED OVER THE REGION. WINDS ARE OUT OF THE 
NORTHEAST IN RESPONSE TO HIGH PRESSURE OVER ILLINOIS. 

UPPER SHORTWAVE WILL MOVE THROUGH THE REGION THIS AFTERNOON AND 
EVENING. LIS AND CAPE SHOW THAT ATMOSPHERE IS VERY STABLE AND MID 
LEVEL LAPSE RATES ARE NOT TOO SUPPORTIVE OF THUNDER. EXPECT

SHORT TIME AS DRY AIR IS PUMPED INTO THE SYSTEM. HOWEVER THE

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 230420
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
1020 PM CST TUE FEB 22 2005

.UPDATE...
LOW CLOUDS CONT TO COVER A GOOD DEAL OF THE MID SOUTH FROM SW OF MEM 
THROUGH MOST OF ERN AR AND WRN TN. NRN MS CLEAR ATTM BUT WITH HIGH 
CLOUDS RAPIDLY STREAMING IN FROM THE SW IN ADVANCE OF THE NEXT 
SYSTEM HAVE ELECTED TO GO MOSTLY CLOUDY EVERYWHERE FOR THE REMAINDER 
OF THE NIGHT. TEMPS LOOK FINE. UPDATE OUT.

.PREV DISCUSSION ISSUED AT 146 PM...
WHILE COLD/STATIONARY FRONT REMAINS SOUTH OF OUR CWA...CLOUD COVER
HAS BEEN VERY STUBBORN ACROSS BOTH NORTHERN AND SOUTHERN QUARTERS OF
CWA DURING THE DAYTIME HOURS. LOOKS LIKE SOUTHERN CLOUDS COULD
CONCEIVABLY BURN OFF DURING THE REMAINDER OF THE AFTERNOON...BUT
NOT SO SURE ABOUT NORTHERN CLOUDS. THIS HAS MADE FOR A LARGE
TEMPERATURE CONTRAST ACROSS THE AREA...LOWER 40S NORTH TO MIDDLE 60S
IN SOME SOUTHERN AREAS.
&&

.SHORT TERM (THROUGH FRIDAY)...
ONLY ONE PRECIPITATION EVENT TO DEAL WITH IN THE SHORT TERM...
OTHERWISE A TEMPERATURE AND CLOUD FORECAST. IMPULSE KICKED OUT FROM
SOUTHWEST U.S. LOW WILL MOVE TOWARD THE AREA ON WEDNESDAY. BOTH NAM
AND GFS SHOW STRONG ISENTROPIC LIFT DURING THE AFTERNOON AND EVENING
HOURS...ALTHOUGH IN DIFFERENT AREAS OF THE CWA. IT MAY TAKE A LITTLE
WHILE FOR THE LOWER LEVELS TO SATURATE...SO WILL START SPREADING
PRECIPITATION ACROSS THE AREA DURING THE AFTERNOON HOURS WEDNESDAY...
AND CONTINUE THROUGH WEDNESDAY NIGHT...CURRENTLY PLANNING ON LIKELY
POPS. LOOKED AT BOTH GFS AND NAM SOUNDINGS FOR NUMEROUS AREAS. BOTH
MODELS INDICATE THAT TEMPERATURE PROFILE SHOULD NOT SUPPORT FROZEN
PRECIPITATION WHILE ANY SIGNIFICANT ISENTROPIC LIFT IS OCCURRING.
WILL GO WITH ALL LIQUID PRECIPITATION...BUT CANNOT RULE OUT ONE OR
TWO STRAY REPORTS OF SLEET ALONG OUR EXTREME NORTHERN BORDER
WEDNESDAY NIGHT AS THE MAIN PRECIPITATION ENDS. WILL LEAVE SLIGHT
CHANCE IN FOR EARLY THURSDAY MORNING...AS A LITTLE VERY LIGHT RAIN
COULD OCCUR ON BACK EDGE OF CLOUD/PRECIPITATION SHIELD. CLOUDS
SHOULD MOVE OUT FOR THURSDAY AFTERNOON INTO FRIDAY.

TEMPERATURE FORECAST FOR TONIGHT LOOKS OK. ON WEDNESDAY...NORTHERN
AREAS SHOULD BE PRETTY CLOSE TO WHERE THEY ARE TODAY...AS
CONDITIONS WILL BE SIMILAR. MAY NEED TO LOWER MAX TEMPS A BIT ACROSS
SOUTHERN HALF WITH MORE CLOUDS AND PRECIPITATION EXPECTED. GFS
SOLUTION A LITTLE TOO COLD FOR WEDNESDAY NIGHT. NAM/MET GUIDANCE A
LITTLE MORE REASONABLE...BUT PLAN TO UNDERCUT THOSE A DEGREE OR
TWO. WILL LOWER MAX TEMPERATURES ON THURSDAY A CATEGORY ACROSS
SOUTHERN TWO THIRDS OF AREA. THURSDAY NIGHT GUIDANCE TEMPERATURES
LOOK GOOD. FRIDAY HIGHS WILL BE IN THE 50S.
&&

.LONG TERM (BEYOND FRIDAY)...
EXTENDED PERIOD COULD BE COMPLETELY DRY. TO MAINTAIN RUN TO RUN
CONTINUITY...AS WELL AS CONTINUITY WITH NEIGHBORS...WILL KEEP SLIGHT
MENTION OF PRECIPITATION IN THE SUNDAY NIGHT TO MONDAY NIGHT TIME
FRAME. THIS POTENTIAL PRECIPITATION EVENT WOULD BE THE REMNANTS OF
THE SOUTHWEST U.S. UPPER LOW FINALLY MOVING EAST. SOME OF THE OTHER
EXTENDED MODELS TRACK ANY SYSTEM ALONG THE GULF COAST...OR ACROSS
THE GULF OF MEXICO. IF MODELS CONTINUE ON THIS TREND...WOULD
PROBABLY PULL THIS MENTION OF PRECIPITATION DURING TOMORROWS
FORECAST. NOT EXPECTING ANY EXTREMES IN TEMPERATURES IN THE FRIDAY
THROUGH TUESDAY PERIOD. TEMPERATURES DURING THAT PERIOD MAY AVERAGE
A COUPLE OF DEGREES BELOW NORMAL.
&&

.MEG...WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MS...NONE.
MO...NONE.
TN...NONE.
&&

$$

SJM

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 221946
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
146 PM CST TUE FEB 22 2005

.DISCUSSION...
WHILE COLD/STATIONARY FRONT REMAINS SOUTH OF OUR CWA...CLOUD COVER
HAS BEEN VERY STUBBORN ACROSS BOTH NORTHERN AND SOUTHERN QUARTERS OF
CWA DURING THE DAYTIME HOURS. LOOKS LIKE SOUTHERN CLOUDS COULD
CONCEIVABLY BURN OFF DURING THE REMAINDER OF THE AFTERNOON...BUT
NOT SO SURE ABOUT NORTHERN CLOUDS. THIS HAS MADE FOR A LARGE
TEMPERATURE CONTRAST ACROSS THE AREA...LOWER 40S NORTH TO MIDDLE 60S
IN SOME SOUTHERN AREAS.
&&

.SHORT TERM (THROUGH FRIDAY)...
ONLY ONE PRECIPITATION EVENT TO DEAL WITH IN THE SHORT TERM...
OTHERWISE A TEMPERATURE AND CLOUD FORECAST. IMPULSE KICKED OUT FROM
SOUTHWEST U.S. LOW WILL MOVE TOWARD THE AREA ON WEDNESDAY. BOTH NAM
AND GFS SHOW STRONG ISENTROPIC LIFT DURING THE AFTERNOON AND EVENING
HOURS...ALTHOUGH IN DIFFERENT AREAS OF THE CWA. IT MAY TAKE A LITTLE
WHILE FOR THE LOWER LEVELS TO SATURATE...SO WILL START SPREADING
PRECIPITATION ACROSS THE AREA DURING THE AFTERNOON HOURS WEDNESDAY...
AND CONTINUE THROUGH WEDNESDAY NIGHT...CURRENTLY PLANNING ON LIKELY
POPS. LOOKED AT BOTH GFS AND NAM SOUNDINGS FOR NUMEROUS AREAS. BOTH
MODELS INDICATE THAT TEMPERATURE PROFILE SHOULD NOT SUPPORT FROZEN
PRECIPITATION WHILE ANY SIGNIFICANT ISENTROPIC LIFT IS OCCURRING.
WILL GO WITH ALL LIQUID PRECIPITATION...BUT CANNOT RULE OUT ONE OR
TWO STRAY REPORTS OF SLEET ALONG OUR EXTREME NORTHERN BORDER
WEDNESDAY NIGHT AS THE MAIN PRECIPITATION ENDS. WILL LEAVE SLIGHT
CHANCE IN FOR EARLY THURSDAY MORNING...AS A LITTLE VERY LIGHT RAIN
COULD OCCUR ON BACK EDGE OF CLOUD/PRECIPITATION SHIELD. CLOUDS
SHOULD MOVE OUT FOR THURSDAY AFTERNOON INTO FRIDAY.

TEMPERATURE FORECAST FOR TONIGHT LOOKS OK. ON WEDNESDAY...NORTHERN
AREAS SHOULD BE PRETTY CLOSE TO WHERE THEY ARE TODAY...AS
CONDITIONS WILL BE SIMILAR. MAY NEED TO LOWER MAX TEMPS A BIT ACROSS
SOUTHERN HALF WITH MORE CLOUDS AND PRECIPITATION EXPECTED. GFS
SOLUTION A LITTLE TOO COLD FOR WEDNESDAY NIGHT. NAM/MET GUIDANCE A
LITTLE MORE REASONABLE...BUT PLAN TO UNDERCUT THOSE A DEGREE OR
TWO. WILL LOWER MAX TEMPERATURES ON THURSDAY A CATEGORY ACROSS
SOUTHERN TWO THIRDS OF AREA. THURSDAY NIGHT GUIDANCE TEMPERATURES
LOOK GOOD. FRIDAY HIGHS WILL BE IN THE 50S.
&&

.LONG TERM (BEYOND FRIDAY)...
EXTENDED PERIOD COULD BE COMPLETELY DRY. TO MAINTAIN RUN TO RUN
CONTINUITY...AS WELL AS CONTINUITY WITH NEIGHBORS...WILL KEEP SLIGHT
MENTION OF PRECIPITATION IN THE SUNDAY NIGHT TO MONDAY NIGHT TIME
FRAME. THIS POTENTIAL PRECIPITATION EVENT WOULD BE THE REMNANTS OF
THE SOUTHWEST U.S. UPPER LOW FINALLY MOVING EAST. SOME OF THE OTHER
EXTENDED MODELS TRACK ANY SYSTEM ALONG THE GULF COAST...OR ACROSS
THE GULF OF MEXICO. IF MODELS CONTINUE ON THIS TREND...WOULD
PROBABLY PULL THIS MENTION OF PRECIPITATION DURING TOMORROWS
FORECAST. NOT EXPECTING ANY EXTREMES IN TEMPERATURES IN THE FRIDAY
THROUGH TUESDAY PERIOD. TEMPERATURES DURING THAT PERIOD MAY AVERAGE
A COUPLE OF DEGREES BELOW NORMAL.
&&

.MEG...WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MS...NONE.
MO...NONE.
TN...NONE.
&&

$$





000 
FXUS64 KMEG 221702
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
1102 AM CST TUE FEB 22 2005

.DISCUSSION...
MONITORING FOR POSSIBLE UPDATE. LARGEST CONCERN IS TWO AREAS OF
STRATUS...ONE OVER THE NORTH THIRD OF THE CWA...AND THE OTHER OVER
THE SOUTHERN THIRD. BOTH AREAS HAD BEEN ADVANCING TO MEET NEAR THE
TN-MS LINE UP UNTIL ABOUT AN HOUR AGO. NOW THE EDGES ARE STARTING TO
ERODE AGAIN. SURFACE FRONT IS SOUTH OF THE CWA...BUT COLD AIRMASS
APPEARS TO BE RATHER SHALLOW. RUC AND MESOETA SOUNDINGS SHOW THAT
ALL TAF SITES SHOULD BREAK OUT OF THE LOW CLOUDS IN THE NEXT HOUR OR
TWO...BUT CONFIDENCE NOT ALL THAT HIGH.

CLOUD COVER WOULD HAVE AN OBVIOUS IMPACT ON HIGH TEMPERATURES.
AREAS ACROSS NRN THIRD OF CWA ARE CURRENTLY IN LOW-MID 40S...AND
WITHOUT SUNSHINE...WOULDNT MAKE 50. WILL MONITOR THROUGH 18Z AND
UPDATE ACCORDINGLY.
&&

.MEG...WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MS...NONE.
MO...NONE.
TN...NONE.
&&

.DISCUSSION...

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 221309
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
709 AM CST TUE FEB 22 2005

.UPDATED...
UPDATED FORECAST FOR SKY COVER. SURFACE OBSERVATIONS SHOWING LOW 
STRATUS HAS PROGRESSED SOUTHWESTWARD. THESE CLOUDS ARE OBSCURED FROM 
SATELLITE BY A THIN VEIL OF CIRRUS OVERHEAD. CURRENT THINKING IS 
THAT PROGRESS SHOULD SLOW SOON NOW THAT THE SUN IS UP AND THAT BY 
AFTERNOON THE DECK WILL MIX OUT.

.PREVIOUS DISCUSSION...
SURFACE MAP PLACES A STATIONARY FRONT FROM NORTHERN GEORGIA THROUGH 
CENTRAL ALABAMA AND MISSISSIPPI THROUGH NORTHERN LOUISIANA AND INTO 
CENTRAL TEXAS. HIGH PRESSURE IS OVER THE UPPER TO MID MISSISSIPPI 
RIVER VALLEY. THIS IS BRINGING NORTHEASTERLY WINDS INTO THE REGION. 
SATELLITE SHOWS A DECK OF STRATUS WITH CEILINGS AT OR JUST BELOW 
1000FT NORTH OF A LINE FROM DYERSBURG TO JACKSON TO SAVANNAH. ALSO 
THERE IS SOME CIRRUS DRIFTING IN FROM A CUT OFF LOW NEAR THE COAST 
OF CALIFORNIA. 

MESOETA MODEL SOUNDINGS THIS MORNING SUGGEST FOG FORMATION FROM THE  
SURFACE MOISTURE FROM YESTERDAYS RAIN AND COOL AIR MOVING IN FROM 
THE NORTHEAST. OBSERVATIONS AT LEAST SO FAR HAVE NOT INDICATED MUCH 
FOG MOST LIKELY DUE TO WINDS STAYING UP BETWEEN 5 AND 10 MPH KEEPING 
THE BOUNDARY LAYER JUST MIXED ENOUGH. PATCHY FOG IS STILL POSSIBLE 
EARLY THIS MORNING AS THE ATMOSPHERE BEGINS TO OVERTURN AT SUNRISE. 
STATIONARY FRONT SHOULD STAY SOUTH OF THE REGION TODAY AND WITH NO 
STRONG IMPULSES MOVING ALONG THE FRONT RAIN CHANCES SHOULD REMAIN 
CONFINED TO NEAR THE FRONTAL ZONE. WILL CONTINUE THE CLOUDY WORDING 
THIS MORNING WHERE THE STRATUS IS HANGING TOUGH. THESE CLOUDS SHOULD 
EVENTUALLY ERODE AWAY HOWEVER THEY MAY STICK AROUND LONG ENOUGH TO 
IMPACT HIGH TEMPS OVER THAT AREA. 

EXPECT INCREASING CLOUDINESS TONIGHT AS A SHORTWAVE WILL EJECT OUT 
OF THE SOUTHWEST. ON WEDNESDAY...THE GFS AND ETA DIFFER SOMEWHAT IN 
THE TIMING OF THE SOUTHERN STREAM SHORTWAVE. THE GFS IS ABOUT 6 
HOURS FASTER IN THE PROGRESSION OF THIS SYSTEM ACROSS THE SOUTHERN 
US THAN THE ETA. THE GFS LOOKS LIKE IT MAY BE SUFFERING FROM SOME 
CONVECTIVE FEEDBACK PROBLEMS AS IT DEVELOPS AN MCS OVER EASTERN 
TEXAS TUESDAY NIGHT AND RACES THE MCS ACROSS THE GULF COAST STATES 
ON WEDNESDAY. THE 06Z ETA SOLUTION DEVELOPS CONVECTION HOWEVER NOT 
AS INTENSE AS THE GFS...RESULTING IN A SLOWER EASTWARD PROGRESSION. 
THIS SLOWER SOLUTION WOULD ALSO ALLOW A TRAILING NORTHERN STREAM 
SHORTWAVE TO TAP INTO SOME OF THIS MOISTURE...DRAWING THE 
PRECIPITATION FURTHER NORTHWARD. FAVORING THE ETA SOLUTION...RAIN 
WOULD RISE UP FROM THE SOUTHWEST DURING THE AFTERNOON ON WEDNESDAY 
WITH BETTER PRECIPITATION CHANCES WEDNESDAY NIGHT AS THE SHORTWAVE 
MOVES ACROSS THE REGION. ATMOSPHERE IS WAY TOO STABLE FOR 
THUNDERSTORMS WITH THIS SYSTEM. HOWEVER...ETA SOUNDINGS DO SHOW A 
POSSIBILITY OF RAIN CHANGING OVER TO A BRIEF PERIOD OF WET SNOW 
NORTH OF A LINE FROM JONESBORO TO JACKSON LATE WEDNESDAY NIGHT INTO 
EARLY THURSDAY MORNING. SOIL TEMPERATURES MAY BE TOO WARM FOR 
ANYTHING TO STICK...BUT STILL SOMETHING TO KEEP AN EYE ON. THIS 
SYSTEM SHOULD MOVE EAST OF THE REGION DURING THE DAY ON THURSDAY. 
HIGH PRESSURE SHOULD BUILD INTO THE REGION RESULTING IN MAINLY DRY 
WEATHER INTO THE WEEKEND.

.MEG...WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MS...NONE. 
MO...NONE.
TN...NONE.

&&

$$

VALLE

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
332 AM CST TUE FEB 22 2005

.DISCUSSION...
SURFACE MAP PLACES A STATIONARY FRONT FROM NORTHERN GEORGIA THROUGH 
CENTRAL ALABAMA AND MISSISSIPPI THROUGH NORTHERN LOUISIANA AND INTO

ANYTHING TO STICK...BUT STILL SOMETHING TO KEEP AN EYE ON. THIS

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 220338 AAA
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
ISSUED BY NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
935 PM CST MON FEB 21 2005

.DISCUSSION...
UPDATED FORECAST TO LOWER CHANCES OF RAIN IN NORTHERN MISSISSIPPI. 
APPEARS THAT SHOWERS/STORMS ALONG SOUTHWARD MOVING FRONT HAVE 
WEAKENED AND BECOME MORE ISOLATED. WILL KEEP ISOLATED SHOWERS IN THE 
FORECAST THROUGH THE EVENING...WITH NO PRECIPITATION EXPECTED AFTER 
MIDNIGHT.

LOWER DEWPOINTS NOTED BEHIND FRONT IN MUCH OF SOUTHEAST MISSOURI... 
NORTHEAST ARKANSAS AND WESTERN TENSSESSEE. HOWEVER...DEWPOINTS MAY 
BE SLOW TO DROP IN NORTHERN MISSISSIPPI OVERNIGHT. GIVEN THAT LOW 
LEVEL MOISTURE WILL BE PRESENT...AND WITH RAIN OCCURRING THIS 
AFTERNOON/EVENING...FEEL THAT AREAS OF LOW CLOUDS/FOG WILL FORM. 
INDICATED AS SUCH IN THE FORECAST.

OTHERWISE...NO CHANGES MADE TO GOING FORECAST.     
&&

.PREV DISCUSSION...
ISSUED 354 PM CST MON FEB 21 2005

19Z SURFACE ANALYSIS PLACES SURFACE COLD FRONT 
STRETCHING FROM KMKL TO KSGT. TEMPERATURES BEHIND THE FRONT THIS 
AFTERNOON HAVE REMAINED NEARLY STEADY IN THE UPPER 50S TO LOWER 60S 
DUE TO COLD AIR ADVECTION STRATOCUMULUS. ELSEWHERE ALONG AND AHEAD 
OF THE FRONTAL BOUNDARY TEMPERATURES HAVE RISEN INTO THE UPPER 60S 
TO LOWER 70S. SOME SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS DID REDEVELOP ALONG OLD 
OUTFLOW BOUNDARY FROM THIS MORNING/S CONVECTIVE ACTIVITY. WATER 
VAPOR IMAGERY DEPICTS AN UPPER LEVEL BLOCKING RIDGE ACROSS THE 
PACIFIC WITH AN UPPER LEVEL LOW SPINNING AT THE BASE OF THE RIDGE 
ACROSS THE COAST OF CALIFORNIA. ANOTHER COUPLE OF SHORTWAVES ARE 
PRESENT ACROSS THE EASTERN UNITED STATES AS THEY ROTATE AROUND A 
NORTHERN ONTARIO LOW. MAIN FORECAST CONCERNS THIS FORECAST PACKAGE 
ARE CONVECTIVE CHANCES TONIGHT AND AGAIN FOR WEDNESDAY.

COLD FRONT WILL CONTINUE TO PROGRESS ACROSS THE REST OF THE FORECAST 
AREA TONIGHT AND AREAS MAINLY ACROSS NORTHERN MISSISSIPPI WILL SEE 
SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS GRADUALLY COMING TO AN END OVERNIGHT. NOT 
EXPECTING ANY ORGANIZED SEVERE CONVECTION OVERNIGHT WITH CELLS 
MAINLY REMAINING BELOW SEVERE THRESHOLDS. HIGH PRESSURE WILL BUILD 
BACK IN ON TUESDAY. BY WEDNESDAY AND WEDNESDAY NIGHT A BLOCKING 
RIDGE WILL TRANSLATE EAST INTO THE WESTERN UNITED STATES AND ANOTHER 
SHORTWAVE WILL AFFECT THE MID SOUTH WITH A WEAK SOUTHERN STREAM 
TROUGH. ADDED POPS FOR WEDNESDAY NIGHT AS 700-500 MB LAYER MID LEVEL 
LAPSE RATES STEEPEN TO AROUND 7 C/KM WITH APPROACH OF TROUGH. 
ISENTROPIC SURFACES ALSO INDICATE LIFT IS SUFFICIENT TO PRODUCE SOME 
RAINFALL ACROSS THE AREA. WILL NOT MENTION THUNDER AT THIS TIME AS 
BOUNDARY LAYER WILL REMAIN STABLE. HIGH PRESSURE WILL BUILD BACK IN 
ON THURSDAY. 

FRIDAY THROUGH TUESDAY...LATEST 00Z MODEL RUNS SHOW A QUICKER 
PROGRESSION OF TROUGH ACROSS THE EASTERN U.S. ADDED A SLIGHT CHANCE 
OF RAIN FOR SUNDAY AND MONDAY...THOUGH STILL SOME UNCERTAINTY WITH 
RUN TO RUN CONSISTENCY.
&&

.MEG...WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MS...NONE. 
MO...NONE.
TN...NONE.
&&

$$

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 211659
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
1059 AM CST MON FEB 21 2005

.DISCUSSION...16Z SURFACE ANALYSIS PLACES FRONTAL BOUNDARY 
STRETCHING FROM SOUTH OF PARIS TN...NORTH OF JACKSON TN...AND NORTH 
OF LITTLE ROCK. MAIN FORECAST CONCERN FOR THIS AFTERNOON IS 
CONVECTIVE POTENTIAL ACROSS THE MID SOUTH. LATEST RUC AND NAM 
/MESO-ETA/ GUIDANCE SUGGESTS COLD FRONT WILL CONTINUE TO GRADUALLY 
SAG SOUTH AND BE OVER MIDDLE TENNESSEE AND NORTHERN MISSISSIPPI BY 
00Z TONIGHT. SURFACE DEWPOINTS AHEAD OF THE BOUNDARY ARE STILL IN 
THE UPPER 50S TO LOWER 60S. MODEL SOUNDINGS SUGGEST THUNDERSTORMS 
ARE STILL POSSIBLE SOUTH OF THE BOUNDARY UNTIL THE FRONT PASSES 
THROUGH THE REST OF THE FORECAST AREA...BUT LOWERED POPS AS WEAK 
CAPPING INVERSION WILL MAY KEEP CONVECTIVE ACTIVITY TO A MINIMUM. 
ALSO ADJUSTED WINDS AND TEMPERATURES FOR THIS AFTERNOON BASED UPON 
CURRENT TRENDS.

UPDATED GRIDS ALREADY SENT.


.MEG...WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MS...NONE. 
MO...NONE.
TN...NONE.

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 211313
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
714 AM CST MON FEB 21 2005

.DISCUSSION...
STRONG LINE OF THUNDERSTORMS BISECTING THE FORECAST AREA THIS 
MORNING. THE STRONGEST STORMS WERE LOCATED OVER HAYWOOD...TIPTON AND 
SHELBY COUNTIES. LINE OF STORMS MOVING EAST AT ABOUT 50 MPH.

THE SEVERE WEATHER THREAT FOR NORTHEAST AR AND MO BOOTHEEL HAVE 
DECREASED RAPIDLY AS THE LINE HAS MOVED TO THE EAST. WEST OF THE 
LINE OF SHOWERS...THE THREAT FOR SEVERE WEATHER WILL DECREASE 
QUICKLY. 

THE FRONTAL BOUNDARY IS STILL PROGGED TO MOVE SOUTHWARD THROUGH THE 
DAY. THIS MAY PROVIDE A FOCUS ADDITIONAL SHOWERS AND STORMS TO 
DEVELOP LATER. SHOULD THIS OCCUR...VERY HEAVY RAIN IS POSSIBLE. WILL 
LET LATER SHIFTS EVALUATE THE PROGRESSION OF THE FRONT AND EVOLUTION 
OF POSSIBLE SHOWERS.  


.MEG...WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MS...NONE. 
MO...NONE.
TN...NONE.



000 
FXUS64 KMEG 210942
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
342 AM CST MON FEB 21 2005

.DISCUSSION...
STRONG SHORTWAVE TRANSLATING ACROSS NORTHWEST ARKANSAS EARLY THIS 
MORNING. SEVERE CONVECTION OCCURRING WITH THIS SYSTEM AS IT HEADS 
TOWARD THE MID SOUTH. THE SEVERE THUNDERSTORMS THAT MOVED ACROSS 
NORTHEAST ARKANSAS EARLIER TONIGHT HAS MADE ITS WAY TO NEAR THE TN 
RIVER. 

EXPECT THUNDERSTORMS TO MOVE INTO THE AREA BEFORE NOON. ONCE THE 
SHORTWAVE PASSES TO THE EAST...THE COLD FRONT WILL OOZE INTO THE 
NORTHERN HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA BY EARLY EVENING. THE FRONT WILL 
STALL ACROSS THE NORTHERN HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA OVERNIGHT. THIS 
WILL SERVE AS A FOCUS MECHANISM FOR SOME POSSIBLE SHOWERS AND 
THUNDERSTORMS. 

WEDNESDAY THE FRONT WILL DRIFT FARTHER SOUTH AS SURFACE HIGH 
PRESSURE BUILDS INTO THE AREA. THE MID SOUTH WILL DRY OUT AFTER 
WEDNESDAY. 

.MEG...WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WATCH IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM       
     ARZ008-009-017-018-026>028-035-036-048-049.
MS...SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WATCH IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM MSZ001>009-014. 
MO...SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WATCH IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM. MOZ113-115. 
TN...SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WATCH IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM. 
     TNZ001>004-019>021-048>055-088>092

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 210331
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
930 PM CST SUN FEB 20 2005

.DISCUSSION...

LATEST RADAR IMAGES SHOW A LINE OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS 
STRETCHING FROM SOUTHERN MISSOURI INTO NORTHWESTERN ARKANSAS. THIS 
LINE IS ASSOCIATED WITH A SHORTWAVE THAT WILL BEGIN TO MOVE INTO THE 
CWA OVERNIGHT. WILL KEEP A WATCH ON THE LINE AS IT PUSHES SOUTHEAST. 
A FEW WARNINGS HAVE BEEN ISSUED FOR HAIL. IN ADDITION...A SHOWERS 
AND THUNDERSTORMS REMAIN OVER PORTIONS OF NORTHEAST MISSISSIPPI. 
TEMPERATURES HAVE ACTUALLY WARMED A FEW DEGREES DURING THE EVENING 
BUT EXPECT AS RAIN PUSHES INTO THE AREA...TEMPS WILL DROP INTO THE 
MID TO UPPER 50S. CURRENT FORECAST LOOKS GOOD. NO UPDATES ARE 
EXPECTED

.MEG...WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MS...NONE.
MO...NONE.
TN...NONE.

FXUS64 KMEG 202048
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
248 PM CST SUN FEB 20 2005

.DISCUSSION...
A LARGE AREA OF LIGHT TO MODERATE RAIN CONTINUES TO MOVE THROUGH THE
EASTERN PART OF THE FORECAST AREA THIS AFTERNOON. COLD FRONT
EXTENDING FROM NORTHEAST MISSOURI INTO SOUTHERN KANSAS WILL CONTINUE
TO PUSH SOUTHEAST TONIGHT AND MONDAY. EXPECT THE NEXT ROUND OF
SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS TO DEVELOP LATER THIS EVENING. SPC HAS
KEPT MOST OF THE FORECAST AREA IN A SLIGHT RISK FOR TONIGHT WITH
LARGE HAIL BEING THE MAIN THREAT. COLD FRONT SHOULD BE THROUGH MOST
OF THE FORECAST AREA BY MONDAY NIGHT SO HAVE LOWERED POPS FOR MONDAY
NIGHT DOWN TO SLIGHT CHANCE. FRONT WILL BE SOMEWHAT CLOSE TO REGION
FOR TUESDAY THROUGH EARLY WEDNESDAY SO KEPT LOW POPS IN FOR THOSE
PERIODS. ANOTHER COLD WILL PUSH THROUGH THE REGION SATURDAY AND IT
APPEARS THAT THERE WILL BE ANOTHER PUSH OF ARCTIC AIR BEHIND THIS
FRONT FOR THE BEGINNING OF NEXT WEEK.


.MEG...WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...

FXUS64 KMEG 200916
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
316 AM CST SUN FEB 20 2005

.DISCUSSION...
MAIN STORY TODAY WILL BE THE SEVERE WEATHER THREAT LATER TODAY INTO 
TONIGHT. THE STRONG SURFACE LOW OVER CENTRAL KANSAS HAS TIGHTENED 
THE PRESSURE GRADIENT OVER THE MID SOUTH. THIS HAS CAUSED 
SOUTHEASTERLY WINDS AT THE SURFACE. MOISTURE ADVECTION TAKING PLACE 
JUST ABOVE THE SURFACE WITH 40-50KT SOUTHWESTERLY LOW LEVEL JET. DEW 
POINTS WILL BEGIN TO RISE THROUGHOUT THE DAY TODAY PROVIDING PLENTY 
OF FUEL FOR STORMS THAT FORM. GOOD SHEAR THROUGH THE PROFILE... 
ABUNDANT CAPE...STEEP LAPSE RATES AND AN APPROACHING COLD FRONT 
COULD CAUSE SEVERE WEATHER OVER PARTS OF THE FORECAST AREA. ANOTHER 
CHALLENGE IS FORECASTING THE AMOUNT OF CLOUD COVER TODAY... 
ESPECIALLY OVER THE WESTERN HALF OF THE MID SOUTH. CURRENTLY CLOUD 
COVER IS QUITE EXTENSIVE ACROSS THE SOUTHEAST AND MIDWEST U.S. IF 
CLOUDS BREAK EARLY ENOUGH...SUNSHINE MAY PLAY A ROLE IN THE 
DESTABILIZATION MAKING THUNDERSTORMS A GREATER POSSIBILITY. SEE 
SWODY1 FOR MORE DETAILS ON THIS.

THE FRONT WILL MOVE INTO THE AREA EARLY MONDAY MORNING AND STALL OUT 
OVER NORTH MS. LOW LEVEL MOISTURE WILL POOL ALONG AND AHEAD OF THE 
FRONT ALLOWING FOR INSTABILITY AND CHANCES FOR THUNDERSTORMS. A 
SHORTWAVE WILL TRANSLATE ACROSS THE GREAT LAKES TUESDAY EVENING 
FORCING THE COLD FRONT SOUTH OF THE FORECAST AREA BY WEDNESDAY.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
250 PM CST SAT FEB 19 2005

.DISCUSSION...
SOME SCATTERED LIGHT RAIN SHOWERS ARE MOVING OVER MAINLY THE
SOUTHERN HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA. SURFACE LOW HAS DEVELOPED OVER
EXTREME SOUTHEAST COLORADO THIS AFTERNOON AND IS EXPECTED TO MOVE
NORTHEAST OVER THE NEXT COUPLE OF DAYS. IN ADDITION...UPPER LEVEL
SHORT WAVE WILL MOVE THROUGH REGION TONIGHT AND SUNDAY BRINGING A
BETTER CHANCE OF SHOWERS TONIGHT AND SUNDAY. COLD FRONT WILL MOVE
CLOSER TO THE REGION BY SUNDAY NIGHT. TEMPERATURES WILL NOT COOL MUCH
TONIGHT AND WARM UP SOME ON SUNDAY AS WINDS SHIFT TO THE SOUTH. WITH
TEMPERATURES IN THE 60S AND THE FRONT APPROACHING THE REGION...DO
EXPECT TO SEE SOME THUNDERSTORMS DURING THE DAY SUNDAY AND MORE ON
SUNDAY NIGHT. SPC HAS NORTHERN HALF OF FORECAST AREA IN THE DAY 2
SLIGHT RISK AREA. LOT OF VARIABLES WILL COME INTO PLAY REGARDING
SEVERE THREAT INCLUDING THE FACT THAT THE CONVECTION WILL BE
ELEVATED. WILL NOT MENTION THREAT IN THE ZONES BUT WILL HAVE SOME
MENTION OF POTENTIAL FOR SEVERE WEATHER IN HWO. FRONT WILL HANG
AROUND SOME ON MONDAY AND EARLY TUESDAY BEFORE FINALLY EXITING THE
REGION SO WILL KEEP POPS FROM MONDAY THROUGH EARLY WEDNESDAY. HIGH
PRESSURE WILL EVENTUALLY SETTLE IN SO THAT THE END OF THE WEEK
SHOULD BE DRY.

FXUS64 KMEG 190923
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
323 AM CST SAT FEB 19 2005

.DISCUSSION...
AREA NWS RADARS INDICATE VERY WEAK ECHOES OVER MOST OF ARKANSAS WITH 
LIGHT RAIN BEING REPORTED NEAR PINE BLUFF. THE LIGHT RAIN HAS SHOWN 
SIGNS OF RAPIDLY WEAKENING OVER CENTRAL ARKANSAS THIS MORNING. LOW 
LEVELS ACROSS THE MID SOUTH ARE RATHER DRY WITH DEW POINTS RANGING 
FROM THE MID 20S TO MID 30S. SOME LIGHT RAIN AND A FEW SPRINKLES 
WILL BE POSSIBLE TODAY ESPECIALLY ACROSS WESTERN AREAS. WARM 
ADVECTION WILL TAKE PLACE TODAY AND SHOULD OFFSET THE LACK OF 
SUNSHINE TO MAKE DAYTIME TEMPERATURES SIMILAR TO YESTERDAY. 

WILL BE WATCHING A SHORTWAVE IN THE SUBTROPICAL STREAM DRIFTING 
ACROSS EAST TEXAS TODAY. THIS WAVE WILL BISECT THE MID SOUTH BRINING 
A GOOD CHANCE FOR RAIN SHOWERS OVERNIGHT. ANOTHER WAVE IS STILL 
PROGGED TO FOLLOW IN THE FOOTSTEPS FOR SUNDAY. LOW LEVEL MOISTURE 
RETURN WILL PERSIST MAKING THE ATMOSPHERE JUICY FOR THIS TIME OF 
YEAR. OVERNIGHT LOWS WILL BE MILD SUNDAY AND MONDAY WITH 
TEMPERATURES IN THE MID 40S TO LOW 50S.

WITH THE APPROACHING COLD FRONT THERE MAY BE ENOUGH INSTABILITY AND 
LIFT TO PRODUCE SOME SCATTERED THUNDERSTORMS. HOWEVER...CURRENT 
MODEL DATA SUGGESTS WEAK LIFT - WHICH IS NOT FAVORABLE FOR 
THUNDERSTORM DEVELOPMENT. WILL HAVE TO WATCH THIS. CURRENT SWODY2 
ALSO AGREES WITH THE POSSIBILITY OF THUNDERSTORMS SUNDAY. WILL 
CONTINUE TO MENTION IN THE FORECAST.

THERE WILL BE A COUPLE MORE DISTURBANCES MOVING IN THE SOUTHWEST 
FLOW WHICH WILL BRING CHANCES FOR RAIN EARLY IN THE WEEK. THE LATEST 
GFS ADVERTISES THE FRONT PASSING SOUTH OF THE FORECAST AREA AND INTO 
CENTRAL MS TUESDAY NIGHT. THIS WILL PROVIDE LOWER RAIN CHANCES WED 
THROUGH THE REMAINDER OF THE WEEK.

.MEG...WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...

SATELLITE IMAGES SHOW CIRRUS CLOUDS MOVING ACROSS THE MIDSOUTH THIS

OVERNIGHT DO NOT EXPECT TEMPERATURES TO DROP AS MUCH AS PREVIOUSLY 
THOUGHT...WILL BUMP UP LOWS A CATEGORY ACROSS NORTHWESTERN ZONES. 
WILL ALSO REMOVE EVENING PARTLY CLOUDY WORDING. UPDATE WILL BE OUT 
SHORTLY.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
241 PM CST FRI FEB 18 2005

.DISCUSSION...
SKIES REMAIN MOSTLY SUNNY THIS AFTERNOON ACROSS THE REGION WITH THE
NEAREST CLOUD COVER SLOWLY PUSHING EAST ACROSS OKLAHOMA AND EAST
TEXAS. SURFACE HIGH CENTERED OVER NORTHEAST LOUISIANA THIS AFTERNOON
WILL SLIDE TO THE EAST TONIGHT. THIS WILL ALLOW WINDS TO SHIFT TO
THE SOUTH AND HELP BRING MOISTURE BACK INTO THE REGION. SOUTHWEST
FLOW ALOFT WILL BRING SEVERAL SHORTWAVES THROUGH DURING THE NEXT FEW
DAYS. THE FIRST ONE WILL MOVE THROUGH SATURDAY NIGHT AND WILL BE
ACCOMPANIED BY SOME SHOWERS. THE RAIN MAY START SATURDAY AFTERNOON
BUT IS MORE LIKELY BY SATURDAY NIGHT AND SUNDAY. A COLD FRONT WILL
MOVE INTO THE REGION SUNDAY NIGHT BRINGING MORE RAIN FOR SUNDAY
NIGHT AND MONDAY. THERE MAY BE SOME THUNDERSTORMS SUNDAY NIGHT AS
WELL AS TEMPERATURES SUNDAY AFTERNOON WILL BE IN THE 60S AND THERE
WILL BE SOME INSTABILITY AROUND. AT THIS POINT...NOT EXPECTING ANY
SEVERE STORMS BUT THEY CANT BE COMPLETELY RULED OUT EITHER. FRONTAL
BOUNDARY WILL HANG AROUND THE REGION FOR TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY SO
THERE WILL STILL BE A THREAT OF RAIN FOR THOSE DAYS. FRONT WILL
FINALLY MOVE SOUTH OF THE REGION FOR THURSDAY AND FRIDAY SO BOTH
THOSE DAYS SHOULD BE DRY.

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 180926
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
325 AM CST FRI FEB 18 2005

.DISCUSSION...
NO MAJOR SURPRISES EXPECTED WITH THIS FORECAST PACKAGE. CURRENT 
GOING FORECAST HANDLES UPCOMING WEATHER VERY WELL. ONLY MINOR TWEAKS 
MADE.

TROPICAL MOISTURE CAUGHT IN THE SUBTROPICAL JET WAS STREAMING OVER 
SOUTHERN BAJA INTO TEXAS AND ACROSS PARTS OF THE MID SOUTH. AN UPPER 
LOW SPINNING OFF THE COAST OF CALIFORNIA WILL DRIFT NORTHWARD AND BE 
ABSORBED BY ANOTHER STORM SYSTEM MOVING OUT OF THE GULF OF ALASKA 
THROUGH SATURDAY. MEANWHILE...NORTHWEST FLOW OVER THE SOUTHEAST U.S. 
WILL BRING ANOTHER PLEASANT DAY TO MANY LOCATIONS INCLUDING THE 
MISSISSIPPI VALLEY. 

THE NORTHWEST FLOW WILL GRADUALLY BECOME MORE ZONAL AS THE UPPER 
LEVELS TRANSITION WITH THE APPROACH OF THE NEXT WEATHER MAKER. 
ADDITIONAL MOISTURE AND LIFT WILL BRING INCREASING CHANCES FOR RAIN 
FRIDAY NIGHT AND INTO SATURDAY FOR MOST LOCATIONS ACROSS THE 
FORECAST AREA. THIS WILL BE THE FIRST IN A SERIES OF WAVES THAT WILL 
AFFECT THE MID SOUTH.

A STRONG AREA OF SURFACE LOW PRESSURE IS FORECAST TO FORM ACROSS THE 
NORTHERN PLAINS SATURDAY NIGHT. THE RESULTING SURFACE PRESSURE 
GRADIENT WILL CAUSE WINDS TO INCREASE FROM THE SOUTHWEST AND ADVECT 
IN MUCH HIGHER DEW POINTS THROUGH SUNDAY AFTERNOON. SHOWERS AND 
THUNDERSTORMS WILL BE POSSIBLE SUNDAY AND SUNDAY NIGHT. WILL HAVE TO 
KEEP OUR EYES ON THIS OVER THE NEXT COUPLE OF DAYS.

THE WET PATTERN WILL PERSIST THROUGH AT LEAST TUESDAY WITH HIGHER 
RAIN CHANCES DIMINISHING BY MONDAY EVENING. THE MAIN FACTOR ON HOW 
LONG THE RAIN LINGERS WILL BE BASED ON THE POSITION OF THE FRONTAL 
BOUNDARY. SHOULD THE BOUNDARY POSITION ITSELF DIRECTLY OVER THE MID 
SOUTH...MORE WAVES OF RAIN WILL BE POSSIBLE THROUGH THE REMAINDER OF 
THE WEEK.

.MEG...WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MS...NONE.
MO...NONE.
TN...NONE.

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 170928
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
328 AM CST THU FEB 17 2005

.DISCUSSION...SURFACE ANALYSIS THIS MORNING CENTERS HIGH PRESSURE 
ACROSS KANSAS AND OKLAHOMA. INFRARED SATELLITE STILL SHOWING CIRRUS 
AND ALTOSTRATUS AFFECTING THE MID SOUTH THROUGH THIS MORNING. 
TEMPERATURES THIS MORNING RANGED FROM THE UPPER 30S NORTH TO MIDDLE 
40S SOUTH. MAIN FORECAST CONCERNS THIS FORECAST PACKAGE WILL BE 
CLOUDS AND TEMPERATURES IN THE SHORT TERM AND PRECIPITATION CHANGES 
FOR FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY NIGHT.

TODAY...BACK EDGE OF MID/HIGH LEVEL CLOUDS WILL GRADUALLY MOVE SOUTH 
TODAY AS HIGH PRESSURE CENTER BEGINS TO MOVE TOWARD THE LOWER 
MISSISSIPPI VALLEY. HIGHS TODAY WILL NOT BE MUCH DIFFERENT THAN 
YESTERDAY WITH HIGHS MOSTLY IN THE LOWER 50S.  

TONIGHT...HIGH PRESSURE WILL BE OVERHEAD ACROSS THE MID SOUTH. 
TEMPERATURES WILL DROP INTO THE LOWER 30S AS SKIES BECOME MOSTLY 
CLEAR WITH 1000-500 MB LAYER RH/S DROPPING DOWN TO AROUND 25 PERCENT 
AND DECOUPLING WINDS ASSISTING IN RADIATIVE COOLING.  

FRIDAY...HIGH PRESSURE WILL BE ACROSS THE SOUTHEAST UNITED STATES 
ALLOWING RETURN FLOW TO SET UP ON THE BACK SIDE OF THE HIGH. CLOUDS 
WILL GRADUALLY INCREASE DURING THE DAY AND WENT WITH PARTLY CLOUDY 
SKIES. I ALSO RAISED HIGHS FOR FRIDAY A COUPLE OF DEGREES AS LATEST 
MODEL RUN A BIT WARMER THAN PREVIOUS RUNS. 

FRIDAY NIGHT...BOTH NAM/GFS MOSTLY IN AGREEMENT WITH APPROACH OF 
GULF MOISTURE INTO THE MID SOUTH AS WARM FRONT BEGINS TO MOVE NORTH 
ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA. GFS IS A BIT SLOWER WITH ONSET OF RAINFALL 
BUT ETA/GFS 300K SURFACE SHOWS DECENT ISENTROPIC ASCENT BY 12Z AND 
20 POPS STILL LOOK GOOD FOR LATE FRIDAY NIGHT. 
 
SATURDAY...WARM FRONT WILL MOVE ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA SATURDAY 
AND SATURDAY NIGHT. MODEST ISENTROPIC ASCENT WILL BE PRESENT...AND 
700-500 MB LAYER MID LEVEL LAPSE RATES WILL BE WEAK /BELOW 6 C/KM/. 
SO...WILL NOT PLAN ANY CHANGES TO CURRENT POPS WITH GRIDS HANDLING 
CURRENT TRENDS WELL. THUNDER CHANCES LOOK MINIMAL IF NON-EXISTENT 
WITH SHOWALTER AND LIFTED INDICIES REMAINING WELL ABOVE ZERO. 

SUNDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY...A TRAILING COLD FRONT WILL BEGIN TO MOVE 
THROUGH THE FORECAST AREA SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY NIGHT. HAD TO 
INCREASE POPS FOR MONDAY AND MONDAY NIGHT AS PAST COUPLE OF MODEL RUNS 
SHOWING FRONT MOVING SLOWLY ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA WITH UPPER 
LEVEL FLOW BEING FROM THE SOUTHWEST. AS A RESULT...WILL CARRY 
SCATTERED POPS ACROSS THE NORTH AND LIKELY POPS FAR SOUTHEAST WITH 
POPS LOWERING ACROSS THE AREA BY MONDAY NIGHT. HIGH PRESSURE WILL 
BEGIN TO BUILD IN ACROSS THE MID SOUTH LATE MONDAY...BRINGING 
PRECIPITATION FREE WEATHER AT LEAST THROUGH MID WEEK. NOT MUCH 
CHANGE IN TEMPERATURES EXPECTED WITH TEMPERATURES REMAINING MOSTLY 
NEAR MONTHLY CLIMATOLOGICAL NORMALS.  

&&

.MEG...WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MS...NONE.
MO...NONE.
TN...NONE.

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 162110
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
340 PM CST WED FEB 16 2005

.DISCUSSION...

LARGE AREA OF HIGH PRESSURE FROM ALBERTA TO THE LA GULF COAST IS
POURING COLDER AIR INTO THE MIDSOUTH. TEMPERATURES WILL DIP TO
FREEZING OR BELOW IN THE ROUGHLY THE NORTHERN HALF OF THE COUNTY
WARNING AREA AND THE MID 30S FARTHER SOUTH. LOTS OF CLOUDS ARE
STREAMING IN FROM THE WEST ATTM...BUT THEY ARE EXPECTED TO THIN
OUT LATER TONIGHT.

A PORTION OF THE HIGH WILL BUBBLE SOUTH OVER THE AREA THU.
NORTHERLY WINDS WILL PERSIST THROUGH THE DAY TOMORROW. THIS WILL
PROVIDE COOL HIGHS IN THE UPPER 40S TO MID 50S...BUT LIGHTER
WINDS WILL MAKE IT LESS CHILLY.

THURSDAY NIGHT...THE HIGH EDGES SLIGHTLY FARTHER EAST DUE TO
ZONAL FLOW ALOFT. BUT...COLD AIR WILL REMAIN IN PLACE AND LET
FREEZING TEMPS OCCUR AGAIN. WEATHER PATTERN WILL NOT CHANGE MUCH
FRIDAY. UPPER 40S TO MID 50S WILL BE FEATURED AGAIN.

FRIDAY NIGHT THICKER CLDS WILL INVADE SOUTHWESTERN PARTS OF THE
AREA. COLDEST PLACES WILL BE AROUND PARIS WHILE CLARKSDALE
RESIDENTS NOTICE LOWS IN THE UPPER 30S. LIGHT RAIN COULD DEVELOP
IN WESTERN COUNTIES LATE IN THE NIGHT.

A MORE WIDESPREAD RAIN IS PROJECTED TO COME IN SATURDAY NIGHT AND
LAST INTO MONDAY.

WER

FXUS64 KMEG 160944
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
345 AM CST WED FEB 16 2005

.DISCUSSION...LATEST SURFACE ANALYSIS PLACES COLD FRONT FROM THE 
OHIO VALLEY BACK THROUGH NASHVILLE AND NORTHERN MISSISSIPPI. REGIONAL 88D 
RADARS SHOWING ONLY PRECIPITATION ASSOCIATED WITH COLD FRONT ACROSS 
THE OHIO VALLEY WHERE BEST FORCING HAS PERSISTED AND ACROSS AREAS 
SOUTHEAST OF NASHVILLE WITHIN THE PAST 45 MINUTES. MAIN FORECAST 
CONCERNS WILL BE CLOUDS AND TEMPERATURES IN THE SHORT TERM AND THEN 
RAIN CHANCES FOR THE WEEKEND.

TODAY...COLD FRONT WILL CONTINUE TO PROGRESS EAST OF THE FORECAST 
AREA TODAY. NOT EXPECTING MUCH SUNSHINE TODAY AS MID LEVEL MOISTURE 
WILL HANG AROUND THE MID SOUTH UNTIL THURSDAY WITH 1000-500 MB RH/S 
AROUND OR ABOVE 60 PERCENT. TEMPERATURES WILL BE AROUND 20-25 
DEGREES COOLER THAN YESTERDAY AND BACK NEAR CLIMATOLOGICAL NORMALS 
AS COLD AIR ADVECTION GRADUALLY BRINGS 2C 850MB DOWN TO THE AREA BY 
LATE AFTERNOON. GUSTY WINDS ASSOCIATED WITH FRONTAL PASSAGE THIS 
MORNING WILL BEGIN TO DIMINISH TODAY AS PRESSURE GRADIENT RELAXES. 

TONIGHT...SKIES WILL GRADUALLY BECOME PARTLY CLOUDY ESPECIALLY AFTER 
MIDNIGHT AS HIGH PRESSURE RIDGE SETTLES ACROSS THE MID SOUTH. 
TEMPERATURES WILL FALL TO AROUND 30 ACROSS THE MO/KY BORDER AND INTO 
THE LOWER/MIDDLE 30S SOUTH. 

THURSDAY AND THURSDAY NIGHT...PLEASANT DAY EXPECTED ACROSS THE MID 
SOUTH WITH MOSTLY SUNNY/PARTLY CLOUDY SKIES EXPECTED. TEMPERATURES 
THURSDAY AND THURSDAY NIGHT WILL BE ONLY A COUPLE OF DEGREES WARMER 
THAN TODAY. 

FRIDAY THROUGH TUESDAY...HIGH PRESSURE WILL MOVE ACROSS THE SOUTHEAST 
UNITED STATES AS LOW OVER THE ROCKIES BEGINS TO MOVE TOWARDS THE 
MISSISSIPPI VALLEY. RETURN FLOW FROM THE GULF OF MEXICO WILL BRING 
WARMER DEWPOINT AIR BACK ACROSS THE MID SOUTH BY THE END OF THE 
WEEKEND. MADE SOME MINOR ADJUSTMENTS TO TEMPERATURES FOR THIS PERIOD 
TO ACCOUNT FOR THIS TREND. MODELS ARE ALSO TRENDING SLOWER WITH THE 
ONSET OF PRECIPITATION AND HELD OFF BEST CHANCES FOR RAIN UNTIL 
SATURDAY AFTERNOON WHEN BETTER ISENTROPIC ASCENT WILL BEGIN. 

CJC
&&

.MEG...WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MS...NONE.
MO...NONE.
TN...NONE.
&&

$$

WAGNER

NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
345 AM CST WED FEB 16 2005

.DISCUSSION...LATEST SURFACE ANALYSIS PLACES COLD FRONT FROM THE 
OHIO VALLEY BACK THROUGH NASHVILLE AND NORTHERN MISSISSIPPI. REGIONAL 88D 
RADARS SHOWING ONLY PRECIPITATION ASSOCIATED WITH COLD FRONT ACROSS 
THE OHIO VALLEY WHERE BEST FORCING HAS PERSISTED AND ACROSS AREAS 
SOUTHEAST OF NASHVILLE WITHIN THE PAST 45 MINUTES. MAIN FORECAST 
CONCERNS WILL BE CLOUDS AND TEMPERATURES IN THE SHORT TERM AND THEN 
RAIN CHANCES FOR THE WEEKEND.

TODAY...COLD FRONT WILL CONTINUE TO PROGRESS EAST OF THE FORECAST 
AREA TODAY. NOT EXPECTING MUCH SUNSHINE TODAY AS MID LEVEL MOISTURE 
WILL HANG AROUND THE MID SOUTH UNTIL THURSDAY WITH 1000-500 MB RH/S 
AROUND OR ABOVE 60 PERCENT. TEMPERATURES WILL BE AROUND 20-25 
DEGREES COOLER THAN YESTERDAY AND BACK NEAR CLIMATOLOGICAL NORMALS 
AS COLD AIR ADVECTION GRADUALLY BRINGS 2C 850MB DOWN TO THE AREA BY

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
245 PM CST TUE FEB 15 2005

.DISCUSSION...
CURRENT TRENDS NOW SHOWING A FRONT FROM SC OK TO NW AR AND ON TO
ST. LOUIS. CLDS/PCPN NOW ASSOCIATED WITH THIS FRONT ARE IN IA AND
N IL. MIDSOUTH IS SUNNY IN MOST AREAS EXCEPT AROUND TUP WHERE IT
IS MOSTLY CLOUDY.

THE FRONT WILL DROP SOUTHEAST THROUGH THE CWA TONIGHT AND STIR UP
A CHANCE FOR LIGHT SHOWERS LATE THIS EVENING AND MAYBE A
THUNDERSTORM AFTER MIDNIGHT IN NORTHERN COUNTIES. IT WILL STAY
WARM THIS EVENING UNTIL FROPA AFTER WHICH IT WILL QUICKLY GET
MUCH COLDER. THE CANADIAN HIGH BUILDING INTO THE REGION WILL KEEP
IT COOL WEDNESDAY. THEN...TEMPERATURES WILL DIP BELOW FREEZING IN
ALL COUNTIES EXCEPT AROUND CLARKSDALE WHERE IT WILL BE NEAR
FREEZING WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY NIGHT.

THE NEXT BATCH OF RAIN WILL DEVELOP SAT NIGHT FROM THE SOUTHWEST.
AMTS FROM THE WEEKEND RAIN WILL BE SIGNIFICANT...LIKE OVER A HALF
INCH.

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 151102
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
334 AM CST TUE FEB 15 2005

.DISCUSSION...LATEST SURFACE ANALYSIS THIS MORNING PLACES A RIDGE OF 
HIGH PRESSURE ACROSS THE SOUTHEAST UNITED STATES AND THE NEXT COLD 
FRONT OVER THE PLAINS WHICH WILL AFFECT THE FORECAST AREA BY 
TONIGHT. MAIN CONCERN THIS FORECAST PACKAGE WILL BE PRECIPITATION 
CHANCES TONIGHT.

TODAY...PLEASANT WEATHER EXPECTED ACROSS THE MID SOUTH TODAY. 
INFRARED SATELLITE IMAGERY SHOWING MID/HIGH LEVEL CLOUDS MOVING 
ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA THIS MORNING AND EXPECT TO SEE CIRRUS 
DURING THE DAY TODAY AS NEXT SYSTEM DRAWS CLOSER TO THE AREA.
850 MB TEMPERATURES AROUND +12C WILL PRODUCE HIGHS IN THE LOWER 70S 
ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA...WHICH MAY TIE OR BREAK RECORD HIGH WARMTH 
FOR JACKSON /MKL/ FOR THIS DATE. WINDS COULD BE A BIT GUSTY THIS 
AFTERNOON AS 30KT LOW LEVEL WINDS MIX DOWN TOWARDS THE SURFACE...BUT 
EXPECTING WINDS TO STAY BELOW ADVISORY CRITERIA.

TONIGHT...COLD FRONT LOCATED IN THE PLAINS WILL MOVE THROUGH THE 
FORECAST AREA TONIGHT. 850 MB LOW LEVEL JET WILL TRANSPORT LOWER 50 
DEWPOINT AIR TOWARD THE MID SOUTH FROM THE GULF OF MEXICO. 700-500 MB 
LAYER LAPSE RATES AROUND 6.5 C/KM...AND 700 MB DEWPOINT DEPRESSIONS 
GREATER THAN 5C AND MODEL SOUNDINGS SHOWING ROUGHLY 400-500J/KG OF 
CAPE SUGGEST POTENTIAL FOR CONVECTION IS POSSIBLE. ANY THUNDERSTORM 
ACTIVITY WILL REMAIN ELEVATED AND SHOULD STAY BELOW SEVERE LIMITS AS 
BEST FORCING WITH THE FRONT WILL REMAIN FURTHER NORTH ACROSS THE 
MIDDLE MISSISSIPPI AND THE OHIO VALLEYS. AS A RESULT...MADE SOME 
MODIFICATIONS TO POPS ACROSS THE AREA WITH THE BEST CHANCES OF RAIN 
MAINLY ACROSS THE NORTHERN THIRD OF THE FORECAST AREA.

WEDNESDAY...HIGH PRESSURE WILL BUILD IN BEHIND THE COLD FRONT ON 
WEDNESDAY. EXPECTING PARTLY SUNNY TO MOSTLY CLOUDY SKIES DURING THE 
DAY AS MID/UPPER LEVEL MOISTURE HANGS AROUND THE FORECAST AREA. 
HIGHS WILL DROP BACK TO CLIMATOLOGICAL NORMALS. /LOWER TO MIDDLE 50S/
LOWS WEDNESDAY NIGHT WILL DROP DOWN INTO THE UPPER 20S NORTH TO THE 
LOWER 30S SOUTH. 

NO CHANGES MADE BEYOND THURSDAY.

RECORD HIGH STATISTICS FOR TODAY
                NORMAL  RECORD YEAR
MEMPHIS         54      77      1976
JACKSON         53      74      1990/1954
JONESBORO       51      78      1921
TUPELO          56      76      1959

CJC



000 
FXUS64 KMEG 140917
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
316 AM CST MON FEB 14 2005

.DISCUSSION...
AN UPPER LEVEL TROUGH AND ASSOCIATED COLD FRONT ARE APPROACHING THE
MS RIVER THIS MORNING. SHOWERS AND SCATTERED THUNDERSTORMS ARE
LOCATED WELL AHEAD OF THE FRONT FROM THE EASTERN PART OF WEST TN
INTO NORTHEAST MS. CLEARING SKIES HAVE ALREADY SPREAD INTO EASTERN
AR.

THE NEXT COUPLE OF DAYS LOOK VERY NICE WEATHERWISE...ESPECIALLY FOR
THE MIDDLE OF FEBRUARY. THE SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS WILL BE EAST
OF OUR AREA BY SUNRISE WITH SKIES CLEARING FROM THE WEST. LOWER
DEWPOINTS WILL SPREAD INTO THE MIDSOUTH AS WINDS TURN TO THE WEST.
THE AIR MASS FOLLOWING THE FRONT IS OF PACIFIC ORIGIN AND WE WILL
ACTUALLY SEE WARMER TEMPERATURES TODAY THAN YESTERDAY WITH MOSTLY
SUNNY SKIES THIS AFTERNOON.

IT WILL BE MOSTLY CLEAR AND COOL TONIGHT. HIGH PRESSURE WILL MOVE
TO THE EAST ALLOWING FOR A LIGHT SOUTH WIND ACROSS THE MIDSOUTH.
TUESDAY WILL BE EVEN WARMER THAN TODAY WITH HIGHS CLIMBING INTO THE
LOWER 70S. SOUTHWEST WINDS WILL PUSH 850 MB TEMPERATURES TO AROUND
12 DEGREES C.

A COLD FRONT WILL MOVE THROUGH THE MIDSOUTH FROM THE NORTH TUESDAY
NIGHT AND WEDNESDAY ACCOMPANIED BY A CHANCE OF SHOWERS. THE GFS IS
FASTER THAN THE NAM ON TIMING OF THE FRONT WHICH WILL MAKE A
DIFFERENCE ON TIMING OF THE SHOWERS...AND ESPECIALLY ON HIGHS FOR
WEDNESDAY. ATTM...WILL COMPROMISE ON TIMING. WILL HAVE A CHANCE OF
SHOWERS SPREADING INTO THE MIDSOUTH FROM THE NORTHWEST TUESDAY NIGHT.
WILL LEAVE IN A 40 PERCENT CHANCE OF SHOWERS FOR NORTH MS
WEDNESDAY...20 PERCENT ELSEWHERE FOR WEDNESDAY MORNING.

COLDER AND DRY AIR WILL PUSH INTO THE AREA WEDNESDAY NIGHT AS HIGH
PRESSURE BUILDS INTO THE AREA FROM THE NORTH. THE NEXT CHANCE FOR
RAIN WILL COME FRIDAY OR FRIDAY NIGHT AS THE HIGH MOVES EASTWARD AND
A WARM FRONT DEVELOPS TO THE SOUTHWEST.

&&

.MEG...WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MS...NONE.
MO...NONE.
TN...NONE.
&&

AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
936 PM CST SUN FEB 13 2005

.DISCUSSION...
COLD FRONT EXTENDS FROM CENTRAL MISSOURI INTO NORTHWEST ARKANSAS. 
REGIONAL RADAR IS SHOWING VERY LITTLE DEVELOPMENT OVER ARKANSAS THIS 
EVENING. WITH THE SUN DOWN AND THE ATMOSPHERE BECOMING MORE 
STABLE...DO NOT EXPECT ANY THUNDERSTORM ACTIVITY AND BASED UPON 
RADAR TRENDS EXPECT SCATTERED SHOWERS WITH THE FRONT AS IT MOVES 
THROUGH. MIN TEMPS LOOK REASONABLE. SKIES MAY BEGIN TO CLEAR WEST OF 
THE RIVER BEFORE DAWN WHICH MAY RESULT IN ANOTHER UPDATE LATER THIS 
EVENING.

VALLE





000 
FXUS64 KMEG 132207
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
407 PM CST SUN FEB 13 2005

.DISCUSSION...
A RATHER COMPLEX PATTERN EVOLVING THIS AFTERNOON AND THIS
EVENING ACROSS THE MID SOUTH...WITH A NEGATIVELY TILTED UPPER LEVEL
TROUGH APPROACHING FROM THE WEST WITH SEVERAL SHORTWAVES EMBEDDED
WITHIN THE UPPER TROUGH. ONE OF THE MORE DISTINCT SHORTWAVE
FEATURES IS MOVING ACROSS TEXAS AND HAS HELPED TO DEVELOP CONVECTION
ALONG THE UPPER TEXAS COAST THIS AFTERNOON. ANOTHER MORE SUBTLE
SHORTWAVE FEATURE IS MOVING ACROSS KANSAS THIS AFTERNOON. THIS
SHORTWAVE FEATURE IN ASSOCIATION WITH A COLD FRONT MAY ACT TO TRIGGER
CONVECTION LATER THIS EVENING ACROSS WESTERN PORTIONS OF THE FORECAST
AREA. THE BIG QUESTIONS STILL CREATING MUCH UNCERTAINTY IN THE
FORECAST ARE THE AMOUNT OF FORCING FROM THESE POSSIBLE TRIGGERING
MECHANISMS (FRONT & KANSAS SHORTWAVE) AND THE AMOUNT OF INSTABILITY
THAT WILL BE AVAILABLE FOR THUNDERSTORM DEVELOPMENT...CONSIDERING
TIMING OF SYSTEM (NIGHT-TIME).

.SHORT-TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...
A STRENGTHENING SURFACE LOW PRESSURE NOW MOVING ACROSS NORTHERN
MISSOURI WILL CONTINUE TO LIFT NORTHEAST INTO THE WESTERN GREAT
LAKES REGION OVERNIGHT. A WARM FRONT STRETCHED SOUTH FROM THIS LOW
REMAINS DRAPED ACROSS WEST TENNESSEE AND NORTHEAST MISSISSIPPI THIS
AFTERNOON. THIS FRONT SHOULD CONTINUE TO MOVE EAST TONIGHT...
PLACING MOST OF THE MID SOUTH IN A SOMEWHAT MODIFIED GULF AIRMASS...
WITH TEMPERATURES REMAINING IN THE LOW 60S AND DEWPOINTS IN THE
UPPER 50S. A COLD FRONT EXTENDS SOUTH OF THE SURFACE LOW ACROSS EAST
KANSAS...EAST OKLAHOMA...AND NORTHEAST TEXAS. THIS COLD FRONT WILL
CONTINUE TO ADVANCE EAST TONIGHT AS THE SURFACE LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM
CONTINUES TO MOVE NORTHEAST. AS THE COLD FRONT MOVES EAST ACROSS
ARKANSAS TONIGHT AND THE SUBTLE SHORTWAVE FEATURE NOW OVER KANSAS
MOVES EAST...A LINE OF SHOWERS AND ISOLATED THUNDERSTORMS SHOULD
DEVELOP AHEAD OF THE FRONT.

THE THREAT OF SEVERE WEATHER CONTINUES TO LOOK LESS LIKELY FOR THIS
EVENING AS WE LOOSE THE ASSISTANCE OF DAYTIME HEATING AND INSTABILITY
APPEARS TO REMAIN LIMITED. STRONG WIND FIELDS REMAIN IN PLACE OVER
THE AREA...WITH SUFFICIENT AMOUNTS OF DEEP LAYER SHEAR AND STRONG
LOW-LEVEL HELICITY. SHEAR PROFILES ARE MORE THAN SUFFICIENT TO
SUPPORT SEVERE STORMS. LOW CAPE VALUES WILL WORK AGAINST THE
DEVELOPMENT OF THUNDERSTORMS. IF THUNDERSTORMS CAN INITIATE...THEY
WOULD BECOME SEVERE DUE TO SHEAR VALUES. WITH POOR LEVELS OF
INSTABILITY EXPECTED THOUGH...SO NOT EXPECTING MUCH IN THE WAY OF
SEVERE WEATHER. IF A FEW ISOLATED THUNDERSTORMS DO DEVELOP THIS
EVENING THEY WILL NEED TO BE WATCHED...ESPECIALLY WEST OF THE
MISSISSIPPI RIVER.

THE COLD FRONT WILL SWEEP EAST OF THE AREA BY EARLY MONDAY MORNING.
HAVE KEPT SLIGHT CHANCES FOR RAIN IN THE FORECAST ACROSS EASTERN
SECTIONS. EVERYONE WILL BE DRY BY MONDAY AFTERNOON AS THE FRONT
CLEARS EAST OF THE ENTIRE MID SOUTH AND HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS OVER
THE AREA THROUGH TUESDAY. THIS WILL KEEP DRY WEATHER IN PLACE
THROUGH TUESDAY AFTERNOON. THE UPPER LEVEL FLOW WILL REMAIN ZONAL
BEHIND TONIGHTS SYSTEM...WITH THE AIRMASS BEING OF PACIFIC ORIGIN.
THIS WILL ALLOW TEMPERATURES TO WARM BEHIND THE FRONT TO WELL ABOVE
SEASONAL AVERAGES FOR MONDAY AND TUESDAY AFTERNOONS.

THE NEXT COLD FRONT WILL APPROACH THE MID SOUTH TUESDAY NIGHT. HAVE
INCLUDED A CHANCE FOR SHOWERS AND ISOLATED THUNDERSTORMS AS
INSTABILITY INCREASES A BIT AHEAD OF THE FRONT. CHANCES FOR SHOWERS
AND ISOLATED THUNDERSTORMS WILL CONTINUE ACROSS NORTH MISSISSIPPI AS
THE FRONT CONTINUES TO CLEAR SOUTH OF THE AREA.

.LONG-TERM (WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...
POLAR HIGH PRESSURE WILL BUILD IN BEHIND WEDNESDAYS COLD FRONT
BRINGING A RETURN TO DRY WEATHER AND COLDER TEMPERATURES (BELOW
SEASONAL NORMALS). THE NEXT COLD FRONT WILL APPROACH ON FRIDAY WITH
MORE RAIN CHANCES ANTICIPATED. THIS FRONT WILL STALL ACROSS THE
AREA NEXT WEEKEND WITH WEAK WAVES DEVELOPING ALONG THE FRONT. THIS
WILL KEEP WET WEATHER IN THE FORECAST THROUGH NEXT WEEKEND WITH
NEAR AVERAGE TEMPERATURES EXPECTED.
&&

.MEG...WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MS...NONE.
MO...NONE.
TN...NONE.
&&

JLH


000 
FXUS64 KMEG 131912
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
112 PM CST SUN FEB 13 2005

.DISCUSSION...
HAVE DECIDED TO UPDATE THE POP FORECAST FOR THIS AFTERNOON...LOOKING
AT LATEST TRENDS. APPEARS THAT MORE SIGNIFICANT THUNDERSTORM
DEVELOPMENT ACROSS WESTERN ZONES WILL HOLD OFF UNTIL LATER THAN
ORIGINALLY ANTICIPATED. THINKING THAT THIS WILL BE DELAYED SOMEWHAT
WITH MORE SIGNIFICANT POPS AFTER 00Z. SO WITH THAT IN MIND...
LOWERED TO CHANCE POPS ACROSS ALL WESTERN ZONES. SHORTWAVE MOVING
ACROSS EAST TEXAS HAS ALLOWED FOR A CLUSTER OF SHOWERS AND ISOLATED
THUNDERSTORMS TO DEVELOP OVER NORTHERN LOUISIANA. THIS SHORTWAVE
WILL CONTINUE TO MOVE NORTHEAST AND KEEP PRECIP GOING OVER
SOUTHEASTERN ZONES. HAVE RAISED POPS ACROSS THESE AREAS TO REFLECT
THIS TREND.

SOME BREAKS IN CLOUDS NOW SHOWING UP OVER WESTERN ZONES AS WELL.
THIS WILL ALLOW TEMPERATURES TO SURGE INTO THE UPPER 60S THIS
AFTERNOON OVER THESE AREAS. HAVE UPDATED TEMP GRIDS TO REFLECT THIS
AS WELL.

UPDATED GRIDS AND ZONE FORECAST WILL BE SENT SHORTLY.


.DISCUSSION FROM 1038 AM...

REGIONAL RADAR CONTINUES TO SHOW RAIN COMING TO AN END ACROSS MOST
OF THE FORECAST AREA THIS MORNING. AS OF 16Z...MOST OF THE SHOWERS
WERE MOVING EAST AND ONLY AFFECTING OUR SOUTHEAST ZONES. THIS RAIN
WILL CONTINUE TO END AS A PRONOUNCED MID LEVEL DRY SLOT CONTINUES
TO PUNCH ACROSS THE AREA...AS NOTED FROM MORNING WATER VAPOR
IMAGERY. HAVE UPDATED POP GRIDS TO LOWER POPS ACROSS WESTERN
2/3RDS OF REGION AND TO REFLECT CURRENT PRECIP TRENDS.

CURRENT REGIONAL SURFACE OBSERVATIONS FROM 16Z SHOWING A
STRENGTHENING SURFACE LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM OVER NORTHWEST MISSOURI
WITH A COLD FRONT STRETCHED TO THE SOUTHWEST OF THE LOW ACROSS THE
SOUTHERN PLAINS. OVER OUR AREA...A WARM FRONT NOW STRETCHED FROM
NORTHEAST ARKANSAS SOUTHWARD INTO WEST-CENTRAL MISSISSIPPI WILL
CONTINUE TO ADVANCE SLOWLY EASTWARD ACROSS MAINLY WESTERN PORTIONS
OF THE REGION INTO THIS AFTERNOON. THIS WILL PLACE WESTERN PORTIONS
OF THE FORECAST AREA INTO THE WARM SECTOR...WHERE DEWPOINTS ARE NOW
INTO THE UPPER 50S. 16Z VISIBLE SATELLITE IMAGERY INDICATING A FEW
BREAKS IN THE CLOUDS OVER CENTRAL ARKANSAS. THIS TREND MAY CONTINUE
TO SPREAD OVER OUR WESTERN AREAS BY EARLY THIS AFTERNOON...BUT
THINK THAT ENOUGH LOW LEVEL MOISTURE WILL BE PRESENT TO KEEP OVERALL
SKY COVER AS MOSTLY CLOUDY. WILL KEEP AN EYE ON THIS TREND THOUGH
BECAUSE IT WILL PLAY A ROLE IN THIS AFTERNOONS SEVERE WEATHER
THREAT.

AS FOR CHANCES OF SEVERE WEATHER THIS AFTERNOON...NAM STILL SHOWING
INCREASING INSTABILITY ACROSS AREAS TO THE WEST OF THE MISSISSIPPI
THIS AFTERNOON. MODELS ALSO CONTINUING TO INDICATE SUFFICIENT DEEP
LAYER SHEAR AND LARGE AMOUNTS OF LOW-LEVEL HELICITY THIS AFTERNOON
ACROSS THE MID SOUTH. THESE STRONG WIND FIELDS REMAIN MORE THAN
SUFFICIENT FOR SEVERE WEATHER. THE BIG QUESTION...AS IS TYPICAL
THIS TIME OF YEAR...REMAINS THE DEGREE OF INSTABILITY. AS MID-LEVEL
COOLING ASSOCIATED WITH THE APPROACHING SHORTWAVE TROUGH OVERSPREADS
THE WARM SECTOR THAT SHOULD BE IN PLACE ACROSS WESTERN PORTIONS OF
THE AREA THERE SHOULD BE ENOUGH INSTABILITY AND LIFT PRESENT TO ALLOW
FOR ISOLATED STORMS TO BECOME SEVERE. THIS THREAT WILL BE CONFINED
TO AREAS WEST OF THE MISSISSIPPI RIVER AND THIS MATCHES WELL WITH
THE NEW 16Z DAY 1 OUTLOOK ISSUED BY SPC.

UPDATED GRIDS AND ZONE FORECAST OUT SHORTLY.

&&

.MEG...WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MS...NONE.
MO...NONE.
TN...NONE.

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 130952
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
352 AM CST SUN FEB 13 2005

.DISCUSSION...
LARGE SCALE AND NEGATIVELY TILTED UPPER LEVEL TROUGH IS MOVING
THROUGH THE PLAINS STATES THIS MORNING. WIDESPREAD STRATIFORM RAIN
COVERS THE MIDSOUTH AHEAD OF THIS TROUGH. THE STRATIFORM RAIN WILL
BE SHIFTING EASTWARD THIS MORNING WITH THE PRECIPITATION BECOMING
MORE CONVECTIVE ACROSS THE MIDSOUTH DURING THE DAY. STRONG LOW
PRESSURE WILL MOVE INTO NORTHERN MO BY SUNSET TODAY WITH A COLD
FRONT TRAILING SOUTHWARD THROUGH NORTH-CENTRAL AR TO NORTHEAST TX.
SPC HAS PLACED THE ENTIRE MIDSOUTH IN A SLIGHT RISK OF SEVERE FOR
THIS AFTERNOON AND EVENING AHEAD OF THE COLD FRONT. HOWEVER...
PRESENTLY THINK THE GREATEST THREAT WILL BE ACROSS THE MO BOOTHEEL
AND EASTERN AR...POSSIBLY CROSSING THE MS RIVER. CAPES ARE FORECAST
TO CLIMB TO NEAR 1000 J/KG ACROSS EASTERN AR BY MID-AFTERNOON WITH A
STRONG SHEARING WIND PROFILE. 0-1 KM STORM RELATIVE HELICITY VALUES
ARE FORECAST TO BE AN IMPRESSIVE 300 J/KG WITH 850 MB WINDS
BETWEEN 50 AND 60 KNOTS. AS A RESULT...ISOLATED TORNADOES ARE
POSSIBLE AHEAD OF THE FRONT ACROSS EASTERN AR AND THE MO BOOTHEEL BY
MID-AFTERNOON. DAMAGING WINDS AND LARGE HAIL ARE ALSO POSSIBLE. ALL
OF THIS HINGES ON THE INSTABILITY WHICH WILL DEPEND ON HOW MUCH THE
CLOUDS BREAK UP THIS AFTERNOON AND HOW MUCH HEATING IS RECEIVED.
THE NAM INDICATES THE INSTABILITY WILL NOT BE AS HIGH EAST OF THE
MS RIVER. TIGHT SURFACE GRADIENT WILL CAUSE SURFACE WINDS TO
INCREASE TO BETWEEN 20 AND 25 MPH TODAY WITH GUST TO BETWEEN 30 AND
35 MPH...ESPECIALLY WESTERN HALF OF THE MIDSOUTH. ATTM...THINK
SPEEDS WILL BE JUST BELOW WIND ADVISORY THRESHOLD...BUT THIS WILL
NEED TO BE MONITORED BY THE DAYSHIFT.

THE COLD FRONT WILL MOVE THROUGH THE MIDSOUTH TONIGHT WITH MOST OF
THE SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS EAST OF THE MIDSOUTH BY 12Z MONDAY.
SKIES WILL BECOME MOSTLY SUNNY TO PARTLY CLOUDY MONDAY. THE AIR
MASS BEHIND THE FRONT IS OF PACIFIC ORIGIN SO TEMPERATURES WILL BE
MILD MONDAY.

ADDED A CHANCE OF RAIN TO TUESDAY NIGHTS FORECAST. THE NAM / GFS
INDICATE A COLD FRONT WILL PUSH THROUGH THE MIDSOUTH FROM THE NORTH
DURING THIS TIME ACCOMPANIED BY SOME RAIN.  WILL LEAVE WEDNESDAY
DRY WITH MODELS DIFFERENCES ON SPEED OF THE FRONT...BUT LATER
FORECASTS MAY NEED TO ADD A CHANCE OF RAIN FOR NORTH MS WEDNESDAY
MORNING.

&&

FXUS64 KMEG 122010
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
200 PM CST SAT FEB 12 2005

.DISCUSSION...
RAIN WILL CONTINUE WORKING ITS WAY INTO THE MIDSOUTH TONIGHT. THE 
RAIN IS ASSOCIATED WITH AN APPROACHING LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM. MODELS 
SHOWING A WARM FRONT DEVELOPING OVER THE AREA TONIGHT. THIS WILL 
KEEP RAIN AROUND THE AREA INTO SUNDAY. THE FRONT WILL PUSH FURTHER 
NORTH BY MIDDAY SUNDAY...WHICH MAY ALLOW FOR A BREAK IN RAIN DURING 
THE AFTERNOON. A COLD FRONT WILL BEGIN APPROACHING FROM THE WEST 
LATE SUNDAY AFTERNOON. WITH WARM MOIST AIR IN PLACE AND MODELS 
SHOWING CAPE VALUES OF 1500 J/KG AND HELICITY VALUES OF 400 M2/S2 
CAN NOT RULE OUT THUNDERSTORMS POSSIBLY SEVERE DEVELOPING SUNDAY 
AFTERNOON OVER WESTERN SECTIONS OF THE MIDSOUTH OUT AHEAD OF THE 
COLD FRONT. HOWEVER IF THE LOW CLOUDS DO NOT BREAK UP OVER THE AREA 
DURING THIS TIME...THUNDERSTORMS WILL BE LESS LIKELY TO OCCUR. SPC 
HAS PUT A SLIGHT RISK FOR SEVERE STORMS OVER THE THE WESTERN HALF OF 
THE CWA FOR SUNDAY AFTERNOON AND EVENING. 

THE COLD FRONT WILL PUSH THROUGH THE MIDSOUTH SUNDAY NIGHT INTO 
EARLY MONDAY MORNING. SHOULD EXIT THE MIDSOUTH BY MID MONDAY 
MORNING. THIS WILL BRING AN END TO RAIN CHANCES. WITH ZONAL FLOW IN 
PLACE...TEMPERATURES WILL REMAIN ON THE MILD SIDE.

HIGH PRESSURE WILL BUILD INTO THE AREA FOR MONDAY NIGHT AND TUESDAY. 
DRY CONDITIONS WILL BE SHORT-LIVED AS A COLD FRONT WILL BEGIN TO 
PUSH THROUGH THE MIDSOUTH TUESDAY NIGHT INTO WEDNESDAY. NOT MUCH 
MOISTURE ASSOCIATED WITH THE FRONT. CAN/T RULE OUT AN ISOLATED 
SHOWER BUT WILL KEEP DRY FOR NOW.

MODELS CONTINUING TO SHOW FRONT PUSHING ENTIRELY THROUGH THE CWA 
ALLOWING FOR HIGH PRESSURE TO REBUILD INTO THE MIDSOUTH FOR 
WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY. WILL REMOVE ANY MENTION OF 
PRECIPITATION DURING THIS TIME.

THE NEXT LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM WILL BEGIN TO MOVE INTO THE AREA FRIDAY 
THROUGH THE END OF THE FORECAST PERIOD. THIS WILL BRING RAIN CHANCES 
BACK TO THE MIDSOUTH.

OVERALL TEMPERATURES WILL REMAIN NEAR NORMAL TO SLIGHTLY ABOVE 
NORMAL THIS WEEK.

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 121000
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
400 AM CST SAT FEB 12 2005

.DISCUSSION...
IT IS A CHILLY NIGHT ACROSS THE MIDSOUTH WITH TEMPERATURES HAVING
DIPPED INTO THE 30S IN MOST LOCATIONS. SOME CIRRUS IS SPILLING INTO
THE MIDSOUTH OVER A RIDGE CENTERED THROUGH THE PLAINS STATES. THE
UPPER LEVEL LOW THAT WILL BE AFFECTED OUR WEATHER THIS WEEKEND IS
SEEN ON WATER VAPOR IMAGERY MOVING THROUGH SOUTHERN CA.

MODELS HAVE BEEN FAIRLY CONSISTENT IN THE DEVELOPING WET SCENARIO
FOR THE WEEKEND. THE NAM INDICATES THE MEAN RELATIVE HUMIDITY
INCREASING RAPIDLY TODAY ACROSS THE MIDSOUTH AS A WARM FRONT
DEVELOPS TO OUR SOUTHWEST AND ISENTROPIC LIFT INCREASES ACROSS OUR
AREA. THE MEAN RH AT MEMPHIS IS FORECAST TO GO FROM 20 PERCENT AT 12Z
TO 90 PERCENT AT 00Z. THE LOWER LEVELS ARE QUITE DRY SO WILL TAKE
SOME TIME TO SATURATE. LITTLE IF ANY RAIN IS EXPECTED THIS MORNING...
BUT WILL BE ON THE INCREASE THIS AFTERNOON ESPECIALLY FROM NORTHEAST
AR ACROSS SOUTHWEST TN INTO NORTHWEST MS.

WIDESPREAD RAIN IS EXPECTED TONIGHT ACROSS THE MIDSOUTH AS A UPPER
LEVEL TROUGH MOVES INTO THE PLAINS AND AN ASSOCIATED SURFACE LOW
MOVES INTO KANSAS.

THE MIDSOUTH WILL GRADUALLY MOVE INTO THE WARM SECTOR SUNDAY WITH A
COLD FRONT MOVING INTO CENTRAL ARKANSAS BY 00Z MONDAY. SPC HAS
PLACED EASTERN AR...THE MO BOOTHEEL...EXTREME WEST TN...AND
NORTHWEST MS IN A SLIGHT RISK OF SEVERE FOR SUNDAY AFTERNOON /
EVENING. ATTM...THINK THE BEST CHANCE OF SEVERE WEATHER WILL BE
ACROSS EASTERN AR...POSSIBLY CROSSING THE MS RIVER. CAPES ARE
FORECAST BY THE NAM TO INCREASE TO NEAR 800 J/KG ACROSS EASTERN AR
DURING THE AFTERNOON WITH 0-1 KM HELICITY IN EXCESS OF 200 M2/S2.
THIS APPEARS TO BE THE AREA MOST LIKELY TO RECEIVE MORE HEATING
DURING THE AFTERNOON AS THE STRATIFORM RAIN SHIFTS TO THE EAST DURING
THE DAY. OBVIOUSLY...THIS WILL CONTINUED TO BE MONITORED BY LATER
SHIFTS.

THE COLD FRONT WILL MOVE THROUGH THE MIDSOUTH SUNDAY NIGHT WITH THE
NAM AND GFS INDICATING MOST OF THE RAIN WILL HAVE MOVED OUT OF THE
MIDSOUTH BY 12Z MONDAY. WILL LEAVE A 20 PERCENT CHANCE OF SHOWERS FOR
NORTHEAST MS AND THE EASTERN COUNTIES OF WEST TN FOR MONDAY
MORNING. HOWEVER...THIS MAY BE ABLE TO BE REMOVED IN LATER
FORECASTS DEPENDING ON TIMING OF THE FRONT. IN FACT...MONDAY LOOKS
LIKE A NICE VALENTINES DAY AS THE AIR MASS BEHIND THE FRONT
FORECAST TO MOVE INTO THE MIDSOUTH WILL BE OF PACIFIC ORIGIN. SKIES
WILL BECOME PARTLY CLOUDY TO MOSTLY SUNNY WITH HIGHS IN THE LOWER AND
MID 60S.

NO CHANGES IN THE CURRENT FORECAST BEYOND MONDAY.

FXUS64 KMEG 111958
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
200 PM CST FRI FEB 11 2005

.DISCUSSION...
HIGH PRESSURE WILL REMAIN IN CONTROL THROUGH TONIGHT. AFTER 
MIDNIGHT...EXPECT A THICKER BAND OF CIRRUS TO BEGIN MOVING INTO 
SOUTHWESTERN PORTIONS OF THE MIDSOUTH. THE CIRRUS IS ASSOCIATED WITH 
AN APPROACHING LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM. THE CIRRUS MAY PREVENT LOW 
TEMPERATURES FROM FALLING AS LOW AS PREVIOUS THOUGHT FROM MEMPHIS 
SOUTHWESTWARD. MAY GO A TAD WARMER IN THIS AREA.

CLOUDS WILL CONTINUE TO INCREASE ON SATURDAY AS A WARM FRONT 
APPROACHES THE AREA. MODELS ARE NOW SHOWING RAIN BEGINNING A TAD 
EARLIER ACROSS THE AREA. WILL NOW ADD POPS EVERYWHERE FOR SATURDAY 
AFTERNOON AND WILL BUMP POPS UP ACROSS WESTERN HALF OF CWA.

WARM FRONT WILL MOVE THROUGH CWA SATURDAY NIGHT AND SUNDAY. AS THE 
WARM FRONT MOVES THROUGH THE AREA THERE WILL BE ENOUGH INSTABILITY 
FOR SOME ISOLATED THUNDERSTORMS TO OCCUR SO HAVE ADDED THUNDER TO 
THE FORECAST. WILL ALSO GO WITH CATEGORICAL POPS FOR SATURDAY NIGHT 
FOR THE ENTIRE MIDSOUTH AND 70-80 POPS FOR SUNDAY. EXPECT A BREAK IN 
THE PRECIPITATION SUNDAY AFTERNOON INTO SUNDAY EVENING BEFORE THE 
COLD FRONT BEGINS TO MOVE INTO THE CWA. COLD FRONT WILL PUSH THROUGH 
THE AREA SUNDAY NIGHT AND MONDAY MORNING.

HIGH PRESSURE WILL BUILD INTO THE MIDSOUTH FOR MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH 
TUESDAY NIGHT. THIS WILL BRING DRY CONDITIONS BACK TO THE CWA. HOWEVER 
THIS WILL BE SHORT-LIVED AS ANOTHER COLD FRONT WILL SWING THROUGH 
THE AREA WEDNESDAY. THIS WILL BRING CHANCES FOR RAIN BACK TO THE 
MIDSOUTH. MODELS HAVE CHANGED THE EXTENDED. THEY ARE NOW SHOWING THE 
MIDSOUTH HAVING ANOTHER BREAK FOR WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND THURSDAY AS 
HIGH PRESSURE MOVES BACK INTO THE AREA. THEN ANOTHER LOW PRESSURE 
SYSTEM APPROACHES FROM THE WEST THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH THE END OF 
THE FORECAST PERIOD BRINGING MORE RAIN BACK TO THE REGION. YESTERDAY 
THE MODELS DIDN/T HAVE THE PREVIOUS COLD FRONT MAKING IT ALL THE WAY 
THROUGH AREA SO WILL HOLD OFF ON TAKING PRECIP OUT FOR WEDNESDAY 
NIGHT AND THURSDAY UNTIL SOME CONSISTENCY OCCURS.

OVERALL...EVEN WITH SEVERAL SYSTEMS MOVING IN AND OUT OF THE AREA 
THIS WEEK...TEMPERATURES WILL REMAIN NEAR TO SLIGHTLY ABOVE NORMAL 
FOR THE WEEK.


000 
FXUS64 KMEG 110955
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
354 AM CST FRI FEB 11 2005

.DISCUSSION...
SATELLITE SHOWS CLEAR SKIES ACROSS THE MIDSOUTH THIS MORNING. WINDS
ARE LIGHT AND TEMPERATURES HAVE DIPPED INTO THE 20S.

SKIES ARE FORECAST TO REMAIN CLEAR FOR AT LEAST THE NEXT 24 HOURS
EXCEPT FOR PERHAPS SOME CIRRUS. WINDS WILL TURN TO THE WEST TODAY AS
HIGH PRESSURE SINKS TO OUR SOUTH. THIS WILL ALLOW FOR A GOOD WARMUP
TODAY WITH HIGHS ABOUT 10 DEGREES WARMER THAN YESTERDAY.
TEMPERATURES WILL NOT BE QUITE AS COLD TONIGHT AS THE WINDS REMAIN
UP SLIGHTLY FROM THE SOUTHWEST.

THE WEATHER WILL BEGIN TO CHANGE SATURDAY BUT LOOKS LIKE MOST OF
THE DAY SHOULD BE PLEASANT FOR THIS TIME OF THE YEAR. CLOUDS WILL
BE ON THE INCREASE FROM THE SOUTHWEST WITH A DEVELOPING WARM FRONT
TO THE SOUTHWEST. MODELS HAVE BEEN CONSISTENT IN SHOWING A TIGHT
GRADIENT OF RAPIDLY INCREASING MOISTURE MOVING INTO THE MIDSOUTH BY
SUNSET SATURDAY. THE LOWER LEVELS WILL REMAIN RATHER DRY
DURING THE DAY SATURDAY SO THINK MOST OF THE RAIN WILL HOLD OFF UNTIL
SATURDAY NIGHT.

SATURDAY NIGHT...AN UPPER LEVEL TROUGH AND ASSOCIATED SURFACE
LOW MOVES INTO THE PLAINS. MEANWHILE...THE WARM FRONT AND
ASSOCIATED ISENTROPIC LIFT WILL PUSH INTO THE MIDSOUTH WITH RAIN
INCREASING.

A COLD FRONT WILL MOVE INTO WESTERN ARKANSAS BY LATE SUNDAY AND
MOVE THROUGH THE MIDSOUTH SUNDAY NIGHT AND EARLY MONDAY MORNING.
PARTS OF THE MIDSOUTH WILL MOVE INTO THE WARM SECTOR SUNDAY.
LATER FORECASTS MAY NEED TO ADD A CHANCE OF THUNDERSTORMS TO THE
FORECAST FOR SUNDAY AFTERNOON AND NIGHT...ESPECIALLY WEST AND SOUTH
OF MEMPHIS. THERE ARE MODEL DISAGREEMENTS ON HOW MUCH INSTABILITY
WILL BE AVAILABLE...AND SINCE THIS IS THIS FAR OUT...WILL LET LATER
SHIFTS TAKE A LOOK AT LATER DATA. WILL INCREASE THE POPS FOR SUNDAY
NIGHT SOME WITH THE FRONT FORECAST TO MOVE THROUGH DURING THAT TIME.

THE COLD FRONT WILL MOVE EAST OF THE MIDSOUTH EARLY MONDAY TAKING
THE RAIN WITH IT.

NO CHANGES WILL BE MADE TO LATER PERIODS OF THE FORECAST. POOR
CONFIDENCE IN FORECAST BEYOND MONDAY DUE TO MODEL INCONSISTENCY.

&&

.MEG...WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.

FXUS64 KMEG 102039
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
300 PM CST THU FEB 10 2005

.DISCUSSION...
HIGH PRESSURE WILL REMAIN IN CONTROL OF THE WEATHER OVER THE NEXT 
FEW DAYS. SKIES WILL REMAIN CLEAR TO MOSTLY CLEAR DURING THIS TIME. 
WINDS WILL BEGIN TO DIE DOWN TONIGHT AS THE HIGH MOVES DIRECTLY OVER 
THE MIDSOUTH. AS THE HIGH SHIFTS EASTWARD ON FRIDAY...WINDS WILL 
SWITCH OUT OF THE SOUTHWEST. WITH THE LIGHT WINDS AND CLEAR SKIES 
TONIGHT...TEMPERATURES WILL DROP INTO THE 20S FOR MOST LOCATIONS. AS 
WINDS SWITCH AROUND TO THE SOUTHWEST ON THURSDAY...TEMPERATURES WILL 
REBOUND INTO THE 50S. 

CLOUDS WILL BEGIN TO INCREASE DURING THE DAY SATURDAY AHEAD OF AN 
APPROACHING LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM. EXPECT RAIN FROM THE SYSTEM TO HOLD 
OFF UNTIL SATURDAY NIGHT. RAIN CHANCES WILL CONTINUE THROUGHOUT THE 
REST OF THE WEEKEND AS A WARM FRONT LINGERS NEAR THE CWA.  A COLD 
FRONT WILL THEN PUSH THROUGH THE CWA SUNDAY NIGHT IN TO MONDAY. RAIN 
CHANCES WILL DIMINISH BY MONDAY.

HIGH PRESSURE WILL BUILD BACK INTO THE AREA FOR MONDAY NIGHT AND 
TUESDAY. HOWEVER THIS WILL BE SHORT-LIVED AS ANOTHER COLD FRONT 
SWINGS INTO THE MIDSOUTH LATE TUESDAY NIGHT INTO WEDNESDAY. MODELS 
SHOWING THIS FRONT STALLING OUT OVER THE CWA WEDNESDAY AND WEDNESDAY 
NIGHT BEFORE LIFTING BACK NORTHWARD AS A WARM FRONT ON THURSDAY. 
THIS WILL KEEP RAIN CHANCES IN THE FORECAST FROM LATE TUESDAY NIGHT 
THROUGH THE REST OF THE FORECAST PERIOD.

&&

.MEG...WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MS...NONE.

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 101009
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
409 AM CST THU FEB 10 2005

.DISCUSSION...
AN UPPER LEVEL TROUGH REMAINS IN PLACE OVER THE EASTERN HALF OF THE
UNITED STATES THIS MORNING. THIS FEATURE WILL HELP KEEP THICKNESSES
LOW OVER THE MID SOUTH TODAY SO TEMPERATURES WILL REMAIN COOL.
CLOUDS HAVE CLEARED MOST OF THE FORECAST AREA AS OF 09Z...SO MOSTLY
SUNNY SKIES CAN BE EXPECTED THIS MORNING EXCEPT ACROSS FAR EASTERN
SECTIONS WHERE PARTLY CLOUDY CONDITIONS WILL CONTINUE FOR A FEW
HOURS THIS MORNING.

.SHORT TERM (TODAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...

THE UPPER LEVEL TROUGH OVER THE AREA WILL CONTINUE TO MOVE EAST
TODAY. AGAIN EXPECTING A MOSTLY SUNNY DAY AREAWIDE LATER TODAY WITH
CONTINUED COOL TEMPERATURES.

THE ETA/GFS/ECMWF MODELS ALL INDICATING UPPER LEVEL RIDGING BUILDING
OVER THE AREA FOR FRIDAY AND THE FIRST PART OF SATURDAY. WEATHER
CONDITIONS WILL REMAIN DRY THROUGH SATURDAY MORNING. TEMPERATURES
WILL ALSO BEGIN TO MODERATE BEGINNING FRIDAY AS UPPER LEVEL HEIGHTS
AND THICKNESSES RISE AND LOW LEVEL WARM AIR ADVECTION BEGINS.

THE NEXT WEATHER MAKER WILL BE AN UPPER LEVEL LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM
LOCATED OFF THE COAST OF BAJA MEXICO THIS MORNING. THIS SYSTEM IS
PROGGED BY THE MEDIUM RANGE MODELS TO MOVE EAST ACROSS THE
SOUTHWESTERN STATES ON SATURDAY AND INTO THE SOUTHERN PLAINS STATES
BY SATURDAY NIGHT. AS THE UPPER LOW MOVES EAST INTO THE PLAINS
STATES IT IS FORECAST TO WEAKEN TO AN OPEN TROUGH. EXPECT CLOUDS TO
INCREASE DURING THE DAY SATURDAY...WITH CHANCES FOR RAIN BEGINNING
LATER SATURDAY AFTERNOON ACROSS WESTERN PORTIONS OF THE FORECAST AREA
AS DEEP LOW LEVEL MOISTURE ADVECTS NORTHWARD INTO THE MID SOUTH. LOW
LEVEL WARM ADVECTION WILL ALSO CONTINUE...SO EXPECT TEMPERATURES TO
EVEN BE A FEW DEGREES WARMER ON SATURDAY.

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)

THE UPPER TROUGH WILL MOVE FROM THE SOUTHERN PLAINS STATES THROUGH
THE LOWER MISSISSIPPI VALLEY THROUGH MONDAY MORNING. THIS UPPER
LEVEL FEATURE WILL HELP DRAG A COLD FRONT ACROSS THE AREA ON
MONDAY. GOOD CHANCES FOR RAIN WILL CONTINUE THROUGH SUNDAY BEFORE
ENDING DURING THE DAY MONDAY AS THE COLD FRONT MOVES THROUGH. THE
UPPER LEVEL FLOW WILL REMAIN ZONAL FOLLOWING THE PASSAGE OF THE
SHORTWAVE TROUGH...SO NOT EXPECTING MUCH CHANGE IN TEMPERATURES FOR
THE BEGINNING OF NEXT WEEK AS AN AIRMASS OF PACIFIC ORIGIN WILL
FOLLOW THE FRONT. HIGH PRESSURE WILL BRIEFLY MOVE OVER THE
AREA FOR THE FIRST PART OF NEXT WEEK BRINGING DRY WEATHER. ANOTHER
NORTHERN STREAM IMPULSE IS PROGGED TO SEND ANOTHER COLD FRONT ACROSS
THE AREA BY THE MIDDLE OF NEXT WEEK...BRINGING ADDITIONAL CHANCES
FOR RAIN FOR WEDNESDAY AND WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND SLIGHTLY COOLER
TEMPERATURES FOR THE SECOND HALF OF NEXT WEEK.
&&

.MEG...WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MS...NONE.
MO...NONE.
TN...NONE.

FXUS64 KMEG 091945
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
145 PM CST WED FEB 9 2005

.DISCUSSION...
SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE WAS BUILDING INTO NORTHEAST ARKANSAS THIS 
AFTERNOON WHERE THERE WERE SOME GUSTY NORTHWESTERLY WINDS. CLOUDS 
HAVE HUNG ON TIGHT OVER THE MID SOUTH REGION IN THE WAKE OF THE 
SHORTWAVE TROUGH. 

OVERNIGHT...THE COOL...DRIER AIR ASSOCIATED WITH THE HIGH PRESSURE  
WILL SEEP INTO THE FORECAST AREA. THIS IS IN RESPONSE TO STRONGER 
SHORTWAVE SWINGING ACROSS THE MISSISSIPPI VALLEY TONIGHT. SKIES WILL 
GRADUALLY CLEAR FROM THE WEST...WITH CLOUDS REMAINING OVER THE 
EASTERN AREAS THROUGH THE NIGHT. AREAS THAT SEE THE CLEARER SKIES 
WILL BE COLDER THAN AREAS WITH CLOUDS...THUS WESTERN AREAS WILL BE 
COOLER THAN EASTERN AREAS. 

WITH THE BROAD TROUGH OVER EASTERN HALF OF THE U.S. THE FORECAST 
AREA WILL FINALLY SEE THE SUN EXPECTING CLEARING SKIES 
THURSDAY...WITH MOSTLY CLEAR SKIES FRIDAY. DESPITE THE ABUNDANT 
SUNSHINE TEMPERATURES WILL BE JUST BELOW NORMAL TO NEAR NORMAL. THIS 
WILL BE DUE TO SHORTWAVES TRANSLATING ACROSS THE GREAT LAKES REGION 
IN THE NORTHWEST FLOW. 

THE FOCUS SHIFTS WEST SATURDAY AS ABUNDANT SUBTROPICAL MOISTURE IS 
PULLED AHEAD OF A STORM SYSTEM OFF THE SOUTHWEST U.S. COAST. CLOUDS 
WILL INCREASE ACROSS THE MID SOUTH SATURDAY IN ADVANCE OF THIS 
SYSTEM. RAIN CHANCES WILL BEGIN TO INCREASE SATURDAY...WITH THE BEST 
CHANCES FOR RAIN OCCURRING SATURDAY NIGHT INTO SUNDAY. RAIN WILL END 
BY NEXT MONDAY NIGHT...FOLLOWED BY NEAR NORMAL TEMPERATURES.

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 091211
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
611 AM CST WED FEB 9 2005

LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM AND ASSOCIATED SHORTWAVE PULLING EAST FASTER
THAN ORIGINALLY ANTICIPATED. HAVE UPDATED THE FORECAST TO REFLECT
CURRENT RADAR TRENDS...BY LOWERING POPS AS RAIN IS ENDING SOONER.
UPDATED ZONE FORECAST WILL BE OUT SHORTLY.


.PREVIOUS DISCUSSION FROM 414 AM...

AN UPPER LEVEL TROUGH WITH EMBEDDED SHORTWAVES WILL CONTINUE TO MOVE
ACROSS THE MISSISSIPPI VALLEY TODAY. THIS UPPER TROUGH WILL
CONTINUE TO MOVE EAST AND AMPLIFY ALONG THE EASTERN SEABOARD AS A
STRONG UPPER LEVEL JET DIGS INTO THE BASE OF THE TROUGH. ONCE THIS
UPPER TROUGH SWINGS THROUGH THE AREA TODAY...UPPER LEVEL FLOW WILL
TRANSITION TO NORTHWESTERLY...WITH NORTHWEST FLOW ALOFT CONTINUING
THROUGH THE END OF THE WEEK.

AN UPPER LEVEL LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM NOW OVER THE SOUTHEAST PACIFIC
OCEAN TO THE WEST OF THE CALIFORNIA COASTLINE IS PROGGED BY THE
MEDIUM RANGE MODELS TO MOVE INTO THE SOUTHWEST U.S. BY THE
BEGINNING OF THE WEEKEND. THIS SYSTEM SHOULD MOVE EAST AND AS IT
DOES...THE FLOW SHOULD TURN MORE SOUTHWESTERLY AND ALLOW MOISTURE
TO FLOW BACK OVER THE MID SOUTH AHEAD OF THIS SYSTEM FOR THE END OF
THE WEEKEND AND THE BEGINNING OF NEXT WEEK.
&&

.SHORT TERM (TODAY THROUGH FRIDAY NIGHT)...
A FRONTAL BOUNDARY REMAINS STALLED ACROSS NORTH MISSISSIPPI INTO
SOUTHERN ARKANSAS THIS MORNING. WEAK SURFACE CYCLOGENSIS CONTINUES
ALONG THE FRONT OVER SOUTHEAST ARKANSAS AND THIS WEAK LOW PRESSURE
SYSTEM WILL CONTINUE TO MOVE NORTHEAST ACROSS NORTH-CENTRAL
MISSISSIPPI INTO EAST TENNESSEE BY LATER TODAY. A LARGE SHIELD OF
RAIN HAS DEVELOPED IN ADVANCE OF THIS SYSTEM ACROSS CENTRAL
MISSISSIPPI AND CONTINUES TO MOVE NORTHEAST. ADDITIONAL RAIN HAS
DEVELOPED OVER NORTHEAST ARKANSAS...THE MISSOURI BOOTHEEL...
WEST TENNESSEE...AND NORTHWEST MISSISSIPPI THIS MORNING AHEAD OF A
SHORTWAVE TROUGH MOVING ACROSS MISSOURI. EXPECT THIS SHORTWAVE TO
CONTINUE TO MOVE EAST WITH RAIN CHANCES CONTINUING ACROSS THE MID
SOUTH THIS MORNING. HAVE KEPT THE HIGHEST POPS GOING ACROSS EASTERN
SECTIONS OF THE AREA WITH DECREASING CHANCES TO THE WEST. EXPECT
THE RAIN TO END LATER THIS MORNING ACROSS MOST OF THE MID SOUTH AS
BOTH THE SHORTWAVE TROUGH AND LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM DEPART TO THE
EAST. HAVE KEPT SLIGHT CHANCES POPS GOING INTO EARLY THIS
AFTERNOON ACROSS SOUTHEASTERN ZONES...AS THIS AREA WILL BE CLOSEST
TO THE DEPARTING LOW.

TEMPERATURES SHOULD REMAIN STEADY ACROSS THE AREA THROUGH MOST OF
TODAY...AND MAY ACTUALLY FALL A FEW DEGREES LATER THIS AFTERNOON AS
COLD ADVECTION BEGINS IN EARNEST LATER THIS AFTERNOON. THE UPPER
TROUGH WILL CONTINUE TO PULL TO THE EAST AND HIGH PRESSURE WILL
BUILD OVER THE MID SOUTH FOR TONIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY. EXPECT DRY
WEATHER FOR THIS TIME PERIOD...WITH CONTINUED COOL TEMPERATURES
THROUGH THURSDAY NIGHT AS THICKNESSES REMAIN LOW. UPPER LEVEL HEIGHTS
WILL BEGIN RISING BY FRIDAY AND FRIDAY NIGHT AND THE LOW LEVEL FLOW
WILL BEGIN TURNING BACK OUT OF THE SOUTH...SO EXPECT A MODERATION IN
TEMPERATURES FOR THE END OF THE WEEK.
&&

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...
AN UPPER LEVEL LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM OVER THE SOUTHEAST PACIFIC TODAY
WILL WEAKEN TO AN OPEN TROUGH AND MOVE ACROSS THE SOUTHWEST U.S. AND
TOWARDS THE MID SOUTH OVER THE WEEKEND. AS THIS SYSTEM MOVES EAST...
EXPECT MOISTURE TO BEGIN TO RETURN TO THE AREA AHEAD OF THIS
SYSTEM. ON SATURDAY...CLOUDS WILL INCREASE WITH SLIGHT CHANCES FOR
RAIN. RAIN CHANCES SHOULD INCREASE FOR SUNDAY AND CONTINUE INTO
MONDAY BEFORE A COLD FRONT SWEEPS THROUGH ON MONDAY BRINGING AN END
TO THE PRECIPITATION. DRYER WEATHER WILL MOVE IN FOR THE BEGINNING
OF NEXT WEEK WITH CONTINUED MILD TEMPERATURES WITH ZONAL FLOW ALOFT.
&&

.MEG...WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MS...NONE.
MO...NONE.
TN...NONE.

FXUS64 KMEG 090357
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
955 PM CST TUE FEB 8 2005

.DISCUSSION...

A STATIONARY FRONTAL BOUNDARY EXTENDS ACROSS THE SERN PART OF THE 
CWA. FOG WAS PRESENT JUST NORTH OF THE BOUNDARY WITH VISIBILITIES 
BELOW A MILE IN A 50 MILE BAND EXTENDING ACROSS MEM-MKL. A LIGHT 
N-NE WIND WAS OCCURING IN THAT ZONE WITH LOWER DEWPOINTS TO THE 
NORTH. A NE WIND WOULD PROVIDE A NEUTRAL MOISTURE ADVECTION WHILE A 
N WIND WOULD PROVIDE DRY ADVECTION AND DISSIPATE THE FOG. EXPECT THE 
WINDS TO BECOME MORE NORTHERLY...SO DO NOT EXPECT THE FOG TO BE AS 
DENSE AS LAST NIGHT. ALSO...EXPECT CLOUDY SKIES THROUGH THE NIGHT.

A WEAK SFC LOW OVER THE ARKLATEX REGION WILL TRACK EWD ACROSS THE 
LWR MS VLY LATE TONIGHT. THIS COMBINED WITH AN UPPER LEVEL SHORTWAVE 
WILL PROVIDE A DECENT CHANCE OF RAIN OVERNIGHT...ESPECIALLY TO THE 
SOUTHERN TWO THIRDS OF THE CWA. THE RAIN WILL LINGER IN THE MORNING 
BEFORE MOVING TO THE SE DURING THE DAY.

A COOLER AND DRIER AIRMASS WILL ADVECT INTO REGION WED PM. A SFC 
HIGH WILL MOVE ACROSS THE AREA FRI NITE THEN TO THE SE OVER THE 
WEEKEND. A RETURN WAA FLOW WILL PROVIDE THE NEXT CHANCE OF RAIN SAT 
NITE-SUN NITE. A PACIFIC HIGH WILL PROVIDE DRY AND SEASONABLE 
CONDITIONS EARLY NEXT WEEK.

&&

.MEG...WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MS...NONE.
MO...NONE.

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 082046
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
246 PM CST TUE FEB 8 2005

.DISCUSSION...
FRONTAL SYSTEM HAS PRETTY MUCH HUNG UP OVER EASTERN PORTIONS OF THE
CWA. NEAR THE FRONT...THERE IS ABOUT A 75 MILE WIDE AREA WHERE CLOUDS
HAVE THINNED OUT OR BROKEN UP. THIS HAS ALLOWED TEMPERATURES TO CLIMB
ABOVE FORECAST LEVELS ACROSS EASTERN PORTIONS OF CWA. THERE IS A 13
DEGREE SPREAD IN ABOUT 30 MILES ACROSS WEST TENNESSEE...BETWEEN
HUNTINGDON AND LEXINGTON. NO SIGNIFICANT PRECIPITATION WITHIN 200
MILES OF MEMPHIS.
&&

.SHORT TERM (THROUGH FRIDAY)...
TROF LIFTING OUT OF SOUTHWEST U.S. WILL MOVE TO OUR NORTHWEST
OVERNIGHT. THIS WILL EVENTUALLY DRAG THE COLD FRONT THROUGH THE
REST OF THE AREA TOMORROW. ISENTROPIC LIFT AND SATURATION IS NOT AS
STRONG AS I WOULD LIKE TO SEE...AND IT MAINLY OCCURS AFTER MIDNIGHT
TONIGHT. WILL ONLY CARRY SLIGHT POPS FOR 6 PM TO MIDNIGHT TIME
FRAME...AND CHANCE POPS AFTER THAT. RAIN AMOUNTS WILL BE MAINLY
LIGHT...ALTHOUGH EXTREME SOUTHERN PORTIONS OF CWA COULD SEE UP TO
0.50 INCH...DEPENDING ON EXACT PATH OF WAVE.

WILL HOLD POPS IN...MAINLY DURING THE MORNING ON WEDNESDAY...AS
SYSTEM CLEARS THE AREA. CLOUDS ARE EXPECTED TO MOVE OUT OF THE AREA
BY MIDNIGHT WEDNESDAY NIGHT...AND SKIES SHOULD BE PARTLY TO MOSTLY
SUNNY THURSDAY AND FRIDAY.

DONT SEE MUCH NEED TO MAKE CHANGES TO FORECAST TEMPS THROUGH
THURSDAY. THURSDAY NIGHT TEMPS SIMILAR TO MET SOLUTION...GENERALLY
A LITTLE WARMER THAN MAV GUIDANCE.
&&

.LONG TERM (AFTER FRIDAY)...
ANOTHER SOUTHERN STREAM SYSTEM TO AFFECT US OVER THE WEEKEND. TIMING
VARIES AMONG MEDIUM RANGE MODELS. MOISTURE SHOULD MOVE BACK INTO
THE AREA SATURDAY NIGHT. ECMWF/UKMET/CANADIAN MODELS ALL MOVE THE
SYSTEM THROUGH THE MIDSOUTH A LITTLE QUICKER THAN GFS. WILL GO WITH
THE MAJORITY AND CLEAR THE PRECIP OUT OF THE AREA BY MONDAY
AFTERNOON. HIGH BEHIND THIS SYSTEM IS OF PACIFIC ORIGIN...SO NO
SIGNIFICANT COOLING FOR EARLY NEXT WEEK.

&&

.MEG...WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MS...NONE.

NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN

.DISCUSSION...
HAVE UPDATED THE FORECAST TO REMOVE FOG ADVISORY WORDING FROM THE
