NOT AS WIDESPREAD. THERE WILL STILL BE PATCHY AREAS OF DENSE FOG
WITH VISIBILITIES BRIEFLY DOWN TO 1/4 MILE OR LESS. THIS SHOULD NOT
BE WIDESPREAD THOUGH.


.PREVIOUS DISCUSSION FROM 418 AM...

THE OVERALL UPPER LEVEL PATTERN THIS MORNING SHOWS A BROAD LONG-WAVE
TROUGH OVER THE WESTERN STATES WITH A FLATTENING RIDGE OVER THE
EAST. THIS BROAD WESTERN TROUGH WILL CONTINUE TO TRANSLATE EAST AND
BY THE END OF THE WEEK...THE TROUGH WILL DEEPEN OVER THE EASTERN
U.S. WITH SOME RIDGING EXPECTED OVER THE INTER-MOUNTAIN WEST. AN
UPPER LOW WILL CUT OFF OVER THE SOUTHWEST U.S. BY THE END OF THE
WEEK AND BEGIN TO LIFT OUT TO THE EAST OVER THE WEEKEND. THIS
WEATHER FEATURE WILL BE A FACTOR IN OUR WEATHER SATURDAY AND SUNDAY.
&&

.SHORT TERM (TODAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...
A COLD FRONT STRETCHED ACROSS WESTERN KENTUCKY...SOUTHEAST
MISSOURI...AND ACROSS NORTHEAST ARKANSAS EARLY THIS MORNING WILL
CONTINUE TO SLOWLY PROGRESS SOUTHEAST TODAY. COOLER AIRMASS WILL
CONTINUE TO BLEED SOUTHWARD THROUGH THE DAY BEHIND THIS FRONT...SO DO
NOT EXPECT MUCH MOVEMENT IN THE TEMPERATURES DURING THE DAY...
ESPECIALLY ACROSS NORTHERN SECTIONS. DENSE FOG CONTINUES OVER
PORTIONS OF THE AREA THIS MORNING...BUT VISIBILITIES ARE BEGINNING
TO IMPROVE SO WILL CONTINUE TO MONITOR BUT THINK 6 AM EXPIRATION
LOOKS OK FOR NOW.

THE COLD FRONT SHOULD STALL ACROSS NORTH-CENTRAL MISSISSIPPI LATER
TODAY. HAVE KEPT SLIGHT CHANCE POPS GOING ACROSS NORTH MISSISSIPPI
TODAY WITH THE FRONTAL BOUNDARY LINGERING ACROSS REGION. THE NEXT
WEATHER SYSTEM WILL BEGIN TO AFFECT THE WEATHER ACROSS THE MID SOUTH
LATER TONIGHT INTO WEDNESDAY MORNING. WATER VAPOR IMAGERY SHOWS A
SHORTWAVE TROUGH MOVING ACROSS THE ROCKY MOUNTAIN STATES EARLY THIS
MORNING WITH SUBTROPICAL MOISTURE CONTINUING TO FLOW ACROSS NORTHERN
MEXICO AND INTO TEXAS. THIS SHORTWAVE IS PROGGED BY BOTH THE NAM/GFS
TO PULL EAST ACROSS THE PLAINS STATES TODAY AND ACROSS THE
MISSISSIPPI VALLEY TONIGHT. DEEP MOISTURE WILL BEGIN TO RETURN
NORTHWARD OVER THE STALLED FRONTAL BOUNDARY LATER TONIGHT IN ADVANCE
OF THE SHORTWAVE TROUGH. EXPECT OVERRUNNING RAIN TO BREAK OUT ACROSS
SOUTHERN SECTIONS LATE THIS EVENING AND SPREAD NORTH OVER THE
REMAINDER OF THE FORECAST AREA AFTER MIDNIGHT. THE NAM/GFS MODELS
HANDLING PRECIP EVENT A BIT DIFFERENTLY...WITH THE NAM A BIT FURTHER
NORTH WITH THE RAIN AS COMPARED TO THE GFS. IN ANY EVENT...EXPECTING
SOUTHERN AREAS TO SEE THE BEST CHANCES FOR RAINFALL WITH DECREASING
CHANCES FURTHER NORTH. ANY RAIN THAT DOES FALL SHOULD REMAIN ON THE
LIGHT SIDE. THIS SHORTWAVE TROUGH SHOULD MOVE EAST ON WEDNESDAY...
BRINGING AN END TO ANY RAIN BY WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON...EXCEPT ACROSS
FAR SOUTHEAST ZONES WHERE RAIN MAY HANG ON A BIT LONGER.

HIGH PRESSURE WILL BUILD OVER THE AREA FOR WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH
FRIDAY...WITH DRY WEATHER AND COOLER TEMPERATURES.
&&

.LONG TERM (FRIDAY THROUGH MONDAY)...
UPPER LEVEL LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM OVER THE SOUTHWEST U.S. WILL MOVE
EAST TOWARDS THE MID SOUTH OVER THE WEEKEND. EXPECT ANOTHER
OVERRUNNING TYPE RAIN EVENT...SO HAVE KEPT CHANCES FOR RAIN IN THE
FORECAST FOR SATURDAY THROUGH SUNDAY NIGHT. SYSTEM SHOULD MOVE EAST
BY MONDAY ALLOWING THINGS TO DRY OUT. TEMPERATURES SHOULD WARM UP
DURING THE EXTENDED PERIOD AS THE LOW LEVEL FLOW TURNS MORE
SOUTHERLY.
&&

.MEG...WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MS...NONE.
MO...NONE.
TN...NONE.
&&

$$

HIGH PRESSURE WILL BUILD OVER THE AREA FOR WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH
FRIDAY...WITH DRY WEATHER AND COOLER TEMPERATURES.
&&

.LONG TERM (FRIDAY THROUGH MONDAY)...
UPPER LEVEL LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM OVER THE SOUTHWEST U.S. WILL MOVE
EAST TOWARDS THE MID SOUTH OVER THE WEEKEND. EXPECT ANOTHER
OVERRUNNING TYPE RAIN EVENT...SO HAVE KEPT CHANCES FOR RAIN IN THE
FORECAST FOR SATURDAY THROUGH SUNDAY NIGHT. SYSTEM SHOULD MOVE EAST
BY MONDAY ALLOWING THINGS TO DRY OUT. TEMPERATURES SHOULD WARM UP
DURING THE EXTENDED PERIOD AS THE LOW LEVEL FLOW TURNS MORE
SOUTHERLY.

FXUS64 KMEG 080210
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
810 PM CST MON FEB 7 2005

.DISCUSSION...
CLOUDS WERE SLOWLY CLEARING FROM WEST TO EAST THIS EVENING. THE LINE 
OF CLOUDS EXTENDED FROM PADUCAH TO DYERSBURG TO FORREST CITY AND 
EASTWARD. OTHER CLOUDS WERE OVER CENTRAL ARKANSAS IN ASSOCIATION 
WITH THE UPPER LEVEL DISTURBANCE. 

RAINFALL CONTINUES TO FALL ACROSS PARTS OF WEST TN AND MAINLY OVER 
NORTHEASTERN MS. THE RAIN WILL MOVE EASTWARD OVER THE NEXT SEVERAL 
HOURS. BY MIDNIGHT MOST OF THE PRECIPITATION WILL BE OVER FOR THE 
NIGHT. 

THE COLD FRONT OVER SOUTH/CENTRAL MO IS STILL ON TRACK TO OOZE INTO 
THE FORECAST AREA BY DAY BREAK. OVERNIGHT TEMPERATURES ARE ON TRACK 
SO NO CHANGES THERE. WILL ONLY UPDATE PRECIP WORDING AND CLOUD 
COVER. UPDATE OUT SHORTLY.

&&

.MEG...WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MS...NONE.
MO...NONE.
TN...NONE.

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 072010
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
210 PM CST MON FEB 7 2005

.DISCUSSION...
COLD FRONT ALONG A STL-DFW LINE EARLY THIS AFTERNOON...AND MAY BE
GETTING HUNG UP IN THE OZARKS. LARGE AREA OF RAIN OVER SOUTHERN
ARKANSAS AND NORTH MISSISSIPPI TRANSLATING ENE. TEMPERATURES
GENERALLY IN THE 50S AT 19Z.
&&

.SHORT TERM (THROUGH THURSDAY)...
COLD FRONT FORECAST TO MOVE INTO THE CWA TONIGHT AND BECOME QUASI-
STATIONARY UNTIL SOMETIME ON WEDNESDAY. IMPULSES WILL MOVE ALONG
THE FRONT THROUGH WEDNESDAY MORNING. GFS CONSIDERABLY MORE AGRESSIVE
IN MOVING FRONT SOUTHEASTWARD...BY ABOUT 100 TO 150 MILES BY
WEDNESDAY MORNING. RAIN AREA ACROSS AR AND MS WILL CONTINUE ITS TREK
ACROSS THE SOUTHERN HALF OF THE AREA OVERNIGHT TONIGHT...AND POPS
WILL BE BASED ON RADAR TRENDS. CATEGORICAL BEFORE MIDNIGHT ACROSS
MOST OF AREA...WITH CHANCE TO SLIGHT CHANCE AFTER MIDNIGHT. A
RELATIVE LULL DURING THE DAY TUESDAY...WITH ONLY A SLIGHT CHANCE
MENTIONED ACROSS THE SOUTHERN HALF OF THE AREA.

TUESDAY NIGHT...MODEL POPS HIGHLY DIVERGENT. MET GUIDANCE HAS
CATEGORICAL POPS ACROSS JUST ABOUT THE ENTIRE AREA...WITH MAV
GUIDANCE IN THE 15 TO 30 PERCENT RANGE. EARLIER FORECAST HAD 40
POPS IN IT...AND THIS SEEMS LIKE A REASONABLE COMPROMISE WITH THE
NEIGHBORS FOR NOW. HOPEFULLY...MODEL GUIDANCE WILL COME A LITTLE MORE
INTO AGREEMENT OVER NEXT RUN OR TWO.

PRECIP SHOULD CLEAR THE AREA WEDNESDAY MORNING AS FRONT FINALLY
PUSHES THROUGH. CLOUDS WILL DECREASE BY WEDNESDAY NIGHT...THURSDAY
WILL BE DRY.

EXACT LOCATION OF FRONT OVER NEXT TWO DAYS WILL DETERMINE ACCURACY
OF TEMPERATURE FORECAST. THROUGH WEDNESDAY...TEMPS TRENDED TOWARD
GFS SOLUTION...BUT EXPECT FORECAST TO BUST SOMEWHERE...SOMETIME.
DIURNAL SPREADS GENERALLY 10 DEGREES OR LESS THROUGH WEDNESDAY. ETA
SOLUTION WOULD COME AROUND TO NEAR GFS NUMBERS FOR WEDNESDAY NIGHT
AND THURSDAY.
&&

.LONG TERM (AFTER THURSDAY)...
LOW CONFIDENCE IN CURRENT GFS FORECAST SOLUTION WITH SYSTEM TRYING
TO COME OVER THE RIDGE DURING THE WEEKEND. THIS SOLUTION APPEARS TO
BE CONSIDERABLY FASTER THAN UKMET/CANADIAN/ECMWF SOLUTIONS. WILL
CONTINUE MENTION OF PRECIPITATION SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY
NIGHT...BUT WILL KEEP IN CHANCE CATEGORY. NO SIGNIFICANT CHANGES TO
TEMPERATURE FORECAST.
&&

.MEG...WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MS...NONE.
MO...NONE.
TN...NONE.
&&

$$

WAGNER





000 
FXUS64 KMEG 071615
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
1015 AM CST MON FEB 7 2005

.DISCUSSION...
SEE LITTLE NEED FOR A MID-MORNING UPDATE TODAY. SYSTEM PROGRESSING
PRETTY MUCH AS FORECAST.

LARGE PORTION OF RAIN AREA IS NOW EAST OF THE MISSISSIPPI RIVER.
STILL HAVE ANOTHER WAVE DOWN TO OUR SOUTHWEST OVER TEXAS...AND SOME
ISOLATED SHOWERS OVER NORTHERN ARKANSAS. PRUDENT CHOICE IS TO LEAVE
POPS IN WEST OF THE MISSISSIPPI RIVER. NOT SEEING MUCH MENTION OF
THUNDER AT THIS TIME...NOR SATELLITE INDICATIONS OF A DRY SLOT
DEVELOPING. IF CONDITIONS STAY AS THEY ARE...WILL REMOVE MENTION OF
THUNDER WITH AN EARLY AFTERNOON UPDATE.

TEMPERATURES CURRENTLY IN LOW TO MID 50S. WITH NO SUNSHINE...
FORECAST HIGHS MAY BE TOUGH TO ATTAIN. WILL MONITOR FOR POSSIBLE
UPDATE ALONG WITH PREVIOUSLY MENTIONED THUNDER.
&&

.PREVIOUS DISCUSSION ISSUED AT 345 AM CST...
DECENT 500 MB SHORTWAVE TROF MOVING ACRS KS THIS MORNING. A SFC
FRONT WAS LOCATED FROM THE LOWER GREAT LAKES SOUTH ACRS MO INTO ERN
OK. A COUPLE OF ILL DEFINED SFC LOWS COULD BE FOUND ALONG THE FRONT.
A LARGE SHIELD OF RAIN COVERED MUCH OF AR THIS MORNING WITH PRECIP
HAVING A TOUGH TIME MOVING ACRS THE RIVER.

ANOTHER SHORTWAVE WL MOVE NE OUT OF TX TODAY WITH SFC FRONT PUSHING
SLOWLY SE INTO THE MID SOUTH. EXPECT WIDESPREAD PRECIP AHEAD OF THE
FRONT WITH A LARGE AREA OF DEEP MOISTURE AND STRONG LIFT MOVING ACRS
THE AREA TODAY. PRECIP WL WORK EASTWARD AND TAPER OFF FROM THE
WEST THIS AFTN. STRONG DRY PUNCH MOVING INTO AR LATER TODAY ASSOCD
WITH SHORTWAVE MAY RESULT IN SOME SUNSHINE AHEAD OF THE SFC FRONT
AS IT ARRIVES INTO NE AR LATE THIS AFTN. IT IS A BIT OF A
STRETCH...BUT THERE MAY BE ENUF INSTABILITY FOR SOME ISOLD TSTMS
ALONG THE FRONT BY LATE THIS AFTN. NAM INDICATES LIS AROUND ZERO
THOUGH SFC BASED CAPES REACH 1000 J/KG ACRS CNTRL AR LATE TODAY.
NEWEST MODEL RUNS BACKING OFF ON THE DRY PUNCH A LITTLE ACRS OUR
AREA.

BY 06Z SHORTWAVE AXIS WL BE ALONG THE RIVER WITH SFC FRONT PROBABLY
FROM MKL-OXFORD. WENT WITH HIGH POPS ACRS ERN SXNS DUE TO THE SLOWER
FRONTAL MOVEMENT AND STRONGER 500 MB SHORTWAVE. AFTER 06Z PRECIP WL
TAPER DOWN IN EASTERN SXNS. LEFT ISOLD TSTMS IN FOR THE EVENING TO
COVER ANY AFTN DEVELOPMENT THAT LINGERS INTO THE EVENING.

ON TUE THE WEAK SFC FRONT WL LINGER ACRS THE AREA. PREFER THE NAM
HERE SINCE THE GFS SEEMS A LITTLE TOO AGGRESSIVE PUSHING THE FRONT
THROUGH. SHOULD BE A GOOD DEAL OF CLOUDINESS AND NO REAL TRIGGERS ON
TUE SO WL GO WITH A DRY FORECAST NORTH OF MEM AND A SLIGHT CHC TO
THE SOUTH ALONG THE FRONT. LOOKS LIKE AN OVERRUNNING SITUATION ON
TUE NIGHT AS A SHORTWAVE RACES ACRS THE MID MS VALLEY WITH 115 JET
SOMEWHERE ACRS THE REGION. GFS TENDS TO SUPPRESS PRECIP ALONG THE
GULF COAST WHILE THE NAM PUSHES IT FURTHER NORTH. ATTM THINK THE
CURRENT 40 POPS ARE FINE.

CDFNT PUSHES THROUGH ON WED WITH A MUCH COOLER AIRMASS. EXPECT WED
THROUGH FRI NIGHT TO BE DRY AND COOL WITH HIGH PRESSURE DOMINATING
THE WEATHER PATTERN. ANOTHER OVERRUNNING EVENT SETS UP FOR THE
WEEKEND WITH MORE CHANCES FOR RAIN.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...CORRECTED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
345 AM CST MON FEB 7 2005

.DISCUSSION...
DECENT 500 MB SHORTWAVE TROF MOVING ACRS KS THIS MORNING. A SFC 
FRONT WAS LOCATED FROM THE LOWER GREAT LAKES SOUTH ACRS MO INTO ERN 
OK. A COUPLE OF ILL DEFINED SFC LOWS COULD BE FOUND ALONG THE FRONT. 
A LARGE SHIELD OF RAIN COVERED MUCH OF AR THIS MORNING WITH PRECIP 
HAVING A TOUGH TIME MOVING ACRS THE RIVER.

ANOTHER SHORTWAVE WL MOVE NE OUT OF TX TODAY WITH SFC FRONT PUSHING 
SLOWLY SE INTO THE MID SOUTH. EXPECT WIDESPREAD PRECIP AHEAD OF THE 
FRONT WITH A LARGE AREA OF DEEP MOISTURE AND STRONG LIFT MOVING ACRS 
THE AREA TODAY. PRECIP WL WORK EASTWARD AND TAPER OFF FROM THE 
WEST THIS AFTN. STRONG DRY PUNCH MOVING INTO AR LATER TODAY ASSOCD 
WITH SHORTWAVE MAY RESULT IN SOME SUNSHINE AHEAD OF THE SFC FRONT 
AS IT ARRIVES INTO NE AR LATE THIS AFTN. IT IS A BIT OF A 
STRETCH...BUT THERE MAY BE ENUF INSTABILITY FOR SOME ISOLD TSTMS 
ALONG THE FRONT BY LATE THIS AFTN. NAM INDICATES LIS AROUND ZERO 
THOUGH SFC BASED CAPES REACH 1000 J/KG ACRS CNTRL AR LATE TODAY. 
NEWEST MODEL RUNS BACKING OFF ON THE DRY PUNCH A LITTLE ACRS OUR 
AREA. 

BY 06Z SHORTWAVE AXIS WL BE ALONG THE RIVER WITH SFC FRONT PROBABLY 
FROM MKL-OXFORD. WENT WITH HIGH POPS ACRS ERN SXNS DUE TO THE SLOWER 
FRONTAL MOVEMENT AND STRONGER 500 MB SHORTWAVE. AFTER 06Z PRECIP WL 
TAPER DOWN IN EASTERN SXNS. LEFT ISOLD TSTMS IN FOR THE EVENING TO 
COVER ANY AFTN DEVELOPMENT THAT LINGERS INTO THE EVENING.

ON TUE THE WEAK SFC FRONT WL LINGER ACRS THE AREA. PREFER THE NAM 
HERE SINCE THE GFS SEEMS A LITTLE TOO AGGRESSIVE PUSHING THE FRONT 
THROUGH. SHOULD BE A GOOD DEAL OF CLOUDINESS AND NO REAL TRIGGERS ON 
TUE SO WL GO WITH A DRY FORECAST NORTH OF MEM AND A SLIGHT CHC TO 
THE SOUTH ALONG THE FRONT. LOOKS LIKE AN OVERRUNNING SITUATION ON 
TUE NIGHT AS A SHORTWAVE RACES ACRS THE MID MS VALLEY WITH 115 JET 
SOMEWHERE ACRS THE REGION. GFS TENDS TO SUPPRESS PRECIP ALONG THE 
GULF COAST WHILE THE NAM PUSHES IT FURTHER NORTH. ATTM THINK THE 
CURRENT 40 POPS ARE FINE.

CDFNT PUSHES THROUGH ON WED WITH A MUCH COOLER AIRMASS. EXPECT WED 
THROUGH FRI NIGHT TO BE DRY AND COOL WITH HIGH PRESSURE DOMINATING 
THE WEATHER PATTERN. ANOTHER OVERRUNNING EVENT SETS UP FOR THE 
WEEKEND WITH MORE CHANCES FOR RAIN.

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 070321
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
918 PM CST SUN FEB 6 2005

.DISCUSSION...LATEST SURFACE ANALYSIS PLACES A BROAD AREA OF LOW 
PRESSURE ACROSS OKLAHOMA AND A SURFACE RIDGE ALONG THE EAST COAST. 
LATEST 88D REGIONAL RADARS HAVE SHOWN AN INCREASE IN RETURNS ACROSS 
THE REGION...BUT NO RAINFALL ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA YET. LATEST 
00Z NAM RUN SUGGESTS PRECIPITATION WILL BE SLOW TO PROGRESS ACROSS 
THE FORECAST AREA OVERNIGHT...ESPECIALLY EAST OF THE MISSISSIPPI 
RIVER. CURRENT GRIDS HANDLING FORECAST WELL AND WILL NOT PLAN TO 
ISSUE AN UPDATE AT THIS TIME.

CJC
 
.PREV DISCUSSION...ISSUED SUN FEB 6 2004.

ON MONDAY...THIS AREA OF RAIN WILL CONTINUE TO MOVE EAST THROUGHOUT 
THE DAY. BOTH GFS AND NAM...FORMERLY ETA...BOTH SHOW A DRY SLOT 
MOVING INTO AREAS ALONG AND WEST OF THE MISSISSIPPI RIVER BY 
AFTERNOON. THE SURFACE COLD FRONT WILL BE ENTERING NORTHEAST 
ARKANSAS DURING THE AFTERNOON AS WELL. IF THE CLOUDS BREAK UP SOME 
THEN THERE IS A CHANCE FOR A FEW THUNDERSTORMS ALONG AND WEST OF THE 
RIVER DURING THE AFTERNOON. ALTHOUGH SEVERE PARAMETERS LOOK PRETTY 
WEAK...SOME SMALL HAIL AND GUSTY WINDS COULD BE POSSIBLE DUE TO THE 
LOW WET BULB ZERO LEVELS AROUND 7-8KFT. EXPECT CLOUDS AND RAIN TO 
HOLD DOWN THE TEMPS TOMORROW EAST OF THE MISSISSIPPI RIVER. SHOWER 
AND THUNDERSTORM CHANCES WILL LINGER INTO MONDAY NIGHT AS THE COLD 
FRONT MOVER FURTHER INTO THE AREA BEFORE STALLING. ETA STALLS THE 
FRONT ALONG THE I40 CORRIDOR WHILE THE GFS NEARLY BRINGS IT 
COMPLETELY OUT OF THE REGION. 

ON TUESDAY...UPPER SHORTRIDGE BUILDS OVER THE AREA WITH ONLY RAIN 
CHANCES ALONG THE FRONT AND MODELS INDICATE THAT SUBSIDENCE FROM THE 
RIDGE WILL BE SUFFICIENT TO MAKE ANY DEVELOPMENT ISOLATED. BY 
TUESDAY NIGHT THE NEXT UPPER SHORTWAVE ARRIVES AND A WAVE WILL 
DEVELOP ALONG THE FRONT. PLACEMENT OF THE FRONT WILL BE IMPORTANT 
WITH RESPECT TO RAIN CHANCES. IF THE FRONT IS SOUTH OF THE AREA AS 
THE GFS INDICATES...THAN MOST OF THE AREA SHOULD REMAIN DRY WITH 
MOISTURE WITH THE SURFACE FEATURE STAYING SOUTH OF THE REGION AND 
MOISTURE WITH THE SHORTWAVE STAYING JUST NORTH OF THE AREA. 
HOWEVER...IF THE ETA PLACEMENT OF THE FRONT IS CORRECT THEN RAIN 
CHANCES ARE LIKELY TUESDAY NIGHT PERHAPS LINGERING INTO WEDNESDAY. 
THERE IS SOME INSTABILITY SOUTH OF THE FRONT ALTHOUGH NOT MUCH AND 
NOT EXPECTING ANYTHING SEVERE AT THIS TIME. 

BY WEDNESDAY NIGHT HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS IN FROM CANADA RESULTING IN 
DRY AND COOL CONDITIONS. THE NEXT RAIN CHANCES WILL BE NEXT WEEKEND 
WHEN A FULL LATITUDE TROUGH WILL MOVE THROUGH THE REGION.

&&

.MEG...WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MS...NONE.
MO...NONE.
TN...NONE.
&&

$$

VALLE

FXUS64 KMEG 062023
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
223 PM CST SUN FEB 6 2005

.DISCUSSION...
THERE IS A LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM OVER THE TEXAS PANHANDLE TODAY. THIS 
SYSTEM IS MOVING TOWARDS THE NORTHEAST AND IS WEAKENING. A SECONDARY 
SYSTEM TRAILS IT IN NEW MEXICO. UPPER LEVEL RIDGE AND ASSOCIATED 
HIGH PRESSURE SYSTEM HAS MOVED INTO THE APPALACHIAN REGION. THERE 
HAS BEEN A GOOD DEAL OF LOW LEVEL DRY AIR IN PLACE OVER THE AREA 
TODAY AS A RESULT OF THE PROXIMITY TO THE HIGH. MUCH OF THE RADAR 
ECHOS HAVE BEEN VIRGA FALLING OUT OF MID LEVEL CLOUDS. PERHAPS THERE 
HAS BEEN SOME VERY LIGHT RAIN SCATTERED ABOUT NORTHEAST ARKANSAS 
WHERE LOWER ATMOSPHERE IS BEGINNING TO MOISTEN UP. THE SHOWER 
ACTIVITY OVER WESTERN ARKANSAS IS A COMBINATION OF THE UPPER 
JET...UPPER SHORTWAVE ASSOCIATED WITH THE LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM AND 
LOW LEVEL JET. 

THE UPPER RIDGE WILL MOVE SLOWLY EASTWARD TONIGHT. THE JET DYNAMICS 
WILL SHIFT EASTWARD AS WELL. THE LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM OVER OKLAHOMA 
WILL MOVE INTO THE NORTHERN PLAINS TO BE REPLACED BY THE TRAILING 
SYSTEM. THE END RESULT WILL BE A MOISTENING OF THE LOWER ATMOSPHERE 
AND RAIN BECOMING HIGHLY LIKELY...ESPECIALLY OVERNIGHT...FOR THE 
COUNTIES ALONG AND WEST OF THE MISSISSIPPI RIVER. RAIN CHANCES EAST 
OF THIS AREA WILL BE LARGELY DUE TO UNCERTAINTY OF EASTWARD 
PROGRESSION OF THE RAIN. ON MONDAY...THIS AREA OF RAIN WILL CONTINUE 
TO MOVE EAST THROUGHOUT THE DAY. BOTH GFS AND NAM...FORMERLY 
ETA...BOTH SHOW A DRY SLOT MOVING INTO AREAS ALONG AND WEST OF THE 
MISSISSIPPI RIVER BY AFTERNOON. THE SURFACE COLD FRONT WILL BE 
ENTERING NORTHEAST ARKANSAS DURING THE AFTERNOON AS WELL. IF THE 
CLOUDS BREAK UP SOME THEN THERE IS A CHANCE FOR A FEW THUNDERSTORMS 
ALONG AND WEST OF THE RIVER DURING THE AFTERNOON. ALTHOUGH SEVERE 
PARAMETERS LOOK PRETTY WEAK...SOME SMALL HAIL AND GUSTY WINDS COULD 
BE POSSIBLE DUE TO THE LOW WET BULB ZERO LEVELS AROUND 7-8KFT. 
EXPECT CLOUDS AND RAIN TO HOLD DOWN THE TEMPS TOMORROW EAST OF THE 
MISSISSIPPI RIVER. SHOWER AND THUNDERSTORM CHANCES WILL LINGER INTO 
MONDAY NIGHT AS THE COLD FRONT MOVER FURTHER INTO THE AREA BEFORE 
STALLING. ETA STALLS THE FRONT ALONG THE I40 CORRIDOR WHILE THE GFS 
NEARLY BRINGS IT COMPLETELY OUT OF THE REGION. 

ON TUESDAY...UPPER SHORTRIDGE BUILDS OVER THE AREA WITH ONLY RAIN 
CHANCES ALONG THE FRONT AND MODELS INDICATE THAT SUBSIDENCE FROM THE 
RIDGE WILL BE SUFFICIENT TO MAKE ANY DEVELOPMENT ISOLATED. BY 
TUESDAY NIGHT THE NEXT UPPER SHORTWAVE ARRIVES AND A WAVE WILL 
DEVELOP ALONG THE FRONT. PLACEMENT OF THE FRONT WILL BE IMPORTANT 
WITH RESPECT TO RAIN CHANCES. IF THE FRONT IS SOUTH OF THE AREA AS 
THE GFS INDICATES...THAN MOST OF THE AREA SHOULD REMAIN DRY WITH 
MOISTURE WITH THE SURFACE FEATURE STAYING SOUTH OF THE REGION AND 
MOISTURE WITH THE SHORTWAVE STAYING JUST NORTH OF THE AREA. 
HOWEVER...IF THE ETA PLACEMENT OF THE FRONT IS CORRECT THEN RAIN 
CHANCES ARE LIKELY TUESDAY NIGHT PERHAPS LINGERING INTO WEDNESDAY. 
THERE IS SOME INSTABILITY SOUTH OF THE FRONT ALTHOUGH NOT MUCH AND 
NOT EXPECTING ANYTHING SEVERE AT THIS TIME. 

BY WEDNESDAY NIGHT HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS IN FROM CANADA RESULTING IN 
DRY AND COOL CONDITIONS. THE NEXT RAIN CHANCES WILL BE NEXT WEEKEND 
WHEN A FULL LATITUDE TROUGH WILL MOVE THROUGH THE REGION.

938 AM CST SUN FEB 6 2005

.DISCUSSION...
RADAR SHOWS A FAIR AMOUNT OF ECHOS OVER ARKANSAS. COMPARED TO 
SURFACE OBSERVATIONS...MOST OF THESE ECHOS ARE NOT REACHING THE 
SURFACE AND WHATEVER IS MAKING IT IS VERY LIGHT RAIN...PROBABLY 
SPRINKLES. REGIONAL RADAR SHOWS THAT THE MORE SIGNIFICANT RAINFALL 
IS STILL OVER THE WESTERN HALF OF ARKANSAS. ATMOSPHERE SHOULD 
CONTINUE TO MOISTEN TODAY AS LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM MOVES NORTHEASTWARD 
THROUGH THE CENTRAL PLAINS. ONLY CHANGES TO BE MADE TO FORECAST WILL 
BE DUE TO AFTERNOON WORDING. OTHERWISE...FORECAST LOOKS ON TRACK 
WITH MEASURABLE RAIN MOVING INTO THE AREA LATE THIS AFTERNOON AND 
TONIGHT.

FXUS64 KMEG 060916
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
315 AM CST SUN FEB 6 2005

.DISCUSSION...
CLOUDS INCREASING TODAY SHORTWAVE MOVES INTO THE SOUTHERN PLAINS AND 
SFC LOW PRESSURE DEVELOPS OVER OK BY 00Z MON. EXPECT RAIN TO START 
TO THREATEN LATER TODAY WEST OF THE RIVER AS THE DRY LOWER LEVELS OF 
THE ATMOSPHERE TAKE A WHILE TO SATURATE. ALL IN ALL SHOULD BE A 
FAIRLY DECENT DAY WITH TEMPS AROUND 60...EXCEPT A LITTLE COOLER ACRS 
NE AR WHERE RAIN AND CLOUDS ARE MOST LIKELY. 

SHORTWAVE MOVES INTO SW MO/NW AR BY 12Z MON WITH SFC LOW OVER CNTRL 
MO. AXIS OF STRONG LIFT AND DEEP MOISTURE WL STRETCH FROM SRN IL 
SOUTHWARD ALONG THE MS RIVER AT 12Z MON. WL GO WITH CATEGORICAL 
POPS WEST OF THE RIVER DROPPING TO CHC ACRS NE MS. THIS AXIS OF LIFT 
AND MOISTURE WL MOVE ACRS THE MID SOUTH ON MON...SO EXPECT HIGH 
POPS. ATTM INSTABILITY LOOKS MARGINAL AT BEST SO WL CONT THE NO 
THUNDER FORECAST. RAIN WL SHUT OFF FROM WEST TO EAST MON AFTN AS DRY 
AIR PUNCHES IN FROM THE SW. SHOULD SEE TEMPS REBOUND NICELY ACRS WRN 
SXNS OF THE MID SOUTH DURING THE AFTN.

MON NIGHT AND TUE...TRAILING COLD FRONT STALLS SOMEWHERE...PROBABLY 
ACRS NRN OR CNTRL MS. WL CONT A SMALL POPS ACRS NE MS...NO PRECIP 
WITH MILD TEMPS ACRS REMAINDER OF THE AREA.

TUE NIGHT AND WED...A DECENT SHORTWAVE FORECAST TO MOVE OUT OF THE 
NRN PLAINS. NAM IS A LITTLE MORE STRONGER WITH UPPER SYSTEM AND 
DEVELOPS A SFC LOW ALONG THE BOUNDARY ACRS THE REGION. MEANWHILE THE 
GFS IS WEAKER WITH NOT MUCH OF A SFC SYSTEM. BEST BET IS TO CONT 
SMALL POPS TUE NIGHT/WED. 

HIGH PRESSURE RETURNS FROM WED NIGHT THROUGH SAT WITH SEASONABLE 
TEMPS. NEXT SYSTEM APPROACHES THIS WEEKEND WITH RAIN POSSIBLE BY 
SAT NIGHT.

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 060321
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
919 PM CST SAT FEB 5 2005

.DISCUSSION...LATEST SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS HIGH PRESSURE CENTERED 
ACROSS THE APPALACHIANS WITH THE MID SOUTH IN A LIGHT SOUTHEAST 
RETURN FLOW REGIME. INFRARED SHOWS ALTOCUMULUS/CIRRUS DECK 
OVERSPREADING MUCH OF THE FORECAST AREA THIS EVENING ASSOCIATED WITH 
A DIGGING TROUGH ENTERING THE PACIFIC NORTHWEST. AS A RESULT THE 
SUBTROPICAL JET HAS AMPLIFIED ACROSS THE REGION BRINGING A RETURN OF 
MOISTURE BACK TO THE AREA. CURRENT TEMPERATURES ARE MAINLY IN THE 
LOWER 40S NORTH TO THE LOWER 50S SOUTH. A WEAK UPPER LEVEL SHORTWAVE 
WILL MOVE ACROSS WESTERN ARKANSAS/MISSOURI OVERNIGHT BUT WILL NOT 
RESULT IN ANY PRECIPITATION ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA.  00Z MODEL 
RUNS SHOW ISENTROPIC ASCENT BEGINNING TO INCREASE BY SUNDAY MORNING. 
BUT ANY RAINFALL WILL HOLD OFF UNTIL SUNDAY AFTERNOON ACROSS THE MID 
SOUTH WITH QUITE A BIT OF LOW LEVEL DRY AIR IN PLACE FOR THE 
ATMOSPHERE TO OVERCOME. WILL MAKE MINOR TWEAKS TO FORECAST BASED 
UPON CURRENT TRENDS.

UPDATED GRIDS WILL BE OUT SHORTLY

CJC

.PREV DISCUSSION...ISSUED 246 PM CST SAT FEB 5 2005.

ON SUNDAY...MODELS SHOW THAT THE LOW WILL WEAKEN AS IT LIFTS OUT AND 
RUNS INTO THE RIDGE. ALSO...THE LOW WILL LIKELY STAY FAR ENOUGH 
NORTHWEST DUE TO THE SLOW EASTWARD PROGRESSION OF THE RIDGE THAT 
MOST OF THE REGION WILL REMAIN DRY. THE LONE EXCEPTION WILL LIKELY 
BE NORTHWEST OF JONESBORO WHERE RAIN MAY MAKE IT IN DURING THE 
AFTERNOON. GFS BRINGS A GOOD DEAL SATURATES THE MID LEVELS DURING 
THE AFTERNOON...HENCE THE LOWER CHANCE POPS EAST OF THE JONESBORO 
AREA. WITH CLOUDS AROUND DURING A GOOD PORTION OF THE 
DAY...ESPECIALLY IN THE AFTERNOON HAVE FORECASTED HIGHS TO BE 
SLIGHTLY BELOW GUIDANCE. THE BETTER CHANCES FOR RAIN WILL BE SUNDAY 
NIGHT AND MONDAY AS THE SECONDARY VORT MAX CURRENTLY OVER SOUTHERN 
CALIFORNIA BEGINS TO ARRIVE. BY THIS TIME THE RIDGE WILL HAVE MOVED 
FAR ENOUGH EAST THAT THE COMBINATION OF THE WEAK SHORTWAVE 
ASSOCIATED WITH THE VORT...GOOD JET DYNAMICS AND LOW LEVEL JET 
BRINGING WARM MOIST AIR INTO THE REGION WILL RESULT IN HIGH CHANCES 
OF RAIN WEST OF A LINE FROM ROUGHLY JACKSON TO OXFORD. FURTHER 
EAST...INFLUENCE OF THE RIDGE WILL HINDER RAIN CHANCES. MID LEVEL 
LAPSE RATES...LIS AND CAPE DURING THIS TIME LOOKS TOO STABLE FOR ANY 
MENTION OF THUNDERSTORMS. 

ON MONDAY...THE UPPER SHORTWAVE AND UPPER JET WILL MOVE OVER THE 
REGION RESULTING IN HIGH CHANCES FOR RAIN. THE EUROPEAN MODEL IS IN 
GOOD AGREEMENT WITH THE GFS IN TERMS OF TIMING OF THE SYSTEM ON 
MONDAY. THIS WOULD TAKE MOST OF THE MORE SIGNIFICANT RAIN EAST OF 
THE REGION BY 00Z WITH AREAS ALONG AND WEST OF THE MISSISSIPPI RIVER 
PERHAPS EVEN SEEING SOME AFTERNOON SUNSHINE. THE NAM...FORMERLY THE 
ETA...IS MUCH SLOWER WITH THE PROGRESSION. NAM LOOKS LIKE IT 
CONTINUES THE CONVECTION OVER LOUISIANA AND MISSISSIPPI DURING THE 
AFTERNOON IN RESPONSE TO WHAT IS A WEAKENING UPPER JET BY THAT TIME. 
GIVEN THE GOOD CONSENSUS BETWEEN THE ECMWF AND THE GFS...FAVOR THAT 
SOLUTION. FAVOR MAV GUIDANCE FOR JONESBORO WITH AFTERNOON SUN AND 
LOWER CHANCES FOR RAIN. WENT COOLER THAN GUIDANCE EAST OF THE 
MISSISSIPPI RIVER DUE TO CLOUDINESS/RAIN CHANCES LINGERING INTO THE 
AFTERNOON. 

ON MONDAY NIGHT AND TUESDAY THE ASSOCIATED COLD FRONT WILL HAVE 
STALLED FROM NORTHWEST MS INTO LOUISIANA. GFS SUGGESTS CHANCES FOR 
RAIN ALONG THE FRONT DUE TO CONTINUED INTERACTION WITH THE 
SUBTROPICAL JET. GFS INSTABILITY DOES SHOW EXTREMELY LOW 
CAPE...PERHAPS A FEW THUNDERSTORMS ARE POSSIBLE ALONG THE FRONT BUT 
NOTHING SEVERE.

ON TUESDAY NIGHT...THE GFS NOW BRINGS ANOTHER VORT MAX AND 
ASSOCIATED SHORTWAVE THROUGH PROVIDING ANOTHER SHOT AT RAIN. TODAYS 
RUN IS FASTER THAN PREVIOUS RUNS SO LEFT A SLIGHT CHANCE IN ON 
WEDNESDAY DUE TO TIMING CONCERNS. HIGH PRESSURE SHOULD BUILD INTO 
THE REGION AFTER WEDNESDAY RESULTING IN DRY CONDITIONS AND COOLER 
TEMPERATURES.

VALLE
&&

.MEG...WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MS...NONE.
MO...NONE.
TN...NONE.
&&

FXUS64 KMEG 052046
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
246 PM CST SAT FEB 5 2005

.DISCUSSION...
SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE EXTENDS ALONG THE APPALACHIAN RANGE. THIS IS 
BRINGING A SOUTHEAST WIND INTO THE AREA. A CUT OFF LOW IS OVER 
THE BAJA CALIFORNIA REGION WHICH HAS AMPLIFIED THE RIDGE THAT IS 
OVER THE SOUTHCENTRAL US. THE SOUTHERN EXTENT OF THIS LOW HAS ALSO 
FORCED THE SUBTROPICAL JET NORTHWARD FROM TEXAS AND OVER THE 
MIDSOUTH. A SECONDARY VORT MAX IS ALONG THE SOUTHERN CALIFORNIA 
COAST. 

THE CUT OFF LOW WILL BEGIN TO LIFT OUT TOWARDS THE NORTHNORTHEAST 
TONIGHT. AS IT DOES SO...MID TO HIGH LEVEL MOISTURE ASSOCIATED WITH 
THE SYSTEM WILL TRAVEL ALONG THE JET AND OVER THE REGION TONIGHT. 
WITH THE SURFACE HIGH MOVING OFF TO THE EAST...SHOULD MAINTAIN A 
LIGHT WIND TONIGHT. COMBINED WITH INCREASING CLOUD COVER...THIS 
SHOULD BE SUFFICIENT TO KEEP MIN TEMPS UP. 

MODELS SHOW THAT THE LOW WILL WEAKEN AS IT LIFTS OUT AND RUNS INTO 
THE RIDGE. ALSO...THE LOW WILL LIKELY STAY FAR ENOUGH NORTHWEST DUE 
TO THE SLOW EASTWARD PROGRESSION OF THE RIDGE THAT MOST OF THE 
REGION WILL REMAIN DRY. THE LONE EXCEPTION WILL LIKELY BE NORTHWEST 
OF JONESBORO WHERE RAIN MAY MAKE IT IN DURING THE AFTERNOON. GFS 
BRINGS A GOOD DEAL SATURATES THE MID LEVELS DURING THE 
AFTERNOON...HENCE THE LOWER CHANCE POPS EAST OF THE JONESBORO AREA. 
WITH CLOUDS AROUND DURING A GOOD PORTION OF THE DAY...ESPECIALLY IN 
THE AFTERNOON HAVE FORECASTED HIGHS TO BE SLIGHTLY BELOW GUIDANCE. 
THE BETTER CHANCES FOR RAIN WILL BE SUNDAY NIGHT AND MONDAY AS THE 
SECONDARY VORT MAX CURRENTLY OVER SOUTHERN CALIFORNIA BEGINS TO 
ARRIVE. BY THIS TIME THE RIDGE WILL HAVE MOVED FAR ENOUGH EAST THAT 
THE COMBINATION OF THE WEAK SHORTWAVE ASSOCIATED WITH THE 
VORT...GOOD JET DYNAMICS AND LOW LEVEL JET BRINGING WARM MOIST AIR 
INTO THE REGION WILL RESULT IN HIGH CHANCES OF RAIN WEST OF A LINE 
FROM ROUGHLY JACKSON TO OXFORD. FURTHER EAST...INFLUENCE OF THE 
RIDGE WILL HINDER RAIN CHANCES. MID LEVEL LAPSE RATES...LIS AND CAPE 
DURING THIS TIME LOOKS TOO STABLE FOR ANY MENTION OF THUNDERSTORMS. 

ON MONDAY...THE UPPER SHORTWAVE AND UPPER JET WILL MOVE OVER THE 
REGION RESULTING IN HIGH CHANCES FOR RAIN. THE EUROPEAN MODEL IS IN 
GOOD AGREEMENT WITH THE GFS IN TERMS OF TIMING OF THE SYSTEM ON 
MONDAY. THIS WOULD TAKE MOST OF THE MORE SIGNIFICANT RAIN EAST OF 
THE REGION BY 00Z WITH AREAS ALONG AND WEST OF THE MISSISSIPPI RIVER 
PERHAPS EVEN SEEING SOME AFTERNOON SUNSHINE. THE NAM...FORMERLY THE 
ETA...IS MUCH SLOWER WITH THE PROGRESSION. NAM LOOKS LIKE IT 
CONTINUES THE CONVECTION OVER LOUISIANA AND MISSISSIPPI DURING THE 
AFTERNOON IN RESPONSE TO WHAT IS A WEAKENING UPPER JET BY THAT TIME. 
GIVEN THE GOOD CONSENSUS BETWEEN THE ECMWF AND THE GFS...FAVOR THAT 
SOLUTION. FAVOR MAV GUIDANCE FOR JONESBORO WITH AFTERNOON SUN AND 
LOWER CHANCES FOR RAIN. WENT COOLER THAN GUIDANCE EAST OF THE 
MISSISSIPPI RIVER DUE TO CLOUDINESS/RAIN CHANCES LINGERING INTO THE 
AFTERNOON. 

ON MONDAY NIGHT AND TUESDAY THE ASSOCIATED COLD FRONT WILL HAVE 
STALLED FROM NORTHWEST MS INTO LOUISIANA. GFS SUGGESTS CHANCES FOR 
RAIN ALONG THE FRONT DUE TO CONTINUED INTERACTION WITH THE 
SUBTROPICAL JET. GFS INSTABILITY DOES SHOW EXTREMELY LOW 
CAPE...PERHAPS A FEW THUNDERSTORMS ARE POSSIBLE ALONG THE FRONT BUT 
NOTHING SEVERE.

ON TUESDAY NIGHT...THE GFS NOW BRINGS ANOTHER VORT MAX AND 
ASSOCIATED SHORTWAVE THROUGH PROVIDING ANOTHER SHOT AT RAIN. TODAYS 
RUN IS FASTER THAN PREVIOUS RUNS SO LEFT A SLIGHT CHANCE IN ON 
WEDNESDAY DUE TO TIMING CONCERNS. HIGH PRESSURE SHOULD BUILD INTO 
THE REGION AFTER WEDNESDAY RESULTING IN DRY CONDITIONS AND COOLER 
TEMPERATURES.

&&

.MEG...WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MS...NONE.
MO...NONE.
TN...NONE.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
935 AM CST SAT FEB 5 2005

.DISCUSSION...
SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE IS OVER THE OHIO VALLEY TODAY. THIS IS 
BRINGING A EASTSOUTEAST WIND INTO THE AREA. A CUT OFF LOW IS OVER 
THE BAJA CALIFORNIA REGION WHICH HAS AMPLIFIED THE RIDGE THAT IS 
OVER THE SOUTHCENTRAL US. THE SOUTHERN EXTENT OF THIS LOW HAS ALSO 
FORCED THE SUBTROPICAL JET NORTHWARD FROM TEXAS AND OVER THE 
MIDSOUTH. THE HIGH LEVEL CLOUDS IS ASSOCIATED WITH THE TROPICAL 
MOISTURE AS SEEN ON THE NORTH AMERICA WATER VAPOR IMAGERY. OVER THE 
MIDSOUTH...THE CLOUDS HAVE BEEN ENHANCED INTO A NARROW BUT MUCH MORE 
DENSE DECK DUE TO THE INTERACTION WITH THE UPPER JET. SATELLITE 
TRENDS SHOW THIS DECK HAS BEEN THINNING...SO EXPECT THAT BY THIS 
AFTERNOON THE SUN WILL BE TRANSPARENT THROUGH THE CIRRUS ACROSS THE 
ENTIRE REGION. WITH SOME SUN...HIGHS SHOULD STILL AT LEAST APPROACH 
THOSE CURRENTLY FORECASTED. ONLY UPDATE TO THE FORECAST WAS TO THE 
ZFP DUE TO WORDING IN THE FIRST PERIOD.

318 AM CST SAT FEB 5 2005

.DISCUSSION...
UPPER RIDGE CENTERED FROM THE LOWER GREAT LAKES THROUGH THE LOWER MS 
VALLEY THIS MORNING. HIGH CLOUDS STREAMING ACROSS THE RIDGE INTO THE 
FORECAST AREA HELPING TO KEEP TEMPS FROM BOTTOMING OUT. PATCHY FOG 
LIMITED SO FAR THIS MORNING. SFC AND UPPER RIDGE TO SHIFT EAST 
TODAY. A NICE DAY ON TAP WITH A MIX OF MID/HIGH CLOUDS AND SUNSHINE. 
850 MB TEMPS OF +8C WILL YIELD SFC TEMPS FROM 58-61 DEGREES. 

EXPECT INCREASING MID AND HIGH CLOUDS TONIGHT AND WARMER TEMPS AS 
RIDGE CONTINUES RETREAT TO THE ATLANTIC SEABOARD. TEMPS WL PROBABLY 
STAY ABOVE 40 MOST PLACES EXPECT ALONG THE TN RIVER AND ACRS NE MS. 

NEXT SYSTEM APPROACHES ON SUNDAY. DECENT SHORTWAVE STARTS TO MOVE 
INTO THE SRN PLAINS WITH INCREASING MOISTURE AND LIFT MOVING INTO 
THE REGION SUNDAY AFTN. BY SUN NIGHT TROF MOVES INTO AR WITH SFC LOW 
PRESSURE DEVELOPING ACRS SRN MO. GOOD MOISTURE ADVECTION ACRS AR 
WITH SFC DEWPOINTS CLIMBING INTO THE MID 50S AS FAR N AS JBR BY 12Z 
MON. ETA AND GFS IN GOOD AGREEMENT ATTM WITH PRECIP AREA AND WL GO 
LIKELY POPS WEST OF THE RIVER AND THEN EAST OF THE RIVER ON MON. 

PRECIP WL TAPER OFF LATE MONDAY AS A WEAK SFC FRONT MOVES THROUGH 
STALLING JUST SOUTH OF THE AREA ON TUE MORNING. TUESDAY LOOKS LIKE 
AN IN BETWEEN SYSTEMS DAY WITH PERHAPS SOME PRECIP ALONG THE STALLED 
FROM TO THE SOUTH AND MORE ACTIVITY TO THE NW OF THE MID SOUTH AS 
ANOTHER SHORTWAVE APPROACHES. TUE NIGHT INTO WED THE SHORTWAVE MOVES 
ACRS THE AREA WITH ASSOCD SFC LOW PRESSURE ORGANIZING OVER THE MS 
VALLEY AND MOVING OFF TO THE NE. FRONT SWEEPS THROUGH BY WED AFTN. 
MOISTURE FIELDS LOOK UNIMPRESSIVE ATTM BUT CHC POPS CERTAINLY LOOK 
FINE GIVEN STRENGTH OF THIS SYSTEM. THU INTO THE WEEKEND LOOKS DRY 
AND COOL WITH HIGH PRESSURE BUILDING ACRS THE REGION.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
915 PM CST FRI FEB 4 2005

.DISCUSSION...LATEST SURFACE ANALYSIS PLACES 1028 MB RIDGE OF HIGH 
PRESSURE ACROSS THE MIDDLE MISSISSIPPI AND THE MID SOUTH. INFRARED 
SATELLITE SHOWS AN AREA OF CIRRUS AFFECTING MAINLY THE SOUTHERN HALF 
OF THE FORECAST AREA THIS EVENING. AS A RESULT...DEWPOINTS HAVE 
ACTUALLY RISEN A COUPLE OF DEGREES OVER THE PAST FEW HOURS. FOG 
POTENTIAL STILL LOOKS GOOD OVERNIGHT AS LOWS WILL FALL AT OR 
SLIGHTLY BELOW CURRENT DEWPOINTS WITH MANY STATIONS ALREADY 
REPORTING CALM WINDS AS THE BOUNDARY LAYER HAS DECOUPLED.  
WILL ISSUE AN UPDATE TO ADJUST LOW TEMPERATURES OVERNIGHT BASED UPON 
CURRENT TRENDS.

UPDATED GRIDS WILL BE OUT SHORTLY

CJC

.PREV DISCUSSION...ISSUED 315 PM CST FRI FEB 4 2005.

ANOTHER WARM DAY FOR SATURDAY WITH THE UPPER RIDGE IN CONTROL AND 
SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE MOVING EASTWARD. GUIDANCE LOOKS REASONABLE 
WHICH SUPPORTS TEMPS AROUND 60. THERE MAY BE A FEW MORE HIGH CLOUDS 
THAN TODAY RESULTING IN MORE OF A PARTLY SUNNY SKY. CLOUDS WILL BE 
INCREASING SATURDAY NIGHT AS AN UPPER LOW OVER THE SOUTHWESTERN US 
WILL EJECT OUT AND BEGIN TO IMPACT THE AREA SUNDAY NIGHT. THE LOW 
WILL BE WEAKENING AS IT RUNS INTO THE RIDGE WHICH WILL HAVE SHIFTED 
OVER THE EAST COAST. AS A RESULT THE ASSOCIATED FRONT WILL NOT MAKE 
IT THROUGH. RAIN CHANCES SHOULD HOLD OFF INTO SUNDAY AFTERNOON AND 
SUNDAY NIGHT. THESE CHANCES WILL BE DUE TO FORCING BY THE LOW LEVEL 
JET THAN ANYTHING. ON MONDAY THE JET WILL MOVE OFF TO THE EAST AND A 
WAVE MOVING ALONG THE FRONT WILL PASS TO THE NORTH OF THE AREA. THIS 
WILL BRING THE FRONT INTO THE REGION ON MONDAY AND THEN THE FRONT 
WILL STALL. 

BY TUESDAY...THE REGION WILL BE IN SOUTHWEST FLOW ALOFT. RAIN 
CHANCES TUESDAY AFTERNOON AND TUESDAY NIGHT LOOK TO BE DUE TO THE 
INFLUENCE OF THE SOUTHERN BRANCH OF THE JET STREAM IN CONJUNCTION 
WITH THE FRONT MOVING BACK NORTHWARD AS A WARM FRONT. THERE LOOKS TO 
BE JUST ENOUGH INSTABILITY FOR AN OUTSIDE SHOT OF A RUMBLE OF 
THUNDER SOUTH AND EAST OF THE TUPELO AREA...NOTHING SEVERE. THEN ON 
WEDNESDAY...A SHORTWAVE TROUGH WILL MOVE THROUGH THE AREA AND THIS 
WILL BRING ANOTHER COLD FRONT THROUGH. THURSDAY AND FRIDAY LOOK DRY 
FOR NOW WITH HIGH PRESSURE BUILDING IN. 

&&

UP FROM THE SOUTHWEST. IT WAS A COLD START THIS MORNING WITH 
TEMPERATURES IN MANY AREAS OVER WEST TN AND NORTHEAST ARKANSAS IN 
THE MID TO UPPER 20S. DEW POINTS YESTERDAY DID NOT HOLD UP AGAINST 
THE STRONG RADIATIONAL COOLING ONCE THE SKIES CLEARED. EXPECT A 
SIMILAR SCENARIO TONIGHT WITH THE ONLY POSSIBLE FLY BEING THE CIRRUS 
COMING UP OUT OF THE SOUTHWEST. DONT EXPECT THE CIRRUS TO BE 
OVERCAST ENOUGH TO BE OF SIGNIFICANCE SO WENT COLDER THAN 
GUIDANCE...SUBSTANTIALLY IN SOME CASES...IN FAVOR OF PERSISTENCE. IF

AGAIN LATE TONIGHT INTO EARLY TOMORROW MORNING.

.DISCUSSION...
LAST OF THE LOW CLOUDS MOVING OUT OF NORTH MS THIS MORNING. CLEAR 
SKIES...LIGHT WINDS AND WET GROUND RESULTING IN SOME PATCHY FOG 
AROUND THE MID SOUTH THIS MORNING. EXPECT PLENTY OF SUNSHINE AND 
WARMER TEMPS TODAY WITH SFC AND UPPER RIDGE ACRS THE REGION AND MEAN 
RH VALUES LESS THAN 30 PERCENT. TEMPS WL CLIMB WELL INTO THE 
50S...ABOUT 5 DEGREES ABOVE NORMAL.

RIDGE SHIFTS A LITTLE EAST TONIGHT WITH PERHAPS A FEW HIGH CLOUDS WL 
MOVE INTO THE MID SOUTH OTRW MOSTLY CLEAR SKIES. ANOTHER NIGHT OF 
SUB FREEZING TEMPS ACRS EASTERN SXNS. RIDGE CONT TO SHIFT EAST ON 
SAT AS WINDS START TO SHIFT AROUND TO THE SOUTH. SAT AFTN TEMPS 
COULD REACH 60 ACRS MUCH OF THE FORECAST AREA WITH 850 MB TEMPS OF 
+8C. MID AND HIGH CLOUDS WL BE ON THE SLOW INCREASE. 

BY SUN RIDGE WL BE SITUATED WELL TO THE EAST ALONG THE ATLANTIC 
SEABOARD. A WEAKENING UPPER LEVEL SYSTEM WL BE MOVING OUT OF THE SW 
U.S. INTO THE CENTRAL PLAINS ON SUN WITH WEAK SFC LOW PRESSURE ACRS 
THE SRN PLAINS. POSSIBILITY OF SOME OVERRUNNING PRECIP AHEAD OF THE 
SYSTEM...ESPECIALLY ACRS NE AR SUN AFTN. 

BEST CHANCE OF PRECIP PROBABLY SUN NIGHT/MON AS BEST COMBINATION OF 
MOISTURE AND LIFT MOVES THROUGH. SFC LOW PRESSURE MOVES INTO THE MID 
MS VALLEY WITH A WEAK FRONT MOVING INTO THE MID SOUTH. MEANWHILE A 
SERIES OF UPPER LEVEL DISTURBANCES PASS BY TO THE NW. MODELS IN 
REASONABLE AGREEMENT ON THIS. STABILITY PARAMETERS INDICATE NO 
THUNDER ATTM. 

ECMWF AND GFS INDICATE UNCERTAINTY IN THE FORECAST IN THE MON NIGHT 
TO WED TIME FRAME. LOOKS LIKE WE WL BE IN BETWEEN SYSTEMS MON NIGHT 
INTO TUE. NEXT SYSTEM APPROACHES LATE TUE INTO TUE NIGHT. ECMWF MUCH 
STRONGER THAN GFS WITH UPPER AND SFC SYSTEM. ATTM TUE NIGHT LOOKS 
LIKE THE BEST CHANCE FOR PRECIP WITH SFC FRONT MOVING THROUGH ON 
WED. 

BY THU BOTH MODELS INDICATE THAT A 500 MB TROF CONSOLIDATES OVER THE 
ERN U.S WITH NWLY FLOW ALOFT ACRS THE MID SOUTH AND SFC RIDGING. 
EXPECT DRIER AND COOLER WEATHER TOWARD THE END OF NEXT WEEK.

FXUS64 KMEG 032035
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
235 PM CST THU FEB 3 2005

.DISCUSSION...

SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE EXTENDS FROM TEXAS THROUGH WESTERN MISSOURI 
THIS AFTERNOON. THIS FEATURE IS ASSOCIATED WITH AN UPPER LEVEL RIDGE 
THAT IS BUILDING INTO THE REGION. SATELLITE SHOWS CLOUDS CLEARING 
FROM THE NORTH WITH THE CLEARING LINE MOVING SOUTHWARD. AN 
EXTRAPOLATION OF THE CLEARING LINE WOULD PLACE IT NEAR THE TN/MS 
BORDER BY 00Z...SOUTH OF OXFORD/TUPELO BY 03Z WITH CLEAR SKIES 
AREAWIDE BY MIDNIGHT. THIS IS SUPPORTED BY THE 18Z MESOETA MOISTURE 
FIELDS. THE NORTHERLY WINDS SHOULD CONTINUE TO ADVECT DRIER AIR IN 
AT THE SURFACE. ONCE SKIES CLEAR...WINDS SHOULD GO LIGHT AND ALLOW 
MIN TEMPS TO FALL TO AROUND THE FREEZING POINT BY MORNING. 

UPPER RIDGE AND SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE WILL REMAIN IN CONTROL FOR 
FRIDAY AND SATURDAY. MOISTURE PROFILES INDICATE MAINLY CLEAR SKIES 
INTO SATURDAY. 850 TEMPS WARM UP TO AROUND +6 ON FRIDAY AND +8 ON 
SATURDAY. GUIDANCE TEMPS INTO SATURDAY LOOK REASONABLE. 

A CUT OFF LOW OVER THE SOUTHWESTERN US WILL EJECT OUT AND BEGIN TO 
IMPACT THE AREA ON SUNDAY. GFS AND ECMWF ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT WITH 
TIMING OF THE SYSTEM INTO THE AREA DURING THE DAY ON SUNDAY WHILE 
ETA IS SLOWER...MORE SUNDAY NIGHT. THE SYSTEM WILL BE WEAKENING AS 
IT LIFTS OUT AND RUNS INTO A HIGHLY AMPLIFIED RIDGE OVER THE EAST 
COAST. THE SYSTEM WILL SLOW DOWN OVER THE REGION AND THE SURFACE 
FRONT WILL STAY MAINLY NORTH OF THE REGION INTO EARLY NEXT WEEK. AS 
A RESULT...THE BETTER RAIN CHANCES WILL BE SUNDAY/SUNDAY NIGHT AS 
THE INITIAL SHORTWAVE TROUGH MOVES OVERHEAD. 700-500MB LAPSE 
RATES...LIS AND CAPES ALL ARE TOO STABLE FOR THUNDERSTORMS 
THROUGHOUT THE FORECAST. AREAWIDE...THE BETTER CHANCES OF RAIN WILL 
BE TOWARDS THE NORTH ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA AND CLOSER TO WHERE 
THE UPPER LOW WILL TRACK AS IT MOVES ACROSS MISSOURI. AFTER 
MONDAY...THERE IS HIGH UNCERTAINTY IN THE FORECAST. BOTH ECMWF AND 
GFS COMING OUT WITH SLIGHTLY DIFFERENT SOLUTIONS ALMOST EVERY RUN. 
GENERALLY SPEAKING...IT LOOKS LIKE THE REGION WILL REMAIN WARM AND 
THERE MAY BE ENOUGH MOISTURE TO SUPPORT A CHANCE FOR SHOWERS THROUGH 
MIDWEEK. THE GFS AND ECMWF BOTH AGREE THAT A VORT MAX WILL DROP DOWN 
THE WEST COAST ON MONDAY AND WORK ITS WAY EASTWARD TO PUSH THE FRONT 
THROUGH AROUND WEDNESDAY WITH DRIER WEATHER EXPECTED TOWARDS END OF 
NEXT WEEK. 

&&

.MEG...WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...

944 AM CST THU FEB 3 2005

.DISCUSSION...

SURFACE MAP SHOWS AN AREA OF HIGH PRESSURE EXTENDING FROM TEXAS INTO 
WESTERN MISSOURI. SATELLITE SHOWS LOW CLOUDS ACROSS THE ENTIRE 
REGION THIS MORNING. MESOETA MOISTURE PROFILES AGREE WITH SATELLITE

HANDLES THE SKY COVER WELL. AM A LITTLE CONCERNED ABOUT EXPECTED 
HIGHS FOR TODAY AND MAX TEMPS MAY NEED TO BE LOWERED A COUPLE OF 
DEGREES. BUT WILL MONITOR SATELLITE TRENDS AND TEMPS THROUGH 1630Z 
BEFORE MAKING A FINAL DECISION.

.DISCUSSION...

THERE DOES APPEAR TO BE AN END IN SIGHT TO THE CLOUD COVER WHICH

EXTENDS FROM EASTERN OKLAHOMA INTO SOUTHERN MISSOURI AND CENTRAL
ILLINOIS. HOWEVER...THIS LINE WILL BE PROGRESSING SLOWLY THROUGH THE
REGION SO IT WONT BE UNTIL THIS EVENING THAT WE WILL SEE
SIGNIFICANT BREAKS IN THE CLOUDS. BY LATE TONIGHT...SKIES SHOULD
HAVE CLEARED AND TEMPERATURES WILL DROP TOWARD FREEZING. FRIDAY
SHOULD BE WARMER AS SKIES REMAIN PARTLY CLOUDY. THE NEXT STORM
SYSTEM BEGIN TO APPROACH THE REGION BY SUNDAY. HAVE INCLUDED SLIGHT
CHANCE POPS IN THE 12-18Z PERIOD ON SUNDAY TO BETTER CONFORM WITH
NEIGHBORING OFFICES. AS WAS THE CASE YESTERDAY...MODELS STILL HOLD
OFF BRINGING COLD FRONT THROUGH FORECAST AREA UNTIL TUESDAY NIGHT OR
WEDNESDAY MORNING SO HAD TO TWEAK TEMPERATURES A LITTLE UPWARD FOR
TUESDAY.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
306 PM CST WED FEB 2 2005

.DISCUSSION...

SURFACE MAP THIS AFTERNOON PLACES THE CENTER OF LOW PRESSURE OFF THE 
COATHE AFTERNOON. WITH 
CLOUDS TO THE SOUTH AND MORE SUN TO THE NORTH...THE RESULT SHOULD BE 
A FAIRLY UNIFORM MAX TEMP DISTRIBUTION ACROSS THE REGION OF MID TO 
UPPER 40S. ANY CLOUDS LEFT SOUTH AND EAST OF THE TUPELO AREA SHOULD 
EXIT THE REGION DURING THE EVENING LEAVING MAINLY CLEAR SKIES 
REGIONWIDE. WINDS WILL BE FAIRLY LIGHT WHICH WILL ALLOW TEMPERATURES 
TO FALL TO AROUND THE DEW POINTS WHICH SHOULD BE NEAR OR JUST BELOW 
FREEZING.

FRIDAY...UPPER RIDGE WILL BUILD OVER THE AREA AND SURFACE HIGH 
PRESSURE WILL MOVE OVERHEAD. THE RESULT...SUNSHINE AT LAST. 
NOTICEABLY WARMER TOO WITH 850 TEMPS BEING ADVECTED IN FROM THE 
SOUTHWESTERN US OF AROUND +6 SUPPORTING TEMPS IN THE MID 50S FOR 
HIGHS. GOOD RADIATIONAL COOLING NIGHT ONCE AGAIN ON FRIDAY NIGHT 
WITH HIGH PRESSURE OVERHEAD...WINDS SHOULD GO CALM. UNDERCUTTED MOS 
GUIDANCE AS A RESULT. 

THE RIDGE WILL REMAIN IN CONTROL INTO SATURDAY RESULTING IN MORE 
SUNNY CONDITIONS AND WARM TEMPERATURES. THE NEXT WEATHER SYSTEM TO 
AFFECT THE AREA WILL BE A CUT OFF LOW OVER THE SOUTHWESTERN US THAT 
WILL BEGIN TO LIFT OUT OVER THE WEEKEND. THIS MAY BRING RAIN BACK 
INTO THE AREA AS EARLY AS SUNDAY AFTERNOON...MORE LIKELY SUNDAY 
NIGHT AND PERHAPS LINGERING INTO MONDAY. MODEL UNCERTAINTY BECOMES A 
FACTOR AT THIS POINT WITH THE GFS ADVERTISING A CLOSED LOW OVER 
MISSOURI THROUGH MID WEEK. ALTHOUGH THE GFS SUGGESTS THAT THE 
ATMOSPHERE SOUTH OF THE LOW WILL BE TOO DRY FOR RAIN AM SOMEWHAT 
LEARY. SO HAVE LOW CHANCE POPS THROUGH MID WEEK.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
306 PM CST WED FEB 2 2005

.DISCUSSION...

SURFACE MAP THIS AFTERNOON PLACES THE CENTER OF LOW PRESSURE OFF THE 
COAST OF MISSISSIPPI. AN INVERTED TROUGH EXTENDS NORTHWARD FROM THE 
LOW. WATER VAPOR SHOWS AN UPPER LEVEL LOW OVER SOUTHEAST KANSAS WITH 
A DRY SLOT OVER THE MIDSOUTH WITH ALL OF THE SIGNIFICANT 
PRECIPITATION ALONG THE PERIPHERY OF THE DRY SLOT AND CIRCULATING 
AROUND AN 850MB LOW. TEMPERATURES TODAY HAVE REMAINED NEARLY STEADY 
DUE TO AN EASTERLY WIND...CLOUDS AND RAIN.

FOR TONIGHT...THE UPPER LOW WILL MOVE OVER THE REGION AND THE LOWER 
LEVEL CIRCULATIONS WILL MOVE EASTWARD. THERE IS A LOT OF LOW LEVEL 
MOISTURE AROUND YET AND EXPECT SCATTERED AREAS OF DRIZZLE TO 
PERSIST. DRIER AIR NEAR THE SURFACE WILL WORK INTO THE REGION LATE 
TONIGHT FROM THE NORTHWEST. MOS VALUES LOOK TOO STRONG IN THE DRY 
AIR ADVECTION OVERNIGHT WHEREAS THE MESOETA VALUES SEEM MORE 
REALISTIC IN A GRADUAL LOWERING OF DEW POINTS. FORECAST LOW TEMPS 
ARE ABOVE MOS GUIDANCE AS A RESULT. 

BY TOMORROW...ENOUGH LOWER LEVEL DRY AIR SHOULD HAVE WORKED INTO THE 
REGION TO BRING AN END TO THE DRIZZLE. MODEL SOUNDINGS SHOW THE LOW 
LEVELS DRYING THROUGHOUT THE DAY RESULTING IN CLEARING SKIES NORTH 
OF I 40 IN THE MORNING AND SOUTH OF I 40 DURING THE AFTERNOON. WITH 
CLOUDS TO THE SOUTH AND MORE SUN TO THE NORTH...THE RESULT SHOULD BE 
A FAIRLY UNIFORM MAX TEMP DISTRIBUTION ACROSS THE REGION OF MID TO 
UPPER 40S. ANY CLOUDS LEFT SOUTH AND EAST OF THE TUPELO AREA SHOULD 
EXIT THE REGION DURING THE EVENING LEAVING MAINLY CLEAR SKIES 
REGIONWIDE. WINDS WILL BE FAIRLY LIGHT WHICH WILL ALLOW TEMPERATURES 
TO FALL TO AROUND THE DEW POINTS WHICH SHOULD BE NEAR OR JUST BELOW 
FREEZING.

FRIDAY...UPPER RIDGE WILL BUILD OVER THE AREA AND SURFACE HIGH 
PRESSURE WILL MOVE OVERHEAD. THE RESULT...SUNSHINE AT LAST. 
NOTICEABLY WARMER TOO WITH 850 TEMPS BEING ADVECTED IN FROM THE 
SOUTHWESTERN US OF AROUND +6 SUPPORTING TEMPS IN THE MID 50S FOR 
HIGHS. GOOD RADIATIONAL COOLING NIGHT ONCE AGAIN ON FRIDAY NIGHT 
WITH HIGH PRESSURE OVERHEAD...WINDS SHOULD GO CALM. UNDERCUTTED MOS 
GUIDANCE AS A RESULT. 

THE RIDGE WILL REMAIN IN CONTROL INTO SATURDAY RESULTING IN MORE 
SUNNY CONDITIONS AND WARM TEMPERATURES. THE NEXT WEATHER SYSTEM TO 
AFFECT THE AREA WILL BE A CUT OFF LOW OVER THE SOUTHWESTERN US THAT 
WILL BEGIN TO LIFT OUT OVER THE WEEKEND. THIS MAY BRING RAIN BACK 
INTO THE AREA AS EARLY AS SUNDAY AFTERNOON...MORE LIKELY SUNDAY 
NIGHT AND PERHAPS LINGERING INTO MONDAY. MODEL UNCERTAINTY BECOMES A

ATMOSPHERE SOUTH OF THE LOW WILL BE TOO DRY FOR RAIN AM SOMEWHAT

WEDNESDAY.

MORNING...WE GET INTO WEAK RIDGING. MODELS TEND TO INDICATE SOME
DRYING. HOPEFULLY...THIS PANS OUT SO WE CAN ACTUALLY SEE A
LITTLE SUNSHINE WITHOUT THE TEMPERATURES BEING BELOW FREEZING.
JETSTREAM SHOULD KEEP COLD AIR BOTTLED UP IN CANADA FOR THE
EXTENDED PERIOD...GIVING US ABOVE NORMAL TEMPERATURES. 00Z GFS
SOLUTION WOULD INDICATE RAIN ABOUT SUNDAY...BUT WITH LACK OF RUN
TO RUN CONSISTENCY ON SYSTEM...WILL KEEP EXTENDED DRY.

THE FORECAST AREA DURING THE DAY. 300K SURFACE SHOWS INCREASING 
ISENTROPIC ASCENT ACROSS THE AREA...ESPECIALLY DURING THE MORNING 
ACROSS ARKANSAS AND MISSISSIPPI. CONSEQUENTLY...I ADDED POPS FOR 
BOTH THE MORNING DURING BEST FORCING AND 20 POPS FOR THE AFTERNOON 
AS ISENTROPIC ASCENT BEGINS TO EXIT THE AREA. CLOUDY SKIES CAN BE 
EXPECTED WITH 1000-500 MB LAYER RH/S REMAINING ABOVE 60 PERCENT.

MONDAY NIGHT AND TUESDAY...WEAK UPPER RIDGING WITHIN SOUTHWEST FLOW 
WILL BRING DRY WEATHER TO THE MID SOUTH THROUGH TUESDAY. LEFT 
FORECAST AS MOSTLY CLOUDY SINCE ANOTHER WAVE WILL AFFECT THE AREA BY 
WEDNESDAY AND NOT AS OPTIMISTIC WITH CLEARING OUT CLOUD COVER.

WEDNESDAY...UPPER LEVEL TROUGH WITH A WEAK INVERTED SURFACE TROUGH 
WILL SWING ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA WEDNESDAY AND WEDNESDAY NIGHT 
BRINGING ANOTHER CHANCE OF RAIN ACROSS THE MID SOUTH AND ADDED POPS 
TO FORECAST.
&&

.LONG TERM (THURSDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...
LATEST LONG RANGE RUN TO RUN CONTINUITY MUCH BETTER THAN THE PAST 
FEW DAYS...WITH ONLY MODEL DIFFERENCES SHOWING UP BY NEXT WEEKEND. 
EUROPEAN DEPICTS A STRONG UPPER LEVEL RIDGING PATTERN ACROSS THE 
EASTERN UNITED STATES WHILE GFS SHOWS A VERY BROAD UPPER LEVEL 
TROUGH ACROSS THE NORTHERN UNITED STATES. NOT EXPECTING ANY 
PRECIPITATION THROUGHOUT THIS PERIOD ACROSS THE MID SOUTH AS NEXT 
UPPER LEVEL TROUGH ARRIVES BY EARLY NEXT WEEK.

&&

AND WEAKENS OVER THE NEXT COUPLE OF DAYS. A PIECE OF THE UPPER LOW
DOES REMAIN OVER MEXICO...AND MODELS TRY TO DEVELOP A SHORTWAVE
RIDGE ACROSS THE SOUTHEASTERN STATES BY TUESDAY.

BEST LIFT SHOULD BE TO THE SOUTH OF OUR CWA. PLAN TO KEEP FORECAST
DRY FOR NOW...BUT WOULD NOT BE SHOCKED IF WE EVENTUALLY NEED TO ADD
PRECIPITATION MENTION TO EXTREME SOUTHERN PORTIONS OF CWA FOR
MONDAY OR MONDAY NIGHT.

SEE NO REASON TO GET RID OF CLOUDS THROUGH THE SHORT TERM...AT LEAST
IN THE LARGE SCALE. WHILE THERE MAY BE A FEW BREAKS...EXPECT MOST
OF THOSE TO FILL BACK IN RATHER QUICKLY. FLOW REMAINS RATHER WEAK...
AND NO STRONG SUBSIDENCE OR DRYING. THIS WILL KEEP DIURNAL RANGES
SMALL. MAY NEED TO RAISE MINS AND LOWER MAXES A LITTLE BIT...AS 15
DEGREE DIURNAL RANGES FOR TODAY AND MONDAY DONT MAKE SENSE
CONSIDERING CLOUD COVER.
&&

.LONG TERM (AFTER TUESDAY)...
NO NEED FOR MAJOR CHANGES AT THIS TIME. SURFACE LOW AT MIDWEEK TRACKS
ACROSS GULF OF MEXICO...KEEPING PRECIPITATION TO OUR SOUTH.
HOPEFULLY...WE WILL LOSE AT LEAST SOME OF THE CLOUDS BY MID-WEEK...
ALLOWING SOME MODERATION IN TEMPERATURES.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
945 PM CST SAT JAN 29 2005

.DISCUSSION...

A SHORTWAVE OVER NORTH MIDDLE TENNESSEE WILL CONTINUE MOVING AWAY 
FROM THE REGION TONIGHT. LOW CLOUDS AND AREAS OF DRIZZLE LINGER 
BEHIND. WITH SLIGHTLY DRIER AIR ADVECTING IN LATER TONIGHT...WILL 
KEEP THE FCST AS IS FOR NOW AND END THE DRIZZLE BY MIDNIGHT. MAY 
HAVE TO END THE DRIZZLE LATER BUT WILL MAKE THAT DECISION BEFORE 
MIDNIGHT.

A BROAD SFC HIGH WILL BUILD IN FROM THE N THROUGH MONDAY. A COUPLE 
OF POSITIVE TILTED SHORTWAVES MOVE THROUGH EARLY IN THE WEEK BUT 
AIRMASS WILL BE DRY ENOUGH TO KEEP THE FCST DRY. AN UNSETTLED 
PATTERN IS IN STORE FOR THE REST OF THE FCST PERIOD WITH A SOUTHERN 
STREAM TROUGH BECOMING MORE ESTABLISHED FROM KY TO THE SE STATES. 
RIGHT NOW...WILL KEEP SEASONABLY COOL AND DRY CONDITIONS.

&&

.MEG...WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 292130
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
330 PM CST SAT JAN 29 2005

.DISCUSSION...LATEST SURFACE ANALYSIS PLACES A WEAK SURFACE TROUGH 
ACROSS THE LOWER MISSISSIPPI VALLEY. TEMPERATURES ACROSS THE 
FORECAST AREA HAVE STRUGGLED TO RISE THROUGH THE DAY WITH LOWER 40S 
AT BEST ACROSS NORTHERN MISSISSIPPI. 88D RADAR TRENDS SHOW TRAILING 
EDGE OF SCATTERED SHOWERS MOVING OUT OF THE FORECAST AREA AND A WEAK 
AREA OF DRIZZLE BEGINNING TO FORM JUST WEST OF THE MISSISSIPPI RIVER 
IN ARKANSAS. 

TONIGHT...UPPER LEVEL LOW WILL MOVE TOWARD MIDDLE TENNESSEE TONIGHT. 
UPPER LEVEL RIDGING WILL SLOWLY BUILD INTO THE MID SOUTH...BUT AMPLE 
LOW LEVEL MOISTURE WILL RESULT IN MOSTLY CLOUDY/CLOUDY SKIES ACROSS 
THE MID SOUTH. CURRENT DEWPOINTS ARE IN THE UPPER 30S BUT EXPECT 
TEMPERATURES TO FALL OFF INTO THE LOWER TO MIDDLE 30S AS COOLER AIR 
ASSOCIATED WITH UPPER LEVEL LOW MOVES ACROSS THE REGION. WILL KEEP 
SOME DRIZZLE IN THE FORECAST THIS EVENING BASED ON LATEST RADAR 
TRENDS. 

SUNDAY AND MONDAY...UPPER LEVEL LOW WILL MOVE OFF TO THE APPALACIANS AND 
EAST COAST AS UPPER LEVEL RIDGING CONTINUES TO BUILD INTO THE REGION 
ON SUNDAY.  EXPECTING MOSTLY CLOUDY SKIES AS LOW LEVEL MOISTURE WILL 
REMAIN TRAPPED BELOW SUBSIDENCE INVERSION WITH HIGHS REMAINING IN 
THE 40S AND LOWS IN THE 30S. A WEAK DISTURBANCE IN THE UPPER LEVEL 
ZONAL FLOW WILL MOVE ACROSS THE MID SOUTH DURING THE DAY ON MONDAY. 
NOT EXPECTING ANY RAINFALL ASSOCIATED WITH THIS FEATURE AS MOISTURE 
WILL BE LACKING ALONG WITH NEUTRAL OR ISENTROPIC DESCENT. 

TUESDAY...NAM/GFS BOTH SHOW A BROAD UPPER LEVEL TROUGH SLIDING 
ACROSS THE EASTERN HALF OF THE UNITED STATES BUT NOT EXPECTING ANY 
PRECIPITATION WITH THIS FEATURE.  

&&

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...STILL SOME UNCERTAINTY IN 
THE LONG RANGE FORECAST BEYOND WEDNESDAY AS LATEST LONG RANGE MODELS 
ADVERTISE A CUT OFF LOW DEVELOPING ACROSS THE SOUTHWEST UNITED 
STATES/MEXICO WITH A BLOCKING PATTERN SETTING UP ACROSS AREAS EAST 
OF THE MISSISSIPPI RIVER. ADDITIONALLY...THE MODELS SHOW THE CUT OFF 
LOW EVENTUALLY MERGE BACK INTO THE FLOW AFTER NEXT WEEKEND WITH 
ANOTHER BLAST OF COLD AIR FROM CANADA. AS A RESULT...CURRENT MEX 
GUIDANCE IS ABOUT 5-10 DEGREES WARMER THAN PREVIOUS RUN AND ONLY 
RAISED TEMPERATURES A FEW DEGREES. I/LL KEEP A DRY FORECAST AT THIS 
POINT ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA THROUGH DAY 7 AS PATTERN CHANGE IS 
STILL EVOLVING. 

&&

.MEG...WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MS...NONE.
MO...NONE.
TN...NONE.
&&

$$
CJC

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
1044 AM CST SAT JAN 29 2005

.DISCUSSION...WATER VAPOR IMAGERY SHOWS UPPER LEVEL LOW SPINNING 
ACROSS MO/AR BORDER WITH OVERCAST SKIES ACROSS THE MID SOUTH. 88D 
REGIONAL RADAR SHOWS LIGHT STRATIFORM RAINS OCCURRING ACROSS THE 
AREA WITH LOW CEILINGS. MODEL SOUNDINGS SHOW MID LEVELS COOLING A 
BIT AS UPPER LEVEL LOW MOVES ACROSS THE NORTHERN SECTION OF THE 
FORECAST AREA LATER TODAY. PRECIPITATION SHOULD REMAIN AS ALL RAIN 
AS FREEZING LEVELS WILL REMAIN AT OR ABOVE 1500 FT BEFORE COMING TO 
AN END THIS AFTERNOON AS AREA OF ISENTROPIC ASCENT DEPARTS THE MID 
SOUTH. HIGHS THIS AFTERNOON WILL BE IN THE LOWER TO MIDDLE 40S. WILL 
ISSUE AN UPDATE FOR CURRENT TRENDS.

AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
200 AM CST SAT JAN 29 2005

.DISCUSSION...
WATER VAPOR LOOP SHOWS UPPER LOW CURRENTLY OVER THE OZARKS MOVING
ENE. LATEST SURFACE ANALYSIS CENTERS HIGH PRESSURE OVER VA/NC. WEAK
INVERTED TROF STILL ALONG MISSISSIPPI RIVER...THEN ACROSS KENTUCKY.
SKIES CLOUDY ACROSS THE ENTIRE AREA...WITH TEMPERATURES GENERALLY IN
THE 30S. MAY BE ONE OR TWO SPOTS SLIGHTLY BELOW FREEZING...BUT NOT
HEARING OF ANY SIGNIFICANT ICING PROBLEMS. RADAR INDICATES
PRECIPITATION ACROSS ABOUT NORTHEAST HALF OF CWA...WITH SOME DRIZZLE
ELSEWHERE. &&

.SHORT TERM (THROUGH MONDAY)...
UPPER LOW TO CONTINUE TO MOVE ENE...AND SHOULD BE JUST CLEAR OF OUR
CWA BY 00Z THIS EVENING. WILL HOLD ONTO LIKELY POPS MOST AREAS THIS
MORNING...THEN GRADUALLY DRY THINGS OUT. GFS/NAM SOLUTIONS INDICATE
AFTER UPPER LOW PASSAGE...NO SIGNIFICANT LIFT FOR SEVERAL DAYS. MOS
GUIDANCE ALSO AGREES WITH THIS. WILL DRY OUT FORECAST FOR TONIGHT
THROUGH MONDAY.

DONT SEE MUCH HOPE FOR SUNSHINE THIS WEEKEND...SO DIURNAL
TEMPERATURE RANGES SHOULD BE 10 DEGREES OR LESS. CURRENT FORECAST
HAS THIS HANDLED THROUGH SUNDAY. OPTED TO LOWER TEMPERATURE FORECAST
SUNDAY NIGHT BY SEVERAL DEGREES.
&&

.LONG TERM (AFTER MONDAY)...
WILL CONTINUE DRY EXTENDED FORECAST. NEW MEX NUMBERS WOULD
INDICATE WE NEED TO WARM UP FORECAST TEMPS...BUT WILL HOLD OFF TO
SEE IF THERE IS RUN TO RUN CONTINUITY IN MEDIUM RANGE.
&&

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 290357
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
955 PM CST FRI JAN 28 2005

.DISCUSSION...NO BIG CHANGES FROM EARLIER. WILL HAVE TO MONITOR THE 
EASTERN COUNTIES MORE CLOSELY THAN ANY OTHER PART OF THE CWA AS 
DEWPOINTS ARE MUCH LOWER IN MDL TN AND NRN AL WITH A STIFF ERLY WIND.
WILL UPDATE THE FORECAST SOON WITH VERY MINOR TWEEKS AT THIS TIME.

&&

.PREVIOUS DISCUSSION...LATEST 88D RADAR RETURNS SHOW RAIN SLOWLY 
PROGRESSING ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA. SURFACE TEMPERATURES THIS 
AFTERNOON HAVE WARMED INTO THE 40S TO LOWER 50S. HOWEVER SURFACE 
DEWPOINTS HAVE REMAINED NEARLY STEADY OR SLOWLY DROPPING INTO THE 
LOWER 20S ACROSS THE NORTHEAST SECTION OF THE FORECAST AREA WHERE 
DRIER AIR FROM MIDDLE TENNESSEE AND NORTHERN ALABAMA HAS TRIED TO 
ADVECT IN. RAIN WILL CONTINUE THIS EVENING ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA 
AS 305K ISENTROPIC SURFACE SHOWS DECENT ISENTROPIC ASCENT ACROSS 
MUCH OF THE FORECAST AREA THROUGH OVERNIGHT. HOWEVER...MOISTURE WILL 
TEMPORARILY BEGIN TO DIMINISH OVERNIGHT...ESPECIALLY ACROSS WESTERN 
SECTIONS OF THE AREA BEFORE RETURNING BY MID/LATE MORNING ON 
SATURDAY. MESOETA/RUC SOUNDINGS SHOW A RATHER PRONOUNCED WARM NOSE 
AT 850 MB /+3/ AND A RELATIVELY SHALLOW COLD LAYER AROUND 1500 FT. 
IF TEMPERATURES COOL DOWN TO WET BULB TEMPERATURES...FREEZING RAIN 
WOULD BE THE LIKELY PRECIPITATION TYPE ACROSS THE NORTHERN THIRD OF 
THE FORECAST AREA. THINK MOST IF NOT ALL AREAS WILL REMAIN ABOVE 
FREEZING...AND WOULD EXPECT PRECIPITATION TO FALL MAINLY AS RAIN. AS 
A RESULT...WILL MENTION RAIN OR SNOW IN THE FORECAST FOR THE 
AFFECTED AREA. EVENING SHIFT WILL CONTINUE TO MONITOR LATEST TRENDS 
IN THE EVENT PREICPITATION TYPE BECOMES AN INCREASING CONCERN. 

SATURDAY THROUGH MONDAY...ANOTHER SHORTWAVE IN THE FLOW WILL MOVE 
THROUGH THE FORECAST AREA DURING THE DAY ON SATURDAY...BRINGING 
ANOTHER CHANCE FOR RAIN ACROSS THE MID SOUTH. ASSOCIATED MOISTURE 
WILL BECOME MORE LIMITED BY SATURDAY NIGHT AS UPPER LEVEL RIDGING 
TRIES TO BUILD IN ACROSS THE AREA. LOWERED POPS FOR SUNDAY AND 
MONDAY AS LATEST MODEL RUNS ARE INDICATING A SLIGHTLY DRIER PATTERN. 
HOWEVER I DECIDED NOT TO PULL POPS COMPLETELY SUNDAY AND MONDAY AS 
MODEL RUN CONSISTENCY HAS BEEN LESS RELIABLE OVER THE PAST DAY OR 
TWO.

&&

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...CONFIDENCE VERY LOW IN THE 
EXTENDED FOR THIS FORECAST PACKAGE AS LONG TERM MODELS RUN TO RUN 
CONSISTENCY EVEN WORSE TODAY...WHICH MEANS ANOTHER PATTERN CHANGE IS 
IN THE WORKS BY THE END OF NEXT WEEKEND AT THE EARLIEST. AS A 
RESULT...WILL KEEP EXTENDED FORECAST DRY FOR NOW. TEMPERATURES 
SHOULD BE NEAR CLIMATOLOGICAL NORMALS /40S TO LOWER 50S/.

&&

.MEG...WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MS...NONE.
MO...NONE.
TN...NONE.
&&

$$

CJC/SWC

WARMED INTO THE 40S TO LOWER 50S. HOWEVER SURFACE DEWPOINTS HAVE

1057 AM CST FRI JAN 28 2005

.DISCUSSION...LATEST SURFACE ANALYSIS CENTERS HIGH PRESSURE ACROSS 
NEW YORK. 12Z UPPER AIR ANALYSIS SHOWS UPPER LEVEL RIDGING ACROSS 
THE EASTERN UNITED STATES AND NEXT UPPER LEVEL TROF SET TO AFFECT 
THE MID SOUTH OVER THE CENTRAL/SOUTHERN PLAINS. MAIN FORECAST 
CONCERN FOR THIS AFTERNOON WILL BE PRECIPITATION TIMING. 

LATEST 88D RADAR TRENDS SHOW LEADING EDGE OF RAINFALL JUST BEGINNING 
TO AFFECT THE SOUTHWESTERN SECTIONS OF THE FORECAST AREA. MODEL 
SOUNDINGS STILL INDICATE SOME DRY AIR WILL NEED TO BE OVERCOME 
ACROSS THE AREA...AND SURFACE OBSERVATIONS CERTAINLY AGREE WITH 
DEWPOINTS STILL MAINLY IN THE 20S. MADE MINOR ADJUSTMENTS TO 
TEMPERATURES AND POPS BASED ON CURRENT TRENDS. GRIDS WILL BE OUT 
SHORTLY.

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 280808
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
208 AM CST FRI JAN 28 2005

.DISCUSSION...
LATEST SURFACE ANALYSIS CENTERS HIGH PRESSURE OVER SOUTHERN ONTARIO.
WEAK INVERTED TROF FROM SRN LA TO NEAR CSV. SKIES CLOUDY ACROSS THE
ENTIRE AREA...WITH TEMPERATURES RANGING FROM UPPER 20S EXTREME
NORTH TO AROUND 40 NEAR TUPELO. DEWPOINTS ARE IN THE TEENS IN MOST
AREAS. IT APPEARS THAT ANY PRECIPITATION REACHING THE SURFACE IS
OCCURRING TO THE SOUTH OF OUR CWA.
&&

.SHORT TERM (THROUGH SUNDAY)...
AS SYSTEM TO OUR SOUTHWEST BEGINS TO KICK OUT...ISENTROPIC LIFT
BECOMES A BIGGER PLAYER IN OUR WEATHER. MOST PRECIPITATION CURRENTLY
OVER LOUISIANA AND SRN MS. BEST LIFT FOR OUR AREA IS LATE THIS
AFTERNOON THROUGH EARLY SATURDAY MORNING. POPS WILL GRADUALLY
INCREASE TO LIKELY ACROSS SOUTHWEST THIRD THIS AFTERNOON...CHANCE
ELSEWHERE. LIKELY TO CATEGORICAL POPS AREAWIDE TONIGHT...AND LIKELY
ON SATURDAY. MOST SIGNIFICANT PRECIPITATION WILL BE TO OUR SOUTH...
BUT EXPECT MOST EVERYONE TO MEASURE. ANOTHER SHOT OF PRECIPITATION
SUNDAY AND SUNDAY NIGHT.

PRECIPITATION TYPE WAS LOOKED AT RATHER CLOSELY. BOTH THE NAM AND GFS
SOUNDINGS INDICATE THAT PRECIPITATION IS EXPECTED TO REMAIN IN THE
LIQUID FORM FOR THIS FORECAST. MAY BE A BRIEF EXCEPTION TO THAT ALONG
THE NORTHERN BORDER OF THE CWA LATE TONIGHT. IF NEW MODEL SOLUTIONS
COME IN COLDER...THE DAY SHIFT MAY HAVE TO BECOME A LITTLE MORE
PESSIMISTIC WITH TONIGHTS FORECAST. FOR MOST AREAS...SNOW NOT AN
OPTION...WOULD BE RAIN...FREEZING RAIN...OR SLEET. ANY PRECIPITATION
SUNDAY OR SUNDAY NIGHT WILL BE ALL RAIN.

NOT A BIG DIURNAL SPREAD ON TEMPERATURES THROUGH THE WEEKEND...
PROBABLY LESS THAN 10 DEGREES. EXPECTING ALL AREAS TO REMAIN ABOVE
FREEZING...IF ONLY SLIGHTLY SO.
&&

.LONG TERM (AFTER SUNDAY)...
NOT PLANNING SIGNIFICANT CHANGES TO EXTENDED FORECAST. 00Z/28 GFS
SOLUTION APPEARS RATHER ODD...AND NOT SUPPORTED BY PREVIOUS RUNS.
BEST OPTION IS NOT TO MAKE CHANGES AT THIS TIME.
&&

.MEG...WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 272137
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
335 PM CST THU JAN 27 2005

.DISCUSSION...LATEST SURFACE ANALYSIS CENTERS HIGH PRESSURE OVER 
MICHIGAN AND SOUTHERN ONTARIO. VISIBLE SATELLITE SHOWS MOSTLY CLOUDY 
SKIES ACROSS MUCH OF THE AREA. DIURNAL CUMULUS WHICH FORMED THIS 
MORNING HAS DISSIPATED WITH NORTHEASTERLY WINDS BRINGING LOWER 
DEWPOINT AIR INTO THE NORTHEAST THIRD OF THE FORECAST AREA. WATER 
VAPOR IMAGERY SHOWS NEXT WAVE TO BEGIN TO AFFECT THE MID SOUTH ON 
FRIDAY OVER THE SOUTHWEST U.S./SOUTHERN PLAINS. MAIN FORECAST 
CONCERNS WILL BE PRECIPITATION CHANCES FRIDAY THROUGH SUNDAY...AND 
WINTER PRECIPITATION POTENTIAL FRIDAY NIGHT. ETA/GFS IN DECENT 
AGREEMENT THROUGH FIRST 36 HOURS BUT BEGIN TO DIVERGE AFTER THAT.

TONIGHT...CLOUDS WILL BEGIN TO INCREASE AGAIN ACROSS THE NORTHEAST 
THIRD OF THE FORECAST AREA AS NEXT SYSTEM MOVES CLOSER. ALTHOUGH 
DEWPOINTS ARE CURRENTLY IN THE 20S...I EXPECT LOWS RANGING FROM 
AROUND 30 INTO THE LOWER 30S WITH MOSTLY CLOUDY/CLOUDY SKIES.

FRIDAY...UPPER LEVEL WAVE WILL BEGIN TO AFFECT THE MID SOUTH DURING 
THE DAY. HIGH TEMPERATURES WILL NOT BE MUCH DIFFERENT FROM TODAY 
/40S/ AS MOISTURE DEEPENS THROUGH THE DAY. MODEL SOUNDINGS SUGGEST 
ONSET OF RAIN WILL NOT OCCUR UNTIL AFTERNOON AS 700-500 MID LEVEL 
LAPSE RATES INCREASE TO AROUND 6 C/KM BY 00Z SATURDAY AND SOME LOW 
LEVEL DRY AIR WILL NEED TO BE OVERCOME BEFORE ANY PRECIPITATION 
REACHES THE SURFACE.  

FRIDAY NIGHT...PRECIPITATION TYPE BEGINS TO GET TRICKY ACROSS THE 
NORTHERN TIER OF THE FORECAST AREA FRIDAY NIGHT. ETA SOUNDINGS SHOW 
A PRONOUNCED WARM NOSE IN THE 900-850 MB LAYER WITH TEMPERATURES 
DROPPING OVERNIGHT INTO THE LOWER TO MIDDLE 30S. THE GFS THOUGH IS 
NOT AS PRONOUNCED WITH ELEVATED WARM LAYER AND WARMS THROUGH THE 
NIGHT. ALSO BOTH THE ETA/GFS SHOW SOME MID LEVEL DRY AIR TEMPORARILY 
WORKING IN ACROSS THE AREA...WHICH WILL GREATLY DIMINISH ICE NUCLEI 
ACTIVATION AND THUS WOULD EXPECT DRIZZLE AT BEST. THINK TEMPERATURES 
WILL STAY ABOVE FREEZING ACROSS MOST AREAS BUT WILL MENTION CHANCE 
OF DRIZZLE OR FREEZING DRIZZLE ACROSS THE NORTHERN TIER OF COUNTIES. 
LATER SHIFTS WILL TAKE ANOTHER LOOK AT SITUATION FOR FROZEN 
PRECIPITATION POTENTIAL FRIDAY NIGHT.

SATURDAY...MODEL DIFFERENCES BECOME MORE APPARENT BY SATURDAY. GFS 
PREFERS TO BRING UPPER LEVEL LOW ACROSS THE MID SOUTH...WHILE THE 
ETA SUGGESTS MORE OF A NORTHERLY TRACK ACROSS CENTRAL/EAST CENTRAL 
MISSOURI. NONETHELESS...WILL KEEP LIKELY POPS FOR RAIN ACROSS THE AREA 
AS NEGATIVELY TILTED UPPER LEVEL TROF SWINGS THROUGH ON SATURDAY. 

SUNDAY...RAINFALL MAY BRIEFLY COME TO AN END SUNDAY MORNING AS UPPER 
LEVEL RIDGING TRIES TO BUILD INTO THE MID SOUTH AS THE REGION 
REMAINS IN A SOUTHWEST FLOW REGIME. THE NEXT SHORTWAVE WILL MOVE 
THROUGH DURING THE AFTERNOON/EVENING HOURS AND RAISED POPS TO LIKELY 
FOR SUNDAY NIGHT. 

LONG RANGE...(MONDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...REGION IS EXPECTED TO DRY 
OUT BY TUESDAY AS LOW PRESSURE MOVES OFF TO THE ATLANTIC COAST. RUN 
TO RUN CONTINUITY BETWEEN THE LONG RANGE MODELS HAVE BEEN POOR BUT 
SUGGEST THAT THE EASTERN HALF OF THE UNITED STATES WILL REMAIN IN A 
NORTHWEST FLOW REGIME WITH THE MID SOUTH REMAINING DRY THROUGH THE 
END OF THE PERIOD.
&&

.MEG...WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MS...NONE.
MO...NONE.
TN...NONE.
&&

.DISCUSSION...LATEST SURFACE ANALYSIS CENTERS HIGH PRESSURE OVER

THROUGH YESTERDAY IS ALREADY ALONG THE GULF COAST. CLOUDS WILL


000 
FXUS64 KMEG 270854 RRA
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
254 AM CST THU JAN 27 2005

.DISCUSSION...
A COLD FRONT HAS SETTLED ALONG THE GULF COAST THIS MORNING AND AN 
AREA OF HIGH PRESSURE IS OVER THE WESTERN GREAT LAKES REGION. 
SATELLITE SHOWS CLOUDY SKIES BEGINNING TO BREAK UP DURING THE 
OVERNIGHT HOURS WITH DRIER AIR MOVING IN FROM THE NORTHEAST. THERE 
IS A STORM SYSTEM OVER THE SOUTHERN MOUNTAIN WEST REGION AND THIS 
WILL BE THE NEXT WEATHER MAKER FOR THE MIDSOUTH.

EXPECT THE DAY TO START OUT WITH SOME SUN. THIS MAY BE THE LAST THAT 
THE AREA SEES SUN FOR A WHILE...BECAUSE MODELS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT 
THAT MID AND UPPER LEVEL CLOUDS CURRENTLY OVER OKLAHOMA/TEXAS WILL 
OVERTAKE THE AREA BY AFTERNOON. NO SIGNIFICANT CHANGES MADE TO THE 
TEMP/WX FORECAST FOR TODAY. LATE TONIGHT...AN UPPER LEVEL SHORTWAVE 
WILL BEGIN TO APPROACH THE REGION. CLOUDS WILL CONTINUE TO REMAIN IN 
TACT AHEAD OF THE SHORTWAVE. HOWEVER WITH NO LIFTING MECHANISMS AND 
DRY AIR IN THE LOWER LEVELS...DRY FORECAST WILL CONTINUE. 

ON FRIDAY...THE UPPER SHORTWAVE WILL MOVE OVER THE REGION. THE 
SURFACE FRONT ALONG THE GULF COAST WILL BEGIN TO SLOWLY ADVANCE 
NORTHWARD. SOUNDINGS SUGGEST THAT THE MID TO LOW LEVELS WILL BE 
SATURATED ENOUGH FOR PRECIPITATION TO BREAK OUT ACROSS EASTERN 
ARKANSAS...EXTREME WEST TN AND NORTHWEST MS. DEPENDING UPON THE 
TIMING..PRECIP MAY BE AREAWIDE BY 00Z. REDUCED TEMPS DUE TO CLOUD 
COVER...ANTICIPATED PRECIPITATION AND WARM AIR ADVECTION NOT AS 
AGGRESSIVE AS PREVIOUSLY INDICATED. 

BY FRIDAY NIGHT...BOTH GFS AND ETA SOUNDINGS SHOW THE LOWER AND MID 
LEVELS VERY WELL SATURATED TO SUPPORT LIGHT PRECIPITATION. BOTH 
MODELS SHOW THE SURFACE LAYER NEAR THE FREEZING MARK OVER A GOOD 
PORTION OF THE REGION WITH THE GFS BEING SLIGHTLY COOLER. THERE IS A 
POSSIBILITY OF AT LEAST A BRIEF PERIOD OF SOME LIGHT FREEZING RAIN 
OR SLEET. HOWEVER...CONFIDENCE THIS FAR OUT IS RATHER LOW AND WILL 
NOT MENTION IN EITHER HWO OR FORECAST. STILL...LATER SHIFTS MAY WANT 
TO REEVALUATE THE SITUATION. 

ON SATURDAY...THE UPPER LEVEL SYSTEM WILL BEGIN TO MOVE AWAY FROM 
THE REGION AND THE SURFACE WARM FRONT WILL BE AT LEAST NEAR THE 
REGION IF NOT INTO THE AREA. MODEL SOUNDINGS STILL SUGGEST THAT THE 
LOW LEVELS WILL BE SATURATED SO EXPECT LIGHT RAIN TO LINGER INTO 
SATURDAY...AT LEAST. 

BY SUNDAY...A SECOND UPPER LOW WILL BE ENTERING THE SOUTHERN PLAINS 
AND ANOTHER SHORTWAVE ASSOCIATED WITH THE SYSTEM WILL BE APPROACHING 
THE AREA. THE GFS TRIES TO DRY OUT THE LOWER LEVELS OUT SOMEWHAT 
SATURDAY NIGHT INTO SUNDAY. HOWEVER...THE ETA CONTINUE TO SHOW A 
VERY SATURATED SOUNDING THROUGH SUNDAY. IN EITHER CASE...STILL 
CLOUDY. MODELS INDICATE THAT THE FRONT WILL BE JUST SOUTH OF THE 
AREA...SO HAVE LOWERED TEMPS THAT INDICATED THE AREA WOULD BE IN THE 
WARM SECTOR. 

ON MONDAY...THE UPPER SYSTEM AND SURFACE LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM AND 
COLD FRONT WILL MOVE THROUGH THE REGION. PRECIP CHANCES WILL 
CONTINUE INTO MONDAY...BUT IT LOOKS LIKE THINGS MAY FINALLY DRY OUT 
BEHIND THE SYSTEM. 
&&

.MEG...WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MS...NONE.
MO...NONE.
TN...NONE.
&&

$$
VALLE





000 
FXUS64 KMEG 270208 RRA
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
807 PM CST WED JAN 26 2005

.UPDATE...
WILL UPDATE TO ADJUST WINDS...GUSTS ARE NOT AS HIGH AS FORECAST IN 
SOME AREAS. OTHERWISE CURRENT FORECAST IS FINE. SATELLITE SHOWS LOW 
CLOUDS ARE CONTINUING TO PUSH INTO THE MIDSOUTH FROM THE NORTH. NOT 
SURE WE WILL REACH FORECAST LOWS WITH CLOUDS AND LOOKING AT CURRENT 
TEMPERATURES UPSTREAM...BUT WILL LEAVE ALONE FOR NOW.

.PREV DISCUSSION...
ISSUED 345 PM CST WED JAN 26 2005

HIGH PRESSURE BUILDING ACRS THE MID SOUTH THIS AFTERNOON BEHIND COLD 
FRONT. STRONG LOW LEVEL CAA WILL CONTINUE TONIGHT AS LOW CLOUDS CONT 
TO MOVE SOUTHWARD. EXPECT TEMPS TO FALL TO THE LOWER 30S WITH CLOUDS 
KEEPING THE MERCURY FROM FREE FALLING. 

HIGH PRESSURE CENTERED OVER THE GREAT LAKES DOMINATES THE ENTIRE 
REGION ON THURSDAY AND THURSDAY NIGHT WHILE A FAST MOVING UPPER 
RIDGE MOVES THROUGH THE MID SOUTH BY 12Z FRI. MODELS INDICATE A GOOD 
DEAL OF LOW LEVEL MOISTURE ACRS THE AREA THU MORNING SO EXPECT LOW 
CLOUDS THROUGH NOON. THEN AS THE RIDGE APPROACHES MID AND HIGH LEVEL 
CLOUDS WL START TO INCREASE IN THE AFTERNOON. MOSTLY CLOUDS SHOULD 
COVER IT. TEMPS WL BE MUCH COOLER WITH CLOUDS AND COOL NE 
FLOW...ABOUT 5 DEGREES BLO NORMAL. CLOUDS WILL AGAIN KEEP LOW TEMPS 
IN CHECK THU NIGHT...EXPECT LOWER 30S WITH SOME UPPER 20S ALONG THE 
NRN 1/3RD.

HIGH PRESSURE MOVES OFF TO THE MID ATLANTIC ON FRI WHILE THE FIRST 
IN A SERIES OF SHORTWAVE APPROACHES FROM THE WEST. BY 00Z SAT TROF 
IS EXPECTED TO MOVE INTO THE WESTERN PLAINS. PRECIP MAY BREAK OUT 
ACRS SW AREAS OF THE CWA AS OVERRUNNING DEVELOPS. COOL TEMPS CONT 
WITH SLIGHTLY BLO NORMAL VALUES. SHORTWAVE AXIS MOVES THROUGH FRI 
NIGHT WITH DECENT 1000-500 MB RH VALUES SO INCREASED POPS INTO THE 
HIGH CHC RANGE. 

IN BETWEEN SYSTEM ON SAT WITH A FLAT UPPER RIDGE ACRS THE AREA. 
GIVEN THE VOLATILITY OF THE PATTERN WL HAVE TO KEEP A SMALL CHC OF 
PRECIP IN FOR NOW. 

GFS MOVES A MUCH STRONGER SYSTEM OUT OF THE SW U.S. SAT NIGHT INTO 
SUN. IN RESPONSE THERE MAY BE CYCLOGENESIS ACRS THE ARKALATEX ON 
SUNDAY WITH A WARM FRONT MOVING NORTH INTO THE MID SOUTH. SFC LOW IS 
EXPECTED TO MOVE ACRS THE MID SOUTH SUN NIGHT AND INTO THE OH VALLEY 
ON MON. EXPECT A GOOD SHOT OF PRECIP SOMETIME IN THE EARLY SUN 
THROUGH EARLY MON TIME FRAME AND WL INCREASE TO 50 POPS FOR BOTH 
PERIODS ATTM.

DRIER PATTERN TAKES HOLD STARTING LATER MON AS HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS 
INTO THE REGION.

&&

.MEG...WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MS...NONE.
MO...NONE.
TN...NONE.
&&


000 
FXUS64 KMEG 261721
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
1120 AM CST WED JAN 26 2005

.UPDATE...
COOLER AIR AND LOTS OF LOW CLOUDS MOVING INTO THE AREA BEHIND COLD 
FRONT ALONG WITH GUSTY NORTHERLY SFC WINDS. UPDATED GRIDS AND ZONES 
TO REFLECT CURRENT TEMPS AND CLOUD TRENDS.  

.PREV DISCUSSION ISSUED AT 200 AM...
SHORTWAVE CURRENTLY MOVING THROUGH THE CWA HAS PRODUCED SOME 
PRECIPITATION ECHOES ON RADAR. DON/T KNOW HOW MUCH OF THIS IS 
ACTUALLY REACHING THE GROUND DUE TO FEW SFC OBS REPORTING PRECIP. 
SHORTWAVE WILL PUSH EAST OF AREA BY 12Z...SO WILL GO WITH DRY 
FORECAST TODAY. SOME MID CLOUDS ASSOCIATED WITH SHORTWAVE SHOULD 
ALSO PUSH EAST BY MID MORNING.

A DRY COLD FRONT WILL PUSH THROUGH THE AREA TODAY. COOLER AIR WILL 
FILTER INTO THE REGION BEHIND THE FRONT. IN ADDITION...EXPECT LOW 
CLOUDS BEHIND THE FRONT...CURRENTLY ACROSS IOWA...TO MOVE INTO 
NORTHERN PORTIONS OF THE MIDSOUTH BY THIS AFTERNOON. WILL GO WITH 
BECOMING MOSTLY CLOUDY WORDING IN ZONES ACROSS NORTHERN SECTIONS 
WITH PARTLY CLOUDY SOUTH.

LOW CLOUDS WILL STICK AROUND CWA TONIGHT BUT SHOULD MOVE OUT OF AREA 
BY THURSDAY MORNING AS COOL HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS INTO THE MIDSOUTH. 
TEMPERATURES WILL BACK TO SLIGHTLY BELOW NORMAL ON THURSDAY. 

CLOUDS WILL BEGIN TO INCREASE AGAIN THURSDAY NIGHT AHEAD OF AN 
APPROACHING SHORTWAVE. EXPECT PRECIPITATION TO BEGIN TO OCCUR ACROSS 
THE SOUTHWESTERN HALF OF CWA SOMETIME FRIDAY. BY FRIDAY 
NIGHT...SHORTWAVE WILL BE MOVING OVER CWA AND SPREADING RAIN ACROSS 
THE ENTIRE CWA. RAIN CHANCES WILL CONTINUE INTO 
SATURDAY...ESPECIALLY ACROSS NORTHEAST HALF OF CWA.

EXPECT A BREAK IN PRECIPITATION SATURDAY NIGHT BEFORE A LOW PRESSURE 
SYSTEM MOVES OUT OF THE SOUTHWEST ON SUNDAY. RAIN CHANCES WILL BEGIN 
IN THE SOUTHWESTERN PART OF THE MIDSOUTH ON SUNDAY AND WILL SPREAD 
NORTHEASTWARD ACROSS THE ENTIRE MIDSOUTH BY SUNDAY NIGHT. RAIN 
CHANCES SHOULD BEGIN TO DIMINISH BY MONDAY NIGHT AS THE SYSTEM MOVES 
FAR ENOUGH EAST FROM THE CWA. 

HIGH PRESSURE WILL BUILD INTO THE AREA ON TUESDAY BRINGING DRY 
CONDITIONS BACK TO THE MIDSOUTH.
&&

.MEG...WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MS...NONE.
MO...NONE.
TN...NONE.

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 260233
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
832 PM CST TUE JAN 25 2005

.UPDATE...
ACTUALLY GETTING AN OCCASIONAL LIGHTNING STRIKE IN NORTHEAST AR. 
ALTHOUGH MOISTURE IS LIMITED THE DYNAMICS ARE RATHER STRONG WITH THE 
UPPER SHORT WAVE. WILL MENTION 20 PERCENT CHANCE OF SHOWERS FROM 
ABOUT JONESBORO TO JACKSON AND NORTHWARD...INSTEAD OF JUST SPRINKLES 
AS INDICATED BELOW.

A STRONG SHORT WAVE IS MOVING INTO THE MIDSOUTH FROM THE NORTHWEST
THIS EVENING. HOWEVER...THIS SYSTEM IS MOISTURE STARVED AND ONLY
PRODUCING SOME CLOUDS...AND A FEW SPRINKLES FROM NORTHEAST AR INTO
NORTHWEST TN. 88D KNQA IS SHOWING ECHOES FROM NORTHEAST AR INTO
NORTHWEST TN BUT MUCH OF THIS IS NOT REACHING THE GROUND.
NEVERTHELESS...WILL UPDATE TO ADD SPRINKLES OVERNIGHT FROM ABOUT
JONESBORO TO JACKSON AND NORTHWARD. REMAINDER OF THE FORECAST IS
FINE.

.PREV DISCUSSION...
ISSUED 211 PM CST TUE JAN 25 2005

STRONG SHORTWAVE SEEN IN VISIBLE AND WATER VAPOR IMAGERY SPINNING
OVER NORTHEASTERN OKLAHOMA THIS AFTERNOON. SOME MID AND HIGH LEVEL
CLOUDS ARE WRAPPING AROUND THE NORTHERN PORTION OF THE DISTURBANCE.
THIS FEATURE WILL SHIFT EASTWARD ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA OVERNIGHT.
EXPECTING MOST OF THE ASSOCIATED CLOUD COVER TO REMAIN NORTH OF THE
FORECAST AREA. A FEW SPRINKLES MAY OCCUR ACROSS THE NORTHERN EDGE OF
THE FORECAST AREA OVERNIGHT...BUT SHOULD NOT MEASURE.

TOMORROW A COLD FRONT WILL ENTER THE NORTHERN THIRD OF THE FORECAST
AREA BY LATE MORNING. THIS FRONT WILL OOZE SOUTHWARD THROUGH THE
DAY. TEMPERATURES MAY BE HINDERED SLIGHTLY BY ANY CLOUD COVER
ASSOCIATED WITH THE FRONT. CURRENTLY THE 925MB SURFACE IS SATURATED
WHICH WOULD HINT AT A CLOUDY DAY...HOWEVER THIS MOISTURE IS SHALLOW
SO HAVE MENTIONED PARTLY CLOUDY..BUT THIS MAY NEED TO BE CHANGED
TOMORROW.

COLD ADVECTION TAKES PLACE OVERNIGHT WEDNESDAY AND WILL PRODUCE A
MUCH COOLER DAY THURSDAY. OVERALL PATTERN SPELLS DRY WEATHER FOR THE
MID SOUTH UNTIL FRIDAY AFTERNOON WHEN THE NEXT SYSTEM MOVES OUT OF
THE SOUTHERN PLAINS. RAIN CHANCES GET BETTER WITH EACH NEW RUN OF
THE MODELS ENFORCING HIGHER RAIN CHANCES. SATURDAY MAY BE DRY...BUT
SATURDAY NIGHT AND SUNDAY APPEAR WET WITH MOISTURE LIFTING NORTHWARD
AHEAD OF THE DEEP TROUGH OVER THE WEST. THIS PUTS THE MID SOUTH IN A
SOUTHWESTERLY FLOW. DISTURBANCES FLOWING IN THE SOUTHWEST FLOW WILL
BRING A CHANCE FOR RAIN THROUGH TUESDAY AS THE TROUGH LAGS FARTHER
WEST BEFORE IT MOVES EASTWARD LATER IN THE DAY TUESDAY.

&&

.MEG...WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MS...NONE.
MO...NONE.
TN...NONE.
&&


000 
FXUS64 KMEG 250716
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
200 AM CST TUE JAN 25 2005

.DISCUSSION...
WARM SPELL WILL CONTINUE TODAY ACROSS THE MIDSOUTH. IN FACT EXPECT 
TODAY TO BE WARMER THAN YESTERDAY. SOUTHWEST WINDS AND MOSTLY SUNNY 
SKIES WILL HELP TEMPERATURES REACH INTO THE UPPER 50S TO LOWER 60S 
BY THIS AFTERNOON.

AN UPPER TROUGH WILL SWING THROUGH THE AREA TONIGHT. NOT A LOT OF 
MOISTURE ASSOCIATED WITH THE TROUGH. ONLY EXPECT AN INCREASE IN CLOUDS 
WITH IT.

A COLD FRONT WILL MOVE THROUGH THE CWA ON WEDNESDAY. AGAIN WITH NO 
MOISTURE TO WORK WITH...NO PRECIPITATION IS EXPECTED WITH THE 
PASSAGE OF THE FRONT. TEMPERATURES WILL COOL DOWN BACK TO NEAR 
NORMAL BEHIND THE FRONT. COOL HIGH PRESSURE WILL BUILD INTO THE AREA 
FOR THURSDAY. HIGH TEMPERATURES WILL ONLY BE IN THE 40S.

SEVERAL UPPER LEVEL TROUGHS WILL MOVE THROUGH THE CWA THIS WEEKEND.  
DRY CONDITIONS WILL COME TO AN END WITH THE PASSAGE OF THESE 
TROUGHS. THERE WILL BE ENOUGH MOISTURE FOR PRECIPITATION TO OCCUR. 
MODELS ARE QUITE A BIT DIFFERENT WITH TIMING ON THE FIRST TROUGH. 
ETA IS MUCH FASTER SPREADING RAIN INTO THE AREA FRIDAY MORNING AS 
THE TROUGH APPROACHES. HOWEVER THE GFS DOES NOT SPREAD RAIN INTO THE 
AREA UNTIL FRIDAY EVENING. CURRENT FORECAST HAS RAIN IN FORECAST FOR 
FRIDAY SO WILL LEAVE AS IS FOR NOW. RAIN CHANCES FROM THE TROUGHS 
WILL CONTINUE THROUGH MUCH OF THE WEEKEND. THERE WILL BE A SHORT 
BREAK ON SUNDAY BEFORE ANOTHER TROUGH BEGINS TO MOVE INTO THE AREA 
FOR SUNDAY NIGHT AND MONDAY.

&&

.MEG...WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MS...NONE.
MO...NONE.
TN...NONE.
&&

$$

KRS








000 
FXUS64 KMEG 250240
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
840 PM CST MON JAN 24 2005

.UPDATE...
CURRENT FORECAST IS FINE. SOUTHWEST WINDS BETWEEN 5 AND 10 MPH WILL 
HOLD TEMPERATURES UP WARMER THAN THE LAST COUPLE OF NIGHTS. UPPER 
LEVEL RIDGE AXIS REMAINS TO OUR WEST WITH THE MIDSOUTH IN 
NORTHWESTERLY FLOW ALOFT. SATELLITE SHOWS CLEAR SKIES ACROSS THE 
MIDSOUTH. CIRRUS TO OUR SOUTHWEST IS HAVING A HARD TIME MAKING IT 
INTO THE MIDSOUTH.

.PREV DISCUSSION...
ISSUED 208 PM CST MON JAN 24 2005

SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE HAS SETTLED ALONG THE GULF COAST THIS 
AFTERNOON. A TIGHT PRESSURE GRADIENT ACROSS EASTERN TX...AR...MS AND 
WRN TN HAS CAUSED GUSTY SOUTHWESTERLY WINDS ACROSS MOST OF THE MID 
SOUTH TODAY. 

MODELS HAVE BEEN TRYING TO BRING HIGHER DEW POINTS INTO THE FORECAST 
AREA EARLY THIS EVENING. THIS APPEARS A LITTLE OVERDONE WHEN LOOKING 
SOUTHWEST AND WEST WHERE DEW POINTS WERE ONLY AS HIGH AS THE LOWER 
20S. THE MOISTURE WILL BE A LITTLE SLOWER TO ADVECT INTO THE MID 
SOUTH TONIGHT. 

THE CURRENT UPPER AIR PATTERN WILL GENERALLY HAVE A RIDGE IN THE 
WEST AND A TROUGH IN THE EAST THROUGH WEDNESDAY. THERE WILL BE A 
SHORTWAVE THAT WILL TRANSLATE OUT OF EASTERN NEW MEXICO THIS EVENING 
AND EVENTUALLY ACROSS THE MID SOUTH TUESDAY EVENING. NOT EXPECTING 
MUCH IN THE WAY OF PRECIP WITH LIMITED MOISTURE...HOWEVER A FEW 
SPRINKLES MAY OCCUR. WILL KEEP AN EYE ON THE STRONGER SHORTWAVE 
SWINGING ACROSS THE GREAT LAKES TUESDAY NIGHT. THIS WILL CAUSE 
ANOTHER COLD FRONT TO OOZE INTO THE FORECAST AREA DURING THE DAY 
WEDNESDAY. THE COLD FRONT WILL PUSH TOWARD THE GULF COAST WHILE THE 
CENTER OF THE HIGH SHIFTS TOWARD NEW ENGLAND BY THURSDAY NIGHT. THIS 
WILL BRING WINDS AROUND TO THE SOUTHWEST AHEAD OF THE NEXT STORM 
SYSTEM. THUS...EXPECTING ENOUGH LOW LEVEL MOISTURE TO BE IN PLACE 
WHEN THE NEXT SYSTEM MOVES INTO THE AREA WHICH WILL INCREASE RAIN 
CHANCES.

THIS NEXT SHORTWAVE MOVES INTO SOUTHERN CALIFORNIA WEDNESDAY NIGHT 
WITH PLENTY OF MOISTURE FOR MORE RAIN TO OCCUR OVER SOUTHERN 
CALIFORNIA. THIS SYSTEM WILL MOVE RAPIDLY ACROSS THE SOUTHWESTERN 
U.S. THURSDAY. RAIN CHANCES FOR THE MID SOUTH WILL INCREASE FRIDAY 
INTO SATURDAY. THE TIMING OF THIS SYSTEM IS STILL QUESTIONABLE. 
SOMETIMES WITH THESE SYSTEMS...THEY TEND TO SLOW DOWN AND THEIR 
ARRIVAL IS SLIGHTLY DELAYED. TRIED TO ACCOUNT FOR THIS WITH A LITTLE 
LONGER WINDOW FOR RAIN CHANCES.

LONG RANGE MODELS SUPPORT A DRY DAY ON SUNDAY BEFORE THE NEXT SYSTEM 
DROPS DOWN OUT OF THE PACIFIC NORTHWEST AND INTO THE SOUTH CENTRAL 
PLAINS SUNDAY NIGHT. HAVE ADDED A SLIGHT CHANCE OF RAIN TO THE 
FORECAST FOR MONDAY AND TUESDAY...AGAIN...PENDING THE TRUE SPEED OF 
THIS NEXT SYSTEM. 

&&

.MEG...WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MS...NONE.
MO...NONE.
TN...NONE.
&&

$$

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 240730
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
200 AM CST MON JAN 24 2005

.DISCUSSION...
HIGH PRESSURE HAS SETTLED INTO THE MIDSOUTH TONIGHT. WINDS ARE CALM 
AT MOST LOCATIONS ACROSS THE CWA. HIGH WILL SHIFT EAST TODAY 
ALLOWING WINDS TO SWITCH AROUND TO THE SOUTHWEST. THIS WILL BRING A 
WARM UP TO THE MIDSOUTH. EXPECT HIGHS TO GET INTO THE MID TO UPPER 
40S TODAY. THE WARM UP WILL CONTINUE INTO TUESDAY WITH HIGH REACHING 
INTO THE MID TO UPPER 50S. 

ON TUESDAY NIGHT...AN UPPER LEVEL LOW WILL PASS SOUTH OF THE CWA. 
NOT A LOT OF MOISTURE IS ASSOCIATED WITH THIS SYSTEM. ANY PRECIP 
THAT DOES OCCUR WILL BE SOUTH OF THE CWA SO WILL CONTINUE WITH A DRY 
FORECAST. HOWEVER THE SYSTEM WILL BRING CLOUDS INTO THE MIDSOUTH.

A WEAK COLD FRONT WILL MOVE THROUGH THE CWA ON WEDNESDAY. AGAIN WITH 
NOT A LOT OF MOISTURE AROUND SO THE FRONT WILL PASS THROUGH DRY. 
TEMPERATURES WILL ONLY DROP TO NEAR NORMAL BEHIND THE FRONT.

HIGH PRESSURE WILL BUILD INTO THE MIDSOUTH FOR THURSDAY AND THURSDAY 
NIGHT. CLOUDS WILL BEGIN TO INCREASE ON FRIDAY AHEAD OF ANOTHER 
UPPER LOW MOVING OUT OF TEXAS. THIS LOW WILL HAVE MORE MOISTURE TO 
WORK WITH AND IT WILL BRING RAIN CHANCES TO THE MIDSOUTH BEGINNING 
FRIDAY NIGHT UNTIL THE END OF THE FORECAST PERIOD. 



&&

.MEG...WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MS...NONE.
MO...NONE.
TN...NONE.

.DISCUSSION...
LARGE AREA OF HIGH PRESSURE EXTENDS FROM SOUTHERN OHIO THROUGH THE
FORECAST AREA INTO SOUTHERN LOUISIANA THIS EVENING. THIS AREA WILL
CONTINUE TO TRACK EAST OVERNIGHT AND WINDS WILL SHIFT TO THE
SOUTHWEST BY MORNING HELPING TO WARM THINGS BACK UP FOR MONDAY. JUST
A FEW HIGH LEVEL CLOUDS MAINLY OVER WEST TENNESSEE TONIGHT. CURRENT
FORECAST HAS A GOOD HANDLE ON THIS AND SO NO UPDATES ARE PLANNED AT
THIS TIME.
