

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 232117
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
316 PM CST SUN JAN 23 2005

.DISCUSSION...
HIGHLY AMPLIFIED UPPER LEVEL PATTERN IN PLACE ACROSS THE U.S. THIS
AFTERNOON...WITH A DEEP TROUGH OVER THE EAST AND RIDGE IN THE WEST.
THE PATTERN WILL BEGIN TO FLATTEN OUT AND BECOME MORE ZONAL BY MID
WEEK. BY THE END OF THE WEEK AND NEXT WEEKEND THE UPPER LEVEL FLOW
WILL BECOME SOUTHWESTERLY OVER THE AREA WITH A SERIES OF SHORTWAVES
MOVING THROUGH THE UPPER FLOW.

.TONIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY...

A COLD SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE SYSTEM OVER THE AREA TONIGHT WILL MOVE
TO OUR SOUTHEAST ON MONDAY AND CONTINUE MOVING EAST THROUGH MID
WEEK. AS THE HIGH SLIDES EAST...LOW LEVEL WINDS WILL RETURN BACK
OUT OF THE SOUTH AND EVENTUALLY SOUTHWEST BY MONDAY AFTERNOON. AS
WINDS VEER AROUND TO THE SOUTH...DECENT WARM ADVECTION WILL BEGIN
IN EARNEST LATER TONIGHT AND CONTINUE THROUGH MONDAY. SO ONE MORE
COLD NIGHT IS IN STORE WITH GOOD TEMPERATURE RECOVERY ON MONDAY...
WITH HIGH TEMPERATURES GETTING BACK TO THE MID 40S NORTHEAST TO LOW
50S ACROSS THE SOUTHWEST. TEMPERATURES WILL CONTINUE TO MODERATE
THROUGH TUESDAY WITH ABOVE NORMAL TEMPERATURES THROUGH MID WEEK. HIGH
PRESSURE WILL KEEP WEATHER CONDITIONS DRY AS WELL THROUGH TUESDAY.

.TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY...

THE UPPER LEVEL FLOW WILL BECOME ZONAL OVER THE MID SOUTH FOR MID
WEEK. A CUT OFF LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM OVER THE SOUTHWESTERN U.S. WILL
BEGIN TO LIFT OUT TO THE EAST AS A TROUGH DIGS INTO THE WESTERN
U.S. THIS UPPER LOW WILL WEAKEN INTO AN OPEN TROUGH AS IT MOVES EAST
AND TRIES TO PHASE WITH A NORTHERN STREAM SHORTWAVE MOVING
SOUTHEAST OUT OF THE NORTHERN PLAINS STATES. AT THIS TIME...IT
APPEARS THAT LOW LEVEL MOISTURE RETURN AHEAD OF THESE SYSTEMS WILL
BE LIMITED. THEREFORE AS THE NORTHERN STREAM SYSTEM PUSHES A COLD
FRONT THROUGH AND THE SOUTHERN STREAM SYSTEM WEAKENS AND MOVES
THROUGH...NOT EXPECTING ANY PRECIPITATION. THESE SHORTWAVES WILL
NEED TO BE WATCHED THOUGH IN CASE MORE MOISTURE THAN EXPECTED DOES
MAKE IT INTO THE AREA. ONCE THE COLD FRONT MOVES THROUGH ON
WEDNESDAY...EXPECT ONLY A SLIGHT COOL DOWN IN TEMPERATURES...AS THE
ZONAL FLOW ALOFT WILL KEEP COLDER TEMPERATURES LOCKED UP ACROSS THE
NORTHERN TIER OF THE U.S.

.FRIDAY THROUGH SUNDAY...

FOR THE EXTENDED PERIOD...EXPECTING UPPER TROUGH TO BECOME RE-
ESTABLISHED OVER THE WESTERN U.S. THIS WILL ALLOW FOR SOUTHWESTERLY
UPPER FLOW TO SET UP OVER THE MID SOUTH. A SERIES OF SHORTWAVES
WILL MOVE NORTHEAST ACROSS THE AREA IN THE FLOW ALOFT. THIS WILL
BRING A RETURN FOR RAIN CHANCES ACROSS THE REGION BEGINNING FRIDAY
NIGHT AND PERSISTING THROUGH THE WEEKEND. THIS PATTERN WILL ALSO BE
CONDUCIVE TO SEASONABLY MILD CONDITIONS OVER THE AREA...WITH
TEMPERATURES REMAINING ABOVE SEASONAL NORMALS FOR THE END OF THE
WEEK AND NEXT WEEKEND.

&&

.MEG...WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MS...NONE.
MO...NONE.
TN...NONE.
&&

$$

JLH

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
1020 AM CST SUN JAN 23 2005

.DISCUSSION...
COLD SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE CONTINUES TO BUILD OVER THE AREA THIS
MORNING. TEMPERATURES REMAIN QUITE COLD AS OF 16Z...WITH LOWER 20S
NORTH TO UPPER 20S SOUTH. CURRENT TEMPERATURE FORECAST LOOKS ON
TRACK. WINDS SHOULD REMAIN BRISK TODAY...BEFORE GRADUALLY
DIMINISHING TONIGHT. AS FOR CLOUDS...HAVE ADDED MORE CLOUD COVER...
ESPECIALLY NORTHERN SECTIONS...AS A WEAK UPPER LEVEL SHORTWAVE WILL
MOVE ACROSS THE AREA. OTHERWISE...ALL OTHER FORECAST ELEMENTS LOOK
GOOD.

UPDATED GRIDS AND TEXT FORECAST TO UPDATE CLOUD COVER WILL BE OUT
SHORTLY.

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 230743
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
200 AM CST SUN JAN 23 2005

.DISCUSSION...
ARCTIC AIR HAS MOVED INTO THE MIDSOUTH THIS MORNING. TEMPERATURES 
HAVE DROPPED TO NEAR 20 DEGREES. WINDS ARE SLOWLY DIMINISHING AS HIGH 
PRESSURE IS BUILDING INTO THE AREA. THE HIGH WILL SETTLE OVER THE 
MIDSOUTH BY TONIGHT. THIS WILL ALLOW WINDS TO BECOME LIGHT AND 
VARIABLE BY TONIGHT. CLEAR TO MOSTLY CLEAR SKIES PREVAIL TODAY AND 
TONIGHT. EXPECT HIGHS TO REACH INTO THE LOW TO MID 30S WITH LOWS 
DROPPING INTO THE MID TEENS TO LOW 20S TONIGHT. 

THE COLD SNAP WILL BE SHORT LIVED AS SOUTHWEST WINDS WILL KICK INTO 
GEAR MONDAY BRINGING A WARMING SPELL TO THE MIDSOUTH. TEMPERATURES 
WILL REBOUND INTO THE MID 40S TO NEAR 50 FOR HIGHS ON MONDAY. 
TUESDAY WILL EVEN BE A LITTLE WARMER.

AN UPPER LOW WILL SKIRT SOUTHERN SECTIONS OF THE MIDSOUTH TUESDAY 
AND TUESDAY NIGHT. NOT A LOT OF MOISTURE TO WORK WITH BUT ETA IS 
PUTTING OUT A LITTLE QPF. GFS IS DRY. CURRENT FORECAST IS DRY...WILL 
KEEP THIS WAY FOR NOW AND WAIT FOR A FEW MORE MODEL RUNS. 

HIGH PRESSURE WILL AGAIN BUILD INTO THE AREA AND WILL DOMINATE THE 
WEATHER THROUGH THE END OF THE FORECAST PERIOD. TEMPERATURES WILL BE 
NEAR NORMAL DURING THIS TIME.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
838 PM CST SAT JAN 22 2005

.DISCUSSION...
SURFACE HIGH NEAR OMAHA THIS EVENING WITH GUSTY NORTH WINDS
CONTINUING TO BLOW ACROSS THE REGION. WINDS CONTINUE TO BE STRONG
WITH SUSTAINED WINDS OF 20 TO 25 MPH AND GUSTS OF 35 TO 40 MPH. WILL
LEAVE WIND ADVISORY ALONE AND LET IT EXPIRE AT MIDNIGHT AS PLANNED.
TEMPERATURES HAVE DROPPED INTO THE UPPER TEENS OVER NORTHWEST
TENNESSEE THIS EVENING BUT THEY SEEM TO BE BECOMING MORE STEADY SO
CURRENT FORECAST STILL LOOKS GOOD.


000 
FXUS64 KMEG 222137
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
337 PM CST SAT JAN 22 2005

.DISCUSSION...
A HIGHLY AMPLIFIED UPPER LEVEL PATTERN IS SETTING UP OVER THE U.S.
THIS AFTERNOON...WITH A FULL LATITUDE TROUGH DIGGING ACROSS THE
EASTERN HALF OF THE COUNTRY...WITH A LARGE RIDGE BUILDING OUT WEST.
THE UPPER LEVEL PATTERN WILL BEGIN TO DE-AMPLIFY BY MID WEEK.

.TONIGHT THROUGH MONDAY NIGHT...

A STRONG COLD FRONT WILL CONTINUE TO PUSH ACROSS THE MID SOUTH LATE
THIS AFTERNOON AND EVENING. THIS FRONT WILL USHER IN MUCH COLDER
TEMPERATURES FOR TONIGHT AND SUNDAY. IN ADDITION...A VERY TIGHT
PRESSURE GRADIENT REMAINS IN PLACE ALLOWING FOR STRONG NORTHWESTERLY
WINDS. THIS GRADIENT WILL REMAIN TIGHT THROUGH EARLY TONIGHT BEFORE
RELAXING FROM WEST TO EAST AFTER MIDNIGHT. MODELS INDICATING WINDS
BETWEEN 35-45 KTS AT 925 MB THROUGH MIDNIGHT...AND WITH STEEP LOW
LEVEL LAPSE RATES IN PLACE AS INDICATED BY ETA12 FORECAST
SOUNDINGS...A FEW STRONG WIND GUSTS MAY STILL OCCUR EVEN AFTER DARK.
THEREFORE HAVE EXTENDED THE WIND ADVISORY THROUGH MIDNIGHT AND HAVE
INCLUDED THE ENTIRE FORECAST AREA.

SKIES WILL CONTINUE TO CLEAR TONIGHT AS STRONG HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS
OVERHEAD. STRONG SUBSIDENCE ON SUNDAY WILL BRING A MOSTLY SUNNY DAY.
LOW LEVEL COLD ADVECTION WILL CONTINUE INTO THE AFTERNOON SUNDAY.
THIS WILL HELP KEEP TEMPERATURES BELOW AVERAGE THROUGH THE REMAINDER
OF THE WEEKEND. HIGH PRESSURE WILL QUICKLY SLIDE EAST OF THE AREA BY
SUNDAY NIGHT...ALLOWING WINDS TO RETURN OUT OF THE SOUTH AND
SOUTHWEST. UPPER LEVEL RIDGING WILL ALSO BUILD EAST WITH SUBSTANTIAL
HEIGHT AND THICKNESS RISES FOR THE BEGINNING OF NEXT WEEK...AS WARM
ADVECTION RETURNS IN EARNEST. THIS MEANS A RATHER QUICK REBOUND IN
TEMPERATURES MONDAY...AFTER A CHILLY START. DRY WEATHER AND
MODERATING TEMPERATURES WILL CONTINUE INTO MONDAY NIGHT.

.TUESDAY THROUGH SATURDAY...

A BROAD UPPER RIDGE WILL CONTINUE TO BUILD OVER THE MID SOUTH
THROUGH MID WEEK. AN UPPER LEVEL LOW PRESSURE CURRENTLY CUT OFF FROM
THE MAIN UPPER FLOW OVER THE SOUTHWESTERN U.S. WILL GRADUALLY LIFT
OUT TO THE EAST AS INDICATED BY THE MEDIUM RANGE FORECAST MODELS
(ECMWF & GFS). AT THIS TIME...THINK THAT SYSTEM AND ASSOCIATED
DEEP MOISTURE WILL REMAIN FAR ENOUGH TO THE SOUTH TO KEEP
PRECIPITATION OUT OF THE FORECAST AREA. WILL NEED TO WATCH THE
EVENTUAL PROGRESSION OF THIS FEATURE OVER THE NEXT COUPLE OF DAYS TO
SEE HOW/IF IT WILL AFFECT OUR WEATHER. THINKING NOW IS JUST AN
INCREASE IN CLOUD COVER.

THE UPPER FLOW WILL BECOME MORE ZONAL BY WEDNESDAY WITH ANOTHER
SHORTWAVE MOVING EAST...HELPING TO PUSH ANOTHER COLD FRONT ACROSS
THE AREA BY WEDNESDAY NIGHT. AT THIS TIME...MOISTURE APPEARS
LIMITED WITH THIS FRONT...SO KEEPING FORECAST DRY. SINCE THE FLOW
WILL BE MORE ZONAL...NOT EXPECTING MUCH OF A TEMPERATURE DROP WITH
THIS FRONT. A MORE SIGNIFICANT SHORTWAVE WILL TRY AND APPROACH THE
REGION BY THE END OF NEXT WEEKEND...AND MAY BRING ANOTHER CHANCE
FOR MORE PRECIPITATION. TEMPERATURES WILL REMAIN NEAR OR ABOVE
AVERAGE FOR THE END OF THE EXTENDED PERIOD.

&&

.MEG...WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MS...NONE.
MO...NONE.
TN...NONE.
&&

$$

JLH

.DISCUSSION...
JUST A QUICK UPDATE TO INCLUDE ENTIRE AREA IN A WIND ADVISORY UNTIL

ACROSS SOUTHEAST AREAS AS WELL OVER NEXT COUPLE OF HOURS. ALSO...
ARCTIC FRONT A BIT SLOWER THAN PREVIOUSLY ANTICIPATED...BUT
TEMPERATURES NOW FALLING DRAMATICALLY ACROSS NORTHWESTERN SECTIONS.
SHOULD SEE TEMPERATURES FALL AREAWIDE OVER THE NEXT ONE TO TWO
HOURS.

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 221632
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
1032 AM CST SAT JAN 22 2005

.DISCUSSION...
A COLD FRONT THAT MOVED ACROSS THE AREA EARLY THIS MORNING IS NOW
TO THE SOUTH OF THE FORECAST AREA. THIS FRONT BROUGHT A LOW STRATUS
DECK ACROSS THE AREA...BUT NO PRECIPITATION. A SECONDARY ARCTIC
BOUNDARY IS NOW ENTERING INTO PORTIONS OF NORTHEAST ARKANSAS THIS
MORNING AND WILL CONTINUE TO PROGRESS SOUTHWARD THROUGH THE DAY. THE
ARCTIC COLD AIRMASS IS LOCATED BEHIND THIS FRONT...WITH TEMPERATURES
ALREADY FALLING THROUGH THE TEENS IN SOUTH-CENTRAL MISSOURI AS OF
16Z. THIS COLD AIR WILL CONTINUE TO FILTER ACROSS THE MID SOUTH
THROUGH THE DAY...SO EXPECT TEMPERATURES TO BEGIN FALLING DURING
THE NEXT COUPLE OF HOURS ACROSS NORTHERN AND CENTRAL SECTIONS AND
THIS AFTERNOON IN THE SOUTH. HAVE UPDATED THE GRIDS TO REFLECT THIS
SCENARIO. SKIES WILL GRADUALLY SCATTER OUT FROM NORTHWEST TO
SOUTHEAST THROUGH THE DAY...WITH EVERYONE BECOMING PARTLY CLOUDY BY
THIS AFTERNOON.

STRONG WINDS WILL ALSO BE A BIG STORY BEHIND THE FRONT THIS
AFTERNOON. STRONG GUSTY NORTHWEST WINDS HAVE BEEN NOTED BEHIND THE
FRONT...WITH SUSTAINED WINDS BETWEEN 20-30 KTS WITH GUSTS AVERAGING
BETWEEN 30-35 KTS. SO THINK WINDS WILL PICK UP QUITE A BIT BEHIND THE
ARCTIC FRONTAL PASSAGE...AND WILL KEEP WIND ADVISORY IN PLACE AS MOST
AREAS SHOULD REACH THE SUSTAINED 22 KT PER ONE HOUR CRITERIA. WILL
CONTINUE TO WATCH SOUTHERN PORTIONS OF THE MID SOUTH LATER THIS
AFTERNOON FOR POSSIBLE INCLUSION IN ADVISORY...BUT WILL LEAVE AS IS
FOR NOW.

UPDATED GRIDS AND TEXT FORECAST OUT SHORTLY.

&&

.MEG...WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MS...NONE.
MO...NONE.
TN...NONE.
&&

$$

JLH

.DISCUSSION...
A COLD FRONT THAT MOVED ACROSS THE AREA EARLY THIS MORNING IS NOW
TO THE SOUTH OF THE FORECAST AREA. THIS FRONT BROUGHT A LOW STRATUS
DECK ACROSS THE AREA...BUT NO PRECIPITATION. A SECONDARY ARCTIC
BOUNDARY IS NOW ENTERING INTO PORTIONS OF NORTHEAST ARKANSAS THIS
MORNING AND WILL CONTINUE TO PROGRESS SOUTHWARD THROUGH THE DAY. THE
ARCTIC COLD AIRMASS IS LOCATED BEHIND THIS FRONT...WITH TEMPERATURES
ALREADY FALLING THROUGH THE TEENS IN SOUTH-CENTRAL MISSOURI AS OF
16Z. THIS COLD AIR WILL CONTINUE TO FILTER ACROSS THE MID SOUTH
THROUGH THE DAY...SO EXPECT TEMPERATURES TO BEGIN FALLING DURING

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 220947
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
345 AM CST SAT JAN 22 2005

.DISCUSSION...00Z UPPER AIR ANALYSIS CENTERS UPPER LEVEL LOW ACROSS 
MINNESOTA WITH AN EMBEDDED SHORTWAVE LOCATED IN THE NORTHERN PLAINS 
AND ANOTHER WAVE IN THE CENTRAL AND SOUTHERN PLAINS.  MAIN FORECAST 
CONCERNS THIS FORECAST PACKAGE WILL BE WIND ADVISORY POTENTIAL TODAY 
AND TONIGHT. 

TODAY...SURFACE ANALYSIS THIS MORNING PLACES COLD FRONT ALONG THE 
MISSOURI/ARKANSAS BORDER. THIS FRONT WILL MOVE THROUGH THE FORECAST 
AREA THIS MORNING WITH TEMPERATURES FALLING THROUGHOUT THE DAY INTO 
THE UPPER 30S TO MIDDLE 40S. I AM A BIT CONCERNED ABOUT WIND 
ADVISORY POTENTIAL FOR TODAY WITH SURFACE PRESSURE GRADIENT BETWEEN 
1008MB OVER MID MISSISSIPPI VALLEY AND LOW AND 1034 MB HIGH ACROSS 
THE CENTRAL PLAINS. SUSTAINED NORTHWEST WINDS IN THE 20KT RANGE WITH 
GUSTS EARLY THIS MORNING BEING REPORTED AROUND 44KTS ACROSS 
NORTHEAST NEBRASKA...ALONG WITH MODEL SOUNDINGS SHOWING 40KT WINDS 
AT 850 MB MIXING DOWN TO THE SURFACE AT LEAST THROUGH MID EVENING. 
THIS DATA SUPPORTS A WIND ADVISORY ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA...AT 
LEAST DOWN TO THE TENNESSEE/MISSISSIPPI STATE LINE THROUGH MIDNIGHT. 
AT THIS TIME IT APPEARS THAT AREAS ACROSS NORTHERN MISSISSIPPI AND A 
SECTION OF ADJACENT ARKANSAS WILL HAVE WINDS BELOW WIND ADVISORY 
CRITERIA...AND WILL LET DAY SHIFT RE-ANALYZE ADVISORY POTENTIAL 
ACROSS THIS AREA CURRENTLY NOT COVERED. MOISTURE WILL BE QUITE 
LIMITED WITH THIS FRONT AND EXPECT A FEW SPRINKLES AT BEST ACROSS 
SOUTH AND EAST SECTIONS OF THE FORECAST AREA WITH A RELATIVELY DRY 
ATMOSPHERE. 

TONIGHT...PRESSURE GRADIENT WILL BEGIN TO WEAKEN ACROSS THE FORECAST 
AREA INTO THE EVENING HOURS AS STRONG SURFACE HIGH DROPS FROM THE 
NORTHERN PLAINS SOUTH INTO THE SOUTHERN PLAINS. WINDS WILL ALSO 
GRADUALLY WEAKEN TOWARDS MORNING. EXPECTING MOSTLY CLEAR SKIES 
ACROSS THE MID SOUTH AS 1000-500 MB LAYER RH/S DROP BELOW 30 
PERCENT. COLD AIR ADVECTION AND DECENT RADIATIONAL COOLING SUPPORTS 
LOWS DROPPING INTO THE LOWER 20S. 

SUNDAY THROUGH TUESDAY...SURFACE HIGH AND ASSOCIATED UPPER LEVEL 
RIDGING WILL GRADUALLY SETTLE IN ACROSS THE NORTHERN GULF OF MEXICO. 
AS A RESULT...NOT EXPECTING ANY RAINFALL CHANCES THROUGH THIS TIME 
FRAME WITH TEMPERATURES EXPECTED TO REMAIN BELOW NORMAL. UPPER LEVEL 
LOW CURRENTLY LOCATED ACROSS THE SOUTHWESTERN UNITED STATES WILL 
BEGIN TO MOVE INTO THE SOUTHEAST U.S. BY TUESDAY...BUT APPEARS TO 
STILL SLIDE TO THE SOUTH OF THE FORECAST AREA AND WILL KEEP FORECAST 
DRY FOR NOW.

NO CHANGES MADE BEYOND TUESDAY.

COORDINATED WITH PAH...LZK...JAN...OHX...BMX...THANKS.

&&

.MEG...WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...ARZ008-009-017-018-026>028-035-036-048...WIND ADVISORY UNTIL 
06Z SUNDAY.
MS...NONE.
MO...MOZ113-115...WIND ADVISORY UNTIL 06Z SUNDAY.
TN...TNZ001>004-019>021-048>055-088>092...WIND ADVISORY UNTIL 06Z 
SUNDAY.

SURFACE WARM FRONT REMAINS ACROSS NORTH MISSISSIPPI AND HAS MADE

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 212146
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
346 PM CST FRI JAN 21 2005

.DISCUSSION...
THE UPPER LEVEL PATTERN WILL ONCE AGAIN BECOME HIGHLY AMPLIFIED OVER
THE UNITED STATES THIS WEEKEND AS A STRONG SHORTWAVE DIVES SOUTHWARD
INTO THE EASTERN UNITED STATES. IN THE WAKE OF THE SHORTWAVE...A DEEP
FULL LATITUDE TROUGH WILL BECOME ESTABLISHED EAST OF THE MISSISSIPPI
RIVER WITH A LARGE UPPER RIDGE TO THE WEST.


.TONIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY...

A LEAD SHORTWAVE WILL DIG SOUTHEAST TONIGHT FROM THE UPPER PLAINS
STATES SOUTHEAST INTO THE OHIO VALLEY BY SATURDAY MORNING. AHEAD
OF THIS SHORTWAVE...A WARM FRONT NOW OVER NORTH-CENTRAL MISSISSIPPI
WILL MOVE NORTH THROUGH THE AREA LATER TONIGHT. THIS WILL KEEP
OVERNIGHT TEMPERATURES FROM FALLING TOO MUCH THROUGH MOST OF
TONIGHT. AS THE LEAD SHORTWAVE MOVES FURTHER SOUTHEAST...IT WILL
HELP TO SEND A STRONG COLD FRONT TOWARDS THE AREA EARLY SATURDAY
MORNING. LOW LEVEL RETURN FLOW WILL BE SHORT-LIVED TONIGHT...SO NOT
EXPECTING MUCH IN THE WAY OF LOW LEVEL MOISTURE RETURN. WITH LIMITED
MOISTURE IN PLACE AHEAD OF THE FRONT...ONLY SLIGHT CHANCES FOR
SHOWERS HAVE BEEN INCLUDED FOR SOUTHERN AND EASTERN ZONES. NOT
CONFIDENT THAT EVEN THESE AREAS WILL SEE MUCH RAINFALL. STRONG LOW
LEVEL COLD ADVECTION WILL BEGIN IN EARNEST BY MID MORNING ON
SATURDAY BEHIND THE COLD FRONT...SO EXPECT HIGH TEMPERATURES TO
OCCUR EARLY IN THE DAY...WITH FALLING TEMPERATURES THROUGH MOST OF
THE DAY SATURDAY. THE MAIN SHORTWAVE TROUGH WILL MOVE ACROSS THE
AREA SATURDAY EVENING. THE CORE OF THE COLDEST AIR WILL BE USHERED
INTO THE REGION WITH THIS SHORTWAVE. IN ADDITION...A FEW FLURRIES
MAY BE SQUEEZED OUT ACROSS NORTHEAST PORTIONS OF THE MID SOUTH
AHEAD OF THE MAIN SHORTWAVE. A STRONG 1041 MB HIGH PRESSURE WILL
BUILD IN BEHIND THE FRONT FOR LATER SATURDAY NIGHT AND SUNDAY...
BRINGING CLEARING SKIES AND ANOTHER BLAST OF COLD ARCTIC AIR.

.SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY...

SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE WILL QUICKLY SLIDE SOUTHEAST WITH UPPER LEVEL
RIDGING BUILDING OVER THE AREA. EXPECT DRY CONDITIONS AND A FAIRLY
QUICK MODERATION IN TEMPERATURES BEGINNING MONDAY AFTER A CHILLY
START. TEMPERATURES WILL CONTINUE TO WARM THROUGH MID WEEK. AN
UPPER LOW OVER THE SOUTHWEST U.S. THIS WEEKEND WILL PULL OUT ACROSS
THE GULF COAST STATES DURING THE TUESDAY/WEDNESDAY TIME FRAME. AT
THIS TIME ANTICIPATING DEEP MOISTURE ASSOCIATED WITH THIS FEATURE
TO REMAIN SOUTH...SO HAVE KEPT POPS OUT OF THE FORECAST FOR THIS
TIME PERIOD. WE WILL NEED TO CONTINUE TO MONITOR THIS TO MAKE SURE
MOISTURE DOES INDEED REMAIN SOUTH. OTHERWISE...CONTINUED DRY. ANOTHER
COLD FRONT WILL MOVE THROUGH WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND THURSDAY...BUT WITH
LIMITED MOISTURE. SO NO RAIN EXPECTED WITH THIS FRONTAL PASSAGE. THE
BEST CHANCES FOR RAIN IN THE EXTENDED WILL COME BY THE END OF THE
WEEK AS ANOTHER STORM SYSTEM ORGANIZES OVER THE PLAINS STATES AND
MOVES EAST.

&&

.MEG...WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MS...NONE.
MO...NONE.
TN...NONE.

FXUS64 KMEG 211634
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
1034 AM CST FRI JAN 21 2005

A BACK-DOOR COLD FRONT THAT MOVED ACROSS THE AREA LAST NIGHT HAS
BECOME STATIONARY THIS MORNING ACROSS NORTH-CENTRAL MISSISSIPPI INTO
SOUTHERN ARKANSAS. TO THE NORTH OF THE FRONT...WINDS REMAIN OUT OF
THE NORTHEAST...HELPING TO ADVECT LOW LEVEL COLD AIR AND A LOW LEVEL
STRATUS CLOUD DECK INTO NORTHERN PORTIONS OF THE AREA. FURTHER
SOUTH...SKIES REMAIN PARTLY TO MOSTLY SUNNY. THUS...HAVE HAD TO
UPDATE THE CLOUD AND TEMPERATURE GRIDS TO REFLECT ONGOING WEATHER.
THINK THAT LOW CLOUDS WILL HANG TOUGH ACROSS NORTHERN SECTIONS
THROUGH MOST OF THE AFTERNOON AS PER ETA12 FORECAST SOUNDINGS...
THEREFORE HAVE CUT BACK TEMPERATURES QUITE A BIT OVER THESE AREAS.
ELSEWHERE...PLENTY OF SUN SHOULD HELP TEMPERATURES REACH NEAR
PREVIOUSLY FORECAST HIGHS.

THE STATIONARY FRONT SHOULD BEGIN TO RETURN BACK TO THE NORTH AS A
WARM FRONT LATER TODAY AND TONIGHT...IN RESPONSE TO AN APPROACHING
UPSTREAM SHORTWAVE TROUGH. MAY ACTUALLY SEE LOW CLOUDS BEGIN TO MIX
OUT LATE THIS AFTERNOON OR EVENING AS WARM FRONT LIFTS BACK NORTH
OF THE AREA. MORE DETAILS THIS AFTERNOON ON THE NEXT APPROACHING
SYSTEM. UPDATED GRIDS WILL BE OUT SHORTLY.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
255 AM CST FRI JAN 21 2005

WEATHER SYSTEMS CONTINUE TO MOVE AT A FAST PACE ACROSS THE
MIDSOUTH. HIGH PRESSURE WILL POUR COOL AIR IN FROM THE NORTH MOST
OF TODAY. THEN...ANOTHER CLIPPER LOW WILL MOVE IN FROM THE
NORTHWEST AND VEER WINDS TO THE SOUTHWEST. ANOTHER HIGH WILL PUSH
QUICKLY IN SATURDAY. NORTHERLY WINDS FROM THIS HIGH WILL BE
RATHER STRONG INTO SATURDAY NIGHT. SATURDAY NIGHT WILL BE SHARPLY
COLDER WITH LOWS BACK INTO THE UPPER TEENS TO THE MID 20S.
ALSO...THERE COULD BE SOME FLURRIES TOWARD MIDNIGHT IN THE
NORTHEASTERN THIRD OF THE MIDSOUTH. SUNDAY AND SUNDAY NIGHT WILL
BE COLD DUE TO THE HIGH.

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 210411
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
1010 PM CST THU JAN 20 2005

.UPDATE...
WEAK LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM OVER NRN MID TN AT 03Z WITH A COLD FRONT 
STRETCHED WEST ACRS MO. FRONT WL MOVE SOUTHWARD THROUGH THE AREA 
TONIGHT. TEMPS STILL FAIRLY WARM WITH STILL SOME LOW LEVEL MIXING 
OCCURRING. WITH FRONT MOVING THROUGH THINK THAT AT LEAST SOME MIXING 
WL CONT OVENIGHT SO HAVE RAISED LOW TEMPS A FEW DEGREES...OTRW 
FORECAST LOOKS GOOD.

.PREV DISCUSSION ISSUED AT 351 PM...
SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE CONTINUES TO PROVIDE A PLEASANT WINTER
AFTERNOON ACROSS THE MID SOUTH. TEMPERATURES HAVE WARMED VERY
NICELY TODAY WITH UPPER 50S NORTH TO LOW AND MID 60S SOUTH. ONLY A
FEW HIGH CLOUDS HAVE BEEN SKIRTING OVERHEAD THIS AFTERNOON AS A
WEAK UPPER LEVEL DISTURBANCE MOVES ACROSS THE AREA. PARTLY CLOUDY
SKIES WILL CONTINUE THROUGH THIS EVENING WITH TEMPERATURES SLOWLY
DROPPING AFTER SUNSET.

.TONIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY EVENING...
A WEAK CLIPPER SYSTEM OVER NORTHERN MISSOURI THIS AFTERNOON WILL
CONTINUE TO DROP SOUTHEAST ACROSS THE MID SOUTH TONIGHT IN THE
NORTHWESTERLY FLOW ALOFT. LOW LEVEL MOISTURE AHEAD OF THIS SYSTEM
WILL REMAIN LIMITED...SO ONLY EXPECTING A SOME HIGH LEVEL CLOUDS AS
THIS FEATURE MOVES THROUGH. SURFACE WINDS SHOULD BACK AROUND TO THE
NORTHWEST LATER TONIGHT THEN NORTHEASTERLY ON FRIDAY. NOT MUCH
COLD AIR BEHIND THIS FRONT...SO TEMPERATURES SHOULD ONLY BE A FEW
DEGREES COOLER ON FRIDAY AS COMPARED TO TODAY. THE LOW LEVEL FLOW
SHOULD EVENTUALLY COME BACK AROUND SOUTHEASTERLY BY FRIDAY EVENING.

.FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY...
A STRONGER SHORTWAVE TROUGH WILL DROP OUT OF THE CANADIAN PRAIRIES
INTO THE NORTHERN PLAINS STATES ON FRIDAY AND THEN SOUTHEASTWARD
ACROSS THE MID MISSISSIPPI AND OHIO VALLEYS ON SATURDAY NIGHT. AHEAD
OF THIS SYSTEM...WE SHOULD SEE A SHORT PERIOD OF RETURN LOW LEVEL
SOUTHERLY FLOW ON FRIDAY NIGHT. SOME MOISTURE SHOULD MOVE BACK NORTH
OVER THE AREA LATE FRIDAY NIGHT AND SATURDAY MORNING. THE BIG
QUESTION WILL BE HOW MUCH MOISTURE. AT THIS TIME IT APPEARS THAT
MOISTURE MAY REMAIN SOMEWHAT LIMITED WITH BOTH THE ETA AND GFS MODELS
BACKING OFF SIGNIFICANTLY ON PRECIPITATION CHANCES FOR LATE FRIDAY
NIGHT AND SATURDAY. HAVE DECIDED TO TRIM BACK RAIN CHANCES FOR THIS
TIME PERIOD...BUT WOULD LIKE TO SEE ANOTHER MODEL RUN OR TWO TO SEE
IF THIS TREND REMAINS CONSISTENT. IF THIS DRY TREND CONTINUES...MAY
NEED TO CUT BACK EVEN FURTHER ON FRIDAY NIGHT/SATURDAY POPS.

AS THIS SHORTWAVE MOVES THROUGH IT WILL HELP TO RECARVE A DEEP
EASTERN U.S THROUGH. IN ADDITION...IT WILL DRIVE A STRONG COLD
FRONT ACROSS THE MID SOUTH ON SATURDAY. THERE ARE SOME MODEL TIMING
ISSUES WITH REGARD TO THE FRONTAL PASSAGE...WITH THE GFS ABOUT 6
HOURS EARLIER THAN THE ETA. THE GFS BRINGS THE FRONT THROUGH AROUND
12Z SATURDAY...WITH THE ETA HOLDING BACK UNTIL LATE MORNING. AT
THIS TIME...THINK THAT THE FRONT WILL MOVE THROUGH MID TO LATE
MORNING ACROSS THE MISSISSIPPI RIVER AND EARLY AFTERNOON FOR POINTS
FURTHER EAST. MUCH COLDER AIR WILL FILTER INTO THE AREA BY
SATURDAY AFTERNOON WITH FALLING TEMPERATURES EXPECTED. THE STRONG
SHORTWAVE SHOULD MOVE ACROSS THE MID SOUTH BY SATURDAY NIGHT. WITH
SUCH A COLD AIRMASS AND SOME LIFT AHEAD OF THE UPPER SHORTWAVE
TROUGH...MAY SEE SOME FLURRIES. SKIES WILL CLEAR OUT ON SUNDAY WITH
COLD BELOW NORMAL TEMPERATURES CONTINUING THROUGH SUNDAY NIGHT.
TEMPERATURES WILL BEGIN TO MODERATE ON MONDAY.

.MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY NIGHT...
BROAD UPPER LEVEL RIDGING WILL BUILD INTO THE AREA THROUGH MID
WEEK...WITH CONTINUED DRY WEATHER AND A GOOD WARM UP IN
TEMPERATURES. A CUT OFF LOW WILL MOVE OUT OF THE SOUTHWEST U.S. AND
ACROSS THE GULF COAST THROUGH TUESDAY. ANY MOISTURE ASSOCIATED WITH
THIS FEATURE WILL REMAIN SOUTH. ANOTHER SHORTWAVE AND ASSOCIATED COLD
FRONT WILL MOVE THROUGH THE AREA ON WEDNESDAY EVENING...BUT LIMITED
MOISTURE SHOULD KEEP THINGS DRY. TEMPERATURES WILL FALL BEHIND THIS
FRONT FOR LATE IN THE EXTENDED PERIOD BEHIND THIS FRONT.

&&

.MEG...WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MS...NONE.
MO...NONE.
TN...NONE.
&&

$$

JLH/SJM

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
1013 AM CST THU JAN 20 2005

.DISCUSSION...
A PLEASANT DAY IS IN STORE FOR THE MID SOUTH TODAY AS SURFACE HIGH
PRESSURE REMAINS OVER THE AREA. UPPER LEVEL NORTHWESTERLY FLOW WILL
CONTINUE WITH A WEAK SHORTWAVE MOVING THROUGH THE AREA THIS
AFTERNOON. THERE WILL BE LIMITED MOISTURE IN ASSOCIATION WITH THIS
WEAK FEATURE...SO NOT EXPECTING ANY MORE THAN SOME HIGH CLOUDS
STREAMING OVERHEAD. THESE CLOUDS SHOULD BE THIN ENOUGH TO ALLOW FOR A
GOOD AMOUNT OF SUNSHINE THIS AFTERNOON...AND WITH CONTINUED LOW LEVEL
SOUTHWESTERLY FLOW AND WEAK LOW LEVEL WARM ADVECTION...THINK THAT
TEMPERATURES WILL REACH FORECAST HIGHS IN THE UPPER 50S CENTRAL AREAS
TO LOW 60S IN THE SOUTHWEST. MAY BUMP TEMPS UP A BIT IN NORTHEAST
SECTIONS...AS CLOUD COVER NOT AS EXTENSIVE AS PREVIOUSLY FORECAST.
OTHERWISE...THE CURRENT FORECAST LOOKS GOOD SO NO OTHER CHANGES
ANTICIPATED AT THIS TIME.

AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
333 AM CST THU JAN 20 2005

.DISCUSSION...
A STATIONARY FRONT EXTENDED ACROSS SOUTHEAST MISSOURI...NORTHWEST TN 
INTO MIDDLE TN THIS MORNING. SATELLITE SHOWS A BROKEN STREAM OF HIGH 
CLOUDS MOVING SOUTHEASTWARD. WINDS THIS MORNING ARE RATHER LIGHT 
WHICH HAS ALLOWED TEMPS TO FALL TO NEAR THE DEW POINT IN MANY 
LOCATIONS. 

TODAY...EXPECT THE STATIONARY FRONT TO MOVE NORTHWARD AS A WARM 
FRONT IN ADVANCE OF THE NEXT CLIPPER SYSTEM THAT IS OVER SOUTH 
DAKOTA AT THIS TIME. EXPECT SKY COVER TO BE SIMILAR TO YESTERDAY IN 
THAT ANY BROKEN OR OVERCAST DECKS IN THE HIGH CLOUDS WILL BE 
SHORT-LIVED RESULTING IN A PARTLY SUNNY DAY. LOOKING AT THE 
EXPERIMENTAL ACARS SOUNDING DATA FROM MEMPHIS THIS 
MORNING...ASSUMING A GOOD AMOUNT OF SUN THEN HIGHS SHOULD APPROACH 
THE 60 DEGREE MARK THIS AFTERNOON. SINCE THE BETTER WARMING IN 
COMING OUT OF THE SOUTHWEST...TEMPS WILL BE A LITTLE COOLER NORTH 
AND EAST TODAY. 

THE CLIPPER SYSTEM WILL ARRIVE THIS EVENING AND DRAG A WEAK COLD 
FRONT...REALLY MORE OF A WIND SHIFT THROUGH THE REGION. WEAK 
DYNAMICS AND DRY LOW LEVELS SO NOT EXPECTING ANY PRECIPITATION WITH 
THIS SYSTEM...JUST OCCASIONAL HIGH CLOUDINESS. THE FRONT SHOULD 
REMAIN SOUTH OF THE REGION INTO FRIDAY. HOWEVER THERE APPEARS TO BE 
NO REAL TEMPERATURE CONTRAST ALONG THE FRONT. GUIDANCE APPEARS WAY 
TO CLOUDY COMPARED TO THE GRIDDED DATA WHICH SHOWS PRIMARILY HIGH 
CLOUDS WITH THE REAL OVERCAST SKIES ASSOCIATED WITH THE NEXT 
SIGNIFICANT FRONT COMING IN LATE IN THE DAY. THIS COULD EXPLAIN WHY 
GUIDANCE IS COOLER. EXPECT HIGHS TO BE CLOSE TO TODAYS EXPECTED 
HIGHS. 

THE FRONT WILL SURGE NORTHWARD FRIDAY NIGHT AHEAD OF A LOW PRESSURE 
SYSTEM THAT WILL MOVE ACROSS SOUTHERN MISSOURI AND INTO SOUTHERN 
ILLINOIS. THIS WILL DRAG A COLD FRONT INTO NORTHEAST ARKANSAS 
TOWARDS DAWN. DYNAMICS WITH THE FRONT ARE RELATIVELY WEAK UNTIL 
DURING THE DAY ON SATURDAY. THEN A STRONG VORT MAX WILL BEGIN TO 
DROP OUT OF THE NORTHERN PLAINS. THIS WILL PUSH MUCH COLDER AIR DOWN 
THE PLAINS RESULTING IN A STRONGER FRONT DURING THE DAY. EXPECT 
SHOWERS TO BREAK OUT ALONG THE FRONT ALTHOUGH UNCERTAIN AS TO 
WHEN/WHERE. THE 00Z RUN OF THE ETA APPEARS TO HAVE SOME CONVECTIVE 
PROBLEMS. IT SURGES THE INSTABILITY UP NORTH WAY TOO FAST. THE 06Z 
RUN OF THE ETA ALREADY IS BACKING OFF OF THIS. THE GFS SEEMS TO HAVE 
A BETTER HANDLE ON THE SYSTEM IMPLYING ONLY A FEW SCATTERED SHOWERS 
ALONG THE FRONT. THUS...HAVE SIDED MORE TOWARDS THE MAV POPS AND 
WOULDNT BE TOTALLY SHOCKED IF MUCH OF THE REGION REMAINED DRY. BOTH 
MODELS SHOW A DRY SLOT MOVING IN DURING THE AFTERNOON ON SATURDAY SO 
DONT BE SURPRISED IF THE SUN MADE AN APPEARANCE FOR A TIME. 
HOWEVER...THE UPPER VORT AND ASSOCIATED COLD AIR WILL MOVE BACK IN 
LATE IN THE AFTERNOON AND EVENING. 850 TEMPS ON BOTH GFS/ETA ARE 
AROUND -15...SO EXPECTING A DECK OF LOW CLOUDS TO COME DOWN AND 
WOULDNT BE SURPRISED IF A FEW FLURRIES COULD GET SQUEEZED OUT.

LOOKS LIKE A QUICK SHOT OF COLD AIR WITH SUNDAY BEING THE COLDEST 
WITH TEMPS LIKELY NOT TO MAKE IT OUT OF THE 30S...HOPEFULLY MAKING 
IT INTO THE 30S IN SOME PARTS. THE WARM UP WILL BEGIN ON MONDAY WITH 
THE PATTERN LOOKING DRY AND WARMER.
&&

.MEG...WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MS...NONE.
MO...NONE.
TN...NONE.
&&

VALLE

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 200250
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
850 PM CST WED JAN 19 2005

.UPDATE...
WEAK SURFACE PRESSURE GRADIENT ACROSS THE MID SOUTH THIS EVENING 
WITH CIRRUS STREAMING ACRS THE MID SOUTH IN FAST NW FLOW ALOFT. 
WHERE WINDS HAVE GONE CALM TEMPS ALREADY IN THE MID AND LOWER 30S. 
HAVE UPDATED TO LOWER MIN TEMPS A COUPLE OF DEGREES...OTRW NO 
CHANGES.

.PREV DISCUSSION ISSUED AT 235 PM...
WEAK TROF OF LOW PRESSURE MOVING INTO NORTHWEST SECTIONS OF CWA
EARLY THIS AFTERNOON. SIGNIFICANT CLOUD COVER HAS CLEARED THE
SOUTHERN PORTIONS OF THE CWA...WHILE SCATTERED CIRRUS ASSOCIATED
WITH A SHORTWAVE AND THE WIND SHIFT ARE MOVING INTO NORTHERN
SECTIONS. TEMPERATURES ARE GENERALLY IN THE LOWER TO MIDDLE 50S
ACROSS THE AREA...EXCEPT FOR A FEW UPPER 40S IN THE EXTREME
NORTHEAST.
&&

.SHORT TERM (THROUGH SATURDAY)...
QUIET FORECAST FOR THURSDAY AND FRIDAY WITH NO MAJOR IMPULSES IN THE
NORTHWEST FLOW. PROBABLY A FEW PERIODS OF CLOUDS...BUT THAT IS IT.
VERY HEALTHY CLIPPER MOVING THROUGH THE AREA ON SATURDAY. COULD BE
PRECIPITATION AS EARLY AS FRIDAY NIGHT IN THE NORTH...SO WILL HOLD
THE 20 PERCENT THERE. WITH MODELS COMING INTO AGREEMENT ON TIMING
OF PRECIPITATION DURING THE DAY ON SATURDAY...WILL GO WITH LIKELY
POPS. PRECIP MAY CONTINUE INTO SATURDAY EVENING...BUT WILL HOLD OFF
ON MENTION OF POSSIBLE FLURRIES...AS MOISTURE MAY DEPART BEFORE AIR
GETS COLD ENOUGH TO SNOW.

TEMPERATURES...GUIDANCE WAS WELL SHORT ON MAX TEMPS TODAY. NO REAL
DRY AIR WITH TROF PASSAGE THIS EVENING...SO CANNOT SEE LOWS MUCH
LOWER THAN WHAT IS IN CURRENT FORECAST...FAIRLY CLOSE TO MAV.
TOMORROW SHOULD BE A COUPLE OF DEGREES WARMER THAN TODAY. BUMPED UP
FORECAST HIGHS/LOWS FOR THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY. TIMING OF
FRONTAL PASSAGE SATURDAY WILL BE DURING THE DAY INSTEAD OF AROUND
SUNRISE...SO HAVE INDICATED RECOVERY IN TEMPERATURES SEVERAL
DEGREES ABOVE OVERNIGHT LOWS.
&&

.LONG TERM (BEYOND SATURDAY)...
THE SATURDAY CLIPPER SYSTEM MAY EVENTUALLY BE A NEWS MAKER TO OUR
EAST...AS GUIDANCE DEVELOPS A VERY HEALTHY COASTAL STORM.  ITS MAIN
EFFECT FOR US WILL BE TO DRAG COLD AIR INTO THE AREA. COLD AIR MOVES
IN FOR 24-36 HOURS SUNDAY AND MONDAY. LOWERED TEMPS FROM EARLIER
FORECASTS. CURRENT MODEL DATA INDICATES THIS AIRMASS WILL NOT BE AS
DRASTIC OVER OUR AREA AS THE PAST FEW COLD AIR MASSES. WHILE TEMPS
WILL BE BELOW NORMAL...STILL EXPECT HIGHS TO BE NEAR 40 SUNDAY. AFTER
THIS HIGH MOVES OFF TO THE EAST...AIRMASS BECOMES ONE MORE OF PACIFIC
ORIGIN THAN ARCTIC. NO PRECIPITATION EVENTS IN THE EXTENDED...WITH
TEMPERATURES MUCH CLOSER TO...OR ABOVE NORMAL FOR TUESDAY AND
WEDNESDAY OF NEXT WEEK.
&&

.MEG...WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MS...NONE.
MO...NONE.
TN...NONE.
&&

$$

WAGNER/SJM

ALSO RUNNING A LITTLE ABOVE FORECAST CURVES...AND HAVE BUMPED

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 190927
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
330 AM CST WED JAN 19 2005

.DISCUSSION...
WARM AIR ADVECTION HAS BEEN OCCURRING OVERNIGHT. AS A RESULT...MANY 
LOCATIONS HAVE ACTUALLY SEEN TEMPERATURES RISING THROUGHOUT THE 
NIGHT. SATELLITE IMAGERY SHOWS A DECK OF 5-6000FT CLOUDS MOVING OVER 
THE REGION FROM THE WEST WITH 10-15000FT CLOUDS MOVING SOUTH FROM 
THE NORTH AHEAD OF THE NEXT SHORTWAVE. THE SHORTWAVE DOES HAVE A 
SURFACE FEATURE WITH IT ALTHOUGH NOT MUCH IN THE WAY OF COLD AIR 
BEHIND IT...MORE OF A WIND SHIFT TO THE WEST/NORTHWEST. RADAR 
IMAGERY FROM PADUCAH AND MEMPHIS HAS HAD A FEW RETURNS...BUT SURFACE 
OBSERVATIONS SUGGEST THAT THIS IS NOTHING MORE THAN VIRGA. DO NOT 
EXPECT ANY PRECIPITATION WITH THIS SYSTEM SINCE LOW LEVELS ARE 
INCREDIBLY DRY AND UPWARD VERTICAL MOTION IS RELATIVELY WEAK.

GENERALLY FAVOR THE WAY THAT THE MAV HANDLES THE SKY CONDITIONS FOR 
TODAY WITH CLEARING SKIES OVER MUCH OF THE AREA THIS AFTERNOON. 
AREAS SOUTH OF A LINE FROM TUPELO TO CLARKSDALE MAY NOT SEE THE 
CLEARING TILL LATE IN THE DAY...PERHAPS EVEN THIS EVENING. NO MAJOR 
CHANGES MADE TO THE TEMP FORECAST FOR TODAY OR TONIGHT. 

ANOTHER WEAK SHORTWAVE/CLIPPER SYSTEM WILL ARRIVE TOMORROW AFTERNOON 
AND EVENING. ONCE AGAIN...WEAK DYNAMICS AND DRY LOW LEVELS WILL 
HINDER ANY PRECIPITATION. SKY FORECAST LOOKS PROBLEMATIC WITH THE 
GFS SHOWING MUCH MORE IN THE WAY OF CLOUDS WITH THIS SYSTEM THAN THE 
ETA. GIVEN THE UNCERTAINTY HAVE DECIDED TO KEEP PARTLY CLOUDY GOING 
FOR NOW AND TAKE ANOTHER LOOK AT IT ON THE 12Z MODEL RUNS. RAISED 
TEMPS SLIGHTLY FOR THURSDAY AND THURSDAY NIGHT TO FALL MORE INTO 
LINE WITH GUIDANCE WHICH LOOKS REASONABLE. 

FRIDAY LOOKS DRY STILL WITH CLOUD COVER STILL AN ISSUE. THE FRONT 
WILL BEGIN TO MOVE EASTWARD AS A WARM FRONT BUT HOW FAST THIS FRONT 
MOVES OUT OF THE AREA AND HOW MUCH LOW CLOUDS IS ASSOCIATED WITH IT 
IS STILL IN QUESTION. THE GFS IS MUCH FASTER WITH THE FRONT AND MORE 
AGGRESSIVE ON THE WARM AIR ADVECTION THAN THE ETA/EUROPEAN 
SOLUTIONS. FAVOR THE TIMING OF THE ETA/EUROPEAN SOLUTIONS WHICH IS 
NOT AS WARM AS THE GFS ON FRIDAY AND BRINGS THE FRONT THROUGH DURING 
THE DAY ON SATURDAY. ATMOSPHERE TOO STABLE FOR THUNDERSTORMS. THE 
FORECAST WILL LINGER THE PRECIPITATION INTO SATURDAY EVENING...THIS 
IS DUE TO UNCERTAINTY OF FRONTAL PASSAGE THAN ANYTHING. EUROPEAN/GFS 
BOTH SHOW A SUBSTANTIAL AMOUNT OF COLD AIR POURING INTO THE REGION 
ON THE BACK SIDE OF THE SYSTEM WITH 850 TEMPS FALLING BELOW -10...AS 
LOW AS -15 ON THE GFS. IF THERE IS ANY MOISTURE LEFT ON THE BACKSIDE 
OF THE SYSTEM...A FLURRY COULDNT BE ENTIRELY RULED OUT. HAVE LOWERED 
MIN TEMPS SAT NITE AND HIGHS ON SUNDAY DRASTICALLY DUE TO THIS 
PLUNGE OF COLD AIR. ALTHOUGH IT LOOKS LIKE A QUICK HITTING SHOT WITH 
THE TROUGH MOVING EAST OF THE REGION BY MONDAY AND A WARMING TREND 
AGAIN TOWARDS MIDWEEK. 

&&

.MEG...WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MS...NONE.
MO...NONE.
TN...NONE.
&&

$$

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 190227
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
820 PM CST TUE JAN 18 2005

.UPDATE...
HIGH PRESSURE RAPIDLY RETREATING FROM THE REGION AS A SYSTEM PASSES 
TO THE NORTH THROUGH LOWER GREAT LAKES. SFC PRESSURE GRADIENT IS 
INCREASING AND SFC WINDS ARE STARTING TO INCREASE FROM THE SOUTH 
THIS EVENING. TEMPS PROBABLY BOTTOMED OUT ACRS MUCH OF THE REGION 
AROUND 01Z-02Z EXPECT MAYBE NE MS WHERE THE GRADIENT IS STILL WEAK 
AND TEMPS WL FALL A FEW MORE DEGREES. MID AND HIGH CLOUDS WL 
INCREASE NORTH TO SOUTH AS THE NIGHT WEARS ON AND THIS SHOULD ALSO 
SLOW ANY TEMP FALL. CURRENT FORECAST COVERS THIS WELL WITH NO 
UPDATES PLANNED.

.PREV DISCUSSION ISSUED AT 140 PM...
SKIES MOSTLY SUNNY ACROSS THE AREA WITH TEMPERATURES IN THE 30S.
WINDS GRADUALLY COMING AROUND TO THE SOUTHEAST. DEWPOINTS SITTING
IN THE SINGLE DIGITS AND LOWER TEENS.
&&

.SHORT TERM (THROUGH FRIDAY)...
WE REMAIN IN NORTHWEST FLOW THROUGH FRIDAY. SEVERAL IMPULSES MOVING
THROUGH TROF...BUT ALL ARE MOISTURE STARVED. ISENTROPIC CHART AT
290K OFF THE ETA SHOWS THERE COULD BE A 3 TO 6 HOUR PERIOD OF CLOUDS
AROUND 5K FT DURING THE DAY TOMORROW...BUT OTHER THAN THAT...PRETTY
MUCH CLEAR SAILING THROUGH FRIDAY.

CONSIDERING CLEAR SKIES...VERY LOW DEWPOINTS...LIGHT WINDS AND COLD
AIR MASS...MAV MINS FOR TONIGHT APPEAR TO BE TOO WARM. THAT BEING
SAID...OVERNIGHT LOWS WILL LIKELY OCCUR BEFORE MIDNIGHT...ESPECIALLY
IN THE WEST...AS GRADIENT/WIND INCREASES. CURRENT FORECAST IS NEAR
MET GUIDANCE FOR TONIGHT...EXCEPT AT TUPELO. WILL LEAVE CURRENT
FORECAST AS IS...BLENDS PRETTY WELL WITH NEIGHBORS.

ON WEDNESDAY...TEMPS SHOULD BE ABOUT 10 DEGREES HIGHER THAN TODAYS
LEVELS. IF CLOUDS LINGER TOO LONG...THIS MAY BE OVERDONE. FWC
GUIDANCE LOOKS UNUSUALLY WARM...MAV MORE REPRESENTATIVE. WEDNESDAY
NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY NIGHT FORECAST LOOKS GOOD AS IS. ETA
INDICATES SIGNIFICANT COOLING ON FRIDAY...GFS MUCH LESS SO. TRENDED
TOWARD GFS/MAV GUIDANCE...WHICH IS ACTUALLY NEAR CLIMO.
&&

.LONG TERM (AFTER FRIDAY)...
NOT MUCH HAS CHANGED IN THE EXTENDED FORECAST...WITH RESPECT TO
PRECIPITATION. CLIPPER SYSTEM FRIDAY NIGHT AND SATURDAY MORNING COULD
PRODUCE A FEW SHOWERS. BOTH ETA AND GFS INDICATE ANY PRECIPITATION
WOULD BE STRICTLY LIQUID.

ONE MORE COLD SHOT ON SUNDAY...BUT APPEARS TO ONLY HANG AROUND 24-36
HOURS. GFS SOLUTION AFTER MONDAY SHOWS WESTERN RIDGE FLATTENING OUT
WITH NO SIGNIFICANT INTRUSIONS OF COLD AIR FOR MUCH OF NEXT WEEK.
WHAT I HAVE BEEN ABLE TO LOOK AT OF THE UKMET AND ECMWF SUPPORT
FLATTENING OF WRN RIDGE. EXPECTING TEMPERATURES ABOVE NORMAL FROM
TUESDAY ONWARD NEXT WEEK. NOT MUCH IN THE WAY OF PRECIP EITHER...
WHICH SHOULD ALLOW THE MISSISSIPPI RIVER TO FALL BACK BELOW FLOOD
STAGE.

.MEG...WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MS...NONE.
MO...NONE.
TN...NONE.
&&

FXUS64 KMEG 180929
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
328 AM CST TUE JAN 18 2005

.DISCUSSION...
THIS MORNINGS SURFACE MAP PLACES HIGH PRESSURE OVER EAST CENTRAL 
ILLINOIS. WINDS OVER THE REGION ARE OUT OF THE NORTHEAST THIS 
MORNING BUT SHOULD WORK THEIR WAY AROUND TO THE SOUTHEAST LATER 
TODAY AS THE HIGH MOVES OFF TO THE EAST. ANOTHER COLD DAY IN STORE 
WITH THE ARCTIC HIGH STILL NEARBY. TEMPS WILL RANGE FROM THE MID 30S 
OVER NORTHEAST ARKANSAS AND NORTHWEST TN TO AROUND 40 OVER NORTHERN 
MS. 

WINDS WILL STAY UP TONIGHT AS A WEAK UPPER SHORTWAVE WILL MOVE 
THROUGH THE AREA. THIS WILL BRING A MIX OF CLEAR SKIES AND CLOUDS. 
COMBINED WITH WARM AIR ADVECTION OVER THE REGION...TEMPS SHOULD 
BEGIN TO WARM UP. PARTLY CLOUDY SKIES WILL CONTINUE INTO WEDNESDAY 
WITH HIGHS APPROACHING 50 DEGREES. A WEAK COOL FRONT WILL ARRIVE 
LATE THURSDAY INTO THURSDAY NIGHT. CURRENT MODELS INDICATE THAT 
MOISTURE AHEAD OF THE FRONT AND LIFT ALONG THE FRONT BOTH APPEAR TO 
BE A PROBLEM AS FAR AS RAINFALL GOES. 

THE BETTER CHANCE FOR RAIN IS STILL FRIDAY NIGHT INTO SATURDAY WHEN 
ANOTHER SYSTEM IN THE NORTHWEST FLOW WILL APPROACH THE REGION. THE 
BETTER LIFT IS ASSOCIATED WITH THE UPPER VORT AND ASSOCIATED SURFACE 
LOW WHICH LOOKS LIKE IT WILL TRACK JUST NORTH OF THE REGION. 
STILL...THERE MAY BE ENOUGH LIFT ALONG THE FRONT TO SQUEEZE OUT A 
FEW RAIN SHOWERS. AFTERWARDS...NORTHWEST FLOW SETUP CONTINUES OVER 
THE AREA ALTHOUGH NO SIGNIFICANT SYSTEMS TO SPEAK OF. 

&&

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 180310
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
910 PM CST MON JAN 17 2005

.UPDATE...
SFC HIGH PRESSURE CENTERED ALONG THE MS RIVER OVERNIGHT WITH NW FLOW 
ALOFT. A FEW MID CLOUDS MOVING ACRS W TN THIS EVENING OTRW CLEAR 
SKIES. SFC TEMPS IN THE LOW AND MID 20S WITH LIGHT NE WINDS. 
FORECAST ON TRACK WITH NO CHANGES ATTM.

.PREV DISCUSSION ISSUED AR 141 PM...
SURFACE HIGH OVER NORTHERN MIDWEST...CONTINUING TO FUNNEL COLD
AIR INTO THE MIDSOUTH. TEMPERATURES IN THE 20S TO MID 30S AT MID
AFTERNOON WITH NORTHEAST WINDS. SOME MID-LEVEL CLOUDS MOVING
SOUTHEASTWARD ACROSS MISSOURI...ASSOCIATED WITH A WEAK SHORTWAVE.
&&

.SHORT TERM (THROUGH THURSDAY)...
NOT MUCH TO TALK ABOUT. WE REMAIN IN NORTHWESTERLY UPPER FLOW.
WEAK SHORTWAVES MOVE THROUGH THE TROF...BUT WITH MOISTURE
LACKING...NO MORE THAN PERIODS OF CLOUDS EXPECTED THROUGH
THURSDAY.

SURFACE RIDGE AXIS REORIENTS NORTHEAST SOUTHWEST BY TUESDAY MORNING.
THIS WILL ALLOW WESTERN SECTIONS TO BE THE WARMEST TUESDAY MORNING.
EXPECT MID-LEVEL CLOUDS OVER MISSOURI THIS AFTERNOON TO BE
TRANSITORY...AND HAVE LITTLE EFFECT ON OVERNIGHT LOWS. LOWERED
EARLIER FORECAST A COUPLE OF DEGREES. FORECAST TEMPS FOR TUESDAY
THROUGH WEDNESDAY LOOK VERY REASONABLE...AND ANY CHANGES TO THOSE
WERE MINOR.

FORECAST CLOUD COVER WILL BE THE ISSUE ON THURSDAY. ETA INDICATES A
GOOD BIT OF SUNSHINE...GFS A LITTLE MORE PESSIMISTIC. ON HIGH
TEMPS...WENT HIGHER THAN THE GFS WOULD INDICATE...BUT NOT AS WARM
AS THE ETA.
&&

.LONG TERM (AFTER THURSDAY)...
BEST CHANCE OF PRECIPITATION APPEARS TO BE AROUND FRIDAY NIGHT
OR SATURDAY WITH ANOTHER CLIPPER TYPE SYSTEM. CURRENT FORECAST
HAS SLIGHT CHANCE FOR THOSE 2 PERIODS...BUT DONT SEE ENOUGH OF A
SIGNAL ONE WAY OR THE OTHER TO MAKE CHANGES AT THIS TIME.
HOPEFULLY...A SOLUTION WITH A LITTLE MORE CONSENSUS WILL BECOME
APPARENT IN THE NEXT DAY OR TWO. PRETTY MUCH DRY OTHERWISE.

TEMPERATURES SHOULD BE FAIRLY CLOSE TO CLIMO ON FRIDAY AND
SATURDAY...WITH ANOTHER GLANCING ONE DAY SHOT OF COLD AIR ON
SUNDAY. MAIN COLD AIR TO REMAIN BOTTLED UP TO OUR NORTH AND EAST.
&&

.MEG...WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MS...NONE.
MO...NONE.
TN...NONE.
&&

$$

WAGNER/SJM

NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
141 PM CST MON JAN 17 2005

.DISCUSSION...
SURFACE HIGH OVER NORTHERN MIDWEST...CONTINUING TO FUNNEL COLD
AIR INTO THE MIDSOUTH. TEMPERATURES IN THE 20S TO MID 30S AT MID
AFTERNOON WITH NORTHEAST WINDS. SOME MID-LEVEL CLOUDS MOVING
SOUTHEASTWARD ACROSS MISSOURI...ASSOCIATED WITH A WEAK SHORTWAVE.
&&

.SHORT TERM (THROUGH THURSDAY)...
NOT MUCH TO TALK ABOUT. WE REMAIN IN NORTHWESTERLY UPPER FLOW.
WEAK SHORTWAVES MOVE THROUGH THE TROF...BUT WITH MOISTURE
LACKING...NO MORE THAN PERIODS OF CLOUDS EXPECTED THROUGH
THURSDAY.

SURFACE RIDGE AXIS REORIENTS NORTHEAST SOUTHWEST BY TUESDAY MORNING.
THIS WILL ALLOW WESTERN SECTIONS TO BE THE WARMEST TUESDAY MORNING.
EXPECT MID-LEVEL CLOUDS OVER MISSOURI THIS AFTERNOON TO BE
TRANSITORY...AND HAVE LITTLE EFFECT ON OVERNIGHT LOWS. LOWERED
EARLIER FORECAST A COUPLE OF DEGREES. FORECAST TEMPS FOR TUESDAY
THROUGH WEDNESDAY LOOK VERY REASONABLE...AND ANY CHANGES TO THOSE
WERE MINOR.

FORECAST CLOUD COVER WILL BE THE ISSUE ON THURSDAY. ETA INDICATES A
GOOD BIT OF SUNSHINE...GFS A LITTLE MORE PESSIMISTIC. ON HIGH
TEMPS...WENT HIGHER THAN THE GFS WOULD INDICATE...BUT NOT AS WARM
AS THE ETA.
&&

.LONG TERM (AFTER THURSDAY)...
BEST CHANCE OF PRECIPITATION APPEARS TO BE AROUND FRIDAY NIGHT
OR SATURDAY WITH ANOTHER CLIPPER TYPE SYSTEM. CURRENT FORECAST
HAS SLIGHT CHANCE FOR THOSE 2 PERIODS...BUT DONT SEE ENOUGH OF A
SIGNAL ONE WAY OR THE OTHER TO MAKE CHANGES AT THIS TIME.
HOPEFULLY...A SOLUTION WITH A LITTLE MORE CONSENSUS WILL BECOME
APPARENT IN THE NEXT DAY OR TWO. PRETTY MUCH DRY OTHERWISE.

TEMPERATURES SHOULD BE FAIRLY CLOSE TO CLIMO ON FRIDAY AND
SATURDAY...WITH ANOTHER GLANCING ONE DAY SHOT OF COLD AIR ON
SUNDAY. MAIN COLD AIR TO REMAIN BOTTLED UP TO OUR NORTH AND EAST.

IN SINGLE DIGITS AND DROPPING ACROSS THE NORTHERN THIRD OF THE 
FORECAST AREA. 

BY TUESDAY...THE HIGH WILL SHIFT SOUTHEASTWARD OVER THE OHIO VALLEY. 
A SLOW WARMING TREND WILL BEGIN TUESDAY AS THE NEXT STORM SYSTEM 
MOVES ACROSS THE GREAT LAKES TUESDAY NIGHT. LOW LEVEL WINDS WILL 
SHIFT TO THE SOUTHWEST WHICH WILL YIELD THE WARM ADVECTION WE WILL 
NEED TO WARM.

THE FORECAST AREA WILL REMAIN FREE OF PRECIPITATION THROUGH MUCH OF 
THE WEEK. MAY GET A GLANCING BLOW OF ANOTHER COOL SHOT OF 
AIR...ESPECIALLY ACROSS THE N ERN PARTS OF THE FORECAST AREA. THIS 
COOLER AIR WOULD BE IN RESPONSE TO A SHORTWAVE DIVING DOWN ACROSS 
THE SRN GREAT LAKES REGION TOWARD WEST VIRGINIA.

AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
325 AM CST SUN JAN 16 2005

.DISCUSSION...
ONLY MINOR CHANGES NEEDED IN THE CURRENT FORECAST. THE STRONG 
SHORTWAVE TRANSLATING ACROSS SRN ILLINOIS THIS MORNING CAN BE SEEN 
ON WATER VAPOR ANIMATION. LOWER CLOUD DECK OVER SRN MO CREEPING INTO 
NE AR THIS MORNING. EXPECT THESE CLOUDS TO CLIP THE NORTHERN TWO 
THIRDS OF THE FORECAST AREA TODAY. THE REAL STORY WILL BE THE COLD 
ADVECTION THAT WILL TAKE PLACE TODAY ACROSS THE MID SOUTH. IT WILL 
BE A NOTICEABLY COOLER DAY AS THE AFOREMENTIONED SHORTWAVE OPENS THE 
COLD AIR FLOOD GATES. CURRENT TEMPERATURES IN STL IS 14 DEGREES 
GRADUALLY WARMING TO THE MID 20S IN THE MO BOOTHEEL.

SOME HIGH CLOUDS ARE EXPECTED TO AFFECT THE MID SOUTH LATE SUNDAY 
NIGHT. THE MAIN EFFECT THE CLOUDS WILL HAVE IS ON 
TEMPERATURES...DEPENDING ON THE THICKNESS OF THEM. CURRENT THINKING 
IS THAT THEY WILL BE THIN AND GOOD RADIATIONAL COOLING SHOULD STILL 
TAKE PLACE. OTHERWISE...MIN TEMPS MONDAY MORNING WILL BE A FEW 
DEGREES WARMER. BY MONDAY...MORE MID LEVEL MOISTURE/CLOUDS WILL 
DRIFT ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA AFFECTING INSOLATION. SO EXPECT A 
MIRROR TO SUNDAY AS FAR AS MAX TEMPS ON MONDAY. 

A DRY FORECAST CONTINUES THROUGH MOST OF NEXT WEEK. THE LONG RANGE 
MODELS YESTERDAY WERE ADVERTISING POSSIBLE RAIN CHANCES FRIDAY NIGHT 
INTO SATURDAY. THE GFS HAS FLOPPED TO A DRY FORECAST AND A DIFFERENT 
PATTERN OVER THE REGION. EVEN THE ECMWF AND NOGAPS HAVE COME TO 
AGREEMENT WITH THIS DRIER SOLUTION. WILL LEAVE FORECAST AS IS FOR 
NOW AND LET NEXT SHIFT RE-EVALUATE IN GREATER DETAIL.

FXUS64 KMEG 150908
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
308 AM CST SAT JAN 15 2005

.DISCUSSION...
HIGH LEVEL CLOUDINESS CONTINUES TO STREAM OVER THE MID SOUTH THIS 
MORNING. ADDITIONAL CLOUDS WILL DRIFT ACROSS MAINLY THE SOUTHERN 
HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA TODAY. MAX TEMPERATURES WILL BE COOLER 
THAN YESTERDAY AS THE SURFACE HIGH BUILDS FARTHER EAST AND WEAK COLD 
ADVECTION OCCURS.

FOCUS WILL SHIFT TO A SHORTWAVE OVER THE NORTHERN PLAINS TONIGHT. IT 
WILL SWING ACROSS SOUTHERN ILLINOIS/INDIANA EARLY SUNDAY. THIS WILL 
PUSH MORE COLD AIR INTO THE REGION SUNDAY. EXPECTING MAX TEMPS 
SUNDAY TO BE ANYWHERE FROM 3 TO 5 DEGREES COOLER THAN TODAY. 
OVERNIGHT LOWS SUNDAY NIGHT WILL BE THE COLDEST FROM THIS COLD 
BLAST. A SLOW WARM UP WILL OCCUR THROUGH NEXT WEEK.

LOOKING FARTHER OUT...WE WILL HAVE TO KEEP OUR EYE ON TWO SYSTEMS. 
ONE SOUTHERN STORM SYSTEM THAT THE LATEST GFS MODEL PICKS UP ON OFF 
THE COAST OF BAJA ON THURSDAY MORNING. THE OTHER SYSTEM IS A STRONG 
SHORTWAVE MOVING ACROSS THE NORTHWEST U.S. DURING THE SAME TIME 
FRAME. THE NOGAPS AND EUROPEAN MODELS AGREE WITH BOTH OF THESE 
FEATURES AT THIS TIME FRAME. WILL AWAIT ANOTHER MODEL RUN TO SEE 
WHAT SORT OF CONSISTENCY THE MODEL SOLUTIONS COME UP WITH. BY FRIDAY 
NIGHT...THESE TWO STORM SYSTEMS WOULD MERGE AND PRODUCE OUR NEXT 
CHANCE OF RAIN INTO SATURDAY. FOR NOW WE WILL LEAVE THE FORECAST DRY 
PENDING AT LEAST ANOTHER RUN OF THE GFS.

&&

.MEG...WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.

.DISCUSSION...
QUIET WEATHER EXPECTED FOR THE NEXT SEVEN DAYS. A BROAD UPPER TROUGH 
HAS SET UP OVER THE EASTERN 3/4 OF THE U.S. WILL BRING SURFACE HIGH 
PRESSURE INTO THE MID SOUTH. THE HIGH WILL SLOWLY SHIFT EASTWARD 
FROM THE CENTRAL PLAINS THROUGH SUNDAY AS IT BUILDS INTO THE OHIO 
VALLEY. IT WILL BE REPLACED BY ANOTHER SURFACE HIGH TO THE NORTH IN

AFTERNOON. THIS WILL GENERAL CAUSE COOL TEMPERATURES AND DRY WEATHER 
FOR THE FORECAST AREA. BY EARLY NEXT WEEK...THE BROAD TROUGH WILL 
PUSH INTO THE EASTERN U.S. AND A BROAD RIDGE SET UP OUT WEST. THIS 
PATTERN WILL CONTINUE THROUGH NEXT WEEKEND. EXPECT STORMS TO TRACK 
ALONG THE NORTHERN BRANCH...ACROSS MN...WI AND MI RATHER THAN THIS 
FAR SOUTH. ANY MOISTURE ACROSS THE MID SOUTH WILL BE VERY LIMITED. 
IN ADDITION...THERE WILL BE A LACK OF ANY SIGNIFICANT LIFTING 
MECHANISM THUS THE DRY FORECAST THROUGH THE FORECAST PERIOD.

FXUS64 KMEG 131016
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
415 AM CST THU JAN 13 2005

.DISCUSSION...LATEST SURFACE ANALYSIS PLACES COLD FRONT STRETCHING 
FROM SAINT LOUIS MISSOURI INTO WESTERN ARKANSAS.  WATER VAPOR 
IMAGERY SHOWS GULF MOISTURE RIDING UP WARM CONVEYOR BELT WITH 
PRONOUNCED DRYING ACROSS OKLAHOMA AND TEXAS. MAIN FORECAST CONCERNS FOR 
THE FORECAST PACKAGE WILL BE EARLY SEVERE WEATHER CONCERNS AND 
PRECIPITATION CHANCES FOR TODAY. 

TODAY...LATEST 88D TRENDS SHOW SQUALL LINE JUST CROSSING THE 
MISSISSIPPI RIVER AT 3AM. POOR MID LEVEL LAPSE RATES /BELOW 6 
C/KM/...ONLY A FEW HUNDRED J/KG OF CAPE AND RELATIVELY STABLE 
SURFACE LAYER ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA HAS LIMITED THE SEVERE 
WEATHER POTENTIAL. 0-3KM STORM RELATIVE HELICITIES AROUND 600 M2/S2 
SUPPORT ROTATION WITHIN THE LINE BUT THINK IT WILL BE LIMITED AT 
BEST.  HIGHEST WIND GUSTS THIS MORNING THUS FAR HAS BEEN BELOW 40 
KTS ACROSS ARKANSAS AND PORTIONS OF WESTERN TENNESSEE WITH ONLY ONE 
ISOLATED REPORT OF WIND DAMAGE NEAR TUNICA. ANY DAMAGE POTENTIAL THIS 
MORNING WILL BE LIMITED TO PORTIONS OF NORTHERN MISSISSIPPI WHERE 
BETTER...BUT VERY WEAK INSTABILITY STILL REMAINS. I WILL TAPER RAIN 
CHANCES OFF BY LATE THIS AFTERNOON AS MID/UPPER LEVEL DRY AIR BUILDS 
IN ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA. TEMPERATURES WILL GRADUALLY DROP DURING 
THE DAY.

TONIGHT...PRECIPITATION CHANCES WILL COME TO AN END AS MID/UPPER 
LEVEL SUBSIDENCE CUTS OFF ICE NUCLEI ACTIVATION. AREAS WEST OF THE 
MISSISSIPPI SHOULD CLEAR OUT BY 00Z AND AREAS EAST BY MIDNIGHT. 850 
MB TEMPERATURES WILL DROP DOWN TO AROUND -2C OVERNIGHT WITH LOWS 
EXPECTED IN THE 20S TO AROUND 30. 925 MB WINDS WILL STILL BE UP 
AROUND 30 KTS AS COLD ARCTIC AIR CONTINUES TO FILTER INTO THE AREA. 

FRIDAY AND FRIDAY NIGHT...HIGH PRESSURE WILL CONTINUE TO BUILD IN 
ACROSS THE MID SOUTH WITH SUNNY SKIES EXPECTED AS 1000-500 MB LAYER 
RH/S DROP TO AROUND 15 PERCENT. WINDS WILL GRADUALLY WEAKEN BY 
AFTERNOON AS BOUNDARY LAYER WINDS WEAKEN TO AROUND 10-15 KTS BY LATE 
AFTERNOON. 

SATURDAY...SURFACE AND UPPER LEVEL RIDGING WILL BE CENTERED ACROSS 
THE MISSISSIPPI VALLEY WITH UPPER LEVEL SHEAR AXIS CENTERED ACROSS 
THE UPPER MIDWEST AND THE GREAT LAKES REGION. SOME HIGH CLOUDS WILL 
BE AROUND AND WILL GO WITH PARTLY CLOUDY SKIES.  TEMPERATURES WILL 
REMAIN COOL THROUGH THE WEEKEND.

NO CHANGES MADE BEYOND SATURDAY

&&

.MEG...WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...

415 AM CST THU JAN 13 2005

.DISCUSSION...LATEST SURFACE ANALYSIS PLACES COLD FRONT STRETCHING 
FROM SAINT LOUIS MISSOURI INTO WESTERN ARKANSAS.  WATER VAPOR 
IMAGERY SHOWS GULF MOISTURE RIDING UP WARM CONVEYOR BELT WITH 
PRONOUNCED DRYING ACROSS OKLAHOMA AND TEXAS. MAIN FORECAST CONCERNS FOR 
THE FORECAST PACKAGE WILL BE EARLY SEVERE WEATHER CONCERNS AND 
PRECIPITATION CHANCES FOR TODAY. 

TODAY...LATEST 88D TRENDS SHOW SQUALL LINE JUST CROSSING THE 
MISSISSIPPI RIVER AT 3AM. POOR MID LEVEL LAPSE RATES /BELOW 6 
C/KM/...ONLY A FEW HUNDRED J/KG OF CAPE AND RELATIVELY STABLE 
SURFACE LAYER ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA HAS LIMITED THE SEVERE 
WEATHER POTENTIAL. 0-3KM STORM RELATIVE HELICITIES AROUND 600 M2/S2 
SUPPORT ROTATION WITHIN THE LINE BUT THINK IT WILL BE LIMITED AT 
BEST.  HIGHEST WIND GUSTS THIS MORNING THUS FAR HAS BEEN BELOW 40 
KTS ACROSS ARKANSAS AND PORTIONS OF WESTERN TENNESSEE WITH ONLY ONE 
ISOLATED REPORT OF WIND DAMAGE NEAR TUNICA. ANY DAMAGE POTENTIAL THIS 
MORNING WILL BE LIMITED TO PORTIONS OF NORTHERN MISSISSIPPI WHERE 
BETTER...BUT VERY WEAK INSTABILITY STILL REMAINS. I WILL TAPER RAIN 
CHANCES OFF BY LATE THIS AFTERNOON AS MID/UPPER LEVEL DRY AIR BUILDS 
IN ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA. TEMPERATURES WILL GRADUALLY DROP DURING 
THE DAY.

TONIGHT...PRECIPITATION CHANCES WILL COME TO AN END AS MID/UPPER 
LEVEL SUBSIDENCE CUTS OFF ICE NUCLEI ACTIVATION. AREAS WEST OF THE 
MISSISSIPPI SHOULD CLEAR OUT BY 00Z AND AREAS EAST BY MIDNIGHT. 850 
MB TEMPERATURES WILL DROP DOWN TO AROUND -2C OVERNIGHT WITH LOWS 
EXPECTED IN THE 20S TO AROUND 30. 925 MB WINDS WILL STILL BE UP 
AROUND 30 KTS AS COLD ARCTIC AIR CONTINUES TO FILTER INTO THE AREA. 

FRIDAY AND FRIDAY NIGHT...HIGH PRESSURE WILL CONTINUE TO BUILD IN 
ACROSS THE MID SOUTH WITH SUNNY SKIES EXPECTED AS 1000-500 MB LAYER 
RH/S DROP TO AROUND 15 PERCENT. WINDS WILL GRADUALLY WEAKEN BY 
AFTERNOON AS BOUNDARY LAYER WINDS WEAKEN TO AROUND 10-15 KTS BY LATE 
AFTERNOON. 

SATURDAY...SURFACE AND UPPER LEVEL RIDGING WILL BE CENTERED ACROSS 
THE MISSISSIPPI VALLEY WITH UPPER LEVEL SHEAR AXIS CENTERED ACROSS 
THE UPPER MIDWEST AND THE GREAT LAKES REGION. SOME HIGH CLOUDS WILL 
BE AROUND AND WILL GO WITH PARTLY CLOUDY SKIES.  TEMPERATURES WILL 
REMAIN COOL THROUGH THE WEEKEND.

NO CHANGES MADE BEYOND SATURDAY

&&

.MEG...WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MS...MSZ012>015-016-017-020>024...TORNADO WATCH UNTIL 15 UTC (9AM)
MO...NONE.
TN...NONE.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
900 PM CST WED JAN 12 2005

.DISCUSSION...
GOING FORECAST STILL ON TRACK. RAIN AND THUNDERSTORMS ACROSS ABOUT
WESTERN HALF OF ARKANSAS...MAIN EFFECTS IN OUR AREA WILL BE AFTER
MIDNIGHT. SEVERAL BOWING SEGMENTS VISIBLE ON RADAR...BUT HAVENT
HEARD MUCH IN THE WAY OF REPORTS UP TO THIS POINT. LIFTED INDICES
AROUND -3 AND CAPES OF 400-600 ACROSS CENTRAL ARKANSAS. PROBABLY A
2 TO 3 HOUR WINDOW OF OPPORTUNITY FOR SEVERE IN ANY ONE LOCATION.

NO TIME-SENSITIVE WORDING IN ZONES...AND MAIN ELEMENTS OF FORECAST
WONT BE IN EFFECT TILL AFTER MIDNIGHT...SO NO UPDATES PLANNED AT
THIS TIME.

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 122142
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
340 PM CST WED JAN 12 2005

.DISCUSSION...

ACTIVE WEATHER IN STORE FOR LATER TONIGHT. THIS WILL BE THE MAIN 
FOCUS OF THE DISCUSSION. IN THE VERY SHORT TERM...A FEW WARM AIR 
ADVECTION SHOWERS WILL CONTINUE ACROSS THE AREA...BUT NOTHING 
SIGNIFICANT UNTIL LATER TONIGHT. WILL LET WIND ADVISORY EXPIRE AT 4 
PM GIVEN THAT MOST LOCATIONS ARE UNDER ADVISORY CRITERIA. STILL WILL 
BE BREEZY TONIGHT.

WATER VAPOR IMAGERY CLEARLY SHOWS UPPER TROUGH CURRENTLY OVER THE TX 
AND OK PANHANDLES. THE TROUGH WILL ADVANCE EAST TONIGHT WHILE 
PUSHING ALONG A STRONG COLD FRONT. VERY STRONG DYNAMICS WILL SETUP 
TONIGHT WITH THIS SYSTEM AS A 140 KT JET STREAK ROUNDS THE 
TROUGH...PUTTING THE CWA UNDER THE RIGHT ENTRANCE REGION. THIS 
COMBINED WITH STRONG 1000-850MB FRONTOGENESIS WILL HELP TO ORGANIZE 
A SQUALL LINE ACROSS EASTERN OK...NE TX...AND WESTERN ARKANSAS THIS 
EVENING. THE LINE WILL PROGRESS EASTWARD THROUGH THE NIGHT. STILL 
SOME MINOR TIMING DIFFERENCES BUT FEEL THE LINE WILL AFFECT EAST 
ARKANSAS AND THE MO BOOTHEEL BETWEEN 06-09Z...CROSSES THE 
MISSISSIPPI RIVER BETWEEN 09-12Z...AND NE MS AND AREAS ALONG THE TN 
RIVER BETWEEN 12-15Z. AS HAS BEEN ADVERTISED FOR QUITE SOME 
TIME...WIND FIELDS WITH THIS SYSTEM ARE VERY IMPRESSIVE. A 70 KT LOW 
LEVEL JET WILL SET UP AHEAD OF THE SQUALL LINE. THIS DEFINITELY 
INFERS A DAMAGING WIND THREAT. THE FLY IN THE OINTMENT FOR SEVERE 
WEATHER WILL BE THE LACK OF INSTABILITY. ETA SHOWING VERY MEAGER MID 
LEVEL LAPSE RATES WHILE THE GFS SHOWS MUCH BETTER ACROSS THE AREA. 
ONE THING TO NOTE IS THUNDERSTORMS ARE ALREADY FIRING WELL TO OUR 
WEST IN AREAS WHERE MODELS ARE SHOWING LOWER LAPSE RATES. BOTTOM 
LINE IS THAT THERE IS A CHANCE FOR DAMAGING WINDS ALONG THE LINE 
WITH AN ISOLATED TORNADO POSSIBLE GIVEN IMPRESSIVE 0-1KM STORM 
RELATIVE HELICTITY. WILL MAINTAIN SEVERE MENTION IN ZONES. CURRENT 
HWO HANDLES SITUATION WELL. THE LINE WILL PRODUCE HEAVY DOWNPOURS 
BUT GIVEN PROGRESSIVE NATURE OF THE SYSTEM HAVE DECIDED TO HOLD OFF 
ON ANY FLOOD WATCHES.

WITH THE FRONT EXPECTED TO BE NEAR THE RIVER AT 12Z...THIS WILL PLAY 
HAVOC ON POPS AND TEMPS. AS FOR POPS...HAVE ALL AREAS 100 POPS AT 
SOME POINT AND TRIED TO ACCOUNT FOR TIMING THE BEST I COULD. HIGH 
TEMPS WILL LIKELY BE NEAR OR JUST AFTER 12Z AND REFLECTED THIS IN 
THE GRIDS. WILL LEAVE A 30 POP IN FOR EXTREME EAST ZONES AFTER 18Z 
TOMORROW TO ACCOUNT FOR ANY LINGERING PRECIP.

MUCH COLDER AIR TO FOLLOW FOR THE END OF THE WEEK AND INTO THE 
WEEKEND. MODELS ARE NOW SHOWING MORE OF A ZONAL FLOW ACROSS OUR AREA 
WHICH WILL SERVE TO KEEP THE CORE OF THE ARCTIC COLD NORTH OF THE 
AREA. GIVEN THAT THIS IS VERY COLD SIBERIAN AIR AND EXTREMELY 
DENSE...FEEL SOME OF IT WILL BE ABLE TO BLEED INTO THE AREA. 
THEREFORE...WILL CONTINUE TO UNDERCUT GUIDANCE. NO PRECIP FORESEEN 
THROUGH DAY 7 AND THE MAJORITY OF THE EXTENDED WAS NOT CHANGED MUCH.

THANKS GOES OUT TO WFO NASHVILLE FOR THEIR COORDINATION.

&&

.MEG...WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MS...NONE.
MO...NONE.
TN...NONE.
&&

$$

JFB







000 
FXUS64 KMEG 121607
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
1007 AM CST WED JAN 12 2005

.DISCUSSION...
FRONTAL BOUNDARY POSITIONED WELL TO THE NORTH OF THE MID SOUTH THIS
MORNING AND STRENGTHENING SOUTHERLY FLOW WILL CONTINUE TO KEEP THE
ENTIRE AREA WELL ENTRENCHED IN THE WARM SECTOR TODAY. TEMPERATURES
WILL CONTINUE TO SLOWLY RISE AND CURRENT FORECAST HIGHS NEAR 70
NORTH TO LOWER 70S CENTRAL AND SOUTH PORTIONS LOOKS ON TRACK.
EXTENSIVE CLOUD SHIELD OVER MOST OF THE MID SOUTH THIS MORNING WITH
THE MOST BREAKS CURRENTLY OCCURRING OVER SOUTHERN SECTIONS. THINK
THAT OVERALL FORECAST CLOUD COVER IS ON TRACK AS WELL. WIND FIELDS
WILL CONTINUE TO STRENGTHEN THIS AFTERNOON...AND AS WE GET A FEW
MORE BREAKS IN THE CLOUDS...ANTICIPATING SOME MIXING TO OCCUR. STRONG
45 KT WINDS INDICATED BY KNQA VAD WIND PROFILER AT 3 KFT...SO WILL
NOT TAKE MUCH MIXING TO GET ADVISORY TYPE WINDS TO THE SURFACE. WILL
KEEP WIND ADVISORY IN PLACE FOR THIS AFTERNOON AND EVENING. PLAN AT
THIS TIME TO LOWER POPS TO SLIGHT CHANCE FOR THIS AFTERNOON AS DONT
SEE MUCH IN THE WAY OF A TRIGGER TO INITIATE MUCH CONVECTION
AREAWIDE. IN ADDITION...REGIONAL ETA12 FORECAST SOUNDINGS SHOWING
DECENT MID-LEVEL CAPPING OF THE ATMOSPHERE. A FEW WARM ADVECTION
SHOWERS MAY DEVELOP BELOW THIS INVERSION...JUSTIFYING THE 20 POPS.

A QUICK LOOK AT NEW 12Z ETA RUN...SHOWING UPPER SHORTWAVE TROUGH AND
ASSOCIATED COLD FRONT STILL PROGGED TO MOVE ACROSS REGION TONIGHT...
BUT MODEL INDICATING THAT THE UPPER TROUGH MAY BEGIN TO SHEAR OUT
LATER TONIGHT. SQUALL LINE STILL EXPECTED TO DEVELOP AND MOVE INTO
AREA LATE TONIGHT AND THURSDAY MORNING. THE BIG QUESTION WILL BE
INSTABILITY. MODEL TENDS TO WEAKEN MID LEVEL LAPSE RATES AND WITH
CONVECTION MOVING THROUGH DURING OVERNIGHT HOURS...MAY TEND TO LIMIT
INSTABILITY. WE WILL NEED TO SEE HOW THE UPPER TROUGH EVOLVES AS IT
MOVES EASTWARD SINCE THIS WILL PLAY A MAJOR ROLE IN AMOUNT OF
INSTABILITY AVAILABLE. AT THIS TIME THINK THAT SLIGHT RISK SEVERE
POTENTIAL STILL EXISTS...WITH VERY STRONG WIND FIELDS IN PLACE...BUT
LEVEL OF INSTABILITY WILL DETERMINE OVERALL EXTENT OF SEVERE WEATHER
POTENTIAL.

&&

.MEG...WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MS...NONE.
MO...NONE.
TN...NONE.
&&

JLH





000 
FXUS64 KMEG 121018
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
415 AM CST WED JAN 12 2005

.DISCUSSION...LATEST WATER VAPOR IMAGERY SHOWING PRONOUNCED DRY SLOT 
WORKING IN BEHIND UPPER LEVEL TROUGH ACROSS ARIZONA AND NEW MEXICO. 08Z 
SURFACE ANALYSIS PLACES WARM FRONT FROM THE OHIO VALLEY INTO EASTERN 
OKLAHOMA. MAIN FORECAST CONCERN FOR THIS FORECAST PACKAGE IS SEVERE 
WEATHER POTENTIAL FOR THIS AFTERNOON AND TONIGHT.

TODAY...LOWER 60 DEWPOINTS ALREADY IN PLACE ACROSS MUCH OF THE 
FORECAST AREA THIS MORNING. NOT EXPECTING ANY RAINFALL THIS MORNING 
AS 700 MB CAPPING INVERSION AND LACK OF A LIFTING MECHANISM WILL 
KEEP MOST IF NOT ALL AREAS DRY UNTIL AFTERNOON. AS A RESULT...WENT 
WITH SLIGHT CHANCE SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS MAINLY FOR BETWEEN 
16-18Z. I/M EXPECTING HIGHS TO BE PRETTY SIMILAR TO YESTERDAY WITH 
HIGHS APPROACHING THE LOWER 70S ACROSS A PORTION OF THE AREA AS MOST 
AREAS ARE ALREADY IN THE MIDDLE 60S.

TONIGHT...SEVERAL SEVERE WEATHER PARAMETERS COMING TOGETHER FOR A 
POTENTIAL EVENT TONIGHT. BUT AS IN THE PAST FEW DAYS...THE BIG 
QUESTION WILL BE INSTABILITY.  ETA/GFS BOTH HAVE BEEN NOTING RATHER 
LOW INSTABILITY WITH CAP IN PLACE DURING THE DAY. 850 MB LOW LEVEL 
JET WILL BEGIN TO MOVE ACROSS THE MID SOUTH LATE THIS AFTERNOON WITH 
FAIRLY DECENT DYNAMICS ON THE BASE OF A 80KT 500 MB JET. A 
SURFACE BASED LIFTED PARCEL CENTERED ACROSS WESTERN TENNESSEE 
(72/60) ONLY PRODUCES 600 J/KG AT BEST BY LATE AFTERNOON/EARLY 
EVENING.  BEST PROBABLE SEVERE WEATHER THREAT WILL BE DAMAGING WINDS 
FROM A DYNAMIC BOW ECHO WITH NEARLY UNIDIRECTIONAL WINDS IN 850-500 
MB LAYER AND 700 MB DEWPOINT DEPRESSIONS GREATER THAN 10C BEHIND 
FRONT. SURFACE WINDS WILL BACK SLIGHTLY AS CONVECTION BEGINS TO 
TRACK ACROSS ARKANSAS. 0-6KM BULK SHEAR VALUES AROUND 60 KTS...0-1 
KM STORM RELATIVE HELICITIES EXCEEDING 300 M2/S2 AFTER 00Z...AND 
LCL/S BELOW 4KFT SUPPORT THE POSSIBILITY OF A COUPLE OF LOW TOPPED 
SUPERCELL STORMS THAT WOULD EVENTUALLY BE OVERTAKEN BY SQUALL LINE. 
HEAVY RAINFALL PARAMETERS NOT THAT IMPRESSIVE WITH BOTH K-INDICIES 
STAYING BELOW 35 AND PRECIPITABLE WATER VALUES WELL BELOW 1.5 
INCHES. WILL HAVE DAY SHIFT TAKE ANOTHER LOOK AT SITUATION AFTER 12Z 
MODEL DATA STARTS COMING IN.

THURSDAY...RAINFALL WILL GRADUALLY COME TO AN END BY EARLY AFTERNOON 
ACROSS MOST OF THE AREA AS COLD AIR ADVECTION CONTINUES TO BUILD 
INTO THE MID SOUTH BEHIND COLD FRONT...HIGHS WILL OCCUR EARLY IN THE 
MORNING AS 850 MB TEMPERATURES DROP TO AROUND 4C BY 00Z FRIDAY. THE 
COLD AIR WILL BE LAGGING A BIT BEHIND THE COLD FRONT AND EXPECT 
MOSTLY CLOUDY SKIES THROUGH MUCH OF THE DAY WITH PLENTY OF LOW LEVEL 
MOISTURE HANGING AROUND. 

THURSDAY NIGHT AND FRIDAY...CLOUDS WILL BEGIN TO DECREASE IN COVERAGE AS 
1000-500MB LAYER RH/S DROP TO AROUND 25 PERCENT BY DAYBREAK. LOW 
TEMPERATURES WILL DROP INTO THE 20S TO LOWER 30S WITH HIGHS 
STRUGGLING TO GET OUT OF THE 40S.

NO CHANGES MADE BEYOND FRIDAY.

&&

.MEG...WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...WIND ADVISORY...ALL ZONES UNTIL 22Z (4PM).
MS...WIND ADVISORY...ALL ZONES UNTIL 22Z (4PM).
MO...WIND ADVISORY...ALL ZONES UNTIL 22Z (4PM).
TN...WIND ADVISORY...ALL ZONES UNTIL 22Z (4PM).
&&

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 120211
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
811 PM CST TUE JAN 11 2005

.DISCUSSION...
SEE LITTLE NEED FOR AN UPDATE AT THIS TIME. WILL EVENTUALLY UPDATE
TO DEAL WITH EVENING/OVERNIGHT CLOUD COVER WORDING...BUT REST OF
FORECAST IN LINE AT THIS TIME.
&&

.PREVIOUS DISCUSSION ISSUED AT 327 PM...
STATIONARY FRONT CONTINUES TO BE LOCATED JUST NORTH OF THE
MIDSOUTH...ROUGHLY FROM NORTH TEXAS EAST INTO SOUTHERN OHIO. IN THE
UPPER LEVELS...STRONG SHORTWAVE OVER CENTRAL CALIFORNIA BEGINNING TO
EJECT EASTWARD. THIS LEAVES THE CWA IN SW FLOW ALOFT.

ALL OF CWA IN WARM SECTOR WITH DEWPOINTS IN THE 60S. WILL NOT BE
MUCH OF A TEMPERATURE DROP TONIGHT AS WARM ADVECTION INCREASES.
ALTHOUGH NO OBVIOUS TRIGGERS FOR PRECIP ARE SEEN TONIGHT WILL LEAVE
20 POPS IN GIVEN THE MOIST AIRMASS AND THE UNSTABLE FLOW ALOFT. SOME
AREAS WILL HAVE PARTLY CLOUDY SKIES THIS EVENING BEFORE MORE CIRRUS
COMES IN. HAVE REFLECTED THIS IN FORECAST.

AS UPPER ENERGY DRAWS CLOSER TOMORROW...PRESSURE GRADIENT WILL
TIGHTEN AND WIND FIELDS WILL INCREASE. A WINDY DAY IN STORE FOR
TOMORROW...ENCROACHING UPON WIND ADVISORY CRITERIA. WILL PASS ON
THIS POSSIBILITY TO NEXT SHIFT FOR FURTHER REVIEW. MODEL SOUNDINGS
SHOW A GOOD CAP FOR MOST OF THE DAY...LIMITING THUNDERSTORM
POTENTIAL. COULD STILL SEE A FEW WARM AIR ADVECTION SHOWERS DURING
THE DAY. CIRRUS SHIELD SHOULD LIMIT SUN TOMORROW...BUT ANY BREAKS
WILL ALLOW TEMPERATURES TO RISE QUICKLY AND MAY HELP TO LESSEN
STRENGTH OF THE CAP. AT THIS POINT...EXPECT LITTLE ACTION DURING THE
DAYTIME HOURS.

MAIN SHOW COMES INTO THE AREA AFTER 00Z THU. THE AFOREMENTIONED
SHORTWAVE WILL DRIVE A VERY STRONG COLD FRONT TOWARD THE AREA. WIND
FIELDS AHEAD OF THE SYSTEM WILL RAPIDLY INCREASE. MODELS IN GOOD
AGREEMENT OF A 60-75KT LOW LEVEL JET...A 80KT MID LEVEL JET...AND A
140KT UPPER JET. SUBSTANTIAL DYNAMIC FORCING ALONG THE FRONT...WITH
THE AREA UNDER THE RIGHT ENTRANCE REGION OF THE UPPER JET. EXPECT A
SQUALL LINE TO RAPIDLY ORGANIZE OVER WESTERN AND CENTRAL ARKANSAS
AND QUICKLY ADVANCE EASTWARD. MODELS IN BETTER AGREEMENT ON TIMING
WITH THE LINE COMING INTO E ARKANSAS 03Z-06Z...ACROSS THE RIVER
AROUND 09Z...AND INTO EASTERN CWA AROUND OR JUST AFTER 12Z.
DEFINITELY A DAMAGING WIND THREAT WITH THIS LINE GIVEN STRONG WIND
FIELDS. ALSO...0-3KM SR HELICITIES GREATER THAN 500 M2/S2 WILL ALLOW
THE POTENTIAL OF EMBEDDED SUPERCELLS WITHIN THE LINE. AS ALWAYS IS
THE CASE THIS TIME OF YEAR...INSTABILITY IS THE QUESTION MARK.
MODELS SHOWING CAPES OF 500-800 J/KG ACROSS THE AREA AND THIS SHOULD
BE ENOUGH FOR THE SEVERE THREAT TO BE REALIZED...ESPECIALLY WITH
STEEPENING MID LEVEL LAPSE RATES WITH THE APPROACH OF THE SHORTWAVE.
IF THERE IS MORE SUN THAN FORECAST TOMORROW...THIS WILL ALSO
INCREASE THE INSTABILITY. WILL HIGHLIGHT THREAT IN THE HWO AND
MENTION SEVERE WORDING IN THE ZONES. THIS MATCHES WELL WITH SPC
SLIGHT RISK AREA.

ALL PRECIP SHOULD BE OUT OF THE AREA BY 18Z THURSDAY. COLD ARCTIC
AIR WILL BEGIN TO FILTER INTO THE AREA BEHIND THE FRONT. TEMPS LIKELY
TO FALL THROUGH THURSDAY. DO NOT FEEL THE MEX NUMBERS HANDLE THE
ARCTIC AIRMASS WELL AND HAVE UNDERCUT TEMPS THROUGHOUT THE REST OF
THE FORECAST. FORECAST LOOKS DRY THROUGH TUESDAY AND DID NOT MAKE
MANY CHANGES TO EXTENDED AS HIGH PRESSURE REMAINS OVER THE REGION.

&&

.MEG...WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MS...NONE.
MO...NONE.
TN...NONE.
&&

$$

JFB/WAGNER

THE CASE THIS TIME OF YEAR...INSTABILITY IS THE QUESTION MARK. 
MODELS SHOWING CAPES OF 500-800 J/KG ACROSS THE AREA AND THIS SHOULD 
BE ENOUGH FOR THE SEVERE THREAT TO BE REALIZED...ESPECIALLY WITH 
STEEPENING MID LEVEL LAPSE RATES WITH THE APPROACH OF THE SHORTWAVE. 
IF THERE IS MORE SUN THAN FORECAST TOMORROW...THIS WILL ALSO 
INCREASE THE INSTABILITY. WILL HIGHLIGHT THREAT IN THE HWO AND 
MENTION SEVERE WORDING IN THE ZONES. THIS MATCHES WELL WITH SPC 
SLIGHT RISK AREA.

ALL PRECIP SHOULD BE OUT OF THE AREA BY 18Z THURSDAY. COLD ARCTIC 
AIR WILL BEGIN TO FILTER INTO THE AREA BEHIND THE FRONT. TEMPS LIKELY
TO FALL THROUGH THURSDAY. DO NOT FEEL THE MEX NUMBERS HANDLE THE 
ARCTIC AIRMASS WELL AND HAVE UNDERCUT TEMPS THROUGHOUT THE REST OF 
THE FORECAST. FORECAST LOOKS DRY THROUGH TUESDAY AND DID NOT MAKE 
MANY CHANGES TO EXTENDED AS HIGH PRESSURE REMAINS OVER THE REGION.

&&

.MEG...WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MS...NONE.
MO...NONE.
TN...NONE.
&&

$$

JFB





000 
FXUS64 KMEG 111639
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
1039 AM CST TUE JAN 11 2005

.DISCUSSION...

STATIONARY FRONT STILL LOCATED JUST TO THE NORTH OF THE MIDSOUTH 
WITH THE ENTIRE AREA UNDER THE WARM SECTOR. DEWPOINTS IN THE LOWER 
60S AREAWIDE. SCATTERED SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS HAVE OCCURRED THIS 
MORNING DUE TO A SHORTWAVE MOVING THROUGH THE WSW FLOW. THIS 
SHORTWAVE IS NOW EXITING THE REGION AND THE PRECIP IS TAPERING OFF 
AND LEAVING THE CWA. RUC/GFS/META ALL SHOW ANOTHER SMALL SHORTWAVE 
MOVING THROUGH THIS AFTERNOON. GIVEN THE ATMOSPHERE IS MOIST AND 
MARGINALLY UNSTABLE (CAPES 400-600 J/KG) WILL LEAVE 30 POPS IN FOR 
THE AFTERNOON. 

TEMPS FORECAST APPEARS TO BE ON TRACK. SHOULD SEE A FEW BREAKS IN 
THE CLOUDS...ESPECIALLY OVER EAST ARKANSAS. THIS WILL HELP TEMPS TO 
REACH THEIR FORECASTED VALUES. IF MORE SUN WERE TO BREAK THROUGH 
THEN FORECAST LOWS MAY BE TOO LOW. WILL CONTINUE TO MONITOR. OTHER 
PARAMETERS ON TRACK. ADJUSTED SHORT TERM SKY GRIDS TO MATCH TRENDS.

.MAIN POINTS OF PREV DISCUSSION ISSUED 350 AM...

TONIGHT...ANOTHER SHORTWAVE EMBEDDED IN THE SOUTHWEST FLOW ALOFT 
WILL AFFECT THE MID SOUTH EARLY WEDNESDAY MORNING. EVEN WITH CAPES 
OF 500-600 J/KG...LI/S AROUND -2...AND MODERATE 700-500MB MID LEVEL 
LAPSE RATES AROUND 6.5 C/KM...I THINK MOISTURE MAY BE THE LIMITING 
FACTOR IN ANY DECENT CONVECTIVE DEVELOPMENT OVERNIGHT...ESPECIALLY 
ACROSS NORTHERN MISSISSIPPI AND WILL CARRY ONLY SLIGHT CHANCE POPS 
ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA WITH BEST CHANCES TOWARDS THE MO/KY BORDER. 
LOW TEMPERATURES TONIGHT WILL DROP BACK INTO THE 50S.

WEDNESDAY AND WEDNESDAY NIGHT...LONG AWAITED STRONG COLD FRONT WILL 
BEGIN TO APPROACH THE MID SOUTH. 850 MB LOW LEVEL JET WILL INCREASE 
TO AROUND AN IMPRESSIVE 70 KTS AROUND 03Z THURSDAY AND STRONG 
MID/UPPER LEVEL FORCING /700-500 MB Q-VECTOR CONVERGENCE/. FURTHER 
ANALYSIS OF MANY MODIFIED SURFACE AND ELEVATED PARCELS ON MODEL 
SOUNDINGS SUGGEST SUPERCELL THREAT MAY BE LIMITED TO AREAS PRIMARILY 
ACROSS NORTHERN MISSISSIPPI AS MID LEVEL CAPPING INVERSION LIMITS 
INSTABILITY WITH LESS THAN 1000 J/KG TO POINTS NORTH. HOWEVER 0-1KM 
STORM RELATIVE HELICITY VALUES WILL BE MORE THAN ADEQUATE FOR 
POSSIBLE SUPERCELLS /350-400 M2/S2/ ALONG WITH A RATHER DECENT SHEAR 
PROFILE ACROSS MISSISSIPPI. I WOULD ANTICIPATE A FEW SUPERCELLS TO 
DEVELOP ACROSS MISSISSIPPI WITH A DYNAMIC BOW ECHO EVENTUALLY 
OVERTAKING ALL CONVECTION AHEAD OF THIS LINE ACROSS THE FORECAST 
AREA AS WINDS WILL BECOME MORE UNIDIRECTIONAL AND 700 MB DEWPOINT 
DEPRESSIONS WELL OVER 7C. I WILL BE MENTIONING SEVERE THREAT 
POTENTIAL BOTH IN THE ZFP FORECAST ALONG AND THE HAZARDOUS WEATHER 
OUTLOOK. 

NO CHANGES MADE BEYOND THURSDAY.

&&

.MEG...WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MS...NONE.
MO...NONE.
TN...NONE.
&&

JFB/CJC

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
350 AM CST TUE JAN 11 2005

.DISCUSSION...LATEST SURFACE ANALYSIS PLACES STATIONARY FRONT 
STRETCHING FROM VANDALIA ILLINOIS BACK INTO SPRINGFIELD MO AND 
EASTERN OKLAHOMA. 00Z UPPER AIR ANALYSIS DEPICTS A WEAK SHORTWAVE 
ACROSS THE MID MISSISSIPPI VALLEY AND A LOINGWAVE TROUGH DIGGING 
ACROSS THE ROCKIES. MAIN FORECAST CONCERNS FOR THIS FORECAST PACKAGE 
WILL FOCUS ON CONVECTIVE POTENTIAL TODAY THROUGH THURSDAY.

TODAY...LOW LEVEL MOISTURE HUNG AROUND YESTERDAY AS EXPECTED WITH A 
RETURN OF LOW LEVEL MOISTURE ACROSS THE MID SOUTH WITH DEWPOINTS IN 
THE LOWER 60S. 00Z RAOB FROM KLZK SHOWED AMPLE LOW LEVEL MOISTURE IN 
PLACE BELOW 850MB. 1000-500MB LAYER RH/S WILL REMAIN AT OR ABOVE 60 
PERCENT THROUGH THE DAY TODAY...SO MOSTLY CLOUDY/CLOUDY SKIES LOOK 
REASONABLE. WEAK SHORTWAVE WILL BEGIN TO DEPART THE FORECAST AREA 
THIS MORNING WITH DAYTIME HEATING BEING THE PRIMARY FOCUS FOR 
CONVECTIVE INITIATION FOR THE AFTERNOON. 700-500 MB LAYER LAPSE 
RATES WILL INCREASE TO AROUND 7 C/KM...LI/S INCREASING TO AROUND 
-6...AND CAPES AROUND 1400 J/KG WITH LITTLE IF ANY CIN /BASED ON 
SURFACE BASED PARCEL OF 71/60/. 88D RADAR RETURNS OVER THE PAST 
COUPLE OF HOURS HAVE ONLY SHOWED A FEW ISOLATED SHOWERS THUS FAR BUT 
THINK SCATTERED POPS ARE JUSTIFIED. A WEAK CAPPING INVERSION WILL BE PRESENT 
THIS AFTERNOON AROUND 650 MB BUT SUSPECT ANY SURFACE BASED PARCEL 
WILL HAVE NO PROBLEM OVERCOMING THE CAP. WET BULB ZERO HEIGHTS BELOW 
10KFT ARE FAVORABLE FOR SOME HAIL GROWTH. AS A RESULT WILL KEEP 
SCATTERED SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS FOR TODAY. TEMPERATURES TODAY 
WILL WARM INTO THE UPPER 60S TO LOWER 70S ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA 
WITH 850 MB TEMPEATURES WARMING TO AROUND 11C IN WARM ADVECTION 
PATTERN.

TONIGHT...ANOTHER SHORTWAVE EMBEDDED IN THE SOUTHWEST FLOW ALOFT 
WILL AFFECT THE MID SOUTH EARLY WEDNESDAY MORNING. EVEN WITH CAPES 
OF 500-600 J/KG...LI/S AROUND -2...AND MODERATE 700-500MB MID LEVEL 
LAPSE RATES AROUND 6.5 C/KM...I THINK MOISTURE MAY BE THE LIMITING 
FACTOR IN ANY DECENT CONVECTIVE DEVELOPMENT OVERNIGHT...ESPECIALLY 
ACROSS NORTHERN MISSISSIPPI AND WILL CARRY ONLY SLIGHT CHANCE POPS 
ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA WITH BEST CHANCES TOWARDS THE MO/KY BORDER. 
LOW TEMPERATURES TONIGHT WILL DROP BACK INTO THE 50S.

BEGIN TO APPROACH THE MID SOUTH. 850 MB LOW LEVEL JET WILL INCREASE 
TO AROUND AN IMPRESSIVE 70 KTS AROUND 03Z THURSDAY AND STRONG 
MID/UPPER LEVEL FORCING /700-500 MB Q-VECTOR CONVERGENCE/. FURTHER

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
846 PM CST MON JAN 10 2005

.UPDATED DISCUSSION...
ISSUING UPDATE TO TRIM BACK FOG AREA...AND ADJUST OVERNIGHT
TEMPERATURE CURVES. FOG IS LIFTING AS WARMER AIR MOVES NORTHWARD.
VISIBILITIES SHOULD BE ABOVE ONE MILE ACROSS EVEN NORTHERN SECTIONS
BY MIDNIGHT. TEMPERATURES SHOULD PRETTY MUCH REMAIN LEVEL ACROSS
SOUTHERN 2/3RDS OF CWA...AND RISE ACROSS THE NORTH FOR THE
REMAINDER OF THE NIGHT. ANOTHER UPDATE LIKELY BEFORE MIDNIGHT.
&&

.MAIN POINTS OF PREVIOUS DISCUSSION ISSUED AT 345 PM...
A SHORTWAVE WL MOVE THROUGH THE REGION AFTER MIDNIGHT SO EXPECT SOME
SHWRS/TSTMS TO BREAK OUT AFTER MIDNIGHT. TEMPS WL BE MILD WITH
SOUTHERLY SFC FLOW SO TEMPS WILL NOT FALL MUCH...IN FACT TEMPS ACRS
NE AR WL PROBABLY RISE.

FRONT WELL NORTH OF THE AREA ON TUE THROUGH WED. SHORTWAVE EXITS THE
AREA BUT SHOULD SEE SOME PRECIP AROUND FOR AT LEAST THE MORNING. NOT
MUCH TO TRIGGER ANYTHING TUE NIGHT SO WL GO WITH LOW POPS. SINCE
AREA SOLIDLY IN THE WARM SECTOR TEMPS WL CONT TO BE MILD WITH
READINGS NEAR 70 TUE AND WED. DEWPOINTS WL CLIMB ABOVE 60 DEGREES.

STRONG SYSTEM WL APPROACH ON WED. ETA AND GFS DIFFER ON TIMING SO WL
SPLIT THE DIFFERENCE AT THIS POINT. ETA IS STRONGER AND SLOWER WITH
GFS FASTER AND WEAKER. EITHER WAY FRONT WL SWEEP THROUGH WED NIGHT
AND EARLY THU. SVR POTENTIAL EXISTS WITH THIS FRONT. PLENTY OF SHEAR
WITH STRONG WINDS AT ALL LEVELS. HELICITES ARE QUITE HIGH WITH SOME
ETA SOUNDINGS OVER 1000 M2/S2. LIKE ALWAYS THIS TIME OF YEAR THE
QUESTION IS INSTABILITY. BOTH MODELS HAVE A SOME CAPE AND LIFTED
INDICES JUST BLO ZERO WITH DECENT MID LEVEL LAPSE RATES.

MUCH COLDER AFTER FRONT MOVES THROUGH AND ARCTIC HIGH PRESSURE
BUILDS INTO THE REGION THU NIGHT. COLD HIGH PRESSURE CONTS INTO THE
WEEKEND WITH TEMPS MUCH BLO NORMAL.

&&

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 101615
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
1015 AM CST MON JAN 10 2005

.UPDATE...
DENSE FOG CONTINUES ACRS NORTHEAST ARKANSAS AND PARTS OF THE MO 
BOOTHEEL. HIGH CLOUDS MOVING OVER THE AREA HAVE SLOWED THE FOG 
DISSIPATION THIS MORNING SO THE ADVISORY HAS BEEN EXTENDED UNTIL 
NOON. HAVE LOWERED TEMPS ACRS NE AR DUE TO FOG. OTRW FORECAST IN 
GOOD SHAPE.

.PREV DISCUSSION ISSUED AT 425 AM...
LATEST WATER VAPOR IMAGERY SHOWS UPPER LEVEL LOW SPINNING ACROSS OFF 
THE COAST OF THE PACIFIC NORTHWEST WITH AMPLE AMOUNTS OF MOISTURE 
STREAMING ACROSS THE SOUTHERN UNITED STATES. SURFACE ANALYSIS PLACES 
A NEARLY STATIONARY COLD FRONT ACROSS NORTHERN ARKANSAS AND EASTERN 
OKLAHOMA. MAIN SHORT TERM FORECAST CONCERNS FOR TODAY IS FOG 
POTENTIAL THIS MORNING AND RAIN CHANCES FOR TONIGHT.

TODAY...LATEST INFRARED SATELLITE IMAGERY SHOWS LOW CLOUDS HAVE 
ALREADY SCATTERED OUT ACROSS ARKANSAS WITH SOME MID/HIGH LEVEL 
CLOUDS MOVING ACROSS CENTRAL ARKANSAS. TEMPERATURES NORTH OF THE 
BOUNDARY ARE IN THE MID/UPPER 30S WITH TEMPERATURES IN THE UPPER 
40S/LOWER 50S ACROSS SOUTHWEST TENNESSEE AND NORTHERN MISSISSIPPI. 
AS A RESULT VISIBILITIES HAVE DROPPED DOWN BELOW 1/4 MILE IN SPOTS 
AND HAVE ISSUED A DENSE FOG ADVISORY FOR POINTS MAINLY ALONG AND 
NORTH OF JBR AND WEST OF I-55 THROUGH 10 AM. TEMPERATURES NOT 
EXPECTED TO IMPROVE TOO MUCH FROM YESTERDAY AS SOME RESIDUAL LOW 
LEVEL MOISTURE WILL HANG AROUND DURING THE DAY. AS A RESULT...WILL 
GO WITH MOSTLY CLOUDY SKIES. 

TONIGHT...WEAK FRONTAL BOUNDARY WILL NOT MAKE ANY PROGRESS ACROSS 
THE MID SOUTH. SURFACE DEWPOINTS SHOULD BEGIN TO INCREASE ACROSS THE 
MID SOUTH TO AROUND 60 BY EARLY TUESDAY MORNING. 315K SURFACE SHOWS 
INCREASING ISENTROPIC ASCENT TOWARDS DAYBREAK. 700-500 MB LAYER 
LAPSE RATES WILL INCREASE TO AROUND 7.5 C/KM ACROSS THE NORTHERN 
HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA ALONG WITH 1600 J/KG OF CAPE...LI/S AROUND 
-6 AND SHOWALTER INDICIES AROUND -1 WHICH SUPPORT A MENTION OF 
THUNDER OVERNIGHT. ETA SUGGESTS THAT MOISTURE WILL BE SOMEWHAT 
LACKING WITH A CAPPING INVERSION PRESENT...ESPECIALLY ACROSS THE 
SOUTHERN FORECAST AREA. HOWEVER GFS IS VERY QUICK TO BRING MOISTURE 
BACK INTO THE AREA. WILL LEAN TOWARDS A MOISTER VERSION OF THE ETA. 
AS A RESULT WILL GO WITH SLIGHT CHANCE POPS TO THE SOUTH AND 
SCATTERED POPS ACROSS THE NORTHERN THIRD OF THE FORECAST AREA. ANY 
THUNDERSTORM ACTIVITY SHOULD BE ELEVATED WITH LOW LEVEL INVERSION IN 
PLACE OVERNIGHT.

TUESDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY...AREA WILL REMAIN IN SOUTHWEST FLOW ALOFT 
WITH THE FORECAST AREA IN THE WARM SECTOR AS SURFACE BOUNDARY MOVES 
NORTH BACK INTO THE MISSOURI AND OHIO VALLEY. MADE MINOR 
MODIFICATIONS TO POPS AS BEST INSTABILITY WILL REMAIN ACROSS THE 
NORTH AND ADJUSTED TEMPERATURES UP A FEW DEGREES FROM PREVIOUS 
FORECAST PACKAGE.

WEDNESDAY AND BEYOND...ETA/GFS STILL ADVERTISES STRONG COLD FRONT 
COMING THROUGH THE FORECAST AREA THURSDAY NIGHT. THUNDERSTORMS ARE 
EXPECTED TO DEVELOP AHEAD OF THE COLD FRONT WITH A 50 KT 850MB 
JET...80KT WINDS AT 500MB...AND DRY AIR AT 700 MB UPSTREAM. THE MOST 
PROBABLE FORM OF POTENTIAL SEVERE CONVECTION WOULD BE IN FORM OF A 
SQUALL LINE. ONLY MADE MINOR ADJUSTMENTS TO PRECIPITATION FORECAST 
FOR THURSDAY AFTERNOON AS CHANCES WILL DIMINISH AS COLD HIGH 
PRESSURE BUILDS IN ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA.

&&

.MEG...WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...ARZ008-009-017-018-026...DENSE FOG ADVISORY UNTIL 18 UTC. 
MS...NONE.
MO...MOZ113...DENSE FOG ADVISORY UNTIL 18 UTC.
TN...NONE.

FXUS64 KMEG 100323
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
922 PM CST SUN JAN 9 2005

.DISCUSSION...
FORECAST BECOMING MORE AND MORE TRICKY AS SATELLITE SHOWS THAT THE 
LOW CLOUDS OVER THE AREA ARE MOVING EASTWARD. SO EXPECT SKIES TO 
BECOME PARTLY CLOUDY FOR AT LEAST PART OF THE NIGHT. THIS WILL ALLOW 
TEMPS TO BEGIN TO FALL AND WINDS TO BECOME LIGHT RESULTING IN FOG 
FORMATION AND POSSIBLY LOW STRATUS REFORMING TOWARDS DAWN. WILL 
UPDATE THE OVERNIGHT PORTION OF THE FORECAST FOR PARTLY CLOUDY 
SKIES...LEAVING IN THE AREAS OF FOG. IF SKIES REMAIN PARTLY CLOUDY 
LONG ENOUGH A DENSE FOG ADVISORY MAY BE NEEDED AROUND DAY BREAK FOR 
VISIBILITIES OF LESS THAN A QUARTER MILE. BUT SUCH AN ADVISORY WOULD 
BE MORE NEEDED FOR THE MORNING THAN OVERNIGHT SO WILL HOLD OFF AN 
ADVISORY AT THIS TIME AND PERMIT NEXT SHIFT TO REEVALUATE. MIN TEMPS 
ARE REASONABLE. UPDATE WILL BE OUT SHORTLY.

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 091901
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
100 PM CST SUN JAN 9 2005

.DISCUSSION...
CLOUDS HAVE BROKEN UP THIS AFTERNOON ALLOWING FOR SUN TO COME OUT 
OVER THE MIDSOUTH. TEMPERATURES HAVE NOT WARMED UP AS QUICKLY AS 
PREVIOUS THOUGHT. GUIDANCE HAS BEEN TOO WARM OVER THE PAST FEW DAYS 
SO WILL UNDERCUT GUIDANCE ON THIS FORECAST PERIOD DURING AT LEAST 
THE SHORT TERM. 

WEATHER WISE ZONAL FLOW ALOFT WITH HIGH PRESSURE AT THE SFC WILL 
PREVAIL THROUGH MONDAY. THIS WILL KEEP THE MIDSOUTH DRY WITH A 
GRADUAL WARMING TREND.

MODELS BEGIN TO DIFFER ON AN APPROACHING SHORTWAVE MONDAY NIGHT INTO 
TUESDAY. THE ETA KEEPS THE SHORTWAVE NORTH OF THE CWA THUS KEEPING 
THE AREA DRY. ON THE OTHER HAND...THE GFS BRINGS THE SHORTWAVE INTO 
THE MIDSOUTH...THUS MAV GUIDANCE IS GIVING RATHER HIGH POPS FOR THE 
AREA. WILL GO WITH A COMPROMISE ACROSS THE CWA. WILL PUT LOW POPS 
ACROSS NORTHERN SECTIONS OF THE CWA AND WILL KEEP THE SOUTHERN 
SECTIONS DRY.

EXPECT CHANCES FOR SCATTERED SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS TO CONTINUE 
INTO WEDNESDAY AS A STRONG SHORTWAVE AND COLD FRONT APPROACHES THE 
AREA FROM THE WEST. WILL RAISE POPS IN WESTERN SECTIONS OF THE CWA 
FOR WEDNESDAY.  EXPECT SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS TO BECOME MORE 
NUMEROUS WEDNESDAY EVENING AS THE FRONT PUSHES INTO THE CWA. SOME 
THUNDERSTORMS COULD BE SEVERE LATE WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON INTO 
WEDNESDAY NIGHT. INSTABILITY WILL STILL BE A QUESTION. HOWEVER 
DYNAMICS ARE LOOKING VERY IMPRESSIVE WITH A 120 KNOT UPPER LEVEL JET 
AND 60 KNOT LOW LEVEL JET MOVING OVER THE CWA WEDNESDAY NIGHT. 
HELICITY VALUES WILL ALSO BE AROUND 400 M2/S2. IF THE SUN CAN BREAK 
THROUGH THE CLOUDS WEDNESDAY AND HELP MAKE THE ATMOSPHERE MORE 
UNSTABLE...THIS WILL ONLY HELP MAKE SEVERE STORMS MORE LIKELY 
WEDNESDAY NIGHT. PRECIP MAY LINGER INTO THURSDAY ACROSS EASTERN 
ZONES.

COLD AIR WILL MOVE INTO THE MIDSOUTH BEHIND THE COLD FRONT. 
TEMPERATURES WILL DROP THROUGHOUT THE DAY ACROSS MUCH OF THE CWA. 
THE COLD AIR WILL STICK AROUND THE AREA THROUGH THE WEEKEND AS 
ARCTIC HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS INTO THE MIDSOUTH. HIGH TEMPERATURES 
WILL PROBABLY HAVE A HARD TIME GETTING OUT OF THE 20S ESPECIALLY ON 
SATURDAY. 

&&

.MEG...WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MS...NONE.
MO...NONE.
TN...NONE.
