FXUS64 KMEG 090921
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
320 AM CST SUN JAN 9 2005

.DISCUSSION...LATEST INFRARED SATELLITE IMAGERY INDICATES ABUNDANT 
LOW STRATUS AFFECTING MUCH OF THE MISSISSIPPI RIVER VALLEY. WATER 
VAPOR IMAGERY DEPICTS UPPER LEVEL LOW ACROSS THE PACIFIC NORTHWEST 
AND A STEADY SUPPLY OF PACIFIC MOISTURE TRAVERSING ACROSS THE 
SOUTHERN UNITED STATES. TEMPERATURES ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA THIS 
MORNING RANGE FROM THE UPPER 30S TO LOWER 40S. MAIN FORECAST 
CONCERNS FOR TODAY WILL BE CLOUD COVER ISSUES AND RESULTANT 
TEMPERATURES. 

TODAY...SURFACE AND UPPER LEVEL RIDGING WILL CONTINUE TO BUILD INTO 
THE REGION TODAY. 00Z RAOB FROM KLZK SHOWS QUITE A BIT OF SUBSIDENCE 
IN MID/UPPER LEVELS BUT STILL SOME LOW LEVEL MOISTURE TRAPPED BELOW 
INVERSION. 850MB TEMPERATURES WILL WARM TO AROUND 14C WITH HIGHS 
ONLY WARMING INTO THE UPPER 50S TO LOWER 60S. MODEL SOUNDINGS 
SUGGEST SOME STRATOCUMULUS WILL HANG AS WIND FIELDS WILL REMAIN 
RATHER LIGHT MAKING IT DIFFICULT TO MIX OUT LOW LEVEL MOISTURE. 

TONIGHT...SURFACE AND UPPER LEVEL RIDGING WILL REMAIN IN PLACE 
ACROSS THE MID SOUTH TONIGHT. SOME LOW LEVEL MOISTURE WILL STILL 
REMAIN ACROSS THE AREA AND EXPECT PARTLY CLOUDY SKIES WITH 
TEMPERATURES IN THE 40S. 

MONDAY...SURFACE RIDGING WILL BEGIN TO SLIDE EAST AS SURFACE LOW 
EJECTS OUT OF THE ROCKIES AND INTO THE SOUTHERN PLAINS. 
HOWEVER...MOISTURE WILL CONTINUE TO INCREASE AND ONLY EXPECTING 
PARTLY SUNNY SKIES AT BEST. HIGHS WILL ONLY BE A FEW DEGREES WARMER 
THAN TODAY.

MONDAY NIGHT...MODELS BEGIN TO DIVERGE WITH HANDLING OF APPROACHING 
SYSTEM. ETA SEEMS A BIT QUICKER WITH SURFACE LOW THAN PREVIOUS RUN AND GFS 
BRINGS MOISTURE IN AS EARLY AS LATE MONDAY AFTERNOON. 315K SURFACE 
SHOWS ISENTROPIC ASCENT INCREASING...ESPECIALLY ACROSS THE NORTHERN 
SECTION OF THE FORECAST AREA BY LATE EVENING. 700-500 MB LAYER LAPSE 
RATES WILL INCREASE TO 6.5 C/KM...LI/S DOWN TO AROUND -2 AND 
SHOWALTER INDICIES DROPPING DOWN AROUND -1. AS A RESULT...WILL LEAN 
TOWARDS GFS SOLUTION AND KEEP AN ISOLATED MENTION OF THUNDERSTORMS 
IN ONGOING FORECAST WITH BEST CHANCES FOR PRECIPITATION AFTER 
MIDNIGHT.

LATEST MODEL RUNS SUGGEST INSTABILITY WILL STILL BE LACKING FOR ANY 
ORGANIZED SEVERE WEATHER ON WEDNESDAY. NO CHANGES MADE TO TUESDAY 
AND BEYOND. 
&&

BEHIND THE FRONT. 

HIGH PRESSURE WILL BUILD INTO THE AREA FOR THE WEEKEND KEEPING THE 
COLD ARCTIC AIR AROUND THE CWA. HIGH TEMPERATURES WILL ONLY BE IN

THUNDERSTORMS MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY. 

ANOTHER ARCTIC COLD FRONT WILL BLAST INTO THE AREA THURSDAY. 
EXPECTING DROPPING TEMPERATURES THROUGH THE DAY THURSDAY. ANY 
PRECIPITATION THAT DEVELOPS ON THURSDAY MAY BECOME SLEET/FREEZING 
RAIN ACROSS THE NORTHWESTERN FORECAST AREA. AT THIS TIME...THE SPEED 
OF THE PRECIPITATION SHOULD BE EAST OF THE AREA BY THURSDAY EVENING. 
JUST SOMETHING TO WATCH OVER THE NEXT FEW MODEL RUNS. THE COLDEST 
MORNING WILL LIKELY BE NEXT SATURDAY.

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 072144
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
344 PM CST FRI JAN 7 2005

.DISCUSSION...
AN UPPER LEVEL SHORTWAVE TROUGH OVER THE PLAINS STATES THIS
AFTERNOON WILL RAPIDLY MOVE ACROSS THE MISSISSIPPI VALLEY TONIGHT AND
INTO THE OHIO VALLEY BY SATURDAY MORNING. THIS WILL ALLOW A
BAROCLINIC ZONE STRETCHED ACROSS THE GULF COAST STATES THIS AFTERNOON
TO SURGE NORTHWARD THIS EVENING AS A SURFACE LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM
DEVELOPS ALONG THE FRONT AND MOVES NORTHEAST.

.TONIGHT...

AS THE SURFACE LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM AND ASSOCIATED UPPER TROUGH MOVES
EAST...ABUNDANT MOISTURE WILL CONTINUE TO SURGE NORTHWARD INTO THE
FORECAST AREA. THIS MEANS A CONTINUATION OF THE RAIN THROUGH THE
EVENING HOURS. THERE WILL EVEN BE CHANCES FOR A FEW THUNDERSTORMS
OVER SOUTHEAST PORTIONS OF THE CWA (NORTHEAST MISSISSIPPI...
SOUTHERN WEST TENNESSEE NEAR THE TENNESSEE RIVER). THE RAIN WILL
TAPER OFF FROM WEST TO EAST ACROSS THE AREA AFTER MIDNIGHT.
TEMPERATURES WILL REMAIN SEASONABLY COLD OVER THE NORTHERN 2/3RDS
OF THE AREA...WITH WARMER TEMPERATURES THIS EVENING OVER THE
SOUTHEAST 1/3RD OF THE FORECAST AREA AS THE FRONTAL BOUNDARY MOVES
NORTH OF THESE AREAS. AS THE LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM DEPARTS LATER
TONIGHT EXPECT TEMPERATURES TO SLOWLY FALL...EVEN ACROSS NORTHEAST
MISSISSIPPI. NOT EXPECTING ANY PROBLEMS WITH FROZEN OR FREEZING
PRECIPITATION TONIGHT ACROSS THE NORTH...AS PRECIPITATION SHOULD
COME TO AN END BEFORE TEMPERATURES FALL TO NEAR OR JUST BELOW THE
FREEZING MARK.

.SATURDAY THROUGH MONDAY...
ONCE THE LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM MOVES TO THE EAST...HIGH PRESSURE WILL
BUILD IN BOTH AT THE SURFACE AND ALOFT. THIS WILL ALLOW FOR A
RETURN TO DRY WEATHER INTO THE FIRST PART OF NEXT WEEK. HIGH
PRESSURE WILL MOVE OVER THE MID SOUTH ON SATURDAY...THEN MOVE OFF TO
OUR EAST FOR SUNDAY AND MONDAY. WINDS WILL REMAIN LIGHT OUT OF THE
NORTH AND NORTHEAST ON SATURDAY. THIS WILL KEEP TEMPERATURES IN THE
UPPER 40S NORTH TO LOW 50S SOUTH. AS THE HIGH PRESSURE SLIPS EAST...
WINDS WILL RETURN FROM THE SOUTH AND SOUTHWEST WITH APPRECIABLE
LOW LEVEL WARM ADVECTION SETTING UP. THIS WILL ALLOW TEMPERATURES TO
TO WARM 10 TO 15 DEGREES ABOVE SATURDAYS HIGHS. CONTINUED WELL
ABOVE AVERAGE TEMPERATURES WILL CONTINUE INTO THE FIRST PART OF
NEXT WEEK.

.MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY NIGHT...
A WEAK COLD FRONT WILL MOVE TOWARDS THE MID SOUTH FROM THE NORTHWEST
ON MONDAY AND STALL ACROSS NORTHERN PORTIONS OF THE FORECAST AREA
MONDAY NIGHT. WITH A WARM AND INCREASINGLY MOIST AIRMASS IN PLACE...
ALONG WITH CLOSE PROXIMITY OF THE FRONT...HAVE ADDED A CHANCE FOR
SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS INTO THE FORECAST FOR MONDAY NIGHT. ON
TUESDAY THIS FRONT WILL LIFT BACK TO THE NORTH AS A WARM FRONT AS A
POTENT SHORTWAVE TROUGH DIGS ACROSS THE WESTERN UNITED STATES. THIS
WILL PUT MOST OF THE AREA WELL ENTRENCHED INTO THE WARM SECTOR.
HAVE PULLED BACK THE POPS FOR TUESDAY AND TUESDAY NIGHT...AS THE
FRONT LIFTS BACK TO THE NORTH AND LITTLE IN THE WAY OF ANY DISTINCT
FORCING MECHANISM NOTED. HAVE STILL INCLUDED 20 POPS AREAWIDE FOR
TUESDAY AND TUESDAY NIGHT...AS ANY WEAK UPPER DISTURBANCE IN THE
INCREASINGLY SOUTHWEST FLOW ALOFT COULD TRIGGER ISOLATED
CONVECTION.

THE STRONGER SHORTWAVE OVER THE SOUTHWEST U.S. WILL EJECT OUT ACROSS
THE PLAINS STATES BY WEDNESDAY. AS THIS SYSTEM PULLS EAST...IT WILL
HELP TO SEND A STRONG COLD FRONT ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA WEDNESDAY
NIGHT AND THURSDAY. AHEAD OF THIS FRONT...EXPECT BETTER CHANCES FOR
SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS. THERE SHOULD BE STRONG JET DYNAMICS
ASSOCIATED WITH THIS FRONT...SO WILL NEED TO MONITOR FOR POSSIBLE
SEVERE. STILL WAY TOO EARLY THOUGH TO PINPOINT ANY SPECIFICS. THIS
STRONG SHORTWAVE WILL ALSO HELP TO DIG OUT A DEEP TROPOSPHERIC
TROUGH OVER THE EASTERN U.S. FOR THE END OF THE WEEK...SO
ANTICIPATING MUCH COLDER WEATHER FOR LATER ON THURSDAY INTO NEXT
WEEKEND.

&&

.MEG...WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MS...NONE.
MO...NONE.
TN...NONE.
&&

958 AM CST FRI JAN 7 2005

.DISCUSSION...
AN UPPER LEVEL SHORTWAVE OVER THE SOUTHERN HIGH PLAINS STATES THIS
MORNING WILL CONTINUE TO EJECT EASTWARD INTO THE MISSISSIPPI VALLEY
BY TONIGHT. ABUNDANT MOISTURE CONTINUES TO FLOW NORTHWARD AND
PRECIPITATION HAS BECOME FOCUSED ALONG AND NORTH OF A SURFACE
TROUGH OF LOW PRESSURE THAT IS STRETCHED ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA.
TEMPERATURES CONTINUE TO RISE AREAWIDE...WITH ONLY EXTREME NORTHERN
PORTIONS OF THE FORECAST AREA WITH TEMPERATURES HOVERING NEAR THE
FREEZING MARK. EXPECT ALMOST ALL OF OUR CWA TO RISE ABOVE FREEZING
WITHIN THE NEXT HOUR OR SO. THEREFORE...PLAN TO LET THE WINTER
WEATHER ADVISORY EXPIRE AS PLANNED AT 10 AM. THERE MAY BE
ISOLATED AREAS ACROSS OUR EXTREME NORTHERN COUNTIES THAT MAY TAKE
A BIT LONGER...BUT NOT EXPECTING MUCH IN THE WAY OF ROAD PROBLEMS
IN THESE AREAS.

ONCE TEMPERATURES GET ABOVE FREEZING...EXPECT WIDESPREAD RAIN
TO CONTINUE ACROSS MOST OF THE AREA THROUGH THE DAY. ONLY EXCEPTION
WILL BE FAR SOUTHEAST COUNTIES WHERE RAIN COVERAGE IS MUCH LESS THIS
MORNING. EXPECT THESE AREAS TO FILL IN BY THIS AFTERNOON. SO PLANNING
TO KEEP CATEGORICAL RAIN CHANCES IN THE FORECAST EVERYWHERE.
TEMPERATURES WILL BE SLOW TO WARM TODAY...ESPECIALLY ACROSS THE
NORTH...SO MAY NEED TO TWEAK DOWN TEMPS ACROSS NORTHERN WEST
TENNESSEE A BIT...BUT WILL WAIT TO SEE LATER OBS. UPDATED GRIDS WILL
BE OUT AFTER 10 AM TO REMOVE HEADLINES AND POSSIBLE UPDATES TO
TEMPERATURES.

FXUS64 KMEG 070912

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
312 AM CST FRI JAN 7 2005

.DISCUSSION...
MODELS HAVE DONE A POOR JOB OF INITIALIZATION OVER THE MID SOUTH 
TONIGHT. NONE OF THEM PICKED UP ON THE ONGOING PRECIP WHICH OCCURRED 
WELL BEFORE MIDNIGHT. 

SURFACE TEMPERATURES ACROSS THE SOUTHERN HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA 
ARE NEAR 32 DEGREES OR HIGHER. THIS IS WHERE THE BULK OF THE RAIN IS 
LOCATED. THE NORTHERN HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA IS AT 32 DEGREES OR 
LESS WHICH WILL POSE A CHALLENGING FORECAST FOR THE NEXT 6 TO 8 
HOURS. KMEM REPORTED LIGHT SLEET 20 PAST 2 THIS MORNING...THEN 
REPORTED THE CHANGEOVER BACK TO RAIN ABOUT 6 MINUTES LATER. LOOKING 
AT AREA SOUNDINGS...THE DEPTH OF THE BELOW FREEZING AIR IS ONLY 
ABOUT 2 KFT...AND ABOVE 2 KFT THERE IS A SIGNIFICANT WARM LAYER. WE 
ARE EXPECTING SURFACE TEMPERATURES TO SLOWLY RISE THE REMAINDER OF 
THE MORNING FROM SOUTH TO NORTH. 

SOME AREAS ACROSS THE MID SOUTH...MAINLY TENNESSEE...THE MISSOURI 
BOOTHEEL AND NORTHEAST ARKANSAS MAY EXPERIENCE LIGHT FREEZING RAIN  
FOR A BRIEF TIME BEFORE THE PRECIPITATION TURNS TO ALL RAIN. WE DO 
NOT ANTICIPATE ANY PROBLEMS RELATED TO THE SLEET SINCE IT WILL OCCUR 
FOR LESS THAN 30 MINUTES IN ANY PARTICULAR AREA AND BE RATHER LIGHT. 
WE WILL CONTINUE TO MONITOR THIS FOR ANY UNEXPECTED CHANGES.

BY MID MORNING ALL AREAS WILL EXPERIENCE RAIN WHICH WILL CONTINUE 
INTO TONIGHT. THE SHORTWAVE TROUGH RESPONSIBLE FOR THE RAIN TODAY 
WILL TRANSLATE INTO THE OHIO VALLEY TONIGHT. MOST OF THE RAIN WILL 
MOVE EAST...LINGERING AROUND THE SOUTHEAST FORECAST AREA SATURDAY 
MORNING. DRY WEATHER IS EXPECTED FOR MOST AREAS THROUGH THE DAYTIME 
HOURS MONDAY. 

MORE UNSETTLED WEATHER IS EXPECTED IN THE FORM OF SHOWERS AND 
THUNDERSTORMS FROM MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH NEXT THURSDAY. A COLD FRONT 
WILL MOVE THROUGH THE REGION AND BRING MUCH COOLER TEMPERATURES 
THURSDAY.

FXUS64 KMEG 062147
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
347 PM CST THU JAN 6 2005

.DISCUSSION...
COLD SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE HAS BUILT INTO MOST OF THE REGION THIS
AFTERNOON. TEMPERATURES HAVE SLOWLY FALLEN ACROSS MOST OF THE
FORECAST AREA TODAY AND HAVE NOW STEADIED OUT LATE THIS AFTERNOON
AND RANGE FROM THE UPPER 20S NORTHWEST TO LOWER 40S SOUTHEAST.
CLOUDS HAVE BEEN SLOW TO CLEAR AS EXPECTED AND ONLY A BRIEF PERIOD
OF CLEARING IS EXPECTED THIS EVENING OVER NORTHWEST SECTIONS.
ELSEWHERE...EXPECT CLOUDS TO REMAIN IN PLACE.

.TONIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY NIGHT...

SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE WILL QUICKLY MOVE EAST ALLOWING FOR RETURN
FLOW TO RAPIDLY SET BACK UP OVER THE MID SOUTH LATER TONIGHT. A
SHORTWAVE TROUGH OVER THE FOUR CORNERS REGION THIS AFTERNOON WILL
MOVE QUICKLY EASTWARD TOWARDS THE FORECAST AREA IN THE FAST FLOW
ALOFT. DEEP MOISTURE WILL SURGE NORTHWARD IN ADVANCE OF THIS SYSTEM
LATER TONIGHT AND OVERRUN THE RETREATING SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE
SYSTEM ON FRIDAY. AS THIS OCCURS...EXPECT PRECIPITATION TO BREAK
OUT ACROSS THE MID SOUTH EARLY TOMORROW MORNING. ACROSS PORTIONS OF
NORTHEAST ARKANSAS...THE AIRMASS MAY REMAIN COLD ENOUGH FOR A FEW
POCKETS OF FREEZING RAIN AT THE ONSET OF THE PRECIPITATION. ANY
FREEZING PRECIP SHOULD QUICKLY CHANGE TO RAIN BY MID-MORNING FRIDAY
AS LOW LEVEL WARM ADVECTION TAKES OVER. THE RAIN WILL CONTINUE
ACROSS THE REGION FOR THE REMAINDER OF FRIDAY AND TAPER OFF FROM
WEST TO EAST FRIDAY NIGHT AS THE UPPER DISTURBANCE AND DEVELOPING
SURFACE LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM PULL EAST.

.SATURDAY THROUGH MONDAY...
A RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE WILL BUILD INTO THE MID SOUTH PROVIDING FOR
A PLEASANT WINTER WEEKEND. EXPECT DRY WEATHER WITH TEMPERATURES
WARMING TO WELL ABOVE NORMAL LEVELS BY SUNDAY AND MONDAY.

.MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY...
A MOIST SOUTHWESTERLY FLOW ALOFT WILL DEVELOP OVER THE FORECAST
AREA FOR THE BEGINNING OF NEXT WEEK. SEVERAL UPPER LEVEL SHORTWAVE
DISTURBANCES WILL MOVE ACROSS THE AREA BRINGING MULTIPLE CHANCES FOR
SHOWERS. TEMPERATURES WILL REMAIN WELL ABOVE SEASONAL AVERAGES AS
LOW LEVEL WINDS REMAIN SOUTHERLY.

.WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY NIGHT...
A POTENT UPPER LEVEL DISTURBANCE WILL PULL ACROSS THE SOUTHERN
PLAINS AND ACROSS THE MID SOUTH WEDNESDAY NIGHT. THIS WILL HELP
DRIVE A STRONG COLD FRONT ACROSS THE AREA WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND
THURSDAY. SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS WILL DEVELOP AHEAD OF THIS
FRONT AND MOVE ACROSS THE AREA WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND THURSDAY. A
COLDER AIRMASS WILL FILTER INTO THE AREA BY THURSDAY...BRINGING AN
END TO THE ABOVE NORMAL TEMPERATURES.

&&

.MEG...WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MS...NONE.
MO...NONE.
TN...NONE.
&&

$$

JLH





FXUS64 KMEG 061617
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
1017 AM CST THU JAN 6 2005

.DISCUSSION...
LOW LEVEL COLD ADVECTION WILL CONTINUE OVER THE MID SOUTH TODAY.
THIS WILL LEAD TO A CONTINUED SLOW FALL OF TEMPERATURES THROUGH THE
DAY. AREAS OF DRIZZLE AND FLURRIES WILL CONTINUE INTO LATER THIS
AFTERNOON AS ABUNDANT LOW LEVEL MOISTURE HANGS AROUND. MOSTLY CLOUDY
SKIES WILL CONTINUE THROUGH MOST OF THE AFTERNOON WITH A SLOW
DECREASE IN CLOUDS FROM WEST TO EAST LATE. HAVE UPDATED THE GRIDS TO
REFLECT THESE CHANGES AND UPDATED ZONES WILL BE OUT SHORTLY.

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 060833
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
230 AM CDT THU JAN 6 2005

.DISCUSSION...

A CLOSED LOW WILL LIFT NORTHEASTWARD ACROSS THE GREAT LAKES TODAY
AS WEST SOUTHWESTERLY FLOW DOMINATES THE SOUTHERN HALF OF THE NATION.
A SHORT WAVE WILL MOVE ACROSS THE PLAINS FRIDAY AND WEAKEN AS IT
CROSSES THE MID MISSISSIPPI VALLEY FRIDAY NIGHT. ZONAL FLOW WILL
DOMINATE THE NATION FROM COAST TO COAST SATURDAY THROUGH MONDAY. A
RIDGE WILL BUILD OVER THE SOUTHEAST AS A SERIES OF MINOR IMPULSES
RIDE THE ZONAL FLOW. SHORT WAVES WILL CARVE A DEEP TROF IN THE WEST
AND THE RIDGE WILL BUILD NORTHWARD ALONG THE EAST COAST TUESDAY AND
WEDNESDAY.

AT THE SURFACE A HIGH PRESSURE AREA BEHIND A COLD FRONT MOVING ACROSS
THE SOUTHEASTERN STATES WILL BRING COLDER AND DRIER AIR INTO THE MID
SOUTH TODAY. THIS WILL END THE RAIN ACROSS THE REGION THIS MORNING.
DRY AND COLD WEATHER CAN BE EXPECTED UNDER THE INFLUENCE OF HIGH
PRESSURE TONIGHT. THE HIGH WILL SLIDE EASTWARD FRIDAY AS A LOW
DEVELOPS OVER THE CENTRAL PLAINS. SOUTHERLY FLOW AROUND THE HIGH WILL
CAUSE MOIST AIR TO RETURN TO THE MID SOUTH WITH GOOD CHANCES OF RAIN
FRIDAY THROUGH SATURDAY. DRIER AIR WILL MOVE INTO THE MID SOUTH
SUNDAY AND MONDAY. ANOTHER LOW PRESSURE AREA WILL BRING CHANCES OF
SHOWERS TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY.
&&

.MEG...WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MS...NONE.
MO...NONE.
TN...NONE.
&&

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 052038
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
236 PM CST WED JAN 5 2005

.DISCUSSION...

COLD FRONT NOW MOVING THROUGH NORTHEAST ARKANSAS THIS AFTERNOON WITH
SOME SHOWERS NEAR AND BEHIND THE FRONT. A LARGER AREA OF RAIN IS
BEHIND THE FRONT OVER MUCH OF WESTERN AND CENTRAL ARKANSAS. ALL THIS
RAIN SHOULD CONTINUE TO MOVE EAST AS THE FRONT MOVES THROUGH THE
REGION TONIGHT AND EARLY THURSDAY. TEMPERATURES HAVE BEEN FALLING
FAIRLY RAPIDLY BEHIND THE FRONT BUT READINGS WONT DROP NEARLY AS
MUCH AS PREVIOUS FRONT AS COLDEST AIR SHOULD REMAIN TO OUR NORTH. THE
RAIN SHOULD EXIT THE FORECAST AREA BY THURSDAY MORNING AND
TEMPERATURES WILL BE SOME 25 TO 30 DEGREES COOLER THAN TODAY.
THURSDAY NIGHT WILL BE THE COLDEST NIGHT FOR A FEW DAYS AS HIGH
PRESSURE SETTLES INTO THE REGION. BY FRIDAY...THE HIGH MOVES EAST AND
SOUTH WINDS RETURN BRINGING MOISTURE BACK INTO THE REGION AND
PRODUCING MORE RAIN FOR FRIDAY AND SATURDAY. SUNDAY AND MONDAY
SHOULD BE DRY AND BY TUESDAY ANOTHER SYSTEM APPROACHES THE REGION
WITH RAIN CONTINUING THROUGH WEDNESDAY NIGHT. WITH UPPER LEVEL FLOW
EXPECTED TO BE MAINLY ZONAL OR SOUTHWEST...TEMPERATURES WILL STAY BE
GENERALLY ON THE MILD SIDE FOR THE NEXT 7 DAYS.

&&

.MEG...WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MS...NONE.
MO...NONE.
TN...NONE.
&&

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 050911
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
311 AM CST WED JAN 5 2005

.DISCUSSION...

A BROAD RIDGE EXTENDING FROM THE SOUTHERN PLAINS TO THE EAST COAST
WITH A SERIES OF DISTURBANCES RIDING OVER IT WILL DOMINATE THE UPPER
PATTERN TODAY AND TONIGHT. MEANWHILE A CLOSED LOW IN CALIFORNIA WILL
OPEN UP AS A SHORT WAVE AS IT MOVES ACROSS THE ROCKYS AND THE
NORTHERN PLAINS. THE RIDGE WILL REMAIN IN THE SOUTHEAST NORTH OF A
CLOSED HIGH IN THE EASTERN GULF OF MEXICO. THE RIDGE WILL WEAKEN TO
ZONAL FLOW FROM THE DESERT SOUTHWEST TO THE EAST COAST THURSDAY AND
FRIDAY AS THE SHORT WAVE SHEARS ACROSS THE GREAT LAKES AND INTO
CANADA. THE ZONAL PATTERN WILL CONTINUE OVER THE WEEKEND AND INTO
EARLY NEXT WEEK WITH A SERIES OF MINOR SHORT WAVES RIDING THE FLOW. A
TROF WILL DEEPEN IN THE WEST AND A RIDGE WILL BUILD IN THE EAST
TUESDAY.

AT THE SURFACE A LOW PRESSURE AREA WILL MOVE NORTHEASTWARD ALONG A
STATIONARY FRONT JUST NORTH OF THE MID SOUTH TODAY. ITS TRAILING COLD
FRONT WILL MOVE ACROSS THE REGION TONIGHT. THE RESULT WILL BE
CONTINUED WET WEATHER WITH SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS. HIGH PRESSURE
BEHIND THE COLD FRONT WILL BRING COLDER AND DRIER AIR INTO THE REGION
AND END THE RAIN BY THURSDAY MORNING. FORECAST SOUNDINGS OF BOTH THE
ETA AND GFS MODELS SHOW THE LOWER ATMOSPHERE DRYING OUT BEFORE THE
RAIN HAS A CHANCE TO CHANGE TO ANYTHING FREEZING OR FROZEN LATE
TONIGHT. ALSO THE VERTICAL MOTION TURNS DOWNWARD. DRY AND COLD
WEATHER CAN BE EXPECTED THURSDAY. THE HIGH WILL SLIDE EASTWARD FRIDAY
AS A LOW DEVELOPS OVER THE CENTRAL PLAINS. SOUTHERLY FLOW AROUND THE
HIGH WILL CAUSE MOIST AIR TO RETURN TO THE MID SOUTH WITH CHANCES OF
RAIN FRIDAY AND SATURDAY. DRIER AIR WILL MOVE INTO THE MID SOUTH
SUNDAY AND MONDAY. A COLD FRONT WILL BRING CHANCES OF SHOWERS MONDAY
NIGHT AND TUESDAY.
&&

.MEG...WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MS...NONE.
MO...NONE.
TN...NONE.
&&

$$

JCL





FXUS64 KMEG 050240
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
935 PM CST TUE JAN 4 2005

.DISCUSSION...

THE FRONT THAT WAS IN NORTHERN COUNTIES OF THE MIDSOUTH TODAY HAS
MOVED BACK INTO SOUTHERN MO AND SOUTHERN IL. RAIN IS CURRENTLY
NORTH OF THE FRONT. TONIGHTS FCST HAS A SLIGHT CHANCE TO A CHANCE
OF SHOWERS IN NE AR...THE BOOTHEEL AND NW W TN. A LOW NOW IN NC
TX WILL STRENGTHEN AND MOVE INTO NC LATE TONIGHT INTO WEDNESDAY.
SO...BELIEVE IT IS BEST TO MAINTAIN THESE POPS IN THE MENTIONED
COUNTIES TONIGHT.

AS THE LOW MOVES ON NORTHEAST...IT WILL DRAG A COLD FRONT THROUGH
THE MIDSOUTH WEDNESDAY NIGHT. THUNDERSTORMS WILL SPIN UP AHEAD OF
THE FRONT. THEN...MUCH COLDER AIR WILL BLOW INTO THE REGION AFTER
FROPA. MOST ALL PLACES WILL BE OVER 20 DEGREE COLDER THAN
TONIGHTS LOWS.

000 
FXUS64 KMEG 042035
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
234 PM CST TUE JAN 4 2005

.DISCUSSION...
STATIONARY FRONT NEAR UNION CITY-BLYTHEVILLE-JONESBORO LINE AT
19Z. MOVEMENT OF THIS BOUNDARY OVER THE NEXT SEVERAL HOURS WILL
MAKE OR BREAK TEMPERATURE FORECASTS FOR TODAY AND TONIGHT. ABOUT A
15 DEGREE SPREAD DEPENDING ON WHICH SIDE OF FRONT YOU ARE ON. ANY
SIGNIFICANT PRECIPITATION HAS MOVED NORTH OF THE CWA...IF THERE IS
ANY PRECIPITATION REACHING THE GROUND...CERTAINLY NO MORE THAN
DRIZZLE.
&&

.SHORT TERM (THROUGH FRIDAY)...
MODELS INDICATE FRONT WILL MOVE NORTH OF THE AREA AGAIN AHEAD OF
SOUTHWEST SHORTWAVE...WITH SURFACE LOW MOVING NORTHEAST ALONG THE
FRONT. NO ORGANIZED LIFT TONIGHT...SO NO WIDESPREAD PRECIPITATION.
WILL MAKE LAST MINUTE DECISION ON WHETHER TO CARRY POPS...BUT
LEANING DRY. AREAS NORTH OF THE FRONT WILL SEE THEIR LOW
TEMPERATURES THIS EVENING BEFORE FRONT RETURNS NORTH. OTHER AREAS
WILL DROP A FEW DEGREES...WITH MOST AREAS PROBABLY NEAR OR ABOVE 60
DEGREES.

A LARGE PART OF WEDNESDAY WILL BE DRY...BUT AS UPPER SYSTEM AND
ASSOCIATED SURFACE LOW APPROACH...EXPECT SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS
TO BREAK OUT IN ADVANCE OF THE FRONT. WILL RANGE FROM HIGH CHANCE
POPS NORTHWEST TO 15 OR LESS SOUTHEAST. ALL AREAS IN WARM SECTOR
TOMORROW...HIGHS IN THE 60S.

FRONT TO PASS THROUGH CWA WEDNESDAY NIGHT...CATEGORICAL POPS AREA-
WIDE ALONG WITH MENTION OF THUNDER. COOLER AIR SHOULD BE INTO
ALMOST ALL AREAS BY 12Z THURSDAY.

WILL LINGER POPS INTO THURSDAY MORNING SOUTHEAST...MOST AREAS WILL
HAVE LITTLE OR NO RECOVERY FROM 12Z THURSDAY TEMPERATURES. SKIES
CLEAR FOR A SHORT TIME THURSDAY AFTERNOON AND EVENING...ALLOWING
TEMPERATURES TO FALL TO NEAR FREEZING FOR THE FIRST TIME IN A WEEK.

FRONT WASHES OUT ALONG GULF COAST THURSDAY NIGHT AND FRIDAY. GFS
RATHER BULLISH ON MOISTURE RETURN...AND TRIES TO BREAK OUT
PRECIPITATION DURING THE AFTERNOON AND EVENING. ETA MUCH WEAKER.
WILL HOLD A TOKEN 20 POPS IN...WHICH FITS WITH THE NEIGHBORS. TEMPS
AROUND NORMAL ON FRIDAY.
&&

.LONG TERM (AFTER FRIDAY)...
BACK INTO SOUTHWEST FLOW FOR SATURDAY...WILL HOLD POPS IN SATURDAY
AND SATURDAY NIGHT WITH WARM ADVECTION...BUT AFTER THAT...DONT SEE
MUCH OF A WELL DEFINED TRIGGER BEFORE TUESDAY OR TUESDAY NIGHT.
TEMPERATURES RETURNING TO WELL ABOVE NORMAL READINGS AFTER SATURDAY.
&&

.MEG...WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MS...NONE.
MO...NONE.
TN...NONE.
&&

962 
FXUS64 KMEG 041641
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
1041 AM CST TUE JAN 4 2005

.DISCUSSION...
SURFACE BOUNDARY HAS DRIFTED INTO EXTREME NW PORTION OF CWA BETWEEN
WALNUT RIDGE AND JONESBORO...WITH A WIND SHIFT AND 10 DEGREE
TEMPERATURE CHANGE BETWEEN THE TWO SITES.

MOST PRECIPITATION HAS MOVED NORTH OUT OF THE CWA...EXCEPT FOR THE
NORTHERN TIER OF COUNTIES. THIS AREA SHOULD ALSO BE MAINLY DRY
WITHIN THE NEXT COUPLE OF HOURS.

ALL MODEL DATA INDICATES FRONT WILL MOVE BACK TO THE NORTH AS
ANOTHER SURFACE WAVE MOVES ALONG IT. JUST NOT CONFIDENT IN EXACT
TIMING OF THIS OCCURRENCE.

HAVE TRIMMED POPS ABOUT 20 PERCENT ACROSS THE BOARD FOR TODAY...AND
MAY END UP PULLING THEM COMPLETELY WITH AN EARLY AFTERNOON UPDATE.
MODEL DATA ALSO INDICATES THAT OUR FORECAST FOR TONIGHT AND TOMORROW
MAY BE TOO PESSIMISTIC. WILL LEAVE THAT FOR THE AFTERNOON PACKAGE
HOWEVER.

FINE TUNED TEMPERATURES TO SHOW BOUNDARY NEAR JBR. UPDATE OUT
SHORTLY.
&&

.MEG...WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MS...NONE.
MO...NONE.
TN...NONE.

SURFACE BOUNDARY HAS DRIFTED INTO EXTREME NW PORTION OF CWA BETWEEN
WALNUT RIDGE AND JONESBORO...WITH A WIND SHIFT AND 10 DEGREE
TEMPERATURE CHANGE BETWEEN THE TWO SITES.

MOST PRECIPITATION HAS MOVED NORTH OUT OF THE CWA...EXCEPT FOR THE
NORTHERN TIER OF COUNTIES. THIS AREA SHOULD ALSO BE MAINLY DRY
WITHIN THE NEXT COUPLE OF HOURS.

ALL MODEL DATA INDICATES FRONT WILL MOVE BACK TO THE NORTH AS
ANOTHER SURFACE WAVE MOVES ALONG IT. JUST NOT CONFIDENT IN EXACT
TIMING OF THIS OCCURRENCE.

HAVE TRIMMED POPS ABOUT 20 PERCENT ACROSS THE BOARD FOR TODAY...AND
MAY END UP PULLING THEM COMPLETELY WITH AN EARLY AFTERNOON UPDATE.
MODEL DATA ALSO INDICATES THAT OUR FORECAST FOR TONIGHT AND TOMORROW
MAY BE TOO PESSIMISTIC. WILL LEAVE THAT FOR THE AFTERNOON PACKAGE
HOWEVER.

FINE TUNED TEMPERATURES TO SHOW BOUNDARY NEAR JBR. UPDATE OUT
SHORTLY.
&&

.MEG...WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MS...NONE.
MO...NONE.
TN...NONE.
&&

$$

WAGNER





000 
FXUS64 KMEG 040846
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
245 AM CST TUE JAN 4 2005

.DISCUSSION...

A BROAD RIDGE EXTENDING FROM THE SOUTHERN PLAINS TO THE EAST COAST
WITH A SERIES OF DISTURBANCES RIDING OVER IT WILL DOMINATE THE UPPER
PATTERN THROUGH WEDNESDAY. MEANWHILE A CLOSED LOW ON THE CALIFORNIA
COAST WILL MOVE ACROSS THE ROCKYS AND OPEN UP AS A BROAD SHORT WAVE
ACROSS THE NORTHERN PLAINS WEDNESDAY. THE RIDGE WILL REMAIN IN THE
SOUTHEAST NORTH OF A CLOSED HIGH IN THE EASTERN GULF OF MEXICO. THE
RIDGE WILL WEAKEN TO ZONAL FLOW FROM THE DESERT SOUTHWEST TO THE EAST
COAST THURSDAY AND FRIDAY AS THE SHORT WAVE SHEARS ACROSS THE GREAT
LAKES. THE ZONAL PATTERN WILL CONTINUE OVER THE WEEKEND AND INTO
EARLY NEXT WEEK WITH A SERIES OF MINOR SHORT WAVES MOVING EAST
NORTHEASTWARD FROM THE CENTRAL ROCKYS TO THE GREAT LAKES.

AT THE SURFACE A STATIONARY FRONT WILL CONTINUE FROM TEXAS ACROSS THE
MID MISSISSIPPI VALLEY JUST NORTH OF THE MID SOUTH TO THE OHIO
VALLEY. A LOW WILL MOVE NORTHEASTWARD ALONG THE FRONT WEDNESDAY AND
ITS TRAILING COLD FRONT WILL MOVE ACROSS THE MID SOUTH WEDNESDAY
NIGHT. THE RESULT WILL BE CONTINUED WET WEATHER WITH SHOWERS AND
THUNDERSTORMS TODAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY NIGHT. THE FRONT WILL DISSIPATE
THURSDAY AS HIGH PRESSURE BEHIND IT BRINGS COLDER AND DRIER AIR TO
THE REGION. THE HIGH WILL SLIDE EASTWARD FRIDAY AS A LOW DEVELOPS
OVER THE CENTRAL PLAINS. RETURN FLOW AROUND THE HIGH WILL CAUSE MOIST
AIR TO RETURN TO THE MID SOUTH WITH CHANCES OF RAIN FRIDAY AND
SATURDAY. DRIER AIR WILL MOVE INTO THE MID SOUTH SUNDAY AND MONDAY.
&&

.MEG...WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MS...NONE.
MO...NONE.
TN...NONE.
&&

$$

JCL





AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
800 PM CST MON JAN 3 2005

.DISCUSSION...

A FRONT DRAPES ACROSS THE CENTRAL PART OF THE COUNTRY FROM S OH
TO S IL AND ON TO NC AR TO NE TX. FRONT COULD DROP A LITTLE
FARTHER SOUTH TONIGHT. BAND OF RAIN FROM NE TX THROUGH THE
MIDSOUTH AND ON TO MIDDLE TN THE MAIN WEATHER MAKER TONIGHT.
PRESENT POPS SEEM WELL SUITED TO THE DEVELOPING SITUATION EXCEPT
RAIN WILL BE A LITTLE MORE LIKELY SOUTH OF TUP.

ALTHOUGH SHOWERS ARE TRAINING...RAINFALL EVENT TOTALS ARE LIGHT
SO FAR AND SHOULD BE LIGHT TO MODERATE THE REST OF THE NIGHT.


000 
FXUS64 KMEG 032057
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
300 PM CST MON JAN 3 2005

.DISCUSSION...
FRONT NEAR A IND-STL-FYV LINE...FURTHER SOUTH FROM THE LAST FEW
DAYS. ROUGHLY A 20 DEGREE DIFFERENCE 50 MILES EITHER SIDE OF THE
FRONT. LARGE RAIN AREA MOVING ACROSS ABOUT NORTHERN 2/3RDS OF CWA.
AREA IS SINKING SLOWLY SOUTHWARD. TEMPERATURES MAINLY IN THE 60S...
ALTHOUGH A FEW 70S NORTHEAST MS.
&&

.SHORT TERM (THROUGH THURSDAY)...
FRONT SHOULD NOT MAKE MUCH MORE SOUTHWARD PROGRESS FOR NEXT 48
HOURS. AS WEAK IMPULSES LIFT OUT OF SOUTHWEST TROF...PERIODS OF
RAIN WILL OCCUR. ANY THUNDER WILL BE ISOLATED. HIGHEST POPS WILL BE
ACROSS NORTHWEST PORTION OF AREA.  MODEL AND HPC QPF HAS FINALLY
BACKED OFF A LITTLE FROM TOTALS SEEN OVER THE WEEKEND. MOST TOTALS
SHOULD BE 1 TO 2 INCHES OVER NEXT 48 HOURS...SO NO FLOOD WATCH
ANTICIPATED.

MAIN PIECE OF WESTERN TROF LIFTS OVER THE RIDGE WEDNESDAY AND
WEDNESDAY NIGHT...FINALLY DRAGGING COLD FRONT THROUGH THE AREA.
WILL BE ANOTHER CONCENTRATED ROUND OF PRECIPITATION (AND A LITTLE
BETTER CHANCE OF THUNDER) WITH THIS FRONT...BUT RAIN SHOULD BE OUT OF
OUR AREA EARLY THURSDAY MORNING.

THROUGH THE DAYTIME HOURS WEDNESDAY...PERSISTANCE SEEMS THE WAY TO
GO ON TEMPERATURES. CURRENT FORECAST HAS THIS DEPICTED PRETTY WELL.
HIGHS THURSDAY COULD BE RATHER EARLY IN THE DAY...DEPENDING ON
ACTUAL TIMING OF FRONTAL PASSAGE. EVEN THIS COOLING WILL ONLY RETURN
US TO NEAR NORMAL LEVELS.
&&

.LONG TERM (AFTER THURSDAY)...
A DRY PERIOD BEHIND THE FRONT FOR THURSDAY NIGHT AND FRIDAY. WITH
FRONT FORECAST TO STALL ALONG GULF COAST...WE WILL HAVE TO WATCH
FOR A WAVE TO MOVE ALONG THE FRONT FRIDAY. THIS COULD BRING
PRECIPITATION BACK INTO NORTHERN MISSISSIPPI...BUT FOR NOW WILL
KEEP FORECAST DRY.

SURFACE HIGH MOVES OFF TO THE EAST ON SATURDAY...SURFACE FLOW
BECOMES SOUTHERLY AGAIN...WITH UPPER FLOW SOUTHWEST. PRETTY MUCH
THE SAME PATTERN WE ARE IN NOW. MAY BE SOME WARM ADVECTION SHOWERS
AS WARMTH RETURNS SATURDAY AND SATURDAY NIGHT. WILL KEEP
SUNDAY/MONDAY DRY FOR NOW...BUT WOULD NOT BE SHOCKED IF PRECIP NEEDS
TO BE ADDED LATER.

TEMPERATURES...FRIDAY WILL STILL SEE TEMPS AROUND NORMAL BEFORE HIGH
MOVES OFF TO THE EAST. AFTER THAT...WE RETURN TO WARMER THAN NORMAL
TEMPERATURES. HIGH TEMPERATURE FORECAST FOR SATURDAY THROUGH MONDAY
MAY EVEN BE A HAIR ON THE CONSERVATIVE SIDE. H85 TEMPS AROUND +10
AND THICKNESSES AROUND 5600 FOR SATURDAY THROUGH MONDAY.
&&

.MEG...WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MS...NONE.
MO...NONE.
TN...NONE.
&&

$$

WAGNER





000 
FXUS64 KMEG 030951
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
350 AM CST MON JAN 3 2005

.DISCUSSION...
STATIONARY FRONT REMAINS ACRS MO AND THE OH VALLEY THIS MORNING. A 
LARGE UPPER RIDGE ACRS THE SE U.S. KEEPING THE FRONT NORTH OF THE 
AREA. CURRENTLY SOME LIGHT RAIN STRETCHED FROM JBR TO MEM OTRW 
CLOUDY AND MILD. MAIN ACTION ACRS NE OK AND NW AR. THIS LARGE AREA 
OF PRECIP SHOULD MOVE INTO SRN MO AND ALONG THE FRONT DURING THE DAY.

TODAY AND TONIGHT...BEST CHANCE OF PRECIP REMAINS ACRS THE NRN SXNS 
OF THE MID SOUTH...AREAS CLOSEST TO THE FRONT. LARGE AREA OF PRECIP 
SHOULD SCRAP THIS AREA TODAY SO WL CONT WITH CAT POPS. EXPECT LESS 
PRECIP AS YOU HEAD TO THE SOUTH AND EAST. CONTINUED VERY MILD WITH 
READINGS AROUND 70 ACRS SRN SXNS. FRONT DIPS SOUTH TO THE NORTHERN 
BORDER OF THE FORECAST AREA TONIGHT. ANOTHER SHORTWAVE MOVES INTO 
THE AREA PROMOTING MORE RAINFALL ALONG THE FRONT. MODELS IN SOME 
DISAGREEMENT ABOUT LOCATION OF PRECIP DUE TO DIFFERING FRONTAL 
LOCATIONS. EITHER WAY...NRN AREAS HAVE BETTER CHANCE FOR PRECIP THAN 
SRN AREAS. 

TUESDAY AND TUESDAY NIGHT...FRONT LIFTS BACK TO THE NORTH. BEST 
CHANCE OF RAIN CONTS ACRS THE NORTH...PROBABLY DURING THE MORNING. 
EXPECT MOST PLACES WL BE DRY TUE NIGHT SINCE THE FRONT WL BE WELL TO 
THE NORTH.

WEDNESDAY AND WEDNESDAY NIGHT...MODELS CONT TO SLOW THE FRONTAL 
PASSAGE DOWN. SHOULD CLEAR MOST AREAS BY 12Z THU WITH A COOLER 
AIRMASS MOVING IN.

THURSDAY AND THURSDAY NIGHT...BEST CHANCE FOR SOME DRY...SEASONABLY 
COOL WEATHER. HOWEVER GFS DEVELOPING SFC WAVE ALONG THE STALLED 
FRONT THAT SHOULD BE JUST SOUTH OF THE AREA. THIS MAY RESULT IN SOME 
PRECIP ACRS NRN MS THU NIGHT. 

FRIDAY THROUGH SUNDAY...SFC HIGH SLIPS TO THE EAST AND RETURN FLOW 
DEVELOPS. EXPECT MORE CHANCES FOR RAIN FRI AND SAT BEFORE A COLD 
FRONT MOVES THROUGH SAT NIGHT WITH DRY WEATHER FOR SUN.

&&

.MEG...WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MS...NONE.
MO...NONE.
TN...NONE.
&&

$$

SJM


263 
FXUS64 KMEG 030254
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
850 PM CST SUN JAN 2 2005

SHORT TERM...LATEST SURFACE ANALYSIS PLACES STATIONARY FRONTAL 
BOUNDARY MOSTLY ALONG I-44 IN MISSOURI. 00Z UPPER AIR ANALYSIS STILL 
SHOWING MID/UPPER LEVEL HIGH PRESSURE CENTERED ACROSS THE PANHANDLE 
OF FLORIDA. MEANWHILE...ANOTHER LOW/MID LEVEL TROUGH SLIDING THROUGH 
THE MID SOUTH AND RIDING UP THE BACK SIDE OF THE RIDGE /EVIDENT IN 
WATER VAPOR IMAGERY/. MAIN FORECAST CONCERN OVERNIGHT WILL BE 
PRECIPITATION AND THUNDER CHANCES.

00Z RAOB FROM KLZK SHOWS DEEP MOISTURE THROUGH 300 MB...ONLY 100 
J/KG OF CAPE AND PRECIPITABLE WATER VALUES AROUND 1.5 INCHES. NOT 
TOO IMPRESSED WITH THUNDER CHANCES AS 700-500 MB LAYER LAPSE RATES 
WILL BE AROUND A WEAK 6 C/KM...LITTLE TO NO SURFACE BASED 
INSTABILITY WITH SHOWALTER/LIFTED INDICIES BOTH BEING POSITIVE. AS A 
RESULT...I WILL ONLY MENTION A SLIGHT CHANCE OF THUNDER ACROSS THE 
NORTHWEST SECTION OF THE FORECAST AREA AS BEST INSTABILITY WILL 
REMAIN UPSTREAM ALONG THE STATIONARY BOUNDARY. 
 
LATEST WSR-88D RADAR TRENDS SHOW A BAND OF RAINFALL DIMINISHING AS 
IT ENCOUNTERS THE UPPER LEVEL RIDGE. HOWEVER...I/M EXPECTING ANOTHER 
AREA OF RAINFALL ACROSS SOUTHWEST ARKANSAS TO MOVE UP INTO PORTIONS 
OF THE FORECAST AREA AFTER MIDNIGHT...WITH BEST CHANCES OF RAINFALL 
STILL MAINLY WEST AND NORTH OF THE MISSISSIPPI RIVER...AND LOWER 
POPS EAST. 

WILL MAKE MINOR MODIFICATIONS TO LOW TEMPERATURES TONIGHT BASED UPON 
CURRENT TRENDS.

UPDATED GRIDS WILL BE OUT SHORTLY.

CJC


.PREV DISCUSSION...ISSUED 330 PM CST SUN JAN 2 2005.

A SFC HIGH OVER THE SE COAST WILL REMAIN IN PLACE THROUGH TUESDAY 
BEFORE MOVING TO THE SE. A STRONG UPPER HIGH ENTRENCHED OVER THE 
GULF OF MEX WILL REMAIN STRONG THROUGH TUESDAY AS THE RIDGE EXTENDS 
INTO THE SE QUARTER OF THE COUNTRY. THIS SCENARIO WILL PROVIDE 
UNSEASONABLY WARM MOIST SOUTHERLY WINDS TO THE REGION THROUGH THE 
FIRST HALF OF THE WEEK.

A COLD FRONT OVER MO WILL APPROACH THE NORTH BORDER OF OUR CWA 
MONDAY...BUT THE BLOCKING RIDGE TO THE SOUTH WILL PREVENT IT FROM 
MAKING ANY SUBSTANTIAL PROGRESS INTO AR/TN. A SERIES OF SHORTWAVES 
WILL PROVIDE OFF AND ON CHCS OF SHWRS...MAINLY IN NW AREAS WHERE QPF 
TOTALS WILL BE THE HIGHEST. SOME EMBEDDED TSTMS ARE POSSIBLE BUT THE 
LACK OF INSTABILITY PROHIBITS ANYTHING MORE THAN ISOLATED 
OCCURRENCES.

THE UPPER RIDGE BREAKS DOWN OVER THE GULF ON WED...ALLOWING FOR A 
COLD FRONT TO MOVE THROUGH THE REGION LATE WEDNESDAY. THE CHC OF 
SHWRS/TSTMS WILL INCREASE AHEAD OF THE FRONT WEDNESDAY AND WEDNESDAY 
NIGHT. EXPECT TEMPS TO COOL DOWN TO SEASONAL LEVELS BY THU WITH A 
BRIEF EPISODE OF DRY WEATHER. 

A RETURN FLOW OF WARM ADVECTION APPEARS TO BE SETTING UP FOR FRI 
INTO SAT...SO EXPECT RAINY WEATHER AGAIN BUT WITH COOLER TEMPS. 
DRIER WEATHER WILL OCCUR AGAIN ON SUNDAY.

SWC
&&

.MEG...WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MS...NONE.
MO...NONE.
TN...NONE.
&&

$$










WILL BE AROUND A WEAK 6 C/KM...LITTLE TO NO SURFACE BASED 
INSTABILITY WITH SHOWALTER/LIFTED INDICIES BOTH BEING POSITIVE. AS A 
RESULT...I WILL ONLY MENTION A SLIGHT CHANCE OF THUNDER ACROSS THE 
NORTHWEST SECTION OF THE FORECAST AREA AS BEST INSTABILITY WILL 
REMAIN UPSTREAM ALONG THE STATIONARY BOUNDARY. 
 
LATEST WSR-88D RADAR TRENDS SHOW A BAND OF RAINFALL DIMINISHING AS 
IT ENCOUNTERS THE UPPER LEVEL RIDGE. HOWEVER...I/M EXPECTING ANOTHER 
AREA OF RAINFALL ACROSS SOUTHWEST ARKANSAS TO MOVE UP INTO PORTIONS 
OF THE FORECAST AREA AFTER MIDNIGHT...WITH BEST CHANCES OF RAINFALL 
STILL MAINLY WEST AND NORTH OF THE MISSISSIPPI RIVER...AND LOWER 
POPS EAST. 

WILL MAKE MINOR MODIFICATIONS TO LOW TEMPERATURES TONIGHT BASED UPON 
CURRENT TRENDS.

UPDATED GRIDS WILL BE OUT SHORTLY.

CJC


.PREV DISCUSSION...ISSUED 330 PM CST SUN JAN 2 2005.

A SFC HIGH OVER THE SE COAST WILL REMAIN IN PLACE THROUGH TUESDAY 
BEFORE MOVING TO THE SE. A STRONG UPPER HIGH ENTRENCHED OVER THE 
GULF OF MEX WILL REMAIN STRONG THROUGH TUESDAY AS THE RIDGE EXTENDS 
INTO THE SE QUARTER OF THE COUNTRY. THIS SCENARIO WILL PROVIDE 
UNSEASONABLY WARM MOIST SOUTHERLY WINDS TO THE REGION THROUGH THE 
FIRST HALF OF THE WEEK.

A COLD FRONT OVER MO WILL APPROACH THE NORTH BORDER OF OUR CWA 
MONDAY...BUT THE BLOCKING RIDGE TO THE SOUTH WILL PREVENT IT FROM 
MAKING ANY SUBSTANTIAL PROGRESS INTO AR/TN. A SERIES OF SHORTWAVES 
WILL PROVIDE OFF AND ON CHCS OF SHWRS...MAINLY IN NW AREAS WHERE QPF 
TOTALS WILL BE THE HIGHEST. SOME EMBEDDED TSTMS ARE POSSIBLE BUT THE 
LACK OF INSTABILITY PROHIBITS ANYTHING MORE THAN ISOLATED 
OCCURRENCES.

THE UPPER RIDGE BREAKS DOWN OVER THE GULF ON WED...ALLOWING FOR A 
COLD FRONT TO MOVE THROUGH THE REGION LATE WEDNESDAY. THE CHC OF 
SHWRS/TSTMS WILL INCREASE AHEAD OF THE FRONT WEDNESDAY AND WEDNESDAY 
NIGHT. EXPECT TEMPS TO COOL DOWN TO SEASONAL LEVELS BY THU WITH A 
BRIEF EPISODE OF DRY WEATHER. 

A RETURN FLOW OF WARM ADVECTION APPEARS TO BE SETTING UP FOR FRI 
INTO SAT...SO EXPECT RAINY WEATHER AGAIN BUT WITH COOLER TEMPS. 
DRIER WEATHER WILL OCCUR AGAIN ON SUNDAY.

SWC
&&

.MEG...WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MS...NONE.
MO...NONE.
TN...NONE.
&&

$$










043 
FXUS64 KMEG 021554
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
950 AM CST SUN JAN 2 2005

.DISCUSSION...

A FRONTAL BOUNDARY EXTENDED ACROSS CNTRL MO THIS MORNING WHILE A 
PERSISTENT SFC HIGH WAS LOCATED NEAR THE GA/SC COAST. EXPECT THE 
UNSEASONABLY WARM MOIST SOUTHERLY WIND TO CONTINUE TODAY WITH AMPLE 
AMOUNT OF CLOUDS. AN EXITING SHORTWAVE WILL CAUSE THE SHOWERS EAST 
OF MKL TO MOVE INTO MDL TN. ANOTHER SHORTWAVE TO THE WEST MAY 
INCREASE THE COVERAGE OF SHOWERS AGAIN THIS AFTERNOON. CURRENT 
FORECAST IS ON TRACK.

THE SFC HIGH OVER THE SE COAST WILL REMAIN IN PLACE THROUGH TUE 
BEFORE MOVING TO THE SE. A STRONG UPPER HIGH ENTRENCHED OVER THE 
GULF OF MEX WILL REMAIN STRONG THROUGH TUE AS THE RIDGE EXTENDS INTO 
THE SE QUARTER OF THE COUNTRY. THE COLD FRONT TO THE N WILL APPROACH 
THE NORTH BORDER OF OUR CWA MONDAY...BUT THE BLOCKING RIDGE WILL 
PREVENT IT FROM MAKING ANY SUBSTANTIAL PROGRESS INTO AR/TN. A SERIES 
OF SHORTWAVES WILL PROVIDE OFF AND ON CHCS OF SHWRS...MAINLY IN NW 
AREAS WHERE QPF TOTALS WILL BE THE HIGHEST.

THE UPPER RIDGE BREAKS DOWN OVER THE GULF ON WED...ALLOWING FOR A 
COLD FRONT TO MOVE THROUGH THE REGION LATE WEDNESDAY. THE CHC OF 
SHWRS/TSTMS WILL INCREASE AHEAD OF THE FRONT WEDNESDAY AND WEDNESDAY 
NIGHT. THE PRECIP MAY LINGER IN SE SECTIONS OF THE CWA THU BEFORE 
DRIER AIR MOVES IN FROM THE NW. EXPECT TEMPS TO COOL DOWN TO 
SEASONAL NORMALS BY THU.

A RETURN FLOW OF WARM ADVECTION APPEARS TO BE SETTING UP FOR FRI 
INTO SAT...SO EXPECT RAINY WEATHER AGAIN BUT WITH COOLER TEMPS.

&&

.MEG...WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MS...NONE.
MO...NONE.
TN...NONE.
&&


000 
FXUS64 KMEG 020931
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
330 AM CST SUN JAN 2 2005

.DISCUSSION...
FRONT LOCATED FROM THE GREAT LAKES SW THROUGH NRN MO INTO THE SRN 
PLAINS THIS MORNING. SCT LIGHT SHOWERS ACRS THE MID SOUTH THIS EARLY 
MORNING WITH TEMPS IN THE UPPER 50S AND LOWER 60S.

EXITING SHORTWAVE SHOULD RESULT IN SOME DIMINISHING OF PRECIP DURING 
THIS MORNING. PERHAPS SOME INCREASE IN COVERAGE THIS AFTN AS NEXT 
SHORTWAVE APPROACHES FROM THE SW ACRS THE SRN PLAINS. EXPECT ANOTHER 
MILD DAY WITH HIGHS WELL INTO THE 60S. 

RAIN CHANCES WL INCREASE TONIGHT INTO MONDAY AS A DECENT SHORTWAVE 
MOVES INTO THE AREA. WL GO WITH CATEGORICAL POPS ACRS NRN TIER WITH 
LIKELY POPS MEM-MKL. EXPECT A SFC WAVE TO DEVELOP ALONG THE FRONT 
AND RACE THROUGH THE OH VALLEY ON MON. AS A RESULT THE FRONT WL PUSH 
ALMOST INTO THE CWA. IN FACT THE GFS DROPS IT JUST INTO THE AREA MON 
NIGHT...BUT THINK THAT IS A LITTLE AGGRESSIVE. 

MON NIGHT INTO TUE NIGHT...FRONT REMAINS JUST NORTH OF THE AREA. 
50/60 POPS NORTHWEST WITH 40 POPS ACRS NE MS. TEMPS STILL WELL ABOVE 
NORMAL WITH HIGHS IN THE 60S. 

STRONG TROF MOVES OUT OF THE SW ON WED. FRONT WL START PUSHING 
THROUGH THE AREA WED INTO WED NIGHT. ANOTHER GOOD SHOT OF PRECIP 
WITH FRONT SO HAVE INCREASED MUCH OF THE AREA TO LIKELY POPS ON 
WED.  

THU THROUGH FRI...HIGH PRESSURE AND DRY WEATHER ALONG WITH MORE 
SEASONABLE TEMPS.

FRI NIGHT INTO SAT...MOIST SOUTHERLY FLOW REDEVELOPS AS HIGH 
PRESSURE SLIPS TO THE SE. GIVEN THE STRONG SW FLOW ALOFT EXPECT A 
CHANCE OF PRECIP. 

&&

.MEG...WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MS...NONE.
MO...NONE.
TN...NONE.
&&

$$

SJM







000 
FXUS64 KMEG 020256
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
855 PM CST SAT JAN 1 2005

.SHORT TERM...LATEST SURFACE ANALYSIS THIS EVENING PLACES LOW 
PRESSURE ACROSS THE PANHANDLE OF OKLAHOMA. MEANWHILE...A WARM FRONT 
EXTENDS FROM THE LOW INTO NORTHERN MISSOURI AND CENTRAL ILLINOIS. 
WATER VAPOR IMAGERY SHOWS QUITE A BIT OF MOISTURE ACROSS THE 
MISSISSIPPI RIVER VALLEY. MAIN FORECAST CONCERNS FOR OVERNIGHT WILL 
BE PRECIPITATION CHANCES. 

00Z UPPER AIR ANALYSES SHOW MID LEVEL SHORTWAVE MOVING ACROSS THE 
FORECAST AREA AT THIS TIME. MODEL SOUNDINGS INDICATE MID LEVELS WILL 
BEGIN TO SLOWLY TRY TO DRY OUT OVERNIGHT. HOWEVER...I THINK DRIER 
PERIOD WILL BEGIN CLOSER TO DAYBREAK AND LAST THROUGH THE MORNING AS 
SHORTWAVE MOVES TO THE NORTHEAST AND BEFORE THE NEXT WAVE /LOCATED 
OVER THE BAJA OF CALIFORNIA/ EJECTS INTO THE SOUTHERN PLAINS AND MID 
SOUTH SUNDAY AND SUNDAY NIGHT. THAT SAID...WILL NOT MAKE ANY 
MODIFICATIONS TO POPS FOR OVERNIGHT BUT WILL LOWER POPS FOR SUNDAY 
MORNING. MINOR MODIFICATIONS WILL BE MADE TO OVERNIGHT LOWS BASED 
UPON CURRENT TRENDS WITH AMPLE CLOUD COVER ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA. 

UPDATED GRIDS WILL BE OUT SHORTLY.

CJC

.PREV DISCUSSION...ISSUED 207 PM CST SAT JAN 1 2005...

.SHORT TERM (THROUGH TUESDAY)...
UPPER RIDGE REMAINS IN PLACE WITH SHORTWAVES EJECTING OUT OF
SOUTHWEST UPPER LOW OVER TOP OF THE RIDGE. THIS WILL PRODUCE
OCCASIONAL BOUTS OF SHOWERS...AND POSSIBLY THUNDERSTORMS THROUGH 
TUESDAY. 

MOST CONCENTRATED CHANCE OF PRECIPITATION IN SHORT TERM LIKELY TO BE
SUNDAY NIGHT INTO EARLY MONDAY...MAINLY NORTHWEST. SHORTWAVE MOVING
THROUGH THEN IS A LITTLE MORE VIGOROUS THAN THE CURRENT ONE. LARGE
DIFFERENCE IN QPF BETWEEN ETA AND GFS FOR NORTHWEST HALF OF CWA
THROUGH 00Z WEDNESDAY. GFS HAS A MAX OF OVER 6 INCHES...MUCH OF IT
SUNDAY NIGHT AND MONDAY. ETA SHOWS A MAX OF AROUND 2 INCHES. GFS
LOOKS OVERDONE FOR NOW...BUT THIS SYSTEM WILL NEED TO BE WATCHED.

NO LARGE SWINGS IN TEMPERATURES THROUGH TUESDAY. HIGHS MAINLY IN
THE 60S AND LOWS IN THE 50S.
&&

.LONG TERM (POST-TUESDAY)...
FRONTAL PASSAGE APPEARS TO BE SOMETIME ON WEDNESDAY...ALTHOUGH IT
APPEARS TO BE A HAIR SLOWER THAN YESTERDAY. IF THERE IS A DRY DAY...
IT WILL BE THURSDAY. COOLER THAT DAY...THEN AS HIGH MOVES OFF TO
THE EAST...MOIST AND MILDER AIR WILL RETURN NORTHWARD WITH
TEMPERATURES RETURNING TO ABOVE NORMAL LEVELS NEXT WEEKEND. 

WAGNER
&&

.MEG...WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MS...NONE.
MO...NONE.
TN...NONE.
&&

$$









444 
FXUS64 KMEG 012008
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
207 PM CST SAT JAN 1 2005

.DISCUSSION...
FRONT PRETTY MUCH WHERE IT HAS BEEN FOR LAST 36 HOURS...AND WITH IT
PARALLEL TO UPPER FLOW...DONT SEE IT MAKING IT INTO CWA ANY TIME
SOON. TEMPERATURES IN THE 60S TO AROUND 70 AT 19Z. AREA OF SHOWERS
MOVING INTO SOUTHWEST PORTIONS OF CWA...WITH MORE SCATTERED SHOWERS
BEHIND IT OVER MS-AR-LA.
&&

.SHORT TERM (THROUGH TUESDAY)...
UPPER RIDGE REMAINS IN PLACE WITH SHORTWAVES EJECTING OUT OF
SOUTHWEST UPPER LOW OVER TOP OF THE RIDGE. THIS WILL PRODUCE
OCCASIONAL BOUTS OF SHOWERS...AND POSSIBLY THUNDERSTORMS THROUGH
TUESDAY. THERE HAS BEEN VERY LITTLE LIGHTNING ASSOCIATED WITH
PRECIPITATION THIS AFTERNOON. POPS TONIGHT WILL RANGE FROM LIKELY
WEST TO CHANCE SOUTHEAST. DEWPOINTS PROBABLY A PRETTY GOOD INDICATION
OF OVERNIGHT LOWS TONIGHT.

MOST CONCENTRATED CHANCE OF PRECIPITATION IN SHORT TERM LIKELY TO BE
SUNDAY NIGHT INTO EARLY MONDAY...MAINLY NORTHWEST. SHORTWAVE MOVING
THROUGH THEN IS A LITTLE MORE VIGOROUS THAN THE CURRENT ONE. LARGE
DIFFERENCE IN QPF BETWEEN ETA AND GFS FOR NORTHWEST HALF OF CWA
THROUGH 00Z WEDNESDAY. GFS HAS A MAX OF OVER 6 INCHES...MUCH OF IT
SUNDAY NIGHT AND MONDAY. ETA SHOWS A MAX OF AROUND 2 INCHES. GFS
LOOKS OVERDONE FOR NOW...BUT THIS SYSTEM WILL NEED TO BE WATCHED.

NO LARGE SWINGS IN TEMPERATURES THROUGH TUESDAY. HIGHS MAINLY IN
THE 60S AND LOWS IN THE 50S.
&&

.LONG TERM (POST-TUESDAY)...
FRONTAL PASSAGE APPEARS TO BE SOMETIME ON WEDNESDAY...ALTHOUGH IT
APPEARS TO BE A HAIR SLOWER THAN YESTERDAY. IF THERE IS A DRY DAY...
IT WILL BE THURSDAY. COOLER THAT DAY...THEN AS HIGH MOVES OFF TO
THE EAST...MOIST AND MILDER AIR WILL RETURN NORTHWARD WITH
TEMPERATURES RETURNING TO ABOVE NORMAL LEVELS NEXT WEEKEND.
&&

.MEG...WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MS...NONE.
MO...NONE.
TN...NONE.

IT WILL BE THURSDAY. COOLER THAT DAY...THEN AS HIGH MOVES OFF TO
THE EAST...MOIST AND MILDER AIR WILL RETURN NORTHWARD WITH
TEMPERATURES RETURNING TO ABOVE NORMAL LEVELS NEXT WEEKEND.
&&

.MEG...WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MS...NONE.
MO...NONE.
TN...NONE.
&&

$$

WAGNER




000
FXUS64 KMEG 011717
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
1117 AM CST SAT JAN 1 2005

.DISCUSSION...
FRONT STILL OVER NORTHERN MISSOURI...AND WITH IT PARALLEL TO
UPPER FLOW...DONT SEE IT MAKING IT INTO CWA ANY TIME SOON.
TEMPERATURES RANGING FROM UPPER 50S TO MID 60S AT 17Z. WHILE
NORTHEAST HALF OF CWA JUST SEEING CIRRUS AT THIS TIME...AN AREA
OF SHOWERS IS MOVING INTO THE SOUTHERN SECTIONS OF THE AREA.
LOW CLOUDS ALSO WIDESPREAD ACROSS MUCH OF ARKANSAS.

TEMPERATURE FORECAST WILL BE TRICKY TODAY. AREAS THAT SEE
SIGNIFICANT SUN...MAINLY WEST TENNESSEE AND PORTIONS OF NORTH
MISSISSIPPI...WILL LIKELY MAKE IT TO NEAR OR ABOVE 70 DEGREES.
WHILE RECORD HIGHS ARE NOT EXPECTED...MEM...MKL AND TUP WILL LIKELY
HAVE A NEW YEARS DAY THAT IS ONE OF THIER 5 WARMEST. AREAS IN LOWER
CLOUDS...SUCH AS JBR...MAY NOT CLIMB MUCH FROM WHERE THEY ARE AT.

WILL MAKE MINOR CHANGES TO TEMPERATURES FOR TODAY...AND CHARACTER
OF PRECIPITATION...BUT NO LARGE CHANGES.

&&



.MEG...WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MS...NONE.
MO...NONE.
TN...NONE.
&&

$$

WAGNER

712 
FXUS64 KMEG 010907
AFDMEG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MEMPHIS TN
305 AM CST SAT JAN 1 2005

.DISCUSSION...
MILD START TO THE NEW YEAR WITH FRONTAL BOUNDARY WELL TO THE NORTH 
AND TEMPERATURES ACRS THE MID SOUTH FROM 55 TO 60 DEGREES AT 09Z. 
SCT SHOWERS STRETCH TO THE SOUTH OF THE BOUNDARY FROM WRN AR ACRS NE 
AR INTO SRN KY THIS MORNING. ELSW ACRS THE MID SOUTH CLOUDY SKIES 
WITH NO PRECIP.

SOUTHWEST FLOW ALOFT WILL REMAIN PARALLEL TO THE FRONT THROUGH NEXT 
TUE NIGHT. THIS MEANS LITTLE MOVEMENT SO THE FRONT WL STAY TO THE 
NORTH ACRS MO AND THE OH VALLEY. MODELS IN GENERAL AGREEMENT ON 
SURFACE AND UPPER FEATURES ACRS THE REGION FOR THE NEXT FEW DAYS. 
THE GFS CONTINUES TO SUFFER FROM SOME FEEDBACK PROBLEMS WITH REGARD 
TO QPF AMOUNTS SO MAV POPS CONT TO BE ON THE HIGH SIDE. RAIN CHANCES 
WL BE HIGHER ACRS NW PARTS OF THE FORECAST AREA...NE AR AND MO 
BOOTHEEL...AND LOWER TOWARD THE TUP AREA THROUGH NEXT TUE NIGHT. 
GENERALLY WENT WITH 50/60 POPS NW AND 30/40 POPS SE. TEMPS BE ABOUT 
15-20 DEGREES ABOVE NORMAL THROUGH TUE NIGHT WITH HIGHS IN THE 60S 
AND LOWS IN THE 50S. 

FRONT FINALLY PUSHES THROUGH WED/WED NIGHT AS UPPER LOW EJECTS OUT 
OF THE SW U.S. HIGH PRESSURE WILL BUILD IN FOR THE END OF THE WEEK 
WITH MORE SEASONABLE TEMPERATURES.

&&

.MEG...WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...NONE.
MS...NONE.
MO...NONE.
TN...NONE.
&&

$$

SJM
